text: I must thankful to them by giving this wonderful stay. I have reserved a delux room but they upgraded it to a suite. Everything was perfect. Buffet spread was very good and food was delicious. Cleanliness is at its max and there hospitality was great. Everything was great and nothing to complained. We will come back again definitly

1.If you want experience next level customer service, Go to this hotel. I have visited many hotels before, But never experienced like this super customer service. Staff was very friendly 2.Rooms was comfortable 3.Rooms was very spacious

We went to Heritance Ahungalla as a group of 7 adults for 2 nights stay. On arrival all of us had a perception that this is a 4 star property but after seeing the rooms and other amenities and the hospitality of staff, chef and services, we can definitely vouch for its 5 star category. We being vegetarians, apart from their big elaborate menus for breakfast and Dinners, chefs personally to care for our food and made all efforts to prepare veg food specially for us. Lady as PR manager Ms Dilsha was an exceptional Dimond star studded to this property. I have travelled to many countries but never seen such hospitality and personal take care by any hotel staff. It was not just us but she was all the time interacting with guests to make them comfortable at the property. Amazing experience !! Amazing Hotel !!

Pros- at the beach. Lovely food. Clean and nice rooms. Cons- all the good restaurants are 20 minutes away in Bentota. The propertyâ€™s hospitality is average. Weâ€™ve seen better hospitality in srilanka.

It is an affordable option among power constructions, but it has sufficient quality. The depreciation of the rupee is a factor, but the cost-performance is unbelievable. Especially when my companion fell ill and we requested a doctor, the attention to detail with room service was also impressive. Thank you.
Great food whopping varieties in food
Thanks a lot for another fantastic stay. Will come definitely come again and againâ€¦.
Highly recommended hotel with all mod-cons and facilities right on the beach.
Friendly staff and neat rooms

Our stay was a great experience, This is our 2nd time here, we were 4 people together me wife and two daughters, the food was great , lovely spread for breakfast western, Sri Lankan and Indian food, amazing location, very fast check in well trained staff.
Great place got gave me an upgrade of the room food Mouthwatering and one of the best in town
Excellent stay
Nice property, Excellent service all round by the staff. Everyone has a smile and courteous and considering clients requests positively. Great work. Keep it up
Very old property . Not maintained properly.check in/ out process took much time. Staff also not friendly and co operative.

If you want to travel with a stay in slow life, this place is a good choice. You can complete everything in the hotel. But if you want to see around, not a good choice. Far from cities, also not many restaurants near. The first infinity pool was not so impressive. Nowadays, you can see the more impressive infinity pool in all over the world.

The hotel needs refurbishment. Some of the corridors and courtyards were in a very poor state. The meals were OK, although not up to 5 star standard. There was only one ala carte restaurant. The restaurant staff were a credit to the hotel - always willing to help. Unfortunately, cant say the same of the reception staff who would benefit from a communication skills training course. The Gym was very poorly equipped and certainly did not merit a 5 star status.
Everything is astonishing, except F/O seems disconnected to the hospitality attitude while the other staff already attached professionally.

Hotel was wonderful from first step to the last good bye. Staff was amazing, quick check in and check out and hotel makes sure the safety of the guests. Pools were properly maintained and hotel is in walking distance to the ahungalla beach view point. a must visit place. Its a hotel which makes Sri Lanka proud ! cheers
Staff was very friendly,But my kids didnâ€™t like the Chinese buffet,Food to be improved.
A friend had recommended the Heritance hotels so we had high expectations. The hotel met and exceeded our expectations. This is a beautiful facility. Food and service were top notch.

the time we spent there was amazing and wonderful. we loved everyhting about this hotel and wanted to stay longer. The hotel staff were very welcoming and nice and the hotel was clean. The facilities and the pool were oh so breathtaking. I would definitely revisit the hotel if I ever visit the area again. The food was great but I have to just add one note, If you are a Muslim or you are nonalcoholic person ask the restaurant staff about the salad dressings if there is any wine or alcohol added in the food. My wife found out that they add wine with the salad dressings especially vinegar. Ask for Halal food and alcohol free drinks and food...

The hotel is an excellent place for any type of family or couple. The staff was impeccable in every aspect and the rooms were spacious. Modern yet with a Sri Lankan feel. I would definitely stay here again.

Our planned highlight, to the end of our Sri Lankan tour, was a frustrating disappointment. We arrived tired and sick, hoping for a clean comfortable room and some simple food. Even though we had booked and paid 6 months earlier, it took a long time to allocate us a room. The room smelled of mould and mould was easily found in the bathroom. My wife complained, but all the staff could do was find the missing outdoor furniture. At dinner, the first night, we had difficulty finding plain food, that would not aggravate our upset stomachs. The chef kindly offered to prepare mashed potatoes, peas and grilled chicken, for us, the next night. However, the next day, this offer was undone by management, who declared we had been selected for "Fine dining". Fearing this was Sringlish for extra spicy, we gave up and went to bed early, without dinned, which we had already paid for. At least at checkout, as some compensation, the hotel did not charge for the sandwich and hamburger, we had at the bar. After my wife presented mouldy toiletries to management, they did offer to change rooms, on the second day; but it was too little too late. The hotel has an impressive entrance and sea view. But what good are those when the hotel fails the basics of room and food.

Stay was great but 1. Considering there is nothing nearby to eat the food choices for A la cart and Room service are very very limited. 2. Phone receiver was smelly. None of the buttons worked 3. Door stopper broken and the the door kept banging if left open for a few seconds 4. Space beneath bed had not been swept or cleaned in a long time 5. TV was not working . Hotel staff were warm and Service was lovely. The location and rooms were fabulous, so we overlooked all faults except Point number 1 on Food.
Awesome! So relaxing

It was very good hotel for stay, but there was good options for vegetarian.Food for non vegetarian was also not upto the mark of 5 star. The amount they charge for Buffet is exorbitant compared to the quality of the good they provide.

Amazing 2 nights spent at Heritance Ahungalla during our trip around Sri Lanka. The pool was amazing, rooms well appointed and comfortable, great selection of food in the restaurant, and situated on one of the most beautiful beaches in Sri Lanka. Above all the professionalism and friendliness of the staff was second to none. Will certainly stay here on my next visit to Sri Lanka and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.
Very Good. Recommended

I thought the "fine dining" restaurant was disappointing and over-priced. The hotel felt too "Buckland's Holiday Camp" for me. Couldn't wait to leave each day on other activities outside the hotel. It looked to me also that the original building design had been messed with. The model airplane at the end of the 'infinity" pool was ridiculous. Surely Geofrey bawa would not have approved.

This hotel is beautiful. 2 swimming pools, that meet the beach. Good food and variety - mostly local style. Very comfortable rooms. Our rooms had balconies overlooking the garden and beach. Staff were friendly, excellent English and couldn't do enough to make our stat memorable. Highly recommend. Good midway point between Bentota and Galle.
it was a really relaxing hotel, staff couldnt do enough for you and were very friendly and spoke english.

Hotel located in good Hotel and some of the staff were very friendly. Had to always wait over 1 hour to have meals served after they were ordered. _x000D_ _x000D_ The website indicated that drivers got free accommodation and 3 meals but the staff did not honor this and made our driver pay. It was very get hold of the Manager to complain so something could be done. Our Driver did not end up getting the money back either> Very Disappointing. _x000D_ _x000D_ Sport Staff (Raja) was very good and was very helpful.. One out of many!!
the hotel is beautiful with great view from the lobby. the sandy beach is quiet.

after a tiring drive, the pool just across the lobby is refreshing and you just want to dive in. The music from the bar next door keeps u upbeat, and top class service wants to enjoy the moment._x000D_ Awesome place to relax and unwind.
The service was lovely at the hotel. The staff were friendly and were not only helpful but always greated us with a smile. The hotel itself is beautiful with it's own private beach.

Wir sind spontan und leider nur fÃ¼r eine Nacht in dieses Hotel, aber es war einer der besten Aufenthalte des Urlaubs: das Personal war super freundlich und hilfsbereit. Ich hatte meinen kleinen Rucksack im Uber vergessen und mir wurde SOFORT geholfen, alles wieder zurÃ¼ckzubekommen. Das Essen und die Zimmer waren auch top!
geen verdere aanvulling

RÃ¤tt trist atmosfÃ¤r pÃ¥ hotellet. Stranden Ã¤r ej badbar pga starka strÃ¶mmar. FÃ¥ bra restauranger i nÃ¤rheten och hotellets priser pÃ¥ mat och dryck Ã¤r alldeles fÃ¶r hÃ¶ga. Kommer aldrig bo dÃ¤r igen och rekommenderar det inte.

This resort stands out as one of the resorts in Sri Lanka which involves the guests for some activities through the day or simply relax and enjoy the vast beach or pool or the room itself. The food is predominantly European with few Lankan dishes. Any other dishes such as Indian may not be up to the mark yet but the chefs are putting in an effort to get it right.

Our check-in experience was smooth and quick. The room we stayed in was clean and spacious, which we appreciated. However, the biggest issue was that the AC in our room didnâ€™t work properly, and we had to endure an uncomfortable, hot night. Although the maintenance team tried their best to resolve the issue, they were unsuccessful, and we received no apology or acknowledgment from the hotel management. On top of that, we were contacted about our check-out time, which added to the frustration. The food was tasty, but the buffet selection was quite average

My parents had a nice stay which was booked for my mums birthday. Service and the cleanliness of the room was very good. They arranged a cake and helped celebrate mums birthday in a special way. Thank you for a such a nice stay! Looking forward to be back.
Room is spacious,clean and beds are very comfortable. (Best sleep in a month hotel hoping in Sri Lanka) Staff are super friendly and helpful.

It was a very pleasant stay with heritance ahungalle. Rooms were very clean, comfortable, and facilities available were exceptional. However, dinner was below my expectation, as although the spread was extensive, nothing was tasty, as those lacked the flavour. Also, the table arrangement was a chaos, since the restaurant staff gave priority for group travellers, with no concern at all for small families.
It was indeed a pleasant stay at the hotel.
Everything was good but we didnâ€™t receive the room category we choose. They said itâ€™s not available. It was a bit disappointing.
Excellent customer service
Thoroughly enjoyed
Awesome

It was a mother and daughter. The staff at the hotel from the housekeeping, the restaurant , the reception right down to the pool life guard were amazing. Nothing was too much trouble for any of them. They truly made our stay memorable and we would stay there again in a heartbeat! We requested for sone crab curry during dinner and they were all so willing to please us. Thank you again to Pradeep who took great care of my mum and the rest of the restaurant staff for being so accommodating! The Heritance group should be so proud of their team at Ahungalla!
Everything was up to standard. The saxophonist was excellent and the staff was exceptional. Dilsha who was at the Reception was really helpful, she went out of her way to make our stay happy.
An impressive experience to chill out in this resort. The nature , the beach are at the door step.
It was good but its an very old hotel. Also there were disturbance at the beach area from local sellers. Was felt unsafe and uncomfortable. it seems Hotel is not able to contorl them.
Perfect beach location and great buffet with variety to enjoy.
Hospitality was amazing. Food was fantastic. Love the cultural dance and the atmosphere. Location is very refreshing. Overall great place for value for money.

We are a family of five: two adults and three children. This was the perfect property- stayed here for 3 nights and did not want to leave! Right from the start, the tall and beautiful Ms. Supunika took care of us. There was some confusion with our booking at the start which she handled very gracefully. We had room 201 and 203, easily the best rooms on the property, ocean view and the children had poo view. The rooms are very large:45sqm of pure bliss. 203 has a massive screen TV so the children were very happy. There was water polo in the pool and we enjoyed games very much. The breakfast was a huge, scrumptious spread that we looked forward to every morning!!! Each dish was absolutely delicious! This is a perfect property for a family!

Nicely designed property with lots of natural elements. Sea is rough mostly if not always - hence settled for pool. Front office lacks lighting and the staff were slow in figuring out simple calculations - wish they could smile a bit. Understandably the security is tight - wish they could be more courteous - this is hospitality industry - everyone is looking forward to improved occupancy rates.

This was a real haven, a complete getaway from the madding crowd. Beautiful pristine beach, although the sea was very choppy it was still fun battling the waves. The show stopper was the food, they really delivered on every level here, in fact, it was a tad too much but that's what holidays are about... I recommend this place 100%, to be honest, anything after this will probably be a letdown, although you might appreciate the rest from the indulgence. 5/5 on all counts, there were no complaints, Chef Thilian was a great host in the dining room, nothing was too much trouble...I will be back soon...thanks again.
i did not stay at heritance ahungalla since you informed it was fully booked later and transferred me to hotel riu.
staff /service is excellent.It was a great stay. The F&B manager is very good and very helpful. food can be better(croissants and danish's not flaky)
We had a great time here, staff was really great they were very attentive and fulfilled all our requests to the best, we were very impressed. Beautiful location by the beach.

I ordered my breakfast to the room which I didn't get .then they firmly apologized for not giving me the breakfast.then asked me to have the lunch instead .then when I had the lunch asked me to pay for it .mind you I was allocated for a complimentary breakfast with the package I paid .

Fantastic but would have been nearly perfect if there hadn't been a wild dog lose in the corridor howling and looking very threatening at 3am. It's nearly unavoidable to have them trying to get in close due to the wonderful open modernist architecture, but staff should be patrolling the open spaces at night much more regularly. My impression is that staff doesn't patrol these spaces at all at night. Also since it's not easy to get to a town for supplies, a small convenience store should be included, where you could buy personal items, like sunscreen, shaving cream, etc.
Upon checking in, power for the room went off. Phone in the hotel room was also faulty. Cleanliness of the bathroom was not up to standard. Dinner buffet was limited in variety and lacking in taste.
Swimming pool not very clean, but good location. Food not really good but rooms are ok.
Outstanding location, super friendly and helpful staff, delicious food. Really comfy bed! DIDN'T WANT TO LEAVE!!!

Geoffery Bawa's infinity pool was amazingly beautiful. we stayed there for two days in May 2015. A perfect location for a quiet holiday. Only pity part was dinner. Main restaurant offers only buffet which was not so attractive. Room service was much better but limited selection.
very good

This was a lively way to finish our 3 weeks in Sri Lanka. The spa has beautiful treatments to help unwind and the pool area and gardens were lively and relaxing. We were there at monsoon season, so had the daily downpour but this did not dampen our stay. The beach was too rough for swimming and the beach sharks ( locals selling sarongs and free trips to see the turtles and local gem shop were out in full force). The rooms were lovely and the staff so helpful and always smiling. A lovely retreat at the end of our vacation.

We felt we could not relax whilst in the grounds, the local sellers both men and women, hid in the bushes of the hotel on the beach, waiting to get people's attention. As soon as you stepped onto the beach, you were surrounded by them. Also so much rubbish strewn about the perimeter. Overall the hotel lacked any atmosphere, maybe it is too large for that? The staff were all lovely and friendly. For the money we both felt very let down, it is marked as a 5 star hotel but I would disagree with that.

Enjoyed our stay here. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Room was large, spacious, clean and we had a large balcony facing the pool and beach. Dc enjoyed the swimming, table tennis, pool table. Breakfast buffet was great. Room service was equally good even though choices were limited. Laundry service was efficient. Getting about wasn't too hard as hotel could arrange for cabs. The gorgeous Geoffrey Bawa-designed hotel and the lovely staff were the main attraction for us. Overall, had a wonderful stay and would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel.

we were a family of 4. we all had a good relaxing holiday. the only downside was the length of time from airport to hotel. The staff cannot do enough for you, very helpful and friendly, always smiling.

If you can afford a couple of days dont hesitate to spent the money ( pr. room). _x000D_ Fantastic service, spectacular suroundings and beautiful beach. _x000D_ We had three days of total relaxation including a fantastic New Years dinner/party

Stayed 4 nights at the Heritance. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and the room was perfect - spacious & clean with a huge balcony overlooking the pool and sea. The food was varied and tasty with a good selection for all meals. There was a very well stocked library and a games room and the hotel had a great feel to it.

bawa's architecture is a little bit old, but its atmosphere still remained. buffet dinner at the main restaurant had rich selection of creative dishes and offered kind service. local students group having a party at the pool were noisy.

Me wife, small son and I just spent several nights/days at this hotel and had a wonderful time. We had a 2nd floor room with good-sized outdoor deck overlooking one of the large pools and a tremendous view of the ocean. The room was spacious and nicely furnished. Wifi in room for no extra charge. Very friendly and prompt service at all times. Spacious grounds that were well cared for. Had monkey's occassionally in large room right near room that we could view from deck or while in swimming pool. Food very good. A con is that ocean waves were very rough, but beach was wonderful and swimming pools were great with view of surf from pools.
Correct mais les prestations du personnel ne sont pas au niveau de l'hotel

Personal,wie Ã¼berall in SL sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Polster in Bar und Speisesaal schmuddelig. Handlauf bei StÃ¼hlen im Speisesaal klebrig und schwarz. Rezeption unflexibel. Meiner Meinung nach mÃ¼sste das Management viel mehr tun

the staff were extremely friendly. our children enjoyed the entertainment provided by the animators, the was a good variety of activities each day
Mycket bra och vÃ¤nlig service. Renligheten var inte i klass med nordiskt och tysk standard men bÃ¤ttre Ã¤n normalt i Sri Lanka. Hotellet Ã¤r slitet och i behov av grundlig renovering.

Had a lovely stay at this place, great access to the beach and superb food. The place lacks some facilities but makes up for it with the amazing pool, access to the beach, delicious food and courteous staff

(+)Excellent location facing the beach with direct access. Two swimming pools make it less crowded. Staff very polite and helpful. We where lucky to spot the endemic (in Srilanka) purple faced langur in the premises. Good restaurants inside (-) Long walk from the road if you want to buy anything personal. Overall all star ratings

No bacon for bfast.repetition of food items on buffet.inedible cuts of meat on buffet,should have cooked in pressure cooker to tenderise the meat.we were told by the head chef only the good cuts are served at the a la carte restaurant not on the buffet.

Hotel location is great with a beautiful beech front and two large pools. Wonderfull clean rooms with plenty of space with amenties. Range of food in the buffet was tasty but not exceptional to a 5 star standard. It is very basic. Buffet area and dishes need lot of improvement. This includes range, garnish and artistical arrangement. Lack in service offering tea or coffee at the end of the meal, specially breakfast. We are very impressed of the friendlyness of the staff and helpfullness. Overall we had a great stay.

The spacious lobby faces the sea, and beyond the blue swimming pool, you can see the turbulent sea. The beach is long and beautiful, but not suitable for swimming. The rooms are spacious and elegantly decorated, the quality of tap water is poor, but bottled water is provided.

Not at all a 5 star property by any stretch . Yes all basic amenities like pool, indoor game, bar etc are there but quality/cleanliness not thr. My son and wife also got food poisoning after eating brownie.
Our stay at the heritance ahungalla wos absolutely amazing the food & room were exexceptional .The staff very friendly ,i would highly recommended this hotel
It was amazing experience with delicious food (calamari and pineapple were the top notch) and scenic views
Really helpful and kind staff. Awesome room and service
Awesome place
Had a great stay with commendable service, nice views, and wonderful atmosphere. Highly recommend this hotel for a relaxing visit.
very friendly staff, nice beach and good food..veg options hardly any though

We were booked for a single room for a day. On asking for a non smoking room,the manager upgraded us to a sea facing suite without any additional charges. It was a blessings for us.The beach of the hotel was very neat n well maintained. Live music in the evening at bar wad excellent. The staff ,in their traditional Sri Lankan uniform, were very attentive n helpful. The only issue was the availability of vegetarian food in the la carte restaurant We wished to have reservations for few days more at the this resort

One of the best hotels I've stayed at, on my trip. It has its own beach and large pool. The breakfast buffet was amazing. My room came with bathrobes and a beautiful balcony. Don't Hesitate to book this

Great hotel to spend a few days with the family. 2 good sized pools, good sized rooms with balconies facing the ocean/pool in most instances. We were full board and the variety and quality of food was excellent with a number of items prepared by the chefs in front of us so didnâ€™t experience â€œbuffet fatigueâ€. Staff went out of their way to be helpful and always carried a smile. There are some corridor sections of the hotel that could do with a bit of tlc (ie refreshed painting/ decorating touch ups etc) but all in all good value for the money you pay.
Friendly, very helpful staff, wide choice of food on buffet, lovely views, wide beach with soft silty sand, pool facilities great
All staff , facilities were exceptional. Probably one of the best hotels in the south coast.
Really indulge into this hotel, the staff are very friendly and attentive, except the Front Desk, disconnect to room guests, and pushy, lacking of empathy....quite odd.
Stayed there over a weekend. Excellent food and a beautiful location by the beach. Sea was too rough to swim in April however hotel well equipped with two pools.

Heritance hotels have always been one of favourite places. The staff is super friendly, the services are impeccable and the food is always so good. This is my fourth visit and it never fails to leave a smile on my face. Plus we got a free upgradeğŸ˜Š

The hotel is huge but there are some problem in management. I didn't set Morning call but my phone ring at 6am. Then at 8am, the cleaning team knock my door ask what time I plan to check out. It's really disturb my rest. They can ask when we check in or ring us the previous night! There should be a better way to deal with instead of annoy customer. _x000D_ Besides, I found stains on the cups and linen. They should check it more thoroughly as their room is expensive.
The iconic boat next to the pool was missing. Hope this magnificent decoration will be re-installed soon.

Had a problem similar to the one we had at the other Heritance property at Kandalama, Check-in took 45 minutes as they could not find the reservation inspite of providing the voucher. Heritance needs to get their act together on this issue
very nice hotel, nice place, staff very cute

The hotel needs a good clean from top to bottom. Except for the pool and bar area it is all pretty grubby eg. the coffee shop chair arms and tabletops are black with dirt. The floor in the hotel room was gritty and some of the linen was gray with dirt or age. Even the most basic accommodation we stayed at in Sri Lanka were better maintained than this. They seem to be cutting costs all round including not enough staff. One good point is the quality of the breakfast buffet which was very good.
3 nights
Everything was good, but they did not make up our room (we stayed two nights). Exceptionally beautiful hotel design and location.
Mediocre
We liked the stay, but sometimes as it was a low season, the hotel looked deserted:)
very nice stay, amazing location, good to relax, very good staff, however little expensive as there are similar oiptions like cinamon bey beruwala with similar offerings.

After 6 busy and interesting days in Sri Lanka, we couldn't find more beautiful hotel than Heritance Ahungalla. The room have been cleaned twice a day. At the reception desk works very capable staff whome are always available. If you ever stay in this hotel please ask for mr Dinusha Kularathne. He made for us surprise in the room (flowers for wife and fruit basket). He makes a great effort to accomplish any request we had. In general this is the best hotel we ever stayed in, don't skip it if you ever come in Sri Lanka.

This hotel is the great. I stayed there with my parents and my boyfriend, And we almost screamed when we entered the hotel.Because hotel's lobby is very beautiful and we could see lobby, beautiful swimming pool ,sea at the same time. And staffs are very kind and friendly. Especially we appreciated one guy. He is a person in charge of room clean.His names is Thilina. He made us a smile and very kind and friendly. If somebody go there, please look for Thilina. He will make you a smile absolutely.

we chose this hotel for 5 days rest on our arrival in Sri Lanka. Whilst the hotel itself is lovely and our room was fantastic - clean, large, great balcony, lovely big clean bathroom - we were disappointed by the aggressive sales tactics of the staff every time we were in the main hotel area. We were constanly being asked if we wanted to try the spa, the fine dining restaurant or the outrageously expensive barbecue on the beach. We found the hotel bar and restaurant to be very over priced as well. This is definitely more of a family hotel so those without children may consider other options. There is a limited amount to do outside the hotel so may be better for people on an all inclusive or at least half board package. We did appreciate the hotel's facilities - two lovely clean pools, tennis courts, table tennis all available but the beach isn't really very usable due to the number of salesmen on it (not the hote's fault).

When I walked in the lobby, it was very crowede and noisy, I saw the swimming pool from lobby, it was as crowded as disneyland, I cannot believe this is a 5 star hotel. And the swimming pool was somehow under maintance, can see the view as saw on the website. No bath tub in the bathroom. My flight was 12 noon, so I had an early breakfast at 7:20am, the breakfast time started at 7am, but it was chaos when I walked in the restaurant, staff in the restaurant were chatting, laughing, there's no Professional at all!! I was sooo disappointed at Heritance Ahungalla hotel!!!
Very helpful staff at the reception but check your booking two times as the person at the reservation counter is a pain to deal with,named Pradeep.

Never have we ever been into such as filthy, serivce-lacking beach resort. The whole premises is a run-down. The restaurants are not clean: sticky tables covered with juice stains; rotten salad, bread crumbs and fish bones seem to be part of the chairs and cushions. Serving beverages with cracked cups/glasses which also have dead insects gluing to them. The food is not well prepared neither fresh, including the seafood! Annoyed to be served with stale seafood in a beach resot! Hotel beach is decorated with trash, including broken bottles. Guests pay 5-star-resort tariff while 1-star serive is provided.

We enjoy the place. Restaurant-Service and quality of food can be improved and is a bit high price Perfect beach stretchâ€¦ Tours overpricedâ€¦ In general very friendly staff and perfect site to relax
Eine schÃ¶ne poolanlage die Zimmer sind leider etwas klein und auch schon heruntergekommen

Det gÃ¤llde verkligen hela personalen! Hotellet har tvÃ¥ pool-omrÃ¥den och det som fÃ¶rst kÃ¤ndes som ett rum lÃ¥ngt bort i hotellkomplexet nÃ¤r vi leddes dit visade sig ligga vid den djupaste (och i vÃ¥rt tycke bÃ¤sta)poolen. Very beautiful hotel We had 2 nights at it. The room was so clean. The main pool is clean, but the second pool is not. The staff are not friendly at the reception. We called the reception 3 times for the laundry services, and they told us at morning will bring our clothes, but they didn't till noon . First day it was too noisy because of the guy who was cutting the grass (more than 4 hours) and and no action from the reception after calling them. After our complaints to the supervisor, they bring us a fruit basket ğŸ˜‚. Also the next day the maintenance where working between the rooms at 7 am. Also some of the restaurant staff were so rude. Also the second day, the guy of cutting grassğŸ¤¯. You will not feel relax.
Most welcomed and Supportive staff Perfect for family gatherings Food was great and had better options Rooms were very clean Gym was good Swimming pool is spacious and can be used for water polo
It's been a wonderful vacation due to the hotel staff and the facilities they had offer to us during the stay. Food is great and rooms are clean. And the pool is good for the kids.
location and resort is really very good liked even food and quality . service is nice , staff is cooperative will surely recommend

The welcome drink was delicious, and the view was beautiful! I wanted to swim in the infinity pool, but it was disappointing that I couldn't because of the rain. Our room was on the first floor, but it had a terrace, and in front of the terrace was the pool, with the ocean visible in the distance, which was amazing! I would like to visit again during the peak season.
We liked the hotel but all extras are more expensive than in this area around. You should buy all inclusive to avoid paying extra. Overall we liked it
That day was fantastic we had halloween dinner party and we did not expect in that days my kid really enjoy we wants to stay another night but no rooms available there
It was a good hotel, helpful staff but food options could been better.
Too much building work going around where I was staying noisy everything was average

We got the best deal @ agoda. Staying at the heritance ahungalla was best. Friendly staff and delicious foods. We are very happy about our stay. Highly recommend agoda app and heritance ahungalla hotel.
We had a wonderful relaxing stay at the hotel. The staff was excellent, so was the food. Thank you Heritance Ahungalla keep up the friendly atmosphere. Recommend it to everyone.
Less Buffet. Not match with 5 star grade hotel
Very friendly & supportive staff. We got a truly exceptional experience. Meals are great with lot of varieties. we recommend this hotel .
Exceptional location ,great staff and good food.

Why bed only? The buffet is over priced, ala carte much better although the selection isn't wide it was sufficient for us. Breakfast buffet was better if I hadn't booked with the breakfast addon (why did I do that??) I would have done ala carte again.
The Room was very good. Food excellent. Staff was very friendly. But even though I booked a luxury room facing the sea on a top floor.. I never got one. But all in all was a good experience.

A disappointing stay. Crowded with run down facilities. Food was ordinary and hotel security did not do enough to keep tuk-tuk drivers and sarong vendors from the hotel grounds where they regularly hassled guests.

Love Bawaâ€™s architecture, so this was a leisure and learning trip for us. One of the best places to see unexpected architecture merge with amazing luxury. A huge thank you to the staff for upgrading us to the suite room. It was an amazing experience and we never wanted to leave!!
Although the hotel and the location by itself was stunning, the rooms were dated, and the fact that this is an old property, showed. There are definitely better hotels out there, which offer more.

It's a beautiful hotel. Very relaxing environment close to the beach with huge infinity pool. Excellent guest service, food, and evening entertainment. It's a well managed hotel with excellent staff who makes you feel at home.
Had a love,y time when I stayed here for 6 nights. The rooms were very clean, the swimming pool really beautiful and food excellent.

we spent amazing and wonderful time. hotel staff were very welcoming and nice. the facilities are really good including clean & very comfortable rooms. pools were spectacular. Delicious food with great buffet. extremely hospitable and cozy.
great architecture

The staff were super attentive, we were upgraded to superior rooms with views of the sea. The pools were spectacular. Its a perfect place to spend 3 to 4 days with children- there is a great games room, gorgeous pools, fantastic food...what more could you ask for!
Brilliant! Very good sea beach location. Food expensive. Breakfast good value. Pools are really inviting and the sea is just there!

we got an upgrade to a suite since we told them about our bad experience at the previous resort. the suite was absolutely lovely! a huge balcony overlooking the beach. they used all eco friendly methods like cinnamon oil for room freshers, glass bottles for toileteries. the staff at the reception was extremely helpful and made sure we were made comfortable. the breakfast and dinner spread was big though as compared to the other resorts the food wasn't as delicious ...and their kids club surely needs more work.. the beach was clean and lovely, they had two pools which were both great, a good cultural show at night which was very entertaining. would surely go back!

We had a pleasant stay at the hotel. The staff were helpful at the checkin. We informed them we were vegetarian and they told us they would inform the cook to have some veg menu. But when we went for dinner we were informed that there is nothing vegetarian and it was Barbeque night. We were asked to go to the coffee shop, over there we were told they would prepare something veg and would take 45 minutes. But what we were served was inedible even our dog back home wouldn't eat it. Over all the hotel was great but we had a bad time with food. The breakfast was good. But rest of the time we had to go to taj Bentota for food. Wouldn't recommend the hotel to vegetarians

We really enjoyed our weekend at the Heritance. The staff were kind and friendly and the environment was excellent with plenty of loungers, adequate shade, clean sand, clean sea, good food and great room service.
We had a great relaxing week following is cultural trip around the Country.
The Heritance hotels live up to thier reputuation - outstanding. I stayed at the Dambulla one last year and the Ahungalla one was of the same outstanding standard (not as artistic though).
We had a very pleasant stay and would highly recommend this hotel. Amazing breakfast and very polite staff. The swimming pool and proximity of the beach is awesome

good and beautiful hotel, excellent location, but needs to be renovated. Quiet and nice garden. Good restaurant. Few people on 1km long amazing beach. Beach boys will be not so annoying, after 2-3 attempts they give up._x000D_ Due to overall hotel wear, should be cheaper.

We were loking forward to staying at this hotel on the coast as we were not travelling to the Maldives. However we were dissapointed with the service and food during our stay. The only savibg grace was being upgraded and the room we got was fantastic. The hotel is set in a great location but if you do not like being hasseled on the so called private beach then this hotel is not for you. There were many locals on the beach trying to sell guests goods in full view of the scurity guards. However the security guards did not stop this from happening and we will not be returning to this hotel.

We love the Heritance chain of hotels and stayed in all 3 properties in Sri Lanka. This particular property has great view, good room and quality however it is the lowest of the 3 - Tea Factory is the best. The F&B in this property is the most expensive but the best food quality is at Kandalama

i rally liked this place.. the staff were very nice and i really enjoyed the pool area . there issnt much to do outside the place but i loved the culture and everyone made this trip very enjoyable for us

Being the first major beach resort hotel built and designed by Bawa around the southern coast of Sri Lanka, this hotel is not new anymore. However if you are a Bawa fan, it is still worth a visit. The whole property is very big and filled with tropical gardens and open space. I particulary like the garden in front of the facade and the open main pool facing the reception.
We had a nice time there

I was there with my 7 years old daughter,she had a wonderful time at the hotel.staff was really friendly.specialy lady who welcomed (guest relation) and at the buffet (kitchen-hirusha) was really helpful for my daughter.overall Hotel is highly recommended.
Beautiful resort with good food and right by the beach. Me and friends had a great time. Very sweet and lovely staff,

I chose Heritance because my family was holidaying there. The best part of the experience was the comfortable deluxe room with the best mattress I've ever slept on and a balcony overlooking the pool. I felt very relaxed and the staff was friendly and courteous. What disappointed me was the breakfast and dinner buffets(I stayed three nights) There was nothing special about the menu and my palate was bored. Everything tasted the same. To me the meals ordered via the in-room dining service tasted slightly better. Overall, it was a comfortable stay. It's a nice hotel if you want to relax, swim and enjoy the beach

We had a wonderful stay at this hotel! It offered great value for money, with clean and comfortable rooms at a reasonable price. The location was perfect, close to key attractions and easily accessible. As a couple traveling together, we appreciated the peaceful atmosphere and the friendly staff who made our stay even better.

Staff is very friendly, but the hotel is very outdated. For the price you pay there are better or cheaper options available in the surrounding area. Facilities are ok. Rooms are very old. It looks like the hotel did very small to keep the place presentable. The only good thing is the pool. Big and great for kids. Restaurants are also not bad and food prices are fair. We had a good time but I personally believe that the hotel management can do more to keep the place more vibrant. Also checkin experience is somewhat strange where guests can feel little unwelcome with the process in place. We got electrocuted when using the hair dryer. Unit was definitely faulty. We reported this to the hotel but no management came to investigate or consult our family. We manage to get a replacement and luckily it wasn't a big accident. I'm not sure if the hotel deemed safety of guest as their utmost priority. But in our case, it felt as though they just simply ignored. I don't think we will visit there again. Locationwise, it's a good place.

I requested a "room with as much ocean view as possible" in advance, and they granted it. The sound of the waves heard from the balcony is the best background music. The staff is friendly and has lovely smiles. I didn't want to go home. However, for some reason, the sink was too high and inconvenient.
enjoyed the stay
Very good hotel with friendly atmosphere.Buffet was delicious with vast variation .
The staff was very friendly. There were 2 spacious pools. All the facilities were very good. There was a widespread buffet. Overall it was worth the price. We had a good stay there.
Excellent amenities , good wifi, amazing breakfast buffet , great staff service !

Our room was upgraded to the suite facing the beach side which was very kind of them. The lady manager was very generous and helpful. The chef at the restaurant was making the best nasi goreng live. Food was really good and overall we enjoyed the trip. The rooms on the back side are not recommended they are renovating that side. The front side suites were really nice.
Hotel, staff and food was all great!

This is a fabulous hotel away from the busier tourist spots / beaches closer to Galle. Everyone needs a few days at East here in this beautiful hotel. And the staff are wonderful. And make sure you take the full board - you will not regret it.

This was a nice hotel at the end of our trip to chill on the beach before the flight home. The pools were lovely and the beach beautiful. Not much about the area and the food was ok, not great but ok.

If youâ€™ve ever been to an all-inclusive in the Caribbean, then youâ€™ll feel right at home here. The hotel is beautiful and service is better than most places in Sri Lanka, but the location is remote, thereâ€™s nothing to do off the resort unless you go to Bentota (20 mins away by tuk tuk). It features buffet for all 3 meals and nightly entertainment. You can also order a la carte in their restaurants, with the Mustard Cafe serving seafood priced the same as their beach restaurant and was quite good. We stayed for 2 nights and we noticed during the week the hotel catered to elderly Package tourists from Europe (the only place I saw overweight people in the whole country!) and younger Russians that came on the weekend. Itâ€™s right on the beach but waves were usually a bit rough so most people stayed by the pool. Come here if you want a beautiful resort with no intention of leaving the grounds or experiencing any local culture.
When I went to check in they didnâ€™t have the booking that I made through Agoda six hours ago. I had to wait for almost an hour before they could give me the keys to check in.
Very Comfortable experience , cool swimming pool with epic view of the beach and sunset. Live band at the bar was cool.
Great atmosphere as Heritance concept. Staffs at reception are helpful. I wish to return so I will leave my comments and requests to improve services at reception.

Its really Beautiful and large. Stayed in the Deluxe Double and the room and bathroom was very spacious. Buffet was decent and seafood was actually better than other places. Sea was rough today but its usually best before 10am They have a Morning Clean service at 10am and then again at 7pm, right after breakfast and before dinner.

We had a great time at this location. Staff was exceptional. Only comment is since our kids were 16 and 14 years old we were told to book two rooms instead of one. I wish we had the option with one extra bed for a fee and charge for extra meal, it would've made bit more sense. Instaed, we had to book one extra room for one child.
We liked the pool.

We stayed 3 nights in Hesitance Ahungalla. The facilites are really good. The room was big and clean, the king size bed very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was good. The beach is spotless, as the swimming pool. The hotel is however a bit big and I would not recommend it for couple traveler as it is full of family or big groups. We however enjoyed our stay where we relaxed after 2 weeks traveling around Sri Lanka.
Bathroom was not clean at all. Muddy footsteps were on the floor and glasses were dirty not cleaned for a long time

The building and the smiling staff builds up a expectation. The logistics are a mess. Takes to long time for small things. Its a general gender problem in Sri Lanka. The female capacity is not taken seriously. IÂ´l think its not important what i say to you in this letter. Whats matter is what I sy on next dinner whit friends home in my country when they ask; "How was Sri Lanka? My answer is, They are spoiling an opportunity to beat Thailand because of bad management. Whish you good luck

Good stay, although there's nothing to do in Ahungalla. Better to stay near Galle or anywhere else south or north with more happening. Food at the hotel was overpriced and there were few local alternatives without taking a taxi ride at least 10 mins away. We found an excellent beach place not far from the hotel and eat there most evenings. The pool, sunbathing in the garden and the beach are great if you want to do Absolutely Nothing.

Two huge, beautiful pools. Helpful and unobtrusive staff. Spacious rooms with nice views. Buffet breakfast and dinner are good, but if you didn't pay for full board, skip the dinner buffet and get the rice and curry at the a la carte restaurant: more than you can eat at half the price. Room service menu is not too exciting, I'd suggest making the trip to the restaurant. Beds are soft, but we got two single mattresses put together instead of a double, which was a bit annoying. Spa: Decent massages if a little pricey. Very nice hotel, no real complaints except for the website: the hotel did not respond to repeated emails before we arrived, and there are no directions or tips for how to get here on the website.

Some of the facilities were pretty good, like the pool, proximity to beach etc however the rooms were very dated for a supposed 5 star resort. The staff were generally ok but check in and check out was ridiculously slow to where we were running half an hour late for our transfer on check out due to the pace in which the staff conducted themselves. The hotel is very expensive given the rooms etc, when I pay 5 star prices I expect 5 star rooms and facilities.

We had a great few days. Beach holidays for us are all about enjoying a clear, warm sea and that is exactly what we got with the added advantage of a good range of food and a good lounging area near the pool.

Ahungalla Heritance Hotel is reassuring when you arrive through its private drive after passing the entrance arch gate. It keeps being reassuring when you discover the open reception to the swimming pool that visually extends straight into the Indian Ocean just few meters away until â€¦ you end up checking in at a bar behind the reception that was very dark as most of its lights were switch off; was it a try of being Eco friendly ?? We had a strange feeling that the hotel was not up to its 5*. This obvious detail was like the top of an iceberg; will we discover the rest of it along our stay? Was Heritance a 5* iceberg? The room was ok, yet had aged and would need a lift. There was no safe deposit (5*?). The room maintenance appeared secondary as we noticed an obvious splash of dirt on the terrace door window and one of the door lock was broken. At â€œMustard coffee shopâ€, we ordered seafood salad, it came with no salad or veggies (misleading salad term). We checked the â€œUpperRestaurantâ€ menu and were not impressed by its presentation neither by the incomprehensive culinary composition of its expensive dishes. The restaurant was empty â€¦ lack of soul, poor lighting, no spark. Instead we went to this little Coconut Hut restaurant down the beach out of the hotel, where we really had a superb and reasonable diner, thank you to Berthy the owner for his welcome. We recommend it. Back to our room, we were not blown by the auto glorifying video of Heritance Ahungalla that was played in random on the hotel TV channel, it sounded too superlative to be true. The Heritance corporate management needs to open its eyes, international real 5* hotel are on their way to Sri Lanka and soon they may be at the origin of the end of Heritance Hotels 5 * era. The F & B department should also be worry and revise its restaurants concepts and put its heart and mind into it.

The Hotel was built in 1983 but has been maintained quite well over the years. There is a Spa, which, however, is is not so special. The beach just in front of the hotel is nice but there are salespeople walking around who can be quite annoying sometimes. Those people are not allowed on the hotel property and thus it is possible to have some quiet time a bit further up on the beach on the sunchairs. The fine dining restaurant "The Upper Room" is excellent, so is the breakfast buffet.
A nice hotel and great location but I think you can do better if you want the same standard for a lower price. OK overall.

I upgraded from a deluxe to a luxury room for a bigger room with a better view and bigger bathroom with a bath. My new room was lovely, really spacious, comfortable bed, large balcony with double aspect. _x000D_ _x000D_ The deluxe rooms are on the 2nd floor, luxury rooms on 3rd floor. _x000D_ _x000D_ The staff were very helpful over a lost passport debacle, making the necessary phone calls and accompanying me to the local tourist police. _x000D_ _x000D_ 2 pools, and the residents only pool was a necessity when the hoards of kids came to use the facilities at various points in the day. The main, infinity pool is stunning. _x000D_ _x000D_ Food was good but expensive. If you are going for local fare, then the restaurant (a la carte) is much better value the buffet next door where you get essentially the same food for half the price. The pool bar menu was limited and very expensive.
One the highlights of our Sri Lanka 2011 trip. Good 5 star hotel with good food, service, and entertainment at night. Accomdation for drivers too. Good swimming pool and beach too

Though the hotel was nice...but definitely needs maintenance. Our room 240 had broken door handles, lights needed to fix, very small bathroom. Good for 2 but didnt find value for money paid. Staff is super awesome and warm. Very nice people and hospitality
Excellent value for money and a beautiful property with a wonderful staff.
Beach front hotel
Nice time spent with fanily at Heritance
Superb
All inclusive stay is recommended. Beautiful location
The hotel was truly exceptional
The restaurant and front office staff are exceptionally friendly and promptly attend to your needs.
Nice stay, would come again!
Best place to stay in Ahungalla, Highly recommended!!
Beautiful heritage hotel designed by Geoffrey Bawa in a great absolute ocean front location
It was a great stay with the fam
Food was excellent ( catering to different palates )
Great location, welcoming staff, great food and comfortable beds
Enjoyed our stay
Great premises but room was small
All good, everything good.
Great resort for families with children
Overall excellent stay
Good hotel for relax
Great hotel to spend few days to relax and have fun
Good views and hospitable staff
We'll be back!
Wonderful location - the hotel could offer so much more....
It was great experience to stay in heritance hotel, its really worth to end up our trip.

A relaxing wonderful vacation place. Great for a family or group of friends to enjoy!

had a lovely stay although expected a little more out of the condition of the hotel

Im very happy.
overall it was a nice stay, wish the view from my room was better

relaxing and staff so eager to help all the time. loved it!

The room was just beauuuuuuuuutifullllllllllll! the design and finish is so amazing. Such a nice color palette for the room we absolutely loved it. The staff is soooooooo warm and welcoming. The initial welcome felt like we were royalty. They handed us some local sweets followed by wet towels and welcome drinks. The staff engaged with us with a lot of warmth. The value for money is excellent. The breakfast lay out is beautiful with good taste and a huge variety. The resort design is amazing with a lot of local and Dutch design elements. The pools were warm and felt just right. Overall we really really enjoyed our stay there.
Straight on the beach, big spacious rooms with balcony. Nice welcoming drinks, big swimming pool.
Nice property on the beach with excellent service and friendly staff.
Room service Rukmal made our stay memorable. Also, the restaurant team front office team made a pleasant check-in process
Amazing location Great facilites All inclusive is very good value for money Staff friendly and hospitable

I recently stayed at this hotel and wanted to express my gratitude for the wonderful experience. Everything from the room's comfort to the excellent service exceeded my expectations. The staffs were very friendly. The attention to detail and the overall quality truly made my stay enjoyable. Thank you for providing such a fantastic experienceâ€”I look forward on returning!
Dinner and breakfast were incredibly satisfying, offering a wide variety of options. The beach area is also amazing.

The location is good, there is a long stretch of beach to walk down. The staff are friendly and helped with any issues we faced, they even upgraded us when the AC was not working. The buffet and alacarte was really good, when there was a hiccup in the order the resturant offered to remake the dish for tomorrow.

I decided to book this place because I needed some peace of mind to relax and they proved it was the best choice. the staff are highly professional and they do more than the required to make you satisfied. Everywhere some disturbances may occur but the way they solve it is the most important thing so I would like to thank them for everything and especially Dilsha for everything she did with us. High quality Spa, super delicious food, outstanding hospitality,big room size, the property is built inside the nature so you can expect an exceptional atmosphere.

a beautiful heritage hotel in a great location, wonderful friendly staff, great food and as a coeliac my dietary needs were very kindly accommodated by the chefs, thank you so much I will definitely return was a super stay
The pool, and the food selection on the buffet. Staff are very friendly and helpful at the same time.
Staff, location, pool
Spectacular view , Designed by Geoffrey Bava son of SriLanka and a well known architect in Asia â€¦ his finger prints are there every where ..
Impressive driveway and reception. Comfortable beds. Great food and selection. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Enjoyed the stay.
The location near the beach. Beautiful old hotel. Rooms were very clean. Friendly, helpful staff.

When we arrived, the room was ready. We were served welcome drinks which were fresh fruit juices. The hotel room and the porch outside, overlooking the swimming pool and after that the sea, were very good. Baby cot and tub was provided on request. The premises of the hotel were vast, and roaming in and around the hotel was fun. There was live music in the evening for both the days that we were there. A la Carte Restaurant was very nice. They had the best Sri Lankan food that we tasted. Breakfast Buffet had many options, and multiple types of salads and sandwiches which we absolutely enjoyed.
Nice swimming pools, nice garden, amazing staff and food with huge variety. Lot of space in the rooms as well.

Breakfast great, staff receptive, all food excellent. Hats off to two staff members Dil, who seemed to be everywhere every day. Every Hotel needs a Dilith fixer, sorter, meeter, greeter immediately likeable, shows genuine concern and solves problems. A great face for the Hotel and it's high standards. Also, a great mover on the dance floor where she encouraged several guests to get up and boogie. They just needed to be told!. She told them. They loved it! The other Dil is Dilishia (prob spelled wrong) who serves drinks at the cocktail bar (amongst other stuff) and does so with thoughtfulness, efficiency and class. Always smiling, always with eyes to the customer for easy contact. Happy to assist. Couldn't fault any staff members, but these two stood out for me.
friendly staff nice environment

Pool was great for the kids. So much space for guests and privacy. Rooms on the new wing were nice and modern with ample space and a good view. Breakfast and dinner buffets were well organized, very tasty and a good spread. The local Sri Lankan food was also very tasty. Staff were very good. Special mention to Kalinga running the bar in the day service by the poolside. Lifeguards deserve a special mention, as very helpful to us and the kids.
Staff was very friendly
Comfort Cleniness Large rooms Swimming pools

Our stay was exceptional, even the standard rooms have all the facilities including bathrobes and slippers. Pools are very clean and big. Food was great, loads of varieties, specially morning buffet was perfect.
The staff are so friendly
Location was very good and views were breathtaking. Staff were very helpful

Beautiful old hotel that's retained its old bones- which we liked as we like the idea of a story being before us. Gorgeous beachfront and pool. Loved all the birds. Food good and great cup of tea! Staff really nice and helpful
A little bit dated but wonderful location and hospitable staff.
scenery, luxury and traditional style of architecture, kind and friendly staffs, calm and noiseless environment.
Very comfortable stay. Good property. Near to the turtle hatchery. Good food.

Unexpectedly very nice. I booked a hotel with mixed feelings due to some bad remarks on the web. However, the Heritance is a well aged hotel that currently faces the odds of Covid recovery and also undergoing the necessary revamp work. The staff is great and I cannot share the bad reviews on the web. I guess it is related to some â€œAll-inâ€ guests expecting an all-in hospitality on the press of a button, forgetting that kindness also needs kindness on the side of the guest.

I guess i loved everything about the hotel. What an amazing location, right on the beach, the lobby couldn't be better with a view of swimming pool and then the ocean. Rooms are comfortable, spacious and very clean. Furnitures are excellent. Overall hotel ambience is so good. They conducted some cultural shows for the guest and has some live music. Hotel staff were polite and helpful. It was a memorable stay for us
Great place to relax, food was alright.
Definitely not five stars :) extras are very expensive. But overall not bad hotel :)
Beautiful open spaces and our room looked over the beach for sunsets. The room was large and clean and there were things to do while it rained. Go to the spa !!!

A fantastic Geoffrey Bawa property - ambience and aesthetic is superb. There was work going on in the property but it didn't bother us. There is something for everyone - the beach, the pool, walking paths, great architecture, excellent food
Good location with great ocean views
Great location Friendly and ready to assist staff Well maintained garden
Such a wonderful calm environment. Highly supportive staff.

Absolutely beautiful location and architecture. Rooms had a beautiful view and were spotless. The Spa experience was great and the therapist Prima was very professional and courteous. Overall the front desk staff and other staff were very good. The breakfast buffet had good variety too.

We chose to stay at the Heritance Ahungalla due to its mix of old-school architecture and modern comforts. The staff were friendly. We liked the fact that there were two large pools, one of which was a quiet pool for families. The food was good, too.
The pools were amazing, it had a real colonial style to it which was fun.

My husband and I stayed here with friends for four nights after we had been travelling around Sri Lanka. We ended up staying at the hotel for pretty much our whole four days there as we were enjoying relaxing and also there were government enforced curfews and things were difficult at that time. The hotel was large but because the staff were super nice so it always felt intimate. I was 5 months pregnant and always felt well looked after and cared for by the staff. Our room and bathroom was large with lovely character and a balcony. The rooms varied in size but all were comfortable. The rooms were well equipped with everything we needed and anything extra we just called reception for and they were very happy to come and sort anything. Our Aircon stopped working at 4am and a maintenance person came up immediately to look at it. Namal did a wonderful job freshening up our room every day, and we were always excited to see what creative bed decorations he'd left for each of us after breakfast. The breakfast was very good. We ate lunch at the pool bar every day and dinner at the restaurant every evening - these both had outside areas so we were able to always be outside. The food was good and a good price, but the menu was a little small to eat there every day! We enjoyed both pools very much. We played table tennis and tennis, but the net took a couple of days to be put up (it was in town being serviced) and there were only two rackets. We used the laundry service which was great and a very good price. We all had massages which were wonderful and the therapists were lovely, but it was expensive. The hotel provided a room for our driver for free and offered his meals for around Â£1 a meal, so obviously we were able to pay for that.
The manager was fantastic and helped with all aspects of our stay.
it was probably off season so not crowded at all. really enjoyed the property was large and so airy

What a beautiful property with a clean beach. Clean Rooms and great staff. They have two excellent pools. Easy Check in and Check Out. Its the perfect resort to just relax and rejuvinate. Amazing food at the pool
Comfortable bed and breakfast was excellent
The service at dinner was extremely slow but the staff and management was apologetic about that

We booked for 2 nights unexpectedly as the election curfew messed with our original plans. The resort was mostly empty. It's not a full all-inclusive, meaning some guests pay a la carte. For the all-inclusive, the selection is OK - local spirits and a short list of cocktails. Wine is only served in the restaurant at lunch and dinner, which is weird. Food was good, but couldn't help the feeling that because it was not fully occupied the choice wasn't all there. The pool is nice, the beach is nearby (but not really a great beach, some serious surf). Rooms were OK, very clean, wifi was fast and the overall experience positive. Staff were extremely friendly and welcoming, which helped a lot. The gym was also a welcome addition - nothing big or fancy but there to be used, which is always a nice touch.
Quantity & variety seems to be the hotel focus. Quality ~ lacking for a 5 star hotel
Itâ€™s vast and rooms are very spacious.
Its good during weekdays for couple.
Breakfast is good, good Sri Lankan food selections but limited English breakfast options (Hash Brown, Sausages, bacon etc)

we had a suite and never expected that the bath/showe will lick - every time we took a shower we had to call housekeeping to clean the bathroom because it was full of water licking everywhere... there is a big potential for this hotel but it feel like an old and not renovated
The buffet was good. Variety of snacks. Lovely decorations.

The best thing about this hotel is the nature. You will be surrounded by monkeys, birds, chipmunks, iguanas (who may sometimes even swim in the pool :) ), little crabs, not to mention dogs, cats, fish in the ponds, and all kinds of insects, big and small. The territory is pretty green and provides a lot of natural shade, saving you from sunburn. Massage in the Spa was good. The room we were in was pretty spacious and featured a beautiful view over one of the pools and a little "chunk" of the ocean. The food was good, and the selection was quite interesting, mixing local and more "European-oriented" cuisines in a balanced way.
Very grand hotel. Nice approach road, reception, rooms and grounds
good location. kind staff.

I had an amazing stay at this hotel with my family! The room was spotlessly clean. The staff's hospitality was exceptional, making us feel welcome and cared for throughout our visit. I highly recommend this hotel for a memorable family getaway!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Friendliness of staff was exceptional - always with a smile and willing to help. Loved the designing and the relaxing atmosphere of the hotel. Rooms were large and comfortable and buffet had variety of food options. Live music in the evening, walking paths, beautiful beach, well maintained pools, nice spa, gaming activities and a library - there was something for everyone ! Hotel was busy proving to be popular with tourists. Highly recommend this hotel!
Welcoming and friendly service always with a smile.
Delicious Breakfast buffet available daily. The pool area was very nice. Very helpful and kind staff. Good service. Nice and clean accommodations. Highly recommendable hotel.
We were impressed by the hotel staff and hospitality. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. They went above and beyond every moment. Would come back here to stay again.

The hotel lobby is just breath taking, this hotel was chosen as a relaxation stop , which really did that, Our room was facing the sea in the first building what a super view we could hear the waves crashing on the shore, Had a great meal then went to listen to the saxophone player at the Bar he was superb what a talent, Their was also an artist selling his paintings so purchased 2 as it was his last night their .Breakfast was plentiful something for everyone , my son even managed a massage before we left. Thank you for the experience.

Amazing property with great amenities! I really liked the spaces and connection to the surrounding and the environment! Truely a Geoffrey Bawaâ€™s Architectural masterpiece. Really appreciate the friendly staff, whom were always positive and attentive to provide an amazing service! Special Thanks goes to Kavindu! Even she was a Trainee she made sure that we were treated well at the property.
Everything was excellent ğŸ‘
The best hotel i visited. The food was amazing. I recommend getting a luxury suite

The entrance and location was very Cosy.. the check in was very easy and well assisted.. the welcome drinks were served in a unique cart...the room was clean with all required amenities.. hotel has two clean swimming pools...nearby the beach ..very good buffet in dinner and breakfast with infinite options...highly recommended

We booked the luxury suite and premium room. We were given special treatment which was incredibly nice as I had an infant and toddler. The staff were super friendly and cooperative. The rooms were very comfortable. The bathrooms were clean. The pool and beach was just amazing!

The location right next to the big and almost empty beach was magnificent. The experience at the spa was great, Prima gave me one of the best massages Iâ€™ve ever had and you can tell she has a medical background. If you stay at this hotel, you should definitely get a massage. Chef Heshan and his team made the best meals. Absolutely amazing food! Love this place and I would love to come back.
The atmosphere and the welcoming staff
The environment
The location
Food, facilities, staff, perfect to rest
Overall service and Room
The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The pool was great and the public beach is nice. The hotel's food was the best part and the restaurant's options were excellent.
Very nice hotel with a well trained staff. View from the hotel room was amazing. Buffet had so many options. There are two large swimming pools.
Beautiful place great staff and very friendly and caring and clean definitely worth a visit loved my time there Thank you ğŸ™ğŸ½
The room. Very large and comfortable.
Food was good, staff was nice, rooms were cool!
Amazing location
good are the 2 separate Pool's / Staff is VERY helpful, extremely nice , we had a wonderful time and will come back Its a place to relax , not having bar's / Pubs around the corner which is great.
itâ€™s beautiful and has the perfect location for beach lovers

The Heritance Ahungalla Hotel is the place you need to visit, Absolutely the best hotel we have stayed in by far. We have two Children and whom experienced the Heritance with us and weâ€™re so looked after from start to finish, with everything you would need from stunning nearby beaches, relaxing swimming pools mind blowing food rooms to die for and out of this world views. Every staff member at the Heritance Ahungalla are so friendly and efficient at what they do they really do make you feel the true Sri Lankan Experience. A special shoutout to the beautiful kind ladies in the reception and the very kind restaurant staff, they all treated our two daughters and us really well and thatâ€™s something special. The Heritance Ahungalla has everything you would need from the food which is not just a variety of cuisine from all over the world as well as traditional Sri Lankan dishes. The swimming pools are cleaned and sterile overnight ready for the next morning, the live music was a touch all of its own and a great thing to come across.
amazing hotel. highly recommend. food/ service / location / pool / architecture.
designs by bawa and drawings by laki. the architecture/ location/ beach
Excellent spre8.
The Spa and how well the treatments were. Extremely professional and friendly. Highly recommended spağŸ‘Œ hotel room was comfy and the toilet was good especially the shower.
Nearly all the staff were brilliant, too many to mention.
Location,Beach front and the pool.
Location was good. Breakfast and dinner had lots of options.
When they say a sea view room double check with them. Our sea view was fully covered with trees. The rooms were really good. Beautifully furnished. Loved the radio option.
Nice hotel, good food but some personal in restaurant need to be more attentive to customers. When you ask somting they donâ€™t even stop just say something and walk away dont care about clients
Too many people and th hotel was not clean enough. the pool was unclean

The hotel is generally good, with good food and is in a great location/setting. The pools were well maintained and weren't over crowded, and are safe for younger children. The architecture of the hotel is still impressive.
The pool in front of the room
Lovely location and good service of staff

I love this place for its beauty and architecture and have been coming here for years (the first time 30 years ago as it was my Sri Lankan fatherâ€™s favourite) . However the profile of the hotel seems to have changed -accommodating large groups of badly behaved guests has brought the experience down .
It was big and next to the beach
Pool and the beach was great. Food was good and had a variety of choices

A luxurious hotel on the shore of the Indian ocean. Imho, the contingent here is not very pleasant, someone turns on his music on the speaker while you listen to live music, someone tik-toki watching at full volume, and the staff does not care. Also, guides or some other people are constantly pestering on the beach and offering their overpriced services. You are just perceived as a money bag here.
This was my third visit- not happy
Itâ€™s 5 stars hotel with guaranteed cleanness and some degree of service
hotel staff is very nice, breakfast and dinner were good. we really liked the pool.
Woods style room
The design of the hotel and the pool
Glamour on the website. Reality very much less than 5 stars. Hugely disappointing.
Food is ok

This is rhe 2nd time i came to stay.. Thanks.
Excellent, polite, friendly staff, above expectations.
Nothing!
The pools and the spar were good. Food (although there wasn't much variety) was good.
Duty Manager was excellent. The staff were very helpful and pleasant

There are no comments available for this review

Recently returned from a 2 week stay at Heritance. Had a great holiday. The hotel staff go out of their way to make your holiday enjoyable. As always with any holiday, there were things which were good and others that we felt could have been improved. The hotel is right on the beach and has lovely garden areas with plenty of available sunbeds. The pool staff are on hand to provide you with sunbed cushions and towels. They do, however, need to provide more sunshade umbrellas. Although the grounds have plenty of trees which can provide shade, having the flexibility of an umbrella would have been better. There are 2 pools, both well kept and maintained. One is quite busy because itâ€™s nearer to the pool bar; the other is nice and quiet but still near enough to nip along for a cheeky cocktail! There are 2 restaurants on site - the buffet and a separate restaurant which AI guests had to pay for. However, when we enquired at reception about using this, we were told we couldnâ€™t by one member of staff and then we could, by another staff member, but only at certain times, which were not our choice. It seemed a little strange, so for some variety we opted to go further down the beach to Jungle Beach restaurant a few nights, which had tables on the sand and a reasonably priced food and drinks menu. The AI list of drinks/cocktails at the hotel was fine for our tastes - about 8 cocktails to choose from and local spirits available. The bar staff were quite happy to top up the measures if that was requested. Just one odd thing thoughâ€¦the hotel provide tea time snacks at 4 pm (cakes, sandwiches etc) and I asked for a glass of wine to accompany the snacks, but was told that wine was only included in the buffet restaurant and I would have to pay at the bar. Again, a little strange. I couldnâ€™t see the difference between wine in the restaurant and wine at the bar. The buffet food is quite spicy. There is a pizza station and a pasta station, but most other things have some element of spice in them. We just had the basic room, which was fine. Plenty of space. Bathroom not the biggest but adequate, with a rainfall shower. Towels were changed every day and the sheets every other day. The cleanliness of the room was spot on. We travelled with TUI and used them for the excursion to the Udawalawe National Park. Enjoyable, but a long day. Pick up at 4.40 am then quite a long drive (2 1/2 hours). Saw lots of elephants. We then headed off for lunch, which was very good. Sometimes on these trips the lunch is hardly edible. We were told beforehand that we would be given time to swim after lunch, but as the whole stop was just a hour, there wasnâ€™t time to swim, which was disappointing. Then off to Galle. The trip, as they always do, included visits to local traders - wood carved elephants and moonstone mine/jewellery, which wasn't for us but obviously you have to go along, and then back to the hotel for 6 pm. A lot of the TUI experiences are far away so start with a long drive - Yala National Park, Kandy, so we opted for the one which was the closest. But, still a tiring day, albeit an enjoyable experience. There are local traders on the beach, who are always trying to catch the attention of the hotel guests. They mainly sell clothing and there is also a local trip provider, going to the same places as the ones which TUI go to. I asked the advice of the customer relations member of staff and she wouldnâ€™t recommend as they wouldnâ€™t have the same, if any, levels of insurance. But, obviously their prices are cheaper. We were disappointed in the weather. It was very warm every day but about 2 or 3 of the days were washed out so everyone headed for the inside areas. Out of 14 days, only about 5 were full sunshine. The others were overcast but as I said, still warm. We went to Thailand same time last year and had wall to wall sunshine. I know the weather is in Godâ€™s hands but people may prefer to know. Use the tuk tuks. We enjoyed grabbing one outside the hotel grounds and asking the driver to take us to various places. The driver will stay with you and only charge once youâ€™re back at the hotel. The most we paid for a round trip was 1000 LKR (about Â£2.80). Visit the turtle sanctuary down the road and/or go for a river cruise on the Madu River. Overall, I would recommend staying at Heritance Ahungalla. The staff are fabulous and my slight quibbles re food and drink didnâ€™t spoil the holiday.

I was in hotel from 26 January 2025 up to 3 February 2025. staff is really friendly and always ready to help. Food is tasty. Spa services is really good and reasonable prices. Beach is clear. In few words satisfaction and relax!!! Hint: order box launches=)

Before I came, I was planning this as a one off, knowing there are several places around the world I'd like to visit. Within 10 minutes of arrival, I knew I would be coming back as the happy smiling workers on reception and the cleanliness of the hotel The hotel is designed by the top Sri Lankan architect Geofrey Bawa and the first thing you see on arrival is the infinity pool. After staying here for a few days, it became clear the restaurant team are quite incredible. With so many people arriving from many countries around the world with so many food expectations and dietary requirements it was quite interesting for me to watch the waiters endlessly making sure everything ran smoothly. Mentioning the waiters, I must make mention of a very smart new trainee waiter called Thurlitha, who was being trained by Jacob, a very experienced waiter who I had the pleasure of watching from my corner watching all the incredible work the staff performed during my stay.
