The French style pastries, the wonderful pizzas included several Sri Lankan fish toppings and a Black Pork Pizza, something I had never heard of before. I'd tell everyone to come here, and come with a completely open mind. Yes, you can enjoy English food here if you need a roast lamb or roast beef with all the trimmings, but I like local food wherever I am, so happily tried a cheese hopper or red rice with vegetable curry served with mango and pineapple chutney. Best thing for me to start the morning with is with a cup of Ceylon tea and a puff pastry or two, if you are truly adventurous try a puff pastry filled with fish curry. I did, because I had never seen one before and just had to try one. I am so pleased I was in All Inclusive, that made it easy to keep tabs of the drink and extra food eaten round the pool. Glad there is a gym here, almost impossible to avoid putting a little bit of weight...! My room was spotless, and was so sorry to leave Heritance Beach Resort to return to the miserable cold weather of England. First thing I did back home was to get straight onto Tui to book another holiday in Sri Lanka at the same resort.

We spent our vacation here. The main goal was to stay at some peaceful place on the shore of the ocean to abstract from the noise and vibes of the city. And Heritance Ahungalla was the perfect choice for this. A great villa type hotel located on the front line of the ocean surrounded by palms and vibrant plants. The room was comfortable and clean, with all standard amenities. Two great swimming pools on the territory. Food was tasty and variable. Special thanks to one of the supervisor guys Chamuditha who was super helpful and made our stay very comfortable.

I highly recommend hotel heritance ahungalla.The staff were good welcoming and friendly.The room was very comfortable and very spacious.Specially it had very beautiful sea view. Food was very tasty and good looking special thanks for executive chef Lakmal. Overall hospitality was incredible.

We had a memorable stay with good service by all the Staff. The food was amazing with a wide varity.. The guided tour by the hotel staff on request to know about Architect Geoferry Bawa was conducted very nicely explaining a lot of details. Thr rooms are very clean. We had a good time at thr pool and the bar loungr listening to the luve music.

At the beginning of last year 2024, we planned to take a vacation in a sunny location. I live in Belgium and here almost all year round the weather is cloudy and often rainy with very few sunny days during the year. We decided to celebrate the beginning of the new year in a sunny location by the ocean, I decided on Sri Lanka.I had a choice between Riu Hotel or Heritance Ahungalla from the Ahungalla region, Bentota. During December the weather is very hot in this region with few days or hours of rain.We hit the jackpot and fate decided Heritance Ahungalla ... the best decision of fate. A great location, a very friendly staff, a clean and very well-kept hotel, a restaurant with a rich and varied assortment for all demanding people, prepared meals for the new year 2025 left me speechless.I'm very sorry that I can't remember the names of the staff, but thank you: the restaurant manager, the reception manager, the waiters and waitresses, the cooks, the assistant cooks and the chefs, the cleaning staff, the bar staff, the pool staff.All of you together made us a wonderful vacation and we really felt at home. We definitely plan to come back. Thanks for everything,from Belgium ps:maybe someone remeber us ;)

Room was decent, nothing fancy. Beachfront was nothing to die for. There are so many better beaches in southern coastline of Sri Lanka. The let down was how the hotel staff discriminate between dark skin people and white skin people. Initially I thought it was a mistake, then a coincidence when differential treatment continued and then understood it is a systemic issue in this facility. All 3 of us had experiences that we can relate to. Also, they make you wear a wrist band during your stay: reminds me of a hospital admission. Perhaps, they cannot remember that you are a hotel guest without having the band.

The pool was very nice and I loved how I could go to the beach every day. The views are beautiful and the rooms are excellent. Room service is great too. Comfy bed, nothing to complain about. Very wide variety of delicious breakfast foods. Had a great time with my family. You need to come here!!!

Jayaru and all staff were excellent- very helpful and friendly. Massage was great, room was comfy, food was good. The selection of local food and western food was good. The beach was clean and not crowded. Swimming at sunset was a bonus. Thanks Heritance!

The hotel is huge, rooms are big and there are never queues. Pools are good and the pool boys also nice. The housekeeping staff, especially Rukmal is amazing. Downside; The hotel has terrible price policy. You need to pay for everything + 18% and extra service charge. The prices are huge and complexity unfair. This is the reason why I will not return here.

We visited Heritance Ahungalla during a family reunion - 21 of us. We found the staff very friendly, service excellent. It is a property right on the beach, and beautifully designed to add to the experience. Their head office had not communicated our booking to the hotel. This resulted in a little delay in getting us into our rooms, but the hotel staff managed this issue well. The wide variety of western and Sri Lankan food were available. The tastes did not disappoint. Great job chef. All in all, a great experience. I will recommend Heritance Ahungalla to my friends. Thanks.

we had a fantastic family holiday. lovely ocean for swimming. Big swimming pool. The food was great with great service. The rooms were clean and well appointed. Plenty of space to hang out play games. Nice spa service too. Happy to recommend this hotel for a holiday in Sri Lanka

This hotel has provided a very relaxing experience for our family. All the staff is very friendly, helpful, and respectful. Spacious rooms, great amenities and food. We only went for the breakfast option but you can opt for all inclusive. Rich choice for breakfast and very delicious and fresh. They have lots of fun activities planned for each day and live music in the evenings. We were lucky enough to celebrate new years at Heritance hotel as they put together a beautiful New Yearâ€™s Eve gala dinner. Big variety of food options and all delicious they also had a band. At midnight they had fireworks set off creating a magical atmosphere.

Food and service was extremely Good. Chef balbirsingh had served us jain food & the taste was extremely amazing. Pure veg Jain food highly recommended by Chef. Hotel is also fantastic Location is really nice I highly recommend all to go visit. Thankyou..

I recently stayed at Heritance Ahungalla, and it was a fantastic experience! The rooms were spacious and offered a spectacular view of the ocean from the balcony, a great beach and swimming pool, all of which were truly breathtaking. The staff was extremely cooperative and went out of their way to ensure we had a comfortable stay. Traveling with two young kids can be challenging, but their attentiveness made all the difference. While the restaurant didn't have many vegetarian options on the menu, the chef, Balbeer Singh, went above and beyond to prepare delicious vegetarian meals for us and our kids throughout our stay. This thoughtful gesture truly enhanced our experience and made us feel valued. I highly recommend Heritance Ahungalla for families looking for a relaxing and welcoming getaway. We look forward to visiting again!

Must visit luxery property in bentota...amazing staff anf service...excellent room size and view...large poool...private cleaned beach ....large buffet ...nothing to complain about this hotel...its a complete package..spa is must try in this hotel....reception and restuarant staffs are well trained and offered awesome experience..one will melt in their hospitality....definitly will come back to this hotel...

Very warm welcome and super friendly staff with utmost care. Awesome pool experience with a great view of the beach. Rooms are spacious, maintained clean and a nice bathroom. I certainly recommend this property for a good holiday along with family and friends ğŸ§¡

**Google Review for Heritance Ahungalla** Heritance Ahungalla is a stunning resort with a private beach and well-maintained pools. The rooms are neat, and the overall environment is clean and family-friendly. Itâ€™s a great place for a vacation with kids. However, the service leaves much to be desired. At check-in, the front desk staff greet you warmly and create an impression of excellent service, but the actual intention to help seems to be lacking. We traveled as two families and requested rooms close to each other. The staff promised to accommodate us the next day, but despite multiple follow-ups, no one informed us why it wasnâ€™t arranged. Additionally, there were several service lapses: - When we reported non-functional TV services, no one responded. - An emergency housekeeping request was ignored until we followed up repeatedly every 30 minutes. - A simple request for bananas for a child after the paid breakfast buffet had closed was also ignored, with staff disappearing without fulfilling the request. While the staff are polite and pleasant in interactions, their inability to provide timely and reliable service is disappointing for a five-star resort. Compared to the service at The Kingsbury Colombo, Heritance Ahungalla falls significantly short. Overall, a beautiful property with potential, but the service experience needs serious improvement to match its five-star rating.

Great hotel. Clean, very friendly staff especially Visal (jake) Rebecca,nelka,chinthaka,Ealing and the pool attendants very attentive and pleasant, all the staff go out if their way to make sure you have everything you need Felt upset when leaving will definitely go back.

Thank you for the services you have provided. Highly recommended, and we would like to come again to have a wonderful stay. Staff was really friendly, and the food was really delicious. Our room was arranged nicely, and it was perfect with the sea view.

The stay was excellent! Clean and comfortable rooms, staff is so friendly and nice, and also a great location with the sea view. The food was delicious, and the service was top-notch. Definitely a place Iâ€™d recommend for a relaxing getaway.

Beautiful location on the beach and 2 pools with plenty of shade. Staff were wonderful and extremely helpful. There was a good choice of options for eating at the hotel which was fortuitous because there wasnâ€™t really anywhere local to eat. Customer relations were great when we had an issue with our fan and fridge and also assisted us with booking a boat safari.

Lovely hotel, but remote location. Great rooms, large, comfy and cool. Good functional bathrooms. Staff are lovely, very friendly. Music at night is both entertaining and WAY too loud. Options outside the hotel are limited unless you want to travel miles. No local restaurants or bars for example. Swimming pools are to die for, plenty of beds and space for all. Nice overhanging trees for shade. Location on beach is lovely, sea very rough when we were there.

Heritance Ahungalla was an incredible experience! A special thanks to Jayaru, the Guest Relations Executive, for her warm and friendly service. She made sure everything was perfect during my stay. The food was fresh and delicious, with plenty of options to enjoy. The pool was beautiful and a great place to relax while taking in the stunning ocean views. The rooms were clean, spacious, and super comfortable. The whole place had such a peaceful vibe. Iâ€™d highly recommend this hotel and canâ€™t wait to visit again!

Thank you so much. Everything was nice food and view We would love to came again next time visit Sri Lanka. If you book this hotel you can stay hole day and chilling. Massage was also nice when you visit here you should try it. And bar was also nice I had cake and cocktails:) Chamuditha bar supervisor very good.

A special thank you to Jayaru, the Guest Relations Executive, for her outstanding service and warm hospitality that made my stay at Heritance Ahungalla truly special. The food was amazing, with plenty of delicious options to choose from, and the pool was a great place with ocean view. The rooms were spotless, comfortable, and perfect for a relaxing getaway. The staff's friendliness and attention to detail made the experience even better. I highly recommend Heritance Ahungalla

One of the best places in down south to enjoy a dayout. One of the friendliest staffs. The buffet has a variety of food items and the sea food are super delicious. They allowed early check-ins and late check -outs. Nothing to say as a bad review.

Old, noisy, really commercial hotel with huge buffets. Everything could use a fresh painting and cleaning. Staff is not really customer minded. No special efforts are made or extra smile. If you look foor cosiness, itâ€™s not the placeğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜

We ended our trip around Sri Lanka with a 4 night stay at this hotel. Despite a few hiccups accessing one of our hotel rooms doors daily, we had a pleasant stay. Although some of the trainee staff on reception lacked enthusiasm the rest of the hotel staff were friendly and hospitable. Special mentions to the housekeeping team, the restaurant staff, particularly Waranu, who went above and beyond during our meals and even got one of the chefs to write down a recipe for us. Also thanks to Rebecca and the pool bar team and Jayaru who always welcomed us with a smile and was happy to show us the hotel amenities.

Disappointing Dining Experience at Ahungalla Heritance I had high expectations when visiting Ahungalla Heritance (part of the Aitken Spence chain), but the food quality was a major disappointment. The lunch buffet was underwhelming, with most dishes lacking salt and flavor. The fried rice, made with samba rice, was a poor choice and didnâ€™t complement the rest of the dishes at all. Tea-time snacks were no betterâ€”minimal variety and nothing appetizing or memorable. We even raised our concerns with the chefs, but unfortunately, there was no noticeable improvement. For a reputed hotel chain, the dining experience was far below standard. I hope the management takes this feedback seriously and works on upgrading their food quality and variety.

If youâ€™re looking for the perfect getaway, Heritance Ahungalla is the ultimate destination. This 5-star resort delivers an exceptional experience in every aspect â€“ from its stunning location to its warm and attentive service. The staff are truly outstanding. Their friendliness and professionalism make you feel right at home from the moment you arrive. Whether itâ€™s at check-in, the restaurants, or by the pool, they go above and beyond to ensure your stay is unforgettable. The food is simply divine, offering a wide variety of dishes that cater to every palate. From authentic local Sri Lankan cuisine to international delights, every meal feels like a gourmet experience. The resortâ€™s location is breathtaking, set against a backdrop of serene beaches and lush greenery. The well-maintained grounds, infinity pools, and proximity to nature make it an ideal spot to relax and unwind. Heritance Ahungalla is more than just a resort â€“ itâ€™s an experience. Whether youâ€™re traveling for a romantic escape, a family vacation, or just some time to yourself, this place will leave you longing to return. Highly recommended!

The room and the service in both the hotel and the buffet area was really good, the staff were so accomodating and kind. The room itself was really clean and comfortable, everything we needed was there and room service was really good too! Highly recommend and will come back if we visit again!!

Highly recommend this place The experience and the ambience at Heritance was amazing. We as a couples state here for 7 days. The best part about the property is that it has a direct beach access. The beaches are clean and less crowded. The hotels staff is very polite and warm. Thank you for your courteous upgrade to a suite. The restore manager Mr Pradeep was very kind and understanding of our needs as we are vegetarian. The soothing sound of the waves is the best part of the resort.

Pathetic service staff was so rude Room lock was not working then they change my room In that room the electric fault was there. When the staff came to resolve the issue they couldn't provide any solution. Check in 22/11/24 Prateek Bansal...

We were blown away by the exceptional gestures from the team. Itâ€™s amazing to see such service driven passionate team. Special thanks to Rebecca Chamuditha, AST FM Kavindu and the cheff who made our stay great. Heritance always have jewel of people.

I visited Heritance Ahungalla during Nov-24. The property is excellent. The hospitality is awesome. WE have throughly enjoyed each moment at Heritance as it is touching the sea beach. My family enjoyed all the thrills at Heritance Ahungalla. The Chef - Mr. Balbir helped us to serve all the Indian veg food as per India taste. Thank you Mr. Balbir for taking care of us of 2 days stat at Heritance Ahungalla. Regards, Kalpesh Gandhi

This beautiful hotel is perfectly located on the beach with a great swimming pool just behind. This stay has been something that we looked forward to when we were planning our honeymoon. And the stay was a wonderful start for our journey planned. Everything was perfect. The room, food, and not to forget the wonderful staff are friendly and attentive. Without a doubt, this gorgeous hotel exceeded our expectations, leaving us with cherished memories that we'll forever hold. Highly recommend for couples seeking an intimate and memorable getaway.

This was the last stop on a busy 2-week Group Tour of Sri Lanka. It was our least favourite hotel. It looks tired in places. We had a spacious ground floor room with a small triangular shaped bathroom. The shower doors looked in need of a good clean. Our patio doors we discovered hadn't been locked properly so anyone could have pushed them open. In the early hours of the first morning we heard 2 distinctive taps on the patio doors which was unnerving. We didn't get up to investigate but whilst the hotel is behind gates and security at the front it seemed to me that there was nothing stopping anyone wandering in off the beach area. This hotel is very popular with locals especially at weekends so when we arrived the hotel was packed with a large group of young men playing volleyball in the main pool. All sunbeds were taken by families sitting round chatting. As this was the only day of R & R part on our trip it was a bit concerning but by Sunday afternoon things had quietened down. This is a very large busy hotel so breakfast was a bun fight and it took us 10-15 minutes to get served tea or coffee. Nice outside seating area by one of the bars. As you are nearer Colombo you will get pestered on the beach to buy things. The sea was too rough to swim in and there are dangerous rip tides. There is nothing to do locally but we did visit the Victor Hasselblad Sea Turtle Research And Conservation Centre just 3 miles up the road. Well worth an hour's visit to see the wonderful work they are doing. None of the multiple hotel staff hanging around reception had heard of it even though it is literally up the same road. But a taxi driver Googled it for us and took us there and back. The Hotel is off one busy road with shops and other Hotels but not in a specially pretty area. This area was impacted by the tsunami so you will see little graveyards and monuments in memory of people who lost their lives. Especially on the train that got swept off the track.

Thanks to Heritance Ahungalla team for doing everything for guests. The view from our room was amazing. Food very tasty. Perfect service. All employees were very kindly. Special thanks to bar supervisor Chamuditha organising for us romantic seafood-dinner.

Staying Experian here is very good. Room services are in time and staff is very friendly. Everyday activities keep your fun on during the stay. Food test good and chef BALBEER SINGH had provided us very much homely test. Thanks to Mr.Singh we had really great experience in food.

The time here was great and specially during night. Everyone here was passionate and swift at what they did. When i was here it was the 31st of october, they went all out to celebrate halloween and brought that spirit to life as most other places in sri lanka doesnt consider it as a holiday. Also special thanks to Duminda and his colleagues for the help.

Beautiful sea and gorgeous largest pool. The hotel staff are good and thank you especially to Chamuditha the Kitchen Supervisor who looked after us, helped us and so friendly and helpful. He makes the hotel a much better place!! We have loved Sri Lanka and the hotel really made a massive effort for Halloween for those that like the celebrations.

A fabulous hotel with architecture built to incorporate original trees. The open, internal courtyards with trees and creepers give a welcoming and airy feel. Collectively the hotel boasts some of the friendliest staff we have encountered on our travels. From Hashini greeting us at every trip to the restaurant; Chamuditha supervising the restaurant team and sharing top tips for where to visit and the best time of day to go; and Dilan who kept our room spotless. And to the many we haven't specifically called out, you didn't go unnoticed!!! Our stay spanned Halloween and we were treated to a restaurant night that went all in. From costumes to decorations and desserts. What a treat!! Would highly recommend to anyone wanting to stay on the west coast of Sri Lanka.

My stay at the Heritance Ahungalla was absolutely amazing the food and my room were exceptional. The staff were very friendly and accommodating from the moment i arrived and went above and beyond to make me feel a valued customer throughout my stay. I would highly recommend this hotel and i am looking forward to my next visit.

I had a quick 2 Nights stay at Heritance Ahungalla in October during my recent trip to Srilanka. This resort is in quiant town of Ahungalla which is roughly 2 hrs drive from Colombo Airport. Though the entrance to the resort is bang on main road, the rooms and overall facilities of the resort are tucked away in quite zone away from the main road. The resort has choice of rooms with Garden View, Pool View and Sea View. All the rooms have a sit out or balcony. All other facilities needed for relaxing holiday like Restaurants, Gym, Games Centre, Swimming Pool, SPA is available at the resort. The rooms at the resort are of decent size with comfortable and functional bathroom. The upkeep of the rooms and overall resort, facilities are top notch. The staff at resort are welcoming and helpful to your requests. The resorts direct access to the beach is added bonus with the beach being quiet scheduled and more or less being private to In House Guests. For Dining options the resort has their Main Restaurant which offers Buffet & Al Carte options apart from Pool Bar and Speciality Restaurants too. The Breakfast buffet is sumptuous with vide variety of food ranging from Local Srilankan to international cusine. The Vegetarians options for breakfast don't disappoint either with plenty of options from Local Srilankan, Indian & Continental Cuisine to choose from. The taste and quality of food served at breakfast is equally of high standard . For Lunch or Dinner you can choose to go with Buffet or Al Carte. The prices for dishes in Al Carte is quite reasonable with decent choice for Vegetarians too. I had my dinner at their all day dining restaurant and surprisingly the Indian Chef dished out simple yet delicious Indian Fare. I would like to extend my appreciation for the Chef Mr.Balbeer Singh who was quite accommodative and helpful in suggesting the food choice considering we were vegetarian. If you are craving for Indian Food at this resort then don't hesitate to reach out to Chef Balbeer Singh who will at your service with great suggestions. Thanks Chef for all your help and support during our stay at Heritance Ahungalla. Keep doing the good work. From Excursion or Sightseeing Point Heritance Ahungalla is reasonably placed from key sightseeing places like Galle, Bentota, Hikkaduwa etc; Most of these places are under 30-60 minutes drive from resort. I throughly enjoyed my stay at Heritance Ahungalla and will definitely look forward to staying at Heritance Ahungalla the next time I am in Srilanka. A big shout out and sincere appreciation to all the people behind the scenes at the resort who are going the extra mile to keep the guests comfortable and happy.

The staff are a great asset to this Hotel. We stayed for 2 nights and enjoyed the pool, dining experience and the other facilities. It rained some but it was still very warm and humid. Although in need of maintenance the rooms were adequate. We would recommend a stay here.

Recently stayed at heritance Ahungalla. Its a good example what a hotel caters.. luxury, location and smiling conceirage ready to welcome you. Rooms are very spacious and with all the facilities. They have 2 huge pools and beautiful beach.They have laid buffet dinner, with wide variety of food whether it was for non veg or veg. They make all the effort to cater you. Chef Balbeer Singh took really good care of us and he is an amazing cook too. As i am a vegetarian he personally took good care of my meals. Worth staying place.

Our stay at heritance ahungalla was nothing short or amazing... the food, comfort, familiarity and staff was very warm.the hotel truly captures the nature at its very best form and delivers utmost luxury to its occupants.... Would recommend 11/10... cant wait to come back next time!

I had two amazing days with my girlfriend in Heritance Ahungalla, and we couldn't have asked for more! The hotel has an amazing beachfront setting with beautiful views of the Indian Ocean. The staff was very friendly and accommodating from the moment we arrived, and they went above and beyond to make us feel valued during our visit. With a private balcony facing the ocean, our accommodation was airy, contemporary, and spotlessly clean, making it the ideal place to watch the sunset. The cuisine was yet another highlight; there was an amazing array of delicacies from around the world and locally, at the buffet. The most romantic part of our trip was the candlelit dinner by the ocean. The infinity pool was also a hit with us; it was like being in a tropical paradise. The grounds were nicely manicured, and we relished quiet

The hotel although at first sight seemed a little shabby in places, turned out to be one of the best places we have ever stayed, it has a certain unique charm all of its own..The staff were all incredibly friendly and attentive. The food was lovely and lots to choose from. The pools were nice, one more for families, the other quieter. Always sunbeds available. Nice low key entertainment. We enjoyed it so much, we have booked again...

Amazing hospitality. Great locality. Staff was very good. Clean pool, great resort atmosphere. Located well with all amenities. Had a great experience living there. Live music is played every evening by good well known bands. Drinks were also affordable.

Our last visit to this wonderful hotel was in 2022. We have also been coming since the early 2000â€™s too. We had a very nice suite on the 3rd level, overlooking the main pool and near the main restaurant. Despite the rainy weather and rough seas in October, we had a great time. Food (as buffet menu) was fantastic, staff were very helpful. Any little issues weâ€™re dealt with professionally and quickly. We would like to thank all the staff we had contact with. Special thanks go to Ms Jayaru in Customer Relations, Chaminda in housekeeping, Ms Hasini and Duminda (who remembered us from 2022) in the main restaurant. They were able to reserve a table by the window we liked. A very enjoyable stay and a place we would recommend.

We had a great experience there. The staff and service was superb. The pool is open until 8pm. There was an indoor games area and library. I loved those places to spend the time. The rooms were clean and had a good bathroom. One of the best hotels in Sri lanka which provides great safety. but didn't have a nice view. If you are a sea food lover, you must visit this hotel. Crab, prawn, cuttlefish and many more seafood things in one place. Never experienced such a thing before. They had a good buffet with a lot of varieties and they served tasty foods. But only a few items were delicious. I experienced that drawback from this kind of bigger buffets serving hotels. Live music nights and a lot of services available through the hotel. I believe it was an amazing visit to Heritance Ahungalla.

One of Sri Lanka's top hotels. We stayed here for two nights, and we were glad that we chose this hotel because it has everything a visitor could want. The staff was attentive and kind. Their faces were bright with smiles as they greeted us. When you first meet someone, they all smile. The bathrooms and rooms were roomy, tidy, and cozy. From the room, you have a great view of the ocean. The food was delicious and well-dispersed. Their cocktails were excellent. All in all, my visit to Heritance Ahungalla was fantastic. We would not hesitate to suggest this hotel and would gladly return.

Heritance Ahungalla staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay was comfortable and enjoyable, thank you team front office and all. The view fantastic and perfect place to stay with groups, place is relax and Excellent, and the resort architecture is stunning and room views Excellent, we will comeback

This is my first time in Sri Lanka. This warm welcome from the hotel staff just made my day. Everything was perfect and well maintained hotel with nice employees. Food is excellent and just right place to spend your time in South of Sri Lanka. Activities near by good for every member of your family. .. Just one tip for the beach area, avoid any plastic trash. I did collect few of them. Thank you!

Excellent service. Live music by the pool at night and The staff went above and beyond in their efforts. Loved our stay we enjoyed the ocean and the swimming pool very much. Staff was amazing and the breakfast buffet had variety of options. Rooms were comfortable and had a big balcony facing the ocean , it was lovely to wake up in the morning to that view. Price we paid was reasonable for the quality of service we received.

Very nice hotel. Well situated on the beach. 2 gorgeous large swimming pools, clean and clear. The food was excellent with a tremendous variety of fish and seafood cooked to perfection. Nightly live music. Nice poolside bar that made excellent drinks. Staff were friendly and professional. Highly recommend

I recently stayed at Heritance Ahungalla and it was a impressive and comfortable stay! The staff were friendly and welcoming. The hotel is designed by Deshamanya Jeoffery Bawa and is wonderful in all sense. The vastness and aesthetics of the property, the breathtaking views of the pool, beach and the surroundings from the moment you enter the hotel. It is definitely an experience. The salt in the air singes your nose in the best way possible. They have tried to upkeep the original architecture of the building from the 1980's as much as possible and it is pleasant on the eyes. The breakfast buffet was decent and had south Indian options. The breakfast buffet had alot of options and varieties, however, the taste of the food did slightly fall behind for the price paid and for what was expected. This also applies to their Dinner buffet. On the other hand, the room service menu though very limited has tasty and reasonably priced options (special mention to the nasi goreng, which was delicious with a good portion size). A special note on the very wonderful welcome we recieved at the property. The cold towel and the welcome drink was refreshing and the staff are very very polite and willing to help you with anything. Me and my wife, we stayed in the 'luxury room' category of rooms. The room was pleasant and spacious with 'L' shaped balcony access. The views from the balcony did not bore us throughout our stay, breathtaking every single time. We just stayed at the property and enjoyed the property itself. However, travelling to nearby locations such an Lunuganga, Bentota river sports, etc should not be an issue at all, as the property is very accessible by uber/pickme. However, despite the food being okay, it's better to opt for full board or atleast half board as there are not many options for restaurants nearby. I highly recommend the hotel to anyone seeking to have a relaxing vacation on the beach while enjoying a piece of Bawa architecture. Rating Breakdown: - Cleanliness: 5/5 - Service: 4/5 - Value: 4.5/5 - Location: 5/5 - Sleep Quality: 5/5

It was a pleasure staying at this hotel. Heritance is a nice hotel with excellent food and service. Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner are good and you can choose: Indian, Asian, etc. Also the restaurant is very good. Overall the experience was brilliant and enjoyed business getaway a lot. I will definitely stay here again.

My wife and I spent two amazing nights with our cousin Nishanthi and Savi who took us to Heritance Ahungalle on the start of our vacation in Srilanka. The hospitality and friendliness of the staff was evident from the moment we stepped in to the lobby. our room on the 3rd floor overlooking the Indian ocean was spectacular. the room was very spacious and comfortable. The balcony outside the room afforded us time to read and relax in the evening.the bathroom was very clean and had ample counter space to keep our toiletries. I must make special mention of the unbelievable spread at each if the buffet meals. We arrived just in time for the lunch buffet Starting with soup to salads to Srilankan Indian Chinese and western dishes the spread was enormous. The dessert menu too was too numerous to mention. The dinner and breakfast menus were excellent with the gourmet spread to cover every pallet needs. We must make special mention of Mr. Pradeep Guneratne the FnB Executive who ensured our stay was memorable, Being a long weekend in Srilanka the hotel was at its capacity. Pradeep and his staff ensured that the guests were seated with the minimum wait times. Pradeep surprised us with a special dish of Srilankan crab curry Coconut sambol and roast bread which truly was a delicacy we had not had in years. Thank you Nishanthi and Savi for choosing Heritance Ahungalle to host us for a relaxing stay, our sincere appreciation to Pradeep and staff at Heritance for the comfortable stay and providing us a great culinary experience.

I recently stayed at the Hotel, and the service was exceptional. The staff was attentive and friendly, ensuring a comfortable experience. Clean rooms and great amenities made it a memorable stay. Highly recommend!ce and excellent food. Nice view with beach.

We stayed for three nights at the Heritance Ahungalla hotel, which is beautifully located facing the coast and close to the main road. The hotel maintains a clean and pleasant environment. Although the property is a bit older, the rooms have been renovated and are extremely clean. The staff is courteous and helpful. A special mention to the Assistant Resort Manager, Mr. Rasika, who made our stay even more enjoyable. He personally spoke to the guests and ensured we had a pleasant experience. When I fell ill, Mr. Rasika was exceptionally helpful and took personal care of my needs, which I truly appreciated. The food was excellent, offering a good variety of Sri Lankan and international cuisines, all of which were delicious. The swimming pool was well-maintained and clean, and the poolside bar staff provided great service. Overall, it was a delightful stay, and we look forward to visiting again.

One of the best hotels we have stayed at. Beautiful location, very clean and specious room, friendly and helpful staff, delicious food with a full range buffet, exceptional F&B, Housekeeping & Front office service. Beautiful pools with easy access to the beach. Thank you Heritance Ahungalla!

This has been a wonderful & truly relaxing experience. I was looking forward to having some downtime when this stay was booked. I feel completely rejuvenated. The staff could not be more attentive, kind & professional. Despite the size of the hotel, it still has a homely feeling because of the care & consideration given by the staff. All of our requests were accommodated where possible. I would definitely recommend staying here, whether for relaxation or a family holiday. The food is 11/10 (!) - a mix of western & Eastern options. There is live music in the lounge area, games & two swimming pools both facing the sea. Absolutely heavenly.

Lovely hotel with friendly and attentive staff, epitomising Sri Lankan warmth and hospitality. Beautiful beach and poolside setting, which was perfect for kids. The food was amazing with a huge selection of food, including the Sri Lankan style â€œyaara teaâ€! Highly recommended and weâ€™ll be coming back for more.

From the point we entered to the point we left the service provided to us by the staff was excellent. I will definitely recommend the hotel Front office service was wonderful Dinning staff went extra mile to serve us Room service and pool staff were excellent Bar team madesure we were entertained to the maximum

In Heritence I had a good time . Food was good . The service was excellent . Chef Shamin and the restaurant supervisor chamuditha very supportive throughout the stay . Recommend to the everyone . I planed to come back to this amazing hotel with friendly staff

The overall experience was great from the greeting when we arrived to the exceptional restaurant service coordinated by Chamuditha(supervisor). The live music at 7pm was an added bonus enjoying a drink after a day relaxing in the great pools.

All in all great services and facilities room category this time little small but good staff were friendly specially in the restaurant we stayed for three days and three nights this was my second visit since June this year kid and and my wife liked very much

I went with my family to herittance ahungalla only for one day. But from the moment we went there and for the top service given by each and every staff at hotel we decided to stay another day. The rooms are well maintained, spacious. The food was lovely and we enjoyed alot. Thanks to all staff at Herittance ahungalla for making our holidays memorable.

It was a very pleasant stay. We stayed at Heritance Ahungalla on suit room for one day. The accommodation was really nice & spacious. The room had a nice ocean view. Food was nice, especially dinner & breakfast. We received excellent service! The staff was really friendly.

Wide variety of food selection with superb service headed by Pradeep and team - Dulanjalee, Hashini, Kavindu etc. selection of Sri Lankan, Asian and Western food items. Do not forget to ask for Yara Tea from Maduranga. ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€. Highly recommended the food and hospitality.

Heritance Ahungalla is really a lovely place to visit with a marvelous architecture and a beautiful beach. Though our stay was short we enjoyed a lot ,as there were a lot of extra activities indoors and outdoors as well. Rooms were very clean ,buffet meals offered were delicious with so many verities to choose as two in our family were vegetarians.,most of all what I loved was the way the whole team at Heritance had prepared our room and organised a small birthday party as we visited the hotel intending to celebrate my birthday....special thanks to Restaurant manager Mr.Duminda and his extraordinary, workaholic team who worked throughout tirelessly to make all the guests a memorable unforgettable stay. Thank you once again for making our visit feel joyous and memorable.

Phenomenal. Brilliant food - best I buffet I have been in the island - prawn tempura,cuttle fish, oysters, beef wellington. Really tasty and well cooked. Staff were lovely, very friendly, helpful and happy looking. Room nice and big. Facilities were plenty, and in good condition. I mainly spent my time around the 2 big pools, which were beautiful. Hotel looks very nice with a general sense of space and abundance. Would recommend.

Great service, excellent food, caring staff - recommend all to enjoy a stay. Staff from front office to room service and restaurant are all carry consistency. Met an overseas guest for the second time who had been here for 45 times and his next visit is in Dec which I guess is a record. Will be here again soon for sure

Excellent service by the Hotel staff, Always helpful and serve with a smile ğŸ˜€. Food was awsome witha great spread of local and international choices, We had a big family of 16, Nice atmosphere with pools, gaming rooms, gym and live music in the evening. Will be back Thank you Heritance Ahungalla.

Thank ypu so much F&B staff and the whole ahungalla team for organizing such a wonderful cocktail party.. you guys are amazing !! Mr.Kavindu and Mr.Duminda thank you for the wonderful support throughout the event. It means alot. Best Regards Kaushalya

I went with my family to Heritance Ahungalla Hotel in September. The hotel was clean, offered good service, and had a variety of delicious food from different cuisines. Rukmal and the others were very helpful throughout our stay. I would totally come again!

First of all, this is my first experience visiting heritance Ahungalla. Mr.navidu arranged today and gave us a super service. Really, there are no words to express the treatment given to us. The food is really delicious, thank you to all the staff for the service. Once again, Mr. Navidu, I wish you the best for your carrier. Good luck.

This is our first visit to Heritance Ahungalla. In fact, everything was very good. We were warmly welcomed and the most special thing was where the table was set for our high tea experience. Wow that's awesome. The surroundings and the staff are awesome. Everyone is very friendly. Navidu is the person who arranged all these things better than we thought. Navidu looked for everything and gave us a very good experience. So Navidu I thought this is the best way to thank you and tell others about you and your service. So thank you for everything you have prepared to make our evening beautiful. Again, it's great. Thank you Navidu. Good work See you again.

The hotel allocated a twin room when we booked a double, so it was not a good start. After waiting for about 2 hours, we were relocated to a suite which was rewarding and made the stay pleasant and enjoyable. The Bawa suite is par excellence. Had all amenities we wanted. Bed was comfortable. Had its own large private balcony. It was perfect.

I visited heritance ahungalla with my wife for a Day outing . My friend Shiran recommended the place and i also recommend it to everyone who wants to have a calm and joyful day out with family. Heritance ahungalla is the best place ever. Two pools to enjoy and fabulous food ever with many varieties of foods. Also i have to pay tribute to the GM, Mr. Rasika and pool bar team and cashiers . Also the Ex.chef and chef lakmal and chef heshan for talk us personally and treat us well. Mr. Duminda and restaurant team shows us the hospitality of five star hotel in the restaurant . Thanks you all. Thanks Heritance Ahungalla team made our day fabulous and special. As a newly married couple we enjoy well.

THis was our 2nd visit and this time it was for my Bday. We booked 6 room all toger and had a great time. Starting from Uthpala in the head office and Chathura , Dinuka and GM Suresh welcomed us snd made us feel very comfortable. On the F&B side everything was looked after by Nipuna and the waiters.

We had fantastic stay . Came for spend the day.. We were warmly welcomed by front office staff.meals were excellent. The satff were very friendly and helpful .......lots of beautiful place to take the picture .highly recommend this hotel .â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸

We recently stayed at this wonderful hotel and had an amazing experience. The location is perfect, with beautiful views and easy access to the beach. The staff was incredibly friendly and always willing to help with a smile, which made our stay even more enjoyable. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, providing a relaxing environment. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a relaxing and enjoyable beach getaway!

Another lovely stay with the friends.had a memorable experience.the food was very tasty.staff were very helpful........ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°. Lots of beautifull place to take pictures......the experience was an overall wonderful......

I went here to celebrate my son's birthday and it was better than I expected.. Mr.Chamuditha (the restaurant supervisor) He has done everything we need with great enthusiasm. His customer service is very high quality. This is a foodie paradise especially for meat lovers

Rukmal was our crew's favorite staff. He made the towels in the cutest ways. It's fair to mention that it's not only him but all staff are so good mannered and nice.thanks for all services. Also the food was good and they served a big range of foods

There are so many good things about this hotel but 3 that made me enjoy staying here even more was: first, the amazing pool it has, second the kindness of all staff and in specific my favorite staff, "Rukmal" who makes the towels in the cutest ways everyday and lastly the pasta station in dinner time. Thank you.

We have spent 2 weeks in Heritance Ahungalla which is really a great place with a beautuful architecture. Rooms are spacious and always clean. There are two big pools, one is a bit quiter and secluded for more a relaxing atmospshere if requiredThe restaurant offers delicious food of all kind, a lot of local dishes and a great choice of deserts. Besides the facilities, what makes the hotel really special are very kind people, always offering a great service and meet every whish you might have. All staff was really great with no exception, special thanks to restaurant manager Duminda and team, our main waiter Jacob, pastry chef Kavinda and team, executive chef Nalinda and team, chef Rahul for a great authentic cooking experiance, pool supervisor Chatu and Rebecca and Maduranga from the pool bar.

I recently visited Heritance, I must say the pool was amazing and not to mention the service provided by Ms. Sanduni and the reception team was really good. They were really professional during our Check in and made us feel comfortable. Also Chathura helped us with a smooth checkout process as well. Overall good service. Will surely visit again.

When I married in 2013, we went on our honeymoon to Heritance Ahungalla. It was one of the best hotels we have been to, and I speak about the experience (fantastic food, very kind staff, excellent service, super and well-maintained facilities). This year, after 11 years, we decided to take our two kids to Heritance Ahungalla. Every hotel we have visited since we got married has used Heritance as the benchmark. I was reluctant to visit Heritance again because I didn't want the high standards we had set to be lowered. To my amazement, after 11 years, it's still the same. The foodâ€”every dish was super yamâ€”the staff is very kind, and the facilities are still well maintainedâ€”I am still amazed. Funny story, today when house keeping came to clean the room, they noticed that my kids had brought their favorite toy with them to sleep with. Before they left, they had kept my kids' stuff in the bed; when we came to the room, my kids were so happy to see that. Small things do matter, very kind staff service.

The property is a great one. The hotel is located by the beach with one of the best views. Had a pleasant stay with my family. Special shout out to Chef Balbeer Singh, he took special care of us and went out of his way to cater to our food requirements. And not to mention, the taste was amazing(veg/non veg both).

The Heritance has a good reputation amongst locals and travel agents. Whilst we did have a lovely stay, we didnâ€™t feel it was on par with 5* hotels we have stayed in other countries or even in line with the other six 5*â€™s we stayed in Sri Lanka as part of a touring holiday with beach relaxation at the end. Proâ€™s: - nice hotel with minimalist design. - smaller and more intimate then the Riu which is located next door - very friendly staff - pool area opens onto beach and you can walk easily - quite location - restaurants food was great and there was plenty of good quality variety. - the hotel was not busy and we were often the only ones in the pool which was great. - although in July the sea is too rough to swim in, the beach was lovely to walk and play on. Conâ€™s: - although in mostly good condition, we felt it was dated in parts - although we Stayed in a suite we didnâ€™t feel the hotel was luxury, the rooms couldâ€™ve done with a bit more soft furnishings to make it feel a bit more luxurious. - suite bathroom only has a large bath with over shower. There is a step into the bath which may be an issue for those with mobility issues. - there is limited number of poolside sun umbrellas which seemed a shame as umbrellas, poolside service etc, we would deem as basics. We had to tip to ensure we got an umbrella reach day which we felt should not have been necessary given it was a 5*. On our first day we were told a couple who had 2 sun-loungers, 2 umbrellas and a spot looking out to the beach and sea were â€œVIPsâ€ and there were no more umbrellas. We did find a more helpful attendant the next day however. - evening entertainment a bit hit and miss. - could put some sun-loungers on the beach for hotel guests. Overall, a lovely hotel and we would definately stay again however request the hotel take on some of our suggestions.

The entrance is very cozy...check in was smooth...welcome drinks were uniquely served...room was spacious with all required amenities...the swimming pool and the beach view was just amazing...Staffs always smiling was very good....in-house buffet dinner and breakfast were amazing with multiple options to choose from...highly recommended.

Friendly welcome. The buffet brilliant with absolutely delicious hoppers made by a lovely lady! Only pain was when we had to wait long for a cup of tea in the morning. House keeping did a beautiful job making the room with a lovely touch of arranging my sons Teddy with a elephant made with a towel! Thank you Rukmal

We had a wonderful visit. Food was amazing and menu was fabulous with different meals both morning and evening over the course of seven days. A lot of variety the pool was great. There are two pools one more for family fun and the other more for relaxation and more quiet. Both are very large and well-maintained, the service was incredible and everybody was very friendly and helpful. We were definitely go again.

good hospitality, food and beach to swim at. Hotel room was clean and spacious. Staff are very friendly and helpful, always ready to help. Perfect place for a family holiday! Heritance has always maintained itself up to very high standards and is worth revisiting.

Ahungalla is my fatherâ€™s hometown, and Iâ€™ve always wanted to stay at this hotel since childhood. My wife and I really enjoyed the day we spent at the hotel on our anniversary. The staff were very friendly, especially Jananjaya from Induruwa at the restaurant, who was very supportive and provided excellent service. He made sure we received a complimentary cake for our anniversary by informing all the relevant parties after realizing we didnâ€™t get one. The room was very clean, and the food was delicious with many varieties

Super nice and beautiful hotel. Everything was good. Great location, great service, friendly staff. Good value for the money. Food was wonderful with lots of choices. Very comfortable room. Would definitely recommend. Thank you. Prabath and HansikağŸ©·

Beautiful beachfront hotel designed by Sri Lankaâ€™s revered architect Geoffrey Bawa. While large as a property, the outside-in open corridors with trees and hanging plants donâ€™t feel overwhelming and thereâ€™s a real sense of space and tranquility. Rooms are well appointed but the real highlights are the pools. the open and empty beachside views and, in particular, the friendly staff and the star of the show, the food. Breakfast is a feast of flavours, with more cooking stations than Iâ€™ve seen in a while. We were lucky enough to experience the Chefâ€™s Table, which is an opportunity not only to cook in the professional kitchens (where a staff of 70 work) but to done there with the wonderful Executive Sous Chef Lakmal Chathuranga. So thrilling to have a ringside seat while the team delivered evening service. We assisted two terrific chefs in preparing a Sri Lankan feast of flavours - prawns, black chicken, tempered rice, dhal and eggplant dishes, which we then ate in the company of the Head Chef, himself a seasoned international culinary veteran. They do say if you want a real sense of a hotel, visit the kitchen. Would thoroughly recommend this at the Heritance Ahungalla, as well as a stay in this little slice of paradise hotel.

I love this place .. because of hospitality, all staff are polite and willing to help.. they always making sure that the guests are happy .. the food is delicious and includes a lot of dishes which satisfy all .. the sea view is Georgious specially the sunset.. highly recommended to be visited ..

The hotel is the best you can get in Bentota. The property is very huge and spacious. Though the property is a little bit far, it is definitely worth visiting. The food was very good with a huge spread. The staff was very cordial and helpful. In conclusion, the resort is worth a visit.

A must visit place it is, and special Thanks to Chef Balbir Singh. We were already in Sri Lanka for 15 days and finding good Indian food and he did the best and served us with Amazing food. Thank you so much to the entire staff of Heritance. Such a hidden gem it is. And definitely coming back soon.

Another well- spent vacation in Heritance Ahungalla for 7th time â€¦ salute to the amazing staff specially Ms . Trilishiya and Ms.Dilsha who cooperate to make us more and more comfort by going over and beyond . Love that wonderful place , delicious food and high quality service . Highly recommend

Very comfortable beds. Slept easily. Buffet had a great spread and very clean. The pool was well clean. The staff was very friendly and made us feel like home. Tasty food good spread of meat and vegetables. Good selection of indoor games. Overall, everything felt at ease and made us feel at home and calm

First trip to Sri Lanka and booked Heritance Ahungalla through a travel app after reading reviews and the competitive price. How to get there from Columbo Airport - It is about 2.5 hours depending on traffic and approximately $125 AUD. Authorities clearly wanting to enhance tourist confidence because there are approved operator (taxi) booths at the airport. You pay at the booth by zone (ultimate destination) and get a ticket. The staff member then takes you to a taxi and there is no further payment required. This actually put us at ease because weâ€™ve all had horror taxi stories. Arrival at Heritance - This is a very positive experience. You are welcomed with refreshments, a friendly smile and seamlessly checked in. If you are used to doing everything yourself then you will have to give that habit away because the lovely staff will do everything. The resort is an old building which has been modernised so it has wide open corridors and the rooms are spacious. The rooms are clean and have balconies. Tv has a range of channels and the bathroom is good quality and clean. We were so pleased that the shower had a hose in addition to fixed shower head. Pool - absolutely no complaints. It is so clean and the pool guy is on top over it all. The staff are well trained and switched on. They wait until you look like youâ€™ve found a spot to sit then bring the cushions and towels and then let you relax. You donâ€™t need to leave the pool, food and drinks are well priced. For example, two club sandwiches, with chips and side salads, plus two cocktails and a wine was about $50 AUD. We thought that was competitive compared to other resorts weâ€™ve stayed (albeit not in Sri Lanka) Beach - The beach is sandy but we did not not swim because our travel is in the monsoon season and sea is rough. We didnâ€™t feel we were missing much because the pool area was so good. Food - thereâ€™s a reasonably priced cafe with lots of options. They will actually make what ever you need work and are very flexible. Thereâ€™s a pool bar and the Buffet is brilliant. With the exception of one night we ate at the buffet every evening. We were very impressed by it. There is lots of cultural options. The Resort must also analyze client origins because a few days had a lot of Taiwan guests and we took advantage of the special menu that the resort created for them. We had gluten free requirements and this was easily accommodated. Taxi/tours - We appreciated that Heritance obviously have taxi/tour companies they have a relationship with because only a select few can operate from the Resort. We used Dhammika as our driver for day trips. All prices are transparently available so you know costs up front and can compare. We found him extremely knowledgeable and spoke good English. He was trustworthy and very accomodating. The day trip with him including a boat safari was a highlight. Iâ€™d recommend asking for him as a driver. Staff - The staff are standouts. They are clearly well trained and their professionalism is indicative of good culture and leadership within the Resort. I canâ€™t speak highly enough. Our late checkout was accommodated even though they were extremely busy. Gym - I used this 4 times during our stay. It is adequately equipped, clean and tidy and the air conditioner was a blessing whilst running on the treadmill. I would recommend this resort if your stay is south of Colombo.

Beautiful facility with lot of character countyâ€™s most famous architect Geoffrey Bavaâ€™s design , was evident every where incorporating surrounding natural elements .. itâ€™s supposedly 43 years old must say very well maintained. Yes the amenities ( light switches, central air conditioning and the airflow may be slightly dated but the promptness of the staff addressing any issues went well beyond what guest expected.. the beach early morning before the hot sun descends was very peaceful and refreshing., all in all if you want a purely relaxing vacation and not expecting to party at near by bar or wanting to do water sports ( water skating, speed boating ect ) this hotel checks all the boxes â€¦ food ( buffet) was good- catering to the palates of guests present .

The stay in the Hotel was amazing and the best part was the Chef Mr. Balbir Singh. We were already 5 days in Srilanka and searching for good North Indian food. Mr. Balbir on our request specially added North Indian delicacies. Thank you so much for wonderful memories. My recommendations for anyone traveling Srilanka to stay in this property and eat Chef's choice menu ğŸ‘ğŸ»

Absolutely incredible experience! The variety of delicious food was astounding, offering a delightful array of flavors for every meal. The hospitality was exceptional, making us feel warmly welcomed and pampered throughout our stay. The breathtaking surroundings added to the charm, creating a perfect ambiance for relaxation and enjoyment. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner were consistently outstanding, with each meal surpassing our expectations. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a memorable and satisfying getaway!

Very kind staff that greeted us at the door very warmly. Nice cozy rooms with comfy pillows that made it feel like home and the dinner and breakfast was delicious with a nice variety of food. Definitely recommend if you want the perfect vacation.

We had a great stay here. Came with my family and we all really enjoyed the food, the pool and the overall atmosphere. They had a wide selection of Sri Lankan and western foods that were all delicious. In the night, they also had live music by the pool! The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and we will definitely be staying here again!

This year during our recent trip to Sri Lanka we stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla Hotel. Wonderful place to stay. Very friendly staff. Overall great kid and family friendly hotel. Great location near the beach with some spectacular views.

The Heritance Ahungalla is a stunning resort nestled on the Sri Lankan coast. The breathtaking views of the Indian Ocean are a constant backdrop to your stay, while the friendly staff ensures a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The resort boasts a private beach, perfect for soaking up the sun or taking a refreshing dip in the crystal-clear waters. Chef Balbir's culinary creations are a highlight, showcasing fresh, local ingredients and innovative flavors. From the moment you arrive, you'll be enveloped in luxury and tranquility, making it an ideal destination for a relaxing and memorable escape.

Highly recommended to visit Relax and enjoyed Foods are ğŸ¤© Staff service - Friendly & Lovely staff Customer service & caring excellent Rooms are so clean & comfortable to stay relax Beach view is real good Thanks a lot for your service and friendly response

Great hotel and lovely staff . Special thanks to DILSHA ( Guest Relations Manager) excellent customer service and interaction with the guest . From our visit I can see that she does go the extra mile to help customers and accommodate. I believe she is a true asset to this hotel and should be recognised and rewarded accordingly.

I recently spent eleven days at the Heritance Hotel Ahungalla and it was definitely a memorable stay! I was given a beautiful room with a view of the pool and beach. It was very comfortable and clean with all amenities and excellent TV (for the occasional rainy day). Special thanks to Saman who really took care of everything in my room to the highest standard. The breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets were beyond expectation with a huge variety everyday. All this thanks to Chefs Kamal and Lakmal and the F&B management Nipun and Pradeep who were so obliging about special meal requests! The Front Office staff, Clive, Sanduni and Dilsha were ever helpful and one cannot forget the Bar staff - Kalinga, Jagath and Ifas. Thanks to them and all the others for a lovely holiday. The property is beautifully maintained and the two swimming pools are marvellous. Every evening there was live music which was great fun. This truly is a perfect destination for all travellers to Sri Lanka.

Had an awesome time at Heritance . The staff was super friendly. We went there with our baby, and they fulfilled our requirements without any hesitation. The lunch and dinner buffet were the best, The food is good, and the variety is even better. Keep up the good work! ğŸ˜Š

We stayed in Heritance Hotel for couple of weeks in mid June 2024. We are family of 3 and this was our 1st Holiday in Sri Lanka. On arrival to the hotel we were greeted in very friendly way by lovely staff. Our room was amazing- The biggest we ever had on this kind of Holiday. The bathroom was also big and we always had plenty of fresh towels and toiletries. Hotel is very environmentally friendly and what we loved was that everything in the bathroom was plastic free. One of the 1st things we noticed about the hotel was just cleaned and well maintained it was. The gardens were well tended too- The gardener would always prepare fresh bouquet of flowers and through it directly to us in the morning on the balcony... such a nice gesture 2 swimming pools were always clean and watched by professional staff - we actually witnessed couple of emergencies - The staff was well trained and attended without delay. In both instances it was resolved quickly and successfully Other Hotel staff were extremely hard working- you could not ask for nicer bunch. We had Raveesha and Kalinga among others looking after us at the bar most of the evenings- most hard working people I ever met. Always smiling , would literally go over and beyond to make sure our Holiday would go smoothly In the evening we had Duminda in charge looking after us in the restaurant- Again- what a hard working- always smiling person ! He also advised us on local area and which places best to visit to make our Holiday extra special In the restaurant we could not be be more happy with selection of food. Hotel was very quiet some days due to low season and we would be served at the table- There was always interesting , tasty food on the menu. The days when hotel got busy and restaurant was running at 100% it was packed with delicious fresh food. We love tasting local cuisine and we were spoiled for choice. During the days we tried to explore Sri Lanka and on our returns we often felt like returning home- greeted as family in most friendly manner. We were even invited to be part of the Poya celebration which was organized by hotel for the local people It was absolute pleasure to spend 2 weeks here and we are very grateful to all hardworking staff for looking after us. We look forward to see you hopefully some time again

Heritance Ahungalla was one of the highlights of our trip to Sri Lanka, largely due the excellent hospitality of all the staff who were attentive and helpful throughout our visit. Dilsha ( Guest relations) was amazing. She was really helpful if you needed anything nothing was too much trouble. The culinary offerings were diverse catering to a variety of tastes with both local and international cuisine. The chefs were on hand to provide for any dietary needs. Nipon in charge of the restaurant also ensured our food was tailored to our needs and was happy to ask the chefs to create any dish we requested as my daughter was struggling with pregnancy. Room service is prompt and attentive, ensuring that your stay is as comfortable and luxurious as possible. The hotel's beachfront location is a highlight, being well maintained and the pools are stunning. Overall, Heritance Ahungalla sets a high standard for hospitality, food, and room service, making it an excellent choice for any travellers seeking a memorable trip.

The experience we had as a local family of 4 was sooooo out of this world, we went here twice. 2nd time we went with another 2 families with kids. All the kids enjoyed the pool. There was a magic show on our first visit to entertain the kids. On our 2nd visit there was a cup cake decorating workshop for the kids. Both were a hit with the children. One thing none of us can ever forget was the food. Ridiculously large buffet. The action station and kiddies station were the main attraction. Tummies and hearts - full!

An iconic hotel with super service and all modern facilities. Friendly and hospitable staff accompanied by mouthwatering cuisine. Plenty of space to enjoy a lovely vacation. Take time to soak in the genius of Bawa's architecture and tropical modernism with across different moods and tones. Luxurious rooms with all amenities. Highly Recommended.

Great location friendly staff chef prepared miraculous food as per each person request I will definitely come to this resort I cannot wait to tell my friends about my joyful experience Pool was maintained properly and have astonishing sea view

Heritance Ahungalla truly excels in providing an exceptional guest experience. The hospitality is warm and welcoming, making you feel right at home from the moment you arrive. The culinary offerings are diverse and exquisite, catering to a variety of tastes with both local and international cuisine that is nothing short of delectab. Maduranga we enjoyed your lovely cup of tea.ğŸ‘ Room service is prompt and attentive, ensuring that your stay is as comfortable and luxurious as possible, thank you Rukmal for your great service.ğŸ‘ Overall, Heritance Ahungalla sets a high standard for hospitality, food, and room service, making it a top choice for travelers seeking a memorable stay.

Excellent service given by the staff specifically Mr Rukmal.. Who is the person given the housekeeping service and also the restaurant staff very helpful and friendly... Keep going good works and all the very best for all of the Heritance family Thanksgiving

We are currently staying in this hotel and couldn't be more happy with the staff,food and hospitality we are receiving The pools are well attended and pool staff is very professional and skilled. Our room is huge and cleaned throughout daily..we really couldn't fault anything One thing I'd like to point out though is the treatment of pets I see all over the island. My heart is breaking when I see the hungry street dogs and cats everywhere...I really hoped it would be different here...I know the money is tight but education is very important too I know there are amazing charities trying to change it but they really need more support from public and government I really hope there are better times coming up for the animals here

Had a lovely vacation at Heritance Ahungalla. Staff was very friendly and the location is excellent. Specially Chathura at front office assisted us to make it a wonderful experience. It was raining and was unfortunate to have the beach experience. Will definitely come back soon.

It was a great experience i have got in heritance Ahungalla. I got very special warm welcome on arrival than other hotel. Rooms and foods are amazing. Daily having different entertainment .Therefore kids were enjoyed lot.Honestly tell you all, Dilsha (Guest relations) given us very remarkable and unforgettable service. My wife and kids were very friendly with her.She always been with nice smile always.Other staff members also given us excellent service. Due to Dilsha's grateful service we would like to visit again.

2/5 Poor service, poor rooms, and poor food quality. Particularly the food was bad. Unfortunately I included full board with my booking and I wish I didnâ€™t. I advise you not to come here as you will definitely regret the experience particularly that there are lots more options in the area that are considerably far better. Off course the high end ones canâ€™t be compared as well

Excellent facilities. Pleasing environment with 2 large pools and access to a golden sand beach. Staff was very attentive to every need and it is the hospitality that stood out the most. Hotel had nightly entertainment, very good dining options, and plenty of outdoor spaces for quiet times. Highly recommend Heritance for a relaxing vacation.

Excellent accommodation, amazing helpful staff, lovely location with beach and two pools, one infinity. Wide range of food options with a number of dishes cooked as requested. Breakfast was my favourite with delicious omelettesğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸ğŸ˜€ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

The stay at Heritance Ahungalla exceeded all expectations. The rooms were spacious and clean, providing a relaxing atmosphere. As for the food, the hotel's restaurant offered a delightful experience. We were highly satisfied and enjoyed all lunch, dinner and breakfast buffet which were tasty and beautifully arranged. Overall, our stay at Heritance Ahungalla was excellent experience and would highly recommend to anyone seeking a luxurious and memorable experience."

Heritance Ahungalle is a beautiful hotel with the feel of luxury and space. We were greeted warmly by the reception staff and taken to our rooms. We were there for 2 nights, 3 days and opted to upgrade ourselves to the sea-view rooms. We did have a view of the sea but one room only had a partial sea-view. The rooms were welcoming, spacious, comfortable and had all the trimmings of a 5 star hotel. The washroom did look a bit dated as itâ€™s an older hotel but was clean. There is a wide and long beach where one could go for walks and the main swimming pool is amazing. There was live music in the evening. On one day there was a saxophonist and he was very good. Out of the three buffets, the breakfast buffet was simply amazing. Even for me who have stayed at many Sri Lankan and overseas hotels, this was a fabulous experience. There was such a variety of fruits, fresh juices, yogurts, cold cuts, cheeses, breads etc to start off. The local herbal porridge (kola kenda) was absolutely delicious. Then there were the hot dishes both Sri Lankan and western with also an omelette station. However, I have to say while the local dishes were excellent, the western and Chinese dishes could be fined tuned a bit more. The Restaurant Manager, Pradeep and his team were simply amazing. They were very friendly, professional and courteous. Pradeep conveyed to us that if there was anything that we specifically need to let him know. He remembered our preferences and acted accordingly. One person in our group was sick one day and the team provided what our friend could eat and made special deliveries to the room. This is greatly appreciated. The only thing that was a negative was that we saw a family that was at breakfast, who, later got into the pool in the same clothes. This is quite unhygienic. I didnâ€™t see any boards at the pool side stating that swimwear needs to be worn. I did mention it to the staff at the reception who were aware of this happening. All in all, it was a fabulous experience and a place that we would look forward to come again. The service all round, from the bell boys to housekeeping and to the restaurant was excellent! Thank you Heritance Ahungalla for a great holiday!

We have spent the last 6 days here - what can I say! It has been fabulous. The hotel was immaculate and the service was brilliant. Everyday we have experience a new height in customer service right through from the cleaner, who has done an amazing job with our room and been very creative with his origami skills, the pool staff have been amazing - I even managed to race the pool lifeguards (they only just beat me!) The bar and restaurant staff have been very attentive. And today, we took part in world environment day, an annual ceremony with local primary school children and were invited to plant a tree at the hotel to help the environment. We will be back

Our family have a few older people with difficulty to walk and few kids. The staff was very supportive and considerate throughout the whole stay. The food was very good and and the pool area is very calm and spacious which was ideal for our large family. The kids ran around and had a great time. Would highly recommend this for a family outing.

This hotel is absolutely beautiful! The way they designed the building with trees and shrubbery planted in and around the hotel makes you feel like you are part of the nature. It is such a peaceful environment you never want to leave. In addition, the staff is phenomenal. They are very attentive to every little detail and make the experience even more special! We will definitely be returning very soon! Thank you for an unforgettable experience!

Room was excellent and very comfortable .The property is located right in front of the beach and has a very nice breeze. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I would like to mention a special thanks to Sanduni who was at the front desk.Food was good.

Wow !! Great experience !!! The swimming pools, beach, food is amazing !! We had a superb time as a family. Highly appreciate the genuine kindness & warmth of the satff. Also much thanks to Dilsha at front-office and Duminda !!! ğŸ’â¤ï¸ğŸ¹ğŸŒ¿ğŸ¥‚ğŸ‘Œ

It was a nice experience in Heritance Ahungalla at my honeymoon.The room was amazing and have a very good room service.I got a chance to have a sea view balconey.Food was amazing.Buffet have lot of varieties. Also the staff was very friendlly

Fantastic place, really loved the hospitality, from the front desk to the restaurant staff, room service all were kind and friendly and very helpful,the pools were very clean, food was excellent, variety to choose from and not to forget the kavum one of the best I've eaten in srilanka so far,thank you to Heritance Ahungalla for giving us a relaxing holidayğŸ‘Œ special thank you to Mr Pradeep FMB and Mr Clive for helping us through out our stay

A beautiful hotel with a great hospitality. The staff is really supportive and friendly. Especially I would like to thank Guest Relations Executive Mrs Dilsha who were very supportive during our stay.we are incredibly grateful for her warm and gracious hospitality .The pool area looks very nature friendly. The food was very tasty and has a large spread. This hotel is highly recommended.

Awesome place to relax. Fabulous! Thank you! The staff is friendly. Breathtaking view and a splendid atmosphere. Beds are comfortable. The sea breeze is awesome. Evening music session was so relaxing. Thank you for giving us a great stay!

The food was excellent. Spread was so vast that we couldn't even have room to taste a lot of dishes. Went during the vesak weekend and so the bookings were full. Rooms were clean and well maintained. Well worth the price. Will visit again. Thank you heritance

One of the best hotels weâ€™ve stayed at. Was so warm and welcoming. Was a home away from home. Dilsha who was part of the front office staff was one of the friendliest and most welcoming people weâ€™ve met. She made both my son and I feel so welcome. The food was delicious and facilities were top notch!

Excellent stay. It was a great but off seasonal stay. We didnt expect sucha great atmosphere during this time of the year down sputh. it was fabulous. We stayed at the suite and the pools were great even having a little windy and cloudly weather, we enjoyed it very much

Exellent hotel with staff dedicated to serving the guests. From Checkin to the bell desk to the restaurant, the staff is always smiling and ready to attend to your needs. The food served at the main restaurant on all 3 meals is very good. There are few live food options also which is very good. The only disappointment is the desert section, which is nothing much, certainly no verity. Rooms are big with comfy beds, fluffy towels, excellent amenities, and a good combination of tea and coffee. You are set for a comfortable stay. Because of the heavy rains, we used the pool only for a limited time. But they do have 2 large pools and a pool bar also.

A really good place to go with your family. The staff was really friendly. The service was excellent. The rooms were great. The food was delicious. There was an excellent variety of food. I really liked their pool . The rooms had a good view of the beach outside. I highly recommend

The rooms were great,the staff were friendly and hospitable and the food was delicious .I especially enjoyed the breakfast spread and the variety it provided.The pools are well maintained and spacious .The easy access to the beach provided us with scenic views essential for a vacation photo session .highly reccomend it.

We stayed in Luxury Suite room for one night FB and it had spacious cozy living area with sofa and separate bedroom. The service we received from hotel staff from welcome at the entrance to entire stay was amazing. This hotel had one of the widest delicious buffet spreads. Recommend as a must visit hotel and planning to be here again.
