This is a first class hotel right on the beach. Very spacious well equipped rooms, beautiful grounds and 2 large pool. Nice restaurant with Buffett but was lacking the choices we had experienced elsewhere in Sri Lanka. The family members I travelled with like a cocktail before dinner but less than half the cocktails listed on the menu were unavailable. They had no limes in a country that has heaps of citrus fruit. We stayed a few nights and still no limes at the end. Only a small thing but Iâ€™m sure they could have bought some just outside the resort.

Very nice hotel and great view, clean and the staff is friendly and nice. Food was great and room service was neat. Love it and would definitely recommend for couples families and even business. The pool is always clean and all facilities are well equipped.

The rooms are good and spacious. Food quality can be improved. But overall, lovely hotel environment. Would be happy to recommend for family vacations. They were flexible with our additional room selection at the last minute too. Dilsha was very nice to us.

Nice and calm place. Staff is very friendly. During our visit there were so many fun activities which included activities for kids as well. Recommended for corporate activities such as staff development programs and etc. Beach is clean and well maintained. Cheers

Ten years ago, we spent our honeymoon here and itâ€™s still one of our favourite places in Sri Lanka. We really appreciate all arrangements made by the staff to make our wedding anniversary extra special. Food and the hospitality was amazing as always. But room could use some improvement and improve on attention to smaller details.

Very relaxing hotel. Super friendly staff. Front office to room service and dining area staff all exceptional. Good food choice with some wonderful cocktails. Being a local I tried all local produce especially old arrack and gin with mixers. Live music at the lounge was really good and relaxing near the pool. We even danced a bit. Parking on site for our cars was very convenient. Clean rooms and bathrooms. Will definitely return soon

I have to say that Ahungalla was the best hotel in my 8 day's trip in Srilanka. What you will have: 1) A super swimming pool when you arrive in the lobby which is directly face to the ocean and it links with beach. 2) All the smiling faces in reception, F&B and guest relationship. 3) A wooden nice room with clean and comfortable bed. 4) Very much cozy environment with cool lighting and srilanka cultural decorations. Thanks to all the people who helped and served us: (Who I remembered name's) Dilsha from Guest Relation/Pradeep from F&B/Nimna and Rahul from hot kitchen.

Good hotel to visit â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦ Hats off to the Chef Balbeer for arranging the Indian vegetarian food for usâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦ Property is nice and cleanâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦ Best part is the beach and pool in the hotel Overall good experienceâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦..

The staff are nice. But the tables in the restaurant are very sticky. We had stayed 2night. The food is quite delicious and changed. My husband and I massage in the spa together, the staff whisper through the whole process. Itâ€™s uncomfortable.
The room service is great! The towel art done by Mr.Rukmal were super creative and fun. The food was also good. The overall design of the hotel was excellent

We went to Sri Lanka, and spent 5 days at the end of our trip at this hotel. It is quite tired, but this was offset by magnificent pools, best food, and really good service. Had the service and food been bad, we would not consider the place. But it was great, hence the positive review. Only problem is that there are no villagers around, so other than the polluted beach, not much to see. Or do.

A very nice hotel, lovely friendly staff! Nice clean rooms. Beach a little bit choppy this time of year but a nice calm one a couple miles up the road. Good tours (safar etc) locally. The food at this hotel was brilliant, very accommodating for allergies too.

We are having an amazing stay at Heritance ahungalla. Starting from the checkin process the service has been amazing. Kudos to the reception staff for going out of their way to ensure our satisfaction. The food was perfect and the room and all other facillities were spoton. The staff in this place keeps the orgsnisation going no matter what.

Iâ€™ve spent wonderful days at Heritance Ahungalla thanks above all to the lovely and very kind Ms Sanduni who took care of me during my staying,and also thanks to the master chefs Lakmal and Heshan who delighted me with excellent dishes and cakes.I really hope to go back again.

We went there in the beginning of April during awurudu festival . We had a really good stay . The rooms were quite comfortable and kept clean . The property is huge and has 2 swimming pools as well . The beach is easily acessible, itâ€™s right Infront of the beach . The best part about this vacation however was the staff . Extremely welcoming , friendly , accommodating to all our needs . They exceeded expectations . Especially the guest relationship officer , unfortunately I forgot her name but she made sure to check on us every day that she saw us in the lobby and my toddler really grew fond of her as well . I believe she is from Matara . . We also really enjoyed the entertainment ie the fire dancing and the live singing . The food was good Iâ€™m the cofffee shop Iâ€™m not so sure about the main restaurant as we did not eat there ( except for breakfast which had a big variety ). Thankyou to the heritance team for providing us with such a wonderful experience

The experience at Heritance Ahungalla was simply amazing. The highlight of it all was the welcome experience The reception staff was absolutely brilliant they paved the way for us to have a fabulous stay in this resort. Not to mention the food was out of this world. We will definitely return. As the hospitality and the warm smiles are contagious.

A short midweek trip with family and friends. Check in took a tad longer than expected. Booked a suit which was located centrally close to both pools and had a large sitting room separate from the bed room. it was excellent as we could have a get together with friends whilst the kids slept in. The spacious balcony opened out to a view of the hotel pools n garden, the golden sands and the westward sea. As it was a midweek day with less crowd, was not expecting much of a spread at the buffet, How wrong I was! It was less than on a weekend but still could hold its own with any hotel's weekend spread. Any foreign guest gets introduced to a good selection of Sri Lankan specialities, Italian pasta station to Indian Doses to Mongolian mixed rice action stations were all busily catering to individual requirements. The fruit selection at breakfast was amazing. The staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms were spotlessly clean. Pradeep the manager at the dinning hall was super! He was checking up on almost all the tables, assisting where ever needed. one of the lil kids at our table had a special request which was taken care of in a matter of minutes much to the amazement of our group. Had such a good time will be returning for sure!

We had a great stay at this place , loved how helpful and attentive the staff was , Maduranga specially was very attentive and friendly. The food was amazing !! We had a great time at the pools. The rooms were spacious and had a great view. Would recommend this place <3
Heritance Ahungalla has the most amazing staff and super food..The staff definitely makes your stay worthwhile.Kudos

Outstanding hotel in fantastic beach location. The bar and restaurant service is exemplary as is the cleanliness. The staff are friendly and canâ€™t do enough for you. Spacious rooms are spotless and well equipped. Also recommend trip to one of the nearby turtle conservation centres.

This is meant to be a 5 star hotel, but is lacking in so many areas. The positives first. The restaurant staff and room cleaning staff were excellent. The rooms are very nice, spacious and beds are extremely comfortable. Unfortunately the reception staff and management were extremely unhelpful and didnâ€™t address issues when highlighted. We visited during Sri Lankan new year and we knew shops and restaurants would be closed, we asked the reception staff and were advised Fri and sat (which is what we expected) I also asked if they knew if restaurants in Galle would be open on the Sunday and was advised they would all be closed as still new year so better to stay at the hotel. This was incorrect as a discovered through a Facebook forum and visited Galle on the Sunday were all restaurants were open. This felt like an attempt to keep you in the hotel spending money. The prices at the hotel were also questionable. The hotel we stayed in the week before had clear pricing on there menu eg Nani goreng 1800 Sri Lankan rupees. The heritance menu do 10% state service charge to be added, but also to be added is 18% vat meaning the prices stated which were already at least 20% higher than the previous 5star rated hotel we had stayed in were much more costly than other similarly rated hotels and more concerningly this isnâ€™t clear. The pools open at 8am which is fine as they need to clean them, but the bed cover and towels arenâ€™t available until 8am and as I am an early riser and like to get up and spend some time in the sun before breakfast and the sun gets too hot this was disappointing. Also out of the 5 nights we stayed here I had to trek around the resort on 3 separate days to find a pool attendant as you canâ€™t get the mattress and towels yourself, having gone to reception on 2 occasions it took until 9 am on 2 of the days to get the towels and mattresses, and all the manager Clive could do was apologise, which given it happened again the following morning was very poor. The issue clearly hadnâ€™t been addressed. Also around the pool, wasnâ€™t cleaned with cigarette ends (dissapointing thatâ€™s scruffy guests leave this is the first place) plastic bottles and beer caps left on the grass for the last 4 days we were there. I would not recommend this hotel to stay at and instead would highly recommend the 5 star Taj Bentota which is only 20 minutes away and is excellent with much more around the hotel as well which if you want to explore is great.

We stayed there in new year seson so was bit crowded. Staff is really good and friendly. Food was delicios and had many varieties. Room was not modern design but it was okay for us. Hotel will be a good option if you are looking for a good dinner / lunch buffet.

Very friendly people, very nice service, at cleaning (THANKS to Rukmal for beautiful towel figure) to kitchen (be happy to open local cuisine). Hope to renovation this hotel as quickly as possible. caught the New Year celebration, it was something unforgettable.

one of the best beach front hotel i ever visited...great customer service...cozy comfy rooms & best part was the food...filled with various type of food and all are tasty...got the pleasure of attending the avurudu ceremony and it was all fun and enjoyable...

The worst hotel Iâ€™ve been to, even 1 star is a lot , this should be a 5 stars hotel but itâ€™s the total opposite, rooms are very old and dirty, corridors are horrible, and when I made a complain their explanation was itâ€™s rustic architecture not dirty and itâ€™s not an international hotel itâ€™s a National hotel, which didnâ€™t make any sense to me What does cleanliness have to do with National or international, the restaurant was like a fish market, stations were unclean and no hygiene at all, in the reception they were putting a welcome drink trolley when I stood by it the servant told me that itâ€™s only for check In customers, people in the hotel arenâ€™t allowed to drink which is very funnyâ€¦ I came with my family to relax for couple of days but unfortunately it was a disaster..

I am absolutely satisfied with everything. The great Hotel, Management, the Beach, Food, Service, Drinks, Tour guides, Entertainment, Rezeption, Pool boys, room chief ect.!!! I always feel great when I am back. Love the place soo much!!

We have been to this hotel 4 times already. The staff is super friendly and customer oriented. I love the pool and the beautiful beach. The cuisine is great with a variety of local and international food. Some smaller restaurants also nearby on the beach. I also enjoyed their fitness center which is ok equipped. The rooms are nice and clean. Overall the hotel offers a great value for your money.

This is a lovely hotel, set on the edge of the Indian Ocean. All the staff are incredible. Nelka, Waruna, Raveesha and Chimuditha to name a few. The welcome is amazing and customer service is the best we have ever experience. Can't recommend this hotel enough.

I absolutely love my stay here at Heritance Ahungalla. The staff here are super accomadating and kind. The service that my family and I are getting here is indeed 5-Star and outstanding as advertised. I've already extended my stay here and will return the next time I visit Sri Lanka ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡°. Nuwan (from Washington DC)

It was really great time with perfect ocean, swimming pool, food and service. The staff was very polite and always ready to help.Housekeeper Rukmal made us smile every day by making funny figures. Thank you everyone for unforgettable holidays!

Categorically unacceptable conditions in controversial situations, the hotel thinks only about profit. This is not a 5* hotel, the furniture and renovations are from the 80s, and in some places there is fungus in the showers and on the balconies. Location is the end of the world, transfer to civilization from the hotel is very expensive for Sri Lanka. I do not recommend it if you have actually previously vacationed in 4*-5* hotels.

Dulaj,a front office staff, provided the best and great service with a smile. He went out of his way to ensure that we were happy with our rooms. Pradeep,food and beverage, provided exceptional service. Our requests for coconut water and masala chai were gladly met. Food was fresh and yummy and there was a good range of beverages. We enjoyed the cooking demonstration on Monday 25th March. The young budding chef prepared delicious mouth watering mustard chicken curry, fried rice and long bean curry. My wife and I from Gold Coast and our friends from Melbourne, Australia really enjoyed our stay at the beautiful Heritance on the Beach.

Great hotel , great facilities, great clean beach , great breakfast , best ocean views , lovely live music in evenings . Fantastic staff always ready to assist . Special thanks to Pradeep in reception who went out of his way to act on our special requests. Very friendly customer service Also special thanks to Dulaj in reception who was able to efficiently change our rooms and make us comfortable. Our best hotel experience in SL . Totally recommend. â­ï¸ â­ï¸ â­ï¸ â­ï¸ â­ï¸

One of the best places in Ahungalla. Had a great time with family enjoying the stay at the hotel without any distractions. The hotel is located in a beautiful location having the direct access to the beach. The food was excellent and the buffet included a lot of varieties. The staff was really supportive and the hotel rooms were great. Thanks Dilrangi

Return visit to this hotel, we still found the hotel excellent . Situated on a lovely large beach and in a great location.rooms good size clean and comfortable. 2 large swimming pools which were never to busy especially the green pool, plenty of sun beds with the staff happy to move them in and out of the sun when you needed it. Good food in both the restaurants with good service by the staff, plenty of choice with some cooked fresh while you waited .we would like to especially thank Chamila Jananjaya for his excellent friendly service and Kavinda Heshan for going out his way to cook gluten-free breadâ€™ pasta and pancakes for us. The night time entertainment in the pool bar was good with excellent cultural shows. We were all inclusive and the local drinks and cocktails were good. Would have liked to have more yoga classes as only had one available during the 2 weeks we stayed. Great holiday and will be returning soon. Thanks to all the staff that made it a great holiday.

The staff and the food are the best things about staying at this hotel. Staff are very kind, welcoming and attentive. Everywhere around the hotel whether it is the staff greeting you at dinner, or waiting, or around the pool and sorting out sun loungers, the staff are friendly, work extremely hard and make you feel at ease. The supervisor, Chamuditha made sure that everything was going well with our holiday, helped us with information, and was kind also , so full marks to all the staff. Thank you. The food at this hotel is so good. A real choice at the buffet. I love all the Sri lankan food and the women who make the hoppers are very skilled. The bar is also a great area for entertainment and drinks. The gym is fine and is air conditioned, a small room but weights and machines did the job. Things that could be improved might be that some parts of the hotel are a bit old and could do with updating and a lick of paint or the hotel could do with some more decoration, however in the end none of this detracted from the stay. The aircon was great and the beds are comfy. One thing I'm not keen on are people on the beach hassling you to sell you things when you just want to enjoy the beach but the hotel doesn't have jurisdiction over that. We had a lovely stay and would recommend staying here.

The hotel really is tired, needs updating and a good clean in places , some staff rude and unhelpful. All inclusive package is not worth the money as they run out of the decent beer and water down cordial to put into spirits as you canâ€™t have fresh juice. Food is very good. I find the hotel is not like the pictures. Sun beds are filthy and in need of a clean. Swimming pools are too hot and could do with some cold water as it is not refreshing when your sunbathing and need to cool down.electrical sockets came out of the wall and needed to be repaired, patio doors did not shut properly this also had to be rectified. Needed som information on transport from reception and we were told to Google it, Unbelievable. Shame there is not separate smoking areas as you choke on smoke wherever you go. I am well travelled and shocked that this hotel shows 4 stars. Other than this I would recommend to anyone who wants a 3 star hotel.

Heritance Ahungalla is a stunning beachfront resort on Sri Lanka's southern coast. With its modern rooms, breathtaking ocean views, and top-notch amenities like pools and a spa, it's the ultimate destination for relaxation. The resort's commitment to sustainability adds an extra layer of appeal. Whether you're looking for a romantic getaway or a family vacation, Heritance Ahungalla delivers an unforgettable experience in paradise.

Rukmal very nice, Everything is very good Sri Lanka is the best cleaner excellent restaurant and staff delicious food, everyone is friendly, everything is very clean, 10/10 nice beach lots of activities volleyball ping pong tennis great pool

The hotel is gorgeous, I really liked the staff, namely a talented man named Rukmal. Every day she carries out perfect cleaning and pleases the eye with stunning animal figures made from towels. The mood is lifted for the whole day ahead. Thank you for your work!!!

This is one of my fav hotels down south even though it is one of the oldest hotels and first one designed by renowned architect, Geoffrey Bawa. The facilities including the two big pools are great. The rooms were very spacious. The breakfast and dinner spread was fantastic and yummy. The service levels were great especially by Chamudita and Dharshana (restaurant staff leads)

It was really nice stay in Heritance Ahungalla. I really appreciate how nice and friendly were people there. Many thanks for always smiling Chef Heshan - he was really halpfull and kind. For me his pastries are at the highest world level. Many thanks

Of all the hotels I've been to, I will definitely return to this one! All the staff are Unique! These are not just staff, these are people every fine hotel should have! Exceptional professionals who know how to make your stay and vacation unforgettable! Spotlessly clean room daily, thank you Lokusuviqa. Pastry Chef Kavinda Hashan, followed every single detail meticulously, assisted all the guests punctually, nothing was missing. Special thanks to Kaveesha and Dilsha- guest relations executive, you girls are awesome. The guy who used to make my unique vegetables, thanks Prarodha, you are the top. And now I pay special attention to a wonderful boy who really impressed me a lot. Special thanks to CHAMUDITHA who is an amazing SUPERVISOR . He is extremely responsive and helpful throughout our stay. His positive spirit made our stay very nice and smiling. For sure for our next holiday we will back in Sri Lanka Heritance hotel . Thanks to Chamuditha . All good hotels should have such staff! My stay at this hotel was simply fantastic and I would recommend it to everyone I know!

Very kind people. One young man stood out among the rest - a great professional, I watched him carefully with interest. He was a supervisor and took care of the guests both personally and with clear and concise instructions to his staff so no one knew if there was a problem or not and everyone was super happy. This young man's name is: Chamuditha

Hello everyone We stayed at this hotel with a friend from Feb 12 to Feb 22, 2024 I want to say right away that the hotel is great, but first things first The beach is just wonderful - very wide, clean sand, garbage is removed, the entrance to the ocean is gentle. There are waves, but they are small for Sri Lanka, so we enjoyed swimming The rooms are clean, some of the furniture is already tired, but they clean very well, our cleaner tried very hard and left flowers and extra water in our room every day, even brought chocolates on the first day of acquaintance) Sunbeds and towels - free ones could be found in the hotel at any time of the day, the staff very quickly brought towels, rearranged the sunbeds in any place at our request and all with a smile. we were buying mangoes and one afternoon we decided to eat on the territory, so the employee saw this and brought us a plate and a knife so that it would be convenient for us, although we did not ask - but it was very pleasant. I especially want to say about the food - we took breakfasts and dinners. Here is a direct respect to the chef - it is very diverse and very tasty: both European cuisine and Sri Lankan cuisine. There are always several options for meat, fish, squid, crabs were given every day, on some days there were even oysters - it's amazing for a buffet, I've been to many countries, but I haven't seen oysters on the buffet yet. There are a lot of different desserts and they are just delicious. Even my picky friend with gastritis praised the food in the restaurant)) I especially want to mention the waiters - in buffet restaurants on the stream they are usually tortured, but here everyone is smiling, sincerely trying to help you, tell you something if you ask I would like to thank the Maduranga waiter and the Lakmal chef for their special attitude and kindness in everything) The only thing that bothered me was the overly intrusive sellers of tours and tuk-tuk taxis, who simply did not let me pass anywhere quietly. Moreover, if you refuse them, they become aggressive, so I immediately share good contacts so that you do not have to waste time searching like us. According to recommendations from other tourists, we used proven and very adequate guys - here I give them contacts, maybe someone will also come in handy Chathumal Tuk-tuk Driver +94 77 440 6412 - speaks English well Car driver and guide Praneeth +94 77 619 8012 - he speaks English well, can tell a lot of historical and cultural facts - this is much better than taking drivers and guides at the hotel - they tell very little, they just drive like drivers Russian tours - Daria +94 76 188 4399 - it is more expensive, but for those who need Russian guides For all contacts, you can just write to whatsapp and negotiate - everything is simple and fast In general, the hotel is suitable for a relaxing holiday, most of the guests are elderly couples. It will also be boring for children here, but for those who want to relax and switch, it's just a great option

Special thanks to Chamuditha who is an amazing supervisor. He is extremely responsive and helpful throughout our stay. His positive spirit made our stay very nice and smiling. For sure for our next holidaywe will back in Sri Lankain heritance hotel thanks to Chamuditha.

We are very impressed with the way that Chamuditha on position Supervisor treated us and have care of us , durning our holiday he just made our stay in Heritance the dream holiday big thanks to him and to hotel Heritance, for sure we will visit Sri Lanka again next season â¤ï¸

My wife and I would like to thank you for a wonderful stay and the service, which was very helpful. We are especially grateful to the restaurant supervisor Chamuditha and the long-haired animator for the professional service. Thank you and we will definitely recommend you

I am really happy about my stay. Tasty and various food, beautiful beach, two big swimming pools, and very friendly stuff- in restaurant supervisor Chamuditha is very helpfull and kind - he is helping in everything and taking care of guests. Animator guy on the swimming - we love you ğŸ«¶

It was such a good trip with my family ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ‘§â€ğŸ‘¦â€¦.I liked it so much. Beach is so beautiful, ! I want to thank everyone in this hotel, especially Maduranga and Chamuditha. They are so professional! That guys gave best service ever!)))))They made my holidays!

The people who work here are amazingly nice and friendly. They constantly pay attention to our needs, we can only recommend the place. One of the nicest workers here, Chamuditha, was ready to answer our every request. We are very grateful! We plan to return.

This is our 2nd stay at this stunning property. Thoroughly enjoyed our 5 night's stay. We were privileged to stay in the executive suite which was great. We checked in on the Valentines day and was able to witness the valentines day celebration put together by the hotel staff on the beach. The GRO Dilsha who checked us in was very friendly and made sure everything was up to our satisfaction. Breakfast has a wide variety of Western and Sri Lankan dishes. Dinner buffet was outstanding and each day had a different theme. Chefs night was interesting with music provided by the chefs and waiters serving in Chefs uniforms. Upon request we were served with authentic polos curry cooked by Chef Saranga Bodinayaka. The best Polos curry we have eaten!! 2 staff in the restaurant Waruna and Jacob were good. Lasan and Chamindu in house keeping did an excellent job. Always with a smile. Kudos to Sisira Senaratne (GM) Who made our stay a memorable one.

Unfriendly staff Fake smiles Attitude Lack of flexibility I feel like a burden on the hotel I didnâ€™t feel like a guest at all Discriminative I felt that im not welcomed One of the staff interrupted me while i was talking to his colleague and told me 1 minute then he started to talk in Sinhala while me standing waiting for his permission to talk lol My first and last stay in this hotel

Perfect Hotel. Perfect Beach. And we finde a perfect Driver. If you value a safe and perfect ride, Indrajith de Silva is the right address for you. He drives very carefully and prudently. He always kept an eye on us in stores and places of interest. It was important to him to visit our places and not the places where he gets commission. He is well educated and it is fun to talk to him about the country and the culture. He also has a well-maintained and comfortable car. In short, the perfect driver in Ahungalla. Contact him. +94777761631 Regards, Thomas

The service was very nice.And the food was very nice . All the amenities were nice and hygienic. The staff were very helpful with all the requests. The sunset view is gorgeous in the evening. The pool was very big and the cleanliness and the safety were on point. I will definitely be recommending this hotel. And plan to visit Heritance Ahungalla again.

Thanks to Dilsha and Chef Kamal we had a fantastic day. The hotel was fully booked so we couldnâ€™t stay.. We had a fantastic day in the pool with easy access to the beach. Lunch was a feast. Seafood galore and lots of yummy puds. Thanks Kamal ( Chef Ashan and fam)

nicest hotel staff ever experienced. very friendly people. everything is very clean and tidy. especially Supervisor Chamuditha and Trainee Eranda made our stay a very pleasent and memorable experience. it was our first time in sri lanka and not the last time in Heritance hotel for sure. greetings from switzerland (Vale & Vivi)

Very much enjoyed our stay here. Lovely peaceful grounds , two large pools, lovely long, Sandy Beach to walk along. Sanduni was very patient with us all when we arrived, sorted out the rooms to our total satisfaction which ensured we had a great time here. We took taxis to Hikkaduwa for snorkelling and Galle for browsing, they're a reasonable price. The first driver was excellent- ML Pemasiri, we'd recommend him, booked via reception. All the staff are very friendly and helpful.

I stayed with my extended families, altogether 05 families on a half-board basis on 03 February. The stay as expressed by other members too was splendid. We were welcomed by Ms.Dilsha who was courteous and hospitable. As and when I saw her, she was wearing a broad smile moving around briskly to see to the convenience of guests. She even took some time to talk to us while we were relaxing at the Lobby after check-out. The dinner and breakfast buffet spread was generous and splendid tantalizing the taste buds. We enjoyed our short stay to the fullest surrounded by tranquility and soothing breeze.

This is a lovely hotel. All the staff are always smiling and canâ€™t do enough for you. From reception staff, bar staff, waiters they are all lovely. We stayed on a BB basis and the breakfast was very good with plenty of choice. We also ate in the Al a carte several times and was always good. If you are looking to do some trips speak to Siri on the beach. We done 3 trips with him and they were great value. Very good English speaking drivers and English speaking guides. If you want a truly traditional Sri Lankan curry speak to Siri. He can arrange this for you. Food was amazing. My husband had be wanting a spicy fish curry but all the ones we tried were no very spicy. Sandamali Boat safari do river trips with traditional Sri Lankan food. They cooked us a Sri Lankan curry for our evening meal which was delicious and nice and spicy. Can highly recommend for a great Sri Lankan experience. We also tried the bamboo massage which was great. Just ask Siri heâ€™ll show you the way. Karen and Michael (England)

Although the hotel is not entirely new, the rooms have good quality furniture and a wide balcony; we got a room on the third floor with a view of the sea and garden The air conditioner works well and silently, there are no Russian channels, but there is a purely music channel, the food is very decent seafood, squid, shrimp, crabs, oysters, beef tenderloin, pineapples, Pattaya, but they rarely served arugula, my favorite greens and Wine is only available in the restaurant, bar, cocktails and beer. But the main thing is that the ocean and a warm pool of 35 degrees are nearby and there are no water-motor modes of transport, a clean endless ocean Live music in the evening but not all musicians are good Requests to notice partially live music on compositions from the Internet were refused, so many evenings it was a bit boring. I donâ€™t recommend using taxi drivers near the hotel reception, the prices are too high, itâ€™s better to take a tuk tuk on the street+94 77 950 4156 Alim , you should also not leave things on the sunbeds in the evening, they took my swimming trunks this way, and you should be even more careful in the shops in a tent Opposite Rio, they didnâ€™t want to give change, we had to threaten that weâ€™d take away everything that was on the windows, then they returned it, I think Iâ€™ll come back here next time

Had a great stay there with our 8 months old baby. Super service and best buffets with good spread. We were very comfortable with the support of the staff. Nice beach and pool area. Safe environment. Highly recommended to experience a stay there.

Apart from the hotel, which offers a lot, great food, beautiful rooms. 10/10... I met here the most wonderful people in the world. I won't reveal too much... you have to visit this place yourself! Dilsha & Chamuditha Thank you so so much!!!!!

We have stayed at herritance few times before and they didnâ€™t disappoint this time also . Great staff good food and excellent views of the beach. From this trip special mention to Nipun from the front office and Waruna firm the service side. Had a great birthday dinner on the beach which was memorable. On my list of hotels to come back always

Outstanding service from the beautiful Sri Lankan staff at this hotel. We celebrated my husbands 50th birthday and were treated like royalty. Strongly recommend all to come here and enjoy. Suite was wonderful and pool was amazing. Breakfast was vast and plentiful.

Whilst we did not stay here, the hotel looked fantastic. Can definitely recommend one of the hotel drivers for tours. Sampath is a polite, attentive and knowledgeable driver/tour guide. He has a lovely modern air conditioned car. We went on a few long trips with him and everything was perfect. He does not operate from the beach but does do trips for some of the booking agents there. His phone number is +94 76540 2575

Excellent Hotels and very friendly Staff there specially Housekeeping manger Mr.Janaka and Front Desk MIs Sunethra and all the staff did great support my friends to make more memorable holidays. Highly recommend

We have had a ten day holiday . The hotel is a delight.the food is wonderful ,and the place stunning but what really makes it is the staff ,all were so friendly and efficient.our room cleaners led by Duminda helped by prasanna and nishan were excellent. Will return as soon as we can

What a wonderful hotel ! Combining as it does all that's best in Sri Lankan food, friendlyness and hospitality with the architecture of Geoffre Bahwa. Comfortable roomsand top rate service from all the staff. A special mention must go the 'room boy' Rukmal. His towel art always raised a smile when we returned to our room. Darshan , the guest services executive, along with the rest of reception staff were also incredibly helpful ,especially when I unfortunately damaged my toe. Thnks to Everyone. A superb hotel !

The hotel is clean, well protected, food excellent local and intercontinental, the staff helpful and polite. Nimalsiri de Silva Tours I highly recommend for excellent organisation skills and focus to make our trips comfortable and safe

Well done stay as the first experience in Sri Lanka, lovely and friendly staff ready always to help, what is national side of local people we loved. Our gratitude to all staff working hard for guests, especially to Rukhal from cleaning staff, my friend Mr. Nelka from swimming bar always friendly and smiled. We respect all their efforts to make our stay comfortable and enjoyed. The restaurant guys prepared palak-panic specially for us, so cute. We noted that a location is not so important because you may find all entertainments in your hotel or it might be outside visiting of sightseeings. We do recomend Mr. Sunny (sunnytours__srilanka) on this matter, speaking English, German and Russian well.

We had a great stay at Heritance Ahungalla this January! The hotel provides excellent quality for its price, everything is clean and comfortable. The staff was very nice everywhere, from the reception to the restaurant, and always responsive to our needs (special thanks to our housekeeper Rukmal, who made our stay even more comfortable:)). There is great food for every taste at the restaurant, if youâ€™re curious about traditional food â€” itâ€™s going to be heaven for you! There are always multiple types of curries, kottus and biriyanis, that vary every day. If you want something more familiar in food you will be satisfied too! We really miss having fresh sweet fruits with every meal. There are two pools at the hotel, one is very big and popular among kids, and the other one is smaller but way quieter and just heavenly. The nature at the hotel territory is very pleasant for the eye. There are some cute little animal visitors on the territory, but no scary big reptiles or insects (you need to be cautious of mosquitoes tho). There is live music in the lobby every night and one of the evenings we were surprised with a beautiful cultural show. On our first day we met a great tour guide whose name is Nimal, we bought an excursion from him to go to the old town of Galle and were very satisfied! Weâ€™ve had a great day, Nimal brought us to various great places and recommended a nice restaurant, weâ€™ve taken our time and explored all these places and the old town itself. We definitely recommend Nimalâ€™s tours! He is a great man that you can trust and always ask for a ride. I hope your stay goes as pleasant as ours! Thank you Heritance Ahungalla!

Excellent hotel, everything was perfect, clean rooms, polite staff, water aerobics every day at 11, varied and high-quality food in the restaurant. We took the all-inclusive package and ordered a Srilanka surprise cocktail every dayğŸ˜. In the main restaurant there are 2 employees, I would like to mention Chamila and Chamuditha, and also Nadeesha at reception, very attentive, polite, pleasant.â¤ï¸ The area is beautiful, there are a lot of different animals: monitor lizards, monkeys, chipmunks, fireflies in the evenings, it was very interesting for both children and adults. In the evenings they hold various events, including local dancing, fire shows, singing, and various games. 2 weeks of vacation flew by quickly. Thank you Ahungala Heritance for an unforgettable vacation!â¤ï¸ Today is the last day of our vacation, it is sad to leave this place. If we ever come to Sri Lanka, we will definitely come to Ahungala Heritance! I will recommend it to all my friends!ğŸ˜ With love, Rooms 108, 110 and 342 :)

Thank you very much for your hospitality and high quality of the service. I was very happy and hope will see you again. Special thanks for the support and friendly relations to supervisor Chamuditha while all period of our staying in you hotel. It was very nice to have meet with him and all staff of the hotel. Thank you and wish you all the best

Amazing architecture and cannot fault the staff; so attentive and kind. Think some of the rooms needs a refurb but nothing drastic just some TLC. Lovely pool, easy access to the beach. Food was pristine.

Heritance Ahungalla is a true gem, with very nice and kind personal and great hospitality. My stay was elevated by the exceptional service provided by Chamiditha supervisor, whose attention to detail and warm hospitality added an unforgettable touch to the experience. Moreover, I had different towel figures every day and it really cheered my up. Also, I love the food, it was very various and tasty every day!

Me and my partner always look forward to spending time at the heritance Ahungalla. What we like the most about the Heritance is its peaceful and relaxing environment. The hotel is designed by Geoffry Bawa who is a famous Sri lankan architect. The architecture blends beautifully with the surrounding natural environment with both open and hidden spaces to fully-immerse in the nature. As the hotel is located in front of a beautiful unspoiled beach it allows for long walks and experiencing the beautiful sunsets. Moreover, the main swimming pool is in front of the beach allowing you to admire the sea and the beach while swimming. The main reason that make us always come back to heritance Ahungalla is the friendliness of the staff. They always welcome us with a smile and make sure we are taken care of. Big mention goes to Duminda, Rebecca and Waruna from the restaurant who are always there to provide all we need and to make sure we have a wonderful experience at the restaurant. They always give us advice on the best food combinations to satisfy our food preference, as well as general advice and they are always there for us. The food at the restaurant is wonderful with a great selection from sri lankan, Indian, thai and European food. I fully recommend the heritance Ahungalla because of the wonderful experience provided by the friendly and welcoming staff, the tranquil environment, the quality of food and the amazing unspoiled beach. The best experience at the heritance Ahungalla is the new year celebration, offering the best buffet with ice sculpture and international food, bbq and sri lanka delights.

We stayed at Ahungulla Heritance just after Christmas 2023 - without family plus 13 friends. From checkin-to checkout, was a seamless process. The staff, lobby, pool, bar, restaurants and room - were super warm, friendly, attentive and efficient. There was a good mix of guests - UK, Russia, Australia, US, Estonia and Japan (from what I noticed). The kids had a great time in the pool - fun ball sports in the pool too. Beach was clean and had plenty of folks on it. The restaurants, both a la cart and buffet food was sensational - I just need to have a little more self control at the buffet! ğŸ˜‚ A big Thank You to all the Staff at Ahungulla Heritance for a thoroughly enjoyable stay. Cheers, Harin

Great hotel with great service! nice beach and varied food! Special thanks to waiters Dilusha and Bathiya. My daughter loved Dilusha! Very attentive and friendly.! Room service is very clean and helpful. There are a lot of animals in the garden, chipmunks and monkeys

Our day outing here was fascinating. Hotel was very well maintained. Swimming pool was large enough to move around. Ample variety of food was available. The Restaurant Manager Duminda was exceptionally helpful and hospitable.

It was an amazing stay. The room was beautiful and comfortable. Everything from the check-in to check out was managed so well by the team. Excellent service.Special thanks to Dilsha the guest relations officer who is so welcoming, helpful and a warm personality. The food spread quality and taste is a different level. Will definitely go back.

Graduation Dinner...!!! " After my Son's MBBS Convocation on 15th December 2023 we celebrated his Graduation Dinner at Heritance Hotel in Ahungalla. Which was the best decision we made as overall they gave us Kind & Warm Hospitality , Delightful Food & Professional Service !!!. Starting Heritance Ahungalla General Manager Mr. Sisira Senarathna & entire Management Team including RM Mr. Rasika, Ex. Chef Kamal, Sous Chef Umesh, Pastry Chef Gayan ,Restaurant & Bar Manager Mr. Duminda & his team , even Valet Parking & Bell Desk members at Lobby area were very polite and decent .They extended their sincere service more than up to our expectations. We were so relaxed and had no worries on our family gathering. Your Resident Manager Mr. Rasika specially took very good care of everything we requested. Food was excellent and made for perfection. Highly recommended!!! .All of our family members enjoyed & praised about your food & service. Once Again ..!!! Thank you so much Mr. Sisira [General Manager] for the wonderful Hospitality and Great Attention to detail..!!!. We enjoyed your comfortable and nice atmosphere with panoramic views of Christmas deco. We highly recommend your hotel specially the mouthwatering food & kind hospitality to anyone who wish experience private Family Gatherings, etc... Please convey our sincerer Gratitude...!!! to all the relevant staff members Best Regards...!!! Gajaba Hettiarachchi [Fellow of the Ceylon Hotel School Graduates Association ]

Me and my family visited Heritance Ahungalla.I have visited two times previously to this hotel. compare to previous visits this time is worst one. Rooms are not clean, and bathroom does not have hygienic seal and bathroom amenities such as toothpaste, toothbrush, slippers, water glass. But I love this hotel very much and food is tasty but does not have more verities except lunch. Restaurant is lonely place especially action station area has lack of persons to serve customers, awaiting lengthy period to taste food. I appreciate service of lifeguard who work at main pool on 16th October 2023. But overall, it was an enjoyable day, and we enjoyed a lot because this time we have room which have both sea and pool view. Beautifully design swimming pool is another attraction has large beach front. I Highly recommended this hotel, but you must improve your customer care and room service. Further I think it would be better if the old boat which is previously locate near the pool is restore because it is iconic attraction of the hotel.

The hotel itself is more than enough for a great holiday. You have your pool, your beach, and your room. The staff is polite and friendly. The food is good to great. Lots of meats and veggies. We only had breakfast and dinner - both were good. However, there were many problems. The rooms are somewhat clean. I believe Sri Lanka was open for tourism long enough to learn how to properly serve customers, but they are stillâ€¦ bad. So donâ€™t expect a perfect room. Rukmal - good cleaner who tried his best to make our stay more pleasant. Appreciate the towel elephant) Also - as long as you are not afraid of wild animals (monkeys, monitor lizards, insects), you will be fine. Otherwise, there are not many places to go to on the hotel premises. These animals are everywhere and I personally was terrified. Nevertheless, great opportunity to get close to wildlife! Overall, the weather and the ocean were unbelievable! Everything else is just a minor inconvenience. Would recommend!

We arrived in Heritance Ahungalle on Friday 8th Dec 2023 with a bunch of friends.Everyone, starting from the bell boy ,front office, restaurant, room service, pool, bar and housekeeping were very friendly and courteous and greeted us with a warm smile. The food was just ğŸ‘ great and divine and each and every dish was deliciously made with much love and care.Even the most simplest 'kola kenda' , ' lunu miris', and all the western dishes were very flavourful and "out of this world " The crispy batter fried fish served with tartar sauce during lunch was just awesome and liked by all. The "steaming pittu served with pol kiri and lunumiris and the hot hot hoppers made with love during breakfast was just amazing. " PANI APPA " is a must try by everyone. The live band which performed on Friday night was simply amazing and their songs were so soothing to listen to and helped us to dance our cares away. The Christmas decor done by the housekeeping section using all sustainable products is highly commendable. Hats off to the General Manager Mr.Sisira Senarathne for a over all good show Looking forward to be there once again to celebrate the New Year's Eve. "HERITANCE AHUNGALLA MY HOME AWAY FROM HOME AND THE PLACE I LOVE TO BE" DAMAYANTHI JIRASINHA

One of the good hotel in beach side with amazing interior designs too. The view with the beach is superb especially the pool area. The buffet was good with various verities as well.Rooms are clean and tidy and also the designs are amazing as the hotel.

Had an amazing stay at Heritance Ahungalla. Rite from the time we arrived we were welcomed with open arms, the checkin process was swift and smooth. The food offerings was an brilliant layout of scrumptious delicacies. Overall we loved every bit of our stay and we will definitely return.

Extremely friendly and helpful staff.. I lost my key card during my stay but they were super nice about it and replaced it without a fuss.. a good variety of food as well.. rooms were lean and well kept..

First advice is please don't go to this hotel. Except the location there is nothing. They are unable to serve proper veg food. Rooms have no proper facilities in washroom. Used bed sheets with blood stains are provided. Electric switches are broken. Telephones not working in some rooms. Seepage on walls. Dampness. Washrooms has no exhaust and smell like hell.

We stayed only one night in the hotel which was fully booked this day. The only option was to confirm a suite room. Price was ok since I am a resident and the room spacious and clean. The bath hub is a catastrophe since you cannot enter. The rain shower also should be repaired.... The highlight was the food. Huge selection of local and international food in good quality. I asked for the chef to thank him. His name was Lakmal.

Rakhim every day clean my room. He is smiling and always helped me when I didn't turn to him. He is a good person and an employee. A perfectly clean room. He's friendly and nice. I had a good time in Heritance Ahungalla.

Very good hotel, thank you Heritance Ahungala for a great holiday. Also thank you Rukmal for your work and smile. Very tasty food and beautiful view to the ocean, clean room. People always smile. Thank you very much. We comeback.

I recently visited Sri Lanka, in October 2023, for 2 weeks. It was an amazing experience, a beautiful place to discover. The people of Sri Lanka are welcoming and lovely. I spent most of my holidays in the south of the island, which is on the coastline and therefore dotted by many beaches. During my stay on the island, I was fortunate to have a local driver, Sampath, to drive me, while visiting the island. I first met Sampath at the airport, when he came to pick me up and he greeted me with the word 'ayubowan', which is a traditional and common greeting used in Sri Lanka. Sampath is a lovely gentleman, he was polite, professional and spoke English. He is an excellent and safe driver. Being a local, he had a vast knowledge of places to visit, where to shop and restaurants to eat at. Sampath was very helpful and assisted in organising my visits and trips to the following places; Hikaduwa, Mirissa, known for stilt fishing. On the way to Mirissa, we stopped at Angel Beach in Unawatuna, for lunch. The hotel and restaurant is on the beach front, it was a beautiful place for a bite and a drink while taking in the views of the ocean. Coconut Hill and then onto Galle. The Mask Museum in Ambalangoda. The Natural Moonstone mine and gem palace in Meetiyagoda. Then to Bordeaux restaurant for a seafood lunch and a boat safari on the Madu river. Aryuveda massages at Amalvilla in Bentota. A 2 day excursion to Sigiriya, where I climbed the Lion Rock. Visited the Sacred Tooth Relic Buddhist temple in Kandy. Stayed at the Mount Heaven hotel in Ella, with breathtaking views of the mountains and valleys. A once in a lifetime experience. Visited the Nine Arch Bridge in Ella and caught the train to travel across the bridge. At the end of my 2 weeks, Sampath was my trusted driver on the long drive back to the airport. And it was time to say my goodbyes to a beautiful country and its people, who have captured my heart and given me a lifetime of memories. I would highly recommend Sampath, +94765402575, as a driver and guide, if you ever visit the beautiful island of Sri Lanka.

My stay at Heritance Ahungalla was disappointing. The management's poor communication left me frustrated, and the staff although willing to help where poorly trained, lacked any authority or understanding of their own systems & processes which lead to a subpar service. The food and bed linens were only of average quality, further diminishing the overall experience.

My stay at Heritance Ahungulla was truly exceptional. The architectural beauty of this property, a tribute to the genius of Mr. Geoffrey Bawa, is awe-inspiring and visually appealing. The property itself is a work of art. The rooms were tastefully decorated, offering a perfect blend of comfort and aesthetics. The level of comfort in the rooms, was outstanding. The real standout, however, was the staff. Their warmth and commitment to guest satisfaction were remarkable. Their attentive service made a world of difference in making my stay memorable. This property is more than just a place to stay; it's an experience in itself. The architectural beauty, well-decorated rooms, exceptional staff, and delightful breakfast create an extraordinary combination. My stay here was nothing short of exceptional, and I eagerly anticipate the opportunity to return to this remarkable destination

Very comfortable Hotel right next to the sea. Big Rooms, 2 huge swimming pools. Super friendly staff and the gastronomy was great too. Big variety in the buffet restaurant. There is also a 24/7 a la carte Restaurant for whenever you are hungry

Hotel and stuff are amazing, the best food on Sri Lanka!! But hotel taxi driver call Sampath is the Best person we've ever met. The Best trip are with him!! We will back to this hotel, we have allready dont know when, but it will be soon.

Heritance Ahungalla offers the best in everything; rooms, beach & pool views, food, and cleanliness. The rooms & washrooms are extremely spacious & tidy. And the staff at the reception are very warm & welcoming! Only suggestion - make sure to segregate the veg options with a proper display. Veg sushi had the display but was mixed with seafood & chicken, and sadly even the chef couldn't figure it out until he tasted it & then confirmed.

An absolutely beautiful hotel, in a spectacular location. Well-kept, clean and tidy. Rooms are quite spacious and comfortable, equipped with gowns and slippers, toiletries, teas and coffees. Close proximity to the beach. Great food. But the best part for me, are the incredibly warm and kind staff. Special mention to Waruna in the dining hall. Thank you for making our experience that more enjoyable.

On arriving at Heritance Ahungallaâ€¦â€¦it was 3am and rain not waiting to come down: we didnâ€™t appreciate until the next morning how wonderful and picturesque this place was until the following morning. Our first couple of days were spent getting to know the hotel and its peopleâ€¦â€¦.they are the most amazing group who go out of their way to make this a home from home and always have a sole on their face all the time. There are too many staff to mention individually but one who deserves special mention is Rukmal who worked his magic everyday on our room and his inventiveness with towels and flowers is a joy to beholdâ€¦..we will miss you and your colleagues greatly and will look upon this as one of the most amazing holidays and locations we have ever been on and look at Rukmalâ€™s leaving present for us on our last dayâ€¦â€¦..think it demonstrates everything that is good about this place. Goodbye Sri Lanka and Heritance Ahungallaâ€¦â€¦.we will definetly return one dayâ€¦..itâ€™s a must !!!!

I was there for two nights with two of my French friends (Tour Operators) The first impression on arrival was extremally good and the welcome was quite impressive even together with the General manager himself of the hotel. Well trained staff in every department and food served was too extraordinary and absolutely there was nothing to grumble... However as a five-star property, this hotel needs an immediate renovation pretty soon. The corridors and most of the other public places look very dull and gloomy. Whilst thanking the management for providing us luxury renovated rooms, we also noticed during the hotel visit that the non-renovated rooms too need an immediate upgrading to compete with the upcoming new properties nearby. (it has been noticed that some renovations especially on the roof are underway)

Ğ’Ğµautiful and comfortable hotel! Cleaning every day. Friendly and attentive staff! Delicious and fresh food. Clear swimming pools and garden. Beautiful sunsets and dawn. Good live music. Give 5 stars and my heart!

Amazing!!! Ocean: wide. The beach is beautiful. Great people around, speak Russian! We have been to Sri Lanka more than once, but it was great here, and especially excursions with a Russian-speaking guide Kamal. He showed us tours all over Sri Lanka in his personal new car. Special thanks for the excursions to Kamal. He knows the history and customs of Sri Lanka well, and also showed us many sights of this island - such as; Sigiriya, Kandy, Yalla, Adam's Peak, Adam's Bridge, and we also visited with him the elephant nursery and botanical garden, as well as the nine-arch bridge. Trips and contacts Kamala +94 (77) 608 5334. An excellent guide to Sri Lanka. I definitely recommend it to everyone!

We had the opportunity to stay for one night. The pool and beach were truly exceptional, providing a delightful experience. The variety offered in all three meals was impressive, with a wide range of flavors that were quite enjoyable. However, I must express my disappointment with the accommodations. The room we were assigned felt quite dated, and the beds were not particularly comfortable. Additionally, the air conditioning unit's controller was malfunctioning, which affected our comfort. The bathroom was notably small, particularly the shower cubicle, making it inconvenient for a comfortable bathing experience. It's worth mentioning that the absence of a hand shower in the bathroom was a drawback. Regrettably, we also found that the staff did not display the same level of friendliness towards locals. Considering our experience, I would suggest this establishment for a day outing rather than an overnight stay.

I am still here, few more days left! The food is lovely, and the staff are brilliant - always there to support. The breakfast and dinner buffets were out of this world. The only minor improvement needed is for the lunch buffet, as it's not actually a buffet - you have to order the main meal, which can take a while. The rooms are clean and well kept, but they do look tired. Don't forget to bring your plug adapters. The only quirk is that without the Venetian blind, there's visibility into the toilet and bathroom, so it's more suitable for partners. What might need improving, room facilities, the bathroom/toilet. Can see into the toilet and bathroom, unless you have the blinds down. Lunch is not a buffet. You will have to order from a set menu.

Wonderful stay, thoroughly enjoyed by all. Highly recommended. Staff gave us a fantastic warm welcome and all around we appreciated the very warm and friendly staff, from reception, housekeeping, pool, restaurant where the very friendly and helpful Waruna and his colleagues looked after us, through to the wonderful and charming GM Sisira, staff were utterly sincere and really keen to extend a warm experience. The food, with their new chef, was outstanding. The hotel and rooms are the best of legendary Bawa's architecture. Loved the clean straight lines, majestic pillars, large and airy rooms with fantastic views, superb in room amenities. The infinity pool, beach views, unrestricted views of the starry sky, lovely clean beach all were breathtaking. I also appreciated some very rare facilities like a good gym, two pools, tennis court, table tennis, badminton, lovely greenery - these are becoming quire rare. Heritage Ahungalle is a true gem. Thank you all for making it a memorable stay

One of the best resorts in the Ahungalla. Really enjoyed our stay in the property. Though the foul smell in the elevator and ongoing construction in our wing was a bit turned off otherwise everything else was really comfortable.

a group of school friends stayed a couple of nights here. The staff at the hotel were extra accommodative of all the random requests. The check in was smooth, the billing too was quick. We found the meals to be of a high standard. The staff however were so pleasant. We tried to play some school girl games (as we were nostalgically reliving our past). The hotel allocated a separate area for our activity, and even provided efficient fist aid when needed. We had a loud noisy party in the night and the hotel ensured that our merriment was uninterrupted by providing - whatever we needed. Definitely a superior choice of hotel for group outings, looking to have an easy and fun time with good food and staff that are very helpful.

This was the second time I visited the Hotel. The very first time I visited with my toddler. It was very easy to handle her with the environment. Secondly, it was my corporate trip on Christmas Day. The gala dinner was superb and beyond expectation. It's so magical. Can't believe the way they managed a huge crowd. Service of the staff was also excellent with such a huge crowd. We enjoyed the beach time and magic event very much.

Really enjoyed the hotel ambience. Amazing staff with smiling faces all the time. Food a little disappointed as there are not many options for veg and chicken. Amazing view from the hotel and very clean . Rukmal was amazing in providing service.

Very nice stay. If youâ€™re choosing this hotel for the stars, donâ€™t. I wouldnâ€™t say itâ€™s a 5* in everything but I will say that the staff deserves even more than 5*! Stay here to be treated right, have a carrying staff and very good food ! I really enjoyed my stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel

Had a wonderful time visiting with the family for one night over the weekend. Been to Heritance properties quite often and this one too delivers the high standards of the brand. Staff were very helpful, friendly and always welcoming. They didnâ€™t hesitate to fulfil our requests. In a nutshell, Heritance Ahungalla is a very family friendly hotel with quality rooms and dining, topped off with an excellent team of staff. Will come back again.

WOW!!! We returned to this beachfront hotel 22 years after first visiting, we took our 2 grown up children for a final "memorable" family holiday. The staff at the hotel were amazing and when they found out that we had been there in 2001 they made us feel extra special. Both rooms had a sea view, both were large, clean, comfortable and air conditioned. The meals were all buffet style and there were always lots of options to choose from, the quality of food was generally very good and the service of the drinks waiters was fantastic. We were on the all inclusive package and the snack menu available from the bar was extensive but only available between 11-12 and 4-5 unfortunately. The drinks from the bar were great and also had a decent selection of cocktails to choose from. Sunbeds were always available and towels provided. Perhaps the best thing however about this fantastic hotel is the attitude of the staff , we were always being told that if there was anything that we wanted then we only had to ask, and they did indeed provide anything that we requested. Very special thanks to :- Sisira Senaratne (General Manager) Dilsha (guest relations), Nalin and Kalinga (bar staff), Presad (pool attendant), Jacob, Nihal, Jananjaya and Nuwan (restaurant), these are just a few of the brilliant staff members, but every single person at the hotel were so friendly and welcoming. So sorry to leave this wonderful hotel but will hopefully return again soon.

A very good expÃ©rience. Staffs are very kind and helpfull and always available. The food is really good with huge variety and good quality too. The view is just extraodinary with swimming pool. Heritance Ahingala is absolutly fabulous.

Short and Sweet!!! We had such a great stay at this beautiful property Heritance Ahungalle!! From the welcoming smiles and till we departed the stay was just impeccable! Sisira Senaratne and his team are amazing !! Dilsha from guest relations is just the most warm hospitable person, Chef Gayan Thank you for the fabulous dishes !! Loved every single meal we had. Especially the customized lunch on the first day !! Varuna and Nelka from the main restaurant you are super stars !! Thank you for being so humble and accommodating us!! I could go on and on .. Highly recommend a minimum 2 nights stay to make the most of this beautiful place. Thank you for making our stay in Sri Lanka a beautiful one!

It was a family trip with my husband and my 16-month-old son. The room was very good. We booked a Premium King with Sea View, but we got a pool-view room. However, the view was not bad but wished they gave us what we booked. The food was not as I expected at all. I stayed at this hotel a few years ago and the food was amazing then but this time the food was very average. I got a rotten taste in one of the meat items. The jacuzzis in the pool area were not working also. Overall it was a bad experience because we had high expectations compared to the last stay. Nevertheless, we liked the rooms very much. It was very clean.

We booked a hotel for 10 nights. Hotel is really nice with a beautiful ocean view ğŸ˜ very friendly and assistive staff. Cleaning was happening every day. The guys from â€œDream Toursâ€ agency - Dinesh and Dhanushka made our trip unforgettable. They can help to arrange tuktuk or a car rent with a driver and guide to take tour anywhere you want. We managed to explore all the Southern coastğŸ˜Š and even Kandy and Colombo with them. Highly recommended, DREAM TOURS Dinesh and Dhanushka mobile numbers 0094779951582, 0094779412592. Very reliable and honest guysğŸ™ŒğŸ»

The hotel is extremely beautiful, the pool is right in front of the private beach. You can view pretty sunsets and see a star studded sky at night. Food was great and house keeping and service was exceptional. Please ask for Rukmal, heâ€™s very helpful!

The property is nice though but the maintenance seems quite not up to the standard. Nice buffet and dining area. The beach view and pool area are very nice and attractive. the staff is very friendly and supportive all the time. Recommended for day outings.

The Hotel is beautifully located by soft beaches and lapping waves. It's a luxury hotel in the spectacular south coast of Sri Lanka. Sprawling expanses of green fauna. Rooms are amazingly equipped with all the needed amenities of comfortable bedding, clean towels, bath robes, tea and coffee stations, private varandas and balconies, study niches and comfortable sofas etc. Food and beverage department is fabulous. Array of variety and quality on buffets for every meal. Several action stations to delight the taste buds of any guest. International cuisine buffets are spread out with fabulous presentations and garnishing. Salads, soups, breads, courses, pastas and meats, seafood and local treats of hoppers, puttus, strings and rices with fresh vegetables and fruits. Deserts and cakes are also amazing in flavour and variety. Executive chef Kamal, Food Beverage managers of Sudarshini and Nipun, with stewards of Dulangljani, Tharaka , Hanshana and the entire team of cooks, chefs and attendees were fabulous . They are couteous and diligent and prompt. They provide personalised care. Front office staff are also very warm and welcoming. We were greeted by a blend of spices and fruit juices and very quicking check-in procedures. Beautiful room was assigned with a view of sprawling lawns and beaches. Two large pools, Jacuzzis and well equipped gym were also available. The animater Raju does a fabulous job with Water Aerobics and volley ball and personalised guiding. His services are indeed a hallmark of attraction to the Hotel. The entire team under the capable leadership of managers showcase the excellence of Sri Lankan Hospitality. Well done Heritance Ahungalla. Will recommend your services to anyone I know.

As a well travelled guest, Heritance Ahungalla was one of the worst hotels I have been to. My friends and I arrived at the hotel after a long day, expecting the welcome they advertise. But we were greeted with nothing and yet I noticed the foreign tour group next to us at the hotel were getting a great welcome. The foreign guests were given a welcome drink in front of me and even when j was checking in, nothing was really done. This was extremely disappointing to see as their attention was on the foreign guests, even though the hotels are kept afloat by locals even in times of crisis. In a sense, it felt as if I and my friends were purposefully ignored at the welcome to focus on white people. Next, the rooms were OK and clean with the needed amenities. The pool was ok and the environment was relaxing and calm. But the Jacuzzis are broken and one was unusable. This really dampened the experience. Thirdly, the buffet. The food experience was TERRIBLE. I stayed ful board for 2 days and the food was the same everytime. There was not much variety and so, it was really disappointing. At one point during lunch, I found MOLD in my food!!! The same night during dinner, my friends and I ate carved roast pork and the meat was rotten. It smelled bad and when I ate a bite, it was so rotten and I had to throw it away. The breakfast buffet had some diversity and was enjoyable. The staff is nice and accommodates our wish. The bar makes a really good cocktail called the green pool. Other than that, it was a poor experience. Serving bad food to guests and ignoring local guests to focus only on foreign guests was what made me write this review. I never badly review anyplace I travel to unless its horrible, like ahungalla was. It did not serve a purpose to my business trip either. Would never visit again.

This was the 4th time we visited Heritance Ahungalla for the year 2023,we have been continuously been handled by Ms. Sunethra who never fails to surprise us on each of our visits. She is always prompt, friendly, courteous and very professional in her approach, she is one of the main reasons we keep on coming. Waruna at the restaurant is a busy Bee efficient as can be, always smiling and never has "No" in his vocabulary. Such a lovely site to meet during the meals. Rukmal , Housekeeping is also very friendly and very helpful, and attends to your every need. He is a very talented individual who can make any kind of animal using towels. Being a former Cinnamon Hotels and Resorts Employee I am amazed at how Aitken Spence Hotels has treated me and my family, it's truly touching. Thank you so much Sunethra and the team in every department for all the memories you have given us, we will be back 0ne last time before we leave Sri Lanka to say bye to you all. The food this time was mouth watering and the best after some time, congratulations to the new Chef. Well done. Wishing the whole team, the very best always.... Keep the flag flying high !!!

A beautiful room with a view of the sea, but it is far from it, and the most beautiful thing is a towel that they form on a dog, an elephant, or a turtle There are two excellent workers whose job I loved rukmal and ronali

Nestled in an idyllic location by the sea, this hotel is a perfect choice for groups and families seeking a lengthy and memorable stay. While not all rooms offer sea views, the overall ambiance is sure to captivate guests. During our visit, the hotel was fully booked, but the efficient front office staff adeptly managed the bustling crowd. Despite being assigned a room on the second floor, which lacked a noteworthy view, we found the accommodation to be below the expected standard for a 5-star establishment. The culinary experience was a delight, with all three meals served in a buffet style. The food was undeniably delicious, although the service provided by the restaurant staff could benefit from improvement. Families travelling with infants may want to arrive at the restaurant early to secure limited baby seats during peak hours. An array of both outdoor and indoor sports activities awaits guests, promising entertainment and enjoyment throughout their stay.

Overall the experience at the hotel was exceptional. Check-in - It was quick and smooth Location - This beach hotel has direct access to a beautiful coastal area. Rooms - Very good. Only negative part was, there was no sea view for the Delux room that we stayed. Food - Heritance hotel chain has not dissapointed me yet regarding the food they offer. Their buffet was good. Overall - It was a very good experience from check-in till the check-out.

We just spent 2 nights at the heritance. We had a lovely stay. Lovely pool and fantastic beach. Comfortable room. Lovely bed. The food was amazing. Such an amazing variety of food for all meals. Something for everyone and so tasty. Amazing sea food. Different foods every meal as well. As always though the best thing about any hotel in Sri Lanka is the staff. Always so attentive and helpful. Special thanks to a few of the team. Room cleaner Saman - very friendly, caring and helpful. Food and beverages- nipun and sudharshini were very helpful. Front desk - Mithma and Bhanuka extremely helpful and so pleasant. Restaurant - Nelka. Looked after us so well. Made us special cups of tea for us at breakfast including a special Sri Lankan " yard" tea

The hotel is very old and is very pathetic the bathroom really sucks the building is very old and needs high upgradation it's not a five star property at all that is Baba Adam ke Jamane ki hotel like Dharamshala the bathroom walls are without pain and that are insect and animal creatures in your room including Chameleon and dogs in balcony very cheap hotel never visit again and waste of time and money you will spoil your tour by visiting this hotel

A lovely hotel, as usual, with a great location. The staff, especially those in the front office including Sanduni and housekeeping areas, are friendly and accommodating. The buffet is fantastic, offering a wide variety of delicious options. The rooms are well-presented and provide a comfortable experience for guests.

It was the best family trip I have ever been on so far and our stay was very peaceful. Checked in 15 minutes before the regular check-in time and management does not rush for the checkout. The hotel staff is really nice to my kids and it was very nice to see that behaviour. Mainly the food is delicious and it had almost all varieties of seafood, vegetables, and meat. The hotel do have 02 large swimming pools and mini jacuzzi type for kids. Highly recommend this place for a stay and hope the staff will remain with the same standards.

HA offers multiple experiences to all age groups. We celebrated our anniversary with our extended family. The older folks enjoyed the sea breeze and the hoppers naan n yummy Fish curry, the kids enjoyed the jnr chef experience and Magic show while the pre teens enjoyed the pool, games and bbq. We enjoyed some romance ğŸ˜

Beautiful hotel! Helpfull staff, tasty food on breakfast and diner!!! Good beach and pool! It is handsome hotel for your trip! Room is big ang has good view on ocean. Hotel has new repair and big square. I will back again!!! Every evening show programm. I recommend all.

The pillows are not fluffy ,the room is not good because the whole hotel is good the food is tasty the ac are cold and. you are so good and I am thankful for GM to bringing for a good good hotel and good city I very very enjoyed it

Excellent & a very pleasant stay. Very cozy rooms. Room service is also good. Beach excess is convenient. Food is good but need some improvement. Ambiance is excellent. Very positive and advice you to stay in this property.

Great arrangements and great staff.and also nice ambience .Sri Lanka is a best place to visit with more varieties interms of climate ,food and all.smiling people and caring is exceptional .This hotel is a classic example for all .

Went to this lovely hotel after a lapse of a few years. The rooms,food and the services were excellent. The staff were super friendly from the reception to the staff at the restaurant. We really enjoyed our stay for three days and hoping to visit soon.

We enjoyed the property very much and good hospitality excellent quality and great experience we would love to visit again excellent reception staff excellent kitchen and food division they gave.veg food as we wanted thanks for making memorable trip

The property, service, ambiance everything was very premium and also they upgraded our stay to luxury rooms and cooperated with us very well Had a great time enjoying in the pool and the beach which gave a very private property feel

Room is really comfortable. All three meals were great with lot of varieties. The premises is free to roam and many activities to engage with like table tennis, badminton, tennis, beach volleyball. And the pools were great where there were pool attendants all the time. And even easy access to beach.

Wonderful experience..wonderful staff throughout the stay with friendly efficient staff especially Mithma at Front Office . Good food selection, overall a super experience. Room and hotel facilities exceptional. Very clean . Hygienic

Excellent place to stay Had a good experience in heritance ahungalla,been here 6 times before, very nice staff, they make food for your preference, nice and very tasty food, clean and tidy rooms, very nice restaurant and room service staff highly recommended to anyone.

We had a great experience in heritance hotel .Front office team is very helpful. We felt comfortable in our surroundings but also very impressed with such good service. I have no hesitation to recommend this place. We are looking forward to returning soon..

My wife & I went from England for a 5 days holiday to celebrate a special birthday at Heritance Hotel in Ahungalle. It is a superb hotel with friendly & helpful staff with smiling faces. Food was excellent with good choices. Room & bathroom was very clean and comfortable. Pool was excellent and plenty of deck chairs with new towels. Nice sandy clean beach was just few meters away from the pool. We were made to feel at home by all the staff. We are planning to go again.

It was indeed a lovely moneyworth stay under a super service from all of the staff members.The location was scenic and quiet.There was an acceptable variety of food items.We highly recommend this place for your vacation.

Awesome architecture embracing nature....a fantastic large pool which seems to merge with the sea! Great food and comfortable rooms. The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. Loved our stay here.....a definite come-back to place.

Excellent Trip .Very good staff. Specially front office.We. had a great time.There are two swimming pools .Green pool was very calm and quite.And also need to mention about hotels animators.Both of them are super talented guys.Thank you for everything.we would like to come back.

Great hotel with delicious food.Thank you everyone specially reception staff .They are very good and friendly.From the check in to check out they gave a very good service.Very attractive staff.Thanks once again.Will come back

Very relaxing holiday, with excellent service from the time we arrived. The room was clean and the sea view was great, comfortable bed and amenities looked after by Silva, our room attendant. Food was delicious with numerous choices, headed by Executive Chef Kamal and must also mention 2 other young chefs Sulochana and Sudesh. Thank you guys. Another person who stood out for us was the Customer Service Executive Dilsha, ever so helpful and always with a smile. Thank you for making the start of our holiday so lovely. To those of you reading this review, you won't be disappointed, this is a great hotel.
