Wonderfull stay. Actually this was my third visit to the hotel. I must say that the friendly staff, delicious foods and cleen rooms were not changed over the years and my stay was perfect because of above reasons.

One of the best stays in down south coastal area. Experience at Heritance Hungalla was amazing. Food was really really tasty and the hospitality of the staff is really good. Room was also in a very good condition with lots of amenities.

Thank you so much Dilsha and the team for the Amazing hospitality. I did feel like it was coming home to with the great love and care which was provided to us with the brief stay we had with you. Keep up the good work and continue to shine.

We were unfortunate to stay at this hotel on a day that they celebrated the Earth Day in 2023. We love, encourage, and actively participate in similar programs. The problem was, how the hotel management went about the celebration and their lack of planning. Hotel management decided to shut all electrical lights in the downstairs lobby area, then lighted kerosene torches. There were so may kerosene torches lit all over the area (including bar, near pool etc.) and the smell was unbearable, air was unbreathable. Add 100C temperature and humidity to the situation and it was absolute hell. What was the point of this stupid show? They probably added more pollutant to the air by burning all the kerosene for few hours than the greenhouse gases emitted to generate electricity. Stupidity at its best was in display at Heritance Ahungalla on 3/23/23.

Mithma was very nice with us all. Food was awesome and loved it all. Hotel as always is so lovely. Thank you team for everything, we loved the stay and canâ€™t wait to come back. Pool and SPA also was very good and it was a pleasant stay.

Exceptional stay at Heritance Ahungalla! Have been to this hotel over five times and their service has never failed once. We were given the highest concern and attention throughout our stay from guest relations (specially dilsha) to restaurant staff and others. Clean and comfortable rooms and exceptional meals! Beautiful hotel, we will definitely be back ! Thankyou Heritance Ahungalla!

We were made to feel at home from the time we arrived with their friendly smiles saying "Ayubowan". The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The pool was clean and welcoming at all times. The dining room was large and well appointed with the variety of food offered you could not go hungry even if you tried. Good surroundings. The service provided by Management and staff was excellent. The staff are friendly and service provided at all times with great smiles, politeness, and very efficient. You need to stay at this Hotel, to get the real feel of the place etc. Thank you to one and all for making our stay a memorable one, and we promise to revisit soon. In the meantime keep smiling. "Ayubowan" until we meet again.

Perfect for a weekend getaway! An amazing experience especially if you love the beach. You will be greeted by friendly staff members of the hotel where ever you go. Overall, the stay was definitely a one to remember.

this is the 3rd time I have been to Ahungalla, sorry to say I found it pretty ordinary, definitely not 5-star anymore. Good: Friendly staff. Bad: Terrible buffet and food offering, pretty ordinary food repeated again and again. Not worth it. Though it is costly, hard even to believe aitkense runs this place. Cleanliness in toilets and bathrooms is not up to the standard. Pretty an ordinary set-up, not the hotel it used to be.

Located 10km north of the city of Ambalangoda, Heritance Ahungalla offers classy stay along a beautiful beach. It has two pools, one with two heated Jacuzzis and a friendly staff. We were warmly received by Ms. Mithma who showed us around and made us feel home. The room balcony had a magnificent view to the Indian Ocean and the beach. The food could have been better, but it was definitely above average. We will surely come back for another stay for the beach and the hospitality!

Well The overall experience is not bad.. The two Pools were clean, big and had a good time swimming.. But the Jacuzzi pools were not clean.. Was very unpleasant to get in.. staff is friendly and supportive, except the staff in the buffet area.. Its like they are annoyed with the guests who are dining there.. One girl poured water to the glass until its over flowed.. She apologised but ddnt have enough time to clean it for us she got occupied with something else.. I dont blame her, But the hotel management becauae it seemed like they were over worked the shifts.. Some of them were exhausted and unable to provide the service as expected by the guests paid for a pleasant dining time.. Poor service from taking away the finished plates to filling up the finished dishes.. Buffet was average in my opinion, food is good, considerable amount of variety was there.. but i hope they can improve a lil bit more when it comes to buffet and dining.. Apart from that the stay was satisfying.. We booked a premium delux room.. Which was spacious and clean.. But the bed was uncomfortable.. I expected for the bathrooms to be cleaner and more pleasant looking for a five start hotel.. Heard complaints from the guests in deluxe rooms.. So make sure to book higher rooms.. I recommend this hotel for a get away with avarage expectations.. Surely not upto five star standards specially compared to herritance kandalama.. The reception staff was very nice.. The check in was easy and quick.. Beach was clean.. Place is quiet and peaceful.. Just some improvements are needed to keep up the five star standards..

We visited Heritance Ahungalla for our Wedding Anniversary and I would like to take my time to say how amazing the service was, the staff members of the hotel was so polite and helpful also special thanks to The Restaurant Manager Duminda who was so helpful with everything.

The stay we had was super, room , food and service was excellent. Special thanks to Dilusha who was in front office who gave special care and treatment for us. Its the perfect hotel for a group getaway and the location is ideal

If you want a cheap five star hotel and youâ€™re not looking for a luxury experience, this will do. But if are expecting quality this is not the place. The good: Rooms are clean and recently renovated, has three pools, great SL food The bad: Common areas are tired, dining room is cramped, you have to fight to get food, bathrooms smell

Beautiful hotel, ever welcoming cordial staff, very comfortable spacious rooms, great flavorful array of food! Our trip to Sri Lanka was completed after staying at this hotel! Thank you for the memorable stay! Will be back!!

We spent 3 nts during the Sinala New year and this was my best New year in years. April 12th -15th. We had an early check in, a good room and excellen servies. Special mention of Roshan pf Housekeeping, Rasika Ratnayake , Mgr,Sudarshini Exe, Jananjaya staff all of F&B and ofcouse Dilsha Guest relations.

Mithma was soo helpful. We came for the anniversary and she organised room deco as surprise for my gf. And the deco was amazing. Gave us a cake as well. Mithma was looking after my surprise to my partner. She was organising everything and I didnt had to look for anything she was managing everything from the beginning to end. If any one plans any special event like a proposal or anniversary contact Mithma and she will get the job done perfectly Food was delicious and service also good. Got a big pool area and some good views

Driven by excellent previous experiences we had at Heritance Kandalama, we booked a 3 nightsâ€™ half-board stay at Ahungalla with similar expectations: that we will receive a service in accordance to a 5 stars hotel, customer oriented and with attention to detail. But unfortunately this was not the case. With the exception of the reception staff who was very friendly and efficient, the rest was below the average, especially at the main restaurant. On more than one occasion had to make exaggerated gestures to catch the waitersâ€™ attention and had to repeat our order of water and or coffee during breakfast and dinner. The used plates were often not removed, so we either had to again make exaggerated gestures to get the assistance of a waiter or make room ourselves. On top of that, getting the food from the buffet was quite a stressful experience by having to dodge tables, chairs and people (it was way too crowded!). Likewise, we faced a similar situation at the infinity pool bar. Given that the waiter was taking too long to come â€“we opted for standing up and going to the bar too make our order. Then we had to do a similar thing to get the bill as well. It was also quite unfortunate that the bar from the guestsâ€™ pool was not operative and no equipment was provided to get a better use of the lovely beach (lounge chairs and sunshades). A real pity, we expected much more from what it used to be such an iconic hotel.

Had a wonderful stay at Heritance ahungala with the family. The ambiance food and hospitality was great. We really enjoyed the stay. The rooms were cozy and comfortable, bit old looking. Recommend this place for a family outing

Stayed with my family beginning of March 2023, accommodation was excellent even though it is pretty old property well maintained and managed. we were upgraded on arrival to a suite room, which was very welcome and never expected 2 rooms to be upgraded. The food in the main restaurant was excellent with a huge spread. And a huge THANK YOU goes out to Sanduni (Front office manager), who helped us from the time we booked until the departure, thank you from our hearts that you took so good care of us during our stay at Heritance Ahungalla. Looking forward for our next stay here.

All the staff were very helpful and hospitable. It was nice to see the avurudhu uthsavaya and the staff getting everyone involved. The food and the room was also fantastic. I also used the spa during our stay and it was an absolutely relaxing experience. Thank you so much to Dilsha for constantly checking up on us and being a wonderful host with a kind soul. Also thank you to Nalin at the poolside bar and all the restaurant staff for their amazing service. We are looking forward to coming back next time.

We had a very good experience at this hotel. The staff were really friendly especially Ms Dilsha. She was very helpful when ever we met her . And they had an Awurudu event which was well organized . The hospitality of the staff was very good and I have not seen in any other hotels as of now. The food was also very delicious . The swimming pools are awesome . The room was also very spacious and comfy. Overall 5 star rating for this beautiful hotel . Itâ€™s very child friendly too. Will be visiting this place again for sure .

It has been lovely stay at heritance ahungalla, staff is very friendly and kind, specially Dilsha has been very helpful. I will definitely visit again. Many thanks to the hotel staff! And yaasss food was amazing!

Good service Friendly staff Good view Actually in this hotel give the best service to us and it's giving good view to us and their giving different kind of services to help for us and try to satisfy them

Very special place to relax and feel the sun and the ocean at its best. But nothing special around the hotel. But no problem to rent a bike and explore the Sri Lankaâ€™s beauty by yourself. Special thanks to Manoi for room cleaning!

Sri Lanka has a lot of beggars, this place secures you from that. Service, food and rooms are great. My time spent here was very pleasant and relaxing. Altought, I failed to figure out if the beach is into the indian ocean or laccadive sea. In summary - great.

One of the best experiences i have had at Heritance hotels. Despite the low tourism wave and the situation of the country , heritance staff still managed to put a huge smile on our face with the wonderful service. Its the little things that matter. On the first 2 days there was no buffet due to low occupancy and my kids were quite disappointed. But the way the staff were catering to our needs we quickly forgot about the buffet. The swimming pool was amazing and what's more there was always a pleasant keen face watching over the kids. It really gave that little break to relax. Same on the beach. we always felt safe and happy during our stay here. The little Christmas choir by the hotel staff was quite cute. Mr Rukmal got a first hand squeals of delight from the kids with his artistic decorations in the room using towels and flowers. :-) Lovely stay and i cant wait to go back. Thank you Heritance Ahungala team for making our stay so memorable

Everyone in the staff is very polite and welcoming. We had certain issues with the room that was given to us on our arrival but as soon as we reported it, Dilsha and her team (sorry for not knowing their names) attended immediately and upgraded the room, which was totally beyond our expectations. The food was amazing as well. Rukmal had also done a fantastic job in preparing our room and his towel origami was truly gorgeous. All in all everything was just *chef's kiss*

I was upgraded to a second floor premium suite which gave access to a quiet balcony that I could use to relax on - facing beach and hearing the sound of the waves. This room also overlooked a green area - enjoyed this. I would recommend booking a room in this side of the complex if you want to relax. Special call out to Sanduni - assist. Manger. She really turned my stay into something else. She and the Staff were so kind and thoughtful. Great hotel for morning and afternoon long walks on the beachâ€¦ this was probably the best part for me. There is also a small beach bar nearby for something different. I swam in the ocean though accept it is not always possible - pending weather. A great stay especially for a family- I met some who really made the most of the swim facilities and well-cared for pool. But like many places in SL - the team are the most important and here are great.

Our family had a very enjoyable holiday at Heritance Ahungalle and the facilities that were available to guests were excellent. The staff members were very polite and professional. They were very friendly too. Mithma in particular was very cheerful and friendly.

Very nice hospitatlity. We were welcomed with a drink which was really nice. Mithma was a really nice staff here as well. She was very nice throughout my stay. The resort is very beautiful. Vegetarian options are also there. Loved your resort

From the get go 'Dilsha' from the front office and 'Tharaka' from F&B went above and beyond to make our experience super comfortable and memorable. The hotel is another work of art by 'Jeffrey Bawa' and has serenity written all over it. I remember visiting the hotel many times as a kid when it was known as 'Triton', before the 2004 Dec Tsunami. Apparently, it is the first 5 star hotel established outside of Colombo back in the day. The only downside was that the sea was always a bit rough, where we had to hold my 6 year old's hand at all times when near waves. The super serene 'Green Pool' surrounded by the most beautiful greenery compensated for this. The F&B section headed by Rasika is beyond commendable. After being exposed to a series of bland food at other hotels, our palates opened up with every morsal of food we experienced. Every type of cuisine had the right balance of flavours with most having a Sri Lanka touch to it. The deserts were fresh, juicy and authentic, from macroons loaded with nuts, chocolate biscuit pudding, gateauxs, cakes, mouses, wattalappam, chocolate puddings, creme brulÃ©s etc. The only property who served fresh crabs and tiger prawns in the buffet. we've been hotel hopping all the way from the north, eastern seas border and Beruwela and was yet to experience this level of freshness, authenticity and effort towards F&B. In short, the food was sooo good that it made me cry happy tears... A hotel with a true Sri Lankan soul, oozing with old school Sri Lankan hospitality is a must visit whether you're Sri Lankan or not! Can't wait to be back!

Our room cleaning service managed by Rukmal was very well done. He made sure every wish was fulfilled. The Hotel itself was unfortunately average, rather a 3 star hotel for european standards. Generally not the cleanest, but okay. Gym was small, old fitness machines (but okay too). The staff was extremely polite and friendly, sometimes they havenâ€˜t been that service oriented as one would wish in terms of: you go to the reception for a certain matter and you have to Come Back again and again instead of them taking a note and reach out to the guest instead. This way the guest has to do the work and not the Hotel. It should be the other way round ( but weâ€˜ve noticed that in other sri lankan hotels). Theyâ€˜re trying, but Just have other Standards. Nice Beach and Pools, a Bit crowded Some days. Food ist average to Good.

Great hotel right on the ocean. Relaxation and opportunity forget about problems. Excellent service and friendly staff. Thanks for Rukmal and all staff for comfortable staying. I hope to come back someday
Perfect and traditional hotel with nice nature to enjoy vacation and relax Delicious food and beautiful beach And comfortable room to rest With good service Kind and friendly staff definitely MITHMA

We had a wonderfull stay at the Heritance Ahungalla in Sri Lanka. People are so friendly and do everything they can to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Special thanks to mister Rukmal who kept our room very clean. A very friendly person. Always a nice attention on the bed with the towels. He did very nice things with it. Thanks to the poolboys who took care not only of the pool but also of the sunbeds and parasol. Everyday fresh towels and sunbeds made up. Also a nice attention from the gardners who gave us fresh flowers every day. Also at the bar and restaurant you were always served with a smile. Great food and drinks. Very nice hotel with great rooms. Just outside on the beach Mister Pathmi can offer you some nice trips..he is an experienced guide and very reliable. Sri Lanka is a very special country with lots to offer and very kind and friendly people. Heritance Ahungalla and his staff were excellent.

Excellent service. Staff is very friendly and awesome. Dilusha who works around us given splendid service. Thanks dilusha & keep it up. All the very best for your future. Lunch, dinner n breakfast are all good.

The lunch buffet is not great, not much of a selection. Washroom is tiny and very uncomfortable to have a shower. Two beds are put together. Room 131 or any other corner room is not a good room. So try your best to avoid that room because it will ruin your stay.

We were at Heritance for 1 night stay but due to super hospitality provided by the entire staff we extended the stay for another day to enjoy & relax.... We stayed in a Super comfort family room which is very clean and well maintained too. Mr Sisira Senaratne - GM , Duminda - Restaurant Manager (The Best) gave a personalise attention all the time , Rasika - F&B Manager took care of us very well. Food was excellent , I would say Bit limited spread (8/10) but Very Tasty Food !!! My son loved the sea food !!

The Heritance Ahungalla is the perfect place to spend a great time at a wonderful sandy beach surrounded by countless palmtrees. Also the two pools are great, although we especially enjoyed the one a bit further away from the mainpool. Our room was ground floor and had a lovely terrasse with some sunbeds and the pool infront. It was a very peaceful and calm surrounding, the perfect place to relax and rest for a few days! We booked half-board, which was served in form of breakfast- and dinner-buffet. But donâ€™t imagine a â€œnormalâ€œbuffet, it was the most delicious and varied food we had of all the 7 hotels (all 4- or 5-stars) during our trip trough Sri Lanka! Very special thanks goes to the stuff of the hotel (from main-desk through pool-and garden-staff to housekeeping)â€¦they made us feel very welcomed and all tried their best to make our stay such a perfect one! (f.e. decorating the room and terrasse with fresh flowers and funny little artwork out of towels - thank you to Mister Rukmal! - serving us fresh King Coconuts directly from the treesâ€¦) If you desire a snack or a drink there is a bar next to the main-pool which serves all day long for fair prices. For the ones who like to keep in shape and exercise during their holidays, there is a gym with some cardio-mashines and wheights to join (nicely cooled by the aircon). All in all for us it was a perfect place for spending 5 unforgettable beachdays in Sri Lanka after our roundtrip and before going back home to Austria! We would recommend Heritance Ahungalla also to our family and friends .

Our Room was everytime an Oasis of "cool" rest. Always clean and proper. The Towel animals always brought a smile in our faces. Fresh Fruits on the table were also very welcome. All toilets articles were always replenished. Thanks to our room staff Manoj. The pool environment are very welcome due the waves in the Indian Ocean ( sometimes tricky). The restaurants were huge and extensive, sometimes indescribable tasty ;-) This was a really great Holiday Trip

Overall experience was marvelous. Food was good, staff was friendly. I would like to come back again, we came here to celebrate our wedding anniversary and i was suprise with the room deco and the cake we received

Food was good. Specially dinner and breakfast. Friendly staff. Spacious property with ample pool facilities. Had access to a properly maintained beach and the beach is clean. However rooms one side of the hotel need to be upgraded including the washroom.

It was a pleasant stay with good food, friendly and cooperative staff. Special mention needs to be made of Sanduni who was new to the place but extended very good customer service. Lovely weekend where we were able to relax and enjoy the wonderful beach and the hotel and traditional food.

We stayed 3 weeks here this time. Previously we have stayed here twice or more over the last 30 years and I have used the hotel long before that as an occasional place to eat or stay. It retains all the charm of the hotel which was designed by a brilliant Sri Lankan architect. The staff are superb and a happy bunch. Many of them have been there a long time. We had a room attendant (Rukmal) who we judge to be among the best we have ever had anywhere, and we travelled Asia extensively for work prior to retirement. The personal attention given by other staff was equally good. Food is good, up there with other similar hotels (we have stayed in many) though we now prefer b&b as three buffets a day are too much for us! There is a reasonable a la carte restaurant and we found two or three eateries on the beach within walking distance. Finally, we also liked having a room at the end of the hotel by a second, quieter, pool. All in all we recommend this hotel very strongly.

Super friendly people, super food, sea views, good rooms, overall superb. We spend 10 super super good holidays days. Live music, very nice and helpful managers, bartenders who were also very helpful. Manager change room to deluxe classes, over two floors, at no extra charge.

Hotel facilities & room conditions are very good. Meals also good. Pool area,hotel view is very attractive.Staff service is very good and specially mentioned GRE Miss.Mithmaâ€™s service is very good and she gave fully attention to us. But one thing want to mention, room cleaning process is not happy because of without informing us they done that. Without informing to clean the room is very bad rule because it is very harmful to our privacy. Please pay attention to that rule and management should discuss and change the rules without any harmful effects to guests.

The room was tidy and spotless. The buffets were splendid. One of the delicious meals I've tried in star class hotels in SL. The staff was very friendly and attentive as well. Overall the experience was awesome and I will visit the hotel once again for sure.

We absolutely loved our stay at the Heritance. Food was amazing, all the staff were friendly and welcoming. Special mention to Rukmal who cleaned our room, he made extra effort and it was really special. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

We stayed at Heritance Ahungalla and the staff were extremely helpful with making our stay as comfortable as possible. Rukmal our housekeeper made sure the room was spotless and always leaving the room with a friendly design as shown in the pictures bringing great joy to the kids. Dilusha from the restaurant made sure my sonâ€™s very specific dietary needs were catered to at every meal throughout the stay. I recommend Heritance Ahungalla for a memorable stay!

Good service and friendly staff ğŸ‘ Environment friendly and we had a sefly.. Had a good holiday Supportive staff The green pool concept is superb where a gren view is given at a sea side hotel. This pool is rely calming and is the best place in the hotel!

Great location by the sea. Living in a Sri Lanka architectural icon (G. Bawa). Very good buffet breakfast and a la carte dinner. Super friendly, competent and helpful staff who could help me in any questions and problems Thanks to you, especially to Sanduni! Will come back!

Irene Leigh and family met Mithma when we first arrived . She was very welcoming friendly and helpful Beautiful location . We have come to Sri Lanka as a family to celebrate our birthdays Mithima ensured we were comfortable explaining the hotel features

We had an awesome stay at heritance Ahungalla. Good place to experience the beach atmosphere. The staff was amazing and super friendly. Special thanks to Mithma and Chathura for their great hospitality. Hope to visit again.

We love the place. The staff is very helpful n warm. The place has Beautiful views. We would recommend the place to our family and friends. Looking forward for more fun . Special shout out to Mithma for guiding with smile.

Good hotel, everything is ok. Meal is perfect. Have some questions to room service. They donâ€™t add toothpaste or brushes before you say about it. Pool is clean but water is a little hot in opinion. My rate 4.8 out of 5

The Heritance Ahungalla Hotel is a great and tidy place. The hotel staff cares about the high quality of service, starts from room service across the restaurant food. Especially room service (the guy named Rukmal) was taking care of tidy in our room every day, and provided us comfort all the time. Place with direct access to the beach, the ocean is rights next to the hotel. Fantastic, colonial style hotel. I give high marks to this place. Sincerely recommend!

We stayed here for three days in February 2023. We could not find any fault with the staff, food, rooms or general situation. Access to the beach was easy, although with two pools there was no need to leave the site if you didn't want to. Would highly recommend and would like to visit again.

It was a fabulous treatment while I was at pool bar area. Excellent hospitality and very good communication, I would like to come back again and again. I recommend to visit this hotel as a experienced guest

He makes beautiful towel art in the room! The people that work in HERITANCE Ahungalla do so much there best to take care of the tourists and they are all very nice and kind...and the food is very good

We stayed here in January / February 2023. The hotel its self is a beautiful building and was immaculately clean and well maintained. as far as I could tell all the rooms faced the beach with either a balcony or terrace. Our room 219 was clean and well equipped with everything you would expect from a hotel of this standard. There are two pools one is a quiet pool where ball games etc are not allowed the other is for fun and games, the pool attendants are friendly and and attentive. There is also a reasonably well equipped gym and a spa which is really well priced. We found the staff to be so friendly and nothing was too much trouble every request was met with a smile and service was efficient and prompt. The food was very good although if I had one suggestion it would be to remember that not everyone likes spice in their food, my wife is one who does not and on occasions found her choices very limited, but then there was always cake!! To conclude I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and should we decide to return to Sri Lanka (and I hope we do) we would certainly go back to Heritance.

We stayed here for two weeks and I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff went above and beyond to ensure we had the best holiday we could, and I only wish other visitors gave the staff the respect they deserve. I do hope that the management at this hotel realise how good and accommodating their staff are. Our room was comfortable, with an excellent shower, and always cleaned to a high standard. Monkeys on the balcony in the morning was an added bonus ğŸ˜Š The food was amazing for all meals and we never tired of the food. Drinks were of a high standard. The cleanliness of the hotel, pool, gardens, was outstanding. We really couldnâ€™t fault anything. Would we return - absolutely! Thank you Heritance Ahungalla for an making our first trip to Sri Lanka an unforgettable experience, and we look forward to returning.

ğŸ§–ğŸ»â€â™€ï¸ğŸ§–ğŸ¼â€â™‚ï¸ğŸ’ƒğŸ¼ğŸ‘°ğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸ We have visited in November 2022 during our honey moon. we had a great unforgettable experience there from the staff at the reception specially sweet â€œTharindiâ€ to the daily decoration by Rukmalâ¤ï¸ of the room to the luxury of the bath and the amazing food. We especially wish to Recognize and Thank THARINDI , Tharindi treated us all royally each morning, like part of her family, especially on the morning she was called us dally for the breakfast ğŸ³ Thank You Tharindi ğŸŒ¸

All the personnel we communicated were pleasant, polite, courteous while not importunate with tips :). Rooms are well cleaned, linen is fresh and new. Furniture is not shabby The hotel has very big garden to walk with many local trees (e.g. Fish Poison Tree, Pandanus Tree/False Pineapple Plant) Pool is large and has constant depth of 0.9 m except small square area with depth up to 2,7 m Ocean bottom is shallow and allows to enter the water even with quite strong waves; Restaurant has mostly European food with only a small corner with local spicy dishes. Dishes were different nearly all the week we stayed there. For some reason mango was never in buffet. Wine was quite expensive - 5 USD/glass. Local beer is not so - 2.2 USD/bottle

I really liked how Rukmal made toys out of towels, very cool! They were always different . Very friendly staff, and the room is always clean , nice and cozy! also, they always put things together and it's very good! Thank you, Rukmal

Heritance Ahungalla is always our first choice when I and my partner visit Sri Lanka. I have stayed in this hotel more than 20 times over the last few years and, there is nothing else in Sri Lanka to beat its architectural beauty, tranquility, beautiful sandy beaches, friendly staff and their hospitality, and great food choices. All our work stresses and worries just disappear into the thin air as soon as we walk into the lobby of the hotel for the first time. Friendly welcome from the staff and the glance of the hotel environment with the infinity pool and the sound of the sea waves set the tone for the rest of our holiday. We love to come to Herritance to celebrate Christmas and the New Year since they organise a fabulous dinner with amazing food buffet with ice sculptures and food decorations which is out of this world, dance shows, fireworks and music by a great band. This experience is heavenly under the stars with the sound of the sea. What is unbeatable in this hotel, compared to other hotels in Sri Lanka, is the friendliness and the quality of the staff who works their. This goes from the General Manager to all the managers, to the waiters who serve at the restaurant, to the cleaning staff, and to the pool staff. They are always their to do their best to make our stay a memorable experience. I would like to give a special mention to Duminda and Waruna at the restaurant who always made sure we have an amazing dinning experience. Rukmal, the towel artist, make fabulous animal figures with towels and surprise us every morning as we come back to our room after breakfast. Pool attendants are always there to prepare our sun-beds every morning. We love walking along the sandy beach in front of the hotel in the morning and also in the evening and enjoy the evening sunset and then dive into the pool for a final swim before getting ready for the dinner. One day we wanted to organise a special dinner on the beach for a friend and his family to celebrate his retirement. The staff went out of their way to organise this dinner with fabulous food and assigned dedicated staff to serve the food. It was an unforgettable experience. I recommend this for couples if you are interested in organising a romantic dinner or for any special events to mark the occasion. I hope to be back again in the summer to re-live this beautiful experience.

We went in for lunch buffet on Jan 01, 2023 and variety of the food is good. Buffet was priced at 6000 LKR per head. The service is poor though; we had to ask for the staff to clear the finished plates from the table several times, and one of the staff ignored the request for water and had to wait around to find a waiter and get some water. There were no staff when needed at the table.

Ruckmal doing his work very good, and this animals made from towels is perfect, thanks a lot! He is very polite and every time helps us. There are not a lot of people who love their work as much as he.

Heritance Ahungalla has by far been one of the best hotels weâ€™ve stayed at in Sri Lanka. From the cordial welcoming to the amenities, our suite and the delicious food, Heritance displayed peak service. The staff were hospitable and prompt to meet any requests and always adorned a smile. A special and heartfelt thank you to Dananja, Duminda, Sanjaya, Dinesh, Rebeca, Waruni, Rukmal, Kalinga and everyone else who we had the pleasure of interacting with. Weâ€™d also like to clarify that there was never a delay nor did the staff ever falter despite certain complaints having been made by other guests. We had a spectacular time and weâ€™ll never forget the music, dance, laughter and joy we shared with everyone at Heritance. Once again, thank you very much and we hope to come again soon when weâ€™re back in Lanka. Blessings for the New Year! - Carl Joshua

We've been holidaying at Heritance Ahungalle for around 10 years, and have always loved it. Unfortunately it's now in a very sorry state. I can no longer recommend it. The management is shoddy, and the staff barely trained. We faced a catalogue of bad experiences - long waits at check in, meals not being available until 20-30 minutes after advertised start time, wrong orders at bar, shoddy service .... and on and on. The swimming pools and beach are still excellent. But the rest has sadly been allowed to slip. Such a pity.

Best towel artist in Sri Lanka - Rukmal Surendra Clean, cozy room. Two big pools with comfortable sun beds. Amazing sea with huge waves and a clean beach. Good drinks in the bars and overall good service. 100% would recommend

It was an overall disappointing stay at Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel was fully booked during our stay, given the holiday season. The hotel staff was very nice and friendly. It is an old building and definitely needs maintenance, particularly the rooms. For a 5-star property, the room is small, and the toilet hardly has any space in it, which is not what you'd expect given the star category this hotel boasts about and when compared to other similar 5-star hotels and resorts in Sri Lanka. The quality of the extra bed in the triple room would possibly befit a 2 or 3 star hotel. On the other hand, the king bed in the room was very comfortable, and one of the pluses was the sea view from the room, which was amazing. The food lacked variety and if you are a vegetarian, stay away from Heritance Ahungalla. They simply don't cater to those needs, even if you make a special note of it. The lunch buffet was the worst of the three meals we had. This was brought to the attention of the chef and the restaurant manager, and they were most apologetic, but it was an overall bitter experience in the end at Heritance Ahungalla. On the contrary, the desserts were superb and delicious. Overall, our stay did not offer any value for money, so I would never visit or recommend this hotel.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Heritance Ahungalla on the 8-10 December 2022. Though it was the peak season, there were not many tourists at the hotel. Jananjaya made sure that we are well looked after and was very helpful. Facilities were great, all the staff members were very nice and attentive. Overall we had an amazing time and food was excellent.

We had a wonderful stay at heritance. Ambiance, food, service and everything was perfect. Thank you Mr. Chathura for making our stay comfortable and looking forward to another staycation at heritance.

Superb Hotel with excellent hospitality. Staff is so friendly. We went their for our 1st anniversary and they have made us with a delicious cake and fruit basketâ€¦ Buffet was awesome with variety of items and the Food was so deliciousâ€¦â€Jananjayaâ€at the restaurant was so friendly with us and handed us a superb serviceâ€¦ Ocean View from the room was spectacular and mind relaxing.. Overall from Check in to Check Out all was awsomeâ¤ï¸

Thank you for your excellent hospitality, its surpassed our expectations. Your staff treated us like family and made sure everything we needed for a comfortable stay was readily available. We look forward to staying at your hotel again soon. Thank you all specially reception staff, room service staff, restaurant staff, housekeeping staff, pool attendants.......... your service was excellent. Warm regards.

Our short stay in this hotel and country gave us a very high impression staying in the Herritance. The hotel had a few repairs undergoing which did not disturb us what so ever. Tha staff were very friendly, good food and clean rooms. The General Manager was always present trying to fulfill needs from his guests. A special thank you to the Front Office staff Mr. Caldera and Mr. Ruwan from the Restaurant. The enlightment of our entire stay was the welcome reception from Ms. Trilishiya Thompsan. She gave us a short introduction to the hotel facilities and made sure that our stay was made comfortable. She works very professional. Thank you Heritance team. All the best

We only stayed two nights. The hotel was very comfortable, but certain areas could do with updating, particularly the main dining area. Sunbeds were showing signs of age. Our room boy, Ranil was very helpful and kept our room beautifully clean

Ours resent stay at Heritance Ahungalla in November, has been a memorable one. Surrounded by the Sunset view, and a well-maintained garden, H Ahungalla is one of the best destinations for Family and friends. From the quality of the food to the presentation, the food is amazing. The service staff was very friendly especially Udani, Supun(ASHM), Rasika & sanjeewa Everything was perfect. We highly recommend Heritance Ahungalla

It was another remarkable stay at Heritance Ahungalla after so many years. we were there during the week end. super friendly staff with warm welcome in reception, nice and clean rooms and goods drinks at bar. An architectural masterpiece. You may have heard of it but to experience it is a different thing. A hotel built in alignment with nature surrounded by a sea. Absolute beauty. The surrounding alone makes a visit worthy. All the other aspects expected in a hotel is ticked beautifuly. Beautiful infinity pool is a plus. Food is great. Service is warm. Absolute recommendation in every aspect.

We stay hotel 2 weeks. And itâ€™s really best hotel. We travel a lot, but this hotel ğŸ’”ğŸ’”ğŸ’” personal very friendly and I miss already so much.. please, one think what you need know: give tip people who work, they 10000% deserve this. For you itâ€™s nothing- for them so much! Our apartment perfect! Food perfect! Rukmal has gone an extra mile to keep the guest happy, what he has done was mind blowing, super service didnâ€™t expect service like this from a housekeeper, very creative. Having employees like this will give the hotel more publicity, I will share this with all my Australian friends

We had a great time spent in the hotel with the friendly staff. We were over joyed with wonderful pools and the fascinating rooms over looking the sea the rooms were clean, our vacation was incredibly well spent in sri lanka. Keep up the gold work thank you for the wonderful time and we will be back soon...ğŸ™ğŸ˜ŠğŸ¤©

Warmly welcomed by the front staff and Ms. Tharindi.. During the stay, staff provided a super service. Rooms are very charming with a very nice view. Food also good. Visit Sri Lanka..! Visit Heritance Ahungalla â™¥ï¸

We had a good time spent in the hotel with nice and kind service by Room service Mr.Rukmal. Rooms are clean, foods are great envirement is great, pool is awsm with jacuzzi pool! ğŸ‘ For improvement, would like to suggest to have more verities in ur buffet! ğŸ¤”

Beautiful Architecture. Each area of the hotel is a Masterpiece. Spacious and clean rooms. Tasty food, one of the best selections in the country. Most of all lovely staff. Great stay ... Will visit again

We stayed nearly two weeks with our little one at Heritage Ahungalla which was an amazing experience. Thanks heaps for Dhananja and his front desk staff for your immense hospitality. Dhananja is very friendly, polite and did his best to make us comfortable which was beyond our expectations. Also Duminda Restaurant Manager and his crew for being such caring and thoughtful for our needs and offering their utmost service to our family that can't be any better than that. We would like to extend our gratitude to all the housekeeping staff, pool staff and security guards for the amazing job they are doing at Heritance..Thank you for the love you all have shown at our little one who missed it badly back home and we very well know that he dearly loved every single hug, thouch and kiss from almost every MAMA and NANDA at the hotel. See you soon guys.. Tharanga ,Arya and little Aegon

Great piece of hospitality, tasty food, huge collection of food in different verities. The atmosphere is great. The cleanliness is perfect. The night club is the place where we enjoyed the most. Thank you for the great service

It has a great location by the beach, rooms are spacious and clean. There is a good lay out of the buffet. They score a 100 percent on hospitality and cleanliness. We were a group of 5 and arrived at 4:30 am. The team was very welcoming and made us feel very comfortable.

Highly recommended hotel with great hospitality. Each and every staff member is very keen on their work and we had an amazing customer service. Hotel has big two swimming pools and we enjoyed a lot even in the heavy rains. Couldn't go to beach due to the bad climate, still the beach is really nice. Recommended to visit this place from November onwards which is the season for the down south. Food is average and didn't have much choices, but not bad. The hotel is very calm and quiet place with beautiful atmosphere. Will definitely visit again.

STAFF ARE LOVELY BUT NOT A 5 STAR HOTEL , EVERYWHERE IS CLEAN AND BED COMFORTABLE. NO BATH ONLY A SHOWER. ROOM ALSO DARK LIGHTING NOT VERY BRIGHT AND NO WHERE BRIGHT ENOUGH TO DO MAKE UP AND ONLY ONE PLUG OVER ON THE DESK, NONE BY THE BED. THE HOTEL IS LOOKING VERY DATED AND IN NEED OF A FACE LIFT AND THE FOOD IS NOT UP TO 5 STAR DINING, THE MENU WAS QUITE LIMITED, BREAKFAST MUCH BETTER THAN EVEING MEALS. VERY QUIET WHEN WE WERE THERE SO NO ATMOSPHERE OR ANYTHING TO DO WITHIN THE HOTEL, BUT MIGHT BE DIFFERENT WHEN MORE THAN 15 OUT OF 150 ROOMS BOOKED.

Wow, it was exceptional. The staff was very very friendly and nice. I should mention Mr.Rasika, Mr.Dhananjaya and Mr.Nipun and all the others which I cannot remember the names, thank you so much for making our short stay excellent.

Thank you for making our stay delightful with the warm hospitality! The food quality was amazing . The pools were well maintained as well ..The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Special thanks to Rukmal for the warm welcome!

We have with our baby for 11 days at heritance. All the facilities and staff are excellent. Mr Namal and other guy gave excellent room service during our stay. Nice clean beach. Highly recommended this place.

Amazing staff and amazing food . Loved every bit of the stay. Special thanks to the below staff Rukmal ( room service ) , Waruna (waiter) , Gayan ( Executive chef ) , Trilishia ( Receptionist), Buddhika ( sous chef ) for your pleasant smiles and hospitality. Will be visiting again soon.

Our family is happy to be in this hotel. We didn't expect that staff ,nature,architecture of hotel will be such wonderful. Restaurant is the best of all,delicious and beautiful dishes are succsesed all greetings. Especially, we want to admit from the staff, Nowan, he helps us very much in many cases. We loved our vocation,it is one of the best.

The hotel is nestled amongst an amazing surrounding with beautiful architecture created by Geoffrey Bawa. Valet service was provided upon arrival and greeted by lovely staff. We checked in to a lovely luxury room which was truly amazing. The food was delicious although the variety wasnâ€™t ample. The hotel has two incredibly large pools, a badminton court, two tennis courts, table tennis and a pool table which we enjoyed which made our stay so much satisfying.

What a great experience. Wonderful surrounding. Great room service. Especially Dhananjaya , Duminda support us. Family really enjoyed. Last not least food... Mouthwatering. BBQ dinner is never forget.

Everything is perfect. Foods, so tasty. Luckily we had all meals buffet Styles. They have good variety of foods. Speacialy sushi, Buns sections, buriyani. Pizza is tasty, but pizza door is very hard. Restaurant staff very helpful. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Room housekeeper Rukmal is veryhelpful. Both pools are superb. One swimming poll maximum deep is 2.75m. Wow.. in these days beach you can not swim. Its very rough. Hotel garden clean and very well maintain. We had a very good time in heritance ahungalla. Definitely gonna visit in future.

It was a nice experience. Great atmosphere. Calm and quite. Lot of photo locations too. Nicely architectured building. Rooms were spacious and clean. Hospitality was great. Everyone took care of us. Specially Mr. Waruna at the restaurent was so pleasant and helpful. And also Mr. Rukmal who did the room service was really good. This hotel can be recommended for anyone who wish to visit.

I have stayed at dozen of hotels in Sri Lanka. This was on the top of the list of best stays ever. My husband and I celebrated our first anniversary in this hotel. Staff was very hospitable including Ranil (Room boy) and there for every need of mine. Thank you so much.

Having booked into the Heritance Hotel in Ahungalla before, my expectations for the luxury resort were exceedingly high, and when I had the opportunity of visiting the resort once more on the 14th of August this year, my adoration for the lodge and its wonderful staff increased immensely. Not only was the location of the resort conveniently placed, but the resort-in itself had put security checks and guards in place to ensure the safety of its guests. I believe, that out of all the luxury hotels in Sri Lanka at the moment, the Heritance Hotel is one of the only-if not-the only hotel that is adapting to the economic crisis and the impacts of Covid-19 sufficiently; as seen by their exemplary service, the exciting amenities they offer and their laudable members of staff. As soon as we reached the hotel, we were greeted by the very hospitable, Mr. Dhananjaya. A true leader at heart, we were given a look at his impeccable organizational skills and his tendency to care for each guest that walked into the lodge. He was aided by an efficient group of staff members who served us a selection of beverages as we waited to settle down into our rooms; two luxury rooms and two luxury suites. The room I had stayed in was a luxury suite(Room 101) and it consisted of a very intriguing selection of reading material, a spacious and comfortable sitting area with plush chairs and pillows, two large television sets, a king-sized bed fit for-well-a king and a luxurious bathroom tiled Harlequin-style with a sound system; wherein a guest could either play music or the daily news. The bathroom in itself contained a jacuzzi and a separate shower on the side, accompanied by a small closet and a heap of neatly arranged, refreshing towels. The room had several, transparent doors conveniently positioned to lead to the niceties outside, e.g., one of the doors led right to one of the pools at the hotel. Moreover, my room was given a panoramic view of the hotelâ€™s commodious tennis and badminton courts-adjacent to a ping pong table (not in view), both of which my family and I were able to utilize to its full extent. The leisure activities that Heritance presented us with, allowed my family and I to engage with one another and even formed my new-found love for badminton. The hotel didnâ€™t stop there, as alongside one of its several different swimming areas, the hotelâ€™s guests were welcomed by a gorgeous beach that encapsulated just how picture-perfect Heritance really is. Iâ€™m not one for morning walks, but members of my family would go on daily jogs or walks on the beach right after daybreak, in order to admire the way in which the sun would shine on the clear waters of the sea and the several little, harmless animals that would come out of hiding. In order to satisfy guests even further, the Heritance hotel also offered an air-conditioned gym, rejuvenating spa services-run by two lovely ladies, a ball room and-shockingly-a conference room, amongst other things I unfortunately didnâ€™t get a chance to come across. The ambience of the hotel was magical. It made my family and I feel at home despite the fact that Ahungalla was quite an unknown location for us. The services we were offered one after another, amplified how amazing this experience was. Although he had no obligation to do so, Mr. Ajith would often help my family and I with small menial tasks and laundry services with a kind smile on his face, and he was quick on his feet, laboring hard to maintain Heritance's high standards of hospitality and service. Which he most definitely didn't fail to do so. Our hotel room was also blessed with snacks and warm cups of tea, specially delivered to our room by Mr. Nelka. Whether it was at the restaurant or at our hotel room, Mr. Nelka made sure to supply us with his commendable hospitality; going as far as to bring extra dishes to our dining table and even making us his signature 'Yard Tea', which is an absolute delight to taste. He managed to make our experience at the hotel ten times better. Our room was cleaned daily by Mr. Rukmal. Who was both, a great conversationalist and an expert at making stunning creations out of towels. Whether it was bringing us extra supplies or extra shuttlecocks for our badminton games, Mr. Rukmal ensured that our stay at Heritance would be extraordinary. Another very special aspect of Heritance Ahungalla, is that they know just how to engage their guests, whether its having different musical groups and musical artists play their work every night at the Hotel, arranging for staff dances, holding fun events like their volleyball tournament or even implementing their â€˜little chefsâ€™ program- in order to energize kids and keep them active. Moreover, the place is very animal-friendly and the animals themselves are very harmless. Youâ€™ll get to see monkeys, iguanas, puffer fish and even, adorable little cats. For the wild-life lovers out there, Heritance Hotel is the place to be! However, I do believe that the staff and the food at the restaurant are what really made the hotel what it is today; a haven of goodness. Mr. Tony was an old face who treated us just as well as he did during our last visit to Heritance. He was very quick and efficient with his services at the restaurant in order to fulfill our demands, and the efforts into which both Mr. Jacob and Mr. Jananjaya went to, to ensure that we received the finest dining experience, were to put it lightly -astronomical- as they were constantly looking for what a guest could want or need. Rest assured, we received exemplary care and service from them. The kitchen staff managed to produce delicious varieties of food, curating a buffet that was, unique, appetizing and very much exquisite. The set of desserts that they would present daily would come from all over the world; e.g., their heavenly Umm Ali-a bread pudding-esque dessert from Egypt. All the staff members at Heritance made us feel welcome and appreciated, but I would like to express my special thanks and gratitude to Mr. Duminda(Heritance's restaurant manager), who went above and beyond to make our stay incredible. Not only did he take special care of certain elderly guests, but he also provided my family and I with special dishes, advice on the hottest tourist spots and gave us a unique home-like experience. He was always looking out for a way to help us. Thank you! I hope that others are able to visit this amazing place one day!

My wife and I wanted a few days away by the beach to relax. Unable to go to the beach for nearly a year due to various factors in Sri Lanka. Very pleasant stay. Staff very helpful including and Udani, restaurant staff including the chef on call, pool & garden staff. Excellent room, food, beach and pool great. Would come again

We celebrated our anniversary with a delicious cake provided by the hotel. Room services was satisfactory and food was fantastic. The reggae musician on Friday night was superb. Gym facilities was up to standard. Maintenance of the swimming pool needs to be improved but the pool staff was nice. Overall we enjoyed!

Thanks to the warmth and hospitality of the Udani, Rukshan, Tharindi and other staff at Heritance Ahungalla. I am grateful to Heritance Ahungalla team for the extraordinary service I enjoyed at your hotel. You all went above and beyond to ensure I was comfortable and well cared for throughout my time with you. This has turned out to be the best vacation I have had so far. Thank you, and keep up the good work!

Good evening We were the hotel Heritance Ahungalle itâ€™s was really nice place with wonderful service by Mr Saman. And all the team was kind. Feel to come back! Thank you best regards Fernando Singappuli Prasanna

Heritance Ahungalla is my favourite hotel and I was able to go again post Covid in September 2022. The room was wonderful and the service was delightful. Buffet meals were delicious. The hotel has an iconic pool and sea view and the Reggae musician on Friday Night was fantastic. Love the Heritance brand!

A Really good weekend, i made my reservation at the last minute on a fully booked day, even though i was denied 1st hotel reservations called us and arranged everything as soon as a opening came, shout out for the reservations team for their fast response. On arrival we was welcomed warmly and we were checked in to a top floor room, even though the view was not that good the room was really good, Shout out for the FnB girls that was working really hard at dinner, Overall we had a really good Experience. Will be coming back for sure. Thank you Ahungalla.

Dear Lekha, your kindness and generosity have touched our hearts during our stay at your hotel.It was such a delight to be accompanied by you and your loving and caring staff.Once again many thanks for everything Lekha.Best compliments !

Last week i went day out with my friends. Beautiful pool view, tasty foods and friendly staff is the best of this hotel. Every staff member is very helpful and kind. Cleanliness is great. Had really fun and will hope go another time.

Thankyou very much Lekha and staff for making my family stay at your hotel a comfortable one.Every need was catererd with utmost perfection making us feel so important . Sending a heartfelt appreciation and thanks indeed again

Had a wonderful time at Herritance Ahungallla with my family. The staff provided a first class service to make our stay pleasant . I would like to thank Lekha , Tharindi and Trilishia who took care of us untill we check out. The food was amazing as well as their drinks. I recommend everyone to try the cocktail ARROWHEAD if you visit Herritance Ahungallla.Hope to come back again . Thank you for the wonderful service.

Excellent service rendered by staff. Continue the good work. Special thanks to the entire team. We had a wonderful vacation. Will definitely visit again. Food and service were beyond expectations Once again thank you all.

This is the worst hotel Iâ€™ve ever stayed. Not compared to other 5 star hotels even just some random hotel with no star ratings is better than this. Our check-in was at 2.00 and we arrived at about 1.50 and the person there asked if we are starting from dinner and she said lunch will be closing at 2.30. once we went to get the lunch all the tables were full. they told us to wait outside till a table is available. we booked 2 sea view rooms and only view we got was pool. rooms were not cleaned properly. you cannot even walk barefoot on those floors. bathrooms were dirty and not properly maintained. we went to the pool at about 7.00pm and the person there told us the pool will be closing in 10 minutes. but when we asked before they told they close the pool at 8.00pm. the guy at the pool donâ€™t know how to speak to people. after 10 minutes he came back and told us to leave. there was a lasagna at dinner buffet that smelled really bad. Thereâ€™re so many other things and this hotel shouldnâ€™t be a 5 star hotel. mainly the staff is very rude and they treat guests like they are staying for free.

My family and I visited this hotel for my dadâ€™s birthday and I cannot even describe what a wonderful time we had. The staff was unbelievably kind and attentive and so sweet. They went out of their way to make my dadâ€™s birthday a special one - from special decorations at the dinner table, complimentary birthday cake to arranging a special bedding. We were so touched. Special thanks to Varuna, Banduka and actually the whole staff. We will be sure to visit again soon! The smiles will not be forgotten!

It was great and pleasure holiday at the hotel heritance ahungalla .This was my third visit ... The front office staff was so friendly and very kind .. The food was amazing... rooms was very clean and tidy.. I had a wonderful vacation with my family ... highly recommended to experience .. Rear Admiral Nishantha Desilva ( SLN )

2 weeks working at the Heritance in Ahungalla. The staff were fantastic, special mention to Rukmal the cleaner who left a different towel image / animal everyday on the bed and Rasika who helped with all the support for the workshop. The hotel has nice rooms, great pools and excellent food. The only downer is the plastics problem that Sri Lanka currently has, every beach had a lot of plastics including this one - despite the efforts of the staff to clean.

My 03rd visit to Heritance Ahungalla & the staff exceeded our expectations as always. Awesome masterpiece,friendly staff & scrumptious food. Thank you Dhananjaya for making our stay comfortable. Heritance Ahungalle is the BEST

It was our 02nd visit to Heritance Ahungalle & we loved it to bits & pieces. Exceptional hospitality & scrumptious food, its the BEST in down south. HERITANCE AHUNGALLE should be in every traveler's bucket list. Highly recommending.

This is my second time visiting the hotel. It is another masterpiece designed by Geoffrey Bawa. The hotel is very large, boasting an expansive garden with direct access to the beach. I was told we could observe turtles around 9 - 10 pm at night, which I unfortunately missed. The rooms are very clean and spacious, with balconies that give a breathtaking view of the ocean. The bathroom was also spotless. The hotel has two large pools that provide great backdrops for photos. The staff members are all very warm and welcoming. I would especially like to mention Udani, who was so helpful and friendly. She has worked at many of the Heritance hotels and had so many stories to share. We actually went there to celebrate my mother's birthday, but we did not specifically mention it to the staff. They had made a note of it when they checked us in and had arranged a beautiful and delicious surprise cake for my mother. I would like to extend my thanks to the chef as well as Sanduni and Rebecca, who arranged it for her. We were provided Ã  la carte menus for all three meals as the guest count was low. But the food was more than any of us could eat, and everything tasted divine. I would also like to mention how kind the staff was as they had cleaned our car after seeing that there were some monkey droppings on it in the morning. Thank you for being an amazing hotel, and we would definitely visit again!

Stayed at hotel with my parents. Manager, front desk team (Lekha, Tharindu), head chef and restaurant staff (Rebecca, Saduni) went out of their way to make us feel at home and meet our needs. Rukmal did splendid job of keeping our room neat and tidy. Relaxing spot with friendly staff.

Hotel is very good! Nice staff, clean and good food. The "tour guides" at the beach are expensive and not reliable. Contact Eranda at +94 77 664 1538 for special and affordable tours. Very friendly Tourguide!

Our family stayed for one day occupying 3 rooms!! Food was amazing and the room service was excellent! I have to specially mention Rukmal who served us! 5 Starts specially to him!! We are surely to be back!

All the staff was very friendly and specially the housekeeping person Rukmal has done a superb job with our room. My kid was so exited to see the arrangement. Food was really good and they were very accommodating to our requests. All in all a good time spent.

Heritance Ahungalla was a lovely experience yet again, my third time here. The hotel staff was courteous and caring. Can't keep the prawn curry with roast paan outta the review, it was so so good. Last but not the least, Ranil for keeping our suite top notch.

Good place to relax and enjoy. Good food and full of fun activities. Only 1 hour drive from colombo. Specially i should mention the room service and the cleaning staff were very proactive on their duties. During our stay housekeeper Ranil provides extremely high customer service. Thanks Imran Lye

We have selected this hotel to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary . We were pleasantly surprised with their arrangements to celebrate our special day. We were given a complimentary cake also. The buffet was fabulous with the varieties of food. For the dinner there was a spicy prawns curry which was very tasty. Also the rooms were very clean and the staff is very friendly . Really enjoyed our stay there.. highly recommended for a getaway .

Excellent Aspects: The staff were extremely helpful. Honestly every single person went above and beyond during our stay. On the weekend they had some great activities for kids: Magician & Cook with Chef. The magician was excellent and quite talented. Room service does some amazing towel art. Good Aspects: The food was really tasty however being vegetarian the options were'good' not excellent. But they were ever willing to cater to us. Things To Note: The halls can be really slippery when it rains. I saw a guest slip n fall just in front of us. The air con works well but causes a tonne of condensation on the floors, especially if you turn it off.

The room was very clean and the people very friendly and helping. Every day the room Was cleaned and fresh towels. Wenn there was a problem with the room, the came immediatly and were helping. The noun and Buffet where very good

I want to say thank you for this special stay in this hotel. It was a plesure to spend the vacations here. The very nice hospitality of the people in the hotel is remarkable. The food (incl. Beverage service) is perfect, delicious and varied. The location is central and the direct connection to the beach is wonderful. A big thank you to our personal room service - RANIL - who cleaned and organized our room so perfectly good and gave our vacations the best feeling for our first travail in Sri Lanka. Thank you again and see you soon. Best regards, Josi and Sebastian (Germany)

Its a beautiful hotel and the staff are masters of their trade. From the front office to catering to housekeeping everything works like clockwork. Given everything that is going on in SL at the moment the hotel maintains the same high standards like it has always done. Well done ! Great food, great hospitality, truly a five star experience.

Very nice view with Indian ocean and food is delicious and exquisite Staff is very friendly, hotel is quiet and peaceful , rooms are well maintained and nice interiors,overall nice experience ,hoping to come again

We all had a Great stay at Heritance Ahungalla .Food was delicious and had a great spread in all our meals from July 16 till 18th 2022 In house keeping Rukmal made us all suprised with his beautiful towel arts . He was so kind and helpful person . Overall highly recommended this hotel ğŸ‘Œ by all of us

We really enjoyed our stay with them , staff are very friendly and helpful and kind. Food is amazing ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜we enjoyed their food from the day we stay. Hotel is very clean. Very nice environment to spend and relax.

The food selection is amazing and tasty ğŸ˜‹ Very clean rooms and the staff are so welcoming and helpful. Beautiful towel art done by Rukmal, very impressive ğŸ˜Š and decorated so nicely with flowers. He made us swans, a crocodile and a cute elephant.

The hotel we originally chose was cancelled and hence we chose this hotel as it was our second choice and what a great choice it was. The island is amazing and we had many trips sorted by Siri whom we met on the beach - I would highly recommend him for any trips. We were there for Valentines night and my wife's birthday. On valentines day we dined on the beach and the experience was amazing, whilst the hotel sorted a cake for the birthday. Food is excellent, room excellent and the staff superb. Special mention goes to Vindya, Duminda, Sugath, Jananjaya who all looked after us throughout our stay.

The staff really made me and my family feel at home by helping me at anytime even when I missed breakfast they still took care of me by bringing room service. Specifically RUKMAL is one staff member you can count on for a first class service, he provided many options whenever I requested anything and was very friendly, he was one staff member among many other great staff members that helped me out whenever I was in need of anything.

Although the occupancy rate was low, the hotel is still maintained vey well. Meals were all Ã€ la carte and they were all of very high quality. The personalised service of the staff was beyond expectations. I was extremely satisfied with the two days spent at Heritance Ahungalla and would recommend to visit at this time if you wish spending a calm and quiet holiday in 5 Star comfort.

We stayed in this place for two nights and founded this hotel very good. We loved amazing food, friendly staff,calm and clean environment. The hotel has two swiming pools and it is near Indian ocean. Good place to relax in Sri lanka.

From the entrance, we felt like very familiar. The reason was the staff... They were very friendly and caring... The rooms were comfortable and clean... The food was good... We can recommend this place if you visit ahungalla.

We were 6 of us looking for a new experience with a chain of hotels. We decided on Heritance Ahungalla even though our first thoughts were with Kandalama. But I must say from the time we checked in till we checked out it was a fabulous and unprecedented treatment we got from all the staff at Heritance Ahungalla. We were awed by your staff's concern and attention to all their guests as we were made to feel exta special where ever we went! Our biggest surprise was getting a buffet which the children appreciated so much and the service was par excellence. We actually felt pity in leaving the hotel as we were treated so well by everyone from the room service staff to the restaurant staff who took good care of us and made us feel at home and very special. All our requirements were met so much care and professionalism. But most of all there cared to do it with all their heart which we Sri Lankans are known for and hadn't seen in a long while. Thank you and we will return soon to your wonderful hotel that we would like to call home away from home. Thank you!

Had a very pleasant stay at Heritance Ahungalla. Restaurant staff went above and beyond in their outstanding service, special thanks to Jananjaya. Food was delicious.Highly recommended. Thank you to all!

Our room number was 111.We stayed here as family with our friends.From the gate to the room caring,hospitality is veey well.Room cleaning and arrangments were good.(Special thanks for Mr.Rukmal) The food and beverages were delicious. (Special thanks for chief cheff Mr.Gayan)The resturant staff was very helpful,caring and supportive (Special thanks for Mr.Dhananjaya) All reception staff was very friendly.The pool was very clean and good.Thabks for all the staff of Heritance Ahungalla.May All of you able to give this service to all the guests.We wish all of you overcome this prevailing situation in Sri Lanka and be successful ever again. Thank You, Primal Hemachandra

Really nice place to have a family holiday. Delicious food, friendly staff, clean room. The staff is very responsive and caring. The room was spacious, clean and had a great view. Highly recommended...

We stayed at Herittance Ahungalla for 2 nights and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Beautiful hotel well managed and run. Food was excellent. Staff were very friendly. Live music in the lobby was an added attraction. The room was outstanding. We wish we spent more time there. Will definitely be back

The Heritance hotel is beautiful and the staff are amazing, very friendly and did everything to make our stay special. Some building work is currently going on at the hotel but as itâ€™s low season this was ok. Sri Lanka is beautiful and the country needs more people to visit. Fully recommend this hotel.

We have toured multiple cities in Sri Lanka, but so far this is our favorite local hotel chain. The interior is well thought out, the rooms are very clean and well kept. The spa is just what we needed and more, and the staff is very sweet and welcoming! The food is also amazing and clean. Guaranteed Best first time experience and wonâ€™t be our last!

The staff are amazing and very attentive. Special thanks to Jagath who went above and beyond to look after us. Most mornings, the gardener gave me flowers which was a lovely touch. It could be a nice hotel however it is very dated and needs some tlc. The hot tubs did not work and to our knowledge it was at least 4 weeks. The bar could not cater for cocktails until I made a complaint and they ran out of diet Pepsi. This is unfortunately not a 4â˜† hotel. I think the worst part was the building work that was started with no notification, and them having to cordon off part of the pool bar area. There are pros and cons with this hotel. It is very far from the airport and you need transportation to visit anywhere. Like all hotels, they overcharge for trips. If you do visit this hotel and wish to go on trips, go to the beach and see Siri. We used him for 2 weeks and you can't get better. Amazing person and very knowledgeable. I would think about returning however, not until it is updated and worthy of a 4â˜† plus

We stayed in this hotel in down south possibly for the forth time. It still maintains the standards of care and service. This is one of the very early creation of Jeffry Bawa, the legendary architect in Sri Lanka. Food was excellent and the staff were helpful.

This is one of our many visits and the first after covid pandemic. Still allure of Bavas creation stands strong. The food, the rooms and the hospitality was great. The service was the highlight and the classical good Sri Lankan hospitality was maintained Our luxury rooms were comfortable and classical . The gym was good

We booked a double room and from the time of our arrival it felt like we were in a quarantine facility. For a beach hotel that should exude a relaxed vibe, the entire entry was roped off!! We were taken over by a hostess from the time of arrival and directed like school children - "stay here, do that, etc". Walked through an xray scanner which is quite okay but which was the only entry. Ordered to sit down, ordered to wear masks etc. It is a really open space and we are all triple vaccinated. The elevators were not working. The room was good but was definitely overrun with moisture issues. "Double" meant two single beds pushed together!! Tried to order a cocktail in the bar but was told that because of "supply issues" only Arrack cocktails were available. Had dinner in the coffee shop and were served french fries cooked in rancid Coconut Oil!! When asked why, was told "supply issues". I was offered a replacement but wondered how was I going to receive a replacement if there was indeed a supply issue?? Was a victim of overt racism at breakfast. As a Sri Lankan, I was singled out and ordered to wear a mask!! At a buffet!! All the other non Sri Lankan guests were exempted including my partner. I did complain to the restaurant manager who was very receptive and apologetic. Tried walking on the beach - impossible. All the vendors and touts just follow you around and obviously there is no control from the hotel. Overall a disappointing experience

My family stayed two nights in the hotel. It was a memorable experience considering the exceptional service, kind staff and the facilities that it provides. My children loved the two large pools, the badminton court, table tennis and the beautiful beach. The food was excellent. We highly recommend this hotel and are definitely considering coming again next time. Prasantha Hapuarachchi

We enjoyed our stay at Heritance Ahungalla (during Avurudu weekend) which is immaculately kept. This is my fourth visit and enjoyed as usualâ€¦The room was very spacious overlooking the sea - the bed was very comfortable. There is always stock of tea, coffee, water in the room along with the mini bar. Pools are fabulous, both me and my daughter enjoyed. Staff are lovely and service is excellent. Especially Dhananjaya who is very supportive and take care of us at entire stayâ€¦.. We enjoyed sun bathing on the beach and had a perfect morning walk. The buffet restaurant is excellent with extensive choices. All three meals were excellent and more choice in the main buffet restaurant. Overall superb stayâ€¦Pasan_Abeygunawardane

I had a great stay at heritance. The staff were very accommodating and food was enjoyed. The weather was not the best when I stayed so I didnâ€™t get to enjoy the pool as much as I would of liked but it was still very relaxing in the gardens and a nice walk on the beautiful beach. The room was gorgeous. Bathroom was huge and beds so comfortable. Definitely will stay here again if Iâ€™m in the area!

My partner and I stayed here towards the end of a luxury tour of Sri Lanka. It was the perfect place to end our stay, and the hotel is brilliantly run with superb service in challenging times given the economy. The setting is absolutely idyllic and stunning, right on the beach, with well-maintained pools. The staff could not have done more to help us, and I would like particularly to praise Rukmal who provided excellent housekeeping services. We returned to find our bed scattered with red flowers and the towels fashioned into swans! He always attended very efficiently to any issues we had. I must also mention Issuru and Athika in the restaurant, who both went out of their way to provide really top-notch quality service. All those staff deserve a salary raise and a promotion! Please tip the hotel staff well, they deserve it. We had moved to the Heritance from an inferior hotel nearby into which our tour operators had unwisely placed us, as it was an entirely different category from our previous five star luxury hotels around Sri Lanka. The Heritance was our saviour for our last few days, as it was the perfect place to relax with superb service. We look forward to returning to the hotel, and cannot recommend it highly enough. The manager is also excellent, and he is a constant presence around the hotel, always checking that everything is satisfactory for every guest.

We have just enjoyed a relaxing time at this hotel celebrating our wedding anniversary. The hotel provides a beautiful setting on the sea front with lovely gardens and two large pools clean and well maintained. The Pool staff are very attentive to guests needs when using these facilities. Whilst the local area is very quiet this is a good location from which to explore the South Western coastline of Sri Lanka and access to a number of popular tourist spots nearby. The staff at this hotel have been superb, eager to please guests and happy to â€˜go that extra mileâ€™ to make visitors feel welcomed. We must give special mention to the following staff for their hard work and for making our stay feel extra special - Jacob, Asitha, Jagath, Nimsara and Sinari. A big thank you also to Lokusuviya for his hardworking cleaning and tidying our room each day and the really friendly young man serving in the hotel gift shop! The food served in the main dining room was of a good quality and always offered a good choice of different Asian and Western dishes. We also took advantage of the drinks and snacks regularly available at the Pool side snack bar! During our stay here we were lucky to enjoy all the festivities and additional events organised by the hotel to celebrate their special New Year. We booked several trips during our stay with Rasika, a local guide, who can be found at the edge of the hotel/beach front. He offers good value and local knowledge/experience and we were happy to support local people rather than the large companies. We were fortunate to enjoy the Elephant Safari at Udawalawa, the Madu river cruise, a day trip to the Galle Fort town and spent time at Hikkaduwa swimming with the large Turtles. We also arranged to see the iconic Stilt Fishermen, the rather moving Tsunami Museum and spent time relaxing on the lovely beach at Unawatuna. Thank you again to ALL of the hardworking staff at Heritance Ahungalla hotel. We have really enjoyed our stay here.

We stayed for 10 days here, I booked 3 rooms and we had a wonderful time. The rooms were clean and very comfortable the beds and pillows were so soft which is a treat when abroad. The food was good and very tasty, the people in Sri Lanka are struggling to get some of the essentials but did the best they could which was amazing.
