The staff were very accommodating and super friendly. The pools were very clean with lots of beds available. The beach is not private but beautiful and a stones throw away from the pool. There are people selling their products at the entrance but if you are not interested and say no they leave you alone, if you want any trips speak to Siri he is stood by the fence and was amazing. He was friendly, kind and his price was fair his driver Bernard was a lovely man so I highly recommend these two. We went to the elephant safari, the turtle sanctuary he also took us to a great seafood restaurant for lunch in Hikkiduwa. If you want to walk along the beach for the best king prawns you will ever taste walk to the right of the beach to Villa Thotupola Siri will show you ğŸ˜‚ it is a stunning cove with a family run place which was excellent food, we ate there twice. To the left of the beach is jungle beach bar again lovely food for lunch. We were advised not to walk along the beach at night so you need to be careful but that is understandable. The extra treat with this hotel is the dogs who live on the beach and visit daily with their wagging tales we loved this part of our holiday and saved a few sausages from breakfast, so if you are not dog friendly then Sri Lanka is not for you they are everywhere you go.

Mr Nuwan Sasanka and his team have to be the most friendly, warming, assertive team I have ever known. They work brilliantly together and ensure all customers, especially my family, are 100% satisfied with what they recieve and how they are treated. Mr Nuwan Sasanka brilliantly conducts himself and his team and is an inspirational leader by example. Our stay here was made as brilliant as it was all down to the impeccable service and friendly & joyous nature! Thank you Mr Nuwan and all his team for making our stay fantastic! The Chapple Family.

This hotel was amazing! the staff are incredibly friendly and go over and above to make your day special. The rooms are modern and clean. The food is good with lots to choose from. Family friendly with 2 large pools and beech. They made our daughters 8th birthday unforgettably amazing! we can not wait to return next year!

Hotel is lovely! Setting is beautiful! Staff are so friendly and helpful, including Rukmal who looks after our room. Cleaning is of a high standard and we always come back to surprise towel â€˜animalâ€™ on our bed! Food is great- plenty to choose from! Loving our stay so far!

Great hotel, small, but have some spare for walking after good dinner, good food, breakfastquite usual,but dinners was very good, especially Rukmal our cleaning service was absolutely fantastic, with surprise every day, made our kid happy every day with his towel art. Everyday in our room number we have found some funny guys made of towels.

A very nice hotel with good atmosphere and friendly people. The food is with variety of choice and good quality (European and local kitchen). Rooms are clean and nicely decorated by Mr.Rukmal who is a master of towel art. The several pools around the hotel are beautiful and well maintained. We enjoy the holidays a lot.

â€¢ I am a frequent guest at Heritance and for the second time in 2022. My holiday joy and that of many other guests was spoiled by the majority of holidaymakers from two other countries. Her reckless and disrespectful manner caused anger among the other guests and hotel staff. Parents didn't take care of their children. The children took over the restaurant as a playground. Eating behavior unacceptable, â€¦â€¦. .Pool was polluted with sand. The employees tried everything to change this situation, but only met with rejection. Not exactly motivating. It's over now!!!!!!!!!!!! From March 31st no more guests will come from these two countries. The Heritance Ahungalla will shine again in its former glory. Come to Heritance Ahungalla and enjoy unique Sri Lankan hospitality nestled in the hotel's paradisiacal setting. I wish you an unforgettable time.

The hotel looks lovely and the rooms are very nice - large, airy and tastefully furnished in a modern take on traditional. Wonderful big comfortable bed, excellent rain shower, big flat screen TV, minbar, generous safe and covered private balcony. Public areas are open plan and also look very nice - until you spot the package operator signs & programs, hear the scream of children in the pool (right beside the only bar & lounge) and realise the predominant language is Russian. Service is hit and miss - there are some excellent staff who cannot do enough to please, but there is also a lot of inexperience and a shortage of staff for the number of guests - leading to some extremely poor service experiences (eg. Wine ordered at dinner not arriving until after dessert; dirty plates left on tables for long periods; tables not properly cleaned between use; buffet dishes not replenished; etc.) The food quality in the buffet is poor - tough cuts of meat, over cooked curries and left out/not refreshed very often. Even at the fresh food stations the ingredients were not top quality and over cooked - and at best all the dishes are luke warm. Breakfast was no better - some good curries, but otherwise heavy doughy croissants, â€˜butterâ€™ that was in fact margarine, a couple of cheap jams, limited selection of fruit and one person cooking eggs and another cooking hoppers for the 100s of guests. To round it off - the majority of the wine list was unavailable (excuse being difficulty with supply chain due to pandemic - but the other hotels on our tour hadnâ€™t suffered the same problems), as were a number of items on the pool bar snack menu. The sl a carte restaurant and the other bars / coffee shop werenâ€™t open either. Definitely not a five star experience.

We visited Heritance at the end of our tour of Sri Lanka. Purpose of visit was to celebrate our daughter's birthday. Our daughter had a fabulous birthday thanks to Jananjaya, Nipun and management who were so wonderful. Thank you so much for making our stay so memorable. Your staff are an absolute credit to you. They go above and beyond. We are truly grateful for your kindness. Sharma family

Consistent with the other recent reviews we were scheduled to stay at the Heritance for the final three days of our SL tour. However, we checked out after the first night. On a positive note, the room was clean and recently refurbished. The food in the optional al Ã  carte restaurant was also good and the restaurant staff very friendly and efficient. On the other hand, the hotel is extremely large with many guests on â€œall you can eatâ€ inclusive deals. This created a very different feel to other hotels we stayed in. The staff were a mixed bag. Some were polite and others simply ignored you. The grounds were somewhat scruffy and the water in both pools was opaque suggesting a problem with algae (see photos). The adjacent beach was full of litter and hawkers. Having decided to check out were asked for feedback and this was positively received. Unfortunately, this didnâ€™t result in any gesture of good will and we paid the full bill for drinks etc. In summary, the hotel is adequate if you want to eat, drink and sunbath cheaply but it does not provide the experience consistent with other hotels in this class.

Heritance Ahungalla is next to a Lovely beach, and has a great view, nice pool and thanks to Rukhal and all the other colleagues for making our stay so nice with great service. Much appreciated by us!

Arrived after an amazing tour to be greeted with a poor reception by hotel staff.Not shown to the room ,two green pools full of algae unable to see bottom of pool.room was sufficient but superficially cleaned, no welcome fruit staff rude , lazy as this is an all inclusive for other countries paying guests are ignored but they stillcharge service charge. Lack of sunbeds but pool staff reserve for tipping guests. Children allowed to run wild everywhere even in the restaurants. Covid restrictions dismal and guests not challenged despite Sri Lanka still insisting on mask wearing. Only one bar open despite advertising all facilities availableâ€¦. Avoid this hotel as a well travelled guest this deserves at best a 3 star rating.

The resort exceeded our expectations. The rooms were spacious, spotlessly cleaned every day. There are two large pools, one of them more relaxing area, the one close to the lobby was more for kids. The food was delicious with a great variety of sea food every day. Entertainment and music every day in the lobby bar was at good level too.. The staff is extremely friendly and polite. The beach is huge and almost empty. The waves are big so a bit difficult for the kids to be in the sea.. We were four friends and all of us very satisfied. A special thanks to Mr Dhananja, Guest relations in the lobby

This is our first visit to Sri Lanka and we are very glad that we got to this hotel. very clean hotel and friendly staff. cleaning in the rooms at a very good level, special thanks to the cleaner Rukmal and the quality of work!

We stayed one night in February 2022 at Heritance Ahungalla. The room was very spacious and clean. We requested a quiet room and the hotel gave us a room which is far from the central pool area, facing the second pool. It was indeed very quiet. The welcome fruit was nice touch. The staff there are very nice and you can ask all kinds of questions. Buffet for dinner and breakfast had both good selection. You can taste authentic Sri Lankan food there although there are many western dishes. We sat in the garden at the dinner as it was quieter. The beach is wonderful and great place to watch sunset. The pool in the center was bit clouded but the second pool was not soo bad. If you want to experience Bawa hotel, this is another wonderful resort.

Hotel stuff showed us how the real warm hospitality looks like in Sri Lanka: very friendly , always smiling, very helpful and care about our needs ğŸ§¡ cuisine is very diverse and delicious ğŸ§¡ weâ€™ll return ğŸ§¡ğŸŒ¸

Stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla after a weeks safari and whale watching. Our suite was very good, thanks to Namal for keeping it nice and clean, and the staff were all excellent. Friendly, helpful and always there for you. A welcome break after all the travelling. Gary & Chrissie Bickerton

I would like to give a special thanks to Rukmal who took great care of us. I would definitely give the property and itâ€™s services a 10/10. The food is amazing plus you will love the pool and the view from here.

I have such mixed feelings about this hotel but Iâ€™m confident in saying that this is not up to the standards of a 5 star. We stopped here for the last week of our 2 week trip to Sri Lanka for our honeymoon and on arrival to the hotel from the lobby/main gates it looked exceptional! On arrival to our â€œdeluxeâ€ room we were instantly disappointed. The room apparently had just been refurbished which I found really hard to believe. The shower was covered in limescale and the room was tiny. After a bit of a battle we were finally allocated another room. This room was slightly bigger but the bathroom was once again the bathroom was again covered in limescale, half decorated, very basic and we couldnâ€™t see anything deluxe or 5 star about it. Earlier in the week we stayed in a deluxe room at a sister hotel â€˜Heritance Kandalamaâ€™ and the room there had an amazing view, whirlpool bath & amazing decorâ€¦ so as you can imagine we were really disappointed with this room. Iâ€™ve attached a couple of photos for reference too. The food was really really good at the buffet and snack bar and we thought the verity of alcohol provided on the all inclusive was good. The staff were friendly but there wasnâ€™t enough staff and they couldnâ€™t keep up with how many people were there. I personally wouldnâ€™t recommend to anyone looking for luxury to stay here and agree with the below comments that this is an equivalent of a European 3 star hotel. Finally, it seems that the management and staff prioritise the returning customers which is such a shame as if they put the effort in to new customers (especially ones who have spent a considerable amount of money on honeymoons) too along with a few touch ups, theyâ€™d receive better reviews.

We stayed at heritance ahungalle for a few days on our visit to Sri Lanka The staff were extremely helpful in particular Duminda the restaurant Manager, Rukmal from house keeping and restaurant staff Varuna, Nelka and jananjaya. We were impressed with Duminda. He is very knowledge and made our stay very enjoyable. Rukmal has a special talent of creating animal motives out of towels. We felt very special. The staff are a credit to your organisation We will visit again Kumar and Elsie. Sydney Australia Clara Thattil Colombo Sri Lanka

I donâ€™t mind staying in 3 star or less and judge them on that criteria , this is the type of hotel I object too , pretending to be a 5 star when it clearly is not . This is a recently updated 3 star at best First Pros Good location , right on the ocean , nice pools that faces the sea , rooms are adequate . Couple of excellent staff , housekeeping and the lady at the buffet Cons Bear in mind this is a 5 star hotel ( allegedly) Two hot tubs , one uncovered and has foot of water the other boarded over with no sigh of life . Broken paving stones by the second pool Old and tired towels at the pool Sun beds all peeling Blinds that come down in poor weather to protect the hotel are shredded and broken Rusty bin in bathroom, Paint peeling in the shower No USB points , Plastic seal on the bedroom shutter coming away Service is sooooo sloooooooooowwwwww Asked about ice cream at the 5 star buffet and told its not included . Sulky waiters 5 star gym is old, 8 year old machines , no matts , What I find suspicious is that all the glowing reviews mention nothing about the tiredness of the place and they are generally written by people with less than 5 reviews to their name , hmmmmm Only here for a couple of days but would be very angry if I had booked a week at a â€œ5 star hotelâ€ to find this

We stayed during January with my wife to celebrate her BDay. And honestly saying I was really surprised by this Hotel. The service was excellent! From the first minute of our arrival the attitude of the staff was extremely attentive. The room was great, the service in the restaurant was wonderful, the pool service was always at a high level. Special appreciates to Mr. Duminda (Restaurant Manager) and Mr. Panditha (Waiter) who made the birthday celebration especially memorable!

I was a guest at your hotel for two days from 5th Feb to 6th Feb 2022 occupying room #305. When checking out I accidentally left behind my phone charger. When I contacted the hotel Ms Leka Thilini, the Receptionist answered the phone and she very kindly helped me to get back my lost item. She took this matter in a very personal way and got Mr Dhananjaya Caldera, the Assistant Front Office Manager to hand it over to me. I would like to place on record my sincere gratitude to these two lovely members of your staff further stating that they are big assets to your distinguished organization A big thank you to them - Mrs Rohini Dissanayake

This hotel is classed as 5* it certainly is not. The refurbished rooms are definitely not. The hotel is tired and scruffy, the rooms are dirty (we were offered 2 rooms) and the pool is filthy. The staff were not bothered that we were unhappy and we were very polite in our complaint. We checked in at 5pm and checked out at 7pm

Overall we were disappointed with this hotel compared to others we stayed in during our trip to Sri Lanka. The room was tired and badly needing updated, things like seeing the same room service plates still outside the same room door hours later was unhygienic and attracted bugs. The food, we were half board so ate at the buffet breakfast and dinner. I really struggled as at dinner there was only a variety of curries available and being pregnant and adverse to certain smells I couldnâ€™t even go up to see what was available. However the staff were fantastic at dealing with this for me and I honestly couldnâ€™t have been in better hands. I really did appreciate their efforts in ensuring I ate a proper meal once they realised I was struggling. The pools were easily the best pools we had access to during our trip, we spent a lot more time using these facilities than we did anywhere else. One of the things I disliked was being shouted at from behind the chain link fence to come and see what the locals were selling but theyâ€™re not on hotel property so I understand there isnâ€™t anything staff can do about them. We were on our honeymoon and our tour operator had told us in our itinerary to bring our marriage certificate in order to receive honeymoon benefits. However when we checked in staff said it wasnâ€™t needed and didnâ€™t acknowledge it was our honeymoon at all.

We liked hotel and stuff, we think that hotel needs renovations but overall it was nice, stuff Namal was very nice made his job for 10 out of 10! Such a good time we spent there and I would recommend hotel

We stayed at Heritance Ahungalla for the second time and again enjoyed the splendid architecture, the beautiful location, the excellent food and - about of all - the friendliness of the staff. Our particular thanks go to Rukmal for the room service and to Dinesh, the pool attendant and to the restaurant manager Duminda and his very friendly and helpful staff. A small recommendation to other guests: try to avoid taking a room near to the pool bar which can get quite noisy in the evening. As a wheelchair user I particularly appreciate that all areas are barrier free.

Years ago this was probably a very grand hotel, however the grandeur has faded. The location & facilities appear very good, however the devil is in the detail and the lack of cleanliness makes the whole place feel grubby. I have stayed at numerous 5 star hotels around the world and have seen how standards vary in each continent. So using a European standard I would only rate this 3 star, which might meet some guests expectations. The staff are very friendly and energetic as we have experienced in all seven hotels during our two week Secrete Escapes tour. What this hotel lacks is Management direction to fix the cleanliness issues. As an example I enclose pictures of our recently renovated room where staff regularly create â€œtowel animalsâ€ when they should be directed to scrub mould of the newly tiled bathroom walls & floors.

A few teething problems which we raised with management and they were quick to resolve. Chaminda in housekeeping ensured the room was spotless. The pool attendant on green pool was very helpful. We ate in a la carte restaurant and food was of an excellent standard as was the service. The manager addressed our issues speedily and appropriately. He checked up on us. We had an excellent end to a great trip.

What an experience itâ€™s been at this hotel. I canâ€™t rate it highly enough. We stayed here for six days in January and it was absolutely perfect from start to finish and thatâ€™s all down to the staff. If we return to Sri Lanka and this hotel - it wonâ€™t be for the bricks and mortar (although itâ€™s great) it will be for the very special people who work here. A special shout out to our room guy Rukmal! Iâ€™ve stayed in plenty of hotels around the world but I canâ€™t remember any as being so attentive to detail as Rukmal is. Everyday he makes me smile with the way he has dressed the room with flowers, nice cushions and the towel art is another levelâ€¦ Heâ€™s such a warm, happy, hard working guy. Also want to give special mention to two guys have made our trip incredible. Lilanga and Nipun - they have catered for our every wish and whim. We set them a challenge of getting us some vintage champagne so we could celebrate something special and the scoured the whole of the island, rang every hotel and managed to find two bottles of vintage Dom Perignon for us before we left. They really have pulled out all the stops to make our stay so memorable. They made sure all our dining has been spectacular by setting up a gorgeous table on the beach, three nights consecutively. I canâ€™t heap enough praise on them enough. Iâ€™m so glad we got to know these guys, and that should be a little tip for other travellers. The hospitality industry has taken a battered since Covid and the staff work so hard by trying to make every guest feel exceptional. I always like to show my appreciation by learning everyoneâ€™s name, giving them my time, conversation and a few words of encouragement - it really does go along way and it will make your time here go from great to excellent. You can move mountains with guys like Rukmal, Lilanga and Nipun on your team. They are an absolute credit to the hotel and the Heritance brand should know what assets they have working for them. The hotel is beach fronted large and comfortable. Both pools is absolutely huge and so warm and welcoming. The food has been wonderful and the evenings we have spent on the beach, dining by the waves have been exceptional. But everything is down to the staff here. Worth 10 stars just for them!

Rukmal from house keeping well deserves a five star rating. Presentation is excellent and cleaniless of the place is 5/5 Very happy with his services here at hertinace ahungalla. Well done Rukmal and the team...

Had a family vacation to Heritance Ahungalla this January. This was our first time in Sri Lanka, so first time experience. There are few beaches down the coast, each with its own features. Ahungalla beach was beautiful: wide and clean. Although hotel doesnâ€™t have its private beach area (I guess none of the hotels do), it is so not crowded with other people so it feels like private. Hotel may seem not as new but itâ€™s a good quality one. It is also very quite and green, which makes it perfect to have the right getaway. Pool is clean with pool bar service available. And the view of the ocean and sunsets is just breathtaking! We had it all-inclusive. Every evening hotel makes different cuisine of the world (Indian, Japanese, Thai etc). We stayed for more almost 2 weeks and were absolutely fine with the foodğŸ‘ğŸ¼ Apart from everything it is people who make your stay memorable and comfortable. I noticed that Sri Lankan people in general are naturally very open and kind, and ready to help. But to say specifically about Heritance we even made good friends with staff! Not all names I could spell right, but thank you Tharindi from the reception and Tony from the restaurant to make us feel like home and being so nice to our family, we are so thankfulğŸ’• All the best to the hotel and team!

Heritance Ahungalla is wonderful. We had a fantastic holiday. Staff is super friendly and go out of their way to be helpful. We were traveling with two kids and they went out of their way to be nice to the kids. Housekeeping and restaurant in particular were superb. Rukmal, Sunath and Pawan even went to the extent of creating adorable animals to keep them entertained. Loved it and definitely coming back! â¤ï¸

for my office day out we choose this hotel,on last December 2021. the hotel is a master piece oF arch Jeffry Bawa, the lobby,landscape walks ways very beautiful. i enjoyed the swimming pool very much and at the deep end you can do even diving too. the lunch buffet was nothing grand, but it was edible, the staff each and everways was helpful..friendly.. hope to visit for a long week end soon

An absolutely amazing place to relax and unwind. Itâ€™s a very open, spacious and quiet environment. Rooms were incredibly comfortable and spacious. The staff were very attentive and quick to attend to any special requests. The buffet was good with plenty of variety. Couldnâ€™t ask for anything more!

What an amazing place to visit and relax with the family... Had a great time.. More than the interior whats special abou this hotel is the surroundings and the architecture (Bawa is a GENIUS) built along with the nature.. The staff were super friendly and excellent service all n all...

Amazing place with the most kind and welcoming staff the location is good facilities r really nice with wonderful view of the ocean the breakfast was great the dinner was fair over all was really nice to stay thereğŸŒ¹ğŸŒ¹

We stayed for 3 nights in Heritance Ahungalla hotel. First night we had few compliance on our room, but early in the morning they fixed everything. They tried so hard to fix everything and to impress us, which they succeeded. Room boy named Rukmal is so kind and great guy, he made our room look like dream. Also I have to mention supervisor Chaminda, he came and present to us that they are on our service and they they will help us for any request we have. Hotel is on great position, beach is amazing, food great and service is very quick. I recomend you this hotel!!!

I would definitely stay here again. There were few hick ups, but the staff friendly and were quick to address the issue raised. LOVED LOVED the infinity pool overlooking the ocean. Great way to spend the afternoon relaxing, swimming, reading, and enjoying life.

Our room at the hotel was very impressive but sadly quite noisy. You could hear everything from the corridors and in the room above. The hotel itself was a bit tired. The green swimming pool was amazing and usually quite quiet but the main pool was very busy all the time and with lots of children playing games so it was not very peaceful. The setting is lovely and the beach is really very beautiful, we enjoyed spending time on it. The staff were well meaning and friendly however we did have a few issues. I think perhaps not all of what we said/asked was understood but instead of asking to clarify they said yes and just said of course, no problem. This meant that we had a couple of situations which left us with problems. We booked a PCR test and expressly asked if the cost could be charged to our room. We were told that this was fine and no problem, then when we came to do the test we were told we needed to pay in cash which we did not have. The hotel did. It do anything to help and we found ourselves roaming the streets in the midday heat desperately trying to find a cash machine and very stressed. We also arranged a late check out which we had to pay for. We agreed this and then confirmed it the next day. Despite this on the day of check out we got a call saying we needed to vacate the room. We queried this and confirmed what we had arranged previously and were told they didnâ€™t have anything on their system and we would need to clear our room straight away but they could put us in another room. We were not packed or prepared for this and the whole thing turned out last day into a really stressful and ruined day.

What a joy the staff here are; just so pleasant and eager to please. Happy New Year Rukmal !!! We were given this charming elephant on our bed surrounded by flowers. Highly recommend Ahungalla Hertance

Everyday the cleaning service came and make wunderfull work its alsways clean Rukmal is the guy that make this wunderfull things I like the hotel a lot. The best in the hotel is room service the food is very good

The room and the hotel was clean. The food spread wasn't that good. My parents are vegetarian and they hardly had anything to eat. However they were very accomodating of my child and his needs. He refused to eat at the restaurant twice and both times the restaurant manager (Mr Illanga) was very helpful with arranging his Mel's. He made sure, at every meal to ask us if my child would need anything special done from the kitchens. It is that kind of hospitality that we imagine getting from a Sri Lankan hotel.

We stayed 4 nights which was great. The whole family had a good time. The rooms were very clean on arrival and well maintained by house keeping daily. The whole hotel was well kept and clean. Food was great. We tried the buffet, a-la-carte and room service. All of which was well made and a very good value for money. The pools are well maintained with life guards monitoring both. Our rooms opened out to the second pool at the hotel which offered ample shade during the day. The beach is also great; we had some good fun riding the waves and building sand castles with the kids! My wife and I had SPA treatments which were great and helped with the relaxation and sun burn! Having local crafts people selling their art work onsite was a nice addition and allowed us to get some souvenirs from the trip. The live music in the evenings was great too! Only disappointment for me was the pina colada score: 1/10

Excellent property well maintained too. Great hospitality with lovely food & great people. 25th December night there was over 250pax for dinner & the hotel was almost full but the F&B staff including all executive put there shoulders to the wheel specially JAYALATH @ the main restaurant is a hard working member with very good skills with ample experience know how to satisfy a customer. I witnessed the pool attendant/ life guard PRADEEP JAYALATH His presence of mind save the life of young child on 26th around 3-4p.m. He too deserves a huge respect too.

The quality of the room was great and the room boy Namal did a great job for us. The housekeeping staff work really hard unlike the pool bar staff who spend more time talking to each other than worrying about the customers who have to wait until they are ready to serve you. The exception to this is Asela who was excellent unlike his colleagues he was vigilant and attentive to customers. Reception staff were very helpful best among them were Trili and Daninja who looked after us very well. Finally the restaurant was okay and Nuwan was the best of the restaurant staff. Nice beach hotel.

What a brilliant place.... The customer service is simply remarkable. It's truly one of the best hotels in Sri Lanka.... Im sure people have been to Heritance Kandalama and overjoyed... this is also something you will never forget... Food is lovely... People are awesome.... â¤ï¸

We had nice time with them... Super good service from Them.... Will come again and join with you guys.... Good food tho.. Nice time with pool.. Atmosphere is excellent.... The room which we stayed is super tidy and clean... and also spa very good ...

We spent the day well... best locations ever.. we got a lots of pictures... super duper vacation ever... they treated us well.. special thankz for tharindi, lekha and all front office staff... thank you all..

Excellent services and very good hospitality. And great time and enjoy the stay at Herittance and would recommend anyone looking forward to have family holidays at this hotel . Very tasty food western and eastern . ğŸ‘

We had a very relaxing 3-night stay in this beautiful hotel. Nice beach, super clean rooms, excellent food, great entertainment programme and cozy pool area. Staff is very helpful and friendly, special thanks to Rukmal - the master of towels art ;)

Apologies ! This should have been written a while ago. By no means does the below completely under rate our experience, but hopefully the feedback will be taken as useful, with both the good and bad. The Bad: Having to change rooms the last 2 days, due to water heating and aircon issues. Lack of food options when less guests (totally understandable but still a shame, especially at breakfeast). Wear and tear is visible, a renovation would be a great bonus. But it by no means spoilt our trip, just an observation. Alot of mould in the bathrooms, requires some attention. I know it's a beach resort but the build up can get a little much. Due to choosing "all inclusive" option, the cocktails are very limited. Are nice but limited. I think if I went next time I would not do all inclusive, purely so we could enjoy a bit more diverse range. Snack foods however, (I recomend the fish and chips!) are lovely ! Due to post covid, lack of features and actitives are limited (again understandable, but needs mentioning prior to booking). Examples, Bicycle rentals, Spas, nightclub etc. Also the build up on rubbish on the shores, but again was due to time of the year with the seas as well. The Weird: The constant hello from a lady passing the perimeter of the hotel nearly every day trying to sell something. A Foreign guest who seems to be treated like royalty & known by all staff (Hi Aiya?!), I know there are less guests, but 3 beds, 6 cushions and 6 towels (with change every few hrs) for 2 people is a bit much... Also witnessed the attempt of trying to give chocolates to everyone including children (other guests) seemed a bit weird, maybe their form of a Santa? The repetiveness of the music in the restaurant and the bar, please I would advise working on changing this ! Or atleast having a different playlist alternating every other day ! If I heard John Lenon's Yesterday instrumental one more time... !! And the rest of Good ! (a lot more) : Firstly, the highest points go to the the staff and service, truely everyone that worked there were such amazing human beings, and we were humbled to have stayed at the resort with them ! Their commitment and attentivness was visible throughout our stay, so thank you very much to all of you. Cleaners : Nearly every day not only were the rooms tidied, but we were left with decorative and hilarious towel arrangements ! Kudos to the creativity ! Shout out to Dukmal and his colleagues for this ! I wish you all the best sir. Front of house & general assitance : Welcomed from the first minute by all and every request and detail asked was attented to. Samith whom we were greeted every day by and was checked in on was a great help & very friendly, even arranged a tour to the Safari for us and breakfasts to take was ensured. Sorry we missed saying good bye to you ! Hope to see you again. Restaurant: Lilanga, a gentlemen in charge of the restaurant, with a wealth of knowledge and tries to cater to all your needs . If you ever feel a meal is not right or if you need something, do reach out to him and he will help you, Thanks again ! A big gratitude to Jananjaya, whom we felt looked after us so much every day. Whom we grew to bond with, it was a pleasure meeting you ! Other names to mention, and sorry for not remembering all ! Tony, Panditha, Chamila as well, and also the lovely ladies who always greeted us and sat us down to our tables for every service. Bar: Much thanks to Calinga ! Thank you for all the cocktails. And again others who served us at the bar ! Pool: Both guys we had were amazing and made sure we always had towels, and cushion for the sunbeds. Dinesh, very nice to meet you and always laughing and joking made us so much more at ease. And last but not least, although I dont have names to mention. Many thanks to the security guards who would tend to go unnoticed, but honestly they made us feel safe and secure always seeing them around. The location, on the beach front, shame about the rough seas, cannot wait to see what it is like when the seas are calm ! With the infinity pool in the main area, it felt like you were in the sea anyway ! The food selection, although sometimes smaller, sometimes bigger. Always had a good variety for most days, and was always very tasty, and fresh. As one can expect, spices are prevalent but again requests can be made to amend this. There is alot of western options to accomodate. Again a shout out to Tony whom after talking about the fact that we never saw any Kottu on the buffet, was then on the main Buffet stand the next day being enjoyed not only by our selves but all other guests ! Buffer / BBQs on the outside garden is alway also a great addition when they can accomodate this ! The peacefulness. I think due to the post covid situation, we had the best of both worlds in a sense. Weekdays we pretty much had the pools to ourselves, and the weekends more locals arrived and so the resort was busier. As much as the peacefulness was appreciated, hopefully in the future, more "animations /activies" & I would look to see all bars in full operation, can be achieved to change the days up a bit. The wildlife, Birds, Iguanas, lizards, monkeys. Nothing disturbing but made it so much more tranquil with the plantation as well being among all of this. Not to mention the few dogs and cats. If you like plantation indoors as well, then you will enjoy the rooms and hotel itself as well, at night time they look even better if the lights are working. We stayed at Heritance 15th to the 27th. And really hope to visit another time in the near future !

We came for the hotel for lunch buffet and then stayed there for the rest of the day. The hotel staff were professional, kind , welcoming and warm. We had a group of 5 kids and 8 adults. Used the pool for the majority of the time and then right next to the hotel you can have beach access to this white sandy beach. The experience was amazing. We have stayed in many different hotels and so far this was the hotel with best service. You can enjoy their pool and all the other services without getting a room but just by buying the buffet. We highly recommend staying in here.

Heritance Ahungalla was a mixed bag for me, despite the grand entrance, the hotel looked slightly dilapidated and we were disappointed to see that the boat in the swimming pool was absent. Given the age of the hotel, I expected the service to be more refined, and, except for an exceptional experience with a man called rukmal who was exceedingly hospitable, the staff seemed worn out and thus slightly disgruntled. In the buffet I had to ask the staff 3 times to obtain a cup of coffee. I got the impression that the staff were overworked, but wanted to help.The buffet was delicious though small( the dishes though were of a very high quality). The rooms were lovely, however, the triple room we booked was just a double room with an small, and uncomfortable foldable bed added on. As I came primarily for the wonderful location, and food, I was not particularly disappointed.

Enjoyed the beach and the food. Pools are spacious and not crowded. Evening entertainment was great. We immensely enjoyed the Fire limbo show.. Hotel is one of the oldest, need a better outlook than this, however this is homely. can recommend to anybody who wants a peaceful holiday. Try to stay during weekdays..

We visited Heritance Ahungalla on 15th December 2021 to celebrate our son's B'day.. .It was a best day to our family. Hospitality of the whole staff was excellent.. We specially thank Mr. Duminda, Mr Jayantha and Miss Lihini with restaurant staff, and front office staff. Because we had a surprising B'day arrangement on that night. We love to visit again. Asanga Liyanaarachchi and family

Itâ€™s always wonderful to come back! I feel safe with all the safety measures taken by the hotel! The experience is always a delight! The service as always exceeds expectation! Keep up the good work and a big thank you to all the hotel staff for making our stay safe and wonderful!

Rukmal brings a little bit of joy to our hotel room each morning! Staying at the Heritance Ahungalla hotel in Sri Lanka. We canâ€™t wait to see what creation Rukmal will leave us every day and what props he will use.

I had a wonderful vacation in the Heritance Ahungalla. Great Service overall, great food and important very comfortable beds!! Special thanks to Trilishiya! A very charming, helpful lady at the reception. Special thanks also to Namal from housekeeping!

This place stinks of quality: the walk to our room was sophisticated with open squares full of tropical trees and a very classy colour scheme throughout. Service was extremely attentive, and the food was impressive. The pool by our room was beautiful. The hotel itself is quite old, with some fittings showing their age, but everything worked and now's not the time to be spending huge amounts on renervations so no criticism there! Excellent overall.

Spent a wonderful 5 days here after a tour. Its still very quiet here- they are desperate for more visitors, but that has meant we have had never-ending attention. The staff are so friendly and keen to please. Rukmal our room boy has made amusing towel creations, the pool boy has given us double cushions and pillows on our sunbeds, the gardening boy has presented me with a beautiful posy etc. The pools are beautiful. The sea is warm but always big waves so forget snorkelling. When you step on the beach a gang of saleswomen try to persuade you to buy their wares! The food is excellent, and the range gets bigger when there are more guests. The trip to Madhu lake nearby is worth doing. Do come and stay here, the staff deserve more guests!

It's a great holiday but the location not so good. The hotel is right on the beach but no swimming the sea was to rough. The staff were great good not do enough for for your but outside of the hotel were very few shops so you have get a taxi every where but they are cheap enough.

Extremely friendly and great service by Ranil from house keeping. My parents and grand parents have been visiting for the past thirty years and will continue visiting again. The hospitality at the hotel is very good

Heritance Ahungalla is a 40-year-old seaside holiday resort with a splendid beachfront location. The hotel has been built over a sprawling area and has all the modern amenities/facilities one would expect. The property has two large swimming pools, tennis courts, a well-equipped gym, a billiards table, a spa as well as shopping facilities. We stayed here for 8 days in September during our 15-day quarantine transit through Sri Lanka, heading onward to the US. It is a serene property ideally suited for middle-aged and older patrons looking for some calm away from the bustle of the city. The food was great. They had different cuisines catering to guests from various parts of the world. The Catering Managers were extremely friendly and accommodating. The front desk staff was also very supportive and sporting. Mr. Lilanga deserves a special mention for his attention to detail and the personal care that he extended to us. The rooms were clean and spacious with a view of the pool and the ocean beyond it. Overall our weeklong stay was very comfortable and thoroughly enjoyable.

We stayed at this hotel for the first time back in the late 90s, when it was called Triton. By the way, the statue of this Triton still flaunts at the entrance. It was a marvelous, respectable hotel with several restaurants, a tea room, fine service, and two lovely swimming pools. This is a beautiful colonial-style building, inside there are very beautiful galleries, between which water flows, trees and flowers grow. This is real architecture, not a soulless block with rooms. Unfortunately, the hotel ended up under water in December, 2004. The staff will tell you that only the first floor was flooded, and they will lie. Typical tsunami traces will also be on the third floor, this can be seen, although the walls are being tinted. I don't really understand how they got 5 stars. It is a very sad sight of destruction and extinction. The hotel is a pity as an old horse, from which they are trying to squeeze out the remnants of strength. Unmown grass, peeling sun loungers, frayed beach towels, yellowed bath towels, stained old linen, squeaky air conditioner, mildew, dampness, musty. Tiles are falling off in pools. Fence-mesh around the perimeter. And that is not all. This once beautiful hotel is now used as a staging post for bus groups, arriving to spend one night before departure. From the pros: It is still an outwardly beautiful building The staff works with full dedication Decent cuisine for Europeans, not too spicy, many adapted dishes. In the room, like more than 20 years ago, a bowl of fresh seasonal fruits will be waiting for you. The staff is still on the ball.

The food in this hotel is very tasty, no other hotel has ever tasted so good. special thanks to the maid Namal, he was very good at cleaning the room and leave a lot of flowers. Beautiful place and hotel

Had a great holiday @ one of the best property in southern coast. Very ferindly staff, excellent buffet with so many varieties of food & brilliant service. Rooms are spacious and comfort. Two pool are were cleaned and will make your stay memorable. So many activities to do with your kids and evening entertainment is also good. Can recommend to anybody to spend their holiday. Thank you heritance ahungalla.

Visited to one of the best best beach property in sri lanka. Very friendly staff, excellent buffet & service with so many varities and luxurious room. So many entertainment and activities to do in the hotel. Recommend to anybody to have a great stay.

Glorious place. Choose the room 105, if you have kids and want easy access to the pool. If you go on weekends they have activities for kids as well. Staff were overwhelmed I think with the number of visitors to the place however they did try their best. The welcome reception should have been a little bit more and not like as if you are checking in to motel.. Food was average, if not below average.

Excellent and safe experience all the way from Check in to Check out...very good adherence to Covid safety guidelines put us at ease considering our age.. Excellent selection of food and Very efficient friendly staff...rooms were clean and well catered for..special mention of our room boy Lasantha who was outstanding.. a hotel with very good facilities for either a fun filled outing or a relaxed get away..

my self, my husband, and my child visited to Ahungalla hesitance during our trip to Galle. We booked one room there suddenly without a prior notice. In front desk, there was a staff member, Lihini, who helped our booking process. She was very helpful and charming. she helped with checking process and also the entire stay. The environment was very good for my child and she adapted easily to the environment thanks to Lihini. The rooms were cleaned and very comfortable. Most importantly the staff was amazing from checking to departure. Special gratitude goes to front desk staff member Lihini. hope to visit again

Spent a most enjoyable weekend with a surprise cake mixing organised for guests and employees. A fun event organized by the talented sous chef and his assistants. An artistic display of dried fruit nuts which were mixed with lavish addition of premium alcohol. Ending with savouries and milk punch served around. Dilkie Umagiliya Colombo

The property is located in a great location and really easy to access. The bawa architecture is well preserved and presented. The pocket gardens maintained within the property is really nice. Food was really good and need to appreciate the staff because they are really friendly and helpful. We had in room dining for our baby and they provided the food without any hesitation. Room we had we spacious and comfortable. They stay was calm and very relaxing and recommends anyone to visit the hotel

Absolutely helpful staff, fantastic Sri Lankan traditional cuisine, 5 star dining and great sea food. We absolutely loved our stay. Beautiful beach location with nearby facilities for snorkelling and sea and river safari Special thanks to Rasika, Duminda, Dhanjaya at the restaurant for making our stay comfortable.

I was offered one of best suite room in the hotel which had almost every comfort and luxury one can dream of in a room . Comfort , luxurious and wide spaced facilities of the room was really attractive . including mr Srinath front desk manager all the staff was really friendly and it was like staying in your own home with super luxury feeling . Food was tasty and had good verities too . There are plenty of activities to be done in side the hotel premises including playing tennis , badminton, cricket . Two large amazing swimming pools are always attractive to have wonderful swimm . I will surely visit this wonderful place again .

We were stayed here two nights on a FB basis. This was our first hotel stay in this year due to covid 19. We got a nice cleaned room, food was so tasty, facilities are nice. There was a one thing which I never seen at any hotel. The restaurant manager personally come and ask from a guests about the tasty of foods, how we satisfied about their service, our feedback, and if anything needed they are ready to provide us. Apart from that here are few things I noticed. 1. There was a lady named Lekha at the reception. She was nice and tried her best to give a superb service. 2.There was a guy named Rukmal at the house keeping, who always doing his duties with a smile. He was attended to our requests within minutes each time, and gave us a superb service. He is a real gentleman. 3.The restaurant staff always did their duties professionally and friendly. I have seen they all are quickly attending to the guest and try to fullfill their requests. Hats off to them for their great service. Based on my experience I highly recommended this hotel to both locals and foreigners and will definitely visit here once again in the future.

Perfect location with nice spacious rooms. The beach was both beautiful and clean. Kudos to all the staff for their amazing hospitality and the great service, especially Rukmal for giving a nice touch to room we stayed. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone!

This was our second visit to the hotel. We were at the hotel for 3 nights to celebrate a birthday.They arranged a cake and a fruit basket on arrival , We were travelling with a small baby and Nilanga in in room dinning made sure to send all baby food is delivered on time.

Everything was great. Staff, meals, room, pool, hospitality , perfect location with beach and view... great place to free from outside world and stress. Highly recommend for local and foriegners. Thank you all the staff especially chef Rakitha and Manoj.

I enjoyed my stay, especially with the super spacious rooms. The food was pretty average but the service was good. The hotel has a nice beach too. The hotel has 2 swimming pools and they are quite big. Service is pretty decent.

I stayed at Heritance Ahungalla from 20th to 24th October 2021 and had an excellent stay. Such a great get away from the pandemic fears and stressful life were just what my young family and I needed. Beautiful beach and great ambiance at the hotel made our stay pleasant and full of fun, especially for the kids. The service was excellent and staff was ever more polite and friendly, attending to all the needs of my young family. I need to specially mention about the food, which was healthy and full of variety. Delicious dishes ranged from all kinds of cuisine mesmerized our taste buds with that aromatic deliciousness. Desserts were so awesome and very healthy. I even wrote a poem after having so much desserts (I am not a dessert person) because it was truly delightful and full of variety! Thank you so much for the wonderful Chefs, and their teams as well as for the hotel staff. We are sure to return very soon! Found love in desserts! Marshmallows in rainbow colours Ginger and coconut pudding Sweet spices and crunch in white So many cakes mouthwatering guests Vanilla cheese cake, raspberry/passionfruit pools, chocolate mousse, white chocolate and coffee crÃ¨me brule Float you up to the clouds Aroma of fresh pineapples, star fruit, papaya, passionfruit and watermelon Sugary and sour with fragrance of exotic power Say all about our home. Sri Lanka!

Excellent ... and supervisor Mr samiti is good treated and all of crew b tread good . Like a family ....... and Mr Jacob sir also good treat we all our friend thanks to evry one of the staffs .... OK ğŸ‘Œ

It was a very memorable stay and I was really impressed with their hospitality. I would rate each and every sector as excellent from the food to the ambience to the coziness in the rooms. Excellent quality standards in room service and pool cleanliness. Definitely would recommend any foreign tourist to come to this place and have a stay that would be a memorable one to them!!

We were on a short visit to SL in October and stayed at â€˜Heritage Ahungallaâ€™. Hotel was just starting to getting back to some normalcy after a long spell of closure due to the pandemic. The staff were extremely accommodating and the service was exceptional as well. Duty manager â€˜Jayâ€™ and his team were doing great job , would definitely send a friend there.

Situated in a wonderful atmosphere with a beautiful view of the sea, family friendly since I came here with a toddler the staff was very helpful throughout the stay. Deserts weâ€™re delicious And they had the best chocolate croissant Iâ€™ve ever had!

We had a lovely time during our stay â¤. I have been to this hotel many times before and am always amazed with the hospitality I receive ğŸ™Œ Great staff and management team who try and accommodate every request you make ğŸ˜€ Great place to stay

The stay was amazing. Unfortunately, the covid situation is still having an impact on the number of guests, which inturns leads to hotels being unable to have a buffet. Heritance compensated well by letting us order anything we had in mind. Mr. DUMINDA went out of his to make this possible. Thank you to him and also Mr RASIKA and the the of the staff staff for a memorable stay.

Good Room service, house keeping service ( Manoj), Satisfactory Restaurant service ( A special thanks to Ms. Rebecca and D silva ) Highly cooperative staffs, ( special thanks to the pool attendant Uchit )

My husband and I spent a spectacular 8 days at Heritance Ahungalla. The property is just stunning, set right on the ocean, with extensive, lovingly tended grounds studded with generous, spreading trees and two inviting pools. The building is beautiful and flows into the natural setting. The rooms have serene ocean and garden views and are very well designed and maintained However, the most outstanding feature was the warm and attentive service. Restaurant manager Mr.Duminda and his team provided delicious meals. We especially loved all the different fresh made pickles and Sambols along with the hoppers. The staff were so hospitable and ever willing to go the extra mile to meet different needs. The Housekeeping staff was awesome, responding almost instantly to all our requests and ever helpful! Thank you all for giving us such an unforgettable experience!!

We have been staying here for 14 days quarantine from 23rd September to 9th October 2021. Cleanliness and sanitization of all facilities is very exceptional especially Housekeeping staff Name â€œRukmalâ€ he is very professional and cleaning our room everyday like you are arriving on the first day. I wish I could upload the post pictures of our room. The resort staff is very nice and professional. The restaurant is very well organized for guests of a Level 01 quarantine facility with buffet meal. I have one special note for fruit section everyday same fruit repeating. They need to put different varieties of fruit on alternative days. Internet connectivity is excellent where we have been staying.

Most amazing stay with incredible views, great rooms with brilliant facilities. The staff are absolutely lovely and so helpful, they serve food, take your bags and see to your every request. Only disappointment is that the spa was closed due to COVID!

The view is splendid, the staff takes of you like you are one of their own. Great variety of choices in terms of food and even if the splendid buffet does not coincide with what you want, they would prepare any type of food for you if you ask for. The two pools are great and there is even a jacuzzi. The rooms are just stunning, and the view completely worth the night price. Itâ€™s also very safe in terms of Covid, protocols are respected and distance kept. 100% recommended

We stay here on 14 day quarantine from Sept 11 to Sept. 26. Though some facilities were nor operative, the gardens, pool and beach etc. are very nice for nature lovers. Cleanliness and sanitization of all facilities was exceptional. The resort staff were very nice and professional. Reception / Front office staff , Mr. Awasitha and all other team (sorry couldn't remember all names) were very supportive and made our stay much comfortable. The restaurant was very well organized for guests of a Level 1 quarantine facility. Special note of appreciation to Chef Chandana Alvis, Lilanga, Duminda, Nihal, Nipun, Chamila, Rebecca and all other staff of the Restaurant who were proactive and made our stay very comfortable. Keep it up ladies & gentlemen!! Internet connectivity in some rooms and areas need improvement. Would like to visit HA once more in normal times !ğŸ‘

I stay here 14 days the restaurant food was good but pastry Chef very bad attitude he not respect the customer (guest) not only me so many people told me he not good in this hotel and Service department very excellent service Thank you

My name is abdul hakeem. From Rajasthan INDIA...... I arrived at heritance hotel on 13 sep 2021 to 28sep 2021. The staff here is very nice. It's great to have food and drink. I love the work of dilan chaimka.

The ambience and amenities is top class. impressed with the hospitality of the restaurant staff. Mr Leelangdar and the chef Chandana who caters to everyone. Ravindu serves with a smiling face and shows genuine concern

All the things is very good like laundry and pool & room at all Great survivor and staffs their behavior is also so sensitive like LIHINI and TRILSHIYA, ACHIRIU, THARINDI, LEKHA, And all. Thanks for your cooperation and support.! And thanks heritance ahungallaâ€¦ Regard, Monis khan

The staff welcomed us after we arrived at the hotel, hotel rooms are very nice and clean, the staff was extremely friendly , the restaurant very flexible and food is good. I would like to convey my experience with Heritance Ahungalla,Where I had stayed along with my family members on that hotel. Especially want to tell about the food the coconut pudding one they made its unexplainable taste ğŸ˜‹thanks to chef chandana and his team members.

Specialy mentioned the staff very good always helping to each abd every possible way. Highly recommended this property who wish to stay here relaxed.... Room, food good, Nice beach and superb swimming pools can enjoy here. Defiantly we will come back here with our families.....

Specialy mentioned the staff excellent but food to be improved. We will be back with our family. Good for relaxing hotel. everyone was willing to help in anyway possible to make our stay as enjoyable as possible for us.

Very nice hotel. Good staff & really helpful. Recommend to any one who looking for good food & best sleep. If you need anything contact Jay or nipun they will assist you with anything. Thank you so much Rebecca, Lekha, nadeeka for the kind hospitality

Exelent services very good Staff Garden very nice Rooms beatifull Food Exelent Reseption staff good responce Music night good Only child activities nothing croserry shop not available Toilet not comfortable for family

Happy moment while staying inside the hotel. Staffs are very polite and good manner. Specily Mrs. Lihini and Mrs. Trilishiya treat us nice manner. housekeeping good service also dining hall. All of staff inside hotel good and polit.

staff are very polite and very kind. ... i have only one comment Kindly toilet glass need to cover sticker or wall poster because we are staying double sharing room but bath toilet feel uncomfortable..

Restaurant food is amazing and special thanks to Mahesh , Ms Nadeeka and Rebecca to looking after us. Room is nice and comfortable. This is a very good hotel good service from jute restaurant and Mr Nipun & Lilanga help me lot in my stay Good room service, good food ,plesent climate ,nice location, every family member elders n children can come n enjoy...... Special thanks to Mr.Nipun & Mr.Lilanga

Incredible hotel in the Sri lanka because I like too much in this interior design or some blanket or excellent view in this hotel different _2 view and such a good beach of sea view of back side of this hotel and service man's also good talking with politely guests that's a lot

Hi, I had a wonderful stay at Heritance Ahungalla. My room was lovely and clean, everything worked well, thanks to the room attendants. The restaurant staff were just superb, with special mentions going out to Rebecca, Tony, Lilanga the F and B executive, nothing was too much trouble and the food was excellent, All Covid Guidelines were adhered to and the reception staff very good too with special mentions to a Lekha and Saponika. I was only going to stay a couple of nights but extended my stay to 10 nights: best decision ever! With the lovely Bawa architecture, I did not feel restricted, although following your first PCR upon arrival, expect to remain in the room until the result. The hotel has to be commended for its good management. I also appreciated the fact that despite the limited number of guests, the bar lounge did provide entertainment, with a singer and traditional dancing.

am very happy in this hotel where I stayed from May 1 - 14 in room 206. The cleanup of Mr. Rukmal Fernando who drew up with towels forms, animals...best towel art man. the jacuzzi was working well, the pool temperature comfortable, the meals plenty ...

We were there for the two-week quarantine. This time was sweetened for us by incredible wonderful staff, helpful at all times, friendly, with a personal touch to anything desired. Whether it was Amila who takes care of the sports activities, volleyball, water aerobique, badminton, cricket, tennis.... he is there, beyond the activities offered, always with a smile. Or the extraordinary team that takes care of the rooms.... from morning to night Dumunda and Rukmal and all the others were there, helpful and caring. Also the staff in the restaurant, the pool bar, the watchmen, or at the reception all are wonderful :)) And definitely the young man who does the tests.... it could not have been carried out more sensitively! To say a word about the accommodation, the facility is beautiful and clean. The rooms are cozy and everything is there to have a good time. There is access to the sea, which was also very nice to have ;) We would come back anytime!

One of the best hotels Iâ€™ve stayed in Sri Lanka. All Covid-19 guidelines are followed very professionally. Hotel has amazing views, staff are so friendly and professional, Incredible food! Thank you all at Heritance Ahungalla so much. Special thanks to Lasith, Lekha and Kanishka!ğŸ™ğŸ½

I stayed at Heritance Ahungalle in March 2021 as part of a government mandated quarantine stay. It is categorized a Level 1 Tourist Bubble Hotel. The hotel had all the quarantine protocols well setup on arrival and my check in process was very smooth. The first PCR test was conducted within half an hour of my arrival. Although it is an older property, it is well maintained and clean. The food choices provided were good and plentiful. The staff went over and above to make me and the other guests feel welcome, safe and comfortable. They were very friendly and quick to respond to any requests. I would like to particularly mention Nipun (F&B Manager), Supunika (Guest Relations Executive) and Namal (Housekeeping) for their exceptional service. The restaurant staff and everyone at the hotel worked very hard during this difficult time to bring a sense of normalcy to all the guests. Thank you from Canada.

We enjoyed staying at Heritance Ahungalla for our 14 day quarantine. This hotel worked with us to provide the necessary paperwork we needed for immigration and airport officials so that we could come to Sri Lanka from the USA. We could not have pick a better place. We had access to a bit of the beach. We enjoyed the beautiful birds and fantastic wildlife that frequent the Hotel property. We especially enjoyed seeing the troop of purple faced monkeys. The food was totally incredible. Our rooms were kept spotless by very kind and thoughtful the room attendants. The attendants and managers at the desk were helpful and professional. They were able to get our quarantine release paperwork done for us in time for check out! Thank you all very much.

Excellent stay with friendly staff - Rukmal, Duminda and Chaminda specially. Very spacious and clean rooms. Lots of entertainment were provided and hotel went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable. Amazing value!

More recently, we had a rest with a group of friends at the Heritance Ahungalla hotel on the island of Sri Lanka. The impressions were the most pleasant. The hotel is very comfortable, clean, tidy and beautiful. The window offers a stunning view of the ocean, there are many vegetation and animals around. In the morning you wake up to a variety of singing amazing, exotic birds. And when you leave your room for breakfast, you can see a family of monkeys, which is located on the branches of the nearest trees. A very funny sight. There were no problems with food, as there are dishes of both local and more familiar cuisine for us. Another pleasant feature of the hotel is that the beach is located some 100 meters from the hotel. Since during our trip there was quarantine in the country, nevertheless, we did not feel any inconvenience, because the ocean was within walking distance. I would also like to mention the staff of the pool bar and in particular Mr. Darshana. Very nice person, brilliant employee and very friendly guy. Always ready to serve and help. In general, I liked the rest very much. I hope I will come here at least one more time.

We had an overall good experience when we were quarantined for 13 nights at Heritance, Ahungalla. The hotel: It was a pleasant hotel. There were many activities, functions for the guests, but we didn't participate because of personal choice. The room: We stayed in a luxury suite, and it was very roomy. I had a large balcony so I could relax while distancing myself from others. I felt like we were staying at a single-bedroom apartment. The staff: Every single person we met went above and beyond. Especially, Duminda and the team and housekeeping. There was not much Sri Lankan food for us, so the F&B team made special orders for the ex-Sri Lankans. That was the highlight of the stay. There was no office room available, so they let me do my work from the cafeteria. Also, Jaminja (Cpt) made me some excellent ginger tea and coffee. Food: Main meals we sub-par for a five-star hotel, but the dessert menu was the best dessert menu I've ever seen. The person who was on the wok station made sure we get tasty meals as well-my personal favorite food station! Tours: We took a 1-day tour to Anuradhapura. Our tour guide did his best to make sure we enjoy our trip, but overall the tour did not meet our expectations; we paid $350 (Rs. 69,500). For breakfast, we received one water bottle, a sandwich made with ham and butter, an orange, a banana, a piece of cake, and a sugary snack. And we received the same for lunch. The vehicle was not roomy; made for long tours- we are average-sized people, and there was not much legroom. We had another tour planned for the day after next to Pollonnaruwa, but I decided to cancel it. We don't mind paying money for the tours but expect a way better service. Overall, it was good. I hope this review would help make things better for future customers and give credit where it's due.

Our stay at Heritance Ahungalla was very nice. We enjoyed the pool, the ocean and the music in the evenig. The Corona-Protection was also very good and we felt very safety during our stay at the hotel. The stuff members were very helpful and we enjoyed the volleyball games with them in the evenig. Also the service at the bar and in the restaurant were very attentive. Further the room service, especially our cleaning guy Rukmal was very good and he created for us a lot of "towel animals". Finally we can say that we had a wonderful time in Sri Lanka and in this beautiful hotel.

Our quarantine stay at Heritance Ahungalla has been exceptional, so much so that we forget we are quarantining for 2 weeks before we are able to head home to see our families. The room, the amenties and food have been excellent - something new and exciting on offer every single day makes the long stay at the hotel go by so fast. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a luxury suite (room 101) with a terrace bigger than most flats in London! Rukmal makes up our room everyday and we always look forward to see what creative towel-animal he's got in store for us every single day! Dumindha and the restaurant staff have been so nice, if we ever miss breakfast for a lie in, they send a plate to our room without even being asked so we don't miss out on anything. They are always asking us what cravings we have so they can ask the chef to make it for us. The reception staff are very polite and helpful and do everything in their power to make sure our stay is comfortable and also plan and ensure we get all our mandatory PCR testing done timely. Thank you very much to Hertiance Ahungalla for your hospitality!

We had to do quarantine during our travel to Sri Lanka, Sri Lankan airlines provided us with a list of hotels (over 90) that we could choose to privately book our stay at. From searching the locations of the hotels other reviews and images i had finally chosen to pick Heritance Ahungalla and if i had to chose again i would hands down pick the same. i have been to many hotels prior to only have a handful of staff that take pride in their jobs, here every employee i encountered was extremely pleasant to deal with. everyone was willing to help in anyway possible to make our stay as enjoyable as possible for us.

The Sri Lankan tourism board currently requires a mandatory quarantine of 2 weeks which can be completed at multiple level 1 safe and secure hotels. My mum and I decided to stay at heritance ahungalla for the full 14 days because the service was that amazing! Since our arrival, the manager Duminda went the extra mile to make our stay a great one. Iâ€™ve also watched the way he interacts with all guests to make everyone feel like a member of the family. Every employee in hospitality should be trained by him- truly a star ! Every day there are multiple activities to take part in from water aerobics to volleyball. Amila the animator has so much energy and makes all the classes enjoyable. Iâ€™d never played volleyball before and the animator took the time to teach me the technique and encouraged me to keep trying and carry on! The hotel has two large pools and a beach where you can catch the sunset around 6pm. Thereâ€™s a gym with life fitness machines and high quality weights. If that wasnâ€™t all enough the tennis, badminton, table tennis and croquet will keep you busy. The buffet is delicious my favourites have been the devilled cuttlefish, crabs, and prawns. Wow the chefs are great and always happy to chat about how they make their delicious dishes. Jananjaya, the host is friendly and so quick! He also serves the best yard tea that Iâ€™ve ever tasted. In the evening there is always entertainment, for example, kandyan dancers, DJâ€™s, fire acrobats and more! Darashana at the bar is great and the drinks are fantastic. In general the whole team at anhungalla heritance have been consistently 10/10. Everybody I have interacted with served with charm, energy and good humour. I canâ€™t wait to come back again. Quarantine here has been paradise !

My husband and I are visiting Sri Lanka from the United States, and according to the Sri Lankan quarantine regulations, we had to choose a â€œLevel 1â€ hotel to complete our quarantine period of 14 days. We chose Heritance, Ahungalla, an Aitken Spence Hotel, and we are currently staying there. I wanted to write this review mainly because of the awesome staff who operates this property. Starting from the General Manager to the lifeguards, the whole crew is dedicated to providing an unparalleled service level to their guests. We felt that the GM, Sisira Senaratne is an asset to this hotel, and has the best crew that he could possibly have. His team represents among the highest levels of guest service we have experienced. The team here goes the extra mile and out of their way at every level to make it a wonderful and memorable experience for their guests. The entire staff here are exceptionally friendly, patient, and helpful in every way that a hotel guest would expect them to be. The restaurant manager, Duminda Gunasinghe, is excellent, and he is personally attending to all guests individually to make sure that guests are happy and satisfied with every meal. The servers including Jananjaya and the three female servers are very hospitable. They always treat us with a smile and taking care of us like family. The chefs are cool, and they always try to create some special dish for everyone. There is only one bar in operation due to safety reasons, and the staff there are so awesome. The bar captain Dharshana, the barman Asela, and all the other staff there are amazing. I want to make a special mention about a couple of staff members: Chatura at the front desk and Kanishka at reservations. These two members went out of their way to help us to get a document that we needed from Sri Lanka Tourism while we were at the Los Angeles airport. We would not have been able to board the plane if not for these two awesome guys. Due to the time difference between Sri Lanka and the US, they had to attend to it after hours around 2:00 am in the morning. We really appreciate what they did. Finally, I want to say that we truly love the top-notch friendly and professional customer service we have received from this Hotel, and I would recommend this place in a heartbeat to any traveler. Kushara Kodikara

We stayed at Heritance Ahugalla for 14 days quarantine. I cannot thank enough the restaurant team enough for their exceptional hospitality. Special thanks to the food and beverage team. Duminda made us feel at home, his warm smile and hospitality were exceptional. The same goes to Rebecca, Sanjeewa(best jokes), Asanka, Buddhika, Nelka, Nirosh, Priyankara and the list continues. All these guys made our stay very pleasant and they went above and beyond to cater to our needs. I also want to thank the pool attendants and lifeguards Dinesh and the team. Also many thanks to the housekeeping team Ranil, Nilanga, and Thakshila. The list continues and we had a great experience.

We had splendid time at Heritance. Although was our isolation period we did not felt any inconvenience. Big shout out to all staff members - who made our stay very comfortable and joyful. We felt just like home, thanks to you ğŸ¤— Special thanks to Dinesh Pool Attendant - Outstanding hospitality. You made our stay really special. Varuna - Pool Bar Captitan, nothing ever is too much, amazing attitude and energy Saman - House keeping, so efficient and attention to details. You helped us a lot during our stay Nilanga - Mustard Coffee Shop - very professional service. Well manners and knowledge. We loved our chats about SLankan culture and history. Wish you all the best! Angelika&Teodor

It was delightful to experience true Srilankan hospitality at Heritance Ahungalla during my recent stay. From the list of hotels to quarantine, having been here 14 years ago, the only place I wanted to stay was Heritance Ahungalla. From Sunethra who is at reservations who was my first point of contact to reception staff and very attentive Tony, Duminda, Nipun, Panditha, Jacob and all restaurant staff to ever so cheerful security guards to the observant lifeguards and the animators and the extremely neat and tidy housekeeping team â€“ especially Namal and all other random staff I bump in to, THANK YOU, for making my 14 days quarantining a breeze. I didnâ€™t feel that I was quarantining, as each and everyone of you lived up to the promise of, â€œweaving a little magic into my holiday while honouring the promise of the finest in hospitality and exceptional serviceâ€. The beautiful cultural shows, buffet dinners at the beach, DJ nights to soothing Sinhala songs were so enjoyable. You all are true ambassadors of Srilankan hospitality. For all of you, it could be another day at work, but your positive attitude to work and the willingness to always make your guests happy meant so much to me for over the last 2 weeks... Iâ€™m looking forward to visiting the hotel again when it is opened up for local guests. Wishing the team all the absolute best and continue weaving your magic!! Thank you!

Wow, from start to finish everything was fantastic! In the times we are in, all measures were taken to protect us from the virus. We arrived with a negative pcr, was retested on arrival and tested every 5 days. The staff were exception particularly the chefs that allowed us do a cookery class as a group with our friend that is a food doctor. Food was unreal! We went for b&b but if I was returning I would do full board. The room is beautiful room 105, overlooking the pool and beach. The door was broken, took a couple of days to fix but that was okay. If we needed anything, the staff were only more than happy to assist. One night we had a bbq on beach, very reasonably priced, 12â‚¬ including entertainment. And what great entertainment! The Sri Lankan fire limbo show was superb ğŸ‘Œ We will miss you, Yvonne x

I am staying in Heritance, Ahungalla, level 1 safe and secure hotel in beautiful, sunny, tropical paradise of Sri Lanka. The hotel is situated by the Indian Ocean with palm fringed,golden Sandy beach and endless rolling waves. The sunset is breathtaking! The scenery is an eye candy. One of the best beaches Iâ€™ve ever been in my many travels. The beach is the green turtle nesting place. If you wonder in to the beach at night, you are bound to experience nesting sea turtles. The hotel staff is wonderful and very attentive. Always with a big smile! The food and beverages are very good. The restaurant team led by Duminda doing a excellent job. The rooms are comfortable and clean. All the guest amenities are there for guests to have a very comfortable stay. I would highly recommend Heritance Ahungalla, if you are visiting Sri Lanka!! Dr Susan Leslie Gavin Leslie

On arrival, when Reception was informed we'd been confirmed Room 333, we were told that our room would not be ready for another 20 minutes. After 20 minutes, we were then told that it would not be ready for another few hours as it's a luxury room & will take that long to clean. When we asked if this was because the previous occupants checked out late, we were told they didn't know, and when pressed, they admitted that was the reason. When we said that shouldn't have happened as the room was booked, & previous occupants should not be allowed to check out late, they offered us a "transit room, free of charge" until the room we had booked (which was more expensive than this "transit room" was ready. How could they possibly think we would be happy with a "transit room", which was cheaper & more basic than the one we had booked & put up with the inconvenience involved in changing rooms? When we said we weren't happy with this & insisted on talking to the Manager, he finally turned up some time later & said the previous occupants couldn't be vacated on time as they were elderly & disabled, but they would have four cleaners clean the room & it would be ready in 30 mins. Finally, we had access to the room we booked at 3.45pm (although, we should have had the room at 2pm), but we still had to wait another 15 minutes (i.e. until 4pm) for our luggage, which had been sent to the cheaper "transit room"& had to be brought back.
