So, they broke their contract. A room we should have had at 2pm, was only given to us at 4pm (2 hours later). We later discovered that the previous occupants were not elderly at all. Therefore the Manager LIED. We complained to the head office and got nowhere. We have not stayed in this hotel again as a result of this disgusting treatment and we NEVER WILL. This happened some time ago, but I'm still so angry about it that I want to report it.

Thanks for this amazing vacation! Hotel is excelent, clean, comfortable, near with Ocean. Have 2 pools, meal is delicious, personal is friendly and polite. Cleaning servis is best, especially Rukmal )) he made various towel things )) like dolly, elefant ğŸ˜„ Bar, waiters, guardian personal very polite.

Heritance Ahungalle, designed by renowned architect, Geoffrey Bawa, is one of our favourite hotels in Down South. We really really love this hotel for it's friendly and peaceful environment. This was our 2nd stay here. There are two large swimming pools but both were closed when we were there in January due to the pandemic situation. The staff was extremely courteous and attentive. Very impressed by the service. Food was excellent. We can't wait to come back...

Worst hotel ever Felt like you are in a graveyard. The room is too far especially you need to walk from the lobby to the room is like 1km Not worth the price at all. Staff were polite especially the manager but they need to consider making the hotel better since we pay more and believe the reviews

Swimming pools are closed and there are limitations to gym due to covid situation, and due to lack of stafg room service took much time than expected .other than that no complains, staff was friendly and also there is a lovely beach

We visited Heritance Ahungalla on boxing day. The precautions taken for Covid 19 were exceptional. Special appreciation to Tharindi for arranging a quick check in as we were late for lunch. The room had a sea view and was quite spacious. Food was served as buffets for all three meals. The spread was good on all three meals. However, in terms of taste it could improve. The dinner was a barbecue, but sadly the food was over burnt. Overall the service was great and would recommend to anyone.

The stay was so serene and peaceful. Lovely sceneries and great food. The set menus had a wide selection and was delicious. The staff was very helpful and full of hospitality. The hotel is great place to chill out.

Quite good. But the pool & spa is not fuctioning during the situation is downlift the value of the place. The complience of CoviD-19 rules and regulations are perfect at the check in to check out. Overall good experience.

A beautiful, soothing and relaxing experience. Excellemt service with very friendly and helpful staff. Food was superb and though the it was A la carte, it turned out that we enjoyed it much more than a buffet due to the extensive choices and flexibility in the 5 course meal as well as due to the attentive staff headed by the bar and restaurant manager Thushara. The resort was well maintained even with the drop in guests. The variety of both outdoor and indoor games was available and a modernized gym. The indoor gaming room with its picturesque view needs a special reference. Geoffrey Bawa's architecture and design always touches the heart of us nature lovers and this was no different; especially after overnight rain in the early morning when you walk out of the room through the hotel to hear the drip drip of water from trees everywhere inside the building's many graceful courtyards was an enriching experience. The trees helped to quell the sometimes frustrating humidity of the coastal salty atmosphere and provided a perfecf balance while the multiple Bawa inspirated works of art added grace to the place. The two large swimming pools were closed due to government Covid restrictions but it was well compensated by all the other things. Finally a beautiful beach with no rocks and minimum dirt and stretching miles to either side. The sea was nice as well but couldn't go too far out due to repeated warnings by hotel staff about sudden undercurrents of the sea in the area. Overall well recommended for all.

We had a great time at this beautiful resort. Food was awesome and tbe staff is excellent. We had two beautiful rooms with a lot of space. Thank you for your great hospitality and we will be back for sure.

Even under the pressure of pandemic restrictions (10th October 2020), many of the staff members....( Specially,the restaurant manager Mr Thushara Gnanarathne and his team;- personally i felt good.And to our suprise he was kind enough to arrange late-checkouts for some guests including us even.)....seemed trying very much to provide a high standared service with a flexible and friendly accent.. Two diverse buffets; one of them with free breverage pacakge and a singal ala carte comprised the full board menu with entertainment as well, even for the low number of guests that day. Sporting wasn't available due to health safety.. Finally, i would thank Heritance Ahungalla and her staff for making another last minute reservation of us,very much enjoyable as another memorable travel experience..

We checked in to the hotel with 2 room bookings on 31st December. The earlier review of ours were all about negative and positive sides. This comment is to mention the good side of the hotel staff and their superb services. Firstly I must say about staff from the time we checked in to the room and until we checked out, the staff was always very attentive to our stay. The Chef of the Hotel too was so good and I must say their food was so good and tasty. Although local rates were low, they have taken every effort to provide a nice buffets for the guests. Hats off to the Chef and his team. The YAARA TEA they provided was so good and the best we ever had. The rooms were very well-done and clean. The front office staff, the Security staff and the baggage handling staff all were very good and smiling and friendly. We will surely come back to enjoy another stay at Heritance Ahungalla and loved the hotel and their services. The only bad comment was our earlier review about the poor and disgusting attitudes of their FOM Srinath. If not for him, our holiday would have being even more wonderful. Hope the Management of the hotel will look in to it that it will never happen to any guests coming in during rainy days.

We just stayed one day full board basis and it was really worth the drive and the money we spent. Booked the hotel with an offer but the comforts and facilities were just the same like before. Staff was extra ordinary going out of the way to help us. Really enjoyed. Food was delicious.

We booked 2 rooms on 31st December at Heritance Ahungalla and always wanted to have a good time We went to the hotel around 3pm. It was pouring rain. We stopped our car under the car porch at the entrance of the lobby. Suddenly the front office Manager (Srinath) came and asked me to take the car out with bit of an arrogant tone and told me go to the car park And come back when it was heavy rain. When I told him â€œLet me just keep the car under the porch until The rain settlesâ€ but the Front Office Manager (Srinath) was so adamant & arrogant that I should take my car out. The hotel was not busy. They only had few room bookings. No other vehicles were coming in and even if a tourist Bus arrived there were enough space for it. My self being a lady driver didnâ€™t like to get wet coming back After parking the car where I have to walk about 50 plus meters to come to the lobby. The front office Manager (Srinath) would have spoken to us polite and easily handled the situation. It was just matter of few minutes keeping The car until rain stops, but FOM (Srinath) was pushing and pushing me with loud voice that I should take my car out. I lost my control and led to an argument. Just imagine it was our check-In/Welcome. The FOM (Srinath) ruined our entire holiday mood. Being the front office manager of a 5 star hotel of Aitken Spence Chain, he would have nicely handled it without any hazel. He would have just used his brain and allowed us to come in & attend to formalities until rain stops and later would have requested us to take the car to the car park. Instead he started a big ha-ho and a big argument with us and ruined our entire holiday Mood. We were going to cancel our booking. But other staff handled the situation and took care of our entry. I must mention, Tushara (Assistant F&B), the stewards, Housekeeping boys, chefs and all others were exceptionally good. They really look after us very well. The rooms, food and the services by the staff was really class. The only thing bad was the unprofessional behavior Of the Front Office Manager (Srinath). He should be given special attention by the top management in training him How to handle a welcome and how to adjust himself specially during adverse weather and how to handle guests without messing their welcome. We wish all the best to Heritance Ahungalla and the team for their wonderful and class service but so disappointed, disgusted & angry with the bad behavior of the front office manager (Srinath)

Spent the most wonderful New Year's Eve with my family at Heritance, Ahungalla and we were delighted with our suite, the amazing views of the beach and also the supportive, humble staff's service. During these difficult times, it was such a relief to see that the hotel's management took extra measures to ensure everyone's health and safety. Special thanks goes to the amazing chef Dilantha Rakitha who nailed three magnificent buffets for us. From starters to main courses to mouth watering desserts, everything was super delicious. Everything about the hotel proved our money's worth and we enjoyed and loved every bit of it!

Every thing was super! Specially foodğŸ‘ŒğŸ‘ŒğŸ‘Œ Thank you for your grate service heritance! Our rooms were 329 and 331, 331 was better and it was a luxury room! If you want to rest and relax this is the best place! Room service was also excellent! Heritance group is No.1 on food! This is how it wasğŸ‘‡

Excellent view. Rooms are well cleaned. Specially we prefer the smell. Christmas eve dinner was excellent. Other meeals aslo good. Had a good variation of foods. We stayed four days here. But we could enjoy the different taste every day. Staff is very flexible and friendly. Great service. Thank you for making our vacation meaningful.

We had a great experience. Everything was perfect even though the staff is short. The food was amazing. The room services were good too. I think everyone should stay for at least one night in this wonderful place.

Me and Hubby boy stayed in this beautiful location , for one day..We had a rough year,because of the covid 19 Pandemic .. Very busy with work and stressed .. Just saw this while scrolling down on social media and booked and escaped .. I think its really worth it.. Ofcourse mianly because of the sea.. Very beautiful ... and Calming down.. We both loved the food.. 8/10 Staff was very friendly 9/10 Dinner time side singers "UAE API"topnotch 9/10. Mostly Covid -19 Precautions ,well above the expeted level.. We felt very safe â¤ï¸â¤ï¸10/10.. To improve - Might need little bit of maintenance to the rooms.. Our room 320 AC was leaking .. Overall its a Good Stay.. â¤ï¸

Amazing experience with amazing food! Me and my wife went here for honeymoon and it was a unforgettable experience for us!!! ğŸ’– We got special complimentary honeymoon upgrade Heritance to Suite room and we were sooo delighted. We were lucky to enjoy buffet with compliance covid 19 rules. Food was delicious and staff was friendly and pleasant!

I was very impressed with this beautiful property. They followed all the Covid guidelines from the main entrance itself. Walking distance to the beach, clean & spacious room. Hotel staff were very helpful & polite, specialy Thushara Gnanaratgna - Restaurant & Bar Manager was extremely helpful always with a smile on his face. Overall service was excellent & well spent weekend. Thank you Team Heritance Ahungalla & will be back soon.

Last month, me and my wife visited Heritance Ahungalla. Needless to say, we had a wonderful experience. The food was so good. The buffets was something to look forward to and the staffs were very friendly and supportive. The place and the ambience was top notch. There were no complaints or critics to point out - we were so glad we chose this place to relax during the particular weekend. Wouldnâ€™t say â€˜Noâ€™ to visiting this place again.

The hotel stay was very pleasant and comfortable. Were very satisfied with every aspect of the hotel. All the staff from the front desk, restaurant staff, cleaners and security were respectful, attentive and extremely friendly creating a wonderful welcoming atmosphere. The hotel is very clean throughout and my room was specious with everything that I needed. Food was substantial and suited all tastes. Coffee, was amazing! Keep up with the great work!

It's not like it used to be when they used to call it Triton, The staff at some points are friendly, the food was not up to standard compared to what we use to have, you could have counted the number of dishes on the buffet and it was 70% Sri Lankan, we requested for a set of pillows at around 10.30 p.m which we did not receive when we called the phone was diverted to someone who abruptly told us that the hotel is closed after 10.30 so the housekeeping is not available and therefore they cannot do anything, once asked who is speaking did he say he is the security, and hung up abruptly, we called again and then the reception adhered to our request.

My stay at Heritance Ahungalle was at a Corporate Outing from October 03rd to 4th 2020. The place is relaxing and breathtaking. Frontage to the Indian Ocean has been maintain very well for any guest to enjoy the beautiful sandy beach. Heritance Team is extremely friendly despite they are encountering some of the worst times for hospitality business. They looked after us very well without letting us feel the scaled-down operation. Cleanliness inside rooms is well as common spaces is commendable. Food was great and the variety is also acceptable for the grand discount offered to us. Hope Heritance will come out this very very difficult period unscathed to continue their superb hospitality for both locals and foreign guests.

We had nice time here. Food was awsome. Staff is very friendly, always smile, hardships among the pandemic. Specially wanna thanks Mr Thushara from food & beverage department who take care of my 8 months baby's food until my departure. And Housekeeping department you all doing fantastic job. Thank you very much for your kindness service. God bless you all. Keep it up good works.

When we hear the name Heritance of Aitken Spence, we usually consider it to be one of the most exciting stays. But unfortunately it is a shame to the so called brand Heritance and as well as for the Aitken Spence. We went there for our annual gathering of my workplace and we have reserved about 19 rooms for the last weekend. please find the following: Welcome: They have warmly welcomed us and given the rooms on time. It is appreciated since we got the rooms just within half an hour. Rooms: The room given to me and my wife was on the third floor. Right at the moment we stepped in to the room we felt that it was not cleaned properly. Basically it was not swept at all for weeks as we felt. We were not even provided with the bathrobes to the rooms. Further, only two towels were available at the room and not even the face towels were placed. Bathroom amenities were so old and an immediate renovation should be taken place. One of the Tea/Coffee mugs in the room was not washed (Pictures attached). Buffet: Only one restaurant in operation or only one restaurant is available. It was totally crowded. Dinner on 26th Sept 2020: Restaurant was fully crowded. They do not provide at least the enough seating capacity for the guests. If I'm not mistaken, there were two other groups checked-in to the hotel during that day. However they have arranged some tables outside the restaurant where they were not attended by a single restaurant staff member just to refill their water goblets. Food was totally bad and had a very bad experience with the so called Sri Lankan Chicken Kottu Roti. It was totally frozen andwas not tasty at all. I have complained but the only answer I got from the so called F&B Manager or the Guest Services Representative was 'Will inform and will check with the chef'. Is that an answer from a so called hotel chain like Heritance by Aitken Spence??? Restaurant staff were not capable of attending to the guests and could not even clean the buffet frequently. Please find the attached pictures of the Ice Cream corner. Breakfast on 27th Sept 2020: Compared to the dinner on previous night, this was slightly okay. But they failed arrange the seating for the whole set of occupents. Lunch on 27th Sept 2020: Again it was horrible and had nothing to eat at all. We went for lunch around 1.30pm and even on that time they are out of some food. They had a bowl with a name tag 'Chicken Sausages' and only a half of a sausage is left. When I asked for 4 sausages to me & my wife, the guy came and noted our table and promised to bring them to our table. But unfortunately I couldn't see him afterwards. When it comes to desserts corner, there were nithing to eat at all and please refer the pictures attached. No more refilling or serving and the time was 2.35pm. Premises: There was a very bad smell in the whole hotel from the evening to the noon of the next day. When inquired, they said it is from the sea. But please note that this is not the only hotel we visted in the sea side and we have no any kind of an experience from the rest of the hotels we visited. I have never being to a Heritance Hotel before and I hope that the rest of the Heritance hotels would not be like this. Personally, I'm so disappointed with the hotel and I didn't expect this kind of a service and an experience from you guys. Lack of staff, does not mean that you are free from providing the five star hospitality. If you don't have the sufficient staff, please do not accept so much of bookings for a day. In my opinion, you should pay more attention to the above in order to provide a better experience to the people who visit Heritance Ahungalla. Further, especially in this period, you all are surviving just because of the locals. I'm truly disappointed and also feel very sad. By the way, Good Luck!

Heritance Ahungalle was definitely worth a stay in Ahungalle. It's located right on the edge of Galle Road and is easily accessible. The check-in & check-out was fast, efficient and seamless. The staff was very polite and warm. The rooms (although a little dated) have star-class amenities (hot water, kettle, tea/coffee, TV, free WIFI etc). The beach is just near the hotel and the two large swimming pools offer a very good time to relax! My only complaint is with regards to the food. Not to say it was bad, but it could use more variety and flavour too. Other than that, it was a lovely hotel to stay at!

We had a nice time here. Everything was really great. Food was amazing. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Nothing to complaint about our stay and we will be back again for a relaxing vacation... Thank you.

Great place and the food was awesome. Pool area was great. The beach will blow your mind way, spread across almost 500 meters. Finally let me commend all the staff from the G.M to the minor staff all was with huge smile even with all the hardships due to the pandemic. May God bless them all.

Our Stay at Heritance Ahungalla was very pleasant. The set menu was excellent. The staff in all sections were friendly and Helpful. The Happy Hour(drinks absolutely free for 2 hours, excellent deal) and credit of Rs. 3,000.00, the whole package was value for money. The b'day cake for my wife, nice touch(without even asking).

Place is very beautiful with a beach and a huge pool yet the worst customer service ever. I ordered a baby food in advance but that was prepared in the last minute and was served really hot. There is no emergency lines to call in the nights. We asked for in room dining but staff were hesitant and was saying to join the buffet. We were waiting for our breakfast to be brought to our room for more than an hour.When we called the room service they said buffet is still not open due to less staff but the time was 7.10am. Highly disappointed.

I have been to the hotels where you get all inclusive packages however this one is different because of their extraordinary hospitality and I really enjoyed it more than any other hotel I have ever been ....

Suddenly decided to have hotel stay. Took several searches and decided and heritance ahungalle as final stay. Online booking had added some discount about 15000 lkr. Roomsâ€” stayed at basic delux. Had no tub on it. Clean. Attractive. I didn't asked for king size bed so got 2 single beds. It's my mistake. Food- all meals were buffet, may be due to weekends. Desert table is very good. Had sea foods also including prawns. But better if breakfast spread is much better specially on desert table. Pool- no baby pool. But 4 ft at non deep end. Staff- really friendly, really helpful. Keep it up and really thanks for that. It impress us as last time heritance kandalama experience. Altogether cost took 25000. Had 3000 credits to purchase food and with happy 2 hours local spirits were free.

The hotel seems to go on forever as it is quite large and very spread-out. We had a corner room on the first floor so this gave us a small Seaview from our balcony. The room was well appointed but needed a facelift as it appeared a tad shabby in places. It may have been due to a Tsunami going through it. The food was excellent to say the least as we dined for breakfast and dinner most days in the sumptuous dining area right near the beach. Food was very well presented with many different varieties. This hotel does cater for and more towards the Europeans that stay there. We indulged in the spa not once but twice and found out that the spa girls were from Bali. So we spent some time talking about Bali as are regular travellers there. They are excellent spa girls and provide a wonderful experience. The only issue in general is that the Hotel is somewhat remote from any towns so shopping you have to travel a bit.

Heritance Ahungalla doesn't fail us ever. We were there just for one night, however the service was beyond expectations. The dinner buffet was absolutely gorgeous with so much of variety. And the best part was that they even had gluten free bread rolls served. Staff was ever so helpful. And the little ones enjoyed the pool and garden so much. Loved every bit of the short stay

We visited Heritance Ahungalla for a weekend getaway. It was a beautiful hotel with a very warm and comfortable atmosphere. Even though it rained most of the evening, we had a dip in the pool in the rain. It was an amazing experience. I very much recommend the Mustard Coffee shop for an evening coffee overlooking the beach and the sea. The buffet also had many varieties and was delicious. The staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable while the bathroom was also spotless. We had a beautiful view of the ocean and a pool from the spacious balcony. TV and wifi works great. This hotel has some very unique architectural designs that made us feel very close to the ocean. I hope we will get to visit this beautiful place once more.

The Heritance provided a pleasing haven over 3 nights for our tour group as we desperately attempted to find flights out of Sri Lanka before Covid-19 sent the entire World into lockdown.Under the difficult circumstances of a mass exodus rapidly emptying the hotel of guests , the Heritance continued to function vey well . The staff remained delightfully friendly and extremely efficient . The buffet breakfasts and dinners suffered a slight reduction in the choices available , but still remained very good in terms of choice and tastiness. The hotel is well designed to provide an ambiance that is very relaxing , with a seamless juxtaposition between indoor and outdoor public areas . The design of the attractive pool fully reinforces this aspect. The overall impression gained is one of airiness and calm. Our first floor bedroom was quite spacious , the bed comfortable, the en suite well equipped , and the good-sized balcony allowed an excellent view of the adjacent beach. The air conditioning, TV, and WiFi all operated perfectly .The only fault we could find was that just ONE electric outlet was provided in the bedroom. Overall , we considered the Heritance provides a truly pleasant and relaxing experience , and we hope - should we ever be in Ahungalla again in happier circumstances - to stay here once more.

What a superb hotel this is. We stayed for our honeymoon and were looked after so well by the friendly staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them and all the facilities were excellent. Food was amazing and what a wide variety there was to choose from. The view onto the Indian Ocean from the pool was simply breathtaking and one that we will never forget. If you can find him on the beach there is a lovely man selling tours, his name is Pathmi and he looked after us so well for our stay. His prices are so much cheaper than the holiday company's and you will get to see the 'real' Sri Lanka with him. Seek him out and you won't be disappointed.

Amazing property, very clean and exceptional service. Staff are very professional, the food is good and the environment is fantastic. Lots of shopping around the hotel. The beach is amazing, and the pool too.

Heritance hotels has never failed us personally with their amazing hospitality and scrumptious food. First of all the management and staff has been very supportive to us in transferring a gift vacation from Kandalama to Ahungalla. The transition was purely since we have experienced the amazing facility at Kandalama many times and wanted a different experience. Right at the check-in, we were upgraded to a luxury room, (without request) and needless to mention the comfort, cleanliness and the facilities provided in the rooms were exceptional. Our room had two balconies with a beautiful view over the Indian Ocean and the crystal white sandy beaches of Sri Lankan southern coast. The hotels beach front is an ideal place to sit down and watch the sun set in the clean sands and to have a dip in the ocean. Hotel has two pools, one with Jacuzzis and a view which was a very relaxing experience. Food and the service of the restaurants were second to none with very friendly staff who were available to serve at a single call. Food experience as I expected was amazing as Heritance hotels never dissapoint me with the quality and the variety. Overall, we had an amazing holiday in a very warm hospitable environment surrounded with happy memories.

The property is beautiful, spacious and clean. Rooms are well kept. The food was excellent - various and tasty - and the staff at the restaurant very polite. All of the staff deserves a big praise - smiling, helpful, polite and always by your side, when you need something. Thank you so much!

Good property , but needs an upgraded. Food is ok Pool is nice to use when sun sets, Standard of Rooms and atmosphere needs to be improved A bit high priced in season , I think both Kandalama and Ahungalle do need an upgrade as properties got tourist attraction

Hotel is perfect! One of my best trip! Hotel for very calm staying with family, food and spa nice quality. Location is good close for everything. Personal are very helpful. Only one minus that waives are very big, hard for comfortable swimming.

The Heritance ist a Synonym for excellence and a quality. Just in front of the beautiful beach, with a nice swimming Pool.Spacious rooms with balcony, a great choice and the quality of dishes, friendly and professionel staff.

Me my husband and our 11months year daughter visited Heritance and were not disappointed. It was a convinient hotel to be at with our daughter even though we have a stroller. The food has been great, the beach was clean and beautiful. What have really stood out though is the wonderful service from the crew at the restaurants, pool bars, pool service, reception and cleaning crew, wow, so kind and humble people. One particular member of Heritance named Rukmal also makes these amazing towel figures so you get so happy when coming back to the room to see what he has created this time :). Thank you Heritance for the wonderful stay.

Fantastic hotel with beautiful rooms and views, the friendliest and most helpful staff and stunning location. 2 amazing swimming pools both with bars and plenty of choice in the restaurant serving a wide variety of buffet food alongside themed dining evenings

We enjoyed our stay here. The room was nice and clean and the room boy friendly. Toiletries and mini bar. Lovely pools. Always managed to get a sun bed. The bar was busy of an evening with a good atmosphere. I think the only slight let down was the service in the restaurant. Always had to hunt someone down to order a drink, (we werenâ€™t all inclusive). The tables never appeared to be reset as people had left. We entered the restaurant at 20.30 most nights and struggled to find a clean and set table. The food however was good with lots of choice. Nothing happening outside the hotel but tuk tuks and taxis were waiting outside the gate to take you anywhere you wanted to go.

Super hotel for the end of our stay. Great personal, always ready to help and smiling, like Rukmal. Food is just excellent and the pool really nice. Rooms were super clean and we enjoyed to find the elephant made with towels. We recommend this hotel to our friends.

I need to explain why I gave only 4 stars for this site. Worn down furniture, fungus in the shower, noisy air-conditioning, fan out of order, dirty walls with paint coming offâ€¦ require general maintenance. That however wasnâ€™t big issue as rooms and facilities were cleaned twice a day so no insects, no mosquitosâ€¦ the shower gel and shampoo were so pleasant and good for skin that we bought it from the hotel and took home. The colonial design, equipment make the spot really great for rest. Additionally, there were no small children during our stay, no music played all day long (like in other resorts), no animations. In other words peaceful relaxing atmosphere. Superior room service (very attentive, smiling, helpful) as well as service in the restaurants, bars overcompensated any inconveniences related to the condition of the facilities. There was nice spa, billiard, beach volleyball and 2 big swimming pools with depth between 1 and 2.6m. There was also night club in the outer wing of the building so no disturbances during night. In the evening every day there were some shows and live music. Food in restaurant was reach, lot of seafood, curry, salads, sweets, fruitsâ€¦ all fresh and tasty. No big choice of drinks and local beer and wines were not too good. The weather in January was just fantastic: air temperature around 30C, ocean temperature 28C, very light breeze. Nonetheless the waves had around 1 m height and it was not recommended to swim far away from the beach due to reverse currents. Very long, wide and empty beach just aks to walk along. Just outside the hotel gates there were taxis and tuk-tuks which could drive you wherever one wants. I would definitely return to this hotel again (which I donâ€™t say very often).

Excellent hotel that is both visually stunning and has excellent facilities and service. Food was plentiful and had great choices. Got rose petals beautifully spread across my bed which was a lovely touch. Nothing is too much trouble here. Not a huge amount to do in Ahungalla but a great base for the surrounding area. Would recommend.

We stayed for 2 nights in Heritance. We were totally surprise by outstanding welcome by the staff. Fresh juices and easy check in, rooms are very spacious and neat. Everywhere is green and relaxing. Pools are highlights and walkable distance to beach. They have buffet system and regular ways too. It was delectable buffet with local caught of the day. My family enjoyed this safe haven. Taxi is available to local tours inside the resort. Pls negotiate the prices. Can be pricey sometimes. The whole resort is beautiful place. I will definitely come next year with my family. I will also recommend highly.

A great hotel. Staff all very friendly and helpful especially if you hand out a few tips! We stayed on a b&b basis and ate in the hotel most evenings as didnâ€™t venture out too much. The meals were all very good and the breakfast buffet catered for most nationalities but the bacon, sausage, beans and an egg station for omelettes, fried etc. won over my husband! Plus endless fruits, pastries, oats, continental and of course Sri Lankan. Evening buffets equally as good for choice, also a fish restaurant, a Mexican and the coffee shop with a varied menu and all very affordable. The aqua aerobics was very good when it was on. Other activities included ping pong, beach volleyball, a gym, 2 pools, the beach with great waves and a spa! We saw so much wildlife including monkeys in the trees, Lena, lizards - small & large and loads of hermit crabs if you venture onto the beach at night! There is SO much to see in Sri Lanka so take some trips out and consider a 2 centre holiday if itâ€™s your 1st visit.

The hotel is huge and pretty but not at par with other Heritance properties. We were upgraded to a suite room and it was very beautiful with all basic amenities. The pool and the beach was very clean. The dinner buffet and breakfast buffet was superb with a lot of options. Will definitely recommend the hotel in and around Bentota,

Very creative bedroom decor by Room boy Sumudu. He is very courtiers & obliging. Well done. Keep up the good work. F&B maneger Rasika too was very courtiers & obliging. Pool table had not been maintained well. Full of dust & sand. Disappointing.

Good service, nice beach and good value for money. Rooms are okay and swimming pool is decent too. Was expecting more based on the pictures on website. We stayed here over the weekend, hotel was full and dinner time felt but crowded. However Food was excellent!

Geoffrey Bawa is a master architect... find out why he is regarded so by visiting this masterpiece.... beautiful frames everywhere. The private beach is a joy to walk on. Day trips can be arranged to nearby villages and other Bawa properties.

Located on a wide expanse of soft sandy beach, this hotel was perfect for us to unwind and relax after 10 days of touring around the beautiful island of Sri Lanka. Comfortable, spacious rooms with outdoor seating on the balcony. Ample storage facilities. Bathroom was compact with a rain shower and toiletries provided. Plenty of food choices at meal times in the main dining area with themed evenings and choice of entertainment from late afternoon onwards. Friendly, attentive staff and our particular thanks to the chefs and the waiting staff in the dining room making our mealtimes an enjoyable experience. Plenty of sun beds available around both the swimming pools avoiding the need to reserve sun beds in advance. Convenient location for doing day trips for eg to Galle, moonstone mines. Confortable, air conditioned taxis are available at a reasonable price, bookable from Reception. Definitely worth considering if looking to stay in Ahungalla.

We recently spent two nights at the Heritance Ahungalla. We appeared to have spent our time there during their peak season as it felt a bit too crowded especially around the pool. Nevertheless, the staff were amazing in attending to our needs and strived to provide excellent customer service despite being incredibly busy. A special shout out to Mr. Prasad Priyanandana , the chief steward, who was always around to make sure the guests were well looked after - he went the extra mile to make sure our stay was a memorable one. We also had dinner at the Wadiya Grill Restaurant which we would would highly recommend for a beach side fresh seafood grill experience. In summary, a great beach escape with excellent customer service.

We had a beautiful experience staying at Heritance. The hotel is surperb across all categories- the rooms, service, food, staff attitude, hygiene. The pool and the beach access was also very good. If you are looking for a comfortable stay then this hotel is a good all inclusive package.

4 of us stayed here from the 7th to the 18th of January. We had originally booked the Turyya Hotel , also 5 STAR , but had a call from our tour operator MERCURY to see if we wanted to change to the Heritance because the Turyya had been downgraded to a 4 Star Hotel due to a lot of complaints. We were happy to book into the Heritance . But did not have the good experience that we had expected. Our rooms were quite dirty . So much so that my daughter cleaned her room with a packet of Babywipes. My Husband did some cleaning with a towel . I refused to do so . I do not think that this should be part of my Holiday. Then we checked our pillows and duvet and had a big shock. We took our bedding to the lobby and were quickly ushered in to a back room . After complaining we were offered an , as the Manager called it , an upgraded room. We were taken to have a look at the room and were happy to move in to it . It was actually exactly the same room as the dirty one but newly decorated with a new shower etc. Before we moved in to the new room the manager asked would it be Ok if he would go and check the bedding . Of course we agreed . At around 11 o'clock I heard loud voices from my daughters room . I went to see what was going on and again the bedding was dirty . Duvet cover had a big brown stain on it and one of the pillows had mould all over it. The manager told us " that is why we put 2 pillow cases on it " OH DEAR !!!!!! But after that , I must praise the boys who cleaned our room , everything was spotless. The next day at mealtimes we were surprised that the restaurant staff seemed to be totally confused . It was a bit like FAULY TOWERS . There were other issues but it would take to long to mention them all . Would we come back to this Hotel . absolutely not , never ever .

Me and my wife stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla for our honeymoon and I can't stress enough how brilliant this hotel is. When we arrived we had some welcome drinks and were congratulated on our wedding. The staff couldn't have made us feel any better, we had a congratulations cake sitting on our room one evening, a bottle of wine with two glasses on another and our room was upgraded, all due to it being our honeymoon. Thivanka/Cassim were brilliant around the green pool bar for both local information and good service, Rebecca in the restaurant was always smiling and helpful, and the cleaning staff were always happy to see you and made the rooms look great. We also went on a few excursions with a local tour company and the hotel were happy to make us an early breakfast and lunch for early pick ups (one was at 2:30am and 2 pick ups we're at 4:30am) which was very kind. These packed breakfast/lunch bags were full to the brim with sandwiches, fruit, water, juices etc. It was a really nice touch and was free for us (staying all inclusive). The hotel itself is beautiful from every angle. At night, the front really makes a great backdrop for pictures and both pools lead onto the beach. The green pool is definitely the best place to spend the day if you're looking to relax. Keep an eye out for the monitor lizards that roam the grounds, the monkeys that come every few days and other wildlife that really adds to the hotel. Ahungalla beach is beautiful and is okay to paddle in, but the current is a bit too strong to swim in. I noticed that after a few minutes of floating I would probably be around 8 meters down from where I started. There are a lot of local tour guides and sarong sellers that will bug you once you leave the hotel to the beach (or if they see you on the way back) which is the only downside, but this is out of the hotels control. The restaurants level of food is diverse, offering both local dishes alongside a wide range of international food. We're not usually a couple to go back to the same place twice, but me and my wife would both love to come back to this hotel in the future to possibly spend a wedding anniversary. I really can't stress enough how much we loved the Heritance Ahungalla and were made to feel at home. We found nothing that we could complain about, everything felt premium and 5*, and we enjoyed every minute of our 11 day stay there.

We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of our Sri Lanka trip in 2 rooms.impressive driveway and entrance lobby and friendly greeting and check in .Rooms are large and had good views to the garden and towards the sea, well equipped and very clean with great service from our daily room attendant, although on arrival both rooms had cockroaches but he dealt with these swiftly and they did not reappear, comfortable beds and nice linens and towels. No signage to any of facilities such as gym. Great pools and very spacious gardens and lots of sun beds with good service from pool attendants.The major disappointment was the attitude of bar staff and some of restaurant staff to all inclusive guests, unfriendly and unhelpful to the point of rudeness! Why offer an all inclusive option and then treat these guests as second class citizens? We were frequently ignored in the bar area and bills presented in a manner which suggested you shouldn't order anymore! Totally spoilt what otherwise would have been a very pleasant stay.

Arrived into Sri Lanka Jan 15th to start a 6day tour, on completion was dropped off at this hotel to be greeted with the warmest of welcomes then to be told I had been upgraded to a Luxury Deluxe room was the perfect start it was fab and very close to the quieter 2nd pool and on the ground floor soon I had the privelidge to meet my room attendant Rukmal who was so nice and friendly and very handy with towels as you will see in my pics we got on so well and he was always their to help if I needed anything.I have really enjoyed my stay here the staff are so nice,the food is excellent and for me it's been one of the most peaceful,relaxing places you could ever wish to visit.I would not hesitate to return thankyou Heritance for making my sri lankan holiday so special ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡°ğŸ˜â˜€ï¸ğŸ‘

We booked a different Hotel in Kalutara for our wedding anniversary, but a few weeks before we were due to travel we were informed that our hotel of choice had been down graded from a 5 to 4 star and that we could have a small refund or a move to the Heritance Ahungalla. We chose to move and I am so glad that we did. Our trip was also tinged with a certain amount of sadness as my father in law passed away recently and it would have been his 90th birthday while we were on holiday. \this holiday was always going to be a tough one for my wife. On top of that my wife has a condition that means that she tires very easily and can on occasions have mobility issues. We arrived by car in the afternoon and were driven in through the security gates and were warmly met by Trilishiya in the reception area. She checked us in while we had a welcome drink and then took us to our 2nd floor room (Lift access) Our room was spacious, clean and well appointed. It had little extras like bathrobes, flip flops, and a host of toiletries. The air conditioning was brilliant and so quiet. There were only net curtains at the window for privacy but it had floor to ceiling shutters ensuring complete blackout at night. Bliss! The french doors led out onto a large terrace with a view over the pool and is one of the few rooms in the hotel with a completely clear view of the sea. Most of the sea view rooms have palm trees and other planting obscuring a clear sea view. The Hotel is built in a Colonial modernist style, is no more than 3 storeys high and has open courtyards within the building full of palm trees and gardens. The Reception area and mirror lounge are open on 2 sides giving the hotel a sense of light and space and successfully brings the outside in doors. We had booked an all inclusive package, which in this case does include almost everything (local Labels) Meals are served in the main restaurant and are buffet style with drinks waiter service. The food is Excellent with a wide range of salad, main courses and desserts. There is something for everyone. There is a selection of European foods (thankfully, no chips!!) at every sitting, but the best food is the Sri Lankan food that is available. Amazing curries, rices and side pickles and dishes Absolutely delicious. Snacks are available at the pool bar when the main restaurant is closed. There is a fine dining restaurant (the Upper Room) that we ate at on our wedding anniversary serving excellent European food. Wadiya shack in the grounds serves amazing sea food. Do get the lobster, so tasty!!! There are 2 pools at the hotel. One is strictly for residents and is further away from the main areas but it has its own snack bar. The main pool is literally off ( and inside) the reception area. When you are in the pool it appears that you are in an infinity pool looking out over the Indian Ocean. This pool is open to non residents but we never found that to be a problem. There are plenty of sunbeds around the pools with comfy mattresses and plenty of towels are provided. From the main pool you have direct access to the wide clean sandy beach. You can walk for miles. The sea can be rough and there can be some very strong rip tides. Caution is advised at all times when in the water. The Hotel does have Life Guards but they are stationed up near the main pool. The crowning glory in this hotel are it's staff.I have never seen or met a more friendly, polite and smiley crew. They are all immaculately turned out and NOTHING, and I mean nothing is too much trouble. The service is unbelievably good. The staff are so friendly and are genuinely interested in your lives and are so grateful when you ask about their lives and families. We saw so many family photos! On our first evening, My wife tripped on uneven paving near the pool on her way to the Bathroom. She split open her left knee and "went over" on her right ankle. The staff were incredible at making sure she was OK. The couple of days later her ankle was still swollen and she just mentioned to Trilishiya that life would be easier if we had sunbeds on our terrace. Within 20 mins 4 men turned up at our door with 2 sunbeds, 2 mattresses and 4 beach towels. Talk about service I have to mention some people by name because they made our stay so memorable and this list includes staff from all levels Rasika,The F & B Manager. A true gentleman who was understood our needs so well and was always there to greet us at meal times Tusara, The Restaurant manager, always making sure that we had what we needed Rebecca, one of the hosts , who every night took the time to explain the Sri Lankan desserts to me (Plus I will admit to being just a little in love with this Beautiful young lady! ! Don't tell the wife!!) Darsharna. The pool barman who tended to our drinks needs wonderfully and when he found out about my father in law, went the next day to the Buddhist temple to pray for him. This reduced my wife to a quivering wreck! Trilishiya, the receptionist who looked after us and has become a friend and who instigated all of the amazing service and never failed to come and find us everyday.On the days my wife couldn't make it downstairs she would come to the room or telephone to make sure that she was OK. We had an amazing stay at this hotel and would stay again in a heart beat. I want to make it clear that the next comment in no way reflects upon the staff above or any others employed by the hotel it is aimed directly at the General Manager of Heritance Ahungalla and at the people in charge of major property renovation at Aiken Spence head office. The floor area around the main swimming pool and the pool bar at Heritance Ahungalla is a disaster waiting to happen. At the very least you may have a large legal claim on your hands at worst someone could kill themselves. The coverings to the pool drainage ducts are poorly secured and in may cases completely loose. The tiling around the pool is uneven, poorly grouted and constitutes a serious trip hazard. This is not a job for the in house maintenance team .A number of staff members told us that this had already been reported a number of times and that nothing had been done about it. Regardless of timing, number of guests this needs serious capital investment immediately.

We visited this hotel at the end of a group tour and were very disappointed with our accommodation. The other members of the group were given different quality rooms despite having paid the same and were mostly very happy but our room was unacceptable. ( I think from the website images it was a â€˜deluxeâ€™ room with partial sea view) The electrics in this part of the hotel were obviously in need of urgent renovation. Two of the plug sockets were damaged with melted plastic around the pin holes and the air conditioning would only work at all by fiddling with the slider switch on the wall and then went off again after a couple of minutes. We complained and a manager said they would sort out the plug sockets the next day but asserted that the air conditioning WAS working although obviously it was not and the room remained very warm. Apparently the hotel was fully booked and there was nothing he could do about it. I was online looking for alternative accommodation when the situation was resolved by our tour guide who generously swopped rooms with us and this room was lovely. Although the electrics were our main complaint, the room also smelled damp and was generally in need of renovation, not really five star. The rest of the hotel was very good and the restaurant was excellent so our experience was a great shame. (Although a word of caution re check out- all members of the group found that they had paid their bills in pounds with a poor exchange rate although the invoice was in rupees and nobody was asked about paying in sterling)

We loved it here. It was amazing. The staff are lovely and helpful. Perfect. We booked a family room for 6 nights. We were travelling with our two young daughters. From the time, we stepped in, we were treated so well. We booked a Luxury Family Room with two twin beds and one double bed on the website. We also booked the all inclusive package which included all our food, drinks, snacks while we were there. I recommend this package. You donâ€™t have to worry about anything. You can skip the buffets and just have sandwiches by the pool, cocktails and beer are included and wine with dinner. Excellent. The room was spacious and had plenty of room for 4 of us, with a lovely view of the quiet pool. There was a balcony which was handy for drying swimsuits for the next day. The bathroom was well equipped. The staff were attentive- we had to call housekeeping as our daughter had been ill overnight. The next morning, the room attendants turned up early to ask for dirty clothes to wash and if we needed any help. When my husband wasnâ€™t well, they offered to send food up to our room. There were activities for children: cupcakes, towel animals, mocktails, a magician, puppet shows. There were fish to feed. There were squirrels, crabs, monkeys and lizards to see. Our kids loved it. Locals sell trinkets on the beach and there were local crafts to buy. No one is allowed to be a nuisance and pushy- which was really good. Special staff were Sunethra who booked our trip, and the lovely hostesses

This hotel is classy, beautifully designed, low rise with wonderful integration of trees, plants and water features within the hotel and the grounds making it feel very peaceful and not destroying the local wildlife, just compare it with the white hulk of the RUI hotel next door! There are two large pools and of course the stunning beach, although the sea is not suitable for swimming because of the rip currents and large waves. A multitude of staff of all categories tirelessly work to offer excellent service. Areas are constantly being repainted and the grounds manicured by the gardeners. The food is wonderful, there was plenty of western dishes on offer but I almost exclusively enjoyed the wide range of sri lankan dishes with chili crab being a favourite and many dishes of large prawns, having the local "hoppa" at breakfast was great. I thought the hotel offered a quality experience and would happily return as it is clear many people do. There are lots of excursions on offer but do your research and shop around because prices differ a lot and there are people on the beach who will seek to sell you tours, a driver, clothing, well almost anything.

Good facilities especially the two pools. The rooms are large and clean enough but if you look too closely you start to notice just how much cleaner it should be. The shower had black mould in the lower corners and the floor tiles had stains. They are repainting the outside but they have a long way to go. I wouldnâ€™t let this stop you too much to stay here as everything else is good. The seafood dinner outside was delicious with Lobster and prawns and mullet fish all good. The lighting in the bathroom was very good and the was a magnifying mirror.

This was our third time at the hotel. We were married on the beach when the hotel was the Triton, visited again on our 10th anniversary and have just returned from our third trip there. The hotel is as lovely as ever and makes for a really relaxing holiday in a beautiful setting. There are plenty of opportunities for excursions to see more of this fantastic country but it's also lovely to relax by the pools or wander along the stunning beach, especially at sunset. The staff throughout the hotel were excellent; from the reception staff at check-in, the restaurant staff, waiters, pool staff ... All were very helpful, friendly and gave a great service throughout our stay. We booked on an all inclusive basis and the food was always very good and plentiful. The staff also arranged a romantic 4-course meal on the beach for us which was superb. Would thoroughly recommend the hotel and we are already planning our next trip back there! Thanks to all the staff who helped make our holiday so enjoyable.

We Had a good time at the hotel. Itâ€™s a calm and quiet place with bawaâ€™s architecture. Alot of privacy and a colonial type bedroom setting. Food was good with great entertainment. Great place to visit.

Very interesting location nice views , nice pool cool poolside bar ,very romantic in evenings very good food options in mainnas well as other restaurants, good beachfront , very good service staff.easily accesible .

We spent 11 days at the hotel. the stay was wonderful and we will remember it for a long time. Hotel right on the beach, great cuisine and great care of the hotel staff. Rooms clean and tidy. An ideal place for a family vacation. Every day a surprise from Rukmal on the children's bed:)

Once you visit Heritance Ahungalla,you donâ€™t feel like going anywhere else.Every holiday that we spent with them,was fabulous.Mr.Thushara,the food and beverage manager is actually the main reason why we come to Heritance Ahungalla.His service goes beyond his title.Heâ€™s exceptionally helpful,super friendly and he knows exactly what the guest wants in a five Star hotel.Our family adores him, not only as a professional but also as a great friend.We would like to thank Mr.Thushara,Mr.Nipun,and the rest of the staff at Heritance Ahungalla,for all their efforts to keep everyone satisfied.Once again,Thank you,Mr.Thushara,for being so caring and always willing to give us the best.

This property was designed by the famous Sri Lankan genius architect, Geoffrey Bawa that incorporates the natural setting into the structure. Beautiful large infinity style pool, efficient checkin, high speed Internet, helpful staff, excellent restaurants, beachside location, and high security. The property is enclosed and away from the main road. This was my third visit, and is one of my favorite resorts. Some ambitious beach sales people have beach clothes and table cloths for sale. Overall, a private place where you can relax. Full and half board is available. I recommend half board, so you can try the poolside and club room restaurants. You have the option to get half board lunch or dinner. Thereâ€™s sundowner cocktails available. Gem sales on the property, as well as across the street. Optional trips available as youâ€™re not too far from Galle Fort, and once we went deep sea diving in some caves south along the coastline near Hikkaduwa. Hotel can suggest trips even to Bawaâ€™s former residence and his brotherâ€™s eccentric home/garden. Highly recommend!

Itâ€™s a good hotel and the room with view was amazing .people was polite and so kind here and each group stay alone . In dinner there was music cultural party so great . Food in restaurant so delicious specially the original Srilanka food . Next time we should spent one week as minimum to enjoy ğŸ˜‰

We spent 10 nights in this resort and it was absolutely fabulous. The ocean was so accessible from the hotel and the hotel itself was spotless and spacious. The food was well presented and there was a huge choice, although it did become a little samey after a while, but the buffet could not be crticised. The staff was always available and willing to help. I must mention Darshana in particular,who was alwas smiling and seemed to recognise us after a few days.

We are currently enjoying a 5 night stay at the Heritance hotel and having a wonderfully relaxing time. The staff here are so friendly and ever ready to help with huge and genuine smiles on their faces. Our baby has also been given special attention and we have been made to feel so welcome here. A special mention to Rukmal who cleaned our room every day. He was so friendly, cleaned our rooms beautifully, and did the most amazing towel art on our beds. Each day it was a lovely surprise and we look forward to seeing what he makes tomorrow!

We ended off our holiday in Sri Lanka at this hotel, booked in for 3 nights. It was a perfect decision as it was pure bliss and relaxation. The hotel offers various amenities to allow you to unwind, with two swimming pools (one overlooking the ocean and another more secluded) while being situated along the beach from where you can take a dip into the ocean. Other amenities include table tennis, a gym and in-house entertainment such as live music and performances. The staff service is friendly, efficient and professional, while the food is good (not too spicy overall but a decent array to choose from). Our dining experience was made memorable with exceptional service from Malake during breakfasts and dinners. The rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious with a balcony overlooking the ocean. The hotel premises were always kept neat and tidy while offering sufficient space to walk around or relax on a pool chair. Overall I would certainly recommended this hotel to any couple or family looking for a place to relax and unwind while being taken care of at a world-class and luxury hotel. Many thanks.

Heritance Ahungalla is a Lovely Beach property approx 2 hours away from Colombo. The staff was extremely warm and friendly. Lakshita (AFM) and Nipun Sameera (Restaurant Manager) and the team made our stay memorable. The New Year party was magnificent rounding off with a great display of fireworks on the beach.

We had a nicevtime gere at heritance ahungalla on our honeymoon.thus is iur first time to sri lanka and we really love this place.we ate planning to come for our1st anniversay too. Thank you heritance for the winderful hospitality.

Heritance Ahungalla is a great place to ralx snd enjoy your holiday. The staff is very friendly and helpful and we had a clran and beautiful room on the 3rd floor.. Definitely we will come back again.

This is our first visit to this beautiful hotel..everything is perfect ..staff is very friendly and helpful.food is excellent..we will come back again..Thank you for the wonderful service you provided..

We had a lovely time at heritance hotel very friendly staff helpful smile all the time will love to come back to Sri Lanka... we will be back soon... my family enjoyed the stay very much... we are very happy...

Nice ambience with a 2 pool options and splendid beach , good dining options , eveng entertainment at lobby , not far from colombo , nice staff , dinner buffet options better than other resorts , good indian options too , suggest to have more entertainment options

Worst hotel I ever stayed at. Beautiful location though, although strong undercurrents so we could not swim in the ocean. Rooms terrible, staff not service minded at all. Everything worn down. Bed sheets dirty, cats running around inside the hotel. Absolutely not a 5 star hotel, would not even give it 1 star. Stay away, do not ever ever under any circumstances go there.

The hotel is located near the beach and location is good. But the hospitality is not so good. Room is also not up to the mark as the sliding door of the bathroom was jammed and room was not cleaned before handing to us. The food was ok ok but catering staff was courteous. Try for Taj Bentota instead.

Location perfect. hotel is run down - needs TLC. Service is great at all times but prices at main buffet are ridiculous. WiFi is stable and reliable everywhere. Beach is awesome and pool area is great. Bar restaurant is good. Entertainment in the evening is 3rd. Rate and needs to be upgraded. Hotel was great in itâ€™s heigh day but needs major updates to make it current. Staff tryâ€™s to cope with issues at all times.

This is one of the best hotels which you can find in this beautiful island. Friendly staff. Clean rooms and facilities are over the moon. Nothing to complain about. Worth the money you spent. Good vibes.

Heritance Ahungalla was the second Heritance hotel we stayed in after Kandalama and we were not disappointed! I thought that after our fantastic experience at Heritance Kandalama, it may be a let down but it definitely was not. Similar courtesy, cleanliness and amazing food!

The room itself was okay, relatively clean and fair in size. My biggest issue with the stay was that, when relaxing or walking on the beach, there were around 15ish street merchants constantly harassing me and other guests to buy their clothes (at extortionate prices compared to going to a local shop or market), as well as being badgered to book tours, again at 2-3 times the price when booking away from the beach. I have to point out that these were not hotel employees, but independent traders whom for some reason had access to the hotel every day we stayed there. The hotel offers a baggage handling service where they will move your bags to and from your room for you free of charge, however, be vigilant as personal items were stolen from our luggage between us leaving the room to checkout, and our bags being moved by one of the staff members. In all honesty, I have stayed at many hotels in different countries and I would say, this is the one time I have gone on holiday and not felt like I was actually on holiday as there was just that much badgering going on that it was almost impossible to relax. Upon walking out of the front gates of the hotel, you would have 4-5 tuk tuk drivers ask and try to take you to places you have repeatedly told them you do not wish to go and although this is not the hotel's fault, when it happens every single day, I feel as though it has to be mentioned. Anyone considering going to Sri Lanka, I recommend it - just consider staying somewhere else because for me, this was a 5-star mistake.

Lovely location and rooms are clean and spacious... Rukmal makes fun towel sculptures... see phot below! All the staff from housekeeping, dining rooms, bars and reception are kind, cheery and helpful... the dining staff are always on hand to discuss local food with us and where is worth visiting in the local area. Great location and beautiful hotel designed by renowned architect Geoffrey Bawa, all rooms are sea view and what a view! Hotel grounds are lush and full of beautiful sweet smelling frangipani trees. 2 pools mean you can find peace away from the day guests and children playing ball games in the residents only pool... or watch the games and enjoy the playful young ones. We had a noisy room, over the main bar area with live music until 11pm each day... when we asked to move, we were in a new room within a few hours. We love our quiet new room on the 3rd/top floor... this holiday is a rest and relax time for us... Together with our comfortable beds (with sprung mattresses) thatâ€™s what we now have ğŸ˜Š If you are in the UK... we booked via Mercury Direct as weâ€™ve used them before and they are great. Our local rep, Malkauter lovely and helpful... not at all pushy, as weâ€™ve had with other companies.

3 nights here.. by the coast... hotel was built by Geoffrey Bawa.. very good place The room we had was massive... clean and tidy.. with big tv, mini bar... huge bathroom The view of the coast was awesome...the breakfasts and dinners were all very nice The hotel staff were all friendly A very good place

Had the pleasure of staying two nights. We have been many times before and this was again an excellent stay. The amenities and services was 5 star as was the hospitality. Special thank you to GM Sisira Senanayake, Thushara, Rasika, Shanika and the pool attendants and all the staff.

Itâ€™s a beautiful created by the famous architect Geoffrey Bawa. However more than the unique architecture, the hotel is renowned for its delectable cuisine. Some areas of the hotel, like the corridor floors need to be re painted. Had trouble finding pool towels cuz there was one person assigned for that task and he was not present all the time. However their food will never disappoint you. Will return again.

Ms supunika took very good care of us as did the whole staff. We got suite room and twin luxury rooms 201 and 203. Immaculately clean. Awesome pool we played polo. Table tennis badminton everything is available. Beach was also nice. Rough sand. The breakfast spread was amazing.

A 5 star stay. From the service to the food and the ambiance, a must visit beach hotel in the south of sri lanka. An old bawa hotel, some refurbishment has taken place. The rooms have been tastefully redone. Had a most enjoyable visit.

A beautiful stylish hotel with the most interesting architecture and interior design ; Mackintosh meets Bauhaus ! Very charming and super - friendly service all round. Breakfast to die for. A shame about the lack of beach weather in September , but Dec- March would be better .

I think this one of the worst places I have ever seen. Very bad experince with the reception team. No smiles, they want to charge me for the air I am breathing. They intentionally selected a very far away room although we are a family. They know it is one night so we will have no time to complain and request room change.

A great place to relax and unwind. The hotel is clean and staff are very friendly, especially Rukmal who went out of his way to help my family. He also showcased beautiful towel art after he tidied up our room. I would highly recommend this hotel for a Sri Lankan getaway.

We travelled around Sri Lanka for 2 weeks staying in 6 different hotels, and this was by far the worst service we received out of our entire stay. The hotel itself is nice, rooms spacious and clean, pool area is nice. We dined in the a la carte restaurant which was nice. Donâ€™t bother with half board / all inclusive - thereâ€™s a handful of restaurants on the beach with better food. The worst part is there seems to be some American expectation of tipping for absolutely everything, and if you donâ€™t then you simply wonâ€™t get served!! Despite many signs around the pool saying sunbeds canâ€™t be reserved, it seems the pool boy is more than happy to reserve these for a tip. I was up at 7:30am (jetlag), and there was just 1 set of sunbeds left despite no one actually being by the pool! We stayed there until midday, and some of the reserved beds only became occupied at 11am! So frustrating for everyone else. One woman took the reservation off and the pool boy flat out refused to give her a towel, even arguing with her! She went and got her own, and by midday no one had come to claim the bed! Awful! We went to the bar one night, they saw us walk in. They proceeded to offer every other group table service but us! I had to go to the bar 3 times for menus, drink etc., yet they still charged 10% service! On check-out you get shoved in some tiny room round back to pay your bill which is actually quite intimidating. No one asked if we had a nice stay or where we were going next, or even said bye when we left! While I do appreciate Sri Lanka is a poor country and tipping is needed, this was the only hotel during our whole trip that had this greedy mentality. We saved hard for this trip and donâ€™t appreciate being treated like lesser people because we donâ€™t have lots of extra money for tips! They also seem to have no problem in letting touts in to the hotel who come up to you on your sunbed to sell you a sari! I get that this happens on the beach but they shouldnâ€™t allow them in the hotel grounds.

This hotel has wonderful staff. Always smiling, welcoming and warm towards their guests. They go the extra mile as shown by the towel at that greeted us in the afternoon. A great way to relax and unwind aftera busy trip around the island.

A wonderful resort to finish our Sri Lanka experience. Beautiful surrounds & excellent staff . The housekeeping staff especially Rukmal was so friendly. Wow the towel art to another level. Food delicious & we return home feeling very relaxed after seeing this amazing country .

This was our second visit to the hotel, we had another very enjoyable 14 night stay. The food was excellent, great verity on offer each day. Would highly recommend trying the fresh lobster in the Wadiya seafood restaurant. One of the evenings there was a Sri Lankan theme night in the Jute restaurant, Duminda took the time to explain the different types of food on offer and which occasions these would be used for. Both Thushara and Duminda really went out their way to ensure dining in the restaurant was a pleasurable experience and always on hand to help. Our room was cleaned to a high standard daily mainly by Rukual, we really enjoyed his towel art. The green pool area was spotless and clean, Dinesh ensured we had plenty of towels and always greeted us with a smile, nothing was ever too much trouble for him. Getting a taxi or tuktuk is easy, just a short walk to the main gate, The entertainment was a bit hit and miss on some evenings. But otherwise this is a great hotel to stay in. Thank you to all the members of staff that really did go that extra mile ensuring that our stay was perfect, you are all a credit to this hotel! We are looking forward to our return next year!

We had a splendid day out with our office staff families at Hesitance and Every staff member with whom we came in contact was attentive, kind and professional including receptionists, room service staff, animation team. Specially would like to thank Rasika, Nipuna and Thushara from F&B department who assist us to make out day a memorable one.

The hotel is beautiful and the pool area is the best place to spend your time. They have an extensive range of amazing food. The hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating. Rukmal from housekeeping made up the cutest towel figureins when cleaning up the room. Loves them! The beach is lovely for an early morning walk. Best place to come over and unwind.

We are frequent travellers to Sri Lanka and were first time stayers at this magnificent resort. We were celebrating the anniversary and an engagement of our granddaughters and their partners. The look of amazement was captured in memory only as it was all a surprise made possible by Sunethra Lamahewa and her team. Thank you so much for your professionalism and attending to detail. The staff were extremely friendly and courteous and always willing to help. The meals were outstanding too as was the whole resort. A great experience!

We stayed in room 145, ocean-view with balcony, the two large trees obstructed any view and we had to be satisfied with listening to the waves pounding the shoreline. We were unlucky with the weather, windy and wet, and it influences my rating decision as we were really unable to fully enjoy the hotel facilities. Our room was spacious, the sliding panels in front of the balcony window rendering the room virtually soundproof when closed. Lighting in the room was poor. The bed was comfortable and we enjoyed great sleeps. Great shower area, and ample quality toiletries provided. Lovely infinity pool between reception and the beachfront. We were treated to a Christmas Cake mixing display in the lobby; wish that I could return for Christmas and sample a slice or two of the finished product. Great staff throughout, courteous and efficient and always greeting the guest with a smile. Both my wife and I agreed that the Heritance would be a lovely resort to enjoy a relaxing holiday.

Warm welcome and friendly and helpful staff, located by the beach and having 2 pools for the times of high waves, great ocean view, 2 restaurants and a bar with amazing music, nice daily programs by hotel including activities for children as well as elders, nice music every night by the bar, very good food, clean rooms, excellent service, will recommend and will go again for sure

What a nice hotel to stay. Beautiful swimming pools and rooms,We stayed 2 nights and very comfortable place. Reception and Customer services are exceptional. Special thanks to Rasika, Duminda, Kenny and Nipun.

Stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla. Despite a local storm this week had a great time. The customer service is exceptional, especially the restaurant manager Diminda. Great pools. Very rough sea so not possible to swim but the beach was great. Evening entertainment with bands and fire eaters. When it stopped racing they had aquarobics. My wife a f daughter enjoyed the spa massage as well. The breakfast and evening buffets were great. As a vegetarian I had loads to eat. Overall a great stay exceptional and attentive service. Highly recommended for a family. Well maintained and beautiful

The room that was given to us was spacious,clean and had plenty of space for the kids to move around.. everything that we requested was arranged for us prior to our arrival so waiting time was less thanks to shanika. The cots were comfortable.food was good with a range of varieties.food for the kids was prepared specially and was ensured to be sent to the room on time thanks to the banquet team and Duminda. Definitely will be back again! The kids and we loved our stay here.

While the big waves pounding, staying inside a cool Aircon room is another choice, or dip in the nice beach side pool, or just dive in the ocean! Well equipped hotel, must say, for all ages, there is game room, literary room, gym of course, bar, cigar/smoking room! They sure well thought of all different levels! Great hotel n staffs!

We visited this property during last weekend.The hotel staff were so friendly and helpful from the reception onwards.Rooms were spacious and clean.There were so many varieties in the buffet and the foods were so delicious.Thank you for providing a wonderful experience.

Our first stay with the Heritance group and we thoroughly enjoyed our 2 nights here. The waterfront location is ideal and although we didnâ€™t get into the water at the beach we did enjoy walking along the beach. The rooms are comfortable and spacious, the bathroom is on the smaller side for what I would expect for a hotel of this standard but was clean and well equipped. The restaurant was good and the food range was acceptable with traditional Sri Lankan as well as Western options. The cultural show on our second night there was also a good experience.

My recent stay at Heritance Ahungalle was an absolute memorable one. On October 21st 2019, I was proposed to by my now finance, Tim Thatcher Tim worked with my parents and the amazing staff at the resort to organize a memorable evening for me and my whole family. We had beautiful rooms, food and entertainment for the evening. Especially, the staff helped organize and execute the proposal by providing us with an intimate space, a spectacular four course candle lit dinner (with a specialized menu featuring our event), full table service, photographers, flower arrangements and overall wonderful hospitality. I want to express my sincere gratitude to the team at Heritance Ahungalle, Mr. Rasika (F&B manager) Mr. Thushara (Restaurant Manager), Mr. Sisira (GM) and their teams for allowing us to execute Tim's vision. It was a very special day surrounded by my friends and family and it wouldn't have been a possibility without the support of this team. Heritance Ahungalle lives and embodies the true Sri Lankan hospitality and service. Thank you to all!!!

We are a spoilt family when it comes to medium to luxury travels. Therefore this review is based on comparison of this hotel against many others in Sri Lanka. Our stay in this hotel was relaxing and welcoming. The rooms are comfortable and clean and the staff are super friendly. Whilst not the most demanding of customers we were made to feel like nothing was a bother to them. Attention to detail and care was taken by the staff. Special thanks to Dumindha who represented his hotel very well. Recommended. Note However this is not a hotel if you want to swim in the sea. Currents are incredibly strong and dangerous. Now for some points to improve: The hotel is looking tired and needs a modicum of renovation. The walkway floors and hallways can get very slippery when the rain comes in. Itâ€™s all open and is a hazard. The reception staff were eager to workout when we aim to checkout. They could tone that down.

Heritable Ahungalla is a must visit in Sri Lanka. We had an amazing stay from check in (Miss Thirindi - efficient, pleasant and professional ) to check out. The hotel design (Bawa) fits the environment perfectly but the staff are the ones who made our stay amazing! Make sure you try the great seafood prepared by Chef Chandanna and his team. Also, Duminda (restaurant manager) gave us excellent service and recommendations- most senior staff have foreign experience so understand what world class service and food is! All staff are humble, professional and efficient .... great culture! P.s - if you feel like some fun activities ask for Raju - tennis, table tennis, badminton, pool - he can do it all and is very helpful!

Had a great time and well organized hotel with Great staff and special thanks to Shanika and DInushi .....for getting the midnight surprise birthday....thanks for the lovely memories and making it special event

The property is located right in front of the beach and the beach is barely 20 steps from the reception. We reached the hotel at around sunset. We skipped all formalities and ran to the beach because the view was simply splendid. The staff is very hospitable and accommodating.
