The chef at the restaurant made us Indian food at our request although the buffet menu did not have it. A special hat tip to Rukmal from housekeeping who did up our room beautifully when we were away - with flower petals strewn around and towel swans.

Friendly staff.tasty food with good spread in lunch & dinner.special thx to the staff as we were upgraded to a luxury room. It would be better if the hotel staff can cosider to improve breakfast spread & keeping life guard in pool area.

The hotel lobby, pool and facilities are large and nice. The beach is good but not suitable for swimming. Rooms are clean. WiFi service is free and of good quality. The location is near to many attractions.

Beautiful hotel with atmost luxury in golden sands of Ahungalla. The hotel was tastefully desighned for at most comfort with spacious rooms. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. The food spread is mouth watering with international varaties. The food is very tasty and healthy. The staff is very friendly and nice with smiling faces. The room service is very efficient with care. A beautiful spa to get energised and refreshing. Overall it is a best property in the south costal belt of Sri Lanka.

As soon we enter the gates , drove through a beautiful garden to get to this hotel, I like this hotel. we were welcome by a very nice lady in a very traditional way and offered complementary drinks. Our room face the sea with a very beautiful view of the sea and the pool. This hotel was designed by a very famous architect JEFFREY BAUER. We have a very nice and spacious room.Breakfast and dinner was excellent with a very comprehensive mouth watering buffet.The staff was very nice, very good customer service.

We visited this hotel possibly for the fourth time and still are happy about the ambiance and service. Food was great and rooms comfortable.Staff was helpful. Hotel is a creation of legendary Jeffry Bawa and still looks good.

It's such a pleasure to go around this beautifully laid-out hotel and encounter their ever-smiling and helpful staff. Special mention of Rukmal, the talented gentleman who always cleaned up my room and left beautiful towel art creations on my bed. Today he put 2 of my hairclips on the dog he made and it made me smile when I entered my room and I haven't stopped smiling yet (just like Rukmal) :-) Lovely location, great attitude of staff, comfortable room, good food... my first solo vacation is perfect.

We spent a day in this beautiful seaside hotel in mid November. It is located along the southern coastline of Sri Lanka. The famous bawa design of the hotel is amazing. The view of the beach along the front swimming pool was stunning. The staff was friendly and offered a good hospitality. We spent more in the outdoor pool. It was awesome. Food were great. Rooms were comfy, neat and equipped with all amenities. Highly recommend for a family stay or for a office day out.

Excellent hotel lovely staff. Had a wonderful time. I would advised management of this hotel to stop tourist visiting and purchasing from Aida gems Bentota.it would not be somthing you would wish your hotel to be associated with. Extremely poor quality work and dishonesty . You will see many very poor reviews mounting to include our own experience. I cannot express myself more to keep away from this dealer. Items will break and gems will fall out. You will not receive any interest in after sales service. Please please share these reviews to others. Thank you for reading.

A beautiful hotel set on the beach, and while it is showing signs of age this is more than offset by its charm. The staff were delightful, friendly and helpful. Cleaning was excellent. The buffet dinners and breakfasts are of a very high standard. I would certainly stay here again.

It was a very pleasant Day-out with family & friends at this great location. It was my first time here and was very pleased with the services offered, Specially, Duminda who helped out from the time I called for the reservation and Dilrukshi who received us in a cordial manner and given us a lot of attention. Thanks Duminda for looking after the buffet reservation and co-ordination of the boat trip in Madu river. We had a great time. Small productive criticism - the bathroom amenities were not provided in the room allocated with the pool use. The shower area is too small according to the people used them and needs more space. Hope these comments are helpful to the relevant Managers in the future. Kind Regards to every one. Deepani Kapuruge

Stayed here for three nights and loved it. Great staff Always willing to go the extra mile and so very friendly. Even the gardening staff always smiling. Room fabulous overlooking the smaller pool which was an added bonus. Food special. Had buffet for breakfast and dinner.

We stayed at this resort for 2 days and loved it. Theyâ€™ve got 2 pools but weâ€™ve been swimming in the main pool. Our rooms were facing the pool and the ocean so the view was beautiful. The food was lovely. They had a bit of everything from authentic srilankan food such as hoppers to seafood such as prawn and fish. Would definitely stay at Heritance Ahungalla on our next visit to Sri Lanka.

Checked in to Heritance with office friends.. very spacious, modern hotel with old world charm.. some historical artefacts preserved within the hotel was interesting. Loved the jacuzzi and the mini- football table at the hotel. Has 3 separate pools and a clean beach. Rooms have the appearance of a wooden-look, old fashioned train station! But very comfortable..

The stay was Excellento! Me and my family had a great time there. The food was really great especially dinner. The adjoining beach is a nice additive to our vacation as well. Pool and jacuzzi was very enjoyable and we spent a lot of time there because it is very well made

I stayed there for three nights. It was a great experience. Architectural design by welknown architect Geoffrey Bawa is awesome. The hospitality and quality food provided by Chef Mr Chandana Alwis was really memorable.

Really appreciate your service. Delicious food , friendly staff. We had excellent service throughout the stay. Variety of food corners specially including healthy food. Service was very quick. Once again big thanks for the heritance Staff. Thushara,Nipun,Rasika,chef rakita,chef Chandana,ex chef Chaluka

This hotel, fronting the beach on a large plot of land, is popular judging from the number of guests when I was there. Some guests had been there more than 20 times over the years. However, I was rather disappointed to see that the hotel is rather run down, unclean from the dust on the floor, some walls looked as if unpainted, the toiletries in the bath-room were just shampoo, bath gel and body lotion topped up in small ceramic bottles which I dislike as they donâ€™t appear to me to be hygienic. Further more, there were in-room slipper and thus makes walking in the room on unpleasant when wet after a shower. I said earlier, this is not a resort. Apart from the pool and restaurant, there were no other fun activities within the hotel for guests. But despite all these, I rather enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere surrounding the place and the friendly services of all staff. Our 3 nights stay there was thus an enjoyable one. As for location, there is no decent shopping nearby.

Booked this for my office staff trip. Place is absolutely beautiful with necessary amenities. Hotel is very old including most of its architecture. Beach access, facilities, Monster pool makes you to feel they are complete. Their dining area is so dark. I think that's one of those dining areas which can attract and impress many. It looks dull. Food variation was average. I was expecting Kandalama and Earls level of food variation which I didn't get. But I'm not worried about the food which was available too. Presented course was well balanced. Room interior is too old in my opinion. Staff was Okey! Had nothing to complain about. Time for an upgrade though. This hotel can easily become the best in Ahungalle

We really like this hotel and design and rukmal the room boy do his job verry verry well he design bath towels like animals , all staffs are verry verry good-tempered , place is quiet enough, heritance ahungalla is one of best resorts that i have ever go. Here i want thanks to staffs specially rukmall the room boy ...

Nothing to say much. Dont go their for offers. Locals are troublemakers for them. Only good thing is food (but limited spred ). Very compact rooms , bathrooms and even dining area. Unfriendly staff. Never expect this..

Very good hotel with very nice staff that make our room beautiful.very delicious food in buffet of dinner and breakfast.wonderful pool but ther beach is not very clean. Privet pool is very nice and quiet but the other pool is not,because of the seller.seller woman and man is around of the pool and try to speak to you.

Great location and facilities. If youâ€™re looking for a relaxing location where you can laze by the pool and hear the waves then this is a great spot . Wifi access is good . There are a few locals who try to spruik their goods which is a little annoying but they are outside the hotel rounds and are largely harmless. Tell them no thanks and theyâ€™ll leave you alone.

It was a very warm welcome from the staff. And took so long time for checking process even though it was not a busy time. The room we received was not at the expected quality and filled with flyers. We had to request several times to remove flyers and finally we requested for new room since we were with an infant. Initially they rejected our request and I had to talk to FOM to get a new room. So until 6. 30 pm from the time we checked in (3.30pm). It was such a unpleasant experience. Other room services were all good. Restaurant services and foods was very good. Sleeping in the new room was a night Meare because of the noise came from ceiling. It seems that the room was just below a walking path or some steps. Infant was waking up most of the time because of this noise.

We visited the hotel immediately after Easter attach when everyone was scared to step into a hotel . The very first day it was only five rooms occupancy. With all these circumstances the limited hotel staff members looked afternoon us very well. They were ready to go to any length to serve the customer and make them happy. We enjoyed each and every moment of stay.Each meal was unique.All the facilities were excellent.ğŸ˜€ We commend the courage of the hotel staff to face the situation which was beyond their control. Itâ€™s so nice to use their Spa area , Balinese for a reasonable price. We recommend any person to visit Ahungalla Hesitance without any hesitation.

We stayed for 4 days at Heritance Ahugalla in August 2019 and it was very good and enjoyable. staff were very friendly and helpful. highly recommended for families with kids. very close to beach and also they have a large and clean swimming pool. Rooms are modern and large. I want to specially thank the daily room service provided by Rukmal who prepared animal figures using the bath towels. the animal figures were fantastic and my children thoroughly enjoyed them.

We stayed here at the end of our trip to Sri Lanka for 4 nights to finish. The hotel is very clean and tidy, spacious rooms with nice views. Food and Drink was very good throughout the day (no alcohol served on religious holidays) Great pools, both in size and cleanliness Only thing that slightly let it down, staff need to do more to stop/move on Dogs, Cats and Water Monitors that walk Iâ€™m off the open beach

Spent a delightful weekend at Heritance Ahungalla during the last weekend of August to treat the two little birthday celebrants in the family. From the moment of check in it was nothing short of great!! Every meal was fantastic and the company of Duminda in the dining room was terrific!! They even got the kids a birthday cake during dinner!! (The bed was decorated with a birthday greeting!!) There was more than something for everyone in the vast buffet and the kids loved the variety! My husband and I are weight watchers and there was a Healthy Eats corner as well. In all honesty i gave this a miss as I wanted to spoil myself a little. ğŸ˜ the room was great and spacious though it was a triple! The two swimming pools were delightful and was great to spend hours!! The staff was always attentive, polite and efficient even when the hotel was running full!! By far one of our favorite beach hotels!!

One of the best hotels in down south sri Lanka...specially the staff is very friendly and helpful...also, we had a nice room on the 3rd floor with direct sea view...thank you for making our stay memorable and comfortable...

What an amazing towel artist Rukmal is. This is what we returned to after our river safari. Lovely hotel to stay in and great service. Beautiful pool and facilities, good food and lots of activities. Very enjoyable stay for families and couples alike.

Me and my family planned this small vacation to Heritance ahungalla because of a recommendation from a friend and after seeing the amazing photos that they have in their website. We stayed in two rooms and the rooms were pretty much normal. The view of the sea was covered from trees as it was in the 1st floor. And basic amenities were there. Nothing to get excited for. Food and the buffet was terrible. Only few options were there for vegetarians. They have not given their attention to minor things. For an example I had to request a different salt shakers during ALL the THREE meals I had during my stay. (One table didnâ€™t have any salt/ pepper shakes, other two times - the salt was stuck in the shaker) . Also the arrangement of the buffet was hideous. Food were all over the place. The variety of food was really poor compared to the price we paid. The pool was amazing though!!! The view and the feeling was spot on ! And top notch!

We stayed at this hotel 2 nights, had breakfast there and it was ok. We are at sunshine restaurant just along the beach for lunch and dinner. Hotel was nice, room was big.. but the decor etc would of put as a 3 star. Staff were friendly, especially the security guards making sure we felt safe.

We returned to this hotel after a few years, but yet again had a lovely time. This time I accompanied my old parents and Hotel took extra support on checking in, other facilities, etc..Thank you very much and we were very happy of it. The place is really beautiful overlooking the sea. Rooms are spacious and quiet. Excellent staff in the Hotel.. Many indoor and outdoor games. My son was able to bit of badminton as well. Two swimming pools. Indoor gardens with green surroundings. Food and staff service is great. Nothing to complain about all aspects of the hotel. Recommended and value for money.

Stayed at heritance Ahungalla which is a lovely hotel on the beach. Lovely food and Ruksan who looked after us and our room gave us a treat each day with his towel art. There are two beautiful pools and lovely grounds to walk round. Badminton, vollyball and table tennis are all available too. A nice relaxing place to stay.

Lovely weekend getaway with wonderful stuff and service. We returned to this hotel after a few years, but yet again had a lovely time .. special thanks to Thushara who went out of his way to ensure we had a wonderful stay. Hotel was very busy with 100% occupancy over the weekend but that really didnâ€™t make any difference to the excellent service !!

The place is really beautiful overlooking the sea.Rooms are spacious and quiet.Excellent staff in the Restaurant .Many indoor and outdoor games.Two swimming pools.Indoor gardens with green surroundings.This is my second stay.Hoping to go again.

When entering the hotel all the guests and bag are being checked by secirity personnels and metal detectors which is a good move to reassure safety. Valet parking is available. We were warmly welcomed and the reception was very busy atthe time we were checking-in. We were offered a welcome drink and a small snack as well as a refreshing face towel. The garden was neat and the lobby area was quite large and spacious. Furniture and the decor was modernised vintage looking. The room was looking so inviting and the lighting did its magic with the look of a lavishly renovated early bunglow. The bed was comfortable and so were the sheets and pillows. The view from our room was partially to the ocean and eventhough it was not directly centered at the ocean, the view of the sea from our room was spectacular. The food was on a buffet set-up and all of what I tried was delicious. Yet, I believe that the variety could have been improved, specially the breakfast service. On the other hand, the dinner was excellent! However, the lunch might not be the best buffets of Heritance Ahungalla I suppose. The buffet quality might be pressed down as a result of low rates being charged in this season to attarct more guests to the hotel. Moreover, the spa was relaxing and the therapists did their part well. Above all, the fragrance in the spa was fantastic. Unfortunately, we had a bad night. After having dinner, a function started at the hotel and we guessed that it was in the lobby area. It was extremely loud and we could not relax in the balcony or sleep inside. I am sure a manager or some authoritative personnel could have made a change in the location of the function. I understand that it was raining in the evening but the hotel might have a certain policy in terms of having functions at the hotel. There is ample space in the property and there might be a better place or a separate place to have functions. So, please make sure that such problems do not occur in the future. The aim of a hotel is to make all the guests delighted in their stay and not making "some" of the guests happy.

Excellent service location is excellent eye catching We love the food and the service of the staff is so good. The staff are very friendly and very helping . I felt it like a home thank u so much for the service given. We enjoyed a lot

Excellent place to enjoy time with the family with an experienced and confident staff rendering a luxurious experience which make are valuable money and time worthyğŸ’¯. The best place to be in Ahungalle without a doubt.

Heritance ahungalla is a really nice place to enjoy with your family. Great rooms, two pools and a nice view by the sea. We really enjoyed our stay also thanks to the large buffet with lots of choices. Special thanks to Chef Rakitha who made our stay even more likeable

Its been a few years since our family holidayed in Ahungalla and when considering an hotel to stay for our Anniversary, The hotel where we had spent 3 of our anniversaries was not far from our thoughts. When your wife says â€œLetâ€™s go there, It feels like homeâ€ it so much easier, Done. Decision taken. And as always a good decision indeed. I called ahead and informed the hotel that we are celebrating our anniversary and they made sure we felt special. Thushara (Part of the management team) is the MAN. He is always on the ball, making sure everyone is taken care of, checking up on how the room is, if our lil son had any special dietary needs etc.. The room was specially decorated for us, our Dinner table was too. The cake and quartet who came along and made our special night even more memorable along with the management team was highly appreciated. Once again Thushara thank you for making it happen, Dinesh Thank you for making sure our glasses were never empty, for making sure our son too was well looked after and for doing a super job. Manoj, Nipun; you and your team are doing a great job of showing what Sri Lankan hospitality really is. Always with a smile, always looking to help and truly professional. As always, we will be coming back!

Heritance Ahungalla is located right next to the beautiful Ahungalla beach with lavishing views all around. It is a very safe and secure spot with efficient checking. We were warmly welcomed to the lobby by Sandali who offered us welcome drinks of different kinds and ensured we had a smooth check-in to the hotel rooms with our luggage sent to our rooms. We had a fresh fruit basket sent right after entering our rooms. The hotel has recreational activities available such as Table Tennis, Badminton, Table Football which are free of cost to play. There are also 2 very large and refreshing outdoor swimming pools available with a lifeguard always around providing you with assistance and towels. At the restaurant, buffet was available at all 3 meal times. The food was very appetizing with a variety of different kinds of food options available to pick from. The Restaurant manager Duminda Gunasinghe, is very friendly and hospitable to the guests and was elated to meet us. He managed everything professionally, making sure everything was properly arranged and up to the mark. We were also offered to have any dish of our choice made on special request by Duminda Gunasinghe. Nilanga was also very quick serving our table and always made sure empty plates were taken away and water was refilled in glasses. Malsh Rebecca was also very helpful in the restaurant, welcoming and arranging seats for new guests coming in for dining. Room maintenance was provided by Rukmal who kept the room hygienic and maintained it tidily by always replacing used towels and other essentials for the room. He is very talented and innovative, creating different types of structures using just towels making the guests feel welcomed. I would definitely visit this place once more and recommend it to anyone wanting to spend a vacation at a holiday destination.

We booked into the Ahungalla Heritance on the 14th of Aug 2019 for 5days and 4nights. It ws situated by the main road and was convenient to locate. We booked into the luxury suite which was room no. 101. The room was fabulous and was the definition of luxury: consisting of a private jacuzzi, two TVs, two separate bathrooms, a spacious sitting area with a comfortable sofa set plus all the other basic necessities(toiletries, grooming kits, iron box and table, slippers, clean towels, etc) and a separate bedroom with a comfortable bed. The best part being the view from the room. It opens to the outside to a neatly maintained lawn, a swimming pool and to the shore of the Indian Ocean which is accessible by a 5 min walk. Laundry service is quick and clean. A fully equipped air conditioned gym open till 10 pm is maintained on their 1st floor. The hotel has two large swimming pools, one at the entrance to the hotel with a poolside bar and restaurant. The main restaurant is only open for breakfast, lunch and dinner and usually serves food in buffet style. Food was delicious most of the time and had a wide variety of choices for all 3 meals. The hotel also has a billiard table, Foosball table, a carom board, 2 badminton courts, a ping pong table(table tennis) and a tennis court... Something that will help with boredom during the rainy times. The view during sunset was mesmerizing every time...makes you want to take a stroll by the seashore..The staff was outstanding with a service that was way above expectations...just to make their guests feel valuable and special...Our host was Mr Duminda Gunasingha ( Restaurant Manager) who is the most humble, friendly and helpful member of their staff...superb service throughout our stay... even went as far as to arrange dishes on our request.. especially for us on at least 3 occasions... Dilantha Rakitha, their sous chef, is the culinary mastermind behind the tasty dishes. Rukmal of room service is an artist who comes up with beautiful creations everyday to make us feel special. Then there was Nilanga who waited on us without a single flaw.. always with a charming smile...Nelka, the special tea expert... And Sweet Miss Sandali, would greet us everyday with a big smile on her face..... I personally did not have any complains during my stay... Would visit again soon and would recommend everyone I know to as well... Thank you... Will see you guys soon..

Loved Heritance Ahungalla so much. Amazing hotel with incredibly helpful staff and delicious food. The rooms are lovely clean and gives you a homely vibe. Will definitely re-visit this place again soon... :)

WE had a nice time at heritance ahungalla.everything was really perfect.staff is very welcoming and friendly.we will come back next year too. THANK you fir everything... we wouldlike recommend to everyone.

The service of all the staff was realy great and they all made me feel very welcome. In the restaurant the food was very delicious especially breakfast but most of all the excellent service given be all was an experience I will never forget. Only room and bed sheets cleaning are 10/6

We checked into the hotel on Sunday a day before a public and bank holiday after the security checking we seated in the lobby for nearly 1/2 hrs and there were no welcome drink no wet towers Following day we saw the cart is serving the guests. Hotel was very crowded and we feel that not enough staff members attend for guests .Huge crowd for lunch dinner and breakfast and we had to come late for all 3 meals . Food was good but less varieties. No entertainment only 2 pics band was playing in the lobby and that also stopped at 11 p.m. due to restrictions , We feel that hotel should give more priority to its in house guests . Rooms are good and clean. The pool was very nice and refreshing. This hotel can be maintained better compared to what we witnessed.

We stayed one night (full board) in a Premium room. The entrance to the hotel was impressive. We were very satisfied with the detailed security check that was done on arrival considering the prevailing situation in the country. The welcome was warm and friendly. Our room was comfortable. The restaurant was ok and food was good. The restaurant manager was very friendly. The hotel has two pools, thus making the pools less crowded at a given time, despite the number of guests. The beach was spectacular! It was a gloomy evening and we walked about 10 minutes to the North (as recommended by hotel staff) and came upon some cliffs that gave the most spectacular views of the ocean! Since we checked in on a week day, we were able to relax and spend a peaceful day. I heard it gets busier during weekends.

Ocean side room. Nothing was too much trouble from everyone at this Resort. Quick check in, we were part of a tour group, nine Australians, having an amazing time in Sri Lanka. Meals, rooms, and quality of linen, towels, we had our room attendant, such a really nice guy, Thank-you Rukmal for the best room service, plus that amazing bed decoration that you made, the best we have ever had made for us from all hotels in the world. Buffet dinners over the top, just so much to choose from. Thank-you all.

Location can easily reach by highway from Colombo to Ahungalla 1 1/2 hours. Excellent Hospitality. implement security checking recently after 21st incident. Delicious food with much variety. enjoyed well. there are two pools. one is the resident pool. other one common. the rooms has not much clean . I asked broom sweep again. bad smell in room bathroom. Other than that it recommended to visit.

Amazing hotel, friendly, courteous and very hospitable staff. Food was excellent with a wide variety. Atmosphere and environment was both serene and entertaining at the same time. Highly recommended for a very good relaxing holiday with family and friends.

Yesterday (11th August 2019) had the chance to drop in at Heritance Ahungalla. To be honest the place was packed with locals and limited foreign travellers. Understandable due to recent incidents that happened in Sri Lanka. Wide area, Friendly Staff and a big swimming pool. The place can be maintained better compared to what i witnessed. One of the largest buffet with ample options for non-veg. "Veggies" I am sorry we have only limited option to go with. A decent place to spend time with your loved ones.

It is a beautiful beach property with well maintained and comfortable rooms, excellent location, warm hospitality and super delicious food. We had gone for a family holiday and we enjoyed every moment of our stay. I would like to give a special mention to Mr. Nipun from the Restaurant team who took special care on providing us vegetarian food and Chef Chandana who was very co-operative in taking our special requests for our choice of vegetarian food. Both of them we very welcoming and ensured that our experience at Heritance Ahungalla exceeded our expectations. One point which I was not very happy about was the quality of indoor games. The hotel should have a dedicated room of a section for indoor games were guests can spend leisure time with family. Apart from this the hotel has everything to make your stay memorable.

i visit this hotel on 7th of august and this became my best vacation in a down south hotel.i were treated with amazing hospitlity.the staff is very kind & helpful always treated us with smile faces.the rooms are well aranged & tidy.i would like to thank chef Thilan for preparing delicious foods & beverages through out the stay.

Had a wonderful stay at the hotel. Checked in 5th and checked out on 6th august.. Huge rooms with extra large TV.. felt that I have stepped in to a movie theater. Friendly staff with good attitude. Two large swimming pools accompanied with jacuzzis made our stay extra special. Never forget the tasty meals with variety of items at the buffet. Special Thanks goes out to chef Thilan who enlighten our tastebuds with his signature dishes. Over all memorable stay at the hotel and willing to go back again. Thanks.

Absolutely a fascinating and charming beach resort with excellent hospitality. Staff and the services from room to restaurant are beyond expectation. Food varieties are just right to cater to all tastebuds. Above all the welcoming and friendly services from check-in to check-out do compel everyone to be a repeater soon or later. Thank you Heritance Ahungalla for the superb holiday we spent to celebrate our Daughter's Birthday. Special thanks to Srinath, Lakshitha, Sunethra, Shanika and the front office staff, Rasika, Thushara, Nipun, Duminda and the F&B staff, Janaka and HK staff, Chaluka, Chandana and all the kitchen staff and last but not least Mr. Sisira Senaratne for the wonderful team that has been groomed for this lovely hotel! Good luck team Heritance Ahungalla !

i think this is the best place that people are having to have a grate holiday in down south at Sri Lanka due to my experiences.from time I step to the hotel and until I leave the place I was treated with best hospitalities with smile faces.the rooms we got are very comfortable and tide with well arrangements. Itâ€™s actually made our minds relax and calm than anywhere before we visited. Specially I should tell this, the hotel is blessed to have a such a talented chef called CHEF THILAN because we were treated with delicious foods and beverages all the time. Thank you chef Thilan and all of you for making our stay very happy.

Heritance is an all time favourite hotel of ours and we have stayed over many times. This year our stay was made extra special with the excellent service from all staff. Staff were friendly and catered to special requests in every occasion. Special shout out to Dhuminda the restaurent manager who made us feel welcome and ensured we were well looked after. We were with a group of 6 children and his extra warmth and service made us feel very welcome. Thank you for the excellent service and no doubt we will be back again next year !!

We stayed in a deluxe ocean view room for one night. The overall experience was great. Specially the food & services. All three meals had different options and the staff was very helpful & prompt. The pools over looking indian ocean are big and well maintained. This hotel quite old but they nicely renovated. The staff in all the departments were very supportive. The rooms are big & clean with all the necessary amenities. I can well recommend this hotel in any sort of a travel which you will experience a pleasant stay.

Simply Excellent.From Rukmal in house keeping to Nelaka at dinning room service and the whole team fantastic service. We had very relaxing and enjoyable holiday. Thank you Heritance keep up the good work!

Hotel rooms are clean and Rukmal did a very good job with our room. Enjoyed his towel decorations. Difficult to book trips around here, and we didnâ€™t like that hotel staff allowed local sales menn in the hotel area. We have been around Sri Lanka but never experienced such mess.

I was here for two week conference and found the hotel to be very beautiful with great staff. I must specially mentioned Duminda and Cassim from the F&B team who went out of their way to help me solve some issues I was having with my next destination. Laundry was also good and reasonably priced. This resort is a self containing resort, great for honeymooners but be prepared to spent a bit on transport if you want to see other sites and locations. there is not much to do around the hotel area and you will need a car to go to other tourist sites.

This a very spacious hotel with ample area to walk and play. Has two lovely swimming pools and quick walk to the beach. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable . Has all amenties . The food was very good. Buffet has wide spread including ample seafood such as crabs and prawns. Very friendly for people with limited mobility Good service

We stayed 2 nights in a beautiful suite with partial sea views and nice breeze. The living room is nice with a TV to watch movies but because i am over 6 foot tall the couch is a little small for me. The bedroom was nice and i liked the TV in the room to watch movies and the movies channels were great along with the nature channels so was good to watch at night. Food on buffet was good and good choices especially the tom yum soup for dinner. I thought that being charged for bottled water in the buffet restaurant was a little ridiculous, but service was decent and one waiter took care of us for fresh juices at the cafe and at breakfast also. I really liked the sunday night band in the restaurant and kind of missed music the next night. Hot food selection was better on Monday than Sunday but overall the foods were good and we will come back. The adult side pool was beautiful and never crowded and the waiter there was awesome we ordered snacks to eat by the pool and he pulled a table over and made it really nice so i thank him for that on monday lunch. Was a good experience for us and having stayed with other hotels in the area we want to come back and possibly use the spa and Jacuzzi. We had a great time and urge others to come and enjoy here. The Saxaphone music on sunday night was incredible and even the band in the bard was nice monday night

Good reception at the gate by guards & the reception at main lobby.All are very friendly staff, varieties of delicious food, clean & tidy rooms, satisfactory security arrangements.Well maintain swimming pool

Beautiful resort with open view on the ocean. The weather was perfect even though the monsoon period. I think we saw the rain twice notwithstanding the forecast was only showing the clouds. Friendly staff and comfortable rooms. Great food and good selection of wines. Lots of places to visit in Bentota. Highly recommended!

Had a stay for 4 nights with family and friends. We love the people working there. Good service, friendly smiles. Our party to celebrate 50+50 was perfect planned and nice, everyone enjoied. Thank you Ahungalla! We Will come back next Year! Regards from Pia and Patrik

This is our 3rd visit to this beautiful place. Food and the service was excellent. We had a nice time here with the Family. Two swimming pools are great and definitely we will be back ............thank you.

We have visited your hotel with friends for heâ€™s special day . And room was excellent the service is great all the staff is very friendly and we have special memories with chef Thilan as he have made our visit more memorable such a nice guy !! We will definitely visit and never canâ€™t forget that food taste, also there was high security service no need to think about safety as they do it much better way !!! Highly recommended for your vacation!!! Best regards JG

A lovely short stay to spend my birthday getaway! I got upgraded into a Luxury room which I was very grateful! â¤ï¸ From the time I arrived until I left, the staff were all warm and welcoming. Hotel facilities were great - massive pool and clean beach! My bed was so comfy. Heritance Ahungulla, a perfect place for holiday! It was so relaxing and peaceful. Thank you for a wonderful 3 nights, a vacation to remember! I am looking forward to my next visit... â¤ï¸ğŸ˜Š

It is very amazing place with most welcoming service, no words can specify this great full experience, the facilities and the staff are very friendly... The food was great All places are comfortable... Thanks Heritance Ahungalla

One of the best 5 star hotels in Sri Lanka with a friendly staff. The room was excellent. No words to express about the food as food was so tasty, great choice. All the staff are very friendly. Room service is also excellent. If you call in the midnight also they attend. Special thanks to FOM, Sunethra, Janaka Liyanage, Thushara, Rasika, Chef Thilan. Thank you Chef Thilan. The food is so tasty. Will be back again. I have visited Heritance Ahungalla so many times and every stay was excellent. Thank you Heritance Ahungalla staff and God bless you all. Dilani Cooray and family. ğŸ’•ğŸ’•

We had a great time at heritance ahungale. One of my favourite place I really love to spend my vacation. Food and the service was excellent. Also the staff is amazing here.they are very friendly and helpful... We will be back for sure..

We checked into the hotel the day before a public holiday. Following day while chatting to a waiter he said there is going to be a huge crowd for lunch hence come by 12:30. Apparently they were going to have about 350 day visitors when the restaurant can accommodate only 175. We had breakfast around 9:00, and no way we could eat again at 12:30. We had no choice but to cut short the holiday and go home. How can a hotel treat its in house guests like this? Instead they should have arranged lunch for day visitors in a separate hall. Everything else was ok.

Heritance ahungalla is a beautiful hotel where you can relax and enjoy your holiday.. we had a great time during last weekend at heritance ahungalla.staff is very friendly and helpful.. food was amazing.we will come back again very soon.

I really enjoyed the service and hospitality. Food was really awesome and enjoyable. A bit crowded these days and we know the reason for that. But really enjoyed the stay. Quality of the Pool was also good. Room arrangements and conditions were good and also clean and tidy.

I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel.We stayed in a royal suite.It was so beautiful and very spacious.The staff was very courteous and professional. Food was good but less varieties. The pool was very nice and refreshing.Beach was amazing and clean.

We spend a weekend with our kids and what is most remarkable of this hotel is their friendly staff (although seems to be over worked), designed by Geoffery Bawa-the nature friendly surroundings are breathtaking. Beach is clean and well kept. The rooms are clean, comfortable and ours had sea view. They have 2 large pools, including seperate jacuzzi.Breakfast and dinner buffet had good variety and food was delicious. We were entertained by a magic show in the evening, and during dinner there was a small band with retro music, which was totally enjoyable.

We were on our annual family trip on 15th June. We stayed one night with our families. My experience in suite was excellent with my family. We enjoyed our trip with kids a lot. Pools and beach is really good. Nice sceneries. Recommended. Thanks to the Management for support.

This is a lovely hotel located next to the beach with all the facilities needed.food is nice and the service is excellent.this was my 2nd visit to this hotel 8 years apart and the quality has not changed one bit.finally if you are planning to visit sri lanka please make note that this country is very safe, friendly and the tourism industry here is waiting to welcome you warmly.

Just concluded a relaxing holiday at Heritance, Ahungalla. The team led by their GM, Sisira Senaratne, went out of their way to make my family comfortable & happy. Especially, the Restaurant Manager, Duminda Gunasinghe with his team looked into all our needs on food & drinks & even made some "specials" which we liked. All this with smiles right round & friendly attitudes. We certainly will be back soon!! Roshan Gooneratne

Travelled with my wife for my Birthday weekend. Stayed one night in one of the luxurious suites. The number of tourists seemed to be a little low after the recent events however there were a few around as well as some locals. The standard of service was very high and very commendable. I was a little worried on whether buffet options would not be available, however to our delight both the Dinner and Breakfast were a lovely buffet with a wide variety of options. The room was quite large and very spacious, a living area as well as private balcony was available in addition to the large bedroom and spacious bathroom. We ordered in room service for lunch, a club sandwich and nasi goreng, both of which were very tasty and acceptable standard for the high price. We also ordered a delicious portion of cheese cake for tea which we thoroughly enjoyed. The swimming pool was very large and due to perhaps lesser occupancy we had a lot of privacy and were free to swim about. Given the standard of service and notable increase in tourists as well as locals travelling these days, booking early to secure a nice room with a view would be recommended. Definitely a lovely resort to visit, architecture is a key facture in the property and there is a lot to be appreciated in the overall design and fell of the location. A lovely option to consider if visiting the Ahungalla towards Galle area. A convenient drive on the souther expressway from Colombo and not far off from the highway exit. Great stay!

I would be failing in my duty if I don't place on record the excellent service provided by the hotel staff at Heritance, Ahungalle during our stay from the 14th to the 16th of June 2019. My father, the Late Mr. Walter Wimalachandra who was on the Board of Directors of Aitken Spence until his demise in early 1990, was very closely associated with the hotel, then known as Triton from its inception, even from the time the land was selected to build the hotel. Therefore it is no wonder that I have such fond memories of holidays spent at Triton as a child, with my family. In fact I have had the good fortune of spending our Honeymoon, our 10th Wedding Anniversary and our 30th Wedding Anniversary on the 27th October 2016 at this hotel. Every time I have visited the hotel, the hotel staff have lived upto the high standards my Late father would have been proud of. It is no wonder that this is my favourite choice when it comes to selecting a venue for much needed rest and recreation. This time too the the service provided by the staff was such that we will always want to return soon. The room reservations, both by Supun at the Head Office and the Front Office staff at the hotel, was carried out very smoothly and satisfactorily. We were provided with very good rooms by the Resident Pool , as requested by us. The Guest Relations officer, Ms.Shanika Jayasekera was very obliging and together with the Executive Chef Mr. Chaluka Rodrigo, organised a birthday cake etc.tocelebrate my husband's birthday. From the executive staff to the room boys and waiters/waitresses, every one was so cheerfuland courteous seeing to our every request. However I would like to specially mention, Mr. Rasika Ratnayake, the F & B Manager, Mr. Thushara Gunaratne, the R & B Manager, Mr. Duminda Gunasinghe, the Restaurant Manager, Mr. Chaluka Rodrigo, the Executive Chef, Mr. Dilantha Rakitha, the Pastry Chef, Ms.Shanika Jayasekara, the Guest Relations Officer, Tharindi de Silva and Trilicia Thomson, members of the Front Office staff. Being a shareholder of the Company under which this hotel is run, it is heartening to know that the staff at Heritance, Ahungalle go far above and beyond their call of duty to satisfy their guests. Well done and Congratulations.

We visited to celebrate our anniversary. Even though its quite apparent that we are a couple, a twin room was provided. In the reservation page its mentioned about a sea view room ("best perhaps are the private balconies â€“ from where it will seem as if the sunsets are ablaze in glory, just for you"). The photo also showing a sea view room. But we were given a garden view room in an isolated corner. When inquired the answer was "sorry sir we are full today". Its not an excuse. I must mention that we were not late for our check in . Actually we came around 12.30pm because we planned to have the lunch as well . Then moving to the condition of the room itself, It's very old looking small one. The doors were rusted, stained & discolored. The Bathroom is small, ancient & basic. Walls faded & definitely need painting & renovation. Even most of the 2-3 star level hotels provided a much superior rooms than this. Neither Toothpaste, toothbrush nor shaving items provided which are expected to be provided in a 5 star hotel. We had to asked for it. When asked they have provided us with two packs of toothbrushes & only one of them had a tiny toothpaste for us two. Anyway we manged it economically for two days although both of us used to brush teeth after each & every meal. We didn't bring those because all the other five star hotels we have visited have provided them without any fuss & we honestly expected this hotel to be the same standard level. I noticed the lack of the shaving kit only in the next day morning. I knew i had to ask for it again. But as we are checking out anyway i didn't bother the housekeeping staff early in the morning and left my self unsaved for the breakfast. I'm wondering whether they are providing older rooms especailly for the discounted booking offers. We reserved Heritance Ahungalla thinking that they would provide with the same exceptional service like their Heritance Kandalama which we visited sometime back. Anyway we have determined to avoid Heritance hotels here after as its not worthy taking any risk ,after our anniversary got totally ruined. I truly hope you could make some improvements in the future.

We could not ask for a better choice than deciding to spend one night out with family at Hotel Herittance. The experience was awesome making our stay a memorable one with the executive staff and the minor staff going out of the way to make sure that we got everything we wanted to make it a special weekend for all of us. The Chef Chaluka went out of the way to make it very special for the 7 vegetarians in our group to compensate with other special dishes on the b-b-q night which was much appreciated by them. A surprise cake was requested to celebrate a nephews birthday and Thushara the Rest. & Bar Manager and Duminda the Rest. Manager along with other staff made it very special than was anticipated which made it a nice tea party to start off our week end with. We all had great fun with dancing, enjoying the lovely two pools and the variety of food offered in all their buffet meals that was not only tasty but were in abundance. All in all we all left very happy having enjoyed to the brim with our family. Special mention must be made about the friendly staff serving in every area who are always with a broad smile which is a pleasant sight to the guests and good reflection to the Hotel! I will not think twice to go there again! The ocean view from every angle in the Hotel is breath taking and the drive through from the entrance to the hotel is very environmentally friendly!

very nicely laid out hotel. great staff and facilities are incredible. Two large pools, beach and spa's. A gym, library and plenty of parkland. The food is great and plenty of variety in food. Rooms are very well apponited and plenty of parking.

We have just finished a 3 night stay at this 5 star resort, as a wind down at the end of our 14 day JourneyScapes tour. The hotel is on the beach but unless you are a strong swimmer I suggest you stick to the pools! Beautiful at sunset but expect to be harassed by the lovely ladies selling sarongs! This resort was designed by famous architect, Geoffrey Bawa, is is cleverly constructed with nature and building blending perfectly together, as is the case in Bawaâ€™s beautiful Lunuganga estate nearby. Donâ€™t miss the old Triton buildersâ€™ lift he designed, now displayed in the foyer! The hotel is not new and could do with some renovation in the future, but it offers everything a 5 star resort should, from two large and immaculately clean pools and well tended grounds to excellent service from all staff. Our room attendant, Suranjith, was especially kind and helpful, always with a smile on his face. He even went out of his way to find out the brand of the lovely bath products in our room. Food in the main restaurant was buffet style, except for the last evening, when most guests had departed. This menu is extensive, well prepared and delicious! There is an emphasis on amazing Sri Lankan food, but there are sufficient choices to suit even the fussiest diner. We particularly liked the delicious a la carte meal on the last night. There is also a cafe and a Seafood Restaurant. The friendly, informative head chef, Chaluka, told us that where possible the food is sourced locally. So fresh! We were at the hotel over a weekend and Saturday was very busy, with lots of people coming for the night. Could be very crowded in peak season. However the staff managed the large numbers very professionally. On Sunday we had the pool to ourselves once again! Our room overlooked one of the pools and was well appointed, with comfortable beds and a large bathroom. Suitable towel rails are lacking however, with the main one over the toilet. However you can ask for new towels whenever you need them. Suranjith decorated our beds every morning with fresh flowers. A lovely touch! Overall an amazing stay, and a great finish to our holiday!

What lovely people the Sri Lankan people are. And the stuff here were continually ensuring that we enjoyed our stay. knowing that i was ill before arriving they continually made certain i was getting better. I would particularly like to thank Duminda from the restaurant. every time we saw Duminda he would smile and ask how we were and what we had done that day or what we were doing for the day. Nothing was ever a problem and every request was met with a smile. Duminda is certainly an asset to Heritance Ahungalla. we will certainly be returning Thank you Duminda. Thank you Heritance Ahungalla

A memorable stay at Heritance from 30th May to 1st June 2019. Stayed here with family, A special mention of Duminda Gunasinghe @ the main restaurant, who made our stay memorable with his outstanding friendly and professional service. We will definitely be back.

We stayed for week and we really enjoyed our stay. Our comments are: What we liked: - Rooms are clean and they pay attention to details. Putting flowers on a daily basis - Our cleaner (cannot remember his name) was very attentive and polite and great - Breakfast options are many and great - Great food in general and much cheaper than all the restaurants around the area - there is a great choice and the food quality is very good - Resort offers daily activities (simple ones) but they are nice to take part in - The resort staff is providing the comfort that they are taking good care of you. They come in to spray the room and get it ready for the night so that you do not have to - returning clients for many years show that the hotel is taking good care of their customer What we did not like: - we arrived late at night and really tired - we would expect to have the check in process easy and smooth but took a long time, and the receptionist did not even know that our reservation included breakfast etc. really not something that we were looking for - services are super expensive from taxis to the airport etc. Get an uber not a tuk tuk that are trying to reap you off, too - the moment you step at the beach people are trying to sell things constantly - the beach and the sea were rough - seriously if you are not surfing there is no way you can properly swim (which is a shame but nothing can be done about it). - tuk tuk mafia in the area - very expensive, depending on European visitors to ask for crazy prices. They follow you in the shops making deals for themselves with the owners by bullying them. If you want to buy souvenirs visit the government shops in Colombo and the airport.

Our home away from home! Our first visit was in 2007 and we have come almost every year since then. Each stay was more memorable then others. Always receive a warm greeting at arrival, mouth watering food, fantastic rooms, beautiful garden, excellent service delivery. We benchmark other hotels to Heritance. Keep up the good work!

Got upgraded to luxury/deluxe rooms upon checkin.. These rooms have pool/beach facing view.. Lots to do and explore in the property. Beach access from the property. Beach is nice, clean and not at all rocky. Very safe Two swimming pools, sports facilities (table tennis, tennis, badminton) Buffet was good (though does get repetitive). If trying ala carte, try the Sri Lankan rice and curry..

Excellent stay,3 nights beach break part of tour. Our room on 3rd floor overlooking pool & beach. Very good wi fi, comfortable bed, hot shower , quiet aircon. A lot of food options, good service, would highly recommend this hotel to tourists. Thank you for a lovely stay

I stayed Heritance Ahungalla on last weekend and had great fun! The staff members were friendly and the food was great and had a variety for dinner buffet! But their staff service is bit slow compared to other place may be due to rush on last Sunday. The place was crowded, but had enough space for everyone to enjoy. But the rooms were again small, and old. Well there was an incident where we checked out, we have been informed that we used the minibar (which we didn't use at all and it was locked entire our stay) and after we explained the situation, they agreed on it as their mistake and didn't charge any extra amount which was so grateful. Overall, I would recommend this place for relaxing holiday with family! Tip: The same incident happened for us in different hotels, so soon after you checked into the hotel room, make sure to check the minibar unless you do not plan to use it to avoid the hassles!!!

Visited the property when it was not very crowded. They were not in their best after the security situations in the country. Hence they did not have a good spread of food for buffet. But they did their best to provide with lovely lovely food for the few customers there. There is definitely room to improve in the food section and the cocktails in the pool bar. Other than that the hotel has a lovely ambience. It has two beautiful pools and the staff members are really friendly and helpful.

We checked in to the room not knowing they have given us a twin room. What made us upset was the girl who escorted us to the room Dinushi, the excuse she gave was "if you checked in early we would have given you a better room" I was stunned! I immediately told them that we will be checking out the next morning even though we were booked for two nights. It was around 6pm when we checked in and we were too tired after traveling from colombo otherwise I would have definitely checked out the same night. Room was so small and very dirty and old. Bathroom was very small and mind you a huge cockroach was running over our bathroom amenities imagine using rhose tooth brushes and soap and those refill type shampoo bottles which were anyway spilt. I was so upset I cabt tell you how much because we were there to celebrate a birthday. It was all ruined. Later on the duty manager came and ask whether we would do a room change and said the hotel was full but we didnt want to trouble the house keeping staff as we were anyway going to check out next morning. Food at the restaurant was ok but not the best of heritance maybe the reason why was because all the guests were locals. Restaurant staff was good. Friendly. Next morning when we came down to the lobby to check out, i cant believe the same girl Dinushi's attitude towards us. Even though I looked at her she made sure to frown at me. Not bothered to atleast talk to us nor apologize. Wow I am from the same industry and I cant imagine the way she acted. Sadned by the fact that we are from the same industry yet we've been disrespected this way. I am disheartened to write all this because as hotelliers we all have so much expectations from Heritance hotels.

We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. superb service and best food. We all loved the variety of food they had.especially a big thank you to Thushara the banquet manager and the team, they looked after us very well. They are so friendly and helpful. Very good hospitality we will definitely go back to this hotel.

Ever so friendly and helpful staff members. Especially manager Thushara and Duminda went out of their ways to make our holiday memorable. Tasty food and good rooms. Two pools were amazing. The highlight was the staff. Best staff ive come across after Uga Jungle beach.

It was a fantastic holiday spent with most friendliest hospitality gesture by the staff of Heritance Ahungalla. If you make visit to this most spectacular masterpiece, guaranteed your second visit. Mouth watering cuisine of Heritance Ahungalla will assure your decision of coming back. Come and experience the true feeling of luxurious hospitality home away your home.

As the heading the meals were above five star and the variety was excellent. We reserved a Suite thinking that there will be a DVD Player which is very comman nowadays. But it was not available. Suites were samll compared with suites in most of the other five or four star hotels in Srilanka. Our overall experience was quite pleasant as the staff was very friendly.

I just got back from Sri Lanka after spending 5 memorable days there. We spent the first four days in the picturesque beach of Ahungalla in Heritance Resort. From the minute I walked into the airy white-pillared lobby, I knew it was going to be a vacation like no other. The staff greeted us with local refreshment and iced tea. The infinity pool stretching to the turquoise ocean left me awestruck for a while. We were taken to an exquisite suite through the lobby which had a distinct Victorian style of architecture with monochromatic chequered floors, tree-lined open courtyards in between stairways. All I could hear while I walked was the chirping of birds, the kind I havenâ€™t heard in cities. The other sound was that of the roaring sea, its waves crashing on the shores. Heritance Ahungalla is a one of its kind of beach resort, designed by Geoffrey Bawa, a reputed British architect who lived in Sri Lanka and has also designed the Sri Lankan Parliament House. The suite is embellished with ornamental wooden furniture, luxurious lounge chairs, armchairs, Jacuzzi and even a curated library. A few minutes later I explored there was a radio playing in all rooms, happy songs of the good old 90â€™s I canâ€™t get enough of! That is the little part of Sri Lankan morning I brought back with me, FM Gold app on my phone and Dimbula fragrant tea. I am in love with the local cuisine and chose to have Sri Lankan food for all my meals during the stay. It is truly a seafood loversâ€™ haven with the fresh catch of crabs, fish, prawns and lobsters cooked with locals spices and a lot of love by the seasoned cooks of the island. Every meal was a delight and the fresh weather ensured my metabolism was higher than usual. Evenings were mostly spent in the sea beach and the infinity pool, where the blues merged, the moon and stars saw their reflections in the tranquil water and they shined even brighter. The hospitality of the staff was beyond my expectation. People are kind, helpful and smiling. Sri Lanka, and particularly the place we stayed is really a place with a soul. Above all, I would really like to mention that the security facilities in the resort and across the tourist destinations in the country are top notch. After the Easter bombing incident, there is army posted everywhere and security protocols are being followed to ensure we are safe in their country. ISIS attacks are happening everywhere in the world - France, Spain, and even the US. But travel advisories were not issued against them. The island country of Sri Lanka lives only on tourism. The dip in tourist flow is wiping away livelihood of millions. While I write this, I have a cup of piping hot Ceylon tea on my table, a phone full of amazing pictures and a mind full of beautiful memories. Sri Lanka, you beautiful country! Love and prayers.

We stayed here 2 nights on HB meal plan and the team at the all day dining Restaurant has been fabulous. Our special thanks goes to Duminda(Restaurant Manager ) who was extremely caring and helpful. We will certainly be back in the amazing place sooner than later ğŸ˜˜ğŸ˜˜

Same as kandalama heritance also have poor hospitality. They don't care about customers. They act like we came to stay and eat there for free. ğŸ˜‚. After having bad experience in kandalama the I went heritance ahungalla. No difference. So after the bad experience from both heritance hotel I stopped choosing heritance hotel.

The best place to go and spend your vacation.You can enjoy the luxury of the hotel while being treated so kindly by the hotel staff.The rooms are in their best quality.You really can enjoy the evening by having a cup of tea viewing the Indian ocean.The food is awesome and the pools, there's nothing to say about it.

We patronize the Heritance Ahungalle simply because it offers exceptional hospitality. Every request is accommodated and you will never hear a staff member decline a request, without evaluating all possibilities. Thatâ€™s really difficult to find these days and that â€œextraâ€ effort is the difference between extraordinary and ordinary. Special thanks to Chef Thilan, Rasika and Nipun and the restaurant for their amazing hospitality, and I must state that the cuisine has certainly upped its game and was absolutely amazing over the few days we were there. The lobster bisque and the Lamb broth need special mention for itâ€™s lovely texture. I wish to also thank Rukmal from housekeeping who always attended/arranged our room the moment we set out. He would always leave a memento of some sort, which actually made us look forward to entering the room. Very nice touch. Everyone on the staff at every level was friendly and helpful, and complimented the beautiful atmosphere of the hotel. Nothing pretentious, just genuine Sri Lankan hospitality.

Heritance Ahungalla is one of the world class hotels,that one could ever dream of spending a vacation.Itâ€™s dreamy atmosphere with a magnificent view of the pool and the beach takes our breath away.As usual we were offered great hospitality,and made our stay extra special.Thanks to all the staff,specially mr Thushara,Nipun,and ms Trilishia and Dinusha for the assistance offered,for our emergency.We will surely visit this paradise again.Thank you,and wish the Heritance team success in their every effort.

Pros- Relaxed beach location with spacious rooms. Good choice of bars and restaurants. Excellent breakfast buffet. Friendly staff, especially in the restaurants and around the pool. Very nice, big pools. Lots of interesting wildlife. Laundry service was excellent and good value. Cons- There were some hawkers on the property around the pool area selling sarongs and tours. An annoyance when trying to relax. The air con in our room was not very effective. By contrast it was excellent in our kids room. There was black mold in the shower. When it rains, the communal corridors are prone to flooding. The room attendants are very pushy about tips. Our attendant Ranil visited our room a day before we left to tell us he wouldnâ€™t be there the following day. We tipped him well, but the next day, the day of our checkout, a new room attendant who we didnâ€™t know came into the room twice on the pretext of checking the minibar and hung around clearly also expecting to be tipped. We are always happy to tip for service, but this pushy experience made us quite uncomfortable and left a bad final impression of our stay. The day before leaving we asked for a late checkout on one of our two rooms and were told that would be possible for an extra $50 US. We happily agreed to this, but the following morning we were told neither room was available. This seems unlikely as the hotel was not at all busy (it was five days after the terrorist attacks). So we had a few hours hanging around the hot hotel common areas before our airport pickup. Not the best way to end what was otherwise a very enjoyable and relaxed stay.

The housekeeper Rukmal kept our room spotless, each day we returned to find flowers and an amazing animal displayed on our bed that he had created from a towel. This man has serious talent - he should be in reception teaching guests his art. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Thanks for such an amazing time.

A truely remarkable place designed by late Jeffery Bawa. With a close view of the sea.i stayed one night with my wife and son and had a marvellous time. The staff was really helpful and available. Food was excellent.

The rooms had tons of storage space.. All main amenities included Two lovely pools. The second pool which is on the right side of the property, has a beautiful tree that leans over part of it, creating some natural shade on hot days. Food was great as always.

This hotel is right on the beach with wonderful views. An interesting turtle hatchery just up the road with a few local shops just outside the hotel gate. I had a good massage at a house just next to the hotel gates down a long drive. The father did the massage and I met the mother and 3 kids which was a great experience. The food selection at the buffet was excellent and of very good quality including many western style food choices. The room was good but a little tired in places. Overall, an enjoyable stay.

For the travellers looking for a true Sri Lankan experience with elegance and world class service, Heritance Ahungalla is among the best in the Island. Front desk staff will make you feel special at check in and check out, by attending to every little requirement you have as guests, and try to do their best to accommodate whatever they can, walking the extra mile. In our case, it was Chathura who made our encounter at the entrance special. Hotel Management and the Staff at the main restaurant and the pool bar were so friendly and helpful at every time. This was a visit we made after a decade and the positive difference we saw is highly commendable. Thank you again, GM Sisira Senarathna, Chef Thilak, staff at the restaurants including Thushara, Dumindu and Nipuna House keeping and maintenance staff, and many others I didn't mention here by their names, for looking after us, and our parents who needed additional support and attention, with love and care in a way we have never expected. Hotel is great for both foreign and local travelers. Breathtaking ocean front, well maintained clean rooms and other five star++ facilities, authentic Sri Lankan food, and excellent service with true Sri Lankan hospitality will make anyone's stay perfect at the Heritance Ahungalla.

Beautiful surroundings 2 pools great gardens sandy beach. Meals were lovely and the bar was very pleasant. great place to relax. Our room 128 opened onto the pool area and it was very pleasant to sit outside. The room was clean and had all that we required

We decided to visit Sri Lanka as 3 couples me and my wife, sister, brother, sister in-law and brother in-law. We booked our trip through Tui and decided to book the Heritance Ahungalla as our accommodation. The only problem was that my brother and sister in-law did not book until a week later and did not manage to book this hotel as it became fully booked so they booked into the sister hotel next door which was the Rio which was partly owned by Tui. Firstly I want to make a comparison between these two hotels the Heritance is more a Sri Lankan style hotel and the Rio is very modern. The rooms in the Heritance are big and comfortable but could do with some updating. It has 2 swimming pools which are very warm. There is main restaurant were everbody eats is ok but can get busy and you may sit outside if you wish you can also eat at 2 additional restaurants at a price if you are all inclusive like us you can get a 50% discount. You have to be aware that even if you are all inclusive not all drinks are free, usually locally produced drinks are but not here. If you eat in the main restaurant and have drinks its all inclusive soft drinks, beer and wine. If you go out to the bar to watch the entertainment and ask for wine you have to pay not only that but even for a cappuccino, even locally produced alcohol. This is not all inclusive! Be aware the staff at the hotel don't speak very good English not like in the Rio. We found that we had to keep asking the waiters and waitresses continually in the restaurant to get a drink as they kept forgetting, but outside in the bar they were pretty quick to serve you drinks. I found this to be penny pinching not like in the Rio as the staff would serve you quickly and what ever you wanted at not extra charge as we found out due to my sister in-law paying for us to have all day access to the hotel for her Birthday. I would say that its up to the individual on what hotel is better suited for your needs. Positive if you want peace and quite pick the Heritance if you want modern with everthing included in the all inclusive price pick the Rio your choice. Tipping staff is helpfull to get what you want.

Although not near the town centre, this hotel is sited on a beautiful beach, with two pools it has something for everyone. Totally rebuilt after the Tsunami. Breakfast buffet was huge, covering all tastes. Vanilla yoghurt smoothie was delicious. Food in the cafe was very reasonably priced and delicious. Forget the taco in the bar, disappointing. Large comfortable bedrooms, air con bit noisy though. Staff delightful and helpful.

Stayed in room 249 - the upkeep of the room was excellent, all staff bent over backwards to accommodate any requirements, the service was always friendly and made our stay very special. Anyone who complains about this hotel is a professional moaner, so please disregard any negative comments you may see. We will definitely return to this hotel and will recommend it to friends and family. Trips that we would highly recommend include Galle, Kandy and Whale watching - check with reception re their deals for these trips before booking elsewhere. One of the best aspects of this hotel is its stunning location.

Good - It has beach and a relatively big swimming pool which is clean and nice. Beach has nice veiw but little wavy. Bad - Lower staffs are not friendly... Foods are clean and tasty but not cheap. Tea was very bad....

This hotel is absolutely beautiful. The rooms are fantastic, the staff are so friendly and welcoming, the pool is divine and it backs on to a beautiful beach, that is near enough empty. Breakfast plentiful, dinner buffet also good. Reasonably priced (mid-range) but feels like you should have paid a lot more. Would definitely recommend!

We stayed 3 nights as part of a 14 day trip. Great rooms, perfect location and spot on service. The idealistic location is hard to go by and we enjoyed the fact that when swimming in the pool you could get a bed in the shade no matter how many people where around. I am sure if you looked there are things that could be improved but for us it was hard to fault.

This is a beautiful well-maintained hotel. Apart from our room key not working three times the food and beautiful surroundings on the spectacular beach are hard to beat! The only problem is that selfish European tourists "capture" their deck chair seats all day starting at 0700 am! this means that when they are in their room or not using them no one else seems to be able to use them! the hotel should definitely stop this and pass a policy to only allow guests who are using the pools to use the chairs and otherwise give them up immediately to be democratic to others. For this reason alone we give the hotel only 3 stars.

Heritance Ahungalla is my second home. Love the view and the amazing breeze that I feel when I stepped in to the lobby. Food is always yummy and I like that taste. Excellent service from all the staff, specially the front desk & housekeeping. I will recommend this hotel to everyone.

Showing its age a bit but a well appointed room this is a hotel great for chilling and catching up on the suntan the staff are friendly and always willing to help the breakfast and evening meals are of excellent standard and always piping hot and a very exspansive and varied menu fantastic beach location we enjoyed our stay but very busy at times as it is a large hotel

Stayed over new year with the in-laws - one suite and one deluxe room. The property is showing itâ€™s age with the rooms and public areas ready for some investment and TLC, however it was part of the charm but it may not be to expectations if looking for 5 stars. Some of the staff were excellent and the location is on a nice stretch of beach although the undertow in the water can be a challenge. Breakfast is a wide spread which was nice, and the beach shack had some excellent seafood bbq whilst listening to some old school raggae. Ultimately there are better hotels and needs a bit of work to it.

This is my 29th visit to this Lovely place.., the staff is amazing and very helpful. food and the service also excellent.. I am so happy to stay here. That is why I am keep coming in every year. my room is excellent with a big balcony. I would like to recommond this lovely place to anyone who wants to have a relaxing holiday.

It was not the greatest hotel we stayed at but it had a good service, nice beach, ok food and all you could expect from a resort like that. We had an upgrade which was appreciated. The property should definitely be refurbished though because it is old and a bit run down. All in all we had a good service but expected a more classy place.

We were underwhelmed on arrival here, with drab buildings and long institutional corridors, but the pools are fab, especially the smaller one, and the gardens and beach large and peaceful. The evening buffet offer is expensive so we stuck to the a la carte restaurant, which was fine.

Heritance Ahungalla is a very nice 5 star Sri Lanken hotel. The reception when we arrived was really good and we had a nice big room that was very quiet. The rooms are cleaned at least once a day. Some parts of the hotel need to be renovated but overall it is a high standard hotel. The breakfast was good and there was plenty to choose from. In the morning we sat outside when we could find a table as inside was cold. Most of the time the evening buffet was outside when wetter permitting. The Ã  la carte and fish restaurant are very good. In the garden we had plenty of space and there are a lot of sun beds. The beach is just wonderful, very clean and wide. The waves are most of the time strong but fun. There are some restaurants on the beach nearby if you want to eat something different.

An awesome hotel right on the beach and swimming pool overlooking the sea. Spacious and comfortable room but looks a little dated, sumptuous buffet spread for breakfast and dinner and the staff who are pleasant and friendly make it a great place to spend time. Thank u Heritance Ahungalla for a memorable stay.

I had a twin room which was very good but maybe would be a bit on the small size for two people. The bed was very comfortable, there was a desk with a reading lamp in the corner. The bathroom was small but fine for just me. There is a big pool very close to, and overlooking the beach and sea. The sea has too many waves to swim in but good for splashing around and having a bit of fun in. There is not much outside the property but there is a jewellery shop across the road with a very helpful and genuine owner and a wine shop to the right who will rip you off with "tourist prices". To get further afield the hotel does offer taxis but they are expensive. I enquired about Bentota and it was $23 return, another couple got a Tuk Tuk and "negotiated" the price down to 700 SLR abut Â£3.50. Obviously the car is more comfortable, your choice. The food and the staff are very good. If you want to eat elsewhere there are a couple of places on the beach on right of the property.

Good place to have a day out and they have events for groups.Food tastes good.9ft depend pool is attractiveService also very good.They will take care with your requirements.Recommending this hotel....

From the moment you arrive till the time you leave this fabulous hotel with its attentive, friendly and engaging staff never fails to impress. Our large airy room overlooked the main pool and beach and when not walking the golden sands or wallowing in the pool or relaxing in the shade of the trees around the second pool there was nothing better than sitting on the balcony enjoying a drink and listening to the nightly music from below. The breakfast buffet was huge. Well laid out and fresh daily. The food in the restaurants was well presented and tasty. My favorite, the Mexican with Sri Lankan influence menu. Ate there twice, different courses both times, everyone of them delicious. Would I return. In a heartbeat.

We visited the hotel on 26.All the staff members are very friendly and supportive.superb clean rooms,variety in cuisines.thank you very much who support us to success our success our program.special thank to general manager Mr.Susil,Mr.Vimukthi,all the HODS,Mr.Manuka and HR team.All the best Ahungalla team

An awful lot of the people complaining about this hotel are moaning that it 'isn't five star'. As I recall, until fairly recently, a hotel in the UK had to have a Corby Trouser Press in the room to gain that vital fifth star. So maybe people are taking their view of '5 star' from the UK and, if they are then they are probably right - it isn't UK 5 star. But if it was you'd be paying a hell of a lot more than Â£150/night for it. It is, by any measure a stunning hotel. Cleverly designed by Geoffrey Bawa this low rise hotel (ground floor and two floors above) is laid out to create a series of separate spaces that never seem crowded (they only have just over 100 rooms). The setting, right on the beach, is terrific and the two giant pools are a delight. Those people giving it a poor review also complain that it is 'tired'. It would hardly be surprising given the fight against the elements that must be waged to maintain it but I can't agree. The grounds are imaculate and, yes some of the corridors are showing their age but the spacious rooms are absolutely fine. I've also found the staff to be gracious, charming and attentive.
