Most Sri Lankans are but here they definitely go the extra kilometre. And you can't fault the food, especially the buffet breakfast which will set you up for the entire day. The buffet supper is also excellent with a cornucopia of choice and a good selection of wines. Don't believe the nay sayers, there's nothing wrong with this hotel.

Room, location and cleanliness were just perfect. The only slightly thing they can work on is the refurbishment of the building that is starting to give sign of the age. In any case it's really worth the experience. The beach is highly recommended.

Nothing five star about this hotel. That doesnâ€™t mean itâ€™s terrible, it just doesnâ€™t do what it says on the tin. We shouldâ€™ve realised when we saw the deal we got. However, blissfully unaware we departed for what was meant to be a 5* hotel in Sri Lanka. From the start things went wrong. I didnâ€™t understand how a hotel with 5* reviews on Tripadvisor could be so different to reality. But, what they do is they hand out cards asking you to rate them 5*, i presume most oblige as if you donâ€™t they repeatedly ask you and get a â€œbitâ€ irritated if you donâ€™t. Unpleasant and unnecessary and not something you would ever experience in a 5* resort. Room: Our first room smelled like an ash tray, for two non smokers this was just an immediate no. After we said we wanted a new room they looked frustrated, but acknowledge the smell. Seemingly they wanted us to just â€˜get on with itâ€™. I donâ€™t know if a 5* hotel which permits smoking indoors, especially with private terraces available. Finally we moved rooms (having to unpack / repack). Our second room had a broken AC, which in 32 degree heat was also unacceptable. After two nights of no sleep, 5 complaints about the AC and being told â€œitâ€™s fineâ€, we finally moved to a third room. The AC worked and the room was much larger, an upgrade we thought. However, after the first night it was all clear. We were next to the maintenance and cleaning room, so at about 6.30-7am every morning we were woken up by the sound of trolly wheels on the stone floor. It is so loud that you donâ€™t stand a chance of sleeping through. Initially they donâ€™t turn down the bed and donâ€™t give you the water they promise. The upside of the rooms are the large and comfy beds, and our room housekeeper (Rukhal) was good and left funny towel shapes (monkeys, dogs etc). Poolside: the pools are great, we spent most of our days by the green pool. Lots of space and a nice atmosphere. However, they donâ€™t clear up so following morning you will find yesterdays banana skins, glasses etc. Quite disgusting. We ended up clearing up ourselves. Staff: some great members of staff, highlight was definitely Waruna. Seemingly the only trained and wanting to please member of staff. The rest donâ€™t want to be there and expect to be greated with eye rolls and attitude even when ordering food. You feel like youâ€™ve inconvenienced them at great length. Try ordering a cappuccino at breakfast and youâ€™ll know what I mean. Especially when you get a cold one and ask for a hot one. Three people will try to tell you to drink it and then dip a finger in when you say itâ€™s cold. Going the extra mile certainly doesnâ€™t come naturally. Another upside was when the guest relations manager walked around asking for feedback. We shared our experience and things improved, that evening our bed was turned down, more water was given and pool was improved. It lasted merely one day though. Also, one member of staff in the restaurant wears an unsightly net vest! I think he is trying to be funny. Seems unhygienic and out of place. The hotel is filled with staff but they are untrained and only do one job e.g open door, fill water (no other beverage) so you end up waiting a long time. They also take your food away from you before you have finished and give you bill before you are ready. Stressful, to say the least. Food: the local food is great, especially the Dahl. Lots of food available and we canâ€™t complain. Not 5* but still very good. Facilities: they claim to have several bars and restaurant but there arenâ€™t, or at least not in use. They also have mould in several areas, cracks and paint chipping. The toilets donâ€™t have soap and are often untidy. Spa: fab! Loved it and worth a visit. Entertainment: avoid! Hotel should stick to the live music. The shows and plays ruin what would be a romantic evening with your other half. Overall: despite all this, we had a great holiday, but that was down to my husband and I laughing about it all and making the most of it. I would even recommend this place to others, but with the caveat - you get what you pay for. Itâ€™s a firm 3*. WiFi is also fab! Tip: visit some of the local restaurants on the beach! Great food. Also, stay away from ocean - strong currents and big waves. Can be very dangerous and if red flag is up your insurance wonâ€™t cover any accidents. Donâ€™t forget to check your bill, they say 50% off but donâ€™t give it to you unless you remind them. Expect an eye roll and potentially an argument before it happens.

Very relaxing place for couples.., the beach is amazing here... two swimming pools are excellent and we really enjoyed.,, Specially we should mention about food.. is excellent.. everything is perfect and we will come again...

Excellent place to relax and enjoy. I came here with some of my friends and they are very happy with the hotel and facilities... Food is delicious..also the service is amazing... We will be back for sure....

Had a great stay thanks to Heritance Ahungalla staff. Reception was very helpful. Pool was lovely. Delicious foods with much varieties. Very helpful staff and friendly. Room was fantastic. Beach was amazing too.

Very nice hotel. A very good team and especially thanks for kind Rukmal with good humor and excellent dedication to his work. One of the mornings here preparing an elephant from a towel. The best was that my earrings decorated as ears and two shells I find on the shore as eyes! Many thanks Rukmal! We had a very nice stay by the pool and beach Nl

We stayed at The Heritance for 6 in February. Staff were very friendly and helpful in all areas ; pool, bar, housekeeping & reception. Breakfast buffet was lovely & chefs were always around to check that everything was OK. Dinner buffet was nice, although slightly overpriced in comparison to the quality of food from the Al Carte Restaurant. Water Aerobics & Yoga were great additions, although they could be everyday (yoga only once a week & water aerobics 3 times). Beautiful setting by the beach. In my opinion, I would rate the hotel as a decent 4 star but not 5 star. Our room was an average size but quite old, it had no bath in the bathroom which I would expect in any 5 star property. We also had the unfortunate experience of cockroaches in our room. When we informed the front desk about this, they told us to speak to the house keeping manager (not our job to do whilst on holidays!) We expressed our concerns about the issue and said we would like to speak to the hotel manager as this wasnâ€™t the customer service we expected in a 5 star - we were told the hotel manager was in a meeting & we never spoke to him/her. The staff we dealt with apologized for the inconvenience but it was up to us to ask if they could do anything to compensate, whether it be changing rooms etc. They offered us a complimentary meal at the buffet restaurant (which had never been relayed to restaurant staff & we were going to be charged!) We completely understand that cockroaches can get into rooms but having 1 crawl on you whilst in bed is not pleasant, had this been dealt with in a more efficient way it would have been better. Recreational facilities such as pool table & tennis rackets are chargeable which should really be part of the hotel. Check out other tour options & airport transfers as the hotel charges double, in some cases triple to decent outside providers.

Do not listen to those writing that the service is ignorant, for it is definitely not, you will be attended for any request, just keep in mind that the hotel is big and popular with the visitors, so let the service take some time. The rates are good, as well as the facilities. The place is not brand new, so you cannot expect fresh furniture, etc., but it feels like a solid 5-star hotel anyways, clean, spacious. The ocean is mostly rough to swim, but you can enjoy the pools or grab a cab to get to Unawatuna for a day. Nice library. The gym is different from the pictures on TA: the barbells have been removed, but the basics are still there for you. The breafasts are good, while I found the dinners to be overpriced if you go for a buffet option. There are many places around that are more affordable and enjoyable.

This was my third visit to this lovely property after a gap of 7 years and a lot has changed around ahungulla . The property is lovely as usual and the service great but the beach experience was average as there are hordes of hotels that have sprung up in the last few years around this sleepy town which has changed the demographics. What i like about this place is the lovely architecture by the genuis Geoffrey Bawa and the special emphasis on the food. The food is lovely and the hoppers served for breakfast in the live counter by these 2 charming local ladies was exceptional. But i should still say my previous experience has been much better but than again i dont blame the hotel for the crazy development all around the once upon a time charming Ahungulla.

Had a great stay at the Heritance - lovely staff, Rukmal in particular was really friendly and helpful with a great smile and could make origami animals out of towels......sounds weird but genuinely amazing and a nice surprise. 5 Star!

The hotel has a very beautiful location and fantastic pool areas. The staff is very friendly and provides excellent service. The food is also very good. You have two other nice restaurants close by on the Beach - White villa and Sunset restaurant. There is also another restaurant close by, the Jungle Beach, but they did not serve any food when I was there due to a volley ball tournament.

We had paid for a normal all inclusive so we're very surprised to be given this gorgeous suite with roof garden terrace. Everyone and everything about this hotel was perfect . Lovely food, staff, beach and ambiance .Asoka looked after us excellently on our floor and always gave 100% to be as helpful as possible. Many thanks Asoka.

Fantastic 8 night holiday in this beautiful hotel where everyone cannot do enough to ensure your stay is perfect, so much attention to detail in every area...food totally delicious, so much choice and variety from day to day (all inclusive), room impeccably clean and comfortable (standard) but above standard in quality and amenities. Both pools very lovely with attendants seeking to ensure everything is just the way you like it, as indeed are all staff in every area ALL the time. Cannot praise these lovely people enough. As we were celebrating a special occasion, had a very special 5 course dinner on the beach (obviously at additional cost) which was out of this world, both the food and the service absolutely perfect. Would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here as an extension of the very full on tour of Sri Lanka with Cox and Kings. Very relaxing and exceptional attentive room service, especially from Rukmal. Beach is beautiful but boy was it hot!

Over a period of around 25 years we have stayed here a total of 13 times - and have never been disappointed. Sometimes we have come here over the summer months, but lately we have opted for the period just before Christmas. Our last visit was for three, very enjoyable weeks. We had a corner room on the top floor and found it very comfortable indeed. Some reviewers have called the decor/furniture in the rooms old-fashioned.If your taste is for ultra-modern fittings and interiors this might be right, but there is a difference between old-fashioned and shabby. There is nothing shabby here. We always find the staff very accommodating and this last stay was no exception. The room boys kept everything tidy and clean and the waiters seemed to go out of their way to please us. We have known many of them for years, but I do not think that other guests received less of a service. Prior to Christmas there is a daily raffle in the hotel (the 'advent calendar') and we won a cookery lesson. We enjoyed that very much - and learned a lot. Best of all: we got to eat the results! Many thanks to chef Manjula for his patience and tailoring the menu to our preferences. We love the beach at Ahungalla and try to go for a walk there whenever the weather permits. Despite the new(ish) Riu hotel further along, it remains a very quiet stretch of pristine sand. There are a few hawkers there, but they are friendly and generally will take 'no' for an answer if you are not interested in their offerings. We always try to fit a trip to other parts of the island into our schedule. There are several people 'on the beach' or 'by the entrance gate' who can arrange such trips - some perhaps more reliable (and reasonable in terms of price) than others. We have used Eranda and his uncle Michael for quite a few years. You can contact Eranda on WhatsApp (+94 77 664 1538) or via email (liyanageerandap@gmail.com). He also has a tuk-tuk and can collect you from the reception area. We have often hired him for a whole day (to take us round the local beaches or further afield). Since we prefer Sri Lankan cuisine to 'international food', we generally use the 'coffee shop' restaurant rather than the main one. The rice&curries there are superb (and very reasonably priced). A special thanks to Sanjun who pulled out all the stops to get us our favourite ones. Breakfast at the Heritance is a sumptuous affair, with a huge range of different offerings. Hoppers and a curry, with some fruit afterwards, are my personal favourites. My wife prefers an omelet - as I said, the breakfast options cater for virtually any imaginable taste. So, thanks to everyone at the Heritance for making our stay there so enjoyable again. We will be back!

We booked a luxury room during our stay, room was spacious and large, however the furniture was old. From the time we arrived we got excellent service right through to the departure. They also have meal upgrade options which for some reason I missed and only found out night before leaving. It's a option worth considering. We had dinner at the restaurant which was excellent in portion sizes and quality and also very reasonably priced. The location however is something to be considered as it is out of everything, other than the hotel there's not much outside.

After visiting Sri Lanka 4 times over the last 6 or 7 years visiting several different hotels, I have to say I wasnâ€™t overly impressed with the Hotel. We stayed for a week in January and to be honest the hotel was ok, the staff were great and the setting beautiful. But I have to buck the trend of good reviews because to be honest the food was average at best. As mentioned above my wife and I have visited Sri Lanka many times without any issues. But unfortunately by the second night my wife and I came down with severe diarrhoea and stomach cramps which lasted the whole week. This could have only been the food or drink because we always drink bottled water. You also dont expect ongoing hotel maintenance in high season with mobile scaffold in the hotel entrance and around the front of the pool for 3 days. Seeing men with breathing equipment sending huge clouds of white smoke into the air in the courtyard outside our room. It was so bad we had to put a towel at the bottom of our door. All together if wasnâ€™t for the setting and the staff it would have been a poor stay in a 5 star resort.

We went to this hotel for a weekend stay with another family. Hotel looked very old but since this is a Geoffrey Bava creation itâ€™s still of so much value. We stayed for one night and was on full board basis. Food was average because of the variety. Sri Lankan food was there but still for a 5 star hotel not good enough. Staff were friendly but overall service needs to improve. They lacked energy and interests. Across the hotel we felt there was some sense of boredom. Room was ok but then again it looked old style if you like them. Overall this is a good hotel which may be in need of a new theme and a service upgrade.

Perfect weekend gateway for anyone who r seeking a beach vacation â™¥ï¸â™¥ï¸â™¥ï¸ Everything is so good. We stayed only one night but thorough out our stay staff treated us so nicely. They were so friendly & helpful. All rooms have partial sea view but there is a free entrance to the beach. Last but not least food was incredible u can do buffet or a la carte on ur choice. Highly Recommended ğŸ˜ğŸ˜

Stayed at Heritance Ahungalle for 3 nights from 13th January to 17th January 2019 with my 2 brothers and 2 sisters. I must confess that we all had a wonderful stay getting all the comforts expected. Special mention must be made of Thushara Gnanarathna for his cordiality. Thanks for all the facilities provided and we look forward to coming back again very soon.

We had very nice experience in this hotel ..And also i want share with you its such a nice place nice product for all the human being ..so comfortable. The staff is amazing.always with good smile and in love.we met mr sisira as well who is the general manager at heritance hotel.such a nice person ..well experienced person ..he is a humble gentlemen.thank you very much ..i really recomend this hotel for eveyone.

The best kitchen we ever have had in hotels of South Asia Chef will do everything to make your child happy The most beautiful beach at this part of Sri Lanka You can feel very safe and comfortable Not good animations, if you needğŸ¤ª

It sure was a welcome change after couple of years of absences. We were welcomed by Lakshitha & Anuradha. Unfortunately, we were staying for one night on BB basis. Breakfast had both Western & Sri Lankan entrees. Of course, the taste and quality was excellent!! Rooms and overall experience were excellent and its only 60Km from the Colombo!!!

We have just returned from our relaxing holiday at The Heritance Ahungalla. We had a great welcome form the staff, who showed us to our room. The room was very clean and comfortable. The only slight negative is that the lighting was a bit dim. We found the grounds of the hotel well kept by a team of hard working gardeners. The swimming pools were both in great condition, lovely and clear at not to much chlorine as some pools have. The pool boys ensured you had a sun bed with a mattress and towels. Special thanks to Dinesh for all his help. We ate all our meals in the buffet restaurant and really enjoyed the local Sri Lankan dishes. The staff in the restaurant were polite and friendly. Restaurant captain Rohann was excellent. He is a friendly very hard working professional member of staff. He works extremely hard to ensure you enjoy your meal, the table gets cleared between courses and you get your wine when required. Every few days in the evening a member of the reception staff would circulate around the bars and restaurants asking how your holiday was going and if there were any problems? Itâ€™s the first time we have experienced that at that frequency. I thought that it was a good idea, if you had a problem they sorted it very quickly. The hotel are interested on improving and keeping their clients happy which is a positive compared to other hotels. The beach was fairly clean to walk, unfortunately red flags were out all the time. You could see why, with the very strong undercurrent. There are hawkers on the beach who are quite persistent. We told them politely â€œno thank you â€œ and in the end they got the message. Unfortunately sometimes they would slightly encroach onto the hotel grounds. I understand that they have to make a living, but I think people would probably buy more if they had their wears on show on the beach and not be pushy. In all we really enjoyed our holiday, we could relax and chill. We found found all the staff very helpful, polite and friendly and a credit to the hotel. We would like to return to The Heritance for another holiday some day.

Stayed for one night half board .The hotel has two large swimming pools .Warm welcome by the friendly staff.The rooms and service provided were good.Beautiful golden beach but sea was fairly rough. Enjoyed the stay

We loved it: beautiful long and wide beach, very friendly personal, super delicious food with a high variety of different tastes and an excellent New Years party. Having had the chance to meet and to cook with excellent and most friendly Chef de Cousine Manjula made my day and holiday experience complete. Thank you so much!!! We will definitely come again! See you next year ğŸ‘‹ğŸ˜ƒğŸ

If you are going to visit this amazing desitination, head there soon and stay at the Heritance Ahungalla - a true oasis of calm and rejuvenation. Right next door is the Hotel Riu - an ugly blot on the shoreline that reminds you more of holidays in the 70s in Benidorm, than resting in the idyliic spot that Sri Lanka is. Word on the street is that next door to the Riu an 800 bed hotel is planned - ruination of the beach thanks to the developers who seem to be focussed more on quantity not quality.

Enjoyed the comfort of the clean and comfortable room, lovely walk down the beach, enjoyed a swim in the pool, and the array of tasty food morning, afternoon and night at the buffet. Ideal location for a reunion with friends.

Staying here now having been on a week long tour of Sri Lanka. The Hotel is right on the beach so you can hear the sound of the sea wherever you are. I am staying in room 303 and wake up every morning to the view of the sea. Having toured for a week around the country I was looking forward to some rest and relaxation which I certainly got here. Booked into the spa and had the most relaxing facial and massage. There are plenty of food options available from buffet style to al la carte so plenty for everyone to enjoy. Staff are extremely attentive and go out of their way to help. Thoroughly recommend the hotel and its staff

We are staying already for one week at the Heritance. As we are retired Hotel-Executives, we can well comment on this property. From the allpresent Executive Staff to the Staff of Reception, Restaurant, Pool, Room, Bar, Garden and Kitchen, we experience every Day their friendliness. All Staff are very communicative and well in English. They are always helpfull und you can feel how proud they are to work for this Hotel. Our Room 131 is faceing the Pool. By 7AM the Deckchairs are ready set at your prefered Area. The Room is well equiped and well maintained. A special Thanks to RUKMAL, our Roomboy. He keeps the Room spotless clean and surprises us Daily with one of his Towel-Creations. The Food-Selection on the daily Buffet is immense, with Lots of Local Goodies , International Kitchen and many live Cooking-Stations. We hope to enjoy the remaining Days at this beautiful Resort, and we are planing to be back by End of the Year.

Great stay and staff is a very friendly...food and the service is excellent..we are very happy with the hotel and facilities here.specially our room is really nice and specious... Thank you for the wonderful hospitality..

Excellent Food and Service. Staff are friendly and helpful. Spread Buffet. Beautifully Location. Smiley Front Department Staff. I strongly recommend for All please go and Enjoy. Room Number 357. Special thanks to General manager and Management Team. Thanks.

The setting of the hotel could not be more idyllic, the landscaping and architecture are beautiful. We upgraded to a larger room and were very pleased we did so as it gave us access to the Green pool. The pool man and our lovely housekeeping man Rukmal looked after us very well. A small tip goes long way and is appreciated. We had dinner B&B, and in hindsight we should have opted for B&B only as there are many beach restaurants within walking distance who serve good food - it makes a nice change. Wine is expensive so stick to cocktails or Lion beer, which is very nice.

First time in Sri Lanka but have done Goa so knew what to expect The heritance hotel in AHungala is former five star colonial styled hotel set in beautiful grounds with a magnificent beach golden sands which stretches for miles The rooms are comfortable and clean the staff are extremely friendly and the service is great The buffet style restaurant offers good selection but it gets bit boring if your there for two weeks as weâ€™re We went for the all inclusive package which is a bit of a joke as apparently all inclusive does not include a whole list of things inc wine at the bar use of the merge sports facilities anything from the mini bar etc. The main problem with the hotel is itâ€™s loaction once you walk out of the heavily guarded front gates you are straight onto the main columbo to Galle Road The reality of Sri Lanka hits you with a vengeance the local village is a ram shackle mess of half finished buildings with rubbish piled up everywhere The road itself is a constant stream of horn blowing buses lorries car taxis and the famous TUk TUk Not the picturesque photos seen in the holiday brochures Itâ€™s also a long way from the main tourist triangle where the main temples and sigara rock are located We did the two day trip the return journey was six and half hours mainly stuck in traffic not pleasant I was ever to return to Sri Lanka I would certainly choose the location of the hotel so as to be closer to the sights maybe week in Kandy the week at the beach

I have stayed at this property before. This time too was a great experience. Stayed two nights with wife and two kids. Check in and out was smooth, staff were very nice and accommodating, the facilities were good, kids friendly, good food. No hesitation in giving a five star rating!

Enjoyed a juicy and delicious Jumbo Prawn in a sauce with rice and veg (a la carte) at Heritance Ahungalla restaurant today. Still dreaming of the experience! The mutton samosas and the pakoras were a delightful starter. Thank you! Hope to catch the delicious Kottu (made by chef Skanda) again at the dinner buffet before I leave SL. Yum!!!!

We decided to go to Herritance Ahungalla during the Christmas holidays , this is three years after our first visit to the hotel. It was very encouraging to see the service was extremely good as it was three years ago, staff was very helpful and friendly , special note to be made on sous chef Manjula who was personally looking into the needs of the guests at the main restaurant , such a personal care make travelers feel very good. The room facilities were very good . The hotel is highly recommended

Our family 9 people visited the hotel yesterday, Sunday 06th January 2019 for day outing. The staff from the Resident Manager, Assistant Front Office Manager, F&B Manager and others were very helpful and given us the best assistance and support. The ambiance is really amazing. The pool is ideal for relaxation. The Drinks in the pool bar is so good especially the cocktails. The lunch buffet is a large spread. Overall we enjoyed the outing a lot and thank you all for looking after us.

With a 4.5 Tripadvisor rating, and nearly 3,000 people rating it either excellent or very good, itâ€™s hard to be the minority guest who complains, and this is perhaps the problem â€“ a little like The Emperorâ€™s New Clothes; if enough people say itâ€™s great, then surely it must be great ? Well no, not necessarily . . . while the hotel is very good in many respects, it has a few underlying failings that are not expected in a hotel of this grade, with the whole experience only held together by a brigade of (on the whole) excellent staff to detract from what was largely a disappointing stay in a number of respects. CHECK IN Absolutely 5 star; we did not even go to the desk; our luggage disappeared in one direction while we were led to the poolside bar and given cold fruit juice while our check-in was processed. We were then escorted to our room and shown the mini-bar, air-con, etc. Very difficult to fault, and a first class welcome. ACCURACY OF BOOKING The first let-down; we requested a top floor quiet room, not overlooking the pool. We got a 1st floor room, not only overlooking the pool with a sideways sea view, but directly over the pool bar. Due to the horse-shoe design around the pool, we assumed all rooms faced the pool; it was only a few days into our holiday we discovered an additional wing either side of this with garden / sea views. By this time we were well and truly unpacked, but how difficult would it have been to read our request and put us in the appropriate room on arrival? ROOM FACILITIES A little tired and showing signs of age, but on the whole everything you need. Excellent a/c that is on 24/7, unlike many hotels where it goes off when you remove your key card. Sliding door-type window blinds that gave a complete night time black-out. Safe in wardrobe, but on top of a small chest, so hanging anything above meant clothes draped over the safe â€“ obscuring the safe and creasing clothes. Extremely comfy beds with daily linen change; ditto daily towel change. Uncomfortable sofa in room and ditto 2 x chairs on balcony; not designed for long chilled evenings â€“ perhaps they would prefer you to be in the bar instead of drinking on your balcony? BATHROOM Excellent shower with toiletries topped up daily. Extraction not 100%, with lots of steam and condensation after showering. A down-side also is the hair dryer; hard-wired to a spur in the bathroom meaning 2nd person could not shower until 1st person had dried hair, or 1st person sat in the room with wet hair while 2nd person showered. Also no nozzle on hairdryer making styling impossible. A strange design of windows in the bathroom stud walls with Venetian blinds; lots of gaps all around, meaning you will need to be on very good terms with whoever you are sharing with. DINING The biggest disappointment of all; we had read all the reviews prior to booking, and were geared up for a feast of real Sri-Lankan buffet nightly; The reality was the same thin, on-the-bone chicken curry trotted out daily, with some variation of veg sides; biggest disappointment was that for the whole 10 days, including 2 Gala Dinners, we did not eat anything that was truly hot. All dishes, from breakfast through to the last dinner, were tepid or luke-warm, with some cold. The selection of dishes might be huge, but the quality is well, well below this grade of hotel. A big issue was the amount of large tables for 12 or more that dominated the dining room to accommodate the several large parties who were there; we struggled daily to find a table for 2 that was not sandwiched between one of these. The sound of grizzling children and loud parents all shouting over each other became the backdrop for all of our eating; the last time I ate in this type of environment was at Pontins Blackpool in 1990. A mass dining hall, not a 4/5 star hotel restaurant. YOUR FELLOW GUESTS We were told by several different staff members that rooms are routinely sold off at highly discounted rates to Sri Lankan and Indian families; not what you want to hear when you have just spent 5K on your holiday . . . This ensured a strange mix of European honeymoon couples, families who had booked through a tour operator, and a disproportionally huge amount of large families of 12-16 who had grabbed a bargain. This was echoed in the dress code â€“ or lack of â€“ in the restaurant, with people rolling up in beachwear and skimpy shorts, while reception was awash with people dashing from the pool to the lift in swimwear, dripping wet and soaking the tiled floors. More 3 star Spain in the 1980â€™s than a 4/5 star experience. THE STAFF Perhaps the nicest, calmest, and politest staff we have ever come across anywhere in the world, which I fear is what stops most people from complaining or â€˜making a fussâ€™. One or two exceptions; the cashier who, on our changing up money, threw back 2 x Â£20 notes with a sneer saying â€˜dirty money Madameâ€™ because they had pen marks on, (from the bank not us I may add); The boy on reception who, on being asked for help with train times, told my wife to â€˜look it up on lineâ€™ then took her phone, switched off flight mode, and connected her to International Roaming; cue a dozen updates and text messages from U.K. Thanks for that; we await our O2 bill with some trepidation. ENTERTAINMENT As above, more 1970â€™s than post-milenium, with the same dated song-book standards being peddled out nightly by a band who are in desperate need of a lead singer. NEW YEAR GALA DINNER This deserves a review in itâ€™s own right â€“ a band who had been warming up since 5.00 in the afternoon playing 80â€™s American rock at an ear-splitting volume; a D.J. who begins his set with Bohemian Rhapsody and Another Brick in the Wall; and best of all â€“ a beauty contest by the pool that started around 10.30 p.m. and resumed again after the New Year count-down. Once again, â€˜entertainmentâ€™ more worthy of Pontins or Haven than a luxury resort, and more to the point, a spectacle that the U.K. consigned to the history books some 40 years ago. As for the food; more of the same; a huge spread, and the work the kitchen put into creating a wonderful display was a marketing exersize worthy of Satchi and Satchi, with hundreds of photos appearing on Facebook and Instagram world-wide; sadly, nothing hot enough to enjoy. ACCURACY OF YOUR TAB ON CHECK-OUT This has to be the prize for staff member(s) most in need of re-training; On paying our bill at 7.00 a.m. on check-out day, we were amazed to see over Â£200 had been added as a â€˜half board surchargeâ€™ when we had booked and paid for half board with mercury holidays. Perhaps they hoped we would not notice? Well, we did, and the resulting argument was not a great start to the day. â€˜Sorry Sir, he is trainingâ€™ . . . , sorry, but training or not, somebody input the charge into the computer when it should have been absolutely clear what board basis we were booked in on. Another sting, (which we were aware of before arrival so we factored in) is the 10% service and 15% Govt. tax that is added to all advertised prices, making a hefty difference to your bottom line. IN SUMMARY A rather pretentious and tired hotel that could very easily be a great hotel if a few easy-fixes were put in place; This is unlikely however when the staff ask â€˜is everything okâ€™ and we all say â€˜oh yes; itâ€™s lovely . . . â€˜ They will continue doing more of the same until guest stop being in awe of the overall experience, wake up and smell the coffee, and politely tell them where they are going wrong.

I was there in July 2018 with my newly married wife. We used to travel around a world (from Europe, Asia to South America) and what we have to admit - we are very positively surprised by the local people whom we met in Sri Lanka. We are stunned by the kindness and warmness of the hotel's Heritance Ahungalla crew who was always ready to help us, talk and exchange experineces about local specialities - such as food, places worth to see or even costs that we should planned while traveling on our own. We would like to higly recommend them: Vimukthi Ishan, Jagath Vimukthi, Anuruddhi Bandara and Danuka Rakitna - ketachen chef, that gave us recepie for the best Egg Hoper ever! Thanks to this people our trip was even more memorable.

My return stay to Heritance Ahungalla once again was excellent. Points of interest would be the personalised service tendered by the front office staff as well as the food and beverage staff to attend to your special needs. The only point to improve would be the food quality at the pool bar was not up to standard. The snack menu offered also should be changed where a selection of local and continental food can be offered where the guest can order as most of guest stay at the pool area. A big thank you to Srinath ( FOM ) and the F/B team led Rasika.

A beautiful hotel, with a long sweeping drive down to an ornamental lake from where we could see through the spacious marble reception hall to the infinity pool and beyond to the beach and the sea. A perfect location. Everywhere was clean and well tended. The restaurants offered a wide variety of food and the evening entertainment was most enjoyable. There were ramps around the hotel for wheelchair users, but oddly no ramps to provide access to the restaurants. We had an excellent stay here. Geraldine and Frank

I am disappointed with Heritance,Ahungalla very much, for pick up taxi from the airport to the hotel did not appear in spite of calling and sending e-mail to request. Further worse, the hotel man said that this occasion had happened because I had not sent him confirmation e-mail and ordered me to call the taxi by myself when I telephoned him to help us with nervous at the air port. After all, I ordered him to arrange the taxi and my husband and I could reach the hotel by local uncomfortable taxi. When I arrived at the Hotel, he did not appear, and no one touched this situation. So I requested to meet him, but he did not appear. So I requested to meet the hotel manager, at last He appeared. He did not apology and insisted he had never received confirmation e-mail, but had done his best. So I showed him my mobile to prove sending him confirmation e-mail after 8 minute later his e-mail. He insisted that he had never received e-mail by showing me his mobile(perhaps he cut my confirmation e-mail)and at last unwillingly apologized me. This time, My husband sent e-mail to request the taxi~ no reply, then I sent e-mail~no reply. Then I telephoned to request taxi, and then received the e-mail with taxi fee and requesting confirmation reply, so I sent back shortly. Is Heritance Ahungalla good hotel? I have never meet such a rude and impolite hotel man like him. I sent my opinion to improve hotel by e-mail and left the hotel's questionnaire sheet, but I have not received anything.

We spent ten days in this beautiful hotel with great service. It's as a fairy time for us. Everyone is so smiling and so kindly. So calm and so peaceful, so restful. Luxury in natural environment. High standard in accommodation and service. Lovely meals with local accents. We have there wonderful wedding ceremony with so professional hotel's organisation. We spend there a lovely time and we wish to come back there in future. Very special thanks to Himasha for her special smile for us and so many professionalism in coordination of our wedding. From first minute we believe that we are in good hands and we don't disappoint :) It was great job ğŸ‘ and thanks for Tinko for special local delicious food. Thanks for all customer service - it was pleasure to be your guest :) Dorothy and Sebastian :)))))

Our extended family of 7 which included 3 adults, 3 children and a grandmother had the most perfect holiday in this heavenly hotel. The rooms are large and beautifully furnished. Spotlessly clean. They were cleaned and prepared twice a day. All the staff were so friendly and helpful. When our TV kept freezing, just a phone call to the reception at 10pm, and 2 engineers were at our door in 5 min. They replaced our TV immediately. The food was absolutely divine! Such a huge variety of food to suit both the local and the tourist palette. The two pools were wonderful. Plenty of comfortable seating around the pool, fresh towels and mats brought immediately. The children just adored playing in both pools. The beach was beautiful and the sea was paradise. There was nothing that could have made our holiday better. Thank you to all the staff and the management. We will certainly be back when we return to Sri Lanka.

Compared to other hotels in the Heritance chain, I believe that Heritance Ahungalla has a long way to go. We had arrived to the hotel at around 1.30PM knowing that the check-in time is 2PM, however due to their high occupancy the previous day, we were only checked into our room at 3.30PM. The food definitely has room for so much improvement despite the large variety. Some meals very excellent and some were very poor. There wasn't any consistency maintained in the quality of the food. For example; the day we arrived, lunch was excellent but the dinner buffet was terrible. Rooms are very spacious and comfortable. Surroundings and environment is very beautiful and peaceful, loved the beach! The housekeeping service was quite efficient and without any time restriction was willing to clean the rooms. Overall staff was very friendly and helpful, which made the staff very pleasant. Overall I'd grade the hotel as a 4* Star but definitely enjoyed our 3-day stay

Not at all a 5 star hotel. Would have chosen a better hotel for this price and facilities. Itâ€™s a mediocre 3 star hotel. Front staff made us wait for 1 hr before handing over keys to our rooms. Bathroom was clogged. No response by housekeeping. Paid for sea view facing rooms instead got pool side rooms. Would not stay or recommend to stay at this place.

Food were really delicious and room service were good and also their staff Good hotel for enjoy with family or friends or couples . Parking available Spa available Dance floor available Rooms are superb

It is a very good hotel with excellent facilities. Verity of food international and local . Friendly staff. 2 swimming pools. one is specially allocated for in house guests . SPA and various other facilities. Lovely place

I woul not recommend this hotel. Specially if you plan to come here on vacation during weekdays. They host weddings and the noise level is really high. We experienced this on a Thursday night where the band that was playing, played until 11 pm at night. It is not a relaxing experience. The noise was overwhelmingly loud. We called the management but they said the loud outdoor music will go on till 11 pm. The service at the restaurants were very slow and unresponsive too. The bars served cocktails that wasn't made properly. It was a disappointing experience at this hotel for us. Will not return here

We are absolutely amazed by our experience with Heritance Ahungala. It's top class from the time we arrived to our check out. The hotel itself is amazing but the attention to detail given by its staff is what really sets it apart. We would like to give a special thanks to Rukmal who took care of our room, went that extra step to make us feel comfortable, and even made beautiful figurines out of towels â¤ï¸. Also Sous Chef D. J. Manjula for making sure our dining experience was exceeding our expectations. One can't go wrong with choosing Heritance hotels as so far our stays with them is just magical! Vin and Olle

All the house keeping and decorating work like towel arts impressed us a lot. Heâ€™s a nice guy always smiling and very helpful. His good morning and good evening was always heart felt. Heâ€™s an employee of worth. Made us feel like home. Thank you

Super good location, big suitable rooms, very very friendly personal. Always everywhere clean. Kitchen is excellent and good choices of food. Pool is very good. Lot of attention to children. Every evening animation.

What takes away your breath is the infinity pool and the beach alongside the hotel property. The Christmas decorations just added more color and festivity to the season! Rooms are spacious and fully equipped with essential amenities. The buffet spread is like amazing even for a vegetarian person. Variety of desserts were superb! Even the spread of food items in the restaurant was carefully placed such that they could accommodate the guests in a comfortable way. One of the most luxurious hotels in the Southern Coastline of Sri Lanka with effortless service and hospitality. Keep up the good work!

This is our one of the favourite hotel. We love to come here. Everything was perfect. Specially the staff and the service was excellent... Nothing to complain.. Enjoyed the stay very much and we will be back for sure...

Had a wonderful experience and staff is excellent and well experienced. foods are tasty and me and all staff members with family members enjoyed a lot. We had 4 trips with around 535 pax. All are appreciate this trip.

Just spent 2 weeks at the Heritance Ahungalla, and cannot fault it in any way. Rooms cleaned daily, linen changed daily, towels changed twice daily. Staff on hand at all times, and they were so helpfull. Nothing too much trouble for them. Highly recommend this hotel and would certainly go back.

From the second we arrived the service from the staff was first class. Nothing was ever too much trouble. Welcomed with a hot flannel and drink, check in was simple and effortless, rooms are a good standard, clean and have all you require. Daily cleaning and twice daily towel change are just added touches the hotel provide. Bars, restaraunt and pools are first class.

Loved everything about this hotel the beach view is amazing along with swimming pool and breakfast was great. Coming here was great experience and had amazing time and definitely worth visiting it again

We have had the best weeks holiday at the Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel rooms are clean and modern 10/10, we had an ocean view deluxe room. The overal hotel is 5 star 10/10. The staff are FANTASTIC, they bend over backwards for you. Nothing is ever too much trouble. I need to mention one member of staff Waruna who absolutely made our holiday. He is AMAZING. Thank you to regards the Parker Family x

We took two rooms for 1 night, Overall it was a good stay. Deluxe rooms are very old and not recommended to anyone, There were bugs and mosquitos in Deluxe room. Therefore, We upgraded to Premier rooms. Special thank to front office officer Shanika for her great assistance. I truly recommend Shanika as a Polite, Professional employee.

I didnt stay here but stopped for lunch on my way to Colombo from Galle. The property looks amazing, with its own secluded beach. Lunch was wonderful. The lasagne and asian prawns with rice were both extremely tasty.

We had a lovely time in this beautiful hotel.This is our first visit and we will come back again. Food was very good and we enjoyed our stay a lot. The view is amazing and this hotel is a superb place to relax.

I have been visiting Heritance Ahungalla almost yearly for more than 10 years now. The food and staff service towards the guests has been to the highest standard. Most importantly this has been maintained consistently throughout the years, which is a great feat.

This hotel is crazy. Everything from the welcoming to departure was awesome. Everybody is smiling and every time. Rooms are very clean, WiFi excellent, and the food... the food ... IT IS REALLY GOOD. Great view from the room with beautiful sunset, the staff is really friendly. I recommend this hotel for any occasion

We take the Chance, to say â€thank youâ€œ to all the People, who are working in the Heritance Ahungalla. You make it really oomfortable to the guests. Special greetings to our roomservice, Mr. Rukmal. He is a really wonderful person and he is doing a wonderful job, that gives us the feeling of beeing special guests. With best regards, your guests from room 133, Nicola and Axel

Heritable Ahungalla is a wonderful place to relax and enjoy.. it has a superb beach... we came here to spend the day with my family.. but definitely we will be back to stay one or two days... thank you for the wonderful hospitality...

Very peaceful hotel with beautiful pools. So nice to wake to the sound of waves...and the best breakfast in Sri Lanka...Rukmal left a nice surprise in the name of our favourite NZ cricketer on our bed with swan and hibiscus ;-)

A hotel on the beach where time is lost to total relaxation. Great food with chef prepared to do specials and house keeping prepared to attend to all your needs. Some rather special towel creations adds a special Sri Lankan delight. Amazing!

Stayed here for a week recently during the Galle test match, the hotel is located right on the beach, the staff were very friendly and couldnâ€™t be more helpful. The restaurant serves decent varieties of food and all were delicious. The pools serving the hotel were again both excellent. If in the area well worth checking this hotel out.

we spent our day with my family it was fantastic.friendly staff and excellent service.nice view..enjoyed main pool..recommended to my friend who want to have relax your holiday.defenently we are coming back and thanks for all staff.

We just came to spend our day, that was fantastic and we enjoyed a great time here. Food and service was excellent and it was very yummy. We would like to recommend this hotel to everyone because this place is very beautiful.

This is our secondvvusit to this beautiful place...staf and the service is amazing here.also food is fabulous ..spcially the sunday buffet with lots of selection.. excellent hospitality we ever had....

We had a lovely, great time with my family. Enjoyed the pool, food and the fantastic service of the hotel. Everyone was so friendly and we love the time we spend here. Special thanks to Resident Manger Manoj and his team at Heritance for the memorable stay.

A unique hotel, great service, but itâ€™s getting old and needs work Whilst the room (suite) was large and well appointed, the bathroom in particular needs renovation. Itâ€™s just getting old and needs work. In particular the shower over a massive spa bath would be very difficult for someone unsteady on their feet to get into - apart from holding on to the glass shower screen there was nothing to hold on to. There was areas of the hotel obviously no longer used, an upstairs bar above reception was empty, the locked billiards room, and the empty kids club were all looking sad and unloved. With some investment in the rooms and some public areas this hotel could easily beat the new chain hotels springing up

This place is the best to relax. Service is the best among all and the taste of the yummy food and drinks cannot forgot. Whenever I wanna relax definitely visit this place at anytime. Without any hesitation I can recommend this place to anyone.

We just came for a short break with my friends,food and drinks are really good and we enjoyed our time.Hope to come back again and we will recommend the lovely hotel to all. Friendliness of the staff is the best .

this was my 2nd visit.and its been a pleasure stay.room was clean,food was good only down side was the service of the stewards.had to wait more than 30 minutes for a coffee.and they go pass us like they are deaf even when i call them.

My family and me (including 2 senior citizens) visited this beautiful hotel this November. Every thing about it is great Lovely property, extremely warm and friendly staff and scrumptious food. Being a pure vegetarian family they made special arrangements for us for the food. We took the half board deal (Breakfast and dinner). Not only is the property good but the rooms are equally enjoyable. Neat clean and quick service. A 10/10 rating for Heritance Ahangulla

We stayed a week on an all inclusive deal. Very friendly, relaxed atmosphere on the beach. Lovely room, good size and quiet. Two pools, each with a bar serving good food and snacks whenever you require.the hotel restaurants also offer amazing choice of food each evening, the Sri Lankan food is wonderful. The hotel also will organise short trips to see the local sites, and a day trip to Galle is recommended. Thoroughly recommended for a week to get away from it all. Although quite a large hotel we always felt there were not too many people around, and the pools were not crowded when we stayed on the property. Staff lovely too.

Heritance ahangulla ...sound of waves .. feel the wind and sand.. awesome ambience ... stunning pools to relax ... live music ... a disotheque .... something for all ages .. a fun place to be in with family and friends

The hotel is a beautiful Bawa designed property with an impressive lobby that overlooks and infinitely pool that goes out to the edge of the beach with the ocean just beyond. The rooms are large and well maintained. But the food was really below average and the service bordered on the indifferent. The dining hall staff were really quite awful and looked and behaved like they hated their job. Tables not cleared, no one coming to check on you etc. Very disappointing on that end. The housekeeping and the rest if the staff were good. Will not return.

For the fourth time I had the pleasure to stay at Heritance Ahungalla Hotel. Again it was very pleasant to find the same welcoming and authentic staff members as the times before with their wonderful friendliness. The hotel is wonderfully designed and "hidden" in a beautiful garden: the first thing you see when you get out of the car is the gorgeous infinity pool and the open reception area, where there is always a pleasantly cool breeze. The two pools are very clean and beautifully maintained early in the morning. The pool guards are extremely helpful in arranging sun beds and parasols according to the guest's wishes. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The housekeeping personell are extremely flexible and helpful. The restaurant offers excellent buffets (from breakfast to dinner) with a plentiful variety of local and other Asian dishes. The kitchen personnel with their Chef take great effort in spoiling their guests. I will definitely visit Heritance Ahungalla Hotel again.

This magnificently designed hotel is a few hours north of Galle, on the sea. Like other great Sri Lankan hotels the foyer/reception area is open so there is a wonderful, gentle sea breeze cooling the reception area even on the hotest day. There are 2 separate pools, both clean, and beautifully maintained. There is a huge tree ocer one them providing natural shade. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The buffet is plentiful but you can also order a la carte in a separate area of the dining room. The breakfast is excellent - so many choices. I had the best omelette I had on my trip (and I a few good ones). As in other Heritance hotels in Sri Lanka, the staff are welcoming, polite and honest. You're on the beach - but you can't swim as there's a dangerous rip. But, oh well, the pool's pretty nice anyway. You can always go for a walk on the beach instead. It felt so luxurious and its actually very reasonably priced.

We hadan amazing time at this beautiful place... we came here for our honeymoon ...beautiful hotel with a lovely beach..we really enjoyed our stay... staff is very friendly abd helpful ..we will come back for sure....

Everytime I passed this hotel on my way to Down South and back there was something in this place which made me to go and have a stay in this awesome place. As I am always passionate about our Sri Lankan architect Mr. Geoffrey Bawa's designs, this was an ideal place for me. The pool area was very relaxing and enjoyed freedom to the maximum level in it. Loved the room interior and food served in the buffet. Hotel staff was also well trained and friendly..

This was an amazing place i have seen. I loved the way you welcoming the guests. Very friendly and always smiling staff. Rooms were Superb...high standard...Foods at the jude restaurant was amazing...every single meal has a burst of favours... The staff at restaurant was very helpful and service was high five... Overall extremely safe extremely clean and extremely beautiful every where... Specialy my thanks for Mr.Lakshitha , Mr.Thushara , Mr.Praveen , Mr.Nipun , Mr.Liyanage and Mrs. Himasha with all executive staff gave a warm welcome on arrival. And thank you soo much for the f&b staff for everything you offered me on my stay and thank you for front office crew for the upgraded. Thank you Randika & Belldesk staff for done a well checking. Finally all of you are doing fantastic.. I loved the hospitality and service quality received from the begging to the end...keep up the standards and improve your service ahead..... Highly recommended ğŸ‘ğŸ¼ Thank you Heritance Ahungalla team you all deserve every success.... see you again....

I dropped in to this resort with my Wife for lunch while returning home from a meeting. Loved the welcome and the super hospitality by the front office crew and loved the juice cart that goes around serving the exotic juices .. i have been visiting this resort even before it re branded .. its indeed a beautiful resort . Not too happy on the Spread they had for the Buffet Lunch for the price paid .. but indeed the quality of the food that was there was 5 star.. it was a very basic spread .. May be it was due to the low occupancy.. i loved the hospitality and service quality received from the begging to the end .. keep up the good work and improve on the Buffer spread on weekdays ..

Got upgraded to the luxury suite free of charge. Lunch and Breakfast buffet were exceptionally better than Dinner. Suite room should have had a jacqousi instead of the typical bath tub. Staff was great

The ultimate dream of a hotel. I had my wedding here and every single guest is looking to return for a holiday. The Best service ever experienced. Highly recommend it. Extremely safe extremely clean and extremely beautiful in every way. Food is out of this world. Every single meal has a burst of flavours. Thank you Heritance Ahungalle team You all deserve every success Thanks Omarah

Set in a beautiful beach location this property offers good standard of accomadation and good service at an affordable price. Would recommend to anyone travelling this way. A great find is if you take the two minute walk down the beach go to the Sun Shine Restaurant for great fresh sea food

We had a really good time here, food was a good standard with plenty of choice. The room was clean but I didnâ€™t like having blinds on the bathroom window as you could still see in through the gaps - I like privacy in the bathroom. The staff are all very friendly and helpful- it was a shame thee is nowhere to tip that is shared between them as you canâ€™t tip everyone constantly. The taxi/trip drivers are a bit irritating and you canâ€™t even walk on the beach without being surrounded by them, this was the only down side that we found. They also try to sell trips to you in reception and one man was visibly annoyed with us because we had chosen to book with our TUI rep. Some people might find this intimidating. We would recommend a massage in the spa, wonderful! The pools are kept very clean and tidy, we spotted monkeys and a snake near the quiet pool. All in all we had a fabulous holiday, thank you to Heritance Ahungalla.

From the first instance, to the welcome received at the entrance to everything else after this hotel is just amazing! We stayed for two nights and even through the weather was not good, we still enjoyed the pool in the rain and did not feel claustrophobic at all as the rooms were very big. The best part of this hotel is the staff and the irresistible food ! Staff was very friendly and warm and welcoming, especially Varuna who served us most of the time. He was always friendly and hospitable. The buffet variety was different everyday and we enjoyed it very much because after visiting many hotels in Sri Lanka and tired of having the same food everywhere, it was great to see the wide spread and different choices. Well done to the management on making the initiative to be different and making the effort to offer the best food we had ! We also enjoyed the many amenities in the hotel, the pool, bar and spa. We loved our stay and definitely will return again, and I hope it would be still be same ğŸ‘ğŸ».

Iâ€™ve visited this hotel several times in the past, so I knew what to expect. I have to say that they have improved even more and the service was excellent. Chef Manjula and his staff went over and above to make sure we were well served. He had the kitchen bring out something special for my daughter who didnâ€™t fancy some of the desserts. The food had a good mixture of local and international cuisine. The beach and swimming pool was so gorgeous and such a beautiful experience being in such beautiful surroundings.

I donâ€™t have anything bad to say , But I donâ€™t understand why they let pest ( Ferrell)dogs wondering around the hotel, and other concern is smokers got all the rights, we couldnâ€™t find any where not smoking signs maybe hotel management not keep up with world trend about non smokers rights , please fix this we will be back surely Thanks

Arrived after a very long journey. Had a lovely warm greeting. The pool and sea that you see in front of you makes it all feel worth the long journey. We was taken to our room, we booked sea view with king size bed. We was taken to room 235, we immediately declined as the shower was so small, you would have struggled to turn or even wash in it! But also i took photos of how dirty and grubby the shower was as well. We called down to reception and someone came to our room straight away. We stated this was not acceptable for a 2 week stay, but another reason is that my partner is 6' 1", not the smallest of people. They said that was ok, and would show us 2 other rooms. The 1st other room, the shower was just as grubby and grimy as the original room, i said no thank you. She then took us to a ground floor room that was 100% better, it wasn't that much bigger in size but it had twin beds (pushed together to make a king size) and from the doors outside over looked the garden and residents pool. We said that was much cleaner but did not have the requirements we booked and paid ALOT of money for. She told us this is all that was available, so we had to accepted one of the rooms, so we accepted this one. I asked if there was an extra charge and she said yes, 30 us dollars a night extra. We said we was going to complain to our travel company and she said no and to come to reception with her. We then saw a Manager, who was very friendly and said it was fine and there would be no extra charge. After 24 hours door to door this is the last thing i expected. i was hot and tired and we have been to the Indian Ocean many many times and never experienced this. It was disappointing. But all in fairness to the staff, they were great. We paid alot of money and made two requests and ended up with neither. We have always had a sea view and king size bed. What made it worse, was my partner proposed to me on our journey and it was fantastic, he organised alot of it with Emirates but this experience seemed to dampen it a bit. The hotel staff are so so friendly, they always make an effort to say good morning/afternoon. The hotel itself does need updating in some parts, especially the rooms. The entrance takes your breath away and to be honest, with that and the staff, it makes you not want to say anything bad, but you have to be honest. The food tastes great but very repetitive. Not a great choice. The sous chefs are absolutely fantastic. My partner had an upset belly for about 4 days, chef cooked him fillet streak quite a few times, they really go out of there way to help you. But i found i was mainly eating rice and salad. Weekends they have a bbq night, but again, the other stuff is all the same. The waiter/waitress were great, they get to know you, your room number and your drinks order. But they will come and clear the plates even if one of you are still eating. One night, a waitress started wiping the table whilst my partner was still eating, i had to ask her to stop. The pool attendant around the residential pool was lovely. He put our towels out every morning and greeted us when we arrived. Always spoke to us and said about places to visit. If you want to go out anywhere, expect a journey. Galle is lovely, the fort, the lighthouse and all the little shops down the lanes. There is a private museum there also which is very interesting. The tsunami museum was extremely upsetting and very humbling. The lady whos house was rebuilt, lost absolutely everything, even all memeber of her family, but still manages to smile. Some of the photos in there are upsetting, but it happened to them. We gave her a donation but wish we could have done more. The statue along Galle Road, is something to stop and see. Then you have some idea of how big the wave that came and hit this town was. We also went on a safari, 3 and half hours to get there, then 3-4 hours the jeep. It was ok, but a long way to go. we didnt get out of a car from 5am, transferred to jeep at 8.30am, then back into a car just gone mid day to return to the hotel. It was a very long day. Felt like travelling really. Outside the hotel you will get asked for a tuk tuk straight away. The guys walk down the road with you. They are harmless but we just wished they would leave us alone, but you dont want to be rude to them. But if you want an ATM, its about a 10 min walk, so you dont really have much choice. The beach is nice, this is the first time we have been to the Indian Ocean and have not seen sun loungers and parasols on the beach. You can certainly walk along the beach, but no one seems to relax on it!! They have a few shows on in the evening and there are a few bars for the evening. Overall, very relaxing holiday. Food ok, could have more choice. Staff very friendly, hotel needs updating.

A lovely hotel. Large, clean rooms, although with a lot of 'dead' space, could perhaps have been designed slightly better. We weren't happy with our original room and at first the staff were reluctant to move us saying there were no spare rooms. But when we were insistent, one materialised. The food and bar were great and the main pool was stunning. The secondary pool was also nice and much quieter. Lots to see and do in the area so well worth a stay. Would stay again.

Had a great time at the Heritance for my friend's wedding. Excellent service and the wedding was really well organised. Good food, great location and professional staff. Highly recommended - I thoroughly enjoyed

We love this beautiful place, view and the food is amazing. Service of the staff is very good and they are very helpful always.We always Enjoy our time with friends and it is a very relaxing hotel to spend holiday.

Eighty miles south of Colombo is 'Heritance Ahungalle', the five star resort hotel located on a 25 acre land. The road leading to the property is surrounded by trees and thick coconut groves on both sides ends at the large beautiful lotus pond in front of the hotel. Pleasant traditional welcome by the the staff, and we are into one of the legendary Geoffrey Bawa's architectural fantasies, designed as 'Triton'. The feeling of the spaciousness of the lounge and the picture-framed view of the sea, still comes back to my mind. It's a pleasure to meet again the General Manager Mr. Sisira Senaratne, a veteran and a iconic figure in the leisure industry, who won the prestigious TUI Top Quality award for 'Heritance Ahungalle', who is more than happy to see us there. Well maintained garden, two large outdoor swimming pools, the Infinity and Green (which has a tree stretches down almost inside the pool) also has a jacuzzi and a pool bar providing cool and refreshing thirst quenchers. There is a tennis / badminton court, a fitness centre with rowing, running and cross trainer machines including a weights section. Welcomed by Mr. Rasika Ratnayake, Food & Beverage Manager of Heritage Ahungalla another veteran of the hotel industry, had our lunch at 'Jute Restaurant', which have a nice view of the garden, pool and ocean. Apparently the name 'Jute' name is from the unusual blend of colours from the Ena de Silva batik-on-jute ceiling which provides dappled reflections. The buffet is Sri Lankan and International cuisine consisting of appetizers, soups, many kinds of salads, several kinds of breads, Rice, noodles, meat, chicken seafood and vegetables. There was a live action food station cooking prawns too, which we enjoyed very much. Many kinds of delicious desserts and freshly cut fruits. Ours is only a day outing yet we had an excellent time with some of the friendliest and most welcoming people you could wish to meet. Great place to be on a weekend day outing on top of a wedding and honeymoon desination.

The best thing about the hotel is the food and the location, perfect to relax with the breeze of the sea. I will recommend this place to anyone who wants to spend a relaxing time with friends and family.

We had an amazing time at this hotel, during which we held a wedding ceremony and party with our friends and family. The hotel has 2 big pools and is directly on the beach. The staff were amazing in helping us arrange the wedding and catering to the needs of the party, in total there was 31 in the group. All the staff were amazing but in particular Shanika & Paveen created an event to remember and took away any stress we may have had in organizing everything. We had a ceremony on the beach followed by a BBQ, and the use of the on site nightclub. Everyone had a great day. All the party commented on how good the food was, we even had vegans and vegetarians who were happy with the food on offer. We will definitely be coming back to this hotel, as we have created many special memories here. We can highly recommend anyone coming to stay as you'll have an amazing time.

I've just returned home from Sri Lanka and a wedding, Kad and Chloe, at this lovely hotel. It was a really nice place to stay and a beautiful wedding. Many thanks to all the helpful staff for making this occasion all the more special for the happy couple.

They have a nice environment to relax with in both beach & huge pool. Room are tidy & nice. Everything is perfect except the buffet. The food was horrible on our stay, specially the lunch. Breakfast was quite good comparing to other meals. Staff is friendly.

Heritance Ahungalla was the destination of the annual trip organized by our company this year. We had a large crowd which was 200+ adults and children. Just after entering the property from the Colombo-Galle main road we felt the difference. Most of the hotels in the area just opens up to the main road but this was not. After following beautifully paved path surrounded with trees, the main building of the hotel appeared which had a large pond in front of it which was again a very pleasant sight. Once our buses arrived the staff scrambled to help the crowd with luggage and welcome them. They have arranged a special desk for us to handle the check-in. Everything went very smoothly and we saw a very coordinated effort of the staff. The hotel itself is gorgeous. Once you are in the lounge you could feel it being infinitely spacious. The swimming pool, the beach and the sea which are next to each other amplify it greatly fulfilling the vision of the architect Geoffrey Bawa (As I have learned later after watching the intro video on the room TV). The rooms were very good with all the necessary amenities and very clean. Me and my colleagues were very satisfied with it. The RFID card based key system was very nice. No need to play around with keys and very easy to carry around. Never seen it in any of the other older hotels. The main restaurant served yummy food to us. Though the buffet spread is not very large when compared to the hotels in Colombo it was complete with all the necessary bits and pieces. And it was consistent and tasty. And the restaurant staff provided us a great service. They handled our large crowd seamlessly. The service was available when ever you need it. And they were very welcoming too. In most of the other places the services usually degrade with crowd but here we didnâ€™t see it. This was the best service we get during our yearly trips so far. Kudos. Keep it up. Though I mentioned about the staff here and there above I felt that they deserve a dedicated section. Overall, I am very impressed by the quality of the service we received from the staff during our stay. Starting from the front desk they were welcoming, helpful and almost always ready for our requests. So far, we never had this smooth check-in anywhere throughout the past years. Just after the trip I mentioned about the quality of service to one of my school friends and he confirmed it. Kudos guys & gals. Though our stay was very short it was very enjoyable thanks to the beautiful hotel and its great staff. Thank you very much. We would love to return in future.

Yet another beautiful stay with lasting memories,at the Heritance Ahungalla hotel.From the moment we stepped in till the time we stepped out,we were important to them.The warmth of their beautiful smiles remains in our hearts forever. Mr.Thushara and Mr.Nipun,Thank you once again for your commitment,your efforts and the responsibility shown to make our stay worthwhile.We highly appreciate The General manager Mr.Sisira Senarathne,Mr.Thushara , Mr.Nipun,and the whole team at the restaurant,for their genuine interest in making the guests feel so important.We would like to wish you great success,in all your future endeavours.You are a great asset to the company.Thank you so much.

Very relaxing place with a beautiful beach..food is amazing. Specially the weekend Lucy buffet.. two large swimming pool where you can relax and enjoy..staff is very friendly and helpful...thank for the wonderful hospitality..

We had a lovely time at this beautiful place.. the bean is really beautiful and very relaxing holiday..our room was excellent and spacious..staff and the service is amazing..we will be back for sure ...

Went for our company trip. CMS. Hotel is very nice as well as the staff. Lunch and breakfast is perfectly. However Saturday night dinner only had few options. We stayed in room 24x. Room had a bad smell. Not sure if it is too much air freshener. However it is a mood killer for us.

Beautiful place and hotel, although little old. What was annoying was the staff calling us from 11 am to vacate the room, it looks like the operational ease has taken over customer care in this place, despite the fact that we arrived previous night late and had very little time(less than 15 hours), we requested to stay late in one room vacating the other....no concern at all, just a nice smile on the face donâ€™t mean anything if no serious customer centric culture is cultivated! little thought for the GM to think about!

This was my second visit to your hotel. Good service , front office Ms. sashini is very helpful , thank you so much for your help. Room service also good , thank you very much for your excellent service ROSHINIE

This was our second visit to you hotel after 10 years. From the time we arrived at the hotel and up to the time of departure, we were taken care of by the staff of the hotel as if we were their family. The service and the courtesy provided by all the staff is unbelievably. We were treated like royalty. The room was spacious and very comfortable and had all the amenities. The toilet was very clean. The food was very tasty and the buffet spread was great, even when the occupancy was less on Sunday night and Monday morning. We only used limited facilities at the hotel such as the swimming pool (both) and gymnasium, which are of very high standard. Overall my family (wife and 2 kids) experienced a very enjoyable and relaxing time at you luxurious hotel. We will definitely visit your hotel again in the future and recommend the hotel to our friends and family. Thank you "Team Heritance, Ahungalla".

Nice place for a family outing.. Excellent service, good food, and relaxing environment. Staff is really friendly and helpful..Rooms are neat and tidy though sime are but old.. They have got evening entertaintment like magic shows...etc. Night club on saturdays...

Perfect destination to enjoy a relaxed and cheerful break. Wonderful service and delicious food. @ Shanika, thank you so much for your great service. You made our day here. Absolutely worth the deal to spend the day ğŸ‘ğŸ˜

This hotel is really nice and just at the lovely beach - the first impression is really wow! Rooms are nice, spacious and cleaned every day - small tips can makes 'miracles':) Service is good, however Staff' English is a little bit poor and you are expected to leave a tip for everything. Sellers are around the hotel but also managing to get into hotel area trying to sell trips, goods, etc. That was a bit too much but understand that is their only source of money...The village is poor so not surprising that all tuk tuk drivers are waiting outside the hotel to offer you a trip, lift, whatever just to make some money - of course they will give you 5 times higher price so dont take any offer until negotiate and agreed the price before you get into tuk tuk - they can be a bit aggressive too. The only one we can recommend is Kamal - blue tuk tuk. When you walking along the main street, there will be plenty tuk tuk stopping and urge you go with them, so you need to be assertive and patient at the same time. When you go to the local shop they will also try to offer you a trip, tuk tuk etc. of course few times more expensive but you dont know the prices so they take an advantage on you. My advise dont buy any trip, arrange for tuk tuk ntil you check few offers. We got riped off on the 1st day terribly, but i guess we let that to happened too. We were using also public transport to travel around - blue buses are crazy I mean the drivers, its like rally really... but very cheap 35 rp to Bentotta, or same distance, 100 to Galle. Red buses (national bus services) are even cheaper. Beaches are lovely, but there is also plenty rubbish which is really sad. Tsunami damages are still visible - its worth to visit the museum and pay respect to all victims. Mind Moon stone mines trips - the prices are cosmic and you will be nothing but pushed to buy something - we had very bad experience with that. Its better to go to the recommended shop (i seen quite few on TA, however only checked them after not prior to going to the moon stone mine). As for the Hotel, the food is good, but pretty much repeatable, mainly orientated on meat eaters, as a Vegetarian or Vegan you have very limited options (dhal curry - was my everyday meal :) There is entertainment every night, but there was not many people attending, so was a bit lonesome. Except for the culture show (inc. fire eaters!) in the garden during dinner - just amazing! Only on the second last day of our stay we found out there was a night club - nothing great but would be nice if there are any directions signs or at least sign above the entrance. In general the hotel is nice, but a bit like a prison when you go outside the gate Good but not excellent. if we go to Sri Lanka again I would prefer staying in many places as travel across the island

This is our first time in this lovely hotel and we enjoyed food, and pool with our kids. Both pools are huge and very nice. Our room was so large and it was very comfortable for my family with the kids. Thank you for the great hospitality.

We had a really nice time with my kids and family, food is yummy and the huge room is perfect for a family. The two pools are cool. We can recommend this lovely place to everyone and hope to see you all soon.

Very friendly and helpful staff... rooms are little bit old and tried... need to be updated.. but the hotel is very beautiful.. swimming pools are amazing... specially the green with with the Jacuzzi...
