beautiful place to relax and enjoy....we had a lovely room with a nice sea view.. staff is very friendly and helpful.. Also the food and rhe service is fabulous... thank you for the great hospitality.. we will come back again....

This hotel is beautiful and our stay was quite enjoyable. The rooms were such a relief after days of hostels and camping, the staff are very helpful and the beach is lovely. The entrance is perhaps misleading in how luxurious the rest of the hotel really is, but it isn't an issue.

We have always wanted to stay at this hotel and this was the first time we had an opportunity. We stayed recently for a few days whilst visiting Sri Lanka. The hotel really needs to be updated, compared to other beach hotels this hotel stands out for being old and dated. Not a good place to be. The rooms are a good size and comfortable but everything needs to be modernised. The food was quite nice and really enjoyed our dinner and breakfast. The hotel is overlooking the sea and the views are great. Both swimming pools are really big and very conveniently placed. The staff make up for the disappointing look of the hotel. They are extremely nice and helpful. They really made our stay and amazing one. The price paid Â£ 155-160/- per night per room is really not a fair price for this hotel. Hence will not return.

Heritance ahungalla is one of our favourite hotels where we can relax and enjoy the holiday ...the room was excellent withtwo big beds ..bathroom is very clean..we will come back again yo this beautiful place

Another Inheritance hotel designed by Geoffrey Bawa but this one, unlike Kandalama, is brutishly concrete and a bit worn. Service and restaurant quality are also jaded. Room and bathroom very good.This is a luxury hotel struggling to hold a 4-star rating. Located on the beach, it has two quality pools and nice grounds. The entrance to the hotel is more impressive than what waits behind. Criticism is intended to be mild because this place is ok, just not up to the best Sri Lanka can offer.

We have just returned from a fabulous 2 week honeymoon in Sri Lanka. We had stayed in 3 fab places before our final stop at The Heritance. From looking at the website and booking the holiday through a luxury travel agent, it looked like it was going to be a lovely retreat to relax in for 5 days. Unfortunately this wasnâ€™t quite the case... I had e-mailed and Facebook messaged the hotel the day before arrival. I asked whether they had any suites or some of their best rooms available to upgrade to, as we were on our honeymoon and wished for something extra special. The responded via Facebook asking for my e-mail address so that they could forward information on. I responded and I didnâ€™t get anything back. I then e-mailed them directly-nothing back again!! Nothing was said on check in...no special greeting...nothing. We were taken to our room, I told the lady taking us there that I had e-mailed and wanted to make sure we got a sea view. She was quite dismissive. When we got to our room, it was ground floor level taking us straight out to the pool. You could hear the sea, but defiantly couldnâ€™t see it. The room was pleasant enough-modern with a big bed but definatly not 5 star. There was a congratulations cake on the table to great us (we had one at most places we stayed to be honest). But that was the only thing we got to feel special. No one asked whether we would like to organise a special dinner etc etc. As the cake was so big, it was going to take us several days to eat it. Housekeeping could have taken it away and put it in the fridge, but instead it was left out on the side to attract ants. We were just overall a bit disappointed...it was defiantly more of a family hotel and there were kids everywhere the whole weekend we were there and breakfast was crazy-we thought that the hotel was opening up the restaurant and pool to non residents at the weekend. The restaurant needs a facelift for sure as it again did not feel like 5* dining. At breakfast we always waited patiently to be seated, once seated the waitress or waiter would hurry off without asking whether we would like tea or coffee. I then had to try and grab someoneâ€™s attention again so it basically took 15 minutes to get a hot drink. A little poor for 5*. We had lunch via room service a couple of days and that was pleasant enough-very little choice but if you like chips and sandwiches then itâ€™s fine. They had no samosas and very few of the wines on the extensive wine list on show. I had to chose 3 different wines before finally getting the 4th one I asked for. Also if you like cocktails, you will be disappointed as the ones I had at the hotel were not very nice. We only ate dinner in the restaurant once during our 5 night stop, as we decided we would get better service and food elsewhere. The fine dining restaurant had no people in on any of the nights we were there and we just couldnâ€™t think of anything worse than the madness of that buffet restaurant again. Where the staff were in attentive and miserable. Sorry Heritance but we just expected more Iâ€™m sorry. And to top it all off we got a phone call the morning of check-out just to make sure we were checking out on time or if we had booked a late check out. And a bill pushed through the door the night before. Come on...it was low season, hotel was not busy at all and we were on our honeymoon. Every morning we were woken at 5am by noisy people checking out of their rooms or walking in high heels right above our bedroom. With being on the ground floor, we were right on the main drag for people moving around. If we had been higher up with a lovely sea view, then we would have hopefully had some peace and quiet.

This is my 2nd time at the hotel. We were allocated a spacious room. The hotel was at full capacity. The F& B managers were very good and helpful. The rooms were clean but I felt the housekeeping service lacked quite a bit. There was a cultural show and many kids activities. On the downside I was a little annoyed when the hotel had left a letter under my door reminding me about our check out for the next day. I had paid in full for both days and I feel such a reminder was not required. A family friendly hotel overall.

This is our second visit to the Heritance Ahungalla. Excellent place for a vacation over the beach. Great hospitality. Very friendly staff and very helpful. Luxurious and comfortable rooms with all the amenities. Two beautiful large pools with nice surrounding. Very clean hotel. Good food with lots of choices and variations. My two kids were enjoyed a lot. Both were very very sad at the time of checkout. Hope to visit again.

We had a very relaxing time with my family. We enjoy our stat a lot. Food and service is great. The two pools near by beach are amazing in this beautiful place. We will come back soon and thanks for the great hospitality.

We had a great time with our friends. Food is so tasty and pool is very nice to relax with friends. This place is situated in a great location nectar to the beach. We will recommend to anyone this beautiful place.

We came to this beautiful place with my friend to have a great time and relax. Service is great and special thanks to reception staff who always help us to feel comfortable. We enjoyed our time with friends and will come back.

Had a good time with my friends.Great food, good service and friendly staff. Enjoyed a lot.... i came with my friends to celebrate the end of a bachelor life of one friend. They prepared a really delicious cake. We were able to have such a good time !!

Beautiful place to relax and enjoy your time whenever you need. This is the best place. So yummy food and the pool is amazing. We enjoyed every minute in this wonderful place. Definitely will recommend for anyone.

We had a great time with my friends in this amazing hotel.We want to come back again to have a great time.Thanks for the great hospitality. We will recommend this place to anyone who wants to relax and enjoy.

The hotel ous located in a nice location. Very good architecture. Rooms are fairly good in space and clean. Natural trees are used up to the maximum to create a good atmosphere. Food is also good. I like the service level and staff also.

The room is excellent and is based on the European Standard or the American standard with local design. We like it a lot. The sea view is great and very nice. The room service is terrific! Rukmal, Our roomboy was always very polite and striving for our well-being. Great praise for that! The hotel should promote his carierre, a better guest service I have not seen yet. There are many roomboys in the world who can learn from him. The food is very varied and good, you always find something delicious. We enjoyed the massage at the spa, the pool are fantastic. But we have a point of criticism. The Beach Boys are, in part, very intrusive and run behind you at the beach. We made a tour with one of the Beach Boys, his name is Rasil you can find him on the beach entrace. The trip was quite good, but for 20â‚¬ per person it was effectivly not sooo cheap -as they say- for a 4h trip to the next Village. But live and let live. What we didn't like was the trip to the herbal garden on same day and trip. This is all about selling scrap for a lot of money. It feels like mafia. Also the women's at beach before the hotel which are selling clothes are annoying. You have no chance to go to the beach undisturbed. We know they want to secure their livelihood, but more privacy would be great, then Iâ€˜d probably buy something. All in all the hotel is great, the service excellent (thank you very much Rukmal!) and the hotel area are well maintained. We'd recommend the hotel.

we had an amaxing stay at this beautiful place . staff is very friendly and helpful.. food is excellent . we will come back for sure and will recommend to our other friends as well. thank you for the great hospitality .

The definition of the word Rare and explosions of flavour in the mouth. Just WOW..... What an experience Well done to the man the cheff of the hour PRIYANTHA who prepared this Absolutely wonderful designer food.... Each bite a step closer to food heaven. Congratulations Heritance Ahungalla you have got a Gem and my heartfelt thanks and congratulations to A star class act PRIYANTHA. I wish you all the very best for a bright and wonderful future

This is our second visit and this is the most beautiful vacation trip ever..,everyone is so fr iendly...food and service is amazing... very clean Hotel..everything is perfect... Hope to visit this beautiful place again..

Excellent place for a vacation over the beach. Beach is very large and clean with great views. Two beautiful large pools with nice surrounding. Had some issues when check-in but overall friendly staff. Luxurious and comfortable rooms with all the amenities. Good food with lots of choices and variations.

It was the annual trip of our office. Upon arrival my first impression wasn't so good because of the old look of the hotel. But inside was nice and staff was helpful. It was a group of 13 people but they sorted out rooms quickly and handed over the keys. Finding the rooms is a bit of a problem as there were no signs for room number ranges. Had to ask 3 people for directions. Spacious rooms and well lit. Washroom was clean and no bad smell came out. There's 2 pools. One right at the lobby and the other one close by. The pool near the lobby dint had a Jacuzzi but the other one had. There was 2 of them but only one was functional. And there's a pool table in the 1st floor. And also they have a spa and a gym. on those 2 days the hotel was fully booked and crowded. But at the dinner, there was very calm and quiet environment. I don't know how they managed it but its very nice of them to have dinner with friends in a noise free place. Food is great (overall). Vast variety and there's everything. Have to mention the staff is very nice and descent. Works quickly and really appreciate that. I would definitely visit this place again. Recommended for anyone for a good holiday.

I was there with my parents when I came on a holiday from the UK.Excellent place for a relaxing holiday with an amazing view of the sea. Great and very friendly staff and they were happy to help at anytime. Spacious and luxurious rooms with all the facilities. Food was amazing and there were lots of choices and it was exceptional. My special thanks goes to miss Dilinie Rajapaksha who gave us a tremendous support when I booked the hotel. There were two beautiful pools and the surrounding of the hotel was exceptional. I highly recommend this hotel and Iâ€™ll definitely visit this place during my next holiday from England.

It's clean and staff is good. For the food, it's same as all hotels..not that sooooo good...but not that bad even.....if you want to have bacon for the breakfast, you will get only 2pcs for a person..ğŸ˜•ğŸ˜•ğŸ˜•. They make hoppers, rotty, and some few items on the spot. So that's good. Tastes wise you can be some happy..don't keep any high expectations. Hotel rooms are clean..and pools ( there are 2 pools, one pool is given for foreigners for there relaxation) clean..there are no any bad things to say about this one. It's a good hotel..but for the price..hmmmm....I'm still thinking about that..ğŸ¤”

When we first arrived we were welcomed by the staff and an amazing view! During our stay all of the staff have been very helpful and accomodating. They have ensured our honeymoon stay was as perfect as could be. Our room was cleaned to a very high standard on a daily basis and we were left with towel decor everyday made by Rukmal. Rukmal is always smiling, he is very friendly and takes pride in his job. On to the food!!!! What can i say, it was absolutely amazing! There was a variety of food everyday and the food was fresh and delicious! Both chefs, DJ. Manjula & Praveen Fernando were phenomenal. Everyday they made sure we ate to our hearts content and even made us our own dishes at request. Other staff we would like to thank are Danuka Madusanka & Himasha Wijesooriya as they both were always very polite & provided a high quality customer service. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Heritance Ahungalla and would like to thank everyone who made it a special experience. Shana & Robert room 354

Having visited Heritance Ahungalla a number of times all experiences have been exceptional! The hotel comes with two pools, one close to the reception and the other close to the rooms surrounded by trees (my favorite pool to chill at) and an outdoor Jacuzzi by the side of the pool. The rooms are really spacious with balconies facing the sea side, also provided with all amenities. Super convenient that each room is also provided with 2 pairs of slippers, in case you forget to bring your own. The food range is amazing, covering from many Sri Lankan delicacies to Continental food items and my personal favorite item - sushi! Probably not so authentic when it comes to the selection of Sushi as size is sometimes too big for a bite size and also too heavy on rice. The service has been decent enough with friendly and attentive staff from the front office staff to the restaurant staff to all the other staff. Thereâ€™s a bit of a hassle from beach side vendors trying to sell you things and offer you boat rides when you take a walk to the beach, so thereâ€™s not much of privacy. There were several times when these vendors mistook us Sri Lankans to be foreigners and rip us off for boat rides, so be aware if you want to take the rides and how much you pay them. The hotel also offers a well equipped gym, a cozy library with many books and a carom board along with a billiard table for in-house entertainment other than the cultural shows hosted at nights. Overall Heritance Ahungalla is a fantastic hotel by the beautiful southern coast of Sri Lanka, less than an hour and a halfâ€™s drive from Colombo and in close proximity to Galle and Galle fort that offers such interesting adventures.

We went to Heritance Ahungalla to celebrate our anniversary and travelled as a family. We selected Heritance as it was by Geoffrey Bawa whose architecture my son loves. And we were not disappointed. The architecture was amazing - simple lines, wide open spaces that blend with nature.... From the moment we stepped in to the hotel, everything was perfect. The view that greets you is amazing! The rooms were excellent and the food delicious.. From the welcome until we checked out the service was fantastic, the staff friendly and accommodating. They all went out of the way to make our special day a truly memorable one. A special thank you from us to all the staff members who went out of their way to make our anniversary a day to remember. Looking forward to another visit!

We walked in to hotel for the buffet, it wasnâ€™t available but the hotel management decided to give us their best service they can. Honestly one of the best hotel staff and management in srilanka, food was extremely delicious. Keep up your hospitality weâ€™ll visit again soon.

Its was my first time ever at heritence n the welcome at the entrance was spectacular even though the occupancy was extremely high which is a lesson to many hotels on the island ..the rooms were clean n massive n the service was the quickest n most commendable..very positive n friendly staff n no discrimination between foreigners n locals.. The buffets had a great variety with sri lankan to western cuisines..the area is massive with 2pools n variety of events..there is abclub with a dj on saturday night n a band at the lobby which takes u back to 80 s..i m looking forward to visit again..worth the money u pay..

We went for our anniversary and absolutely loved it. The hotel has a old-scl charm and vibe with 2 pools and alot of space to explore. The food was very good, though the rooms were smaller in size, it was an overall great experience. The staff was very friendly and food action stations were well rounded! Recommended!

The best hotel in Bentota at absolutely fantastic location. The hotel is bang on the beach. I went there to unwind and absolutely got what I wanted. We were welcomed very fondly at arrival and asked to relax at reception while completing check-in formalities along with varities of welcome drinks. From the reception itself you will appreciate your decision of choosing this property for vacation. Rooms are spacious and clean. Property is big enough offering various activities such as two big pools, jacuzzi, table tennis, lawn tennis court...etc. Caferteria is big enough and offers variety of rich and tasty food, I loved they asked and served my favorite dish at the dinner, and I found that the best around. The staff is very courteous and shows empathy towards guests needs without wasting a minute. I enjoyed sri-lankan cocktails at bar. I also enjoyed various cultural shows every night arranged by the hotel. Looking at so many things, you can pretty much stay in the hotel all day without getting bored.

The hotel is apparently 35years old and the location is absolutely fantastic. The hotel is bang on the beach. Unfortunately the beach is not a swimmable one during this time of the year. The room allocated to me was in the residents wing. At least that's what I believe it was called. Very quite and peaceful place. I went there to unwind and absolutely got what I wanted. Was welcomed very fondly at arrival and my room was also ready. The front office team was kind enough to give an hour's late check out.

My home town is balapitiya and im 3 km away from heritance ahungalla. I have been to most of the hotels in sri lanka and the only one hotel in sri lanka can matched the quality of this and its heritance kandalama

The hospitality starts from the 1st step into the hotel; warm welcome with traditional variety of fresh juices. Front desk was very helpful and friendly. Once they saw the kids, they were informing the parents about the events organized for the kids on that day. They had magic show and chef programs for kids during our stay. The room was clean. Food was amazing at the restaurant and all staff were very helpful. In the night, they had local live music. This hotel has 2 pools; The green pool with Jacuzzi and trees around is my choice and it is the best. They also have plenty of indoor and outdoor sports.

Loved the stay ! Stayed in the suite and the property welcomed us with Champagne ğŸ¥‚. The suite was huge and very well appointed. The service overall was splendid! Highly recommend and if you happen to be choosing to stay in the suite , itâ€™s totally worth itğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ»

It was a very nice stay in the Heritance. All was very nice, like the food, the people where you can ask every time and especially our cleaning boy for our nice room. The name of our cleaning boy is Rukmal and he made a wonderful Job ervey day, like nice figueres on the bed. We enjoyed our Trip and we will recommend the Heritance Hotel.

Amazing first day at the Heritance ahungalla. Great suite 262, good food and courteous service. The rooms are cleaned twice by courteous staff. The restaurant staff are very friendly and quick. The wide variety of food is tasty and fresh. Overall a great place for a relaxed holiday. A separate pool for residents makes it less crowded and enjoyable.

Heritance Ahungalla is a great place to relax and enjoy with your family, they got a bunch of very friendly staff who are very hospitable, food was awesome n got breathtaking surroundings. We canâ€™t forget our fantastic housekeeping person RUKMAL for his great work, especially for making our little four year old munchkin happy with all the little things â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸ Thanks Heritance Ahungalla

The hotel is very beautiful. The people are very nice and friendly. The pool is hudge and there is also a little whirlpool to chill in. The rooms are always clean and Rukmal our housekeeper always made wonderful decorations on our bed.

Excellent Location, Amazing Architecture by Geoffrey Bawa. Nice View from the rooms facing the Indian Ocean. Two nice swimming pools, one with two Jacuzzis. Loved the food, and the buffet was full of varieties. Very friendly and welcoming staff, especially Praveen & Thushara from the F&B Dept. Will visit again for sure!

Heritance Ahungalla is a beautiful hotel in a lovely location. The staff is helpful and courteous and service overall is exemplary. The food is heavenly and an extensive selection is available at buffets. We visit the hotel at least twice a year and intend to keep on visiting.

I stayed for one day and a half.The hotel was in very good quality. All facilities were in easy to find places. The food had amazing taste but it could be better if there was more variety in food as there were very little meat. Otherwise and amazing play to play. There was man who always called everyone for sport activities this allowed me to try new sports and activities which was an amazing thing. Thank you so much for the such a quality stay and service. Will never forget this stay.

Very relaxing hotel with lovely people... both pools are amazing... food and service is excellent... my sister had a lovely room with a nice view.we will be back again to visit this lovely place.thank you...

Basically ome of my favourite getaway hotels to have a good time with really good food. Service is incredible and staff is amazingly friendly. What can I say except the fact that if you are planning a visit to Sri Lanka this is the place to stay at.

A Weekend getaway with the extended family. Great location but the hotel is dated, and overdue for a major overhaul. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The washroom unfortunately small,and gloomy. Great Band on Saturday night! Thank you Praveen Fernando, Chef Skanda Wickramasuriya, Kenny at reception, Wasitha De Silva, and the rest of the team for the great service. We had an enjoyable time. Special mention of Uthpala Abeysekara at the head office Colombo, who went out of her to make our trip special. Excellent PR skills. Thank you Uthpala.

This year we choose Heritance Ahungalla as the destination of our office trip. We stayed 9 and 10th June there on full board basis. We had a head count of about 50 people and the hotel treated us well. I must say that the breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets were all good and was up to good standards, the buffet had considerable variety and the staff and their families enjoyed it. The rooms too were very comfortable and none of us observed any issues with the facilities in the rooms. The hotel staff were also very helpful and attended to our needs and assisted in the evening events and gatherings. The view of the beach from the hotel is also very good and calming, I greatly enjoyed the morning sun bath and the walk down the beach. The hotel had two great pools and a Jacuzzi which we enjoyed. Based on our stay I recommend this as a great hotel.

Perfect Hotel! Very great and polite staff! The service is perfect, you will feel like King and Queen Special Thanks to Rukmal, our room was every day an event.... see the pictures... definitely the best Roomboy ever!!!!!

Visited Heritance with the family. It was a very pleasant stay. The check in staff, restaurant staff and reservation staff were excellent. Very concerned and excellent service! Special mention of Reservation - Kanishka who was very helpful and professional.

The hotel has breathtaking view from their lobby..The staff was friendly and willing to help us in all possible ways.The rooms are cosy and clean.We stayed for three days and the location is perfect to have relaxing mind. The breakfast spread was very generous with good variety of local and international dishes. My special thanks to chef Skanda Wickramasuriya for his effort in satisfying different group of people..Iâ€™ll definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to escape from hectic city life.

We went on a long overdue family holiday to Sri Lanka and stayed at Heritance Ahungulla. Being our first trip to the island nation, we were keen to stay in a property designed by late Sri Lankan architect Geoffrey Bawa. It was the best decision we made. The hotel is stunning- from the entrance with its water garden to the infinity pool which overlooks the ocean. The hotel staff are wonderfully warm and courteous. A special mention must be made of Mr Rukmal from housekeeping who has the most amazing gift of creating animal shapes out of bath towels. We'd come back to our rooms every day to delightedly find the sweetest elephants, swans and even crocodiles mad out of pristinely white bath towels arranged on our beds! The food is a mixture of Sri Lankan, Continental and Asian. The two swimming pools are a blessing as the beach at Ahungulla is unsafe for swimming. June being off season, meant the hotel was only half full which in turn meant that we had a wonderfully serene holiday. The weather, with only a few bouts of rain, was lovely. Our trip was a wonderful introduction to Sri Lanka. Thank you all at Heritance Ahungulla for making our visit such a wonderful experience!

We would like to make the world of connoisseurs aware of the treat the 3 of us were witnessing tonight at Ahungalla beach in the Heritance Hotel. Especially Kalinga, Waruna and Danuka thank you so much for making this night so special and attentive. Your service was extraordinary. You not only made us a gorgeous table ready for us you took great care of us recommending to us the menue, lobster and rice, fillet and vegetables and Risotto which was served to us in the most romantic way and 5 star way. And then, by the end of the main courseâ€” the rain started to pour on us! And you guys ran towards us protecting us and the cuddly dog with a huge umbrella. Later for coffee and rum and tea we finished the evening with great live music. Thank you soo much. You overachieved by all means.

I and my family stayed in a suite with great views of the ocean and the beach below, comfy beds with spotless crisp white linen. The bathroom unusually spacious, tastefully designed, with all the amenities one can think of. We being regular dinners at some of the well known restaurants in Colombo, assert, that the food is of high quality, fresh and Very tasty .A fine balance,of the East and West . Restaurant Manager Rasika , and Praveen, and Thushara of his team , will ensure that you have the perfect dining experience, while periodically going up to the guests, to inquire . Nipun can make anything happen, in and out of the restaurant . Randeepa and Sanduli was very attentive, cautious and super friendly and wanted to feed us more and more ! And Charming Nadika after a day, knew exactly what to serve, and also a specialist in â€œ water on the rocks ! And of course our star, the versatile singing chef, Skanda, who will rock the restaurant depending on his mood, apart from devising the delicacies for the dinners. The Human touch makes this hotel very special. The unpararel feature of this hotel is, the members of the management staring in their self- choreographed drama to entertain the guests, bringing absolute laughter ! This brought a sense of togetherness; the guests and the staffâ€¦â€¦.a fine way to bring the evening to its end. What was special again was that the check out was as warm , as the welcome at check in. And Nipun was always there ! The hotel was full , and perhaps this may be the only hotel, where the Front Manager Srinath , busy schedule, was loading the baggage of the guests to the vehicle, along with the staff ! Heritance Ahungalla is unique ! An experience not to be missed, when in Sri Lanka ! I and my family wish to thank everyone in this lovely hotel , who make our stay unforgettable ! Executive chef Chaluka Rodrigo and General Manager Sisira Senarathne, WELL DONE ! Senadhi.

Loved our stay here! Perfect Holiday for the family. Great Staff at the restaurant, our Breakfasts and Dinners automatically tasted Better!!!Lovely Pool and Beach. Felt like we owned the place! 7 Star Feeling !

Ha This was our first visit to this amazing hotel. It was low season but still seemed full I met some wonderful staff who were very helpful and made our stay comfortable and memorable A huge shout out to the guest relations officer Himasha she had the most beautiful cheerful smile everyday for us making sure we had everything we needed Nirosh from Bachus Bar was cheerful and served me the best passion fruit drink Nipon who was the food and beverage executive made sure our bellies were constantly full with some of the most delicious food. Manjula whipped us up a fantastic banana fritter and ice cream even though it wasnâ€™t on the menu. That was to die for. Dharshana been the Restuarants captain was always making sure we had everything we wanted and more We had the pleasure of meeting Chaluka Rodrigo who is the executive chef who had whipped up our delicious dinner Jananjaya Restuarants captain was always making sure we were well taken care of. I cannot express my joy in finding this place and spending 4 nights here. Close to the ocean Beautiful pools spaciously located with beautiful greenery Perfect for couples and families I cannot praise all the staff enough for all the great service. A huge thank you and a memorable one as we celebrated our anniversary here

A piece of Geoffrey Bawa architecture in Ahungalla nice place to relax as beach and pool stay. meals are awesome also seafood dinner always yammy yammy. near miss this place if you finding something without a rush city.

"WOW".. the exact words I said out loud as I walked into the reception lobby of Heritance Ahungalla. It is a Majestic beach hotel with outstanding services and facilities. I couldn't have asked for anything more. I mean I would say you would be " living the life" if you spend a good 3-4 days here. An exquisite room with state of the art furniture and a cozy touch to it with the balcony overlooking the pool and beach.The swift sounds of the water hitting the sand makes it so soothing. The best part is that you can end a perfectly spent relaxing day at this hotel by taking a nice walk by the beach in the night and probably get a chance to see some shooting stars if you get lucky. All the staff members are extremely caring and friendly. You can experience fine dining here with a vast spread to choose from. Now since my family and I are vegetarians, chef D.J.MANJULA and chek SKANDA personally attended to us and took us through a rich culinary experience with a special veg menu crafted just for us which made our stay even more pleasant. A huge thank you to both the chefs and the entire team for doing such a great job and making sure that all your guests leave with a big fat smile because we sure did. Thank you Heritance

This is an amazing resort in the south part of Sri Lanka. Friendly staff, great service, great food, clean rooms, beautiful beach and pool. Loved our stay at this resort. We were very happy. It was very relaxing to hang out by the pool and see the ocean waves.

This is my second stay and I want to say that the serivice is excellent with great hospitality and a very friendly staff and a Beautiful Place to spend your Vacation ! Thank you Heritance Ahungalla ! Looking forward to see you again Soon ! Thank you once again !

My Family checked in to this Glorious Hotel for a Wedding Function. Function was brilliantly organized from the beginning! The function hall was eye catchingly decorated. The most important thing was that this function did not disturb the residential guests. The Food was Scrumptious! Chef SKANDA WICKRAMASURIYA & his team had done a Marvelous job I must say! The service was Outstanding! Under the guidance of Mr. PRAVEEN, the Service Team performed magnificently. SHEHAN, LALITH, CHAMILA, CHAMITH & NADEEKÃ€ had done a Marvelous job to delight the guests. They were all smiles & incredibly pleasant while serving us! They should be recognized & encouraged! Mr. PRAVEEN was always there delighting the guests & their needs. I remember him from my previous visits to this Lovely Resort. He is a Real GEM for the HERITANCE Hotels Group. Thank You Heritance Ahungalla for an Absolutely Wonderful Experience!

From start to end it was an awesome experience. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Special thanks for the front desk. They were very helpful and poters has a very good idea of the places to visit. Restaurant staff is also very helpful and friendly. Food is awesome and carries the traditional touch of lanka. Hotel has two pools and both are clean and enough size for a big crowd. Thank you for the grate experience and we expect to return soon.

An interesting sea view.Lovely place with best hospitality. Had a lovely day out that was reasonable priced inside the restaurant and very good buffet was included.Hope to visit again & again.:-) :-) :-)

We had a very nice day out that was reasonably priced in the restaurant and a very good buffet was included. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Had an excellent stay and I'm highly Recommending â™¥ï¸â™¥ï¸

As soon as we arrived we were welcomed warmly and a traditional way. Front desk was very helpful and friendly, even though the lobby was busy all staff had a smile on their faces. Checking was done fast enough and we were taken to our rooms. We got two room's next to each other as we requested it had a very lovely view. Clean rooms with a little touch of antique designs was perfectly done by the housekeeping. Food was amazing at the restaurant and all staff were very helpful. Thankyou for all the support. And I highly Recommend this place to anyone looking for a place to spend some time in Ahungalla area.

Good location.. The sea is rough for a sea swim. However, They have two pools to compensate for that :P and a wide beach with a lovely relaxing view. This is the second time I visited this place after a long time. The place has evolved. I noticed that in the evenings they had local cultural dances and events to keep the guests entertained. Even the dinner area they had unique local live music which was very relaxing and soothing. The hotel is lovely with friendly staff. Also they had an area with dining close to the beach in the open area with lamp lit dinner.. it was a sight to see and im sure would have felt good for the ones who enjoyed. They have a spa which was super good. They have the authentic Bali massages from the Bali nationals which was super relaxing and value for money. The food was great. Buffet is served on all three meals. The service can be better, in terms of clearing the tables in time. The only negative experience i had was that the stopper in the batch tub in my room was missing. I had to call thrice and wait for 2hrs until they got it fixed. The bad experience spoilt it a bit. But still overall i would not hesitate to visit the hotel again.

Last weekend, we spent 2 night at this beautiful hotel. Situated in a beautiful place where you can go to the beach within seconds. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and well arranged and spacious. Most of the rooms were overlooking the beach and in the evening, you can witness a beautiful sunset. Two pools are there. Infinity and Resident. I loved both of them. At the main pool, there is a bar so you dont have to go somewhere else to have a drink. Foods selection is good. Well thought about different types of tourists.Sometimes waiters get busy with the people and they tend to forget to clean the tables and dishes. If they can focus on it, I must say this is one of the best hotels you can come across in Galle District.

we spent 1 night full board at this really good hotel over the weekend. i highly recommend this hotel for couples, family and friends. the staff is very friendly and courteous..always with a smile. the rooms are over looking the beach and very nice. the bathrooms i felt needed a upgrade and a good clean..not a deal breaker..!!. the bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows for 2. i wish the TV was bigger and the movie channels were better... the meals were superb..maybe not to everyone's liking since my wife thought some of the dishes were tasting bland... parking is available at the property. i recommend using the valet. overall i highly recommend this hotel...will defiantly come back maybe this time stay for 2 nights.

I must say that this is an exemplary fairyland! It dissolves all sorrows and pains when entering to the lobby.This amazing view got us for another paradise along with the warm and unique welcome. Food was awesome and hats off for all the staff! Service rendered by a well trained staff and they are absolutely courteous. Two swimming pools add the serenity but love the Green pool a lot. Direct access to the beach is perfect. Special thanks to Mr. Sisira, Mr. Rasika & his marvelous F&B team, Chef Skanda, Mr. Lakshitha & whole Front Office team. Thank you all for your amazing service which can not beat for another.

We recently stayed here for two weeks and have to say had a great time. The hotel and grounds are lovely. It is right on the beach front which is beautiful. I can only comment on the room we had which was a deluxe room with partial sea view. The only reason it states partial is because there are palm trees and bushes between the room and view but it was lovely all the same. The room was spacious and had everything we needed. Lovely basket of fruit on arrival which was refreshed in the second week. Bottled water Daily and a mini fridge full of soft drinks, alcohol, crisps and chocolate. Rooms were cleaned daily and beds turned down each night, fresh towels twice a day. Lovely towel art left each day. The room cleaners really are a credit to the hotel. Although I have to say all the staff are a credit. All very helpful and pleased to help. Food was amazing. We were on an all inclusive basis which we wouldnâ€™t normally do but would recommend as not much nearby outside of the hotel. Great selection of meals all day. Have to say we were in curry heaven. Good selection for non curry eaters! Many reviews say Diet Coke isnâ€™t included in your drinks package which concerned me being diabetic, however they actually have Coke Zero which is included. Wine is only served at meal times in the A.I. Package. Two great pools in the grounds, we spent our time by the quiet pool. Bars were good but we spent most of our time at the pool bar were most of the entertainment was in the evenings. Some of the shows a bit bizarre but thatâ€™s A.I. for you. The days spent on the sun beds were filled with sightings of monitor lizards, chipmunk type creatures and monkeys roaming the grounds. Whilst here make sure you get out and about there is so much to see. We used a local guide who was a fraction of the price of tui who we travelled with. Found him prior to going and booked all our trips via him before going, didnâ€™t require payment until we arrived and met him personally.There are lots of local guides inc ones on the beach and the money stays local. *** Try Charu of czarek tours *** you can find him on Facebook or at charukadesilva5@gmail.com Also donâ€™t listen to tui when they say you have to use your rupees up before the airport or exchange what you have left in the departure lounge prior to going through security. You can spend them in the airport!! Finally we would like to thank all the staff at the Heritance for making our holiday so special. I would certainly stay here again if we return.

It was an amazing stay with my husband in this beautiful and luxury resort in Ahungalla. Rooms were well organized with everything we need. we had tea/coffee making facilities and they had Wi-Fi. A king sized bed and all. Rooms were clean. Food was so yummy. Stay on Half board basis. Don't miss their dinner. You can visit few nearby places like Turtle Hatchery etc. Galle is not close. Few hours drive. But Ahungalla is a good location too. No need to go to Galle again. This is close to the beach and you can go to beach as well. I would definitely go again and pamper myself.

Very much like the hotel . Special happy about the service given by . Name call Amila . Beyond the expectations. Keep up the good work! Thank you ! Can recommend to others too . And great music given by dinner time . Very talented singers

We had a really great time! The hotel staff were very helpful and they provided us with everything we wanted! We really had a great time.. we at the luxury room and I would say we got the luxury service too.. the buffet was excellent! All three meals the food was yummy!! Really loved my stay! Would recommend anyone to stay there!!

Very good stay This is our 5th visit. When we want a break from our busy life we always end up at Heritance. Very good atmosphere. The food is great. I love this place . The friendly staff. And usually when the check out time comes they don't call and give reminders. And it's upto us to be ethical in vacating the room. This is what I like in them. I feel it's like my second day home

Buffet offers verity of dishes including Sri Lankan meals. Suit was nicely arranged with space and cleaned. Met friendly staff whose always keeping the smile on the faces. Recommended for leasure purposes.

We had the best time in our lives,this year too,at this heavenly place,where those loving, smiley faces,worked so hard to serve the best and make each and every moment of our holiday extra special.We were super lucky to be part of your Staff Avurudu event,as that was extremely entertaining,and worth watching.Every visit refills our minds with fresh beautiful memories of the Heritance Ahungalla family.We would like to thank specially the restaurant and the bar manager mr.Thushara,and the food and beverages executive,Mr.Nipun,who have been offering a valuable service for us,on our every visit to Heritance Ahungalla.The whole team made our stay fabulous,once again.The warm welcome offered by the general manager,is highly appreciated.Exceptionally cleaned rooms,delicious food,relaxing surrounding,superb entertainment and unmatchable hospitality.There was nothing we could ask for more.Thank you so much,once again.You guys are the best.

Excellent place to visit. People on the hotel were very friendly and they given a good service. I will recommend anyone for that hotel for stay on down south in Sri Lanka. Fantastic service, amazing food...

Stayed at this wonderful hotel, and all I could say is we had a unforgettable stay experience. It started from the moment we entered the hotel, Wonderfull staff with genuine smile all around. what agreat view of the sea, sand and sun ! Very clean hotel with tastefully arranged lobby and guest rooms. Quality food and pristine beach is definitely add. If you are looking for a hotel on the beach, I have no hesitation of recommending this wonderful hotel. Good luck and thank you to all at Heritance

Not really one for wiring reviews but let me tell you,this hotel is nothing short of exceptional. Fantastic service, amazing food, beautiful architecture inspired by tropical modernism, all finished off with a beautiful view of the Indian Ocean.

I returned to Heritance Ahungalla after several years to relive my memories from the last trip which was excellent. This time however the hotel fell way short in meeting my expectations. It all started with a 45 minute waiting time just to get checked in. The lobby was storming with guests and baggage scattered everywhere reminded me of a government hospital than a star class hotel. The room was very clean and neat however, I had booked myself in to a "Deluxe King" room with a "King Size" bed on the ground floor (printed on the confirmation). However I had been given a room on the 1st floor with two single beds put together. We were so eager to get to the beach that the minute we came to the room we unpacked and stormed off to the beach. It was when we returned we figured out that it was not a king size bed. Called and complained to the concierge and I was told that "Sir, you have to make a special request for a king size bed at the time of booking if you needed one". After 15 minutes of arguing and speaking to the duty manager was I offered to be shifted to another room. Again, a very clean and comfortable room but a small shower in a very odd triangular shape. Not for someone who is claustrophobic. We went for dinner in the main restaurant and it was chock-a-block. They had stuffed every available chair and table in to it and we could only move about sideways. The seemed to have a shortage of plates as we had to wait up to 5 minutes sometimes for fresh clean plates. And no service what so ever. There were only five or six waiting staff to serve and we hardly caught a glimpse of them. We were never even offered water. And I am still waiting for the tea I ordered to the table on the second morning of my visit. Dinner was really good. There was a very decent variety of food and the taste was very good. But breakfast was not so exciting. There was no variance and every day it was pretty much the same assortment. In-room dinning was an absolute disaster. It felt as if "In-room dinning" is a whole new concept that the hotel staff is yet to hear about. There was no menu available in the room and two cheaply printed A4 sheets stapled together arrived at the door 30 minutes when we called and asked for one. We ordered two fried rice and let me tell you that I have had better fried rice served on a plane. It was a mixture of rice and boiled chicken with the odd piece of carrot. The hotel is beautiful, comfortable and very clean. As long as you lower your exceptions in terms of service, you might have a decent stay. For me however, I do not see myself returning any time soon.

The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel was bit crowed during my visit. washroom was bit small and outdated also not that clean especially the shower etc. Food was ok and garden and beach was well maintained.

Rooms - We booked 4 deluxe rooms. Our deluxe room was spacious with music in the room. It was overall good. Two other deluxe rooms were smaller than this a lot but we're new. 1 deluxe room looked very old and was not spacious at all were disappointed to have in 5 star hotel. Bathrooms - Urs was spacious with music and a good showerplace. Other 3 bathrooms were very old and aging. the walls were no tiled as well and only concrete was seen. They were very small as well. Very disappointed. Food - This was a beachside restaurant but the buffet was not good at all. there were very few varieties of food and the only seafood for dinner was fish and prawns. Even the restaurant is too packed and not appealing. Others all good. I rated this according to the room we got and not considering others rooms Here's how I gave rating 1-Room 1-Bathroom 1-Pool 1-Beach and other recreational activities 0-food

Visited the hotel during the new year holidays with my family. The hotel rooms were good and the food was amazing. The hotel was really crowed because of the news year rates promotions gong on , but the staff at the Hotel worked really hard to give a good customer experience. I will definitely visit this hotel after the rush months and Iâ€™m sure it will be a good experience. Keep up the good work guys !

We stayed two nights during the Sinhala New Year. The hotel staff were very friendly both at the front office and waiter staff. The senior chef went all the way to prepare baby food for our 1.5 year old, that was quite touching. The hotel organised a cultural show as well which was entertaining indeed. The food was excellent, lots of variety both at breakfast, lunch and dinner. The hotel has two pools And a private pool for Inhouse guest. The room we stayed has a beautiful sea view and most rooms do I believe. The only negative thing I can comment is the toilet. It's was very outdated and not that clean especially the shower etc. The time we stayed it rained quite often there weren't much indoor activities at offer in this hotel so you are basically confined to your room. Either way we recommend this hotel to anyone who wish to spend a nice hotel.

Indeed a great stay to remember. Sri Lanka being the Wonder of Asia is truly gifted to have a place like "HERITANCE AHUNGALLA". whether you are a local or a foreigner TEAM HERITANCE AHUNGALLA will treat you with a miracle touch and care which will surely make your holiday an unforgettable experience. Apart from that would like to extend our heart felt gratitude to the hotel staff for their sincere care, friendliness, affection and providing the best services willingly at all times. Special thanks goes to Mr. Thushara, Mr. Praveen,Ms. Sandali and Himasha for the attention they gave when my friend had an injury. It was certainly beyond what we would usually expect . Our best wishes to the special team of this great hotel. Looking forward to visiting this nice place with more family members and friends. Samitha, Sathira and family!

A really nice place to stay, very clean rooms, very friendly personal. very clean pool. stuff is very helpful, breakfast is not bad. in case i will go back to Sri Lanka i will stay in this hotel again, and i will recommend to my friends!

Overall, the facilities were nice but we found this property to be poorly managed. 1) Check-in process wasn't organized well. 2 days after check-in, I was contacted and told I had an extra person and I had to pay more money. They didn't even bother understanding their error! We had provided all passports at check-in and we had booked 3 rooms. They had mixed up the adults/kids in the rooms and thought we tried to sneak in an adult at a kid rate. How is that possible if we provided our passports at check-in??? Then at check-out I was still charged and had to get it resolved again. 2) Food was average. And the setup is not optimal. Buffet is split into 2 rooms, with one room having large, open doors which basically let's in bugs/flies. This comes across as unhygienic and dirty. 3) When sitting out by the pool, had to ask 3 times to get towels and ended up getting them ourselves. 4) The room setup isn't good. The bathroom has blinds so it makes it really awkward for someone to use the bathroom. Also, the thermostat directions are on the balcony door (why not next to the thermostat). 5) We arrived on a Wednesday and were excited there would be a show. The show was terrible with what appeared to be some sort of mime type of performance. 6) The gym is a joke! You don't even feel like working out. It's small & cramped with old equipment. 7) There is one elevator that is old and slow.

We travel at least twice a year to Heritance Ahungalla as this is one place we feel very much at home. It was a different experience this time celebrating Sinhala & Tamil New Year (Avurudu). The set up created for the guests to experience a traditional auvurudu ceremony was remarkable. Excellent job done by Mr Sisira Senaratne - GM and his Team. One of the best hotels if you like to spend a few days on the beach peacefully.

This hotel should learn service and quality from at least Colombo 3 star hotels. The value for the price paid is zero. If there is a refund process, for sure I'll go through that process. It is a shame to Sri Lankan hotel industry.

This is my fourth visit at this property, amazing customer service from each department, they have gone above and beyond to ensure we had a pleasant stay. Thank you to all the staff. The property is well located , 2 pools and a good spa, perfect to relax and unwind.

We had two night at this hotel and it certainly did not disappoint in any way. The location at the beach was simply superb, the room was nice, the buffet dinner was fabulous and the buffet breakfast was also great with a wide selection of local and western dishes. The staff were attentive although some were probably in need of a little additional English language exposure.

I stayed at this hotel from the 19th to the 29th March 2018 and got married on the 28th. These were the best 10 days of my life. With regards to the wedding: I'm from the UK (England) but got married at this hotel on the beach (see picture). Our wedding had 80 guests from the UK - all of which were impressed by this hotel and staff. Guest Relations Manager Himasha Wijesooriya was brilliant. She's kind, professional and made sure me and my wedding guests were happy and relaxed in the days leading up to wedding. She assisted in organising all aspects of the wedding from the legal registration to the decorations, food, drink and party. She was the perfect wedding coordinator. Thank you! Me and all my guests had the most amazing experience! The staff at this hotel treated us like royalty. Food and Beverage Managers Nipun Mawaththa and Mr Prasanna helped coordinate an amazing party with an outstanding buffet and cocktails. Food and Beverage Executive Praveen Fernando also helped tremendously by supporting the events and hosting my family and friends. The polite and dedicated people working at this hotel quickly transformed from staff to friends. The wedding ceremony organised by the hotel was exceptional. We had a beautiful Poruwa ceremony on the beach complete with Kandyan dancers and drummers. Although we out-sourced our wedding and reception decorations from the local town, instead of using the decorations provided by the hotel, the Heritance team coordinated the entire event to perfection. We could not have had a more perfect and enjoyable day. With regards to the hotel: This hotel is perfection. Beautifully designed to see the ocean as soon as you enter with tranquil nature just around every corner in the open-plan corridors. The hotel sits at the bottom of a long driveway so all you can hear are the birds and sea.The rooms are comfortable, clean and decorated beautifully. The swimming pools are brilliant and the Animation Team organised an enjoyable pool-volleyball game for me and my guests. The restaurant food is delicious with plenty of choice from top-quality chefs. One of the defining features of this hotel is by far the location. The Heritance is located so elegantly on one of the most beautiful beaches in the world, Ahungalla beach. You can hear the ocean from the room balcony and late into the evening at the bar. This place is paradise. Thank you so much to all the staff at Heritance Ahungalla. We will be back for sure!

This hotel is the true mining of a 5 stars resort. Well maintained, impeccable cleaning and courteous staff. The buffet they offered were different every day we stayed and I have not seen this in all hotels of the same caliber. The sous Chef at the restaurant, Skander (I hope I remember well) could not be more spot on walking around, introducing himself on individual basis seeking for feedback and to provide further assistance (like anyone could ask for more than they offer!) but all other restaurant staff was observed frequently interacting with all guests. My child did a silly joke in the pool asking help during swim and the pool supervisor was next to her even before she could finish the sentence (very unpleasant for us but extremely hands on personnel, I can guarantee). My apologies, again. Overall, beautiful place to stay in and incredible family oriented. Thanks for the lovely stay and looking after my family.

Great stay over April 2018 The property is quite nice, beach front, and the resort has mostly open areas which makes it quite nice. The rooms are quite nice with dark wood and the bathrooms have a nice walk in shower and quite spacious. My room was on the ground floor in front the second smaller pool with a nice terrace which was great as I just walked out of the back doors straight to the pool. Breakfast buffet at the main restaurant is great with a variety of local and western options. Don't miss the egg hoppers, the crud and treacle and the fresh fruit stations. The restaurants have both buffet style and a la carte. Both very good quality and with good options. The Spa is well run and definitely provide a relaxing space. Treatment was done in a very professional way and very relaxing. The beach is great but there are not umbrellas nor chairs available and it looked a bit rough at times. There are some beach vendors walking around and also a few shacks by the beach next to the hotel offering local food. Overall a great place with personality and charm and not pretending to be something that is not. I would definitely come back

Our stay was from 01st of April to the 02nd of April. As April was a month where a lot of tourists are attracted to Sri Lanka, the hotel did have a lot of guests. But the staff made sure that everyone was treated in a special way. The mastermind behind the architecture of Heritance Ahungalla is Late Geoffrey Bawa and as a result, itâ€™s one of the most striking resorts in the Sri Lankan coast. From the moment where you set foot in the hotel till you leave, the staff stays by your side making sure that your stay is memorable. We experienced a situation which made our visit unforgettable, on the 02nd of April. It was my daughterâ€™s birthday on the 02nd and on the previous day, Mr. Nipun Mawatta happened to know about it from a friendly talk with us. However that simple conversation was enough for him to alert the rest of the staff to surprise my daughter at breakfast on the 02nd by appearing suddenly with a trolley laden with balloons and a birthday cake with the restaurant crew coming together to sing happy birthday as she cut the cake. It was totally an unexpected, well-planned surprise and Mr. Mawatte and the staff deserves a shower of thanks. Not to forget, the food at Heritance was always â€œnever-enoughâ€ due to their taste and variety. The rooms were lavish and we highly recommend the rooms with the ocean view as it is truly amazing. The infinity pool is always inviting in the burning heat. During our stay, several gents in the staff decided to display their hidden talents from a hilarious performance after dinner. It kept everyone laughing every time we recalled it. Heritance Ahungalla is one of the greatest places to experience the beauty of the Sri Lankan coast and a place â€œWHERE TRADITION IS ALIVEâ€.

A splendid, well established hotel. Our air-conditioned, en-suite room had generous proportions and was comfotably furnished. We enjoyed a direct view of the Indian Ocean over the trees that lined the wide beach of soft, golden sand. Two pools and extensive gardens with plenty of comfortable loungers provided a relaxing setting. The room attendant maintained a high standard of cleanliness throughout our stay. The flowers arranged over the bed at evening turn-down time was a delightful touch. Service in the bars and restaurants was attentive, courteous and good-humoured. The buffet in the main restaurant was incredibly varied with dishes from around the world. Chefs were always on hand to provide guidance. We also tried one of the al a carte restaurants and found the food superb and very reasonably priced.

I will start with the positives as they far out way the negatives. This was my 8th visit to Sri Lanka and because the bentota beach was closed for refurb we stayed here for the first time and will return. Positives Arrival - greeted with fresh juices and friendly smiles, check in was smooth and stress free. The reception area was well presented, spacious and had stunning views of the pool. Food - main restaurant food was varied and very tasty, catered for all tastes and the head chef happily cooked us a "special dish". Staff in the restaurant were friendly and everything was so clean. Towards the end of our holiday a large Arab family arrived and they were picking up food with their bare hands and putting it back, being hygienic I complained to a floor manager and very quickly the baskets of touched food was quickly removed - I was impressed. The pool snack bars served the most amazing "fishfingers" etc so we ate their for lunch Drinks - the local alcohol was quite pleasant and plentiful in choice, international brand mixers were also included. Pools - the infinity pool was not to our taste as most of the sun beds were under low lying trees so offered little sunlight. We opted for the residents pool which offered lots of sunbed space, lovely pool staff, its own bar (with friendly bar men) and 2 jacuzzis. The staff kept the pool and surrounding area so clean. LOcation - right on the beach, although too rough to swim the sea was fab for a dip and a mess about in the waves (sadly an English man drowned whilst we were there - he did however ignore the no swim warnings) and the staff at the hotel were fantastic with his poor wife and handled the situation with dignity and respect. There are a couple of shops just outside the hotel and bentota is a 20 minute drive away if u want to see a real local town. Staff - we have friends in Sri Lanka and our good friend Sunil introduced us to the hotel manager and several other people who ensured our stay was (almost) perfect. It was the first time we saw so many female staff in a Sri Lankan hotel and it was refreshing and showed they are more forward thinking than other hotels we have stayed in over there. himaesha was a lovely lady and a real asset to the hotel. We also found fernando (who stemmed to work everywhere) a pleasure to spend time with-always smiling and upbeat. All in all the staff are top notch throughout the hotel. NEgatives I travelled in a small group (5 of us) one of which was disabled and myself on my own so I requested rooms together, we did not get them and could not of been any further apart - being spread out on 3 separate corridors. Rooms - balcony size varies two of the rooms had huge balconies with amazing views and mine you could not swing a cat on it! My room also had a view of a large tree! The rooms are very dark and lighting needs to be looked at as they do not make much difference in the rooms, if you get rooms 242 or close by request a change I tried and was told the hotel was fully booked.... Beach sellers - that is where they belong but for some reason the guards were allowing them within the grounds (not as far as the pool side) weaving between the beds on the grass which if I had been sat in the area would have seriously hacked me off. So that's it, we loved it, want to return and would recommend the heritance ahungalla

We have just spent a wonderful 2weeks at the Heritance Ahungalla . Our first impression of the hotel was. It looked a little tired and in need of a refurbishment, especially our room. But we have never stayed at such a warm and friendly hotel . The staff were marvellous , especially Warooni ( not sure if correct spelling ) and Jananjaya in the restaurant . The food in the buffet restaurant was exceptional ,again possibly the best all inclusive we have had. There were always plenty of sun beds . The pool attendants were most helpful. We preferred the residents pool as it was very relaxing with the occasions monkey, chipmunk, and huge lizards for company. The beach was also very nice for an early morning stroll. Would not hesitate in returning here. Loved every minute.

My wife & I have just returned from a 2 week holiday staying at The Heritance Ahungalla resort & we can only say....wow what a great hotel, the setting,staff,food were fantastic. Please try the seafood & fine dining restaurants, you will not be disappointed. The overall atmosphere is one of pure relaxation. We will be back.

Stayed 20 Mar-03 Apr 18. Located approx 2.5 hours drive south of Negombo airport (Columbo is 30km south) on the west coast. This hotel was built in 1981 by a Dutch designer. The hotel has many open plan areas, foyers and alcoves etc, all with fully matured plants and trees making it considerably more pleasant than your average modern hotel. Set along the beach with 2 very large Mis-shaped (not the standard rectangle!) infinity pools looking on to the ocean and beach. It also has 2 jacuzzis at one of the pools. It is common to see the local wildlife in and around the hotel including monkeys, squirrels, large monitor lizards, a vast array of birds and if your lucky, a snake! (I only saw one on the beach which was a black 7-8â€™ Rat snake which is apparently non venomous and the most common snake!). The staff across the whole hotel are mostly pleasant and friendly and always said hello when passing etc. During our stay, the guests were predominantly British and German with a few other mixed nationalities. Rooms: Varying standards available although dated due to the age of the hotel, they are cleaned twice daily as well as beds being turned etc. Bed linen is of very good quality and very comfortable. A variety of power sockets are available in the rooms including uk 3 pin, multi voltage shaver in the bathroom and a multipurpose socket in the room. A below average Hair dryer is also available as well as a TV, kettle and tea/coffee. Also included is a fridge / mini bar*(see all inclusive comments below). Food: There are a number of eating venues but those on all inclusive have fewer choices which come free but to be honest, the main restaurant has sufficient enough variety to cater for most. I highly recommend the Sri Lankan food and the curries are to die for which I eat most days although I was not brave enough to eat one for breakfast! Additionally, the head chef often walks round at meal times and asks if your happy and if there is anything you would like made especially which he will gladly do! The service in the restaurant can become a little chaotic during peak times and drinks may take a while to turn up etc. For those that need a taste from home occasionally and are on the all inclusive package, the snack bar serves chips, burgers, club sandwiches etc up to midnight. Drinks: The bars are open all day for beer (Lion), cocktails (limited if on AI!), basic tea and coffee (if on AI you will need to pay for cappuccino, latte etc). Coke and Coke Zero are also available on AI. Pool side/Sun loungers: Fortunately, this is not the sort of hotel that attracts (or needs) the sun bed warriors who get up early to claim a spot! This hotel has modern, comfortable, wooden loungers everywhere. On arrival at the pool sides or garden areas you need only pick a spot, the pool attendant will locate you the required amount of loungers, and bring you your loungers Cushions and towels. Note: no towel cards required! Just leave them on the lounger when finished. Also note, there are no loungers allowed on the beach. The main attraction for myself at this hotel is the lack of annoying entertainment staff around the pool areas constantly on their microphone forcing entertainment. Bliss! All Inclusive Package! To justify my following comparison, all of my larger 2 week holidays over a numbers of recent years have been in the Caribbean staying in RIU hotels (Palaces etc) and there is a RIU situated next door to this hotel (2 min walk). However, unlike the RIU next door the all inclusive in the Heritance hotel does NOT include the contents of the mini bar in your room and you will be billed for everything you use. Additionally, and one that causes the most controversy is the wine! This is ONLY available in the main restaurant at lunch and dinner! You will NOT be able to get any wine at any of the bars in the evenings unless you pay for it! As we only generally drink wine in the evenings we chose to buy a bottle most nights which for an average red or white costs approx 5000 plus an additional charge of 1000 for corkage - total approx Â£30 per bottle!!! Hindsight: If you are the type that likes to be out and about a lot, plan what you want to do in Sri Lanka before you book your hotel and then choose one central to your requirements. There are lots of things to do and are very spread out and some journeys are a considerable distance on mostly poor roads (less a few new highways). This one is ideal for whale watching in Mirissa at the southern tip, about 1.30 to drive. Pros: Outstanding and well established hotel with great staff.ğŸ‘ No annoying pool side entertainment.ğŸ‘ No sun bed wars and the beds are not 3 Deep at the pool side!ğŸ‘ Cons: Wine! ie; The lack of regular access to it on the All inclusive package.â˜¹ï¸ Mini bar is not on AI package.â˜¹ï¸ Summary: Assuming my wine requirements subside and I choose to come back to Sri Lanka, I would absolutely use this hotel again. I highly recommend this hotel over any other 5 star hotels I have been in, including the RIUs. This hotel is exceptional and skims off most of the annoying traits of large hotels. I have rated this hotel a 5 out of 5 irrespective of the AI package issues as the hotel is Excellent and should be graded as such. If the geographical area works for your trip, go for it as you definitely wonâ€™t be disappointed. Enjoy ğŸ‘

This was a family holiday with my husband, son and his girlfriend. The holiday was booked via Tui. We werenâ€™t sure what to expect as this was the first package holiday we had booked for some years. We booked an all inclusive suite, which came with a bath big enough for two. All rooms had sea views. There was plenty of room, fruit daily and a welcome bottle of god wine. This is a Beautiful open plan hotel with a fantastic infinity pool which was like a bath in the afternoons. Monkeys roam freely around the hotel corridors. Lizards walk between the sunbeds. Excellent choice of food at breakfast, lunch and dinner and if you were still hungry there was a cafe and bar open for burgers, sandwiches and home made fish fingers. The only down side to this hotel was access to sightseeing, most of the trips involved at leat 2-3 hour mini bus or coach trips and the sea was too rough to swim in properly. There are no sunbeds on the beach and no life savers. The Red flag warnings were up all of the time, however this was not the hotels fault, but is something to bear in mind if you want to snorkel or love beaches. The turtle sanctuary was a highlight and were released six turtle babies back into the sea, there were at least Four weddings at the hotel whilst we were there, all beautiful, therefore an excellent choice for a wedding! We would definitely re-visit and recommend this hotel.

This hotel is in a great location. The staff cannot do enough for you but they are not in your face. We had a very relaxing time. The hotel is immaculately clean and the food is lovely. Rated as 4 star but I would give it 5

Since we had a corporate event with our staff in Dialog Axiata to encourage and entertain their motivation towards the company we had to organize it very carefully. so, for that we had a great help from Mr Praveen, Mr Prasanna and Mr Nipun to experience what we actually expected. they have organized that to have the maximum fun for our staff with out disturbing to the other in-house guests during the event and we had a wonderful dinner buffet without any single complain. For that we like to thank to the chef too for his cordination. so we like to appreciate all the staff members of Heritance who gave us a great corporate to conduct this event successfully.

This resort hotel has a great relaxed feel and plenty of space. Right on a really good beach or plenty of space for lounging around the pool or in the grounds. Nothing locally to walk to and so very much a beach vacation. About an thirty minute drive to Galle proved a superb visit. Eating tends to be buffet based.

Sri Lanka has been my dream since I remember. I wanted everything to be perfect, so I spent a very long time picking the right place to spend my days in this beautiful country. And I found this hotel, Heritance... I have a few very strict conditions about the location, food, staff, beach. Every little detail was important to me. I hate new, too shiny, too luxurious hotel. I prefer something with longer history. I also traveled all by myself but I never felt threatened or in danger. I've felt completely safe in this lovely place. The only thing that annoyed me was the sellers who persecuted me when I wanted to be alone and walk around the beach. I could not even pass one kilometer, I always had to go back. But this is their character I was ready for that. Im really excited that I will be there again this year during April:) Can not wait to see you again Heritance!

The room we had (307) was a good size with a nice balcony overlooking the trees and beach. It was clean, with tea making facilities, a fridge and safe. The bathroom could have done with a bit of attention, the shower leaked out at the bottom meaning the mat was always soaking and there seemed to be a water leak from the sink meaning the floor around it was always wet. The cleaning of the room was excellent and there was always an array of flowers or towel decorations on the bed. There are 2 pools which were kept nice and clean. There are sun loungers around the pool and on the grass area and the attendant was always on hand to supply the cushions and towels. The beach is lovely although between the pool and beach there are a few dogs and you are pestered by sellers of cloths, trips etc. and you can feel unsafe leaving the hotel environment. The all inclusive buffet was very good with lots of choice and different themes throughout the week, although at the busy time of 7pm - 8pm we were asked to have a drink in the bar as there was no room. The Jute restaurant looked very nice but very expensive for all inclusive guests who had already paid for an evening meal, perhaps if there was a happy hour from 7pm-8pm where all inclusive guests could dine for half price that would take some pressure off the main restaurant. Overall a lovely 10 day stay, only wish it was longer.

My family booked this lovely Hotel online. We enjoyed our holiday there - it's a great place - close to the beach; good food; friendly service. The hotel has some kind of activity going on every day for all age groups, including activity for kids......the staff were kind enough to upgrade us, as in the recent past....it was a pleasant experience, and a relaxing holiday for us.

I spent 3 nights in this beautiful hotel with my wife & my then 10 months old son. Hotel reservation staff members were so kind to upgraded us to a suit where we had a baby cot too. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there as all staff members were very friendly and respectful towards us and one particular lady who was the restaurant supervisor even looked after our son while we were having our meals whenever she was working. Itâ€™s surrounded by beautiful scenes and i would definitely go back there when I next go to Sri Lanka.

For last 7 years I have been to this property for more than 4 times. Every time the staff surprised us with their warm service and great smiles. Excellent food with Sri Lankan touch. Great property and enjoyed the dips in pool. Kudos to the team

We booked through Tui who apart from booking it after I booked on line did nothing, even after booking the wedding package we had to basically organise everything ourselves. The rep at the resort ( Gerard ) was helpful though. ğŸ‘ The hotel was superb, the staff were really helpful, the wedding coordinator ( Imarsha ) was so helpful it was untrue! Even to the point of changing the time by 3 hours due to weather forecast. The pool, bar and restaurant staff were great too. The room was spotless, cleaners every day with clean sheets and towels twice daily. The food was really good, but the only fault is that like all other All inclusive it was a little repetitive but thatâ€™s expected. The wedding itself was the best day ever, even more than we expected, the staff sorted everything and it couldnâ€™t have gone any better. I would like to take this opportunity to thank all of them from my wife and I. I would highly recommend the Heritance if you want a nice quiet holiday, good food and in general just being looked after. The one down side which is really out of the hotels hands is the Tuk tuk drivers outside the main gates, they do tend to pester and follow you as soon as you step foot outside! But they are only trying to make a living.

Many years of returns to this place give high expectations. Heritance really take care. As usual the staff is making the stay to a pleasure. One unforgettable dinner on the beach was the perfect ending. Mr Sisira promised god memories and we got, thanks!

We had a great get-together at the place. Food was excellent. Staff was Friendly. Nice location which is easily accessible. They got two large swimming pools out of which one is exclusively for the stay-in guests. So your holiday will not be ruined by the outsiders. Great for couples too

The hotel is situated in Galle road, Ahungalla and can easily be accessed by a public bus. The hotel was good, clean, and the food was nice. The hotel is built with an antique look/theme however. The old rooms are a bit gloomy and therefore, you might want to spend some extra bucks and ask for a newer/premium room (which I got). There are two large pools and there are 2 small jacuzzis (no extra fee) next to one of those pools!

We recently returned from our stay at this hotel where we were greeted with smiles and great service. Our room was clean and very spacious with lovely views. The staff at this hotel are excellent, special mention for the reception staff, our room boy and particularly Asela who could not do enough for us. Breakfast fayre was excellent, lunch extensive and evening meals plenty to choose from. Would certainly recommend.

We have just returned from a 2 week (all inclusive) stay at the Heritance and had a great time. Our room was a bit tired but I believe is due to be refurbished, some rooms already having been renovated.
