The hotel is in a good position on a lovely beach â€“ great for a walk and it would take us just over an hour to walk to the far end and back. The sea is a bit rough for swimming in and the red flag was up for our entire stay, however it was good fun in the waves if you donâ€™t go out your depth. There are 2 decent sized swimming pools and we never had any problem getting a sunbed. Being all inclusive, all our meals were taken in the buffet restaurant. However there is an a la carte and a fish restaurant if you fancy a change, although you would have to pay for these and there is no discount. We found there was plenty of variety on the buffet and the food was of an excellent quality with authentic local dishes and of course a wide choice of different curries (green pea/cashew and beetroot/potato were some of our favourites). All the staff were very friendly and efficient. The chap that cleaned our room (319) was excellent and the bed was always beautifully decorated with flowers. Jananjaya in the restaurant was always there to top up our drinks. When you first arrive and walk on the beach or go out the front gate you will be approached by people looking to sell you trips/tuk tuk rides. Whilst it can get a bit annoying they are definitely better value than the tour operator excursions. We had a taxi to the fort at Galle for Â£30 between the two of us and the driver waited for us, whereas the tour company were charging Â£55 each for a half day trip to Galle. We also took tuk tuks to Brief garden by Bevis Bawa and the Lunuganga Estate of Geoffrey Bawa, and they were some of the highlights of our trip. There is an ATM about a 10 minute walk up the road. One thing to be aware of at the airport when you leave Sri Lanka is that you cannot take bottled water onto the plane, even if you have purchased it in the departure lounge. Oh and by the way there is a public holiday when there is a full moon and no alcohol can be sold anywhere and is not available at the hotel.

(+)Same old same old... and it is what we like about this overprised hotel. We recodnised an amazing flavor of Heritance Ahungalla first go. Our suite room was perfect. Greate stuff and cervice level. (-)The hotel was overbooked. After checking - in (13p.m.) we could not find a free couch with the pool area and put our things on the stairs. We could not to find the stuff as well. The next day was the same situation.

From the moment we arrived we were greeted with smiles and fantastic service. The level of service throughout the hotel was without exception first class. We stayed in a room overlooking the main swimming pool and also a suite, both of which were lovely. All of our wedding arrangements were taken care of seamlessly, and the whole experience of getting married abroad could not have been smoother. A special thanks has to go to Shanika Jayasekara who co-ordinated our wedding and was there throughout the day making sure everything went to plan. Shanika and Mawatte Mawanna both Executive Officers at the hotel kindly acted as witnesses on the day for which we were both very grateful. On the wedding day we had a tropical storm in the middle of the service, this meant we had to quickly re-locate to a covered area, this was done by many hands in little time, everyone very willing to make the best of the situation. This made a big difference to our day and eventually the sun came back out and we finished the service in the gardens of the hotel. Many thanks for making our wedding unforgettable.

We spent 3 nights here and had what can only be described as a well catered for break. Super friendly staff within a medium sized property located right on the beach is a dream combination. With two pools and the beachfront location, you can not fail to find an area and an ambiance to suit your taste. Quiet, lively, pool side or beach, you can find a number of differing locations. Unfortunately, outside of the resort the small town has little to offer but Bentota and Galle are in the area and can be reached from the hotel.

This was our 11 th visit to this hotel designed by Geoffrey Bawa. The General manager Sisira & his staff are very approachable & helpful as always. We had the previledge to meet up with Thushara & Prasanna both of whom we first met at their sister hotel in Kandalama in 1995. Thushara at f&b was outstanding as expected & went way beyond the call of duty to make our stay that much more comfortable & homely The main restaurant & coffee lounge served great food & our room on the 3rd level was magnificient

I visited with my adult son & we were really impressed with this hotel. The layout was spacious, the room immaculate & the gardens lovely. The buffet has plenty to choose from & was busy enough that the food was fresh & not over cooked, and the a la carte restaurant food was varied & excellent. The garden area is gorgeous & the 2 pools are large & the T shapes made them really good to swim in as there are plenty of ways to swim lengths. The staff were friendly & efficient enough & the bar areas were buzzy without feeling crowded. The beach is expansive, but the sea was somewhat rough - recommended for looking at rather than swimming in.

I stayed with my family including my two kids for 3 days , it was nice and very enjoyable stay for all of us. Food is excellent (taste and variety ), adding resturatn service given by the staffs made us more comfortable. Overall very friendly service all over

Having spent 8 days braving the roads of Sri Lanka touring their cultural triangle, we arrived at this hotel looking forward to a lovely rest for 7 days and we were not disappointed. This hotel is right on the beach and there is very little around it. It is for this reason that we went half board. A good decision is some respects as there is only one other bar 500 Metres up the beach along with a beach shack. The food at the beach bar was fine and considerably cheaper than the hotel should you be buying on a day to day basis. We often walked to the beach shack at a lunchtime for a beer (300 rupees and considerably larger than that offered by the hotel for 600R). The hotel, in effect has three restaurants. The buffet, the fine dining and the fish restaurant. If you are all inclusive or Â½ board you can use the buffet (drinks are extra) but if you choose to use the other two you have to pay. We did not use the fine dining but the food looked good. We did use the fish restaurant on my birthday and it was a pleasant change to the buffet. The surrounding are not particularly appealing, the table and stools not comfortable. Because it was my birthday they had prepared a lovely table for me and provided â€˜properâ€™ chairs making for a much more comfortable experience. The fish was fresh and delicious and went well with the white wine we had ordered. Because Sri Lanka does not produce wine, it is imported and so by locals standards, quite expensive, but no more so that what we pay in the UK. I do feel that the hotel could offer a discount at these two restaurants if you had paid for Â½ board or all inclusive but chose not to use the buffet The buffet has a large selection of food on offer and so if you were just using the one hotel for your stay in this country a great way to try the curries that seem to make up the staple diet. (You can even have curry for breakfast). There was considerably more than curry though raging from salads (all cleaned in bottled water), soups to fish and meats. The range of sweets was very good and finished the meal off nicely. My criticism is that perhaps there is too much choice with the main course and as a consequence the food was on the whole not that hot and it was definitely quantity over quality. I cannot say the food was bad, but in my experience it was no more than average. I have certainly eaten a lot better around the world. Breakfast was once again a buffet with a very good selection or hot food and pastries and continental. In my opinion a better experience than the dinner. Turning to the rooms. We were first given a room on the second floor (they use the American system so no ground floor (1)) with a sea view. Number 229. Ok there were some trees in the way so perhaps sea glimpses would be more appropriate, but that did not distract from the fact that we could see and hear it. The room was not that far from the reception but we were told it was a quiet room. It was very â€˜tiredâ€™ with the decor needing to be updated. At around 9pm we could hear the singer in the bar and also people arriving in reception. The music went onto 11:00 by which time i had been to reception to arrange to move. This was the only major complaint I have as the man on the desk first told me the hotel was full and then looked at his watch as if it was relatively early and made me feel that it was my fault that at 10pm I wanted to get to bed. After not accepting the excuse that it was full they arranged for us to move further along the corridor to the far end of the hotel, well away from the bar and reception the following day. This was in the same design room but one that had been decorated and refurbished. This had been done to a high standard and was very comfortable. We had this for free but they do charge $20 a night for the privilege of having a room that has been refurbished. We were told that the original rooms had not been decorated in 32 years. The room was cleaned daily sheets and towels changed. In the evening housekeeping came round to see if everything is ok and if you needed anything. I think at this point I need to say that all the staff were always friendly, polite and willing to help. Nothing seemed too much effort for them. I cannot praise the staff enough and they certainly make your stay enjoyable. There are two pools, the infinity pool that you see as you arrive at reception, and another in the grounds that whilst not infinity is big enough to swim/cool off and is far less crowded, by far the better choice in my opinion. There are more than enough sun beds, but as at most resorts there are some that insist on putting their towels on the beds that they consider their own for the duration of their stay. If you are prepared to tip the pool attendants, as some did, they will put towels on the beds for you, as they set them up early in the morning If you have a bed by the perimeter you do get hawkers that are in the grounds of the hotel, but stay on the perimeter trying to sell you trousers and sarongs (my wife bought two pairs of trousers at a shop on our travels for 500R whilst the hawkers wanted 2000R for one pair!) I am told that the hotel intend to keep them out of the grounds in the near future. I am aware that this seems a bit negative, not something that I intended as i wanted to give constructive criticism and to make it informative for those considering booking this hotel. I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel. The new rooms are lovely, the ground beautiful (watch out for the little tree squirrels and the small Iguanas) that are lovely to see. Of course in conclusion I reiterate that staff is amongst the best I have encountered and make this hotel what it is.

We stayed at Heritance Ahungalla for 3 nights. Itâ€™s a well maintained property with a very clean beach and lush mangroves around. The interiors are great, good swimming pools (2), reasonably decent staff compared to some of the other properties we stayed in and decent food. They have a couple of restaurants, bars etc. with plenty to chose from with a large buffet spread as well. The menu is largely continental and mix of Sri Lankan cuisine. The customer service was fine, but not as per 5 star standards. Overall, good stay and they can do better.

We spent a week at Heritance between 28.12.2017 and 4.01.2018. Everything was perfect. We lived at the highest floor (room no.301) with fantastic seaview. Room was clean, spacious and well equipped. Hotel area very well maintained and not crowded (no problems with sunbeds and quiet places to relax). Choice and quality of food was amazing. The New Year's party was organized perfectly. (our best New Year's party ever). Long and clean beach excellent for walks (no problems with "beachboys"). But the best thing at Ahungalla is staff. Always polite and helpful. Special thanks for Mr. Praveen Fernando (food & beverage executive), Chef D.J Manjula and Mr. Nuwan Sasanka. Thank you very much for everything and see you in December 2018.

Fantastic beach but they do not allow sun loungers and shades on the sand. I have been told the hotel does not encourage you to use the beach in case locals come along trying to sell items. This to date is our only complaint.

My wife and I stayed here for three weeks and overall found it to be a comfortable and very friendly hotel. This is branded as a five star hotel, but in our experience, these star ratings are pretty meaningless and we have found that nearly everywhere we have been in the world. If you are influenced by star ratings you may be disappointed for reasons I will explain later. The public areas are expansive and the hotel looks out over a lovely beach area. The red warning flag flew every day of our stay and you would do well to take notice of this because there are strong undercurrents. But we swam nearly every day in the hotel pools both of which are large and set in the attractive hotel grounds. Our room was on the 3rd floor and a good size with all the usual fittings including tv with mostly English channels, very effective shower, balcony overlooking hotel gardens, hair dryer and a safe. One day a room attendant arrived to change the safe and after emptying, picked it up and put it on his trolley. Not so safe then! There is a well equipped gymn on the 2nd floor and there is good Wi-Fi throughout the hotel and even in the grounds it isnâ€™t too bad. Here I have to mention what many visitors will regard as the main criticism of the hotel. The rooms are a bit dated and well used. By that I mean they do look a bit tired and in need of refurbishment. Having said that, I don't think people should be put off by this because there are many really good aspects to this property. For example, we stayed on an all inclusive basis and the food in the main restaurant is outstanding. Every day there are at least seven or eight choices of main course. If that's not enough Chef Manjula who walks the restaurant floor during service, will cook something to your liking. Most of the cuisine is curry orientated but you can get plain fish or meat. He cooked a very tasty sirloin for me. Coupled with the friendly service, and the delightful staff, this really is the main selling point of the hotel. It is worth noting if you are all inclusive that you can only get wine (it's Italian) in the main restaurant and not from the bars. This was a bit irritating for us since we are wine drinkers and didn't want to drink beer, shorts or cocktails they serve in the bar areas. The other point to be aware of is that for religious reasons, if it is a full moon the law forbids the sale of any alcoholic drink for the whole day. There are quite severe penalties if any establishment is found selling or distributing alcohol. We also got caught out on Independence day and regional election day both of which were no alcohol days. The hotel has two fine dining restaurants and a seafood shack called the Wadiyah. We tried this and had fresh grilled fish right by the beach. In our opinion, it is not particularly fine dining. The table mats were dirty, only bar stools were provided until we asked for proper chairs, the music stopped and was never restarted, the salad was very small and the area is poorly lit. It lacked any real atmosphere. You have to pay for any of the alternative dining and we paid 15000 Sri Lankan rupees which is about Â£75 including wine. We also dined in the Upper Room where mostly European food is served and had New Zealand lamb which was very good. In our opinion this is a good hotel with excellent food in the main restaurant and wonderful friendly staff. They really do go the extra mile to make your stay a happy one. This all goes a long way towards overcoming the increasingly pressing need for refurbishment of the bedrooms.

Had a fabulous 2day stay at this resort.the food was awesome especially the breakfast spread.the beach is awesome and the spa is great.everything about this resort makes you feel absolutely relaxed! Loved every moment if my stay here

Loving this place, staff are friendly and helpful. Food is one of the best we have had. Sea is a little rolling so snorkelling is out but with two large pools like bath water canâ€™t moan. Sea is great for paddle and a lovely long walk on beach. Would definitely come back again â¤ï¸ğŸŒ´ğŸ’ğŸºğŸ°

We spent two nights of total rest and relaxation. Staff were friendly and helpful. The high tea was a disappointment as it took nearly an hour to be delivered and when it did arrive the food was disappointing too. Breakfast and dinner buffets had an extensive selection of food. Sous-chef Manjula was very helpful and got us some special dishes from the kitchen. The lady making the hoppers was very kind and helpful too. Beautiful landscaped gardens. Everything was clean and tidy. Great after dinner entertainment. During the day there are plenty of activities to keep the guests entertained. (Water aerobics, beach volleyball etc)

We stayed in this hotel 3 nights during our trip in Sri Lanka and I have to say, that definitly, when I will be in Sri Lanka again, so for sure back to this hotel. Absolutly great services. Very nice, helpful and always smiling staff. Very well equiped room. And what is very important: Fantastic food with huge veriety. Nice and clean 2 swimmingpools and outdoor whirlpools with warm watter. As well the beach is very nice, without sunbeds and umbrellas, but we stayed in the hotel garden, where is a lot of different treas and palms, it means as well shadow, and we were only going there for swimming. You can watch at fantastic sunset. When you go to the beach and you will continue to the right side, there is little rock with nice view to the ocean and small fishing harbour. At the end of the beach is as well small restaurant Sunshine Ahungalla where is great sea food with funny prices and I have eaten there the best butter-garlic shrimps ever. For sure it is good idea to have in the hotel only hb and for lunch to walk to this place. I can only recommend this place to everybody - families, couples, singles.

So first impressions... Hotel design and overall impression is just lovely. It is airy, with open atrium spaces dotted throughout the hotel, filled with established trees, beautiful. Room - needs some TLC and more clothes hangers!! NB there never is in any hotel!!! Extra ones delivered within the hour. but overall was clean and spacious. Twin bed quickly made into KS (within 30 mins!) and handle not attached to drawer... fixed next day. Could do with some more easy accessible plug points in the room. All staff very friendly and keen to help and someone always cleaning somewhere! Food - OMG!! Curry heaven!! Mix of western and traditional, some curries not for the faint hearted... Head Chef walks around the restaurant speaking to the guests and offering to cook requested dishes (within reasonable limits) which is a nice touch. Things to know: Lunch at the coffee bar a good option, fish fingers and chips delicious and not what you expect.... sometimes service here a bit slow, but you are on holiday!! Go for the quiet pool, though more people getting to know about it, on sunny days monkeys come to the fruit trees here about 5, but not every day. Lots of wildlife, lizards, geckos, palm squirrels (look like chipmunks), birds and the random cats and dogs Do have a look at the non-inclusive cocktail menu : ) Be careful of what is not all inclusive...Diet Coke not, zero coke is!! Nor are the bits in the mini bar Evening entertainment mixed, but the Sri Lanka day on a Friday is lovely. Unusually, the hotel shop is not very well stocked, so do not rely on it for emergency toiletries!! Luckily I donâ€™t. Sells mainly gifts. Dakshika and Trilishiya on the reception desk always greet you with a lovely smile and will try and help any way they can, they are both a real credit to the hotel. Danuka in the bar area is really helpful and attentive (swear he has a twin brother as he is always there!!) and very kind. Jananjaya is great with keeping us topped up with tea and coffee at breakfast!! A thank you in Sinhalese is always appreciated. Hawkers on the beach and edge of hotel do stop you but will take no for an answer, always haggle by at least half. Chaminder at the beach great for arranging transport, did a tuk tuk to Bentota and driver stayed with us the whole time and translated and helped haggle. Later in the holiday we hired a mini bus with driver through Chamindra to take four of us to Galle, firstly Â£50 all in versus Â£50 each they TUI! Stopped at a moonstone mine on the way, did a spot of shopping en-route. At Galle, walked and drove round the fort and town, stopped for lunch on the way back in Hikkadula, then had walk round Natural Silk factory and shop on the way back, some lovely bits there! Bought some tea from a local tea shop in Ahungalla for a very good price and lastly to the Spice Garden in Ahungalla, again interesting but beware the hard sell and the â€˜freeâ€™ massages which are far from it...donations are expected. Got picked up at 10 and back by 5 Trips: Elephant day at Uduwalawe amazing! Long coach trip there and back about 4 hours each way. Loo and later lunch stop at Centauria Wild, lunch ok, but the hotel also gives you a lunch box as well as breakfast one! Give one away to the driver , Well worth the money and the early start!! (4.30 pick up back about 6.30) Whale watching - accept there is no guarantee of what you see, we luckily saw dolphins, pilot whales and blue whale, amazing!! However, if it is a rainy day, take a change of clothes and a waterproof bag for your camera and phone!! We got soaked by rain and salt spray from the boat, plastic bucket seats really uncomfortable and not for the larger derriere ... the real shame is the amount of boats out at the same time, convinced it scared things off! The boats are not well designed in that the seats are very close together so it is really hard to get across and see things on the other side of the boat and some people do not move to let others see. The whole itinerary is great value for money if the weather is kind, but if you can stretch to booking a private car and boat, do it! Now I know what I know, thatâ€™s whatâ€™s I would do next time. This is a 4.30 pick up, back for just after 7 Madu river cruise - AMAZING! Do it!! Great value for money, short coach journey (less than 20 mins) we were lucky enough for the time of year to plant a mangrove sapling and release a baby turtle into the ocean, but think both these things depends on the time of year, so ask the rep. It is an afternoon trip so you get to spend the morning by the pool, back by 6.30 Kandy day, very very very long day... picked up at 4am from hotel got back at 9pm..... did the part coach, then train, then coach back, train was fun, a throwback to the 60â€™s... some other groups got back at 11pm... Temple of the Tooth, whilst very interesting, we went the day before a National holiday and it was rammed! Beautiful building and setting, but too busy to take everything in. Lunch was the usual buffet affair, then onto the botanical gardens, lovely if you like plants and gardens, sadly wasted on me! Onto the tea factory which was really interesting, you can buy it cheaper from a local supermarket, but from the factory you know exactly where it came from. Final stop was a herbal and spice garden, which again is very interesting if you have not done it before. Least favourite of the four visits as too long a day and too much crammed in. Remember...4.00 am pick up and back for 9pm.... if you are lucky! In summary, loved Sri Lanka, the people, the environment and would very happily come back to the Heritance.

What a location, with the pool ,beach and sea combined! With spacious rooms and awesome food what else you expect! On top of all is the lovely staff who were always smiling and offering their services. Check in and out was very personal with welcoming. Thanks to all the lovely staff!

My partner bought me here for my birthday Hotel is lovely & friendly staff . The house keeping staff where very friendly . Lots of food and drink to offer . We loved the wadiya shack where we eat for my birthday and the birthday cake getting delivered to our room was a nice touch. Only fault we would of liked to walk on beach more but couldnâ€™t because as soon as you foot hit the sand you would be asked to buy sarongs and to go on trips we kept declining but would get followed .

We were welcomed with such love...from the time we arrived until we left we were treated like royalty. everything is perfectâ€¦The pools, food, and room is amazing! Hope to come back and I will recommend for anyone. Special thank for Food And Beverage Executive Mr.Praveen Fernando and all staff members.

Would love to thank all the members of Heritance Ahungalla who supported to success SLITHM Food and Beverage-025 Hotel Visit. It was a great place and the service was on a great level. And would love to give a special thank to Mr. Praveen Fernando, F&B Executive.

On 9th of February I and my colleague at SLITHM went to Heritance Ahungala hotel as a dayouting. I would like to mention the first impression of the hotel which is the warm welcome by the hotel staff was excellent. The staff was very friendly and supportive. They cared about us throughout the day. We enjoyed our day very well. The hotel itself had arranged some team building activities. They were wonderful. The pool was perfect. The sea view is relaxing. The food was delicious. We got a five star hotel experience. And I would like to give special compliments and thanks to the Food and Beverage executive Mr. PRAVEEN FERNANDO, who was a graduate of Sri Lanka Institute of Tourism and Hotel Management, for arranging our tour to Heritance Ahungala and providing us all the facilities. I like to thank rest of the management team and the staff for their great service throughout our vist. I and my fellow colleagues highly recommend this hotel as it provides all the facilities for a real five star experience. Overall Heritance Ahungala is a very nice and calm hotel to relax and enjoy.

We traveled to Heritance Ahungalla on 09/02/18 as a part of the SLITHM F&B 025 class the hospitality we received right from the time we checked in till we were on our way back was magical.Heritance ahungalla is really a great place to make memories .The food, service, accomedation,pool,recreation facilities provided were notthing less than 5 star. Special recognition should go to the f&b exective Praveen Fernando who provided us witha detailed explanation of the hotel plus thought us a lot related to F&B. All in all if im to talk about HERITANCE AHUNGALLA it would be MAGESTIC .truely is one of the best 5star rated hotels in the country all the very best to all of you at heritance ahungalla cheers

Perfect landscaped and self sufficient garden which is designed by Geoffry Bawa.Peaceful place to relax We had a couple of rooms for our changing pourposes.hotel rooms looked lovely and very clean The food was excellent.our group had a mixture of western and local food.it was wonderful and memorable stay. Kind,polite, and pleasant staff. I really appreciate their service.special thanks to Mr.Praveen Fernando ( food and beverage executive )he was the person who took care of us and arranged everything during our stay.I should say that as much as our group and myself enjoyed a lot at Heritance I left determined that my next visit to Heritance Ahungalla must include an overnight stay. Best Regards

Thank you for all the staff members who supported to success SLITHM Food and beverage-025 hotel vist and Special thank for Mr.Praveen Fernando F&b Executive.We had a great time at Heritance.Perfect service and beautiful Hotel.Thank you Heritance

Today we went to a heritance ahungala as a dayouting with my colleagues of SLITHM colombo. And it was a really well spent day out there. We were warmly welcomed by the staff and through out the day we were well cared. Specially the staff was realy helpful and as well as very friendly. We enjoyed our day very well. Pool , food and rooms were perfect . And there were some teambond building events oraganized by the Animator ( sry i cant remeber the name ğŸ™‚) which were very interesting. We enjoyed a lot and experienced a real five star service. And specials thanks goes to Mr. Praveen fernando who is the food and beverage executive and to the rest of management team , as well as all the staff members for taking care of us really well and giving all the facilities and all. Highly recommended place. And its worth to say that "one of the best five star resort in downsouth. " Cheers ğŸ˜Š

A great resort right on the beach with great rooms and service . 2 great swimming pools , a night club and other amenities . Clean and well maintained rooms . A great weekend capped by a well organised Independence Day celebration organised by the staff .

Excellent Place to spent holidays. place is very peaceful and calm. service is excellent. Best staff we met so far, very understanding, flexible and pleasant. Pool is very clean. Beach area is also good. Food is excellent. we are really satisfied. hope to visit again.

Iâ€™m afraid this review is late in being written as we had a new addition. We travelled to Heritance and had a wonderful time. The staff cannot do enough for you and always a happy face. At the time we visited, the rooms were being redone I think, but ours was a little dated. For the value though and the view you really can look past this. Itâ€™s like an animal paradise with monkeys, giant fruit bats with a 2 metre wing span, sea eagles and so many more and thatâ€™s just around the hotel. The safari is well worth going on where you will see elephants as as bee eaters and so many more. The infinity pool and the beach really make the hotel. The breakfasts and the fresh fruit was so fresh. We had various towel art in our room and the room was cleaned daily. I would recommend to go with a recommended taxi from the hotel as we decided to walk out ourselves and as much as we were safe the road is quite narrow and the buses did get a little bit close to us at speed as we walked to the turtle sanctuary. Also if you walk to the end of the beach to the left as you go on to the beach expect touts at the end who ask for money for through passage. They were just trying to make money but we did not feel completely sure about their intentions. Thanks so much for making our trip a special one and weâ€™d love to go back and enjoy the beach which was nicer than those I saw in many areas of Thailand. A real paradise.

Our problem started upon our arrival when we were told that we had been upgraded to a luxury room, but it turned out to be an isolated one (at the very end of the hotel) with a view on tennis courts. In addition, the room contained only 2 beds (One queen-sized and another â€œExtraâ€ bed). As we had explicitly requested (and confirmed twice with our travel agent) a room with 3 beds and a sea view, we made this clear to the staff member who showed us the room. After she spent some time on the phone, she referred us to the manager on duty( Srinath A ). This manager was beyond rude and impatient, immediately telling us that there were no other rooms available for us to change, because apparently we had checked in late (6 pm). Brushing aside this unprofessionalism, we peacefully requested a refund, in order to be available to switch hotels and find what we are looking for elsewhere. At this point, the manager refused and defiantly told us: â€œWe donâ€™t have money at the hotel. Talk to your travel agent to get money, and go''. After spending 3 hours in the lobby and threatening to escalate if we were not refunded our money right away, suddenly and magically, a suite became available for us to move into, which uncovered the lies that were being told before about the hotel being fully-booked. Such dishonesty and disrespect is not worthy of a 5-star hotel.

This is a very nice hotel with 2 pools. Food is great. lovely atmosphere. the staff was great & very helpful Nice place to be. Food is great though NOT much variety. Location is superb near the beach. love this hotel.

Our trip was in Dec which is a busy month. However when we called them in the morning to check if an early check in was possible they said 12pm would be fine. On our arrival we were made to sit in the lobby for 2 hours. We could have saved that time by coming later if it was not promised for 12 pm. When they finally gave us the room it was not cleaned well and we were told that the family before us had really messed it up and also stayed on way past check out time. Apart from this our stay was good. The room was big and spacious and the beds very comfortable. If the doors were left open a few mosquitoes would get in so its best to keep them shut when going to the pool or beach. The room service was ok. Best to stick to the rice as the burger we ordered was not very good. The fried rice was quite good. The staff are friendly and helpful. The chefs at the live stations in the morning (specially a lady) were very unenthusiastic about serving and overall the service was very poor. We expected more as it is after all a Heritance Hotel and should have 5 star service. The residents pool is the highlight. Its clean, big and quiet so we really enjoyed spending time at the pool. Hope the service improves.

This place is not too far from Colombo and we could reach the hotel in less than two hours. The pool was big enough to accommodate a big crowd and had a big moderately shallow area so that the kids can enjoy. The beach next to the hotel was clean. The rooms are bit old but well maintained and all the toiletries were there. The condition of the bed was also good. The food was satisfactory for the price paid. Spread was reasonable but the salads section could be improved. The staff was very friendly and supportive. They even offered to make something special for the little kid. Overall a nice experience.

I was there on Sinhala Tamil New year. Staff is very friendly and rooms are great with sea view. Food was not that good. But the pools were great Very calm and relaxing. They had traditional dances , singers and other entertaining plays. Wonderful place

We visited our favourite hotel , this time with our second born and entire family. The room we got has been upgraded and was very comfortable. The food has improved even more ( not that it was ever bad), service standard was once again 5 star plus. Hotel had the guest engaged all the time, magic show on Saturday , and cookery demo for the kids,as seen in the attached photograph. Special thanks to F&B manager Mr. Thushara and GM, Mr. Sisira Senaratn e.We look forward to returning again.

Excellent service, fab location and gorgeous. Beach is clean and wide. The cleanest we have seen so far. It's also a great choice for families as there was a great magic show and a night show. Food was lovely and the hotel in general was excellent value for money.

Our initial impression was that the hotel was ok but in need of some TLC but to be fair the rooms were kept clean and the general atmosphere made for a very pleasant holiday. General points you may like to note: - the Sri Lankan people are genuinely very friendly which to begin with can confuse westerners. - the beach sales people arenâ€™t actually that troublesome (nor are the dogs) - both pools are lovely though the green pool has far fewer kids - we never had any difficulty actually getting sun beds, though not always were we wanted them and there was a shortage of umbrellas - Food flavours lovely though we personally found the meats tough on occasion. Truthfully food does get a bit sameâ€™y after 14 nights. Wine in our first week on the all inclusive package was ropey but seemed to be changed halfway though. People said there had been complaints. - There are 2 complimentary bottles of water in room each day and it is in plentiful supply. - there is 1 â€œBritishâ€ electric socket in the room but the rest require an adapter. Wall mounted hair drier ok but nothing special. - mosquitoes are a nightmare - take loads of spray. If you are on a TUI all inclusive it maybe helpful to know: - wine is only included with lunch and dinner. Cocktails are ok but not great. Ask for bottled tonic. - you can eat in the other restaurants at additional cost but with a 15% discount. - some tours (e.g Kandy by train and whale watching) start at 4 or 4.30 in the morning! Which wasnâ€™t pointed out when we booked it. We didnâ€™t get back from Kandy until 9.45pm so a very long (if great) day. Weâ€™d also recommend the Madu Nature Tour. 1/2 day with a turtle release at the end - joyous! - upgrade flights if you get the chance. Itâ€™s about Â£250 per flight per person but is worth it in our opinion from the airport lounge to the slightly larger seats it adds to the holiday. To sum up we will return to Sri Lanka but not on an all inclusive basis ...

We returned to the hotel after having been affected by the 2004 tsunami, when our holiday was abruptly terminated after just four days. The staff, at the time, had been superb in a very difficult situation especially, as we were on the ground floor and our room and all our possessions had been completely destroyed. It was a great pleasure to return once again. The wonderful design, by Geoffrey Bawa, still impresses, and the location of the hotel - right on a very clean beach - is excellent. I have only one grumble. We were rather disappointed by our luxury room, especially the bathroom, which had limescale all over the shower glass and unpleasant tile grouting. Apart from that, I have nothing but praise. The room boys kept the room spotless, and were very efficient. The food is of an excellent standard, and there is always a wide variety. The breakfasts are superb, usually with two omelette stations - and there is always something unexpected, especially at dinner: roast leg of lamb, a whole roast turkey, a bbq with delicious langoustines. As well as some 'Western-style' food, there is a lovely range of tasty Sri Lankan dishes. Even the bread is impressive, with a wonderful choice of bread loaves and rolls. The pastry chef, and his team, also deserve great praise for the skilfully made, and delicious, deserts. The variety of food is such that one would never get bored with what is on offer. The quality of the staff can make or break a holiday, and the staff at the Heritance are wonderfully helpful, warm and friendly - from the reception desk to the bar staff. We enjoyed cocktails on the restaurant lawn one evening, when the General Manager, hearing of our previous experience, kindly invited us to a really excellent dinner on the beach, making our final night a very memorable one. Thanks to all the Heritance staff for their friendly and welcoming attitude. It makes for a really memorable holiday, and we will definitely return again.

Arriving at this hotel, it looked rather impressive with its long entrance and infinity pool overlooking the beach and ocean. On closer consideration, expecting five star quality, I was surprised to see stagnant water in some of the fountains, the quality of the material used in the hallways of the hotel looked rather cheap and our room, while quite big and comfortable seemed kind of empty (as if some furniture had been removed or was mssing something). The hotel food was average (which was how I found most of the food during our stay in Sri Lanka). For the positive, we loved the beautiful beach, which was one of the highlights of our trip, the greenery surrounding the pool areas and the natural beauty of it all, was what finally made our stay quite enjoyable (as well as the geckos wandering around). To reiterate, our room was very comfortable, clean and quite large for the three of us, with a very nice, large bathroom. We had a balcony overlooking the pool area and we could hear the waves of the ocean (unfortunately as of the evening we could not leave the doors opened because of the mosquitos).

We stayed 6 Night all inclusive in Nov. 2017. We choose to have a small suite and had room 258, which was at the corner of the quiet relax pool area. A great choice. Lots of space, clean, quiet. Our roomboy Rosham was fantastic. Everyday nice decoration of towels, flowers, etc. The food was fabulous. Usually we are not the all inclusive type of guests. And before staying at the Heritance, we did a private 8 day tours throughout the country. The Heritance food chefs managed to have an aboundance of curries, salads, soups and others local dishes at an individual local style level. You could get typical international food, as well as at least 8 different curry per dinner, lunch, ... fantastic. A real pleasure. The staff in general was very attentive and caring. The beach is clean and a long streched out sand beach, so you can walk along it for a while. The resort is clean and tidy an we always found a sun bed for us. Drinks, etc all great. I celebrated my 50th birthday at the Hertiance, and I even got a small surpise cake and flowers after my wife inquired at the reception. I will definitively come again. A big "Thank You!! to all of the staff.

Had a three night stay at this hotel ideally located on the beach at Ahungalla. The checkin with our group had a few issues with rooms not being ready even after checkin time!! The rooms are clean and tidy and the linen is fresh and cleaned daily. Room 305 is excellent and offers wonderful oceans views. The dining room offers a fine array of meals both at breakfast and dinner. Overall the hotel is quite good but probably in need of a refurbishment.

We had a family reunion of my mother's extended family, tied up with her 90th birthday celebration last weekend at Heritance Ahungalla. There were 41 members in all, ranging from ages 90 to 1. From giving us a special discount rate and booking code (for the overseas family members ) by the reservation desk at Aitken Spence head office, to the many demands we made at the hotel for the various celebrations - eg;private meeting place to have drinks and to celebrate the 4th birthday of little Luka (a great grand nephew from New Zealand) the hotel lived up to its reservation for warm hospitality. Despite being full, the restaurant staff were somehow able to accommodate all those who came to dinner, with extra tables and chairs sprouting up as occasion demanded; the food was superlative, including BBQ lobster, and many of the overseas relatives who had been touring the island before coming to Ahungalla, declared the food here to be the best. There were many action stations- so guests could watch how vadai/ thosai and other sweetmeats were made. There was a magic show to keep the kids entertained as well as a cultural show, including a devil dancer and fire eater. On Sunday there was even a baking session for the little ones, who were all given a chef's hat and white overall.They also made a special effort to celebrate Thai Pongal with a kolam at the entrance and serving all the related food and sweetmeats associated with the festival. The hotel also offers baby sitting service and some family members felt very comfortable in having them look after the children in their rooms, while they had dinner in the restaurant.I noticed that even the management staff were hands on,helping out as a team with service staff. There is a sense of space and serenity at Heritance Ahungalla which makes it very special. I know now why we chose that hotel, out of all the hotels in Sri Lanka, some with more competitive deals. Shanthi Dias

Staff really helpful and they try their best to make your stay as lovely as possible. Attention to detail as Kaushal demonstrates with his towel art after cleaning the room. Massage in-house was particularly high standard, Balanesse style and they'd been trained well. We paid to upgrade and although the hotel is in need of refurbishment in places, it was good enough for The President of Latvia, who was in the rooms next to ours.

I loved the hotel its in a quaint place and just near the beach. The pool is excellent and the best thing is the location right by the water. WE spent most of our time between the pool and the beach. Need i say more!! Service and rooms were nice. Check in was easy and food was good. Had a good time here.

Our second visit to the hotel, the staff was great from the check in very attentive. No issues what so ever. The standards were really kept to the level. Food was great and plenty of variety. Dining staff was very attentive and made sure refills were on time. We opted for the green pool which was much quieter and private with the Jacuzzi. Very well maintained and cleaned. Stayed at the family suite and was thus far the best stay done down south. A special thanks to the GM-Sisira Senarthne who made it his duty to pay attention to all guest regardless the category and keep everyone happy and enjoyable. Thanks & keep up the excellent work. Sumesh

From the moment we stepped into the hotel it was nothing but amazing hospitality and good conversations will all the people working at the hotel made us feel welcomed. From the room to the food to the beach everything was amazing. I would definitely recommend this for anyone and definitely would visit again for a much more greater period.

This is a fabulous hotel in a splendid location, with good facilities and very friendly and helpful staff. Our recent 3-week stay was our 12th visit to the Heritance in Ahungalla â€“ and it was just as enjoyable as the previous 11 times. We had not been here since the new Riu down the beach opened its doors (in 2016) and were slightly apprehensive about the possible effects this might have had on the surroundings. We need not have worried. Yes, the Riu is an eyesore, but you do not really see it from the gardens of the Heritance or its stretch of beach. Moreover, the Riu's guests, by and large, do not seem to spend much time on the beach. The Heritance has much more extensive grounds and we had a lovely room overlooking the residents' pool and the garden around it. Our arrival unfortunately coincided with that of a major cyclone â€“ the first major storm in this part of the country for decades apparently â€“ and there was quite a bit of damage to the garden and parts of the hotel roof. However, the staff worked very hard to minimize the disruption and within 48 hours things were more or less back to normal (â€“ returning the roof to its original condition took a little longer). The food is excellent. We particularly like the sumptuous breakfasts. My personal favourite is the swordfish curry (with a hopper or two), but if you prefer a more European-style breakfast you will not be disappointed by the choice available. There is virtually something for absolutely everybody. Whenever possible we try to grab a table outside. The setting is superb. I almost forgot: there is a huge range of fresh fruit available, including some quite unusual types. Our own preference for dinner is a Sri Lankan style 'rice & curry' (in a semi-outdoor restaurant they somewhat misleadingly refer to as the 'coffee shop'), but the main restaurant offers a huge buffet (with a theme that changes every day) if that is more your thing. There is also a seafood 'shack' and an a-la-carte restaurant offering high-end cooking. There is free wi-fi throughout the premises and it works well. I have already said that the staff are great. We always feel like royalty when we're here â€“ and I'm sure many other guests feel the same. Our room boy, Kaushal, was excellent and kept everything spick-and-span. He also decorated our bed beautifully with flowers and animals fashioned out of towels. The waiters, too, are fabulous. Special thanks to Nihal and Jacob â€“ and the kitchen staff, who were very accommodating (as usual). If you are looking for a well-equipped, quiet hotel on a fantastic beach, you will find the Heritance hard to beat. If you come here for a longer stay, you can use it as a base for exploring places like Galle and Hikkaduwa or the Bentota area. All are easily reached by tuk-tuk. If you want to see wild elephants, you can visit Udawalawe National Park from here as a day-trip. You can also get to Kandy and back in a day, but it is a long journey. There are good locations for a river safari quite close. We had been on safaris on the Madu river several times before; this time we tried one along the Bentota river. We saw all sorts of wildlife, including crocodiles and snakes. If you are interested, ask Eranda, one of the tuk-tuk drivers usually waiting by the front gate, for a quote. His uncle Michael (you'll find him on the beach) is also a good choice if you are looking for somebody who can organise a trip for you. Thanks to everyone who made our holiday at the Heritance so memorable. We will certainly be back.

This was our dream destination and we had an amazing time, enjoyed the pool, food and specially the service.. Everything is beyond the expectations and we don't have words to explain the exceptional service..We will recommend to anyone and we will definitely come back to this beautiful place soon..

Heritance ahungalla is a beautiful resort where you can relax and enjoy.... Everything was excellent. Specially the front desk staff is amazing.very helpful and friendly... Food is awesome.... We really enjoyed our honeymoon..

We stayed at the hotel for ten days and from that stay we will most definitely remember great food and warmth of the people. We were in many places all over the world but by far the food served in that hotel was the best. That's mostly thanks to the amazing chef D.J. Manjula who not only takes care of the food but also entertains the guests.

We like to sit in the Coffee Shop and enjoy the nice view of the pool and the beach side. Last night, we did enjoy a very tasteful dinner,presented by our favorite R & B Supervisor,Mr Nuwan Sasanka de Silva,who's always very helpful and professional,a precious advisor and a charming person, we are very happy to meet,year after year. A special thank to him, for his wonderful way of making us feel at home, while at the Coffee Shop.

So it seems that even though we booked a 5â­ hotel, we were unlucky to get the most outdated dirty rooms I've ever seen in such highly rated hotel. I always judge my room by the condition of the bathroom. The bathrooms here in both rooms were so dirty. The shower was the worst. The shower screen was completely covered by soap scum. The tiles were mouldy. Clearly the housekeeping had not heard of bleach or sugar soap or any kind of deep cleaning. Even run down hotels can be presented well with proper maintenance & care. These rooms don't deserve anymore than 3â­ rating. Very disappointed. The food outlets however were fantastic. We dined at 3 outlets during our stay and each area was superb. Food was delicious. Best buffet food I've experienced this time in SL. The service was equally incredible. We travel with a toddler and we can demanding however the team made it so pleasant for us. Thanks you F&B team. Keep up the great work. You guys run a true 5â­ rated Hotel restaurant. Message to the Heritance brand. High time you pay attention to the condition of your rooms rather than leveraging off the great locations your hotels are based at.

Our stay at this property was 9 nights during our holidays and we wouldn't have expected much from this hotel's overall experience if the grading system of this hotel was honest about being below a 4 star. Despite the general friendliness of staffs at the hotel, there is absolutely nothing to recommend about this hotel if you are expecting it to be a 5 star. From: - trying to put us in a lower category room (which we didnt book through Agoda) - bathroom amenities were never refilled and replaced - what 5 star hotel does 2 in 1 shampoo and conditioner??? - room walls were made paper thin and it didnt help they placed us beside the housekeeping room and we heard every clamour there were starting from 7am every morning - bed sheets looked and felt like it was 30 years old from the stains and the lint built-up which was made to feel like climbing into rough potato sack fabric. - on the swimming/lounging private part of the property they allowed hagglers still on the property to haggle guests to buy products or their services. Overall, it should be reviewed how this property gets to be a 5star or be honest and lower the stars for what this property actually deserve which is no where near being a 5 star.

Great service, well maintained facility with good beach. As a young family, all of us had something enjoy, staff is very friendly and always willing to serve. As usually, "Hesitance"'s food is some thing that I enjoy very much.

we attended for a wedding couple shooting , it only been 3-4 hours, but the amazing hotel service was spectacular. hotel surroundings were awesome. very awesome pool and ocean view. advance environmental aspects. rooms are very clean

This is our third visit to this hotel and probably the last one . The hotel is in need of serious updating . It is classified as a 5 star hotel .... May be when it was first built 30+ years ago .I will give this hotel a 3 star rating .

We had a perfect holiday at this beautiful hotel. Rooms are very clean. People are very friendly and professional. Specially the reception staff... We had a warm welcome and a early check in.. thank you for everyone...we will be back...

We had a lovely time at heritance ahungalla. Beautiful beach resort. Staff is very friendly and helpful... Specially i should mention about food. It was fantastic... Main swimming pool is amazing. We enjoyed a lot.

We visited this hotel for the new year, booked a ocean suite. The room was amazing with a spectacular view of the beach and sunset. The hotel buffet had a large selection of food and very well presented. The hotel staff friendly and nice however sometimes I felt like they gave more attention to the foreigners than the locals. Which was a little annoying. The Madu Ganga river cruise was quite nice. It is definitely recommended. It cost only 27USD. The only issue we had was the bathroom tub did not drain properly at all but after contacting housekeeping the issue was partially resolved. Overall the hotel is pretty decent.

Absolutely exceptional stay. We booked 3 nights here and stayed in a luxury suite unit 359. It well exceeded our expectations with space and amenities. The staff here are incredible. They Go above and beyond to fulfill your requests. All three themed dinners were tasty and there was always a broad selection of food for our large party of 15. Special thanks to chef Manjulla for taking care of our kids with chocolate pancakes for breakfast. The staff here work very hard and are happy to take care of you. We will certainly be back for another family reunion here. Many thanks to everyone at the hotel, from front desk to restaurants to cleaning staff. Couldnâ€™t have asked for anything more.

The resort is run very well. The staff is very courteous and speak English. The beach is very clean. The buffet is excellent! You will not go wrong if you make this a destination. Relax on the beach. The resort is only one to two hours from Columbo International airport. Make sure the driver knows where the resort is before you get into the van.

We spent 4 nights here and it was a sheer delight. The rooms were perfectly appointed and spacious. The rain showers were heavenly, the food fantastic, and service spot on. The hotel has 2 pools, one of which is reserved for in house guests. The trees surrounding it offer shade from the Sri Lankan sun and you can easily spend hours here without any worries of getting sun burnt. Breakfast was well thought out with a good selection of Sri Lankan, Indian and continental cuisine. Dinner too offered a reasonable spread of tasty food including seafood on some nights. The staff are well trained and seem happy to be working there. They were polite and genuinely made an effort to make our stay memorable. The only downside to this hotel is that the sea in front of the hotel can have rips and therefore not recommended for swimming. We compensated for this by driving to Hikkaduwa only 20 minutes away and swam there.

This is a decent hotel. Rooms were up to our expectation. I was personally very happy to find tennis courts, badminton courts, table tennis and pool facilities provided. Breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets had a wide variety of cuisine. However, there weren't much options for vegetarians :(

We were a group of 10 adults (couples) and this property was part of our itinerary. The minute we entered the property, we were in awe of it but thats it. Our problems began right from the word Go. Our check-in process took almost an hour which ideally should have been a 5 minute job since our passport copies and all details were with the agent and hotel. Post the checkin, our ordeal just began to rear its head. Of the 5 rooms we were provided, 3 of them were with twin beds when it was clear to the hotel that were were couples. Then further, of the 5 rooms, 2 of them were side corner rooms which were nowhere near the deluxe rooms as shown on the website. The plumbing and the lighting too wasn't in order. On asking for a room change, the manager on duty just told that this is all that is available. With absolutely no remorse on settling us for subpar rooms. This is surely not how a 5 star property treats its guests. Thank god I stayed just 1 night. The room service was pathetic and they took almost an hour to get to us since the mini bar was completely empty. What I liked about the property was the various activities, the food and the variety. I liked the proximity to the beach but I just hope the property gets their act together, have proper signboards on each floor and get better processes in place.

We were a group of 20 people in 10 rooms at Heritance Ahungulla for the new year. The service is absolutely the worst I have encountered across Asia. Staff in general are unhelpful and sometimes rude. The breakfast place is fine but the bar and snack place is absolutely terrible. We had to wait for almost an hour for a club sandwich and when asked three times they kept saying â€œ2 minutesâ€. Finally when I approached a more senior person at the bar, he was totally unapologetic and asked the same waiter who said â€œyeah, I will get itâ€. This is one example amongst many incidents - from no towels in the pool to poorly made up rooms. I certainly do not recommend it - there are many other places in Sri Lanka that are far better.

We were a family of ten having booked five rooms in Heritance Ahungalla and were really looking forward to our stay after a long drive of Six hours from Nuwara Eliya. But right from check in it was a big disappointment, as check in itself took more than one hour. The rooms were not as expected of this property, the key didnâ€™t work for one room, lights didnâ€™t work in another room, the wash rooms were ancient looking with flush making scary sound in another room. The pass word for wife was outdated and had to be changed. The duty manager was not apologetic but showing his helplessness , arrogant and argumentative.The rooms were of different sizes and badly done up, never expected from Heritage Ahungalla.Instead of king size beds we were given single beds joined . It was a terrible experience stay and the worst of our trip of seven days in Sri Lanka. We will never recommend this hotel to any one. J P Alex and family.

One of our best holiday! Had a great time in this wonderful hotel. The staff is really friendly and helpful, our room was fabulous with all the amenities and food is excellent. We will recommend this place to anyone and hope to visit soon!

It was a great stay with the family and friends , we all enjoyed a lot. We had a lovely time with my family and friends . I would like to mentioned about food and servise speacially , it was excelent and exceed expectations . Staff was very friendly and engaged. Take the time to thanks for the management team mr: prasana mr: nipun mr: thushara and mr: traveen to make our stay much valuable . Thank you, hope to visit heritance ahungalla again in the near future

We spent 3 days around Christmas as a family. The beach is pristine and private and is a 2 minute walk from the room right across the pools. The rooms are large and airy with large bathrooms. The property has tennis courts etc to keep the youngsters busy. Food is just awesome and the Christmas Eve gala dinner had a spread so wide that one just cannot do justice. Staff are very helpful and efficient. We had no reasons to complain at all. An absolute pleasure

We were welcomed with such love...from the time we arrived until we left we were treated like royalty. The kids felt like home...the staff wereore than attentive and accommodating. The food was excellent and we were even treated to special food upon request. The rooms are very clean and the houskeeping staff are very efficient. This must be rated more than a 5 star hotel. Overall the experience was very humbling and we were so blessed to meet amazing staff. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

We had a great stay in this hotel, everything is perfectâ€¦The pools, food, and staff is amazing! Hope to come back and I will recommend for anyone â€¦Lovely holiday and the direct access to beach is really wonderful!

We had a fantastic time at the Heritance Ahungalla hotel. The fresh fish was phenomenal, we ate under the stars and candlelight outside - a lovely atmosphere. Thank you to Chef Manjula for all of his help. The hotel staff were so welcoming and helpful. Highly recommend for some relaxation.

Room was nice, we had a pool/sea view, generous sized bathroom and the cleaning services were very good. Staff were friendly and polite. We booked on a bed and breakfast Vas us but ate dinner there too and there was always a good choice of food. On the last night we ate at the sea shack which is onsite and offers amazing sea food, we wished we had done this earlier as the food ( we had lobster) was fabulous. Lovely relaxing end to our holiday

We stayed two nights at this Landmark hotel designed by the iconic Geoffrey Bawa,Loved the food,the layout of the hotel and the staff was friendly and efficient. Even though the wooden interior of the rooms gave a homely and classic look and feel,itâ€™s time for some refurbishment,specially the walls/bathroom and Corridor areas,the pool area was breathtaking and the Christmas decor was just wonderful. Had heard so much of this place for the longest time and wasnâ€™t disappointed when we finally visited. Will visit again :)

Distinct architecture, management style, service quality of Heritance Ahungalla blends well with natural resources to offer an unique experience. One of the best beach hotels in Sri Lanka. Love this place!

We just arrived back from a weekâ€™s stay at the Heritance Ahungalla with my wife and two young kids. Really enjoyed our holiday and a great experience. Great hotel, very friendly and accommodating staff. Location is perfect, only a two hour transfer from the airport and right on one of the most beautiful beaches Iâ€™ve ever seen. Hotel food is also really good and plenty of places around the hotel if you wanted to venture out in a tuk tuk. Also a couple of great beach bars/restaurants within walking distance down the beach. Would definitely recommend and return to the hotel.

A very nice hotel. Great service - food was OK. Very seculded place and no Lankeses allowed as it seemed. Very nice pool area. Calm peaceful. We had a great time here. Almost impossible to move by foot outside the hotel - there are so many people wanting something from you. Traffic was horrible. I guess this is the case in most smaller cities in SriLanka. Colombo was OK on this though.

One thing which makes Heritance Hotels stand out is the food and hospitality. So I had high expectations. I have already been to Kandalama and Negambo, in both cuisine and hospitality is great and flawless. The first thing I noted is that they (Heritance Ahungalla) cannot handle a crowd. No welcome drinks for some of the guests. Very few (sometimes none) food options to vegetarians. The restaurant space was not enough when crowded. Service is really bad at the restaurant. Several times we had to ask for water and wait for it. Both Negambo and Kandalama is excellent in service where they event do not let the water glass finish in any of the tables. So lot of improvement is needed. And it is noted that the service is delayed not because the staff is very busy, but because there are some idle staff as well. More organization is needed. Rooms are okay. The first day there were only one shower cap in the room. The other shower cap box is empty. On top of that, the second day, there were no soap. Even the soap from the previous day has been removed. Location is okay. Nice pools. If the main is crowded or sunny in the day you can use the other pools.

It was a remarkable experience for my entire family, including my parents, my mother in law, my sister in law and my niece. although I and my family have been to Heritance Ahungalla before, it was the first experience of my other family members. we all had a wonderful time at Heritance. facilities and incomparable warm hospitality is highly appreciated by all. special thanks should be given to Srinath and Thushara for the wonderful support given to us which made our stay even more enjoyable. looking forward to visiting you all very soon. Cheers !

On arrival GRO Hemashi greeted us with a pleasant smile. And then we were escorted to our rooms and from there onwards we all enjoyed the rest of the day. Thank you heritance for your great service. And not forgetting the food wow it was so delicious.

Such a beautiful hotel with friendly staff. The lunch buffet was massive with a wide variety of food The rooms were really spacious and there were more than one swimming pools. Would definitely come back here again.

Working in the Hotel Industry myself, this is an experience I havent made before. I contacted the Hotel over 2 months ago, asking for an offer for a Family of 4 and myself for 4 days, Half Board. - used the Website mail: no answer - used the contact form: no answer - sent a mail to the Reservation department: no answer - Called the Hotel: was given another mail address: no answer - called again, persisted on the Reservation department directly: Reservation Agent (Trevin von Gunster) confirmed that he saw my mails from 10 days before, but was Â´Â´too busyÂ´Â´ to answer. - received an offer for 3 people, not 5, as requested - asked for a Change, over a week: no answer - called again: same person, apologies again, promised a new offer - receive a new confirmation, again for 3 adults, Kids missing - asked for a Change: since the 29th of November: no answer. I am trying since roughly 6 weeks to make a 2.500 Dollar booking, have spend hours and significant amounts on phone calls to Sri Lanka, have been kicked out of line repeatedly by the reception, have sent dozens of mails by now, and the result is: Zero. Absolutely astonishing.

Though it's described as a five-star resort, my parents and I were sorely disappointed by this hotel and will not be returning. The cons: 1. The receptionist offered us the opportunity to upgrade to full-board or half-board at a discount (USD30 instead of USD25 per meal). When we asked which restaurants this was applicable for, they said that it was only for the main restaurant, but failed to mention that it was ONLY valid for the buffet. If we had known, we wouldn't have signed up for two days of buffet-only meals. We found out because the waiter told us we couldn't have ala carte, and all of this happened after we'd paid for half-board for two days. In addition to not being told exactly what we were paying for, we discovered that the buffer cost LKR3,700 (USD24.2). So you're telling me that I didn't receive a discount--I'm actually paying the full cost of the buffet AND I'm locked in for a two-day commitment. This was dishonest on the hotel's part, and according to our travel agent, they shouldn't be directly giving us discounts--they're supposed to go through the agent. All in all, very poor form on the hotel's part. 2. On the morning of our check-out date, my bathroom didn't have water. I couldn't use the sink, I couldn't shower; it's a good thing I didn't have to flush anything. I checked my dad's room next door - also no water. It took two calls for housekeeping for the water to come back. How is this acceptable? 3. Our room had an odd smell that came from the bathroom drain. When we told the GRO, she said housekeeping would be around shortly to attend to it. They arrived 18 hours later. 4. When we first arrived, there was no porter to be found and we waited a solid few minutes before the receptionist noticed that we wanted to check in with our bags. He then rushed out and seemed very frazzled. Out of the 7 hotels we stayed in Sri Lanka, this was by far the poorest reception we'd received. The pros: 1. The restaurant staff were lovely, warm and attentive. My mum had a broken arm on this trip and the chef himself came out and helped her take food for the buffet and then walked her to her table. 2. They provide comfortable flip flops for guests to use on the beach and around the property. 3. The food was delicious. Every dish we had was delicious--both Sri Lankan and international fare.

We were there for two days ie 06 and 07 Dec. Let me objectively articulate the good thinga and things which needs improvement: Good ones 1. Well kept resort with private access to the beach 2. Huge open swimming pool which from the reception provides an illusion as if the pool is merging into the sea..a visual delight 3. Nice rooms with a balcony and I was told all rooms were sea facing Areas for improvement: 1. The access to the beach or otherwise ia uncontrolled ie no real security or barricade ..there were outsiders/ touts soliciting business and no one controlled them. 2. Most guests were Europeans and no wonder ..the entire menu was made to cater to their preferences barring a few local items 3. The menu for both dinner and breakfast practically remained unchanged thru our stay 4. Though the staff and chef were helpful, they probably had little clue about Indian dishes / ingredients/ taste. Despite their beat effort to provide one odd dish especially for us, the food experience was far from satisfactory. So if you are Indian and crave for Indian food ...this ia not the place for you. In contrast, all other places we stayed in SriLanka ie Kandy, Nuwara Eliya or Colombo, there were some Indian dishes on offer and some of them tasted good too. 4. Lastly , despite making a special request for cake/ flowers for our anniversary and reminding that very morning again, they messed it all up. Finally with the intervention of our travel agent they did bring a cake but by then the damage was done. It also gave me a feeling that they are probably still under slave mindset of licking the white skun. Thus on balance, 3 to 3.5 stars is what I will give

It is one of the best property I have visited.Best part of the property is the swimming pool facing the beautiful sea.while enjoying the pool you can see the beautiful sunset.Rooms are clean and spacious.Food spread is average for vegetarians.House keeping service is poor.The worst part of the room is its sharp edges glass top centre table just placed near the balcony which can gv you a sharp cut if not vigilant which I and my friends had.We will like to visit again this property.

as a returning guest i was impressed by the improvements at heritance , the refurbished rooms with the washrooms are much brighter also the food was much better this year, maybe the competition next door has helped in this, but the biggest star of the heritance is its staff Thushara, dinesh at the pool nimasha,chamichand thanks for the flowers each day Sodad , to name but a few but everyone made our stay very welcoming , great location on the beach ,good food , comfortable rooms, room 246 . 23/11 - 3/12

the hotel staff were very welcoming and always had smiles! The renovated rooms were spacious and clean. The Sri Lankan food was quite good. Its a nice hotel to visit as there is direct access to the beach. Will recommend to friends!

Kindness and Smiles everywhere, despite the situations. Travelling with a wheelchair user In Sri Lanka has proven to be difficult due to decreased facilities available in most parts. During our 4 day stay at the Heritance, we were faced with wonderful members of staff who went above and beyond to make our stay as comfortable and accessible as possible. I cannot praise the restaurant staff enough, Executive Chef Chaluka, Supervisor Priyanga went out of their way to ensure that we were taken care off. They have a lovely attentive team working for them who made sure ramps where in place and food was served promptly. Due to adverse weather, we were offered a lovely upgrade for our safety, and staff where available 24 hours which when travelling with a disabled guest who has a lot of needs was a blessing. A beautiful main pool with beach access, and sun loungers everywhere, my only criticism would be to provide wheelchair accessible pathways on your lovely grounds, not just within the hotel building. Thank you for all your service. Will definitely come back if in the area Kresh and Family, UK

stylish hotel, a little tired in places but that adds to the charm. Lovely renovated rooms, lovely attentive staff, lovely sri lankan food in the buffet restaurant. Only about 150 rooms for such a large site, gives you room to stroll and find somewhere quiet when you need it. And what a great beach!!

Check in - Pretty easy. They have mistaken the booking, but they offered another lovey room and it was massive. But they handled their mistake smoothly. Room - Clean and nice! And it was really comfortable. They have long corridors that is acceptable because after a long walk you get a nice room and a lovely view. Rooms are spotless clean! Food - Nice. If you want to taste Sri Lankan cuisine in a big hotel, this is lovely place to go. Plus they have really coffee which is a big yes to me.

I visited this hotel few months ago. Foods really good and love the rooms as well.but hotel staff only care about foreign customers .they donâ€™t think about Sri Lankan customers . I donâ€™t know why they are doing this for Sri Lankan but management should think about this otherwise you will lose Sri Lankan customers because of your staff . But hotel is very clean and rooms also. All the things are good. I will recommend your hotel to my friends for sure .

Huge hotel, but has a nice relaxed atmosphere and plenty of facilities to stop it becoming crowded. It has two enormous swimming pools which are immediately adjacent to the beach. The beach can be a frustrating place to spend time unfortunately, as there are a large number of pushy locals trying to talk you in to various activities (some clearly not legal!). The hotel provide security to stop them entering the hotel grounds though, so we preferred to spend more time around the pool areas. Incredible breakfast with just about everything you could ever want, including lots of really good local options (hoppers for breakfast were great!). The dinner options are good, too, and even has a separate seafood restaurant right by the beach which only serves fresh seafood. Our room overlooked the beach, was perfectly equipped and of a really good size. Without doubt the best hotel we stayed in in Sri Lanka (& we stayed in five others).

We came to this hotel for a couple of days of rest and sun at the end of a two week tour of Sri Lanka. I have to admit it was my least favourite hotel. Yes there was lots of opportunity for sunbathing around the pool. The men were very attentive with keeping the grounds immaculate and bringing mattresses and towels. Also the bars were located around the grounds so drink was easy to obtain. But despite this being a hotel designed to blend with nature, I found the stark long corridors austere and unfriendly, and very noisy. In fact they echoed any noise particularly in the early mornings. In the restaurant there were far fewer waiters than previously and those that were in attendance were much less attentive. And the entertainment was a mixed bag. We saw a delightful cultural show followed by a very amateurish fire show. Positives? Lovely large rooms. The quietest air con ever. Great range of food. Lovely location on a pristine beach.

Have mixed feelings about this resort. Amazing team at the breakfast and dinner. The main cook went out of his way to offer us food that were not in thr menu. The main buffet for that night was maily chinese and we didnt want to eat chinese food in srilanka. HE WAS Very professional and asked us for food items we would like him to make for us! All the staff at the restaurant delivered 5 star experience. only if all the staff at the resort delivered similar experience. Main reception provided decent welcome. Pools were beautiful and service there was 4 star. Can't swim at this beach which is a disappointment. Cleaning staff did a great job overall. I would recommend this hotel for 2 night stay.

Attended a corporate Day-out with my family at this truly amazing hotel which has kept the uniqueness to the bit that "Heritance" concept has. Hotel has a well maintained lush greeny garden with a pond in middle at the entrance. Lobby was quite big and the most interesting catchy part of the hotel is the gigantic pool just above the lobby facing the sea with a view. It has that space for many to have their swims all over while looking at the sea next to it. Hotel has a few big inner gardens which we also occupied doing some games with the team. Rooms were up to the standard with balconies. My next favourite was the Lunch Buffet which has the finest and most delicious spread in the town. Staff was so helpful and looked into all your needs. Would recommend for a family visit and even for a corporate day-out plans with the space, quality and the superb service at this unique hotel.

I stayed in this hotel for 4th time still impressed with service, food & the atmosphere. We simply loved everything. The chef Manjula always wanted to provide what my kids wanted to eat & extend a great hospitality to all of us. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone. Further we cannot forget the help and support we always received from Mr Indika Gonawela (RM) at anytime when we are there.

Me and my mum wanted to spend some quality time together so we were heading for the usual yummy buffet when we were stopped by mr Munasinghe and offered the a la carte menu. I must admit going with his decision was the best . I wish I could rate it seven stars not five the food at this hotel is beyond comparison . We ordered soup , grilled lobster and baked cheese cake .... the food was fresh and delicious ...compliments to the chefs and the GM .. Munasinghe service is very very good ,and he is a asset to the hotel
