Had a lovely time on the beach! my room had a great view of the ocean and the pool design was nice. food was great and rooms were good. all services offered were very nice. I would love to come back to Sri Lanka!

Spent a week end in November (3rd-5th). Weather was not ideal for the season. Occupancy was about 75%. Intermittent rain but bright sun shine during the mornings. Sea bathing was not advised. The infinity pool and pool adjoining the bar was warm and inviting. Leisurely walks along the endless beach with warm white sands was most pleasurable. Coconut palms and lush foliage along the beach adds to the beauty of southern beaches in Sri Lanka, not seen in most countries. Heritance is an exotic location unmatched on the coast. The food ,service and simplicity of architecture is not easily rivaled. Star quality enviorenment. My stay was extremely pleasurable.

The four of us were enjoying our first evening at this hotel with a drink by the pool and soon found ourselves chatting with the Bar and the "Upper Room" Restaurant Manager, Rohana. Rohana was highly customer focused, engaging, interesting, funny and attentive in anticipating our needs. On every interaction with him over our three day stay he consistently provided excellent and friendly service, in particular, during a special dinner in the Upper Room restaurant to celebrate 3 birthdays and the end of our trip where he went out of his way to make it an extra special experience. We had stayed at several hotels during our trip around Sri Lanka and we particularly enjoyed the facilities and food here, however Rohana was the icing on the cake in making our stay at the Heritance Ahungalla a special one, thank you!

I visited Heritance Ahungalla first time 16 years ago and again 15 years ago (when it was still operated under the name Triton), so I was very excited to go back to the hotel to see if it still carried that adventurous atmosphere that it did 16 years ago. I was also vevry excited to see how they had renovated the hotel after the horrible tsunami that destroyed much of the hotel about 10 years ago. I remembered the hotel as a luxurious hotel with a very high standard both in the restaurant and in the small bars around the area where you could buy from a large snack menu. Many of these places were closed now to my disappointment. The hotel of course more or less looked the same and the beautiful architecture of Geoffrey Bawa - Sri Lankas world renowned architect - was of course still stunning. I should say that my previous visits was during the peak season in february where the weather on that part of the island is fantastic. This time I visited in october and we experienced several hours of heavy rain on several of the days we stayed there, and of course that adds to the experience and the atmosphere as they had to keep huge plastic curtains down at all times to keep the water from running into the reception area and the bar area. The hallways was flooded due to the heavy rain and the open design of the hotel so they had to keep staff constantly mopping up water and that was of course no fault of theirs. That's just how it is during this season. But something seemed changed. The hotel seemed to have lost that exclusivity that set it apart from other hotels in Ahugalla/Bentota region.15 years ago there were a wonderful atmosphere in the evenings with jazz band and dancing in the lounge next to the reception and pool area. This time around that was gone - much to our dismay. We also remembered that every afternoon there was a very nice complimentary afternoon tea with buttercake and scones that you could enjoy just next to the large pool but when we asked if they still had it noone even seemed to remember that they had it 15 years ago. We stayed in one of the huge suites with several rooms a seperate living room two bathrooms, a huge balcony overloooking the residents pool with a view of the ocean behind the row of palm trees along the coast line. I don't know if some of the changes to the design and decor was due to the tsunami 10 years ago (after I visited the last time), but I remembered the beautiful residents pool (the other pool that are closed to anyone but guests in the suites and rooms in the fine wing with ocean view, and it was originally made with the most beautiful dark blue tiles that made it one of the most beautiful pools I had ever seen. This time the tiles have been removed and the pool was just an ordinary pool with a normal lightblue surface on the sides and bottom and not made from tiles anymore, just like so many ordinary pools you see all over Sri Lanka. That was sad - I thought. I may have needed refurbishment or renovation but they should have stayed true to the original design with the beautiful dark blue tiles when repairing the pool instead of the cheaper solution, as this did something to make the place stand out in a way that it now doesn't anymore. They also had a wonderful original boat like the ones used by the original population in Sri Lanka that was a trademark of Triton (as it was once called) but they had done little to keep it maintained, so it had obviously deteriorated over the last decade so they hadn't saved it (unless of course it was taken by the tsunami ten years ago). To me it was just a little sad to se that on the patio where it was once standing proud in the middle of the large pool was now just an empty plate with nothing to decorate the otherwise elegant pool area around the public pool and bar area. Another thing that added to the impression they had lowered the standard since we last visited 15 years ago was the many families with screaming children running around the pool. 15 years ago there was a much more tranquil and serene atmosphere with adult guiests with a certain sense of etiquette, which includes preventing your children from running around the other quests at the pool and adressing strangers asking all sorts of questions instead of staying near their parents as they are supposed to when using the residents pool. What had since we last visited become a sad but necessary precaution was a several meters high fence between the hotel grounds and the beach where only a small opening heavily guarded by two guards at all times (day and night) was the only passage to the beach. In the old days one could just stroll down through the line of shady palm trees and reach the beach from anywhere along the hotel grounds. But it was obviously a necessary precaution as we could see that many more touts and beggars and people selling all sorts of ridiculous junk and overpriced sarons, were all over the beach. It even seemed to us as if some of these local hustlers had some corrupt arrangement with some of the guards as they sometimes happened to be inside the fence (which means they have passed the guards unattended), and even when guards saw them on hotel grounds contacting the guests, they did absolutely nothing or very little to stop them from intimidating the guests and/or even excort them from the grounds, which would of course be their duty. One of the nights I stood in the dark on my balcony outside our suite and I noticed a visibly drunk guard who could hardly wallk in a straight line talking a little with himself while he suddenly stopped near the tennis court and fumbled with his trouser until he mannaged to unzip his pants in the middle of the lawn and urinate. That latter I could even live with - I'm no prude - had he just walked behind a tree and taken care of business, but I didn't find the fact that he was visibly drunk very reassuring. The folloing nights I stayed for an hour on my balcony to see if the guard from the night before would return, would return, but much to my surprise I saw something very strange occur. One of the guards (not the same as the drunk guard from yesterday) suddenly turned on his torch and he waved it up and down and from side to sight while pointing it in the direction towards the edge of the hotel grounds. Shortly thereafter I saw two locals walking past the tennis courts and sitting just below my balcony between the building/wing and the tennis court. They couldn't see me as I kept the balcony lights off as well as the lights in the livingroom so I was hidden in the dark. I looked in astonishment as these very suspicious looking local people arrived and they opened small packages and presented them on the top of low walll surrounding the terrace belonging to the suite just below ours and the guards looked at the "goods" in the beam of their flashlight at what looked like small packages of either pot or very small portions of khat to me (I've only seen khat but nevver tried it so it could be something else, but I know that khat is very poular if you have a job where it's hard to stay awake and it's popular amongst lorry drivers etc. so I could imagine that a boring night shift would also tempt someone to use khat to keep from falling asleep as it is a mild energy booster that make that kan keep you awake and alert) and khat is actually not amongst forbidden substances in all countries (at least not in Europe), so the use of khat may even be legal in Sri Lanka, that I don't know. Well, that aside, the guards clearly counted and exchanged money for these "goods" in the dim light from their torch. Suddenly one of the guards heard me making a noise as I was taking a step back and he pointed the torch directly at my face and for a short while I was blinded, and they saw me on the balcony, so he turned off the torch and they exchanged a few hasty words with the locals who then wrapped up the rest of their goods and ran away along the tennis court and disappeared in the dark. This was in no way frightening or intimidating, but it just seemed like something that wouldn't have happened at the classy and stylish Triton of the old days, and it only contributed to the vague feeling that the standard of the hotel was not quite the same as it was 15 years ago. From the experiences above one would have thought that it was a horrible experience, so why do I give it four stars after all? Because they still provide many of the things they provided in the old days. We always live in large suites when we travel, so I have a large backlog of experiences to use as comparison, and I must say that the suite was wonderful. It was clean and beautifully furnished and the large balcony streched all the way around the suite and had access doors from all rooms in the suite. I will also like to give the place the benefit of the doubt, because many things were closed - and that might be because it is the low season in october, so my final judgment should not be made until I've tried the place again in the high season between medio january until medio march where the weather in the southwest part of the coast line of Sri Lanka has the most beautiful weather. We also dined at the a la carte restaurant (not the large dining hall, but Restaurant Mustard at the terrace on the left side of the reception area just after the reception desk around the corner). The food was delicious, the service was perfect, and the setting was cozy with a dimly lit area and a very romantic atmosphere. So taht was truly perfect. The in-room dining (room service) was also very good and arrived quickly. The breakfast was wonderful and came on time every morning exactly at the time we've put on the breakfast list to hang on the door before going to sleep. The staff couldn't do a better job. They were quick, courteous, smiling, polite and they didn't hover at any time or made certain trick to earn extra tips (such as coming two persons to a one man job, or staying in the room and keep asking if everything is to our satisfaction, etc. - you know the drill). But none from the staff we met did that at any time. Of course my wife and I both agree on giving a generous tip at no less than 20% of the bill every time something is served, so we allso made it easy for the staff not to hover, and that should perhaps be taken into consideration, but we also find that people in Sri Lanka live on extremely low wages, and compared to the prices in Denmark where we live, even an additional 20% still makes for a very cheap price for people living in Europe, Australia and North America, so i cost us so little but means so much to them, so there is no need to be a miserly cheapskate. If you can afford an expensive plane ticket and to stay in a somewhat pricey hotel like this you probably can also survive giving 500-1000 Rps ($3-$6 USD) more when tipping the waiter, room boy, luggage carriers, drivers, etc. It takes so little and being generous when tipping often comes back a thousand fold throughout your stay when you are being served by the grateful, hard working, staff at the hotel, trying to accomodate even your most extravagant wishes and habits.(That's just my personal opinion on this subject, and each to their own, of course). I believe all rooms are non-smoking but most rooms are with a balcony (or a terrace if at ground level) so this is a comfortable hotel for smokers.

Was here on a two night trip with the rest of my colleagues from office. Really not much to write home about. It didn't stand up to my expectations of a five star hotel. The staff was very courteous and helpful. There is no argument about that but the hotel infrastructure wasn't exactly that great. The car parks are somewhere way away that you have to rely on valet parking. This means you have to pick up every single thing you need from the vehicle before you check-in. The dining halls are pretty dark and gloomy, mostly I believe due to the dark colouring of the ceiling which is decorated with batik. The buffet area was really odd, it was almost like walking in to someone's kitchen to get the food served, the dining hall and the buffet area have very different vibes. The pool is good and well maintained and they do have some activity rooms where you could play 8-ball or carrom or chess. But the overall set up just put me off. Will not be returning here.

The hotel is visited by large groups and the long corridors can be noisy when these groups insist on having loud conversations or let their children run â€˜wildâ€™. Itâ€™s a large hotel and at times can feel impersonal although the design meant that it was not soulless. The â€˜internalâ€™ gardens were a nice touch. Staying B&B for 1 week Restaurants/Bars â€“ a wide variety to cater for many nationalities but not inspiring or of particular high quality, itâ€™s mass catering. Being only B&B I looked in on the main restaurant once in the evening and was not encouraged to eat there. I also looked at the a la carte restaurant and the sound of the menu was good but I like to eat local cuisine. We ate at the on-site fish grill twice and the food was tasty and cooked really well. Iâ€™m glad I didnâ€™t stay all-inclusive as the food was not really inspiring â€“ mass catering again and Iâ€™m not a big drinker. In the evenings, I often like a â€˜quietâ€™ bar to read, chat or contemplate â€“ only the main bar and coffee bar were open when I stayed, both in close proximity. There was evening entertainment (thatâ€™s a whole other story) in one bar area but because of the proximity was intrusive. Rooms â€“ clean and well appointed Beds â€“two singles pushed together but comfortable and the bedding was clean & of good quality. Air con â€“ Iâ€™m not a fan of air con but the room got very stuffy without AC running. It was quiet and effective. Intrusive piped music at 7 am!! And a similar time in the evening. Why? I forgot to feed this back to reception. Wifi was generally good throughout the rooms and grounds. Service - Nice friendly staff and seemed well trained and were generally effective. Beach / Security â€“ The hotel is located right next to the beautiful beach although it is separated by a rather ugly chain link fence. There are plenty of security guards around and there seems to be an unwritten rule about letting the hawkers come about 20M onto the grounds. The guards sometime turn their backs and â€˜allowâ€™ the hawkers to encroach further. The hawkers are a pest and there are a constant stream often calling out to gain attention. If you sit around the pool rather than facing the ocean, you not be affected by them. We visited late October and because of the ocean currents you need to be a strong swimmer to go into the sea. The locals warned us that people had died. Pools are large and clean â€“ I particularly liked having a guestsâ€™ only pool which was segregated from the public pool. Neither got particularly busy and the 8pm â€˜curfewâ€™ was well observed. The pool attendants, did a good job. Grounds â€“ well maintained and extensive Tennis court surface was a disappointment but just fine for a knock about. I was very pleased to see sports equipment available and in good repair. Entertainment â€¦hmmm Thereâ€™s not a lot to see in Ahungalla itself but as a base for local attractions itâ€™s good. Whenever we went roadside of the hotel we were followed, pursued, badgered, etc, by tour guides. A repeated â€˜noâ€™ did no good, a firm â€˜noâ€™ occasionally worked. We had to resort to a â€˜just leave us alone!!â€™ a couple of times. My teenage daughter got a lot of attention and was made to feel quite uncomfortable on a couple of occasions, but this is not a reflection on the hotel in any way. The local children were more direct and just held their hands out bluntly asked for money and these experiences tainted our visit to Sri Lanka somewhat.

Poor room condition. Very old bathroom and room. Need to get a renovation. But nice location. Nice pool and nice beach. We went there with our friends wedding anniversary. We enjoyed sea bath lot. It's really good experience for us. We enjoyed a Very quality and very tasty buffet. It was really delicious and more varieties. There was a sea food corner also.

Nice location and good food. Pool is very nice and rooms needs to be improved, Doors are broken and no irons and toothbrush and stuff inside, have to call the room service and order all time, however the staff members are very friendly.

Heritance is a beautiful hotel with lovely views of the beach in front. We were upgraded to a deluxe room which was massive. The staff are very helpful and friendly, always happy to help you. Breakfast was a real highlight with a large selection of fresh fruit, breads, continental and traditional Sri Lankan breakfasts. The only downfall is that it is situated in quite a remote area with only a couple of restaurants outside the hotel nearby. However if you are going to be staying all inclusive, that is not an issue! Thanks to all the staff for an excellent stay!

Excellent welcome and a wonderful stay with all very helpful and friendly staff.Rooms were spacious,having the old look.The restaurant staff very helpful and asking whether theres anything we need.But i was not told when entering about the other section where the hot dishes were kept...other than that it was a perfect one day stay... In future would recommend to some extent have modernised rooms having the old look..,To have a baby pool,and to improve on the view from the balcony without just barely the pool...(Ex-Amari-Galle),In which i stayed the day after.Having something to seperate the pool from the beach would be essential,without the view of the sunset being disturbed.it was really disturbing to be on the beach where there were stray dogs all over. and also coming to the pool for water. Overall it was a perfect stay and would recommend family and friends for a peaceful relaxing stay....

My stay in Ahungala was made great by fabulous Heritance Ahungala. The beauty of its location made us long for a longer stay. Our stay coincided with Christmas cake mixing event and that really brought the Christmas spirit ! Himasha and Mahesh kept us engaged with their updates and service.

We spent amazing and wonderful time. Hotel stuff were very welcoming and nice. The facilities are really good including clean and very comfortable rooms. Pools were spectacular. Delicious foods was great buffet. Extremely hospitable and cozy.

So we went to the hotel to celebrate my mom's birthday and it's truly an architectural masterpiece it's simple yet sooo elegant and beautiful. With this also comes the fact that the level of activities in the hotel are quite less (personally I'd prefer some music when I'm dining or just chilling in the pool area) The hotel gives a warm welcome and the level of hospitality is absolutely high. The lunch was delicious each and every dish was so tasty yet we were very disappointed with how the evening tea was presented ,yes we came for the day package yet there was no proper place in which it was given and there was no place to sit and I was quite worried about the amount of flies setting on the butter cake. Overall everything was absolutely perfect just that the evening tea was abit clumsy.

I only stayed for one night but it was a memorable and amazing .the staff welcomed us very nicely,the rooms were very clean. i don't have any thing negative to say about this place , there breakfast had a nice variety of food.

We ended our tour around Sri Lanka with a couple of nights at the Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel is well situated by the beach and we enjoyed walking along the shore watching the ocean roll in. We arrived with high expectations given all the five star reviews, but our experience did not live up to this. The bathroom in our room was disappointing for a 5 star hotel - small, bare plaster (not sure whether the room was being redecorated or this was the intended 'vibe') and the door wedged on the floor every time you tried to open it. The handle came off a drawer in the bedroom as the staff showed us the room when we checked in. On a positive note, breakfasts were buffet style with a very wide selection. Rather than accept the 'special offer' to upgrade to half board on arrival, we ate a la carte for dinners which meant we could choose what we wanted and this turned out to be much more cost effective than the half board offer/buffet. When we ate at the Mustard the place was very quiet, but we were rushed by the waiting staff - main courses arriving when we were half through our starters and left on the table, and dessert offered and our plates whipped away as we enjoyed the last mouthful of main course. Why the experience had to be rushed when the place was far from busy I don't know, perhaps the service could be most generously described as 'over eager'. This is a good hotel in a nice location. Staff were friendly. Just a few things which meant that our experience was not 5 star.

We had a wonderful time at Heritance Ahungalla. Reception staff was excellent, very helpful, always with a smile and kind hearted, given us the most convenient room acording to our needs. Food was amazing, nice combination and delicious.thanks to the head chef and his team for giving us the most fabulous food ever . Staff was brilliant, always cheerful, helped us when we needed with lovely smile. We must give our special thanks to Priyanga, Sandali, chef Isuni, Thushara and the lady with the specs at the reception for the amazing service rendered to us. Entertainments was really joyful specialy Fire Bimbos. We have been several star hotels in UK,Europe and Sri Lanka ,but this was the best among compared to all. All the best . Keep the good work.

Visited with my husband to Heritance and stayed one day there and had a memorable experience.Excellent hospitality Superb location and lovely food with great team spirit. No hesitation to recommend anyone who likes to visit this hotel and I must say it was a memorable stay.

We came for a Vacation from Australia. Our initial plan was to stay only one night F/B. Once we walk in to the hotel it's very relaxing and welcome was very friendly. Food and customer service is excellent. Because if this we ave decided to extend the stay for another day. Special thanks goes to Nipun Sameera (F&B Ex) Thushara (R&B) Nelka - Excellent Sri Lankan tea.

Visited Heritance Ahungalla for a day out with a day room. Superb location close to the beach and also had a nice big pool. The food was great. Room was clean and comfortable enough. Friendly staff. Can be recommended!

35 of us booked 20+ rooms for our high school reunion at Heritance sept 23rd to 26th ( people came from all over the world USA, Canada, Australia, NZ, SL, Vietnam, UK etc,,,). From check in to check out the service was 5 star+++, when the group arrived we were met by the GM Sisira and his front office manager and our rooms were ready didn't have to wait in line it took us less than 10 minutes to get all the rooms. The buffet had wide variety and the food was excellent, the dining room staff was fabulous. The rooms are nice big and clean with balcony and sea view. We had our Gala dinner on the 24th in a private banquet hall and the banquet hall was decorated beautifully like a wedding reception ( 20+ staff worked hard with a smile to make it nice) they had fire and candles by the entrance. We played cricket, volleyball, water polo and several indoor games. Their pool (3 of them) and the grounds are big nice and clean.... lots of room for everyone. Can't say enough good things about their staff and our stay. The entire team from their corporate office Thilini, their GM Sisira and his staff Gamini, Srinath, Chaminda, Priyanga and the rest of the staff were amazing. All of us had a great time. Thank You SR Sharva

One of the best beach hotels in sri lanka with perfect qulity service. Nece spacious luxury room 355. Clean room. Restaurent service and variation of food perfect. Tasty food bit oily and spicy. Mr Thushara treated us well. Thanks to him a lot.

Our honeymoon went over all the expectations, and was truly unforgettable thanks to all the staff and hotel in general. When you walk in, you're already in love with nature, big pools, beauty of everything that you see. Great people are working in the hotel. Especially Tharindi. She was very helpful, always smiling and absolutely nice!!! Our room was great, always new design of flowers, and fresh fruit. We were very satisfied with out choice, and hopefully we will be back again!

Traveled with my wife last week. Overall, the service is excellent. The rooms were neat and tidy despite the fact that the hotel was operating at its full capacity during that weekend. Staff is very friendly and helpful. There are two pools in the hotel, one is exclusively for the residents. When coming to meals, we enjoyed both the breakfast and dinner buffets, which had a variety of dishes, both Sri Lankan and Western. My wife also had a mini treatment in the SPA and she was very happy with the staff and level of service. Even though the hotel has a nice beach, Swimming in the ocean is not allowed due to obvious safety concerns.Overall, a wonderful experience and we are hoping to come back :)

Overall quality and service were good with the unique layouts of the destination. Pool was quite amazing with the structure, clear water and also with a space for water polo. There were supportive staff but they should consider more about their varieties and selections of foods.

Just spent a week there following six nights at Jims farm villas. Very nice room and very helpful staff. Two great pools and hotel was right on the beach. Most guests in the hotel were German with a few British and Chinese guests. Food was buffet style so always something to suit could be found. The food was good but no more than that, it can't be easy catering for different tastes and large numbers. There is a separate fish restaurant (extra cost) great fresh fish - we had a Lobster and a local fish (can't recall what) and some large prawns together with a nice starter and a couple of beers for about Â£35 so you can't complain about the prices. We used this week to doss about the pool having done a week of sight seeing prior. Outside the hotel on the main drag it's not what you would call tourist friendly, there aren't the usual abundance of shops selling mementoes, you will get you own guide who latches on like a limpet as soon as you walk out of the gate trying to guide you into the stalls or local shops as we have been told they get a kick back from the shopkeepers. You will also get the local girls showing their clothing range on the perimeter of the hotel by the beach. Pretty entertaining but barter well if you want to buy.

After a two-week tour of Sri-Lanka it was lovely to relax and unwind in a luxury hotel. Our room was clean and comfortable with a nice balcony, unfortunately view of the beach was hidden by a large tree! Wasn't feeling very well during our stay so ordered room service. Great menu and huge portion sizes. Hotel also in a convenient location when sick because a pharmacy and shops located at the end of the driveway. :-)

Location , food and staff very good. Rooms very nice (especially if on ground floor leading straight to poolside) good choice of food. The only downside was not being able to swim in the sea due to monsoon conditions :-( tut tut to nearest swimming beach only 20 minutes away. Would recommend the local train to Galle ! Would like to say thank you to the attentive staff, and special thanks especially to NIROSH and DARSHANA who looked after us ğŸ˜ƒ

with my family we spent 5 days in the hotel , I booked B&B and then upgraded it to half- board , the hotel facilities are in good shape , clean rooms , excellent service , and continuous follow up on . food is excellent limited in terms of number of dishes but very good in quality / taste . make sure to book sea view room , I was not lucky to get one.

We spent 02 nights in this lovely seaside hotel. We found every aspect of this hotel, to be excellent. Rooms are nice and clean. Staff are very polite, helpful and attentive to details. Food was just great in terms of variety and taste. A special thank you to Mr. Lakshitha Salgado who upgraded us to a suite and 02 luxury rooms (due to the slight issue we had at the check-in, when sorting out the room allocation). Help from Chathura and Trilishya at the reception is much appreciated. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will come back again...

Every year when we're visiting Sri Lanka, Heritance Ahungalla is a must. With all the newer hotels around, Heritance has proved to be a very solid hotel and has never disappointed us. Accommodations, pools, and food is great and the service of the staff is exemplary. They are very attentive, helpful and never without a smile. With two young children, our family always has an awesome time there and will keep visiting. Thank you.

I recently visited the hotel and it was a wonderfull hotel with all the facilities.Himasha from the staff is so helpfull and i had nothing to do myself because she was there whenever i had to talk to the hotel.I recommend this hotel as the best in the area

Pros: Very nice seaside resort hotel. Clean comfortable rooms with excellent service by staff. Cons: Overpriced for the total experience. Buffet lacks variety of foods. Rough seas most of the times hence unable to go in.

The rooms are a bit dated. Still on round pin plugs so adaptors are needed for all appliances in the room! Would be nice to have fluffier towels. Yet I think it I'd good value for money. Food is excellent as with all Heritance hotels. Location by the beach, the expansive pool, service is all great! Gym is very basic. Just one cross trainer and no treadmill . Certain,y the hotel is not plush but for the price it is pretty good.

I really enjoyed my stay here - the room was clean and comfortable, the breakfast was great and the location by the beach was lovely. The spa was also lovely and the treatments very relaxing. Only a couple of things let it down - mainly that the service wasn't as good as the other hotels we stayed in in Sri Lanka. There was an incredibly loud party going on in the room above us in the early hours of the morning and on calling reception to ask them to ask the people involved to stop, they didn't seem too bothered and didn't do much about it. There was also a very strange speaker in the bathroom which played music constantly and we couldn't find any controls to switch it off! Relaxing outside here was difficult as the chipmunks from the trees were constantly running around on sun loungers and we were pestered frequently by people trying to sell us things.

We stayed three nights in this beautiful hotel. The hotel is very nice and calm Room are excellent.Specealy food is excellent and f&b staff is very Frendly and attentive. Specialy nelka,pasan & nuwan are really helpful. Hope to visit this marwalas place again.

Staying here during low season has the benefit of fewer guests, which means the dining rooms, bars and pools are quiet. The sea is too rough to swim in until November but this hotel has two nice pools and plenty of entertainment if it rains (table tennis, badminton, games room etc) The buffet style dining room is well-laid out (I like the hot meals in an annex.) The food was pretty good and there was variety each evening - enough to cater for different dietary needs. However, I think it is a bit mean to charge for small bottles of water with your meal! There were a few issues with wifi when we stayed there - you get two passwords per room. If the weather was more consistent you could spend more than a few days here. The hotel is only an hour from Galle and just over two hours to Colombo on the highway. This is a good hotel for families or couples. The rooms are large and comfortable - great A/C and we had a room which had doors opening out into the garden and pool which was perfect. The bathrooms seemed recently updated. (There was a lot of noise above our room during the day as it seemed they were renovating or cleaning with heavy duty machinery - very noisy until 6pm.) if we had been staying longer we might have asked to have been moved! Overall a good experience!

Located in a lovely place near beach. Very friendly staff. Excellent food. All 3 meals are buffet. Enjoyed every moment of stay. Two big pools with bars. Pool staff is bit rude.not very supportive. Great for a vacation.

Me and wife chose Heritance Ahungalla to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We stayed there for 2 nights and had an amazing stay. We had smooth, quick check in, even though we did check in the day that hotel staff had the family get-together. We got 2nd floor sea side room. We received a fruit basket and a cake to room ( ? Anniversary gift ). Room is well equipped. The hotel has 2 big swimming pools where you can relax. The beach is just in front of the hotel. Morning/evening walk on this clean beach is a must. Also hotel has table tennis,badminton and tennis court where you can enjoy a game with your partner. Also it has a gym, that we couldn't explore as we were busy with other activities. Throughout our stay we had buffet in main resturant for 3 meals, which were superb. Pool bar has lot of options. It has 2/3 restaurants, which we couldn't explore. They have different events organized every night and we experienced fire limbo and black and white show in our stay and they were superb. The gem store (premadasa) at the hotel is a must visit place. It has genuine gem stones for a reasonable price. Mr Ismile at there is superb. ( Yaa I had to buy a stone ring for my wife as she felt love with it ) Hotel offers lot of activities for guests and really you don't need to go out for anything. Altogether it was a superb stay for us. Yes, definitely we will return.

Everything was so perfect nice view two big pools clean rooms.Staff is exceptionaly well trained restaurant staff is very well organized.we really enjoyed our two days.fire thing that had on tuesday night was so good we had so much fun.there were some nice games as well.only negative experience that i had was with the lady who make hoppers.she was so rude i greeted she did not greet back.i asked for a sweet hopper one with sugar in it she said cant only plain and egg hoppers available.then i asked for a treacle one she again said cant.she needs some customer service training.i ended up not having any hoppers.she was plain rude. Other than that everything was perfect.we loved it.

I visited heritance ahungalla with my office colleagues.Really nice hotel with nice pool.Fabulous foods and Room conditions was superb,and i really love room concept as well.but the staff not that much friendly.they must be very close with customers with nice smile.For local customers as well.Anyway i really enjoyed and i love heritance ahungalla. Definitely recommended!

The Heritance Ahungalla and Heritance Kandalama were both designed by the famous Geoffrey Bawa. The Ahungalla building is more conservative in design, but still displays a lovely aesthetic. We chose to stay at this hotel for the last four nights of a long tour, in order to simply enjoy some purely indulgent relaxation on-site. It did not disappoint, and we would be very happy to return. The highlights: - two fabulous swimming pools: a large 'infinity' pool, and a smaller pool which is somewhat secluded and beautifully landscaped. - the beach is immediately accessible for walks and for viewing the sunset. The sea is too rough for swimming, however. - Day trips are easily made possible to Galle fort, and Geoffrey Bawa's 'Lunuganga' (I should mention however that it is possible to arrange for hotels/residencies at both of these places). - the dinner buffet experience is fantastic, with a huge variety of delicious food to choose from. Excellent service. Warm, friendly staff. Recommended! :)

Enjoyed an amazing weekend here with family including 2 children - ages 4 and 6. Nothing was too much trouble for the dining room staff- we had half board and the food was brilliant. Every morning for breakfast a huge variety to choose from - 6 different Brekafast cereals, 8 different cool drinks, chefs on stations - eggs anyway you want hoppers, dhosa, idll, bacon, sausages, cold meats & cheese platters, huge selection of freshly made breads, doughnuts, danishes, cakes and fruit. Seriously a lot of fruit plus yoghurt and curd. Food is taken very seriously here. Saturday nights choice of evening meal was again amazing - freshly cooked giant king prawns, as many lobsters as you could manage, freshly grilled fish, chicken, kebab meat. We were truly spoilt for choice and even though there was a huge amount on offer, the chefs still cooked for my children anything they wanted for example plain chicken and chips. The dining room staff so very helpful and couldn't do enough. We meet the executive chefs too on the dining room floor and it was good to talk to them. Sat night also included ice-cream night which had a choice of I think 8 different quality ice-creams plus as many desserts as you can eat. Sri Lankan night on Friday meant freshly made oil cakes and lots of Vesak delicacies. We stayed in a lovely suite at a quieter end of the hotel which suited us at ground floor level which meant we could walk straight out to poolside.There are 2 generous sized pools we preferred the green pool as there was a large tree overhanging providing shade, also the hot tub is on this side. The shallowest depth is 127cm, so children need to bring water wings- can also be purchased easily roadside or from hotel gift shop. Both pools have pool side bars from which to order drinks. The hotel architecture is also really beautiful and it's a very pleasant place to stay. The beach is sandy but the sea too rough at this time of year for any swimming, but you can still jump waves. My children too young for evening entertainment but they enjoyed the live bands around the hotel on the way to and from dinner. The hotel also has a good wet weather plan with plenty of activities. We were close to the table tennis room, badminton and tennis courts. There is also a spa on site with lots of lovely sounding treatments, but sadly didn't get a chance to use it. To be honest we were either in the pool or eating! This is a fantastic hotel, all the staff we found were extremely polite and friendly.

The hotel needs improvement right from room allocation to Food and service. We were a groupof 27 people stayed there for 3 nights but rooms were allocated in all different corners, thou requested no one bothered to even take any efforts. Food was very monotonous for both breakfast and dinner On all three days , totally not exciting. . Staffs were polite but were on their own Sweet time and very laid back . Rooms are clean and well maintained .

Heritance Ahungalla was our choice for a relaxing family beach holiday. On arrival our impression was not so good after seeing the car park with all disused items piled up. However, welcome drinks and hospitality from the staff at front desk compensated that. Our rooms were lovely and spacious and close to each other. However instead of a king size bed advertised and we had in our confirmation, we had two beds stuck together in our room. When we complained they said they will sort it out but all they did was put a bigger sheet covering both beds! Hence the 4* rating in the review. There are two outdoor pools. One is about 4ft deep and one end is deeper. This one has trees close by and hits a bit of shade during the day. The other pool is about 1m deep (one section is deeper) and great to be enjoyed with kids. The pool is huge and close to the sea. When you are in the pool it kind of give the feeling that the sea and the pool is just one. Food was very good both traditional Sri Lankan and Western foods were available for all meals. The beach (beautiful and clean) is just yards away and you can have peaceful walk in the morning. Unfortunately the sea was rough at the time we visited- hence we could only have a paddle. I would highly recommend this place.

Great food & excellent service!!!! Recommended for family outings and for honeymooners. We would definitely visit again. Rooms are clean and classy. Saturday BBQ night was exceptional. Made our weekend heavenly...

I stayed here for just. one night on a G Adventures trip throughout Southern Sri Lanka, and I wish we had spent more nights here. This hotel was the best of my Sri Lanka trip. Comfortable beds, clean and spacious rooms with lots of natural light, a beautiful indoor/outdoor pool that looked out on the Indian Ocean, fast wifi, the BEST shower I had in Sri Lanka, and attentive staff. I do not stay in many luxury hotels, so I don't have much to compare this one to, but it was a wonderful stay and I wish I could have stayed longer!

I want to share my experience (no so good) at The Heritance Hotel Anugila. I along with my 2 sisters had made a booking for the 3 of us for 2 nights 17th and 18th August 2017 at The Heritance hotel Anugula. We checked-in the hotel on 17th Evening and were smoothly escorted to our room number 224. 1- On reaching the room we noticed that the floor was a little wet and asked for it to be cleaned with a delay of 5-10 minutes the floor was cleaned. 2- Tired of all the travel throughout the day, we thought of making some tea/coffee in the room, just to find that there were only 2 of all the things in the room. 2 cups, 2 glasses, 2 spoons etc. (for a room booked for 3). Why would the arrangements be for 2 when the booking is for 3??? 3- The electric kettle was placed in a cupboard which had no plug points. we had to shift the kettle to some other table to actually use it. But again to my surprise, the electric kettle plug (Flat pin) and the plug point (Round ones) in the room did not match. 4- My sister sat on the third bed to find out that the bed was actually not stable. If you sit on one side of it, it would lift up from the other. 5- We called up the rooms service for the above 3 points (2,3 and 4), but to my disappointment they could not have been slower. When you have a 5 star facility I would expect the staff to know English. The room service were not able to understand our plain English!! The room service addressed the plug problem, we made tea, and one of us had tea in a glass tumbler as there were only 3 cups in the room! 6- I went for a swim in the evening and came back to my room to take a shower. I land up in the bathroom to find out that there is no Shampoo or conditioner in the room!!! I call up the reception for the same and they tell me they will send it to my room. I wait for almost 15 mins no hear no knock on my door. In the end I had to take a shower without a shampoo or conditioner. 7- At dinner that night, my sisters were a little disappointed as there were not much veg options (they both are vegetarians). The chef was there taking feedback and my sisters told him the same. The next morning we were to go for an early whale watching trip and had to leave at 5.30 AM. We had already asked the reception to pack our breakfast. Previous night, while talking to the chef, my sisters told him that we would be leaving early and to pack good breakfast for 3 (2 veg (for my sisters) and 1 non veg (for me)). We woke up and were leaving for the trip. The reception handed over our breakfast nicely packed. We opened the packets around 10AM on our way back from the trip to find out 3 non-beg meals!!!!! My sisters could not have breakfast that morning, thanks to the chefâ€™s goof-up! 8- We reached our room, called up the reception for shampoo and conditioner (Which were still not there in the room). The room service comes to the room with an unlabelled bottle and said that was shampoo. I asked for a hair conditioner and I am still in shock that he did not know what that was!! I explained what that was, and he said that they do not have a hair conditioner available!!! Believe me I am in shock as I write it!! 9- The day went on, we did not want to spoil our mood as we were on a 3 sisters vacation! But the next morning when we woke up, we found out that the entire room was dripping of water (see pictures attached). The room had always been wet throughout our stay (as found on check-in) but it started dripping literally next morning. We had our luggage placed on the table above which the ceiling was dripping! All our clothes were wet! We had to quickly move the luggage from there to the beds. And then there was no place to sit. I called up the room service to show them that, to hear a reply that we should not have the window open. We were in a sea facing room and were there to enjoy the sea, not to seal ourselves up in an AC room. That we do anyway at our offices when we are not on vacation. Why would you be in a sea facing room and not have the balcony or windows open?? I have not seen a beach side 5 star property of not having slippers or bathrobes in the room. I do not think these facilities should be provided on request. Isnâ€™t it obvious that on a beach side resort the guests will go to the beach (or swimming pool) and would need slippers? Why should they have to ask for it?? Again still in shock - No conditioner!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! There are no plug points next to the bed!!!!! only 1 plug point far away fromt he bed. No multi-plugs available in the room. You have to call room service for that as well! We were in Sri-Lanka for a 7 day trip, stayed in all 4 star resorts. We wanted our last 2 days to be special and relaxing and hence we chose a 5 star. Our experience in all 4 star places was far better than these 2 last days! A Dissatisfied customer

We stayed at this hotel for a couple of days for a corporate outing / workshop and did enjoy the amenities. The food spread at the main restaurant was really good and we enjoyed all the varieties that were on offer. Easy access to beach and a nice pool too. Overall, nothing too fancy but a decent place for a day or two stay...

We were spoilt by the appearance and service of heritance kandalama and tea factory. We arrived and the hotel is a big resort as you'd expect. A bit weather battered but a high quality. The rooms are large and clean. Have everything we need. The service is slow and impersonal. Not what we had come to expect in Sri Lanka. There is little ambiance. The evening entertainment is unnecessary, keeping the bar open later would be better. The pools are great just note that you can only swim in the sea in Nov or Dec. It's really rough and dangerous at other times.

Front office reception staff specially Shanika was really friendly and helping us, food was delighted and so much of verities to enjoy The rooms are really clean and well arranged, room service is on time very friendly, special events were organized such as magic show, active performances really enjoyed in my stay.....So do not think go for it and enjoy your stay.....

Have stayed in this hotel 7 times and have never had a bad holiday. Love the hotel, love the people on the beach who are so friendly especially a guy called Fredi who i could trust with my life. All in all a great place to go.

Just pass by stay for 5 minutes you'll love this place forever. The staff at Heritance Ahungalla is one exceptional equipe that cannot be found in any hotel in the world. Everyone you meet at this hotel will do anything they can to make sure your stay is more than perfect. The food is amazing there is always a wide variety to enjoy and munch on. The rooms are really clean and well arranged. Service is really good. This hotel is a MUST. Thank you for the fantastic stay Ahungalla, will be back for sure.

We went with friends and one of our friends lost their foot ware , ten feet from the pool and they were few hawkers selling few things and the securities of the hotel are very careless . They also had some maintance work going on . Over all an ok place . The chef took special care

Excellent hotel with clean rooms, fabulous foods and beautiful pool. Had a memorable day with great variety of foods. Huge selection of desserts. Very big and clean pool. Room was big and clean. Highly recommend this hotel.

"This hotel just gets better and better.We stayed at the heritance ahungalla in last week and had such an amazing experience that we decided to return soon.Again I cannot speak highly enough of this wonderful hotel.The staff are amazing and make you feel so welcome,specially I would like to thank Restaurant and bar team(including In room dining ) service was very quick and perfect.soon we'll be back!!!!!!!!!"

Friendly staff, relaxing atmosphere, beautiful surroundings. If a relaxing beach holiday is what you want (and we did) this is a great place. We did the all inclusive and it was great value. We didn't do any trips as that is not what we wanted, apart from a trip down to Galle to see the Sri Lanka India Test match (1 hour approx).

Stayed here for two nights. Excellent pool with beach view. Beach was not crowded at all. Served halal food which is a major plus. Hands up to the management on this part. Changed menu's daily. Pool was good. Didnt try the other pool which also looked good. Bar had good food. Kids loved it. Staff was very welcoming af warm. Held kids event, which is good for families. Loved it

If you want to spend a pleasant time in Down South in quite and noiseless place on a beautiful Indian Oceans coast for a really affordable price Heritance Ahungalla hotel is exactly for you! Nice rooms, tasty national, Indian and western cuisine, very friendly staff and of course beautiful beach.By the way they have Two pool too. Specially I would like to thank Mr.Thushara (F and B Manager), I will definitely recommend and hopefully be back.

We spent the last 3 night of our honeymoon at Ahungalla and it was the perfect end to our journey. The room was big and the bathroom clean. We spent a lot of time in the pool by the restaurant which was spacious. The staff was very kind and helpful throughout our stay. Every night the chef would come to our table and make us anything we would want because we were a honeymoon couple. Also, the staff helped my wife plan a surprise 5 course meal on the beach for me which they executed perfectly. Thank you Ahungalla

We went as a family to spend a couple of days at the beach. It is convenient being just a couple of hours drive from Colombo. The pool was really nice, with views out to the ocean. The rooms are quite spacious and had little balconies from where you can see the ocean and even sunsets. Food was ok too though I wouldn't say exceptional. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.

I used to be very pleased with service and product. Today after 4 month I come again but the place has changed. Now be careful if your bill. A waiter asked me you know how many beer you have consumed, my answer yes; 3. Waiter no 4.well it is only 3 and this is fraud attempted by the staff. They had to admit that yes only 3 beer was served so why have this stupid discussion trying to make me pay for something not consumed. Very disappointed.

My son and i have spent 1 week in the Heritance Ahungalla. The 1st day was a bit complicated as i have bought the resort because there was a kids club and unfortunately, there was no kids club ! Despite this misundertsanding and the fact that i couldnt go to the gym or have time for myself, we had a great stay. The rooms are huge and because we stayed one week, we had few amenities on regular basis.. thx to our room attendant, Hashan, we had a different animal every day on our bed (made with towels)... my son wanted to be the first one to enter into the room and discover which animal it will be... Pool is huge and there is aquagym every day... there are even 2 pools, one closer to our rooms but deeper and with a jaccuzzi and the main one, where the activities and restaurants are... Tisharia in FO was the one who checked us in and she was very nice with my kid and all guests... very friendly staff and if you go on excursion, you can ask for an early breakfast... The food is very good, there are lot of waiters, always nice and friendly with us and the quality of the food is very good.. lot of choices, different themes evey day and a sri lanka corner, always different, food is very fresh, fruits are tasty, congrats to the chef and his team... Chamila,our waiter during the week was always friendly and smiling For the ones who like, there are musicians and/or dancers every evening, so you wont get bored. I had a massage the last day and my regret was that i should have done it earlier as i would have done more treatments...Nella, a balinaise lady was so amazing... strong and very efficient... and value for money is good, so try the spa when you arrive....not at the end.. Nice experience, sea is a bit rough is july but our guide told me that its ok between September to april.. Nice hotel, dont hesitate to book, but if you come with your kids, dont count on the kids club... it's the only regret... thank you to the Resident Manager and the team...

We Spent a really relaxed and rejuvenating 2 nights / 3 days at Ahungalla early this month. A Big thank you to Mr Sisira Senaratne and his team for their hospitality extended to the 4 of us. Upgrade of 1 room to a suite was never expected. Both rooms were excellent and specious. We spent most of the time in the 2 pools. The food spread at all meals were quite appetizing. A special thanks to the Gardener who gave flowers each morning to my wife. Such a sweet gesture. This place is highly recommended to all.

Happy about the service. Great customer service and clean atmosphere. Good foods and specially bar service is exelent. Had a great time. Enjoyed the time spent there and great pool area and the sports field.

The check in was very smooth. Was assigned to a room in the old wing which was very clean. The bathroom was very compact but did have one negative impact since it was party made out of glass and was covered with wooden blinds. This method is not very family friendly when it comes to privacy. The staff was very helpful when changing rooms when we were upgraded to a family suite which was "AWESOME" overlooking the GREEN POOL. As usual the Heritance Chain kept up to the standard when it came to the meals where you could find a massive variety and availability. However appreciate if activities for children and catered for since it was quite hard for us to keep the kids occupied and made it boring for them. All we could find was a GHOSTLY kids room. The beach was very clean, and was the only things which kept the children occupied other than the beach. Since the sea was a bit rough kid's couldn't get the full advantage. Last but not least I would like to bring up some thing, the only negative point is you must discuss at the time of check in about the child policy since I was asked about the ages of my kids at the time of check in (which were 6 & 11), in the end at the time of check out (mind you we had a Triple Full Board booking and prior read up of child policy of the hotel) were charged extra for the child, which I see is not professional. So it's advisable if you confirm prior to booking to avoid any unpleasant surprises.

We had a pleasant stay at Heritance Ahungalla. Loved the atmosphere and the excellent service of the friendly staff . Went with kids and they attended to all our request ( kids meals , laundry , etc) without any hesitance . Keep up the good job and waiting for the next trip there.

It was a sudden decision and a quick getaway with my wife and the 3 year old. Well... the welcome was warm and pleasant, but I would say you could have been a lil bit more organized in the check in process, and that's something you can improve. The room was a deluxe and I would give five stars for that. The room was spacious and the wooden floors added an extra cosy atmosphere. Washrooms were small but I believe bigger washrooms were not the trend way back in 1981 when the hotel was established. There were a few minor problems with the cleanliness, but a sophisticated refurbishment would have corrected all wrongs. The pool was big and clean, but I would have appreciated a much shallower end and a baby pool. Need to mention the beautiful flute player at the pool. The dinner was OK... I would give 5/5 for the taste of food but the choice was just average. I would suggest a BBQ on a busy Friday night. The breakfast was again 5/5 and also a very rich variety. Check out was smooth.

Wonderful atmosphere in the hotel and a have large pool. can go for a sea surf is it's not monsoon. Foods are delicious and specially the Saturday dinner is awesome. lot of live cooking's and had my favorite lobsters.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We had a complimentary fruit basket in our room. The rooms were clean and comfortable. View from the room was fantastic overlooking the ocean. Staff was exceptional. Spa amazing. You can enjoy two well laid out beautiful swimming pools and also the beach. Meals were very tasty with a wide choice.

Woww Paradise hotel, best service, everything perfect. Very delicious food, Excellent and friendly staff. Best place for honeymooners. Still sharing memories with family and friends. Definitely I will visit again.

Many times have we visited Heritance Ahungalle, previously known as Triton Ahungalle. This visit was to be with visiting friends, who attended a family wedding. The greatest part of this resort is the amazing placement of the pool, and the architecture of the Master of Sri Lanka, Bawa. Nothing will match this awe aspiring view of the sweeping water to the sea. The front office staff were polite and most helpful, especially Ms Shanika (?) who went out of her way to make sure we were comfortable. Thank you all ! We were disapointed that the food standards had dropped since our last visit, but the pool menu made up in some part, for snacks. It is an aging property, but special care is given to keep it good condition. My only criticism was the speed of the staff in the dining room, if we requested water or any small item, it took ages to arrive. This kind of service is in need of rapid attention, as guests sit waiting and waiting, and it feels as if you are forgotten ! The pool was spotless, the pool staff much more attentive than the inside staff. We love this place and will return again, in the hope that these small areas will receive the attention needed to revive its service. Thank you for a holiday that renewed memories of the years gone by....

My husband and I stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla for your honeymoon. Could not wish for better accommodations for special week. We stayed in beautiful room overlooking one of the two pools. The food was excellent and was offered with such a variety that we never had a problem of eating the same thing. The staff was very friendly. Seriously loved it there and did not wanted to leave.

We were travelling in low season (june to july). Unfortunatelly swimming in the ocean was not possible. But because of the low seaon we had the hotel including the two pools nearly for our selves. And while relaxing in the pool, you have a breathtaking view of beach and ocean. It was en awesome stay with lots of beautiful and fascinating memories.

Thanks to the staff of your esteemed hotel for finding & returning the lost gold pendant. The people I spoke with (Receptionist / Guest Relations Officer) were very kind and understanding in helping me with the recovery. This is a great service and restores my faith in mankind. A special thanks to bell boy (Anil) for his high integrity.

We stayed in this wonderful place to spend our annual trip and we were treated as ambassadors. Wow. Excellent service from all over the resort with personal touch. Food was yummy. One of the key point to keep up the place unique is attentive staff. Keep up the good work guys.

Wow superb place for a day out and the service of the receptionist are exceptional. Definitely I will visit again. Very delicious food and had an awesome time. Excellent and friendly staff. Recommend for any family or friends for a vacation.

If you are visiting southern province, sri lanka Heritance Ahungalla is the best hotel for relaxing. Nice environment, best service, awesome foods and much more. I had a best time with my friends in heritance hotel. Awesome memories. Cheers

What an excellent holiday we had, me and my family was welcome by the staff as if they knew us for a very long time. ever since then until we draw off saying goodbye after three days we wee looked after extremely well by the staff. the duty manager him self came and spoke to us many times and even cleared our table by him self. customized service according to my family requirement was very touching. Mr.Thushara took care of with an VVIP treatment and i have no words to thank him. A man who has tremendous talent in food and beverage knew what needs to be done according to the time and place to make his guest feel comfortable and welcome at all time. i sincerely hope the management recognized such staff in days to come.reception staff who had a smile, bell boy with a helping attitude whom we for got to tip to the housing keeping staff who cleaned the room twice a day and the list goes on. i wish them all the best and promise them that i'll visit them soon

I visited Heritance Ahungalla with keeping high standards in mind with experience had with Kandalama. Actually it was great, and Priyankara make us visit very remarkable. Thushara the other person whom kept restaurant at higher standard which I want to thankful. Imesh is the very first contact person at the reception gave us a superb service gave the positive kick start.

Heritance Ahungalle is a one of jefffery Bawa's place. Beautiful hotel with a lovely beach.. Two nice and relaxing swimming pools.food Wasana fabulous.. Staff Was amazing... Will recommend to our friends too...

This is my(Family) first visit to Heritance Ahungalla.We had a very nice time last weekend.relax atmosphere and we got very good newly refurbished room. Very good delicious food ,good taste and good variety,even a off season they are maintain their five star standards.Food and beverages department staff always treated utmost satisfaction to ensure "the customer is King".Specially Mr Thushara Gunaratne(Restaurant & Bar Manager) doing great job there.Always going here and there to see the satisfaction of guests .I must say he is a big asset to Heritance hotels(.If somebody ask what is hospitality definitely we can show him) . Very friendly staff ,Well Done guys & Gals Keep it up and keep momentum going . Except one matter (Communication between front office and head office very poor and trying to charge extra from us )I think this one of best hotels in Aitkenspence hotel chain in sri lanka.I recommend this place for anyone and hope visit again next year too..

Visited the hotel after one year from my last visit. Blown away by the service and the hotel as a whole. Even on a low occupancy month they ensure the customer is treated with utmost care and given priority. Good job guys. Keep it up.

We had a lovely time at this beautiful resort... large swimming pools... food was superb. Nothing to complaint about it... room and the service also great... the staff was very friendly and helpful. We will come back...

Beautiful hotel with the best staff. The reception is ready to assist you with anything you need. The food is mouthwatering and don't get me started on the deserts. The hotel threw a mermaid fire show, it was magical along with other many entertainments they provide. Being an animal lover I quiet enjoyed being surrounded by many animals around the hotel monkeys, squirrels. This experience is memorable and I look forward to coming back here in the future. I recommend this hotel to anyone wanting an unforgettable relaxing experience.

We came here to spend our summer holiday. Great hotel, lovely service, employees are very hospitable and willing to help. All in all a great experience. It was a good choice for us this holiday. Thank you.

We stayed here for a few nights over a long weekend and decided to go with the all inclusive package. Staff were very helpful and polite and happy to help you with any request you may have. There a two pool one at the entrance and another closer to the rooms which was very nice. One thing we did request was a king bed, and when we arrived in the room we found two singles.. we then informed staff that we would like a queen/King bed which they said they could do, as we were paying for that. We came back a little later to what we thought was a king bed, but they'd just put a big sheet over both beds and moved them together.. We were woken up both mornings too by people chatting in the hallways as they echo and noise travels but this is not the fault of the staff obviously. All in all, good package deal with all inclusive and staff are extremely helpful and always smiling! Would recommend staying here :)

I stayed there for two nights and I had the best time ever. From the moment you arrive to leave they will look after you. The pools and beach were great. Rooms were lovely. Food was yummy. There's nothing negative about this place.

Visited in September'13 Heritance ahungalla is the most amazing place to be in Would love to visit again sometime Lovely infinity swimming pool Enjoyed swimming specially during evening, night time n early morning.....feels like heaven Well maintained n beautiful rooms Good food Beautiful location Freindly staff Excellent !!!!!!

Excellent get away from the hustle and bustle of Colombo. The Sri Lankan food was so tasty and authentic! Friendly staff, ever ready to help. The hotel has been designed by Geoffrey Bawa, Sri Lanka's renowned architect.

Heritance Ahungalle is a great place to visit. Hotel contains full luxurious rooms, fantastic food, natural pool, a windy beach. Employees of the hotel is doing there job perfectly. They are very helpful to the travelers. Thushara Gunarathne, Chandima Karunarathene is some of them. Come and enjoy your self in this FIVE STAR SUPER FANTASTIC HOTEL "HERITANCE AHUNGALLE!!!!!"

Heritance Ahungalla is a great place to visit on holidaysğŸ‘Œ.Hotel contains full luxury rooms,fantastic food and drinks,natural pool and the beach....The employers are very strong and helpful and they are doning their job very well....And finnaly I think this is the only one great hotel I have visitedğŸ˜‚ğŸ‘

Red ants everywhere. In the room, in the bathroom. Even got into our luggage. The lobby is gorgeous but the room was full of sand. Not sure if they forgot to mop our room but it was very sandy. Food was not very impressive either. The one positive thing was that the hotel staff were very helpful after our son got sick in the restaurant. I am grateful for that. This hotel used to be wonderful. This trip however was sub par. Not sure we will be back.

Lovely place to visit, surrounded with a wonderful environment. Everything is perfect. Love to be there again. Staff was also friendly with us. Ideal place for honeymooners. Room was perfect. Quite and calm surround with fully natural environment. Thanks for everything Heritance Ahungalla.

We visited the place last month, had a warm welcome and the environment was so peaceful. Everyone was very friendly and their hospitality is the greatest! Food is very delicious and the variety superb..The green pool is very calm and quiet and that's so lovely! I must thank everyone there, for their great hospitality and had a wonderful stay! I recommend this place for anyone and hope to visit again.

I like this hotel, very nice hotel.everything was perfect. I would like to come back maybe next yearğŸ™‚. The food was delicious. The pool was great. Very good and professional person. The destination was excellent.

The property is old and there was construction happening in the restaurant area. Only one restaurant was open during our stay and the Ala Carte had nothing much to write home about. The hotel does not have any facilities on the beach (no beach chairs etc.) and the beach seemed completely dry with very few tourists during our stay. Breakfast had a good range though. Rooms look old and the bathroom had strange blinds which did nothing for privacy. Not sure what I missed. Staff told me they get lot of German and Chinese tourists but I couldnt really imagine why anyone will choose to stay here rather than Bentota. Maybe during the season it is more vibrant, we unfortunately did not feel the vibrancy.

We stayed for 10 nights at this hotel and every single one of them was perfect. Room: Spacious and clean. Plenty of storage space (we don't travel light!), very comfortable bed, great bathroom and the lighting in the room was excellent. Our room boy was extremely good. Thank you. x Restaurants and bars: The service was excellent. The waiters were so helpful and always with a smile and we had a good laugh with most of them. The food was outstanding especially when the Head Chef, Mr. Majula made us some special meals. He has won many culinary competitions and we can understand why. Also, we would like to mention Thushara Gnanarathna the Restaurant & Bar Manager for looking after us so well. We saw him at all meal times making sure everyone was happy. He does a splendid job. The bar waiters did an excellent job too and were so friendly. Sorry we can't name all the waiters but every one of them who looked after us did an excellent job. Thank you all. x Pools and beach: Brilliant. Plenty of sun loungers at both pools and in the garden and none of them were too close to each other. We stayed mainly by the Green Pool which is residents only and it was so relaxing. The beach is very wide and you could walk for miles. The sea was too rough to swim in but it was the Monsoon season. The pool attendants did a fantastic job and really looked after us. Thank you all. x Reception: The staff were very friendly and helpful and always with a smile. Also, we would like to mention the cashiers who were also very helpful. Thank you all. x Lastly, we would like to mention the lovely Himasha Guest Relations. She is a most delightful young lady who I am sure once she has finished her studies will do well in her career. We saw her each evening when we were dining and she would always come and have a chat with us and other guests. She does a splendid job. Thank you Himasha. xx Thank you all so much for making our stay a memorable one and we shall certainly return in the future.

Traveled with family on May 2017, well it was the rainy season, so not much luck enjoying the outdoors. Hotel was ok. the property is huge, well managed. Staff is friendly and attentive. Food was ok. Selections on the buffet was fine.The main restaurant seems a bit cramped up for room. breakfast options were a bit limited though.all in all a good experience.

The hotel is beautiful and had fantastic views of the sea. The variety of the food was amazing they have a good range of western, eastern and Sri Lankan dishes. Food was tasty and value for money ! Overall good experience and value for money :) anyone who wants a break should look at staying at heritance.

Stayed in Feb 2017 for 2 weeks, had a great time and it's worth a 10/10 for the beach,pool,rooms,food and staff Got on very well with all the pool boys and bar staff,if your thinking of traveling to Sri Lanka then I'd recommend this great hotel for couples and families Sea was very warm and welcoming,you can walk for miles along the soft sandy beach Had a brilliant holiday here

Had a lovely stay at this beautiful hotel.good place to relax and enjoy. Staff was really helpful and professional... food was great... special thanks to Mr. Sisira,sunethra,janaka, asha trevin, lakshitha,trilishiya shanika. I will be back for sure..

The best 5 star beach hotel I ever been.... The staff was amazing... Helpful and friendly.. Special thanks goes to sunethra, travers and lakshitha .. Had a lovely room..it was very clean and spacious... Service staff also very helpful... Thank for everyone for giving us a relaxing holiday...

A very pleasing property with two huge swimming pools and a very warm and disciplined staff to help without any glitches.The food here was good with Chef Manjula and Chef Scanda to help us choose the right kind of vegetarian food.For the non vegetarian there is a whole lot to choose from.Would recommend people & friends to stay here.

No where in the world you will find a property like this. Believe me the pool and the ocean is just 50 Meters from the lobby. What a location! Friendly staff, Great food, Unforgettable location. check in as well as check out are smooth. There was an issue with our Air conditioning during our stay in one of our rooms. they fixed it ASAP, Love the way the attend to the issues.

We have just spent 11 glorious days at the Heritance 5 star hotel to celebrate my wife's 60th birthday, many hotels claim 5 star the heritance is 100% 5 star with service which is second to none should it be the reception, bar staff, or the young man who cleans your room. I have been privileged to stay some great hotels all over the world if you want the best go to the Heritance you will not be disappointed, other hotels set your standards by this company and you will have many happy returning customers like us. Clarry and Caroline Dunn

Had a great stay at Heritance Ahungalla. Stayed there with friends and family. The property is nicely laid out with good rooms. Service in the hotel and restaurants was also great. The chefs in the restaurant were friendly and very helpful in arranging meals for kids. I know most people wouldn't visit the gym on a holiday, but I did and it wasn't in the best condition.

Heritance Ahungalla is a decent hotel with excellent staff. Stayed three nights with family and friends and the staff were always obliging and eager to please. They also work hard. The hotel was busy and it covers a big area and the staff were as busy as bees. But always good to the guests. Where I mark the hotel down is: a) The hotel is dated and looking very tired. I think one wing looked recently renovated, but the wing we stayed in, although clean, looked too tired. It badly needs an upgrade. A '5 star' should not be allowed to deteriorate to this extent before renovation b) It's a large hotel but surprisingly low on activities. As a result there is no 'wow' factor to justify the expensive rates. The beach is nice and it's a long stretch but the hotel is strangely lifeless and boring. As it is I would say this is a '4 star'. We had a nice time but there are so many options in Sri Lanka now and there isn't a good enough reason to return to this hotel.

Had a very relaxing time at Heritence Ahungalla . We have upgraded to luxurious suite room . kids were really happy , awesome food and excellent service from the staff. Thank you very much, Lakshitha . Sunethra & Keshan . We were really disappointed with AitkenSpence head office reservation team ( But Supun & Uthpala handled our reservation very professionally ) Thank you very much for everything .... Had a very memorable stay .....

Visited the hotel for lunch and to visit some old friends who work at the hotel. Had a fantastic meal prepared by Chef chaluka rodrigo. Excellent food and the desert spread was fantastic. Had a special tea, called the 'Yara Tea'.

My friends and my spouse and I had a great holiday at Heritance Ahungalla. We were fortunate to get upgraded to spacious luxurious suites which were tastefully designed with beautiful furniture and we had a lovely time. We wanted to relax and unwind so never used the wi-fi though the staff gave us the user name & password.. The service was excellent, and there was a variety of food to choose from in the buffets. The whole experience was great, and thank you to the great staff!

It's was the very first time we wanted to experience our stay in down south and we choose Heritance Ahungalla and it was the best choice. The staff there was fabulous and the rooms were really gud and the the RESTAURANT service was superb actually thanks to the Food and beverage Manager Mr Thushara he gave us the best out of the best thanks very much for making our stay so special. And we are goinh to miss the srilankan night l. We surely would come back next year again to Heritance for sure. Thumbs up guys . Thankyou Thushara ğŸ‘ğŸ¼ğŸ‘ğŸ¼

Mouthwatering dishes. Mmmmmmmm! I really love it....! large swimming pool And good service. thank you mr Thushara . i think this is a nice destination for a recently married couple. Recommended .******

Our family recently visited to celebrate my brother's birthday and the staff helped to execute the surprise so perfectly! We even got the chance to see inside their state of the art kitchen, talk to the chef and see where all the culinary magic happened. Indian night was one of our favorite meals! Clean and comfortable accommodations. Fun activities like badminton, tennis, and table tennis. Of the two pools, the residence pool was our favorite due to relaxed and cosy vibes. The jacuzzi was a nice touch. The staff from the reception to servers and even the pool attendant were all so friendly and helpful. It was the courteous and attentive service that truly made our experience wonderful. Worthy mentions: Lakmini & Jacob at the Jute Restaurant. We have been visiting regularly for 3 years and this hotel has become our family's favorite getaway vacation spot.

My first trip to Srilanka with family. Overall it's been an excellent and fun filled holiday for my kids, wife n myself. Great hospitality showcased by my Lankan friends. Especially in Hotel Heritance Ahungalla Mr Darshan from F&B :) Regards, Pankaj Kadu

My wife and myself recently returned after spending one night in the hotel. Welcome was friendly and we were quickly checked in to the room even though we arrived at the hotel earlier than the scheduled check-in. Room was specious and cozy with a king size bed.
