We were offered with an upstairs room over viewing the beach. It was a lovely experience to be there. Moreover hotel had had a full course buffet which included a vast spread and the food was simply amazing. And the staff is super friendly who took a greater care on my pregnant wife and always ready to go an extra mile to assist her. Must mention the support of Mr. Thushara Gnanarathna - Restaurant and Bar manager who is always around just to make his guests are enjoying the stay to the fullest!

We visited there this Saturday with our office staff. We had a great day. Pool is very good to our kids. They also had sooo much fun. Thnx for Mr. Praveen of F&B for helping us on this occasion & giving us the special rate. Food is good. There were sm more items for vegetarians also. Thnx again.

I went to spend this weekend to heritance ahungalle with my family, and it was an excellent choice! The food, hospitality, service, was very good. If you're searching for a good hotel to spend your holidays with your family or friends, doubtlessly this is the best choice!

I was there one night with my family & absolutely good place to visit again. I will never forget their foods, hospitality, room quality, environmental friendly location, quick service, smile of the in house staff, architecture, swimming pools etc. I was being in Heritance Kandalama before & this is the second Heritance experience of me. I have heard about the service of Heritance ahungalla from my colleagues. It is another reason to select this hotel as my next travel destination. I want to write a sentence about foods here. Foods are amazing & there is a big buffet in there. We enjoyed it lot & it is lovely place to visit again.

Just spent two wonderful weeks at this Hotel. We were on the all inclusive package and although we had some fears of this, we were surprised at the quality of of the food. Only two points per this Hotel down, why would Coke be on all inclusive, but diet Coke was not?? Also there was only a small space to eat outside, not everyone wants to eat inside! Would go again.

During our tours of the country, we had dropped in to this hotel as a family several times in passing over the years for lunch etc (excellent experiences) and finally took the opportunity to stay few nights this year. As always, the famous GB architecture in the reception area was fabulous, staff were very helpful courteous. There were some issues with the online booking system where the exact facilities in each type of room was not clear but the staff on the night managed to sort things out satisfactorily for us, even with the hotel being near full occupancy. The room we stayed in was clean and modern (appeared to be a recent refurbishment, the multi-socket wall powerpoints took in my overseas devices without the need for an adapter!), room service was good, Wi-Fi excellent, the gym smallish but adequate, pool & beach areas great and there were some good traditional outdoor displays/ activities during local New Year celebrations. Overall, a good experience & would be even better if the online system and a few minor maintenance needs were to be tidied up by the hotel group.

We spent the day there with my family. Hired a day room, used the pool had lunch and dinner. Had an amazing day. Food was lovely and the Restaurant and Bar Manager made sure we had a lovely time. Would definitely recommend.

This is my second experience at a Heritance. I absolutely loved every bit of the day. I visited this place with my besties for a spend the day. The hotel was magnificent and attractive. It has a nice view of the beach. And the food was amazing. The buffet was extremely satisfying, it was so delicious. We never missed any food item on the buffet. The pool adds more value to the whole experience and they have two gigantic pools. Me and my friends had a lovely time there. And I really appreciate the service also. The staff was really friendly and helpful. Hoping to visit Heritance Ahungalla again, and of course for a vacation.

I and my family visited Heritance and stayed for 2nights and 3 days.The service provided by the restaurant was great!Mr.Thusitha, main chef and the team made sure that we were provided with the best food and service. Their hospitality was amazing! My family and I normally travel and visit hotels in Sri Lanka but must say that they were extraordinary amazing!ğŸ‘

Recently returned from a two week visit to Sri Lanka, staying mostly at the Heritance Ahungalla. The welcome was warm and friendly, with bags taken to the room quickly and efficiently. The room itself was clean, well decorated, cool and well equipped. We had a family suite, which had a bed big enough for an entire family!! Even though we had an additional single bed in the room, myself and my children shared the comfortable large bed and were very happy for the two weeks. The pools and poolside were cleaned daily. Sunbeds were easily acquired. We were in a group of 17 and found beds together every day we stayed around the pool. The quieter pool was slower for drinks, but ever so relaxing. The beach was breathtakingly beautiful. We weren't hassled at all. The current and waves were very strong during our stay, which meant swimming wasn't advised, however, we jumped and played in the waves which was lots of fun. All of the communal areas were kept clean and tidy. The lunch time menu at the bar was lovely. The chips and burgers were extremely yummy! Having booked on an all inclusive package, we used the one restaurant that was included for breakfast, occasional lunch and dinner every day. By the end of the first week, admittedly, this was a little monotonous. The food didn't vary very much from night to night, even though the chef did try to make it themed. However, the food was delicious and to a very high standard. It would have been nice to have a little more variety on offer though - perhaps in the way of a second restaurant/place to eat. Service for drinks in the restaurant was sporadic. Depending on the waiter, we could wait for around 15-20 minutes for drinks alone. We combatted this by building a rapport with one waiter, who after a few days, looked after us and would bring drinks quickly. The evening entertainment wasn't fantastic. And we found the evening's could drag a little. So be sure to take your own entertainment with you! While staying here, we attended a friends wedding. The wedding planner was very friendly, but failed to explain the traditions that the couple were undergoing in their service, which left them and the group confused. The hair and make up provided by the hotel were sufficient - although our bride did end up taking off the make up, as it was a little too much. The photographer was unobtrusive, yet quite dated in his approach. Even though these may sound quite negative, we couldn't fault the wedding itself, which was incredibly special to the couple and us as guests. The staff were so kind and helpful throughout. Overall, we were so pleased with our stay at the Heritance. All of the staff were happy and helpful. Everything was completed to a high standard. And yes, there were some aspects that could have made it even better, but overall, it's been a holiday of a lifetime. Would highly recommend a visit here!

The food variety is magnificent the best I've seen out of the many hotels I've been to. I gave the 3 star rating just because how much i love the food and the creativity of the design in and outside the hotel. We called 3 times reporting in a technical issue in the room giving them 30-40 minute gaps but they didn't respond until we decided to yell at them. As usual we were given the room 45 minutes late. And is asked to leave right on time. The bed was okay but isnt the most comfortable. Staff is friendly and helpful . Loved that fact which is why I wouldn't wanna rate this any lower. Its a good place but could be better for this price

We have just arrived home from a 2 week stay at this fantastic hotel and already we want to go back. we chose this hotel for our wedding destination and couldn't have picked a more beautiful place. The service we received from the hotel and the wedding planner was excellent she was just fantastic! Gerald was a brilliant rep very helpful and didn't push any excursions. Both our suite and our guests rooms were brilliant spacious, clean with excellent views. The food was lovely and the kitchen spotless, service can sometimes be a little slow however we have to give a mention to Darshana when he was working service was excellent and he even remembered all 17 of our orders and kept our drinks topped up nicely!! sun loungers were nicely spaced out around the pool and gardens so you didn't feel like you were in a sardine can and everyday we manged to get 17 together so finding a space is not a problem. Sri Lanka is one of the best countries i have ever been to fantastic country, fantastic hotel, fantastic holiday!

We stayed 1nights with our family last year. No words to say about foods and it was fabulous. They have given us room upgrade as well. But there is Night club also when we went there there was not crowd. But we enjoyed well. I hope i would visit to this place again.

We spent 3 weeks in Sri Lanka and stayed in 12 hotels and this we ranked last at number 12. On arrival our room was not ready despite it had gone 14:00. We were told this was due to a late check out and we were made to wait at reception without any offer of a refreshment. We reserved a table for evening food and upon arriving at the reserved time the table had been given to another group. We received phone calls on both mornings waking us up. One was at 07:30 regarding some washing being ready for us despite not having any done. The laundry department were insistent it was ours and then Hung up when we told them it was not. When we tried to speak to management we had to ask three times and after 10hrs we got to speak to a manager. They heard our complaint and offered half price food for the evening as a good will gesture. The buffet was on par with other hotels and the restaurant food was very good. Unfortunately despite the managers efforts at departure time we were phoned regarding when to collect our bags. We asked for 10 minutes time which they said they could do. After 25 minutes we walked our own luggage to reception and left the hotel in the same style we arrived, little to no service. During our visit some of the facilities were shut despite the hotel supposedly being fully booked. The room was fine and clean but the communal areas looked tired and not what was expected from a 4 Star hotel. The restaurants lacked soul and character. Due to our experience I can not recommend this hotel and I would question the awards and endorsements it has. I hope that others receive better service than we did given the price. Date 16-19th Apr 17, Rm 333

We stayed at this hotel for one night (half board) as part of a tour and was lucky enough to be upgraded from a standard room to the best room in the hotel. Our room was 359 and was absolutely amazing - could not fault a thing. The room was huge was a separate lounge area, stunning bathroom with a jacuzzi, 2 vanities and walk in shower plus a very very large patio/verandah area. The hotel is located on the beach and also offered 2 pools and free wi-fi. What let the hotel down was the service in the public areas. We decided to go to the coffee lounge for coffee and cake when we arrived. Finally found a staff member where we asked for a menu which wasn't forthcoming. I eventually played a game of 20 questions and placed a coffee/cake order. It took quite a while to arrive which was surprising. I eventually realised that the 'coffee lounge' actually doesn't have a coffee machine and it was made at a bar at the other end of the hotel. Very odd. Friends of ours staying there also had the same experience albeit separately. At dinner time we had the same experience with lack of service. The staff were doing the best they could but definitely required more staff on the floor. They were extremely busy and just couldn't cope with the numbers they had. I saw one poor waiter being slammed by a Chinese customer and having to apologise profusely. There wasn't so much pressure on the staff at breakfast time but the service was still a little poor considering the numbers in the restaurant. I really wanted to give this hotel a 5 as the facilities deserved it. Unfortunately the lack of service staff prevented me from doing that.

If you're visiting Sri Lanka and want to get the tropical island experience, this is the place for you. Or if you're local and want to get away from the daily stress of life; this place is the ideal place. First thing you'll notice when entering to the hotel is its unique exotic exterior and interior architecture. And you'll find the friendliest , top notch staff catering to your every need. And if you're kind the person to enjoy the beach and waters; consider yourself entertained. Excellent food, clean rooms with wifi and all the things just to suit for your needs The whole experience I had visiting there was a spiritual one.

We stayed here for 4 nights having travelled around the southern part of the island. We stayed in a refurbished room room which was large and appealing. The patio doors opened directly on to a private patio and was about 10 paces from the second of the two swimming pools. It was a quiet hotel with access on to a beautiful, wide sandy beach. We used to walk on it as often as possible and paddle in the water which was always warm. There was no hassle from Hawkers whilst we were there and very few people were ever on the beach. The restaurant was buffet style and had a varied choice although the service in there was slow; it was oftens the case that we would be half way through our meal before we were offered a drink and even then we had one occasion where the drinks didn't arrive (I had read about slow service in previous Tripadvisor reviews). There was a family of monkeys which appeared daily around the hotel trees and would sit on the roof which everyone liked, they didn't cause any problems and provided everyone with a photo opportunity! We used the laundry service which was efficient and very cheap and also the currency exchange; this was also ok but they would not change the rupees back to sterling on the day of our departure so that is something to bear in mind as we had quite a lot that we ended up having to try and spend at the airport just to get rid of it. All in all a pleasant stay.

Trip was off to a rocky start when they assigned my parents' tour group to some rooms far away. The group was made up of 65-85 year olds and the rooms that they put them in were terrible. In order to get to the room you had to go to the second floor walk three minutes and then walk down the stairs to get to the room. There was no elevator access, which was troublesome for some of the folks and the room patios were directly next to the restaurant and there was construction happening in the spa. If you can, I would avoid rooms 101-105 and opt for an upper floor view. That being said, the next night they rectified the situation and switched the unhappy folks to different rooms. The pool view is picturesque and beautiful, and the beach access is extremely convenient from the hotel. There were hardly any people on the beach. The most redeeming quality about the hotel is the wonderfully kind and talented executive chef, Chef DJ Manjula. He checks in with the guests as you're walking around the buffet, and graciously offered to make an off-menu course: steak and mashed potatoes which was the best dish I've eaten in Sri Lanka. It's no surprise when I learned that he's a decorated chef that's won many cooking competitions. Thank you Chef Manjulla!

Just got back from what you call a weekend in Paradise ..having experienced the beautiful beach , an infinite pool , delicious cuisine and most importantly the warmth of the staff. Heritance Ahungalle is the place to be for an assured great time and attention to your individual needs.

Visited a while ago and the hotel and grounds are beautiful, right on the stunning beach. Staff were delightful. There is nothing outside the hotel apart from the local village so you have to eat in the hotel or the one beach bar. Perfect for a lazy holiday but if you want to venture out you will need a car!

The rooms were very well presented and comfortable with decent sheets and towels and overlooking a great pool. Only a short stroll from a great beach and didn't feel overcrowded. Decent food and great staff

Every so often even the mighty falter. What matters is recovery. After an impressive check-in, things went south at dinner. Inattentive service, cold food and total apathy left me wondering if this was the wrong place to spend three nights. I usually provide feedback at the end of my stay, but this bothered me enough that I penned an email to the corporate office that very evening. I did not expect a quick response. The next morning, with a fair amount of trepidation, I went for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised when a staff member approached me and apologized for the unpleasant experience the evening before. Before long another two managers stopped by to offer their apology. The balance of my stay was perfect. This property is beautiful. I was fortunate enough to get a room with an incredible view. The accommodations were comfortable and technologically up to date. The pool is huge and strategically located within 10 meters of the beach. I was on a half board plan and had the breakfast and dinner buffets during my stay. Good selection as well as taste. One of the days I ate lunch in one of the restaurants that offers a la carte service. I asked the chef to prepare lobster Sri Lankan style and it was absolutely delightful. All in all an excellent place for holiday in the Galle district.

We viaited this place back in 2013. Choose this place last minute as this place foe selected for office trip but change later. But i wanted to go this place and decided to go here. It was correct decision. They got lovely pool. Food was nice. Staff was very friendly. Once they realise that we come there for my son's second birthay they arranged a samll birthday cake. It was very thoughtful. We appriciated a lot. Nice sourrounding . Can give a 5 star without any hasitation.

Beautiful hotel, great sprawling property right on the beach. As soon as you enter the reception you are greeted by a pool and just a short distance from the pool is the beach! That''s the awesome sight that welcomes you... The beach is beautiful and pristine and few people are around, making it a wonderful place for those who do not like crowded places. The hotel staff were very helpful and hospitable. The food could have been a bit better though and the dinner buffet could do with some more options. But overall an amazing place.

I previously stayed here when it was the Triton 19 years ago. It was stunning back then ,and it's still just the perfect place to be. All of the staff our smiling ,friendly The view of the beach and sea is 2nd none. I have 3 more days left and i know i will be back.

Substantial renovated 3 story complex on the beach. Large area of beach front. Huge pools. Lovely sitting areas with natural shade. Extensive smorgasbord meals of local and western food. Choice of additional restuarants. The building Survived the tsunami with no loss of life. Very good service. Rooms large and well furnished with sea views. Aust couple on tour with Travellanka.

Me and my family were there on April 1st to 2nd. It was a great time for me after a long time. It was really worth while for us for our pay. We stayed for all 3 different buffets and all of them were varying to each. Lovely,yummy food.. My child is 2 years and 4 months old and they were covering them as well in their menu. She also enjoyed a lot.There were 2 pools and both are really good. Room also nicely set up and very luxurious.Staff is really good, polite and provided a nice service to us in all the ways. I recommend this place to anybody for a great vacation with delicious food.

Five night stay following our tour and a well appreciated rest. Rooms clean facilities good lovely setting amazing beach. Staff mostly helpful and friendly. We went on a half board basis would advise going full board as drinks and food expensive. Plenty of choice in main dining room at night but sadly lacking in atmosphere felt more like a canteen, staff not very attentive more often than not you would be left with all your Crockery on your table until you vacated it.Trying to gain the attention of the waiters/waitresses was often a challenge to try to get a drink or even a cup of coffee. Beverley Hewitt, London

It was a great one night stay. The staff was very good and service levels were excellent. Attention to detail was good. The food was very tasty. Thushara and his staff was very hospitable and always checked if we were enjoying our stay. Will certainly visit again soon.

Heritance Ahungalla is very quite hotel as it's away from the main road. I join with my company colleguess, It's easy to find your own quite space around the beautiful grounds. We played outdoor events, such as Volleyball, cricket. The pools are really nice and clean. The buffet was amazing with different curries offered every day. I enjoy the breakfast buffet since it provide lot of Sri Lankan traditional foods, such as Hopers, string hoppers, Milk Rice with Lunu Miris. I enjoy the lunch too, but my point of view Dinner wasn't that much tasty. They have delicious range of desserts and starters. The rooms are comfortable and the service was quick and awesome. Staff was friendly and efficient. I really enjoy my stay at Heritance Ahungalla. It was truly and amazing experience since I'm a beach lover.

Hotel caters for all needs. Food somewhat expensive as per many high end hotels in Sri Lanka. Look at prices and then add 25% for service charge , vat and city tax. The buffet dinner was a highlight for us and one of the best we have ever had. Chef Manjula produced a fabulous range of seafood options plus a wide variety of Sri Lankan and western dishes to suit all tastes. I love Sri Lankan dishes however the other 3 in our party not so much......we all agree it was one of the best buffets that we have experienced in our travels

We were having a short break with an extended family. Refreshing welcome drink on arrival was perfect after a long journey. My sister had a beautiful room with a balcony( some kind of a suite room) Very friendly staff in all areas of the hotel Plenty of space out side we even managed to play cricket to make our stay unforgettable

This is a traditional hotel set right on the beach with a colonial feel. We booked a deluxe double room and it was very spacious and well furnished with very comfortable beds. A good bathroom with rain shower and plenty of storage for clothes etc. The room service was excellent even on a night someone would call round asking if you needed fresh towels or a tidy up. All the staff at the hotel from the gardeners to the management were friendly and helpful smiley people. The food was very varied and excellent quality with the traditional curries which were delicious plus a variety of other foods with every taste catered for. On our last night Chef Manjula came out and offered to cook us a special dinner as it was our last dinner at the hotel. We said we would be very happy with what was on offer. My partner mentioned how good the food had been and he had especially enjoyed the prawns (which were griddled huge and succulent). When going to make his choice of dinner the Chef was stood at the griddle and gave both my Partner and myself a great plateful of beautiful prawns. After we had finished he appeared with a plate of fresh mango each to finish. He even wanted to go and get us some ice cream which we refused as we were full to bursting! The grounds to the hotel are beautiful with trees and an abundance of birds and wildlife including chippmonks and lizards also monkeys in the trees which were very amusing to watch. A lovely infinity pool and another more natural pool. It made for a very nice atmosphere as everyone wasn't crowded round the one pool and the wooden sunbeds were scattered through the gardens for a more peaceful time. I would like to mention Dennis the Pool Attendant at the quite pool. He went the extra mile to accomodate everyone. With fresh towels, matteresses, moving of sunbeds and always with a big smile. As I mentioned before, all the staff were exceptional. The beach is lovely, miles of golden sand. The sea was often rough with big breakers and a strong under-current so it is not an ideal place to swim but it was great for a splash about in the waves. All in all a brillant place to stay and I was very sad to leave.

We had our annual planning workshop @ Heritance Ahungalla and all the staff members provided us an excellent service. Food, environment and the hospitable services of the staff members made us the session very meaningful and productive. Special thanks to Shivanka from Aitken Spense head office and Gamini and Gayathri from Heritance Ahungalla.

We stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla for our honeymoon and were not disappointed. Having done our research we liked the more traditional style, location and hotel size from looking at reviews on TripAdvisor. This is a beautiful hotel, very clean with some fantastic staff. I did unfortunately injure myself while we were there but the staff were very caring and attentive. The food was very good and there was a good variety although it was unusual that not all the restaurants were included as part of the all-inclusive and wine only available at meal times. Our room was beautiful and we had a stunning view of the beach which was right on our doorstep. The only piece of criticism I would have, would be that the walkways and grounds could do with a little more manicuring between the two pools as this looked a bit untidy. All in all we had an amazing stay and I would recommend this hotel. Sri Lanka as a country is beautiful with an abundance of exotic wildlife, culture and some of the friendliest people you will ever meet. This was certainly a memorable destination for our honeymoon, different from anywhere I have ever been and we would love to go back and explore more.

I have being to many hotels in Sri Lanka, by far this is the best hotel i can recommend. Food is great and staff is friendly. Pool area & beach is great. From arrival to checkout the experience was great.

Everything about this hotel is first class. From the comfortable and stylish rooms to the great food to the warm helpful staff. Thank you to Chef Manjula who was attentive to the quality of food and opinions of diners who consistently produced excellent tasty dishes and also his lovely staff In particular Shan and Dumidu.

We were there for 11 days. It was wonderful time for us. Had some problems in room, but manager assistant Nihal helped us a lot, thanks! Very happy Heritance Ahungalla has such a good people working there. Tasty food. Very polite and smiling little girls meets you at the entrance to place of meal.))) Very beautiful nature in the hotel and around it. If wonna go some trip - try to find Amal, the great guide and our friend now) So try to be happy from the first day to the and of your vacation! We will miss you Heritance Ahungalla.

My wife and I spent the last two weeks of January here. The hotel is very nice, clean and the staff are attentive and helpful. The food in the buffet restaurant was OK.... nothing too special, but they try to cater for all tastes. We booked B&B only as we prefer not to be 'tied' to the same place for meals. However, outside the hotel, there is little choice along the beach. Only the 'sunshine bar' at the far Right as you look at the sea. The food there is simple, but very good and very reasonable. We eat at the 'Mustard' restaurant as well as the 'Fine Dining' restaurant that is within the hotel grounds. The food at both was very good, but because most of the guests were 'All Inclusive' and eat at the buffet, we dined alone in the other restaurants. I did have a bit of an issue with one of the 'room boys' though. The one we had at the start of our holiday was very attentive and made sure he told us each day that 'he was our room boy' (obviously after a tip at the end of the holiday). But he disappeared halfway through our time there. So, when we finally came to pack our bags, we gave our tip to the room boy that took over. However, as we walked with our cases to the lift, we were approached by the original room boy who made it obvious that he wanted a tip also. But we had already given our last Rupees away, so had nothing left. It was a cringingly embarrassing moment, which I didn't feel we should have been put in. I've seen comments here about the 'beach sellers' ... Our experience was nothing but good. I got friendly with a middle aged man called Pathmi, (usually wears a Red baseball cap and carries a Red Sri-Lanka tourism bag) He took me and his Nephew on a fishing trip in the mangroves. It was great. He also invited me back to his house, where his wife had cooked a 1.5kilo fish, potatoes, rice and curry sauce for lunch.... It was a real honour to go into his house as well as humbling..... So please look out for him on the beach. He's a real 'find'! If you are looking for a hotel that can provide good, clean accommodation, as well as good food and are happy to more or less stay around the hotel/beach area... this is a great place! If you are looking for a hotel, but would like to walk along the beach to find different restaurants, then look again. There's none there! (apart from 1)

We arrived at the Heritance Ahungalla at 9pm yesterday evening after a long journey from the States. We were told that the rooms we had booked and paid for were no longer available. This is a small boutique style hotel. They solution was to send us next door to a large all inclusive party resort We contacted Agoda who booked the room and failed to notify us it was cancelled. They offered a 15% discount. Big deal, we had already lost our first day of a three day visit getting bounced around and treated like a bad disease. Escalation within Agoda was requested but ignored. Instead we got an email congratulating themselves on how well they did resolving our issue. Heritance management were worse and could only blame Agoda for not telling us they would not honour a fully paid reservation. Bottom line, do not trust doing business with these two shysters.

This hotel was very nice and pleasant. The beach was remarkable and the food was very good. I will definitely come again! If there is a place that you want to have that is very peaceful where the staff treat you with respect and humility than this is it.

For the sixth time we returned to this hotel. Everytime we go to Sri Lanka we must stop here to check if the familiar, friendly atmosphere and the good food still are there. And it is, always. The Geoffrey Bawa building is in need of renovation but they are planning for that next year, good. They have alredy started with a few room but more to come. The crew take very well care of the guests and you fell comfortable all the time. Special thanks to Thushara and Gamini for spoiling us, chef Manjula for very nice food.

An amazing property, one of the few hotels that have a large buffet, spacious rooms, plenty of garden space for outdoor activities,what is significant about this hotel is, its Typical Sri Lankan hospitality!

We got married at the Heritance at the end of February and it was a fantastic stay. The hotel staff were helpful, especially Himasha in guest relations and Thilini our wedding coordinator. The wedding was simple but beautiful and just as we wanted. The hotel itself is stylish and the two rooms we had (we were upgraded after the wedding) were beautifully decorated, well equipped and relaxing. One minor thing is that housekeeping staff need to learn that if the red light is on the door they should not disturb - they had a habit of knocking to turn down the room just as we were showering for dinner every evening! The food was great - by far the best I've ever had in an all inclusive buffet style restaurant. We also ate in the fine dining restaurant twice which was also great. All in all, a stylish, relaxing resort that felt very intimate. Highly recommended.

It's wonderful place to just wander. We were very happy with the room, the service, and the restaurant. The staff was great with our 1 year old, who was equally happy exploring the grounds and pool and beach. But the thing that really blew me away was the incredible building, designed by the great Geoffrey Bawa. It really makes this hotel a destination in itself.

A longish trip from Colombo Airport was worth the journey. Although the hotel was full for part of our stay it never seemed overcrowded and there was always plenty of room around the pools, with no difficulty in finding sunbeds. We used the smaller of the two pools, the green pool, which was always quieter and the three pool boys were always very friendly and helpful. The buffet restaurant had plenty of choice for all meals although a little more western food at times would have been good. However the Head Chef and his deputy were always around and made it clear that, if you wanted anything else to eat it would not be a problem. We took them up on this offer at times and were not disappointed. There is a small 'Fine Dining' restaurant at extra cost but it was not really worth the money. The rooms are all of good size, mostly overlooking the sea, and most (but not all) have recently been refurbished. Rooms overlooking the green pool are the quietist. There is some limited evening entertainment but it is not up to much, not that it worried us at all. All the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Most of the guests tend to be British or German (but still no problem in getting sun beds !). The long sandy beach is always uncluttered and like a picture postcard - wonderful. Best to go 'all inclusive' as there are not many other restaurants/shacks about that are easy to get to.

This place is worth the stay alone for the amazing architecture! The rooms are beautiful, although the satellite connection for TV was a little spotty at best. Not a setback though as the pools and beach are enough of a distraction. The buffets serve adequate food with enough variety. Lovely stay

I spent a holiday at Heritance with my friends. Best thing in the Heritance is pool which opens to the beach. Its an amazing view and really refreshing mind. the buffet had a variety of dishes and all are tasty. But I felt that the hotel has gone down in some areas such as maintenance. The major minus point is the unclean bathrooms, ponds and entrance. Overall a very enjoyable stay. Lovely service..

The hotel gave a marvelous first apearance as we entered and saw a large swimming pool that was beautified with the view of a sandy beach shading the brilliant blue water. Everything was perfect till we approached the reception. We informed the receptionist that we made our reservation through a voucher we recieved. The receptionist firstly told to sit and wait while having the welcome drink. I dont mean to be fussy but i expected a small hi or hello. A personal note of welcome, something to the tone of. "Welcome to the heritance." "nice to meet you." What happened just seemed a quick cut off. I realized while waiting for the room key suprisingly that everyone was greeted the same way. Quick. Were they busy? I was not sure. Or maybe they must have been informed to act accordingly. After that though i must say things just kept going uphill. When i went back to the receptionist I realized she was a very nice person and not only her all those that were at the counter seemed very professional from then on. My voucher was for a standard delux room but very very kindly i was uped to a luxury room. The room was huge. two queen beds, a 50 inch TV, bathroom had a big bathtub with a seperate cieling shower. My bags were brought up to my room. A man whom i think was named Dinesh/ Danesh was warm and exceptionally proficent throughout the trip aquanted himself to us as we entered the room. Then ofcourse the beach was beautifu,l the buffets were really good. lunch, dinner and breakfast. The A'la carte menu was not so impressive and the food compared to the buffet was not exceptional infact the chicken asparagous soup was not of a 5 star hotel standard. Overall I would definitely come here again and again and I thoroughly enjoyed myself. They have a lot of activities that can be done on their premises ranging from Tennis, badminton, volleyball, table tennis, ofcourse a gym and did I mention they have two large swimming pools. I might have missed a few. This was just in the top of my head March was a good time to go and if you stuck with me and patiently read the whole review. Then there's nothing more to do but book your tickets, pack your bags and go for it.

Decided to spend a holiday at Heritance with my family and friends, based on the excellent experience I had there during a corporate get away. Although I felt that the hotel has gone down in some areas such as maintenance and room quality, it was still a very enjoyable experience. The pluses: Spacious rooms. Excellent F&B. The fresh salmon starter for lunch was one of the best I've had in SL in a long time. The buffet for dinner and b'fast had a variety of dishes and the beli juice was a lovely surprise. Great facilities. The main pool opens up to the beach. We enjoyed the second pool that some what hidden away, and looks like a natural pond with the over hanging trees. The minus points- The bathroom was rather cramped. Some of the furniture and equipment could use refurbishment/replacing. Overall a very enjoyable stay. Lovely service and F&B.

A classic Geoffrey Bawa designed hotel, low rise, on a beautiful beach, with plenty of space to relax. Gradually being refurbished, it's main strength is the quality of the well trained and charming staff, who looked immaculate at all times. It never felt busy even when full. Ahungalla is on the west of the island, about one hour north of Galle, and 20 minutes south of Bentota. Two hour transfer from the airport by taxi. We opted for the 'All Inclusive' package, which we felt was good value. We are pleased we did as the dining options outside of the hotel are limited if you are staying for a couple of weeks. The main restaurant is buffet style, but with a full team of chefs constantly cooking fresh dishes. Mostly local (spicy) dishes, but with plenty of European style dishes. The food we would describe as 'very good'. Breakfast good. There is also a 'fine dining' restaurant where we ate twice, but as guests of the hotel. All inclusive drinks are somewhat restricted in choice, but suited us fine. Wine only available in the restaurant, and only by the glass. This is not a hotel that encourages over indulgence, and that, for us, is a good thing. If you want 'wholesale drinking' (as it was described to us!) go to the Riu next door. The hotel is gradually being refurbished, we were allocated a refurbished 'Luxury' room, which was very comfortable and large (almost 600sq ft). Wifi (free) in the hotel was very good, extending to all areas, right out to the beach. The beach itself is a few km long, beautiful, and pretty much deserted. The current, however, is very strong, and it's not ideal for sea swimming, although if you walk to the southern end of the beach it's fine. All in all, a rather nice hotel, and we enjoyed our two week stay

Whenever,we plan for a trip to relax,and enjoy with the family,the only place that comes to the head is,Heritance Ahungalla,for the magnificent view at the entrance,the service that CANNOT be MATCHED and of course the great taste of the food.Their way of entertaining the guests are simply remarkable.the lovely music after dinner at the lobby area with the breathtaking view of the ocean and the pool,and the dance acts of their staff give us the relaxation of a lifetime.we would sincerely like to thank Mr.Thushara,(the restaurant manager) and the staff for the splendid service offered as usual.A very special thank you for Mr.Thushara for making our stay wonderful, everytime.Thank you so much.

Located right off a huge stretch of private and almost deserted beach. The resort is very quiet and chill which is an amazing, relaxed end to our Sri Lankan trip. We were even upgraded to a suite with a nice view of the ocean. Breakfast and dinner spread is huge - they have themed nights so guests will not get tired of the same food every night. Most of all, the staff are very nice and friendly - the birthday cake they got me was a nice touch! Thank you Heritance team!

Probably the best restaurant in Ahungalla. The waiter is very polite, efficient and superb service. As I live in the area I will definitely come have dinner again. For travelers I recomend that you at least one time have lunch or dinner at this hotel. The pool is also good.

Excellent location and beach. Hotel is a fantastic design. Great food and the majority of the staff are really friendly. Unfortunately however, although the management have repeated on a number of occasions that the renovations have been completed, they are far from complete. We did have a look at some of the rooms that had been renovated and they looked excellent. Unfortunately, we weren't in one of these, our room was extremely dated, the cleaning was not done to a very high standard and we don't think the balcony had ever been cleaned! We used the pool furthest from reception which was excellent, with well-kept lawns. The major problem here is that there are only 8 umbrellas, unless you want to sit under the trees, we we didn't. I always sit under an umbrella and my wife always sits in the the sun but the problem is that the pool boy reserves the beds/umbrella's for those that have tipped him previously which then involved us having to have an argument with him most mornings to get a place with an umbrella - on some days there were 2 or 3 umbrella's/sun chairs that he had reserved but there weren't used all day as the guests must have gone out for the day, but he wouldn't let anyone sit on them! The main pool at reception area is excellent although the surrounding lawn areas are extremely scruffy. Overall had an enjoyable holiday and stay at this hotel but the room we stayed in wasn't up to standard. Stayed first 2 weeks in Feb 2017.

Large hotel well off the main road on a fairly small beach. Beautiful pool area, good breakfast although the stations were widely spread out. Excellent service by housekeeping staff. All were helpful and friendly. Beach was clean.

The location on the beach is great, calm and scenic, close to the water. The hotel pool area is good and quite high level of service around the pool. Some days the pool area was not so quite that we had expected. Layout of the hotel is fine but it need some updating and I understand it will take place in April this year. Communication among staff was non existing, service quite low if you rate yourself as a 5 star hotel, which it is not compared to international standard. The food did not live up to a 5 star hotel standard, medium quality to quite high rates. Breakfast was rather chaotic and serice level among staff low. It seemed as staff wanted to delivery a good service but did not know how. Only on the very last day they checked in and ask how it was and if we were satisfied. Shops in the hotel area were very boring and expensive and far from 5 star hotel standard, recommend to either close or improve a lot. Wil go back to Sri Lanka but will chose antoher place to stay.

The staff are so friendly, comfy rooms, superb pools, lovely beach and overall its a great hotel in a nice environment. The food was not that great and very less dessert varieties. The washroom in the day room has transparent glasses and broken mat curtains so it was quite uncomfortable with friends in the room. So we had to use the washroom with the lights off..

hotel is well designed , the public areas open onto the beach fronting the Indian Ocean. Staff were friendly and attentive . Choice of food was excellent . Overall , a memorable stay â€¦. wish it could have been longer .

We were staying at the RIU next door but as they could not do anything special for our silver wedding anniversary the Reps from our hotel organised for us to have a meal at this hotel on the beach it was AMAZING it did cots about Â£200 but was so very worth it and made our special day even more memorable. thank you Heritance hotel

I booked myself in for a week to relax and this place didn't disappoint. This place is huge, rooms are clean and large. The service is excellent. The grounds are the perfect place to relax - 2 pools, both very clean and it's easy to get a comfy sun lounger. The food was very nice and cuisines ranged from local Sri Lankan to international including european and chinese. I'd recommend this to anyone who wants to visit Sri Lanka.

We had a great time. Perfect location. Beautiful beach. Good food with lot of variety. Helpful efficient staff. Spacious clean rooms. Two big pools. What more do you want when you are on holiday.......

My mum and me stayed for 2 weeks in the hotel and had such a wonderful time we will definitely never forget. Everything was just perfect.. the food amazing delicious, the rooms perfect clean and most of all the staff were fantastic. Very lovely caring and friendly.. you never had to ask for someting as they somehow knew what you needed:) very warm thanks especially to sandali and jagath who just know how to make a great service.. we miss the lovely smalltalks with you.. another thanks to indrajith our housekeeper who made a great job and had a feeling for details and lovely decorations:) thanks to the whole staff, please keep it up! We will sure be back and miss you a lot. Greetings from Germany and Switzerland;)

My wife has Coeliac (celiac) disease and is unable to eat any food with gluten in it. We made this known to the hotel when we arrived and we were soon put in contact with the member of staff with overall responsibility for the bars and restaurants. He was knowledgeable, fully aware of the disease (as were all the senior staff and chefs) and informed the member of staff in charge of the restaurant we would use (Dayal) of our needs. We could not have had a better service from the staff, we were met as soon as we went into the buffet restaurant and a chef took us through what was suitable for my wife to eat. They also cooked food specially for her e.g. grilled prawns or fish if they were being prepared in batter, a chicken curry, at lunchtime if we had chips they were cooked in fresh oil, gluten free bread baked freshly at breakfast and in the evening. The chefs went out of their way to be helpful and I understand the hotel is going to expand the number of gluten free dishes they regularly offer, including more sweets. All the local curries on offer are GF and we ate those regularly - they were excellent and each evening there were new ones to try. I can't emphasise enough how well we were looked after by the staff. The hotel was opened in 1981, designed by Geoffrey Bawa, the most famous Sri Lanka architect. It is a most interesting building built in the colonial style with many period features. It is well worth spending some time looking round and appreciating the many detailed touches that make the hotel different from many modern white soulless hotels that seem to be springing up everywhere. The pools are excellent and the view from the main lobby is stunning. It is next to the sea but shielded from view by palm trees so it is only glimpsed as you walk down the beautiful beach. There are many naturally shady areas in the grassed grounds and plenty of sunbeds. The hotel has 150 rooms and they are being modernised without losing their period charm. We stayed for 2 weeks and although the hotel was often full in the evenings there was never too many people around the pools probably because some groups only stayed overnight. By adjusting eating times is was easy to avoid the busiest times in the restaurants and they continually refreshed the food so late arrivals weren't having leftovers. I would advise people to have a minimum of half board (which we had) because the hotel is isolated. There are a few shops by the entrance but there didn't seem to be many places to eat outside the hotel. Prices. Beer 650ml and cocktails were about Â£4 each. Soft drinks less. Wine in the restaurant was expensive, over Â£30 a bottle but they will keep an opened bottle for you. Lunchtime snacks; fish and chips or burger and chips about Â£4 On all inclusive you only have free wine with a meal and some soft drinks appeared to be randomly chargeable, otherwise all is included as far as I could tell. All the staff were friendly, helpful and conscientious. They have a cashier where you can change currency and get a supply of 50 and 100 notes for tipping.

Efficient Staff . Especially The Most friendly and helpful GRE ever "Thilini Tennakoon". Everything about the hotel was Exceptional. I was very pleased with my stay, And I hope to be back for a longer visit in the future.

We had 4 nights here at the end of a tour and it was by far the worst of the hotels we had stayed at. No problem with the room (though our friends managed to get their room booked out whilst they were in it!) but the service on two nights in the Coffee Shop and the Upper Dining was VERY slow. Added to this was the meat when it arrived after 90 minutes (!) in our meal at the Upper (Fine) Dining was overcooked in part and a lump of fat for the duck! This was very disappointing as we had been introduced to the company's head chef at a previous hotel. The Jade restaurant (buffet) was good both for dinner and breakfast though.

I took Mum to Sri Lanka arriving on boxing day and leaving on 15 January. The hotel is situated on a lovely beach and you can go in the sea but it is advised not to go swimming as the undercurrent is very strong. If you walk to the north of the beach near the White Villa Resort, the sea is a little calmer and you can have a great sundowner on the beach at Berty's Sunshine Restaurant! The hotel has two great pools - one is for residents only and was our preferred area for most of the time that we were there. The staff at Ahungalla Residence are lovely, very dedicated and try to assist with any query - they are without doubt the hotels's greatest asset. Although all were great, we would like to thank in particular: Gayathri - restaurant and bar at resident's pool - such a lovely lady, Dumido at the restaurant - very kind and attentive, Gussup at the resident's bar and pool - such a lovely man, Nirosh in the main poolside bar - so helpful and always smiling and of course the lovely Sarath who organised sun beds every day with no complaint and always very efficient!!! We were at the hotel for New Year and the effort made by the staff was enormous. There was very good entertainment organised despite very heavy rainfall in the days prior to New Year (they were building a boat for the festivities) and the atmosphere on the night was perfect. The Chef (Mr Manzulo) and his catering team in particular excelled themselves with a buffet fit for royalty with ice sculptures and the most delicate cakes and puddings decorated beautifully. I would definitely go to this hotel again for New Year. The food was very good throughout our stay and there is always Sri Lankan food available, which was always excellent. If you ask for items at the bar that are included in your all inclusive package, you still have to sign for them, which can become a little tedious but I am sure they have their reasons - just check the bills though as we were presented invoices for many drinks that we had not ordered at all!! The northern part of the hotel has been painted and refurbished and is around the residents pool - this is a very relaxing part of the hotel. We stayed in rooms above the kitchen and although they were acceptable, the trolleys going up and down could wake you up (perhaps they could use trolleys with better wheels to eliminate noise?). We stayed at the hotel for 3 weeks and they told us that we could change rooms but in the end we did not. However, if we stayed again we would prefer rooms around the residents pool - I know some people prefer the rooms at the south and so it probably depends on the preference of each guest. We had no complaints about the inside of the rooms in any case. The paving slabs near the poolside bar do need some attention as they are uneven - we tripped on these and saw so many other people tripping (this was a worry for Mum). Having said this, most of the hotel is well cared for and maintained. There is one point to mention that actually is not the hotel's direct fault though I believe they should be aware of it.There is a very aggressive tour seller on the beach who seems to target this hotel and he can be relentless with his pursuit of guests. We experienced this ourselves and also were aware that other guests were finding this was making their stay less pleasurable than it otherwise would have been. We went on one tour with him at the beginning of our stay to the rain forest but found him and his partner to be unprofessional (taking us to places that belonged to their family with no prior warning of turning off track, stopping on route with no explanation to do their own business, more expensive than other tour operators etc). So we decided not to use him again. However, he continued to harass and it was even impossible to walk along the beach without him following at one point, which made Mum who is 74 very uneasy. He even asked another guest to approach us while we sunbathing at the residents pool to ask us if we wanted to go on a river trip. We and this guest thought this was very strange in a luxury hotel! We used tour operators at Berty's Sunshine bar and we found them most professional and we actually extended our stay in Sri Lanka for a tour through Yala and Candy with them. Just before we left, the beach tour operator challenged us on the beach and told us that he was most disappointed in our decision to use Sunshine as they were more expensive than others. We told him that we liked them very much and that in fact they were cheaper than him. Mum and I have travelled the world together and appreciate that people need to make a living and we try to always support the local population. So I mention this only because if Mum had come here on her own, I am certain that this would have made her go home early and certainly she would not have returned. She told me that she felt threatened and found this particular man to be "predatory". We know that many Sri Lankans can be very direct but this is a great shame as we visited many other beaches, towns, villages, cities in Sri Lanka and did not have any similar problems whatsoever - it is of concern that some people employed by the hotel are recommending using this tour operator. We certainly do not and this type of attitude is not helping this hotel at all!! Having said this, do not be put off going here - from what we saw in Sri Lanka, this is a very, very good hotel but do not be intimidated by the beach tour seller!!!

The hotel staff was very friendly. We were there for learn about the hotel back operations. It's a valuable opportunity to learn about the hotel. The view from the entrence. The enviroment inside the hotel and around the hotel rooms are so calming and quiet. The food, it was nicely presented, and very tasty.

Great service. I can feel the people smiling when they do service to a guest. F&B Executive Mr Janatha. Learned a lot from him about the hotel. Food was delicious at the bufe. Learned to grill Kebab. Bufe service was great.

Arrived at the Heritance Ahungalla at 2.00am in the morning after a 10.5 hour flight from Gatwick and a 2 hour coach transfer from airport. Absolutely tired out. We had booked 2 double rooms and 2 single rooms through Thomson's I had had problems regarding the wrong names in the wrong rooms and couldn't get it sorted through their call centre. When we went to check in they had only three rooms with a little bit of stern talk they sorted it. I believe the problem lies with Thomson's Their airport Rep was with us but did absolutely nothing to help. After that the Holiday was superb. The Hotel has the most friendly of staff Especially Himasha. The Buffet food is excellent with a vast variety of cuisines from English through Italian to Chinese and Asian. One tip! every one advises not to swim in the sea. as there are strong under currents safe enough to paddle but even then you can feel the under current drawing you out. However the 2 Hotel pools are beautiful and so swimming is no problem. I should give this hotel a rating of 5 but the problem at check in forces me to drop a star sorry.

Its a good hotel, slightly old, rooms are good, but bathrooms could be better. They follow and earthy feel so there r no tiles in the bathrooms and are very small. Its good to get a ground floor room which is closer to the beavh and pool. The food is amazing. Theybhave great variety of sea food and the flavoursvare great

We visited this place for our annual business meeting. Ideal place for a get away and it is 2 hours drive from colombo. There is a vast Swiming pool where you can play water games. Excellent and delicious food.

The service throughout was first class for the whole 3 weeks of our holiday. The staff are honest, attentive and considerate. The room was very clean, comfortable with private balcony. 2 pools with sunbeds and sandy beach right in front of the hotel. The food was delicious and different every night with a buffet of Sri Lankan curries and western dishes and an excellent pudding buffet! Special mention to the following staff: Gayathri for excellent restaurant management skills, Saman for perfect housekeeping, Waiters, Jayal, Nihal and Petal, the Hopper Chefs, Himasha in the lobby, perfect hostess, and the most honest laundry staff ever! Thank you all at the Heritance for a wonderful holiday one which we intend to repeat soon!

Firstly, the hotel is GORGEOUS! Gorgeous pool, gorgeous beach. Local food at the buffet breakfast was simply out of this world. Staff were exceptionally friendly, helpful, kind and nice. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here thanks to the staff, the amazing food, the location and the wonderful hotel. Highly recommended. Can't wait to come back. Thank you

We had the most wonderful stay at this beautiful hotel which I cannot recommend enough. Our room was fabulous- clean and spacious with all of the amenities one may require for a holiday away. The hotel itself is beautiful, the pool is outstanding and the views out to sea are breath taking. The food provided was varied throughout our stay and the kitchen staff even asked daily if there was anything additional we would like as they would do their best to prepare it. We went on several trips which were amazing. Firstly we attended the nearby water safari, we arranged this through the TukTuk providers on the beach and were not disappointed by the experience. Not only do you see varying types of landscapes and animals but you also get to see Temples and local crafts such as Cinnamon production. We also visited the Elephants at the National park safari. This trip was absolutely outstanding however; please bear in mind that it takes roughly 4 hours to get to the park. Sri Lanka is a beautiful place and this was truly a remarkable hotel. We would definitely return.

Walked to this hotel from the Riu down the road and found an amazing colonial style building with astonishing grounds, where we came across a rather large Monitor Lizard, and beautiful beach front. We enjoyed an ice cold bottle of Lion Beer while sitting in the shade by the large swimming pool surrounded by fig trees. A fantastic way to spend an hour away from our hotel. Would look into staying here but might be put off by the price because the two beers cost us 1,300 Rs, which seemed a bit steep given the cost of living in Sri Lanka.

Dear Team Heritance, I would like to take this opportunity to thank you and your staff for the wonderful evening we enjoyed our Kaspersky Southern Regional Meet 2017. Your staff were real credit to you - very attentive, polite and everything ran very smoothly. The function hall was a perfect size for the number of guests and the tables were beautifully set out on the beach. Your kitchen staff served the meal very efficiently, and it was absolutely delicious. I am getting very positive feedback about the whole evening and I wish you all the very best for the future.

My Mum and I stayed in a sea view twin room with balcony. Lovely sized room with wonderful views, as anticipated. The hotel was at full capacity but you would never had known. Beautiful gardens and grounds were well cared for and spacious offering opportunity to relax in one of two pool areas without a busy atmosphere. Staff couldn't do enough for you and the food and services were great. Only downside that I could say was that the cocktail menu for all inclusive was not very extensive and mini bar in room was an additional cost, even tough we only had soft drinks. This was a little unexpected.

This is a great hotel in many ways. It is a Bawa design so the actual structure and lay out of the resort is outstanding. The rooms are well appointed with great showers. But for the price and the history of the place I thought the resort could have been better. 1) The resort falls down in comparison to other world class hotels in the details. For example, every room is given a fruit basket designed to resemble a traditional Sri Lankan out rigger. This is a great touch but the problem is that the boat basket was quite broken and falling apart. It should have been replaced long ago. There are examples of this where a good idea is not quite executed correctly. Another example was the intrusion of more conventional resorts into the appearance of this heritage building: in the bar area upstairs there was a Red Bull fridge displayed quite prominently. Does anyone truly think Bawa would have approved of such a thing? Of course not. It disrupts the entire point of a place built by Bawa and damages the aesthetic. The managers should be aware of this. 2) The food was okay but was a mass produced buffet designed to accommodate a large number of people. This led to the food becoming pretty routine after a few days. We also found that it was difficult to get the attention of staff and I found they were not very attentive. Sometimes we had to ask twice for something simple like water. My feeling was that they were very understaffed. 3) A big issue for me was the mattresses. I have some muscular skeletal problems so sleeping on a hard bed is not good for me. But the beds at Ahungalla were very hard. In general I cannot understand why they would not get medium softness beds to accomodate everyone's needs. These may seem like small details, but for the price, for the fact it is a 5 star hotel, and because of its history and heritage, I think the place could do better. Having said that, it is certainly a considerable step up from the majority of large resorts on the SL coast.

This hotel has clearly seen better days. It seems a bit dated now. I believe that this was one of Geoffrey Bawa's earliest hotels. It is not without charm though. Rooms were quite spacious and the bathrooms were pretty functional. Buffet breakfast and dinner did not disappoint. This can be an useful base to visit other areas close by.

My wife and I had a two week holiday here in December. Weather was good and we did trips to Yala National Park (4 hours by car) and Kandy (4 hours by car). I list below the positives and the negatives of our holiday. Positives : Good food in restaurant buffet with a different daily menu. Friendly and generally helpful staff throughout the hotel. Excellent sea view from our first floor bedroom balcony. Excellent sea front location offering lovely beach walks. Two very large and spacious swimming pools kept clean. Room very clean and some wonderful animal shaped towels kept us amused. International plug sockets, always a help. Good size balcony. Much needed cold drinks upon arrival. Clean sheets and towels daily. Large 50" TV in bedroom. (A negative for us as we don't watch TV but probably a positive for others). Plenty of colourful bird life in the hotel grounds. And so to the negatives. No Jacuzzi for our entire stay. When we enquired we were told they were waiting for a part but by the time we left the Jacuzzi was looking very grubby with gathered dropped leaves and rainwater. Alcoholic drinks were expensive particularly a small glass of wine with dinner. Costly alcoholic drinks turned up very quickly at dinner but not the free water. On several occasions I had to ask three times for water. Lack of local railway train information at reception. No postcards sold at the hotel. We had air conditioning problems in our room which took a while to resolve. The plug in the wash basin didn't operate properly. No curtain in the bathroom for the first three days of our stay. Wobbly fan on the ceiling (maybe it was meant to be like that !). Wobbly bedside table definitely shouldn't be like that. Nowhere to walk to / have a coffee/beer/snack out the front of the hotel (busy road). That's even if you manage to get past the tour guides who hover by the hotel gates. Lack of lighting at night between the hotel front and the hotel gates. Insufficient staff in the restaurant when busy. This was particularly noticeable at weekends. Noisy building work being carried out on one wing of the hotel during the day. Some of these points might seem petty but added together it wasn't the holiday my wife and I had hoped for. Would definitely recommend Yala National Park. A visit to a Turtle hatchery. The Botanical gardens at Kandy. The fort at Galle .

A Excellent resort overall, very good service, food. Beautiful swimming pool and beach, me and my wife stayed in December. Though you cant swim here coz of high wave and rip current. Best to swing is Hikkadua and Bentota beach. Tour desk very helpful to arrange day trips to Bentota, Hikkadua, Galle, Unawatana. If we get scope we will surely stay there again.

The hotel environment is very nice. Our room is very big & has direct access to the pools & the ocean. Food is ok. Yet, very disappointed that the bedsheet & pillow case are dirty .... and somewhat disgusting.

A lovely setting for the hotel with the view across the foyer especially at sunset being spectacular. The hotel itself is a bit tired, and the front counter reception staff need a good talking to as they are too laid back and careless. On the other hand the staff in the dining room, bars and housekeeping are superb. In typical Sri Lankan style they cannot do enough for you with their service, attention to detail and genuine friendliness. And the food? Is absolutely divine. We had Sri Lankan food morning noon and night, and could not get enough of it. But for those who want it - there are plenty of opportunities for Western food as well.

We stayed for 7 days on an all inclusive basis. After a 9 hour flight and 2.5 hour transfer we arrived travel weary and thirsty in a group of 8 couples. The reception team didn't seem to be prepared for our arrival even though we were later than expected and it took 45 minutes before we got our room keys and 20 minutes before we were given a welcome drink. Our room was beautiful, a good size with a view over the gardens and a sea glimpse. The all inclusive meals were served in a large dining room on a buffet basis. The food was beautifully presented fresh with lots of fruit salads and vegetables and typically Sri Lanka very tasty. The staff were delightfully attentive especially after a couple of days and they got to know us, very friendly and always smiling from the guy who cleaned our room and the gardeners to the pool attendants and the bar and dining staff. A little more information on the All inclusive facilities would have been very useful. There was another restaurant on the site in addition to 3 lovely bars, but during the week that we were there we didn't see the restaurant being used, I believe that the menu offered 15 0/0 of the prices for all inclusive clients, I think that a nice gesture would have been to offer all inclusive customers one night during their stay to eat in the al a carte restaurant maybe at a fee of say Â£20 per head. This would have made a nice change from the buffet restaurant. Just a short distance from the hotels there is a turtle hatchery, and rescue sanctuary. On the way to which (by tuk tuk) we passed a tree full of enormous fruit bats, both these were well worth a visit. Walking along the beach to the right are a couple of beach restaurant bars good prices and an excellent place to watch the gorgeous sunsets. All in all a wonderful experience.

Buying buffet tickets were as though lunch was freeLaid back service. food prices way too much compared to other hotels in this area. We had lunch buffeut and it was not at all good. It does not justify charges.

The location: Pleasant drive from Colombo.Beautiful , tranquil entrance. But the feeling did not last so long as it was a pain to check in. So many forms to fill and signatures, 4 separate ID documents for the 4 rooms. I would suggest the guest relation takes care of the forms instead of requesting the guest to fill it.Different ID docs per room, different signatures!!!! Absolutely ZERO CHILL!!! The rooms :Drab & dated in stark contrast to fond memories i had, visiting this establishment few years ago The food:Good variety , delicious & living up to Heritance standards Service: There were a few attentive staff.But had some bad experiences. My mother had a cramp (after swimming in that gorgeous pool) and requested some warm salt water brought in late night(10pm) .It took more than 30 mins for it to arrive .I wonder how long it would have taken to get a meal to a room. Dogded that bullet!! I feel like the new property next door must have poached best service personnel from here.

This is one of the best places i have stayed at to date. I was ushered straight to my Beautiful room after a nice welcome drink and an ice cold towel to clean my face. I can't say enough how helpful and friendly the staff have been, its a nice feeling when everybody is happy and smiling around you even the security guards had big warm smiles on there faces! Restaurant was excellent , great variety and very high standard buffet- delicious sri lankan curries with all the trimmings had me everyday! The staff in the restaurant have been great and i would personally like to thank them for making it such a lovely experience.

Stayed 2 nights. Nice Hotel and the food and bar area is great. Nice activities in the hotel with cultural shows etc. Service is great, and the staff is helpful. Check in takes a bit of time, but it is normal for SL.

We loved our stay here. We booked direct through Booking.com and arrived to a stunningly landscaped hotel. However our room was dark and the standard was below that we had experienced at other Heritance hotels in Sri Lanka. The dining room equally was dark and the morning buffet compromised quality for quantity. We asked to see the GM, explained using pictures from the rooms and talked about the catering. Specifically we mentioned the very undercooked bacon. The GM and his staff could then not have done more to turn things around. We were moved to outstanding corner rooms, were treated to an evening Russian Christmas celebration (lobster and fireworks) on the beach and came down to breakfast the next day to fresh orange juice, excellent service and a chef whose responsibility was to deliver crispy bacon. The GM and his senior team came over and checked on our satisfaction during the day. We understand that there will be an extensive renovation programme starting in April including a renewed dining room and improved rooms. Once done, and with this management team who listen and respond to feedback, this hotel will be an even more superb place to stay.

Very nice hotel, beautiful beach with less people, friendly men and women at the service (young girl Himasha is so nice), delicious food, sri Lanka is such a nice island, I will come back, thats for sure

I've only checked in but so far my experience is terrible. Booking and check in process was thoroughly disorganized and apathetic. Location and hotel are beautiful though so I hope the trip proves from here.

Had a marvellous time here, after an intense 5 day sightseeing tour of Sri Lanka it was just what we needed. The rooms are fabulous, the staff are courteous (it's a Sri Lankan trait) and the range of services etc are excellent. Two big pools, rarely very crowded, and a lovely sandy beach a few yards beyond the pool.

We had a family holiday here in October. We were really impressed with the attentive and personalised service. I had the impression this was something to do the with hotel culture itself as all staff responded with interest and care. There was a mishap with our booking which the reception manager handled so well which compensated for any inconvenience. I have been in such situations before which leaves you feeling irritated. however there was a distinct (positive) difference in the quality of customer service here which makes customers feel valued. the Food is super!! great location and beach front and Bawa's architecture does have it's charm!

I love my room so much. It is so beautiful and comfortable. The swimming pools are also beautiful. The food in the buffet is delicious. The staff are so gentle and polite. I wish I could have more time there.

I was there on Christmas Eve, 2016 and the resort was well decorated, As you enter the building, you get the horizon view with swimming pool first, soft sand second and limitless sea, without any obstruction. For Christmas Eve, a live band was performing and they had huge variety of cakes and patisseries. Band was playing good and when people hit the floor to dance, it played some rock tracks. The resort also attempts to give you extra other than sun, sand and sea by having a foosball table, pool table and carrom. For swimming pool, they also give you volley ball and rugby to play with. They have good facility and numerous poolside benches to relax. Improvements: Over all, the resort provides you with all the luxuries, however, there is a room for improvements as well. First, the resort is very less decorated as compared to the era of resorts in trend. Second, the resort shall attempt to organise games and other activities to keep the tourists engaged. Third, though the resort always had huge menu, the taste can be improved.

We had 5 nights at this hotel - our start wasn't great after travelling all day to arrive to issues with check in and delays to get to our rooms - not ideal with three small children. But the staff made up for the error by delivering a wine with apologies later. Staff were fantastic at breakfast and dinner - special mention to our amazing chef who took great care of my family catering for their food requirements. Buffet was excellent - lots of choice. Rooms very clean. Poolside staff amazing also especially entertaining the children with games of cricket and water polo. Not cheap by any means to stay here. Hotel is in need of capital funds injection - gym facilities and hotel aging - needs up keep to be 5 star quality. Lovely stay

I used to visit this lovely place with my family many times. Every time we were taken cared and offered us the best hospitality in the southern region. I must say food is absolutely wonderful with so much to choose. In deed it is delicious. Rooms are spacious and top clean. Special thanks to Mr. Janaka for the lovely bed deco. Restaurant is at its best service. Altogether me and my family had a lovely time on Christmas Eve. Santa's arrival on a turtle gave a totally different and surprise experience Thank you all for the most amazing time in this Christmas.

My family and friends loved the beach, the swimming pool and the long walks; one of which took us to a rocky area with a fort like construction. The service was great and they had a good food spread. The head chef prepared specific dishes to suit our palates (and allergies). The spa was a tad pricey, but one should expect this! The water Zumba was a super hit. A definite must visit.

We were part of a 4 family group on a holiday to Sri Lanka. We spent 2 nights here. Amazing property, great view, nice pool. Overall a great experience. However, as a vegetarian, I found the food scene a bit disappointing. Apparently it is a sea food lovers paradise. Kid friendly place. They have pool tables, a library, carton board etc. Plan to do nothing but eat , swim, vegetate and chill. Take a stroll on the beautiful beach, play beach volleyball. Don't miss to take a walk to the nearby private property/resort. They have a small rock beach with amazing views.

So i stayed here in november 2016 what a great hotel staff very friendly and the room was beautifull. I would recomend this hotel for people wanting a quite and relaxing holiday. Be Warned you will need to get some pure cinimmon oil to fend off the mosquito's as the unusual sparys dont work. my only complaint is that due to this hotel only having 180 rooms there is not the best choice of food in the buffet resturant. But you can get al-carte food at the other 2 resturants in the hotel it cost me about Â£40 for me and the wife for a 3 course meal. I will definitey be returning to this hotel in a couple of years

As a couple, we stayed here for 4 nights and we absolutely loved it. Yes the rooms are a bit outdated but it has character and the staff are so lovely. Customer service is the most important thing to me and they exceeded in that. The hotel is right by the beach and has two large pools. There is also a game room with pool tables and other games. We don't have kids but the kids play centre could be improved. The food stations in the buffet are fantastic - great variety and delicious. I went to hotel riu next door and this hotel is much nicer and more relaxing. I've also stayed at Heritance Kandalama and had a similar great experience. Thank you to all the staff who made our experience wonderful. Would definitely recommend this and would stay here again.

Returned after 10 years and found the place to be just as amazing as I remembered. What I didn't expect was the care and kindness from the staff. I was sent a surprise birthday cake after dinner! But i was moved by the assistance provided to us when my 4yo daughter slipped and fell near the pool just before checking out. Family members left in the hotel, while we were at the hospital, were looked after well. The staff were kind enough to arrange a special meal for us as we were not back till hours after the buffet lunch was over.

Our family stayed two nights from 23.12.2016. Prompt check-in and fully escorted from reception to the guestrooms. Nice place to chill and relax by the pool and beach. Spacious room and comfortable bed; however, interior looks dated. It appears that some rooms are newly renovated while some are dated.
