As for housekeeping, again we observed inconsistencies as with other hotels we stayed in throughout our trip. Restaurant staff are courteous and register good memory of guests. Food was good. Spa masseuses from Bali were good. Kudos for the well-organized Christmas Eve party! It was a memorable time for my family...surprising entrance by Santa, and fireworks at midnight!

This hotel is about a 2-hour car ride from the airport. You will be warmly welcomed with a drink etc. but the check-in takes a little longer than desired. Best to confirm details with the hotel and ensure your room is ready. Also, as itâ€™s a busy holiday period the rooms were overbooked to begin with. This hotel is rated as a 5* hotel. Sometimes, the service took awhile via housekeeping and a few calls to clarify were necessary. The amenities/ toiletries were less than average, so pack something of quality for yourself. The views are 6* and the 2 pools are just fantastic, also worthy of 6* stars, they were clean and they overlook the beach. Note: fairly deep pools for non-swimmers, a shallow end but not for toddlers, it gets deep quickly! The breakfast and dinners are of 5* quality. A special mention to Chef Manjula who gave the 5 children the extra special service. Staff are friendly and happy to help. Sometimes language miscommunication - misinterpretation occurs so double-check requests. The rooms were clean but to be frank this hotel is dated in parts and could use a capital injection to make the place sparkle. Iâ€™m traveling with cousins but usually travel solo. As a solo I would be reluctant to be here because patrons donâ€™t tend to mingle as they do in smaller boutique hotels. However, if youâ€™re seeking downtime (alone time) then itâ€™s a great place. Would I recommend this hotel? Yes, for the pools, food and views but equally there are other hotels that would compare easily. I didnâ€™t go to the spa but my family members said it was â€˜goodâ€™ (hotel prices). Cocktails reasonably priced. Service/Tax charges are high in SL. The check-out was efficient. The hotel has three floors, some views from some rooms are brilliant, facing the beach or gardens. Good luck, I hope this review was helpful.

Just return from a week in Herritance Ahungala. The hotel is amazing with its infinity pool facing towards the ocean. Plenty of sunbeds, beautiful beach. Maybe the rooms needs to be renovated but that is no important, the most important are the people, with their heart on hands just to make your stay perfect. They are not a staff they are a heritance family and try to do everything that you become also a part of their family. Food prepared by Chef Manjula is just delishes. Beginning from European cuisine ending on real taste of Sri Lanka. Grilled lobster, crab curry, dhal, egg hooper are to die for. The food was the best I have been eaten in the all-inclusive hotel. Must say that in many good restaurant you will not eat better. Chef Manjula, who I have had chance to meet personally gave me is even his secret recipe for dhal. I have seen some negative comments about the rooms, food, cleaning- so if you look for a just the hotel (good drinks, animation, standard hotel food) do not go there but if you want to feel the soul of Sri Lanka is the place for you.

The staff were very courteous. Especially the staff at the restaurant including the managers, were very helpfill. The pool was well maintained. The rooms were very comfortable. The food and ambience excellent. Overall it is an excellent place to stay.

This is my third time in Heritance, and every time I get there I am stressed out but by the time I leave I am happy and relaxed. The hotel is rustic and very chilled out. Highly recommended for a break.

First of the good: The people and the rooms are great. Very helpful and kind staff. Rooms have a great view. The bad: Co-ordination of our trip was very poor. We got in very late and realized that they only booked us in 1 room when our reservation said 2 rooms. They ended up finding a room for my wife and I, but it had 2 twin beds rather than a king/queen. Same goes for my parents room. Food: Food was average at best. At a 5 (or 4 star) property, you expect the food to be excellent as you end up spending a lot of time just hanging out at the property rather than running around from place to place. Us being vegetarians was especially hard. We had the same 3-4 dishes to pick from. Most of them even seemed to be served from the meal before. The chef told us that we should have informed them of our dietary restrictions. However, from a 5 star resort, you expect them to follow up with you prior to your visit or during reservation, asking you of these things. Nothing of the sort happened. Of course, if they had followed up prior, the mix up with the room would not have happened either. In addition, if they followed up, they would've known that my father is disabled and would have found a room closer to the elevator.... I can't really recommend this property for the price we paid.

Fabulous pristine beach. Spacious hotel which blends in to the surroundings. Simple relaxed and calm. Rooms are comfortable. Food with all inclusive buffets caters to all types. Courteous and helpful staff.

We visited Heritance Ahungalla on 14 December and stayed one night. (This was our second time at the hotel. First visted about 5 years ago). Travelled with our two young children and parents. We booked two rooms via hotel website as it offered a 30% discount. Upon arrival, we were greeted by friendly staff members who offered scented towels and a nice fresh fruit juices as welcome drinks. The check-in process took about 30 minutes as the staff were unable to locate our booking and had to call the head office in Colombo to verify the booking. We were told that online bookings sometimes dont show up in their system. I was not impressed by this as 30 minutes to check in is a long time and we were waiting at the lobby with two young kids. We requested for a free upgrade to compensate for the long wait and we were given an upgrade to rooms in the new wing of the hotel on first floor (Rooms 245 and 247). They were beautiful rooms , very tastefully deconrated and I loved the wooden furniture. They added an extra touch of elegance to the room. We had views of hotel's second swimming pool. It was great.The bathroom had a rain shower and looked new and very clean. The bed was perfect. The rooms did look very new and we were very pleased to get a free upgrade. Thank you to the front desk staff for your generosity ! One negative thing I noticed was that the front lobby area looked a bit old and needs a facelift. I have been to many hotels and resorts in Sri Lanka and have noticed that hotels don't do regular maintenance of their facilities. They seem to wait till facilities look really bad to undetake refurbishment. I felt the same about this hotel. Though our rooms were very nice, I wonder how the older rooms are and if they are in good condition. I must mention that the staff often went out of their way to help us and meet out needs. They even asked if we needed any food that was not in the buffet to be prepared. My 6 year old daughter was disappointed that the dinner and lunch buffets didnt have ice cream for desert but the staff quickly brought her an ice cream cone on both occasions. The management should be extremely proud that they have such good staff and are so willing to assist guets. The dinner buffet was great, it was an Asian theme that night and had chinese, thai and vietnamese food including lots of sea food. We thoroughly enjoyed the food. The breakfast and lunch were good as well. Overall we were very very pleased with the service and regretted that we only stayed one night. We will definitely be back again.

I visited Heritance ahungalla in the last couple of days and it's been a very joyous time for me and the whole family. As always the staff is extremely helpful and friendly and is quick to render their services to meet any customers specification. Cleanliness and room quality astounds anyone who would walk in to their rooms, it's honesty top class. Food was amazing (which is one of the main reasons I visit Heritance atleast once a year without fail for the last 5 or more years). The decorations and the special events arranged for christmas made the hotel look even more festive than usual. A special thanks to Mr. Thushara ( Restaurant and Bar Manager Of Heritance Ahungalla ) for making our stay even merrier than normal. I will be expecting to definitely make my next reservation in probably next August. Thank you to all guys at Heritance Ahungalla, You really do deserve a pat on your backs and a huge thumbs up for everything.

My favorite hotel in down south Sri Lanka...Beautiful place...Nice friendly staff..Good widely spread buffet meals.. Clean and tidy rooms and nice view of Indian Ocean from hotel lobby...Always love to go there. ..Special thank goes to Mr. Thushara , Managers of FB Department. ..

I was extremely satisfied with the service provided and the room. Also the food was as great as always. Their ice cream sandwich is highly recommended! Special shout out to Mr.Thushara ( restaurant and bar manager) for making our stay comfortable and enjoyable :)

I would say that the meals were excellent and well suited for the Sri Lankan pallet. The staff was very helpful and friendly. They could improve on the rooms as I found the interior a bit outdated compared to other hotels. I would say overall it was worth the money and would go there again.

We have visited heritance last week to stay for 2 days. I must say from the first moment till we check out their service was awesome. Friendly staff with professional service. Rooms were as described, comfortable beds with AC and bath rooms were spacious. Now comes to the best part.. the food! Breakfast was fabulous lots of varieties..If you are Sri lankans visiting from anyother county don't forget to go outside of the main restaurant where all the tasty "Appa" and Sri Lankan food is available.. also they had "seeni Banis" and tasty "maalu Banis" Lunch and Dinner were also great.. too much various food.. suitable for any person around the world.. Ah the last thing the swimming pool.. they have one of the best swimming pools in the country.. facing towards the Sea huge swimming pool which is children friendly. Why don't you give a try? My kids and grandma enjoyed the stay. Hope you will do the same. Genuine review!

This hotel is hit or miss. We stayed in a beautiful room but had a view of trash and falling apart tennis courts. There were ants in our room. There are some nice areas (main pool) and some very run down areas (spa area). The beach is nice and long but water is rough with currents and rip tides. The breakfast buffet and lunch buffet were plentiful so it was easy to find food for each preference. The service was good but slow. It took us 20 minutes to check out through some outdated cashier methods (spa had to bring a paper copy of their charges while we waited).

This was our third stay at this hotel . The food was very high quality . Most of all the front office , restaurant and the house keeping staff were very friendly and helpful . The hotel was very modern and attractive . We enjoyed our stay a lot . We hope to visit again !!!

We hosted an International Conference on Assisted Reproductive Technologies for a group of 90 doctors from around the world. We have been hosting such meetings annually in destinations like Nepal, Goa, Khajuraho, Seychelles, Singapore & more. This was one of our best experiences with a Hotel that taught us what Sri Lankan hospitality is all about. The front office staff, the back-end staff, the F & B staff and the event management team were all excellent and helpful and set new bench-marks fro us for future meetings. The property is visually stunning and the open lobby takes your breath away with the majestic ocean view on entering the Hotel. Attention to small details like the design of the trolley that brings welcome drinks to a guest checking in and the smiling faces of the front desk staff go a long way in first impressions. Although the property is 35 years old, it is very well maintained with huge trees planted in the stair-wells. The architecture and design and the room interiors all blend for an exotic asian experience. The meals are wonderful, the four bars in the hotel are superlative and the three swimming pools take your breath away. The conference was running two halls simultaneously and the meeting went off without a glitch. Three nights we had music concerts in the main hall and cocktails being served. This was a global gathering and the unanimous opinion was "this was one of the best experiences we have had!" Since I was the President of the meeting, I did not have time to relax and want to go back for a short break only to take in the same sights and smells again. This was like Heaven.

Glad to see you are renovating the rooms which are far better than the drab rooms with rusty fridges on the other side but what happened with the food which was very average maybe even poor , heritance was known for its food, we only had one night of decent food and that was for a tour group, also I see nothing has changed with the beach boys/men hovering at the hotel and a constant annoyance,

We had a two days stay in heritance ahungallla, and i would certainly recommend this hotel for anybody who are looking for a calm quite and luxurious experience with huge private pool and specially i would state that they have an excellent food spread for both locals and foreigners!. Affordable! Clean ! Calm & Quite ! The staffs are very friendly and the hotel is very homely feeling. *******Good Luck*******

Excellent Hotel along with their service..we have been visiting this Hotel for the last 10 years...service as always been excellent..lots of Food variety...two fantastic pools.. friendly staff perfect environment for a holiday.

Me and my wife stayed at Heritance Ahungalla. It was a lovely hotel with classy architecture. The room was spacious and looked clean. We got a room with sea view. Food was good but no varieties at all. But we enjoyed our one night stay in this hotel.

This hotel offers a very good beach side location. The beach is unspoilt compared to there places that I stayed at in Sri Lanka. The facilities, service and food are all excellent. If I return to Sri Lanka, then this hotel will be where I stay.

We came here for our honeymoon. Very good rooms. We were given a cake upon arrival as well! Furthermore we were also upgraded to a suite! Super food as there was variety as well. wonderful service and friendly staff. Pool was also good (there were two pools and one was not used much and a private place. Perfect for us). I have come here plenty of times and will visit again!

The hotel is too large and it is a 40 year old So it is kind of an old hotel The room service is late We checked in and the shampoo and body gel bottles were empty Regardless of all this they have a nice looking beach The lobby is wide and open to the ocean and unfortunately it is as hot as the ocean and the outside street I dont know it is a good hotel if they did renew it

We travelled with family on an outing, that had been planned a couple of months in advance. One of the members of our party is in a wheelchair and from the time of booking, this was mentioned as a special request. However, it was extremely difficult in getting confirmation from the hotel (both head office and hotel were contacted) if they were able to accommodate this guest. Several calls and emails went ignored and we resorted to calling a friend. This was extremely annoying as full paying customers you would like to think that the hotel would want to provide you with this basic service. A complaint made to the FB page provided some call back, but as always the trail went cold. We were unsure as to if this guest was able to make it, so in sheer desperation we had someone physically visit the hotel the week prior to our holiday and ask if they could be shown a few of the room categories, we were happy to upgrade if necessary. However, the person was not shown all categories and so the guest decided to only come for the day. Needless to say, we went there already disappointed with what the hotel had to offer. Once we checked in, we realised that one of our rooms was able to accommodate the guest in the wheelchair, and then proceeded to go to great lengths to ensure this guest joined us for the night. When we questioned the front desk as to why this room had not been shown to us, we were not given a valid response and we let it be, as we felt like we had already exerted way too much effort in what was meant to be a relaxing holiday! Needless to say, I felt like reservations, front desk and the head office staff were negligent and incompetent in this regard. Thereafter our trip went along smoothly, the staff were friendly and courteous and cooperated with requests such as bringing out a birthday cake. The rooms were clean and the common areas pleasant. It is a decent family hotel. The food was average at best, with no real highlights. Nice enough for a holiday with kids, but not good enough to compensate for all the hassle with the levels of initial service rendered.

We are a European Asian couple who came to Sri Lanka for our Winter vacations. We admire Geoffrey Bawa as a legendary architect and decided to come to one of the hotels designed by him to live his work for real. So We booked two nights in Heritance Ahungalla. Today is the second night of our stay and we just left the beautiful beach after the music reached the point of a super loud sound test. When we checked in we were made to sit and wait in front of a really loud bad music group. We complained a few times about the loud music right in our ear but they smiled and continued, forcing us to move away with our bags. Otherwise the treatment we got in checkin process was cool. But all the good mood was gone thanks to the awful music. Bawa designed his buildings in a way that the outside is coming to the inside and there are lots of open spaces. So really bad music in full volume means that you will hear it all over the hotel even in your own corridor. We complained more than 10 times and witnessed that other tourists were laughing at the music and walked away as far from the lobby as they could. The hotel management put really ugly ridiculous christmas decoration in the lobby and inside the beautiful infinity pool making, a big mockery of Bawa who designed the lobby so that you see the sea behind the infinity pool. The food was okay, nothing special other than a terrible vegetable chop suey and vegetable fried rice we got for yesterdays lunch. They have great freshly baked bread and spreads which we loved. And nice veggie burgers. Our room was interesting, as it seems to be originally as designed by Bawa years ago. The mini bar was dirty inside and the refrigerator quite rusty. The wifi worked well for my computer every where in the hotel, but my wife had not as much as luck as i did. The staff were trying to give us a friendly face and some times we met nice people. A front desk guy called Khan was really funny and cool to talk to when he helped us secure the late checkout which we were promised via booking.com. The dining area got really wet under my own feet with lots of rain water this morning when it was heavily raining. Our corridor and the bar/ reception area was flooded because the roofs and windows were leaking. They have amazing pools designed by Bawa and we used every opportunity jump in to them. The hotel is an architectural masterpiece and in a very cool location. However, the company that runs it seems to be treating this paradise for architectural lovers as just a another cheaply run 5 star hotel to use as space for mega groups they bus in to maximise profit. The loud music and badly maintained building may kill it for most. For us, we will not come again unless some miracle happens tomorrow. We are extremely disappointed of the fate of Bawa's hotel.

This is our third visit to heritance Ahungala we were welcomed warmly as always by the front office staff we were given a nice rooms clean and has a good view food is excellent and staff gives a superb service We will come back again next month special thanks to Khan and Thilini From the front Desk

There was some minor renovations of the neighbouring rooms, but since we were mostly at the pool or out during the day, it didn't really bother us. Helpful attentive staff and a great breakfast. Other meals were good too. Loved the in house guests only pool as compared to the main pool as it had more shade. But main pool had a lovely view of the ocean. This hotel has its charm in its design and fittings. Not like the neighbouring Riu which I'm sure is great but is more modern and ... well white. The beach here is clean and really nice. Nothing much near the hotel, except the turtle hatcheries. May not appeal to many but do understand that at least the eggs are being hatched and released rather than consumed. So don't begrudge the entrance fees.

last night we were at Heritance . That was a lovely hotel. At the entrance they gave us a admirable welcome . After that we entered to the dinning area . The food was delicious . They had variety of food . Yesterday [ Friday ] was Sri Lankan night . We enjoyed our meals very well . We could taste different traditional Sri Lankan sweet meats . We enjoyed the king coconut drink with lemon grass the most . Finally we saw a troop of kandyan dancers . The restaurant manager Mr. Praveen and G.M Mr . Senarathne and the entire restaurant team were very friendly and helpful . Yesterday was an unforgettable day for our lives!!!

Came in here over the weekend, drove from Colombo and got in late but the reception was ready for us and got us checked in real quick. They had a spacious room for three but they missed the basics like refilling the amenities like toothbrushes etc. and had to be ordered. And the shower gel, conditioner and Shampoo had no labels so we had trial and test to see what was what. So frustrating!! Nevertheless they made up with the amazing location absolutely amazing service and great spread for both breakfast and lunch as that's what we had. Ordered room service for dinner which was apt but they overkilled on the French fries!! I'd recommend you guys to go for the ambiance and location and hopefully if they correct these small issues you have a killer deal!! Cheers!

Me and my wife spent our Holiday at Heritance Ahungalla.. When we arrived at the hotel the staff welcomed us with a traditional sweet. The check in process was so easy we were asked to relax in the lounge while the staff organised everything. The room provided was a 100% match to the description with all the Amenities.. The staff were quite polite and friendly throughout our stay.. The food at the hotel was amazing.. They had a wide variety of Sri Lankan and Western food which we both enjoyed a lot. We are so glad that we selected this hotel .. ğŸ‘ğŸ¾ğŸ‘ğŸ¾ğŸ˜˜

I used to be a frequent guest since early 2009. This hotel used to be one of the best in every possible way. I should say that the location is great, with absolutely stunning views of the southern beaches of Sri Lanka. The architecture, flora and fauna gives a very relaxing feeling away from the commercial/business feeling. The staff is still very helpful, most would bed over back to entertain the guests. During the last visit with my wife they even upgraded me to their best suite, the Sachin Tendulkar Suite with no buzz or hazel at all. I must say, the rooms are of good size. But unfortunately that is where it ends! The buffets are not up to the standards ( I am being very polite and generous towards the hotel here). Variety is lacking, taste is lacking, freshness is lacking. The edible items run over in 1 hour, so if you go there it late - you are left to trial the buns and sandwiches like parchment, and some left over stuff. As with many other hotels in SL they seem to cater a specific corporate client base, as a result the food spoils it for the relaxing holiday traveller. This is not just one time experience, but my observations over time. Restaurants and ala carte has little to offer. The "best suite" feels like collapsing on one end, not cleaned for days on another note, and worse of all even the renovation seems to be left at half way. Little activities happening at night, and the management does not seem to be interested in addressing it for years. Last few visits all I felt is that the staff at junior positions, room services, and reception are trying to blow some warmth and energy into it, but the higher levels seem to be not bothered about what they offer to the clients. While I do believe, looking at the number of corporate customers in the restaurant (mainly East Asian and Indian - whom I have randomly come to contact with, have informed me that they are sent to this place via corporate arrangements, not by choice) that the hotel is likely making good returns and is not financially pressured to invest in restructuring and renovation; it makes me sad that this is like an aincient giant which is approaching its last legs. Would I recommend it to anyone? Probably not if you are on your vacation. Given there are quite nice new boutique hotels in the area, for a fraction higher price point. Would I go there again? Probably not, unless the hotel addresses these issues effectively, because it's a waste of time and money the way it is.

This place has deteriorated unbelievably. I have visited the hotel on multiple occasions. In the early 2012s the Hotel was decent with friendly staff. Now its all gone down sour. I revisited again in 2016 but was shocked to find out that the standards have turned so bad. Firstly, I was welcomed by the usual friendly smiles and what not but the staff at the pool were extremely rude, and racist... I took some family visiting from the middle east for lunch and soon found that the hotel service made them very upset. They tried to use the pool, however soon knocked back and told that 3 quarter shorts weren't suitable for pool. These idiots have no idea. As a traveller in many western countries, I have never seen such fools running a hotel.. They don't know what guest services means... then the racism part kicks in where the staff are plain rude and are like robots and smiles at white skin guests, but frowns upon anyone with a tinge more of colour... Absolutely ridiculous and I discourage anyone from travelling and staying at this hotel....

This hotel was designed on a very grand scale, and is having a hard job keeping up to date. Nevertheless, we had a good stay. Our room was fine, with seaview. Fittings were perhaps not the newest/most modern, but good nonetheless. Tea/coffee facilities and bottled water provided each day. Breakfast buffet is varied (note: cooked breakfast is outside through a set of doors - not immediately obvious!) and good. We ate at the hotel 'Mustard' restaurant twice - choices of international cuisine and local. Poolside bar offers cocktails and ice-cream sundaes (Spice Inheritance sundae was great, though not as large as the photo suggests!). Bike hire is possible - though you're likely to get a local standard one with no gears. This is ok for going around the area. The bellboy will, when prompted, provide a map of a route (says 2 hours, but is less time) past cinnamon plantations etc. (The hotel reception seemed unaware of this route information, and anyway it needs updating and could be better signposted!). Pool table costs 300 Rs an hour; snooker table 600 Rs. Would have thought these could be provided free of charge for guests. Beach is great. Loungers and towels available. Chipmunks fun to watch (and once an iguana!). TukTuks available outside the hotel - charge 1000 to go to Bentota and back - the TukTuk drivers know some excellent places to find souvenirs/tea/Ayurveda stuff that you wouldn't find on your own. Hotel taxi would offer to take you to same place for 3000 Rs.

We spent quite a few hours checking and selecting the place to stay during our vacation on Sri Lanka and never regreted about staying at this place! 1) Location - very good and convenient, you can go whenever you want from this part of coast, whether it is about tours, cafes or shopping - and it won't take too much time. 2) Hotel - very neat, modern and clean - during our stay we saw a lot of workers who were looking on plants, cleaning, fixing issues and making everyhting to get the guests a pleasant stay. What can I say more when we get the room cleaning service 2 times per day! That is just amazing. You use the towel after the pool or the beach before the dinner and when you come back after it - the towels are new and your bed is made! 3) Staff - super friendly and welcoming, always smiling and willing to help. Really feeling like a special treatment. Special thanks to make me feel special at my Birthday. 4) Food - just incredible. Can't say more, it is impossible :) 5) Beach - however the beach is not related to the hotel but it was always clean. And the lifeguards were taking care of irresponsible swimmers 6) Atmoshpere - relaxing. Whatever it was - lying on the pool or chilling at the bar - you did not feel anything uncomfortable or annoying. There was just one small thing I did not get. When we checked in I asked on reception if possible to give us a room with a great ocean view as it was my birthday and we wanted to chill a little bit and celebrate with my husband on the terrace. I was told that I am given with the best room they have (which is obviously not true as i was not requesting a luxe, just wanted the same type i had but with better view options). The guy stressed out several times that he is giving us the best room and he is doing his best. Of course he got some tips for that. It ended up with completely the same room as our friends had but on the next floor - with a really GREAT view - a huge tree in front of us. Obviously no ocean view, just sound :) After that this reception guy just ignored us through the whole term of our staying. All I got was the feeling that I've been used somehow. Well, no offence, just don't get his approach to the service. Apart from this small detail the rest staff and the hotel in general is the must visit for everyone who ever wants to visit Sri Lanka. P.S. if you need a really awesome local guide who is not expensive but professional and very-very friendly - ask around about Wimal. He is the extra-friendly and always willing to help you and to show the best places! Highly recommend.

Me and my family stayed on FB basis for one day at heritance, ahungalle in october. the best thing was the food there. However, except for the welcoming staff at entrances staff was un or minimally attentive most of the time, of course they attend to us if we go and poke them repeatedly. we have booked a triple room and checked in around 4pm but there were twin beds in the room and after repeatedly reminding them they finally added an extra foldable bed. the person who brought the bed looked like a senior for that area, when we complained he just muttered something like 'twin bed room is the only room type available at heritance when you book a triple room and we always add an extra bed , only difference is you will get meals for 3 people' and walked away rapidly, on us... there were no room amenities in the room- no iron or ironing board, no water for three people, no slippers ,toothbrushes, cups etc at all. when we needed something we had to call and wait and call again . ultimately one person appeared with a trolley and instead of replacing missing items asked us to take whatever missing in the room. and the dark color pillow covers were so dirty we just kept them away. no one has bothered to change them for ages . safe was not functioning and when we typed numbers it missed some and got locked,then the person who attended late to fix it couldnt identify that its battery was low. finally it was fixed and by about 8.30 we managed to go for dinner. it may be due to overcrowded hotel but they already had 2 hours extra to check the room beforehand since we were late for check in. meals were good, staff was also more attentive. no one offered a baby high seater for our 3 year old and we had to go after them at all the 3 meals for a chair... restaurant is overcrowded and no one is there to offer water or clean tableware. they are only interested in taking plates away, at least that's a good thing. chefs and the restaurant manager were very supportive and offered some food for our baby , they were kind enough to deliver the dishes to our room as well. There is no sea view from the room and there was some construction work going on right next to our room which we didnt mind much.. next morning we asked them to take the plates away but no one showed up. by 1pm we were ready to check out and until that time no cleaning was done and room smelled of stale food. overall we didnt mind it as it was a one night thing ,tolerable on a full stomach and surely this place happens to be a typical siri lankan hotel, no matter how many stars they got,..

Submitted for a friend on holiday with no internet access: If you are considering going to Sri Lanka with Thompson don't bother and have had to post on here as your in resort reps are ignoring everything!! Ahungalla Heritance Sri Lanka, in resort rep name is Ruwan and his team leader won't even speak to us, they won't move us and are not interested. The toilet is leaking into the room !!! There is massive construction work that we were not told about going on with jack hammers on the go, on top of this there was no privacy in the bathroom due to the room/window set up and when it was complained about a member of the hotel staff used masking tape and cardboard to cover it!!!! We Have offered to pay the difference to move next door And the hotel and the resort reps don't care, and to top it off despite paying for all inclusive .... they won't give out soft drinks. Shocking customer service, shocking in resort service do not use this company or resort they do not care!!!

My partner and I have arrived from the UK this afternoon and we knew instantly, that we had made a big mistake choosing this property as our base in Sri Lanka. The lobby has as much ambience as my mothers funeral in September!!!!!! It is dark, unwelcoming, cold,uncomfortable furnishings and lacks any kind of warmth and inviting environment. We had paid for an upgrade on our room prior to leaving the UK with a double bed deluxe sea view. We got neither. Room was damp with a smell of urine from the bathroom. Interior was again dark with numerous scratches on furniture. No ocean view and two twin beds put together and the safe was not secure to anything!!!!! Tiles missing from the bathroom and no kettle,ironing board and iron!! The list is endless. Complained to the management and the front of house manager did state some of the rooms had not been upgraded in thirty five years. We were moved to another room which was supposed to be an upgrade. Alas not. Toilet that leaks, as well as the air conditioning: no secure safety box and the smell of fresh paint. Have eaten n the restaurant this evening. Best described as bland, average and uninspiring. We have already been in touch with our tour operator to move us or we will be returning early home. The only positive are the very friendly staff. If any of the hotel management read this we are in room 355. If you want luxury, with the added little touches do not come here, save your money and go elsewhere.

WARNING!!!! The entire place is revolting. Dirty!! I have stayed in backpackers cleaner than this dump. Mould all throughout the shower & air vents. The dinner buffet was inedible and costs $38 pp. So throughly disappointed. The only thing this place has going for them are friendly staff. Such a disappointment after such amazing accomodation in SriLanka Total rip off 100% would NEVER recommend.

On arrival we both thought this was a 4* hotel but within 24 hours we realised why it was rated 5* - every staff member contributed to our * rating upgrade. We were made to feel like we were the only guests there,nothing was too much trouble. Newly refurbished rooms were beautifull as was the infinity pool which greets you on arrival.The food was top class - lobster Thermidor for lunch on a Tuesday!! This all inclusive hotel really is 5* ALL staff were very professional and our thanks to Sisira Senaratne for running such a wonderful hotel, wouldn't hesitate to recommend it,can't wait to go back.

The hotel environment was amazing. Number of places to relax, walk and chat. The beautiful beach and the pools provided an unforgettable experience. Our dinner was superb; number of choices / delicious. Staff was friendly and flexible.

Comparing this hotel to other Heritance properties it falls well below. The facilities are good and the hotel is ok. In every area of the hotel, staff seemed a little directionless. When we arrived the checkin process was disorganised. Everyone was quite pleasant but just not efficient. At the pool bar we had 3 waiters just walk straight past us. The person who seemed to be the head waiter was standing there checking his mobile phone. Eventually we had to ask to be served. On the pool deck no one was offering service. We had to go hunt it down. Some people were staying here on an "all inclusive" package which may explain the poor service. The buffet was "unloved". I'd often open a closh to find it empty underneath - eg no sausages or bacon at 8.30am during breakfast. The staff at this hotel had poor English skills and it was often difficult to be understood. I appreciate that English is a second language but it's essential in a five star hotel. This hotel needs a sharp eyed management team to set high standards and coach staff effectively. On a positive note - Heritance Hotels have the best toilet paper of any hotel group in the world!!

Several times I was in this Hotel.Very specialy I have to mention that the staff is soooo kind and helpful.From the Entrance to the Exit they were provided their best services. Specialy I have to mention that Mr.senarathne (GM)doing great Job. And Mr.Thushara Restaurant Manager & Mr.Praveen were very special to us in this evening. They did nice team work.well done sir ! Atmosphere and the Food were so beautiful. We enjoyed nice traditional srilankan show. Definitely we would like to come again !!! Good luck Boys !!!

We spend the weekend on Heritance and it is a hotel with great landscaping.Has a nice pool and easy access to the beach, we had a sea bath and enjoyed a lot. The rooms are clean and tidy but bathrooms are small. Food was average, restaurant staff except chefs was nice and friendly.There were few chefs at the buffet and most of them were rude and had unpleasant attitudes. The hotel has facilities to play table tennis,carom,pool and has a small book collection as well.

A truly delightful hotel to relax in. Comfortable well appointed rooms and superb food. With a choice of places to eat. The hotel was being renovated while we were there but it did not detract from the relaxed atmosphere. Lovely pool and beach. Service was extremely good. Also the spa added to the experience with amazing treatments on offer.Staff were very attentive and friendly.Look forward to going back.Live music and shows at night too.

the hotel is situated in a serene and quiet place. Transport is not a problem. Time taken to travel from International Airport to the hotel is a maximum 3 hrs drive(without traffic, since we went early morning around 5 AM). Location is fabulous just on the beach with a fantastic swimming pool. Food spread across for breakfast and dinner was fantastic with equal stress on American and Ceylonese cuisine. The sweet dish was sumptuous. Live music, fire shows in the evening are worth mentioning.

Hotel situated in a nice quite place with easy access to the beach. The buildings and the surrounding has some old look and it add nice ambiance to the hotel. Swimming pool is also quite nice, it shape like a cross. Must mention the buffet, its one of the best things about this place. Great taste and nice variety ! Here comes the but part, I would have give this place 4.5 or 5/5 if it not for their service and rooms, specially the rooms. we took a deluxe room which had two single beds, we have asked for a one extra bed when we make the reservation. But they haven't put the extra bed when we checked-in, they said they will arrange it. After 4-5 hours we had to make a complain to the reception then only they came up with the extra bed. The biggest worry was the room condition it was no way near the 5 star standard. Room key card doesn't work. Couldn't work out the room safe, the safe itself had different set of instructions compared to the leaflet they gave us on check-in. Tried both of them but no luck.Then they gave us Wi-fi credentials which took 2-3 hours to get activated. The bathroom is covered with glasses, there are blinds but they are jammed and when you put lights on the bathroom you can see the inside. Bathroom door lock was also didn't work. The biggest worry was the shower :/

Never have I felt the urge to write a review while I'm still staying at a place... But just so that no one else is cheated , I'll do it now... "Steer clear" ... We viz. 2 couples with young children were given twin beds in a "deluxe category" room... God only knows why... They expect the kid to sleep , hanging in the crevice... The house keeping is extra sloppy... 1 hr to get room slippers (read-only I had to personally go to the store room)... Air con s/w broken... Staff got me phenyl when I asked for an antiseptic (dettol) solution... No idea where the first aid kit is... This is my first 2 hrs at the hotel... What's amazing... All this at a ridiculous price

This is a very nice hotel to get some rest and recreation, especially for a family with kids. Although the hotel is old, it has some great architectural features. There are courtyards with lush foliage, which gives a cool atmosphere. The grounds are full of trees too, which provides well-needed shade during the daytime. Big pool and the ocean is right next to it. The rooms are also nice and comfortable. The design and interiors are a bit old fashioned, which I personally liked, but not if you are looking for modernism. The staff is very friendly, and the food is quite good, with a lot of variety at all meals. They even had a kids table, which I found very quaint.

Enjoyed one night stay at this hotel. Hotel looks bit old, but clean, spacious and beautiful. Food is up to the "Heritance" standards with so many verities. Main restaurant is crowded and packed sometimes.

I stayed at the Heritance at the end of October for 3 days. The hotel is beautiful and makes the most of it's stunning surroundings. We opted for half board and were very impressed with the selection of food on offer for breakfast and dinner. The live cooking stations were a great addition. The staff were very friendly and made an effort to remember us and our preferences. The infinity pool is large and lovely, and as we went out of season there were plenty of sun loungers. However there didn't seem enough if the hotel was full. The only downside was the electrics and power points in the room. During our short stay we had three power cuts, the only power sockets in the room that we could use where to power the telly and mini-bar so we would have to simultaneously remove one to be able to charge phones, or straighten hair. The other sockets available didn't fit any sort of travel plug (I'd packed a world compatible one and it still didn't work!) the room comes with a kettle and tea making facilities however even the kettle plug didn't fit in the sockets! Slightly disappointing side to an otherwise lovely hotel.

Nice hotel, but getting a bit tired. In need of some renovation. Rooms were comfortable, but had to be moved after first night because our so called de-luxe sea view room was situated immediately above the kitchen and dining rooms. Very difficult to see the sea, due to heavy tree line. Replacement room was much better. Restaurant and food were excellent with great choices every morning at breakfast and then again at dinner in the evening. Staff were very helpful and always with a smile. Service was slow in the restaurant. Bar staff were great. This is not a five star hotel, more between three and four.

Great place to entertain business and leissure clients The F&B manager Gamini knows to offer the best for my clients The lobster lunch was great and value for money My Dutch clients mentioned that during their two weeks round tour in Sri Lanka this was their best meal as it was fresh, tasty and the presentation was on the highest level. Thank you Gamini and the team for this tremendous team work. If you are in Down South (in Sri Lanka) worth trying out this hotel as always it's one of the best in the region for many decades

We checked in on the first week of Oct. The check in staff was friendly and welcomed us with a refreshing drink. The room was spacious but we received two single beds for me and my husband. Which I found really ridiculous. They should have inquired regarding this when we made the reservation or at check in. When we asked to change they said the hotel was fully booked. We then asked the housekeeping to dress the beds with a single double bed sheet. Which still didn't make a big difference. The room fridge and the phone was not working. Informed them and they replaced it. The rooms need refurbishment and new equipment. The lunch buffet was not that great. The Srilankan option was good but the other dishes were not tasty. The starter section looked really pathetic. And added to that the prawns were not de-veined. Which was unacceptable. The waiting staff was dazed. We had to ask for water. Nobody escorted us to tables. The staff was basically a little lost. During dinner they had barbecue going on which was good. They had a seafood dish again the most prawns were not de - veined again. Brought it to the attention of the management and informed them that there could be consiquences for consuming non de - veined prawns. They apologised and offered to get something else. I informed them I don't need anything else but to keep the kitchen staff informed regarding this. Breakfast was good and tasty. Again during breakfast the waiting staff was lost. Asked for coffee and never got it. I just left it. The other complaint is to get more high chairs for kids to restaurant because our friends needed a high chair and everything was taken. So if the hotel is full there is no option. But I have to tell that hands down the best buffets to go to for is heritance Kandalama and Negombo. So tasty and great variety.

Stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. Situated right by the beach this is a beautifully architectural designed hotel keeping up with the Heritance Hotels standards. The room was large with all amenities and a good view of the ocean. A large swimming pool, gym, library and a spa adds value to the hotel. The food was good, specially the breakfast. A fine place to relax and enjoy the beach.

Was there with colleagues we had the best time ever the management gave us a very good treatment we even got our own party place we had drinks by the beach it was simply wonderful we really enjoyed the hotel is Fabulous has a great sea view too

The resort is beautiful and located on the beach. The service and staff make your stay exceptional. The room I had looks out over beautiful scenery and the ocean. The room was clean and stunning. The food and drink excellent. This is a must for an amazing vacation. Try out the spa it's worth it.

My husband and I have recently returned from our honeymoon here and we have completely fallen in love with it! The hotel is immaculate, the room was spacious (we loved the towel animals) and the view from our balcony was outstanding. Above all each and every member of staff were so friendly and acommodating, we couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. The drive up to the reception has a truly wow factor that continued beyond. Thank you for making our honeymoon so special and memorable. Highly recommended!

this time its 3rd floor and service on this floor is fabulous. just a learning during my stay that pool and gym are not available before 8 AM so if you are a early morning riser, you have to spend initial hours just roaming around on the beach.

We wanted a break from this hustle and bustle,and planned a trip,and again ended up in Heritance Ahungalla,a place where we have visited many times,but has never got fed up of.The moment we entered the hotel,the breathtaking beauty of the entrance kept our mind at peace.The service offered by everyone from the reception to the restaurant is superb.They surely know how to entertain guests.The frontline staff showed their talents by their beautiful dancing and hilarious acting.We like to thank Mr.Thushara food and beverage manager,specially for his warm welcome and always making our stay an amazing one.Thank you so much,From Indika,Eshara,and little Sanayah.

I must admit that Iâ€™m totally in love with this place. Starting from the architecture itself which is a marvel by renowned architect Jeoffrey Bawa, from entrance to lobby, hallways, restaurants, pools, rooms are all unique and well thought out. Then the staff, one of the most friendliest and attentive staff, I have ever met in my trips. It would be a great miss, if I didnâ€™t mention about their buffet. Wow, itâ€™s too much and Iâ€™m not exaggerating. They have huge spread of mouthwatering local and international cuisine. The main pool is one of the best pools I have seen and sheer size of it made it really easy for us to enjoy without a hassle on a crowded weekend. The deluxe rooms have sea view and they are well equipped to give you total relaxation and satisfactory entertainment. The beach next to the hotel is adequately clean and enjoyable. But the sea is rough during this month and therefore not suitable for sea bath. There are only handful of negatives I can point out about this place. In fact, this is not directly linked to the hotel itself but about making the reservation via phone through Aitken Spence Head Office. They had a credit card offer for locals and I had to go to the head office to make the payment to confirm the reservation, which is a hassle. I seriously suggest them to follow the industry practice of sending online credit card information sheet to be filled and followed by auto deduction from willing parties. Other than that till the end of October there is some construction happening at the premises and it is not at all any hassle to the guests. In fact, Iâ€™m sure most of the guests who were there even didnâ€™t notice a construction is in progress. The only negativity about the construction is you cannot use the resident pool during this period. In summary, Iâ€™m impressed about Heritance Ahungalla and I have no hesitation in recommending it to anybody who is looking for place for a weekend getaway with the family.

I really like the customer service of this Hotel. Friendly and pleasent looking staff who always wearing a big smile on their faces. Also i liked the food. Rooms are quite and comfortable nice too. But I dont like the welcome drink.

After a week travelling Sri Lanka it was nice to have this last week enjoying the pool and beach at this excellent hotel. Upon arrival you are always greeted with a hot face towell and a fruit juice, which was the same as all hotels we visited. The hotel facilities are great you have a choice of 3 restaurants unless you choose all inclusive where it is buffet choice only. We chose bed and breakfast only as it gave us the chance to wander to the 2 restaurants by the beach both for lunch of which were well worth a visit and also only so much buffet can eat so we got to try cafe mustard at the hotel which we really enjoyed, we did the buffet and for a similar price of the buffet you can go the 'posh' restaurant which we failed to do so in the end opting on another trip to cafe mustard instead. There is also a wine/off-licence out of the front of the hotel to the right where you can stock up your fridge if you feel the need (the prices will change whenever they see you but still cheap). Prices at the hotel for drinks are reasonable anyway it works less than Â£3 a pint or less than Â£5 a cocktail. The guys who work by the pool soon remember you and will set up your beds if you give them a 100 rupees tip (about 60p) each time then you will soon find your bed is ready and waiting for you each morning. The staff cannot do anymore for you, we had the pleasure of meeting Suprani who was fantastic (even organising aqua aerobics for my wife the next day) she is a great asset to to the hotel but also the greeters for the buffet, the staff at Cafe Mustard and the housekeeper who makes animal shapes with towels on the bed and the animation guy were all excellent. Flip side of the experience is the entertainment in the evening. We only stayed Sun-Sat which is typical as Sat seems the best night from talking to those around us. They hide the musicians in a dark corner so they simply become background music. The Friday was good in all fairness with the Sri Lanka dancers. The daytime activities are decent they just need to do more and advertise what could be happening as this would drum up the interest. Lastly have to mention the beach boys who cannot enter hotel premises so stand at the end beckoning you over or waiting for you to walk the beach, they can seem a little intimidating and ruin the experience. I found attack the best cause of defence and went straight to the ringleader Siri on day one. These guys want to take you to gem stores, spice gardens, the local restaurant (where they will also be fed claiming to be your guide) see turtles, see the whales, hsve a massgae or take you in their tuk-tuk. Some people used the beach boys with the outcome you would expect one chap saying his massage was a pretty rough handed experience on his sun burned shoulders. I approached them all sitting together and asked how much for an air conditioned taxi to and from Galle (with no shops/spice gardens) and they agreed 5500 was a fair price. I then went to the hotel taxi was quoted 6000 where he also waited for 4 hours to bring us back and was well worth the 500 more. Later on one of the beach boys said he would of done it for 4000, I still prefer the hotel taxi service for what is Â£10 more, but if you enjoy a haggle you could have a little bit of fun. All in all an excellent stay however really enjoyed this hotel and would recommend highly just a few tweaks needed only

I am writing this review sitting at the hotel on our penultimate night. I can honestly say we have utterly enjoyed our stay at this wonderful hotel. From the moment we arrived we have been treated like royalty with the staff always on hand for whatever your needs may be. Firstly, we stayed in room 301 which has wonderful views of the sea and the pool. The bed is comfortable with nice pillows and an adequate bathroom. The housekeeping staff often surprise you with their creativity and knock on your door in the evening asking if you need extra towels which is a nice touch. The food has been delicious with plenty of variety. I can truly say both my husband and I have been in a food coma after every meal. Just when you think it can't get better but the next day it does. The buffet has choices of steak, chicken and plenty of seafood in addition to the traditional curries and local cuisines which are all delightful! Even when you're full you must try the little sweet treats that melt in your mouth! The staff in the restaurant are attentive and you don't have to ask for a drink as they keep it coming. Thank you all the wonderful kitchen and restaurant staff for the first class service! The pool is large and there is always plenty of beds for a lazy pool/beach day. Although the sea is very choppy and the red flag has always been up! The pool bar staff are attentive and often walk around the pool asking for drink orders. The life guards are always smiling and as soon as you're spotted they run over with cushions and towels making it all a lovely experience. There are two things I would like to highlight, the beach isn't private and you get the sellers standing by the beach shouting over trying to get your attention on a regular basis. You learn to ignore this as we understood everyone has to make a living, however there is a group of guys that sit in the corner and as a girl I often felt a tad intimidated as they would stare making me feel uncomfortable. There is a pool security guard that prevents these guys from approaching you by the pool but as soon as you get up or go to the beach they walk by you making it a nuisance. Secondly, there really isn't much of an animation team in this hotel if you're like my husband that enjoys the odd game you will be disappointed and you may just have to settle down with your book and the odd swim! Our overall stay at this hotel has been outstanding! Yes the hotel can do with a makeover but our room was comfortable and you really do get the authentic Sri Lankan experience. I must also add the hotel is always sparkling and the hotel gets regular locals come for a stay! If you want to stay at just another commercial establishment then there is a Riu that's opened next door! My husband and I are keen travellers and we can truly say that Sri Lankan people are the nicest nation we have come across! They can't do enough for you without expecting a tip! Everyone is approachable and makes an effort to get to know you leaving you feeling special. I would highly recommend this hotel with spectacular views and for a relaxing experience. I must add, if you want to explore, there really isn't much to do without the 1 hour taxi ride outside the hotel which we took. Thank you Heritance for looking after us and we look forward to seeing everyone again in the future.

Good: The food and room facilities were good. The staff is really friendly. Highlights: Swimming pools were great! Love the beach! Bad: At the dinner table, staff was pushing the guests to review hotel by asking for their mobile phones and we found it quite intimidating hence putting 4 stars.

The food was delicious, rooms were clean and neat. Although the room we stayed was not much large, it had enough space and sufficient accessories. Overall, we had a great, relaxing experience at the hotel. Might visit this place again.

An awesome hotel with an amazing staff. The rooms n food was amazing so where the ever helpful staff when we locked ourselves out of our room many times... lol. Will definitely be back in a heartbeat when we are next in the country!!. Keep up the good work always!!.

We have been to Heritance Ahungalla many times and like in the past, we had a wonderful time yet again. The hotel is apprx 2.5 hours drive from Colombo. The check in was quick and the reception staff was very helpful in getting us an early check in. They also accommodated all our requests including a ground floor room opening out to the garden and closer to the pool, which the kids enjoyed quite a lot. Food at Spence hotels has always been outstanding, though quality has slightly dropped compared to the past and the main restaurant needs a facelift. However, all in all it had a wonderful weekend.

Heritance Ahungalla serves up some of the best buffets out of Colombo. Great variety, local and foreign cuisine. Amazing food hands down! Been there several times during the past 5 years and they do not disappoint! highly recommend the place locals and foreigners alike. (They have several ocean facing Suites with a great view)

Its always nice to have resort to come back everytime you visit Srilanka...Heritance Ahungalla is always the best. Service was excellent from front office staff to f/b to housekeeping. A special thank you to Buwaneka - Resident Manager for his personalized attention to detail as well as a warm welcome. Look forward to my next visit...

A stunning, sprawling hotel with superb Sri Lankan service and food. From the moment you arrive the Geoffrey Bawa designed hotel gives a great sense of connection between the land and the sea beyond. With pools in front of the open plan reception through to a main pool which appears to run straight out into the Indian Ocean - just stunning. A a guest you can use not just this main pool, which is also open to the public, but also the incredible green pool with carefully trained trees branching out over it. The hotel is a great base from which to explore the local area. There is a cab company based on the hotel grounds, but get a little more local colour by walking up to the main gate and hiring one of the tuk-tuk drivers. Remember to agree a price first, and if you are happy with them they will look after you every day you are there - there is no shame in just saying 'NO' if that is not what you want to do.

This place is just stunning! Such a beautiful entry and pool area. Gorgeous beach which they say you shouldn't swim in because of dangerous currents. Still didn't stop us, although it does stress he lifeguard... Rooms are lovely and service is great. Such friendly people! Not a lot to do in the town, we got a tuk tuk to Bentota (1/2 hour) and did a little bit of shopping. Mainly just a place to come and relax. Wonderful!

A vast, open resort that we intended to use as a base to travel between Bentota and Hakkaidu before moving on to Galle. Apparently the place was fully booked but a paid upgrade is always available :). As with any resort, this place is fairly self sufficient in keeping the guests entertained. On poya day, they had organised a cultural, fusion dance which was quite enthralling ( I usually walk away from such events) and left us longing for more. Mid sept our options for outdoor activities were a tad limited, the sea was too choppy for Whale watching, had already experienced the river tour which left us with only the local safari. Overall hotel facilities were up to the mark, the huge pool and extensive spa offerings kept us usefully busy the two days we spent at this resort, breakfast/dinner buffet as good as can be expected, overseen by attentive staff. Would recommend this any day.

It is our first time to this hotel. Starting from the welcoming to the checking out everything as perfect. Kids enjoyed a lot.Main pool relaxed our minds and food is awesome.Thank you all! Specially my friend Janaka gave us a good service.Supuni's attention into detail is perfect. Thank you all for making us this much happy!!!

We were on our honeymoon and really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Yummy food, friendly staff and the swimming pool with the ocean view are the best things about this hotel.Only issue is that the beach area is open to the general public.

The hotel facing beach view is very nice but the room we had was in corner on 2nd floor. When we checked in evening we dint notice the water purification unit next to the building which made load noise all the though night. Not that great customer service. We tried to speak to front desk manager, tried serval times and have our call back Number but dint receive any call back.

We were welcome by the amazing view desinged by geffoery bawa plis with a hint of traditionalism.Wonderful hotel with excellent service...enjoyed a unique and memorable experiece ..Food at jute restaurant and its service is amazing. I should not forget the service from the hidden service from engineering. Service is so quick.Front desk staff is amazing.Thank you so much heritance ahungalle for the memorable stay.

The hotel need an urgent renovation ... Location good but far from center .... 15 mn with a tuktuk ... Pool is clean ... Breakfast and dinner buffet are good .... Entertainment not bad ... All in all is a good place to be for relaxing after a long trip in Srilanka

I have wanted to go to the hotel since it was called Trident and finally went when its Hearitance Ahungalla. The friendly and professional staff, good food, fabulous rooms and the unique touch, the Heritance group of hotels has is their with Ahungalla as well. Stayed and Luxury room and it was spacious and quite. it was designed by Jeffery Bava. you can still see the old elevator which was used to supply materials to the upper floors by labours when it was built. Heritance + Jeffery Bava this combination always gives immense happiness and wonderful memories for me.

Enjoyed last weekend at Heritance Ahungalle with my wife. Good hotel. Nice scenic view as the large pool seemingly meets the sea. Quiet place. Great to rest and relax. Food was average for my Sri Lankan pallet. But would be good for foreign visitors as it is less spicy. But on the plus side you are spoiled for choice. 5 stars for the deserts definitely. The only part of the menu we enjoyed. Watch out for in-room dining as there is a variance in pricing. All in all the best thing about the Hotel were it's staff. Every member we met was cheerful and made our stay warm and pleasant.

Again im with family heritance to refresh past memories here .the hospitality is superb as same as previous. My friend Manoshi ,Supuni (Tha GRE) Lakshi (@ reservation) treated us well.hope come back again as soon as

This is a five star hotel. We got superb food Night club And soooo many activities However, the old area of the hotel has small rooms which a are not acceptable for a star class hotel at all The new side of the hotel has nice rooms.

Very nice place. Kid friendly and close to most attractions and water sports etc. The highlight for us had to be the food! Fantastic choice for breakfast and dinners were superb. We did not have lunches here so I can't comment but overall it was excellent. The other thing was the service..everyone was so kind and courteous in the hotel. We were travelling with a kid and infant and they were most helpful. Special mention about Tushara who looked after us. Will visit again soon

Heritance Ahungalla: Heritance Ahungalla is an Ideal place to enjoy with your family. Appreciate their friendly services. International foods as well as Authentic Sri Lankan Cuisine. Thank u Heritance Ahungalla

This was my second visit to the Hotel and I was not disappointed. All staff I encountered was friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the wide selection of food laid out for the buffet with many options for those are health conscious / vegetarian. Love the architecture / design of the hotel which has an old world charm. This resort hotel being steps away from the beach is also a plus point. I was able to walk along the sea shore. Due to the sea breeze, the corridors of the hotel were damp/slippery however the staff had put up notices to caution visitors. Hotel need to caution guest in a more direct manner about sea-bathing when the sea is rough, as I saw a guest being stuck at sea, unable to come to the shore due to the strong current being rescued by the hotel staff. My only disappointment was that out of the two swimming pools, the less crowded one was not open to gussets due to maintenance. The whole atmosphere of this hotel is laid back ad makes you feel you are in an oasis, cut out of the daily hustle and bustle of city life. Overall it was a wonderful and relaxing holiday.

We went there with a group of colleges as a company retreat. First impression of the hospitality and hotel surrounding were great. Check in time was 2.00pm but they were kind to give our rooms at their earliest, we received our room at 11.00am. The room is very clean and attractive. we got sea view room in the 3rd floor. When it comes to swimming pool, it is located closer to sea and has a beautiful view. Meals are excellent. was in a huge range. more likely to combination of delicious sea foods.

Have to say, its not a great hotel in need of some serious updating, lots of new hotels about to open very close by so they either need to up their game or rebuild the place. Beach sellers/beggers were a pest and security didn't seem too bothered with their presence, one lunch time we watched some sneaking in. Buffet restaurant, was not well stocked once the first lots of food was taken, the room didn't seem all that clean, bedrooms were tired, the ala cart restaurant was empty and expensive for the food on offer.

Went with two kids under the age of five and they thoroughly enjoyed the stay. The sea was very rough and that is always the case on the west coast at this time of the year - so bathing in the sea was out. But we made sand castles, dug for small crabs and enjoyed the beach. The pool is huge and is three feet except for the deep section which is clearly mentioned. we and our kids enjoyed the pool, although we did miss not having a baby pool where the kids could play more freely. The food was good - the breakfast and lunch menus were more enjoyable than the dinner. All in all, a place we will definitely go back to.

The place is really quiet and nice with the sea view. I have been their twice. They also upgrade my room for my second visit without any additional charge (with the availability) . I also participated their earth hour celebration. The food was awesome . They have huge varieties. Staff was so friendly and helpful.

We had 2 nights here. Very good customer service. but need to give some feedback about the buffet in main restaurant, their is no large verity of foods. i was there for my birthday. they were arrange me a surprise birthday cake.Thanks for a lovely surprise. Room 329 is superb.

I recently visited Heritance with a group of friends after my wedding in Sri Lanka. We stayed there for 3 nights. The hotel itself was comfortable, with all the necessary amenities. The highlight was definitely the pool, which was great as the monsoon meant swimming in the beach wasn't possible. Another highlight was the quality of food at the dinner buffet which had great variety. The hotel has been there for a number of years and it turns out Aitken Spence (the company which owns the hotel) is opening another large hotel just down the road in the coming months. This may explain the "tired" state of Heritance as it seems like there hasn't been a lot of recent investments. Another disappointment was the lack of evening entertainment. Because Ahungalla itself is secluded with very little night life or day time options (compared to Hikkaduwa or Bentota) it was a shame that the night time activities were so limited. The only options we found were a tired lounge bar, and quiet pool side bar. When I compare it to other hotels in Bentota which had more live music and more bars it was disappointing.

very friendly staff specially need to mention Mr. Thushara Gnanarathna (Restaurant & Bar Manager) setting a example for rest of the staff, tasty food & lot to choose had good time. I have recommend my friends & family to have nice hotel experience @ Heritance Ahungalla.

We arrived at Ahungalla Heritance for our anniversary. The arrival drinks were custom made for us, which was a treat from the random fruit drink we would normally receive at other hotels. We got room 208, which is a wonderful suite facing the ocean and gardens. They provided a cot for our son and there were enough sofa's to sleep our other child. We got a triple room and did full board. If you do not do full board, the cafe has a great menu for lunch. I inquired about all inclusive packages and was quoted 5100 rupees per person for all you can drink. This only includes local brands of hard liquor. Each drink typically costs 500-750 rupees, so It would be the equivalent of 6 drinks/person. We opted to simply purchase when we were thirsty. The buffet has been one of the best we have been too. The service is impeccable and they are very attentive to the kids. They offer us kids items such as fries, ice cream even though not on the buffet to ensure our kids are happy. The food has been very tasty and high quality. I cannot say enough about the restaurant service and Pravin the manager of the food services has been very attentive. The pool is nice and the seating lines the pools. I don't like how locals hover at the edge of the resort beach hoping to sell us on tours, etc.. They are not too bothersome, in that you just say no and they leave you alone, it just feels odd. I would recommend this hotel and if you have children, certainly feel comfortable to book room 208 which has ample of room for your family. The bathtub is a jetted tub and our kids loved bubbles baths after a long day at the pool It was actually a hi light for them.

Traveled with family for my mom's birthday. All of us had a wonderful holiday special mention to the beautiful, clean beach. My 15month old toddler loved everything about this hotel the beach the pool etc was a bit worried about the room condition as the hotel is a bit old but no problem what so ever... Keep up the great work....

We had 5 nights here with 3 adults and 2 kids. After a bit of a slow check in and having to swap rooms because of renos, we settled in and had a merry old time. Fab swimming pool and warm, friendly and very helpful staff. The food was terrific, we ate in all the restaurants in this hotel. The amazing team in the kitchen cooked us up some top seafood nosh. Loved the beach dining. There were a few niggling issues with a lack of hot water hot water and dodgy door locks but that aside I would not hesitate to recommend. Ware the beach boys prowling the shore, ready to pounce, and I don't recommend swimming in the surf, massive undertow!!

This is a beautifully set out hotel, it has 2 swimming pools, the deluxe rooms were excellent. We meet DK the chef on our second night there, he is a decorated chef, he had great pleasure in showing us around his vast kitchen, the chocolate room is a must. Thank you very much for showing us your little museum, it was one of the highlights of our trip. And congratulations to you and your staff for all your awards. We did the boat trip on the Madu River, was ok, ensure you have plenty of money for tipping.

I had a problem when I was having a shower. Water suddenly stopped. I informed the operator twice and waited for more than 15 minutes. No one came so I could not finish my shower :(. The bell boy was very careless. I personally told him to be careful with my CK bag. Not to put it on floor. When The bag is inside the room I noticed dust marks on the bag :( Food is good. Gym and swimming pool is good too. Other staff members were acceptable and one front office staff member was exceptional (Kanishka).

A quaint 36 years old very well maintained beach resort Hotel with one of the finest and largest infinity swimming pools! The only problem was that the exhaust in the bathrooms was not working. Each room faces pool and some rooms face the sea too. The food ( especially the sea food) was excellent at this people.

wonderful place to relax. We went there for a nice meal and the service was superb along with the food. Great place to have a nice meal and relax by the pool. There are large open areas with great views of the ocean so nice at night to take a walk on the beach which is wide.

We only went here to hangout at the cafe and to check out the architecture. The architect of this phenomenal hotel was Geoffrey Bawa. It has a classic feel and just heading in through the gates take you back in time. For all those who love the arts and aesthetics this place is a must, even if for an afternoon visit. We sat here for a couple of hours just to relax and unwind, sipping at our coffee and nibbling on some snacks. It was lovely just sitting there by the poolside and watching it simply become a part of the great visual expanse of the sea. It was almost surreal being there, knowing that this historic building had withstood the Tsunami although apparently the entire ground floor has generally been swept away. We never got to see the rooms, although we did tour the hotel going up a couple of floors and taking quite a few pics there. It was simply exquisite just being there. Great ambiance and welcoming and polite staff. Majority of the crowd here seemed to be Westerners and Arabs.

This is a older hotel but we enjoyed staying here. It has a lovely big pool. The water was so warm. The hotel could do with a reimbursement as the furniture is a bit old. We visited the Brief gardens and house of Bevis Bawa. THis was very interesting and full of history.

A place with a beautiful set up. Food is commendable. Two pools. Very good customer service. Valentine's day and other theme nights are celebrated. Suites are available such as Tendulkar. Had an amazing experience. Tasted chili chocolates. Lobster thermidor is done exceptionally well. "Yara tea" is also prepared. A must visit as it leaves nostaligic experiences.

This place is awesome. Very friendly, helpful staff. Rooms were immaculate and the towel origami animals on the beds at night were fantastic. The restaurant had everything and if they didn't you cold ask and they would be happy to make it for you. We asked for butter chicken one night as it wasn't in the buffet and within minutes it was on our table. The two pools were pristine and no one seemed to mind when the kids made a bit of noise and a splash. Loved the beach and the surf was pretty good for body surfing. Remember to get out before dark or the sea snakes will get you. There's a nice private adults bar which made a good escape from the kids. Plenty to do for everyone. Excellent all round. Can't wait to go back!

This hotel, designed by the renowned architect Geoffrey Bawa, is about 30 years old (or more), and at the time it was built it was the leading hotel in the South West coast and despite the addition of numerous other hotels since, it remains very competitive.The "infinity" pool when seen as one enters the hotel appears to stretch into the horizon. The hotel is well-patronised. wi-fi in rooms is free.

Second time here since the last time in 2011. Read my full review as that still stands though all the renovations have been completed. Still a lovely hotel and enjoyed it even more with a large group and used more of the facilities. This time around I tried buffet at Lunch and Dinner - WOW - lovely lovely food. Especially the curries. Full international on offer too and so much too choose from and the sweet bar was laden. All in All a lovely weekend at a lovely location and hotel. :-)

This is a beautiful property with incredible views.They have 2 large swimming pools and plenty of amenities to keep you occupied. This is our last night but we have had a great stay. Check in was great with Khan , he was helpful and very gracious. We had one of the suits with incredible views. Their buffet needs improvement , increasing live cooking stations, better service. The pool Bar and Mustard were great. I ENJOYED my meals there. Housekeeping was great and Staff were wonderful and warm. The hotel will need to advertise their other dinning venues as they are better , with good service and great food. I think its a great property stretched on large piece of land and does not appear too crowded We loved the location and Ambience An issue I had was looked after promptly by Duty manager. Thank you

Stayed for 02 nights and had an awesome relaxing time. The hotel has its own beach and a superbly designed swimming pool by Geoffery Bawa overlooking the beach.The staff is very friendly and helpful..
