We only stayed for 2 days but it was super relaxing and enjoyable. We were upgraded to a better room in arrival and it was a pleasant surprise. Our room was on the top floor with a gorgeous view of the sea. The room was big, clean and tidy. It had plenty of room for our 1 1/2 year old son to prance around which was a big plus point. Bathroom was also very clean and neat with all required amenities. The breakfast, lunch and dinner buffet has a huge spread of dishes including so many seafood dishes as well. I have to mention that they had a little buffet type thing for kids as well with finger food and little sweet treats. This was ideal for our son and he enjoyed the food. The pools are well kept and clean. Overall the stay was very enjoyable. One tiny thing I need to mention is the lighting in the room. It was a little dark as the lights are all set with shades. Other than that it was a really enjoyable stay and would highly recommend it to anyone.

This property claims to be a 5 star property. Yes there is a 24 hour coffee shop etc but they have many things to fix before they can claim to be in par with 5 star resort properties in the Asian region. For example the ugly garden, dirty exterior walls and the nasty smells in the lobby and the lifts. The old fashioned keys to the rooms with only one key the double and triple rooms too where guests have to juggle that single key among themselves to leave or access the room. The minibars that are not stocked as on the list and the sizeable spider we had in one room. The in-room and poolside rain showers that don't have enough pressure and the pool that doesn't open until very late in the morning. Having said all that, the staff are super courteous. They go out of the way to anticipate the needs of guests and help often. There were lots of such instances. One morning I was stranded outside the room wet and cold, because of their one key issue and a supervisor passing by got the door opened for me to get in even without my making a request. The main restaurant has only a full dinner buffet priced at Rs 3,000 ++ , much dearer than even the best of the best in Colombo and they don't serve a-la-carte. So while dining in the Coffee shop we casually asked the Supervisor whether the main restaurant's buffet catered for "starters only" or "desserts only" diners as many 5 star hotels in Colombo do. That was not the norm at this hotel. However, within a few minutes the Supervisor had spoken to her Boss and got approval for us to have a Dessert buffet in the main restaurant at a very nominal price per head. her name was Gayathri and throughout the stay we saw her working her magic with other guests too and keeping an eye on all the tables. The rooms are nice and comfortable. The mattresses and bed linen excellent. The quality of the towels though can improve a little to vie for 5 star quality. Yes, the tea/coffee making stuff need to be hidden away, but they can be made more user friendly with an easily accessible plug point and one with the correct sized and shaped holes, some liquid milk in the fridge etc.

We wanted a quiet beach holiday, not bothered where in the world and found the Heritance Ahungalla which seemed to be just what we wanted. We booked our holiday as a package through Travelbag with flights, accommodation and private transfers. The flights were with Sri Lankan Airlines and we were able to get a great price for Business Class so treated ourselves.. After a two hour journey from the airport we arrived at the hotel and it looked even better than it did in any photo that we saw when researching our holiday. We were taken room 202 which is an Ocean Front Deluxe room. The location was great, close to everything and no noise issues. Some reviews had mentioned that the rooms were getting a bit tired but our room was fine. For nine of the ten nights of our holiday our room attendant was the amazing Saman who kept our room spotless and also presented us with towel art every day. There was a minor maintenance issue that was quickly fixed after a phone call. We were able to see a renovated room while we were there and while it was very nice we didn't feel like we were missing out an anything with our room. We were on an all inclusive package and loved the variety of food and drink available. There was more than enough choices at the restaurant for all meals and there seemed to be plenty of choices for people on dietary restrictions. On our package wine was only available at meal times but there were plenty of drink choices at the pool bar to keep us happy. We were there during the quiet season so the amazing pool seemed empty most of the time, tour groups used the hotel but they were mainly only there in the evenings. Often it was the case that there would be 46 guests in the restaurant for lunch and then over 250 for dinner, at no time did this affect the high service standards. There are local traders on the beach selling tour and souvenirs. We did go on tour to Yala booked through a beach trader after he was recommended by another guest and while we had a great day in hindsight we would have preferred to use one of the hotel drivers. We used a hotel driver to go to Galle a few days later and his driving standards were so much better and we then realised that we should have used him for Yala. The hotel does not seem to push excursions but reception has a price list if you ask. The WiFi seemed very good. WiFi passwords are available from reception, each device needs it's own code and you will need a new password after 7 days. The staff were all always helpful and friendly and all helped us to have a lazy holiday!

I have been visiting Heritance Ahunghalla ( formerly Triton Ahunghalla) since I was a small kid as my parent favorite holiday destination was this hotel. In the good old days it took a 3 to 3 1/2 hours to travel from Colombo , but now with the southern highway you can come in 45 minutes. The hotel has sustained its quality in service and comfort over the years and the food served is among the best rated in any hotel in the island in terms of taste and variety. The staff is extremely good and I specially appreciate Mr. Thushara Manager F&B who was extremely nice to us and my little baby , constantly ensuring that our stay was pleasant. What i like most about Heritance is the unending breeze that you get near the pool and reception area , this breeze is such a pleasing experience.

I like this hotel . Not only me my wife and even my daughter. Sice this was our 4th stay felt more comfortable. Got free upgrade. Food was not that great ( dinner), but breakfast was ok. I love the pool.

Great Place, Friendly staff, good food, large Pools, lots of places and things to do nearby. Rooms are fairly large and the Suits have nice different themes and all are excellent . They go out of their way to make sure you have a pleasant stay and upon request will arrange special Romantic dinners and cater to many other requests as well. overall Loved it.

We visited the last two weeks of June and we had an amazing stay. The hotel was superb.... Everything from the the design of the hotel... It's beautiful pools... And the staff who just can not do enough for their guests. Uppal the general manager is so helpful and I am sure he is totally proud of all his staff. We loved the wildlife in the grounds.... From monkeys to iguanas around the pool to the sweet little squirrels which my husband fed daily and they all followed him around. The staff who do the rooms and look after you around the pool and in the bars just want to deliver first class service and they do. We ate in the main buffet restaurant and also in the a la carte restaurant a few times.i have food allergies and the chefs could not stop trying to deliver me special food... It became a joke that I always ended up with a least 3 plates of food in front of me. One lady who was lovely and ensured that we were always happy where ever we were eating was Gayathri.... She was so friendly. And it was lovely to hear all about her wedding next year. The hotel is next to the beautiful sandy beach which we loved walking along. If I could just change one thing it would be to get Uppal to get his staff down to the beach and spend an hour filling bin liners with all the rubbish that is being washed up , due to the flooding and rubbish going into the rivers and then into the sea. Myself and my husband, our daughter and her fiancÃ© will definitely be returning as this was a holiday which certainly met our wishes and more.

Best food, superb rooms, having 2 pools and really exclusive, beachfront and can walk on the beach, beautiful architecture of the hotel & very friendly and helpful staff. One time in life to experience this hotel usca must.

Third visit Food is as always the Best and the service has been always good exceptional , stayed for two nights and was amazing just mentioning Diyabath on the previous day , it was available the next days breakfast ( A Sri lankan traditional dish made from Red Rice cooked mixed with raw onion and green chili with fresh coconut cream) Need a Facelift to the place very badly , place needs renovation ! Pool sides needs more attention from staff ! Enjoyed the Special Sri Lankan Show !

The hotel was great with a fantastic sea view. The rooms were large, clean and comfortable. The service was excellent from the arrival. The buffet was the best with a huge spread. They got variety of choices and a wide range. The pool was very nice and overall a wonderful place to relax.

One of the best hotel located on the west coast of Sri Lanka. Vast, luxurious, spacious, multi pools, many bars across the property located 45 minutes north of Galle and 2 and 1/2 hours south of Colombo Airport via the new Express way. Great beach. Lovely gardens. The rooms are large, well appointed, with lots of wood all around. Nice spa attached to the hotel. Friendly and helpful staff

I visited with my family and kids loved the hotel... Nice location, very friendly staff and clean, neat rooms... We were given an upgrade too. Nice pools and delicious food.Had a lot of variety in dinner buffet... Worth every cent we spent.

Visited with family for a day out. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. The pool has gorgeous views of the ocean. The best part is that it's enormous so there's tons of space. The lunch buffet is top notch. The spread was huge and despite going late for lunch there was plenty of food. Waiters could be more attentive to tables as we had to repeatedly request them to refill our glasses. A special mention should go to Supuni at the front desk for going out of her way accommodate us. Plus she takes amazing photos!

We have stayed in this hotel during August 2015. Hotel is on a very nice location, though property is a bit old. Rooms are nice but insist on sea-view rooms which are closer to beach. Property is stretched on a large area and if you got the room at the other corner, it becomes painful to walk each time you want to go to room, so it is better to take room near reception. Poolside area was nice and hotel has multiple well managed pools. Food was also nice and there are lots of options to choose from.

We finally decided to give this hotel a shot as we were traveling through the area mainly due to its architecture (Jeffrey Bower design) and location. Sadly this place failed us. Trivago lists the room that we were given for around $90 US. We paid $175 per night for the two day stay with the full understanding that we'll be getting a decent room. I was expecting much better accommodations given it's the off season and the hotel in near empty. Firt room we got was so bad that I refused it immediately. They then moved us to a different "deluxe" room, as I was told, which was marginally better than the first one. The bathroom is dirty, no bath robes in the room and the view is sub par. The room is located in the far corner of the hotel. It is a smoking room and we were not offered the option to choose whether we needed a smoking room or not. It's puzzling to me that the hotel staff felt this room is consistent with a 5 star hotel. I'd rate this place and our experience at 3 stars at best! I've given them two opportunities to rectify the situation and they utterly failed both times. They've had a golden opportunity to wow us and grantee a repeat customer but for some reason, that I still can't understand, they chose to make sure that we will not come back again. In this copetitive field, where there are many other options availabe, the accommodation we've received is not what I had expected from a Heritance chain (Kandalama in contrast was fantastic). We'll be in this country 3 more days and was hoping to to spend it in this area had they met our expectations. Instead we'll be moving to the Hilton in Colombo for the remainder of our stay. Needless to say that this is the first and the last time for us in this perticular facility. Situation of this type do not warrant a third chance. To the management team... look very closely into the culture that is set forth. I don't think you can afford to have customers like us, who travel all over the world and are often in Sri Lanka, to be this dissatisfied with your facilities. Every one that complains on a site like this, ten goes without taking the time to do so yet they are just as dissatisfied. You're alianating the very customers that is your life blood. This is an absolute self inflicted wound.

Good food and good service. by the way rooms are not so spacious comparing other Srilankan 5*s.. We booked a triple room it's basically just adding foldable single bed to the double room. So the space become limited. And it's time for renovation. And it's fare to mention here that we were bit annoyed at reservation at head office that they rejected to apply the out of the season discount for gift voucher. the voucher is paid in full by cash and its obviously equal to cash. And I had to convince them to apply the discount. Which is not fare and ethical by the way all the hotels gives big discounts this season for locals.

Travelled here for 2 nights stay with friends which was an utter disappointment, been an Atkins group hotel we expected more valued services. There's is so many things wrong in this hotel firstly The rooms, I have been to so many hotels I have not seen such a dirty room, from the kettle to the floor is filthy if you are looking for basic hygiene this isn't the hotel to stay. Broken plug points, toilet leaking underneath, shower door with full of dried soap marks, and many other issues as on pictures.

To all the staff members at Heritance Ahungalla. Both of us would like to thank you all very much for your kind support throughout our stay. You guys were such an amazing team from friendliness to well experienced service. Food was delicious with a great variety. We had a lovely time. Hope to come again. Highly recommend the hotel....Room 321

A excellent hotel with an excellent staff.The food is extraordinary and the two swimming pools by the beach are splendid and the beautiful beach just a few yards away. We enjoyed every second of our stay.A must visit place indeed!

Friendly helpful staff, good banter. They shared the hidden treasures of the hotel kitchen and showed us their collection of food sculptures. Lovely pool and beach. Food amazing, especially the seafood. Thank you for the fantastic experience.

Buffet for 3 meals, great variety. Very good access to beach. Large beach. Rooms are nice and well maintained. Views are not that beautify or unique, but lean and nice. Large hotel with lot of rooms. Some times had to walk long distance to get to the room. We booked 2 rooks and they allocated us 2 rooms apart, bit disappointing. Staff seems bit confused at time. We arrived early. They first told us to take the lunch and then later go to rooms. then when we went to take lunch, buffet staff told us lunch is open in another 40 mins. Then we went back to reception and they arranged us to go to our rooms. Ideally, staff should know at what time the buffets are opening and advice customer accordingly. Seems they did not know which time the lunch is opening.

one of best hotel we stayed in our sri lankan holiday. and the beach was perfect and peaceful. staff was friendly and helpful always. around the hotel you can see local life and villages. i will recommend this lovely hotel to any travels in Ahungalla area. Thank you.

Hotel has great sea view good veg food staff is helffull and keeps their best to keep guest happy some rooms are not up to mark due to small ants hotel organises events to keep the guest busy. Location is also good thanks to all staff members for making our holiday memorable

On our way from Colombo to Galle we stopped by this establishment without prior reservation. The grand driveway and facade of the Heritance Hotel where impressive at first sight. Having arrived there the good impression faded quickly. The room rate given at the reception was US-Dollar 140 per room without breakfast, which is expensive for the island, but we accepted without a written receipt. First of all we had to wait over 1 hour to get the room. By that time the dinner was about to finish, so we were advised to go to the restaurant where a buffet was presented. The quality of the dishes were far from higher standards. The room was alright, but nothing special. The hotel was crowded with tourist groups from China. The next morning by the tome of check-out a bill was presented of 280 US-Dollar. The chef concierge refused to get the man on duty from yesterday night. The outrageous room rate was ompared by us with rates shown on booking sites. The same night rooms had been available from 58 US-Dollar! After were rude discussions we left the hotel with a "discount" of 60 US-Dollar and paid incredible 220 US-Dollar. A never come back experience!

Travelled here to part of our office annual trip and certainly lived upto the expectations. The rooms are well maintained and face the sea. Our room located in 4th floor(some staffers say 'sachchin's suite) that faced the sea and the wind blowing towards us. What I liked most was the pool which was amazing in the evenings. It faced the sea and gives a stunning sight towards sunset.

What a lovely place, we have had a great room which was in direct view of the pool and sea, we also had a room close to the bar which we personally liked as we could sit on our balcony and listen to the music. The food was amazing and if you meet the head chief he will want to give you the tour of his kitchen and will make a point of making you feel special with cooking something fresh for you. The entertainment was interesting on some nights and was not to our taste. We used the gym every day which was awesome and had a fantastic view of the pool. This is the pool we used in the day as it was quieter, if you get one close to the gym the bar does open up for you on occasion but not very often. I would return as I really enjoyed it. We did the turtle sanctuary and safari which was good.

Travelled here to spend 3 days and the hype certainly lived upto the expectations. The rooms are well maintained and face the sea. Our room had a corridor that faced the sea and the wind blowing towards us. What I liked most was the pool which was amazing in the evenings. It faced the sea and gives a stunning sight towards sunset.

From the moment you arrive till your departure the hospitality is amazing. All the staff is very friendly. The food is lovely. The hotel atmosphere is breath taking. The spa is also superb... I will definitely visit again...

Designed by Sri Lanka's most influential architect, Geoffrey Bawa, Heritance Ahungalla sits in a quiet tropical location on one of Sri Lanka's untouched beaches. Quieter than it's neighbouring Bentota, Ahungalla is a perfect location to get away from it all. With light and airy rooms and spacious, tree-lined corridors, the hotel, along with its show-stopping infinity pool blends seamlessly with its surrounding tropical landscape and the Indian Ocean beyond. We spent 2 blissful days lounging around the different spaces the hotel had to offer. Three restaurants, spacious rooms with balconies, numerous reading rooms and the poolside mean that there is enough space to ignore (if not completely avoid) the package holiday crowds should you wish. Bike hire is a good way to explore the surrounding countryside. I understand that there are plans to renovate the hotel. I hope the updates are respectful of the hotel's charming heritage.

We stayed the night in a luxury room with a huge sitting/dining area and a separate king bedroom area. Lots of space for our little ones. Room was well appointed and amenities as listed on hotel website. Eventhough bathroom was good size, the raised up jacuzzi tub with an overhead shower was impratical. Literally need to climb in and out of the tub. We didn't experience the award winning cuisine from the buffet dinner. (Extremely salty grilled prawns, burnt BBQ meat. Poor food presentation). Breakfast was a tad better. Our benchmark was the dinner buffet at Heritance Kandalama. That's what we called award winning. We enjoyed the two pools and the wonderful beach right at the hotel doorstep. The service from the staff was excellent. Hotel ground was beautiful with a majestic view of the Indian Ocean especially from the lobby. Recommended if you get a good deal otherwise not worth paying the high price as this is 3.5 stars not luxury 5.

Good property, nice location with some good team to take care of guests. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay as team there was always ready to help. On a suggestive note....since other properties are coming up in vicinity as well, need to improve rooms a bit and increase menu as well. Rest....perfect property and recommended.

We have just returned from our first trip to Sri Lanka. We had a wonderful time and Sri Lanka is stunning. We stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla expecting a little bit more than we got however the biggiest disappointment was how dirty and aged the rooms were. There was no bath and the shower was filthy as was the rest of the room. My son on the first night was sick (not sure how) however we asked that the room be fully cleaned the next day which is was not. You could still see the smears of sick on the floor from where we had cleaned during the night. The bed sheets were also stained and did make you wonder if the sheets were clean stains or not. The corridors to the rooms were also in a poor condition and looked more like the corridors on a run down housing estate (I can say that as I lived on one for 5 years). The bathroom amenities are also just refills with dirty lids so make sure you bring your own! However!! The staff were amazing and so attentive and the natural beauty of Sri Lanka makes it all worth while. Would we go back to the same hotel? No! Would we go back to Sri Lanka? Yes! Yes Yes! Special mention to Sri Lankian immigration too who are so friendly. Looking forward to returning to Sri Lanka.

I wud say no hotel has impressed me.so much. From. The hotel staff to the kitchen staff all were very helpful and friendly. This was my second d visit. Food was superb as always. Wud visit again definitely.

We can this hotel fully recommended. Service staff and everybody in this hotel was excellente. Food was delicious and different every day. My husband had birthday celebration and received from hotel birthday cake. For my next trip I will choose this hotel again

We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights. Our room was with a kitchen view and smell. Our room was certainly not delux. 2 main pools, beautiful beach with golden sand. Very tasty food and poolside bar had wonderful cocktails. Kindly and helpful staff. I'm not sure if I would award this hotel 5 stars. It is perhaps closer to 4 -. Don't expect a high 5 star experience. And - be carefull with some tuk-tuk guys on the beach. Remember - you are here just walking cash machine. Enjoy!

We had not been to this Hotel in over a year but decided to stay for one night on a credit card offer. Used to be a good hotel even prior to rebanding but I think its now at its best ever. Right from the relaxed check in where you are seated and the forms are brought to you whilst being served with a cold tower and fresh juice, you know there is attention to detail. The service is almost preemptive and is always with a smile wherever you go. Two swimming pools mean you can usually find your quiet corner somewhere. Helps that this hotel is blessed with one of the best stretches of beach on the Southern cost, with pure golden sand. The highlight for me was the food though.I honestly havent seen a hotel execute gourmet level food for mass consumption at buffets the way it was done during our stay. The type of produce the Chef is given is amazing (think Lamb, Duck, Giant Lagoon prawn etc) however I have been to hotels where the kitchen isnt quite sure what to do with such produce. After two stunning "buffet" meals better than some of the gourmet gastronomic meals we have tried at Colombo restaurants I actually asked to meet the head Chef, and was introduced to Roshan Pujitha. Chef Roshan was really friendly and willing to share whatever secrets he could. The secret to pulling off amazing dishes in both meals was using fewer ingredients and matching the sauces perfectly to the main. The highlights ranged from roast lamb falling off the bone with mint sauce, tempura prawns with the perfectly crisp batter and giant lagoon prawn with a delightful cheese sauce to spicey pork ribs with pineapple. Not trying too hard to overeach but going to with the well recognized methods of preparations whilst matching the sauces perfectly, the kitchen staff here are really special. At dessert time the hits kept coming, one of the best dark chocolate mousses with low sugar (using low sugar here as opposed to the customary uber sweet desserts in Sri Lanka is something the chefs here have mastered) led the way ably followed by a divine banana custard, a mango panacotta, a milk chocolate, caramel and biscuit base slice, each bang on point and a sparkling example of how to keep dessert light, fresh and easy on the pallet after a heavy meal. I am sorry I am going over the top here with the food but honestly I have been so disappointed at falling standards of buffet fare at the bigger hotels in Sri Lanka recently (even in the capital Colombo) that I wanted to give a special pat on the back to Chef Roshan and his team The room was comfortable. A comfortable library with some English books (mostly foriegn languages though) and a gym (which I obviously didnt use, as it looked far to healthy) I think most rooms have ocean views, but if not it is worth asking for. Wifi is free and fast. One thing to note is that it can be quite a walk for meals, its worth asking for a room close to the lobby lift area if you are with kids or other guests who have difficulty in walking I sincerely hope the Hotel and the Group is able to retain their staff and keep them happy. We saw lots of high end tourists from all over the world and I am sure that will continue as long as Heritance Ahungalla continues to do everything right. 5 Golden Stars!

We stayed at this hotel for ten nights earlier this month. The setting is superb and the hotel was beautiful. The sea was too rough to swim in but the hotel pools made up for this. In fact the main pool is one of the most beautiful we have seen. Our room was very good with a sea view. We went bed and breakfast and the breakfast options were varied. We ate a few nice meals at the reasonably priced a la carte restaurant but mostly used a couple of local restaurants a short walk up the beach. Our favourite was The Sunshine about a quarter of a mile up the beach to the right - basic, but lovely food and a great atmosphere. Ahungalla is a small fairly quiet place but we did a couple of trips and would really recommend going up to the hill country and Kandy, Tooth Temple and taking in the elephant orphanage and other places on the way. It is quite a long trip for one day, but well worth it.

We stayed two nights over a weekend. At the very beginning we were disheartened by a welcome which made us feel inferior to foreigners. Room was well decorated. However, they have not met over request to provide us with a king size bed, but only provided two attached single beds. Balcony overlooking the beach added value to the stay. Restaurant and food was superb with lots of variations in local and continental cuisine. Selection of wine range was good. Candle light dinner at the beach can be arranged by a request. Due to rain we were unable to do that. Poolside bar had wonderful cocktails. Enjoyed the night time cultural events. Visit to Madu Ganga and Turtle Hatchery can add extra value to your journey during the hotel stay.

The pool and the Beach was so relaxing and it was a nice stay for us in this hotel. The staff was also very kind and helpful. The buffet was very delicious with many varieties and I highly recommend everyone to Visit this beautiful place â¤

Visited the hotel in Jan with my extended family members. We we upgraded to a luxury room on the arrival and it was really nice. In the evening there was a magic show followed by some snacks for kids and they really enjoyed it. As usual buffet is really good with lot of choices. Pool , Beach and the surrounding offers a lot to enjoy the holidays...

We visited as a family with our 21/2 yr old daughter.loved t pool though there was no baby pool.food was great and the chefs personally attended to our daughter's preferences too.rooms were comfortable.altogether a great place to stay

When we arrived we were taken to a room that clearly wasnt set up for us and our two kids. Not only was no baby beds set up, we could not commit to the room as it was too dangerous for our kids. The balcony had steps to railing, which meant our 1 year old could jump or climb over. There were holes i the railing where our 1 year old could slip through. We then spent almost 2 hours looking for another suitable room. Its been horrible as the only room they could put us in has no floor space to walk as the infants beds and pram take up the entire room. Im so sad that i bought my family here on a holiday as its horrible. They are moving us rooms but this is costing a lot more. This place is not for families.

The place is beautiful although can get crowded during peak holidays/weekends. the rooms are comfortable big and luxury as well. However, was not a big fan of the widely spread buffet as nothing tasted exceptional. It was average for the price paid. Other than that a great place to spend your holiday

This was I think our 10 th visit since inception in 1984. The grandeur has not diminished much with time & the hotel is due for a overhaul perhaps next year. The food as always was excellent both in the main dining area & the coffee shop. We met Gamini the f&b manager & his deputy Thushara whom we first got to know at the sister hotel in Kandalama in the 1990's-they both recognised us & made our stay that much more enjoyable-thank you. hoping to revisit when next in this beautiful Island perhaps next year

One night stay on the 14th and we wished we could have stayed few more days ... Beautifully Engineered hotel surrounded by the natures beauty overlooking the ocean ,. We were given a free upgrade and it made our trip even more splendid , food is always awesome practically at all Heritance resorts. Friendly staff and always at your service , I would recommend anyone to first speak to Chathuranga the front office executive who is a very nice and kind boy, always gives priority to guests and looks into all their needs to make the guests holiday joyful, his Courteous and beautiful personality helps brighten overall the entire hotel and its image, I guess people like him should exists at all hotel sectors to make the guests have the assurance of a comfortable stay and have no regrets in choosing that particular hotel for a holiday at all.

We had 3 nights here at the end of our 16 day tour of Sri Lanka. Lovely big pool in the main part of the hotel ideal for all the family. Comfortable rooms although noise from the floor above came through our ceiling. The buffet restaurant could be very noisy so we found the cafe more to our taste, although being open sided with it's own music it was a little jarring on the ears when there was other music coming across from the pool bar. Staff very helpful. We left for the airport feeling a bit pushed as reception rang our room at 11.30 asking us to vacate, even though check out time was given as 12.

We went on an extended weekend break with friends to Srilanka and booked this place based on the recommendation given by a friend. Heritance Ahungulla truly gives you the best nature's experience with infinity pool right at the entrance and greener belt around with a view of the beach right in the front... They are also environment friendly and have taken care of the same in each room as well in terms of the space,ambience and toiletries usage... Only drawback is the food which I felt was just about fine..In terms of quantity there was enough but in terms of quality and service by the staff at the restaurant it needs a bit of improvement...but the warmth by the people and staff overcomes these drawbacks... However, overall the experience is brilliant as they have full fledged itinerary for each day activities and staff keeps you engaged throughout....

The entrance of the hotel puts into a state of peace. The pool starts from the reception lobby and ends next to Indian Ocean. The expanse stretches from the lobby to the horizon. The staff puts you to ease and takes care of filling the forms. This is just the beginning. The restaurant, the bar, the pool - everything is quite enthralling. The regular list of guests include Cyrus Broacha of Mtv fame. The pool was very relaxing. Diwali vacations well spent there. The biggest letdown of the hotel are the washrooms. The walls of the washrooms are Transparent GLASS. On expressing our disappointment the housekeeping stuff put up blinds. The space is very small inside the washroom. There are small terraces either facing a landscaped garden or pool. Mr. Praveen from the restaurant was very very helpful and upbeat. The age old preserved Lift was an added attraction. All in all we had a very good time and chilled out big time.

I'm not sure if I would award this hotel 5 stars. It is perhaps closer to 4 and a half or 4. It was a really pleasant stay and the staff were plentiful and helpful. I don't know if I would stay there again because it is expensive for what it is. I have stayed in similar places around Asia for much cheaper prices. The breakfast buffet was great. I enjoyed eating Sri Lankan breakfasts every morning. The help when booking tours was lacking. There wasn't much in the way of information and there was no price list. The hotel was only willing to book taxis for you and then you were on your own. I would recommend this hotel and the area to anybody but don't expect a high 5 star experience.

Delicious food dishes, Sri Lankan, Chinies, Lot of veraity with reasonable price.Staff waiter are very friendly.Atmosphere is good,both restaurant & baris near the pool.location of this hotel is excellent, ideal for the families .

This was the fourth and last hotel we stayed at during our journey through Sri Lanka, and although the first three had been amazing, too, we loved this one the most. The location is perfect. The facilities are really nice. We're a family of 4 (2 adults with 2 children aged 7 and 8) and spent 5 nights in a family room. The room was spacious despite the extra bed, and the view from our room was stunning. Such a treat to wake up looking at the ocean, after a hectic journey through the country. We loved the pool and the recreational area with sun beds around it. The staff was exceptionally friendly and well-trained. Breakfast and dinner buffets were splendid. So much good food, way too much for only one stomach ;-). We honestly loved every single items on both buffets, every day! The only trouble we faced was a smelly room. The room adjacent to ours was under refurbishment, and a strong smell of chemicals reached our room through the A/C. The issue was handled very professionally by the Duty Manager who offered us another room and complimentary free dinner. We were kept happy! The hotel features a play room with snooker and mini foot, carom, etc. The outside space is vast. always enough sun beds and smiles for every guests. A special shout out to Mahi, our favorite pool attendant, who made our stay so much more enjoyable :). The Heritance Ahungalla is worth a stay and comes highly recommended!

We stayed here for 2 nights with high expectation, but were a bit disappointed about the in room facility. The room is a bit old, the electric water pot was quite dirty. The tooth mug was dirty with crack, the shower gel container also had crack and without a cap. I don't expect all these for a 5 star hotel! Speaking of service particularly the restaurant serving the buffet. It takes me several attempt to refill the coffee and got the plates collected. The waitress saw us and not responding. However, they are responding proactively to non Chinese. This gave me a sense of discrimination! Despite the negatives, the swimming pool is fantastic. It faces the Indian Ocean which is awesome!

Very good place to spend you're holiday lot of entreatments. Good swimming pool . Beach swim , playing facility . Good service. Lot of food varieties . Relaxing , fun traditional Dancing shows. And we spent with tour guide Chinthaka . Baja Bike tours . He gave lot of facilities by located at Heritance Ahungalla

My wife and I got married at Heritance Ahungalla last month and the hotel more than met our expectation that it would be the perfect venue for the wedding. As a lot of these reviews have said, the location is stunning - and its natural beauty was perfectly complemented by the functionality of the hotel, as well the sincerity and attentiveness of the staff. We needed somewhere to host our big day and house the 130+ guests that were attending, and the scale of the hotel made it an obvious choice. But I'd just as happily spend time there with just my wife or a small group of friends. It caters for everyone because there's no end of things to do...or not do, as the case may be. We divided our time around the wedding day either relaxing by/in the two huge pools, working up a sweat on the beach volleyball courts or eating/drinking our way through the extensive food and beverage menus. And I honestly can't think of a better way to spend a holiday of this kind. One of the reasons we chose Heritance Ahungalla, over the countless other resorts on the south west coast of Sri Lanka, was the more local feel and authenticity to the service. As odd as it may sound, we didn't want guests to experience the sterile atmosphere that you sometimes encounter when you go to large international chains, where staff are all reading the same global manual on customer service. We were, after all, asking our friends to travel a large distance, so it was important to us that they experienced truly local hospitality, and that they did. The staff were extremely kind and friendly and bent over backwards for us, while their professionalism on the day of the wedding was consummate and went a long way to making it the success that it was. The food, both on the wedding day and generally, was fantastic. We'd paid for B&B and were delighted with the vast buffet laid on each morning at breakfast, offering both Western and local options; from cereal, pastries, fruit or a full English to the more traditional curry and hoppers. We ate an unbelievably fresh seafood lunch (which I highly recommend) at the aptly titled 'Jungle Beach Restaurant' just 300m walk up the beach from the hotel, but otherwise had lunch/dinner at any one of the hotel restaurants or bars. I'm not normally a fan of such a repetitive approach but the hotel food was simply too good to resist. On the wedding day we had the hotel serve up a Sri Lankan buffet, which proved a massive hit with the guests. Special thanks have to go to Gamini (F&B Manager) and KK for their help with organising the wedding and co-ordinating the countless moving parts on the day, Upul (GM) for his hospitality and joviality (he spent a large amount of time talking to guests and making sure they had everything they needed) and the front-of-house staff, who did an admirable job helping to unravel a bit of a screw-up with lost bookings that seemed to originate at the Colombo head office that we'd been dealing with up until that point. Guys, it was a day that will live long in our memories and we will forever be grateful for the role that you played in it. We visited countless other hotels over the course of the rest of our trip and there wasn't one that we thought would have been a better wedding venue. Thank you for making our dream wedding come true and we look forward to paying you a visit again soon.

As you enter, the view of the beautiful pool .... merging into a pristine beach ... merging into the sea sweeps you away. Unfortunately you don't get swept off your feet at this property. Since we didn't get a booking at the VIVANTA by Taj in Bentota we thought we'd try the Heritance. The property is run down and seems to have seen better days. A renovation should be on the cards sooner than later. We were upgraded to a suite named after the legendary Sachin Tendulkar but unfortunately the exhilaration of of the room or the hotel in no way matched the Little Master's batting. The room was ill-planned. No light switches and plug points in the right places, basins in which you couldn't splash your face, a Mini Bar fridge with a broken shelf, and never replenished, pathetic mal-functioning wifi...... and one could go on and on.... Minor glitches but collectively a huge nuisance for the price we paid. The biggest problem was the air-conditioning, never below 24 degrees Celsius. This in a hot and humid Bentota was a big problem. Two large swimming pools. Wow !! one for playing and kids and one for peaceful and serious swimmers like me. A Great idea! However the pleasure was short lived when we entered the pool. The water was cloudy and had particles flowing in it. Temperature was like soup. The Gym was exceedingly ill-equipped for the number of rooms. Only two treadmills, one of which was closed non-functional for the duration of my stay. One large dining area for buffets. One fine-dining restaurant but we never saw a living sole there in the 4 nights we spent. The food at the buffets were exceptional, but in case you're a vegetarian please be very careful. Options are very limited. Since large groups were coming in the buffet tables had huge queues. I for one am fond of nibbling tit bits going often to the table. But that was a Big no-no. Dealing with the lower staff is impossible. Not only is their a pathetic standard of English, many of them pretend to understand and say yes but things are not done. However I'd be failing in my duty if I didn't mention here, that the senior staff ably led by GM Mr Upul Peiris and the F&B Manager Gamini, were extremely courteous and helpful. Highly responsive. Problems brought to their notice were promptly attended to. I believe Mr Peiris has been here only for a few months. Seeing his leadership abilities and genuine concern for the customer I'm very sure these glitches should be a thing of the past very soon. The management needs to move from Responsiveness to Pro-activeness. My recommendation is to go here at a quiet time and not during peak season.

Pool & see in same level looking from Entrance and exiting beach area and very beautiful and well organized archaeological building and feel better in side the hotel. Very easy to reach from Colombo via Golle Road and better reception for welcome and food also better and delicious.

Good welcoming. Food was good. Need to improve the service. Beach was clean and nice. Room was too small for what we paid I think. But it is a nice place to stay and that was my second time there after attending a office conference. But as a hotel they need to have had other varieties of alcohol and tea rather than promoting the mother companies or its owner's products.

Wow what an amazing place. My son Ravin and his beautiful fiancÃ©e Liz got married at the Heritance 3 weeks ago. It was the perfect location for their wedding. They wanted a beach wedding and it was magical on the day. 95% of the guests travelled from overseas and also made it s holiday. The wedding was organized by the couple remotely from Australia with a bit of help from me and we pass on our heartfelt thanks to Gamini, the F&B manager and his team who worked tirelessly with us to make the day perfect for the bride and groom. KK who was a big part of the initial organizing team was unfortunately not around on the day as he left to work overseas Thanks KK! The food and drink was excellent matched by the great service which was enjoyed by all. Majority of the wedding guests stayed over in excess of 4 days and everyone enjoyed themselves. We ate together in large groups and there was fun and laughter all around. We could not fault the service. The staff were always smiling and so happy to help. The General Manager Mr Upul Pieris was often around chatting with the guests to make sure all was well. The front office team did a great job when some of the bookings had been messed up by their Head office and they were overbooked. Chathuranga who was there that night somehow sorted the mess and found rooms for these guests who were arriving late at night from Australia. So it's a big THANK YOU to the General Manager and staff of the Heritance Ahungalle for a wonderful job done. We heard only praise from all the wedding guests who stayed there. We highly recommend this beautiful hotel.

This hotel is just the place for you to relax , with 2 pools and the nearby sea , big and clean rooms , we ended our tour in Sri Lanka at this hotel , it had nothing magical as other places but certainly it is a place to rest and swim after a long journey ğŸ˜ƒ

Clean and nice beach, we recommend to families who is looking for silence and peaceful place to stay, good food and kind people. Rooms are getting old need a bit renovation and the drinks in minibar a bit rip off

This hotel lives up to its claims. Beautiful location on a stunning beach. Currently not overly developed so you'll feel like it's yours with only a handful of other beach dwellers Lovely restaurant choices and two fantastic swimming pools in the park like grounds. Lovely stay with a great room and awesome service. Well worth it. The beach hawkers are a bit intrusive but that was the only negative.

We had an Enjoyable and relaxed weekend.. excellent stuff coupled with good food and a clean, comfortable room! The stuff went out of their way to ensure that even our 5 year old son had a great time!

We stayed 4 nights at the hotel and had a nice room in front of the second/small swimming pool. The hotel has many facilities, different restaurants and a magnificent beach a minute from our room (literally). The breakfast was very good, many options available from fresh fruits to local, international or even indian cuisine. The staff is very friendly and accommodating and although breakfast ends at 10 am they will still let people have breakfast if they arrive late. The outside restaurant have a good variety of finger food, main dishes and deserts as well as different drinks. Our room was a bit smelly probably because of the humidity but i do not think the hotel could do much about it, our overall experience was very relaxing and we will be back for sure! Tips : if you walk north the hotel on the beach you will find a couple of nice restaurant where local fishermen sell fresh fish. The food is delicious !!

This is our third visit to the Heritance, our first being 33 years ago, when it was called the TRITON hotel. It is pleasing to see the approach, frontage to the hotel has not changed during all this time, despite being badly damaged by the Tsunami that hit Sri Lanka. The open air lobby, reception area still has all its colonial charm looking out to the sea beyond the large pool that extends into the lobby. We were fortunate to meet the recently arrived Executive General manager Mr Upul Peiris who as it happens was at the hotel as a junior manager 33 years ago. It was amusing going down "memory lane" and he was interested in our views of the hotel over the years. Mr Peiris and his management team were very keen on ensuring the hotel staff were committed to giving customer satisfaction and service. This was very apparent during our stay, an excellent service given by all staff. A special mention to SUDESH, pool bar waiter who looked after us so well.. Good selection of food ( Buffet style) in main restaurant with a very good a la carte and Fine Dining restaurants. As it happens we were at the Heritance over the Chinese New Year and had an influx of people from this country. They were noisy but kept to themselves although were quite rude and lacked manners when talking to the staff. In fairness this could have been due to the language problem. Have been advised the hotel bedrooms are due to be refurbished, the bathrooms are looking dated and need to be upgraded, however, rooms were kept clean and to a high standard. Would highly recommend the Heritance Hotel as a holiday destination. Had a great time and only regret is that we did not book a longer stay than the 10 days we were there. Will definitely be returning.

We had a very relaxing and enjoyable vacation after spending 4 nights at this 5 star hotel in Ahungalle. We stayed in a luxury room and the rest of our group in 4 other luxury rooms which were all fabulous in their own unique way. All rooms were extremely spacious and we were upgraded to a suite which had a huge living room along with a separate master bedroom equipped with flat screen, DVD player and sound system, a huge bathroom with shower stall, elevated jaccuzzi tub, separate his/hers sinks and a huge wrap around patio with deck chairs. I'll post some pictures to illustrate but please note these were taken just before we left so naturally the room was a bit messy. The hotel has all the amenities for fun with 2 outdoor pools, tennis courts, badminton court and table tennis. The main outdoor pool by the lobby overlooks the ocean and is very picturesque. We particularly enjoyed the other pool which had the shade of a large tree and hence it was never too sunny for a swim. The food was good with seafood at every meal and breakfast was by far the best meal as well as one night with a Sri Lankan fare dinner. Jananjaya a waiter from the main restaurant went out of his way to please and provided the best service I've ever experienced in a buffet setting. Kaushal one of the housekeepers was also very attentive and made lovely animals for our son from towels. Even David P a trainee at the hotel went above and beyond to ensure we had a great stay. Overall from the time we arrived the service was impeccable and probably largely attributed to the very unassuming and nice general manager Upul Peiris who appears to be leading from the front and has clearly set a high bar for the service culture, he mentioned he had previously managed several resorts in the Maldives. The only downside to this hotel is it was designed by a famous Sri Lankan architect who believes in blending in with nature and hence it is not safe for young kids to wonder around alone since the stairways do not have rails, there are ponds all over etc. There is also no separate kids swimming pool. The beach by the hotel is very nice, however, the ocean maybe a little too rough if waves and body surfing are not your thing.

The food is good, the hotel is old but nice. The pools are beautiful. The beach is clean but the waves are to high for swimming. The only but very anoying problem was they started renovating the rooms and stairs next to us and wrote our travel agency there won't be any renovation when we asked. That's not possible in a 5 star hotel.

I have stayed here several times and each time have been very content. The hotel is a beach front property with 2 large pools. It's a large hotel which is creatively designed to provide lots of areas to lounge and chill, including a small library. I would recommend for family get aways as there is additionally a table tennis table and a badminton court to keep occupied. The food buffet have a wide range of choice but the taste can be improved.

This is a beautiful hotel located designed by Geoffrey Bawa, beach side with stunning views. It's about 15 km south of Bentota, on the way to Galle. Lot of the original features have been restored after the Tsunami disaster. One gets a tremendous sense of proportion and to appreciate this have to get up early and stand in the hotel lobby and look across to the pool and sea on one side and the palm trees on the other side. On the plus side you have excellent staff, good food and service, with a pretty quiet beach. There are local vendors who are polite and not pushy. The coffee shop/ restaurant has a great snack menu. Unlimited wifi works well throughout the hotel. On the downside the bedrooms need complete overhaul and refurbishment. Tip is to ask for a room with a shower. May be avoid ground floor room. Room 308 is a great suite but no shower! Hotel is a ideally located for visiting Galle, Mirissa( about 1 hour) and the Tsunami memorial.

Really great resort style hotel close to Colombo. We chose to stay an extra day on our trip just relaxing by the pool. You can also visit nearby turtle hatcheries and donate money as well as see the turtles. This hotel is huge and has several restaurants, a gym, two pools. Quite a bargain really.

Checked into heritance ahungalla a week ago to start my long awaited vacation and had an excellent stay here. From prompt front office service staff to the GM Mr. Peiris made my stay a memorable one. Highlight of the trip would be the room upgrade as well as the breathtaking pools to relax. Look forward to coming to the resort for my next vacation. A big kudos to the entire staff.

They say first impressions are everything!! We knew we were in for a rough time as soon as we arrived. On arrival we were shown to a scruffy bar area with tatty leatherette seats which were all torn and ripped. For the third time in 6 days in Sri Lanka we were taken to a really horrid room (No. 228)!! OMG what a dump - we had paid for a king-size luxury room and what we got was a prison cell twin!! It was filthy, pokey, run down and utterly horrid. Needless to say we made a fuss and were initially told we would have to pay for an upgrade!! We were finally upgraded to a suite gratis. Unfortunately this was not much better!! The hotel is in a terrible state and is in dire need of major renovation. One of the biggest problems in this hotel is the design. This hotel is celebrated for it's design and architecture but in my opinion this is misplaced. All the bathroom walls are simply skimmed concrete which gives them a horrid dingy, dirty prison cell-like appearance. There were no curtains - just these filthy heavy shutters which moved in filthy tracks. The blinds were broken, filthy and flaking!! Pillows were stained. The remote control for the TV was held together with sticky tape, the hotel guide book was covered in sticky dried food, the chair at the desk was filthy and the mini-bar fridge was rusty and leaking water. The final straw was the insect life living in the room!! We were tired, upset and ready to leave. By this time it was very late at night and we contacted our travel agents in UK and told them we wanted to return to UK asap. We were told there was nothing that could be done until the morning. We spent a very uncomfortable night and waited to see what would happen. Well; we had obviously stirred the hornets nest!! Next morning we were contacted by the front of house manager and within minutes we were surrounded by loads of staff members apologising and promising to make things right. After a short while we were upgraded again to a genuinely luxury suite which was lovely. Clean linen, clean floors, curtains and the biggest jacuzzi I have ever seen!! Throughout the whole process all of the staff at the hotel were wonderful and helpful and charming!! We enjoyed the rest of our stay. Once this hotel has been renovated it will be fantastic, if you are looking for a stunning beach resort. The location is idyllic. The buffet restaurant is good with plenty of high quality options - western and local cuisine. Make the most of the area - hire the bikes that the hotel offer and enjoy the amazing countryside. - we spent a couple of hours cycling through the local village. What a treat!! Giant Monitor lizard by the side of the road, buffalo wandering towards us on the road, local farmers working in the paddy fields surrounded by cattle Egrets and monkeys jumping through the trees!! It was very hot but one of the highlights of our trip. A day trip to Galle was very worthwhile as were trips to the local towns. The local Turtle hatcheries are wonderful but beware the 'Spice Gardens' - rip-offs aimed squarely at parting unwary tourists from their cash!! I was genuinely shocked at the number of people putting their towels on the pool-side loungers before breakfast and then obviously spending the whole day baking and drinking beer. Bloody long way to go for skin cancer and to not experience all the amazing sights, people and wildlife this wonderful country has to offer!!

This hotel is set back from a beautiful beach view and it is difficult not to relax in the setting there. My room was stunning with a huge rooftop balcony area. It was cleaned twice a day and I was left with beautiful towel creations on my bed each day along with flowers laid out (I loved the elephant!). The staff were very polite and always willing to help me out. I was at the hotel for my friend's wedding and many of us enjoyed their great facilities such as the lovely spa where I had a very relaxing hot stone massage, swimming in their two large pools with spectacular views and an aqua aerobics class and their restaurant and coffee shop. The breakfast buffet was enormous - you could have a contintental breakfast, a cooked western style breakfast or Sri Lankan food such as hoppers and curry. All the food was tasty and they even had a good selection of wine on offer (which you don't get in many asian countries). The only downside is that there were a few mix-ups with the rooms - some people didn't have rooms ready on arrival and the check-out process was quite painful. If there was any discrepancy with the bill it took so long to review that everyone just ended up paying the stated amount to avoid missing their transport connections etc which wasn't great. With such a lot of people checking out at the same time, they needed more staff on point for this process and a faster way of dealing with any arising issues.

After I spent one day without any super delicious culinary works. On the second day I have experienced great improvement. Then I have noticed an arrival of a new Chef Mr. KAVINDA. He was personally looked in to every detail of the dishes & how the people enjoy the dining experience. I was truly impressed! I've got the opportunity to visit their kitchen which was absolutely super clean. I was really fortunate to visit their culinary carvings which helped HERITANCE AHUNGALLA to win many CULINARY OLYMPICS accolades for the past years. The carvings were mesmerizing. The latest culinary champ Mr. JAGATHSIRI was really helpful in showing us around.

We had a lot of trouble securing a room here before we arrived but then mysteriously some rooms appeared the day we tried to relocate from a nearby hotel. Lucky break! The location and amenities really are fantastic and the breakfast is incredible!! Definitely allow for some time to laze by the pool and maybe join in the water aerobics. We were in a large group and had a ball! The room was upgraded and was absolutely beautiful - very comfy bed (deal breaker for me) and a welcome basket of fresh fruit was a nice surprise. The bathrooms are starting to look a little tired (water damage on room etc) but overall we had a brilliant time. Infact, it was tempting to spend every waking minute at the resort and not go out adventuring. If you need cash, get your taxi to stop on your way to hotel as there are no cash point machines nearby to the hotel. And ask about the secluded seafood hotel (about 300m up the beach) for a really special treat. Amazing!

Since I stayed in the hotel for almost a week with all inclusive package, I have had enough time to examine every part of it. ROOMS. It can be seen that the hotel is old. So are rooms. Even though staff cleans them regularly, you can't hide things like mold or very old and severely used furniture. Bathroom was clean, but not in the best shape either. Our neighbours had some creatures coming out from bathroom sink, but the issue was quickly solved by staff (so be careful and notify staff if you see anything weird). Rooms are not soundproof at all, so you hear all the noise from the hallway and from outside (especially, from a wedding or a "private party"). FACILITIES. Pools and theirs surrounding facilities are fine. The only annoying thing are beachboys (some guys offering you tuk-tuk rides and women selling clothes). These people might follow you and annoy from day to day, but a firm "no" is ok for them to go away. Be aware that prices are higher than anywhere else. Also, be careful with the tuk-tuk guys. Negotiate the final price and all other aspects right away, so you won't get fooled in the end. They will tend to bring you to their "friends" (places, where prices are super high and tuk-tuk driver gets his cut), such as local ayurveda farm/massage, gemstone mine, souvenir shops, and some tea shops/ spa's. Beach is not populated - guests are swimming in the pool (which I found weird, because the ocean is so warm). Some (and again, SOME) of the public bathrooms around hotel stink like hell. They were clean, but that smell... I can still feel it. Also note, that the hotel is located in Ahungalla, which is not that famous for its tourist attractions. New hotels are being built, but it takes time until the whole tourist infrastructure will appear around this place. FOOD AND DRINKS: Breakfast, lunch, and dinner buffets are fine. The variety of food is also fine, however, if you stay more than 5 days you will get bored with the food (it is different, but usually tastes the same). One great thing: desserts are marvellous! The barman at the pool bar is quite experienced and nice. A la carte menu is somewhat average. Be aware, that "service costs" are usually will be between 25 and 50%, which I found ridiculous. STAFF Friendly, as mentioned before. Not all of them speak proper English, so if you have a question or a request - try to use simple words. During the buffet, drinks are poured by waiters. From the day one I realized that you have to say twice if you wanted to have a drink, otherwise they would forget it. Some of staff saw my all inclusive bracelet and asked if I could get a beer/cocktail for them from a bar. if you want to use their taxi service, I highly recommend a driver named Nishan. Competent young man, who does not try to fool you. Overall, good experience. CONCLUSION. There are some positive things, but you can't say this hotel has five stars just because of friendliness of staff. Rooms, some facilities, surroundings, and other minor things don't make it a 5*. So, for this price you can find (I believe) something much better. But I wish good luck to Heritance and hope it will change to the better.

An impressive building giving access to a beautiful beach just a few yards away. There is a very open feel to the place especially when you arrive at reception. Our room just about had a sea view, but was certainly well presented, clean and tidy. WIFI worked well everywhere. We stayed two nights and had the buffet once. Although we were feeling a bit anti buffet, after having one virtually every day of our tour, this turned out to be a good one, with fresh prawns in particular on tap. The other night we ate in the a la carte restaurant but the food there was only average. All the staff were friendly and helpful. We sunbathed one night near the beach. There are vendors who are a bit of a nuisance and I would suggest you have nothing to do with them. Their prices are more than you would expect to pay elsewhere. Unfortunately my wife did have an issue with one woman who tried to cheat her and it had to be resolved by the hotel beach staff. Be careful to avoid a room over the kitchens because of the fumes. One of our tour had this problem but was moved promptly by reception. Overall this was a good stay in an impressive hotel.

I went with my family to spend a day to this hotel on 21st of February 2016. The architecture of the hotel is fabulous. From the gate to the hotel, the famous Sri Lankan architect Geofrrey Bawa , who designed Sri Lanakn parliament, has showcased his best skills and the entrance looks so green with trees of different families. The staff were very friendly and helpful. From the time we checked-in, till we checked-out they offered the best service. The lunch buffet was not the best but it was ok. They had a good spread but the taste wasn't that great. Salads, soups and desserts on offer were awesome. The bar was facing the main swimming pool and it is well stocked with experienced bar man. The hotel also features a second pool which is strictly for residents. The long meadow with well grown trees attract variety of birds and squirrels. It gives a nice sight and all birds and squirrels are very friendly with the guests. The guests can perform sea bathing but it is at their own risk. The rooms and common restrooms are maintained well and those are kept clean all time. It was also visible that the hotel was fully booked yet the staff handled the day very well. The day ended with a great coffee and a piece of cake. I would strongly recommend everyone to pay a visit to this hotel and get your self treated like an emperor. Key attraction: the beautiful architecture and landscaping

hotel and the view is very beautiful,bathrooms need to be refurbish,restaurant staff is very friendly with good service skills,most disgusting thing is a girl come to every table @ the restaurant and begging for good reviews on trip advisor so don't judge on those reviews ,please stop doing that.food is old fashioned ,cant expect these quality of food from a five star hotel.the good lesson i learned from this hotel is not to book any hotel by looking at the reviews.you guys put a bad image on the heritance name.

This hotel is a 5* for: size and quality of the rooms, facilities (big pools, big public areas to stay,...), cuisine (breakfast, lunch and dinner) and the well located at the beach with gold sand and brave ocean. We liked the hotel even we had 3 terrible weather days (raining dogs and cats)

We spent a couple of nights here after a tour of SL. From the moment you step off the bus and look through the hotel across the pool to the golden sand and sea you appreciate the great design of the hotel. It sits so comfortably in its palm gardens right by the beach that despite being a large hotel it feels calm and relaxed. BUT I did not feel that the detail lived up to the 5* billing. I get the minimal architecture - whitewashed walls, exposed concrete - but for it to work all the details need to be perfect. I could go through a list but one thing illustrates it perfectly. Sleeping in after a tiring trip, I decided to make a cup of tea without disturbing my wife. I found the kettle in its little cupboard. Square pin plug. Lots of plugs in the room but all of them round, except the one for the telly. Unplug the telly. Cable on kettle not long enough to reach the floor. Have to move the telly so I can perch the kettle next to it. Even a â‚¬50 B&B can get these things right! Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed our stay there. My rating is against where this hotel should be!

Wonderful location with a lovely beach... food is awosome.... staff is very friendly and helpful.... swimming pools are amazing.. specially the green pool... but only thing is lights to be improved in the room..

We stayed for 10 in the luxury room during February. The room itself was large and clean, however the accommodation in general needs to up its game to 5 star standards. We were shown two of the newly refitted rooms which were beautiful, however planned works due to start in May have been delayed. What a shame! Other areas of the hotel are showing signs of wear and tear for example the gym with its old equipment. Now to the positives of which there were many. The layout of the hotel is stunning with two massive pools at either end of the hotel. The staff at the hotel are outstanding with particular reference to the pool boys and resaurant staff. Nothing was ever a problem and each request was greeted with a smile . I would advise to eat at the hotel as there aren't that many options outside. Although buffet fare there was always lots of variety, and we were pleased We had a couple of issues , however these were sorted out by the general manager. If you are not happy speak with him and the issue will be resolved. We had a super relaxing break and felt totally looked after with that personal service The hotel will be 5 plus after the refurbishment. We visit again

the staff was perfect and the food is very goog and they are so friendly and the location also very good and the beach is very clean and perfect actually i like the staff very much specially shanikka is so candlly and friendly

I planned a day out two weeks ago and requested details from the Hotel. I got the confirmation on 10 Feb with the reservation number. Representative from the hotel called me and confirmed my booking also. When We went to the hotel, the front office said they could not give us a room since hotel is fully occupied and they give the rooms for the day use on availability basis(not informed at the time of booking). However, they agreed to give us a changing room (B Grade room as per the front office) on FOC basis and we said ok since we traveled 2 hours from Colombo to Ahungalla. However, we didn't get the changing room also which was agreed to give within 10 minutes. We were there for about 1 hour and we cancelled our day out and came back to Colombo. At that time the front office staff asked the confirmation number and he said the booking was in the system. :( I don't about the process of Heritance Ahungalla, but this was my experience with this Hotel.

Hard to fault this place as its defiantly got some class and style. Coming from Western Australia we did find the beach a bit disappointing and bizarrely very unused , most likely due to the hassle that the tourists get from the local hawkers. We got a suite upgrade for one of our rooms which was very nice and the other room was great too. Buffet breakfast was pretty good but had a very disappointing ala carte dining experience including a nearly 90 min wait for main course, which was pretty average. Pools were nice . The hotel really needs refurbishment which I believe is happening later in the year . There is also a monster new hotel being built right next door. Staff were lovely. All in all , a really good hotel just needing a facelift

Great property , superb location, EXCELLENT HOSPITALITY! The property is situated right on the beach with 2 amazing pools !A special mention to Mr Pravin and Mr Gamini for taking special care in regards to food since we were vegetarians ! Overall a wonderful and comfortable stay for 3 nights !

We stayed here four four nights after a long and tiring tour of Sri Lanka and found it was a perfect place to relax and unwind after all the travel. It is a beautifully designed hotel with a gorgeous pool overlooking the long sandy beach. There are plenty of sunbeams and helpful pool boys who will place your beds in sun or shade as required. Plenty of shade in the hot midday sun offered by the palm trees and shrubs, and great fun to sit and watch the tiny squirrels playing round the trees and sunbeds. Staff are polite and helpful and the food is good. The rooms are probably a little dated but spacious and we certainly enjoyed fabulous views over the beach and sea. The beach is lon and sandy and great for long walks, many played and swam in the sea but I thought it seemed a little rough when we said there. I have read many moments complaining about the men and women who hang about the entrance to the beach trying to sell you saris , trips or whatever, they are persistent it is true, but usually accepting of a firm 'No' and being waved away. I had another advantage by speaking nothing but Welsh to them if they were too persistent and that utterly confused them. Their presence took nothing away from our stay and we would be happy to stay at the Heritance again.

I want to start by saying we had a gorgeously relaxing break here. Overall our experience was very positive. Despite being classed as 4 star the building looks tired and in desperate need of renovation. The promised deluxe ocean view room faced one of the pools and garden, which was pleasant enough but not the sea view that was expected. The bedroom itself was very spacious and accommodated 2 extra beds for the children without losing the sense of space. The children thought that their beds were very uncomfortable but the main bed was comfortable. As with all areas of the hotel the bedroom was sparsely furnished and decorated. The swimming pools (2) were both large and very clean and the beach was fantastic. The food in the hotel was good quality and tasty. They are no children's menus but enough choice to satisfy my fussy daughter! The staff are all polite and helpful. The other hotel guests consisted mainly of older (retired) couples and larger groups of Chinese people. There were only one or two other families there which made us very self conscious of any noise we made in the swimming pool. Next door there is a very large 5 star resort under construction (due to open later this year). I would recommend the Heritance to people travelling through the area wishing to stay 2 or 3 nights, there are some interesting day trips in the area and it's a lovely place to relax and unwind.

We stayed two nights with our supplier who came from China & they enjoyed their stay with full of fun...the staff were very kind & supportive in all the ways,the pool was awesome,A must visit place!!!

Generally I found the experience here more professional than in our other hotels in Sri Lanka. I had no negative experience at all. One small point - it would make sense to be able to print out one's boarding pass for the flight home - can I be the first person staying at this hotel to try to do this? There is a computer for guests, but why not link it to a printer? Other hotels I have been in do this. The hotel is on a gorgeous beach, with a lovely pool and all the loungers you need. The food is excellent, slightly more expensive than other hotels we stayed at, and there are fish restaurants along the beach. I'm not sure there is much to do in the immediate vicinity, but for two or three days of relaxation at the end of a trip, it is just right.

impressive driveway leading to the reception area and infinity pool looking straight out to the beach and sea. The hotel is a little tired and needs updating but was spotlessly clean everywhere. Special mention of our room boy Rashan, who was always very happy and greeted everyone with his huge smile. Our room was always spotless and nothing was too much trouble. Buffet style meals were good and the food was always being attended to and constantly being refilled by the numerous chefs. Vast majority of the staff were extremely helpful and friendly, there is always the odd one who is a bit sullen but they are a small minority. hotel is situated on a bay, and there were never more than 2 dozen people at any one time on the beach, excluding the traders. don't know why because the beach was lovely for walking, although the sea was quite rough with bad undercurrents so wouldnt recommend swimming. The beach traders were a bit of a nuisance, being allowed to offer their goods and taxi services on the edge of the hotel grounds. you had to walk through them to get to the beach, and majority were particularly persistent. We even became involved in an extremely loud and animated argument between two taxi traders on the beach, one accusing the other of stealing his business because he had spoken to us!! we had made no promises to either trader and just walked off leaving them to continue their shouting! we did receive an apology from one of them later but we said we did not want to get involved with any arguments from anyone. Appreciate that the traders need business but this is not the right way to achieve it. Plus by the end of the holiday we realised that the beach traders including the women selling beach clothes etc. were very expensive compared to shops and taxis outside the hotel. My advice would be to use the taxis, tuktuks, local shops outside the hotel.

We used this hotel for a four night stay after touring Sri Lanka and this provided an excellent place to recharge our batteries. The hotel looks great and is well designed. Perhaps a little tired but we could see that the rooms were being upgraded. As they are they are comfortable although in need of a bit of updating. The pool area is good with helpful Pool Boys ensuring you had a sunbed, towels etc. The pool bar is good offering good snacks which were delicious served by helpful staff. Overall service was very good. Food across a number of outlets is good with the coffee shop the best place to go with good good at a decent price. We did have one nightmare evening at the fine dining restaurant where service a food was well below standard. Our complaint was dealt with well. There is a good beach in front of the hotel albeit this is not owned by the hotel do there are no sunbeds. WiFi is available throughout.

We were blown away by the service we received by the hotel staff. We were absolutely spoiled by them and didn't want to leave this place. We were there for 5 days with my family and it was an experience to remember. We were upgraded to a very spacious room and at the hotel restaurant staff went out of the way to make sure we got what we needed. Any kind of Sri Lankan food we wanted to try they made it available for us. This is the 2nd time I have been at this hotel and definitely will be going back again.

I have been to Sri Lanka last winter. I stayed in 5 star hotel Heritance in Ahungalla. I lived in big room with amazing ocean view. First day we spent on the beach, on the great beach! Second day we rented tuk-tuk, and went to shop to buy something, and visit turtle farm. And there, we bought rum! In Sri Lanka very good rum, i advice to drink Sri Lanka's rum. A few days late we went to river safari. Then we went to Safa Park. It's beautiful place with many different animals like elephants, monkeys, alligators, deers and so on. And I advice to visit city Galle, it's amazing city with great people. We went there in last day, and didn't have much time, that's why I want to visit Galle again.
