In Sri Lanka very beautiful nature. When we went to Sri Lanka, we thought Sri Lanka dirty country like India, but it's not true. It's clean. If you want to go to paradise, you must go to Sri Lanka. I fell in love with Sri Lanka.

As we pulled up outside the entrance to this hotel we were amazed at the view. We were looking forward to some relaxing days. We were shown to our room which was disappointing. It had a poor view and the shower was in need of some good quality cleaning products, with the grouting all black and the glass door was covered in limescale. We were so unhappy and disappointed (this was the third hotel in the group that we've stayed at on this trip) that we asked to be moved to a different room. This was facilitated but we had to wait almost two hours for the replacement room to be ready. This room had a much better outlook and whilst the grouting was cleaner, there was still the same issue with the shower door. Some good limescale remover used regularly would work wonders. That said, the overall cleanliness of the room was very good. The room cleaning service was always good and the guys couldn't have been more helpful. The pool and gardens are nice and the staff at the pool were very good. On one occasion a man was in difficulty in the pool having wandered out of his depth, and the lifeguard on duty leaped to his aid. A happy ending. Don't be too worried if you see chipmunks and land monitors passing by. Perhaps even the occasional monkey. We found the service at the pool bar to be friendly but quite slow, with some staff, on occasion, preferring to stand and chat together. We ate in the outdoor restaurant twice and found the food to be pretty awful. After those poor experiences we ate in the buffet restaurant. I wish I could be more positive but I can only be honest - the evening meals were not up to the level of that at the previous hotel at which we'd stayed. We found many dishes overcooked and almost cold. At the dessert bar, only half the items were labelled, and if you went to eat after the main rush it felt like we were being given the leftovers. The whole presentation was lacklustre. The staff though, were very nice and friendly and the service good, though some worked harder than others. I feel this establishment would benefit greatly from more staff training and motivation.

It was my second visit to this hotel with family and it was great!!! AGAIN!!! The staff is well trained and you can just FEEL the sincerity in their hospitality. Its no surprise that the team won the culinary awards because the food it just AWESOME...We enjoyed our stay and the kids had good fun. Cheers to the team..

the staff went that extra mile to make the vacation extra special to the kids and their effort should be well mentioned. the food and beach were nice. the property needs refurbishment and i learnt it'll be done by May 2016.

Spending out holidays at heritance ahungalla was one of the best decisions ever. The "Captain" of the fantastic kitchen crew Mr. Manjula gave us a very warm welcome and invited us to his kitchen. After dinner we were allowed to see the impressive cooking areas and also the chocolate production. After that we were taught to cook a real Srilankan chicken curry- wow!!!! Two days later we enjoyed an outstanding birthday dinner at the beach with very nice seafood and excellent service. Thank you so much Mr. Manjula - we enjoyed our time with you so much and will definetely return :-). Room, location, pools&garden, room service etc. highly appreciated as well.

We stayed at this place for a business conference (02 days) and everything was fine from the hotel side. This hotel is another beautiful Geoffrey Bawa design blended with nature and exterior/interior spaces.

I'm proud to say that I went again to the heritance ahungalle. Now its like my home. Their warm welcome always surprises us with three different drinks. Front desk is awesome.always help us to get the better view rooms.Geoffrey Bawa's architecture makes us relax. Thank you so much for giving us the best holiday!

Stayed for four nights in January with the family. Had a bit of initial hiccup about not getting the room on time when asked for it with many calls. We also were staying in a deluxe room and they kindly upgraded us. So, the rooms are aging. The upgraded room was not what I liked but I got it when the upgrade was conveyed to me. What I loved most was the reaction when I spoke to the GM. He came, heard me, took the feedback well. Takes a good gm. Once i spoke to him I felt the service lot personalized. Was superb and was well spoken to, taken care of. Especially when we stay four nights, we wanna feel home. The restaurants are fabulous. Buffet meal, fine dining and in my opinion a coffee shop with a to die for menu. A veg menu in the coffee shop is also superb. Cannot fault most of the food in the coffee shop. This hotel has a lot of crowd which comes in tourist busses and stay for a night or two. Somehow it irritates me. But then, no harm to us. The lobby area pool is open to day visitors also and the other pool only for residents. If the plan is to sun bathe, swim, eat, drink and repeat then ask for room on ground floor by the pool. The landscape of the property and the pool ate V well maintained and attended to well. Again, I had a tough time with the pool attendantz but then I'll forget that part. The beach which the hotel overlooks is beautiful to sit and spend the evening. The nights are quiet and nice, the food is well. I'll come back once the property is done up. But importantly for me, I would want a nice personalized service especially if staying beyond two nights. The GM has impressed again and he made sure things were sorted. Thats a sign to come back here. Start your breakfast early and before the tourist bus crowd with their long table reservations get to the breakfast area. Gt noisy. The pools are superb and come to this property and do swim. It feels good. Don't wrote off the coffee shop. The food is fabulous and try the veg food. You will like it.

The services was excellent, room was spacious, total privacy with a gorgeous view of the sea . food was good had a good variety of food. and Excellent services from the staff. We Will be back soon and I would highly recommend here if you want to have a break away from a busy life. :)

One my favorite beach side hotels in sri lanka. Visited this lovely hotel last week and that was my 4th visit this heavenly place and I would recommend Heritance Ahungalla to anybody who love the beach side hotels. One of the best food you can ever taste!! They have a very good verity of food for you to taste. There is a magnificent view of the beach and enough walking space and kids get enough space to play on the beach. Both the pools in the hotel are lovely but the resident pool is much more relaxing and less crowded. The staff at Heritance was very friendly.

We booked to stay at Heritance Ahungalla for 2 weeks to celebrate our honeymoon, and overall it was an incredibly enjoyable and relaxing couple of weeks. If you are looking for a stress free and laid back holiday then it is ideal. The beachside location is amazing and the hotel in itself feels private and secluded. Situated directly on the beach, separated only by the large infinity pool, the transition between beach and pool is incredibly easy. What really made the holiday was the amazing staff and brilliant food. From the waiters and pool attendants, through to the chefs and reception staff, you do feel they really want you to have an amazing time and go out of their way to provide what you want. Some of the best services were cocktails delivered to your loungers, and having tuna and prawns cooked fresh for you at meal times, and the lovely floral displays left on your bed after it has been cleaned. The buffet in itself offered good variety, and we stuck to the local Sri Lankan curries and local meal options every day and did not get bored of it at all. A personal favourite were the breakfast hoppers, and it was a great experience to go into the kitchen with Chef Menjula and have a cooking class on how to make them. They even gave us the recipes. There were so many members of staff that got to know us and spoke to on a daily basis and we are not able to remember and list all of them, but special mentions need to go to Chef Menjula and Chef Sanjay for the incredibly tasty tuna and prawns cooked to order, waiters Dharshana, Nelka, Sanjay and Thursita. Rohana, Kalinga, Sudesh and the many bar staff, whose names were given, but forgotten after a steady supply of local Lion beer and Gin Fizz. And of course the lovely Giayathri was always incredibly happy and smiley everytime we spoke with her, and was a fountain of knowledge on the hotel and its history. There was also an abundance of wildlife around the hotel grounds which for us was brilliant. A family of monkeys often visited various trees and roofs around the hotel, and were more than happy to come and grab a banana from you. Numerous birds, chipmunks and lizards also wondered around as you sunbathed and swam in the pools. Anyone looking to stay here, we would strongly advise the all inclusive option. We initially booked just accommodation and breakfast, thinking we would be able to leave the hotel when we wanted to eat in local restaurants etc. The village of Ahungalla is pretty remote, and without many of these facilities for tourists to try. We ended upgrading to all inclusive to really get your monies worth, as paying for things as you go ended up being really expensive. The clientele of the hotel were slightly older than we may have preferred to have been with, and this was reflected in the evening music, which for our tastes, tended to be a bit on the slow side. The exception in this being the local live music they had on occasion. Another slight negative would be some areas of the hotel looked slightly tired. Whilst the pools and rooms were lovely, some parts looked like they needed a bit of attention. Saying this, over the last couple of days they had started to renovate he hotel, and a full renovation was due to get underway once the hotel closes for the season in April. It is for these reasons only we couldn't give it a 5, and would have liked to rate it 4.5. The staff and food were definitely worthy of a 5! It will be interesting to see what it looks like when it reopens next season!

We stayed for a week and enjoyed our time. Impressing view from the moment one enters the resort. Friendly and attentive staff. They did their best to make us feel comfortable. We got an upgrade to a corner-suite on the 2nd floor - very spacious, nice view. We could experience a wedding ceremony from "the balcony". A minor construction error in the bathroom caused some flooding while one took a shower, but we could adapt. And although the housekeeping staff was really creative and sweet with daily new arrangement of flowers on our bed, it caused also the presence of tiny ants, which we had to get rid of back home. The food was excellent - a good variety of native and western dishes - and amazing desserts! We were even invited to a guided tour through the kitchen by the sous-chef, and we could see some of the high standard guidelines the staff are challenged to live up to. The grounds around the pools were well kept and one could relax without any disturbing noise. The great beach invites one into the sea - but I had to learn the hard way how important it is to take the red flag really seriously. The current can be really strong, but the hotels lifeguards did a great job pulling me out of the water. The hotel offers a massage parlor, where we got high quality treatment. Being new to Sri Lanka we wanted to go for a round trip after our stay, and asked the reception for advice and help with the arrangements. We were referred to a tourist agent sitting at a table around the corner - without pointing out that he was not attached to the hotel staff. Our trip was ok., but the hotels he suggested were not even close to the level of the Heritance Ahungalla, something we expressly asked for. All in all - we enjoyed our stay very much, thank you!

Me and my wife came to Heritance Ahungalla to celebrate our first wedding anniversary in last week end. Hotel staff warmly welcome us and they prepared an anniversary cake for us. Food was delicious and hotel staff is very kindly. Hotel is very clean and beautiful. This is one of best 5 start hotel in Sri Lanka.

A great place to relax and enjoy your holiday... I came here with a group... They really enjoyed.... Specially the beach... Clean and beautiful beach.... You can enjoy a lot in e evening.... Fantastic food... Lots of verities ....thanks.....

Heritance ahungalla is the one of best service hotelsin Sri Lanka. Staff is extremely helpful and friendly....service is oweut of the world.... Delicious food and lovely beach.... Definitely we will be back....

This is my first time to heritance ahungalla.......A very nice place nice decoration in the room for honeymoon friendly staff and good service....warm welcome with a niceeeee cakeeeeee. Thank you so much and we will come back....

Stayed for 9 nights in January (wish it had been more). This is not a Caribbean 5* resort so don't compare as such. It is half the price and in a way better, in that it has a rustic charm and a really chilled out atmosphere. It is more than ok and we thought the food, location and the people were brilliant. The two pools are lovely the beach beautiful and the Spa excellent. Yes some of the complex could do with an upgrade but that is just being picky. Thank you to all who made our holiday special we would have no second thoughts about returning. A special mention to the chefs who gave us a tour of the kitchen and offered to cook me (as part of my all inclusive) a special dish and cooked me the best curry I have ever eaten in my life. That's how personal this place is.

Room was satisfactory at best. Few charger portals also phone kept going off at random times. Toilet was in a dire state. For a '5 star hotel', the toilet cleanliness was spotty at best. Dinner Buffet was expensive which was why we expected better quality food as compared to the hotels we stayed in Sri Lanka. There was limited variety and food lacked freshness. For a 5 star hotel with 5 star prices, this was a very terrible stay

Wonderfull view of beach.clean and besutiful beach.....exellent service and care.tasty foods with verities.... We will come back again and recommend to anyone.... Thank you for everything...........excellent resort....

After seven years living overseas decided to visit back to Sri Lanka for holidays I had the opportunity to holiday in Ahungalle Heritance by Chance .At the moment I cheked in I felt that I stepped in to a heaven with great location covered one side with Ocean and front viewed nicely with eco friendly pool. When come to foods cannot be compared to any other places that I visited during my stay in Sri Lanka .Rooms are spacious and well clean.Out of all most facinated thing is friendly staff with quality service /very hospitable and polite. Never foget about Yare Tea that was served by the excellent staff. I highly recomended to tourist to make visit Ahugalle Heritance for your dream holiday. Finally thanking for the management and the dedicative team giving us wonderful service

Nice hotel and good facilities, the best hotel in the down south..amazing beach. very clean and beautiful.. swimming pools are fantastic.. food is out if the world... â˜º our group really enjoyed the breakfast buffet here,

We came to heritance ahungalla for our hooney moon. Their service was fanntastic. Specialy in the restaurant. Large spred tn the buffet. Even people are very nice and very healfull. They have large two pools and over looking nice beach front. We can recomond this hotel to our friends. We would like to celibrate our first anniversary at this hotel.

Heritance ahungalla has a lovely beach....this is my frist time here.. like a paradise... food is great... staff and the service is good.... but rooms need to be improved..but great service and great people....

The hotel is great. The beach is the best thing there. Not to mention the food and the diversity of the buffet. The bathroom in the rooms is a bit exposed. The curtains they are using to cover the windows of the bathroom from the inside can show everything in the bathroom which totally elimates the privacy.

We got into this by accident and are very happy !!! the hotel is very nice, the prices in the restaurant are expensive. but very zorosho staff. -Swedish breakfast table, a lot of food, delicious! I have never had a stomachache. many pools. Many animals. I recommend this hotel.

It was a wonderful experience at the property. ..lovely location. ..beautiful beach...specially great hospitality by Chef Manjula...he helped us by preparing very tasty dinner...and he himself came twice to confirm everything is perfect.

Excellent staff. .specially at the reception..... Food is awesome.... Lovely beach... Breakfast buffet is excellent.... Specially Sri Lankan corner... But rooms are not up to standard.. please update your rooms... Thank you.

Nice place to stay.... Food is really good and excellent service..... Staff is excellent... Always helpful and very friendly... Beach is amazing... Beautiful and very clean... Big swimming pools.... We will recommend ....

My travel agent recommended this hotel to me.. very nice hotel with a lovely beach...very clean and beautiful..... room is amazing.... i came here without my kids.... but now i am very sad now.... next time I will bring them for sure..,,,,

In theory, a four star. In reality, five star excellence A must stay in Sri Lanka for at least one night. The pools and beach are perfection, service is so warm and friendly, the ice cream is to die for. Set in a private area, it's all relaxation.

Great hotel. Booked a delux room and got and upgrade. Spacious room with great view.Friendly staff. Beautiful place with two superb pools. Nice buffet with huge variety of food items. Had a wonderful stay. Definitely a must visit again.

The hotel is Nice, and that sums it up really, rooms and surrounding areas are immaculate , situated on a magnificent beach, the only down side we found the food was very repetitive with very little variation, if I returned it would only be on a bed and breakfast.basis.. The staff are very nice, and smiley, although reception was rather impersonal .

Hotel property is very beautiful and big property where you can relax... Good two night spend... Food was not that great... But the service is excellent.....staff is good......................thank you... We will come back..... Mira from India .....

When you arrive at this hotel you cannot help but be impressed. There is a large water feature outside reception and a lovely pool just inside. The rooms were pleasant but not great. When I got to the balcony the sea view was not quite what I imagined, the hotel is set a bit further back than it may appear in brochure photos. Found the staff very pleasant and the buffet choices quite expansive. The major disappointment were the cocktails on offer on the all inclusive. A couple off the Arrack based ones were OK but the others were pretty naff. Other AI's I have been to have a better range, although sometimes there is a small charge for the more expensive ones. Here it is full payment for non AI menu.

We really like food n services in hotel Nd specially for superb location on beach Having too much fun over here ...v r really very thankfull to all members of hotel .. I hope v come back again .........

The hotel us really good and well organized.... staff us very polite and helpful... We really enjoyed the beach... staff looked after us very well.... good hospitality.... we will recommend..... and if have to come back sri kanka again i will definitely come back...

We stayed from 18 to 21 January with a group of 13 family members. This was the second hotel in the Heritance group we stayed at during our 23 day holiday in Sri Lanka. Compared to Heritance Kandalama Ahungalla was a real disappointment. It looks great when you first arrive - the pool looks fantastic but everything else about it was disappointing - the tiles in the foyer area and along the corridors are stained, the bathrooms need a really good scrub, the food in the buffets was boring and many of the staff looked like they just didn't want to be there. Overall there just didn't seem to be the attention to detail we saw at Kandalama - we booked 3 double rooms, 2 twins and one triple room. On arrival the 3 doubles were all made up as twins and the triple had only 2 beds. One of the couples called reception on arrival to have the beds remade as a a double and had no problems, the second called and was told that it was not their practice to do that and in order to have a double bed the couple would have to be moved and that couldn't happen at the time because the hotel was full, the third couple then rang and was upgraded to a better room, despite the previous couple being told that there were no other rooms at all. In the triple room a small fold out bed was provided and most of the first evening was spent trying to explain to the staff that the tiny bed was not large enough for a teenage boy. Eventually after much conversation a better bed was provided. My parents have visited this hotel 4 times, however I would not go there again. In its current condition it is not worth the price charged.

The property is little interior from Bentota town. A well maintaimed swimming pools overlooking the Indian Ocean. Fine sand beaches welcomes the guest from their rooms and the Sun sets in to the ocean looks so beautiful. Sipping a cup of hot coffee sitting in the room balconies gives you so much freshness & pleasant feeling in the mornings. Restaurant serves Asian and Continental food. Service is very good. Rooms are good in size decently furnished.Over all, we had a refreshing and relaxing time.

Had a most wonderful stay. Really friendly staff. Clean, spacious rooms, really good buffet with a wide array of local and international food. The infinity pool was fabulous. Unique architecture in the hotel is mind blowing. Totally recommand it

Dined at the Mustard Restaurant while we were staying at the Heritance Ahungalla. Staff were very friendly through out our stay and the service was exceptional. Darshana, Kusun and Waruna serve d is very well, always cheerful and ready to serve with a cheerful smile. All the staff were forever smiling making us feel very welcome. The hotel met all our expectations, good clean rooms with a magnificent views from the balcony. Facilities were excellent, the swimming pools magnificent, the beach to die for. Overall an excellent hotel, we'll run by efficient staff with a ready smile. Well wor th the visit, well recommended !

we really enjoyed our holiday at this beautiful hotel... beach is superb... food is really nice....specialy breakfast buffet... rooms are good.... my daughter is very happy with hotel and i was very comfortable here....

Best service we always getting from heritance staff.. Staff always friendly and smiling.. Specially I really like restaurant staff they always attend to all the tables.. Restaurant buffet is huge.. Food was excellent. We will come back to you on march this year.. Thank you heritance lovely staff!!!

We visited on 19th December we were a group of 7 adults and 3kids we received a warm welcome and it was a very busy day to fount office. All three meals were very good kids also enjoyed as well as us and rooms are also good and clean... we have booked 2 double rooms and a one triple room, But they don't have triple rooms they only give a extra bed for the third person... Wen they fixed the third bed it was a tragedy! none of us can sleep on that bed because it was a very small folding bed. I have never seen a extra bed like that in my life. we have visited many star class hotels, and we always booking a triple room as we are travelling with our mother. I have never seen such a small extra bed.... When we ask about this from the hotel they told us this is the size of a extra bed they provide. That bed is good for a kid not for a adult... I'm very very disappointed...But I couldn't let any one to sleep on that bed I barely manage that bed so didn't had a good sleep... It was a sleep less night. But except the bed all other things were at the hotel is good... We enjoyed the beach as well as the pools...

Service at its best!! Friendly staff and a great ambience at the restaurants.. We enjoyed every minute of our stay. Will recommend it for anybody who wants to experience the best of Sri Lankan hospitality!!

Dear all this is one of the great hotel which our family has visited. Thanks for the wonderful staff and the hotel management for giving us a sucher grateful happy stay. The meals are superb and it's tast is awesome.

Fantastic service with friendly staff attending all nitigrity when required as it was a family vacation with kids. Couldn't have asked for a better service and the suite was extravagant. An awsome food spread compromising of an assorted array. Loved it....cherished memories for certain :)

Heritance Ahungalla, one of hotels owned by Aitken Spence group. It is situated in a very convenient location. The staff was very friendly. Food was superb. Rooms were so clean and quality. Overall excellent hotel.

We visited heritance ahungalla for our honeymoon. There service was very good. And good variety of foods in the buffet. They have two nice swimming pools. And nice beach front location. We would like to recommend this to our frends. Special mention chamara who help us in the Bar.

Food exellent , staff service exellent . High recomandand hotel . It was our 3rd year wedding anniversary, we decided to celebrate it with full of joy and happiness . So we came here, Heritance ahungalle. Its a beautiful place to stay calm. Very comfirtable rooms, delicious foods, candelight diner, warm welcome, olso very friendly staff who know how to show srilankan hospitality appreciate. the hotel is very beautiful, its arround calm pool and sea.

this is a fantastic place to spend holiday with friends, family or alone - u will feel wonderful even alone here. rooms are good, service is super, staff - very friendly and supportive, kitchen - amasing. thank u all ğŸ˜

The hospitality and the environment of the hotel is awesome.. Friendly an supportive staff with superb facilities . Food is delicious and represent a mix of Western and blend of authentic Sri Lankan recipes. Had a great time and one of the best places to relax with your loved ones..

Fantastic pools and beaches. Wonderful atmosphere. Rooms facing the beach are amazing. Live music in the evening is fun. Very relaxing and staff are so friendly and can't do enough for you. Smiling faces of the Sri Lankans are something to look forward to.

The atmosphere and the environment of this hotel is very pleasing and very entertaining... We only came for dinner and food was very delicious and we loved the main dishes sooo much and the service here is awesome tooo

This hotel is superb in its presentation and location. The rooms are well appointed and clean. Bathrooms have all modern appliances. The beds are very comfortable with fresh linen daily. The hotel offers 2 pools which are both fantastic. The hotel is only metres from the beach. One area for improvement is check in which took an eternity Well worth a stay, a tremendous hotel

Beautiful hotel! Spacious room and lovely beach views. Staff are friendly and accommodating. The second pool is beautiful to swim in and shaded by trees. A lot of pool chairs to sit on. Yummy cocktails. Enjoyed our few days of stay here. Thank you

Great experiences with so much indoor and outdoor activities, beautiful environment, very very friendly staff, very clean and quiet room.. nice beach view,had a lovely time with my wife. Specially recommend for beach lovers.

We came last weekend with my family for 2 nights. The hotel was awesome. Has superb view. Room was good. Meals was excellent. Specially service was superb and Thushara and Praveen has give the excellent services. I enjoyed candle light dinner at Jute Restaurant. There wasn't Ice Cream. But the restaurant staff went off his way and bring the ice cream and give it to my child. Definitely I will be back.

We have been traveling around south India and Sri Lanka for almost 1 month. This hotel is not the worst of the lot, but it missed only by one place. In general it looks an feels very tired and you don't have to look very hard to find the dirt, grime, dust, and sand, and that was just in our room and bathroom. The same goes for many other public areas. With the exception of a few staff members we got the same impression. Tired of dealing with tourists... The food was only OK compared to everywhere else we stayed. It's a beautiful location, but unfortunately a disappointing experience compared to almost every other resort or hotel we have stayed at on this trip. Can't reccomend.

I've been patronizing this hotel for about 10 years and its a must place that you should be if you ever come to Sri Lanka. It has beautiful sea view, especially at sunset, lovely swimming pools and offers delicious food. The rooms are very comfortable and about the right size for a couple or a family. The food was superb as usual but perhaps lesser spread and variety than what it used to be 2-3 years ago. But the service is excellent as usual. You can request any type of food, even very traditional sri lankan food, the staff will bring you promptly. If you are travelling with children ,infants even, do not worry the staff is there to serve you. If you are looking for real Sri Lankan hospitality, this hotel should be there at the pinnacle of it! I really love this place and looking forward to visit every time I get an opportunity.

My family and I had a fabulous time in Heritance Ahungalla. I sure will come back and recommend my friends and family to stay at The Heritance. Great staff, very friendly and helpful. My family and I just loved our stay At The Heritance Ahungalla.

Rooms are really nice Food is amazing..., Location is really beautiful.... Beach is very nice snd clean...,,specially in the morning... Staff is very friendly at the reception..., Highly recommend and we will be back..,.ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€

Our family has been here for the fourth time in a row and this hotel never fails to disappoint, in fact the overall quality merely improves. The service is impeccable, the food amazing and the rooms of the highest state. We will definitely be returning here next year!

Lovely stay, very helpful and smiling staff. Enjoyed our three days. Would definitely recommend to come and stay here if you looking to chill out and enjoy great food and ambience! We were upgraded to luxury rooms and it was really a good surprise. My mom s birthday celebration provided by the hotel was very very special.

I came here with my sister for second time.... We had a great and relaxing holiday..... Staff is really friendly and the service is amazing..... They are always smiling... Swimming pools are very big and beautiful....ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€

We travelled to this resort in Sri Lanka, located between Bentota and Galle, Our main reason for choosing this resort was our daughter was keen to visit Jeffrey Bawa designed properties and resorts, as she was a student of the subject. The Resort is a masterpiece, and also has it's own flaws! The meandering drive-in from the Highway into the Lobby will build up your excitement BUT the view on alighting from your long drive will take your breath away! The Lobby blends in with the pool and the pool with the beach and the beach with the Indian Ocean, all in a seemingly undivided attachment. Literally, there is no dividing wall or fence, There in lies the beauty! Besides, the resort has several facilities for the visiting travellers, including a games room, billiards table, 2 swimming pools, 3 restaurants, 1 bar, room service, etc. Nearby attractions include the Galle Fort, whale watching, a visit to the many turtle hatcheries in the area or Bawa's Estate - Lunuganga (now managed by his Trust). However, the very very pricey water, wine list and food, as well as the poor service in the restaurants are issues that need to be seriously addressed to by the management, besides the quality and variety of the food, including vegetarian fare.

very nice honeymoon destination in sri lanka....room is really nice and beautiful.... room service is very friendly... and the recepion is amazing... we had a good welcome from them.... guest relation lady is very helpful....

Great food... Good rooms...very clean and beatiful view... Staff is friendly...and good... Service is excellent... Swimming pools are clean and big... Highly recommened....... We will come back and good luck for the new year....

Very clean and beautiful resort in Sri Lanka. My family is really enjoying the holiday... Rooms are clean... Staff and the service is excellent... Food, specially breakfast is good..... We really love this hotel.....

We are in this hotel end of last december 2015. This hotel has aged quite a lot, even including the rooms. In our washroom water was not draining properly. Complained but nothing happened. Food was very mediocre...mostly Sri Lankan cuisine. Hotel check out was quite haphazard...You need to get into a room to checkout but not at the reception, looks like government organization. Staircase is not kids friendly. There were no safety railing in the staircase; kids can fall through the staircase. Requested the manager to give a feedback, but he was unavailable and he send the housekeeping manager (even though I explicitly requested the manager). They say resort is due for renovation, mid 2016. Well if it is due for renovation why charge premium rate...hmm not value for money.

Excellence Beach Resort..... Lovely Beach..... Staff is really friendly and very helpful.....rooms are very clean.....Hotel is very besutiful in the evening when you go to the beach you will See a paradise....,thank youğŸ˜€

Excellent service.The staff was very friendly and helpful. The food was very delicious and little variety was required and the rooms were very goid clean and had a lot of fascilities..... the atmosphere and the environment was pleasent will come back to this hotel again

it is a very good place with the service nice , people do all the possible for your comfort . the view is beautiful with the swimming pool . It's peaceful and quiet . lot of activities and good atmosphere

This is my Firth visit to heritance ahungalla..... Staff is really friendly... Specially Nihal (Houskeeping exceutive)...He is very friendly and helpful..... Rom Attentdant is very good and He did Different bed decorations for me..... thank you. ...

love this property so much mostly because of the kind hearted people and how attentive they are for the guest services.... the rooms are very beautiful and the food is also delicious... we will definitly visit here again....

This was my first time at Heritance Ahungalla. The reception was so welcoming and nice. Throughout our stay the staff attended to our needs well. The rooms were clean and neat. The breakfast was great and the choice of food good. However, the dinner was not that great. I think the menu can be improved. Overall, it was a pleasant stay.

Every thing was great and nice food was excellent and adorable that was the best hotel I wish I could come next time bacause that's what a hotel looks like I really enjoyed every minute in this hotel and the view was adorable I loved this hotel and thanks for everything â¤ï¸

The Heritance saved our holiday after we left our original hotel after one night (it was terrible!). The hotel itself is wonderfully designed to have tons of light, airy walkways, and in general present a idyllic, peaceful atmosphere. This is the best hotel I've been to in Srilanka, I love the atmosphere and the view. The service is great and the people that work here are lovely. It's a good thing that each person gets a different username & password for the wifi because it's now easier and faster to use. Thank you for your great hospitality.

The rooms are very good the view of the rooms facing the sea is excellent ... The food is very good because it's spicy .... And there was a lot food too... The service is excellent and the wifi in the room should improve.... The pools are very big and they have 2 lived it here and will come back again.....

We were visiting from Chicago, USA, and spent a couple of days at the hotel with my brother's family. And Wow! What an amazing time it was. From the time we drove in to this breathtaking site we were treated like Royalty. We received a very warm welcome from the front office staff. The staff was always very pleasant and were always willing to cater to our needs with a smile. It was a Bonus to meet with the GM of the Hotel Mr. Refhan Razeen. It was beautiful to see the Top Guy of the facility always being around, meeting and greeting his guests, and offering his services. It was obvious that he was much loved and respected by his staff. Mr. Razeen has put together a great team who seem to love and take pride in their work. The hotel rooms were very clean & comfortable, with great views. The food was exemplary, with so many choices prepared tastefully. It was truly a Five Star Experience for us.We look forward to coming back again when we are visiting Colombo at the end of the year.

The hotel has an amazing view, two great pools and absolutely lovely rooms. The staff service is very very good and they cater to all our needs. The food tastes great and they've got a variety. Definitely a place to revisit and I'd recommend this place to anyone!

Visited Heritance Ahungalle for a short stay. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful throughout. The food was generally very good and if you wanted anything extra they would be happy to accommodate you. The rooms and buildings are a little dated but they are closing for refurbishment in the next few months. Beautiful beach and pools, overall a lovely stay.

One of the best hotels.Friendly staff, lovely environment and good room service. Breakfast buffet is good, lovely beach. Best place to relax. There were two pools in the hotel and loved the green pool. love this hotel alot.

Room was very good and well clean.staff was was very friendly and helpful..room service was excellent and fast..wifi is ok.best place for to relax and food was amazing..view was nice with sunset.i love the place and wish i come back soon..thanking for staff..

This is a lovely beach touching resort. The beach is a lovely almost private beach. It has a lovely large pool just touching the beach. The rooms are nice but feel slightly dated, some have great sea facing views. Food variety is the only downer - especially for vegetarians, not that many items in room service menu and similar in the restaurant. Breakfast has a good spread overall. The Spa is good but bit pricey for Srilanka standards. Service is decent although we had a slight issue with our billing. Overall a very nice property and worth staying!

I came with my wife to this hotel for my honeymoon.. It was really amazed to be here.. I got a nice room with a very good view of the ocean.. My wife was so happy.. The staff was so friendly and specially David and Chathuranga in the front desk made sure that my stay in this hotel was a beautiful one.. I recommend this hotel for anyone to get the experience of this marvelous property.. ğŸ˜„ğŸ†ğŸ»ğŸ´ğŸ

The hotel was one of the best relaxing places we have been during our holiday. It was a comforting place with trustable, friendly people. The food was delicious they cater our needs like the devilled pork upon request. There was a lovely view and it looked beautiful at sunset near the beach. I highly recommend this luxuries and beautiful hotel as your next holiday destination . Hasanthie Mendis Melbourne, Australia

Friendly staff/ great service/ tasty food & good variety/ beautiful clean beach/ good rooms but needs refurbishment / two big swimming pools and ample garden space/ daily entertainment in the evening & some days animation staff shows/ I will surely come back

My family stayed here for nearly a week over Christmas 2015. The hotel location was excellent, being right on a beautiful sandy beach which was fairly private (apart from the slightly irritating hawkers etc). We had 3 rooms together (for 5 of us) and we found the rooms to be well equipped, with a large comfortable bed and plenty of amenities. The window shutters were very effective at keeping the light out, so we all slept very well during our stay. The hotel wifi is free in all areas and worked reasonably well, though the system for issuing separate codes for each device was a bit fiddly, some devices dropping off (thus requiring a new code), while others worked fine. We were on half board, so this included breakfast and evening meal, both of which were served buffet style, with a changing selection of dishes, some international and some local. We found the variety was excellent - there was generally something for everyone each morning and night. We bought drinks most nights, and they had a reasonable selection of wines from various parts of the world, though they ran out of our favourite Chianti a couple of nights (no big deal). The entertainment at the poolside bar was generally very good, and they served a good variety of cocktails which we all enjoyed. We even ventured to the Night Club one night (Saturday), but were slightly surprised to find we were the first people there. We were eventually joined by a few others and had a good enough time, but not quite what we expected. The pool staff were particularly helpful and we had a few days of doing not very much sunbathing (or in my case hiding from the sun) by the pool. The pool itself was very good - possibly the warmest water I've swam in, and we even ventured into the sea one day where the water was also pleasantly warm, though the currents were slightly scary. Generally speaking the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We were due to leave at midnight on New Year's Eve and were a bit unsure how that would work, but we managed to agree a compromise with the hotel manager, whereby we took part in most of the Gala Dinner and also kept one of our rooms until midnight. Overall I would say the holiday was very successful - we did a couple of trips out of the hotel - one to Galle, and the other to Udawalawe (to see the elephants), both of which were enjoyable, if a bit tiring.

Heritance always has good food, Ahungalla is easier to get to with the expressway around. The service is always good too! I'd highly recommend it. The beach is not the nicest but it's cleaner than some other beaches, it's easily worth the money!

Had a great time with our family at Heritance Ahungalla. Great location, great facilities and the staff genuinely make an effort to ensure great service. Spa facilities here are excellent too! The range of dishes at the buffet was good however the quality of food could be improved. We will certainly come back.

It has a very pretty scenery with an amazing pool. The rooms are very clean And neat. The beds are SOOOO.... Comfortable. I could stay here everyday Pretty good service and everyone is very nice and caring

Staff was AMAZING! Pools & bars the best in Sri Lanka! Room was very nice & clean. Our family loved the Buffet -lots of choices..Restaurant very nice! Will be back for sure - we celebrated our 16th anniversary here- they surprised us with a cake - thanks guys & gals!

Came with a 2,5 year old child and very satisfied with the friendly service and level of service is very high! Every day some interesting performance takes place and our family enjoys it very much :)))

Perfect rooms with very nice sea view. Rooms are spacious. ..specially i should mention about the beach. ..it ist very clean and beautiful. ..food is really nice. All the chefs are friendly... Staffl is very friendly and helpful. ...

The hotel is old but well maintained. Garden is wonderful and night lighting also. With regards to the food and beverage, the buffet is ok without any plus. The chefs are very helpful. Buffet conditions are poor, chafing dishes are broken, salad buffet is basic. The Sri Lankan corner is quiet repetitive. Breakfast was up to standard, except the scrambled eggs. Service during breakfast needs to be looked after, as we waited 10 minutes before we were asked for our beverages. Pool bar : Beverage choice ok, but service is not a 5 star and cocktails quality is not up to what expected. Check in was very long but friendly and professional. One major point that the management needs to tackle is the beach boys and all souvenir boys that literally bother you once you go on the beach. Over all good stay, but certainly not at 5 star level. The hotel is extremely overpriced.

Great place to relax and enjoy a super holiday by the sandy beaches down south............ Friendly and helpful staff to go with the lovely sunsets by the ocean :) specially enjoyed the fire show.. definitly a spectacle to be witnessed :)

We absolutely loved our stay at Heritance ahungalla. The staff was very friendly and pleasant. The food served at the restaurant was amazing. I loved the sago pudding. A few pools to choose from. Free access to the beautiful beach. The bathrooms could have been better.

Loved the dinner buffet, specially the pork chops. The staff were really friendly and helpful. We loved spending time in the pool and the beach. The rooms had a nice feeling to it as well. Would definitely recommend to anyone who is looking for a relaxed holiday.

The Heritance hotel in Ahungalla Sri lanka, is really good. The service, the food, the atmosphere and the architecture of the hotel are perfect for you to spend a lovely evening. The buffet offers you a wide variety of choice that will surely satisfy your taste buds.

We had dinner at heritance ahungalla. The staff was very friendly and the place is very big and clean. We had a buffet with a mix of international cuisine. The food was very good with a lot of variety from sri lankan food to mediterranean to all kinds of desert. I really recommend it.

Amazing! Everything is perfect here, the food, the place, the beach, the service and the staff! tushara, and ibrahim are very nice waiters at the restaurant. The pool at night looks so nice, everything is illuminated with lights. It's a little paradise in Ahungalla! Do not miss out

Very good service. The buffet is exellent. There is a huge variety of food from italian to sri lankian to sea food. And the best part is the huge selection of fruits and vegetables. I recommend this place. The hotel is very beautiful and the location is perfect

Heritance Ahungalle takes the meaning of customer service to a whole new & higher level. The welcoming, kind nature which filters down from GM. Mr. Refhan N. Razeen, through to his staff, which is certainly second to none, makes you feel at home right throughout your stay. The rooms are beautiful & clean whilst the very obliging housekeeping staff member, Kularathne ensured our rooms were of high standard. The F&B team led by Mr. Thushara Gnanarathna always went the extra mile to ensure our dining experience was unforgettable & I must add the buffet selection for every meal was unsurpassed & not to mention amazing! It is very nice that they take an extra minute of their day just to do that for us. The food here is very nice with a great variety of things to eat. I found them very delicious to eat. Very good hotel Excellent food and good worker. Amazing lopy at night Clean swemming pool Recommended. ....truly it was a perfect holiday...we will come back in 2017....thank you for all the staff.....

We had a nuce time at this amazing resort.... staff is very friendly and helpful.....specially at the front desk.. food is really good at the coffee shop... beach is beautiful.... thank you for the wonderful holiday......

Had a trip to Ahungalla just for 4 days, nice and quite place to relax. Only the fitmess center was poor. Kularathne the men who was in charge in our section was very friendly and kind. Also the foos in the restaurant wered mostly fresh and the fruit bar was rich. I love passion fruit.

When we entered the room, we complained about the smell of mould - the hotel did nothing. We had paid for this hotel nine months previously and we were now trapped. At dinner that night - we were asked how our soup was - and we honestly advised there was too much salt (another freshly made batch was produced). Twenty-four hours later, I was screaming at a lady from Guest Relations, the Food and Beverage Manager and the Housekeeping Manager, all standing in our room, (yes at this stage they were willing to change rooms - why I cried, you did nothing 24 hrs ago when I complained.) So they said we were being upgraded to Fine Dining - oh really, we had already paid for an evening meal, So we went for a snack, then slept. (The night before there had been a graduation - that's where the blood came from - and our future leaders had a wonderful noisy night). Upon checkout I was asked if I would like to complete a feedback form - oh dear, you really want me to write about our experience and state that we had to pay for our food. To her credit, she ran and my husband was given back the money he had just paid - and I received two bottles of water. The photos speak for themselves. Five star accommodation - I don't think so.

Had wonderful time with family, food was amazing & delicious my kids enjoyed very much. Ambience was beautiful (Restaurante, pool, room etc) and very approachable polite staff. Internet was powerful comparing to other 5 different hotels so far we already visited. Merry Christmas & Happy New Year :) Zeya & Aziz

nice place and sure will have fun with it . near to beach..... Beachis beautiful and very clean...... nice food ..rooms are clean and neat....beautiful sea view from the room....staff is really goodand friendly... thanks....â˜ºâ˜º

I loved the hotel and would like to come back every winter if i have the chance and the hotel management is very friendly and the feeling of swimming while seeing the beach and this feeling can't be compared to anything else

This is an amazing hotel i loved the view frm here i would love to stay more and explore the area of the hotel. ... the pool here is also good nd very big.... the food here is also nice nd the service is also nice i mean the people here are soooooo polite ğŸ˜‡ğŸ˜‡

The wonderful staff made it a very special for me and my family from the time we checked in. From food to room service and everything else was very exceptional. I will definitely be back spending More time here in future in my next holiday to Sri Lanka. If you are looking to spend time next to the beach , Heritance Ahungalla is the place to be.

It.was an amazing hotel because it has a great view of the sea and the service is good and the people who work always have a smile.... The food is delicious and the spaghetti is very tasty.... The rooms are very good with great view... Sure we will come back

I must say that the staff is very lovely specially Anushka & Dayal and the pool staff.. The rooms is lovely and we are staying in the cliff Richards suite... And the housekeeping is very good always decorates our room.. .. The food is excellent...

We stayed for 6 nights at the Heritance Ahungulla. It's a nice hotel, we had a luxury double room facing the sea which was spacious and comfy bed. The only thing that lets this place down slightly is the food as you get a bit sick of it after a while, so definitely venture out of resort. Also, watch the hawkers out on the street if you go outside the gates to go to the local shop across the road. They are on you as soon as the gates are closed, asking you if you'd like to see gems, have massages or see spice gardens etc. One even tried to get in a tuk tuk with us, however we politely told him to get out. Good staff, but our room cleaner was hanging around us too much after we had tipped him one day; like he wanted more. Just made me feel a bit uneasy. Apart from that it was somewhere good to stay.

Had a wonderful experience. Friendly staff amazing food and very comfortable rooms with so much more. From the time We entered the hotel to the time We left they made sure we were well taken care of. Want to come back for sure to enjoy comforts to the fullest.

Being a Sri Lankan living away from my country I never miss to pay a visit to Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel is so relaxing opened to the beach and facing a lovely pool. The staff is so friendly with an excellent service in a timely manner. Recommend this hotel to anyone who would want to experience true local hospitality and relax enjoying the lovely beach down south

Best Hotel I ever gone. The best service and very friendly Team.& very helpful for any issues. I also recommend the food as it was very tasty.also the rooms are very clean . I hope to visit every vacation as this was my best place to come.

I think this is most exciting experience in a hotel. The way people's are treating, caring about the visitors are fabulous. Those are very clear delicious and very healthy also no any doubt about the anything. Hotel staff also very helpful to any visitors no any separate treat to any local or foreign. This is a nice and warm experience. Keep doing good service what you are already supply. Best of luck to your every success Thanks you very much for giving us a fabulous services

We arrived at the hotel after almost 20 hours by plane and found out that espresso coffee is a special coffee and will have to pay, although it has the same taste and in no case was an espresso. I mention that we had an all-inclusive supplement and the coffee was included First Breakfast: i wanted an omelette I asked the chef to prepare "well done", but he became visibly irritated because I have explained in more detail. He said something in his language, evading after I asked him what he said. I inspected the room where I was staying and found that under the bed were traces of visible dust probably old before those who have been staying here previously, the bathroom is not the bathroom of a 5stars hotel. The towels are to used and have old stains. On the ceiling we discovered traces of mosquito / dead flies on the ceiling of the bathroom The beach behind the hotel filled with annoying vendors that are allowed by the security agents even inside of the hotel property limit. We found the waiters mostly unprepared, lazy and disinterested. At the pool if you order a drink lasts an eternity. In fact, if you order anything in this hotel last an eternity. The food at dinner buffet is an ordinary cantine and you can easily see that they recycle the food from evening to another or is the same food. The concept of all inclusive is a joke, because there are only a few types of local drinks and those bad. Beach towels are to used and have old stains. We chose the restaurant "fine dining", but the disappointment continued. We first drink comes after 15 minutes, and the food was brought after an hour of waiting and although you must have 15 / discount due prepaid package of all inclusive, we were charged 100 / requires that the next day to ask for explanations, explanations that reduced bill. However, the food is typical of a normal restaurant. Not bad, but nothing special. I have to mention that in the fine dining restaurant were only 2 tables with people. It was empty! The new years evening was ok, but we wanted to order champagne and they told us they are out of stock. We wanted Moet, they gave us Mumm. How can you not have stocks of champagne for New Years Eve? The food was very good. If this have been the food for all the holiday i could have forgot all the other things At 14.30 in the nect day the room was not cleaned in the context in which We left at 9 am the room. I ordered a soft drink included in all-inclusive package, it was added to the bill and replaced at the my request. Conclusion: if you're not careful pay twice. Wishing to relax at the beach we waited 30 minutes for the staff to find sun beds towels. Another breakfast: I asked two omelets ( for me and my husband) everything OK, I asked him and the third omelets for my son and the cook was getting nervous. The adventure continues... For sure the hotel management will have a respond to this post, but it will not make any difference , because my new years eve holiday was ruined, so I recommend you avoid this hotel that can be classified as no more than one 4-star hotel!

Returned to Heritance Ahungalle after 7 long years. The quality of service was excellent and was reminisce of our past experiences of this hotel. The quality and choice of food has improved to a level that is on par with the famed Heritance Kandalama.

Great Service! Great people, always smiling ... Very humble a Extemely polite. I will recommend this place to anyone who wishes to see true SriLanka. Food off the charts Ambience very cozy Transport very punctual

We stayed here, and It was an amazing experience. The staff was excellent and the service was remarkable. The issue we had, however was the pool. There were people in the pool wearing ordinary clothes. Which is so off-putting and unhygienic. You are supposed to wear swimming attire and wash yourself before getting into the pool. This made us feel very uncomfortable and surprisingly the hotel management didn't seem to take notice of it either. Then when we went to the second pool, there was another couple the lady was dipping with her clothes on! This is not the type of environment we expect from a classy hotel. I really hope that the management takes required steps and fix the issue. Other than that it was a great stay and an extremely hospitable hotel.

I really love this hotel.staff is amazing.. Food is outstanding..... Rooms are clean and beautiful view...evening entertainment is very relaxing.truly nice place to relax the holiday...... Thank you...we will come back for sure...
