Good atmosphere, good food spread, pleasant staff, excellent service. Clean beach and beautiful, nice place to relax especially on a long weekend, would recommend to friends and family, hoping to come e back again.

excellent service and great food. Rooms are great. Excellent thought of organizing the magic show for children's. Staffs are very supportive and we would recommend to any one. Fire show was good need some theme improvements

We enjoy our trip to ahungalla staying at the heritance ahungalla hotel. We enjoyed the place, the beach as well as the buffets. Accomedation is also very good and very relaxing. Enjoyed the beach very much with the cool breeze.

It was my second visit. Wonderful experience. Although the rooms were a bit old and dated, equipped with all the necessary facilities . Food was great. View of the sea in evening is breath taking. Hotel is having two swiming pools. One common and other only for residents. I was lucky enough to see the cultural dancers and fire drills organized by the hotel. Experience at the night club was great. Customer service is great. Worthy visit.

My cousin and I had a wonderful stay at this resort . We feel that a special mention must be made about the staff at Heritance Ahungalla . Never have we seen staff at a resort or hotel who were so attentive to your every need . One truly outstanding person , is Kusum , who works at the restaurant The Jute ...... What an amazing person ! He was so attentive to everyone 's needs . You did not have to wait long for anything you needed . When we were eating the most delicious " appoms" with our fingers , Kusum was there with a finger bowl for our messy fingers ğŸ˜„....even before we could ask for one . He remembers little details like the hot tea that we always end our meals with and brings it to us even without us asking , just at the right time ... Kusum always had a beautiful smile for everyone at the restaurant . Chef Roshan was another person who impressed us , he heard that we were eager to eat a certain type of fish and he took the trouble to check with his kitchen staff to see if he had the fish as he wanted to cook it specially for us . I have never seen any place like this , where the chefs all come out during meal times , smiling and greeting their guests . We will be back and one of the main reasons will be because of the fantastic staff that 's at Heritance Anhungalla.

The Hotel of Heritance is a good hotel to stay with family. This is my 2nd visit. I personally like this place.Because their staff and service was excellent. We want to come back again my next Holliday too.

Very good friendly staff..... good food...... this is my 5th time I love it..... willing to come again nice pools.... Lovely beach... Nice and clean room ........................... ............. .......

Amazing place near the beach.Unfortunately our time was limited to be on the beach or the pool. Got to enjoy the Breathtaking views and the settings. Staff was extremely friendly with a smile and the helping hand. Food was delicious and couldn't ask for a better day out. Thanks!)

The hotel is in a distance which is not too far and not too close to Colombo. A place to visit if you are a sea food lover. The view from the third floor is one of the best you could get. A clean beach and can experience a good cultural show as well.Friendly staff. A place to relax away from all the hectic work life.

I enjoyed the stay at Heritance. It's an amazing hotel where both my husband and I relaxed and enjoyed the food. The room was really cozy and comfortable. The cultural show was superb and staff was really attentive.

good location,nice staff, very helpful. tasty food with wide variety.best place in the southern coast..we definitely want to come back again.lot of entertainment in the evening,had a very good time with my wife.

Have stayed at Heritance Ahungalla for few times and it was a lovely experience. Staff is always willing to help with a smile and it offers excellent range of food.The rooms nice and are well maintained.Nice surrounding environment. In summary, nice place for a family stay.

Heritance Ahungalla is a superb hotel lying on the Indian Ocean. The service is fantastic with a wonderful team of caring staff. Both the pools are inviting and the sunsets are amazing. I highly recommend the cocktails.

April 2015 i was staying at Hotel Heritance Ahungalla, Good location, beautiful beach property...food was ok, Room service was bad.the TV was not working,flush was not working.The hotel had 2 swimming pools both beach facing.

We spent three days staying at this beautiful hotel. From the moemnt we arrived, we were able to relax and enjoy the stunning surroundings, designed by one of Sri Lanka's top arichitects, Geoffrey Bawa. The staff were always friendly and helpful, quick to respond and unfailinging polite. They took great care of us. We particularly enjoyed the gorgeous pools as well as the local beach. There was a massive range of choice at the breakfast and dinner buffets, and the chefs took great interest in how much our children, especially, enjoyed the food.

Good staff ,nice looking Good food Beautify pool Good people Nice beach Climate is good Ecelebrity super breakfast Good bed room It is quite room Clean garden Beatidily garden Good house keeping service

Had a great experience visiting the hotel. The staff is excellent, friendly and attentive - the main reason I thought of leaving the review as they deserve it. Hotel is also nice, clean. Rooms are very spacious. Buffet was good, nice swimming pool and clean beach. Recommended. :)

Hands-on managed, all Heritance Hotel Ahungalla staff are attentive, courteous, friendly, service-oriented and smiling. We felt at home (away-from-home), comfortable, safe and welcome during our stay. We are a family of five with a teenage daughter and two pre-teen sons (12 and 10). We had two adjacent spacious pool & sea view rooms at one end of the property on full-board basis. The on-duty chefs and catering staff (at the buffet restaurant) were always keen to ensure the dietary needs of our vegan daughter and plain - hamburger / hot-dog & fries - younger son were met; and moreover enthusiastically introduced us to Sri Lankan fruits and dishes. Surprisingly to us, the cooking staff regularly participate in international competition and the Head Chef has most recently won best chef at a competition in Europe! Heritance Hotel Ahungalla is a perfect choice for those looking for a hassle-free and quiet, couples or family holiday in a lushly landscaped, sea-view Sri Lankan First Class property. Our family enjoyed a memorable holiday there :) Thanks to the GM and all staff, now our friends!

We visited the hotel in April with my husband and small son.As we entered to the hotel we were warmly welcome by the infinity pool with very own heritance traditions and three different types of fresh juices also.Fortunately we could have a room within 10 minutes, even we didn't reserve our rooms earlier.It was fast when considering to the other hotels in Sri Lanka.We were guided by Ms.Supuni to the room and she explained us everything in the hotel with giving the maximum definition to the hospitality. Later my husband wanted to see the green pool even we were not allowed to use it because we were just for the day use. Again we were guided by Ms.Supuni and she explained the history of the hotel that we wanted to know. My son was very happy during the stay because he used to get lollipops when he needed. Food was awesome and I think there is no other place to compete with.Credits to chefs!Our room was cleaned and comfortable although we got a room nearby the spa. We have visited many hotels in Sri Lanka but never felt a hospitality as in Heritance-Ahungalla. Staff is very friendly and always supportive to the best of it. My son was very upset to leave the hotel and we couldn't extend our stay due to overbooked situation. Miss.Supuni is a credit to your hotel and definitely we will be back to feel the hospitality again to this beautiful hotel.Highly recommended for everyone!

We came to heritance ahungalla with a group.today we had a dinner on the beach.excrllent food.service was very fast.staff is very friendly and.helpful. The best hotel in sri lanka We want to come back next year too......

We had very nice time , there is beautiful view , kind staff , great service , supportive staff , i think i hope i have another chance to come srilanka and visit this hotel ,, also i forget to mention that the food was fantastic

nice stay nd had a good time...good hospitality....food was good...superb place for office day outing....even for family stay over night...pool can accomadate lot of people to hav fun....nice hotel to visit again..

It was our 3rd visit to this lovely hotel...hospitality @ its best...starting the reception to room service to restaurant to pool attendant.... Had a good spread for lunch... Most importantly its surrounded by a clean beach And of course a lady who celebrated her 70th b'day,wld hv had a lovely memory...

It would be a sin to not reccomend this hotel during our vacation we visited many hotels around Srilanaka and i have to say that this was by far the best, with an amazing ocean view and extremly nice waves, they had a decent pool, and very good food , staff were extremely nice and helpful as i said before it would be a sin to not reccomend

My self andd my husband with our family's came down for the weekend.and from the time we stept in the hospitality and the amazing friendliness from the staff was amazing. food was good and had a great time in the pool rooms we clean and comfortable . and we would definitely come again keep up the good work.and who ever who has not visited plzz do :)

Very good service and hospitality, lovely view and friendly and helpful staff. Lovely place to have a good holiday, food is also nice. Room is clean. This is was our third visit. we will be back again. thanks

They are very friendly because they ask your needs and fulfil it. Jacuzzi is really comfortable and fun. I had lost my sun glass and they helped me find it and I finally found it. The food is EXCELLENT!

Rooms were superb with great facilities and food was great... Had a nice view of the beach and I think it's the best place to enjoy a walk on the beach as well as a swim in the large swimming pool.........

All the staff were friendly and helpful. Nice atmosphere, clean rooms & tasty food. The only thing was they said there will not be a buffet since it was an off season weekday but there was a buffet on that day and a la carte dessert menu. it was a bit confusing. Anyways it was worth the money. And we got a complementary yummy cake since we went there to celebrate a birthday :)

Beautiful location, beautiful architecture, beautiful setting, beautiful weather, beautiful food, beautiful staff. Honeymoon part 1 a great success now on to Heritance Kandalama......................................................

Very clean and beautiful hotel.friendly and helpful staff. Specialy shanika and madhumini from the reception.excellent service.the beach is very clean.food is fabulouse. Best hotel in this area. We want to come back again with our family and friends.

Nice place to relax. Very friendly staff. Food was good. View was mind blowing. Pool was neat and clean.Room was cosy and comfortable. Had a relaxing holiday. Thanks to all the staffs. Hope to visit very soon.

One of the best hotels in sri lanka.we got a very nice room.two swimming pools are clean and beautiful.staff is very friendly and helpful.the food is really good. good value for money.we would love to come back. Its so beautiful during rainy season in sri lanka,highly recommend.

this is our first visit to heritance ahungalla.staff and the service was excellent.we really enjoyed.speally my kids.rooms are very clean and food is amazing. we really want to come back on our next holiday too.

Fantastic stay. Staff couldn't do enough for us. This was our Honeymoon and they made it very special for us. Recommend a massage if you can. Food very good......Everywhere very clean.....room very nice....

From the moment you arrive, you are treated as though you are the only guest and nothing is too much trouble. The hotel is in the perfect position, with the the warm sea a few metres away, and with pools surrounded by beautiful tropical gardens that team with wildlife, this is as close to paradise as you can get. Having been lucky to stay in some of the most exotic places in the world this is up with all of them. John & Barbara - England

My family & I had a great stay at the hotel, very friendly staff and great atmosphere. Enjoyed every bit of the weekend stay. Definitely will be back for more. Thank you all for a wonderful experience

We really enjoyed our stay in the Heritance Ahungalla Hotel and fully recommend this place to everyone. The hotel is situated directly at the nice beach, where just another restaurant and hotel is, so the beach is calm and not crowded, which is beautiful! The two pools are clean and very nice. The outside area is natural with a good atmosphere! All (!) the staff was always that friendly and worked with the full heart, they supported us in any questions we had. We thank you for your kindness, love and happiness! And we will come back to Sri Lanka and surely also to the Heritance Group! With the best for you, Vera & Patrizia

Just stayed for some drinks on the way to Galle on our trip from Colombo. Magical place and a grand entrance with stunning view over the pooÃ¶ and the ocean. Very nice staff and they tokk good care of us even if we wasnt over night guests. This is a must for our next time in Sri Lanka for sure.

As you enter Heritance Hotel, you are treated to a spectacular view of a massive pool and an expanse of Indian ocean. We arrived very late at night but the staff were excellent, a quick check in, accompanied by some piping hot Sri Lankan tea. Our room was nice without being outstanding and did not have a sea view. Would recommend that you ask for one. We were on half board, so dinner included _ a good decision since not too many good restaurants work walking distance. Food, both breakfast and dinner were adequate. The chocolate mousse being the stand out. Staff and the overall hotel were very kid friendly and the beach being at our doorstep was amazing. Slightly better housekeeping and some facility for basic watersports like boogie boards would have been useful. Go: with kids or in a group Don't go: if you are looking for a top end five star experience

After starting our holiday at the heritance hotel kandalama we didnt think it could get better. We travelled around for 2 weeks and wanted to end our trip relaxing by the beach. We booked this because of the good service we had at the kandalama. This hotel has got amazing views, great amenities and attention to detail. David one of the managers gave us a warm welcome and upgraded us to a suite with a cake and fruit basket arriving in the room as well as rose petals on the bed. After 2 nights we enquired about a room with a view, our suite was great but we wanted to see the sunset from our balcony on our last night. David was great he swapped our room to one with an amazing view of the sea and infinity pool, food was great and the staff couldnt be more accomodating, would definitely recommend a stay here

The service in this hotel is spectacular. Filled with warm smiling faces of the staff and the sweet aroma of cinnamon surrounding. The view is amazing from the first step and has the best first impression by far of all the Heritance hotels. Especially I would like to mention Dinusha and Sachini from the front office, as they were very helpful with information and other requests of ours. The restaurant hostess were very well trained especially during the busy times, always working with a smile. The food is also exceptional and A big thanks to the talented chefs who created the meals. To end I say that Heritance Ahungalla is second to none! We hope to return very soon!

hi guys ....this is yo. from colombo. I recently visited heritance ahungalla.itz AmaZing feeling for me n ma family. rooms are very clean and food is 1st class. I must thank mr thushara thr fnb manager.very kind guy.he arranged every thing superbly.I highly recommended heritance ahungalla. satisfaction garanteed for the money yu spend..

We enjoyed a lot. Staff and the service wa excellent.food was superb. We really want to come again because of the staff.they are amazing.beach id very clean and beautiful...............................

My self and my friends had a lovely time at heritance ahungalla. Superb service. Staff were excellent. Specially thushara . We love to come here again. Exceed expectations...feel like home....Thank you heritance.

Excellent service. Friendly staff. Quality room service. We'll never forget the experience in Green pool. So much things to enjoy. Especially the spa! We enjoyed very much. Spend peacefull two days with mouthwatering foods and breathtaking views. Thanks Heritance!

We had a wonderful stay and the staff, particularly kevin eere very friendly and extremely helpful. The pools are great and child friendly and the good catetef to vehetariens. Thanks for a very relaxing stay.

This would be my 6th stay and what keeps me returning is the atmosphere altogether. Friendly and accommodating staff and good food is always a good combination. Hope the quality will be maintained in the future!

We had a super holiday at Heritance Ahungalla. They have two huge beautiful pools. The beach is just 100 yards away. The buffet is an endless variety of food and desserts. Very friendly and attentive staff. Kids had a great time too.

Myself and my girl friend had a lovely time at heritance ahungalla.staff and the service is excellent.food was fabulouse.room service was given twice a day..and clean comfortable room.towel decorations were so adorable.

The Wandering Yank here again. We spent 5 days here at the end of our tour of Sri Lanka, and we had a wonderful time. The facilities are beautiful. It's a low-rise building almost hidden in the trees just back from the gorgeous beach. The lobby and Mirror Bar are open air and served well by sea breezes. The immense main infinity pool is the centerpiece of the building. Service was excellent, as we enjoyed everywhere else in Sri Lanka. The restaurant food was okay, not spectacular, at the breakfast and dinner buffets. We also ate at the Mustard cafe and the fine dining restaurant, which we thought had the best food. I particularly appreciated the clove-scented elevator :) We spent a number of hours in the little-used 3rd-floor library. There was a selection of paperbacks and old magazines (multiple languages), but best of all were the comfortable chairs with excellent views of the beach. It was a very relaxing 5 days at the end of our often tiring journey throughout Sri Lanka, and like I said, it fit the bill!

We stayed at this hotel for two nights at the end of 3 weeks touring Sri Lanka. We really enjoyed the beach and lovely swimming pools. Our room was average directly above the main restaurant with a very hard bed we asked staff to it a mattress topper which they did but was not really any better the second night. We We're woken up very early one morning by room service but had not placed an order Breakfast wAs more like a cafeteria this hotel is very popular with the locals and they obviously have very different standards to us they love a Buffett which is exactly what we don't want. This is supposed to be a five star hotel and they certainly charge accordingly but they are not providing five star service or food More expensive for two coffees Than in Melbourne we did not eat any other meals at this hotel we went out to local restaurants recommend jungle Beach 10 min walk turn left at the beach Heritance need to have a look at there food and in particular the price of water prices $100 US for dining on the beach without drinks and the food is just not good enough standard The staff were friendly and pleasant at all times we found this at all Aitken Spence hotels

We stayed at room 327. Superb room . We had an excellent stay. Front office staff very good. Specially Shanika. Nice family retreat. Exceed expectations. ...thumbs up!. Will come back again. ...beach is fantastic with the pool.... kids enjoyed. ...

This was the last stage of our April Holidays where we chose Heritance Hotels for our stay. First Kandalama and the last day at Ahungalla. The hotel is spacious and has good food and amenities, and is very family friendly. The staff especially the reception and restaurant staff were helpful when they met our needs. We'll be back! ğŸ‘

Had a variety of food and fantastic taste. staff was very friendly typical of Sri Lanka, magnificent hotel with pool and beach made the stay memorable and exciting. This hotel wil be on top of my list for another visit.

We visited Hotel Heritance Ahungalla for our 5th wedding anniverssary and was mesmerized by The true beauty of the surrounding, the structure and the friendliness of the staff throughout The holiday.for the 4th time we came to the Heritance hotel with 20 of our relatives to celebrate Avurudu (srilankan traditional festival) on the 14th April 2015, and spent 2 days and had the Best time of our lives.superb service, clean and luxury rooms, delicious food, and didn't feel That we were away from home.super friendly staff and they were eager to help us at anytime. Mr.Thushara the food and beverage manager was extremely helpful at all times and made sure That everything went well.we would like to thank Mr.Thushara and his staff specially for the Superb service rendered,and we would be visiting hotel Heritance Ahungalla very soon.

We had a excellent stay at ahungalla with my family and we really enjoyed the aurudu holiday. It was realy nice.Exceed expectations. Definitly will be back again. Feel like home. Staff and the service is excellent.

I have stayed here with my daughter. We have had a wonderful holiday at the end of my 3 month stay here in Sri Lanka. It's a perfect place for anyone of any age from anywhere. The food is excellent, there is so much choice. I have tasted the best hoppers & string hoppers in Sri Lanka here! Service is excellent. The room is always spotlessly clean & arranged, regardless of how messy we have left it! The staff are always smiling & approachable. The swimming pool very clean & well maintained- suitable for swimmers of any age & ability. The pools have shallow enough areas for non swimmers to be comfortable in the pools also. The beach in front of the hotel is clean & beautiful, as well safe for sea bathing (as per the advice from the lifeguards). The greenery that the hotel is set in is very calming. There is plenty of space to relax around the pool & the beach. For even more stress relief & relaxation, the therapists at the Spa are brilliant & we will pay another visit when we retun here. Highly recommended. No negative comments to write. We shall definitely be returning when we are next in Sri Lanka ğŸ˜ƒ

My mother & I visited on a 2 day break whilst in Sri Lanka. We have been thoroughly spoiled during our stay here. The food has been absolutely delicious & the service excellent. We have eaten the best hoppers in Sri Lanka! Even my mother, who is extremely discerning in her culinary opinions was dazzled by the food here- that is no mean feat!! The staff are extremely friendly & cannot do enough to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The rooms are spacious & we had a beautiful sea view. There are 2 swimming pools, one of which is quiet & has a jacuzzi. The proximity of the hotel to the beach is an additional benefit as the beach is very soft sand & perfect to have a sea bath. Overall a delectable & relaxing experience which I would recommend both to those who use this as a destination hotel & those who wish to use the hotel as a base to explore the south west coast.

This is the place to be if you are a sun, beach and food person with a quite environment. I travelled with my kids and my BIL's family and they had a great outing. They have two pools and a jacuzzi . we preferred the one which is hidden from the entrance. the food was great and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Guaranteed, you will not be disappointed with your stay here.

we were here just before Sihnala new year. this is a nice spacious place with a nice long beach, two swimming pools (green pools which is the second pool is for in house guests only, which is a more convenient arrangement). In room facilities are very good and reminds me Heritance Kandalama. Staff is so friendly and need to tell that their service is better than most of the other places that i have stayed recently. Even with large number of people staying during these two days (including Prime minister of Sri Lanka), staff offered a great service. Food (especially breakfast) had a great verity, however i don't rank food as the top positives of this place. But that doesn't mean food is bad. (this can be a more Sri Lankan view) when selecting a room, if possible ask for a sea facing room (directly). all in all it is been a great stay..

One of the best places in the island. Talking about the staff: awesome, friendly and is a homely place. Rooms are of good quality and the place it's located. We stayed here for two days and enjoyed alot. Prices are reasonable as a five star hotel and I would recommend it to anyone first of all. We've been here for the past six to seven years when ever possible and had good times. Entertainment is at its best and recommended to anyone.

Decided to stay over at Ahungalla for my birthday with the family. The Management & Staff had made every effort to make us feel special. Arrangements in the room and the very charm birthday celebration done by the restaurant staff without disturbing the other guests was a surprise. Everyone was very friendly and helpful as usual and specially the people who knew us as frequent visitors. Never felt that we were away from home. Will be back soon.

Facilities marvellous. Avurudu games were really good. avurudu food was really nice. Had fun at the pool . The beach was really nice. Lovely views. Organised lovely traditional food , shows and games. Restaurant food was great.

Me and my husband had an amazing honeymoon in Heritance Ahumgalla. Apart from the good food, clean rooms and friendly staff....what I loved the most about this place was its location. I love beaches and if given a choice, I would happily spend my life on one. And Ahungalla beach is breathtaking! I want to specifically appreciate the breakfast buffet. It has a wide spectrum of things and you get confused as to what type of breakfast you want. We really enjoyed eating dinner by the beach. Although I suggest that you can slightly improve upon the cocktails you serve. Also, different menu on different days (for the beach dinner) would also not be a bad idea :-) But, to summerize, our stay in Heritance Ahungalla was memorable one. We will definitely visit them again.

We have very good time with our holy day and good aura du u the awaya and the beach are very good and clean also the staff are very nice us and the food are very good and we get halal food tx...................

Awesome experience, kids had a lovely time..... The avurudu programs were lovely, well organized.....would love to come back. Thank you for everything...!hopefully we'd get come back around avurudu season.... Enjoyed the beach too.

We had a relaxing and unforgettable 3 days, from the almost personalised service to the high quality food and the enjoyable new year activities, we didn't even need to leave the hotel. This is a must visit resort and one of the best in the country.

My son who is 9 years old tells me it's the best hotel he has been to. He is a big traveller eventhough he is 9 (about 20 in srilanka and 3 abroad). We all loved the food and the staff. There was one staff Thushara who was always being at the restaurant and checking the wellbeing of the guest. I have to give him credit because he made the hotel experience even better for us. All in all its one of the best hotels in srilanka and in the best in South coast I visited. Room was super spacious (luxuary).. staff was super polite and helpful. .. food was amazing with a wide range. Keep up the good work !!!

We had a week there in April. Weather was great, hotel staff were polite and helpful, however some were perhaps a little too obvious in their hope for a tip or two. Food was very good and couldn't be better located for the beach. Beach hawkers, although were kept off the hotel property, were a little keen on (noisey) trying to attract your attention despite making it clear purchasing a top/skirt/hat etc wasn't going to happen!

The staff there is very friendly, they serve very nice food, but the service is sometimes not that good. Our rooms (319, 323) were quite nice, and very clean. (Special thanks to kularatha from the house keeping) Especially the dining at the beach was very delicious and beautiful. Thank you :)

Great service, very friendly staff,clean and neat, great beach, Great sunset view, Good food, good music, recomended for relaxation Really not to be missed Go there at the end of your tour for couple of days

Lovely hotel! Very clean and extremely friendly staff. Great food, quite quiet-which makes for a very relaxing holiday, if that's what you're looking for!! This sea is ok for swimming if you're careful. Overall we would highly recommend!!!!!

We stayed here as part of our honeymoon for 7 nights. Overall a very good stay and a very good hotel. The grounds are lovely - there is a really nice 'open' feel to the hotel. It is a very quiet hotel, which was perfect for us as we wanted to just relax but if you want nightlife this probably isn't for you - however they do provide some entertainment in the evening. The two pools are good, very clean. Situated on the beach....no one really uses the beach (which is unusual)! The sea was great fun.... huge waves but also a very strong current so be careful.Sunbeds were really spread out, which we really liked - made a change not to be right next to loads of other people - however we were having to get up at 7am to get sunbeds and more importantly an umbrella. I think there needs to be more umbrellas available as there is not much shade around- and the option of shade is vital!! Rooms were good. Spacious and clean. Cleaned everyday and our room attenedant was lovely- always leaving flowers for us. Food was of good quality - lots of choice and the desserts were amazing! We went all inclusive, however I would not recommend going all inclusive. We have been to many all inclusives and found this hotel lacking in choice - this mainly refers to the drink options, there was quite a lot restrictions and not much choice. I was quite disappointed that you could only have wine at dinner and unfortunately that wasn't 'free flowing'! You would definitely be better off going full board (for the lovely food) and then buying the drinks as you go!! The hotel is in quite a secluded area - so most day trips are a full day so worth bearing in mind when planning. Also we were keen to go on the whale watching trip but it only happens once a week and was fully booked so maybe plan early to avoid disappointment. Free WIFI available and is high speed internet...nice bonus. All round a great trip - would return again!

We spent 10 nice days at the Heritance Ahungalla in april 2015. To summarize, the stay was in general a good one. The setting is wonderful indeed. Spectacular beach. Great weather. The hotel as such is not bad at all. However, given the fact that it is supposed to be on the upper end, and that is has been designated the title Travelers Choice, we expected a lot more. This is more like a mid-range family resort. The good: Wonderful surroundings, sea view from the balcony, tasteful spacious rooms with a well-regulated AC. Great breakfast. Pretty good food quality in general. Friendly service. The headwaiter acted very professionally and listen very carefully and arranged adjustments when we complained about the buffÃ© dinner. The Bad: Dinner is a BuffÃ©, served in an environment reminding you of an elementary school. Let us say - not very cozy. They brag about their fine dining restaurant, which serves excellent lobster (hence, you should go there once) at a quite high price, but the rest is nothing special. Expect â‚¬40-50 for a bottle of wine anywhere in the hotel. It is a family resort. Some days the pool area is crowed with screaming kinds, despite that pool rules say: NO GAMES. The staff does nothing to moderate. Between the hotel and the beach there is an area with palms and bushes. In the shade, a dozen or so sales men and women do their best to attract the attention of the guests all day long. Hello, hello! Our plane departed late so our travel agent suggested that we should ask for a late check out. Initially the response sounded as if that most likely could be arranged, but somehow the hotel was fully booked on the Monday morning when we should leave, so we had to leave the room and take the shower in a cramped public shower with no shower gel and no space to leave your belongings. That was the end of a glamorous holiday. Well, maybe not. Suggestions to management: 1. Dinner: Try to do something about the elementary school dining room. Serve the BuffÃ© twice at 19 and then again at 20:30. Make sure that the food is fresh all the time. 2. Mixing families and couples: You have two pools. Why not enforce strict quiet behaviour at either pool and let the kids play at the other. Everyone will be happy. 3. Public showering facilities: It is warm. People are the for swimming. Make sure they can take a shower in a respectable bathroom before they say goodbye. It will be the last impression they take with them back home as they say Au revoir.

We have visited Sri Lanka 10 times and stayed in really lovely hotels but have never revisited any but this year we are going back to the Heritance because it really was the best .Staff could not do enough to make our stay perfect Special thanks to Pasindu who always seemed to know what we wanted and when which must be difficult when the hotel is busy Looking forward to the great food great service and know we will have a great holiday

Pristine beaches to pool, so much fun and relaxing for my husband, 3 year old daughter and parents. The rooms were beautiful and the staff were all accommodating. The buffets were awesome too. Nothing bad to say, all great! Loved it. Wish I stayed longer than one night.

My stay at the hotel was for 2 weeks and was absolutely beautiful the rooms are spacious and always clean the staff are so friendly and very helpful. The beach is clean and private. Definitely would recommend :)

Awesome service, clean rooms and staff was really helpful. We got a larger room than the original one we requested.Food was excellent too and they have a wide variety of buffet items. Had an awesome stay. Good value for money

We spent one week in this hotel (B&B only). The hotel is built in a minimalistic style that I liked very much and has a great swimmingpool. The rooms were clean and neat. After several reviews on this site on the condition of the rooms, I can only say that to us they looked very modern. We are in the middle of choosing a new bathroom and what we saw here is what we had seen at home as being very much op-to-date. After 4 days they needed our room for a groupbooking and we were upgraded to an even bigger room! The people were very friendly, no problem getting a sunbed and towels. The food was good, all kinds of snacks during the day. We have not seen any people in the Upper Room restaurant, the Jute Restaurant was for the buffets, so we had dinner in the Mustard coffee shop 3 times, which was very good although a limited choice. When you go out on the beach, turn right and after a 5 min. walk you will find the Sunshine Restaurant, where we had dinner 4 nights in a row. Fresh fish from the grill with a delicious salad and fried rice. Together with a bottle of wine for some 5000 Rs (half of it for the wine). We read about people on the beach selling tours (Charli, Sunil and others). They try to catch you on the first day, so you have not had time to compare with others. Where Charli would charge you 8000 Rs for a trip to Galle, we had Manu (from the Sunshine Restaurant) who has a tuktuk and is a licensed guide and driver. He took us on a tour to Galle for only 2.500 Rs! We also did the river safari with Manu. He is a very friendly guy and not so pushy as the guys on the beach......

We stayed on route to Australia 20th . 26th Dec . it was the worst Xmas ever. It poured with rain , the hotel was supposed to be a 5 star but really no more than 2 star. The only good point is the staff and they tried their best to please us . but the bottom line is the dismal grotty rooms the gray plaster bathrooms poor quality towels , generally grubby. The main restaurant is dark brown , noisy scraping chairs, dingy, grotty. The food caters for the sri Lankans/ Indians not Europeans . I got a bad tummy that stayed with me for two weeks. I could write a book about all the horrid aspects of this hotel but suffice it to say Don't Go .

Originally designed by Geoffery Bawa this is a hotel with impact. Beautiful pool areas and superb setting. The staff are always polite and friendly - always ready with a smile and going out of their way to assist. When booking a room be sure to state if you want a double rather than a twin. This hotel codes 'double' as twin beds positioned next to each other. So for a shared bed you need to request a 'king size' upon booking. A small irritating change of descriptor that lead to many a confusion and many a room change request I'm sure. The rooms are of a good size with brilliant en suites - great power showers. We had a large balcony - more of a terrace which was perfect for a g&t as the sun went down. We were on an all-inclusive package eating from the main restaurant each meal whilst in the hotel. Whilst I am never a fan of buffet style dining the quality and range of good was astounding. Always a fab selection of salads and local fruits as well as everything in between. We sampled do many new local dishes - one chef even cooking a new dish to try especially for me! If however it's Mediterranean/English fare you fancy whilst in the tropics, well then too you will not be disappointed. There were always about eight non-local dishes and about the same of Sri Lankan. Plus - if you're still peckish - a dizzying array of desserts. We arrived out of school holiday season and both pools were perfect for working off all that food, or pootling about in. On the last days of our stay however considerably more families arrived which made the pools, whilst beautiful, a little impractical for a full hotel. Whilst Western standard five star this certainly is not, overall it's a fine all inclusive offering.

Wow, this hotel is fantastic if you want to chill out and watch the world go by then this is the place to do so. The staff are very attentive going out of their way to ensure everything is ok for you. We were only booked on a B&B package, AI would have been better as there is very little outside of the hotel in terms of restaurants and bars. We did enquire about upgrading to AI but was too pricey for our appetite & would have restricted meals to the buffet option & we much prefer a menu choice. One of the chefs invited us for a tour of the kitchens, cleanliness was top notch & we really enjoyed seeing the food art studio ( chocolate & butter carvings were absolutely awesome). The waiters & waitresses remember you & what you drink, they have lovely genuine natures always ready with a warm smile. The pool attendants are there straight away in the morning setting up a lounger with towel wherever you want it. Breakfast buffet caters for every taste ( waffles, egg hoppers & fruit selection are out of this world). At no time did we feel like the hotel was overcrowded, always beds available,room to swim in one of the pools and tables in the restaurants. The sea has a strong undercurrent so always take care not to go out of your depth. As is usual in this part of the world you get the beach hawkers, they are only trying to make a living and are gracious when you say thanks but no. All in all a fantastic week with nothing but praise to amazing staff in a fab hotel!

Very nice rooms, staff really attentiv and friendly! Choice of food is good and specially the sri lanka menues are excellent!! Complete service is good.the beach is very beautiful and clean. Nice place to relax and we want to come back again.

I think sri lanka is a wunderful country and this is a very nice hotel. The stuff is very very friendly! Thank you! The pool and the view on the beach is amazing. Also the rooms are quite pretty. But i felt really stressed as soon as i went near to the beach. You couldnt enjoy for some minutes, there were always some people who tried to sell you some stuff. That wasnt okay and the hotel shouldnt accept that.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights first of all we asked for a sea view room and they told us that they will upgrade us to a suite with a sea and pool view wich made our stay. The property is nice clean and unique .it has 2 pools. The main pool is located in the heart of the hotel with a close distance to the sea . The beach is clean and the rooms are good and well air conditioned. The food is good but a little pricey. The staff are friendly and well trained we will definitely be back.

Our family enjoyed the stay and loved the facility... The staff is very courteous and friendly... Food awesome... Pool and the beach exotic... We would love to be back .... ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

We stayed here for 12 days and we don't wanted to go back home - what more can a holiday stand for? The staff is very friendly and always helping when there are questions. The food is soo good that we probably have to go on a diet now ;) There is so much to eat and so many new things to try... I also really liked the atmosphere during earth hour with all the candles and the fire show. Many thanks go to all the staff and we will always remenber the nice tour in the kitchen! Furthermore I want to thank the life guards and the animator for bringing me back savely to the beach after loosing the sand under my feet due to the current!! :) We enjoyed our stay here and we will be coming back for sure! Thank you so much for our great holidays here!

I am a seasoned traveller and get to see the good the bad and the ugly of the hotel world. I can honestly say that this is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. It is perfect for a relaxing holiday spot. The staff are always smiling and are genuinely enthusiastic about making sure you are happy and contented. They clearly have great pride in their nation and its culture and are more than happy to inform you of anything you want to know. I would recommend this place to anyone seeking a quiet tranquil break as a couple or as a family.

We stayed at Heritance Ahungalla for our honeymoon. After travelling the country and staying in several different hotels, we can honestly say that Heritance Ahungalla is the best in every way. The rooms, the service, the food and the amazing private beach is something we will never forget. Thanks to KK and Thushara for making our stay so memorable!

Stayed 3 nights this stay and despite checking in at 1pm was welcomed with a friendly smile and great service, even at that time of the morning. Service at this hotel is always flawless and am looking forward to a 3rd visit in the future. The room was amazing, with a beautiful view of the ocean and staff kept it clean everyday. The 2 pools are great, the food is always delicious and breakfast buffet has a good selection of quality food and the freshly made egg hoppers are yum.

I appreciate the steps heritance ahungulla is taking to save planet earth. The breath taking programme stirred my senses. The hotel is really awesome in its service, ambience and beauty. The idea of the beach adjoining the swimming pool is really greattt.

One of the best hotels in Sri Lanka, directly leading to the beach with a large and beautiful swimming pool. The buffet is also quite amazing with a variety of meals. The staff are very good and kind who are always supporting the guests even with questions indrectly about the hotel and also very efficient. A very good place to stay and relax also near places with Portugese Historical Heritage. This is the 12th time I have been here, even when the name was Triton.

Staying with my family at the Heritance for two weeks, the delightful atmosphere will always be remembered. A highlight of our stay was the astonishing show for the Earth Hour. I was asked by the very friendly personnel and artists to participate in their performance which was an unforgettable experience for me. Thank you very much for the wonderful evening!

Very beautiful Hotel next to the sea where you can hangout on the beach os on the large swimming pool. The Service is very good and the buffet good. Small remark concerning the room which was a bit dirty when we arrive, but the staff was very professional and reactive to order a new room cleaning which made everything alright! I recommend!

My fiancÃ© and I returned to this hotel following a stay in 2011. We enjoyed our time spent here and combined a visit to Ella and a stay in a guest house in Kosgoda. We would agree with other reviews that the hotel is in need of updating, however we heard that they are closing the hotel next year for improvements. Having said that, the rooms are fine and all areas are very clean (just quite tired). The service and hospitality is very good and friendly, the bar staff, pool/sunbed staff and especially the lovely man we had cleaning the room (Asoka), we saw him every day and he always went over and above, asking if there was anything he can do or anyway he could improve our room. We actually asked to change rooms as we weren't happy with the view from our first balcony (it overlooked the pool and we wanted something a little more private) and within 30 minutes a new room that suited us was ready. The pool area and garden are beautifully maintained and we loved our time spent around the pool overlooking beautiful Ahungalla beach. We stayed on a B&B basis as we enjoy eating outside of the hotel and there are lovely places to do this; the two beach restaurants just a 5 minute walk from the hotel (jungle restaurant and sunshine restaurant), a beautiful restaurant in the next town along (sankarest garden restaurant, a 5 minute tuk tuk ride at 250 rps). There are also other restaurants in Bentota but this is slightly further afield, 20 minute tuk tuk journey at c. 700 rps (depending on how you haggle). We went to tutle hatchery whilst there and a boat trip, both very worthwhile doing. As previously said, the beach is beautiful and very quiet however, I would be interested to see how it changes once the 500 room (vs. heritance 140) hotel next door is completed in two years time. As other reviews have said, you do get a bit of hassle from the beach sellers however this didn't bother us to much and seemed to die down after a couple of days of saying 'no'. We did book a boat trip through a nice guy called Charli who we'd met and had trips with in 2011, you can find him on the beach and ask any of the sellers for him as they all know each other. We would have liked to have taken the opportunity to hire bikes from the hotel but the weather was just to hot during our stay for either of us to have wanted to do this! Overall we really enjoyed our stay at heritance.

we spend 10 days in this lovely Hotel. The Service was very good and the meals extremely delicious. We never had meals at this high Level in a Hotel before. The property conditions are as well but you can see that the building is an old one. It is a good Place for relaxing and swimming in the waves.

Me and my husband stayed here for 13 nights in March 2015. We are quite well travelled and this holiday, by far, has been our absolute best! The hotel, the staff, the service, the ambience and Sri Lanka in general... We just fell in love. I'm an avid TripAdvisor user (I'm a travel agent) and after reading some reviews I did become slightly nervous about choosing the Heritance Ahungalla as our All Inclusive hotel. This is going to be a long one... The transfer wasn't too bad from Colombo airport. We booked our transfers privately and using the new Toll road the journey took just over 2 hours. As soon as we arrived at the Heritance we were taken to a seating area near the pool bar for refreshments and check in. The check in was super speedy and we were escorted to our room and its amenities were also pointed out to us which was very helpful and informative. We were in room 218 which is located above the Jute restaurant. You would of thought there would be a lot of noise or cooking smells coming up to our room, but not a thing. I didn't even realise our room was above the main restaurant until a couple of days in when we got our bearings. The view was lovely as we were overlooking the sea and gardens. The room was pretty great inside too. We did get 2 large single beds pushed together which in a way, was good as we could stretch out a little (I like my space! Haha). The lighting in the room wasn't the best at night when your trying to put makeup on, but no big deal, used the bathroom instead. I was quite happy with the room decor, the bathroom maybe could of done with a lick of paint, but the actual bathroom suit was fantastic! The rainfall shower was just divine! There was never a shortage of hot water either, no matter what time of day. We booked the All Inclusive package at the hotel which is well worth every penny! The food we sampled on our holiday has been excellent throughout. We didn't really sample the A La Carte restaurants as we were quite happy with the food and service in the main Buffett restaurant, Jute. The food choice sometimes was repeated a couple of nights, but there is so much choice that it didn't really matter. Plenty of other foods to try. I particularly liked Friday evenings as they did Chinese elements, lovely! The drinks included in the All Inclusive were pretty good too. I would of liked to of seen maybe more choice in the available cocktails, maybe the hotel should think about offering a 'cocktail of the day' just to mix it up a little. The hotel offers beach dining too in the evenings. We decided to give it a try and book it, boy was it delicious! We were waiter served for 2.5 hours and the food was just mouth watering! My husband had the Lobster and I had the steak, simply brilliant! It was so lovely with how they set the tables with lantern lights and the sound of crashing waves a few meters away. Definitely recommend you book it! Just before we had dessert the Sous Chef Roshan Pujitha came to our table to introduce himself and also offered us a kitchen tour after our meal which we accepted! It was really interesting as he also showed us the awards the hotel and its chefs have collected over the years. The hand made chocolates (which I honestly thought were Guylian Belgian Chocolate) were incredibly good! Roshan showed us how they made them, they are that good! Thank you Roshan for taking the time to come and see us throughout our stay too. At the start of our holiday we had the absolute pleasure of meeting Kumara (KK) the assistant restaurant manager, who simply went above and beyond. My husband is a Type 1 diabetic and KK went out of his way to accommodate his dietary needs. Most hotels do this yes, but KK was very generous in accommodating his needs. Thank you KK for everything you did, you made our holiday and it was absolutely lovely meeting you, you are an absolute asset to the Heritance company! The pools are just fabulous! We chose to use The Infinity pool during our stay which was awesome. The water was pretty warm and not cold at all either, which was nice. Most of the pool is waist height but there is a 'deep end' which is signposted with a water buoy. The beach hawkers aren't that bad actually. The couple of times we did set foot on the sand they did jump on us, but I found if you were polite and simply said no thank you, they left you alone. There is a guy on the beach, Tino, who offers day trips. We never used him as we pre booked our trips before arriving in Sri Lanka, but some other hotel guests recommended him and when I did speak to him, his prices did sound pretty good, and he'll take you where ever you want, easy. At the end of our holiday we decided to take a hotel run trip to the fishing harbour near Bentota. It was an early morning start obviously at 05:30 but we were back at 07:30 so wasn't too bad. We were escorted by M.Nuwan and chef Lakshan. This wasn't really something I wanted to do, but my husband did. I am so so glad I went though, it was fantastic! It certainly exceeded my expectations anyway! We were taken through the hustle and bustle of the harbour, shown all the different varieties of fish that had just come in etc. We got to choose some fish too which Chef Lakshan said he would give us a cooking class later in the day and we would have it for lunch! We got 4-5 fish altogether and at midday, we met Lakshan in the Mustard Cafe and he took us back into the kitchens and supplied us with chefs hats and aprons! The cooking class lasted 20-30 minutes and we were then seated back in the Mustard Cafe were Lakshan waited on us with a 4 course meal including the fish we had earlier bought and prepared. After the meal Lakshan and the executive Chef Kasun Premachandra came to see us at our table and said we could have the remaining fish for our evening meal if we wished. So again, in the evening, in the Jute restaurant, Lakshan prepared our food and served us again. Thank you so much Lakshan for the absolutely fantastic food and the experience! Apologies for such an in depth review but we loved our holiday and the hotel, I really wanted to share our experience. Thank you so so much to all the above mentioned, you really made our trip special and we will see you all again in August when we return!

Stayed 5 nights this stay and despite checking in at 3am was welcomed with a friendly smile and great service, even at that time of the morning. Service at this hotel is always flawless and am looking forward to a 4th visit in the future. The room was amazing, with a beautiful view of the ocean and staff kept it clean everyday. The 2 pools are great, the food is always delicious and breakfast buffet has a good selection of quality food and the freshly made egg hoppers are yum. Had a few drinks at the Pool bar, Wall bar and Apollo bar and staff were always friendly and smiling. I would like to specially thank Lakshitha, Kusum, Sudesh, Dayal and Chandra for amazing service, although service from everyone in the hotel is always fantastic, even from the cashier Nihal when i was checking out. I am always sad to leave this hotel. My only small disappointment this stay was from one of the staff (Bell Boy). A Sri Lankan friend came in to meet me for dinner in the hotel around 7.30pm on 12th March. We were walking into the foyer of the hotel and the Bell Boy ran up and interogated my friend in Sinhalese on what they were doing here. I was most embarrassed and spent most of dinner apologising to my friend for this bad experience. I unfortunately did not get this staff members name. Needless to say we had an amazing dinner after this incident with great service again. It was the only poor experience i have encountered in the 3 stays at the hotel. The other Bell Boys have always provided great service.

Stay here for two weeks We have a great stay .the best is the staff very polite always smile Even the service can bee a little slow sometimes. The garden and the swimming pool are just great . The Room are outdated and cleaning could be better, but we have a nice guy take well care of us . Breakfast is good a lot of choice.we enyou ours in the shadow outside .The dining room are dark. I will recommend the hotel for the surrounding.

My wife, me and granddaughter wanted to enjoy in January sunny weather and swimming in the sea. Hotel itself has big rooms comfortable rooms and excellent, polite staff. At that time the beach is practically empty, you will definitely enjoy the sea, its waves and the beach. The place itself is quite, hotel level is 4 stars, the food average, after a few days you would like to change restaurant but practically nothing is in the walking distance. You have to take taxi or tuk tuk . If you want to make a few trips around the Sri Lanka I recommend to start with 3-5 days tour around the island and than finish at the seaside. Just a few miles drive last very long because of heavy traffic so for the trip you have to start early morning (4-5AM) and you will finish late night.

This hotel stay was good stay; it was convenient booking; then 100Kms away from colombo warm welcome; faster check-in, good explanation of available amenities lovely morning beach.. good pool; good for kids not so deep very good food; and courtesy of staff; faster check out. mostly they had baby cots and baby chairs at restaurant; Badminton, tennis, pool, billiard, carom, table tennis were available; and quite helpful staff improvements would be; [Room:212] telephone showers are not available in deluxe rooms. washing kids is not so easy. its a good idea to have a proper & Secure place for parking. rooms are not very new; your kid may wake-up as the wooden floor sounds as you walk. no good lighting inside the room. its only two bedside lights and a table light; all are covered and focused. Bed was two combined single beds with separate mettresses

Stayed at the hesitance as a base for our two week stay in sri lanka. The hotel itself was lovely, the staff were amazing and really helpful. It's also really close (10 minute yuk yuk) to Ambalangoda where you can easily get trains for about 50p (sterling) to Galle and Colombo etc. The breakfast is fantastic with a great range of dishes and the two pools are both equally lovely with the guests only 'green pool' providing plenty of privacy and quirt (although the main pool was hardly noisy). Right on the beach and a lowly breeze blowing through all day. Great for both couples and families.

The Hotel is a wonderfull design by Jeffrey Bewa, beautiful details made me feel special. Rooms are nice, the pool area very big with seaview and withe sandy beach. The stuff is alwaya friendly and helpfull. The kitchen was great we really enjoied our time. Super wifi

We were at Heritance Ahungalla last weekend and were treated like VIP"S ! Special mention is made about - the staff - extremely courteous and friendly, without exception ie from reception to the restaurant. Special mention is made of Gamini Wijetunge, Head of F & B and his Assistant, Thushara, who went the extra mile to make our short stay memorable.l The food was superb - the buffet was fantastic, be it breakfast , Lunch or Dinner... - what a spread !! - Also the rooms are well designed, ( plenty of power outlets to charge phones, IPads and laptops) comfy beds, clean linen and towels,and of course, we were pampered with a fruit basket in our room !. The bathroom was large, with a rain shower and a bathtub, specially the Luxury Room we were in. This review is not complete without a special mention about the infinity pool . Lovely view of the Ocean,,and although the pool is massive , you can wade in - safe for kids - with a specially demarcated deep end area and the the hotel looks like a fairyland in the night from the pool side... Thank you all, for the wonderful stay. We will come back ! Ranjit and Kuveni Wijeratne

My husband and I spent 2 days in this stunning venue. As soon as I entered the reception I was taken back by the stunning view of the pool and beach.The rooms were clean and very modern. The rooms were refreshed twice a day by friendly staff. The food was amazing had a good selection. Plenty of meat,fish and vegetables served day and night. Extremely friendly staff who looked after us during our stay. We spent most of our time in the green pool and the beautiful beech. Felt relaxed and already looking forward to going back thee again.

One of the main reasons why we had an exellent stay in the hotel was the the extremly friendly staff. In particular we would like to name: Indika Gonawela, Pahan and Susil Also we would like to mention the variety of food.

Hotels entrance and lobby is very good. Amazing ambience of reception part but unfortunately unexpected rooms. Horrible the first day when we checked inn the room. Room was in a very bad condition. After a fight with front desk got a new room but next day. That was better but not upto the mark. Bad news for vegetarian indian food lovers "No much choice". But yes for any indian veg food requirement in the restaurant there is 1 very helpfull person available i.e. MR. Praveen. He supported us a lot and arranged very good veg indian food for us for all 2 days. Thanks a lot to him again. Overall our stay was very good. Beach , Swimming Pool, Jacuzzi etc etc. This hotel needs a renovation very badly.

Had 3 lovely days at heritance ahungalle with my husband and 2 kids. Friendly staff and great service. The food was amazing and the rooms were cozy. The kids loved the pool and the beach. Great hotel for a family get away. Relaxing and loved the staff. Especially My 5 years old daughter who commented how lovely the lady staff members were :)) thank you for a great holiday!

Night club was awsome. And great customer service by Lakshitha, Shanika and the staff. Silent pool was very chiling. Buffet is also great. Lovely sea side location and view of the beach. Calm and quiet place.

Great customer service, arranged everything acording to our needs. Thanks to the staff specially lakshitha and shanika for the hospitality. Had fun at the night club, which was greatGreat food, great place!

During a recent trip to Sri Lanka, my Travel agent suggested the Heritance Ahungala hotel. As a frequent traveller, I have stayed in many hotels around the world and consider myself as an expert of hospitality industry and customer service. I trully liked the hotel, the hard working and dedicated staff. There were few small issues, that I brought to the management attention. I received an immediate responce from the management to my feedback. I appreciate the hotel's management dedication to customer service and their ability to solve the problems immediately. I may consider Heritance Ahungala in case if I decide to go back to Sri Lanka.

The hotel and pool area is absolutely stunning. I couldnâ€™t stop staring from the main lobby over the pool to the ocean. Gorgeious. Not much around the hotel â€“ couple of restaurants nearby and very small â€œtown.â€ Wish there were more places to walk to â€“ but youâ€™re pretty much stuck with the hotel/resort itself unless you have a driver. Pools were great. Ocean was very nice too â€“ but unfortunately we found we couldnâ€™t really enjoy the beach at all b/c we were constantly harassed by local restaurant owners trying to get us to go eat at their restaurants. Used to hawkers throughout SE Asia â€“ but these guys just wouldnâ€™t go away/stop. We ended up simply avoiding the beach and staying at the pool â€“ which was unfortunate b/c the ocean/beach were beautiful. Not sure what the hotel can do about this â€“ but it definitely would be a reason we wouldnâ€™t go back. With that said, breakfast was good. The Fine Dining Restaurant was fantastic â€“ although we were one of only two tables the night we ate there â€“ which seemed a bit odd. Found out there was an activity director on our last night there â€“ things like volleyball for example. Wish we had known that earlier â€“ we would have enjoyed that â€“ hotel needs to do a better job of informing guests of activities going on. Music in the bar at night was a bit amateur â€“ but fun and cheesy. Native dance presentation one night was spectacular â€“ but again we just happened to be down there by happenchance b/c we didnâ€™t see where it was advertised. Overall â€“ if youâ€™re looking for a quiet, upscale beach resort and just hanging out at the pool â€“ this is a perfect place. If youâ€™re looking for more than that â€“ Iâ€™d recommend trying Bentota or Hikkaduwa instead.

Set away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life, this hotel was magnificent. It served superb food which had plenty of vegetarian choices. The staff were welcoming and professional. The pool was lovely and blended in with the gardens. A most enjoyable stay.

Travelled with my boyfriend to this hotel about a year ago, it is very far from the airport but Sri Lanka's such a beautiful and exciting country there's enough to see from the car that you don't get bored! Although their driving is so crazy compared to british roads we didn't see any crashes, only near misses thankfully. It was our first time in Asia and this hotel was perfect and definitely has the wow factor when you arrive. You're greeted with a drink and a cold towel which is nice after sitting in a car for hours and when jet lagged. The hotel itself is massive and we were on the first floor, I can't remember the room number, but we had a balcony and could just about see the sea over the trees. The room was spotless and a lot bigger than we were expecting with an inside seating area with mini bar and lots of storage space for our clothes. The grounds are amazing too, with the massive pool overlooking the beach and sea and then the other more secluded pool which was a bit quieter, with so much wildlife to see including water monitors and chipmunks! The pool attendants did a very good job of keeping both areas clean and tidy and making sure all the sun beds were clean. We thought the food was very good all round, both the dinner, lunch and breakfast buffets had a massive and varied choice with something to suit every taste from curry to salad and soup. It was sometimes quite difficult to get tea/coffee in the morning as you had to wait for them to come round and ask, but aside from that the service was good, especially considering how many tables their were. We ate in the a la carte restaurant on our final night and the food was AMAZING with massive portions, I would definitely recommend it. The staff were all incredibly friendly and they worked so so hard with us seeing pretty much the same staff everyday for our 12 night stay, and they were still all constantly smiling. We only had a slight issue with a few members not wanting us to pay as we went and would rather us put everything on our room but once we explained most were cooperative. Overall, we would love to stay here again it is the perfect relaxing holiday destination with also lots to see and do and we would recommend it to anyone!

mixed feeling about this hotel. the hotel grounds are beautiful, the pools and the beach are great but the building itself and the rooms are kind of old. the staff are helpful and it had a good breakfast spread. the main issue was the toilet as there was a weird mold or sewer smell

I went to Heritance for my wife's bday. The welcome was good and we were ushered to our suite, which was very spacious. We didn't use the outdoor facilities so cannot comment on that but all seems to be in place and the other guests seem to enjoy. There were many restaurants and they even arranged a dinner outside on the beach for my wife's bday but unfortunately we couldn't experience the same, as there was a drizzle but the thought was just amazing. They advised on what we should do there and we visited the Turtle Hatchery and we got a chance to release more than 85 baby turtles! Now that was an experience of a lifetime!! My wife was thrilled!!! All in all, excellent rooms, good food and great service. This is my second visit and I would certainly return.

A very nicely run hotel where all the staff are fully committed to serving the guests rather than maximise their income! As vegetarians, their catering staff went out of their way to make our stay very pleasant.

A very nice and romantic place for couples .. The perfect for relax and swimmIng.. The music played in the lobbyis similar to the arabic music which is good and made me feel like iam in my country.. Iam sooo happy that i chose it for the last two days of my visiting to stilanka

Facilities are excellent, Beautiful and safe beach to enjoy any time. Sun down is a sight to be seen while having drink in Swimming pool. Staff members are so friendly, Specially the reception manager Shanika and her crew did a wonderful job there. When it comes to food, very clean, so delicious and the restaurant manager and crew always willing to help you with smile. It would be a crime if I didn't mention the hard work of pool attendance in both swimming pools. They keep those two places so clean and tidy, happy to help with moving chairs as you wish and the lad who worked near the jacuzzi in last Saturday, even clean it for me just because I wanted to use it late and it was little bit dirty. Hope the management appreciate his work for me. I'll be back again in my next visit for sure.

Room is superb.food is exclusive. All expectations are very high. Both swimming pools are clean and very comfortable. Evening music is perfect and nice place to relax. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Specially shanika and kasun at the reception.Unfortunately we were lost luggages at the airport. but the hotel reception staff helped us to bring our luggages back. Atmosphere is very good and safety feeling. We would like recommend to anyone who like to have relaxing holiday in Sri lanka. This is unforgettable holiday and We will definitely come back.

Spent a few nights here before heading home - fabulous beach location. Pool is amazing and great views out to sea. Staff really helpful and attentive. Rooms a little tired in places but some appeared to be being refurbished so may not be an issue going forward. Lunch menu in the cafe was ok, main meals were in the buffet restaurant (all inclusive) but choice sometimes felt limited e.g. Salad selection however breakfast was always plentiful.

We are not common to visit a hotel twice, so three times would normally be out of the question. For Heritance Ahungalla we gladly make an exception. The personel treats us as friends for being repeaters. A perfect hotel for a VIP feeling.

We spent three weeks visiting Sri Lanka for the first time & had been touring for the first two weeks round the island. When we arrived at the Heritance we were ready to relax which was exactly what we did. Turning off the busy coastal road there was an immediate sense of calm & we particularly enjoyed the Bawa architecture which suits the climate so well. We had been upgraded to a suite which was fabulous so my husband spent most of the five days on the balcony overlooking the gardens, pool & beach. He was in seventh heaven & I could relax by the pool which was a good size for swimming. (This was not the pool by the entrance which is also lovely. Having two there was always plenty of space for everyone to swim & cool off.) We were on half board & found the buffet selection very comprehensive as we were happy to sample the local diet. If you wanted something less spicy there were always alternatives & it was a great treat to eat outside most of the time. Everyone looked after us & there was always a cheery greeting & a smile. We left feeling completely chilled with some great photos to remind ourselves how laid back we were.

We travelled to the Heritance for a 3 night stay we had previously been to the Hotel twelve years before when it was called the Triton so we were worried that it would not have been as good as our previous experience - we needn't have worried it was better. We went BB rather than all inclusive and chose to eat in both the Ala carte and fine dining restaurants - both were lovely but the Ala Carte seemed to provide better value for money with a wider choice and catered for children. The staff in the restaurants were all attentive to our requirements (including the chefs who were fantastic in providing for my wife who as a glutton allergy) and genuinely ready to chat which added that personnel touch which adds that special extra to the holiday. Our room was superb - suite with all appropriate mod cons and the cleaner (Thilma I hope I have the name right) he was extremely decent and helpful throughout our stay. There are two pools the main one with the fishing boat is a focal point of the Hotel and the beach is lovely however the waves can be quite strong. The Heritance has a special significance for our family and was fantastic and when (not if) we return to Sri Lanka we will certainly be booking the Heritance once more.

Arrive on 23 rd with average expectation. The weather forecast was bad, I just want to relax. From the first step the staff was friendly and helpfull. We had the luggage in t he room before we arive after the wellcome drink and refreshing towel. Big room, excellent matress, perfect shower and tube. Front view to the great garden and ocean. Food for everibody from vegans to curry lovers. Good wine and desert. The bar offering lovely cocktails and snaks. Great smile on everibody's face from the reception to the housekeeper. Btw they did cleaning everytime you went outside. So 100% recommendation. You must be here.

We stayed for 5 nights at the Heritance as part of our honeymoon trip. We stayed in a superior room with ocean views, and stayed as a half board. On arrival it is clear that this has the Geoffrey Bawa style architecture, with trees incorporated into the design of the hotel, and a nice transition between outdoors and indoors. It has 3 restaurants, if on half board that gives you access to the buffet restaurant for breakfast/supper only, there is also an a la carte restaurant, and a fine dining restaurant. Very impressive swimming pool that is next to the lobby on arrival, very friendly staff that greet you, and happy to help with any queries or organising trips for you. Nice room, that was always well cleaned by staff. Positives: 1. Staff - extremely courteous and friendly - excellent customer service. 2. The pool- the pool is a large pool that is in the centre of the hotel, with good views to the sea. 3. food - we only ate in the Buffett restaurant - but there was a large range of options so there was also something for everyone to eat. Themed nights throughout the week were a good idea. Negatives: 1. Hawkers on the beach - although not too obtrusive, a bit annoying as anytime you wanted to dip a toe in the sea they would pester you a bit. Can understand why they are there, but can be a little wearisome after a while.

I am currently staying at this hotel with my husband, friends and grown up children. Yesterday my husband and myself celebrated 25 years of marriage by renewing our wedding vows. It was an exceptionally organised and beautiful experience. The staff at the hotel went out of their way to ensure we had a fabulous day. The hotel guest relations executive Shanika Jayaseaara not only organised the day for us but assisted in the arrangements needed so our grown up children could come out for our renewal,managing to keep it a complete surprise. She was very attentive to our every need. The beach was beautifully decorated, the drummers and dancers were fantastic and Shanika herself officiated the ceremony.It was lovely to have someone who was not only professional but also very friendly overseeing the ceremony. Shanika also arranged for us to have a tree planting ceremony. This was not included in the vow renewal package, she just thought it would be an additional thing we would like. Again showing the exceptional service provided by Shanika and the hotel. It was also our friends 10th wedding anniversary at the beginning of our holiday. Shanika and the hotel staff decorated our table at dinner with flowers and provided a lovely cake. The restaurant staff paid extra special attention to our friends again providing an exceptional service. We still have 7 days of our holiday left and I can truthfully say we are all looking forward to every moment.

We stayed at this hotel for five days from the 13-18 February, in a superior room, on the ground floor overlooking the gardens with a partial sea view. From arrival it was apparent that the room had a stale smell that had been unsuccessfully masked by the cleaning staff using cloves to hide the odour.In general terms the rooms are large,although extremely outdated by the original 1980's dÃ©cor. Limited attempts have been made to upgrade the bathroom by the replacement of the original sanitary ware. Although bare plaster,binding door,pop-up wastes that do not seal negate part of this exercise. The restaurant prides itself on the training of its Chefs,although has considerable difficulties in balancing the menu to provide a mixture between eastern and western food.There is little provision for some travellers who may not want to eat Sri Lankan food for the whole of their holidays. This was mentioned on more than one occasion to the Assistant Sous Chef,and The Sous Chef,who provided a detailed tour of the Kitchen,although no indication why the menu is so one sided. The restaurant is open between 7-10 pm,when we arrived at 8.30 pm most of the salad trays where empty and had not been replaced. The one European dish,pasta, had two spoonfuls of "penna" left in the tray. When we queried this with the Assistant Sous Chef he asked what we would like to eat?,and this could be prepared for us.I also noted that many of the dessert trays where empty and would be withdrawn and not replaced,normally at 8.45pm. At this time the restaurant is open for a further 1Hours and 15 minutes. I really would expect better from a 4*-5* hotel.

We booked our holiday in aid of 2 special events, our wedding anniversary and our friends wanted to renew their vows celebrating 25 years of marriage. In the run up to the holiday we contacted their Guest Relations Executive a Shanika Jayasekara who really was fantastic. Shanika went above and beyond to make sure both events were very special, we had room upgrades and these were right by the green pool which was our preferred room location, our rooms were made available for an early check in and this was quick and hassle free with a welcoming drink and cold face towels. On the day of our anniversary we were made to feel very special and given a cake in the evening and our table was decorated beautifully with flowers. As a surprise for our friends renewing their vows we had arranged for their grown up children to fly out for the ceremony and to join us for the rest of the holiday, Shanika was able to allocate them a room next to ours and help hide them until the ceremony. The vow renewal was a very special event indeed with drummers, dancers and an elephant, the way the hotel and especially Shanika organise these events is perfect, they really do think of everything which means we were able to just sit back and enjoy every minute of their special day. The package price was very reasonable and included a 5 course meal on the beach in the evening, with a cake.
