The hotel itself has the friendliest staff who really want to ensure you have a fantastic time, we are still here at the moment but felt we had to write a review sooner rather than later to let everyone know what a fantastic hotel this is. The food is very good and always something to choose to meet our tastes and if not the chef will happily cook something especially for you, we chose to eat outside in the garden area which was quieter than the main restaurant and lit beautifully with lanterns. The pool attendants made sure we had 7 sunbeds in the gardens right between our rooms and the green pool which was beautifully quiet with rarely more than 5 people in it at any one time. The beach sellers are not pushy if you are firm with them, we were able to relax on the beach without much disturbance. There are other members of staff who deserve mentioning but unfortunately while writing this I do not have their names at hand, however I will endeavour to write an addition review to this at the end of the holiday when I have their names and can give a final update.

My family has been at this hotell 4 times and we will defenetly return. Because you can feel the staffs teamwork and that they allways put you in the best mood. This is our favorite hotell at Sri Lanka and we know because we have stayed at several hotells thrue the years. The beach and the pool is lovely. The food is faboluse. /Pia

We spent time at Ahungalla for the fourth time in 5 years. We didnt got disapointed, the hotel and its staff delivered, as usual. Every year we travel around on Sri Lanka and stop by 5-7 hotel, this time 5 hotel. The Atmosphere and everyhing is perfect. The building is starting to get old but still we like it a lot, there is only one Bawa. The staff has a special working-spirit. Yo can feel that they are enjoing and work as a good big team. By now almost every one know about us and they always give a big smile and perfect service. We have experience from many Sri Lankan hotel and at this Place the staff is the best. /Patrik We are alredy planning for next visit.

We are two couples that have a lot of experience traveling together and visiting many cities around the globe. This hotel is known as luxury hotel,but is not!!! You can not have a relaxed dinner because it's SO noisy , it was a kind of a violent experience. The room is nice but far from being clean. Don't try!

Exellent staff members. Quality foods. We went on a very busy day though it was very busy the Front office staff members took care of us as we are the only guest inhouse. Very old hotel but its not an issue. we enjoyed alot.

Turning in from the frenetic activity of the Sri Lankan roads into the peace and tranquility of this hotel was priceless, as is the "wow" first view through reception to the pool and sea beyond. We arrived absurdly early in the morning and were VERY grateful for being permitted to check in several hours before normal as well as being allocated a lovely quiet room, though it must have been at the end of the plumbing run, as the hot water took an age to reach the shower! Loved the furnishings in the room. Though the bathroom was a little tatty, everything worked and it was clean. Our policy of selecting our preferred "hawker" early in the holiday worked well. Patmi (spelling?) arranged a tuk-tuk to take us into town for bottles of coke (to do with the duty free!) and extra water for our room and we called in at the turtle hatchery en-route; he then arranged and came along on our Madhu River trip and priced up and provided our whale watching from Mirissa (at Â£95 per couple, less than half the price suggested by our local agent for the same standard of boat etc). As we had already "adopted" him, we were not bothered by any other "tour" hawkers. Of the sarong sellers, the guy (Indika?) offered by far the best prices - while the ladies turned quite nasty when they thought we had been comparing prices with other tourists! We booked B&B and quickly found the Sunshine restaurant (turn right along the beach) and also tried the White Villa (the smarter building) and the Thotupola behind. Of the three, we felt that While Villa was overpriced and they got our order wrong once, the other two are probably very similar in quality and price but we got into a habit of eating at Sunshine and always felt very welcome and looked after (a tuk-tuk to take us back during a thunderstorm). Dont be put off by the eclectic mix of furniture!! We were paying around Â£15-20 per meal for two, including beers. Wine was expensive (for Sri Lanka prices) though good and came in an ice bucket! All in all a lovely beach holiday and a great location.

This hotel's location is absolutely beautiful but the hotel rooms and after hours in -room dining are a real disappointment and are definitely not 5star worthy! However, the staff in the bar/ restaurant area are extremely helpful. I would definitely recommend to take their Romantic Dinner Set up on the beach which is extremely unique and a great menu. The peak of the hotel is the main swimming pool as it really is the focal point of the hotel. The pit of our stay is that we were not informed about anything during check in such as useful information like: you have the choice of enjoying your breakfast in your hotel room or the buffet concept restaurant & coffee and tea are complimentary during your stay (including in room dining orders!!!). All these points are great highlights which were not informed to us and we only found out by asking proactively asking questions or having the lovely surprise of not being charge for breakfast by in room dining. We really want to thank Front Desk Assistant Manager, Kansu (I think that's his name!) who looked after us during our stay and even surprised us by placing a happy anniversary cake in our suite. Overall, our stay was lovely but I feel that the hotel would benefit from a refurbishment as some areas of the hotel are a bit outdated or need a good clean up.

This resort is very good! We can walk on the beach after dinner, and the staffs here are very kind, they just did their best to satisfy my requests! The buffets are also amazing! the swimming pool here are very clean and cool, they're so big and we can see the sea when you relax beside the pool. The bar is fantastic as well. By all means, this hotel is really recommenged!

I stayed one night with my husband. Great place to relax. We both enjoyed the swimming pool. Second swimming pool is shady even in the mid day. Restaurant is great. Buffet was wonderful with variety of food. Staff is really nice and restaurant manager Thushara was out of the way to help. I wish they could provide some ironing facilities to rooms. Overall excellent hotel. Keep up the good work.

We have just returned from a fabulous holiday at the Heritance. This was our first visit to Sri Lanka and the stay at the hotel helped make it a memorable holiday. All the staff from the reception desk to the pool boys were so friendly and helpful. The hotel should be congratulated on their staff training programmes as it is clear they have an outstanding bunch of people. Holidays are all about people! We ate at all the different restaurants In the hotel and were treated to a great selection of well cooked local and western food. A special mention goes to the chef in the The Upper Room restaurant who made us feel so special - he even gave us a tour of the kitchens, amazing. We had a great room on the second floor overlooking the pool and we were able to hear the waves from the sea. The room was cleaned spotlessly every day with fresh towels twice a day and bedding changed frequently. Our recommendation is, go for an upper room with pool or sea view. We have noticed that some people complain about the guys on the beach selling gifts and trips, come on people, get a life, they are only trying to do a job and earn some money, if you are not interested, just be polite and say no thanks. Two pools, plenty of room to spread out, pool boys who looked after you and moved sunbeds into shade or sun! And of course the bar staff who kept you rehydrated!

This hotel has it almost all. It is located on a great sandy white beach with crystal clear water in a hot indian ocean. If has a great seimming pool - one of the nicest I know. actually, it has two great pools. The food is extremely good edpecially for those like me who might struggle with the spiciness of the local cuisine. The buffet offers a great choice of high quality dishes and the hotel also offers an a la carte restaurant and ... fine dining on the beach. The rooms are very comfy and all staff are very friendly and efficient. There are facilities such as a gym, snooker etc. I love this place and I am sad that I soon have to leave. Why "almost" perfect? Sea is great for bathing but no offers no opportunity for snorkling. But I knew that in advance. Hotel services - apart from wifi which is free - are a bit expensive. But still, this is a great hotel.

So happy we had our wedding at heritance ahungalla.it was a lovely ceremony.our wedding planner shanika was brilliant and made sure everything went to plan.we were very happy to see our room had been upgraded to a suite as we are honeymooners.a big thank you to all the staff at the hotel especially pool bar staff who kept us topped up with drinks! Every meal we had was lovely with plenty of variation.little mention to charli(taxi/tour operator) on the beach a very helpful and nice man

We have had 4 wunderfull days at Heritance Ahungalla with great experiences. Let me mention the most lovely Valantines Days Dinner at the beach last night which the staff had put a lot of work in to be fantastic. Yesterday the hotel also hosted 2 weddings at the beach with Sri Lankian dancers and elephant visit. The staff is extremely friendly and helpsome and the other night after a splendid dinner we were invited out in the kitchen to see all the Championship that the Chef had won and also their interesting chocolate factory. A hotel that we can give our warmest recommendation.

Married 14th Feb 2015 @ heritance ahungalla- amazing ceremony in an incredible location. We really wanted to get away from it all and have a nice beach wedding. Ceremony included drummers, singers, traditional sri Lankan blessings and a going away elephant. Incredible photos and memories! :) staff in hotel are very helpful and friendly and you fell very spoilt when you stay here. Food is excellent with good choice of both western and local cuisine. Highly recommended for anybody who would like a unique experience. Shanika was our wedding planner and made everything easy and stress free - which is perfect for anyone looking for a fuss free wedding.

Our last destination on a round tour ended here and it was the best by far. We really felt like this hotel was like a home away from home. Narmika was a very nice lady. Along with all the waiters and receptionists were very helpful. The food was excellent and like eating the heavens. Our room boy, Chaminda, was a delight and created amazingly funny animals. We also had an interesting tour of the kitchen and chocolate factory with the talented chefs to see some of their amazing carvings! Definitely can recommend this hotel for any couple or family!!

Service really good not a single issue about the service BUT The rooms - we booked 2 deluxe rooms one triple and double, as per my knowledge deluxe rooms should have a king sized bed not twin beds, im quite sure we were given superior rooms not deluxe and the third persons bed was a folding bed, which made our stay really uncomfortable, could not sleep all night. The funniest part...the shower cubicle was not enough for even one person. .. Very old and unsatisfying. .. Never going to any of the Aitken spence hotels ever... Must add...head office reservation lady was very un polite. ..don't remember her name. .. Overall - BIG NO NO NO

As part of our second leg of the management offsite we landed at the beautiful resort in Ahungalla in the serene nature midlands of Sri Lanka after a 3 hour drive from Colombo. The best view of the Ocean is the highlight of the hotel lobby which is spanning across a large space and gives an impressive view of the ocean...truly an ocean front hotel. Most of the visitors of the hotel were foreign nationals and the hotel was bustling as it was a weekend. The hotel has got very good rooms but they are too far from the lobby. There are traditional dance programs for the entertainment of the guests on the beach at night which is truly world class. The hotel has got a gym and the restaurant is huge. There are many small swimming pools and a jacuzzi alongside some of the rooms.

have just returned after two weeks at the heritance in AHUNGALLA.We had avery good holiday& the hotel staff were very friendly & helpfull.The only thing that let this hotel down was the rooms which are in dire need of refurbishment.The bathrooms have a half glazed screen with blinds which i found very odd.Some of the walls are finnished in a polished concrete effect , which might have been fashionable thirty years ago but not now.However i do not want to put people off this hotel because the rooms are still comfortable & functional. we found the food also very good with a good selection to suit all nationalitys.The service in the pool bar could be a little slow at times & we did feel that people who were not on all inclusive got a better service than people who were .The other down side to this hotel is the distance to the airport . This can take anything between two & three hours depending on the traffic & the time of day. To conclude i would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends.

we had a nice week in this spacious hotel overlooking a lovely beach but unfortunately not suitable for swimming because of strong current and waves The hotel has no good concierge service which was a bit frustrating. The taxi service of the hotel is excellent with fixed price so no haggling The restaurant can be a bit busy and the tea service was not optimal however this was sorted out with good initiative by the excellent waiter Nilka. The pool bar was god and the waiters were very helpful. God swimming pool but can get noisy with many children

We have holidayed in many different parts of the world, but our Sri Lankan holiday at the Ahungalla 'Heritance' Hotel stands out as one of the best. The location of the hotel next to the magnificent beach, it's beautifully laid out gardens, the views of the ocean, not to mention its superb cuisine are hard to beat. But what makes this hotel exceptional is the unfailing courtesy and friendliness of the staff who spare no time or effort to ensure that their guests are well looked after and that all their need are promptly met. Some of the staff deserve a special mention. To begin with: Roshan Pujitha (the magician of the kitchen); Dinusha (Assistant FOM); K. K. (Kumara) and Gamini, both responsible for the restaurant and bar; Pandita, Nihal, Sanjaya, Praveen (waiters); Supuni, Sachini and Shanika (members of the wonderfully helpful reception staff).

Booked this hotel as part of our tour of sri lanka , it was the last one having stayed in 4 other hotels .Recommended to us and overall it was a nice hotel but let it self down in certain areas. Arrival was pleasant and we had a slight delay before going to the room , which was very nice spacious but in need of some improvements . wardrobe doors did not close on the runners , blinds in the bathroom had no function to close them , did report to reception but nothing done . Pool area very nice always able to get a sun lounger two pools available and the attendants were first class in providing towels and arranging the beds for you . Staff in the restaurants and bar areas were also first class being both attentive and professional. Only down side the evening was based around the pool and i feel they need to provide a better more comfortable seating arrangement instead of the same seating for the daytime pool drinking and eating tables and chairs . food and drink was good with a good choice and selection . beach is lovely but quiet due to , beach sellers and men pushing their taxi business which disrupts the relaxing environment , they stay behind a line of flags but it is close to the sun loungers. overall this is a nice hotel and nice beach side location nothing outside the resort if you go B+B then you must eat in the hotel which can work out expensive . The let down for us was the last day , most flights out of sri lanka are late evening , we were due to be collected at 21.30 . The room had to be vacated at 12.00 ( no late room available ). At 12.00 which was embarassing a member of the reception team came and cut off the all inclusive bands when we were with other guests. this is the first hotel which stopped the all inclusive many hours before we left . also if you want that shower prior to departing then they wont provide a room , we had to shower in the pool shower which is also the toilet nowhere to hang clothes or dry your hair . this was a disappointment to me which let the experience of the hotel down and which in my opinion stopped it being classed as a 5 Star , the sri lankan people were great i will return again but not to this hotel , i did read the reviews and thought i could ignore the beach sellers but it did spoil it . couple in our 40's

Two nights at Heritance was definitely not enough. great food comfortable accommodation and just great location. The hotel was full due the been so close to christmas. Staff were busy however treated us all like we were the only customers. Great turn around from the previous time we visited when the hotel was called triton.

A nice beach hotel to stay in. The staff are very friendly and helpful although when the restaurant is busy you may have to wait a bit. Special thanks to Nelka in the restaurant and Waruna 'The Captain' in the pool bar for their friendly approach and their help, especially in getting my green tea just the way I like it! There are some hawkers hovering around on the beach but, overall, they are not too troublesome.

This hotel is a very nice place to stay. THe staff are very helpful. We were here for 2 nights after a tour around Sri lanka. All we wanted to do was relax. The meals in both restaurants were so nice including the buffets options. The pool is just beautiful spanning the length of the front facade. There is also another pool and a gym with a range of equipment. I must also mention that on the last day I became ill just before I was about to travel 20hours to go home. The staff were very helpful in caring for me and getting me the food and drink I needed to get to the airport and packing some supplies for my flight. THe manager spoke to me personally and made sure his staff very doing all they could to help. I would recommend this hotel to anybody who would like a relaxing hotel by the beach.

We stayed here for 11 nights and were really impressed with the consistently great service we received. The staff are such a credit, and they really look after you well. We loved the quality of the food, and the breakfast buffet was outstanding. The room was also good, with a lovely view of the sea. There were a few small problems with the room but nothing major. For example, we booked a double but got a twin room instead. Also our safe broke a few times, but this was always fixed promptly. The main disappointment was not really with the hotel but the beach area, and lack of life on the beach - except for pesky sellers. We didn't really understand why there were no sunbeds on the beach. So we made use of the pool areas which were great, but not quite as nice as the beach. Although you do get to see some of the lovely wildlife in the hotel garden... iguanas, squirrels and even black monkeys in a big tree just behind the hotel. We were really surprised by how much we were hassled and harassed by the local sellers... not a fault of the hotel, although they do get a bit close in the pool area, which can be a bit of a nuisance. Just a warning - the locals don't seem to appreciate that tourists want to relax and not be 'sold to' all the time! They always have a hidden agenda, and when you ask them to take you somewhere you want to go, they insist on stopping at rip-off tourist traps where they can earn extra commission. So be prepared to say NO a lot! If you are wanting to eat outside the hotel Hikkaduwa is good - it's a 40 min tuk tuk ride. You can haggle down to 1500 rupees return, but make sure you agree the price before you go or you could pay double - Even if you've used the same driver already!! Also, a great beach awaits you at Hikkaduwa... not the part of the beach where all the tuk tuks stop but a bit further along... just keep walking and you'll find a huge beach with surfers, plenty of bars and cafes, sunbeds etc. Beautiful! Shame we only discovered it on our last day!

We really enjoyed our week on the beach haere after a tiour. Our room which was I think deluxe was great spacious with great views. The hotel is lovely and well located on the beach with two great pools. The staff were great and could not do enough. There is not much outside the hotel though my partner had great massage down the beach. Other negative points; the food is not brilliant in our view though others did not agree. We certainly did not think the fine dining was worth it. There are also not enough umbrellas on the beach and the lifeguards cannot but help disappoint some people. They did help us out but we were on the beach early. None of this stopped us having agreat week.

This is our third trip to heritance ahungalla and had a really poor customer service. First we had to wait for more than 15 minutes for our welcome drink since lot of foreigners arrived just AFTER us and had to remind 3 staff members. we went only for lunch buffet and while entering the dining hall our tickets were checked, but while we were dining one lady approached us and wanted to know our room number, so we told we are here only for lunch. Then she again wanted to see our tickets one by one while we were having lunch giving the impression we havent paid. we were amazed by this 5 star treatment. This not what we are expecting after paying Rs 3500 per adult. we will never come back to this place.

Our first trip to Sri Lanka and Heritance Ahungalla. Nice hotell located in an absolutely fabulous garden with a calm and relaxed atmosphere. Staff absolutely wonderful and always present. The rooms need a brush-up to deserve 4 / 5 stars. Local food ok, but international food was a bit tasteless with no spices at all. WiFi excellent. Long beach free of beds, but strong underwater currents raised the red flag every day. Pool area quite ok. Lots of local "business men" on the beach and some really noisy people selling clothes right ouside the hotel garden, but they all seemed very friendly. After some days we got used to them. A bit expensive to eat and drink. We recommend this hotel for grown ups seeking peace and relaxation, not for younger people seeking more action

Husband,myself & friends staying here after a 8 day tour on an all inc basis. Really lovely hotel with very friendly helpful staff. Great pools & good facilities. Normally stay in riu hotels & comparing All inc here very restrictive. Otherwise very nice.

My husband and I are seasoned travellers to Sri Lanka and the Indian sub-continent. We are just finishing a 4 week trip to probably one of the best hotels on the Island if you are looking for a beach holiday. Without exception all the staff are absolutely wonderful - if only we could 'bottle' their smile before returning to the UK? The management readily admit that they need to update the bedrooms and public areas of the hotel but this in no way detracts from the amazing stay you will have from the minute you arrive until the very last minute before you leave. All staff are worthy of mention but as we do not have room to name them all, 3 in particular will ensure your stay remains not just an experience but a long lasting memory (KK Restaurant Manager; Nihal Restaurant Supervisor and Saman (our houseboy for Room 102). The lifeguards at the poolside also deserve a mention; not all guests are easy to deal with but they remain polite and cheerful whatever the guest request! The hotel, originally designed by Geoffrey Bauer has pride of place on a wide, long stretch of sandy and 'sun bed free' beach. Part of me doesn't want to write this review and to share my holiday with you - the only reason being we don't want lots of people to spoil it!! So enjoy - you will not be disappointed and if you are wondering if we will return - of course!

I would recommend this hotel for The excellent set up, the great customer service that their staff provide from the front office staff to the room service staff to the waiters to the pool attendents all are very friendly and very helpful. I would specially like to thank Shanika from the front office she was very helpful to us during our stay here... They could really work on improving on the food spread found the choices available to be very limited... Other than this excellent in everyway

They say 'First Impressions are Important', and that is certainly true of the Ahungalla. From the first view through the open-plan lobby area and across the giant, inviting swimming pool to the beach and crashing waves of the Indian Ocean beyond...Wow ! The setting is magnificent on a long, wide sandy beach with little else there currently to disturb either you or the view. (another large hotel is under construction further along the 4km stretch). While the hotel is large in size, it is well designed so that blocks of rooms with their own balconies are positioned throughout the lush, beautifully-kept grounds where you can find a rich variety of tropical trees and plans. There are two large pools which are safer than the sea. There is a strong current and sudden drops in the sand close to the shore so beware. The hotel boasts an award-winning chef and a variety of restaurants. I can recommend the tasting menu on tables set-up beside flaming torches on the beach - definately try the local catch. The main breakfast room served an excellent variety of local produce, especially fruit, but it was slightly dark and I would recommend asking for a table to be set-up on the lawns outside. Two of the bars are air conditioned and I preferred the one on the terrace with views beyond the beautifully-lit pool to the Ocean. It is relaxed and the staff are engaging and efficient. Rooms are quiet, well-appointed, comfortable and bright with garden and ocean views - there are several suites. (Cricket lovers can ask for the Tendulhar suite where the Indian superstar stayed and containing some fascinating memorabilla). Cable TV, air-con, ceiling fans and, importantly, wi-fi all worked well. The local town is a short Tuk-Tuk ride with shops, bars and restaurants, all a little cheaper than the hotel and well worth a try if you are spending several days at the Ahungalla. Ask staff for recommendations. There is also an indpendently-run bar and restaurant at the end of the beach about 10-minutes walk from the hotel. While I was there on business, most were on holiday and seemed to be a mixture of those spending at least a week at the hotel and others seeking beach and sun at the end of a tour. Either way, it appeared hugely popular with guests praising the excellent staff, food and atmosphere.

Good staff and good food also rooms and good wifi service , we hope to come back again, very beautiful swimming pool and we all enjoy the holiday with heritance and ##########â™¡â™¡â™¡ very quite and comfortable place shanika the best girl in the hotelâ™¡â™¡â™¡

This was our last hotel during a 10 day tour of Sri Lanka. We wanted to end the trip with two days at the beach to relax. The room was modern, clean, quiet and very comfortable. We loved swimming in the ocean. There were great waves for body surfing! The pool is also lovely and very sizable. I should note that food and drink was quite expensive at this hotel compared to the other places we stayed. Also there are locals at the beach that try to sell you stuff all day. If you are looking for a private beach, this is not the place for you. Although I will say most people didn't seem bothered by the sellers and most were buying from them. Overall had a nice stay.

One of the hotels that impressed us very well.staff were very freindly and helpful, Food was what impressed me. As muslims we were very particular about halal. The team had taken the effort the distinguish between vegetarian halal and non halal food.

We were in rooms 209 and 210. Pros: - well laid out and planned hotel - swimming pool area is beautiful - proximity to beach lovely Cons: - hardly any lights in room-very dim - run down - wifi not too great - very sparse room-not even a coffee table! - kettle had a calcified or corroded heating element so we did not want to take a chance with boiling water for our morning coffee. While it was well camouflaged, there was no plug point attached to the kettle so it would had to be physically moved near a plug point to operate-bad design. - bathroom has windows with only dusty, uneven Venetian blinds for so-called privacy - floor was dirty with dirt stuck on it - room was smelling musty when we came in. Couldn't leave balcony door open for too long to air, due to mosquitoes. - no room numbers written on key card envelopes-had to go out the door to check! - no in-hotel numbers written near the phone - cobwebs on balcony panels-rubber coming off - hotel information papers in the binder were not in order-pages missing. - no in-room menu in room. - checking in took time and we were shown a seating area that was impractical to sit in as sofas were not placed opposite of each other but next to each other. We stood around for about 10-15 mins and no one even asked us to take a seat at another more practical area which was close by. - the man showed us everything in the room but to omitted to show us the balcony! We could not see it as it had opaque sliding type panels that covered the sliding windows - the towels and sheets did not smell fresh - hardly any vegetarian options in the menu to warrant the money so the only options were a la carte in the coffee shop and that were going to take 45 mins to order. That hardly seems fair for vegetarians, does it? Since there was no other option, we ordered 3 western choices from this menu. Unfortunately, we were disappointed with the quality and taste of all the options. The veg lasagne had pasta that was chewy, the pasta primavera had peas that were raw and the potato and bean 'pie' was in fact not a pie at all-just potatoes, onions and beans topped with cheese! - The place needs a lot of maintenance.which it wasn't getting - staff need to improve their English, esp since there are so many non srilankans visiting-language was definitely a barrier esp when it came to ordering food. - staff need to be better trained to know what the hotel offers-boy who showed us to rooms said we could get a la carte in the dining hall. Instead there was only a buffet and no a la carte. - in our room, 210, we had no locking system in the door inside the room-no latch or knob, so ostensibly, the master key could be used to open the door at any time from the outside, even while we are inside the room - no tissues in tissue box in room 209-poor housekeeping - took 20 mins and reminding a few times to get our coffee at breakfast - took a long time for the dirty plates piled up from the buffet breakfast to be cleared. Had to point it out. Sadly, the cons far outweighed the pros. I would not stay here again unless it undergoes a major restructuring.

Located on a seclude part of the beach far away from the bustling town of Bentota. Rooms are big and fairly clean. Service is good. Food is good with large variety. Best part is the easy access to a long, large stretch of clean beach. 2 swimming pools. Very picturesque.

Whilst arriving at this hotel from our 5 days travelling across Sri Lanka we were greater with cold towels and refreshing drinks. The hotel has a very good vibe and very clean surroundings, the pool, beach and rooms are spotless 24/7. The beach staff are extremely helpful with beds and towels and you should never go unhappy with them around all the time. It became apparent that having a dinner on the beach is the most asked question, with 4 members of staff asking if we would like this in one day, for $80 per head it doesn't seem good value at all. Would come again but possibly for more of a stop off than long stay.

This hotel is Good at the lobby area, huge n best view of sunset, the room is old n luck of amenities, almost bad n u must bring your own to avoid disappointed. Coffee set n maker are very old n scary, time to replace with a new one. Buffee at restaurants is ok n the service gone bad do to crowded n rush hours. 9 pm is quite hehehe, dirty beach n pool is huge n normal.

Ahungalla resort has a lovely seafront location and is nestled amongst lush green gardens. The rooms are large and nicely appointed. My husband and I had a 1st floor room which had a good sized balcony and nice views overlooking the garden pool. The food excellent and the breakfasts have a good variety of dishes to suit all tastes. WE particularly liked the excellent 24 hours restaurant for dinner, the food was sensational and the staff pleasant and friendly. If you feel the need to "dress up" for dinner, then the fine dining restaurant is very good. We were very impressed with the staff at this resort, everyone tried to do everything in their power to make the holiday one to remember. Coming back to the room after dinner each evening we were pleasantly surprised to find a "towel art" piece on the bed expertly created by the housekeeper. Especially liked the elephant. Ask the staff to show you through the "Sir Cliff Richard Suite" it is lovely - want to stay there next time we visit. Staff will organise a taxi if you want to visit Bentota or surrounds.

A good location because it is one of the best beaches closest to Colombo, and easily accessible from the highway. The beach is is wonderful! Not crowded at all. perfect water temperature and perfect sized waves for swimming and bogie boarding, The hotel itself is managed by Heritance, which is my opinion is the best luxury hotel chain in Sri Lanka (outside of colombo). So the food was delicious, the management was considerate, and more than enough service to go around. If you've in Colombo and looking for a short getaway, this is the perfect one.

The good first - Hotel staff are all wonderful, helpful and the service slow but very friendly. The beachfront location is excellent. The food is good- even the buffet - which I normally dislike with a vengeance was above average, but the fining dining experience (lobster) was excellent and the coffee shop a la carte was also very good. The main pool is fabulous and the other okay - but the Jacuzzi is dreadful - small, old and uninviting. The bad - oh dear!! The rooms are drab, dysfunctional and this was after 3 changes!! We arrived tired after a long drive from Kandy and were given a twin despite requesting a double - when we complained we were moved to a double and told this was an upgrade - despite it being exactly as the other but on a different floor! Complain again - as this was supposed to be a 5 star - and the room was very tired - and we were told that we could move the following day to a luxury suite but not until 5pm. Trying to be accommodating and not spoil a so far wonderful trip to Sri Lanka we agreed not to unpack and move rooms the following evening. But, three rooms later - okay this was larger - a very large separate, very stark work room - with a private balcony and wonderful views but the air conditioning didn't work in the bedroom, there were cigarette buts on the balcony and the shower (which my husband couldn't stand under - built for little people) leaked to wet the entire bathroom floor. However, the wonderful staff, sous chef, and just about everyone we met were so lovely we forgave everything. But this is NOT a luxury hotel!! Just a very standard hotel charging luxury prices and it will be interesting when the 501 roomed giant opens its doors next door to see if it survives. Oh and the ugly - the sunbeds are from the last century and the pool attendants who set them up very pushy for their tips.

The Hotel is in a great setting on the beach. Yeah its a little tired in places, but we found it excellent. Staff were very friendly. The locals too friendly. As said before, you get constantly hastled by the leaches, sorry locals on the beach who want to sell you anything. Its a shame the hotel cant do more to address this. That said, i managed to get surfboard hire from one for afew days and we bought a couple of bitd to keep them from bay. The food is good, drink service a little slow, but overall, very good all in all.

Stayed here in January with family. Set amongst beautiful pools and gardens on the beach, this hotel has huge potential. This was our second stay here and felt service and maintenance of the property had slipped considerably. Room are large and well equipped though a little bit dated. The pool and gardens are kept well however buildings were in a need of paint and maintenance. The service and food in the main restaurant were the worst we experienced throughout our stay travelling throughout Sri lanka. Breakfast was a good spread with plenty of variety, getting a cup of coffee took time though, sadly dinner was the worst experience we have had through our travels, the food was just slapped on, we were there for three nights and for two of the three nights we encounted empty dishes when we were serving and this was not replaced for a considerable amount of time, there was more emphasis on western dishes and sadly not much choice. We found service to be very slow, dishes were not picked up when one had finished their meals and staff were not every efficient compared to all the other resorts we have stayed in and we did choose this hotel given the positive feed back that was left on past experience. Sadly we didnt think much of this hotel at all.

The entrance to this hotel will make u fall in love with the place. A pool at the entrance overlooking the beach. They have another pool on the inside. 3 restaurants, a fully functional gym, its just heaven.

We were only here one night and arrived mid afternoon, so we were not able to get a very comprehensive view of the property. Check in procedure was very slow, albeit they do bring you a drink and snacks and invite you to sitâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.and sitâ€¦â€¦â€¦.â€¦..and sitâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦..and just when I was about to get up and enquire what was taking so long, they finally invited us to go to our room. There WERE a few people who arrived at once, but it really did take some considerable time, for reasons not clear to me Check out was also somewhat slow, and then getting summoned to an office behind reception makes you wonder what is going on NOW ? Has my card been declined, my visa an irregularity, am I wanted for something ? Turns out itâ€™s just the cashiers office ! So why not just accept payment at the front desk like every other hotel in the world ? Room was fairly large, comfortable, and of a good standard, with everything one expects from a resort hotel. I particularly liked the sliding shutters, as opposed to curtains. Cesar Ritz said about an hotel needing 3 things - â€œposition, position and positionâ€ and this property certainly has position ! Located right on the wide sandy clean beach, (not sure if one can swim from it) warm infinity pool reaching towards the sea. Palm trees, lawns, shady trees around the pool area â€“ itâ€™s the epitome of a beach resort hotel ! Itâ€™s a fairly large property too. The standard tourist trap shops selling souvenirs, but I suppose thatâ€™s to be expected ! The dinner buffet was of a good standard, and it was very pleasant to be seated in the warm night outside under the palms, on a lawn adjacent the beach, with lanterns for lighting â€“ all very Polynesian Island stuff ! Food was of a good standard, though I found the drinks service a little slow, and slow to follow up. Yes, they were busy with a lot of people, but I often have cause to question whether that is in fact an excuse or not ? In general itâ€™s often about having sufficient and well trained staff, and quite often just about general organization. On the one hand the hotel has everything you would expect of a luxury beach resort hotel, and there is nothing to complain about as such, but for me there was just something slightly missing - it was all TOO standard luxury beach resort, like many others I have stayed in, and no real â€œwowâ€ factor as such. I suppose itâ€™s difficult to be a â€œdifferentâ€ beach resort, and perhaps I just stay in too many hotels, but these beach resorts all tend to have the same formula and once one has stayed in a few, they all sort of blend together in your mind â€“ nothing truly memorable ! I had recurring thoughts of Monty Pythonâ€™s â€œPackage Tour Complaintâ€ skit â€“ go look it up if you arenâ€™t familiar with it ! We would actually like to go back some time and spend a bit longer, as lazing around the pool with a drink was just what we needed at the end of a busy 3 week trip to India and Sri Lanka. In the end though we had a pleasant stay, and no real issues, and I therefore recommend it as a good place to spend a few days and relax !

My husband and I, recently spent a week here. We thoroughly enjoyed experiencing the elegant hotel created by Geoffrey Bawa, and harmonious integration of outside/inside spaces with the beach setting. It is a much larger hotel than we anticipated and seemed to cater to package group tours, but given the nature of the hotel layout one could escape the more vibrant activity. The staff are friendly, courteous and quick to respond to specific requests. The breakfast buffet, provided a vast array of choice and was well presented. The fine dining restaurant was a pleasure, with delicious combinations and well executed dishes. The chef was particularly attentive and welcoming ensuring he engaged with all patrons at some point during the evening that only added positively to the overall dining experience. The two swimming pools are fabulous, great temperature, clean and provide a choice of setting. I personally loved watching the local wild life (birds, squirrels & lizards) co- existing amongst the sun lounges. We understand that the local community need to make a living and that the tourists can be a great source of income , but perhaps a sunset beach market could be collaboratively set up between locals and the hotel to minimise the continual daily spruiking alongside the pool area and beach interface. I had one treatment at the spa, and the massage itself was excellent. My recomendations, are that the Spa pricing on the menu be updated to reflect the actual charge in rupees ( which is high by international standards), and that consideration be given to enhancing the approach to the spa centre and spa reception area. Do be aware that unlike some other hotels we stayed at in, Sri Lanka (Cinnamon Red, Colombo and Maheweli Reach, Kandy), a 10 % surcharge and government taxes are added to all prices, which comparably, resulted in rather inflated prices. We also recommend catching the local buses to experience other cities such as Galle or Bentota. These were clean, uncrowded and gave a high vantage point to enjoy the scenery. Also exceptionally priced. Overall we had a great experience and recommend this hotel.

Well, if you like a large noisy hotel with shabby rooms and indifferent food, then this is the place for you. On the plus side the beach is pristine, and the inexperienced staff try their best. BUT it is a very large hotel which opens its doors to day trippers at the weekend, so the pool is full of screaming children. In the morning you cannot sit by the main pool because of the noise from speakers accompanying aerobics - ugh. The rooms are decorated in the bare plaster look which does not stand up to wear and tear. The food is average if you like buffets at specific times. A la carte is mainly burger and chips with variations. The prices for food are higher than the Hilton in Colombo, and what really annoyed me the most was that the hotel write up proports to show this as a 5* establishment, with prices to match when in fact I have stayed in many rest houses with better facilities.

We travelled as a family and stayed in a deluxe suite, so had plenty of room. The furnishings in the room were a little dated, and the hotel as a whole could do with a revamp. There is a new luxury 5 star hotel being built next door, and I wondered whether the Heritance is gradually sliding to the rung below international luxury hotel, so as not to have direct competition. The food and service here were definitely substandard in comparison to the other hotels on our trip (Ulagalla, Anantaya and Jetwing Lighthouse and Yala), and our son ended up with food poisoning on our last evening, nearly delaying our return home. It was hard to get a table in the restaurant, and once seated it was hard to get the staff's attention for any drinks. The hotel was not very responsive to requests (we had problems with ants in the room, a lamp not working and a couple of other things) but the boy looking after our room was very attentive. Having said that, the hotel was very helpful about allowing us to use another room on the day of departure so that we could continue to use the facilities. I think there was a laundry issue: each time we asked for pool towels we were told there weren't any, but they did eventually materialise from a tumble dryer. Service at the pool bar was extremely erratic and inconsistent - we usually had to walk up to the bar to get attention. The stretch of beach by the hotel was lovely, and the currents not as strong as in some places, but still a risk for swimming. There was often entertainment on the beach, but two days after fireworks, the debris was still littering the beach. You have a great stretch of sand, don't ruin it! All in all, the hotel gives the impression of a gradual decline, which is a shame. Our room (at the very end of a corridor) was very quiet, but our friends stayed in a suite nearer to the main part of the hotel (329, I think) where you could hear all the entertainment all evening.

We stayed here for 21 nights for our 30th wedding anniversary and stayed bed and breakfast. The staff in this hotel are excellent, from the waiting staff in the restaurants to the pool staff. They could not do enough for you. Our rooms was lovely with a really large balcony, the air conditioning instead of a unit which in many hotels are above the bed are placed behind panels and thankfully not over the bed, shower was fantastic. We had a tour of the kitchens and on talking to the staff discovered that we could ask for anything not included on the menus in Mustard and the a la carte restaurant. The menus were quite small and we wondered how we would manage for 21 nights but the food on the menus were good, especially the curries and the prawns, on request we were able to order some traditional Sri Lankan food. The chef came out and spoke to us and was pleased that we had taken our time to research the Sri Lankan food and asked for it to be cooked. We took a 4 day tour up to Dambulla, Kandy etc and it was very good indeed (organised through our tour company Mercury Direct). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Its location on the beach is excellent but it would have been nice to have been able to have had a sun lounger and umbrella on the beach but we were put off by the hawkers who won't leave you alone so you can't have a quiet walk to the sea or on the beach without being followed - it is the only thing that I would comment negatively on - luckily the grounds are pleasant to sit in, sun loungers plentiful and the wildlife totally fascinating.

The hotel is very beautiful and has 2 pools, and spa facilities. One of the pools had a live entertainer playing some sort of traditional flute. The location of the hotel is convenient as it's directly next to the beach. We tried the massage and the spa facility, and it was very good, although a bit expensive when compared to other 5 star hotels in Sri Lanka. The rooms were tidy and well equipped. The bathroom is a bit small, but up to the standards. As with previous Heritance hotel we visited, the bottles of shampoo and shower gel need to be reviewed from an ergonomic point of view. They are difficult to pour from, either you pour too little or too much. On the down sides, the check-in process took around 30 to 40 minutes. Not sure why. The buffet was a disappointment. After all the great things we encountered in this hotel, we were looking forward to an amazing gastronomic experience. However the buffet was poor in terms of both variety and quality. We happened to be at the hotel on a full moon (Buddha Day), which is a holiday in Sri Lanka. Maybe that was the reason for the bad quality of the buffet, due to lack of staff? I'm not really sure. In general it was a pleasant experience and would recommend staying at the hotel.

Very nice environment!! Nice and clean ! Food is pretty awesome would recommend this place to anyone specially to families . It's in front of the beach too nice sandy clean beach must go if you're going to lanka !!! Thanks for the awesome service guys !

The food at this hotel was great but overall experience of hotel was average The shower in the room was great very powerfull The food is very good - great choice at breakfast and very fresh, high quality food

This was one of my greatest ever place I stayed in my visit to Sri Lanka. Mainly I have to say this place feels like your home to relax. Beautiful views with sea breeze made me to feel not to leave this place forever and as well this was sharpened more and more by the friendly helpful staff who works in the hotel. Special thanks goes to all staff. Something I shouldn't forget to mention is about the excellent food served by the hotel gives more pride towards the reputation. For that many thanks for the excellent work done by the hotel chefs. so all and all amazing lovable place with awesome food among friendly staff made my visit perfect and meaningful.

We stayed at hotel in couple of days and I highly recommend this place based on the excellent service we got. The food was delicious ..... The service is superb and the staff is really friendly. Waiting for my holidays to stay again

The big plus of this hotel is its location. Its right on the beach, and a beautiful one at that. Also its swimming pools are really nice and big. We visited the place in December 14 - with our three little children. For travelers with family the one big downside is, that the hotel doesn't offer any rooms with inter-connecting doors. So unless and until you have a suite (not sure if they have any) you might end up with two rooms that are not connected, which is a serious problem if you travel with young children. With one or two children you will be all right since that would probably allow you to all stay in one room. As long us our children are young we would not go back to this hotel. The other downside was the breakfast. The breakfast room/area is very noisy at times its quite difficult to talk to each other due to the noise. If the weather is good, try to get a table outside. I would recommend this place to couples for then to families.

Very good beach resort with 2 big pools. The rooms do not directly open up to the beach though. Few ground floor rooms open to pool others just have a patio to the garden. The upper floors have a good ocean view from the balcony. The suites are really nice. Fantastic food with a wide selection at the buffets. The dinner on the beach is a nice touch. Great for honeymooners as well as families.

We have just arrived home from the New Years Eve vacation in Sri Lanka. We stat in Heritance for 8 nights with all inclusive. I will start this review by saing that the hotel is not a 5 star rating by any standards I would rate the hotel rather as 4 star. The meals were very good with great diversity and the local beverages were more than satisfactory. At the time of our visit, the chef was chinese national and the variety and taste of the food (sri lankan, chinese and international) was significant. Tip for all inclusive: Ask for fresh pinapple juice and if you look for lemonade ask for lime or lemon juice and add soda and sugar of your choice. DO NOT ASK FOR LEMONADE BECAUSE THIS IS A BOTTLED JUICE not a fresh juice. Ask for local whiskey and local Lion cold beer that are of a good quality. We had two deluxe rooms on the first floor and there were no issues with noice as we read on several reviews. We had experimented the hotel massage and we discovered that it was a ballinese massage not a traditional ayurvedic massage. The hotel massage was good but I will rather try an Sri Lankan traditional massage in Sri Lanka. The hotel massage for two was 190 USD and this was over-priced. We had also try the ayurvedic massage near the hotel in a local facility and this cost us 40 USD for two persons and it was realy great. For a local ayurvedic massage go on the beach and turn right, go towards the Sunshine restaurant and just before the restaurant turn right on a small street and you will find the massage center on your right hand side after a 100 meters walk. When you walk on the beach you will be approched by local "guides" that will try to sell trips or goods and you can avoid them with a smile and simple NO THANK YOU. If you walk out on the main street there is a different story and the "guides" are more aggresive and we discover that it was difficult to get read of them. We had some bad experience with the street guides and I will strongly suggest to plan a trip within the hotel premises an leave the hotel with a guide on a tuck tuck or taxi. After the unpleasant experience from the street we used the service of a local propper guide, Mr. Channa mobile number +947726300008 (check also on www.channatoursbentota.com) and the trips were of a good quality and VERY reasonable price. Concerning the hotel location you will discover that is located within a village with no option for entartainment in the hotel vicinity. The nearby excursion were Maduganga river safary that was on a 5 minutes tuck tuck drive and Galle trip that was 1 hour by taxi. Unfortunately the rest of the trips were involving a full day travel due to the poor local infrastructure. If you wish to feel the Indian Ocean take care with the underwater courent that is very strong. If you wish to visit more of the country you should consider if you stay in a single hotel and travel every day for an entire day or you travel from one hotel to an other for an adequate visit. As a conclusion, from my point of view, the travellers that are looking for relaxing time on a beach with great food, good local drinks and just a couple of trips this hotel is adequate. If you wish to see more of the island beauty and explore Sri Lanka you should consider traveling from one location to an other and go also to Heritance Ahungala for a relaxing day on the beach (swimming pool) with good food and drinks. The wifi was available but very poor as speed and signal.

Nice atmosphere. Good place to relax your mind and soul. Nice sea view. Average service. Quality of food is not upto the star class hotel standards. Poor spread of food. Staff needs to be trained further.

We had bee here in 2002 and 2004 upon arrival having booked a suite it was full of Mosquitos we booked A I went for dinner inedible the wine was just terrible! We went to remember the 10 anniversary of the Tusnami , when we were there. It was a huge dissapointment! It was with regret we had to complain. After a meeting with the general manager every thing changed, we renegotiated the AI do not do it! We re started on B&B it all changed. It is NOT the standard hotel it was, it is with regret I have to say this, the horribly black dinning room! On we go the sun beds are so unbelievably bad they aren't describable , when you see the staff wheeling one wheel with the other on the top ready to stick it back on, residents having to use just the pads on the floor as they don't have enough beds and lying on the grass infested with ants. There are so few umbrellas when yo leave your bed they have to move them for other residents , this is a 2 star or less and I really hate to gave to give this review , but I as an experienced well travelled Sri Lankan tourist I'm so sorry to say I will not be returning. Also to add the beach sellers who I had known since 2002 and have supported. Even to getting a sewing machine funded are the most intense in all our travels they drove us to distraction ! No we won't ever go back and this leaves me with a sad heart on my live of my beloved island

What a great property. Besides the facilities is a sea facing pool and other regular things for residents, the smile on the faces of each and every staff made the stay wonderful . Spent 3 nites with family and enjoyed every bit of it . The food was well structured and appealing to the palate of large groups of multinational people . That says quite a bit that the hotel is used to managing this kind of crowd. Overall a great property/ great facilities/ great food (especially if you are a seafood lover ) and wonderful service and hospitality . Kudos to Heritance Ahungalla !

I chose this hotel because it was designed by Geoffery Bawa. The rooms and resort are lovely, but definitely in need of upgradation in many areas. The upper floors look like they've been refurbished, but the lower floors have not. Upon check in, we realised the air conditioning in our room wasn't working, we got twin beds, when we had requested a king size bed and the wi-fi was intermittent. Given the quality and state of the rooms, i was not happy to pay 280USD a night.

What a lovely hotel this is and the staff are a real pleasure nothing is too much trouble. We asked for a quiet room and were give same in on the 1st floor away from the noise. The pools are a delight both clean and uncrowded and the food is of excellent quality with plenty of choice at all meals. If there is anything here that could be improved I would say that the man bar area just off reception is probably a little small when the hotel is full and the seating here is quite uncomfortable although aesthetically pleasing; perhaps more seating could be provided in the actual reception area at this time. All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would return with no hesitation

Hotel is excellent. Rooms are great and spacious. Excellent bed and got a very nice balcony. Food is excellent with a very wide spread. Got a wonderful beach and a very. Ice pool. We had a wonderful time.

We know the hotel as we used to stay there several years in a row some years ago. The architecture is stunning, but some improvements on the rooms are needed to bring it back to 5 star standards. Upon check-in we were early and were told that normal check-in time is 2 pm. We waited for 2 1/2 hours til 2 pm and several inquiries, there we were told, that they are checking. At 2 pm it seems everybody arriving after us was checked-in and we still did not get any information. I went to the reception to complain, but they were busy to set up other guests internet on the phone than to attend to guests who were waiting for 2 1/2 hours. After asking for the manager it suddenly worked and we got a room and apology. Although we asked for the new wing, we were offered a room in the old wing. Despite of kitchen odor this room was definitely the better choice for us as on the other side a 2 day party was going on with lots of noise. Room was ok and had a nice sea view. Cleanliness of the room could have been better. Especially in the shower there were signs of mould and shower door was completely covered with limescale. Service especially upon check-in was definitely not 5 star standard. Also for breakfast it was announced to start at 7 am, but when we came down ones at 7.10 am, nothing was ready, noone was taking note in order to serve coffee or tea. The egg corner was not occupied to order eggs, etc. If 7 am is published for breakfast, it should be ready for service. Food was very good though. Another point to reconsider might be the christmas decoration which did not fit the hotel at all. All in all we had a nice stay in the end. If we would come back, we are not sure as we know better from this hotel from previous stays and it is quite pricy for the service offered.

I am currently in the hotel for 4 nights, may observation: Last city before returning to Colombo tomorrow 1 excellent location 2 2 hours from Colombo 3 enjoyed long beautiful beach ( sunset and sunshine) 4 excellent food varieties of local and European style 5 relaxing under the trees with beautiful sound of the Indian Ocean 6 children are happy with pools 7 nice celebration of New Year 8 good staff with smile 9 comfortable room and room service 10 24 hours coffee restaurant with delicious food Important points: Improve the jacuzzi with warm water near the pool Massage you can make it outside cheaper than the hotel Visit Galle city - very beautiful photos you can take one hour drive To be car full when go to the ocean ( deep and strong waves) they cannot control The area ( long beach). Visit the turtle center 10 minutes by tuk tuk you can see the white one appear only One in 2 millions. Dr Adel Aloffi Bahrain

They have organized an amazing wedding for my friends- organization, design and staff- just great!!! and foooood- delicious! one of the best I ate in Sri Lanka! location is amazing- just by the beach! The staff was almost reading our mind:) very nice and friendly! would love to go back there

Have been visiting Heritance Ahungalla for years and like i've always said the staff are (for lack of a better word) Awesome :) The kids love the almost endless beach and pool. Its one of those hotels that I simply have to visit at least once a year as i find it really relaxing.

Great place to stay for a much needed vacation. The property is huge with a long stretch of private beach, quite apt for pleasant morning and evening walks. Found the breakfast buffet quite good with many Indian breakfast choices. The food quality was also up to the mark and satisfied people with different palate. Rooms are beautiful with a nice balcony (view of the beach and waves) and the decor gives the feel of a nice cottage. Room service is good and given the expanse of the property, it is quick too! It can get a little noisy in the night by the beach, if the hotel is having full occupancy. Else the stay will be peaceful and quiet.

After leaving the rain and cold behind in the uk we got off to a great start of a two weeks break starting here and then to be followed by a week in the Maldives,no big delay with SRI airways which was fantastic,food provided was really good as was the service ( who were spotless in uniform and appearance unlike BA who we traveled later to Maldives who's uniform looked liked it had purchased from a second hand shop!!!!)We arrived and picked up by our lovely driver who told us the journey to the hotel would take 3 Hours ( not for the faint hearted ) so you have been warned .When we arrived at the hotel the staff couldn't do enough for bringing cool drinks/towels after our long journey. The hotel was lovely has you travel through it the style is very unusual as in some parts it's open to sky with trees where if your lucky you catch the monkeys jumping from one to another there was also a crashed plane ( not a real one ) full scale that lights up at night . We really loved it But if I'm going to be a bit picky ,we did full board if I'm honest it was very little choice I got bored after day two And here comes the big negative was The Beggars on the beach as soon as you stepped out of your pool area they wouldn't leave you alone ( whatever you do don't befriend them it took 45 mins to get rid of one guy) I only went in the sea once In the whole seven days we stayed , such a shame as it was beautiful,but overall lovely hotel and staff.One tip if traveling from here to Maldives do not purchase any at duty free alcohol at the airport as it will be confiscated at male airport ( but will return it to you on your return trip ) .

Heritance Ahungalla is truly the best customer service oriented hotel in Ahungalla. We stayed at Heritance from December 18th - December 22nd and we did not receive any of the negative services mentioned by other reviewers. GM Rifhan and F&B Director Gamini and Kumara went out of their way to service out every request. Indika, Shehan and Nadesh did a wonderful job taking care of our reservations. The team at Ahungalla not only went out of there way to provide us great service but they went beyond their job description to service us. My wife and I were responsible for the beautiful Marquee that was put up. We had planned the wedding for over a year and the team at Heritance went out of there way to help us through it. Chef Dimuthu and his team created a wonderful menu and all the guests raved about the food and the desserts. I apologize for any guests that had their view obstructed but it was only up for 2 days and the team at Heritance made sure all the other guests who were there were taken care of. The Heritance team from the management to the wait staff provided ALL 62 of our guests PERFECT service. All except 1 but we can ensure that if needed we will get all 61 to review heritance and all 61 would be happy to review this hotel positively. This hotel has magnificent views as well and if your planning to stay here, I would fully say that the pool and sea view on the hotel is by far the best in the area. My wife and I cannot thank Heritance enough and we want to ensure their staff that their hard work is not going unnoticed and that everyone at the wedding truly enjoyed themselves. Thank you for giving us our dream wedding.

We stayed in the luxury suite which was spacious. The service from the staff was excellent and very obliging. A few issues which need to be resolved - 1) the facts in the information section in each of the rooms indicating that Tamils mostly arrived in the 19th century is fraudulent, 2) internet access needs to be improved such that someone doesn't need to re-register every time they leave the room or the hotel and return, 3) showers sometimes seem to not drain properly leading to flooding.

Heritance Ahungalle Hotel is a great retreat in Sri Lanka, but you must adjust your expectations before moving in. We had booked a de-lux room with balcony overlooking the beach and ocean - romantic, eh?Unfortunately, the hotel and consequently the room was very 'tired' and had seen better days. The hotel even suffered poorly maintained sidewalks, tennis courts, beach loungers, etc. Most was simply under maintained. Our balcony was adjacent to the rooms on either side, separated only by planters, and the view of beach and ocean obscured by a large (but beautiful) tree. It may not have been a problem anyway, as on the second day of our stay, the hotel maintenance people set up a huge beach-obscuring marquee (JAG_68056) for another wedding. They have about 20 weddings per year, so we learned. Perhaps that wasn't so bad either, but the band wars (wedding band, bar music, and local flute player) that ensued developed an impossible cacophony of loud music which made it impossible to sleep. Our 'package' was directly booked through Heritance's agent: bed and breakfast. We soon discovered there were many alternate 'packages' which ranged from full board to 'good deals' offering better accommodation for less than we paid. Check it out before 'checking in'. The food was good, especially the buffet (good value and variety) ... but the beach-hawkers were definitely a deterrent from enjoying the beach. The hotel should definitely do something about them! They were ever-present from sun up to sun down. The redeeming feature of the hotel was the always friendly and hospitable staff ... always willing to serve and support. The Guest Relations team did their very best. One last word of advice would be to insist that any Ahungalla-related transportation from Colombo Airport to the hotel take the new highway ... it seems that the drivers attempt to circumvent the highway-toll gates by taking secondary roads which are long, uncomfortable, dangerous, and nauseating. Happy travels!

I would personally like to thank the ahungalla heritance team for making my special day memorable as the whole hotel staff came together to make this event the best wedding!! And for making so many adjustments just to make us happy. The buffet was so good that my friend from Brazil wanted to marry the buffet!! Also the beautiful cake which is unbelievably tasty and looks so beautiful!! The wedding is the most important day of any girls life and Heritance Ahungalla made it happen!! Also would say the Care they took of all our families who stayed there which was about 60+ rooms was great too. Once again highly recommend the hotel and specially Refan, Gamini, kumara, Indika, Nadesh chef Dimuthu and his team and the team who made the best buffet too! Thank you from the bottom of my heart! Hope to celebrate our anniversary every year at Heritance Ahungalla ğŸ˜˜

Heeitance Ahungalle in ahungalle town, which is barely 20 mins drive from bentota. Though you are away from bentota you don't feel the distance much. The reception has a good view of the pool which overlooks the beach. The beach is clean and inviting. Nice place for a quick retreat. The spread of food is reasonably good. Jeffrey, the architect has given a local and rustic touch to the deco of the rooms. One can consider staying on the 3rd floor (rooms 325-330) which had a good view of the ocean. Few negatives. The property has only one lift, which caters to all the rooms and one needs to walk alot if the rooms are allotted on the other side of the lift, which may get annoying especially with elders. Secondly the food may be an issue if you are a vegan unless you are not very keen with the spread. overall a good choice. Good staffs to look out for - Ms. Shyamalee (banquets) and the F&B manager, missed out his name..

This is a nice hotel. We generally enjoyed our stay, but qualified by the comment below. Special commendation for the hotel's service staff who were very helpful and pleasant. The qualification: The hotel website features photos of lovely views of the ocean from the hotel's main dining areas and pool. Moreover, we booked a "premium" room to enjoy the view of the beach and the ocean that comes with these rooms. A guest of the hotel should have a reasonable expectation that was is displayed on the website regarding visual amenity is what they will get if they book. However, for much of our stay, the hotel's beach-side amenity was marred by the construction and deconstruction (over four days) of a large marquee running the entire length of the hotel's main access way to the beach. This marquee does not appear in any photo on the hotel's website. Its presence, in my view, thus represents a breach, however minor, of the contract between hotel and guest. Because full-fee-paying hotel guests were not put first in this regard, it is unlikely that we will return to this hotel.

Really pleasant staff .Staying here over Christmas.Long distance from anything. Best part was a beach resturant Sunshine . Poor tennis court surface Buffet meal tasteless ,no outside area to eat. Coffee bar area slightly better to eat in. Hawkers on the beach a nuisance.

I was attending a wedding held on 20th December 2014 and a friend of mine and I had decided to stay at Heritance. Coming from the UK I was keen to stay close to the wedding venue and enjoy the supposed five star luxury that this hotel boasted to offer. My friend a resident of Sri Lanka arranged the accommodation some five months in advance for us to stay from 19 Dec till 21 Dec, using Booking.com. However upon arrival, they didn't have our booking for 19 only 20. Some 45 minutes, emails and phone calls later I was given a room based on half board. The room itself was large and nice. A bit dark in decor but view of sea front was nice. The hotel is large however there is no clear indication of how the rooms are numbered on each floor. There is according to the member of staff showing me to my room a north and South wing again this is not indicated visibly so it's easy to get lost. The entrance of the hotel is stunning however the rest of the hotels falls in comparison. For four hours I was without WIFI, a number of phone calls later a staff member turns up and fiddles with my phone including switching my phone off airplane mode connecting me to my UK service provider and leaving me with a Â£40.00 data roaming fee whilst still not realising that the Wifi was an issue with the hotel and not my phone. After trying to relocate me to a new room much smaller with a terrible view I eventually head in hands and eyes filled with tears of frustration and tiredness, was placed in a more pleasant room with a bigger balcony that over looked the sea and the wedding venue. The sliding door which acts as a blackout was unable to fully close because the side table was too big. I had to move this in order for the blackout to fully close. The air conditioner controls were broken in all three rooms so I had to use my nails to switch off the air conditioner. The shower cubicle was placed in such a away that you had to get in close the door before turning shower on. The hotel toiletries were poor - the shower gel and shampoo were all placed in bottles that were not sealed and the soap was well rather useless. There were also no small hand towels or towels big enough to dry hair with. All in all two large bath towels and two hand towels. No bath robes either to sit and relax in. A basic I feel for a hotel claiming to be five star. The mini bar of the last room was broken and had never been checked so we found the drinks warm mouldy and in drinkable. The cost of a glass of wine in comparison to the bottle found in the mini bar also made no sense. It was cheaper in the mini bar. The dining room (only one restaurant in this hotel) was dark and dismal. The hot food area was hard to find until further inspection. The food was ok. A very basic selection. Nothing fancy or elaborate. The bar area outside by entrance was far more prettier yet the service was poor. Morning breakfast in the same dining room was a very dark and gloomy affair. The decor and seating was so basic and dark that you just didn't want to eat in there. The only blessing was the guest relations officer Shanika who was so lovely and ever so eager to ensure we were happy that she went out of her way to do everything to make us feel at ease. We were on exit served with a $200.00 a night bill which I had to question over and over again. I am really sad to say that it was really shocked and disappointed by everything I had witnessed at this "luxury" hotel and having had a thorough read of what is expected to meet the international standards of a five star hotel - this to me is just a glorified bed and breakfast. Having experienced five star luxury and also other ratings of hotels I think I have had better staying in a cheap bed and breakfast in Brighton for far less the price tag. I can't say I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would recommend those that work hard for their money go look elsewhere.

We returned here this December (for the 10th time!) for a relaxing 10-day beach holiday in lovely surroundings. We love this place because of the feeling of spaciousness which the hotel's design engenders - and because each and every staff member seems genuinely interested in doing all they can to ensure that you have an enjoyable stay. Our room was fabulous, with views right across the gardens and the beach. Breakfasts are impressive affairs, and particularly enjoyable if you manage to get a table in the garden. The main restaurant usually provides good buffet style meals. However, we prefer to sit outside and the cafe serves excellent 'rice and curries' dinners (as well as a number of European dishes). Unfortunately, the a-la-carte restaurant was closed for refurbishments during most of our stay. Work on a new hotel adjacent to the Heritance has started, but there is no noticeable disturbance from this. There is free wi-fi throughout the premises and, apart from some difficulties with access codes expiring for no apparent reason, it worked quite well. We thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Heritance and would recommend it to anyone looking for a peaceful hotel on a fantastic beach. The location is great for excursions to places like Hikkaduwa, Galle and Bentota. It literally takes only a few minutes by tuk-tuk to get to the Madu river, where you can rent a boat for a river safari. Michael on the beach arranged some nice trips for us this year (and in the past) and we would also recommend Eranda, one of the tuk-tuk drivers usually waiting by the front gate.

Great location, great food, quite beach, good rooms. Definitely place to visit again. I was there with my family and everyone enjoyed. Good service. Huge property and had 2 swimming pools, nice and clean. Nearby there is turtle hatchery and river safari, must do. Don't waste time visiting moonstone mines. Whale watching missed since We didn't book in advance.

I was a part of a team coordinating a wedding to be held at Heritance Ahungalle on Saturday 20th Dec. All plans were in place and all of us in the coordinating team were moving ahead with the game plan when we got to know that the furniture supplier had messed up the order. Needless to say that all hell broke loose while we tried to work out an alternate solution, it was a mere 3 hours before the wedding ceremony. A lot of stress, tension and heart stopping moments later the furniture arrived at 3.00 pm, we had to set up and decorate 30 tables in 1 1/2 hours - guest were due to arrive at 4.30 pm. The team at Heritance Ahungalle, stepped up to the occasion, they deployed additional crew to unload and set up furniture and get it all going to ensure that the wedding set up was ready on time. Their attitude was fantastic - it was a case of everyone working together to give the couple a wedding to remember. The result was fantastic, everything was set up and ready for the wedding with mere moments to spare and it all looked brilliant. It was a result of brilliant cooperation, understanding and adrenaline. No one entering that marquee would have realised the tension we all had to work through - the set up looked stunning and the couple said that it was more than what they expected. What's important is that it was not the responsibility of the hotel to do all this and we in the coordinating crew know that if not for the team at Heritance Ahungalle lead by their F&B Manager Gamini we would not have been to get it all together on time for our clients and give them the wedding of their life. Thank you so much! I have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to anyone.

We would like to extend our sincere thanks to SHEHAN (not sure if its the correct spelling) for being so kind and helpful to us throughout our one night stay on 18th DEC.
