We were late for check-out (because we were caught up in unexpected circumstances during our whale watching that morning) and he was so helpful to extend our check-out by a few hours. We were greatly touched by his service and really appreciate his effort in making our stay a pleasant one. We stayed in Kandalama hotel before this which is also managed by the Heritance Group and both hotels didn't disappoint us at all. Their customer service is outstanding and always full of smiles. Thank you Heritance Ahungalla for making our stay an awesome one.

Had 3 nights while travelling around Sri Lanka Beach stunning Pools very nice and needed as very hot Food good and very happy staff Enjoyable stay in a nice spot Perfect to stop if looking to visit South of Sri Lanka Beach sellers abit of a pain but did leave you alone if you asked All in all good hotel in great location which has decent food and is very clean. Beach is very nice and staff are very helpful and happy. Rooms and big and clean and very nice. Perfect winter holiday

We went there for our honeymoon for two weeks.must say each penny was worth spending.the rooms were clean,the staff is so friendly and above all a great relaxing beach.had a great time,enjoyed every meal there.would recommend.

Stayed here on the first leg of our Sri Lanka holiday, it has a great beachfront location which is a little undermined by the hawkers. To be fair a guard patrolled the 'dividing line' but as soon as you step over that line they have a habit of following you which is not particularly threatening but somewhat annoying. The staff were always really nice and courteous, we opted for bed and breakfast and used the services of a driver (through Aitken Spence) which was a must in my view, who guided us to local sites and restaurants. Rooms are okay if a little underwhelming but nice public areas, and breakfast was nice. If you visit this hotel be sure to take a walk along the beach to Silva's Sunshine Restaurant, simple, fresh and friendy and great value.

Really good place to stay. 2 excellent pools and on the beach. Very good in almost all respects.Only negatives were the pestering beach hawkers and the buffet which had more quantity rather than quality. Very good a la carte restaurant. Rooms a roomy, clean and well appointed. The hotel was spotless too.

Visited the hotel for 4 nights. I had booked 7 rooms for friends and family. Great food and very courteous staff. I had booked a suite but the quality of the room was poor, when I discuss this with the front office he promptly moved us to another suite.

Claims to be a five star resort. It's not. Five star resorts, in fact any decent hotel should care about their guests. They do not have a bloke with the loudest industrial strimmer working right outside a guest's bedroom ceaselessly from 5.30 am. Oh and the wifi is crap.

Another warm welcome to this hotel - the last stop of our brief visit to the wonderful island of Sri Lanka. After a welcome drink, we were shown to our Deluxe Room. It was small, dark and dingy! Not what we had been used to. We were shown another room - but these rooms were still small but had a sea view but alas the bathroom lacked a bath. We needed a bath to ease away our aches and pains after an amazing tour of this amazing island. I ended up speaking with the Duty Manager, a lovely young gentleman, named Praveen and he graciously upgraded us to a Luxury room each at no extra charge. The rooms had sea views, tea/coffe making facilities, mini-bar, tv and the bathroom contained the most important thing - a bath. I was in the older wing of this huge hotel and had a few problems with electrical problems, which were soon sorted out. I noticed that a lot of maintenance was being done in this wing - which was a good thing as this was low season and maintenance needed doing to bring this wing up to its star rating! The pools were amazing. This hotel had a gymn, tennis courts, billiard room, spa - in fact everything that one needed was here. In the gardens, I saw iguanas, cheeky little squirrels and a lot of birds, It was a little peace of paradise. My description of this hotel read " a beach hotel, where style and substance mix like a classic cocktail. Just as the turquoise infinity pool seems to blend into the ultramarine Indian Ocean, award-winning cuisine fuses the best of east and west. Heritance Ahungalla, where a little magic is woven into your holiday memories, while promising you the finest hospitality and best luxury services among Sri Lankan beach hotels. This description summarizes my experience of this hotel perfectly! I quickly got to know the staff and found them extremely friendly and helpful, The wait staff in the restaurant and bars were a fantastic bunch! Thank you one and all for such a memorable stay!! A very special thank you to the wonderful Chefs who treat us like Queens and honoured us with a tour of their kitchen. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Thank you all xx I was lucky enough to see two bridal parties, which took my breath away. Another day, a couple had hired an elephant for a private photo shoot - but we all got in on the action! Would I visit this hotel again - YES PLEASE!

This is a great hotel to stay, I had the most amazing time and the food is wonderful. The rooms are clean and big with sea view balcony. You get woken up with a lovely suttle music which is played with a flute by a local gent seated on a boat next to the pool. The pool is a serenity pool wich is huge and it is next to the beach. The hotel is suited for couples and family and it's very safe. Only 10 to 15 min to Hikkaduwa.

We have visited Sri Lanka 9 times and have to say this was the best hotel the staff are a real credit to the hotel they couldn't do enough for us A very relaxed atmosphere first class service in every respect from gardeners to chefs Special thanks to K K and Pasindu and all your first class chefs had a wonderful stay would recommend it to everyone ( happy days )

Just as I remembered it. The superb food, the charming staff and off course the flautist. It couldn't have been a better place to stay. Great facilitates such as the Tennis Court, Table Tennis, Badminton and the gym. Even when we left they gave us one more gift of a little 'leaving' bag with a bottle of water. Will definitly stay at this hotel again, bit sad as it is quite far from the Capital but otherwise all round great!

This was the much anticipated final stop on our recent Sri Lanka tour. The welcome, the hotel and the room was wonderful. We were upgraded to a beach view which was fantastic and our housekeeper chap made a point of saying hello and checking we were happy. Problems with our safe were quickly and efficiently fixed and copious apologies all round! The bar and the pool was superbly kept and very quiet during the day, adding to the peace and calm. In terms of food, breakfast was excellent and the lunch bar options were varied and tasty and real value for money. Dinner wad also good, in fact, the head chef gave my husband a back room tour, including their amazing award winning chocolate creations. The only slight, slight, point I might make is options were slightly more limited in terms of variety towards the end of our stay, similar curry options, a couple of uninspiring choices, but the quality did not fail and there were fewer guests, but an amazing pudding selection, according to my sweet toothed husband and for me, the best hoppers of the tour. We found the beach sellers to be friendly, they left you alone when you asked and were nowhere near as annoying as other parts of the World....and Crikey, they are trying to earn a living! Overall, a lovely end to our holiday!

My 3rd visit to this hotel. I have always been very happy. Staff is especially nice to children. Guy called Chathuranga was especially helpful and nice from the booking process and through out the stay too. Only complaint are a stair case that is unprotected (risky for children) and the bacon in the breakfast that was not cooked enough.

Re-visiting after many years, Heritance Ahungalla(formerly Triton) more than lived up to our expectations. Superb food, the staff could not have been more helpful and charming. We will certainly be returning the next time we are in Sri Lanka.

A well established hotel, providing good service and excellent food. A lovely well serviced room with a balcony and sea view, with constant sound of the sea. Easy access from Colombo. We have enjoyed several visits here and have never been disappointed. The breakfast is especially wonderful with a quality selection of sri Lanka specialities as well as a good choice of other foods.

I've had the privilege of visiting the Heritance Ahungalla Hotel quite frequently over the years and admittedly their warmly welcoming traits in the spirit of culture and tradition reminds me of the saying that you never get a 2nd chance to make the 1st impression! Its not just the arrival to tease but the way in which they attend to the guest from the beginning to the end is a very enriching experience for me consistently over a period of time and in that context, I salute the much valued top to bottom driven service oriented style of approach which extends a special feeling of being cared for right through the stay. As per my experience, they truly live up to a 5 star beach resort including impressive food, tastefully done rooms, good leisure activities and special areas of relaxation with refreshing water as the focus not forgetting the attractive design uniquely created. When one has to pay a price in accordance with its status, obviously any guest would want to be assured of the highest standards in every aspect to feel that the value for money element is most worthwhile. As for me personally, everything revolves around excellent service oriented skills which enhances the level of confidence that one's requests are being addressed efficiently just the same way how effective communication can build trust followed up with expected delivery. The beauty of a hotel is truly enhanced by the character of its human resources and also the attention to detail attitude which I have experienced first hand and hopefully this trademark that Heritance Ahungalla has inherited will be sustained to benefit the many guests who are looking for a holiday that embraces the rich cultural values of Sri Lanka with warmth and an enchanting smile unique to our nation.

After coming from Heritance Kandalama we expected the same. This is not the case. I did not want to jump on here and be outright negative, but there is good and bad here. Our room has a broken aircon, bathroom exhaust fan, telephone and main door lock, with no safe. Pretty alarming. Our guy that cleans the room is wonderful and has tried his best to get everything fixed up. So far the kettle has been replaced. They have tried to fix the phone several times with no luck. Reception rings you constantly but you can not talk to them, very annoying. Outside the gates are pushy tuk tuk drivers in a dirty street. Surprising since Sri Lanka is a very clean country with mostly beautiful helpful people. Not here though. We were really looking forward to a few days in the pool looking at the ocean after a pretty hectic schedule. As soon as you get to the pool the yelling people on the beach trying to sell dodgy wares ruins it straight away. Even security and staff were called several times to try and help ripped off tourists. But security does nothing. It is like they work with them. After all the places we have stayed in Sri Lanka this is the worst. We would not come back here again.

We stayed in this hotel on our first visit to Sri Lanka and fell in love with personnel and Sri Lanka. The beach was clean and specially made swimming possible even when ocean was wavy. Personnel was very attentive, everywhere was very clean, hotel territory and interior was well designed, rooms are large with ocean view. In Heritance Ahungalla we discovered the true heritage of Sri Lankans and really enjoyed our stay. It's worth to mention that the food hotel is serving is authentic, incredibly tasty and diverse.

Approach to hotel uninviting, but then through the gates a lovely setting and warm welcome, but irritation factor from incessant beach vendors and loud guests and even the street dogs make it into the hotel too because of its open design. Felt sorry for the staff dealing with inconsiderate drunks day and night. The service was hit and miss, food varied and well presented, but not the best I had in Sri Lanka, though signature spiced ice cream was wonderful. Some very nice staff, but suspect some unsavoury ones in league with beach vendors and tuk tuk drivers. Beach immediately in front of hotel fine, but elsewhere litter and no peace if walking cos of beach boys. Found lack of chains and double locks on room doors unnerving. Pillows gave best night's sleep in SL. Spa has a great range of treatments and lovely staff and one of the nicest I have ever been to and worth every penny. Would not choose to return here unfortunately. Prefer Heritance Kandalama.

My previous heritance experience at Kandalama and Tea Factory set a high expectation from Ahungalla as well and they did pretty well. In Sri Lanka, this is my favorite hotel chain, because they make you feel awesome from the point you arrive at the hotel to departure. I arrived with a warm welcome from the staff and I was surprised that they were informative enough to guess that Iâ€™m the one â€œwho booked 3 rooms online with 3 infants and a toddlerâ€. I received an upgrade for all 3 rooms since the hotel was fully booked and they made every effort to serve us although we had to wait quite a time to receive the 3rd room (due to late check-outs and we arriving sharp on time for check-in). I enjoyed the entire stay with exceptional hospitality. At the restaurant, each and every member of staff greets you. Iâ€™m sure the organization takes a lot of effort to keep this attitude across all staff and the unique fact is they treat locals and foreigners with same level of enthusiasm and respect which many local hotels donâ€™t do. To talk about food, it was awesome. I particularly got excited with several dishes, to name a few â€œdiyabathâ€, egg hoppers with cheese, heritance spicy ice cream, yogurt ice cream (which took me back to school days which resembled the taste of â€œyogurt ice packetsâ€ we used to eat). They had endless variety of food at the buffet from battered prawns to crab, turkey, porkâ€¦you name it they have it. I appreciate the fact that it was not only variety but the tantalizing tasteâ€¦â€diyabathâ€ was a winner! The hotel itself was not so exciting in terms of exquisiteness. Still love the view of the pool at the entrance. I would like to draw hotelâ€™s attention to the t-shirts and scarf sellers loafing around trying to sell stuff to hotel guests and people who are not hotelâ€™s guests hanging in the hotelâ€™s beach. All in all hats off to Ahungalla for making our stay feel much at home. Keep going! Thanks Mr. Thushara for that fantastic effort to take a group picture of us including the little ones who didnâ€™t bother to pose ïŠ

Best of the best out of 21 hotels I have visited. Really really big rooms with delicious meals excellent service I ever experienced. Definitely once again im gonna visit that place. Really enjoyed everything. thanx Heritance.

This was the 04th Hotel I selected for my vacations in Sri Lanka in 2014. Although I experienced some unexpected long delays in checking me IN, the rest I experienced removed my anger faster than I wanted to. Room (suite) is very specious and well laid-out. Linen were clean, crispy with nice fragrance. Restaurant is clean, good quality tasty food with plenty to select, but the hall is slightly dark towards the centre. Plenty of space to wonder around, two swimming pools, Nice (but small) gym, tennis and badminton, Snooker, library..all in good shape and order. We were served with evening snacks on all three days, tea, coffee..all good enough to create a wonderful memory. Above all, the dinner arrangement outside on the beachfront to celebrate our wedding anniversary was commendable! Most of the staff were very friendly except for the one at the reception who failed to handle our arrival and delays from the hotel side in most wrongful manner. Another negative was the shower inside the toilet continued to spill water outside of the tub and keeping the toilet dry was a nightmare! Despite above two negatives, In general, it was a very pleasant stay and wanting to go again!

I went to this hotel after 15 years. It was our Annual Company Staff trip. Rooms were ample and well kept. Very comfortable bed and suiting lightings. Food was to be amazed not so good. Everything was lacking something and not the best food ever surprisingly. Service wasn't up to the standard. I had to wait more than ten minutes after requesting cutlery for dinner. And requesting hot water took more than ever. At breakfast I had to eat without a serviette because Steward never showed up. Sometimes I had to yell at them in order to get water. This type of service is never expected from a five star rated hotel. The night club was so much fun. The other terrible fact about the hotel was they switch off the lights in the corridors and we had to assist ourselves with a torch in order to find the room. Some of my friends had mistakenly tapped the wrong room. I mean this is a hotel which operates 24/7 and why do they wanna switch off the lights? Anyway I'm very disappointed with the service and food. I hope this will no longer continue. The best thing was the soothing beach view which was so relaxing. The two pools were breathtaking too.

We started our honeyroom trip from heritance hotel. It was our first stop and stayed for 2 nights. They were kind enough to upgrade our room once they found out that we were on honeymoon. Additionally, they decorated our room and left us with complimentary fruit platter, cake and some sushi.. It was a really nice gesture from them. Room we stayed on was good and had a great vew of the Indian ocean. Staff was friendly, attentive and always helpful. overall it was a good experience for us.

See comments below. Rooms - very poor, given cost Food- depends when you eat, the later the worse. Beach location excellent Gardens excellent. Staff good Definitely wouldn't go again or recommend. Yet the outdoor areas were lovely

Nice hotel but could be so much nicer with a bit of TLC! Mainly the corridors leading to your room and could be a bit creepy when leaving hotel in early hours, as there are no corridor lights! The infinity pool is lovely as you first walk in! All the staff are lovely and helpful! The drink selection wasn't so great, I couldn't find anything nice to drink (I don't drink lager, which I noticed most people drinking)! The cocktails weren't great but you don't go to Sri Lanka for cocktails! The food was amazing not only in the hotel but everywhere! I did try hard to eat Sri Lankan food all the time but my stomach couldn't take it by the end of the holiday! The restaurant was very atmospheric and the staff very attentive (you hadn't even put your knife and fork down before your plate was whisked away)! As we travelled around the island a lot (staying in different hotels) we only spent two days by the pool! Which was lovely and relaxing with constant food and drink service! The beach was a no go area! The sea was too rough and you were constantly surrounded by the locals selling. Overall, the hotel was a good base for us to travel around this wonderful island! We visited so much in our short space of time there!

We spent five days in this nice resort.Rooms are spacious and well equipped but need mild renovations.Location is magnificent overlooking the indian ocean, with a beautiful lovely nature all around as well as very relaxing atmosphere.Staff without expetion are so friendly and cute.Food quality and diverisity outstanding.There was more than outdoor swimming pools, a moderate gym and spa all were as expected. Highly recommended for all kinds of trips.

We selected this hotel for one night on 1st November 2014 on our way back to Colombo. It turned out to be a good choice to enjoy the week end. Hotel has a small car park and if you are not a fan of valet parking, better ask the security of a proper parking place before you take your vehicle out from the reception. We had a warm welcome at the reception and a choice of welcome drinks were offered as well. However we had to wait approximately 35 mins at the lobby until the rooms got prepared. I had booked two standard rooms but the hotel gave me a suite room saying its a last minute promotion. I was bit annoyed by the delay but accepting the suite room made everyone lives pleasant at that moment. Main restaurant is located in the ground floor and they have two swimming pools as well. Food is good, especially the seafood preparation. Pool-side bar is also a nice place to go and have drink. The pool to the north side has a small jacuzzi. Had a great time during the week end but sadly there was no one to say good bye to us when we left the hotel in the evening. Which I think the reception staff should try and improve, because that is also important in this hospitality industry.

I went there in a group and loved the service. The staff were friendly, the rooms were clean and the location was perfect. I would highly recommend anyone wanting to explore a quiet, beachside hotel which is adequate in luxury, appeal and class. The food however, the buffet could have had more meat options....

It was a Trip with my office staff (friends) to Heritance. The Place was really unique and they have tried to preserve the environment and the looks of the place. This was evident when we went in a big bus there and the coconut trees were in the middle of the road and we had to navigate the bus to go to the entrance of the hotel complex which was fun. The interior looked nice with white walls in most of the place and it looked nice. The rooms were very clean and they had TV, A Small Kettle with Tea and Coffee Sachets and clean towels. The room had a fairly nice view with half ocean and half the garden which I can't complain about. The Shower presented to be a problem where when I had the evening shower the hot water was working fine but early in the morning the hot water was not there and I had to call-up the housekeeping to turn it on. The shower drain was not draining the water properly and when I finished the shower I was standing in a pool of water in the shower cabin. Also all three Shower Gel, Shampoo and the Body lotion available in the bathroom were of the same fragrant not sure why is that. Other than that the stay was a smooth ride for me. In the night they have arranged a nice place in the beach with lanterns hanging around and nice music playing while we had our drinks and socialized. Then in another part of the hotel they had dinner arranged which was superb with a grill station and DJ music which was fun. The Morning Breakfast and the Lunch was good, they had verity of food and a long line of it as well. We had the chance to feast in all of the variety. The Hotel staff were very friendly and the house keeping was really efficient. I had two instances where in one I wanted an iron delivered to my room it took them only a minute or less to get it to my room and when I asked someone in the ground floor lobby to deliver some fresh towels to my room and when I took the lift and went near the room one of the staff was already there with the towels knocking on my door. In conclusion the stay was really good and they can improve on some of their flaws.

After visiting the sister hotel in dambulla, I had high expectations for customer service. However I was sadly disappointed apart from a very few members of staff. We arrived after touring Sri Lanka for our honeymoon for a rew days relaxation by the beach.. Dispite the local security we were often harrassed by the local "beach boys". A stroll on the beach was anything but relaxing. Although not a private beach the constant calling and shouting at by the locals was very annoying. Even after explaining we were on our honeymoon we were still surrounded by a number of the locals. Obviously this is made worse by the lack of security at the hotel, which allows locals to stroll around even to the resident only pool. After on evening sitting for a pre dinner drink I noticed a number of flis around and which point my husband pointed the food and liquid on the adjacent table. After letting the staff know and expecting a prompt clean up, nothing was done about the mess. In comparison to other hotels within this chain and other hotels we stayed at the hotel was not well maintained. I never saw anyone clean the main lobby and bar areas dispite obvious mess. In fact e only time I say a brush was during a lunchtime of heavy rain to brush the water out and this was only done once. There is a lack of information provided by the hotel. This could easily be rectified by adding a little more information into the room guide. Information about the surrounding area, places to visit and information about food within the restaurant. The hotel food however was of brilliant quality. We enjoyed a meal at the fine dining restaurant and can say this food would not have been out of place at any top london restaurant. The food at the the al a carte restaurant was also of a good standard. The evening buffet was expensive and so we avoided this as we felt it would be poor value and probably poor service what experience we had of breakfast. Now breakfast was a terrible fair, although a wide selection of food not enough waiters or chefs. We came down for breakfast at various times, but noticed if we came after 9.30 no one was around to provide tea or coffee or chefs to cook the food. If we came earlier it was so busy we had to queue for the dishes and the cold foods we're not refilled often enough. Rooms were of a good size and clean. However try to get a room a reasonable distance from the lobby as this can be noisy especially on the weekend. All in all this hotel has the basis for being lovely. The food was good, the views gorgeous, just a little more customer service and focus would improve anyone's experience massively. Maybe the staff here should vist kanadlama or the tea factory for some tips!

Group of 9 family members stayed there and we found this hotel immaculate in every respect and the friendly staff were exceptional.The buffet both breakfast and dinner was very extensive and delicious. There were many foods to select, either local or international. There are two swimming pools, recommend the pool which is located bit far from the reception. Only bad experiance was the pool bar delay. They took 45 min for 4 cocktails and 3 potions of chips. i had to go and check two times about the delay. We had great time there.

overall stay was good but property specially corridors and washrooms needs attention. beach front was amazing and swimming pools are just added advantage. I highly recommend this place to stay if you want to have calm and enjoyable vacations.

The staff were very helpful in moving us to a different room when the first one we were given was very damp & was affecting my Asthma. at first we were offered a room right next to the construction area of the hotel but the dust would have been just as bad as the damp & we were given a better option. However we had to put up with two single beds instead of a double as requested. There was a huge choice and selection of food available in the restaurants & the chefs were creative with the menu choices. Drinks took a very long time to arrive if you ordered from the bar area during the day, sometimes up to 40 minutes. we chose to upgrade to all inclusive but finding a menu with what was available to drink was near impossible. the Pool guys were super sweet and tendered to everyone's needs fetching plenty of clean towels & sourcing an umbrella for shade. the pool was spotless & they worked hard to keep it so. The security guys on the beach front were great at fending off the locals who kept calling across. they were firm but fair and just moved on the sellers when they became too loud or pushy. We loved the wildlife in the gardens and had an amusing time watching the chipmunks, birds and lizards go about their everyday life. All the staff said hello & greeted every guest. My only criticism was when we had to check out for an early pick up on departure all the lights in the hotel were off. it was pitch black at 4am in the morning with no one around. We managed to feel our way around the corridors in the dark & finally saw the emergence exit signs that gave a little light & lead us to reception. We had confirmed with reception several times and the day before that we had an early checkout but they seemed surprised when we were needing to leave so early. staying at this hotel helped us unwind after a very busy tour of the island & we enjoyed our stay.

Large, modern design hotel. Excellent restaurant and super employees. Really good food. Room probably nice once, but in urgent need of refurbishment. Internet speed fair to good. Usual tv channels, but a bit fuzzy. Our room stank of cigarette smoke and there were many burns on the furniture. Ok, our fault as we did not specify non-smoking. You may wish to. No shampoo etc. in bathroom. Minibar not restocked. Annoying 'theft-proof' hangers. Generally a bit shabby. Our 'double' was two single beds pushed together. The major issue is some second floor walkways that are seriously dangerous. Only narrow ten inch high flower trough separates you from falling to the next floor. Not good for kids. Don't touch any of the black-painted handrails, particularly if you are wearing white. The paint comes off the rail, but not off your clothes. Watch out for very slippery floors at times of high humidity. But it is not as bad as it may sound. Other than the above gripes, this is a good hotel with exceptional employees. There are some glowing reports here, so perhaps some rooms have been refurbished more recently than ours.

First of all, the staff at Ahungalla are extremely professional and very friendly, so I give them 5 stars for customer service. The general setup of the property is nice, and it has two excellent pools. The food is great, with a wide range of delicious salads, mains and deserts, with enough vegetarian choices. The rooms were generally clean, but some of the furniture was looking worn-out. We were on the 2nd floor and had a good view of the ocean. We had a strong musty smell in our room, and were told there were no air-fresheners. The linen and towels were fresh and clean. There was some construction work going on (probably a good thing in the long run!), with hammering from what sounded like above our room, however, this would start around 8am and had stopped by night-time. Good place for one night, but I think there are better options around.

Good environment nice rooms friendly staff. Good food second best heritance experience behind kandalama... Nice pool with blue water.... Nice Beach too... enjoyed a nice sunset.... The hotel looks a bit old ... undergoing renovation...... how ever we thoroughly enjoyed the stay.....

Spend a night with my wife in this hotel. The room is done up so nicely. Room comes with a balcony with lounge chairs. It also has a nice view of the sea, just lovely for reading a book and watching the sunset. Food was great lots of selections. Most important thing is the service and the hospitality of the hotel staff. It was superb. Speedy free Wi-Fi (Need to get the free voucher from the reception) . Had a chance to participate in the Christmas cake mixing. It was a wonderful evening. We enjoyed the stay in Heritance Ahungalla.

We really enjoyed our stay here. The beach is stunning, although it wasn't possible to swim in the sea. However,we weren't too disappointed because both pools were great. The staff were brilliant. The food was good, but not up to the standards of heritance kandalama, where we stayed earlier in the week. Some of the inside of the hotel could also do with updating, although I think this is in progress sine there were quite a lot of workmen around during our stay. Overall, a great hotel!

We stayed 2 days in this hotel. Unfortunately the pictures on the website correspond to a long gone history. This hotel needs urgent maintenance. Especially the bathrooms, the floors, and the gardens and furniture around the pool. The people are really kind and try so hard their best, but we considered the place as a wrong choice.

What an amazing Hotel !! Staff (from the gardener till the cleaning-boy) is very friendly and proud of the Heritance. Breakfast is really unbelievable....so much choice and it tastes really good. We had B&B, so we went out for diner in Bentota (only 10 minutes with tuk tuk). Beachboys are not a problem, just a firm "NO" and they will not bother you any longer. If you want a really great holliday and see some special things about Sri Lanka....than ask for Raja (very good guide).....his number is: 0776954583 The Heritance is absolute the best hotel we ever had and we will definitely go back to this wonderful place.

The hotel is beautifully located on the shores of Sri Lanka Ahungalla. The entrance view of the hotel is stunning as it is open, airy, has the view of the pool and also the beach. It is stunning. The rooms are spacious and well decorated. The facilities and amenities of the hotel are good. The dinning area is good but has an unpleasant smell. The food was good but not very outstanding taste. There is a lot of room for improvement for the food and the dinning area, taste, presentation and staff servie too. The staff in the dining area need to step up. The uniform of the chief's at the live cooking station was so dirty that it was unpleasant to look at. The hotel overall has a very relaxing and soothing ambiance. It was clean and well organised. The hotel has 2 pools both have a very relaxing feel. Our stay was very short, just one day. Wish we had stayed longer.

On arrival greeted with cool flannels and drinks, promptly checked in along with baggage to room. To our pleasure we were upgraded from a deluxe to a superior room and would recommend this upgrade would be worth the extra. Nice sized room with large glass doors and private balcony not overlooked by other residents, all very clean, complimentary bottled water and plenty of tea, coffee, sugar, milk and well stocked mini bar topped up daily, the air conditioning was easily and comfortably controllable. Bed linen and towels were changed daily, bed & pillows were very comfortable. We were in room 351 which has a perfect view of the residents only pool, surrounding grounds, foliage and the sea also less noise and traffic, it would not be so private on the ground floor, it did show a few wear & tear signs but made up for by everything else. The en suite functioned well, shower was good and no smells plenty of complimentary toiletries etc. I liked the special electrical socket that accepts just about all varieties of plugs from around the world which saves packing adaptors. The grounds were very green and well maintained, the two pools were very large and chlorine levels maintained at a level that does not blind you, the pool guys were very prompt in issuing and setting up sun loungers and there was never a shortage and as the grounds were large there was plenty of space for peace and quiet. The main buffet appeared to have a reasonable selection but I'm not keen on buffets so chose to snack in the pool bar for lunch and dine in the coffee shop personally I liked the coffee shop because they served anything from a plate of chips to a full a la carte menu or a selection of good curries and both are open 24/7 which is great. Breakfast was very good with a large selection of hot and cold foods and fresh fruit, you could even have a curry, the omelettes and eggs were cooked well and the best bacon i've had outside the UK, we were nearly always late for breakfast (due to the comfort of our beds) and were never once turned away or made to hurry like most other hotels which made for a relaxing start to the day. Most nights were spent in the Bacchus bar where there was reasonably good entertainment every night and a relaxing atmosphere which is just as well as there is nowhere else to go for miles. They had a good selection of drinks and as usual alcohol was a bit expensive especially wine but this seems to be the case in most of Asia. The staff were well presented, very helpful and friendly which helps make a holiday nothing was too much trouble for them and room service was very prompt, the laundry service was also of high standard. We did not visit any areas during our 5 night stay as we were tired having previously travelled around Sri Lank for 5 days non stop sight seeing. The beach was good and sea temperatures one of the hottest I've been in but unfortunately to rough to swim in at this time of year but able to ride the surf. The beach venders can be an issue but eventually they go away there is a marked perimeter between the hotel grounds and public beach which they are not allowed to cross it became amusing to watch their fashion show of silks, sari's and other goods. Although we were in the rainy season it only rained twice for an hour or so in the day after which only ever at night great to watch the lightening shows and helped to bring the temperature down to a reasonable level. As we checked out at 05:00 hrs and were about to get in our taxi the staff had made us a take away breakfast which was a nice gesture to end our vacation. All in all a great place to relax and a nice atmosphere would highly recommend and if I ever returned would book this hotel. A couple of small items I feel could be improved there were no bath robes unlike their sister hotel in Kandalama and very difficult to receive WiFi, certainly not in our room unfortunately although on vacation I still need to keep in touch for business reasons, it does get a bit busier at weekends when local families check in for a day or two. We did eat out twice both times at the same place the Sunshine bar 100 yards down the beach towards the rocks, sea food, lobster, tiger prawns & fish all fresh bbq'd specially for you a great way to spend a totally relaxing afternoon and at night romantic, bring your own wine as they don't have any it may look a bit dodgy but was once a two storey restaurant destroyed by the tsunami.

Stayed at the hotel for two days one night on full board basis...the beach is lovely but the sea is rough in this time of the year. Not the ideal place for a sea bath. But the hotel has a very big pool to have a dip in the water. Variety of food was available. Staff was very friendly and supportive. Hotel has undergone a refurbishment but the age could be visible in some infrastructure/ toilets etc.

This hotel is one of the nicest hotels I've ever been. The personnel and staff is extremely friendly and helps whenever they can. The food is mainly local, some people hate it, others love it, but if you hate it, no problem, at the pool bar you can get burgers and fries. Room was very nice and clean, fresh towels 2 times a day and they even have a night service to open your bedsheets. Positive Points: - Friendly Staff - Nice local food - All inclusive formula is nearly perfect (will come back later to this) - Nice views of the pool - Nice, clean and big rooms - Wifi EVERYWHERE Negative Points: - All inclusive doesn't include "light" drinks, so as a person with Sugar disease you can not take Cola Light but only regular Cola. This is something where they should look for an alternative for people who can not have that much sugar and don't like water. - The people at the beach who try to sell you stuff, they are nice and friendly, but if you are friendly back and buy some stuff, they just keep coming asking for more, asking for drinks, milkshakes,... This is something to watch. Overall it's a very nice hotel and I will definitely come back to this one.

A fabulous piece of work by late architect Geoffrey Bawa. The entrance is very nice with the corridor running parallel. The infinity pool is nicer too. The staff, specially the front office staff is very polite and welcoming to make us feel homely. The food spread was enormous and we couldn't select what to eat. The hotel indeed needs a refurb to maintain and enhance the quality standards, but a credit goes to housekeeping for the lovely room set up. Suggest the hanging light length to have the self adjustable option as per guest wish. Nice and warm pool !

This is the second time at The Heritance Ahungalla. Guest Relation Executive (Ms Madu) and others were all too hospitable and welcoming us into the hotel. The lunch buffet had an incredible looking spread with so much options and variety. starting from General Manager until housekeeping are very friendly, we are very happy at Heritance Ahungalla Resort because we feel safe and comfortable. This is a great location for a hotel. Set on a beautiful piece of coast. We would highly recommend Heritance Ahungalla to anybody looking for a beach hotel.

we stayed 5 nights up to the 22nd sep in a luxury rated room which I upgraded to for Â£50 per night extra from a deluxe room they wanted Â£61 but a deal was done ,the room was fine good size .ac did not regulate cold or cold. in general hotel is very tired and needs a refurb,looking shabby the public areas in particular,chairs and tables in bars and restaurants are sticky thru not being cleaned properly. only really one main bar area next to main pool and reception this is completetely devoid of ambience and comforts hardly a good advert for checking in guests who are brought here. the a la carte restaurant next to the main dining room while serving reasonable food is dirty with table runners stained and dirty when restaurant manager challenged about theis he quickly had it changed the same night our food came out cold ,not good for curries!the meal was remade but it was too late the damage done,they tried to make amends with a free dessert please too little too late. the main dining room is where we took breakfast and on one occasion a buffet dinner,the tables and chairs again dirty also the table runner.food wise the breakfast is good also the dinner buffet with plenty of choices available. we tried the fine dining restaurant one night and it was very good my wife taking the new zealang beef and me the 2 fish curry price wise of course dearer than the other two dining rooms but light years superior which you would expect if you pay more but not expensive to European prices. a bone of contention ,if you have a wine list then maybe the odd bottle is out of stock,but it got to the point all that was left was the expensive wines costing Â£25 plus for what we get at home for Â£6 now I know all about mark ups but rip off! the daytime was spent by the resident only pool as this was the quietist and the pool attendant was very good at arranging our beds and towels on the same vain all the staff were very good one or two thrown in at the deep end I suspect with a poor lack of English in the restaurants. avoid the weekends as it fills up with locals on a freebie with their company and they are noisy and usually drunk playing drums at all hours. now while you are relaxing on your sun lounger near a pool you will be beckoned over to the hawkers trying to sell sarongs tee shirts or days out in a taxi,now they are not supposed to step over a line in the sand enforced by security guards but all day long they are shouting to you waving the sarongs etc,they stand on the boundary of the hotel and the beach which means the beach is a no go zone unless you don't mind saying no thank you many many times over. don't know what can be done they need to make a living you are trying to have a peaceful holiday. so to sum up after touring around sri lanka for a week we intended to chill out for 5 days didn't feel we achieved it so we do not recommend this overated hotel more 3 star.

This is a great location for a hotel. Set on a beautiful piece of coast, but seas too rough for swimming. We were welcomed by the staff, with drinks and smiles. Room was well appointed and always clean. Was great to be able to sit on the balcony and relax. Housekeeping was excellent, as was laundry service. The bar at the pool served great lunch snacks, and the ice cream was yummy. The restaurant served a variety of food, which was tasty. However the dominance of Arabs and Russians who were very rude towards women, and uncontrolled children made meal times trying! Staff in the hotel were excellent, whether reception, pool attendants, bar staff, housekeeping.

Beautiful property. very comfortable rooms. the second pool away from the busy area was our favorite place to hang around. it was so quiet and peaceful. the pool attendant was so helpful. we tasted a excellent Pena colada or two ;-)

We visited three Heritance Hotels during our stay. This was sadly the only one where customers were secondary to hotel maintenance. We were Woking up by hammering of temporary barriers and scaffolding at 2 am as well as loud porters moving beds all through the night. That said, the day staff were all pleasant and helpful but little thought was given to guests when they carry out maintenance work both day and night. The hotel rooms were tired and needed the work, but managed well, they could have sealed sections of the hotel rather than maintain where guests were occupying rooms.

What can I say.. We checked in and were greeted with smiles and then after the welcome drink were escorted to the room whilst the staff engaged us in small talk to keep us feeling fresh.. When we got to the room, it was even better as the room had been decorated and it was not even our honeymoon.. Every little detailed attention was given to ensure that we were presented with a room that would make us go "wow".. The food, the service.. Everyone in the hierarchy down to the minor staff knew what was expected and treated us with love and care.. PS : and we were not VIP's either and have seen my share of resorts and service. Every little counts - and the hotel made sure it did more than that.. Definitely a place to relax and a place to unwind.. I call it the small piece of heaven ğŸ˜‰

This hotel is fantastic. The rooms are great. Right by the ocean. Great pool and the staff are absolutely fantastic. All very friendly etc. But the food was below what I expected. It just wasnt that great. The choice was decent not what I expected of the buffet. Thats the only reason I have given 4 out of 5 stars.

Heritance Ahungalla has been my first choice for family trips always. It wasn't just me, my 3 year old daughter also loves this place and this is her 2nd trip to Hesitance. As you enter - As you enter the hotel, you feel the difference, you feel like you are entering an ancient sSri Lankan village. The warm welcome at the reception with a tropical fruit juice was so nice after a long drive from Colombo. The check-in was very quick and the friendly chat until you get your room keys makes you feel so at home. Room - I went on a Saturday and surprisingly, my room was upgraded to a luxury room at the third floor. The room is so spacious with a nice living room and a separated bed room with a large balcony having a superb sea view and also the pool view.. The bathrooms were very clean, and the room set-up was perfect. Pool, outdoor and entertainment â€“ The resident's only â€œGreenâ€ pool is very convenient when the hotel gets crowded. My little one loves this pool and thatâ€™s one of the main reasons for her to pick Heritance for her outings. Hotel has got a large beach area with adequate security personnel being available. The lobby area during night time is eventful with live music, traditional dancing etc. Even though we stayed just one day there, we had plenty to do! Food â€“ Simply awesome! I guess they are having an award winning chef, and since I started my meals from Saturday night, it was getting better and exiting till the Sunday lunch. My kid, who is very fuzzy about food, surprisingly enjoyed the kid's buffet and the action sea food at the buffet. Me and my wife loved the sushi and smoked salmon at the Sunday buffet so much. Hotel staff - More than anything, I think they make the difference there! Their courteous, flexible and very supportive staff provided an excellent service from the begging until we left the hotel which is above our expectation. Their Resident manager, Sampath was checking with you personally about your needs and was trying to accommodate those. Thushara, who is the restaurant manager was constantly checking with you about our dining needs from the moment you enter the main restaurant. Together, all of them made our stay very pleasant. While some hotels charge you even for a bottle of water, someone came running and put two bottles of water inside our vehicle for our journey back home. These little things makes this hotel a very special place. I wish them good luck and hoping to see them back very soon again! they are the best.

I stayed here for 3 nights with my husband, my one year old and my four year old in August. This is a lovely hotel, well maintained with great staff. Everyone was very helpful and considerate especially as I spent most of my time running after my one year old. The only let down for us was that there wasnt a kids pool - my son could only stand up on the steps of the pool which meant we were constantly on guard. The close proximity of the beach was beautiful so the kids enjoyed the playing in the sand. The buffet was good - there was a different choice every night. For lunch we ate at the pool bar which i enjoyed more. There is a very small kids club room so the kids spent a little time colouring. I would recommend this hotel for older families or couple - purely based on the pool depth.

My husband and I selected heritance as our vacation spot to celebrate our anniversary along with our kids.. having kids who are 2 1/2 & 1 1/2 is usually not so relaxing :) but the staff at the hotel made it easier for us. . There was a 'kids club' activity planned out on Saturday which was quite exciting. .. the f&b staff inquired if any special food should be made for the little one. . Little gestures like these made us feel welcome... all in all we had an awesome time and many thanks to the GM and staff at heritance.. we would definitely recommend it to anyone and we will be there next year as well... :)

I stayed here only one night with my family. Nice hotel for a beach holiday and unfortunately we were there during the monsoon period. Our room was 158 and it is a huge room in the corner , room was very clean , food was average. They have super friendly staff. Normaly they organize fire show in Saturday night and I enjoyed it a lot.

Last month i visited to The Heritance yet again for the 3rd time which has been superb. Staff were very warm and friendly as always & they did everything they could do to make sure my stay was a relaxing and enjoyable one. Heritance is definitely a home away from home & you feel more comfortable as you do in your own home. The service was outstanding & i enjoyed every minute of my stay. Apart from that tasty food, spotless clean room & private swimming pool...list goes on & on. Thanks for making my stay memorable :)

The only thing about that hotel that I did not like was the fact that I had to leave.we were lucky to have a beautiful room with a view. The pool was nice and the ocean looked beautiful. The sandy beach was enjoyable. Staff members were polite. The food was delicious

We visited with some friends on 17th for a night's stay. We had to wait a while to check in because a lot of people were checking out as we got in. But the hotel made up for the delay by allowing us to check out late.The rooms are pleasant and comfortable with a nice view. But I had specifically asked for 2 rooms with king sized beds but were given a room with two twin beds pushed together and one room with a king bed. Not sure what happened but we didn't make a fuss. The guests- only swimming pool + hot tub is a great feature and allowed us to spend some time in the water well away from the crowds. The food was great with a good variety but the crowds were big at breakfast. We arrived a bit late but had to sit in the non-AC area because the main room was full of families. Perhaps a separate family area where bustling/running/screaming/crying kids won't annoy the rest of us would be a great idea :) We had a problem checking out as the person who was sent to check the minibar in one of our rooms claimed that 4 bottles of liquor was consumed when we didn't even touch them. We couldn't help but laugh as the cashier gentleman recited the list - "Scotch, Cognac, Vodka and Rum". But once we assured them that we didn't consume the liquor, they wrote it off so we didn't have to pay for it. Perhaps the management should assign more thorough staff to check the minibar upon check out. We were told by the cashier gentleman that the previous occupants in the room may have drunk the liquor and the staff didn't check properly. Yikes! Despite a few snags, it was a comfortable stay! I'd recommend this to others.

This hotel has a wonderful location right next to the beach. Adjacent to the spacious lobby there is a huge Infinity pool and just beyond that the beach starts. From the moment you enter the gate, the grounds itself are great. The hotel has two pools - one of them has a a Jacuzzi. nearby. Rooms are spacious and well appointed with small patio opening onto the garden. On Saturday nights there is a special poolside cultural show which starts at 9.30 pm - we were lucky to be able to catch it. What sets apart was the service - very friendly,courteous and warm. Somehow our special request information which was confirmed by our travel agent had not reached the hotel - but the senior front office executive immediately assured us that next day when the offices were open he would get it sorted out and he kept telling us that we should concentrate on on enjoying our stay . And true to his word , next morning we got confirmation from him that it is sorted out. Even the hotel General manager (Mr. Reehan) was very friendly and keen to listen to our suggestions.And introduced us to other key staff. The highlight of our trip was that the Sri Lanka and Pakistan cricket teams were staying there - so we got see first hand the special welcome function put up for the teams. Food was also good - on our request the restaurant even made special Sri lankan vegetarian dishes for us. The only minor improvement I would suggest to the hotel is to improve the brightness of the lighting in the bathrooms. Overall an excellent beach hotel for a relaxed holiday.

Heritance Ahungalla is a hotel i have wanted to visit since i was teenager. I had great memories of cozy bedrooms and an array of foods. Unfortunately, I went on holiday to this hotel recently and i was greatly disappointed. The suites are ridiculous and needs refurbishing, the bathrooms in the suites are laughable. The food was the only thing that lived a little bit up to expectation.

It iswoundrful experience near the beach at Heritance Ahungalla, thefoodwas excellent and there were lot of outdoor activities that we wereableto do such as a bote ride I Madu gaga river. The overall experience was great.

A beautiful 5 star hotel with amazingly attentive staff and incredibly high culinary standards at every meal from gourmet dining under the stars to absolutely everything you could wish for at breakfast. The delicacies turned out from the Heritance Ahungalla kitchens would go down well in London and other international capitals; the team of chefs has a highly impressive array of skills. Infinity pools and the understated elegance of a beautifully designed hotel set in its own bay give this beach experience a unique quality to create an outstanding experience. What is exceptional is the very high quality management team and the enthusiasm and warmth of the staff that they engender. The training is clearly exceptional giving the staff the ability to move with ease from dealing with families with young children to celebrities with the same charm and attention to detail making every guest feel special. This is a gem of a hotels which thoroughly deserves its exceptional reputation to deliver a wonderful experience on every occasion.

Efficient check in. Was escorted to our room by one of the staff. Bathroom floor was dirty but was cleaned promptly when we showed it. Good food and great variety. Restaurant staff bit untrained at times guessing from their behavior. Awful spelling mistakes on some of the dishes available in the buffet. Great hotel and they have maintained the high standards they are known for. Been going to this hotel for more than 20 years now.

Amazing Place. Doesn't look 30 years old and is maintained in a spic and span condition. We had a beach facing room which was an absolute delight. The staff took care of us and very very helpful until the time of our departure. Plus, they are also eco-friendly. The place is quiet and the sounds of the beach kept us in-trance for most of our stay.

Having visited the Triton, now the Heritance, 25 years ago we were pleased to see that some of the familiar places remain. The staff were very attentive and helpful. Our dinner at the Upper Room was excellent .. The food was superb and very tasty. Our large room was omfortable and our butler was very accommodating ... Nothing was too much trouble for him. It was relaxing to sit by the infinity pool and enjoy drinks then cool off with a swim.

Beautiful hotel with lots of garden space. The rooms were nicely decorated. Great ambience. The staff were very helpful from the time you arrived til departure. The hotel recycles old newspapers to make gift bags. They dont use plastic. Good job!!

Let me start by saying that I agree with so many of the other reviewers: this hotel has a lot of positives: beautiful pools, steps from the beach, fantastic food, and wonderful attentive staff. That being said; there were a few basics that fell far short. I have traveled all over the world, and I have never stayed at a hotel that didn't provide wash cloths! Yes, you read it correctly, NO WASH CLOTHS!! Additionally, there was no tooth brush, toothpaste, disposable razor, individual bottles of shampoo, conditioner, lotion, slippers--items that are a must for any hotel that is in the 4 to 5 star category. The toiletries in my bathroom consisted of two shower caps, and a small box containing three q-tips and two cotton pads. Even bath mats were non-exsistent. Folded hand towels were used as a substitute. The bars of soap (one for the sink, one for the shower) were so small, after one or two showers, they were just too small to use. I'm not being picky, just pointing out the obvious. On the plus side, this hotel's exterior is stunning. Every restaurant affords a view of the ocean. Very relaxing, very open and airy. How wonderful to sit and have a cup of coffee while watching the sun rise up over the ocean ! Even though I was traveling alone, I never felt alone. The staff (from the front desk, to the wait staff), could not have been kinder or more attentive. Whenever I needed to leave the property, there was always a driver ready and willing to whisk me away via tuk-tuk (which has now become my favorite means of traveling!) All in all, the Heritance has much to offer, and as long as you remember to bring your own toiletries, your visit will be delightful !

We found the stay medioco. The food was not that great and the alcohol is highly overpriced. The staff is great and very helpful. The extra family activities stated on the brochures are not available. The spa was super though. More entertainment facilities too are welcome.

a must visit. I Went in 2011 n the staff n hotel everything was amazing impeccable n makes your stay and money worth it. I haven't seen a more courteous staff than heritance. I went on the World cup and they were fully booked. even then the staff was smiling and ready to serve you.

A stunning hotel with long drive and beautiful gardens with lots of wildlife including notions, squirrels and monkeys. Our room had a large balcony and views over the sea. The pools were lovely, we used the quiet one away from the main foyer. Unfortunately we were there in monsoon season so the beach was too rough for swimming and we had the daily 30 minute storm which was an experience. The spa provides great massages and facials which we found relaxing. Meals were delicious. Beware of the local beach sharks ( locals selling goods) who trap one into walking along the beach to see a turtle only to find themselves trapped in a gem store or trapped into buying a sarong they don't want. The staff were exceptional and this was a lovely way to end our 3 week holiday.

We went here purely for relaxation The hotel is a dream, the staff is friendly and the food was fantastic. Plenty of live food counters in the buffet they were entertained our special request on food . We were able to see the kitchen & we had nice cooking class with chefs. Rooms were good and has a great antique out fit. Two pools were great option for us. We loved the place and we had a great experience for the spent and waiting to go back to the heritance ahungalla soon.

We enjoyed the most incredible personalised attention at The Heritance. Our entire experience was amazing - great food, location, service & varied experiences provided by the hotel. Amazing! We have travelled widely & this hotel is by far one of the best where we have stayed.

We loved our stay here! The food was fantastic and the pool n beach were exquisite! Do take the chocolate tour in the hotel - the chef is an absolute darling :-) Also if ur staying during a weekend,make sure to see the light show in the night,overall,awsm hotel! :-)

I recently stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla with my family and level of service that we received was outstanding. Every need was catered for and every wish granted. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and cannot wait to return.

I am writing this over a cup of coffee from the hotel. I have visited this hotel from the days it was triton and this officially concludes my 8th visit to this place (yes thats right !) And i am not joking ! Why so many times well two things always bring us back , one is the food and next is the service and fllexibilty. So this makes it my first visit for this year and believe or not i m due there in september as well. Over the years this hotel was able keep up as one of the trendiest in the vicinity however now it seems to lack behind. The food was once heavenly but now let me simply say " not as heavenly" . We were always amazed by the weekend dinner barbecue but this time it was highly dissapointimg and disorganised. We always loved the jumbo prawns and lobster (cray fish) that they always did have . but this time the stock seemed old and frozen . Worst of all the buffet spread never seemed to be re filled . Todays breakfast , i had to tell more than 3 jr chefs to re fill the bacon and it took them 20 mins. So yeah alot of negatives seemed to be observed by our group of friends who have just like me been patriots of this establishement. Rooms seemed to have changed very little. Some rooms seemed to be well stock with all the essentials some rooms seemed to lack a few things e.g bottle openers tea /cofee refills and glasses . However for a person visiting for the first time this perception can definitely differ . This was written with a lot of dissapointment and heart break hope the management will be able to revive this place before it becomes uncontrollable ( not that it is bad ) . Ps one thing that has never ever changed is the friendly staff so kudos for that. Love how pleasant everybody is ! C u soon as always :)

The five star Heritance Ahungalla, a stylistic blend of concrete and the natural in the most seamless manner without the slightest hint of any encroachment on nature which is one of the famed architect Gefforey Bawaâ€™s classics. It boasts of 152 rooms and is located on the southwest coast of Si Lanka that constitutes a place for ultimate enjoyment. Being at the hub of the south coast it offers exciting getaways to the tour the adjacent Madhu Ganga, see the Kosgoda Turtle Hatchers or visit the splendid Galle town. As the guest approaches the hotel through the winding road line with swaying coconut palms greet and green turf beckons, the eye wanders to the luxuriously appointed expanse of the lobby and the infinity pool just ahead of it which is strategically built in line with the eye and beyond it the blue waters of the Indian Ocean lying yonder stretches from horizon to horizon, and is most often dotted with sailing crafts. All the rooms offer panoramic sea views and scrumptious buffets are available to delight and tickle the taste buds. The main restaurant is dedicated to a particular theme very often and offers a unique cuisine to enjoy. Dining in the Upper Room is available with some exotic and unusual options and the Heritance special menu is a must try. The service is superlative and the staff clad in printed batik attire and management very courteous and polite and goes out of their way to make the guests comfortable. This hotel is famous for the rich tapestry of accolades it has earned and continues to be a flagship hotel of the south coast and has reached the Green Globe benchmark certification for wholesome environmental practices and continues its energy saving thrust in being a good exemplar to the entire hospitality trade of Sri Lanka.

This was our first time visiting heritance ahungalle and we were looking forward to a relaxing weekend. First up when we arrived our room wasn't ready and even though I had specifically requested for a king size bed since we were travelling with our son instead of individual beds this too was not taken into account. After sitting in the lobby for over 30 minutes we were finally taken up to our room . The luggage however was not brought to the room and after waiting a good 30 minutes we had to go looking for it. As for the food we found it to be basic and lacking in flavour. Breakfast was much better as it had a variety with many local dishes and seasoning. I found it bizarre that very little seafood was on the menu being a sea side hotel. The staff were attentive and went to the extent of asking if anything special was required for our son. Location is beautiful and rooms are good. Need to improve in food and urgency of staff In getting things done.

This hotel is the best in Sri Lanka. We spent four nights and the location, suite, food and service can not be faulted. When we arrived we were greeted by Dayal at the pool bar. He looked after us in every way possible and organised a night for us in the fine dining restaurant and also a dining experience on the beach. The food was the best we had in Sri Lanka and in particular the seafood was amazing. He also organised a kitchen tour and we met the chefs. An amazing experience. The other staff were also just as fantastic and in particular Sudesh, Lakshitha and Kusum also made our experience an amazing one during breakfast, lunch and dinner within the restaurants.The two swimming pools are immaculate and it was a hard choice each day on which we would swim in. I cannot fault this hotel. It is a totally amazing experience staying there. All the staff bent over backwards to ensure our stay was perfect. Will be the first hotel I book on my next Sri Lankan visit. Highly recommended!

Reading all these wonderful reviews on tripadvisor, it was a no brainer when i had to pick up a beach side hotel in Sri Lanka for 14 of us planning a one week official conference. However I have come to realise the hard way that what works for tourist is not necessarily that good for official travel ! Rooms: Positives: - Rooms are decently sized and well stocked with balconies outside. Perfect for tourists ! - They put flowers on the bed every evening when room is cleaned up Negatives: - No slippers on the sandy non carpet floors - No toothpaste - Imagine flowers on a double bed for two colleagues sharing the room - When we asked for arranging rooms with two single beds, we were given a room with two joint single beds - when asked for separate bedsheets, pullovers and blankets, they threw an extra blanket on the joint double sheet covers Restaurants: Positives: - A good choice of small bars, fine dining and a well stocked buffet restaurant - Excellent choice of food, well stocked bars and very tasty food on the buffet for all 3 meals Negatives: - I ordered beefeater gin on a night when we were all high on beer. They gave me something that tasted like acid. When i asked to see the bottle they showed me a Gordon's. Being a regular gin drinker i knew this was neither beefeater nor Gordon's but was some local gin served and billed at higher rates, but could not quantify this and hence had to roll back to beers. Pool / Gym: Positives: - 2 well sized pools, one scenic & facing the ocean - One jacuzzi next to the pool is a good touch Negatives: - Gym is stocked with rusting weights and age old equipment. It is better to not have one than having something dilapidated Conference Rooms: Positives: - None Negatives: - Old smelly stuffy conf room with a noisy air conditioner - Mints and dry fruits kept in the room on day one where not changed or filled in for next 5 days Service level: Positives: - Extremely warm staff, but nothing extraordinary compared to other places like maldives or kerala or Goa Negatives: - No personalization basis type of guests (tourists vs those on official trips) - Was kept waiting for an hour during check in - Bill was inflated during checkout and I had to involve our booking agency who had to argue and show proofs that the hotel was double charging me for something that the agency had already prepaid ! Overall recommendation: It is a good property isolated from rush of bigger / commercial areas and its bang on the beach. You should def try this as part of your srilanka trip "if" and only if you are tourists. Stay away if you plan office offsites or conferences in Sri Lanka !

Me and my wife stayed here for 3 days and we really enjoyed the stay.very professional staff and great service. They have an extensive buffet featuring different cuisine.rooms are huge and you get a nice sea view and you can smell the sea breeze, awesome!! Try in room breakfast in mornings and smell the fresh air you'll love it!

My husband and I visited this hotel for our anniversary celebrations last week. We enjoyed each and every minute of our two day stay. Staff was friendly and helpful. We truly had a memorable time here. The food was delicious and they had plenty of variety of breakfast and dinner. We had a room overlooking the pool area and we enjoyed the view and comfort of the room. They have two pools and as other reviewers had pointed out the second pool is more secluded if you want privacy. The main pool overlooks the sea and there is always vendors waiting to sell something to the hotel guests. Overall a pleasant experience in Ahungalla.

I wrote the review earlier when I said this was a lovely hotel but spoilt by the guests. It seems only fair to revisit that review in the light of the rest our stay and the efforts made by the management to address our concerns. Apart from one disappointing day the rest of our holiday was bliss- and the response from the General Manager to my review typified how hard everybody worked to make our stay special. It's a wonderful hotel, beautiful location and fantastic food (particularly when the focus is on Sri Lankan food). The sunsets are the stuff of films. What makes this hotel stand out above many others is the staff. They are unfailingly helpful, polite and utterly charming. It is difficult to pick out one from the many who made our stay so memorable but I want to make a special mention of Madhu, who was so patient with our beginners' Sinhala and helped create some special memories. Go to the Heritance and enjoy the view, the charm, the food, spectacular pools and sunsets and most if all the people working within the hotel who work hard to make any stay extremely special. We felt very welcome and will be back.

We had 2 nights at Heritance Ahungalle, and this was just what we needed! The best service we have ever experinced. Everybody are so nice and polite and if you need something it's your own foul 'cause you get provided literally 24/7! The food was an experince for it self! Really a professional and good cuisine. From the local srilankan dishes to international food as sushi, lobster, burger and I could keep going. Both the buffet and in room dining. You can get anything you can imagine. Without a doubt a place we would love to visit again and recommend to all.

Such beautiful architecture, the layout is amazing - the integration of trees and water. That's just the start. The staff here were some of the friendliest we found in SL and nothing was a problem. The hotel has great facilities and the food we had while here was fantastic - so many choices on offer. Highly recommended.

We stayed for 2 nights with family and experienced a very comfortable stay. Kudos to the extremely hospitable and accommodating staff who were the X factor in a beautiful but decently average property(maintenance-wise),which looks like it will need some renovations(interior) in the near future. Being local we were not impressed by the costs of the extras which were geared more towards the foreign purse! Room rate on FB basis was of extremely good value. Overall very satisfied with the experience and would highly recommend!

This is my 5th visit to this hotel. Like always "Great friendly staff great food! ". I always love the way they welcomed us to the hotel. It was a very nice experience, with the 2 huge swimming pools near the beach and the nice buffets with a large variety of foods to taste. We played tennis for almost 2 hours with a fee of Rs. 400 per hour. We did enjoy our game but they must resurface both tennis courts(clay). The rooms were very comfortable in few years back, but unfortunately not now. It was terrible dirty and smells like cockroach. The building really need to renovate to keep up with changing times and tastes We used to love our stay in this hotel!!!

Excellent place to spend the holiday. Superb hospitality and the food also excellent. Location also in a calm and cool place. Supper view to the Sea. Just 1 n half hr from colombo......................

So a lovely resort, with 2 beautiful pools, great service and excellent rooms. Loved our experience. Right on the beach, the bar and coffee shop are a delight to chill at. The game room, library and spa are an added bonus. The pool with a tree! what a concept and what an experience. Definitely recommend it and will be going back soon!

We found the restaurant staff to be very friendly and hospitable. Nothing was too much trouble. They were interesting to talk to and showed us full attention. They are to be fully complimented on their professionalism.

We stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla from 21st June to 23rd. It was not the first time we stayed in Heritance hotels, however the experience which we gained at the Heritance Ahungalla was second to none. We were met by the Resident Manager and Front Office Manager who were very warm and extremely acccomodating . We were a group of seven guests and my two toddlers who also were given the full attention by the lobby staff which added to a great experience. The choice of food consisting Eastern and Western Dishes were phenomenal. The taste, quality and quantity were fabulous and mouth watering. The Executive chef including all of his team, went above & beyond our expectations. As I had two toddlers with me I was unsure how they could prepare the baby meals,however they could not have been more helpful than they were. Kitchen staff were very friendly, and the service they provide to us was excellent. In a nutshell, the total experience in Hertance Ahungalla was unforgettable and we hope to see you again in next year. We have a large group of friends & colleagues who we will be making sure they know what a wonderful hotel that we have been to & we have no hesitation of recommending it to them We would like wish staff our sincere gratitude for an amazing two days which ended far to quickly.We look forward of seeing you again in the future. Lots of Love Denise Huggett, Gemma Hartman, Ivy Sparkes and M Munaweera

The Heritance hotel is a combination of excellent service and a fantastic property! The Hotel's location, facilities and service are really very very good! We were a group of 12 people who spent 2 nights there (21& 22/Jun/14). The Service is really good, the staff are polite and helpful without being intrusive. The room we stayed in was one of the older ones near the Spa. The newer rooms in the main blocks are superior; that being said these rooms are not bad at all. Being a Vegetarian the food choices were limited. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us, they added extra curries to the platter we ordered and were extremely helpful. The limited options were delicious! A special note for the beach. The sands are soft and clean. There are enough activities around to keep anybody occupied. One disappointment: The spa treatments could be better for the price I would highly recommend this place!

This is a very quiet resort located away from the town.there is pretty much nothing to do around here other than lazing by the pool and the beach.The sunset here is awesome.The hotel is a bit old and i would not rate it as a 5 star hotel.the view was nice but the room was poor and give you the feeling of the 80s starting from the key to the furniture,the ac,the toilets...The main buffet restaurant is extremely tired.We stayed on a half board basis so ate at the hotel a lot and the quality of the meals was a bit inconsistent.The breakfast buffet was very limited.The first night dinner buffet was also limited but the next night was great because of new guests form arabian countries!!!!it was the best meal we had during our whole stay in this hotel!!!Live music every night was enjoyable.High speed free wifi was excellent.The room boy had mad an elephant with bath towels on bed.Thanks A Lot

A quick drive from Colombo,a great choice if you are planning a trip with bunch of long lost friends . Good food, friendly staff and a lot of things to do while you are there.The range of food is better on weekends I guess so try to plan your trip accordingly.

We were at heritance ahugalla for Two days on the 21st and 22nd of June 2014. While the other aspects of our stay was satisfatory the food was HORRIBLE and maybe even nearing on Atrocious!! In all meals the food was actually flavor less... the worst part is that most of us had to suffer from food poisoning and purging the same day! I will definitely never visit this hotel again and will definitely advise all of my friends and family to never go there even if it was the last place on earth!! solely because there was something that was seriously wrong with the food in that hotel So please if anyone of you are thinking of going there... Think again
