My husband and I visited Heritance, Ahungalla last week (on a week day), for a one night stay. We were pleasantly surprised by the warmth of the staff and the beauty of the hotel. It's obvious that the hotel itself is a bit old, but this will hardly cross your mind when you see its location which allows breathtaking views of the sea. The residents pool towards the north wing of the hotel is great, secluded and shady enough for an afternoon dip. The food was excellent. All in all, a great stay. Special mention must be made of Amila and Shehan who went out of their way to show us a good time.

We stayed for 5 nights at Heritance Ahungalla as part of Emirates Holidays Best of Sri Lanka tour. Upon arrival on the Saturday night we were at first a little taken aback with the number of people in the infinity pool/reception area where we were welcomed with the traditional hot towels and fresh fruit drink. The receptionist explained that there was a lot of activity because they have local families staying at the weekends in the low season and that by Sunday afternoon there would only be a handful of guests - which was correct. Our room on the 3rd floor overlooked the private swimming pool (which was quiet) and the Indian Ocean - fantastic view. Saturday night was busy in the buffet restaurant however the food and service was excellent. Sunday we were in the restaurant with only 2 other couples! All the staff were always extremely polite, professional and couldn't help you enough - but without crowding you. Always greeted us with a wave and a smile and asking how we were, this included the room service, reception, waiters, pool attendant and security guards - we were even invited to tour the kitchens and the chocolate museum. We went onto the beach - the only drawback was being asked if we'd like to see turtles and being led down the beach only to find we were being taken to see the local restaurant and other business ventures! so be prepared to be misled - although they were amicable - almost begging us to go to their shops etc. - it was the low season and they do need to make a living as well. The hotel was very clean, comfortable, spacious and the wildlife in the rounds included kingfishers, and many other birds, squirrels and iguanas which kept us amused with their antics and being chased from the lawns by the gardeners! Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Heritance Ahungulla was everything that can be expected from a top class Hotel on the beach at south western Sri Lanka. We would not hesitate to recommend it and we would love to come back. The ambience and service was exceptional.

I took my wife here for her birthday, and boy was this place a treat! 1. The architecture of the hotel bears the hallmark of its creator - It was designed by the legendary geoffrey bawa and its a beautiful work of art. 2. The service was the best I've experienced in any hotel. The staff makes you feel like really special. And I have to commend Indika (The front office Manager) and Shehan who really went out of their way to make our stay memorable. All hotels can learn a lot from these two and their style of doing things. They are indeed two of the finest I've met. 3. The food - the fine dining restaurant deserves a review of its own. The food was 1st class. Then again, I'm told this hotel has an award winning culinary team. 4. Other facilities - if you're staying here, use the resident's pool- gotta love the secluded setting and the jacuzzi. All in all, probably the best hotel stay I've ever had. Will be returning soon!

What a fantastic place to relax! First class service and great facilities. Highly recommend Heritance to anyone wishing visit southwest of Sri Lanka. Beautiful and clean beach. Popular with 'high-end' visitors. We had a very happy time and enjoyed everyminute.

A great hotel in a beautiful place. I was very impressed and satisfied with the place, service and the food. Specially Sri Lankan breakfast. That was how I expected Sri Lankan food to taste like after being away from home for so long. I would highly recommend this place.

We had a super time ! good quality time with our friends and family. can recommend to anyone. Food was excellent and lot of variety to choose. pool was excellent when you travel with young children and need very little supervision.

WOW...what a hotel foods, location, service, entertainments, quality... perfect hotel. Highly recommend for every one....The best hotel i traveled in down south. I traveled with my friends in 2011 and i had a very good time..thankx.....

Absolutely wonderful! The resort was a tranquil haven set away from the busy main road and made you feel like you have just stepped into paradise. The hotel is beautifully laid out, allowing you to go from swimming in the pool to swimming in the ocean with just a few steps along a very private beach. The architecture is stunning. The hotel had a wide array of amenities like 2 pools (one with Jacuzzi), bars, restaurants, a library, tennis court, spa, putting green, gym, loads of games, etc which I felt made it ideal for either couples or families. There were always activities for both children and adults like mask painting, water aerobics, traditional dances, etc but they were unobtrusive, allowing you to either be entertained or just relax in peace around the pool, without being bothered. The rooms were beautiful, comfortable and cleaned spotlessly every day. The service was outstanding with smiling happy faces greeting you wherever you go. Nothing seemed too much trouble to do and they made you feel like you were part of the family, not just an anonymous guest. Special thanks to KK who made us feel like we were royalty every day and went out of his way to help us experience Sri Lankan culture. The food was spectacular with a wonderful mix of Sri Lankan and international dishes. We were mad about the Egg hoppers and wonderful Sri lankan curries with their endless choice of sambals, chutneys, pickles, pitu, etc. This is a wonderful escape that makes you feel absolutely pampered every step of the way.

We booked 3 rooms for 6 adults and 3 kids. Two rooms were very spacious and comfortable. Third room was normal Deluxe type - but very comfortable. Not sure how we ended up getting the extra-large rooms, but very happy about it! Service was excellent with lots of friendly staff looking after all the guests with enthusiasm. Very friendly atmosphere. TT table and rackets need a desperate upgrade. But we managed to play a few nice games. Great food! Will plan to again..

Good nice hotel, beach and the main pool were lovely.. our kids enjoyed a lot. rooms were small compaired to some other hotels and was not 100% clean as we found dust in corners of the room. lovely food with varities. friendly staff. overall we had a good stay.

A brilliant location for a hotel. The views from the first floor rooms that have views of the beach are majestic. The restaurant caters for every taste, the curries are spicy and delicious. The staff are very attentive to every need. We enjoyed 9 nights at this hotel and could have stayed for 99. Highly recommended. Must you must reserve an ocean view room to take full advantage of this location.

Stayed here for 3 days on a company off-site. It's a sprawling property about 3 hours drive from the Colombo airport. Very beautifully designed with a private beach and a good pool. The best part is the food - they a very wide assortment in their buffet which has a local taste as well. One negative is that there is nothing much to see closeby in terms of sightseeing.

we stayed at this hotel during April 14. really had a great time and the ambiance, food, comfort and the overall experience was excellent. we have decided to stay here for a longer period as soon as we can find some time to fit in. food at the buffet breakfast was varied and delicious. they had special spread for diabetic patients and it was really really tasty. live counters were fast and good. in the restaurant there is a person by the name darsana....he was very very kind and good. made us feel special. (actually he was like that with everyone)..all in all a great experience. if you want to unwind and relax totally, this is the place to be...

We travelled around Sri lankas west and middle areas due to my son playing cricket. We stayed in 7 different 5 star resorts on our trip, and none came close to this place. The staff were exceptional, and the cooking was of the highest including a tour of their award winning kitchen that was amazing, and a must if you can get an offer. The two pools are by far the best we saw. Shallow pools for mucking around in, and deep pools for having fun.I would come back here at a moments opportunity. My one complaint is the townsfolk who hover at the edge of the resort and do not take no for an answer, but they can be kept away with a stern no about three times. Maybe four times. This place though was the highlight a great and informative trip. Some resorts are so modern they are unfriendly, but this is old enough to have style and in good enough condition to impress.

My husband and I had 2 magical nights away at Ahungalla in between our busy wedding week in Dec 13. We were incredibly well looked after from the moment we arrived. From the welcome drinks in the foyer to the quick and friendly check-in, the staff were always polite, friendly and helpful. We were very pleased to have received an upgrade to our room with a lovely view. The swimming pool, beach access and general atmosphere all contributed to a wonderful stay but the highlight of the trip has to be the amazing food! All three meals were of a very high standard, we were very impressed and thoroughly spoilt for choice. I will gladly go back to Heritance Ahungalla anytime I visit Sri Lanka in the future!

Located in a good place near to the sea. Love the pool very much. had a good welcome. excellent service by all the staff. Less varieties of food. Rooms are in good condition but not much space in the bathroom.

We do an annual getaway with my parents and stayed at this beautiful property for two nights this time. The service, warmth and general demeanour of the staff was outstanding, making this the best vacation we've had in any property in Sri Lanka. A definite recommend to others who visit in the future

We stayed here based on recommendations from friends who said that the hotel was excellent; I couldn't agree more. It was my birthday and members of staff went out of their way to make it a memorable stay and were always accommodating, friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The food at the buffet was great; plenty of choice and very good quality. We also experienced private dining on the beach; I would thoroughly recommend this experience to anyone looking for something special. It was an exceptional meal in a beautiful setting. All in all, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

The location and layout of this hotel is very nice. This was my third or fourth visit and as before, the rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable and the staff pretty helpful and friendly. This hotel is a popular choice for families due to its proximity to Colombo so expect it to be fairly crowded all year round.

Best set of staff I have had for a long time. Always willing to go extra 2 miles to make you comfortable. Our 3y son had so much attention worried he'd expect that at home from his two very busy parents who got a very good vacation!

This is our first time in HA. We stayed there Two nights.. What a pleasant surprise!! This is a beautiful place that you would want to come again.I can't fault anything of this hotel. Excellent Staff. Excellent food & service. I enjoyed every minute . Everything was perfect. But Stay away from beach hawkers. Thanks for the management & staff for making our stay a very pleasant one...

The staff are so polite and helpful, including the restaurant manager, the lifeguard and the reception staff. The room Was clean and comfortable with a lovely beach view. The food was very good, the staff couldnt be more helpful offering to make you anything that was not available already. The chefs were really polite and friendly. The pool was lovely in particular the second pool. We watched a lovely wedding on the beach. We only stayed 4 days but were really sad to leave.

We booked our 2 day stay after reading the good reviews but were a bit unsure if we would get the same watered down treatment we received in a hotel in Sri Lanka which had good reviews from foreign tourists and where we stayed last year. Although living in Australia for 22 years we do not exactly have a "foreign" accent, having been born in Sri Lanka we speak the local language which gives us away to the local staff who generally love to pamper the foreign tourists only. What impressed us in this hotel was that the staff made no distinction between the local tourists and the visitors from overseas, and we were well looked after from the time we arrived. Checking in was very friendly, no standing at the reception, but a staff member escorted us to a sitting area and we were offered a choice of freshly squeezed fruit juice. While we enjoyed our complimentary wood apple juice, we were checked in by the staff member. After we finished our drink, we were actually escorted to our room by this staff member who conversed with us in perfect English and told us about the hotel amenities. We had booked a luxury room with balcony and ocean view, and the room was very comfortable. We enjoyed the view from our balcony usually after waking up in the morning, sipping a cup of tea before heading down to the restaurant for breakfast. The food was really good, the restaurant staff smiled as they approached us. We were even asked to let them know if there was anything we would like to have that was not in the menu, and they did actually oblige with my wife's request for grilled seer fish on Kebab night. We were hoping for a quiet relaxed stay during the middle of the week away from busy Colombo where we had spent most of our Sri Lankan holiday, and we had exactly that. The only thing that wasn't to our liking was the persistence of the hawkers on the beach. My wife bought a sarong that looked quite nice from one of them, however this appeared to be a mistake because that enticed the rest of them to keep following us although we very firmly told them we were not interested in buying something from each one of them. Probably there was nothing much the hotel could do about them. Just one other thing and this is about the bathroom. This was very spacious and we liked it very much, however, the louvered blind on the glass wall adjacent to the bath tub wouldn't shut properly. Not quite sure if this is a deliberate gesture by the management to promote intimacy between couples using this room!

I am surprised at the number of glowing reviews this hotel has received. Either my wife and I were unlucky, too hard to impress, or other reviewers for this hotel were being too kind. Ill start with the positives. The hotel grounds are very nice, the pool is excellent, the location right on the beach very nice. The rooms are ok, they have everything you might expect or want. Nothing more or less. However this hotel seems to follow the usual business model you find in these types of regions. Hire the cheapest staff you can find, provide only the basic training, charge the guests international rates, make a fortune on high margins. Staff were slow and spoke very little english. They cannot engage in conversation which is frustrating when you need to ask about the local area, request extra food items, or anything you might require. There was no imagination, such beautiful grounds yet no outdoor BBQ for guests during the day or night, outdoor pool bar, or even music. And then there is the idea of apparent supplementation of hotel income by allowing corporate/local guests in with their families in tow on weekends. About 20 screaming kids in the pool and all the deck chairs taken forcing guests like myself to retreat somewhere else. I just dont expect this at a hotel that wants be considered in the luxurious category. Food was overpriced for the quality. It was fine, just not what you would expect for the price. Staff would take away an empty bottle and just fail to ask if you wanted another. Basic stuff. Staff are just in a constant state of apathy. I found myself having to look for the barman, find the guy to bring my wife and I the towels for the pool area. They were just never where you wanted them to be. When you did they were slow and emotionless. And the hawkers waiting outside the hotel limits on the beach. I mean that put me off straight away. We couldnt go anywhere without being accosted by these people. If I want a poorly made garment Ill go the street market myself thanks. Other guests actually hesitated walking on to the beautiful beach just so they didnt have to interact with these people. How is that fair? Upon checkout, my wife and I sat in the lobby area for 35 minutes as we waited for our driver and werent offered a single beverage/refreshment. Guess once you check out you arent worth the time anymore? Given so many of us only have only a few weeks a year allotted for holidays due to work commitments, its heartbreaking not getting what you think you are paying for. I think the Heritance Ahungalla has become complacent due to all the kind reveiws. When compared to the surrounding area it is 5 star quality, but internationally its 3 star at best. Its not a bad hotel at all, just not that great. Therefore I gave it an "average" rating as its simply average. UPDATE: We have just checked in to the Fortress in Galle and it makes the Heritance look even worse. I wish we hadnt bothered with Ahungalla at all now. Im sure Ill get some half-hearted response from the management regarding my critique as they have done to others. I would have given it to them personally had they asked, but they never did.

It was our honeymoon we experienced an amazing hospitality and a homely welcome by the staff... The food was superb... The service,the smile of each and every staff bought us an comfortable during our stay in heritance... Regards Ruwan Fernando and Sonali Anjalika - Australia 18/08/2013

Had a excellent time, very attentive staff, nice pool to wind down, good food with choice. Overall recommended for couples & family. Will recommend all inclusive boarding and try try the buffet lunch & dinner which changes daily.

I stayed 02 nights with 06 of my office colleges at the Hotel and 3rd day we had a workshop for 18. Service was excellent and staff was very helpful. And I have never seen such good service standards and staff with pleasant smile. Our meetings and workshop arranged perfectly according to our instructions and always they were really flexible to do any changes as an when we needed.

It's wonderful place to stay with my family with six children My children enjoyed very much specially the resident area with the pool & jacuzzi It's given us more privacy & relaxing the food break fast and the dinner it excalant Specially my family love the desert area Staff it's very friendly & pleasant We spend three night & we looking forward to visit again Simply it's fantastic place to spend the holidays

Amazing hotel, very friendly and helpful staff. Our two night stay with a 3 year old was very relaxing as we had plenty to do, two pools and a wonderful beach kept us all busy and happy. My daughter loved the traditional dancers and the evening event and still talks about it. Food is great, you have a lot of choice at the jute buffet, the in room dining is great too as you can sit in you balcony and enjoy a meal in comfort. The hotel was fully booked on our weekend stay, but still got a hot dinner served in room withing 20 minutes which I thought was good!. The hotel is set slightly away from a town, so for longer stays and wondering about you may have to walk about half km to get the the gates to access the main road, and would struggle to get about on own if you are not a local. You can get a tuk tuk, without much difficulty during the day. I would like to thank the staff and management for the wonderful time we had and would love to stay again on our next holiday! I found it is a nice touch that senior members from Management team Mr Razeen, Mr Sampath and celebrity Chef Mr Kumarasinghe spent time meeting and speaking to guests in the evening without sitting in offices. I felt it was nice that they cared about how guests felt and they were easy to access if you had concerns. Thank you!

A beautiful location and a wonderful hotel for a relaxing holiday. We found the staff very attentive and nothing was too much trouble, with their infectious smiles you canÂ´t help but feel at ease in this location. When we arrived and looked through the reception area and saw the beach we realised we had come to a special place and we were not disappointed during our stay. Great variety of food available from the daily buffet, although there are other restaurants to use or arrange an evening dinner on the beach. We would have no problems recommending this hotel to others and are looking forward to returning..

This is the most difficult review I have written so far. The hotel has two parts â€“ one is brilliant and another is terrible. Therefore I summed everything up and evaluated it as average. Brilliant points: Extensive, very clean beach with clean ocean water. Fantastic pool area (two pools fit for any taste) with very good service. Nice reception, pleasant and airy open lobby. Beautiful grounds with veritable zoo: variety of birds, squirrels, shy langur monkeys, almost friendly molitors, etc. Superb food both at evening and morning buffet. Terrible points: Rooms and bathrooms are outdated, dirty, smelly (sometimes smell of sewage is overwhelming) and ill-kept, some may be cockroachy. After one night I asked to change my room on the ground floor which totally awful to only slightly better on the first floor (at least with more light). Housekeeping is poor: rooms are not cleaned until very late and then, several hours later, in the evening there comes house keeping again for god knows what reason. Also in the dining area at one point the floor was slippery because of spilt fat and remained so for at least two days. Hotel spa prices are more than exorbitant, go for massage to the village. Beware when dealing in cash: bad exchange rate (and different than told at the reception) the cashier cheats (tried to swindle me and one of our group too), so count your money carefully. Even when in the hotel grounds (and especially on beach) you are periodically accosted by touts, seller of various goods, tuk tuk drivers, etc. If you leave the grounds and go to the village you are immediately swarmed with â€œhelpersâ€ who tussle between themselves and finally you will have one fixed â€œleachâ€ who will follow all the time offering all kinds of goods and services. So, if you are indifferent to the room you sleep in, the hotel is perfectly all right, even great. But otherwise consider other possibilities.

Its a beautiful place, but we missed the hotel coming because their was no sign going towards Colombo. So we had to drive back to get to the hotel. The rooms were good and spacious, but the TV has to be in a better angle as it wasn't facing the bed. The food was very good, and had a lot of variety to choose from. The toilets were big and clean, which was a great thing. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The beach was a bit rough but very good. We definitely will visit this hotel again.

very clean, quiet place with super friendly staffs. Breakfast and dinner superior. Lunch we did not take. From our side a 100% recommandation. If possible we would choose this Hotel again. Never hade more friendly and polite staffs before

Room= nice bed, good view nice balcony alot of ants though. Kind of a walk and no lift. Spacious. NO IRON. Bathroom= overall good bathroom clean and we'll equipped. Restaurant= A La carte= expensive for pasta and one pasta looked freshly made other looked like it had been in the microwave and it was disgusting even the waiter said it wasn't good.But didn't care. Kind pushy for us to get drinks when we specified water 3 times. Food took 2 long and like I said quality was bad. Buffet= nice buffet girl was good and since my wife didn't eat just wanted pineapple she said it was ok and let us just get pineapple and one buffet so she was friendly. Really good variety and service was good. Breakfeast= breakfeast was ok. Only happy person was the one making our waffles this was April 27 by the way. He was answering our questions and was good at what he was doing always working. Asked for late check out and got it til 2 thank you very much. And also check out was the worst. Fyi always get an outside cab hotel gets you a cab. EXPENSIVE and not worth it. And waited 20 minutes for my bags to come down( the lift is only for them). Beach however is awesome just people trying to sell u things as soon as u put one foot out the hotel. Beach was empty so perfect only me my wife and like 2 other people. Awesome beach.

Rooms are not clean at all, I was waiting to see all type of animals but not mouses passing near the rooms.it smell really disgusting especially when u are in the breakfast and dinner and u don't have anything to eat even cheese is crispy because of the long time stay outside! Don't hesitate to choose another hotel!!!

From the moment you walk into this hotel, you can enjoy everything that is on offer. Service quality is exceptional, staff are well trained and are very courteous. Rooms are spacious and clean. Awesome food. I have been going this this hotel on and off for more that ten years and I never get sick of the place. Great hotel and great location.

We stayed here five nights at the end of January. It was a friendly welcoming place and we had a lovely relaxing time enjoying the sun sea and beach. Beautiful pool and sandy beach. I can't find a fault about this place. All the food we had here was great and there are good selection of food everyday. A special thanks to the young chef Vikasitha who was very attentive and kind enough to cook me some Sri Lankan curries to my request. We occupied room 335 and our room boy Priyantha was a polite chap and make sure the room was clean at all time. We would highly recommend this hotel. A very welcoming place with friendly polite and attentive staff.

Just came back from two weeks in HA. This is a lovely hotel and we cannot add too much to the previous positive reviews but just would like to share some of the points that we think worth to be mentioned. Location. This is the most important thing that needs to be considered if you plan to choose this hotel. The thing is that it is unexpectedly isolated. Most of the beach side hotels in Sri Lanka (especially such big as HA) have a developed touristic infrastructure just outside their entrance doors - shops, travel agencies, restaurants, etc. HA is not the case. Here you can find only two restaurants on the beach and â€¦ thatâ€™s all. Needless to say that the prices for everything (from taxi to excursions) are the same or just a bit less than in the hotel. Just as an example we found out that ordering a room service dinner is cheaper than going to the restaurants. So, be prepared. At the same time the good point is that the Beach is just perfect. Because the hotel is so isolated the whole huge shore line is used only by the guests. This is the advantage that cannot be underestimated. Rooms Rooms are Ok. Not bad but nothing special. We were staying in the luxury room on the second floor. All floors have all types of rooms, but the third floor is considered â€˜specialâ€™ and costs some extra money. We asked for relocation to the third floor but were explained that we needed to pay a difference. As it was written in the other reviews only the third floor had a full sea view. The second and first have it only partial. This does not mean that the view is bad â€“ no, youâ€™ll be overlooking the big (really big) and nice (really nice) pool or picturesque garden with monkeys and varans . Position HA stands rather far away from the main touristic attractions of the central and southern Sri Lanka. If you want to see something you should expect to get up at 5 or 3 a.m. to spend a whole day in the car. The trip from the airport takes around 2.5-4 hours. When you negotiate with taxi it is advisable to make it clear from the very beginning that the price include highway fee. If you do not choose highway be ready to spend 4 hours in the permanent traffic jam on the local road. Conclusion Would I recommend this hotel? Yes, why not. It is well maintained, stylish and relaxing. If you like the beach relaxation, travel with a kid or just want to have a break after exploring the island HA might be a good option. Would I come back? No, next time weâ€™d rather choose some of the hotels on the south closer to Galle.

This is a late review owing to my not having Internet until the last few days. I stayed with my partner at Heritance Hotel for the first two weeks in February and it was one of the most memorable experiences ever. We stayed as 'all-inclusive' guests on a Kuoni trip and from the moment of arrival - frazzled from an 11-hour flight and a 3-hour rush hour taxi ride - we were able to relax - bags, thirst and hunger taken care of by an obviously motivated and attentive staff. Our room was fabulous, with a balcony overlooking the Indian Ocean and throughout our stay we were constantly pampered by attendants, room service and the staff of the bar just along the landing. Everything about the Heritance is five-star. The management is always available to assist, the bar and restaurant staff are simply marvellous and each and every one of the highly-skilled chefs is happy to talk to you about what they do. I was actually given a tour of the extensive and spotless kitchens by one chef whom I befriended. I reckoned the buffet tables in the restaurant were over 40 metres total length and the choice of food was simply phenomenal, as was the quality. The Spa offers treatments such as massage, manicures and pedicures at extremely reasonable cost, and like everywhere else in the hotel, the staff are wonderful. The location of the hotel makes it easy to visit nearby attractions and there are always drivers and tuk-tuk operators to take you (tuk-tuks are very cheap, but the drivers are motivated by commission to take you to other places en route!) We found the buses on the main road just outside the hotel to be an interesting and exhilarating way of getting to places like Galle, Ambalangoda, Hikkaduwa or Balapitiya. I'm saving already to go back !

First and foremost, the Hertitance is a great hotel. You begin by turning into the gates, up the tree lined way and the first site of the Hotel, with the beach and the sea through the open reception is stunning. We were greeted by a personal staff member (I'm rubbish with names, even after promising myself to name them all) and welcome fresh fruit drinks, whilst we were checked in. First impressions met. We were taken to our room, we'd booked a suite as we needed the extra room for the two kids, and I have to say the room was lovely. Sure there were a couple of bits and pieces that could have and maybe should be rectified, e.g the somewhat tatty bathroom blind, the light fitting in our main bedroom and a couple of minor paint jobs, but overall it was great. A huge entrance hall, a big lounge, a huge and lovely bedroom and then a lovely bathroom. The bedroom and lounge had balcony access which provided superb sea views and of the immediate gardens - even the wild, huge monitor lizard that kept walking past in the morning. When we'd checked in, we were given the impression that they'd accommodate our two young girls in whatever way, whether it be dietary, baby sitting or otherwise and this wasn't wrong. The hotel has a number of different eateries, all of excellent standard. We were on a bed a breakfast package only, but this wasn't a problem, the pool side snacks or the 24 hr restaurant offered great food and service, and we were always asked whether the kids wanted anything special doing. Even the little touches like providing free fresh milk for the girls whenever we asked during the day. That said, with notice the chefs were also happy to make anything special that they could, especially traditional Sri Lankan. The main restaurant offers a buffet of different variety every night which we used once - the standard and range of different dishes impressive, but we then used the A la Carte places which again were nice. When we got there, there were a couple of large parties which gave the place more of a young persons resort, but when they'd checked out, the real place shone through, a real family place. The beach is nice, although with the usual Hawkers just on the beach passed the Hotel grounds, but they soon get the message being polite but firm - indeed we found it lovely in the morning and evening to walk down with the girls. The pool is great, very relaxing, with sun beds also around the grounds. There is a 2nd pool, the residents pool, which seemed much quieter but we never went in there. Loads of crabs running round the place - a couple even in the pool which was unique! One of the Hotel 'Animation' team did water aerobics a couple of days, all free, and very well attended. The hotel also offered kids activities to order should we have needed them. Entertainment was by the pool bar in an evening but we never stayed long enough with the children to really see it. We took one day trip down to Galle that we'd pre-arranged and it was about an hour away - no fuss and an easy drive down. Getting to the hotel was a little bit longer given the roads in Sri Lanka but it was overall worth the wait. We didn't want or need to leave the Hotel apart from that. My wife used the Spa one day and said it was great, maybe a little expensive but the treatment was lovely as were the ladies in there. But it was also quiet. The downsides. Apart from the aforementioned tidying up of the general room decor, there's very limited buggy/ pushchair access to the higher floors (we were on 3 of 3), but there was only one lift and the day that was out of order, I was carrying the buggy up the stairs until we were told about the service lift. The sun loungers by the pool need modernising - too many of them were broken or needed a bit of repair, but that's really it. Nothing to worry about. The Heritance certainly isn't a 5* hotel, but that said, we never had any of the problems or bad experiences as some people have commented. The hotel has all the right things in place - the position, the hotel buildings, the views and most of all the staff who I couldn't praise enough. The Heritance can be whatever it wants to become - addressing a few small issues like a paint, replacement off sun loungers would make it a truly great place. Would we go back, yes without a doubt.

we booked a room for 2 nights & checked out after staying only for one. Room & toilet were not clean to a 5 star standard. The sofa & furniture in the room were old & worn out. Food was just baisc stuff. The pools are big & excellent. A average hotel.

If there can be more water sports available will be nice.Staffs are so kindly to solve our requirements. Environmentally-friendly hotel with groups of monkeys and cranes. Beds in standard room are a little high for me and my mom. The price of the gem store is quite unreasonable and much more higher than shops in Colombo, do not buy anything.

We visited Heritance Ahungalla in December 2013 during our summer vacation. This was a memorable experience for us. The location was beautiful. The beach was breathtakingly wonderful. The hotel is ideally located. The rooms were large and beautifully appointed with comfortable beds and the bathroom was a luxury. We have stayed at other Heritance hotels and this was no exception, The service was second to none. The staff were always ready to please. We loved the choice of food too. The choice was vast and the taste was superb. The chef went out of the way to prepare us extra dishes to please us. We would certainly recommend this hotel.

We have been to this place number of times including our honey moon, every time we got a very good service Pros: nice hotel architecture, big pool, food with plenty of varieties child friendly Cons: Small rooms Small restaurant compared to kandalama

Absolutely no choice of food for a vegitarians. Even after the Manager and the Chef were appraised, having promised vegitarian food, they gave only two eggless hoppers after a wait of 20 minutes. Chef Dinesh gave an excuse saying that he had to manage the hotel with two chefs as others have gone for a competition. There is a massive choice for non vegitarians. They dont seem to care us as we are locals. I would not recommend this place as they dont have any regard for locals and especially for locals. We are waiting to get out of the hotel as it ruined our holiday and wasted our money.

a truley reccomendable hotel, rooms are spacious and extreamly clean, the bathrooms are fully equiped, 2 swimming pools, clean and beautiful , peaceful and lovely beach. management and staff excellent, the buffet is outstanding, you get a grand variety of sri lankan and oriental cuisine, wonderful experience.

First the good bits: pool and beach here are gorgeous. Staff are all excellent and try very hard. That's it for the good bits This hotel is on desperate need of an upgrade to claim its 5 star rating. 5 star this is not. Tired rooms, leaking shower, bath that did not drain , mouldy screens etc. Lobby bathrooms - 2 out if 3 cubicles no lighting, doors did not lick and paint chipping off the doors. The food here is ok. If you are looking for a good 3.5 star hotel then this is fine but we have stayed in many other so called luxury hotels on this trip and they were all way above this hotel in terms of fit out and upkeep . They do many things really well here but 5 star lodgings it is not.

Beautiful Geoffrey Bawa designed hotel in a lovely quiet location. The staff are incredibly kind, generous and attentive. The food is fabulous and we were treated to a cookery demonstration by the chefs and a tour of the kitchens. Just a fabulous place to relax and reasonably priced too. 2 massive pools. I would highly recommend a stay here. River safari trip was I think the best value for money excursion, a really great day.

Had 1.5 days at this wonderful hotel. Great facilities, great staff, and great ambiance. A fantastic place to relax and unwind. The breakfast in the garden was fabulous and an early walk on the beach is a must. Be patient with some of the new staff, for their English may be a bit weak, but their hearts are definitely in the right place. The management did everything they could to accomodate us. Our only problem was that we didn't get to stay longer!!! Definitely a place to go to unwind!

The Heritance Ahungalla staff must be complimented for the outstanding service! The Premier rooms we occupied on Level 3 were spacious and comfortable. The Luxury Room # 333 which Farina and I occupied was unusually large, with a very spacious living room and large balcony. We spent an enjoyable 3 days at the hotel. The pool for resident guests was quiet and had privacy. The beach was clean and broad and the sea...warm and inviting!

Spent 3 days chilling out on the beautiful beach at this lovely resort. Rooms are gorgeous, spacious and tastefully decorated. Housekeeping is very good and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast service / dinner service in the buffet restaurant is great - extensive spread with very friendly staff - even the chefs were engaging and remembered our preferences during the stay. The 24 hour restaurant menu was ok - the staff were a bit grumpy on the 2 occasions we dined there. Not by any means bad - just paled in comparison to the excellent service in the buffet restaurant.The food in this restaurant is good - some more casual options would be great - i.e. pizzas, burgers, toasted sandwiches etc. Two nice swimming pools to explore ( the green pool had a better atmosphere). Spa is well done - very professional treatments and city prices.

Great place to end our Holiday. Quality room, immaculate beach,outstanding service. F&B slightly expensive due to the taxes. However the buffet and breakfast spread were fantastic. Great work with chefs cooking hoppers and dosai. Particularly would like to thank the all day dining staff and manager who were fantastic. Special mention - Kumarasiri Salinda who was outstanding with all guests. He remembered names and what our son liked. The front office and porters are equally to be applauded. Great work and will see you next year. Would suggest fellow travelers to stay away from the beach hawkers.

We did a one night stay at Heritance when we were down in SL for a vacation. The delux room we got was spacious with a comfortable king-sized bed and a balcony with a sea view. The food was amazing (we did full-board) with a good selection. Nice infinity pools. Most of all, the service provided was excellent by the friendly, very attentive staff. They were thoughtful enough to help us with our toddler while me and my husband dined. Overall we had a lovely stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a peaceful family holiday.

What an exceptional hotel. Glorious location on a stunning golden sand beach, beautiful garden teaming with birds, monkeys, iguanas and a fabulous staff who go out of their way to be helpful and friendly. Thanks to General Manager Refhan N. Razeen for his great hospitality and kindness and for his amazing eco-friendly policy of sustainable, environmentally friendly hotel management. Also thanks to Kumara Karunaratne for managing a superb buffet restaurant with a staggering choice of delicious foods. No wonder Heritance Ahungalla won Beach Resort of the Year Award. Altogether a great holiday location.

Very good hotel. Nice location ( in the middle of asian small village), lovely long deserted beach - exellent for those who like privacy and calm atmosphere. very good food!!! Thank you for giving us room 132 with the direct access to the swimming pool! Nice service. We liked almost everything, except for the shortage of sunbeds and Sun umbrellas ( even thoug we were in low sezon). It is not the thing you should worry about in this kind of hotel....Also some parts of rooms/ bathrooms nide some renovation.

During our tour of Sri Lanka, we stayed 4 nights at this hotel. For us a very good experience and one of the best of our 23 day trip The rooms are spacious and kept clean. The food in the restaurants is very good quality and also the buffet well warm.en tasteful. Attentive and service oriented staff, who do everything to make your stay verry well. The only thing we didn't like that there were too less beach chairs provided and many were in poor condition. For the rest, this hotel is highly recommended. Sincerely, Ben and Leone Brouwers The Netherlands

Four of us in the family chose Heritance, Ahungalla for. one day stay and it was fascinating. Booked through the hotel web site. Check in was cool, slight delay, as the hotel was on full occupancy and we were upgraded into a luxury suite and a deluxe Room. That was great and overall nice please to stay. Staff were very attentive, food was varied and suit most pallets. Good pool especially one reserved for residents was clean and nice with a good pool attendant. Will recommend any one to spend the holiday at this nice property.

My husband and I stayed here for the second week of our honeymoon in Sri Lanka at the beginning of March. We had our room upgraded as we were on our honeymoon which was amazing as it had a huge balcony looking strait onto the beach and out to sea. All the food we had at the hotel was very good. We found the breakfast selection good and the freshly made hoppers fantastic mmm! The 'cafe' restaurant next to the pool was good value and the food was all high standard. All of the staff were friendly and helpful and the pools are great. There is not a lot around the hotel (other than the fantastic stretch of sandy beach and the sea) but you can easily get a tuk tuk or taxi to Bentota or we went to Galle for the day which was lovely. We also visited Kosgoda Turtle conservation hatchery, very cute! I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you have done your exploring of the country and want to relax in an amazing setting!

all though the hotel and people were very good we found that being only bed and breakfast we liked to go out to different restaurants in the evening which was a 20 minute ride away as there was not really anything closer.We felt that on the beach you were never left alone and if you went out of the complex you ran the gauntlet of the locals

Been here with my wife and had the most relaxing time on one of the most beautiful beaches in Sri Lanka. - Great food quality at the buffet but I can really recommend the a la carte restaurant next to the pool bar, we had amazing lobster and other dishes there - The beach is tidy with nice sand and the sea is really warm and great to swim in Service is outstanding - ask for Mr. Thushara he helped us with everything!

Stayed in August 2013 for Business Meet.The location of the hotel is superb with a lovely view of the sea. The rooms appear to be old need renovation, the rooms don't have card key. the meals were not suiting the tastes for Indian Palate. The staff is not attentive at all, language problem I suppose always had to be called many times even for water. Overall was an average experience.

We have just spent a very enjoyable 17 nights at Heritance Ahungalla which is set on a fanastic stretch of beach. On arrival the view through the reception area is breathtaking with the infinity pool stretching out towards the ocean. Our welcome was very friendly and check-in was quick, which is just what you want after a long tiring journey. As you go about the hotel and are greeted by members of staff you very soon realise what an amazingly friendly hotel this is, where the staff are happy to help you in any way they can. The Guest Relations team were always happy to chat and a great help as were the front desk staff particularly Manjula. Having a pre-dinner drink by the pool, with the sound of the waves crashing was one of those perfect moments, especially if Madhu served us - it wasn't quite so perfect if it was her day off !!! The standard of the food was excellent and so much choice, plus the desserts were to die for !!. Staff in the Jute restaurant were all very helpful and efficient particularly Nelka-priyan, Lakmal, Anouska, Lassiter and Charuka. We stayed in a suite (an up-grade) which was very spacious and comforable with a wonderful view and very quiet air conditioning. Housekeeping were very attentive with extra touches : flowers and towels arranged as swans on our very comfortable bed. This was our 4th time in Sri Lanka and Heritance Ahungalla is by far the best hotel we've stayed in.....we will be back.

This was our first trip to Sri Lanka and we chose the Heritance Ahungalla after reading the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed, arriving at the hotel, driving through the entrance gates, being met by welcoming staff and the stunning vista across the infinity pool, we could feel the 'stress' just melting away. The beach , stretching for miles, is stunning with large breaking waves, fun to play in but for swimming the pool is a safer option. Staff could not be more helpful and always had a friendly smile, pool staff tried to ensure your sunbed was in the area you wanted to relax, rooms were kept meticulously clean, the view from 217, gorgeous, and the food superb! We booked on half board and enjoyed the buffet meal each night, there was a wide variety on offer, beautifully presented and delicious, often hotel food looks good but actually, on tasting, is a little disappointing however at the Heritance we found the flavour matched the appearance. Congratulations to all the catering team! If guests do not book half board there is an excellent small beach restaurant, think it was called sunshine? sunview? We could not mention the Heritance food without a special mention of Tinkle, one of the chef's, his food was delicious and we thoroughly enjoyed his special attention and dishes he specifically prepared for us. If booking trips through Aitken Spence ask for tour guide Roshain D'Silva, he is knowledgable, always ensured we got the very best out of the trip. and became a friend during our stay. If you would prefer a short trip by tuk tuk, then seek out Susantha at the hotel gates, he is a lovely fellow and excellent driver! Would we return? Most definitely, we can't wait! The owners of Heritance Ahungalle should be proud of their hotel and very professional staff team .

i love sri lanka but i'm not coming back to this hotel. we got bad service in the reception, with the cashier, at the pool bar, at the fine dining restaurant and the buffet restaurant ... we stayed there for three days and in the end we were pleased indeed to leave. we experienced that the staff was highly incompetent and at times rude. they also had no track of bills and there were a long wait at all, even the purchase of a single Soda! the exception was the friendly helpful people at the pool and housekeeping. they did a really good job.

My four girl friends and i had a wonderful two day stay at Heritance Ahungalla. Service was excellent from the very start. Waiters went out of the way to attend to our every need. The hotel has an award winning chef (Chef Demutthu) and we were privileged to have a tour of the kitchen and see some of his award winning works. loved every minute there and was so reluctant to leave

We stayed 5 nights as an add-on to our two week island tour when the hotel was busy mainly with German, Russian and Ukrainian guests many of who were in large groups and are on all inclusive packages. Its is a quiet location on a beautiful beach with no other hotels nearby. Whilst we were there the sea was quite rough with a strong undercurrent. There is a well designed and maintained infinity pool, just off the lobby, that blends in with the sea giving the impression that you are actually in the sea. There is also another large pool elsewhere in the grounds. We were disappointed with the deluxe room that we were offered and so paid considerably more (although discounted) for a luxury suite upgrade which was very nice though was somewhat more than we needed though nothing else appeared to be available. The main restaurant (Jute) serves an excellent buffet as it offers a large choice of good quality international food though with probably less Asian dishes than we had at other hotels elsewhere. The groups sit at large tables in middle of this restaurant and can be quite noisy at dinner times. Our room hotel guide stated that attire for dinner was â€˜smart casualâ€™ though this was largely ignored by many guests and especially by some men who wore jeans, shorts, T shirts and football shirts. Beach fine dining was excellent with a good choice of dishes from an a la carte menu including some wonderful seafood. Attentive and friendly service made this a truly memorable occasion. There was a lack of sun beds and umbrellas around the pools and grounds. Also, the sun beds and towels were old and many of the beds were broken or had wheels missing so there was the daily early morning rush to get towels on good beds with umbrellas. The hotel needs to invest money in buying new furniture and towels to ensure there are enough for all guests. Lunchtime food at the pool bar was limited to burgers, sandwiches and half a dozen other snacks which really should be supplemented by some salads and some more Asian snacks. Service in the grounds Service away from the two pools was infrequent and we usually had to walk to the bar to buy drinks. We have discussed our views with a representative of the hotels management (Dinusha Kularatne) who says he will be writing a report detailing our comments. It's a good hotel but it didn't live up to our expectations of the luxury hotel we wanted at the end of our holiday.

We recently returned from a two week vacation in Sri Lanka. The first half was very active.. touring the cultural triangle, the tea estates and sites in between. While wonderful, that part of the trip was tiring. We had planned to then relax at Ahungalla for several days. Our stay at the Heritance Ahungalla was the perfect balance to the hustle of the prior week. The accomodations were exquisite. The Bawa designed building was beautiful, with classic elements of Sri Lanakan architecture as well as the trademark blending of structure with nature. The food was exquisite, especially the Sri Lankan fare. The spa is fantastic (my wife said "the best massage of my life"). The staff was incredibly gracious, welcoming and thoughtful. Our children were especially delighted by the daily towel sculptures in the room. And, Ahungalla was a good base for smaller excursions to Galle, Madhu Ganga river safari and other smaller destinations. This was one of our favorite hotels on the trip (even though we stayed in several other Aitken Spence hotels the prior week). We would definitely come back here on a future trip.

We have been to many hotels on Sri Lanka but Heritance Ahungalla has the best employees. Everyone is kind and smilig an do their best. We want to stay there because of this, and their good food, because of good chefs. Our treenaigers want to stay because of the animaitors, so everyone enjoying. This trip we stad at six fivestar hotels everyone good but Ahungalla best.

Leading architect Mr.Jeffry Bava's design concept hotel. the hotel is a ideal place for those who love tranquility. And there is no much activities for those looks for active vacation. Award winning culinary art chefs food is one of the attractions for the most guests.

Second time @ Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel is luxurious en the staff correct en very considerate. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The restaurant has a large variety of the finest fresh food. The kitchen has been awarded with the gold medal for New Sri Lankan Cuisine in the Culinary Arts 2011 competition organised by the Chefs Guild of Sri Lanka. The beach-attendants give you the feeling you are a VIP. The undertoe in the sea was strong and we had a red flag all week. I guess this was exceptional for this time of year. We will surely return to this hotel.

It was only because of the hotels staff that my 2 nights stay here from being a horrible one to a very good experience. We checked in very late one evening and were given rooms above the coffee shop grill which meant that the rooms were full of the grill seafood smoke. A few minutes inside the rooms we started feeling like grilled fish ourselves. Upon request for room change we were told that the hotel was full and our request thus denied. Dinner at the coffee shop was a pretty sad affair too. The chicken that we were served was so hard that I am sure if I'd thrown it at a passerby that person would get hurt. After a stroll on the beach when we came to our rooms past midnight we realized that there was no water supply in the rooms due to some maintenance work and that it'd be restored around 2 am. That too did not happen. Our arms full of woes we met the Resident Manager Sampath De Silva and were surprised that he offered no arguments but only an apology. From that point onwards our stay turned into heaven. Mr Sampath offered to change our rooms and the staff went out of their way to be helpful, courteous and friendly. I'd particularly like to mention manager Praveen from the restaurants who made sure that the fare that was served to us was excellent. I'd recommend that future travellers take advantage of an exclusive special table d' hote that they arrange on the beach. The experience is put of the world.

Housekeeping was helpful, he tried very hard to please us and cleaned twice a day. Showers need a good clean up especially the tiles which had black spots. Dining room: Large variety of foods for curry and spicy food lovers, great deserts.

My wife and I have just spent 10 nights here half board Feb 2014. This was our first holiday in Sri Lanka and all being well we shall be returning before too long. Having read other guest reviews before booking The Heritance it was pleasing that the standards were as described in the more favourable descriptions. The staff with very few exceptions were all obliging and friendly and the service they gave was by and large very good. Our room with sea view was just to the side of, and overlooking the swimming pool on the top (third) floor. A nice room and location apart from odd occasions when music from the hotel beach party became very loud, although it has to be said not too late at night. The guests were truly a global mix but a small minority (not connected with the Corporate bash) encamped by the pool frequently chose to disregard the "no diving" sign or maybe could not read English! So best sit in the bar area not too close to the water to avoid being splashed. Dining is buffet style and the standard and variety of dishes on offer was good. However, in our opinion standards slipped a notch over the 2-3 days the hotel catered for 250-300 attendees of a major European corporate function. We usually ate dinner around 8.00pm but to make sure of not being disappointed I think it is probably advisable to be there early doors as a few dishes were not kept replenished frequently enough. Drinks and food prices are reasonable (perhaps with the exception of wines) but the guest is not given a copy of each bill. Therefore in our experience it proved prudent to ask the hotel for an updated statement of account every couple of days as mistakes did happen no matter how unintentional. As for the locals selling their wares on the beach we found them to be real characters who love the banter. OK they are a bit persistent but the stuff is the same as in the nearest town and prices are the same after a good bit of bartering. No tuk tuk ride away either. On the subject of tips to the room cleaners, porters, etc.100 rupees (50p) to show appreciation is a small amount (all hotel bills have tax and gratuities added automatically so no need to tip extra if you don't want) and after seeing a sign in Colombo offering breakfast AND dinner for 100 rupees it brought it home to us just how fortunate we are.

Ceylan (Sri Lanka) is astonishing! Unfortunately this seaside hotel was the worse in our journey around Sri Lanka. Even if it's classified 5 stars, on reality it is not. The hotel needs a huge renovation ( a must for the 80's superb architecture from very well known Sri Lanka architect), the cleanliness could be much better and the staff (almost all of them very friendly) should have better management and be more professional. Even though ( even next time going visit Ceylan is better booking and hotel north of Colombo, because is near the cultural and forest tours), the stay was relaxing and, for a change at the far east beaches, there were 26Âº C 3 meter waves to brake....

We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our tour of Sri Lanka for a bit of R&R by the pool. The design of the hotel is fantastic designed around the landscape with trees and pools around every corner. The swimming pools and garden areas were great including the local lizards and chipmunks providing poolside entertainment. The food was great in the restaurants we tried. As it was valentines day we had a special dinner on the beach and the food was fantastic, as was the spectacularly cheesy entertainment, it hard to stop laughing at some points but it just added to the experience. My wife had a massage in the spa and assured me it was very good and the price was reasonable for a resort hotel like this. Now for a few minor gripes I have. Firstly the rooms could just do with a little TLC to bring them up to the standard I would expect (a couple of light switches did not work, a little paintwork peeling etc.) Secondly while many of the staff were excellent there were a couple who let the side down, some of the staff seemed intent on giving you the bill for drinks and soon as you put down an empty glass rather than offering more drinks, it just seemed like they did not trust you to sign the bill and wanted to get you before you ran away. Also the prices did not include service charge or government tax which meant 20% was added on top of everything, why not just include this in the price? All in all we had a very enjoyable stay they could just improve a couple of things ot make it even better.

Just returned from an 11 night stay at Heritance Ahungalla and already making plans to return. Check in was fast and faultless. The room was well appointed, spotless and, considering the amount of guests, quiet too. Efficiently cleaned daily (even the balcony), tea/coffee replaced, evening turn down service, couldn't fault it. Having spent a month travelling,in Sri Lanka, this was by far the best hotel of my trip. Breakfast buffet was something to look forward too with a superb and varied choice. The evening meals had a different theme with a massive array of western and asian dishes, all cooked and presented at a high standard. After a longish stay at a hotel, buffet meals can sometimes become a bit tedious with a longing to eat elsewhere, but despite several beach cafe choices, we were never tempted away from the quality food served at the hotel. Getting tea and coffee could require a bit of patience in the mornings but this is not logged as a complaint just a niggle when you need your early morning caffiene fix. The pools are amongst the best I saw in Sri Lanka, cleaned daily, the grounds kept neat and tidy and the beach vendors kept at bay by security and a respected boundry line although they do become a complete nusiance shouting and calling out to try and sell their goods but after a couple of days they tend to get the hang of who is worth pursuing and who needs to keep having sales tactics applied to. Beach is a beautiful mile plus of fine sand backed by palm trees and suprisingly free of plastic debris; not totally free but judged against standards of some asian beaches and the collection of bags etc that gets washed up, it's a gem. Only problem is that a walk along this beach is punctuated by the attention of several 'best friends' you never knew you had that want to get you to a cafe/gem shop/ tour but a firm 'no thanks' seems to be respected. There is a handy wine shop to the right of the hotel and several little shops that sell most stuff you could need but don't let any of the men that pounce on you the moment you walk through the gate follow you or continue any sort of converstion as they will be clocking a commission at your expense for taking you to the shop. They get the plan and politely telling them to stop, stay here and don't follow me is respected and didn't cause offence. Would I return to this hotel, too right I will. Would I recommend it, absolutely without hesitation!

This is a lovely hotel in many ways but it isn't quite good enough to get a "very good". It seemed very expensive for what one got but that may be because we booked a suite directly with the hotel. I suspect many of the hotel guests had booked via tour operators and got a considerably better deal than we got. We were shocked by the average age of the guests which must have been 60+. Don't come here expecting a wild or exciting time! The setting is lovely and the beach is good. The waves are wonderful to play in but they are very strong and only for confident swimmers. The food was of a high quality and reasonably priced although breakfast was a little disappointing. Staff were well meaning but often inept. I once asked for bread 5 times before we got any. We could see the bread baskets in the restaurant ready to be given to diners but the waiters just didn't seem able to serve us (there was only one other table dining in the restaurant so the waiters were not rushed off their feet). We also asked for the bill only to be ignored for 15 minutes (despite being the only people in the restaurant by then). When we asked again, we were met with a blank look and a lack of comprehension. In the end, we said we were going to our room and asked if they could send the bill to us there? The bill never arrived although we were charged for the meal so someone managed to sort things out. At breakfast, we wanted to sit outside as the restaurant was very gloomy. There was only one umbrella between about 20 tables so we would sit in the shade which sometimes necessitated moving the table a little or turning it so we weren't in the sun. Quite often, the staff would then move the table back whilst we were serving ourselves at the buffet. We would then move it again. Also, I asked the chef making omelettes if I could have poached eggs and he had no idea what they were. Fortunately, another chef did and went and organised them for me in the kitchen (they were cooked perfectly). Having said all of that, the staff were lovely and wanted to please. The Valentine's dinner was great. It had the perfect level of cheesy entertainment (the dancers were hamming it up brilliantly), the food was very good and the staff couldn't do enough to please. The beds are very uncomfortable so do consider that if bed comfort is important to you. It was like sleeping on wooden boards. We had a good holiday here but it really wasn't worth what we paid.

Heritance Ahungalla is a beautiful hotel, pools excellent especially the one with the infinity design! Staff could not be more helpful, rooms were a bit tired but the laundry/towels changed daily and room cleaned. Hotel is on a beautiful beach which is almost always empty, except for the rather troublesome vendors, you have to be firm and eventually they go away. Not much choice of places to eat out if you don't eat at the hotel, we found one restaurant called Sunshine, really nice, but other than that it is a tuk tuk ride into a nearby town, about half an hour or so, this was a bit annoying as we were not full board. I would recommend this hotel if you wish to be full board, otherwise it would be worth going to another area.

Our 1st visit to Sri Lanka won't be our last thanks to our stay at Heritance. I'm repeating what others have said before me but the staff at all levels were wonderful, friendly, well spoken and nothing was ever too much trouble. Our room, pools and restaurant were immaculate. Sri Lanka is a beautiful country and we did some wonderful trips booked though our rep Mercury Direct. We also hired bikes from the hotel one morning and followed a route (ask at reception for map)that took us past temples,paddy fields and a couple of villages, this was an amazing experience, but be aware when you first step outside the hotel gates you will be bombarded by eager tuk tuk drivers and shop owners all wanting your attention. I can't really complain about the people selling things on the beach as I did buy from them, but I feel they are a little bit intrusive, they're not allowed in the grounds so call to you from the beach. I just can't wait to return to Ahungalla and wish I was there now. Whooops nearly forgot to mention the food was exceptional, the best hotel meals we ever had, its certainly ideal for curry lovers and vegetarians

We are about to leave the hotel after a fantastic week at the beach. A little hiccup at check in where we booked 2 adjoining rooms, as we have two young boys and were told connecting rooms were not available. However we got a great suite with spacious balcony that made up for it. Staff is smiley and corteous, and service is of high standard, though sometimes a bit slow. Overall the beach is excellent, despite the red flag my five year old really enjoyed the waves. The pool is also excellent and really relaxing. The spa is of good quality as well. Sugar one of the staff is particularly talented. A trip to Kandy is well worth it, despite terrible traffic. Temples, local culture centre and elephant orphanage have made an unforgettable experience.A great family experience, sand, see and great service. We hope to be back!

This was a great holiday experience in a great hotel. The hotel itself was superb as was our room. It's in a lovely location with excellent facilities, giving us everything we wanted from our holiday. The two pools are great to lounge around and set in attractive grounds with lots of natural shade to enjoy. It's also easy to access the beautiful beach. The staff were all exceptional. Polite, friendly and helpful, they were always ready to engage in conversation and take an interest in how we were. The food here is of a very high standard. A mix of traditional Sri Lankan and western and always fresh, varied and plentiful. The range of curries were superb. Wine is expensive but good quality Lion lager and delicious EGB (elephant ginger beer) makes up for it. The cocktails are great too! Possibly the one downside was the attention from the beach vendors. The vendors selling saris, tunics and throws were ok and were nice to talk with. But some of those selling trips and promoting their restaurants were very annoying. Persistently following you when walking on the beach. But you soon learn to deal with them. Overall this was an amazing holiday in what is an amazing country.

This hotel is a joyous masterpiece of design and makes full use of the flora by blurring the distinction between outdoors and indoors. All corridors and most public spaces are open to the outside. The gardens are extremely spacious and sun bed and umbrellas can be placed to give a maximum amount of privacy - there is certainly no fighting for sun beds round the pool! To keep you company in the gardens are water monitors and chipmunks. The staff are all unfailingly cheerful and friendly and always willing to engage in conversation. On one occasion the Sous Chef, Roshan stopped for a conversation in the dining room and when we asked about the kitchen he invited us to look round. The hotel is very proud of its culinary accomplishments, winning prizes at international competitions and the quality of the food certainly reflects this. The value of the pound against the SR Rupee makes this a reasonably priced holiday, and even the prices at a hotel of this standard are reasonable (except the wine list). Galle is in easy reach by car. We hired a car with driver and guide for 8000 Rupees and apart from simply going to Galle our guide, Pippi, also stopped at a mask museum, the tsunami memorial and a moonstone mine, none of which we asked for but which enhanced the trip. The journey itself is of interest and highlights the devastation of the 2004 tsunami and the efforts made to repair the damage. An unforgettable holiday and well worth going, the only downside being the length of the flights!

Hotel itself was very nice but our room smelled of mould at times. Also the service staff when they knew we were in our room had a habit of knocking on the door so many times it became obvious that in fact all they were after was a tip. I appreciate there is poverty in the country but this was the on thing which spoiled our stay. The meals in the restaurant were excellent each time. I would highly recommend staying here if you do not mind being 'tapped' for tips.

We have been in this hotel more than 10 times and our next stay is already booked. Our feeling is like to come back to our second home. Managment and staff is very friendly and helpful. If you like to relax it's the perfect place to stay.

The most accommodating staff I've met. One of our favorite hotels in terms of atmosphere & we absolutely love the pool with the tree by the side of it. The food is great & the prices are very reasonable indeed. A must visit for anyone really!

We had a suite upgrade which was great. Seems many of the visitors are Europeans on a beach holiday. Leaving the hotel was an experience - not really recommended.......... Really have no other comments

Heritance Ahungalla is a must see and live destination. I have been on this lovely hotel more than 10 times. Beach, food, service, professionalism are all perfect. I recommend it as a super destination.

I have just returned from a one week stay at this hotel. The day of my arrival was Independence Day and therefore preparation for celebrations were in full swing, funnily I immediately felt part of the hotel. The staff were lovely, helpful, calm and polite even when I was a bit fraught with things not exactly working out as planned from my travel company. Lazy days on the beach were marred by enthusiastic beach vendors, however with the help of a German guest I managed to negotiate a good price for a silk scarf having told myself "I am most certainly not going to buy anything from them!" Sri Lankans are welcoming people and not all are after your money, although I did find the tipping to the hotel staff obligatory which got embarrassing, if not down right annoying one guy round the pool seemed to want tipping to speak to me! Yet another saved my sunbed all morning for only a smile. On my last morning my pick up time was some unearthly early morning hour, but the kitchen staff managed to lay on my own personal buffet breakfast AND I received a breakfast picnic to take with me to the airport. Food was mediocre but good a selection at breakfast, dinner with my half board was a bit "breakfast warmed up" with some dishes, although as a vegetarian my tastes were well catered for plus an offer of my personal selection from the chef. A Fawlty moment one evening when I asked for a black coffee to complete the meal. I was told "Coffee off, no more coffee, sorry coffee is finished" err is this a hotel? this was rectified when a member of the waiting staff later turned up with my coffee. It needs more polish. Little things like a stain on the table cloth, cloudy glasses, no hair conditioner, a chip on the bathroom mug,a stain on the net curtains in my room and the corridor to the room looked more "seaside guest house". They were improving the walls on the stairs of the hotel with stencilling. A warning, I hit my head on a metal plank balanced precariously between the bannisters where the "artist" stood. Health and Safety in the UK would have closed it down. I did mention it and the reception staff thanked me for drawing it to their attention. The plank remained. The hotel was over all quiet and the music went on till only 10.30pm I did like an early night but the music was pleasant enough despite hearing it in my room and as I say it was only to 10.30pm. The hotel did seem to regulate conferences/weddings to noise minimum and respect to their guests. It might pass for a 4 star only Sri Lankan style but it was not 5 star. Too many rude Russians but this is not a hotel issue just a way of life on holiday now.

We stayed hear from the 26th of January for 10 nights I have to say the staff could not do more to please you. check in was smooth and simple, we stayed on an all-inclusive basis and for some reason initially we had to pay for a glass of wine at the pool Barr as my wife likes to drink spritzers however one of the Barr chaps noticed this and spoke to the management who change this policy for my wife. On the second day we were joined by around 150 French people at the hotel and that evening we were stopped by a member of staff who asked if everything was alright because of the added guest which to me was showing care for the other guest. The first thing I think other travellers need to consider is the amount of people who pass through these hotels and the amount of abuse they sustain, however I think I saw a man with a paint brush everyday touching up the paint work and there was always a maintenance man doing something. On one occasion the manger asked if we had any problems and I commented that the light in the wardrobe didnâ€™t work and on returning from a tour the next day it did. One evening when browsing the sweet selection a member of staffed asked if there was anything he could do and I said I fancy chees and biscuits 5 minutes later I had chees and biscuits. The staff just could not do enough for you and I would like to thank Refhan and his staff for all the hard work they put in, ask to see the chocolate factory amazing. There were beach touts but the were OK not to pushy and left you alone if you said no, we used our tour companies excursions which meant we had a mini bus to ourselves with a good guide but to get to the cultural triangle is a bit of a drive but interesting.

Stayed here recently during tour. Great resort type complex on beach, great pool. Pity so far from Galle and all the attractions . Nothing interesting outside the hotel , can feel " trapped". Had most amazing chicken dish in casual restaurant . Friendly attentive staff. Lots of European tourists soaking up sun and resort facilities.

This is a peaceful and beautiful hotel. Before setting off from England the hotel was very helpful in arranging a taxi to pick us up from the hotel. We had a very lovely driver called ***Sampath*** (so please ask for him as he is helpful and became our driver for the duration of the trip. He also took us to get a VERY VERY good interest rate) he also lives at the hotel. TIP- PAY IN USD for the taxi TIP-HOTEL ACCEPTS RUPEES ONLY We stayed for six nights and felt very safe being to young girls. The facilities are great how ever do choose the residence pool is by far the most relaxing. Only two negatives the hotel food can be very repetitive there was a lot of fish varieties and and not much chicken choices. A couple of nights we paid to eat at there a la carte restaurant where the food was 1000%%% better and could really indulge. Be prepared for the long 2.5-3 hour transfer (please don't be put off) it is worth every minute on arrival. You are automatically swept off your feet by the wonderful staff and stunning view through the reception over the infinity pool and face the wonderful ocean. TIP - If you want to avoid the transfer time on the way back you are able to talk to the hotel about staying in Colombo before the flight to break up the journey we used our last two nights free of charge to stay in Colombo H/B and it really did finish off our stay in a relaxing way. TIP FOR THE HOTEL- The rooms would be more pleasant if the bathrooms were ungraded they do not look finished.

The hotel is a bit old and I would not rate it as 5 star hotel. I stayed there for 3 nights last FEB in a 2 interconnected rooms, the view was nice but the rooms were poor and give you the feeling of the 80s starting from the metal key to the furniture, the AC, the toiletsâ€¦etc. I had all the meals in-room dining and it was by all means disaster, not clean at all (hair in the food, dirty plats, wrong orders) I made a complaint and the reaction of the restaurant manager was excellent and honestly he was professional gentlemanâ€¦thank you Mr.KK.

We stayed here for a week on 8-15 jan 2014. The hotel is lovely, the staff are friendly and the food is good. There is plenty of choice and the fine dining restaurant was amazing and so cheap!! We went on a few trips, charlie our guide was so informative, he is insightful he has so much time for you nothing is too much trouble, we enjoyed his company so much that we requested he take us on our second trip on another day.
