He told us all about Sri Lanka he stopped at very photo opportunity. He picked us up at 420am one morning and didn't drop us off until 715pm we had an absolutely fantastic day and the whole time he was smiling away and pointing out all of the major sites etc. truly enjoyable and so nice to have someone who takes their time to explain everything to you. In two days we saw the pinwalla elephant orphanage a tea factory the bentota river cruise, whale watching, an elephant ride, we saw blue whale and dolphins, galle and the cricket ground, the turtle hatchery and much more truly enjoyable and the weather was gorgeous. It is a long way to travel to all of the trips but well worth it as there is so much to see. It is a lush country with so much produce and the people are genuinely so friendly; a truly magnificent place.

We stayed at this hotel at the end of 10 days touring the beautiful island if Sri Lanka. Our first impression was of the lovely setting the hotel was built on. Even though we were a bit daunted by the size of the hotel, once we had found our feet we liked it. The planning of the building has resulted in there being a quiet relaxing atmosphere. Our first room was not to our liking as it was at the junction of several corridors. However we asked to be relocated and found this room to be perfect. The staff in the restaurants were exceptional and on our first evening I enquired about gluten free bread which they provided.The following morning this was available and the manager of the restaurant said he would ask the kitchen chef to add more butter to make it softer. This is beyond my expectations. Each morning this was brought to me. I can honestly say that having dietary requirements can often be a challenge but this hotel certainly steps up to the mark . A big thank you to the catering staff. Hot water was plentiful and the house keeping of a high standard. This hotel gave us the opportunity to relax after a hectic tour . Our only suggestion would be to provide more umbrellas. We found that there were only about eight around the pool that we were sitting around and these were already spoken for very early in the morning.

We had booked this hotel some time ago, as part of a package with the parent company, Aiken Spence. The trip was paid for and confirmed. We arrived at around 1pm on the scheduled day, to be told the hotel was overbooked, and that we were to go to a smaller hotel 2km away. They apologised but offered no compensation. We had to demand to see the new hotel (we were told the room would be a suite, it wasn't). We had no call previously. The front desk people were very keen to move us along rather than ensure we were satisfied with the arrangements. Only after a displeased call to aitken spence were we offered recompense- half board at the hotel and a room upgrade, when we arrived there the next day. This practice of overbooking at hotels in Sri Lanka is not unheard of, but ought to be discouraged. Our advice would be to call the hotel to confirm yourself, and, if it happens, don't leave until you have spoken with the manager. This is a very shoddy way to treat paying guests. Apologies don't cut it, especially when over bookings are either deliberate or easily avoided,

The hotel complex was very spacious with a beautiful garden with trees and palm trees. By the open architecture was often a breeze, which given the hot temperatures very pleasant was. For the whole day looked the staff sweep and garden alright hold, i however not disturbing. The types of people were quite mixed, on german, english and french there was also in the, as well as guests from Sri Lanka, with their families only at the weekend were there. Guests in the 20. was virtually non-existent, the majority of the guests were approximately 40 years and older. In the entire property, there was free wireless internet, and the reception not everywhere was good. My room was in the area of peaceful pools and had direct sea view, it was a nice size, the bathroom with shower also. It was very nice furnished and had a balcony with a table and chairs. In bed i fantastically well slept. There was an easy to use safe (free of charge), as well as a minibar, tv , telephone, in bathroom with shower there was a hair dryer, as well as the usual shower gel, body lotion, bathrobe and slippers. The air conditioning was easy to regulate and hardly audible, there was also additionally a ceiling fan. The staff at reception and in the restaurants and bars was very friendly. With english you could communicate without a problem,. The cleaning of the rooms came 2 times a day and left this blumenbilder on the blanket, as well as always another animal out of towels folded. When a light bulb was broken, it was replaced immediately, although it was already in the evening after 22:00 o'clock was.

All our expectations for a 5 star hotel were fullfilled. Everything was really nice. We loved our 5 day stay, and actually we didn't leave the hotels properties, because it was so beautifull, and we loved the silence and the nice staff after more than 2 weeks roundtrip around Sri Lanka. Thanks to all the staff.

It was a pleasant experience from the time we got off the vehicle to the time we got back in to leave. The welcome we received and the casual check-in process they adopt put you at ease immediately. From there onwards the room, restaurants and the common areas are very well designed and decorated. It was obvious that the staff were well trained as the service received from different staff members from different departments were the same and exceptional. The quality of food and the variety available at all meals made dinning a pleasure. They even handled our request for exceptional family rooming requirement and accommodated us. We will certainly be back soon!

We have just returned from a most wonderful stay at this hotel, and can recommend it in every way. The situation, right on a beautiful beach, and the architecture blends perfectly in to the environment and makes the most of the cooling breezes. It is conveniently placed for visits to near by Galle, and we especially enjoyed cycling through the lanes of local villages. What makes this hotel stand out, though , is the staff. Although we only stayed for a week, they made us feel like members of the family, and we were totally at home there. Every member of staff went out of their way to anticipate and meet our needs, and it is almost impossible to single out particular individuals who made our stay so special. KK, the restaurant manager and his assistant Anushka, ensured we had all we needed for every meal, and even arranged a delicious picnic for us to enjoy on our trip home. The food was absolutely delicious, catering for every taste, and Praveen Fernando found us a shady table outside for breakfast every morning. Mr de Silva, the general manager, was always on hand, and we felt cosseted and cherished throughout our stay. The swimming pools are amazing, and the shady garden a delight to relax in. The rooms are comfortable and spotless , again, with wonderful service. The local people of Sri Lanka , offering such warm and genuine a hospitality, are what makes a visit to this country so very special, this can be experienced in full at the Heritance Hotel. We had the most wonderful holiday , and will be recommending it to family and friends. We can't wait to return. Many thanks to all the members of staff who contributed to our delightful stay.

The service was exceptional in this hotel - hence I am starting off by mentioning this - everyone was so friendly and went out of their way to be welcoming. In fact this is the main reason we would return to this hotel. The rooms were fine - we stayed on the 3rd floor and they gave us a nice basket of fruit,biscuits and peanuts to welcome us. I thought dinner was average but nevertheless enjoyable; breakfast was lovely. It is more of a family hotel/ older couple hotel and I think the entertainment is geared to that audience. For the price this hotel is amazing. Another thing worth mentioning is this hotel seems to do a lot for its local community which I think is fantastic - there was an ad for a charity it supports in the lift. I also did wonder if the hotel endorsed the beach sellers - some people probably find the beach sellers a bit annoying but actually if you just tell them you are not interested they leave you alone. These people are just making a living and if I can help them by buying from them I am happy to do so.

After much debate of where to celebrate our 1st anniversary...my husband and I finally decided on Heritance Ahungalla and spent 3 nights there last December. In retrospect we both agree that we made the best decision! From the time we arrived we were treated to very personalized service that we were quite frankly not expecting from a hotel this size. In lieu of our anniversary we were upgraded to a luxury room - which was very spacious and had a fantastic bathroom - fully equipped with TWO wash basins, a bath tub and a fabulous rain shower!! This was a super start to our anniversary celebrations! On the actual day when we came down for dinner we were thrilled to find a specially decorated table for us and we were treated to a cake for dessert as well. This gesture from the Heritance team made us feel very special and truly added to make our day even better! We were on half board so we had both the beakfast buffet and the dinner buffet on all 3 nights - food was delicious but what is truly worth mentioning is the fantastic service. I really must commend Mr. Kumara Karunaratne ( KK) for his excellent service (we both truly feel he is a role-model to more junior staff members) - he goes down to minute details and goes the extra mile to make guests feel like they are the most important people there. The F & B team too must be commended for their great personalized service despite the high occupancy at the hotel. We were further treated to a beautifully decorated bed every time we got back to our room in the night. So I must not forget to thank the housekeeping team for their thoughtful gesture!! All in all..we had an unforgettable weekend away - where we basked in the luxury of the amenities the hotel had to offer us (the residence pool and the spa were great!)....and most of all were treated to 5 star service which I feel is what this hotel's true USP is!!

Situated on the beach most rooms have a great view of the beach. The pools are beautiful, the Restaurants and bars are lovely and our room was magnificent. Comfy beds and pillows a wet room in the bathroom plus small lounge area and work desk. Not enough lounges around the pool as most guests (Europeans)claim them in the morning and keep them when they go off to breakfast and lunch, not very considerate of other people. There are not any shops etc near the hotel and the hotel shop has very limited stock. Hawkers will try and sell you sarongs etc from the beach we looked at a table cloth and they wanted 8,000 rupier we ended up getting it for 3,000 so be strong and walk away and if their sales are down they will come looking for you - they cannot walk on the hotel grass so they will stand on the beach and call to you. If you walk the beach the hawkers will be at you - boat trip, restaurant, jewelry shop, sarongs, massage etc be careful a guy named Freddie would not leave us alone.

We spent 7 nights at the Heritance in Ahungalla, and enjoyed the beach and the pools of the hotel. The hotel is very nice and the hotel facilities were great: 2 large pools and lots of sunchairs and umbrellas for relaxation in the shadow. Our 2 kids spent most of their week in the pool, but the beach and ocean is amazing. There were a red flag on the beach throughout our stay, which meant you should not go into the water, but unfortunately this is only for 'insurance' reasons for the hotel. The waves were big in the afternoon, but the wind and surge were not very dangerous. Small children should probably stay out though. Ahungalla village did not provide any restaurant nor sight of interest, which was a small disappointement. But since the food and buffet at the hotel was outstanding, we did not suffer. We went on day trips to Kosgoda for Sea Turtle Hatchery, which was interesting. I suspect we were tricked by the tuktuk driver to go to a place which was built up only for tourists. Run down and dodgy, but kids loved it because we could hold sea turtle babies in our hands. I would chekc up on these hatcheries, there are apparantly 2-3 to choose from. We also took a boat trip at the Madu river. Basic but still very nice. Recommended, and our local boat driver Dinesh was outstanding. We also used the Spa at the hotel for a Balinese massage, highly recommended.

Highly recommend this hotel. The food was excellent. The staff was very friendly. Big pool. It's not too far from Colombo. If taking the highway, take the ambalangoda exit though. The aluthgama exit road is still being done up.

This hotel in the past was one of the best in Sri Lanka,but now it is a well worn ,out of date of the modern class of hotel. Since the name change from the Triton years ago, it's been on a downward spiral.We used to visit every year until the Tsunami occurred,we were there then as well. We revisited it two years later when it re-opened Lots of the old staff that knew what they were doing have gone,replaced by new , not sure of what they're doing. It is now full board, all inclusive has disappeared along with the regular visitors to the hotel.This is now made up by having day visits of Sri Lankan people. This I accept as you need custom. But when I've paid good money to stay in a 5* hotel, and I have to put up with locals using the swimming pool, fully dressed in all the sweaty clothes that they have travelled in, then walking round dripping wet,playing water polo in the pool bawling their heads off, not giving a hoot for the residents,and with kids running wild, then that is the time to take a good look at the hotel and wonder if it is a good place to stay after all. The hotel itself is in need of a good maintenance team,not just the paint brush brigade,covering over cracks. On the beach, you are now pestered from morning to night by the beach sellers, who previously weren't allowed to come close to holidaymakers,but now the exclusion zone is minimal.

We had little sour taste in the mouth on arrival as our room was not ready by 6.00pm. But they made it up thereafter and we had fantastic time The staff were very friendly and helpful. The chefs were fantastic and prepared vegetarian menu which was out of this world.We dined at fine dining which was amazing and all three chefs came to meet us. They also gave guided tour of the kitchen and the award wining cake room.

its very nice hotel near to sea from swimming pool straight u can go to sea .rooms are very good with balcony ,nice view to sea,swimming pool is very beautiful .we enjoyed a lot.its little scary ,bcz tsunami happened in this area.

Last stop on our Sri Lankan tour and after being greeted like VIP's at every other hotel, this hotel seemed a little disorganised. However, after our initial hiccup, I can not rave enough about how amazing the service was. We are a very active family and the animator was enthusiastic and would always provide us with new activities to try (despite low uptake from other guests). As vegetarians, I have never come across chefs who take great pride in the food that they serve. After our evening meal in the cafe, the chef came out to see what we thought of the recipe as it was one of his own inventions... and a special mention has to go to the chef and sous-chef in the fine-dining kitchen. I can not believe we were the only ones eating here. They went out of their way to develop a special 5 course vegetarian menu and it was such good value. It that restaurant was in London, it would have been awarded a michelin star without a doubt! The swimming pool is kept very clean and on the doorstep to the beach. Beds very comfortable and shower very good. Great place to end our trip.

Arrived 2am 28/12/13 reception like an aircraft hanger very open . Shown room not up to standard, buffet breakfast room like a canteen. Definitely not 5 star, complaint made to manager and rep. Rep waste of space . Manager brought in kk restaurant manager . He was very attentive and always seemed to be on duty. We ate of the al carte menu at no extra cost in the mustard cafe waiters provided excellent service worth special mention. Room changed after 3nights. Do not book de luxe rooms these are the basic rooms. You could not beat the staff they were all very helpful and pleasant. Hotel needs a big makeover to make it a 5 star. Fine dining food excellent. Sri Lanka very nice.

This has to be one of the best resorts in Ahungalla, if not Sri Lanka.The rooms are too class with good privacy. The staff are very friendly and very helpful. The beach is good one, but not the best.The restaurant is very good and you can't go wrong with most items. The only down side is the touts on the beach. Highly recommendable to travelers looking for classy crowd(unlike Goa).

We only stayed here for one night - it was a beautiful hotel - our room was lovely and great bathroom. The hotel is very open and spacious - we did have a long walk to our room, however we did not mind - we saw monkeys in the trees as we walked to the main hotel area. We had the buffet dinner which was very good - breakfast was the usual Si Lankan fare

We stayed in this hotel for four nights just before Christmas 2013. The location is stunning, right by the ocean with a fabulous sandy beach. You do get bothered by touts if you venture on to the beach - they are mild by the standards of, say, Egypt, and the hotel are trying to do something about it - but it must be difficult given it is public land. The influence of Geoffrey Bawa is very evident, the bedrooms are spacious and the public areas are very cool and airy. Excellent inventive food, and the staff cannot do enough to ensure you have what you want and need. The main buffet restaurant suffers from being in a rather large room with an oppressively low ceiling covered in a jute batik, and the cooking stations appear rather industrial. However, ask for them to set up a table for you on the lawn and whether it breakfast with the resident egrets in attendance, or dinner under the stars it is a peaceful and magical spot. Strangely they never seem to expect anyone to sit outside even though at every meal many people wanted to, so there was a lot of impromptu furniture moving going on all the time! Our experience of the fine dining restaurant was entirely ruined by the nightly show - the only real "package holiday" attribute of this hotel. This particular evening the dancing required all the lights (and I mean all) to be extinguished so that UV light alone would illuminate the dancers. That meant we were plunged into darkness just as our beautifully presented meals were served. We ended up having to illuminate each other's meal with an iPhone torch so we could see anything at all. The show only lasted 30 minutes - why not advise us and ask if we'd like to wait (or find somewhere else to put on the show, or where we could dine with lights? I've waited to review this hotel until I finished the holiday - it claims to be five star - well perhaps against the competition in Sri Lanka where they don't have the benchmark of a Mandarin Oriental, a Raffles or an Oberoi to compare with. It's a good hotel, and probably amongst the best on the island - but don't compare it with the best in India or SE Asia.

We just stayed one night at Heritance. what a wonderful place it is..!! A special thanks to Asha who made the reservation for us, we were lucky enough to get an upgrade to a luxury room.. The kids really enjoyed the pool, beach and the food. Excellent service by all the staff members. I wish we could stay more but will definitely come back. Everything was so beautiful and immaculate...The food was great... Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable..

Some of Sri Lanka's seaside resorts have dropped their ubiquitous themes when ushering in a New Year. Such events in the past had been mostly to select the prettiest among those at dinner dances and picking the best dancing couple. This time, however, the Heritance in Ahungalla had a uniquely different theme altogether. The coastal resort which was fully booked was turned into an "International Airport." The dinner-dance tickets were turned into "Passports." Guests had to queue in to have them sealed by "Immigration Officers." Interesting enough the hotel staff were all attired in different uniforms. The General Manager Refhan and his Resident Manager Sampath were in the attire of two pilots. Front office staff wore the uniforms of flight attendants. So did the waiters. Once the passengers were "cleared" by "immigration," they were subjected to security checks. The guests walked through a metal detector and had to produce their "passports" to be allowed in. The dark backdrop of the coast formed the backdrop for a mock up aircraft. The buffet was right below. Then the fun began and went on till the wee hours of January 1. A remarkable feature was the wide array of international and local food. It has been prepared by Food Olympic award winner Dimuthu Kumarasinghe. A few of the guests I spoke with were thrilled at the new theme, a departure from the mundane annual activity. The following pictures are self explanatory:

I wish I could stay forever. Remote quite location with nothing else than sound of the ocean. It is worth the 4 hours bus journey from Colombo. All the staff so friendly and profesional, comfortable rooms with rain shower bathroom, safe, minibar, tea maker and the priceless view over endless beach and blue ocean. Huge pool with cocktail service, nice gym, freshly grilled fish in the evening ... just perfection. The whole hotel has very airy open plan and feel spacious and private. Also no other people on the beach so it feels like you have the whole place for yourself. Breakfast was good also...the cucumber juice is the best ever. Turtle sanctuary, georges river delta and busy beaches are near by so you can have all you need few minutes drive away. There are as well some shops outside the gate of the hotel if you need groceries,or pharmacy. It is the perfect hideway and I cant wait to go back.

Heritance Ahungalla I have just returned from a delightful holiday by the sea at Heritance Ahungalla. Beautifully appointed, and architecturally designed by the renowned Sri Lankan architect Jeffrey Bawa, the Heritance Hotel is simply wonderful. Driving up to the Hotel through the front gates, one passes frangipani and coconut palms and is greeted at the entrance with a feeling of tranquility. The Lobby is vast and open with an infinity pool and the sea is visible too with the sunlight glinting on the waves. Heaven! I found the staff at Heritance courteous and helpful, and as I was visiting with my disabled mother, it was a relief to find them so kind and obliging. Nothing was too much trouble. The Hotel has won numerous international awards for its food. The chefs really turn out a wonderful spread day after day, and meal after meal, at the main restaurant. I was on â€˜Half boardâ€™. I had my breakfast and supper at the main restaurant and lunch at the Pool Side Bar. I so enjoyed sitting at the pool side bar at lunchtime looking at the sea eating scrumptious fish and chips and prawns with my ice cold beer. One of the nice features of the hotel is that it has two very large swimming pools. Again beautifully appointed among the trees. So they never get too crowded or noisy. Heritance does have tennis courts, spaâ€™s, karaoke bar, organizes boat trips up the river et al. I however was happy to relax by the pool, and have dips in the sea all day long. The beach is pristine white and a walk along it at dawn is a super start to the day. I have visited many beach resorts in Sri Lanka over the years, Heritance is definitely my favourite and I recommend you take a look yourself, when you next need a seaside holiday in the tropics. Elizabeth Gunewardene

Very good beach hotel, good vegetarian food and fruits. Only concern was in the resident green pool service was very slow due to only one staff covering the whole pool area with snack food being brought from the main pool bar, very courteous staff and friendly staff. Should have more staff in that area .

After leaving the hotel we realized that we had left a iPad at the hotel, but didnt know where we had misplaced it. It could have been left in the room, pooside or anywhere in the hotel. We called the hotel and they were very professional in locating it and returning it to us promptly. Thank you very much! We have been to Hesitance Ahungalla many times in the past. As always staff and service is here is just exceptional!! Far better than at Cinnamon Bey, Beruwala, which was our next destination which was a nightmare. At Heritance, everyone from the front desk to the pool staff to the restaurant staff to the gentleman who reads palms is friendly, attentive and courteous. The lovely hotel in the beautiful location could do with just a little bit renovation to make things perfect. We will definitely be back!

Having stayed at this hotel around 8 or 9 times over the last 20 years, we returned with high expectations. I am pleased to be able to say that the actual experience exceeded our expectations. We were given a large room on the top floor, well away from the restaurants and other potential sources of noise. The room was furnished beautifully and the bed was very comfortable. Everything was squeaky-clean and kept that way by our room boy, who also replenished our fruit bowl regularly. The hotel has a superb location at the end of a long beach and we were pleased to find that you can still stroll along its full extent without meeting more than a handful of people. There are two pools and plenty of sunbeds in the extensive garden area, where you can watch the many birds and chipmunks as well as the occasional monitor lizard passing through. We enjoyed the food, particularly the excellent dinner arranged for us by the head chef. The weather during our stay was pretty mixed, but we managed a few dinners at the seafood station by the side of the pool. I would recommend both the food and the relaxed atmosphere there.There is also a small covered 'open-air' restaurant area, where we had some good curries. Breakfast is a sumptuous affair with a wide range of choices, including hoppers and curries as well as the more traditional European-style offerings. There is also a splendid selection of fruit and juices. Whilst the hotel and its facilities are very good indeed, it was the friendliness and efficiency of the staff which really made our stay memorable. We were constantly surprised by the way in which people anticipated our wishes/preferences and provided what we were looking for - and much more - without ever having to ask for it. Truly exceptional service and hospitality! There were many familiar faces amongst the staff and we were also pleased to find that Eranda, our favourite tuk-tuk driver, was still offering his services by the gate. We have used him on many occasions and have found him very accommodating and utterly reliable. Resort areas such as Bentota and Hikkaduwa are within easy reach by tuk-tuk. We even went as far as Unawatuna this time - and enjoyed a 'roti lunch' with Eranda in Galle on the way. (Without him we would have struggled to order anything.) As the title above suggests, we have no complaints whatsoever. We only regretted not being able to stay longer. However, we will certainly try to come back.

Both of these are symbols of Sri Lanka and it was good to see it displayed so well in this hotel. Food was excellent and the beds were comfortable after a long drive. The rainwater shower was tops! Of course the enormous infinity pool which seems to bring the sea into the hotel, was splendid as usual. All round good marks for this hotel.

Since we had already experienced the exceptional hospitality at Heritance Kandalama and The Sands at Kalutara (Aitken Spence properties), we booked our Christmas vacation at Heritance Ahungalla a couple of months back to avoid disappointment. When we arrived at the property we were pleasantly surprised to find out that we had been upgraded to the Luxury Suite with the garden balcony. The Suite (room 324) was HUGE compared to a regular room, in fact if I am not mistaken, the bathroom of the suite probably had the same square footage as a regular room, with a 2 person bathtub, a shower stall, double sinks and a huge walk in closet. The suite was richly appointed with real furniture including a small library. My 13yr old was thrilled to find an age appropriate book by Rick Riordan that she had not previously read. The bedroom had a comfortable king sized Four Poster bed and a recliner. Mini fridge, TV, surround sound system and tea/coffee service rounded off the comforts. Food was excellent as this hotel's chefs had emerged as the Most Outstanding Culinary Team in Sri Lanka after competing against both international and domestic star-class city and resort hotels at the 15th Culinary Art Competition. Sous chef Roshan Pujitha was kind enough to show us some of the culinary masterpieces and their chocolate factory. Most nights were theme nights, and on the night where they served Chinese food, we were prepared to order A la Carte for our daughter who has nut allergies, but the server quickly brought her a plate of Lasagna from another restaurant at no extra charge. the wait staff was attentive and responded to our requests in a timely manner. The rooms were clean and well stocked with fresh towels, bath robes and bottled water. The room steward came every evening to make sure we had fresh towels and to turn down the beds. Fresh fruit was also delivered to the room. The only issue we had was, we wanted the vacation over Christmas, but we were told that the hotel was booked solid. This was not the case as there were plenty of vacant rooms available. This was a bit of a disappointment since we really wanted to be away during Christmas. It was a pleasant surprise to meet Ms Niranjala the hostess, who was also at Heritance Kandalama during our visit to that property in August, and she recognized us and came over to chat. It was an enjoyable experience and a great vacation.

Staying at heritance ahungalla was indeed a superb experience.The main buffet was extremely delecious and the staff were very helpful when anything extra was needed. The rooms were very clean and the room service very efficient. Hospitality was at its best and it was nice to see all the staff well mannered. It felt like being at home

My 13 year old daughter and I spent 4 glorious days in the hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms are spacious and comfortable and they have a daily program of activities which include water aerobics, beach volleyball, stretching and pool games. The activities suit all ages and are loads of fun. We have been travelling the world for 8 months and the staff at this hotel are the best we have come across. Not only are they good at their jobs but they take great pride in their hotel. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. I would recommend that any families with children stock up on snacks before arriving at the hotel.

This hotel was the first destination of our honeymoon. The cool and calm environment that one encounters as you drive through the gates up to the reception is certainly inviting and to say that reflects the hotel's outlook would be an understatement. The check in was breezy with a warm welcoming service by the front office staff - now that's what I call hospitality. Although the room we got was located in the far corner, the room condition and facilities were simply breathtaking. The snacks provided were somewhat overwhelming but they tasted so well, that one would be stupid to resist. The Jacuzzi was a mind-blowing experience. As for the hotel service, I simply don't know how they do it, but they will be there at your doorstep literally seconds after you keep the phone. The restaurant and its management have won many accolades which they proudly display at the entrance. It was not before long that we realised why they receive them. The food is simply amazing with an endless spread. To walk around and have a look alone can fill you up. The flavours blend so well and they know how to exert the correct balance of tastes especially in local cuisines. The action stations were constantly full of action with a variety from prawns, sausages, bacon and waffles steaming continuously. Despite serious time restrictions and a house full of guests, the staff will go the extra mile just to see that smile on your face. The weekend extravaganza is something that one should not miss. On Fridays and Saturdays, the hotel features a cultural extravaganza with traditional and contemporary performances including the occasional fire limbo. Simply worth the time. The locality of the area features picteresque river boat rides to which the hotel also has some arrangements at additional cost. We could not make this journey, but previous experiences suggest that this cannot fail. The only option for improvement that I could think for the hotel is that it shows no signage for anyone plying from the South towards it. Whilst motorists from Colombo along the Galle Road (A2) would not miss the hotel sign, we travelled along the expressway (E1) to come up from south. Nearly missed the turn but managed not to overshoot it too much thanks to some roadside assistance. All in all, this was the first destination upon entering matrimony, and the warm service and comfortable outing at Heritance Ahungalla will be etched in our memories forever. A surefire revisiting option for us.

We stayed here for one night towards the end of our trip to Sri Lanka and had a fantastic time. The hotel is right on the beach and the pools are lovely. We are at the Mustard Cafe and enjoyed a delicious Lobster Dinner. The staff have to be one of the hotel's best features, everyone was polite, professional and very helpful our waiter in particular (whose name I can't now remember) was wonderful. We highly reccomend!

A place you will be treated as a family. You will find a staff who sill look after you very well. They will provide you a good service. And the Pool area is really cool with the Sea very relaxing. Housekeeping guys are like machines. You can enjoy a Dinner with Fire light in the beach area.

This hotel has the friendliest staff of all the hotels of this category that I have been in SL,UK,USA and India. They work as a very good team to entertain us and to help us in all the possible ways.Rooms were in good quality and house keeping guys were very efficient.There were two good swimming pools.outdoor badminton court was not very good because of the wind.It would be very nice if they had an indoor badminton court.All of the other facilities were very good.

If you are looking to chill out this is the place to stay, although make sure driver takes you on new road to get there from airport, two & half hours! Staff very friendly & attentive, plenty of food choices, lovely pool but wild seas not brilliant for swimming in. We really enjoyed the relaxation, not many English people! Spa worth visiting, grounds & public areas well maintained, lovely views from rooms.

Our stay was very enjoyable and relaxing. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Our luxury suite was excellent and we have no complaints with the quality of this accommodation once inside. Overall the quality of service and facilities were very good. However, two areas that need to be improved are: i) The drab and poor condition of the dÃ©cor of the walkways leading to the bedrooms and the condition of many of the bedroom doors need to be improved to meet the standard expected of a top quality hotel. ii) Although service was excellent overall we noticed that used plates and empty bottles from room service were left outside rooms for two days before being removed.

Hi went here for just over 2 weeks for our honeymoon and have to say it was the best holiday we could have possibly asked for!! on arrival we instantly felt welcome at this hotel! We only had bed and breakfast so had to buy our evening meals. We are vegetarian and explained to the staff that there inst much vegetarian food on here that we like! 10 minutes later the head chef came out to speak to us about what sort of food we would like, 1 hour later we had out own personal menu with 10 vegetarian dishes to chose from. we got to use that menu for the whole stay and when I say the food was amazing!! wow it was amazing! out of 16 days, we stayed within the resort for 14 of the days, didnt feel the need to leave. the water ball games at 11am were really fun! feeding and going on the horse ride was great. Spa was really good! the days we did leave, we went to goal which is a near by town one day and we had a really good time. the other day we went to a few different places but I would really recommend the piniwala elephant sanctuary!the best part is went you walk with them to the lake where they have free play time, a truly amazing experience.

It is our first trip to Sri-Lanka, but not the first trip to other country from Ukraine, that is why we have something to compare. We are in hotel Heritance Ahungalla, Deluxe Room on the first floor. During our 10 days we had nice time without rain. Tomorrow our last day in this country, we already saw everything and now we can objectively evaluate this hotel. The nature is wonderful here, beautiful ocean, many animals, so sweet fruits. The biggest plus in this hotel - people. Staff extra good, helpful and kind. I want to write about Thushara Gnanarathe - R&B Manager in Heritance. He is responsible for resto and bar. Food very good and so tasty! Service is perfect. But hotel is old, rooms need new life, tables in the rooms not new, bathroom is not modern. We saw many hotels and this one is not 5 stars, as for us. I think CEO of this hotel must update his hotel, rooms need nowadays breathing. And in conjunction with your ideal staff your hotel will be real 5 stars too. Thank you!

It is our second time at the hotel, you come to place twice only if it worth it. This hotel absolutly desrve the title of best hotel in Sri Lanka! I want to mention the great rooms, the beautiful view, freindly staff, and exellent,professional, and very special and delicious kitchen! I recommend this hotel to everyone!

During our 4 weeks we had really a very nice time a part from some rain in the evening.Beachfront hotel large and well kept property, Room confortable with everything you need, rooms a little too dark in the evening.Towels and bedsheet in perfect conditions, rooms very clean.Staff kind and helpful also in the 2 pools, the pool attendents were always ready to give you new towels and to help you to change place when necessary.The food in the main restaurant , usually self service, is various and abundant, of course You must like oriental food, not accordingly to european tast, but very spicy, ( not strong or pure fire,) just spicy as a matter of fact the majority of the guest are arabs, indians, and other asian countries.For us italian was OK. Good entertainment afternoon and evening, fire works, shows , music etc.Something special was the man playing flute in the morning at the main pool.What was not good at all, was the great quantity of russian, ukrain and soviet people, noisy,arrogant,impolite, mainly dressed with shorts, shirts withouth sleeves and sandals, and all this at the main restaurant. Also a great deal of small children were roaming shouting and screaming in the main restaurant sometimes . In a 5 star hotel this is not acceptable!!!! In any case this hotel is good and advisable. bruno e marisella torino italia

What can I say, this place is simply amazing, the staff are the most friendliest lovely people on the face of the earth, nothing is too much trouble, if something isnt to your taste the cooks will specially make something for you, I could not have felt more welcome or more like part of the big family that is Heritance Ahungalla. The rooms are relaxing, clean and tidy and are cleaned by lovely people leaving flowers or towel animals on the bed. The bathroom is lovely with a big rain shower head- fantastic hot water!!!!! The grounds and pool are kept up to a very high standard and you can always be assured of fluffy fresh towels when visiting the pool. The breakfast and dinners are buffet but they have two restaurants to choose from so variety isn't a problem - they also have dinners on the beach - very romantic and I would recommend it!!! Also free Wifi in rooms and everywhere on grounds. I stayed for 3 nights and only wished it could have been longer..... Only downside is beach touts trying to sell sarongs or trips - they can't come onto ground security chases them away but once you're on the beach you're fair game- be firm but polite and they leave you alone. But Heritance Ahungalla you are amazing I will be back to stay again!!

Stayed at the Heritance Hotel for 3 nights in October and was rather disappointed with the quality of the rooms and the rest of the building. It seems to me that many of the bigger hotels in Sri Lanka that trade as 5 star are in much need of refurbishment. Heritance - spend some money on the joint. 3 star at the best. Matthew Melbourne Australia

I stayed at the Heritance ahungalla for 7 nights and could not have asked for a more perfect stay. The hotel and grounds are stunning and the staff are the nicest, friendliest, most helpful people I have met. Especially Niroshan who cleaned our room and left us amazing towel animals. Food was outstanding every day and the restaurant staff were attentive and always went out of their way to make you feel special. Rooms were simply decorated and tasteful which makes them relaxing. I cannot wait until I can come back to this country, this hotel and the hospitality you find here

stayed here last week for six nights last week everything is superb lovely rooms fantastic staff made us very welcome and nothing was to much trouble, pools, beach etc all gorgeous, food was superb we mostly ate at the mustard cafe which was our favourite but all were good ,did some trips also river safari is worth going on and went to galle on the train from the local station all in all a very good well run hotel a credit to the staff and sri lanka

Well clean hotel with greet full housekeeping staff. Also nice lobby area with straight pool and sea view. Housekeeping EPA always keep in touch with us. Great service. I love to be at bar area in the evening time. Superb bar in down south. I love this hotel.

This hotel was booked following recommendations. The booking process was not straightforward but we were very pleased with the service we received, once we arrived. Check in was smooth and friendly and the service as a whole was very good. Beautiful surroundings to include a large pool with the beach just beyond. Total relaxation! Food was good and the choice was great too. Will have no hesitation booking this hotel again and recommending to friends.

We had come from Colombo via Dambulla and Kandy to stay at the highly recommended Heritance Ahungalla in Galle. No disappointment here. Wonderful impression when you arrive and the sea lies just beyond the pool through the lobby. Much has been said about the genius of architect, Geoffrey Barwa. The building is beautifully designed and a pleasure to be in and to look at. The rooms are stylish, comfortable and well maintained. Staff are extremely friendly, happy, attentive and keep smiling even when dealing with large groups of demanding, ill mannered tour groups. Food is good. Beach is clean and well patrolled. (important because of the very strong rip) Huge pool. Lots of activities. In all, a great place for a relaxing holiday and a base to explore the surrounding cultural sites. OH.....don't forget....the Heritance has the BEST TOILET PAPER IN THE WORLD!!

We arrived at the Heritance Ahungalla following a week's tour of the cultural triangle so were ready for the relaxing part of our holiday. We were given a very warm welcome and pleasant check in experience by being offered a refreshing drink and relaxing as the check in was conducted. Then we were shown to our room which was very modern and beautifully appointed - no bath but excellent shower as well as the other high quality fittings. The room was large with a spacious balcony offering views of the main pool and sea. Each day the room was attended to at least twice by the cleaning team who added delightful touches such as flowers on the bed and beautiful designs created by folding towels into swans etc. The food was very good with a wide choice of mouth-watering dishes every day and the staff were so friendly and warm - sincere smiles greeted us everywhere. They seemed to be proud of their hotel and took great pride in their work at all levels. This included the pool attendants who would do all they could to ensure all guests were quickly provided with towels etc. The only downside was not being able to walk onto the beach without being accosted by a swarm of touts - not the hotel's responsibility as the beach is a public area, but I thought it might be an idea for the hotel to engage with the touts and perhaps educate them to the buying behaviours of European tourists - we are far less likely to purchase items or services if we feel in anyway 'hounded' into it. Perhaps the touts could be encouraged to have a bazaar style set up on the beach where I am sure tourists would actively visit and buy. Just a thought, but otherwise, a great stay, great staff and an overall wonderful experience.

We went to heritance for a weekend get away. We booked in to a standard room, and they were nice enough to upgrade us to a luxury suite. In terms of dining, we felt that the starters were great, but the main course was not that great. The service was exceptional, though the dinning area was full and very busy, there was always a waiter around to serve us. Its a great comfortable hotel, with exceptional service.

Very disappointed with our stay. Rooms definitely need upgrades. Stayed in a triple room where the third bed was just a small folding bed. Blinds in the bathroom were broken and could see through them from the room and the outside. Flies in the room. Communicated all this to front desk but nothing done about it. The second pool was "apparently" under maintenance every time us locals wanted to use it but all the foreigners were constantly swimming!!!!! Again spoke to front desk and we were told the pool was not closed???? Very sad is all I have to say. If this is what we call 5 star then I have no words. Will not be staying here again.

The Heritance Ahungalla has an amazing beach right in front of the building. Make sure you get sea view and enjoy a fantastic sight. The beach is sandy and and very big so you feel sort of lost in paradise. The sea is rough but perfect to go for a bodysurf and the local lifeguard always keeps an eye on people. Apart from the scenery do not forget to eat for dinner in the local restaurant, the young cook is absolutely outstanding and a very nice person to have a chat with.

Ahungalla Heritance Hotel is reassuring when you arrive through its private clean drive after passing the entrance arch gate. It keeps being reassuring when you discover the open reception onto the swimming that leads your gaze straight into the Indian Ocean just few meters away. It is a large hotel of 152 rooms and was originally the Triton Hotel redesigned by the famous architect Geoffrey Bawa who had a vision of wrapping the indoor with the outdoor as he did for this reception hall; this architectural effect hypnotizes your senses until â€¦ you are checking in; for our check in we were lead to a bar behind the reception which was very dark, most of its lights were switch off (environmental ??), this gave us the strange feeling that the hotel was trying to save electricity. Not really our expectation of a â€œ5*â€ hotel standard. To tell you the truth I started to be suspicious at this moment as this appear to me as a symptom of a poor management. This significant detail was like the top of an iceberg that would lead us to the discovery of the rest of it. Was Heritance Ahungalla a 5* iceberg? The room was ok. We enjoyed the little terrace where we were having our coffee. Yet the room has aged and would need a lift. It is no equipped with a safe deposit so if you bought gems stones along your trip (very probable as anyone can understand) .. better check with the reception if they can keep them safe for you. The hotel and room for instance maintenance seems secondary for this â€œ5*â€ hotel as we noticed in our room a splash of dirt on the terrace door window. We believe that rooms are cleaned by the house keeping employees but no housekeeping supervisors check them or not properly. There are two swimming pools, the main one at the reception that dives into the ocean (visually) and the other one which I preferred for its quietness and its tropical tree that grows over it like mangrove. The Mustard coffee shop where we ate once (we had a 3 days stay) was nothing special, we ordered a seafood salad and when served, it looked like no salad at all, no veggies or leaves were composing the dish, it looked like a cold seafood stew in a dark dressing. We had to ask for additional fresh leaves and vegetable â€¦ a sald. The Mustard coffee shop floor is cover of pavement like those used in European old streets, we were not disturbed by the crowd only a table of 2 and 4 were having late lunch. We checked the â€œUpper Restaurantâ€ or the â€œprime Restaurantâ€ menu, open 7pm to 10pm and were not impressed by the menu presentation neither by the incomprehensive culinary composition of its dishes, a so call sophisticated fusion Cuisine (Sorry chef but â€¦). The restaurant was empty â€¦ lack of soul, poor lighting, no spark. We did not go. We felt the price not too friendly as well. Instead we were curious to check this little Coconut Hut restaurant â€œSunshine viewâ€ down the beach (not part of the hotel). We were attracted by the freshness of its seafood that Berthy the owner presented to us earlier in the afternoon. We appreciated Berthy â€œnot pushyâ€ manner. We really enjoyed our grilled king prawns garlic sauce at Rp3000 per portion actually the portion is a set as these very large prawns, almost baby lobster size, came with a generous fresh mix salad and fried rice plus a fresh fruit salad served in chilled dish (very Pro) thank you to Berthy. We had few beers, Rp 150 only, a very satisfying diner and tasty one we had there, we recommend. Back to Heritance, we were not blown by the auto glorifying video that is played in random on one of the hotel TV channel, it sounded too good to be true and in fact it was. The Heritance corporate management needs to open its eyes, international real 5* hotel are on their way to Sri Lanka and soon these competitors may be at the beginning of Heritance Hotels losing stars. The food & beverage department should also be concerned and hurry up in revising its restaurants concepts and put its heart and mind into it.

Having traveled and stayed for extended periods of time in the US, UK, Dubai and a few Asian countries and enjoyed what some of their hotels have to offer I have to say I have found my Home away from Home at Heritance Ahungalla! having stayed there 7 times I think I can say that I know what I am talking about. The staff at the entrance have always been very welcoming, and it is nice to see a few familiar faces when we walk in. The last few visits have been with our lil baby and they made sure that we are checked in within no time. Within a few minutes of us calling, a cot was delivered and set up. We are very concerned with the rooms being clean and free of any dust, The rooms were spotless and the toilets were very clear. The food at the fine dinning restaurant was excellent. It was quite obvious that a lot of attention to detail had been given. The level of service was even better. It was very kind of the waiter to push the stroller around with our baby to calm him down when he was getting a bit restless, Even the chef who came to the table to inquire about the food was entertaining baby with his hat. We did not ask either one of the to do this nor did we expect them to, This for us was going above and beyond the call of duty. At the buffet we are always greeted at the entrance with big smile, the food, the variety and the service have all been of the highest order. During the week end during peak season there have been times where the service has been a bit slow due to the packed buffet hall. Generally the staff would inquire about the food and the service. A few observations, Wheel chair access to the buffet hall (Didnt see/notice it from the mail entrance) also the use of long carpets to connect the buffet hall with the mail hotel during heavy rain. Reading some of the bad reviews I was really shocked because All most of of the staff that we have encountered have been pleasant and helpful. I must take a moment to give credit to a few members of staff who we feel deserve recognition for their service as well as the lengths they go, to ensure the guest are well looked after, Gamini who is always checking up on guests make sure all our needs and requirements are taken care of, Thushara will visit every table at the buffet and see to all the guests culinary requirements are met and last but not least Sampath who seems to make it his mission to make every guest's stay at Ahungalla a memorable and special one, My wife as well as I can vouch for this having spent a wedding Anniversary & Birthday at Ahungalla and plan to go there for many more.

A big call I know, but this hotel has ticked so many boxes and more that I didn't even think existed. It's located in an amazing setting. The luxury is over the top but not ostentatious. The service is exactly right...genuine and taking care of all your needs. And then the room!: we stayed in the Tendulkar suite and man o man o man...it was AMAZING. We were really living the high life! :-) It has a massive bathroom with a central bath/Jacuzzi (it comfortably fitted myself, my wife and 2 kids). And a corner balcony that overlooks the tennis courts, the ocean and the pool(s). The bed was super comfortable and BIG. The swimming pools wrap the hotel - they are cater for small kids, adults and teens by being deep, shallow and bordering on the bars. And if pools aren't your thing, the beach is literally at the pools edge.

One of the best resort properties in this part of the globe...you might just start liking it so much...you might not miss home...:(. The food is excellent...very genuine hotel staff...cant wait to go back again.

Stayed here with my wife after a week in a hotel in the north of Sri Lanka. The food in the buffet was extremely poor. The al carte was very expensive which would of been ok if the food was good but it was terrible. We had bolognese one day and the spaghetti had been cut up in to tinny pieces or they had served us the crumbs at the bottom of the packet. Second time we ate there the lasagna was also terrible. It had been reheated so much that that the pasta literally could not be cut let alone eaten. When we complained it took nearly half hr and a six man conference In the kitchen to come to the conclusion that it was not edible. We then decided to try the fine dinning restaurant only to find out it was the same chef from the al carte restaurant ! We ate in local restaurants from then on which were really nice and a fraction of the price. Finally upon checking out we were charged for basically the entire mini bar ! After disputing this are bill was quite quickly adjusted to what we had actually taken from the mini bar. In conclusion the hotel is drab over priced and you are extorted at ever opportunity ! My advise would be to keep well away

We agree with our fellow reviewer a few days ago (who had enjoyed his second visit here); we spent five days here in October 2013 - our ninth visit - and continue to be delighted with this place. Some members of staff are now just like old friends; we are also very happy to see newer staff members settling in and being actively encouraged to excel. Our thanks to everyone for a wonderful stay....AGAIN!!!

Having just returned, the 4 of us would like to thank at the staff for a excellent and memorable first stay in Sri Lanka - we will be back. The staff were so friendly (as was everyone we met), so helpful and so attentive to our needs - too many to mention by name. The pool attendants are superb, being very proactive and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were very good, the room boy did an excellent job, and the amenities more than matched our needs for a relaxing time. The food was superb, especially the desserts with the only downside being a tendency to over eat to try to sample everything as well as the local Lion beer/lager being "more than acceptable". The pool settings are memorable and we especially enjoyed the residents pool albeit the view from the main pool is fantastic. The local wildlife was varied and will keep your interest. Location wise, there is much to see around this area of the island if you want to venture around and it does not cost a lot to do so. The "hawkers" on the beach are fine - have experienced much worse. They are polite and accept a "not interested" answer if you are polite in doing so. The time of the year is important for overseas visitors to see the hotel at its best I expect in that we did experience rain every day, given it was the end of the monsoons and moving into high season. The rain ranged from a light shower to amazing electrical storms but the staff always did a great job of mopping up and it did not detract from our holiday but I can see that it might at different times of the year if constant. As a suggestion - why not put most of the hotel TV (Channel 1) onto your web site as it tells a great story and would be a VG selling aide to help future travellers select your hotel in particular, in that once visited, you sell yourselves as to a return trip in the future. Thanks for a great time.

I have been to Sri Lanka on many occasions over the last 10 years, often combining work and leisure. My experience of Heritance hotels has been consistently good and Ahungalla was no exception. As with the other Bawa properties I have visited in Sri Lanka (Kandalama and Gallery Cafe for example), Ahungalla is beautifully crafted out of local materials, respects local traditions and also meets the needs of a tropical climate. Ahungalla is also located to provide a stunning view out to the Indian Ocean and several pools from which to enjoy the experience. Perhaps more importantly, the location and architecture are complemented with a warm and extremely professional team of hotel staff. Indeed, in my 30 plus visits to Sri Lanka, only Kandalama has exceeded this hotel in terms of service quality. I co-organised an academic conference at Ahungalla in September 2013, and many of the 142 local and international delegates were equally complimentary of the overall experience, but particularly the architecture and service quality. Unlike many other hotels that host similar events, Ahungalla also benefits from having conference halls somewhat separate from the main hotel. This benefits delegates and hotel guests alike, with the conference proceedings not distracting from the ambience of the hotel. The only slight downside is access. As with much of Sri Lanka, roads are not that good and congestion is common. The Expressway has helped somewhat, but it runs some way from the coast, where most hotels are located. Access from the airport is also difficult, but when the Outer Circular opens, which will bypass Colombo, this will certainly alleviate most of the access difficulties. Despite this and overall, an excellent experience and while I don't visit down South that often, when I do, I shall definitely look to stay at Ahungalla in the future.

The hotel was quite good. The staff were very friendly and the hotel was clean and well organized. I especially liked the swimming pool area facing the beach. Although, there were a couple of things that could be improved. For one thing, the rooms I stayed in had a few maintenance issues (the ac was not working properly for one of the rooms and the shower drain was clogged). Rooms where not that great. The food in the hotel was good but not nothing special compared to other hotels I've visited in Sri Lanka. Another thing that was lacking were the sports and recreation facilities. All in all, it was a nice stay but I definitely would not the best in Sri Lanka

Nothing matches the exurburent architecture of Jeffrey Bawa than a great location, excellent service and great food. All of this can be found in the Heritance Ahungalla. Having stayed at both this Heritance and the Heritance in Kandalama which is also another Bawa architectural masterpiece..I can count myself as being a truly lucky man.. The hotel, the ambience and the ways the staff and the team go out of their way to make you feel welcomed, this is truly a 5 star experience. Lovde every minute of my weekend stay. Since I work in Colombo, I will be coming back to these Heritance hotels! Great weekend!

As the title says, this was my second trip to Sri Lanka. I was determined not to repeat any destination. The only exception I made was for Heritance Ahungalla, because I had had the most amazing time there on my previous visit. And I couldnt imagine going to Sri Lanka without staying at Ahungalla atleast for a short while. I was not disappointed. In fact, I was so surprised because they have made an already excellent property even better. We drove straight 7 hours from Kandalama, so we werent feeling too good when we arrived. But the moment we arrived, we were surrounded by smiling , caring faces who whisked us away, sat us down, gave us cool towels, refreshing drinks within seconds without once hassling us unnecessarily about things. Check in was smooth. We were given an upgrade to a luxury suite (we had booked a regular one). Not only us , but the family travelling with us was also given an upgrade to match us. The moment they heard it was our second visit, nothing was too much to ask. The rooms were great. The property looked absolutely fabulous. The manager called us up to find out if we were comfortable and whether we were happy with the room. WE had a lovely meal at the coffee shop , and we were soo well served by Dharshana. Infact, Dharshana really made our stay for the next two days special by looking after our every need. Nothing was too much to do for him. Next morning, we were given an upgrade to their best suite on the top floor. My son was especially excited because it is named after Sachin TEndulkar and has many of his memorabilia on display. He actually stayed there. The two pools , the beach , the food are all to die for. They have now installed a lift which was missing earlier.Every request is fulfilled with a smile. There are activities planned by the hour eg pool aerobics, water polo...very enjoyable and relaxing day spent. Lots of things to do and very peaceful as well, if you prefer. The beach is as pretty as ever.. But what really makes it special are the people, the service, and the smiling faces. Thanks everyone, and especially Dharshana. We hope to be back soon. Food was excellent as always. However, I think some additions are required to the vegetarian menu, especially for Indian guests. I also sorely missed the seafood restaurant which existed earlier. But may I say that I seem to remember that the buffets last time were even more lavish, especially the fruits. But I was told that this isnt really the season for fruits so perhaps April is a better time to visit for that.

Good rooms with all amenities in a beautiful beach resort. Excellent and immediate service. As an added plus, the hotel offers a fine dining experience that truly is..fine dining. Designer food presented in an attractive venue. To spark our interest, we were presented with the days fresh catch for review by the chef. Unlike anything else we've found in Sri Lanka after three weeks of travel. Also enjoyed a tour of their remarkable kitchen by Executive Chef, Kasum Premachandra and further look at their extraordinary chocolate making by trainee cook B.H. Lakshan. Good food and lots of fun.

I was in Sri Lanka for the second time. Prior to this trip would never have believed that Sri Lanka has such a luxurious hotel with a very kind and responsive staff. The ocean is not deep at the hotel, my 9 year old daughter a lot of swimming in the ocean. The beach boys are friendly, trying to help. If you have forgotten something - be sure to bring in, do not steal. Very good food, I recommend HB

We had a wonderful and relaxing stay. The suite was large and beautifully furnished,and had a Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. Very close to the beach and the suite opened out to a private patio right by the pool. The food was delicious and varied. The staff was very friendly, courteous and helpful. My wife and I had a great stay and will definitely come back the next time we visit Sri Lanka.

Had the pleasure of spending 14 nights at this hotel. Firstly I would like to thank the friendly staff for all their hard work, they made our stay perfect. An extra thank you to Thilina in housekeeping for the fantastic service and all his hard work, you really do go that extra mile to make the rooms special by adding that extra touche, I loved the elephant (room 254) Also thank you to the pool attendance (green pool) for their hard work, the sun loungers and towels where ready for us every morning and thank you to kithsiri for inflating our lilos. All the bar and restaurant staff gave a fantastic service too, Rohana always ensured all our needs were met with a smile. Narmika and the young lady stood at the door in the breakfast room most mornings always gave us a warming welcome. All the members of staff were friendly and couldn't do enough to make our staff perfect. I would recommend the fine dinning restaurant, the food was amazing. The coffee shop served great food too, ideal for an afternoon snack or even a evening meal and all reasonably priced. The rooms were comfortable and clean, good supply of clean towels every day, a balcony with a lovely view, excellent air conditioning and ceiling fan and complimentary tea, coffee and sugar everyday. You need to take extra care when walking through the corridors as they can become slippery due to the humidity level and when returning to the room late at night it's always good idea to have the light on your phone handy because the lights are turned off, maybe sensors on the lights are a way forward in the future. I would recommend this hotel, the staff are hard working, very friendly and go out their way to make your stay a memorable one, the hotel grounds are immaculate, great food and entertainment. Everything you need for a relaxing holiday. Can't wait to see you all again next year. Sri Lanka at its best

The overall experience was very good. The location, the sea, the rooms, the staff and the entire property was excellent. The food was very good. Was woken up by the sound of waves in the morning. Wonderful experience. One of the best hotels that I stayed in Sri Lanka. Truly a memorable stay.

Out-of-this-world food, we found ourselves pigging out. Heavenly pools and hot tub. Very luxurious rooms. Friendly and considerate staff. Lovely beach and waves. Convenient location. Beautiful layout. Had a memorable stay. Wish it could have been longer.

This hotel was simply amazing. From the time we arrived the checkin was very smooth. Then we were taken to our room which was small but very nice and well furnished. The room was clean with new furniture and a ocean view balcony. The architecture and view in this hotel were amazing. From swimming pool to its proximity to the beach everything made it a unique experience. The food is also good with big variety. However we faced only one drawback during breakfast where the dinning hall was smelly so we had to sit outside to avoid it. I strongly recommend this hotel to other travelers.

We arrived to red carpet treatment and band, albeit for the wrong bus as another group bus pulled in behind us. The welcome was meant for them. We were a bus load of 2 families returning from a family wedding. We were greeted, given welcoming drinks and escorted to our rooms. With 3 small children in our group, we have been catered for with high chair readily available (a safety harness would be an advantage here) and children's meals have appeared promptly. Swimming pool is very child friendly with plenty of space for everyone. Thilina, our room attendant, surprised the children by making towel elephants and went out of his way to make sure we were happy with the room. Beautiful setting, friendly and helpful staff and great food.

My wife and I were married at Heritance Ahungalla in September 2013. We had the most fantastic time and we can't thank the hotel enough for the care and attentionthey gave us. If only I could rate the service below as a 6 then I would! I'll start the review with the hotel itself. What an amazing entrance! You make your way down the winding drive and are then presented with this beautiful vista across the ornamental pond, through the reception colonade and across the pool and onto the sea. Truely breathtaking. The staff welcomed us at the car with cool towels and drinks and we were made to feel like kings! The staff were so happy and smiley and exuded a real warmth which really resonated with us. The hotel itself is an architectural gem with so many lovely little areas, all with their own character, and it handsomely rewards exploration. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable and every night we found our bed covered in fresh petals and our towels made into an array of animals! Every meal was fantastic and the selection of food changes daily with so many delicious Sri Lankan dishes to choose from. The wedding was something which we didn't know exactly what to expect. We booked it having never even been to the country before and were a little trepidacious at what to expect. We neededn't have been. The hotel were absolutely amazing and took care of everything for us. We booked the Managalam package with them but they were happy to change details here and there and even threw in a few items as a surprise on the day which we were delighted with. A big thank you to Neranjala for all her help getting our special day arranged. The ceremony was in a beautiful setting on the beach, which we arrived at in style as part of a procession of drummers and dancers through the hotel. The ceremony was a lot of fun and full of lots of little details which delighted our guests. The highlight was the elephant ride at the end - well it beats going away in a car with tin cans on the back! The evening reception and meal could not have been more special. We'd like to thank K.K for all his help in arranging the food, drinks and entertainment. The weather forecast was changeable so they set us up a table outside in the gardens as well as one indoors and sectioned off a whole area of the restaurant for our meal. The food was amazing and they even snuck in an ice sculpture which delighted us. We had a fantastic cultural show and fireworks as well as part of the evening's entertainment which we would highly recommend too. Overall we had the most wonderful time there, as did our guests. Their attention to detail and level of service was unlike anything we've experienced before and both of us agree that we'd like to go back. This is the only place we've ever stayed where we would go back to stay again, just for the hotel. Thank you Heritance Ahungalla, you really gave us a wedding to remember.

A place that will force you to think that you are a king. THe service is excellent and beyond 5 stars. Compared to all other hotels, the staff is really friendly & the service is outstanding. Superb.Great staff and service! Loved the beach and hotel ambiance. One of the places you should visit when you are alive. A wonderful place.

We spent 2 days in the hotel and it was a lovely experience. Buffets are very good. however, it could have been better. however, we had to wait for more than 2 hours to check in as the room was not ready. finally we checked in around 4pm. That is the only negative comment i'll have to mention. however, we don't mind visiting again in near future simply because of the food, pool and the long island iced tea/mojito served at the pool bar.

Great staff and service! Loved the beach and hotel ambiance! They throw an excellent breakfast buffet with heavenly pan cakes, waffles, omelets and so much more! Sri lankan dishes int he lunch buffet are to die for. Overall its a perfect vacation :)

My friends and I went to visit a factory and came to ahungalla for Lunch their food was amazing and the service was excellent. They have a very friendly staff their warm and welcoming nature made us want to stay more. The animators were really fun too. We had an amazing time!

We stayed just one night due to our busy schedule. But the experience was fantastic and all the food was fabulous !!!!!!! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Definitely will visit next time !!!!!

This was a one of a kind experience. Me and my family were part of our organisations annual trip. The Ambient and the interior was more relaxing. The Lobby with the sea view over the swimming pools surface, creates magnificent scene. The staff s hospitality and the service is remarkable. The events organised by the hotel in the evenings attracted most of the travelers. These events are in a wide variety from traditional Sri Lankan dancing to modern creative dancing. There was soft piano music or a flute play during the tea time. The commute to the hotel is easy ans its just along the Colombo Galle main road. The tours can be easily arranged to Hikkaduwa Coral Reefs, The famous boat rides at Madu River or to the nearby turtle hatchery. The hotel has a wide variety of food, which is very tasty. This is one of those hotels in Sri Lanka I can name "worth on what you pay for".

Post our long journey from Nuvara Eliya we arrived at Heritance, with a great welcome and briefing we were left at our wonderful room.. Thanks to the upgrade :-). Fantastic view and facilities perfectly matching our requirements of having a relaxed break. Food was excellent with a good spread and helpful staff with our two year kiddo around. Could have been better with wifi as we had to go to the lobby for better signals. We would definitely select this hotel next time....

We spent only one night there but it was a very relaxing stay. The residents pool is definitly the way to spend day and is spacious enough to have a bit of personal space for families. Enjoyed the food, it was not a large spread but the selection was excellent. Would suggest that action stations keep their food warm even after its cooked otherwise it tends to lose the flavour(prawns).

We stayed here for two weeks in September/October and loved every minute. The staff were brilliant - attentive, helpful and friendly, including the 'behind the scenes' staff such as the Chefs. We are vegetarian and having spoken to the Foods and Beverage Manager he arranged it so we could have dishes tailored to us. We were also given a guided tour of the kitchens and shown the various prizes the culinary team have won. They have a resident 'Olympic' Chef who has won many gold medals at the Olympics of the food world. There are two beautiful pools and as we were off-peak they were very quiet. The only downside is if you like swimming in the sea, this isn't the time to go as it is red flagged and you can't go in there. The surrounding area doesn't have to much to offer but there is a pharmacy and fruit stall that are easily accessible. We didn't mind as it was a good base to travel from. Galle isn't far and the Madhuri River (for the little islands you can visit via a boat trip). We did do Yala National Park from here but it is literally a full days worth. The locals unfortunately were hit hard by the tsunami and have resorted to pestering you outside the hotel grounds. The beach always has some hawkers floating around which we found uncomfortable but the hotel can't do anything about this. Back to the hotel, the rooms are generous size and cleaned several times a day (we had a deluxe standard) and has a good temp controlled a/c system and the view is brilliant. There several shows during the week which are quite rustic and the music band and violinist aren't bad. If you enjoy sports, there are two decent tennis courts and an ok badminton court (all outside). They have a billiards table which kept us entertained for quite a few evenings! Overall, we loved it and the food and drink was superb. The staff are very friendly and approachable and nothing is too much. We definitely intend to go back.

We spent 7 days there, the location is amazing, our rooms was on 3rd floor which was perfect. The staff was very friendly, helpful and hardworking (especially through the storm that happened while we were there). Restaurants downstairs are good. I would recommend this hotel for families more than couples. The prices were high compared to the rest of sri lanka, and for a 5 star hotel I would say they can do much better on rooms cleanliness and fighting insects inside them. Overall though, we had a nice experience and I do recommend this hotel for a short relaxing stay.

We stayed four nights at the of a two week tour of Sri Lanka and loved every minute of it. We had a deluxe room on the 3rd floor that was slightly bigger than other rooms in the same category. The hotel was only half full (October is the low season) so it was fairly quiet and the room rate was very attractive. The staff were fantastic - attentive and helpful, as well as being friendly. We had dinner two nights in the fine dining restaurant - superb food, reasonably priced although like everywhere in Sri Lanka, opening a bottle of wine doubles the bill. There's not much else around the hotel which may be a disadvantage if your staying beyond a full week but I didn't find neighbouring towns particularly appealing and rather enjoyed the reclusiveness.

The hotel has an excellent view on the ocean along with the 2 pool facilities with nice beach, the rooms are spacious with good size of bathrooms and other facilities such as the free internet services. The main issue with the Heritance is the Restaurants, the hotel needs to have a compete refurbishment of the main restaurant with better ventilation systems since it has unpleasant smell and this shocked us when we entered the restaurant. Also they need to have more options of restaurants there is only 2 main dining areas. Overall rating good.

We stayed one night hotel and there is only special thing is cultural mask dance show. we enjoyed the show as well as others. you will not enjoy as other heritance hotels. hotel is definitely will need improvement lot. will see next visit
