One of the best I can rank when it comes to food. Friendly atmosphere. Friendly staff. Cozy rooms. One thing that I like is the cinneman fragrence in the rooms. Not so happy about the location as there was nothing much to do. Otherwise all was good.

We stayed here as part of a tour of Sri Lanka, finishing with a 5 night stay by the beach. Positives: the staff are friendly and try very hard. Food was plentiful and usually of good quality. The pools are very pleasant and well set out. The size of the room was good, and the aircon worked well without being too noisy. Drinks were reaonably priced - large beer Â£1.20, cocktail typically Â£3.75. Negatives: the building is over thirty years old and doesn't really look as though it has had a proper makeover at any time. It looks a bit tired. Although the staff try hard, they are bit chaotic and prone to mistakes when it is busy. On arrival, the wrong bags were sent to our room, and despite me making this clear, the porter seemed determined to leave them with me - a minor gripe, but typifies things. Drinks and food orders were wrong on occasions. I think that the food was pricey for Sri Lanka at Â£20 each for food from the buffet. Food at the buffet was not always piping hot, depending on what time we went. There is almost nothing to do outside the hotel. The "entertainment" in the evening is dire.

that is really the best hotel in my whole packege for my honeymoon in Sri Lanka .. Thanks a lot for your good services and kind dealing with us .. I wloud like to visit your hotel again and again ... Thanks a lot Rakan

From most of the reviews here and because of the generally good reputation of Heritance hotels we had high expectations for our stay here. This was the last part of our Sri Lankan trip before returning to Colombo and the plan was to relax and enjoy a luxury hotel along a beautiful beach. The beach was beautiful but the hotel was disappointing. Pros: -Beautiful beach-clean, not crowded. -Decently appointed room with large balcony. -Wifi that worked well. -Lovely reception area and infinity pool. Cons: -Room floor was sandy, bathroom mats with dirt smudges. -Bad housekeeping service. After being out all morning our room still wasn't cleaned - I called and asked to have it done right away while we were at lunch. They finally arrived while we were napping three hours later. -Broken minibar never repaired or replaced, after we requested -Breakfast buffet restaurant -Very strong moldy/mildewy smell permeates. Buffet adequate but not great. Chaotic atmosphere and spotty-to-bad service. -Hall noise (many children in hotel during our stay) -Noise from pool area - music at night, exercise activity in pool mid-morning Altogether there were too many things wrong with this stay. Disappointing for what is touted as a five star hotel. We would not return or recommend.

The Heritance Ahungalla so amazing can't wait to go back. The staff were fantastic and they really provided a great service .The hotel is in a great location and our room had a beautiful view of the sea. Food was also lovely and they had plenty of choice. I would highly recommend this hotel it was above expectation, can't wait to go back!

This was our First personal Trip to Heritance Ahungalle and starting from the Reception to the Restaurant everyone was so pleasant and help full and everyone enjoyed including the kids who stayed at Heritance Ahungalle. We enjoyed all meals and every meal my family members commented on the food so much including the restaurant staff, who was so willingly to assist the kids and even my old father was well attended. We intend visiting again and thank you so much for giving us a memorable holiday

Fantastic hotel overall, great location, super friendly and helpful staff, excellent quality and choice of food. Nice having a choice of pools and very picturesque setting with sea views from poolside. Hotel rooms were vert spacious and nice decor. Overall an incredible stay, 6 days wasn't long enough!

As a frequent traveler, it's important for me to comment when a vacation has really exceeded my expectations. Having visited Sri Lanka for the 1st time for a week & staying at Heritance Ahungalla made me realise what great teamwork looks like. Working in a Service industry myself , I tend to be extremely aware of what I expect as well as what great service looks like. The staff were very friendly , professional & accommodating - always smiling & willing to please. They all worked together to make the holiday fun & enjoyable for the guests. We thoroughly enjoyed the dining which was full of variety as well as the evening entertainment where there were live bands or dance shows. Hotel , although very big , was clean & tidy. I have already spoken to my friends & family about visiting in 2014 - Will definitely include Heritance Ahungalla as I loved the Hotel as well as Sri Lanka - People are just amazing! Thank you guys for making it special for us & yes , keep room 306 ready for me in 2014!

Traveled: Oct 2013 With: Family (spouse + kid 9 yrs) Stayed: 2 nights Pros: Excellent place for a family to stay and visit the south coast of SL. Coastal destinations are a short drive away (~ 50 km). Staff were most courteous and very professional. We were lucky to avail an online offer (Stay 2 Pay 1 for Foreigners). Travelers are highly recommended to check the hotel webpage as well before finalizing an internet booking. The staff who handled our check-in (Vilma) was patient enough to shows us a choice of 2 rooms (our request) before we selected the one we liked best. We surely appreciate the gesture. The pool was superb. The views were great. Room (incl the bathroom) was clean and neat. Breakfast was very complete and tasteful. Daniel's Pub (near the entrance of the hotel - not connected with the hotel) seems to be a moderate place for guys/men (read "not family w/ kids") to stop for a quick drink/meal. There are one or two grocery stores within walking distance to buy bare necessities. There are no decent restaurants in the vicinity. Nearest towns are Balpitiya or Ambalangoda (10 to 20 km). Again, if you are visiting Heritance, then plan to spend most of your time in the hotel including meals. Travelers are advised to go with triple occupancy or extra beds for the child/kids since the double bed will not be adequate even for small children. Extra fee is charged, but nominal and complimentary breakfast is included (B&B basis). Concerns: 1. The beach strip beyond the pool is, at times, frequented by local touts who are quite insistent on interrupting the guests' time by accosting them for the river safari (other tours like coral reef and whale watching were not possible due to the rough seas), asking the guests for phone numbers, trying to corner them for an appointment (or sort of promise). They would hang around to check if the guests were returning later to try again. Although this may partly be beyond the hotel's control, some effort can be exercised by the management to preserve the guests' privacy and leisure. I admit that I did not report this "at that time" to the management since the Hotel Security was very much on the beach and a mute spectator. 2. Beyond the pool and carrom, there are no activities for kids. The library does not have kids books/magazines. A play area and a moderate level of kid-centric activities would help young couples with children in a very big way.

Heritance Ahungalla is a resort that is very well maintained, there is no noise from the road, and is set right on the beach. Many rooms have great ocean views. The pool is large with plenty of lounges and umbrellas (attendants supply towels, drinks, etc as desired). 3 or 4 cafe / restaurants exist on site but the quality and variety for the food provided with the accommodation / meal deals was quite good. Balinese Spa was very good quality with reasonable rates. We stayed for 4 nights in a room on level 3. The room was large, well appointed with a good size balcony. Bathroom was large with a rain shower but no bath. TV had plenty of channels, 6/7 in English. Room had both aircon and a fan. No iron in room but was supplied by housekeeping when requested. We stayed for 4 nights ( but wished for more). The stand out though was the staff. All very friendly, professional and more than willing to help one learn the basics of Sinhalese. The stand out though was Anushka. Wherever she was working (Check-in, the restaurant, pool bar) she did a great job with a smile. Will book here next time!

This was my second time stay @ Heritance Ahungalla in sri lanka. As a sri Lankan I'm amazed with the true sri lankan hospitality with Heritance Hotel. The experience I had with the stay and the service level I received from the hotel staff was amazing. keep the same spirit and I'm gonna visit the place soon. Thanks n Best Regards /// Nilan Palihawadana Proprietor Daffodil Travels & Tours

Simply loved our stay in this hotel! Great friendly staff great food! I love the pool and we were welcomed in a very exceptional manner! The room was very comfortable and the privacy given was excellent! The sea view was astonishing and the sea was nice and clean! Superb spot for honeymooners!

It was two nights staying at Heritance Ahungalla with my family. Actually It was our annual office trip. big crowd visited to Hotel, But they accommodate well. Atmosphere was really cool and carm. Beach was really good, we played both days evening on beach. Fireworks at night was amazing. it was unique to Heritance Ahungalla. They welcome kids well. we had a birthday party for 3 years boy and they organize everything well and has a magic session for all kids and all enjoyed. Foods were really good and no any bad comments on it. Staff were very friendly. Only thing one lady at the restaurant door asking the room number from all people in. it was unpleasant. We visited to Madugaga River safari Trip on same Holiday. Hotel arranged everything for us.

I visited this hotel in The first week of Oct this year (2013). I must say that this was one of the BEST hotels I have visited in the recent years. I was with my family ( wife and three kids ). The service was fantastic. The staff were so friendly and obliging. They make you feel like you are their only priority. Lots to do in the hotel and the surrounding areas. A must visit place if you are planning a trip down south. Great value for money and five stars all around....

We only spent two night here but this is a place where you could go for your whole holiday. In a large tourist area with plenty to see and do around the local area. Beach is stunning. pools are very inviting, room was large and well furnished. buffet meals are extensive with plenty of choice too. this may be a little bithigher priced than all the other Hotels we stayed in, but the quality is significantly higher too.

From first arriving at the hotel we were greeted with friendly faces and the staff could not have been more helpful. The food was first class and although some of the bedroom furniture probably needed replacing the beds were very comfortable and clean as was the whole of the hotel. Our room overlooked the sea and was very pleasant.Although the hotel is in a small village getting around was no problem with either the hotel taxis or the local tuk-tuks which are outside the hotel gate.We used the same tuk-tuk the whole time and we were taken to some lovely places we would never have found on our own. We would certainly have no reason not to recommend it. The evening entertainment on some of the nights was quite spectacular with the mask dancers and also a show in the pool.

We have travelled to many countries and stayed in many Five Star properties for holidays / business trips. There is nothing that can match the breath-taking beauty of Heritance Ahungalla, the scenic beauty and the perfection of the interiors. And no other team can match the finest hospitality & care that we experienced from the team at The Heritance Ahungalla. From the front desk team to the Managers, every single person on the team went the extra mile to make us feel comfortable. Being hard core vegetarians, we had preference which they matched beyond expectation and we have carried back some very special memories of our holiday in Srilanka, thanks to The Heritance Ahungalla. Truly a memorable trip with my father who is 83years old

I consider Heritance Ahungalle the best hotel in the Aitken Spence Group and have tried to stay here at least once a year for the last 10 years or so. Indika is great at allocatng rooms, and never fails to give us an extremely comfortable room depending on our requirement. The restaurant staff are very attentive, and always gave us a good table in the dining room during our most recent vacation which was from the 4th to the 6th of October 2013. I must make special mention of Thushara and Nelka, who were very attentive at the dining room. The few issues we had were promptly rectified by the staff, so we had a wonderful vacation at Heritance Ahungalle, as always. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and attentive to every need. As for the food, they had everything one could ever wish for. I would recommend this hotel to any one looking out for a really great holiday by the beach.

We stayed for two weeks at the end of September after the hotel was highly recommended to us by a friend. From the moment we arrived we were treated to a true five star experience. Our room was a deluxe room overlooking the Green Pool with a view of the sea and we couldn't have asked for better. The bathroom had double sinks and the bed was better than our one at home. The buffet food was always fresh and inspiring and the chefs would always cook some plain chicken for my fussy 6 year old daughter. The restaurant staff, even when really busy, were always smiling and attentive. We were especially impressed by KK (Kumara) who went out of his way to make our family holiday incredible. He is a credit to the hotel as well as his colleague Thusara, who also looked after us. The bar staff were great, as were the canapÃ©s served with our delicious arrack. The pools were lovely to swim in, especially the Green Pool. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel, even though it's large it has the personal feel of a smaller hotel. It's also worth mentioning that we booked the hotel with Imthiyaz at Sun City Travels in Colombo and he got us a very good rate for our stay. We would like to thank all the staff for their fantastic efforts in making our holiday so amazing. My daughter says she would give the hotel 10 stars if she was allowed. We look forward to returning in 2014. Hector, Maria and Kandy Baker.

If you want a large hotel with conference facilities this would be a good choice. However if you want a 5 star luxury hotel look elsewhere. The hotel is noisy the rooms decidedly past their use by date. The location is a problem with limited local facilities. Taking a walk was a hassle both on the beach and in the village. The main buffet restaurant is extremely tired. The one saving grace are the staff who are really excellent.

We only stayed one night in 2 rooms occupying 4 adults and 2 children, but enjoyed our stay fully. Few problems such as insufficient lighting (just one bright light would do to be able to read comfortably) would have been better while some precaution against mosquitoes (although air conditioned) would have been helpful. The toilet was leaking and needs repair or attention in Room 132. It would have been better to indicate clearly as to how to use the radio, control the A/C fan speed or the temperature and other technical items which was lacking. I had some problem in booking the hotel initially since the telephones were not answered promptly and had to ring 3 times and took about 20 minutes to get a positive response. May be because, it is connected to the Head Office and then transferred and therefore with no one to take responsibility. Also, after the booking, when I tried to contact the hotel directly, the immediate response was that "we are fully booked" even without knowing what the prospective customer needed to know. Hence, definitely they need some coaching in answering the phones and be able to give some friendly and supportive responses. You may ask why am I explaining all these. That was due to a friendly relationship I had with one of your Managing Directors who brought me to this hotel about 20 years ago. He has passed away now. May God Bless him! Also, during the check out, I was given an invoice without any consideration to the deposit (50%) I made, although it was corrected immediately after pointing it out. These things should never happen if the systems are perfect and the staff are properly trained. This is me stating as a ISO consultant who is conversant with customer care and satisfying their needs while improving efficiency and closing loop holes. However, the staff were excellent and were helpful and anticipated the customer requirements in a positive manner and the busy bodied staff in the restaurant was a site to see. The environs by the side of the blue sea was beautiful with the view of the pool in the foreground that blended graciously with the palm trees around. Ahungalla Heritance is a place that I would recommend without any hesitation, barring a few but vital improvements that are needed.

Excellent stay ,Excellent food & service by all thank you to the GM & the RM of the hotel & all associates who helped up keep up the good work & the food was fantastic two nice pools my kids loved it & also the room was very good / welcome was unique nice welcome drinks (with a sri Lankan touch )

My stay was for three nights on a corporate conference. The location and facilities were great. Amazing variety of good food. The staff were well trained and must commend their attentiveness. They were willling to go out of their way to assist guests. The room lights felt somewhat dim, not enought tto dampen the overall great experience though!

Stayed for 2 weeks for rest and relaxation and got just that! What an amazing place, had a lovely ocean front room, staff couldn't be more helpful and the pool was lovely. Cannot praise the staff enough, we didn't even have to ask what drinks we wanted after a few days as they just looked at us and remembered. The pool boys were great, would get your beds and umbrella ready for you in the morning without even asking, and the residence pool was great, so warm. The food was lovely, lots of variety in both the buffet restaurant and the mustard coffee shop. Highly recommended A+++++++

As soon as you walk in to this hotel, it's clear it's been uniquely designed with nature in mind. The whole hotel has a strange feeling of being 'outside' and blending in to its surroundings. Wherever you are in the building you can still hear the crashing waves on the beach outside. The room and furnishings were lovely as was the bathroom and shower. Everything spotlessly clean. The breakfast was ok as was the buffet dinner. But we did find there was a slightly strange 'musty' smell in the dining room. We actually thought the dinner at the 'Mustard Restaurant' was better - the rice and curry was wonderful. The outstanding feature of this hotel was without a doubt the pool and the way it blends almost imperceptibly in to the beach behind. Just beautiful. I think more should be done about the touts on the beach who try and sell boat trips and other things in the area. I understand they have to make a living, but they gather near the pool and beach area all day and swarm upon you as soon as you make a move on to the sand. It's just a bit irritating. Other than that, beautiful hotel and beautiful surroundings.

The hotel is well laid out on a gorgeous stretch of beach and has a couple of great pools in the grounds. I think the best of the hotel is outside as the rooms and corridors while laid out well are in need of upgrading. The sea was very rough but it was stormy when we were in Sri Lanka (end Oct/early Nov). It is a large hotel and the restaurant needs to cater to that so I appreciate that they have volume and varied tastes to deal with but while I enjoyed the stay I was glad not to be staying longer than a few days as the buffet style was repetitive and not the highest standard. The staff were very helpful and welcoming, there are some lovely outdoor bar areas to relax in the evening. On choosing the hotel to start our stay in SL this didnt stand out as being particularly cheap so we chose it on location and the pictures/reviews but I didnt think it stood out and wouldnt go back if I returned to SL.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, the rooms are lovely with nice balconies overlooking the ocean. There are 2 pools which are both very big and relaxing. Very nice, open plan restaurants and bar areas.The views of the surrounding gardens and ocean is lovely. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The food in the restaurants was great and very well priced. There was a mix up with the Spa and we had our appointments cancelled 30 minutes before they were booked so we were disappointed by that. However, everything else about the hotel is great. It took us 4 hours driving from Colombo airport but the location is good. Close to turtle hatchery and mangroves boat ride which were well worth the visit. Highly recommended.

We stayed 4 nights at this hotel, and I want to commend the staff for their excellent service and they made the stay a very pleasant experience.Keep up the good work! It would be good if half-board included the a la carte restaurants because a guest staying for several nights can get a bit bored of the buffet after a few nights.

I have been to Heritance Ahungalla many many times. It is a second home to my family and my first choice for a family holiday, for an office trip or for a corporate training event. The difference at Heritance Ahungalla is the consistency in service and the courtesy and assistance extended by all, from the GM to a steward or housekeeping staff. Very innovative in everything they do, excellent rooms and delightful cuisine. I will never forget the 'ice-cream sandwich' served after an outdoor training session I had Heritance. The welcome and the departure is equally warm, which is not common - Gihan Talgodapitiya

We stayed for nine nights, and we were sad to leave. The staff are all very attentive, positive and pleasant. The rooms are o.k., better than expected but could do with freshening up - appreciate that this in not easy in such a tough climate. The two pools are excellent, and probably the main attraction. I didn't think the food was great, but I never like buffet meals and catering for big numbers has its challenges. But we ate out every night, after a curry in the coffee bar on the first night which was disappointingly luke-warm (literally). We played tennis every day, but were the only ones inclined to do that. The courts aren't great, and reflect the occasional tattiness starting to creep in in places. But, overall, it was good value and an enjoyable experience.

Staff was very attentive and proactive, keep that up. Not seen that lately in a hotel down south. Reckon the rooms need some attention. The AC switch was defective, and few others. Hope the hotel does something about it

This mu first visit of down south hotels vacation but the second time of Aitken Spence hotels. (i stay at Hiltop)Seems the hotel location fantastic and environment was good. Reception was not very good as we had to wait more at the the front on my vehicle because less of your drivers which is cause a vehicle ques. Reception ladies good and they are pleasant to visitors. Swimming pool good but they are not providing mat and swimming towels when we went there. I inquired but the workers not provided specially for locals seems they are more focusing on foreigners. Food - Not quite goods/taste may be your staff forcussing on foreigners. Direction not clear - Restaurants, Spa Rooms, Gym etc. Not path direction given when coming out form rooms. Rooms - I stayed Deluxe room seems the private balcony was dirty, chairs, table and chair mats not cleaned. Water bottle provided for room are not enough because they are small ones. Restaurant Service also not quite goods as we have to move our palates beside to have next meal according to your course menu. They more focusing on foreigners not locals. Spa- Need brief introduction of Spa and massage, i was planned to have but due lack information i gave up. Better have induction for locals how, when, where, who is doing.(develop a interest) Finally when i am seen the hotels through the web thought it will be fantastic one but it was not there when i came in. my aim to develop you all to serve better in future not to make complain against you all. Have a great businesses.

swimming pool- heritance got two great swimming pools.one at the main entrance,and the other pool on the right side of the hotel.main entrance pool ideal for kids..2nd pool call green pool ideal for adults.. Restaurant and meals- superb and a perfect resto,,meals were excellent we had our breakfast lunch and dinner,,it was a perfect mix of food and deserts. Rooms- great rooms with lcds..top class washrooms..i think every room has nice sceneries... staff- Friendly people from the top to bottom..had a great time @heritance ahungalle keep it up...

Service and ambiance is superb, i like the subdued architecture and setting. Except for a minor intrusion by a hotel staff when he accidentally entered my room without knocking for housekeeping purposes (since I might not be able to hang the "do not disturb" sign on the door knob), everything went well as planned. When it comes to food, a staff should have been present to inform the diners which of the dish is spicy or not (due to health restrictions), but overall the banquet food affords the hotel guest a wide array of dishes to choose from.

Stayed 2 nights. Wonderful hotel, with great food and a relaxing spa. Very hospitable staff, helpful & always with a smile. Although you are inside the building its like living outdoors with so many court yards , trees, water pools inside the hotel....Could hear the sound of the sea while in the room.... The massage at the spa is worth the price... Would certainly visit again.... Overall had a wonderful stay.

We have stayed in another heritance hotel before in Kandalama and refreshingly the branding was held through by this equally pleasant hotel by the beach. We had unfortunately to cut our stay short but the Front Office Manager Indika Gonawela was very accommodating and helpful and the staff as a whole were friendly and thoughtful throughout our stay

A hotel that has an impeccable service and warmth about it. From the time you enter to the time you leave the staff will make you feel so at home. Filled with smiles and excellent service 24/7. A wonderful atmosphere with an infinity pool to die for. However i would like to give some constuctive feedback to the hotel management with regard to food. As a five star resort i expected the food on weekdays to be what i would say awesome. But i was disappointed to see the buffet was average. It didnt make me say wow and the dishes were predictable each time i came to the buffet as i stayed 3 nights. I was surprised to hear the hotel has an award winning chef. However it did not reflect so with the cuisine. The silver food containers were very hard to open and close. The buffet should be more colorful and the dessert needs to have variety as i have experienced in other five star hotels in sri lanka. The hotel didnt have a tea/coffee buffet for the evening tea. (As advised by the staff when inquired). Other hotels provide these services for full board guests. The tea in the room is not that pleasant due to the creamer tasting weird with tea. So they need to have a tea corner as well. Next time i return to the hotel i wish see this as a five star hotel to its fullest and not only to the star count. Dinuk Weerasekara (Sri Lanka)

I stayed in Heritance for for three days and it was a pleasant experience, Though I am a Sri Lankan I had the opportunity to taste the best Sri Lankan style food. Staff of the hotel were very friendly and extremely helpful.Hope I recommend Heritance to anyone who wish to spend their holiday in beach side, in Sri Lanka.

I booked three rooms at half-board and came with my wife, 20 month old daughter and wife's relatives for two nights in September 2013. I was keen to experience a Geoffrey Bawa architected hotel and was impressed by the thoughtfulness of his design. The hotel aims to merge with nature, and allow for breezes to flow throughout the compound, providing a natural cooling. There were two pools, which we well maintained and a great place to lounge through during the day. I was very keen to experience the food at the hotel - as I had heard that it was rated as one of the best dining resorts in Sri Lanka and I was not disappointed. I was struck by the thoughtfulness of the dishes in the Jute restaurant - and also couldn't recall any dish tasting bad. All the food was balanced and tasty. Even the Sri Lankan food was unbelievably good. The staff were helpful and always with a smile. Also enjoyed the gym, badmington court and table tennis facility in the venue. The only negative for me was the reasonable isolation of the resort. As I tend to always like to explore the surroundings, I was a bit disappointed when leaving the resort by the lack of facilities around walking distance of the hotel. Again that was my preference, but if you wish to travel and only stay in a resort to rest and relax it is a great place.

The hotel was right on the beach, gated and setback from the main street.with numerous restaurants to choose from. We found the coffee shop lobster more superior to the fine dining restaurant experience. Great buffet breakfast-try the hoppers. The gym was the only disappointment with 2 walking machines and one permanently broken. Pools were great but ocean too wild to swim due to monsoon rains that came and went. The spa was average-reasonable prices but service disappointing. We went to the turtle farm nearby and other day trips are possible. If this is your last night I would suggest going further towards Colombo and staying at Mt Lavinia Hotel which is closer to the airport.

We stayed here for 4 nights and had a great time. The resort is very large and has many amenities (swimming pool, tennis, table tennis, pool table) on offer to keep guests entertained. The entrance to the resort is probably the highlight of the place with the large infinity pool sitting in front of the open plan reception facing the sea. Both pools in the resort are great and very relaxing. The beach is also lovely although the water in September is too rough to swim in. The only downside to the beach is the constant group of locals setting up camp on the edge of the resort grounds and pestering every guest who ventures on to the beach. Surely there's a more effective way to sell goods/tours to guests than annoying every one of them when they pass a certain point. The rooms are nice with large comfortable beds and decent en-suites with a great shower. Our only complaint here is that everything in the room was quite damp. The bed, the pillows, our clothes... I don't think much can be done about this though as my guess is that it's down to the time of year and the sea air. The food was hit and miss. We had the buffet on one of the evenings which was decent although very pricey at Rs 3,300. We had one in the Cinnamon Grand in Colombo a few nights later which was only Rs 2,600 and was of far higher quality. The a-la-carte menu also left a bit to be desired and at times worked out quite expensive for the quality when the service charge and taxes were factored in. The breakfast was a plus point though with the freshly made waffles a particular highlight. We found the staff here very friendly and helpful and felt that they certainly made our stay here as enjoyable as possible.

Resort location is awesome. I was just speechless after I entered the resort. What a view of the ocean straight from the swimming pool. Hats off to the architect of this resort !!!! Also the amenities in the bathroom were excellent (specially shower gel) which i have never seen in any 5 star hotel. It was totally a wonderful and memorable experience for me. Food need to be improved for Indian people specially. Indian chef must be there otherwise everything is up to the mark. Congrates :) Hiren +919624045777 Skyline Tours, Surat, India

It was my first visit to Sri Lanka ,very beautiful country and very nice people. the hotel Heritance is a very nice place clean and very good staff clean and polite. The only problem was the ocean it was impossible to swim . heavy rain but not disturbing. Good variety of food and what I ate was tasty. Our tour Gide Mr. Raja was very helpful and extremely polite.

A great place for conterences and relaxation...but only u have to travel for 3 hours from the airport.... food there was really great...all staff are smiling and welcoming...the site was exceptional....great sea front and so beautiful nature and green!!! Surely I will come back so soon for another vacation..but this time with my wife and kids...want them to enjoy this paradise with me....even though we have to travel for so long hours from my great country JORDAN!!!!!

We were looking for the finest destination for our annual branch outing and the Heritance Ahungalle was named by most of the colleagues . It was a really amazing one night stay by the sea and among the spectacular architectural designs of the world renowned Mr.Jeffry Bawa. It was a great opportunity to meet the celebrity chef & seeing all his achievements made us think that we had chosen the correct place. At the same time I thank Mr Indika the front office manager,the animators and the staff for their excellent service.

we did not technically stay at this hotel as the hotel authorities had messed up our booking and had to re-accomodate us with some other properties. they did make up for their mistakes with a few upgrades and free food and wine thrown in, no worries. the reason for this review is the time we spent at the swimming pool side - the awesome pool view and location that this place has! infinity pools should look like this...very nice! also - a word for the staff...though they had messed up the bookings, they did try to make amends as best as possible with the re-booking at a resort in Hikkaduwa and also free lunch and dinner thrown in with some bottles of wine.

it was a very nice experience, with the huge swimming pool near the beach and the nice buffets with a large variety of foods to taste and the room was very comfortable with the large balcony and beach view

My sister and I were really looking forward to ending our 9 day tour of Sri Lanka in an excellent 5 star hotel. To our dismay, we were presented by a hotel which should not be claiming it's 5 star label. A three star at best. It was by no means dirty, but very rough around the edges. It was in dire need of renovation. The room itself had nothing wrong with it, but no determining feature to tout it as a 5 star resort. The food was ok. Unfortunately, it was a big anticlimax for the end of our trip.

We spend 5 nights at Heritance Ahungalla. The location is very nice and a good choice to spend some relaxing days. The restaurants serve delicious food, the deluxe rooms are furnished with care and provided with every comfort. The staff is friendly and attentive. Many thanks again to Thilina who surprised us with fresh flowers each day. :) We'll stay here again.

we stayed two nights at heritance ahungalla and it was a great stay.beautiful hotel and friendly staff. my father used to work here when i was a kid and we used to spend all of our school vacations here.its been a long time since i went back there and it was not disappointing at all. brought back a lot of memories.the food was amazing as always! room service was a tad bit slow thou and there are two pools at the hotel and a Jacuzzi which was amazing! it's nice quite place for a great stay!

Luxurious hotel on the sea front. We spent the last 2 days of our holiday here and found it a very good location from which to visit Galle, and other coastal attractions such as the turtle hatchery at Kosgoda, the mask museum at Ambalangoda and the Madu River mangrove cruise. The hotel has 2 large attractive swimming pools set in well looked after gardens. The rooms were spacious and clean and there was always a good choice of food in the buffet restaurant. Best of all, the staff were very friendly and helpful - always smiling. Tennis, badminton and table tennis were available. Beware the hawkers on the beach who are very persistent.

A well located resort, very calm, with good buffet menus... the resort needs some works, there was some cleaning issue (rooms, restaurants...). they didn't provide robe, iron, sleepers without asking. No beach activities

Everything Was Good The people at the hotel were also were very helpful and it was value for money. Will be visiting soon again. A must stay place in Sri Lanka The food was excellent. & pool was very clean

Oh my god, this place was amazing. I am basically a beach lover and this place is perfect for beach lovers. We stayed just one night and we had a great time and very good food from breakfast to dinner. We enjoyed their varieties of selection and they had sri lankan and western buffet. I stayed with my kids and it seems to be a family friendly hotel. I would love to visit here again.

During my stay, I was really satisfied for each/every thing offered by Heritance Hotel.. I was in HB, as the Resturant was so good & delicious.. Heritance Ahungalla, It's the place which you will always remember.. Eng. Khalid Bayounes Saudi Arabia - Jeddah

Me and my partner have stayed in Heritance Ahungalla in May 2013. Service was fantastic. Front office team, F & B Team, Room service everyone was so nice. Special Thanks to Thilini(Front office executive) who went out her way to make our stay memorable. Beach dinner we had was fantastic and bar staff made beautiful cocktails. Highly recommended.......

The staying at the hotel was an amazing experience.The service was lovely and the breakfast was mouth-watering.Had an amazing stay at the hotel. The people at the hotel were also were very helpful and it was value for money. Will be visiting soon again. A must stay place in Sri Lanka

We stayed at the hotel from 27th to 29th August 2013 on full board basis with three families occupying 4 rooms. on arrival the GM upgraded one room into a suite due to previous relationships. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.The food was excellent. The restaurant staff was constantly inquiring too our well-being looking into children's tastes. The children were enjoying the outdoor activities such as badminton/Tennis Table tennis.Since the pool and the beach are situated close to each other it was really fun to enjoy the evening running from one to another. We are very thankful to the GM and the entire hotel staff for providing us a memorable holiday for our 3 families

The hotel was quite good and I enjoyed my stay there. The staff were very friendly and the hotel was clean and well organized. I especially liked the swimming pool area facing the beach. Although, there were a couple of things that could be improved. For one thing, the rooms me and my family stayed in had a few maintenance issues (the ac was not working properly for one of the rooms and the shower drain was clogged). The food in the hotel was good but not nothing special compared to other hotels I've visited in Sri Lanka. Another thing that was lacking were the sports and recreation facilities. All in all, it was a nice stay but I definitely would not rate it as one of the best hotels I've stayed in in Sri Lanka.

We had 2 days relaxing by the sea after a tour of Sri Lanka. The hotel is fairly large, but clean and well organized. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The food was good and fairly hot in the buffet restaurant. It was mainly Sri Lankan dishes. There are several swimming pools and right on the edge of the beach. The sea was very rough, but there was plenty of room to swim in the pools.

Lovely views towards the sea. Buffet restaurant very suitable for families but coffee shop very very good for couples. Also a fine dining restaurant. Friendly efficient staff. We were upgraded on arrival due to celebrating an anniversary. Had better room which was very large and looked out onto residents pool. Pool boys very efficient and friendly, putting out beds and towels each morning.

We stayed 1st to 10th August all inclusive. We had a fantastic and relaxing time during our stay. The hotel itself is clean and well maintained. The people who clean the rooms leave some nice touches such as petals on the beds and animals made from towels. The scenery from the lobby and our room (we requested an ocean view) is breathtakingly beautiful. The sea at this time of year is choppy and cannot be entered but this is not a problem with two large, clean swimming pools with pool attendants to provide comfortable sun beds. There is a great selection of gorgeous food and we never once felt hungry! Plenty of facilities and entertainment such as gym, table tennis, tennis courts, spa, pool table, live music and evening entertainment. But what really makes this hotel, is the friendly, hard-working staff who went out of their way to make our stay a memorable one. They couldn't do enough for us. A special mention for Nirosh, Robhana and Sampath (the resident manager) who looked after us so well and Ayesha who made us some fantastic cocktails. Would I return to this hotel? Most definitely! The sooner the better! From Mr Mark and Sarah!

Hotel is really nice, people are very good. Facilities are really good and comfortable. Location is really amazing. Lot of things are there to do sports, games etc. It'd be much great if some other outdoor activities such as cycling etc. are available. Foods are not so good.

Heritance Ahungalla is an awesome hotel. When I use the word 'awesome', I am not using this lightly. I stayed at Heritance Ahungalla for 4 nights on my honeymoon and the food was very yammee.. Every time I go to have meals I come out stuffed... hehe.. :) The hospitality of the hotel is very good and the people are very friendly too. Every one working there, even the guy who was painting the hotel, would smile and greet us. The hotel is well maintained and room service is excellent. The view from the lobby is very cool. It's as if, the pool is connected to the ocean. I would recommend this hotel to any one who is planning on going on a holiday down south or on their honeymoon... :)

We spent 2 night at Heritance recently. It is indeed a memorable visit for us as it was after quite some time we visited down south. This is a hotel we wanted to visit for a long time and August school break provided an ideal opportunity . Why Heritance? Well, it is a generally accepted fact that they serve good food and my previous visit had proved that too. When we checked in I casually mentioned to the reservation executive that it was my daughters birthday (11 Years) and he immediately informed us that he was going to organize a complimentary birthday cake. What was left for us was to decide the size of the cake. So the first day dinner we concluded with the birthday celebration, the staff joining us with cutting the cake and singing happy birthday for my daughter. Such a wonderful moment for three of us. As usual the food was upto the expectations and in many varieties too. Different themes every day/every meal time and plenty of options for everybody, including enough varieties of sea food, one of my favourites. Rooms are quite clean and tidy and I have no complains. The residence pool was one of my favourites places. This is ideal for a quiet evening swimming. Don't forget to dip in the Jacuzzi near the residence pool if you happen to visit the hotel.Badminton and Tennis as well the Gym Table will burn your extra fat intake, if you are concern about your health during your stay. The most striking feature of the hotel for me is their friendliness. Everybody is willing to spent at least one or two minutes talking to you and is also willing to assist you in whatever manner possible. On improvements, I guess the gardening and landscaping has been somewhat neglected. Heritance Ahungalla, you could definitely do a better job than this.

We had excellent stay in Heritance Ahungulla with the family, room, service and food was very good, children enjoyed swimming pool very much. Also we want to share very good experience with our driver Hiran Rangana (www.Ipalanka.com) he spend with us almost two weeks and we are very lucky to get such a nice and friendly man as our driver. He knows the country very well and is very selflessly helpful (he shared his experiences and recommended us to visit some places which all of us enjoyed very much), also helped to negotiated the prices or made arrangement by himself on our behalf in order to minimize the costs. God bless him :)

It was a family trip and we thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of this trip.The staff are very helpful,courteous and kind and go all the way out to be hospitable.We would definetely like to visit again and enjoy the experience.It has been a totally memorable trip from the welcome we got when we arrived to the goodbyes when we left.I want to thank each and every member of the staff in all the departments for their service and i guess its one of a kind hotel where everyone works from the heart and it makes a huge difference for guests.Keep up the good work!Best wishes!

i was at the hotel afew days ago with colleagues for a workshop. The location is well located. Staff were also pleasant and of help while needed. My main disapointment was the rooms. As i was taking a shower, water didnt run through the drain as fast as its supposed to. This was a clear indication that the drainage is poor. Also, i noticed a dry roll of tissue placed on top of the septic tank, Yak! I immediately threw the tissue in the bin.The walls of the bathroom are not very clean. I would suggest that they invest in putting tiles on the wall. The sheets were also not sparkling clean. One had a stain of something......i dont know what. The towels are also not new. I had one tired look towel which they tried to hide with the newer towel. The hotel needs to really look into the small things that give guests total satisfaction. Otherwise, i dont think i would want to go back there in the near future.

It is a nice hotel. i have been to this hotel a few times long ago. this was the most recent visit. The staff is really good,friendly and attentive. They had a large range of drinks for the breakfast. With two swimming pools you have choice. the DJ at the club was playing really good music but it was totally empty because nobody is aware of the club. The room condition is average.

Spent 3 nights here after touring the cultural triangle. Pros * Excellent service and friendly staff who arranged transport to other nearby areas. * Large, quiet swimming pool. * High quality rooms - we were upgrade to a suite at no extra charge - this had a huge bathroom and seating area as well as all the usual amenities: mini bar, hair drier, safe etc. * The breakfast buffet has a wide range of local and western choices available until 11am. Cons * The sellers on the beach are NON STOP which made it nearly impossible to enjoy a walk along the beautiful beach - even sitting by the pool if you look up and catch their eye they shout over for about 10 minutes. * We relented to one of the hawkers and agreed to go to his restaurant down the beach for dinner but although it looked beautiful with fairy lights and candles, 2 of our party were violently ill after eating seafood here. * The hotel is away from everything else so it's not easy to get to alternatives for dinner etc. we got a cab to Galle which is beautiful and has many restaurant choices - I would stay in Galle if I went to this area again.

We stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla for 4 nights in August 2013 at the end of a 2 week visit to Sri Lanka. The Heritage Ahungalla is the only hotel where we experienced poor service and poor housekeeping and felt that the hotel did not live up to its literature (website). Things started badly and unfortunately certainly did not improve. On arrival only some of our party of 5 were offered hospitality and this itself was done unsatisfactorily, being given before the hand towels were provided. A small blip but, as it turned out, indicative of what was to follow. The check-in process was acceptable, slightly slow but not beyond what was reasonable. The assistant (off his own back) confirmed that my wife and I would be in one room and our 3 children in another room (as we had booked). We were then shown to our two â€œluxuryâ€ rooms. The children were allocated an incredibly large room with a double bed for the girls to share (not uncommon in Sri Lanka) and a separate bed for our son. No complaints there. My wife and I were then taken to our room. This was approximately half the size, and had twin beds pushed together to resemble a double bed â€“ with a double bed headboard and the top blanket pulled across the pair â€“ but there were undeniably two separate beds. It was hard to believe that the two rooms were of the same category. It was also perplexing that the hotel had designated the rooms as they had and, most of all, astonishing that they had not put my wife and me in the room with the double bed (the other room was still plenty large enough to accommodate the children). We raised the matter at reception but were told that nothing could be done; no double bedded room was available for us. The only thing the hotel suggested was that we could swap rooms but by that time everyone had unpacked and settled in and (quite apart from the obvious inconvenience entailed) this reversal would hardly have gone down well with the children whose expectations had been raised by what the hotel had given them in the first place. Dinner: Unlike everywhere else we stayed, the main restaurant (the Jute) did not offer an a la carte dining option, only a buffet, although the in-room literature (itself in a ragged state) indicated it did. To rub salt into the wound, the buffet was very expensively priced compared with the other comparable hotels we stayed in. It then emerged that the policy on what rate to charge for children was seemingly wholly arbitrary and depended on whether one asked about it. The default position was a full/adult charge but when this was queried a concession was immediately made for the children, this being apparently down to the attitude of the particular manager in question. We chose to dine in the Mustard Coffee Shop (a much smaller establishment) where one can purchase individual dishes. The food was acceptable but of a distinctly lower quality than we had enjoyed elsewhere. Breakfast: This (included in our package) was provided in the main restaurant. The food was ok and there was a fairly good selection. However, the service was undoubtedly by far the worst we experienced during our holiday. Quite simply, there appeared to be too few waiters. It often took quite some effort to order tea and to have dirty plates etc. removed â€“ in marked contrast with the attentive service consistently shown at other hotels. Also, it appeared that the hotel provided breakfast for substantial numbers of non-residents (attending conferences etc.); this made the restaurant particularly busy and not the place for a restful, relaxing meal. Housekeeping: A joke. Our room had not been properly cleaned on arrival; there was sand all over the towel hook. We had to call twice to have it seen to. Our request that a blown light bulb be replaced was never met. The second day was ok. However, on the third day housekeeping did not come to either room. It took 3 calls from us to get them to clean the rooms â€“ which they did eventually in the late afternoon. Further, they failed to leave any bottles of water in the childrenâ€™s room, even though they had done so the previous day and despite the fact that on the same occasion they left fresh water in our room. When our daughters asked for a supply for them (to brush their teeth etc.) they were told that water was only provided free-of-charge for the first night and that thereafter it must be purchased. This was a clear fob-off (inconsistent with and contradicted by the hotelâ€™s own actions on other days and in relation to our room). It took intervention from my wife to get this issue resolved. Down the corridor some other guests had spilled fruit over the floor. Housekeeping, along with a trolley of cleaning materials, passed by the scene but failed to clear it properly. Eventually we asked for it to be cleaned. When we left there were still watermelon seeds on the (sticky) floor. Pools: The main pool (featured on the website) is open to non-resident guests and can become very busy, meaning that in effect you feel confined to using the second pool. Check out: We had to leave at 4.30 a.m. to catch our flight. I told the hotel this and settled our account around 10 p.m. on the final evening. The hotel thus knew our plans. At 4.30 the following morning we all trooped to reception with our cases and I handed in our keys. It was clear to the staff that we were leaving then. We waited in front of the desk with our cases for our taxi to arrive. There was no sign of it; the forecourt was empty and there was no vehicle visible. After 10 minutes or so my wife asked the reception to telephone the taxi company for us. Only then did the staff inform us that the taxi had actually arrived some time ago and was parked in a dark corner with all its lights and engine off! Why they did not volunteer the information before is a total mystery. It was sheer good luck that we asked them to make the call for us (rather than trying to call the tour company ourselves); otherwise we could have been waiting at reception indefinitely, oblivious of the fact that the taxi was just some yards away! Indeed, when we were on the road the taxi driver told us that due to some confusion (for which the hotel was not responsible) heâ€™d been booked to arrive at 2 a.m. On arrival â€“ having entered via the security-controlled gates â€“ he had told the staff. Why they had not seen fit to call us in our room to notify us is again utterly inexplicable. It is just typical of the absence of service we experienced throughout our stay. All in all: the Heritance Ahungalla should be avoided. It is very much the weak link in the Heritance chain (we stayed at Heritance hotels in Kandamala and Nuwara Eliya which were both good). By all means visit Sri Lanka â€“ but I strongly suggest you find somewhere else to stay.

This hotel was recommended to us by people who stayed here 4 years ago as 'best hotel in SL'. Unfortunately the hotel did not live up to expectations of 'best hotel' or even a 5 star hotel. The upkeep of the hotel is very poor. I understand the humidity and moisture in the air would make it difficult to maintain but the other hotels are managing to maintain standard. Firstly the rooms are looking tired and old!! -The bathrooms were filthy!! i asked house keeping to re clean!! Shower screens had mould and l was told this is hard to keep clean! - what a load of rubbish!! - Beds had bed bugs in them, we were bitten so badly and i thought this was odd as we have been traveling around SL for 2 weeks and not one mozzie bite throughout the whole trip! -Cockroaches in the bathroom after dark! - Complex too large (may be a positive for some people) - Main dining room dark and mouldy smelly + The positives are the staff!! Always friendly and very eager to help. When i complained about the first room we were moved immediately + house keeping really tried to clean the room upon complaint Needless to say as this was the part of our trip to relax we moved hotels and could not have been happier. If this hotel was rated down then i would not have written a review like this but this is definitely not a 5 star hotel

It's charming!I love the green view and the fresh air.The staff is very nice.The time is too short to stay here.I wish that I could be Heritance Ahungalla.Thanks for your service.I have a nice holiday in Srilanka!

If you are looking for a hotel in which to relax and unwind after a hectic tour of Sri Lanka then this hotel will fit the bill.As you can see from my profile I do not do reviews and use trip advisor to get an idea of what to book based on other peoples experiences. However I feel that after staying at this hotel for 7 nights I should write a review. The arrival and check-in went very smoothly and we were taken to our room without delay. I had booked a 'de luxe ocean view' room and this is what we got with a view over the main pool and expansive view of the sea. The room was bright and airy with plenty of space. The air conditioning worked well with some minor adjustment for our own tastes. The house keeping of the room could not have been better with some very artistic towel creations every night! The main dining room offered buffet style eating which was always of a high quality with a choice of local or European style foods. I prefer a quiet pool to swim in and relax by and the smaller pool was perfect for this. There was never a problem with pool loungers and after chat with the pool attendant the loungers can be arranged for the following day (no getting up early with towels) what makes this hotel special is the staff. From the beaming smile of the lady as you enter the restaurant to the bar staff at the pool bar, they are all trying to make sure you are happy and enjoying the experience. They take an interest in where you come from and will sort out any special requests. I let it slip that it was our wedding anniversary and a special cake was presented to us after our evening meal. The only downside to staying at this hotel is, as mentioned by other reviewers, the problem of the hawkers on the beach. They can be intimidating but a firm no and not making eye contact seemed to work and we were not bothered again as we walked along the beach All in all a wonderful stay and we would certainly return.

Overall a very good hotel and staff were excellent. Some areas of the hotel were tired but everywhere was very clean. Rooms were comfortable and facilities good, with a reasonably well equipped gym and two large pool areas, where the attendants were helpful in providing towels and arranging beds. The food was very good however, our experience in the dining room was mixed, mainly because at the weekend, the hotel is open to non-residents, so there were suddenly huge numbers of extra diners for dinner on Saturday and breakfast on Sunday, which turned the experience into a bit of a bun fight. The quality of the food was still good, however the presentation was off putting as staff could not keep up with the volume and serving dishes were left messy and tables were not cleared as quickly as on other days. We ended up in the 'outside area' which felt very 'make shift' - perhaps this area should be made available for non residents so that residents at the hotel do not experience reduced standards at the weekend. On the plus side, there is a quieter residents only pool, so it is possible to escape during the day at the weekend. My advice would be to avoid weekends when the hotel is open to non-residents as it becomes far too busy and noisy, specifically in the dining area.

The hotel is generally good. I was informed that it had been hit by the tsunami in 2004 and all the ground floor rooms were submerged. I travelled in a group and somehow got upgraded to a large deluxe room which was fantastics with all the trimmings. The room was spacious with a great view. However, my friends who were in standards rooms didn't like their stay at all. They complained about the rooms having flying cockroaches. The culinary experience was not as great as I hoped considering the hotel was voted as being the Best in Culinary Experience in Sri Lanka. Maybe because I was comparing with Hilton Colombo where I had just come from and which I would rate as better. The gym was ok but the electic equipment such as treadmills and cross trainers could use an upgrade. The gym is open throughout i.e. it's never locked which is great for flexibility. The swimming pools are very inviting and the meeting room were provided was ok though the selection of coffee/ tea beak snacks could be improved. One thing that was interesting was the sea was rough all the time throughout our stay. No guests could swim in the sea at all. This is a very interesting phenomenon which i had not previously experienced.

my overall stay was very good.. staff was friendly n helping.... breakfast was amazing... view was breath taking.... we were able to listen the sound of waves all the time which was very soothing and relaxing.. the only thing which was not impressive at all was the lighting of the hotel... not only rooms but outside the room with in the premises of hotel... rooms need to be more lighted.. and i didn't get the reason behind switching off all lights ... not even a single bulb around the entire hotel .. which makes the hotel looks like a haunted place in the late hours... at least a lil bit of light should be there so that it becomes easier to reach to the room in late hours... other then lighting everything was good.....

My husband and I have just spent a week at the Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel it's self is very tired and needs a full refurb this is mostly evident in the main dinning resturant and pool side. The hotel needs to deal with the beach traders who make it very difficult to take a walk along the beach. With regard to the staff this was by far the redeeming aspect of our trip as every member of staff we dealt with we're exceptional. The food also cooked by the chefs in the fine dinning was also second to none and you would find it hard to eat a more tender fillet steak or rack of lamb.

The Hotel is amazing and I agree with all the reviews but the Main Restaurant was over priced compared to other 4/5 star hotels in Sri Lanka, Please consider reviewing your prices vs service and quality. E.g. 600 rupees +++ for simple juices like Pineapple/Lime/Papaya, For the same price you can get cocktails at Galle Face Hotel.

A beautiful vacation well spent in a fantastic hotel, the driveway into the lobby from the main gate itself gives you an idea that you are surely in for lots of surprises. A spacious lobby followed by a large swimming pool extending into the beach takes your breath away. A huge five star heritage hotel with most warm staff ever experienced. An elaborate buffet for each meal awaited us for an entire week and none of the cuisine was repeated, the desserts were to die for. Savoured king coconut water in plenty. Swimming pools, tennis courts, table tennis, spa, live music, art shops, bar, library all adds to the zing that you want for your comfort away from home. Keep it up, will highly recommend for all and any,

Our vacation to the South has always been at Heritance Ahungalla or Triton as known in the past. Thought of having a change this time and checked into another 5 Star Resort Hotel in Beruwela. Never felt comfortable from the time we stepped into thier lobby although it was a hotel built long after Triton and refurbished very recently. So the same evening made reservation at Heritace Ahungalla and shifted the following day, which was only a 15 minutes drive.

I got married at this hotel on 12th April this year. I have to say from the moment we arrived we were looked after. I must say a big thank you to the Guest Relations Executive - Thilini, she made sure our big day went by stress free. As a bride there were a few things I was worried about but I had no need to be at all. The flowers, cake and everything were perfect. We had friends join us at the hotel throughout the holiday and they too were welcomed. We had arranged dinner on the beach on the evening of the wedding, the service was faultless. We sat down to eat later than the scheduled time due to a rain shower but it was no problem at all. Whenever we were ready, the staff were ready. The staff always had a smile even after working long days continuously. I would recommend to anyone to stay here and I will always have fond memories of Sri Lanka and the Heritance Ahungalla. The GM of the hotel Refhan was always around and visible, he introduced himself to us before our wedding day. The facilities are spotless, the buffet selection is good and the al a carte restaurants also great. I cannot fault this hotel at all. Thank you again to all the staff who made our stay memorable.

I have been going to this hotel for the past 25 years + and have always enjoyed my stay there. The staff are friendly and very helpful, rooms clean and comfortable and the food very delicious and a great choice at every meal. It is a five star hotel with a six star service. Certainly recommend a stay here when visiting the south cast of Sri Lanka

We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights on full board basis. The design of this hotel is magnificent, with great attention to detail. The amenities are amazing. We would especially like to mention the animators who kept us all busy with water polo, table tennis, boules, volleyball, the evening shows etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful, nothing was too much for them. The food at breakfast, lunch and dinner was outstanding and the variety amazing. We will definitely be returning to this hotel next year for two weeks!!

We loved our three days, the breach boarders the hotel. Clean air and quiet. We had full buffet and enjoyed the fresh food. We have now stayed here three times and enjoy the self contained convenience. The highway makes the hotel within two hours range of Colombo. Our only challenge was finding the hotel from the highway.

We were only able to stay one night, however it was fantastic. The hotel staff were extremely attentive and thoughtful in securing us a room as close to the lift as possible to suit our special needs. The room itself was large and spacious with a lovely view overlooking the beach. We spent most of our time by the pool which is gorgeous, right by the beach! The food was really great and the restaurant staff very friendly. We had a lovely time at this hotel, it has a great atmosphere!

I have been to this hotel once before and it has managed to exceed my expectations. Great Service and Brilliant Staff, A family friendly atmosphere. Reasonable variation in cuisine to suit all flavor palates. Loved the location, excellent place to get away from your busy life.

Excellent in terms of facilities, nice pool, excellent play ground to play cricket. The games were arranged in short notice. Friendly staff and the level of service is above the expected level. But the variety of Foods for Lunch and Dinner were not up to standard. Needs more variety specially for lunch and dinner

This Hotel has won awards for its cooking particularly pastries so the croissants are outstanding. My room was delightful and well serviced. Everyone in our group had a wonderful 2 days there. I am concerned however at the long hours the staff are working. If you look carefully you will see the same people at 10pm as at 8am and that is too long a shift. I was a little puzzled too by the inconsistency of the pool attendant at the pool that non residents can visit as I was quizzed over my costume which had a floaty bit of material on it and had to prove it was part of the costume yet when a school party arrived they were playing a ball game in clothes-tee shirts and shorts, in the pool-very definitely not costumes or pool attire. Fortunately there is another pool just for residents where you could go for a quieter swim where the attendant was much nicer and more helpful. I found that every time I went to the beach people approached you and it got so difficult I stopped going as it became uncomfortable. This would put me off any lengthy stay here.

We stayed two nights and it was fabulous. We had our meals in the main dinning room both days and I must mention one particular staff member mr Dayal De Silva from the restaurant he anticipated guest needs and reacted quickly. I was talking to my wife about having a good cup of tea and mr De Silava heard us and he offers us tea. However I must mention that during our stay choice of food is very limited in the buffet. First night they had Srilankan night and the second night they had Indian night both night choice of food is limited. Service levels are inconsistance to locals and foreigners should be given equal treatment. I never received a call from the guest relations team to find out about our stay or what could have been done to make our stay memorable.However I got a call from the head office Mr Upendra Serisena sking how my stay and what can be done to make our stay memorable. I think that was a very nice touch on his part and kudos to Mr Serisena. Guest of room 325 & 253 Abeykoon family

we stayed her for 3 nights and honestly i could have stayed longer only we had so much more to see on our holiday. the staff were very efficient, the setting for the hotel was superb. the rooms were fantastic and the pool was great. there was nightly entertainment which was good fun as you were away from all other hotels and towns so it was easier to stay put.

Our vacation was made more memorable by the excellent service and hospitality extended by the management and staff at the Heritance Ahungalla. The view from our room, of the pool and the surrounding beach, was fantastic and our stay was truly relaxing. Wish we could have extended our stay by another day or two......

We returned to Heritance after 23 years ..... In the early '90's we would drive down twice a month. We were apprehensive when we decided to take our teenage daughter to experience what we had loved so much about this resort. It is with great appreciation to the welcome of the staff, that we realised that everything was in immaculate condition, the pool, the rooms, and the food was as we remembered, delicious. Our stay was wonderful,we enjoyed each day and we will return again. Thank you !

Ideal vacation spot for the traveller who loves the beach combined with the comfort, luxury and fantastic service of this star class resort. 2 fantastic pools especially the one reserved only for in house guests are a fantastic form of relaxation as well as recreation. The rooms are lovely and the food is simply fantastic......staff will go out of their way to make you feel at home and comfortable.... you could also organize a lovely romantic dinner for two under the stars on the lovely stretch of beach.....

We spent two nights @ heritance ahungalla with all our company folks and families, it was remarkable experience. Excellent service from the beginning to last minute, Courteous, flexible and very supportive staff I ever met specially Shyamalee and Indika coordinated and organized the event really well. Excellent rooms with nice sea view. We all enjoyed a lot and hope to visit again. I wish very good luck and all the success to the hotel and the staff

The staff is very helpful, flexibility and great. We had all the support from the staff and they simply bearing for us every time in the restaurant. service for kids are also on a very high level and we certainly enjoy the place. We experience very very high quality and friendly service. We had a great variety of food choices.

We felt totally great in such a refreshing place among a very special ambiance for relaxation. However you have to bear in mind that this time period provokes a quite rough sea where it was not allowed to swim. The food was perfect with a great variety of choices and show cooking. In particular the luxury room went far beyond our expectations. Special thank goes to our pool waiter "Senarath" who provided excellent service to us.

We arrived at Heritance Ahungalla and immediately relaxed. We arrived early but we were immediately welcomed and every effort was made to get our rooms ready as quickly as possible. The swimming pools are definitely the highlight and sitting by the pool drinking a cocktail before dinner was so relaxing. Checkout time of 12 noon gives you the chance of making the most of your stay.

Brilliant food and excellent service as expected. Lots of fun activities for kids. Fire show was great. Very obliging and caring staff. Great music by the band on Saturday night. A good base to explore the southern city of Galle with its Dutch fort or for an expedition on the river. The sea is quite rough but the clean wide beach almost compensates for not being able take a dip in the ocean.

Customer service is excellent. and there is a huge pool. Saturdays and Sundays are great. The food, the service, the staff, the room, everything was perfect. There is no point in describing it all. One must experience it. it's the best place I've ever been and I simply can not wait to go back.

I had my first visit to Hertance with my family, it was our office trip. The rooms are above average, but food and other restaurant services were not great. Most of my family are vegetarian, all vegetarians had the same food experience as we had. Dinner had a BBQ and some dishes, but lack of tasty vegetarian food, they should have at least added some Indian food items. I hope they will seriously look into this. Thanx Anura

A good place to relax and enjoy. But pool rules must be obeyed specially by Muslim ladies, who sometimes come in burca and jump to the pool disturb guests. Food is extremely good. Staff is very friendly. Good nice beach is really beautiful.

This is a truly lovely resort hotel with a stunning design, making the most of a beautiful location. We stayed here for our final two days after a fascinating but exhausting tour of the island and it provided the ideal retreat for rest and relaxation! From the warm welcome with refreshing cold towels and a choice of juices to the moment we regretfully left for the airport, all the staff seemed to go out of their way to make our stay a memorable one. Our luxury room on the third floor had a stylish bathroom and lovely outlook over one of the pools to the ocean beyond. Staff who serviced the rooms were not only efficient but added an element of fun by leaving a different 'animal' sculpted from a towel on the bed each evening! We stayed for three nights and dined in a different location on each. On the first night 'The Mustard Cafe' suited our needs as after a tiring day we just needed refuelling before bed. The international menu featuring pasta, burgers, etc..was functional and service was friendly and efficient. However the atmosphere was a little 'soulless'. The buffet on the second night in the main restaurant was again 'functional'. It was certainly not the worst buffet we had encountered during the holiday but neither was it the best and the vast room again lacked atmosphere. Our third night however was very special. Due to a problem with the air con in the Fine Dining A la Carte restaurant we were offered the option of dining on the beach. This was truly magical. Our party of 6 were the only ones eating on the beach that night and to be served freshly caught lobster and other delicacies with silver service and flickering lanterns to the sound of the waves and a distant Kandyan drummer was a memory that will long live on. Apart from trips on the Manu river and to the turtle hatchery at Kasgoda, there is little in the immediate vicinity of the hotel to tempt one out. We could not swim in the sea due to the strong currents at this time of year but the beach was spectacular to walk on and we did not witness undue amounts of litter as a previous reviewer encountered. As for the 'hawkers', they were only present in small numbers and were genial and never threatening - all adding to the local colour! There is also a small fish restaurant a few hundred yards along the beach to the right of the hotel (little more than a shack) which provided a pleasant alternative venue for lunch. Meanwhile, back at the hotel, if one tired of lazing by one of the beautiful pools (in the company of two resident monitor lizards!) the 'animators' were on hand to organise an impromptu volleyball tournament for those teens and twenties with more energy than their parents! This hotel is another example of the Aitken Spence Group at its best. I have rated it as 4 rather than 5 stars simply because we were lucky enough to have stayed at The Heritance Kandalama and Heritance Tea Factory ( all in the same group). Their unique locations and innovative design led me to award them the extra star but for a beach resort The Ahungalla would be hard to beat!

The beginning of the holiday started in a very disappointing way. We arrived at the hotel at 2PM on time for check in. However we were informed that the rooms were not ready. As a result we had to wait for over two and a half hours to get our rooms which was a very disappointing experience to start a vacation. The excuse given by the staff was that the guests have not vacated the rooms on time. This is not a plausible excuse. The hotel should know when to call and inform guests that they need to check out on time. The least they could do then is call us and let us know there is a delay so that we can plan to arrive late to the hotel. My mother who is elderly had to sit for along time in the reception area and found it difficult to walk afterwords as well. We actually decided never to come back to this hotel again but we changed our minds after the experience afterwards. The staff in the hotel mainly the room maintenance and restaurant staff were very polite friendly and courteous. Never before had we experienced such a good service from staff in any other hotels we had been to. Another plus point was the food. The food was excellent. There was a wide variety and it was very tasty. One negative aspect is that we stayed one night on a day where there were less guests. On this day the food variety was not there and that was a bit of a undermining experience for us. Another unsatisfactory experience I faced was with the pool attendant. When I went to the swimming pool I asked the pool attendant for a towel. His reply was that the hotel had instructed him to inform guests to bring their room towels. This seemed very odd to me as I saw other patrons having pool towels. Anyway I proceeded to have a swim and I could not dry myself as I had no towel and I had to go to the room all wet. With the cold wind blowing I could have got pneumonia as well but thankfully that didn't happen. Later on I called the reception to clarify this and they said that the pool attendant should have given me towels and that he had given me false information. In any case I do hope the hotel takes this experience as a learning and inform their pool attendants as to not to refuse to give patrons pool towels. Finally I would like to say that the hotel did allow us to have a late check out in order to compensate for the delayed check in. Overall I would say that I would come back to Heritance Ahungalla due to the friendly and polite staff and the good food. However I hope that I will not face the unpleasent expeirnces I mentioned above, the next time I visit.. Dilshan Thambawita

The rooms are spacious, clean, with everything you need. The staff was always friendly and helpfull.
