There are many facilities (2 swimming pools, badminton, tennis, pingpong, spa, gym) and many are free to use. One minor: There is nothing to do or see in Ahungalla. If you leave the hotel for a walk in the town or on the beach villagers always try to sell you things. This is the case everywhere in Sri Lanka, but it makes you feel trapped (in a golden cage).

Dear Team at Heritence Ahungalla, More than anything it is the service that i admire most... Simply great service! From the Porter to the GM all had one thing in mind which is how to make the customer happy. Constructive feedback for the team from us is that, rooms need to be decorated with more paintings/hangings, may be a day bed for the suite, couple of easy chairs for the balcony ..etc. (Anyway overall room facilities were very good) I will recommend the hotel to my friends & family and thinking of staying at the hotel again..

Dear Mr.Refhan & team, I wish to thank you & the team for warm hospitality extended to me & my family during our stay.food & the services are excellent. Staff are always very helpful to us.Hotel is very cleaned too..my family enjoyed their stay even though it was a brief one & eagerly waiting to visit Heritance Ahungalla once again which i too am looking forward to. Thank you very much once again Mr.Refhan for the great hospitality extended which shall be in our minds for many more years.

Great location; great facilities; fabulous, helpful and friendly staff. The rooms are spacious, nice and very clean. The food was fantastic - especially considering we visited in low season. Do yourself a favour - if you are visiting the southwest - book it!!

Pearson staff spent a really great vacation there in Heritance Ahungalla last weekend. This stay was a really value for money and everybody thoroughly enjoyed every bit of it. The food was great and I really liked the Sunday lunch. Fire show on Saturday night was very innovative and creative which was not a typical fire show that I usually see. Everything else was arranged as per the Pearson staff expectations and there was nothing to complain. I must specially thank the Hotel staff being so friendly and helpful not only during our stay but also helping to get this trip arranged. Special thanks should go to Sampath (RM) and Indika (FOM) and Deshan. I have been to quite a few star class resorts but Heritance Ahungalla is really a star among other resorts and it is the hotel staff that made it. I would highly recommend this place for anyone who wish to spend their vacation. Good job Heritance and wish you success!

Very very very excellent hotel; Shashi and wasitha are very friendly and kind people in hotel especially shashi animation .nice rooms,nice beach,nice pools.thank you reception workers are very good one advice:all facilities must be free of charge because it's a five stars hotel

apart from the great food and beautiful place, the best part about this hotel is its service. the staff are polite, kind and very alert. they made our stay so much better. we were with a 1 1/2yr baby, and they made sure she was made special meals. loved the place!! highly recommend it to anyone!!

My family stayed here, attending a beautiful wedding ceremony. Our two kids loved the spacious pool and the food. The staff were very kind and alert to our needs. The hotel was quick in contacting a doctor for us when one of the kids fell ill, this always being a concern when you travel. Make sure you ask the staff to spray your room for Mosquitos.

Lovely looking hotel with a beautiful location. A few irritations though - no soap in the rooms, just two empty soap boxes in the bathroom bin! The boutique appeared to have exactly what I was looking for, but despite three trips to the shop and finding the "open" sign in the window, the door was locked and nobody was there. As we had to depart, I didn't have time to try to find someone. On arrival we had to remind the reception staff to give us back our passports. And there was extraordinarily loud drumming below our room for perhaps 45 minutes after dinner! We presumed there must have been some sort of cultural show on that we hadn't been told about. We were just starting to get really tired of it when it stopped. We had dinner in our room, and it was served quite promptly and was delicious. Breakfast was also delicious, with a great variety. Despite this list of irritations, the hotel was quite lovely, and if we had been staying longer, we would have taken the trouble to sort them out.

We attended a wedding at Heritance Ahungalla and stayed for four nights. The staff was very service minded, kind to our kids and intend on giving us the best possible experience on our stay. Our two small boys really enjoyed the pools and catching crabs on the beach with the help of the friendly guards seated at the hotel perimeter. The breakfast buffet was good and overwhelming in choice. Lunch at the pool bar is recommendable and the eating options (different restaurants) are generally very good. However, we tried the Mustard restaurant twice but were not so impressed with the meals here.

We stayed here for a four night beach stay to end our tour of Sri Lanka. The hotel is in a nice location next to the beach. It has two pools, one near the main foyer and another one in a quieter spot - you can't see the beach from this pool but it is nicer and used more than the other one. We checked in on a Sunday afternoon - although it is low season, during the weekends the hotel is still fully booked due to package specials. This meant the reception was very busy when we got in and may be why we were allocated a poor standard room initially. It was dirty and had an overpowering musty smell - we were very disappointed, but fortunately after a few hours we were able to go in a much nicer room without the smell and a good view over looking the ocean. We generally felt that our stay here was below the quality of stays we have had a similar resorts. Some staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was enjoyable, but then some staff were not as accommodating. For example there are hawkers from the beach that come up in to the resort, so that when we were relaxing they would be yelling out to us to buy their wares - there is a security guard there so it is hard to believe they are even allowed to do this. We were even more shocked when one of the pool attendants actually encouraged us to buy a shirt from one of them! The beach is not actually very nice to spend time on due to a lot of rubbish washed up on the shore. We stayed on a half board basis so ate at the hotel a lot and the quality of the meals was a bit inconsistent. The first night dinner buffet was very limited so we asked to have a la carte and this was kindly provided. The next night, there were so few guests that a special a la carte menu was offered - we had a seafood dish and wow - it was literally the best meal we had during our whole Sri Lankan holiday! Then we had a great buffet one night with lots of beautiful hot and fresh food. We also ordered lunches and the menu was quite limited - again we had some great dishes and some that were a little disappointing.

We attended a wedding at Heritance Ahungalla and stayed for five nights. It was a great stay. The hotel staff was very serviceminded and the hotel facilities are great. Our kids especially enjoyed the two very large pools.

We were staying there at the New Year 2012/2013. In real, we didnt choose this hotel, it had choosen us)) of the mistake in booking of our touroperator. Some persons of staff were very polient and helpful. Breakfast could be more various and tasteful, I think. Prices for dinners were too high and we didnt take it. Nice beach, but there are a lot of local people, who always wanted you to buy something. Somebody of them could be really crazy, so please, dont walking alone by yourself at the beach. Rooms are nice, but it needed renovation in parts. There are not directly view at the ocean, but in the garden there are a lot of funny animals. Probably for somebody it is nice place, but I am nor sure that we would like to return there again.

One of the most beautiful hotels in Sri Lanka (we've stayed in 6 different ones on our trip). The grounds are wonderful, gorgeous pools with beautifully kept landscaping, very friendly staff, great food although the breakfast area can be a bit messy on the weekend, but their chocolate croissants are the best we've had in Sri Lanka. The cereal display could use some organizing (bowls were missing). The chef was very kind and accomodating as I was craving mangoes and he kindly sent over a big plate of mango slices although it wasn't offered at the breakfast buffet! The restaurant staff was always smiling and ready to assist you. We were upgraded to an incredible suite on the second floor due to a reservation problem, and it seriously made our stay even more enjoyable. Comfort, luxury, and relaxation at their finest! The hotel has a very well equipped gym that overlooks the pool area and the gardens. Unfortunately, we didn't get to play tennis although we really wanted to (lack of time), nor play table tennis and pool, but if you're looking for entertainment and/or activities to do while you're at the hotel, you won't be disappointed :-) Try the a la carte restaurant outside near the main pool; the food is excellent. Very reasonable prices although a cappucino and a latte at the main lobby were a bit overpriced. It was a shame that we couldn't swim due to the red flag, but I can't wait to return during the swimming season to make the most of that amazing hotel. Overall, a fantastic experience. Thank you Heritance Ahungalla, you made it much more difficult to leave Sri Lanka!

My wife and I wanted to have a beach wedding in Sri Lanka and we were looking for a great place to host our wedding. We had guests from all over the world, US, Denmark, Sweden, Australia, Dubai, Germany, Kenya and last but not least Sri Lanka (about 80 guests). So we were looking for a place large enough to accommodate our guests and have a wonderful experience, not just for us but for all our guests as well. Then we came across Heritance Ahungalla and we are so very delighted to pick Heritance Ahungalla to have our wedding. From the start, the staff at the hotel was very helpful and accommodating, and offered suggestions to make our event wonderful. The booking of the hotel for all our guests went very smoothly and Front Office manager Nihal from reservation department handled all the reservations with extreme professionalism. At the front lobby Thilini welcomed all of our guests and made sure that they are well taken care of. As for the wedding, let me start out by saying that everything went exactly the way we had hoped. We had the master of the ceremony provided by the hotel and also hotel staff was kind enough to provide us the best scenic location for poruwa (Sri Lankan traditional marriage stage). We felt like the whole staff at the hotel was part of our wedding, felt almost like a one big family. Food and Beverage manager Gamini Wijetunga was excellent and extremely helpful in planning the event from the start, offering suggestions to make our event very unique. He made things very easy for us. Most importantly, Gamini and the rest of the staff are extremely professional and honest. General Manager Refhan Razeen was also very kind and made sure to accommodate all our requests. More so, we felt that he really cared for all our guests. Food and beverage executive Dilum Samarasinghe was always in the main restaurant making sure that the guests were happy with their meals. He always had a very pleasant smile, and very helpful with planning the event as well. The hotel is simply beautiful and the pool/beach location was the perfect scene for the traditional Porowa ceremony. We were concerned about the weather and possible rain but whole staff at the hotel was very kind enough and went out of their way to offer optional areas to have the reception. Drinks and food was delicious and served with great timing. Our guests (Sri Lanka, Europe, US, Aus.) stayed for several days and had a wonderful time, not just with the wedding but also relaxing by the pool, touring nearby sights etc. Second pool at the side of the hotel was excellent as well. Pool boys were very nice and always around the pool area to offer towels etcâ€¦ In room dining was also excellent and gave us a good service. Apart from the wedding ceremony during our 5 days at Heritance we experienced a good variety of food at the buffet, with good Sri Lankan and Western options. Apart from the main dining restaurant, the bar cafÃ© and the Ã€ la Carte restaurant had excellent food as well. We would highly recommend Heritance Ahungalla to anybody looking for a beach hotel and beach wedding in Sri Lanka. All members of the staff (restaurants, reception, pool, room service etc) were very helpful and always had a smile on their face. We want to thank them all for making our special day just perfect! My wife and I, all of our friends, and family had a great experience and cannot wait to visit Heritance Ahungalla next year!

Excellent food selection and taste also good.service was good and was very friendly. When we were there,large group were there which came on annual trip.hence during lunch time restaurant was not enough and was felt cramped up.however staff did their best to cater, it's up to the management to up grade the dining area or have special arrangements for large groups like that. Other than that overall I am impressed

Everything was o k except for few service setbacks in some areas. But my concern is that the food quality and selection . it didn't stand out despite having the most awarded celebrity chef. The hotel must be careful in selecting the range if foods that compliment each other and food taste was of average quality. When the hotel is championing their chefs individual brilliance they must make sure same is trickled down across the board

Although we went in low season, the staff were excellent, very welcoming and the service was flawless. The room was very clean (twice per day) and the facilities were pleasant with their 2 huge pools and easy access to the beach. The restaurant was good but the menu A La Carte a little bit limited. The breakfast was good with a great variety of foods. We really enjoyed our stay there and we strongly recommend this hotel.

We stayed there for one night. Room was clean and big. The food was nothing great. it was all ordinary stuff and not much variety. There are 2 big pools and the beach was nice. The water aerobic sessions were interesting. Staff were friendly.

Large (i mean LARGE) hotel, feels like you are among thousands of rooms, room slightly shabby (cvery 1970s India ashoka hotel type), ordinary food... the sort you would expect package tourists to come in droves. the redeeming feature is the pool and the beach right on the property, where you could escape, as you could to a hundred places on the Galle road... would not recommend when there are a thousand other options here...

My trip was last September and it was an amazing experience with my wife at Heritance Ahungalle. The friendly and welcoming staff escorted us to the lobby and given refreshing drinks while the check in formalities were all taken care by them. I found the architecture of the hotel very interesting especially because every room had a beach view. A photo taken, seated on the â€œlovers chairâ€ near the main pool overlooking the ocean is a must do. We got the Tendulkar suite. I loved it so much since Iâ€™m a very big fan of the little master. The housekeeping and the room facilities were in perfect condition, which also had a private Jacuzzi .The complementary fruit baskets given to us every day added a nice touch. The service standards and attention to details by the staff were excellent. The main restaurant by the poolside each night was themed. The ambiance of the place was very classy and traditional. Both of us enjoyed the food very much which had a very large selection of local and international dishes. At the end of our stay we were taken for a hotel round up and were very impressed on how eco-friendly and efficient the hotel is. Will be back in Sri Lanka this September and hope to repeat this wonderful experience at heritance.

This was my third visit to Heritance Ahungalla and it's been a wonderful place to be with the family and friends for a holiday out. Warm welcome extended to each and every gust who comes to the hotel by the guest relation executives and personalize service starts from moment you step in till the departure. I was received by the Asst Front Office Manager at the lobby and had a smooth check in process where everything was perfectly arranged. The room was spacious, clean, comfortable and well equipped with all the modern five star facilities. The buffet had a large variety of food and perfectly presented too. Been travelling in Sri Lanka for a long time and nothing can beat the taste of the Heritance Ahungalla food. During my stay, one of my favorite place was the hot water Jacuzzi, which was situated near one of the two outside well maintained swimming pools. Had a nice time with my friends at the hotel's night club which provided the music and the entertainment. Overall, it was another fantastic stay at my favorite hotel and really enjoyed the "bed tea" which I got to my door step in the morning.

The Hotel is One of the best Hotels Where i ever stayed. The Beach, the Restaurant the SPA and the Service was very good and comfortable. The Girls in the Bar and Restaurant made a very Good aperetive/Cocktail with arak (thank you for the refreshing Drinks)

Mr.Rafhan N. Razeen General Manager Dear Sir, It is my great privilege to write few words about your hotel. I was fortunate to witness one of my nieceâ€™s wedding at yr property which was promptly organize by your staff. As the Groom was from Sweden , there were many different nationalities from all over the world from both northern and southern hemisphere countries. Being a sri lankan , I am really grateful for your staff for offering them the best of sri lankan cuisines as well as the real feeling of sri lankan hospitalities. We were really touched , specially the gusts from Denmark , uk , Canada , Australia etc.. by your grate sri lankan Hospitalities while accommodating all our / their requests as well as making us to feel that we are at home. Most of them had promised to visit your property in the coming years too for enjoying your great hospitality as well as the delicious Food too. Wishing you and your staff for great heights and success in your industry And hope to see you soon. Best Regards, Nishantha WICKRAMAACHCHI

We stayed at this hotel at the end of a 10 Day Tour of SL. Like all the Heritance hotels we stayed at this Hotel was fantastic. Great DÃ©cor, fantastic building (One of Geoffrey Bawa's), excellent food and most of all Fantastic staff. We really cannot thank them enough. The staff went the extra mile always. We miss egg hoppers.

Hi!dere evrebody whom I used 2 follow (Sir.Lalith Gunawardana),(Chef.Gamini) & who followed me & helped me 2 deliver da excellent service which I ever catered from da bottom f my heart ever since I've been wit u.I'm writing 2 u frm Mongolia frm where now I live & work as da chef 2 da 1 & only Sri Lankan Restaurant 4 here which is Ceylonta Sri Lankan Restaurant & Tea Bar.It's been a while I've left SL but here now I am catering my own guests with our own Sri Lankan Cuisine & I leave da restaurant each & every day with a smile on my face bacause ever since I've been here they only say "WoW! ITZ ABSOLUTELY MOUTHWATERING!" & "SRI LANKA IS DA BEST!".So I'm @ dis stage running da 1 & only Sri Lanka Restaurant in here its u da 1 whom ever encouraged me to follow da path to the awaitng future Sir.Lalith & Chef.Gamini & da rest of Heritance Ahungalla Family who always await 2 welcome YOU wit da genuine Sri Lankan Greeting & assure your comfort frm da start 2 the end.@ de end all da best wishes goes 2 Chef.Kasun & Chef.Rukshan as well as Sir.Lalith & Chef.Gamini 4 da Heritance Ahungalla 4 a delighting future!!!!!THANK YOU!Regards!Pradeep T!

I went there for my honeymoon, service was excellent and the staff is really helpful. The food is really really good, a lot of variety, and suits all tastes! I recommend it to anyone who just wants to go there and chill without any worries!

Its my fifth time in Heritance and the standards continue. They have a good selection on dinning, though the dessert range seem to have come down a bit. The Fire dance entertainment is a bit of a joke. We Sri Lankans can never do it like the Africans. We rather do what we are good at like a Low-country mask dance, would have certainly thrilled the visitors than the "Fire Dance". Such dance would have even entertained the Local crowd as well as the foreigners. Parking lot for the residents can improve. Big hump (almost not visible) on the entrance gate brushed up in to my chassis of my new 2013 year car ! Wish that did not happen. Also the parking area is full of grass. They have Baby/Kids care facillity. Had we known before, we would have been prepared to get use of it.

The stay in the Heritance Ahungalla is a wonderful experience. The food was fabulous & live cooking is also very interesting. Nice Spicy srilankan dishes to tickle the appetite. Rooms with all the facilities & nice architecture. Fabulous view of the swimming pool & Lobby. It is the whole resort team is doing very well & keep it up. Will surly visit again.

It was a full moon day and although cloudy, we were able to see glimpses of silvery moonlight shining on the sea and glitter of stars scattered over the sky. We opted for fine dining and were treated for a delicious lobster dish with wine and a wonderful dessert. The suite we occupied was well appointed and comfortable with all one can ask for, away from home. We particularly liked the solid wood furniture.As expected the staff was courteous, efficient and well trained, one can see. We received more than we bargained for.

My parents and I, together with two friends spent a wonderful weekend at this lovely beach resort last week. The hotel is a 5 star beach resort which belongs to Aitken Spence Hotels group and situated by the sea with a beautiful garden and two spacious swimming pools. The rooms are spacious, very clean and comfortable with room balconies overlooking the sea. The service we received from the entire hotel staff was absolutely amazing. From the time of checking in to the final goodbye, they were very friendly and efficient!! A special thank you to Nilanga (Ms), Indika, Dinusha, Nihal, Sunethra (Ms), Gamini, Thushara and the rest of the wonderful staff at the hotel. Food was very tasty & fresh and a huge variety with dishes to suit all tastes. We enjoyed all three meals on buffet and evening entertainment was great too. They had a live band playing at the Lobby and a separate Night Club with DJ for the young crowd. It was happening :) Overall, we had an awesome stay at Heritance Ahugalla and we love to come back there!!

Excellent hotel to relax and spend quality with friends! the staff is very helpful and the food was excellent.We played some beach cricket and the swimming pool was cool :).we got triple rooms which were Ok for three people.

The staff are very friendly and helpful. The food is excellent for the weekend buffet. The rooms are clean and comfortable. If the rooms are refurbished with more modern furniture and interior I would rate overall excellent. But overall it's real value for money.

As you come in through to the hotel, the view is just awesome. Can see through the lobby straight into the pool and the ocean. This first view is what sets the experience for your stay. Rooms were great, we got a double room,... but we ended up in something of a suite. Lots of space and great amenities. Food was good too, quite a big selection. Very friendly staff, really enjoyed our stay.

The newly renovated hotel has spectacular ocean views. Devastated by tsunami in 2004 this hotel is glorious in new form. On arrival we were greeted by lovely staff and drinks provided. Checkin was a breeze and rooms were clean, spacious and great ocean views. Buffet dinner was busy but provided a large variety of foods catering for all tastes.

Excellent hotel to relax and spend quality time with family & friends! the staff is very helpful and will go out of their way to make you feel at home.. we were really surprised to see the Residence Manager Sampath De Silva in almost the same attire as the staff walking around and talking to the guest unlike in other hotels were the snr managers tend to sit in their room in suit and wait for guest to approach them! Food is catered to the European taste buds due to the majority but with a local selection as well..Overall excellent Hotel.

Enjoyed our stay...my husband loved the suite...very clean,and must say hospitality in the hotel was exceptional...will definitely stay again..loved the food in the oak room..value for money,good gym,

From the moment we entered the hotel lobby and until we left, the hotel staff took an excellent care of us. They were really helpful, friendly and professional. The food was delicious and hotel surrounding made us feel relaxed. As we have experienced the hospitality in many hotels in Sri Lanka, like to note that HERITANCE- Ahungalla is one of the best hotels in down south. We would like to specially thank Dinusha, Sampath, Dilum, Thushara, Gonawela and Mr.Razeen.

It is a really friendly and helpful place I have ever been. Hotel staff is helping their guest out of the way if there is a need. Food is really good and large varieties. They have two big swimming pools and both are very clean and nicely maintain. The hotel is gifted with such a beautiful stretch of sea beach. One of the best sea beach location in Sri Lanka (although not recommended to have sea bath in off-season) The best place to have dinner at beach with your loved ones or friends. I should never forget Indika ( Front office manager) who is a real asset to the hotel with good PR and well knowledge about the other location to visit. I am sure that he will always there to help you with his very friendly staff .

It was a perfect experience on the beach of the indian ocean, nice pool, great rooms, unforgettable moments, the lobby is great and everything is just perfect, u can enjoe every moment. Nice hotel for honeymoon

I had my best holiday at Heritance Ahungalla last week. It has the best beach and scenic view from each room. We stayed in tendulkar suite which carries memories of tendulkar and remarkable room on his stay. Which has spacious living room, bed room, jaccuzi, home theatre system with 32 " led etc.... Mr. Indika (front office manager) was veryhelpful on our hospitality during our stay and he is easily accessible throut the day at lobby with his presence. Mr kumara (food and beverages) manager who catered us with some personalized menu to our table. I had the best sea food mix devilled dish which was sweet and sour served to our table though there is a buffet goin on. The buffet spread was awesome with some action station and variety of world class menu planned by world famous celebrity chef mr. Dimuthu. No words to say about the chocolate mousse and other desserts served Our bed tea was served on time to our room. Rooms are well neat and tidy. Hotel staffs from porters to top managment was very helpful. Remarkable thing is their smile and helpful courtesy carried out from bottom to top staffs ( from porters till managers) We would like to wish to have another holiday at this resort. I wud suggest heritance ahungalla for all trip advisor users that there is no any other reosrts in beach could cater you like ahungalla as i have travelled many hotels in southern costal Wish you all the very best

Another very enjoyable stay at the Heritance Ahungalla-or, as I still prefer to call it, the `Tritonâ€™. The food is very good, thanks to superb chefs such as Chef Dimuthu, and the service and hospitality have always been outstanding-largely because there are many on the staff, such as Mr Dayal and Mr Jayantha, who have worked at the hotel for years and take great pride in its operation. Management personnel, Mr Indika and Mr Sampath went out of their way to be helpful, as usual. The hotel has a unique and enduring beauty because of its location and the extraordinary architecture, the courtyards and the foliage that are found throughout the hotel-and which make it a nightmare to maintain (especially when it rains-and it poured on this trip, with monsoonal ferocity, giving me a new experience of the hotel) but thankfully that is not the guestâ€™s responsibility, although do be careful with the wet floors. What I particularly appreciate about this hotel are the different and varied areas it offers such as the private pool, the four bars, the library. So there is somewhere to escape even when it is crowded. The hotel provides cultural or musical shows nightly, meetings with the cooks can be arranged apparently, and an evening trip on the nearby river is very enjoyable. But for me the Triton/Heritance is perhaps best for those seeking a holiday `getting away from it allâ€™ rather than those looking for entertainment. I have stayed at this hotel at least once a year for the last eighteen years, and always emerge refreshed and revived. My one reservation on this occasion is that the prices in the coffee shop are exorbitant-more than Rs.600 for a banana milkshake! (In any case, I would recommend the Thambili-King Coconut- which is one of the cheapest and healthiest drinks available. I think it is cheaper than bottled water and it is a good remedy for dehydration).

We are staying at the Heritance Ahungalla during the monsoon low season, but weather has been great. The hotel is a beautiful Geoffrey Bawa resort, not new but reasonably well maintained. We have a lovely comfortable, well appointed room, spotlessly clean and attended to each day. Beautiful swimming pool (can't swim in the ocean at this time of year as it's too rough). Friendly staff. Great breakfast. So why aren't I giving this resort 5 stars? A few problems. Firstly the service at the outdoor bar area is very slow for simple snacks/ lunch. You wait and wait for a simple sandwich for example. Prices are very high. With tax and service we just paid 2,000 rupee for a bottle of Lion beer, a lime and soda and bowl of devilled cashews. The resort feels a bit isolated and there aren't obvious alternatives for dining etc. (that may explain the high prices.) The resort is large. Next time I will stay in all boutique hotels and guest houses for more personalised service and better value in Sri Lanka. I feel a bit ripped off at this resort (and we have stayed at a range of places around Sri Lanka). Even up market resorts need to understand that there is a limit to what tourists will pay for basics.

From the initial booking over the phone, staff was very attentive, warm & friendly. this was further proven at the gate, reception,what a courteous welcome. Great experience. specially the serene nature of people, and the environment. Food was plentiful ,varied and delicious particularely the dinner. enoyed the pool side fire work & music. Kids enjoyed the pool and beach. rooms were very clean. so is the room service. value for money. great place for holidaying

From the moment we approached the hotel and could view the picture-framed sea through the open-air reception area, my wife thought there was something strangely familiar about the place. Of course I insisted that she was wrong until the ever happy to please restaurant manager Kumara Karunaratne, informed us that this used to be the Triton hotel until it was destroyed by the tsunami. We had stayed here 18 years ago! I deservedly lunched on humble-pie that afternoon. Back to the hotel - there is no doubt that most of the staff at the hotel realise that the success of their business is wholely dependant on guest satisfaction and recommendation and none more so than Kumara (aka KK) and his team, who tirelessly greet you with a smile and a 'can do with pleasure attitude' at all times. It is fair to say that the property itself is due for an extensive upgrade and hopefully the new road from the airport, which is due to be completed in 4-6 months will reduce the journey time by half (currently 3hrs) and make this destination even more attractive. The bedrooms are spacious albeit modestly furnished and our interconnecting rooms were perfect for our family of 5. Parents with fussy eating children can relax - nothing is a problem for the kitchen and I am delighted to advise that you get exacty what you've ordered. All in all, we had an excellent time in a paradise-like location with some of the friendliest and most welcoming people you could wish to meet. More importantly, the children loved it despite their revision.

Great place for a nice relaxing vacation. Great food prepared by the olympic gold medal winning celebrity chef, the facilities and amazingly attentive service. Stay at the Sir Cliff Richards Suite and sleep on the bed he slept whiles listening to his music in the in room CD player. What a treat.

From the initial approach up the gated drive,the infinity pool in reception,courteous welcome: it only got better.Room was very clean.On ground floor,pool just outside the patio doors.Food was plentiful ,varied and delicious.We always ate outside.Only ever 3 or so couples out there.Attentive service.Cannot compliment the staff more,they were superb.Beach clean and big..Going back to do another tour in 2014.Heritance will be on our return visit list.

Great hospitality, friendly staff make home like atmosphere for the guests.This hotel is situated in a beautiful location in the southern coastal line. Room and amenities are nicely arranged for a relaxing stay. Two pools; guests can have a private bath in the green pool or can play water polo in the other pool. Food was delicious! All is well, highly recommended!

Another relaxing and joyful holiday spent at the Heritance Ahungalla! I've said many times before and i'll say it again the Staff at Heritance Ahungalla make your stay that much better, they are ever willing to help and always with a smile. To me they are benchmark by which I measure all other hotels in Srilanka. Pools, beach and room were excellent as usual

Stayed with family over the 24/26 May long week end. Hotel was packed with more local guests and the staff was making an extra effort to make sure that all guests are comfortable. A notable feature was the smiling faces of the staff. Food was excellent and the service was exemplary. It was a wonderful experience and recommend the hotel with pleasure.

We went for a long weekend with friends and family, and although I have been to this hotel on at least six different occasions before, and has been one of my favourite hotels in Sri Lanka, my previous visit was several years ago. The location is obviously beautiful with a wide stretch of beach right in front of the hotel, and the two pools (one general, and one only for residents) are set out beautifully. The service too was very good, with all staff members appearing well-trained and professional, while maintaining the warm Sri Lankan hospitality. Unfortunately, our room was not up to the standard we expected, and what we have come to experience on our previous stays. The bathroom had an inexplicable odour and even had cobwebs in some corners, and we found a cockroach as well. Once again, the hotel staff was extremely accommodating and let us change rooms - especially due to the odour, but we happened to find a cockroach in the bathroom of the new room as well. We only had breakfast and dinner buffets at the hotel - the food and spread were average, but not too impressive. The staff once again was very hospitable and accommodating. We hope the management will take necessary measures to maintain this beautiful property, make the buffets more exciting, and bring the hotel back to its former impressive reputation.

I always visit this hotel with my friends when I have free time. The pool is amazing in the evening with the sea view.All the staff members were very friendly and helpful and gave there best to enjoy our holiday. Food also good with lots of choices to select, and I do not hesitate to recommend this hotel to a friend to stay.

In this hotel i like the person plays the flute,top of the boat..at night it is just relaxing...food excellent staff excellent,room,atmosphere...some times its bit crowded though its a good getaway from Colombo to spend your long weekend may be with your girl friend..worth it..

My husband and I received a wedding gift of vouchers for a two night stay at Heritance Ahungalla, we managed to confirm our booking over the Vesak holidays and were delighted with our stay at the hotel. The staff and service were excellent, everyone went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and welcome. The entire vesak programme was very entertaining and showcased Sri Lankan traditions and customs in a very memorable manner, we particularly enjoyed the cultural show featuring masks and dances from various parts of Sri Lanka. A treatment at the Diviyan spa was a worthwhile addition to our stay at the hotel, the treatments are excellent value for money and the ladies at the spa do a great warm stones massage. Although the dining room did tend to get crowded, the spread was varied and tasty- especially the Sunday lunch buffet. I also really loved the fact that I hardly had to ask for my water glass to be refilled as the restaurant staff were so attentive. Overall we enjoyed a very relaxing and memorable getaway at the hotel and would like to commend the staff for their standard of service and hospitality. Mr. and Mrs. Jayamaha

We stayed at heritance ahungalla with family in May 2013. Our stay was very good all round. Generally a busy and crowded hotel during the weekends.. but still we had personal attention from staff and we didn't have any problems there... reservations - the guy was very helpful and ensured what we requested was reserved for us when we went there. reception - she welcomed us cheerfully and showed to our rooms without any delay in arrival formalities. room - comfortable, clean, good view, good in room facilities such as mini fridge, safety locker etc. clean & functioning bathroom.. food - breakfast was very good.. a lot of variety. dinner was good but mostly vegetarian (we were told that no meat was served due to wesak full moon poya weekend... bad... we had picked the wrong weekend...) staff - friendly & helpful.. ensured our comfort. didn't keep us waiting... billing - they overbilled us but quickly corrected it without any issue or delay once we pointed it out (please check your bills) Overall we enjoyed our stay there.....

Breeze, sand and sea Relaxing @ Hotel Heritance Ahungalla Nice friendly staff and Great Architecture is the best. Food is average. Clean and good rooms. Two good swimming pools. Yes.. Had a good time with my family.

At the entrance to the hotel there was a big advertising board claiming to have the best culinary team in the island, since another tourist recommended the food here we booked in for lunch as a special treat. It was a buffet priced at over Â£27 per couple which is quite expensive compared to normal Sri Lankan standards, considering all the hype we were expecting a grand lunch to remember. We were tempted by the grilled seafood skewers as a starter and this was the beginning of the worst meal in Sri Lanka ever. We could not eat them they were stale and tough as old boots. I decided to go for the main course and on the way noticed to my horror the cause of the awful starters the chef was taking out old cooked seafood skewers from a container and putting them back on the hot grill. The main course did not impress one bit the meat curry was stale and very dry, the vegetables were overcooked. The desserts were awful and the only good thing served here was what they did not prepare themselves" the curd & honey". During our meal we requested to see the chef to make a complaint regarding this terrible food. Finally a gentleman appeared at our table who was unable to give us any satisfactory explanation. We ordered coffee and guess what it was stale and lukewarm. By then we were fuming and demanded to see the manager who was very apologetic and requested us to come back that evening for a meal on him, how kind. He even charged us in full for the worst meal we had in Sri Lanka. Do you think we went back that evening for another repeat performance on the house, "Hell no". Do not be fooled by false advertising claims when you can get a much better meal from any roadside cafe for less than Â£8 for two.

We had an excellent stay.... Even our veg food requirements were personally looked into by Mr.KK the restaurant manager. The resort is excellent, comfortable with a beautiful view of the beach. Strongly recommended.....!!!

We stayed here for two nights. At first we were given a standard room, but our toilet was not working. So thankfully we were upgraded. After this small hitch, all our tour group was upgraded. This lovely hotel, has two beautiful pools and it is quiet and relaxing. The food at this hotel is also good, the staff are friendly and overall a pleasant stay. However on checkout much confusion with bills being mixed up within our tour group. This took about 45 minutes to sort out and when the cashier was asked for proof of purchase, he had to fish the receipts from the bin. This system needs an overhaul to ensure correct bills are billed to the correct person. Would definitely stay here again.

it was too crowded, cockroaches in our room, also food was not so impressive and the atmosphere was not good for a relaxing holiday the day we stayed there. Didnt like the bathrooms either. sorry but i think it should be a three star hotel Only good thing was the staff, they were so friendly and helpfull. will I go back , nope.

My wife and I celebrated our first wedding anniversary at Heritance Ahungalla and I wantto say a big Thank you to all the staff members at Ahungalla Heritance for making our Anniversary a memorable one. From the moment you step into the hotel you will not fail to notice the pleasant genuine smiles of the staff members. From the reception staff, to room service, to the staff at the restaurant to the pool attendants, to the spa girls everyone were very pleasant and friendly. You walk into a five star hotel and the rooms and the food are obviously up to high standards. The pools were very beautiful. The residents pool was even more beautiful. However, the credit needs to go to the all the staff for giving us such a wonderful experience. After all, it's people that make the difference. A very special thank you to Mr Sampath as well. We hope to come again soon. Thank you once again.

We recently visited Sri Lanka and spent 3 night at Heritance in Ahungalla. One of the best beach properties we have stayed at. The hospitality and the staff are real nice and warm. We got to see the Tendulkar Suite, which is in honor of Sachin Tendulkar. Beautiful swimming pools. They have daily activities conducted by the hotel staff, i.e. Pool Yoga, Kids Face Painting, Water Polo, etc.

I contacted the hotel & arranged a reservation for my parents & sister to stay at the hotel. A lady from the head office was in contact with my father until the day they arrived. My parents & sister said that the stay was wonderful & truly enjoyable. They specially said that the hotel staff, from the reception, to the restaurant waiters/servers, to the room service attendants were very helpful & always served with a smile. I want to convey their regards & gratitude for your hospitality & for serving with a smile. Keep up the great work. Cheers

We went for a 2 days stay at heritance last March.The staff were extremely efficient and friendly,which is what we noticed straight away.The refreshing welcome drink and warm towel was indeed exactly what we needed on a sunny March day. Although we had to wait about an hour more we were upgraded to Sir Cliff Richard suite which had both the sea view and pool view. Food was commendable although there wasn't much variety for vegetarians. The beach is just a stones throw away, clean and safe. The hotel had organized some traditional as well as modern performances for earth hour celebrations,which we enjoyed thoroughly. More than anything else the human factor is what we remember most from heritance, as the staff just never failed to greet us with a friendly smile coupled with admirable efficiency. An ideal place to get pampered like a VIP.

I meant to write this review long time back but a good comment for this absolutely wonderful hotel is never too late. This is the best beach resort in the country in my own opinion and is highly recommended for its wonderful hospitality, atmosphere of the hotel, the two lovely pools, quality of food, friendliness of the staff and the star class facilities in their rooms. They have a vast range of food at the buffets and theme nights for the week including Sri Lanka, BBQ etc. The rooms are very spacious and beautifully decorated. I would go there over and over again and is my favourite beach resort always.

This was a perfect holiday for us. The staff was excellent, friendly and ready to support us with EVERYTHING. We had great room with a very nice room boy who was making sure everything is in order (twice or more per day!). The hotel is a master piece and perfect in every regard. Lots of respect for the nature. The food was delicious, any special request was accommodated (more/less spicy, something special for baby etc). I've seen wedding arranged by the hotel and was regretting I had not made my mind on time to do the same - very special moment. I hope we will come back there!

I wnet their to celebrate the birthday of my spouse and never regretted my choice. They also arranged a nice surprise for her (upon my request) which was much much more than I had expected for. The location and service is really commendable.

On behalf of MIT admin and I may I express my sincerest thanks for the high level of hospitality, kindness and first class service exhibited by you and your staff at your lovely establishment. A special thank to Deshan and Shyamalee, We will certainly be recommending your hotel to our friends and hope that we can return some time. Many thanks again Millennium IT Admin

The hotel location is superb. The entire staff go an extra mile to make your stay wonderful. To be in such a lovely place where the only sound we could hear for a long time from our room, was the sea and the wind through the trees. Will go back hopefully

Overall, our stay was very good. We enjoyed the hospitality of the staff all the time. They are all blessed with typical Sri Lankan warmth and smile. Room was good but lacked the warmth the staff had. Most disapponting was the tea sachets in the room. I am a tea lover and looked forward to have a nice cup of tea and they had some stassens tea which was simply horrible. There was no taste but it had a dark reddish colour and an aweful smell. I wonder how the tourists felt about that tea and of Sri Lanka being a good qulaity tea provider. I strongly recommend that stassens tea sachets be removed from rooms as soon as possible.

I was with my relations at Heritance Ahungalla last week. We enjoyed the stay. Very good service from the staff. Some of my relatives did not like to uniform worn by the staff. We stayed one night. There were lot of local and few foreigners, i am sure therefore hotel might have arrange for more local food. If you compare the food with other 5 start hotels in Colombo i think they would have done a better job. We stayed on the 2nd floor rooms. Rooms were really good. Unfortunate thing happened to me first time in my life, i locked the all the doors of the card keeping the key inside, which led the staff extra work in getting the lock open. Thanks to the staff of the hotel i managed to unlock the car.

My party of 6 couples tour Sri Lanka annually. We have developed a friendly circle of Lankan friends there and never fail to enjoy our touring of this fascinating country. This property has always been on our list of hostelries and we do enjoy the ambience. Service is dependable and the food above average. The rack rates are on a par with similar European hotels and you will certainly be relieved of a lot of Dollars or Euros during your visit. And of course, the staff is paid at the prevailing poverty rate of Sri Lanka so the margin for this hotel must be handsome. And yet we always marvel at how efficient and professional the staff is considering their vastly underpaid salaries. As most international travelers know, these upscale hotels tout their in-room "convenience bar" as an enticing feature of their service. Somehow we are supposed to be honored to be able to purchase these exaggeratedly priced items. I suppose that the hotels theorize that throwing our money away on these insignificant "treasures" makes us feel socially superior. As a result of this, and on principle, my party avoids the handy bandits like a plague supplying our own snacks purchased at a mom & pop store on the way and use the bandits for storage. So it came to pass that I nonchalantly reached in for one of our Snickers and was horrified half way through that I realize that I had actually grabbed the hotel Mars Bar. So quickly I replaced it with one or our Snickers which was why the cashier at check-out time contracted a severe case of apoplexy when the chamber boy dramatically reported that he had found a desecrated Mars Bar wrapper in the trash and that a Snickers had been substituted. To give you perspective on the severity of the cashier's grand mal seizure, a Mars Bar, at 51 grams of sugar, waxed chocolate and fat, sells at 300 rupees, [current exchange rate = $2.37, mom & pop price 85 rs, 7 cents USD]). Through his glazed eyes the cashier could see a lost 353 % markup margin leading to corporate bankruptcy, for which he would undoubtedly be held responsible. The replacement Snickers at 57 grams (mom & pop 150 rs [$1.19 USD]) seemed not to appease him at all. Perhaps it was the total combined hotel bill of over $2,133 that clouded his aleertness and in the confusion we slipped out to our chauffeured car with instructions to the driver to out race the police if need be. I have instructed our travel clerk to delete this property from our standing list of Lankan hotels so that the cashier and management at Ahungalla can be absolved of having to host a notorious international group of candy bar thieves.

We stayed at room 260 from May 1st to May 5th 2013. After a change of our initial room which was not what we wanted, we enjoyed our stay very much. The staff was extermely professional, courteous and helpful. we felt that our needs were met and more. The food experience was memorable from local to seafood to international cuisine. The location and the beach are recommandable. We will surely recommand this hotel to our family and our friends and can not wait to visit again. A special thanks to all staff members who made our stay so pleasant, specially Dinusha (the front office executive).

Triton as we used to know it before re-branding, was a hotel i looked forward going to....unfortunately, not anymore... The rooms on the left wing are large & empty and the bathroom accesories were on the wrong side !! We booked in for half-board and dinner was hopeless, hardly any variety for a buffet & tasteless... but must say that breakfast the next morning made up for it !! The overall service was average, but the service in the dining area @ breakfast time was quite good

This hotel has a fantastic location with it's own beach yards away from lobby & main Pool. The 2nd residential pool with a hot tub is also decently maintained. We visited during the Sinhalese New Year and the hotel was packed. Seems very popular amongst natives. The hotel has good amenities but is in need of a major face lift project. Stayed at 250. Our Bathroom wall could sure use a fresh coat of paint. Service level is good and Check In was pleasurable. But our request for a crib was only met after repeated reminders and 3 hours later. Food quality in the restaurants are good but there should be more variety/number of restaurants in a hotel of this level that boasts internationally acclaimed Chef. There are only two proper restaurants, one of which is predominantly for Buffet meals. With no alternatives for dining around the hotel surroundings, a couple more restaurants of various cuisines will serve the hotel well. But overall, my two night stay was pretty good and relaxing.

We spent a night at Heritance Ahungalla in the end of April 2013 and really enjoyed the experience. The hotel is spread out over a large property on the beach. It's spaced out, serence and you have your privacy. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. Food was delicious and there's really nothing to complain. The stretch of beach that the hotel is on is beautiful....The drive and other places around the hotel are lovely too - several interesting antique & furniture shops. We've always enjoyed Aitken Spence hospitality!!!

During the Apr holiday period in Sri Lanka I was at heritance , I should say the property is located in a excellent place ,there are few hotel's in that starch but heritance stand tall among them due to the hard work of the General manager and his staff .from the time you step in to the time you go back you will be looked after like royalties . I would highly recommend Heritance to anybody want to visit Sri Lanka as well as I would visit back again when ever I go to Sri Lanka well done all you made my stay a very memorable one .

Lovely Atmosphere. It was a trip with friends so had a great time with activities... I enjoyed the food to the maximum & all meals were super, specially fresh seafood.The Beach was clean and relaxing environment. Service was nice & rooms were clean as well. Overall i rate it good & hope to visit back again.

We've been to heritance Ahungalla for one day just to spend our weekend.The hotel was amazing. We booked a premium Room but at the time of check in they said we have been upgraded to a luxury suit.Our room had a separate living room walk in closet , bath tub and separate shower and first of all huge private verandah with breathtaking view of the ocean. You get a good choice of food for all three main meals at the main restaurant and also you will have verity of restaurants to choose from.Even if they have an office party at the main pool don't worry you have another pool "Green Pool" only for residents.In every morning they have a man playing calm music with a flute at the main pool and that is so... relaxing. We had a wonderful stay at Heritance Ahungallaa and we'll be back soon. Thank you so much !

Heritance Ahungalla became our most favorite location in Sri Lanka. We have been to the property for the first time and the beauty is you never get tired of it. Staff was very friendly and the service was Excellent. Diviyan Spa was excellent... Do not miss a massage if you are there... All three meals were buffet excellent food and the weekend buffets you will get the best variety. Only draw back was the weekday buffet with less variety.. Prompt service from the reception and they took us around a wonderful hotel tour including the back side of the hotel which was an great experience. We will come back again.

We visited Heritance Ahungalla recently and observed some pros and cons that might be useful to point out. Pros. 1. As the room was booked as a part of our anniversary, we were given the most spacious room of the category and really loved every bit of it. It was cozy and relaxing. Our favorite part was how it seemed to be a sort of a separate building to the main hotel and opened up to the jacuzzi and resident green pool. 2. The hotel in general was very relaxing and spacious and never felt like it was crowded. well probably because it wasnt! but either way even if there was a heavy crowd it felt like you had your own space. Cons. 1. TV - Ofcourse you dont come on a holiday to watch TV BUT it would be great to have a few good options. The cable tv had very few channels excluding some of the most entertaining movie and tv show channels which I thought was a bit of a bummer. 2. The food was not great and not bad. Average I must say. We expected a large spread but it seemed that since it was off peak season and less crowd also because it was a weekday, there was very little variety and thereby "threw a dagger" to our expectations. Anyway Thanks Heritance for the nice stay and we hope to see you again sometime!

My spouse and I stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla for two nights while touring in Ahungalla in late-April. On the first night, I would have given the hotel a three star rating, but having stayed here for two nights, I give it a four out of five rating (I would have given the hotel full marks if not for some minor details). Amenities/Common Areas: Cons: --surprisingly (expensive) food charges. Shortly after arriving at the hotel, we took luncheon at the Mustard dining area. At the end of the meal, we were presented with a bill with additional compulsory 10% service charge (mentioned in the menu) and a 15.75% government tax, not mentioned in the menu (surprise!). Magically, our 30 USD meal became 40 USD. --sad koi not swimming in the moat around the main dining room. Pros: --the second (very large) swimming pool was less than ten meters away from our room, extremely convenient and inviting --douche in the toilet --two swimming pools of different depths. The front swimming pool had a deep end of more than 2.5 meters. Very nice as many hotels donâ€™t have such depth for lap-swimmers like myself. --grounds are extremely well kept (very green) Breakfast: The spread is excellent with a huge variety of South Asian dishes (curries, milk rice, hoppers), cheeses, bread, meats, etc. The only thing I found lacking were green vegetables that werenâ€™t raw or prepared in a curry. No stir-fried vegetables, no sautÃ©ed spinach. Room Description: Cons: -- We requested for a king-sized bed, but instead got two twins pushed together. This was a bit irritating with the gap in the middle. --Room service for a bucket of ice was prompt on our first night, but took about half an hour on our second night. --not completely spotless for a five star hotel. The office area in our room had cobwebs on the lamp for both nights we were here (see attached photo). --electrical outlets not the same in every room (we were shown a room with an international electrical outlet, but the room we chose closer to the pool had only Indian-style electrical outlets.) Pros: --The beds were very comfortable. --Direct access to the swimming pool and beach. Conclusion: I will come here again. The direct access to the pool was so convenient. The environment was so nice, casual and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family if they were to visit Ahungalla.

This hotel is showing it's age slightly. The rooms are fine and the surroundings are beautiful but just not quite top notch. However we found the standard of service to be superb and are surprised at some of the reviews rating the service poor. We ate dinner in the main restaurant once and the Mustard Cafe three times. One meal in the Mustard Cafe was not up to scratch - the stirred fried beef looked as if it has been made several days ago - all dried up. However all the other meals were excellent. Breakfasts in the main restaurant were very good. There are two swimming pools - one by the main entrance and one outside the north wing. This latter pool was huge and nice to swim in. We also paddled in the sea which is right outside the hotel. The waves were very strong while we were there so it was not safe to go swimming but the sand is beautiful. There are people selling on the beach - it is difficult to see how the hotel could get rid of them as presumably it is a public place. However we didn't feel too pestered as we just ignored them and they went away. All the staff were friendly and courteous. The room boy was especially cheerful and the room kept really clean, in fact they changed the linen more than we needed

Truly amazing experience . Excellent location, clean beach , great food and super service. Hotel .... Nice large rooms with all good facilities . . . Buffet was good with many action stations. Overall excellent stay and will be going back for sure !!!

While the food, the rooms and location are quite easily on par with the best Sri Lanka has to offer, the service level put the Heritance Ahungalla in a class of its own. Exceptionally well mannered, attentive and professional in every way.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Heritance,. The hotel is in a beautiful location with a very clean beach. The facilities and the food is excellent.There are two large swimming pools and a large garden. The staff was very friendly and courteous. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone going for a holiday in the southern coast. SCA Pelawatte

Our six day stay at Ahungalla was really nice with a kind and helpful staff. We was glad to meet the staff every day because they gave good service and recogniced us. Good management and excellent staff ist two things that really are special here. We have been on many hotels on Sri Lanka (>20) and the level of service so far is best here.

Let me say few words just after vacation.Hotel is located in really good place close to the ocean.Hotel staff is ok.Good rooms.Our room had great view on to the ocean. As I understand, Heritance is the best choice. Minuses: breakfast could be little better. Hotel staff should replace buggage trolley wheels from plastic with rubber to avoid noise from corridor early morning. Recommend to everyone to enjoy time in Heritance Ahungalla. Vitaliy. Odessa,Ukraine

Driving up to the hotel it looks wonderful, and it is. Great welcome, and always friendly staff. Two pools, set over a large area, lots of space to seat out. Set over 3 floors, long corridors.Gym, and spa (expensive). 3 restaurants, very good veg curry, best we had all holiday.Balcony to all rooms. Rooms could do with a little more lighting, very dark if you want to read or do work. The Large restaurant that is used for breakfast, is all enclosed, some times gets very noisy and stuffy. Breakfast food very good. Can be hassled by local sellers on the beach but they will move on once you say NO. would stay here again.

This is the second time I stayed at the Heritance. I want to go back there again. Its such a nice hotel with excellent staff...It was overlooking the beach and they had two nice swimming pools...The rooms were also great each having a small verandah/ balcony to have tea or enjoy some fresh air. I would recommend Heritance to anyone

It was home away from home; we found the friendliest staff at this hotel. Every staff member had a smile. The hotel is professionally managed and the staff is aware of whatâ€™s happening daily basis. Comfortable rooms.

Heritance Ahungalla is a beautiful hotel, with 2 relaxing pools and a wonderful beach just a short walk away. The management is excellent and the staff go out of their way to help you and make you feel comfortable. This is also a very kid friendly hotel with kids' activities like magic shows, painting and sand castle building planned over weekends. The rooms are well equipped and comfortable and most have beautiful views of the pool and/or ocean. The breakfast and dinner buffets were exceptional with a vast array of Sri Lankan and continental selections. Overall, we give this hotel 5 stars and would definitely recommend this to our friends and family visiting Sri Lanka. Bill and Prashanthi

In addition to the friendly and efficient staff it had everything our family wanted.There were activities for our kids. Entertainments for us and they helped our wheel chair bound father all the time it is needed.Two good swimming pools and almost every sport tennis TT badminton and billiards ete and the nice beach with TLC by the staff.It was a wonderful stay.

This hotel is positioned on a wonderful beach. While the hotel is starting to show its age the staff try very hard to look after the guests. The breakfast buffet is great to start the day and everyone should try the egg hopper! The beach is the real bonus of this hotel and the waves are great for body surfing. However, there is also one BIG downside. It would be great to be able to be enjoy the beach without the constant attention (unwanted!) of the touts trying to sell cheap and nasty products on the beach. It became so unwanted that we were forced to retreat to the privacy of the hotel, a not bad second option. Having spoken to the manager about touts it is clear that the hotel is trying to address the issue but is not there yet. I wish them success!

It was a great place to stay, will definitely recommend it to all our friends planing to stay in that area, we mostly liked the spacious rooms and the friendly staff, the two pools were very relaxing and the sea view is incredible, thank you.

i had stayed two nights at this Hotel i have nothing to complain about the offerings but would like to mention that i noticed there is some improvement to the service offered compared to my stay thress years ago, i also noticed that overall staff are friendly willing to help since i have a toddler whenever we go to the restaurant the door staff open door help lift the stroller up the few steps, many of the chefs manning the cooking stations were helpful one such gentleman was M.C.De Silva he offered to make us a simple toddler meal that our toddler would like to have in other words a kids meal free of charge, he was humble and extremely polite, his speciality was making great Hoppers that he churned out at the hopper station during breakfast to keep up with the demannd, i have had hoppers in other hotels as well but this guy knew the right consistency and performed fast in delivering the demand for hoppers.you get that feeling that you have stepped in to a hotel but then you feel at home with the service.

We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our touring holiday. Although we had a room with a beach view it was above the bar area - and each evening we had to endure really loud really awful karaoke type music. Luckily this only went on until just past 11 but it sure wasn't the peaceful, relaxing stay we had anticipated. We asked to change rooms but were told it was not possible. The food was luke warm and the service, particularly for drinks, was slow. We did enjoy time spent around the quieter of the 2 pools and the beach was only a short stroll away. There were touts but we got used to them, it's a third world country after all. It wasn't a disastrous stay by any means but I would describe it as more of a 3 star than it's supposed status of 5 star - so it's expensive for what you get. Be warned - it's about 3-4 hours drive from the airport.

The hotel was great, nice beach and good stay. Rooms r big n comfortable, lil bit expensive compare to prices in srilanka! Nice view but keep the window closed, I had 2 cockroach in my room! Week ends n holidays too many local w kids come to the pool, if u don't like kids AVOID it

four of us stayed three nights. we really enjoyed the food which were well made. hotel was beautiful and the staff was very nice and friendly. but we found for the price we paid, rooms should be of higher standard. Room carpet was dirty, had loose light fittings etc. Also found unpainted toilet walls making them gloomy. Overall, we loved our stay.

After a slightly delayed check in that coincided with a bus load of Australian junior cricketers and their families, we soon forgot any inconvenience as we were welcomed into the wonderful warm world that is the Heritance Family. We had a great time at Kandalama and this property did not disappoint either. We had visions of going "out" but it was too easy to stay in! Love Love Love this place!

The views are simply breathtaking, no person can take credit for the beautiful ocean, but this hotel is certainly well-placed to enjoy it in all its splendour. The staff are outstanding, smiling, gentle and very helpful at all times. The real excellence (apart from the ocean) is undoubtedly the food - i've been back a week and still miss it - it is simply outstanding. the rooms are spacious, clean, and although the surrounding 'gardens' are a little tired, overall an amazing experience to stay here. The only thing is the spa - very expensive prices, in an area where you can get the same treatments for a fraction of the price... I came with a friend - two mums and our 12-yr-old-sons - very welcoming, very safe, very relaxing if the kids love the pool and you enjoy the views/reading/sky-watching. I highly recommend - expensive, but worth it.

Stayed here for two nights with family in late March-2013. The staff are friendly and obliging. The breakfast, lunch, and dinner spreads were good. A wide variety to choose from. We were pleased to learn that the hotel does not use MSG in their food. The facilities are great. However, the rooms and the bathrooms are aging. Nevertheless, they are extremely clean. The beach is great.

7 of us spent the weekend at Heritance Ahungalla and the overall service was excellent. From the time of check in to check out it was almost like a personalized service. Food was excellent and had a good spread.Additional requests were entertained positively.

Staff is very friendly and the atmosphere very relaxed. The rooms are spacious. Food is highly recommended, specially the breakfast. Dip in the pool is a must and is a very relaxing expereience. Can accomodate large groups too. Ideal for corporate trips/ resdient conferences as well.

i spent a weekend here with my family, parents and in laws. it was the second heritance hotel i stayed, kandalama being the first.for me the highlight was the staff. all so friendly, attentive and very helpful and full of smiles!! loved that. the rooms were clean and comfy. the air conditioning was little on the warm side i thought. may be it was due to the very hot weather we had. and although the website says all rooms are with sea views (we stayed in deluxe) not all have great sea views, so better ask specifically when booking. the food was excellent in keeping with the heritance reputation, with a huge buffet with many options. breakfast was our favorite. only thing i noted was the lack of fish this being a beach hotel!!each menu had only one dish of fish. and no fish at the BBQ night. missed the grilled fish. the two pools and the jacuzzi were great spots for relaxation and some fun. not to mention the private beach with clean sands. a negative point is rooms being not ready by the time of check in. overall it is a wonderful place to spend a holiday with family, kids or for a romantic getaway.

Itz nice relaxing place with tasty food I got room front of pool I preferd pool room are good n clean with gud shower itz nice place to relax feel free b relax with this wonderful place. We had buffet at resturant seafoods are tasty I think I love the pool of this hotel

If you don't want a place that is too swish, but is warm, friendly and laissez faire, this is for you. Big enough for you to be inconspicuous, staff welcome you at every encounter. The food is amazing - but then I'm a huge fan of the local seafood cuisine. Great residents' pool, nice and quiet, plenty of room to swim. Nice gardens and grounds border the huge beach. Great value, and really relaxing.

We arrived by pre-booked transfer at Heritance Ahungalla at 8am. and were shown to our room within an hour after a welcome drink. Check-in isn't normally till 2pm.. Housekeeping were quick to install 2 'z' beds in our room for our 2 children, 4 and 10 yrs old. All of the staff we came into contact with were friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is beautifully designed, but in need of some TLC. There are 4 dining options at the hotel which can get a bit boring after you've tried them all, there is a shack half way down the beach which also serves food and alcohol run by the locals, and that's it. Bentota is the nearest village with other dining options and is 20 min tuk tuk ride away. The hotel is classed as 5 Star by Sri Lankan standards, we live in the UAE and have been very spoilt by the hotels here with regards to service and the hotels themselves, I would then say the hotel is more in line with a 3 star in the UAE or a 4/5 in the UK. You have to remember you are on the coast of a small island with the jungle on one side of you and the sea on the other, and that the whole area was devastated after the Tsunami of 2004. The transfer from the airport to the hotel too 2.5 hours using the new highway toll road and cost us an extra 250 Sri Lankan Rupees, Â£3 ish, on our return trip the driver didn't use the toll road even though we told him to, and used the main coast road through all the villages before driving through the centre of Columbo, 3.5 bumpy hours later we arrived at the airport. There are kids activities between 3-5 in the afternoon but we never used them as our kids were just happy to play in the pool, and we never used the spa. Electric sockets are circular 3-pin with the occasional square 3-pin socket. The bathrooms / balconies would benefit from a washing line, somewhere to dry off swim wear! The hotel shop stocks very little, so if you need any toiletries or paracetemol you need to go off site.

Quite disorganised staff. My car was taken to be parked but never given a token as reference. Fail to find the key afterwords which I had to go and select myself. Checkin time was 2pm and the time now is 2:40 ....still waiting for a room to be ready ....Will think twice before booking this hotel again.

I live in Dubai, so I know what a USD$400 per night hotel room should get you. Therefore, in Sri Lanka, it should be at least on par - if not a thousand times better. This review comes with a disclaimer â€“ the hotel did compensate me with a rather dramatic discount upon departure. I do not believe that this hotel can realistically charge the amount they do for this level of property and service. In the end I believe we paid a fair amount for what we received. They begged me not to write a bad review, so I will not, but I will state the truth. Letâ€™s start with the â€œprosâ€: - Beautifully designed hotel with authentic colonial architecture. - Lovely view from most of the balconies. - Several dining options available. - Good bathrooms. - Good a/c in rooms. - Massages at the spa are heavenly. Probably the best Iâ€™ve ever had! - Management responded well to our complaints. Now over to the â€œconsâ€: - The â€œconfirmedâ€ airport transfer was not booked. We waited 2 hours at the airport before they finally arranged. - Our room was filthy. Even after complaining it did not improve. - Room service, bar and snack menus are the same. No Sri Lankan food in sight! - Manicure and hair treatments at the spa were disastrous (rough nails and stripped colour from hair). - Dirty linen at all F&B outlets and room service.

Heritance Ahungalla is our family's most favourite seaside getaway. We've been to the property many times, but the beauty is that you never get tired of it. I have seen my kids growing up to embrace the ambiance of the hotel over the years from the days of their infancy. The staff has been very cooperative, sometimes even baby sitting while we ate. Now that my kids are big; 4 n 6; on every visit, they pick up a way to enjoy the hotel on their own. My last visit was on the 28th of March this year; a tight squeeze of one day between two hectic days. For the first time my junior jumped into the pool. It broke his heart to know that we would have to leave so soon. In fact, both were sulky with misty eyes when we left. They only asked, "When are we coming back?" We thought of altering our regular April holiday plan and now have decided to visit Hertinace Ahungalla again for three nights this April. The place really deserves it. You find the most amazing Front Office Manager; Indika, great support in the restaurant and wonderful crew everywhere; very friendly, energetic and ready to help. The rooms are very clean, spacious and comfy. The beds are cozy and snugly. Bawa's architecture in this property, is family friendly and cheerful. The beach is safe n inviting. To me, the sea, the pool and the Jacuzzi make up the right blend to spend the day. Awesome! Can't wait to get back.

This was the first time in Sri Lanka and what a beautiful experience. Hotel has open lobby with pool and beach that you can see upon arrival. When arrived we were accommodated and given a very refreshing welcome drink. Room key was given quite fast, however instead of the booked king bedroom we were given a twin room. Once approached they changed our room and provide us with correct one. Pools are very nice and the ocean view is fantastic. Food in the restaurant was very good with good variety and quality. Overall we really enjoyed the place and staff was very friendly and always willing to help.

If you are looking for a beach resort along the west coast of Sri Lanka, Heritance Ahungalla is just perfect ! It has everything you would need/want/desire !!! Pool Activities - water aerobics was just great, Beach Activities, Relaxation at the spa, Excellent Food, Great Service.....Beautiful and comfortable rooms....it had everything....just did not find the need to go out of the resort for anything what-so-ever. The breakfast spread is great !!! Make reservations for the beach dinner....TIP: Do not walk bare foot on the beach, some areas might have unwanted objects.. Also dont forget to take some time to visit the library and sit at the beautiful bay window to enjoy a good chat over some good books !!

Me and my wife and her family visited first time Heritance Ahungalle in 2010. And after that me and my wife visited the hotel every year for the last 3 times. And we are visiting again in May 2013 . I have been travelling a lot and visited many resturents and hotels. And out of that i have never experienced such plesent and wonderful service from anyware else. I was surprised to see the bad comment down from the chinese visitor bellow. I'm more than sure that we are not talking about the same hotel. I don't know why he wrote such a bad comment and I guess it is someone who wants to do some dirty marketing. But I guarntee that this hotel is very safe. There are security staff all arround the beach for the visitors protection and last time when i went with my wife and with my 1 year old daughter the staff really looked after us. We felt so much cared and respected. The food was great and infact their food is one of the best out off many hotels in the island. I RECOMEND HERITANCE AHUNGALLE HOTEL TO SOLO TRAVELLERS TO FAMILY TRAVELLERS.

I've spent two nights on B&B basis at Heritance Ahungalla. Actually my wife and myself had a good time at the hotel with its really nice surroundings. The bedroom was pleasant and relaxing. We really loved the pretty large beach area which is just great! also the pool was spacious. However the responsiveness of the staff and follow up was poor. E.g. My wife is pregnant and she needed bottled water as we have run out of the two, so i phoned house keeping .. hours passed by without any water at all.
