So i had to go my self to the bar and get two bottles. We even called the reception and they said they will look into it. Water to the room never arrived. Meal variety in ala carte menu was not good either. For people who signed up for B&B doesn't have a variety to choose from. Even at different locations such as Coffee shop and snack bar have the same menu. no choice what so ever and we couldn't make a decision as what to eat.

The waiters needs to be trained about the table etics as they try to clear plates before the client finishes having the meal. Also, we requested a tripe room and a double room was given by just adding a folding bed. They facilities for the room was only for two and we had to request for the third persons facilities on anf off despiting paying for a triple. the reason given by da hotel for not providing a tripe room was it was not ready of occupation. Thats the main reason I have rated the rooms poor. Tks.....

Came here for a couple of nights on our family trip to Sri Lanka. Rooms were clean and comfortable and service was overall very good. The main breakfast / dinner restaurant was always smoky (from preparing food) and it seemed there was no air con or exhaust fan to remove the smoke. Selection of food at the buffet was good. Cocktails were poorly made and extremely strong! Pool was not as clean as expected and it didn't seem that it was cleaned everyday. Jacuzzi was full of sand. The shower glass in our bathroom had soap scum which looked like it hadn't been cleaned for a month. Security around the perimeter of the hotel especially on the beach side needs to be beefed up. There were a few people around the beach who were hassling the patrons. The positives were that there was a live band at the bar every night and amazing views of the beach from the rooms. Overall, average especially for a resort that is meant to be 5 star.

HOTEL: We stayed at the Heritance for 10 Nights. The hotel and staff are lovely. After reading a previous review about being to scared to leave the room, i feel that this is an insult the the hard working staff there. At no point did we feel we threatened by staff, housekeeping staff smiled and never asked for a tip and the same said with the staff in the bar area. I suppose the hotel could do with a lick of paint but as for broken sunbeds i didnt see any, and there was always loads to choose from. The only negative thing about the room is the size of the fridge which is very small. But again it wasnt a real problem. YES.. you tip for most things but we never felt preasured to do so, and even if you do its 100rs at a time! The sellers on the beach are a bit of a pain, but a firm no and they go off to the next person, and after a while getting the same response from us they didnt even bother. Our room was on the 3rd floor and it was lovely, and we even had our own little gekcho which was great for eating insects. Our room was cleaned twice a day with clean towels and more water. The food was lovely, the only downside is there isnt much options for vegitarians. The only major downside with ther Heritance was location. when we travel we like to go out and try local resturants which is why we booked b&b, however other then the little fish resturant (which is cheap with lovely food) along the beach there isnt anything walking distance. We did take a taxi RS3500 (that waited 3hrs and brought us back to the hotel) to Hikkaduwa where you'll find bars/resturants and several rotty cafe. If we'd of known this we would of booked HB as we ended up spending most evenings eating in the hotel. TOURS: We did several trips whilst in Sri Lanka. The first to Uda Walawe park, as much as it was a long drive it was lovely to see the elephants roaming around freely, its def worth a visit. We then did a 2 day trip to Kandy and Sigiriya again a lot of driving, we stopped off at a tea shop on the way which was ok, then the botanical gardens which is a lovely place to sit with an ice cream and watch the world go by. We then went to the temple of tooth which was lovely, and to be honest go without a guide as ours was a bit of an idiot trying to get us to pay for him to study etc etc.. which we felt was very cheeky whilst inside a buddhist temple!!! In Kandy We stayed at Chaaya Citadel which was lovely and great food, to be honest it was a shame we only stayed the night. The next day we had an early start and more driving to Sigiriya, this was via a spice market and to be honest at 830am we probably wasnt the most awake customers!! but we listened and left! Once we arrived at Sigirya we headed up the many steps in the mid morning heat!!! the views at the top are lovely and make for great photos, they even had a family of monkeys that live on the top. Then it was the 7hr drive back to the hotel. Be warned your driver will take you to various tea/gem and spice shops!!!! We asked our driver if we could skip these but its something they have to do, even though we put our foot down and said no to the gem store. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Heritance and its lovely staff.

We stayed at this hotel for four days and it was the worst hotel experience ever. A COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY AND A VERY EXPENSIVE DISASTER! I recommend reading the lowest reviews for this hotel before you book; there is a real discrepancy between the nightmare reviews and those that are praising this hotel. Make sure you understand what is the worst that could happen to you also if you choose to stay here, because the worst scenario did happen to us. We did not read what the low ratings on Tripadvisor said about the Heritance Ahungalla. We wished we did because so many of these complaints reflect our experience. My friend and I are both seasoned travelers, and have stayed in both five star accommodation and budget ones, all over the world. Given the cost of staying at this hotel, we were both incredibly disappointed and also traumatised during their stay. We felt so uncomfortable and threatened during our stay that we locked ourselves in our hotel room. We have lodged a formal complaint to the travel agency about our stay at the Heritance Ahungalla. Our main complaints are as follows: - Worst service: for the entire duration of the trip, the staff was incredibly rude. There was no â€˜hospitalityâ€™. The staff pestered us repeatedly for tips, from the receptionist to cleaning staff to waiters. When we made all the complaints listed below to the staff, we were completely ignored and were shouted at. No attempts were made to apologise or to resolve the problems. We were incredibly frustrated by this, and were very close to tears. - Terribly unhygienic: stained bedsheets, dust and mould. Restaurant tableware and cutlery was not cleaned properly and had stains. - Pests: cockroaches, flies and mosquitoes in the bedroom and the bathroom. - Touts: The hotel was full of touts, from the pool to the beach, also pestering us and other guests to buy their goods. At one point, one of the touts even made a completely disgusting sexual advance on my friend! The hotel made no effort to safeguard the safety and/or privacy of their guests. - Food: the food was always lukewarm at best, and/or cold. Food would take at least 45 minutes to arrive. We ended up eating only burgers and fries for the four days that we were there, as it was the only food we felt was safe. For a holiday experience, this was disappointing. It would have been better to have just eaten McDonaldâ€™s. - Bad facility condition: The hotel is quite old, and many parts require fixing. A number of sunbeds were broken and completely unusable. We will never stay there again and are warning everyone who visits Sri Lanka to avoid this place. If you plan on staying there, at least read both the good and bad reviews to decide for yourself. There is a higher risk staying at this hotel, because of its location. It is incredibly far away from Colombo and any other properties, so if you arrive here and the hotel is a complete disappointment, there is no other property that you can escape to. BEWARE!

The hotel is of an excellent standard - first class attentive and friendly staff, lovely swimming pool and located on the beach. This is an ideal place to spend a few days after a tour of the island which we had done. The food is varied and of an excellent quality, but do watch out for the curries - the staff claimed they were 'medium' but far hotter than the average vindaloo in the UK!

Very nice hotel! We was for the first time in Asian and we are very happy about our hotel choice. Excellent location, beach is a pure paradise, alot of smiles, sun, fruits, ocean, a very good library with books and magazines in many languages, very funny animals around the pools and great service! A special Thanks to Mr.Nihal and his staff for making our stay absolutly perfect! We wanna alredy come back to Heritance! But we missed a russian chanel on TV and more varied breakfast (it was the same every day!) to stay on Heritance longer.

Had a beautiful holiday at the Heritance Ahungalla with my family. Nothing prepared me for the warm welcome and the hospitable and warm reception of the staff at this five-star resort located on the southern beaches of Sri Lanka. My reservation was efficiently and warmly handled by Lakshitha of Front Office, who continuously made sure that our stay was enjoyable. During our meals, the assistance extended by Anushka at the restaurant was unforgettable. Her smile seems to be permanent and I never saw her without her friendly smile throughout the two days I was there. The food must be the best in the entire southern coast of Sri Lanka. It is prepared under the careful guidance and supervision of an award-winning chef. Beautiful Holiday! Beautiful Hotel! Look forward to visiting again and again.

Highly recommended if you are in Bentota. Beautiful location, well designed hotel with modern amenities. Smiling & commited staff. Beautifully located swimming pools. You always wish you could have stayed little longer.

We stayed here for 3 days then visited Yala and came back for another 4 days the food is outstanding especially the desserts. The pools are both stunning and the wild life around it are amazing we saw several Squirrel type cute and friendly and several large reptiles. The staff are very friendly always happy and willing to help. The rooms very tasteful we had room 257 and 304 I like 304 best it is a little smaller than the others but the views of the sea and pool more than compensate. They also made a Birthday Cake for me which was much appreciated.

We booked this hotel through an agency based on their recommendation. Stayed two nights. We loved the place. The hotel design is unbelivable. Stunning as you arrive at the reception. The blue pool and sea are seen in one veiw. Great. The rooms were large and very comfortable with wifi. Resturant and food very good. There are 4 restaurants. The most striking thing was the service. Unbelivable. People so responsive and freidly. I saw reviews from past years complaining about the service. I guess they made a big change. Bottom line - one of the best hotels we have visited. You have everything, great facilities, great pools great beach and great service. Aldaag

We were met with cool drinks and cold flannels after a long trip from the North of the island. The staff were wonderful although there was some confusion with us being all inclusive (some of the staff did not quite get the meaning of this). We were upgraded on arrival to a beautiful room overlooking the pool and the sea. The rooms were clean and tended twice a day by very friendly staff who took great pleasure in arranging our towels into numerous animal shapes. The food in the restaurants was always beautifully presented and there was plenty of choice for everyone We were apprehensive as although we eat curry my husband is not a huge lover of it so we were delighted with the choices we had. . The staff were again exceptionally good and eager to please, We had an early pick up and the staff were kind enough to make us a packed breakfast to take with us.

This place was the highlight of the trip. The place is very well designed, amazing architecture. Although there was a slight glitch when we checked in, one of the 4 rooms we had booked wasnt ready. They literally took 2 hours to set the place up but it smelt really nice and it was worth the wait. Stepped out into the balcony and saw an elephant being bathed. then there were horses running in circles in the compound. It was amazing also because I got to share the view with my neices and nephew who were wth us. The breakfast was decent. Lots of fruits, be sure to feast on them when in srilanka. there's an outside-yet-inside sort of sitting area near the pool, connects to the bar. sometimes monkeys ( some variant ) sit on the tree tops but they're harmless and quite cute when u consider that they arent threatened by the development. Be wary of the touts on the beach. They're harmless but they tend to annoy u a bit, especially the ladies who are selling some thing or the other and they'll stick to you unless you can politely and firmly tell them that you arent interested. there's a seafood place on the beach, didnt check it out but drove around 20 mins to another seafood place which wasnt that bad but a bit overpriced. I would recommend this to people who can pay the premium. There are other options though if ur on a budget, closer to the last town you'll pass on the way to heritance. And, other than the curtains there are shutters which shut u off from all any light which might finds it way inside. the balcony is spacious too.

The reception area is large and open with beautiful views out to sea. The staff are welcoming and immediately cannot do enough for you. We arrived tired and fed up after finding no room for us at Jetwing Lighthouse despite a booking being made April 2012 (see separate review). The hotel was about to welcome the Sri Lanka and Bangladeshi international cricket teams and although there was great excitement we were made to feel just as important. We were told there would be extra security but this did not affect us at all. Bearing in mind we were not expected we had a fabulous 3rd floor upgraded room overlooking the sea and the pool. The choices at dinner and breakfast could not have been better and when I asked for some French cheese the chef apologised and said he would try and get some for the morning. Although it did not appear at breakfast the enthusiasm was there. Great hotel, great location.

My husband booked this hotel for our holiday. We were there for 5 days. Absolutely loved it here. It is an older hotel but with the best hospitality ever. Our room was quite large and with a wonderful view of the ocean and the second pool. They take care of your every need. You are greeted upon your arrival and through your stay. The Indian Ocean is right there so, as you swim in the beautiful endless pool your view is spectacular. They cleaned our room twice a day. Waited on our every whim. Took care of us through the stay. They have a "Upper Room" restaurant that was a bit expensive but the food was the best I have ever put in my mouth. If you want to relax, be pampered, and have the most awesome holiday ever, than stay here!!! The drive from the airport is a bit long but by August of 2013 it will be a 45 minute drive because of the new toll road that will be complete.

I visited this hotel a couple of times & this is one place you should try for sure irrespective of whether you are a local or tourist. From the lobby itself you can feel the difference. True that there are many hotels with wonderful facilities...some might even have better facilities than here but the real factor that makes a difference here is the "people factor". The employees of this hotel made me & my team feel very special indeed. They have what I would call the personal touch which is the most important thing. I was truly amazed as to how far the General Manager,Residential Manager, Head Chef etc is willing to go to make us happy & make the visits simply perfect! If I were to commment about the faclities....lovely rooms...infinity pool...great restaurants...bar..sat TV....wifi....animators, DJs to facilitate groups....night club..beach view....etc..What more would one want? And also the food is worth every bit that you pay. The range they offer in their buffets is vast & delicious...it'll fit both young & old alike...I would recommend Heritance Ahungalla for a family\business trip without any reservations! Looking forward to my next visit there! Cheers!

Just wanted to relax and did just that . Service was pretty good, very courteous and all staff could converse well. Room was in top shape ( slept like well behaved babies) , view was amazing, pool was fab and the food was just as brilliant . Had good memories from back in the day and glad we could relive it . Thanks !

Stayed here for a conference & was pleasantly surprised. This is a superb hotel with everything taken care off. Superb location facing the sea ( private beach ) with an excellent infinity pool facing the sea. I was given to understand that this property was hit during tsunami...but now nobody can say so..such wonderfully it has been kept. Service is excellent & the staff really tries their best to keep every guest happy & contended. They give a very traditional welcome which is nice. Rooms are very good..but the only drawback is the room air conditioning. Hope they could improve that what with Sri Lanka remaining hot & humid most of the time. Breakfast service is very good & the quality of food is top class! They have nice bars. The hotel also organises local boat trips which is very nice. This would be a very good place to come with family & I would love to do so at some point. The hotel gets the local craftsmen to sell their wares each evening...and each day a different set of villagers come to sell different types of local manufactured goods. This was a nice gesture and tourists like us could buy the local stuff without bothering to get out of the hotel. On one evening, we had an event in the open facing the sea...but due to a sudden downpour, we had to change indoors. To my surprise, the hotel team managed that effortlessly in just half an hour!! Much appreciated. Would love to be back here.

We stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla for 6 nights following a tour of Sri Lanka arriving back in the UK on the 4th March. Our travel agent, Clare at Journeys a la Carte had personally recommended this hotel, having stayed there herself quite recently. From arrival and check-in to leaving 6 nights later we had a superb experience and a very restful holiday. Our room was on the 3rd floor, overlooking the hotel guests only swimming pool, with a wonderful view over the beach and out over the sea, great for watching the sunset! The room was spacious and modern (the hotel was built in the early 1980's but you would not know it because it has been very well kept and updated) and kept immaculately whilst we were there, with fresh towels every day, complimentary water daily and even fresh fruit. Dining was as easy as we have experienced anywhere and the quality and variety of the food enough for any discerning diner. The hotel features a Celebrity Chef on it's website and the results he produces justifies the hype; of course there were curries available at every meal but also a selection of meals from around the world with something for everyone and always well cooked and presented. The grounds of the hotel were kept clean and tidy at all times and we were always able to find sun loungers available in the spots we wanted to be sitting in. I'm sure the hotel was busy but it just did not seem frantic and there was a complete absence of hustle and bustle, hence the Tranquility and Serenity in the heading of this review. We were on half-board and drinks and lunches were charged extra but it was a very easy matter to charge this to your room, settling the bill at the end of the stay. We had no problems doing this and no difficulty when it came to checking out. The staff were just superb, always smiling, always friendly, nothing too much trouble and never obviously doing it for the tips. Tips, if given, were accepted with appreciation. We could mention many by name but if we did, we would not do justice to all those who helped make our holiday very special, whose names we did not note. Nevertheless, we must mention Mandulla in the Restaurant and the beautiful girl who greeted us at each mealtime with a beaming smile and traditional "Ayubowan" - sorry we did not get your name. Entertainment was good with the music from both the modern trio and the very traditional drummers and dancers a delight to hear and watch. Never too intrusive and certainly never blaring out endlessly and mindlessly as I'm sure many people have experienced in other countries. Listening to the guy playing his flute sitting in the old boat near the swimming pool on a morning was an excellent way to start the day, so gentle and quiet! It was possible to go out of the hotel to explore the local shops and bars, Rosie's was worth a visit and the beer, just as good as in the hotel but less expensive. Walking out always prompted the local tuktuk drivers to offer their services but this was always done in a non-aggressive way and if refused, they just waited for the next passenger. Money changing was very easy in the hotel and whilst we may not have enjoyed the best rates we had the convenience.

Last hotel in our Sri Lanka group tour holiday. Location was superb...street, hotel, swimming pool, beach, Indian ocean, what can you ask more ? Big hotel with open lobby area. Large room with garden, ocean view, comfortable bed, airco could be a little bit cooler but you can correct this with the ventilator fan on the ceiling. Negative point in the room is the lack of lamps/lighting. Bathroom, spacious, clean and large shower cabin, no bath in our room but that's what we like. Minor remark in the bathroom were the (polished) concrete (!) walls. Maybe design like, but felt a little bit as a bunker from WWII. Very large and clean swimming pool with free beds and towels on request. Bar, open on the swimming pool side, very nice. Beautiful white sandy beach. Dinner at the restaurant was tasteful, buffet style with plenty to choose from, always fresh sea food available ! Prices for wine are normal ! Nice selection too. Good service. During the night you hear the sound of the ocean, magnificent. Pity we stayed here for only two nights because this hotel is perfect for a longer beach holiday !!!

Stayed here on a recent tour of Sri Lanka. Took quite some time to check in, room was ordinary clean except for shower stall which was filthy. Service at pool bar was good, pool fabulous! Room service was good, food delicious, though they tried to overcharge, said prices had gone up since menu printed. Breakfast very ordinary, restaurant looked tired and in need of refurbishment. Checkout a bit weird but room service overcharge sorted.

The Hotel is nicely done, with an infinity pool and all the works..it has a great view of the Indian Ocean. The rooms are nice too and the service is quite friendly and nice. What I would like to change about the place is the food -- particularly the dessert option. I didn't think the selection and/or the quality met the quality of such a highly rated hotel.

Good location, excellent service, marvelous suits, huge water pool, tasty food and very pleasant employees (especially Annushka in the main restaraunt). One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. Highly recommended!

This being the fifth and last hotel of our trip (other than our final night being back at the Jetwing Beach Negombo), arriving after a gruelling seven and a half hour transfer from Nuwara Eliya I was a little disappointed with this hotel. The open lobby facing the pool and fishing catamarran with beach and sea behind was an impressive feature. There was also after dinner entertainment just inside this area although the quality of the singers was cringeworthy. We were pleased with the large room of the standard we had come to expect on our trip and our first floor balcony looked over greenery to the beach. Great beach but irritating hawkers. Buffet restaurant which I found a little disappointing and unfortunately although it may have been down to one family, crying babies at every meal we had. Lovely friendly and polite staff once again. This south west coast area including Galle which we visited was perhaps not the most interesting of the trip to me although there were some sobering reminders of the tsunami here including many graves along the beach road. The nearby mangrove boat trip complete with crocodiles, cinnamon island, island temple and fish pedicure was a must and great fun. Not a bad hotel, just not my favourite.

We didnâ€™t know much about Sri Lanka and actually we discovered Heritance Ahungalla by chance. we booked our family new year holidays for 7 days in another Yoga Resort, but when we checked in that Resort we realized this is not the place where we would like to spend our next 7 days and we decided to shift. We called few of our friends and they asked us to try Heritance Ahungulla. Due to new Year there was rush and the hotel was almost booked when we landed with luggage. We thought they might ask us exorbitant amount because of new years week. But they didnâ€™t and gave us 3 rooms for next 7 days. We were delighted. The Resort is quite big. The lobby looks awesome and there is a huge pool right at the entrance. The staff is friendly and speaks English and Sinhalese. Rooms are clean. There are 2 swimming pools in the resort one is very big another one is comparatively small but nice. There is a small Jacuzzi also. The health club is just a formality and has nothing much to offer. There is a cafÃ© where you can relax by having cup of coffee or a glass of beer near the pool side. You can have some snacks as well. For food there is a restaurant where you can have food according to there menu. For Indians again they have not much to offer if you are a hardcore Indian cuisine fan. The menu has mostly continental and European dishes and there are not many options for vegetarians. Though you will find vegetables to eat. For breakfast there is a huge buffet and you can get many options there for vegetarians as well non vegetarians. The price is on higher side when it comes to food but in any way this is Heritance. Spa is managed by an Indian lady settled in Sri Lanka with a staff of mostly Asians. Itâ€™s a good spa but again rates are high but if you negotiate hard they might give you some discounts not much but. The Spa is well equipped with Sauna and steam. There is beach behind the resort where you can go and relax and swim if you want. But there is a problem with the beach. I donâ€™t think its owned by the resort and thatâ€™s the reason the resort cant stop locals to come on the beach. And because of that petty sellers and some snake charmers bothers you a lot when you are on the beach. The life guards and staff of Hotel try to stop locals but they cant do much about it because after all itâ€™s a public beach. Foreigners surrounded by local people asking for money or asking them to buy something from them is common site. The resort should do something about it. There is not much activity from the resort side when it comes to children. Though they have some swimming dances classes etc but not much. So if you want some activity then you might get disappointed. The resort doesnâ€™t have much to offer. The new years eve was good and was organized by the management. The tables were reserved on first come first serve basis and buying of wine was a must. But it was a great evening. The staff performed some great items and the new year was celebrated in a grand way. Food was good too, but again vegetarians were disappointed. The service is good in the hotel, specially the house keeping. They even clean your room twice if your tip them well (but why will you do that? unless you are very messy) The only problem I always faced during my stay in any resort/hotel around the world specially in South Asia, they donâ€™t pay much attention to Indians. The staff also keeps you on 2nd in priority. For example, if you want to relax near a pool (everybody wants to do that because there is no other activity in the resort) so you need pool chair s or pool lounges, they are limited and mostly given to Europeans. You will see many Indians arguing for pool chair in the resort. Over all a good experience, but activates can be improved

Our worst stay in the honey moon while others Mt. Lavinia Hotel, Serene Pavilions and Heritance Kandalama being really great. Got a great beach and couple of good large pools. Service is average. Rooms are old and not impressive. Some switches are broken. Air condition control really sucks, bathroom door can not be close properly. Management should consider doing some major renovations.

Well worth travelling here from Colombo. Peace and tranquillity . Gracious service with a smile. The food was excellent . No need for a la carte as the buffet was superb, with wide cosmopolitan choice. Great place to chill out. Can't fault it , and would highly recommend .

Was at the hotel during a long weekend in February, with my family. Very relaxing atmosphere, and the staff was very polite and helpful. Lots of entertainment. Very child-friendly environment. Food was excellent.

One of four Heritance hotels we stayed in during a ten day tour. Large and has good architecture and enviable position on the beach this Hotel does lack the attention to detail that others had. No welcome drinks or towels which though not a deal breaker was noticeable because when we mentioned it the promised drinks later did not appear. The dining room was large but you were left to find out for yourself that half the breakfast buffet was in the quieter other room. Beach beds were placed by someone who seemed to feel the tired faded towels were far too precious to distribute. We had a good time but did not feel the staff overall were well motivated.We would return again to any of the others ie Kandalama, Earls Regency, and theTea Factory but would probably give this one a miss next time. Amazingly the A la Carte restaurant was not able to secure many or any takers on Valentines evening. We never felt the hotel was geared up to making guests feel special.The rooms were fine but some public areas do need a makeover. If you have a Mirror Lounge its probably a good idea to replace the rusting mirrored ceiling which detracts from the ambience.

Taking an HSBC offer for lunch dinner and breakfast at a discounted price at Heritance Hotel, Ahungalla our visit to this hotel last weekend was to serve a purpose. We were looking for good hotel for my son, his wife and the two kids (my grand children) coming to Sri Lanka end of July this year for a weekâ€™s holiday from Germany. For my daughter in law and my grand children it would be their first visit to this Island. So it was very natural we wanted the best available resorts in Sri Lanka. Having seen and been in many hotels around the island, Heritance Ahungalla vast space, a centrally located large pool, and the entire complex so close to the sea left us little to desire. Being very health conscious I found the salad bar was more than average to keep my hunger at bay. There was a variety of hot and cold food to choose from and the restaurant staffs were very friendly serving with smiles too. I would not exaggerate a rare feature absent at most tourist hotels: Meeting helpful personnel. However, a pleasant young lady- Vishmie de Silva- made it her second nature to disprove this common notion, by answering all our questions patiently. She took time to show the different kinds of rooms and all other the facilities available at this complex untiringly with a smiling face. She promoted and convinced us this hotel is exactly what we are looking for single handedly. When she finally leaves this hotel to migrate to different country end of Feb 2013 this hotel loses a valuable asset. I also know that no one is indispensable but there are special people who leave lasting impressions on the sands of time and Vishmie does exactly this. I am certain my grand children and daughter in law would not be disappointed with their stay here at Heritance Ahungalla shortly.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Heritance Ahungalla. The high quality service was evident and experienced from the moment we entered the hotel. The friendly staff were more than helpful and were ever willing to assist the guests. Their warm smiles added more value to our enjoyment of the chosen venue. The management had done an excellent job in training the staff and their friendly attitude is definitely a big bonus. The food was great catering towards international travellers without forgetting the local cuisine. The cleanliness of the rooms and the location in general is highly praiseworthy. We will definitely visit this lovely place again.

The hotels is a bit run down. beyond what i can remember and is in need of a good spruce up, But everything else was wonderful. We required an early check in but we weren't too bothered with getting the room as long as we can lounge around in the pool. However the reception staff was quick with sorting out the room. we also got a late check out. Room - was generally spacious. I wish the bathrooms were a bit more spacious though. but the room was very comfortable. Lovely view of the ocean. Food - YUM! I was craving something spicy (even though I do eat it every single day of my life) but The food was quite nice. quite a good variety and lots of options available. We decided to go with the half board option to make sure we don't really overeat :)) Pool - If you do go try to use second pool. the main pool is super hot. Not a lot of shade around the main pool area... the second pool is awesomely shaded and not too crowded and for those photo-bugs out there an ideal location. \ Pool bar - We wanted Lion beer which was declined since this was not the main pool bar but the second pool bar, so were rye bread sandwiches. the reason being we need to go to the other bar. which i thought wasn't a good enough excuse, but since we were in a relaxing mood it didn't kill our buzz Service - There was a positive and negative. However the positive is so overwhelming I don't really need to write down the negative but however it should be mentioned. When my husband and I went down for dinner we were after wine and didn't want anymore drinks, however one of the waitstaff decided to come ask us about drinks, which we politely declined. He was quite rude, he stood there pouting adn gave us a quizzical look. I was a bit taken back because I was definitely NOT expecting that. because as a customer we have the right to say no IF we do not want anything. but it seemed to be the wrong thing to do. But the positive was at breakfast I requested a bowl of ice cream to go with my waffle and Nihal the waiter (who is awesome) made that happen. I've been to quite a few places and some places have actually declined as it was not on the menu. but Nihal made that the best waffle ever! Also the hotel is quite spacious and large, well equipped with a library and games room and bars. the staff is extremely friendly and go out of their way to help. Also it was my husbands birthday so we got a cake courtesy of the hotel. which was a nice touch to an amazing day away from colombo.

The Heritance was our final stop on a lengthy trip around Sri Lanka and we went for a week of R & R with no distractions. After experiencing quite poor weather for a lot of the trip by and large the weather in Ahungalla was good and we were able to make use of the pool and grounds. We preferred to sit near the "garden pool" away from the organised activities and on our first day the noise of the "beach party" was extremely annoying. Fortunately this did not repeat but if you are after total relaxatioin you need to be aware this is a large and busy complex (actually it is much bigger than the hotels we like to stay in for R & R and we prefer a more personal service). Our trip was put together by our UK agent but we had looked at the hotel website and decided that an upgrade to a "luxury room" looked worthwhile. We were really glad to have done this and our room was absolutely superb with massive space, an excellent bathroom and a masive balcony on two sides of the room. We certainly enjoyed staying in it. We were booked on a "half board" basis so it was breakfast and dinner. The large dining room is quite nice but the low ceilings and lack of soft furnishings make it quite noisy and slightly impersonal. The buffets were quite good but not quite as imaginative as some of the other places we stayed (Grand Hotel in Numwara Eliya for example). There are several other dining options and actually it would probably have been better to have booked for B & B because the concession made for not having the "already paid for" buffet dinners was quite poor. For those interested there is usually some evening entertainment. Other than an occasional walk on the beach we did not step outside the complex having already been touring extensively in Sri Lanka and although some people may have been pestered by locals "offering services" a very firm no does the trick and you should not feel in any way concerend about offending touts - they are trying to con you!

beautiful hotel on a quiet stretch of beach. The beach had golden yellow, soft sand which was clean so was perfect for walks along the shore. The hotel pool was huge and offered "infinity" pool looks to the sea. Despite going on a local long weekend, the families and children did not infringe on pool use due to it's size. The hotel offered plenty of romantic dining choices from dining on the beach with lanterns surrounding the table to the "lighthouse". Food was tasty and service was personal and friendly. Rooms were big, clean and comfortable, each with a large balcony which looked out to the sea.

This is the place you don't want to leave. Has everything you need for a pleasant stay and a wonderful vacation. Definitely the choice! The breakfasts are very good, liked the menu and the service at the restaurant. The green territory at the hotel with the swimming pools are the place to be, very clean, the pools are great and right next to the beach. Every morning, after breakfast, we have spent at the territory. The hotel even has a library, not a big one, but for your convenience, they've placed a PC in it. The personnel is very kind and helpful.

It's what you don't see in the glossy photos and marketing blurb, but step one metre outside the hotel grounds (front/roadside or back/beachside) and you'll immediately be surrounded by local touts, who draw you into conversation with general chit-chat (Where are you from? How long are you staying?) before swiftly moving on to the HARD SELL (for tours, tuktuks, souvenirs, restaurants, etc), or muscling in on trying to carry your shopping and gathering around when you get your change in the hope of receiving some cash. In short, it doesn't make you feel like a human being; more like a walking Rupee or Dollar bill waiting to get rinsed. I am expecting the mandatory response from the hotel manager (does he really write these Trip Advisor responses?!), saying the hotel is working with the touts to improve the experience for guests... if this is true (and it seems to have been ongoing for some time), it simply is not working. A cynic would suggest the touts benefit the hotel in scaring guests into only using the hotel's services. We did this initially - a 9km taxi trip was a set hotel price of $27 return, compared to Â£2.50 single in a tuktuk. And the hotel taxi driver was hell-bent on taking us to a turtle hatchery, temple, Ayurveda centre, tea shop, etc. instead of where we had actually asked to go, which was exasperating. As for the hotel itself, one you get beyond the wow factor of the pools, the hotel rooms are comfortable and functional, serviced by attentive housekeeping staff. The buffet restaurant is acceptable as a day-to-day dining option and the communal areas are decently maintained. But will we be recommending the hotel or visiting it again? Sadly, the persistent pestering and hassle we encountered from the locals means the response is a resounding 'NO'.

Superb resort, large, well equipped, modern rooms all facing the sea, three restaurants, two swimming pools, nice spa, tennis courts, table tennis, very friendly staff. We were three couples all celebrating our 20th wedding anniversaries and the staff made it a point to make it a memorable holiday for us. Surprised us with cakes after dinner. The morning activities in the pool were great fun. Food is also good in all restaurants. A great hotel to spend time in. Something for everyone.

just as you enter to the hotel you see the blue pool along with beautiful sea beach, the garden the two pools makes you think what pool to jump to, walk to the room you are are there to enjoy. The food is top of the menu specially the action stations and the sea food.. you will love this place as the people really care when you are there

Our first stay here was in 1993, when it was the Triton. Subsequent stays started in 2006 (first week opening after post-tsunami refurbishment.), and every year since. Hope to return in October this year. We are not "beach people" but, if we're in Sri Lanka, we HAVE to stay here. NOTHING COMPARES. The people are outstanding... and that's what matters to us. The rooms and food are also excellent, but it's the people who make it special (and they know who they are).... stay there, and you will know that we are right!

Having dealt with five consecutive days of rain, the skies cleared up for our last day at the Ahungalla Heritance and it proved quite pleasant overall. The dinner buffets were delicious, lunch and breakfast as well. The hotel is also beautifully designed. Rooms were clean and service excellent, however that said the bathrooms weren't exactly spotless with some grout and mold found in the shower, still not a huge point of complaint. The swimming pools were wonderful and the hotel is right on the beach and stunning sunsets happen quite often. Ignore the touts who hang out in front of the hotel and by the sea who try to get you into their tuk tuks, restaurants and what not they weren't the most polite when we refused their services. Arrange your transport to Galle and around privately or through the hotel and you should be fine. Taxi's from Colombo should be cheap enough and they'll pick you up too. The only complaint I had was with some of the other guests; tour groups from countries I won't mention who smoked in the jacuzzi, were unhygienic in the pool, and frequented the buffet tables with plastic bags.

We spent five nights here on the beach at the end of a three week tour of Sri Lanka. At first I was surprised at its size but as occupancy was not particularly high when we were there this had little impact. Despite its size the service was efficient and very friendly. It seemed like there was a smiling helpful face round every corner and right the way up and down the chain nothing was too much trouble. Food in all the areas we ate was excellent. The couple we travelled with had their wedding anniversary whilst we were there and we booked the fine dining restaurant. We weren't disappointed. KK the catering manager found us in the afternoon and agreed a menu with us. The food was very good and Dayal and the Chef ensured it was a very memorable experience for our friends. We returned for our final night tethered and were again impressed. Wee also recommended it to others who had a similarly good experience. The rooms are standard and we had a large sea facing balcony. However I have never understood the need for some hotels, thankfully very few, to have windows between the bedroom and the en suite shower room ( there was no bath). Thankfully there were blinds which we utilised!! But Why? Also I though just leaving the en suite walls in the original grey plaster gace a dowdy unfinished look to the room. They need tiles. That apart the rooms are clean and well serviced. The hotel is right on the beach but the beach is over patrolled by pestering beach people selling there services and items. This does get annoying but there is ample space and loungers on the hotel premises for crashing out without being disturbed. The public areas are attractive and really well kept and offer plenty of areas to relax in the shade and have a drink. Overall I enjoyed the experience and the time to unwind in the sun before a return to a cold European February.

We stayed at Heritance Ahungalla for two weeks and had a really pleasent time. The staff is wonderful and very friendly. The food is delicious and diversified. And the hotel architecture is beautiful! The city of Anhungalla is rather small and not much to see but there are lots of nice daytrips that you can do from there, to Galle for example.

My husband and I arrived in Sri Lanka celebrate their 25th wedding anniversary. Land of amazing beauty. Second hotel we came to was this hotel, amazing hotel design, service and food. Strongly recommends reach the hotel.

I was so impressed with everything about this hotel. The room was beautiful, clean and very spacious. The bed was huge and comfy, even the cot for our 20 month old was the nicest we've ever had in a hotel, with a proper mattress and mosquito net. Staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. We ordered from the kids menu each night for our child and they brought it to the room each time free of charge. There was a massive selection of food at the buffett to cater for every taste. Breakfast was amazing with one of the biggest selections I have seen- the freshly cooked waffles were my favourite. There are 2 pools, both are lovely. We were always able to get a pool lounger and the pools never felt busy. Only small issue was it was sometimes hard to find a pool attendent and pool towels. Overall we had such a wonderful relaxing stay and would definitely return. Tip: If you require a babysitter it would pay to try book in advance as they are limited and we were only able to get one for one of the nights.

beautifully situated at the side of the sea.wonderful welcome when we arrived and that service continued throughout our 4 day stay.lovely choice of eating places.two excellent swimming pools set in lovely gardens to relax in. rooms were immaculately kept and well equipped.

Heritance Ahungalla is a beautiful property right on the beach close to Bentota. Unlike other beach resorts I have been to, one can walk directly from the infinity pool on to the beach and into the water in a couple of mins.. It has a really pretty infinity pool with an actual deep end for swimmers.. there are two pools in the hotel with one of them being very quiet, under the shade of a tree..very relaxing!! The hotel offers this amazing option of 'dine where the waves break' where they organize candlelit dinner for a couple with an exclusive table right on the beach with a 5 course meal menu. very romantic meal.. The staff is exceptionally good and takes care of the requirements of the guests. All in all a great experience, would definitely do it again!

Staying here for the umpteenth time. The best thing is that you can get here from Colombo in little over an hour thx to the expressway. Despite the busy weekend the GM and his staff went out of the way to make it an exceptional great weekend for us. Will certainly be back.

This place was amazing. From our arrival we felt very welcome here. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They were always on hand to help with a smile and were immaculate in presentation. The location of the hotel is idyllic, the pool was fantastic & the room was perfectly clean and practical. The food was 5* quality, great selection to choose from and reasonable at cost. Take the buffet breakfast! You may see an elephant wandering the grounds ;) This hotel had plenty of character, there were activities going on all day & entertainment in the evenings. We even got to try scuba diving in the pool. The spa was fantastic, we had hot oil massages which were just heavenly. We were very happy with our stay here, we only stayed 2 nights - We will be back again for sure! I cannot recommend this hotel enough!

I went to heritance ahungalla in february 2013 to celebrate the birthday of one of my friends. As soon as the staff knew, they prepared a very special dinner for us 6 at the beach , with a personalised cake and a decoration of flowers and balloons. It was a very thoughtful gesture, we appreciated it so much ! thank you for making our stay so special !

Have been to Heritance Ahungalla several times and have enjoyed it every single time. Good value for money. It's a fairly large hotel with quite a number of rooms, and is always quite busy. However, service is pretty good especially, that of the reception staff. Great rooms...tastefully furnished and clean. The bathrooms are quite big too. As for food, the buffets offers quite a range of food, from local to international cuisine. One of the best things about the hotel is the access to the beach and the sea. It can get quite crowded though. Like the fact that one of the pools is accessible only to in-house guests, providing more privacy. There was entertainment in the evenings, with a band playing. The complimentary water bottles and a quick windscreen wipe when we were leaving the hotel was a nice touch and added that extra bit to our stay. Highly recommend the place.

love the food.... they had a very good varity... rooms were ok.......pool was good...staff was very helpfull and responsive.love the work by J..Bawa.... its one of teh things which makes this hotel diffeent from anyother....but be careful if leave things in the beach as there are beach boys and people who steel the things you leave in the beach....sunglasses..goggles etc... beach is clean and can have long walks on the beach as it runs for miles....

In Jan 2013 I spent several wonderful days with my wife in the Heritance Ahungalle, work of one of the renowned architects J Bawa.The reception was very friendly. It's a beautiful Hotel for a pleasant stay. The rooms are large, very clean and well furnished. There is also a large pool area. Beach is clean and lovely to swim. [ staff make it happen ]The friendly staff will make sure that every guest at the pool or beach is looked after. It is glorious to eat out with the sunset.

Hotel is beautifully done up and the Rooms, Pool and Beach are Lovely. The Staff are Excellent too always very responsive, concerned & Friendly. I fell the Taste of Food can improve further to match the Hotel Setting and Buffet Prices. They had many entertainment items to keep the Guests on their feet during the Christmas holidays. We loved the "Jackson Five" performance. We enjoyed the privacy of the Beach and the Private Blue Pool. Rooms are maintained perfectly with daily House keeping. The place is extremely clean and safe. I would no doubt recommend the Place to friends & Corporates. Thank you Heritance!!

We decided to stay at Heritance Ahungalla during our recent trip to Sri Lanka for two reasons... 1. The taj At bentota was under renovation and 2. People generally had good things to say about it. However our experience was OK. Rooms- they are clean, decent size, comfortable beds...but they were somehow a little dull.. Otherwise the rooms were quite clean and the housekeeping generally was good. We had a beautiful view of the sea from the room Food was expensive in the fine dining restaurants.. Buffet and coffee shop were ok though. We didn't quite like the dinner buffet, the breakfast buffet was decent. Overall hotel is ok. When you enter the lobby you don't feel that this is a luxury property. Though it's clean it's really minimalistic. They say it's the geoffery bawa minimalistic design and I personally prefer less to more but This place was actually quite bare. The pool however is very picturesque,,,and very clean. The main disappointment however was the beach. The beach actually was ok .. clean and all but the ocean floor was not a gentle sloping floor like in bentota near taj. It's some thing like it will be 3 feet deep ten feet from the beach and then 1 foot deep when you go further. S it was quite scary for a non swimmer like me as I was not prepared for the sudden drop in the ocean floor. The service overall was good and very courteous. However, the fact that the housekeeping staff barges into your room once u call for a check out was something I Didn't appreciate and thought it was very rude. They knock once and use their key to enter to check the minibar. They don't hv the decency to wait till we open the door or ask them to come in. The other staff was very good. There were a lot of children at the resort and the staff was very patient with all the kids who were almost wrecking their Christmas trees and running around the buffet place like crazy

We ended a 2 week tour of the island with 7 days here to relax before the long journey back home and relax we certainly did. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and although it is a big hotel the service was excellent at all times. The reception area is big and airy and opens out onto one of two infinity pools which was backed by the beach and Indian Ocean. A spectacular view on arrival. The staff were extremely friendly without being overbearing and were helpful at all times especially as we had to call for a doctor at one point. We had booked a luxury room (357) which was on the far side of the hotel overlooking the second pool and whilst it was a lovely room in some senses I think most of the luxury referred to the size rather than anything else. It was actually too big! I say this because it didn't feel very relaxing. Although it had a seating area and flat screen tv everything looked lost in such a big space. Luckily for us we did a deal and moved into into a suite at the end of the corridor which was just superb. We had a separate lounge, lovely bedroom, amazing bathroom with jacuzzi and more importantly a big balcony from which to view the ocean and superb sunsets. There were plenty of sun loungers and space and the pools were big enough that they were never crowded. There are three restaurants to choose from so we avoided the buffet because the other options were so much better and more relaxing and the fine dining restaurant really is superb. The chefs here regularly enter and win awards at the chefs Olympics so that shows how good the food is. Once again, you cannot swim in the sea but the beach is lovely. You will get some of the locals wanting to sell you the usual clothes and tours but they were not too much of a problem and if you walk far enough there is a small beach cafe ( king lobster) where you can get the owners to cook you a meal or have a drink or you can walk further down the beach and see the villagers hauling in the fishing nets. It really was a lovely way to end three weeks in Sri Lanka. It's just a shame we had to leave and go home to snow!

Ahungalla Heritance can be proud of its employees. Most striking impression was their ready smile & willingness to help old without requesting for assistance. That showed their genuine willingness to help others. And food was excellent ! I would say too much of variety. Thank you Heritance, keep it up !!!!

We have been to Heritance several times and in my opinion its the best beach resort in the Island. The beach is exceptional..... its not shared with tons of other hotels so you have it almost all to yourself :) Rooms are always in excellent condition and very very clean and spacious. When it comes to Food they always have a great spread and even the a la carte menu is fabulous. The most important aspect of this gem of hotel is the staff - they are ever so friendly and helpful always going out of their way to make sure you are comfortable and happy. The Staff truly are the 5th star in this hotel.

Had a fabulous stay in this beautiful hotel... Rooms and public areas all kept clean and to a very high standard. The food and drink selection in the bars and restaurants is excellent. What sets this hotel apart are the staff, every member from room boys and pool attendants through to the managers themselves are nothing but friendly and helpful, with nothing being too much bother. I thoroughly reccomend this hotel if you are considering a visit to Sri Lanka... Looking forward to returning soon

This is a stunningly beautiful hotel is in the most amazing location right on the ocean front. When we first arrived at this hotel I was overwhelmed with how amazing it was and only wish we had of stayed longer than one night! The hotel grounds are like what you see on postcards picture perfect! The room which we were in was basic though nice and very comfortable, the only disappointment was that we were on the side of the building so we didn't have front facing ocean views only a side glimpse. After reading past reviews about the bathroom not really being up to standard cleanliness wise for a 5 star residence with limescale etc. we found it to be not so bad but it could be improved on which would make a big difference! The hotel itself is quite sparse and very light and airy with several different bars located around the hotel. The food was great though my only suggestion would be to have more of a western choice at breakfast as it was mainly Asian and if your not wanting to eat curry for breakfast your very limited to what choice there was available. I would highly recommend this hotel to other travellers but try and stay longer than just one night as I didn't want to leave.

My partner and I had the most excellent and enjoyable stay at the Heritance Ahungalla.What makes this hotel special is its staff and the food.This hotel really understands the meaning of customer service. We stayed in this beautiful hotel, maintained fantastically, for 20 nights and every day we were greeted with beautiful smiling faces, the staff had the "yes I can do" attitude and made us feel like home.Every day was a special day due the staff and their incredible friendly manner,from breakfast to pool & bar,dinner and houskeeping staff and chefs, we were spoiled by their attentiveness and pure kindness, The food is out of this world,the variety of dishes on the buffet,the freshness of the ingredients,the presentation and the taste was outstanding,every dish tasted like heaven.To our dearest Kusum,Anushka,Jananjaya,Nelka and Aeysha in the restaurant,Madhu,Puspakumara,Waruna,Indika and Lakshitha at the pool bar,Thilina in housekeeping and Rukshan and his chefs, thank you all from the bottom of our hearts for this unforgettable stay.We truly appreciated your endeavours to make our long stay the best we ever had and for that we salute to you all and to the management for treating their staff well.In sum we highly recommend the Heritance Ahungalla to all you travellers out there,there are no worlds to describe it just go and experience it yourself.Thank you again and see you soon. Yours sincerely Izra Mannan and Frank Herrenbrueck

I love the hotel, beach and food at Heritance Ahungalle. As you walk into the hotel, the view is amazing... you see the pool and then the beach.. It's impossible to explain you just need to see it. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and greet you with a massive, welcoming smile :) The rooms are very nice and comfortable and the food is really amazing. The selection of food at lunch time is amazing! If you don't want to laze by the pool, beach, or bar which is located close to the pool, there is a verandha which is also by the pool for anyone to chill out and do whatever they want. If i'm not mistaken there are one or two games available to help you happily pass the time. The beach is sooooo soft and the sea is warm at all times and you can wade quite far in with the water being at your knee. :) Love it! Have gone there atleast 10-15 times and i still can't get enough!

My wife and I would like to share our wonderful / memorable stay at Heritance Ahungalla during this short trip. We will definitely come back for a longer stay. The team of Sampath ,Gamini and Thusara took care of us so well that we felt we were being spoilt . As I told them in the service industry this is what make the difference. I believe Heritance brand should not expand too fast and special attention should be paid to training and succession planing not forgetting staff retention . A lot of respect should be given to old staff who have been hardworking and loyal which is something I could notice in this hotel organization . Congratulations and all the best wishes. Once again a big thank you for the reception at your hotel .

It's a wonderful place folks specially if you enjoy a great pool, a good spread of food with a choice to suit all types of palates, friendly and helpful staff not only to you but also to the children. Our only hassle was the delay in getting the rooms organised though the booking was made a week or a few days before our arrival.(Mind you this was a FB booking.) Once the rooms were given the unfriendly front desk staff or member of staff was so rude in asking for the rooms when it was time to leave.We were told that we could stay on till 5 or 6pm but to give up the rooms and to stay by the pool if we liked or anywhere else !!!Ha ha It's a hotel! It's a holiday! It's your job to be hospitable. Rooms are booked by people for comfort..a home away from home, if you took back a room or two and gave us the use of one room till we checked out at 5pm that would have been better.

This was our first stop of our family vacation in Sri Lanka during the Christmas break in 2012. We had given the hotel a rooming list one month prior to coming to Sri Lanka and they screwed up royally with the rooms. They had rooms all over the hotel on the second floor in both wings and it was very difficult for the family with 7 children in total to keep an eye on them as the rooms were almost 5 minutes walk from each other. They also did not have the room types as we had requested (one month prior) given to us. Some of the couple were given twin beds and the extra beds which were requested were not given at all. Food was very good here though. The property itself is a beautiful one with the pool and beahc so close to each other.

This is one of the best hotels in Sri Lanka. We spent few days there for our honeymoon and we had a wonderful time. Room was in excellent condition and I love every detail of the room. The bed was decorated with flower petals everyday when we arrived. Loved the specious toilet. To the hotel room you can see the blue sea and and you can enjoy the sound of the sea waves. Amazing. The swimming pool runs parallel to the sea/aligned with the sea, so when you look at it in a distance you feel like they are linked together. The entertainment area includes a piano, some board games, etc. The hotel was built with minimum harm to the nature, leaving all the trees as it was (you can see a lot of frangipanni trees in an open area in the middle of the hotel building) Also the garden of the hotel is so big and very interesting. Food was really good with a wide selection. Staff was friendly. Want to go back again and again. During our stay they played nice flute music (live) at night in the garden. This made the area so serine when it was mixed with the sound of sea waves, the traditional srilankan architecture, etc.

As a stand-alone resort, the Heritance Ahungalla is a great property. However, if you're looking for activities, there is not a lot nearby. The hotel itself is beautiful, a typical Jeffrey Bawa designed sprawling property. The room was very with a nice view of the beach. However, because it is a sprawling hotel, it was a bit of a walk to my room. The pool is a beautiful. It is large enough for children to play and adults to drift around without bothering each other. The buffet restaurant was just average. Most of the guests are on full board, so dine in the buffet restaurant. I dined one night in the a la carte restaurant. As I was the only customer, they set me up at a candlelit table on the beach with a private waiter. The food was excellent and it was a great experience (though a bit odd sitting by myself at a romantic, candlelit, oceanside table!) I definitely recommend it over the buffet restaurant. The spa was very good. The staff were skilled and professional (all from Bali) and the atmosphere was very relaxing. The touts on the beach were a bit annoying. Perhaps because the hotel is the only game in town, I found them more persistent that at other resorts long the coast. I took the boat tour up the river. I highly recommend it. It was a very interesting couple of hours with terrific scenery. (Besides, there's not a lot else to do in the area.) I suggest being price conscious. At the right price, this is a perfectly nice resort. However, there are other newer and better resorts along the coast so be sure to compare prices.

We spent three days at this beautiful hotel which is situated on a sandy quiet beach. The pool, the food and the general cleaniliness of the hotel cannot be faulted. The staff were exceptional. They couldnt do enough for the guests. We had a wonderful restful holiday. Perhaps the two areas that could be improved are - a) the evening entertainment needs to be improved especially as there is nothing available outside the hotel. Something as simple as having a cinema room would help b) the wifi is very unrealiable, which can be frustrating. Overall, very happy with our time at the hotel. M.J

Our stay in this hotel was most enjoyable. All staff worked hard to make our holiday enjoyable. Our room was very comfortable with a sea view. The hotel, grounds and pools are well designed, particularly the main pool. The team of pool attendants are the most helpful I have ever encountered in any hotel in the world. I would certainly recommend this hotel however there is one issue I would suggest the hotel management team consider and that relates to noise from the pool activities and the lounge bar. The hotel has two pools - the one in front of reception is the one seen in all their promotional materials and is beautiful. However, it gets very noisy as a result of very loud music associated with activitites in the pool including aqua aerobics. This mirrors the experience of another reviewer jennymartyn. There is a second pool on the property which is not quite as stunningly beautiful but is still a nice pool. However, the noise from the main pool travels and that spoiled our enjoyment on a couple of occaisions. We prefer to listen to the sound of the waves on the beach and the noise of the birds in the trees not head-banging noise from aqua-aerobics and beach based activities. A big thank you to staff including reception staff (can't remember all their names), Vishme (guest relations), housekeeping and pool staff for trying so hard to meet our needs.

Great location, nice property on a lovely beach! We spent 4 days after driving for a week through the pearl island and it was the perfect place to chill and unwind. On the downside, I feel the rooms should have been bigger and the glass walled bathrooms need better blinds!! That said, we had a swell time in this super resort!

We have just spent over a week at the much vaunted Geoffrey Bawa designed Heritance Hotel. We enjoyed our week on the coast but find it tough to rate the hotel better than average. No doubt in its day the hotel would have been considered ahead of its time however today its minimalist design and decor highlight the fact that hotel is getting tired. The rooms have apparently been renovated recently and they are OK however the public areas are uninspiring. We visited a number of hotels on the coast while in the area. It was noticeable how many are either new - Chaaya at Hikkaduwa or recently upgraded - and Surf and Avani at Bentota, or in the process of being renovated - Vivanta by Taj at Bentota. The latter, based on the upgrade we saw to date, is going to be fantastic. The Heritance will need to watch its competition. The beach is nice once you've been rude to the touts to keep them off. Tourist information is not readily available and most things you'll want to do are away from Ahungalla. We got most information and help in getting around from the on site taxi drivers who can arrange pretty much anything including motor bike hire which despite the local traffic we would recommend. Tuk Tuk drivers outside the hotel are bad news - rude and argumentative which we didn't find anywhere else. Finally the hotel entertainment is amateurish. At +US350 a night it wasn't cheap for what it is.

We were really looking forward to a relaxing stay here after a busy touring holiday but feel disappointed. When we arrived there was a beach disco party starting and the noise was deafening. This was followed by an aquerorobic session played at full volume, we have not stayed at such a noisy place ever! Tonight is Russian Xmas and we have two lots of noise, from the disco and the lounge bar! My advice? Bring ear plugs! Our room is fantastic and of you were staying with a large group or family and friends it would be great, but I don't think we will be back

Unless your dream holiday is to sit by a pool all day with staff continually at beck and call this isn't for you. There is very little to do around the hotel unless you have a car or a driver. we found ourselves getting rather bored of it, quite quickly. The hotel is on a stunning sandy beach but you cannot swim in the sea, and the areas round the two pools are full of Russians with money to burn. I don't like customers being rude to staff but saw plenty of this. However staff accepted it due to massive tips and pretty much ignored everyone else. Food in the hotel was good and rooms were clean but wouldn't go back. The whole hotel was pretty impersonal with massive long white corridors which reminded me of Victorian hospitals. This hotel was the final one on our trip so we only stayed two nights, which for us was one night too many. As I said in my intro the hotel was perfect if you want to spend all day on a sun lounger but it didn't suit us.

I was very lucky to experience the beautiful view and atmosphere of the Hotel. a very relaxing place and friendly staff I was very lucky to experience the beautiful view and atmosphere of the Hotel. a very relaxing place and friendly staff I was very lucky to experience the beautiful view and atmosphere of the Hotel. a very relaxing place and friendly staff

Beautifull hotel, clean rooms and terretory, friendly people. Great beach view. All rooms with a sea side. Tasty food (we took only breakfasts). Near the hotel you may find fish resturant with great dishes. Unfortunatly ocean isn't for swiminning near the ocean, because of dangerous ocean (big waves and underwater swirls).

For the layabout to do nothing, the fitness fanatic to be at peak, the gourmet to garner all the delights or the holiday maker in search of serenity, there is one place in Sri Lanka all rolled into one. That is the five-star Heritance at Ahungalla, where the blue ocean kisses the sand and the swimming pool stands between the airy reception area. This may sound like a leaf from a flyer or an advertisement. It is not. Thatâ€™s my experience during a week-long stay at the luxury resort. The absence of what seems an orchestrated hustle and bustle in some of the resorts, being left alone from the taunting touts on the beach and caring of the staff made all the difference. I fell in love with what I saw and what I enjoyed. The buffet meals for breakfast, lunch and dinner had a wide variety to choose from â€“ a cross section of the most popular Sri Lankan cuisine and a widespread selection of western and continental food. That is not to mention the fine dining restaurants. If you need to learn a little more, go beyond what the glossy magazines and flashy advertisements on websites say. I did that. The tins, bottles, corrugated boxes and other degradable items do not go waste. There is a team to sort them to be re-cycled. An award winning Chef, Dimuthi Kumarasinghe finds no space on the walls of his room or his tables to place any more awards including trophies. They are full. Ask him to give you what they call an â€œindigenous meal.â€ Itâ€™s a three course lunch or dinner with produce including catch of the sea within a radius of five kilometres from the hotel. I told Manager Refhan N. Razeen that I was pampered. â€œThat is our style,â€ he said. So, if you also want to be pampered in southern Sri Lanka, Heritance is the resort. Donâ€™t believe me. Have a go, try it.

we had a fantasitc time. Staff is really friendly and food is great. We relly like the beach and summing pool. It was very relaxiing. weather is fabulous. We wish we had more time to enjoy the weather and entertainments. We wii be back when we come next time to Sri Lanka.

Nothing prepares you for that magical feeling that you experience as soon as you enter this place. As a practice I generally look up the hotel and I must say the pictures just fall short in projecting the beauty of this property. The reception is located on the banks of the swimming pool and the pool is on the shore i.e. where the pool ends the sea begins and there is also a wonderful antique chair placed just at the end of the pool where once can sit for hours together. The rooms are nice and we got a sea facing room, it was neat with all the amenities in place. The food though needs improvement especially for vegetarians. We are pure vegetarians and there were not many options but the view of the sea more than makes up for the lack of good food especially for sea lovers. Overall, very good place to stay.

It was a last minute deal I got for an offer from HSBC Credit Card and i decided to stay at the Heritance Ahungalla, It was a wonderful experience. 2 Large Swimming pools which can accommodate many. The Sand on the Beach is so soft and golden. Very nice to walk on the beach. The Staff are very courteous and Friendly. Nice food spread. if you are traveling with kids, There is a kids club with very professional animators to look after the kids. They do face paintings, teach kids to draw and many more.

Staying right now in this property, very good service, given welcome drink, have a sea view room facing the 2nd pool. nicely decorated room, but was disappointed with food, could hard find decent food, unfortunately we r pure Vegetarians, felt the buffet dinner was too pricy as we were not too hungry, went to the one of the restaurants, and could find only 1 or 2 veg dishes. we chose the spaghetti Napolitana, was cold, and was like spaghetti dipped in tomato ketchup and too pricy. every thing else is very good. i think if they want to achieve a 6 star rating then they have to improve food quality and would have to cater both non - veg and veg equally. i only hope the breakfast is good !!!!!!

We just stayed at the Ahungalla Heritance Hotel at Ahungalla near Bentota..A super hotel with a breathtaking waterbody..followed by reception...huge pool & as the pool ends,the ocean begins...terrific symmetry & a wow factor to the view...The beach was good too & so was the food..almost everything was worth making your holiday very exciting...

this truly was the best hotel i stayed in Sri Lanka... amazing pools ( 2 of them) and great rooms .. we got a sea facing room & it was class ( only thing... the TV used was still an archaic CRT) good service & food options were great even for veg

Stayed there for 5 days with a group of 83 PAX. Great Staff always friendly and helpful. The hotel is a bit old on the outside, however is the best you can find in the area. The beach despite it's rough sea on that time, was really nice! The rooms were nice and spacious, the buffet restaurant was good with a big variety of choices. On the overall everybody enjoyed their stay. Really nice, i would definitely return again! Roberto

Location wise this hotel is located on a beautiful stretch of untouched beach. The hotel has lovely rooms and the staff are amazing! We dinned on the beach with incredible food by their celebrity chiefs. We stayed for 3 days and truly relaxed. This is by far my favourite hotel in Sri Lanka.

After a week of touring around Sri Lanka for the first part of our honeymoon we were looking forward to spending a week by the sea in a 5 star resort. Unfotunately we were very disappointed with this hotel. The good points about the hotel are the large swimming pools and the view of the sea from most parts of the hotel. The bad points are numerous: -During our stay the weather was very windy and it rained heavily. The hotel is not designed to cope heavy rainfall as it is designed in a very modern, open minimalist way. All the corridors, a bar and the cafe are completely open to the elements. This meant that rain was constantly pouring in and the floors were several centimetres deep in some places. This made the floors very slippy and we found we were unable to get around the hotel much and it made sitting in the front bar and cafe impossible as the bar does not have any front covers to keep the rain out. The staff are constantly sweeping the water away and moving furniture around out of the rain which was very irritating. The overall cleanliness of the hotel is not that great either and the hotel is starting to look rundown. The bathroom in our room had lots of mould in the shower(picture attached), and there was no bath option, you have to pay for a premium top floor room to get a bath! Having stayed in many 5 star and 4 star hotels all over Europe and Asia, I would say this is a 3 star at best, the other 3 star hotels we stayed in during our holiday were in fact much better. -The food is boring and pricey by Sri Lankan standards although you would expect that in a 5 star hotel. We went to the fine dining restaurant one night which was pretty good, although very run-of-the-mill options such as steak and mash. The desserts were interesting but after waiting over half an hour, when they arrived they were poorly executed and my dessert was not even what I ordered. Being the only other couple in the restaurant this was certainly not what we expected. The breakfast is also disappointing, the only positive being the traditional Sri Lankan curries offered. The omelette queue was impressive every morning and that only left under-cooked waffles, anaemic chicken sausages and fatty bacon cooked to order. The rest of the buffet was luke-warm at best. The fresh fruit offered however was fesh and ripe and there was lots of choice. -The beach is not for swimming or being on for any length of time. There are local people constantly waiting on the edge of the hotel and the beach trying to sell you things aggressively and stray dogs wandering about do not make you feel safe. The security guards do nothing about the sellers and leave them to shout at you whilst you are lying on sunbeds within the hotel grounds. -Another point to make is that there is nothing to do in the local area- we went to the 'turtle hatchery' before going to the hotel and it took us 10min to look at the 2 ponds in which 2 poor adult turtles are kept, and a small area of sand where the eggs are buried before they hatch.
