We ended up leaving early as we were fed up with the food, not being able to go on to the beach and the inefficient staff. Wish we had gone to the Maldives!

We stayed in this hotel while we were on vacation in Sri Lanka. Me , my wife and two little fellows enjoyed our stay thoroughly in here. Room was big and clean with a very good view at the pool and sea. Checking in was very smooth and staff were wonderful and always treated us with a smile. Best feature of the hotel was the infinite pool which was really clean and enjoyable where all of us spend most time in. Restaurants were good and staff service was so good that you feel that you have your own butler in there. There was wide variety of food and Sri Lankan dishes were really nice. Whole experience was a very good one and we would recommend this to anyone visiting the beautiful island.

We stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla towards the end of our tour around Sri Lanka, having stayed at two other Heritance Hotels (Kandalama and Tea Factory). We were looking forward to a relaxing three days... Firstly, the positives...We were upgraded to a beautiful suite, which was one of the best rooms we had during our tour. The room had a comfy bed, a large flat-screen tv (with seating in front), and a huge, luxurious bathroom. The whole room was kept scrupulously clean thoughout by our friendly "room boy". Breakfast was the usual buffet (including excellent dosas). The staff at breakfast were friendly and offered us different teas to the usual. The hotel has two pools...the residents' pool was generally quiet. The other pool (in front of the reception area) was busier, and was somewhat blighted by the beach sellers (more on that later!). So, the negatives...Looking at the hotel's website, they seem to be badging it as a luxury-style resort...hmmm, well sadly, we found it a bit lacking: The food was rather average compared to the offerings in the other Heritance hotels we 'd stayed at. Elsewhere we had good quality, creative snacks when we fancied a change to Sri Lankan food (for example excellent club-style sandwiches, items for sharing etc). Here, there selection was a bit mundane. We only found out that there was a veggie menu when we had a chance discussion with a staff member...there was no mention of this in the in-room pack, or displayed in the restaurants. This really does need to be made clearer. Also, the veggie menu is available 24hrs in the cafe/bar, but apparently isn't routinely available for room service! We had a couple of frustrating phone calls trying to order from it...we called at 5.15pm and were told to call back after 6pm..and when we did call, were told to call back again at 7pm! We also ate in the cafe/bar, but one order was not as described on the menu (chop suey with pad thai turned out to be sloppy veggies with a small pile of rice). The rice with veggie curries were delicious, but there were so many flies it put us off (we appreciate that its not unusual to get flies when effectively dining alfresco, but it was a bit much when I turned to spoon some more curries and half had flies in them (surely a cover would have been sensible?)). Although the residentâ€™s pool was generally quiet, we were disturbed a couple of times by people trying to sell stuff (the resident palm reader and vendor of wooden items which could be purchased from the other pool). And finally, our biggest complaint....the beach is effectively a no-go area due to sellers of sarongs, tours and local hoteliers trying to pursuade residents to visit their hotel for dinner and spa treatments etc. These people were relentless and aggressive in their tactics, following tourists along the beach, and would not take no for an answer if you made the mistake of venturing onto their patch (ie. step off of the grass onto the sand). We even witnessed them shouting to people sunbathing around the pool. We feel this could be an amazing hotel, but it is rather average at the moment...

We stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla for 2 nights at the end of October. The hotel is on the Ahungalla Beach near Bentota and is a scenically beautiful and spacious property. The view from the lobby of the pool and the sea - unbeatable!! First day it was raining quite a bit so could not enjoy the pool and beach to the fullest... the red flags were always up at the beach and apparently the sea is not very swim worthy for novices. Second day thankfully the sun was out and we could paddle around a bit in the sea and the pool. Lovely pool!! Food at the hotel - what we had for dinner one day was fine, the breakfast is fairly good too. Spa - my husband tried it out - and he said it was very very good. The rates are fairly expensive though and we ended up paying almost as much as we would in Dubai for a similar massage! Rooms - We had a mix up with reservations and so finally landed up paying much more than the going rate (20% off rack rate) and this was sad. Paid more than what was the current rate for a premium room for a deluxe room, and got "upgraded" to a premium room. Reservations tried to help but since we had booked through an external agency they couldnt help much. So I guess for all of you out there - please try a couple of time on their direct reservations site first!! Rooms continued - Lovely sea view from the premium room, but housekeeping needed to be called in as i felt the room was not too clean. Also the drain in the bathroom was smelling and they came by and put some cinnamon oil and covered the drain with a towel!! All in all it was a nice stay, but i would look for another option near bentota or hikkaduwa before I return to the Heritance Ahungalla.

We stayed at this hotel for a week at the end of a touring holiday in Sri Lanka. It is claimed to be the only five-star hotel on this coast, which is not entirely accurate. In some aspects the hotel is very good - the two huge swimming pools, large public areas, well spread-out accommodation & nicely-appointed rooms - and deserves its five stars. However, there are some aspects which are not five-star and were a source of irritation during our stay. For example, on the whole, the food was very good but tended to be served not very hot, and is rather expensive for what it is. We tried the buffet, which is OK, but very expensive. We had several meals in the Coffee Shop, which is more reasonable in price but, despite being a la carte, we twice had to send food back because it was virtually cold. Getting things like that fixed, which would happen promptly in a real 5-star hotel, seemed to take an age. Service is helpful & charming, but inept and inefficient at times. There often seems to be no-one on duty with sufficient authority to make a decision about things. Complaints are handled by constantly referring them to some-one else, who often is not in a position to actually do anything, other than telling someone else. The staff are not very quick to clear up after the rain sweeps into the public areas (which are tiled) leaving very slippery surfaces around for too long. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel, but I think they could try harder to merit their 5-star tag.

Stayed in the Heritance Anhungalla for six nights in September. It is a smart stylish hotel designed by Bawa, Sri Lanka's foremost architect. Some may find it a bit stark and white, we loved it. The rooms were large with a lot of character; comfortable beds and a very diligent roomboys. Food in the main restaurant was buffet style with lots of choice and some interesting Sri Lankan dishes. Prices are a bit on the high side, there is a cheaper restaurant but the menu was limited. There are two pools, one is reserved for reidents, they have weekend visitors who can use the other pool. It is quite a large hotel but still got a bit crowded when they had a convention at the weekend. There are fabulous sunsets out to sea. The beach is heavily occupied by traders, the ladies have some good scarves and sarongs at cheap prices, guys want to sell you a boet ride or visit the restaurant down the beach. Some of our party did and found it very good and cheap. The beach boys are very polite, as are all Sri Lankans that we met and if you say you just want to be quiet and don't want to talk they leave you alone. The beach drops sharply into the sea and waves were popwerful so bathing is banned. This is one of the drawbacks of the hotle. The other problem is that there is nowhere to walk outside the hotel, if you venture out of the gate swarms of helpfull people appear! I think it's a great hotel for three or four nights, we got a bit bored after that.

The hotel's right by the Galle Road (A2) about 75km down South from Colombo. Had to drive around a bit (within the hotel premises) to find a place to park the car. Checking in took sometime as well. The hotel's interior is aesthetically designed. It's got two big swimming pools. One is near the lobby. The other is in a more secluded place; making it the better option. We got a Premium room on the 3rd floor with a balcony which overlooked the sea. The room was well appointed with a comfortable bed, flat panel TV, spacious wardrobe and safe. The rain shower-head in the bathroom was great. However, noises from the corridor could be heard in the room. Better soundproofing would've been great. Also, the door did not have a chain-lock; which we were surprised to find out in a star class hotel such as this. The food was excellent! Great choice at the buffets and tasty food you really can enjoy. We also made a trip to a turtle hatchery nearby in Kosgoda just a few kilometres away. The hotel staff helped us locate this place. It's at the end of a road that runs by the Kosgoda Police station. In short, Heritance Ahungalla is a great sun & sand hotel with truly star-class food.

An excellent experience where food served was extremely delicious (particularly the breakfast menu). We stayed at luxury rooms which were good but nothing exceptional to really 'wow' us over. The staff at Heritance were very courteous and friendly. They were also flexible in all our requests. Had a great time while at the hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

The hotel looked amazing when we arrived and we were upgraded to a fantastic suite which we were very happy with. The beach was long and wide however the sea is rough so don't expect to do too much swimming in there. Having stayed in a few other Heritance hotels during our visit to Sri Lanka we were pretty expectant when it came to the food at Heritance Ahungalla if nothing else, but we were let down here. There was not enough to choose from which was our main issue. Another bug bear was how the hotel allowed women in niqabs to swim in the hotel pools, not the type designed to be worn for swimming which of course I have no issue with. Despite these relatively small complaints we had a very relaxing stay and would recommend the hotel.

My self and my friends wanted to spend some time away from the norm of life, looked for a place where we could be feel free, be pampered and have a memorable experience...and that's exactly what Heritance Ahungalle surprised us with!! From the very second we entered the Hotel we greeted with such warmth and taken to a lounge where we were offered refreshments and to relax while the paperwork was taken care of, everything was done no different to a Butler service which was awesome.

My Wife and I wanted to spend some time away from the norm of life, looked for a place where we could be feel free, be pampered and have a memorable experience...and that's exactly what Heritance Ahungalle surprised us with!! From the very second we entered the Hotel we greeted with such warmth and taken to a lounge where we were offered refreshments and to relax while the paperwork was taken care of, everything was done no different to a Butler service which was awesome. We stayed in a Suite on the first floor, had a great view of the beach and the room was more than excellent. We felt so relaxed as they offer a personalized service and the best part is the atmosphere that the Hotel has makes you feel right at home and free. Food was excellent! During the day there are some activities to engage in whilst the evening brings in the perfect soothing and romantic settings, with the music and lightning, all the while the staff providing nothing different to a Butler service. I would highly recommend this Hotel for anyone, be it Couples or Family looking for a break and some quality relaxation and time with loved ones. Would recommend to visit the Turtle Hatchery nearby.

My wife the 3 kids and myself spent 5 nights in this hotel. It was perfect, the location beautiful the hotel it self is very nice and quite. We had breakfast and dinner at the hotel and food was very nice. The staff was very friendly satrting from the front desk staff who always helped the sprots team that gave us personal attention and the rest of the staff who was very efficient . They make it a much better hotel and stay. As part of the stay you should dirve to the close village and visit.

Fantastic spacious room with a balcony and a view. Lots of menu options to choose your dining experience. Great pool area with bar, beach and sun lounges, a real focal point. There was a cultural show in the evening that meant there was no real need to leave the resort. Staff were helpful and attentive but the sheer size of the resort meant that it felt large and impersonable at times especially when you want something from your room during the day. Outside the hotel there is not much on the street front but the beach is pretty. On a personal note I found the wi-fi login system problematic which was disappointing as I had hoped to contact my husband at home and email some photos through. Otherwise it was a fantastic place to spend our last couple of days in Sri Lanka.

I liked the food it was really good with the actions station in the night. Such variety I have only seen from the likes of Hotel Kandalam. Sometimes though they had not labelled all the items such as the sushi section and the various sauces that go with sushi were not palced at the same spot. Also the room was way too small, i would call it a bit stuffy as there was no space to move around with the mini bar/tv stand and the baby cot also in our room. But even for a couple the room is small. I did like their swimming pool routine and they got everyone invloved in the pool. The playgrounds are further down the hotel, but the pathway leading to the playground had a lot of weeds and not clean. Overall the food and the accomodation was very good, I would recomend it. Also there were two swimming pools which was excellent. Both the pools do not have separate baby pools, so you have to keep a close watch on your kids if you don't want them to enter the deep end.

Mais nous donnerions un fort indice de satisfaction Ã  cet hÃ´tel. Chambre plus que confortable, avec vue sur la mer (sans avir payÃ© de supplÃ©ment), sdb somptueuse avec musique douce, attentions nombreuses (2 x corbeilles de fruits, gÃ¢teau pour mon annif, ...), piscines toutes deux somptueuses (celle plus isolÃ©e Ã©tant dun graphisme gÃ©nial avec cet arbre qui la recouvre en partie), restaurant buffet de trÃ¨s grande qualitÃ©, .... Il reste que sur la plage on vous propose tout et n'importe quoi, des tissus en passant par la drogue, la prostitution, ou plus simplement des excursions. Passez un accord avec le premier qui vous accoste et les autres vous laisseront tranquille. Plage en fort dÃ©vers (abimÃ©e par le tsunami), et hÃ´tel relativement isolÃ© (mais tout est vite accessible en fait). Rien Ã  dire du service 5 Ã©toiles, et rafraichissement des facades en cours. De quoi passer d'excellents moments en fait....bonnes vacances.

we reached the heritance after having a tour of galle fort ,we were offered welcome drink and proceeded to our rooms .grand sea view and attached pool with well equipped gym.after having a swim session in the pool we had our dinner ,very authentic food and reasonably priced.dinner and music....a deadly combination.in the morning we played beach volleyball ,and then had buffet breakfast..sumptuous.then we had an appointment for shirodhara....oil massage,oh it was heavenly man.then we visited deval devi temple .it is most beautiful beach resort

It was my first visit to Sri Lanka and this was the best ever experience had in my life. We had a warm welcome on Arrival and the reception staff handled us extreemly well. I went with my kids and they were not willing to leave the hotel and wanted to stay with Vishmie & Amenca... That was our dream Holiday. Restaurant service was awsome. You will be able have good breakfast but same spread every day. Coffee Shop and upper room food is average but they were willing to serve what we like. Rooms need a refurbishment need to improve on cleanlines of the rooms. Spa was good.. pool show was fantastic... Overall it was a fantastic relaxing Holiday. Hat off to Front Desk & Restaurant staff who looked after us like their family members.

Stayed here for 2 nights as part of a tour around southern Sri Lanka. The positives: Large pool Very helpful staff Well appointed room - large bathroom The negatives are more numerous and sadly affected the enjoyment of our stay. There were about 8 locals hanging around on the beach outside the hotel for the whole time on both days. They were very aggressive in the way they would wait for you to leave the safety of your hotel sun-lounger, and try and sell you everything under the sun. Just be firm and say nothing else other than 'NO!' If you engage them in conversation, they will pester you ALL DAY. We saw others suffer as a result of this and the hotel must do something about it. Worse still, there are sellers operating within the hotel itself, pestering you for palm readings and the purchase of overpriced wooden ornaments. The hotel management need to realise that the hotel should be a refuge from some of the hard-sell that exists out in the surrounding towns. Also the hotel did not seem particularly clean, and the food was distinctly average at both the Upper Room restaurant, and the 24-hour restaurant. There was some renovation work going on, but I didn't let it effect my overall view as all hotels need to do it at some point. Normally hate to be too critical, but there are some issues that need to be addressed before this one can call itself 5 Star.

Pros - great view of the ocean (sea view avaiable with Premium rooms0 - speacious clean rooms - good size pools (note there are two pools, and one is mostly only offered to foreigners) - good spread for buffet (but its almost the same everyday for bfast) Cons - teriible reception/front desk service; had a don't care attitude and were often rude - had electrical problems in the room when the fan was turned on but even after informing the reception twice (on two seperate days), they did nothing about it..did not even apologise or offer to change the room - requested king/queen bed but were only given twin mattresses - no bath tubs, this is only available in luxury rooms - Not much choice for in-room dining - Don't visit during the weekends; the hotel allows far too many groups to have the spend the day on the weekends (allowing one or two groups is fine but there should be a limit so that the pools are not over crowded); My personal opinion is that the hotel treated foreigners differently to the locals (including locals from overseas); with the locals, they just didn't care. Me and my husband are Sri Lankans and we visit Sri Lanka often and like to escape out of colombo for a few days. We were really disappointed with the way they treated us. I think i've had far better service in other hotels in the area (bentota etc). Great hotel but would not recommend due to the horrible service.

We stayed at Heritance for 5 days and it was a great vacation overall. The room was spacious with a great sea view, the breakfast buffet had delicious food every day, the pool was refreshing and the staff was nice and friendly. The only downside is the amount of flies everywhere! I felt like I had to guard my food and drink every time or else the flies will dive in your plate and glass. There are restaurants outside the hotel which I highly recommend. There is a lagoon at the residential area which I encourage everyone to visit since itâ€™s difficult to swim at the beach due to the heavy waves. Just be a bit careful as the vendors at the beach can be very aggressive and annoying when they are forcing you to buy stuff that you donâ€™t need. Nonetheless Sri Lanka is a very beautiful country and itâ€™s hard not to enjoy the scenery and food.

The hotel looks stunning offers great views.We had booked the premium rooms sea facing. We found the service lacking in all aspects.From the rooms check in to the restaurant service. We were quite displeased with the hotel. I had planned a surprise for my husband and had requested the hotel for a cake and for the room to be decorated and offered to pay extra for the same. I had called and re-confirmed this more than three times. I had called in even three hours before check-in to ensure this is done. I was assured it would be done before we arrived. We came to the hotel and the front desk staff intimated that they never received any such request. Since it was a surprise it turned out to be quite a spoiler. Though the room was nice. We were given one with twin mattresses. We had to repeatedly request for a change in room with at least a queen mattress.(So much for an anniversary). We were told the hotel was running full.So we would be given a room change the next day.It never happened.Quite disappointing. Even the service in the restaurant was appalling none of the waiters bother to even keep the cutlery on the table after we have taken out plates or serve us even drinking water we had to repeatedly request for it.Being a 5-star hotel we were surprised at the dismal service. I might not consider the property again solely for the lack of service. Also the restaurants lack a choice of vegetarian food. especially the fine dinning restaurants does not serve any vegetarian food. even on request.We we forced to use the buffet every time.Which also has limited options.Disappointed again. We would not recommend this to others.

We spent three nights at this beach resort after 5 days touring Sri Lanka and staying at a number of different Heritance hotels. We were ready for some rest and relaxation and certainly received it here. We had a room with a window overlooking the ocean. Unfortunately the ocean was too rough to swim in at the time of year we visited. They had two lovely pools. We enjoyed the smaller pool which was quieter as the main pool attracted more families with children. The al la carte menu in the restaurant was very reasonably priced and the breakfast buffet had plenty of choices. The staff were very friendly and overall our stay was pleasant despite some rude, aggressive guests.

We have stayed at Heritance Ahungalla twice now, and loved it both times. The hotel is beautifully designed and airy with well appointed rooms. The beach is lovely, except for the occasional hawker that can be somewhat insistent. The breakfast buffet is superb. The extensive "international" (read: hotch potch) dinner buffet was not appealing, and we opted to have local food at their open air cafe, where we were served great food by lovely staff. (A note to all Sri Lankan hotels: Please have more local food items on your menus!!!!)

We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights during the 2nd week of August. Took the new Southern Express Tollway to get there and was amazed at how the relaxing the dirve was compared to the Galle Road which we have driven through in the past which used to be a trying experience. The GRO greeted us and offered us a choice for the welcome drink (Watermelon, Orange and coconut water) and also a refreshing cold wet towel which was most welcome as the humidity was pretty high that day. The hotel pool which can be seen from the time you get off the car is absolutley fantastic and overlooks the ocean. We were upgraded to higher level room which gave us a pool view as well as a partial sea view. The lighting in the room was decorative and as I've always noticed in most hotel globally too dim during the night. Why the designers of hotels allover think that mood lighting has to be dim I will never fathom. The food (we were on HB basis) in the retaurant was fabulous and they had a western as well as Sri Lankan choice. We had lunch on 2 days from the speciality restaurant on a la carte and that too was excellent. The choice of wines is limited as expected in a 3-4 star hotel of that standard. The beach was quite nice although the sea was quite choppy on both days due the season we were told. The hotel has limited activities compared to a 5 star hotel in the city but this is to be expected as one goes to these type of resort hotels only to enjoy the beach and pool. The hotel does have a 2nd pool but we did not use it as it was 1.7m depth all round and was too deep for my 2 kids and also had a lot of leaves fallen in du to the close proximity of large trees along the pool. The service was quite good but could also be attributed to the fact that we were staying during the week where the occupancy is lower than compared to the weekends.

My husband and I had amazing stay at the Heritance Ahungalla ( previously known as the Triton Hotel). The service was excellent and the view from the hotel was breathtaking! The dinner buffet was rather average but the breakfast buffet made up for it!

In my view this is the equivalent of a 3 star hotel in the UK (not 5 star) as positioned. Having waited over 2 hours to be shown to our rooms we opted not to stay. 1. Old food was left outside rooms. 2. the main pool in all the photos is public ( paying a lot of money for this) 3. it would appear that an entire wing of the hotel is being held up by scaffolding 4. our rooms smelt of drains. 5. they got the lunch order wrong!

Heritance took us by suprise in the first look with a no frill lobby were one could see the pool and the view of the beach as you get off the car before the reception!!!!!!!! advice get as many books as you can for this holiday great place for readers as there is not to be done in the area so preferred to stay in the hotel with the two pools, great food, great hospitality. other than that Bentota/ Ahungalla doesnt have much to offer.

The Heritance Ahungalla is a lovely beach hotel directly on the Indian Ocean, with the lush, tropical forest enroaching onto the beach itself. It is simply stunning. I went at the end of the monsoon season in late August, which is technically the off season. As a result, the hotel didn't put on any of the nightly entertainment (discos on the beach, clubbing by the pool etc) or daytime sports activities (volleyball and aerobics on the beach, aqua aerobics in the pool) and that actually suited me much better as I enjoyed calm, serene peace and quiet the whole time! The rooms are beautiful with quaint decor and gorgeous balconies. The pool is fantastic and although we couldn't swim in the sea due to the season, we still hung out on the beach and dipped out toes in the water. The lifeguards were constantly on duty, keeping a discreet eye on us and making sure we didn't wander off too far down the beach. We did go for a long walk with one of the locals and he took us into the area where some of the homes were destroyed by the tsumani. We also bought sarongs and saris off local women on the beach. The hotel doesn't let them come into the pool area but doesn't ban from the beach entirely, which still allows them to be involved in the whole tourism experience in the country, which is only fair after all. We did an incredible river safari about 30 mins drive from the hotel which was one of the major higlights of my trip to Sri Lanka and I would recommend it to anyone. We also arranged for a tuk tuk to take us to the turtle hatchery (around 20 mins drive away) and the nearby spice garden in Bentota. The staff were very polite and attentive, in particular the pool staff. The hotel in the main buffet restaurant was excellent with plenty of choice. My only gripe would be that the room service food isn't very good and the poolside food isn't great either, but I suppose it's fine if you're ordeirng for kids who want simple things like chips and cheese sandwiches. I would definitely recommend sticking to the main dining hall!

The rooms are very beautiful and very clean. The staff was excellent and very helpful. The beach was lovely with big waves and fairly clean. The pool area was big and relaxing. Food was awesome with lots of varieties. We had a lovely time here. I recommend this hotel to any one who would love to experience the south cost of Sri Lanka.

i fell in love with their food. rooms were really nice and clean. we got sea view. and it was very relaxing. friendly staff. great view. two big pools. beach is clean but we could not enjoy that since its off season.we enjoyed our stay a lot.

Rooms are beautiful, Balcony with see view. Both pools are great. Friendly staff always with a smile. Beach is clean but this is the rough season. Nothing to say about the food. it was marvelous. Chef doing a great job. we enjoyed our stay. Thanks a lot

Been here twice now and each time was wonderful. Beautiful location facing the beach. Inviting pool. Staff attentive. The rooms are superb..especially if you get them facing the pool or the ocean. Very relaxing...something for everyone.. My kids aged 5 and 8 enjoyed swimming...there are two pools...horse back riding was offered through the hotel. There is also a volleyball net...guests got together to form teams. Also pool tables and lots of lounging spots. Food at the hotel was scrumptious...buffet included a full Sri lank an spread as well as international cuisine. Only 2 hrs or less from Colombo, so a great relaxing weekend away. Highly recommended.

After a tiring drive the hotel is a refreshing site. the pool across the reception is soo inviting that first thing you want to do is "to dive in'. nice comfortable rooms, overlooking the sea. The service was phenomenal and staff very warm and willing to go the extra mile. You can spend days without stepping out of the hotels, but if you must there is ample to do around. The hotel food is awesome, with world cuisine and local delicacies both cooked to perfection. awesome experience.

We stayed two lovely nights at this wonderful hotel where everything is done to make you feel at home. The rooms are beautifully decorated. Nothing is missing. A lot of attention is paid to the details. Staff take time to listen to you and are always at your disposal. The food is very good. Thank you very much !

Attended a wedding here and the place is amazing. Great food pricey drinks. Lovely public areas and an awesome infinity pool. Would recommend for a wedding they were very attentive and the service given was second to none

We had our Residential work shop at the Hotel premises for two days. They have arranged everything very smoothly and the staff were extremely helpful. The duration was Lunch to Lunch (4 Meals). They had very good varerty in the food and we never felt bored with all. Rooms were very comfortable and all the equipments were working with out any issue. Room Service also was good.

The long driveway leading to the entrance provides a glimpse of what awaits guests - a stunning, large infinity pool with the ocean in the background. Not sure about the welcome nibble of a mix of sugar, cummin and coriander seeds on a bed of betel leaves but a choice of three fruit drinks reflected the class of hotel. Menus for ice creams and cocktails were another clear indication of the luxuries in store. While not a great fan of the Geoffrey Bawa style of design - long, relatively bland corridors that gave the interior a rather cold, sterile feel - the rooms are well appointed with those overlooking the beach providing a private balcony with tabel and chairs. We couldn't complain about the service over our two day stay except for a delay in getting our bags from our rooms on departure. All staff we met were friendly and ready to help. The range and quality of food was what we'd become accustomed to on our holiday on the island - fantastic! Free access to a gym and a lovely beach, as well as the pools, provided plenty of opportunity to work off the calories in time for the next sitting. Yes, the ubiquitous hawkers are ever ready to accost you as soon as you step forth on the public beach (I understand hotels are not allowed to privatise these areas) but they understand English and a couple of friendly but firm words of rejection should prevail. After all, everyone needs to try and make a living. I cannot comment on the value as this stay was part of a 11-day package tour but the experience of my family (which included three typically-demanding Gen Y'ers!) was that we'd happily return there. I'd give it 4 and a 1/2 stars if the option was available,

Beautifully designed hotel, stylish and contemporary feel, with simple furnishing using lots of wood, slate and polished plaster in the bathrooms. The view of the sea was blocked by trees in the first room I was shown, so I upgraded to a deluxe for a better view, more space and a bigger bathroom with a bath. Downside - horrendous pillows, and intermittent wifi. The staff were really helpful over a lost passport and accompanied me to the local Tourist police. The evening buffet is delicious although a little pricey at US$30. The beach gangs weren't a problem and polite no thank you and no eye contact meant I was left alone. Apart from the water aerobics class which involved very loud music that reminded me of my son's DJ practice, it was a very peaceful place to relax for a few days.

We are being local was a bit skeptical about hotel service towards us locals. Believe me I have many experiences with Local hotels, when it comes to service and treatment for local guess. I traveled with my wife and 8 year old son. I wanted to get away from my busy schedule to a calm and quite beach location in down south. I was searching for good hotel through the web for almost 2 days, and when I was about to give up I came across Heritance Ahungalla. Still, I was not too how it would turn-up. But it was to my surprise that I realize I was so wrong about Heritance Ahungalla. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, we were treated like Kings and Queens to utmost extent possible by their whole staff. Food was fantastic. Especially chefs and the team had done a great job on preparing a broad range of food for all 3 meals. Every time they would have small conversation and check if we comfortable with our food and what else they could prepare. The whole staff at â€œJudeâ€ restaurant was very friendly and helpful to us and the entire guess at the hotel. We stayed in a deluxe room with direct sea view (No. 321 premium room), was so spacious. Bed was so comfortable, clean and nothing bad to say about the room. I was very pleased to stay in that room. I must truly say it has been a very enjoyable and relaxing experience to all 3 of us. We will for sure visit again and would stay bit longer next time. To all locals, I would definitely recommend this place. A BIG Thank you to Heritance Ahungalla team, for making our short break a wonderful experience!

This is a First Class hotel and deserves its rating It is excellent in every way but has one huge problem ! The huge problem is the Beach Gangs who patrol the hotel frontage to the beach These gangs are totally illegal but the hotel allows them to harass and harangue the guests These gangs do not accept a polite refusal They are well organised and surround each guest and are extremely agressive They do not give up and basically they hound and bully each poor guest until in desperation a guest agrees to purchase goods from them The goods they sell are unlicensed excursions, unlicensed trips , unlicensed massage parlours and meals in local Hostelries which would be closed down by Health and Safety without even entering inside the premises I think that this is an appalling situation as it is blatantly obvious that Sri Lanka is a poor country and relies heavily on the income from tourists I can assure readers of this column that not one rupee from the pockets of the Beach Gangs will be used to benefit the local community or Sri Lanka as a whole I would also remind readers that in the event of an accident ( which is very common on the crazy Sri Lanka roads ) that Insurance Companies will not pay one penny if a client was travelling on an illegal or unlicensed tour or trip or taxi ride . An unforeseen accident in Sri Lanka can result in enormous medical and hospital and repatriation bills I did complain to the Heritance staff about the continued agressive behaviour of the Beach Gangs ( who also shout to the guests reclining in the hotel grounds ) The staff advised that they all lived locally and thus did not wish to upset the Beach Gangs for fear of repercussions on themselves and on their families In conclusion , I find this an appalling situation whereby the Hotel Management is turning a blind eye to the discomfort and unhappiness of their guests I must also admit quite openly that unless there is some form of financial reward being given weekly to the Hotel Management , I can see no earthly reason why the Hotel Management encourages the Beach Gangs to extort money from their guests Apart from the above problem , I can confirm that this is an excellent hotel I have stayed in most of the decent hotels in Sri Lanka but this is definitely the best in my opinion The rooms ( bedrooms and suites ) are a good size and immaculately furnished; towels , soaps , water etc are changed twice daily and the Housekeeping service is of a very high standard The food is superb and every mealtime offered a new selection of mouth watering delights ; huge prawns and devilled crabs were in such abundance that we eventually declined them as we simply could not eat any more ! There are 2 very large landscaped pools here and both of them were crystal clear and beautifully warm at all times There are also many sports and fitness facilities at this hotel and we really enjoyed our daily game of badminton This hotel sits alone on a massive empty silky sandy beach backed by tall swaying palm trees ; the beach stretches for miles from one headland to the next Swimming in the sea is definitely not possible at this time of the year as the sea is very rough with tremendous undercurrents However , the pools at the Heritance are so large you can easily imagine you are swimming in the sea I should also add that the Ayurveda Spa is a must and is in the most Romantic position imaginable ; their treatments are excellent and their methods of curing aches and pains are really incredible In conclusion , this is an excellent hotel but it will quickly lose its popularity if the Owners do not step in and banish the Beach Gangs

Now, we have been coming back to this Hotel since it was called Triton because it stood out among typical beach hotels in Sri Lanka and coming here once in a while was treat for our children. It is a quite different now, and not particularly in a good manner. Our last stay at the hotel was on a weekday and was out of season. The property was about half full and a renovation was going on in the main side. At the dining hall, for some odd reason, there were no cloth table napkins and instead, a cheap replacement of paper serviettes. The food served were all so bland and nothing impressive, that's including desserts. I even overheard a couple saying that it was the same for the past few days! Breakfast had in store for us, an averagely spicy Sri Lankan food corner which was quite good. Pools and activity around the pool was enjoyable and the best part of this stay. An interesting underwater Zumba class also took place! The rooms were the same as before, thank goodness, but one thing made me stop my praise. The bidet shower was out of order. There was a surprise at the check out. I made reservation by calling this hotel and made sure that child meal charge was included with the price. (Child stays free in a double room sharing bed but for the meal, they charge about 30USD). In any case, we were asked to pay extra for the child meal because the price mentioned was the Double room rate. It was a mistake done by booking operator and the Hotel said that if we refuse to pay, the balance will have to be deducted from operator's wage. Since we did not want that to happen, we just paid and left. Overall, I think the hotel could have done a little more to repeating guests. I think that the hotel might have gotten complacent, due to the five star rankings people have given them, but as of now we lost loyalty to this hotel and unlikely to recommend others to stay.

A tranquil & amazing stay at this hotel which is set back from the main road with a STUNNING INFINITY POOL and access to the white sandy Indian Ocean beach (where you can see fishermen working hard for their daily catch). Ahungalla is quiet and there are limited offerings around (although never too far away are roti's and spice gardens). The hotel has all of the amenities that you would expect from a top range hotel, so if you are looking for total RELAXATION, The Heritance delivers in spades! EXCELLENT service and incredibly friendly staff who work together to ensure guests enjoy their stay. On arrival you receive a mouth cleanser (different albeit slightly strange) and a welcome drink (multiple options - very refreshing). There were plenty of options for breakfast and dinner (vegetarians and even just fussy eaters have choices to make). The rooms are large, comfortable and well equiped - the best few nights sleep we had in a 3 week trip!

We married here 2 years ago and I cant believe I didn't do a review at the time. Just looked at the website and certainly when we married there we found no reason to disagree with what they state on their website. I would definitely recommend marrying here. Would you believe it rained on the day we were due to marry and there was no fuss or bother, they asked us to give them more time so they could move the ceremony from the garden to the beautiful, marble hotel lobby. We took the weeding dinner on the beach only for the heavens to open again! They tried to protect us from the rain but the waiting staff were getting soaked so we moved indoors to a private dining room and carried on with the dinner. They were marvelous and it didnt spoil to occasion at all! It was all professionally handled, the staff were marvelous, food fantastic, location outstanding and we would definitely return here.

it was our first holidar in Sri lanka,good services and great staff.it was so peacfull.a great location for rest.a good outdoor pool with special bar,the breakfast was fabulous.we had seen a turtle in beach,it was an special moment .

The hotel is just beside the beach and away from the main highway. Thus the sound of the waves makes the stay more enjoyable. The view from the reception of the Indian Ocean over the nice blue swimming pool is simply awesome. I stayed at this hotel during my company's conference and i would remember it my whole life - the view of the beautiful ocean from my room, good food, good service, recreation, live music playing around in the evening and with the sound of the wave , it makes all the tension and tiredness to go away. Would love to visit once again and this time with my wife to spend a very special honeymoon.

A perfect location - right on the beach. The place is very beautifully designed - lovely view of the ocean from the rooms. The infinity pool opens up on the beach. A place where you thoroughly enjoy the ocean. Indian ocean doesn't have high / low tide - same water level all 24 hours. The place was washed away in the 2004 tsunami. They have built a new hotel here. Good food and pleasant staff ready to help you. It's beyond expectation.

We were at the Hotel in February 2011 for our Honeymoon! We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel thoroughly. I had booked our stay at the Hotel through 'Aitken Spence Travels' Company. They tok good care of us, right from receiving us at Colombo Airport and dropping us off on the last day. The hotel property is beautiful, and their location is splendid. The location of the Hotel is perfect, away from the busy traffic of the city. The quality of food was great and the staff was very helpful through our stay. Our room was over-looking the 2 Tennis courts, but that wasn't a problem. The Hotel spa was also nice. The 2 Swimming pools were awesome! Overall a great way to spend your Holiday and thoroughly relaxing.

I was at the hotel with my staff and their families occupying 8 rooms last week end. Rooms, pools and the food were at its best. All the staff were very pleasent and always ready to help. Our group was small but the hotel staff was very concern on keeping us occupied and always inquired whether we need any extra activities to be done. We all had a splendid week end and will recommend to others as well.

Sri Lanka has beautiful hotels but some of the hotels owned by Aitken Spence are by far the best hotels I have stayed in during my stay. There may be better hotels but as far as I know, I enjoyed every one of the hotels. Heritance Ahungalla had a charm and sence of peace, that I found to be quite enchanting. From the moment we walked in, I felt relaxed. The first thing you notice is the beauty that surrounds this hotel, the main pool and the lobby that faces the ocean. At check in, we were offered a drink while the staff got us the rooms. The hotel is large by comparison to other hotels. We got the rooms that were quite a long walk, but the good thing is that the rooms were away from the music in the main lobby, that sometimes was quite loud. One of the rooms we were staying in was quite large, and we had trouble cooling the room due to its size. However, the beds were so comfortable and you feel so relaxed. The hotel has three pools, one in the main lobby area, and the others situated on either side of the wings, mainly for the guests of the hotel. Sometimes it can be crowded during the weekends, due to weekend travelers coming to the hotels, but after Sunday afternoon, the hotel is peaceful and enjoyable. The food at the restaurant was extremly good and we loved the food selections featured. The weekend breakfast and lunch can be a challenge as the capacity of the guests outnumbered the seats available in the restaurant. It is best to come early and get a good table. But the selection of food offered on the weekend is the best. You simply can not finish all the food choices. As far as going to the beach area, it is not that shallow and the waves can be a bit harsh and very choppy. On two occasions, my kids got stung by a small, black jellyfish and had to be treated by the hotel staff. The staff at the hotel took extra care of the kids when they got the jellyfish stings. Even after the event, they wanted to know how the kids were. The staff at the hotel made my stay such a pleasant experience that I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff of this hotel were so attentive to everything we needed, and made sure everything went smoothly. One thing I forgot to mention is that this hotel seems to be getting old fast due to the close proximity of the ocean. However, they do their very best in maintaining the hotel to the best of their ability. The dinner time music at the pool area was great to listen to, and it was also a good place to relax and listen to the ocean waves. Hope this review was helpful.

experienced relaxing weekend with friendly staff and tasty foods at heritance ahungalla ...Scenic beauty of the sea & the cleaned wide beach nowhere else in the south West coast. ,lovely lobby design and ambiance express the uniqueness of the Heritance where inheritance blended with heritage blessings. Special thank to zashin,indika at the pool bar and the R/boy for the special arrangements done to surprise my GF Thankz GG

We arrived at the hotel after a long trip from Nuwara Eliya and we were wellcomed with refreshing wet towels and delicios soft driks. The lobby is beautiful and you can't wait to make the check-in to go to the beach. We had a small problem at check in , but it was solved in no time. Our suite was spacious with nice furniture and 3 balconies, where we could enjoy a cup of coffee or tea and listen to the sound of the Indian Ocean's waves. The location is beautiful; you feel like stepping in a postcard with fabulous colors. The beach is amazing and you could sit there forever. We enjoyed the breakfast and lunch at the hotel's reataurants;plenty of food and sweets exposed with taste. The staff is friendlly and helpfull. The hotel is very quiet and private. A perfect place to spend a dream holiday.

Great ambiene enhanced by the genuine warmth of friendly staff. Comfortable rooms. Probably the breakfast spread and variations need to be looked into. Overall a wonderfully relaxing stay at the Heritance Ahungalla.

We stayed in this hotel as the relax part of our trip to Sri Lanka. We can said that the others heritance hotels we been were better. Because you are in a village, we probably will have all your meals at the hotel, we were disappointed about the quality and the variation of the food during dinner. The hotel is very large and they have to swimming pool areas, the northern one has less people.

Have promoted the resort amongst 100s of guests, it was recent that I took the time out to check it my self. The welcome is warm, Front ambience is great, Staff ever so friendly and out to help, Found the higher deluxe rooms greatly comfortable, The deluxe suites much more appealing, Upper walkways needed some attention looked a bit worn off may be because of the sea weather conditions, Great pool, Scrumptious food, Clean beach however mostly warned with red, wish to rate the Heritance Ahungalla an overall gem in the resort list down south in Sri Lanka...(RJ)

As a traveler the two thingsI look for in a hotel are location and class. The Heritance Ahungalla is the perfect hotel which gives you both. it is in the heart of Ahungalla, a small beach village about 20 minutes away from Bentota. it is a relatively quiet town with not too much to do or see except bask in the Sri Lankan sun. The first thing which caught our fancy was the infinity pool which led right into the beachfront. The lobby was clean and the staff extremely helpful. The beach was very clean and the water a pleasant greenish blue which made you want to just change into your swimsuit and sunbathe all day. The welcome drinks were a mixture of guava and mango juice which were extremely refereshing after our long drive from Nuwaraeliya. We were escorted to sea facing rooms which boasted of a beautiful view of the beach. Our balconies were spacious and had chairs where one could enjoy a hot cuppa tea and watch the sunset. After settling in, we went to the part of the beach which was owned by the hotel and sat for three hours in the tidal pool just lazing around and watching the world go by which is what a holiday is all about. For lunch, we went to a shack situated just five minutes away from the main beach sampling some of the best local fresh seafood in Sri Lanka. The coffee shop in the hotel was also a beach view and had the standard five star breakfast items which is always a good start to the day. the staff were courteous and attentive pouring coffee, water and juice within seconds of request. The gym was a small but nonetheless a good workout. A calm place to spend the last two days of your holiday is what Ahungalla was all about. Initially we contemplated staying in Bentota given the reviews on the Vivanta but I am glad we made the decision to go to Ahungalla instead.

As soon as you arrive at the hotel you can see through reception across the main pool to the beach and sea. Makes you want to go straight to the pool and beach. The staff set a high standard straight away with a warm greeting, welcome drinks and towels. The rooms are very nicely appointed, we were in a pleasant room facing the sea across a small lawn. The beach is exceptionally quiet, this hotel being the only one within this bay, with wonderfully soft sand. The hotel has two pools. My two young sons loved the main pool, with views across the beach to the sea. We did not get a chance to try the more secluded pool, which looks stunning. Food in the restaurant was delicious, both the Sri Lankan cuisine and the international offerings. Salad and fruit were both wonderfully fresh. The Spa is certainly one of the best in Sri Lanka with expert staff and a relaxing and tranquil setting. We will definitely stay again.

A Geoffrey Bawa hotel on the coast of Sri Lanka. There are some real highlights: smooth, cool design, excellent swimming pool, fantastic location next to the beach. And some lows: the horrible smoke-filled restaurant (we had to ask for Sri Lankan dishes: they aren't always offered), irritating piped music, dodgy evening karaoke-style entertainer (though, to be fair, some guests seemed to enjoy it), and inadequate wi-fi. I would liked to have given this hotel 3.5 stars, since it is better than "average", but that doesn't seem to be available.

Excellent resort with a grand size swimming pool just adjacent to the sea coast gives you a feel of taking a dip in the sea itself. Nice rooms with wide balcony mostly with sea facing view. Wide range of platter to choose from. Breakfast spread is huge specially if you are looking at a heavy breakfast to extend your lunch timings. Good gym, childrens entertainment, snooker table etc. Availability of arranging local traditional dance programmes etc. Overall a nice place to relax and send some peaceful time.

That this hotel was designed by Sri Lanka's most respected architect Geoffrey Bawa is plain to see at your very first glance. The opulent pool looks like it is part of the ocean. The food is delicious and the hotel has won many culinary awards. The deluxe room was spacious and clean with a big balcony that has great ocean views. The bathroom was good. There is a second pool further away from the reception which has a jacuzzi. It also has a tree with branches arching over the pool. My sons had great fun climbing the tree and jumping into the pool. A unique experience. We ate at the Jute restaurant and the food was very good. We also ate a delicious lunch at the Mustard coffee shop. We had lovely ice cream sundaes at the pool bar. The staff were very good. A very memorable stay at a fantastic hotel.

We spent 5 wonderful nights at this beautiful hotel. The staff made us feel like VIP's and their special attention made our stay so memorable. Our room was very comfortable and although we had a few little issues when we first arrived, they were quickly dealt with and were relatively minor. Special thanks to Nipun who provided us with excellent service as well as a tour of the kitchen with a cooking demonstration. It was fantastic and thank you to all the chefs including Sanjaya, Manual, Piyumal, Ruckshan and everyone else who gave us their time and skills in the kitchen. Needless to say the food was fantastic and reasonably priced. The location was perfect for us and after spending 6 hectic days sight seeing, a little piece of serenity was just what we needed. The beach is beautiful and although the surf was a little rough, it was great fun to body surf. The pools were spotless and we loved spending most of our days just lazing on the plentiful lounges near the infinity pool. Although it is a large hotel we were treated like family and it made our stay really wonderful.

Got a very nice welcome....and the overall stay was nice because of the excellent staff. I had arranged a surprise for my partner and the staff did a wonderful job in executing it and helping me in making it a very romantic evening. My only disappointment was the food and I came across a big insect on the corridors on two occasions....not that the hotel can be blamed for it because its an open hotel with trees in the corridors. We had a nice room with beach view and a big balcony.....but the other side of the hotel (near the gym) had very eerie and hospital like corridors. So it may be a good idea to let them know you want a room away from the gym. The spa is good but overpriced. Overall nice if you want to escape for a weekend...anything more than 2 days and you will find the place boring. For good food in bentota....I suggest Aman villa located near the old dutch fort,Galle.....Must try the crab curry!

This hotel was a bit of a disappointment, not the five star rating we were expecting. In our opinion this hotel needs to be downgraded to four star. Whilst there was some painting/maintenance work taking place while we were there, the hotel didnâ€™t have that â€˜luxuriousâ€™ five star feeling about it. Certainly comparing it to a five star rated hotel we stayed in whilst holidaying in Zanzibar 18 month's ago, it was definitely of a different class/standard. The fruit bowl, dressing gowns and slippers were not in our room when we arrived and there was no mention, when we checked in, of them arriving later. The cream rug was filthy (we rolled it up and put it under the bed) and that improved the look of the room immediately! On the plus side, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and very responsive to our needs. On several occasions we only had one bath towel left instead of two which meant having to call house-keeping. Although immediately we called the second towel would rapidly appear, this isn't the level of service we would expect from a five star resort. The restaurant areas were nice and the food was good. We tended to eat in the coffee shop which also served as a restaurant which did some nice meals, we did eat occasionally in the buffet restaurant. The pool area is nice. The hotel is located on the beach, but most of the time the red flags are flying due to the under currents there. On most days despite the red flag flying people still went into the sea, if you went with caution you were fine, but there were occasions people got into difficulties and the life guard at the hotel had to come to their rescue. We enjoyed watching a wedding take place whilst there. We also had the experience of seeing one of the resident monitor lizards digging up and eating another monitor lizardâ€™s eggs (13 in all!!!). We were lucky enough to see a turtle come ashore and lay her eggs on the beach before going back out to sea â€“ wow what a wonderful experience. We also visited a turtle hatchery up the road, take a tuk tuk (itâ€™s cheaper than a taxi) and if you want to experience putting baby turtles into the sea you need to go at dusk around 6.00 pm (in Feb). Before booking this hotel we were told we could go out of the hotel and that there were lots of eating places in the area, this is not the case. We were told not to go out of the resort at night, so that was also disappointing. Sadly there is no â€˜all inclusiveâ€™ option here. In summary, this is a nice hotel, situated on a lovely beach, not five star luxury, but a nice four star. We were here celebrating my 50th birthday and wanted a bit of luxury after touring for 8 nights and in retrospect wish we had stayed at either The Jetwing Lighthouse or The Fortress in Galle.

Beautful room with a balcony overlooking the beach. Great pool and poolside bar. The staff were very friendly and helpful but it is a much larger hotel than any others we stayed in on our Sri lanka trip and a little lacking in atmosphere.

The hotel decor is a little stark and requires a makeover - with the corridors resembling a hospital ward - a few pictures would liven the place up a bit. That said we ate at the Bar Restaurant and the food was very good. the hotel pools were enjoyable - but the seclusion was spoiled as the beach was intersected from the hotel grounds by a number of hawkers - who were polite enough but incessant. The beach was lovely - and we even witnessed a giant turtle arriving on shore in teh afternoon to lay its eggs - amazing. All said - I expected more - and beware teh burning sun!

At a loss to understand how some guests have only given this hotel just 1 or 2 stars. Have just spent a month there and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. The best part was undoubtedly the friendliness of all the staff. Our only negative was the fact that the hotel was NOT all inclusive. A special mention to Dinusha Kularathne, who relly looked after us. Many thanks. It was not a cheap holiday, and four weeks was probably a week too long, but we have no hesitation in recommending the Heritance Ahungalla.

A large hotel in good location but after some of the other places we stayed in Sr lanka it was rather soulless and way more expensive. Having said that it has all the usual facilities , the room was fine and the buffets at dinner were excellent. The swimming pool and sun bathing facilities were good and the staff looked after us fine. You should visit the turtle breeding/refuge nearby.

We stayed at this hotel for just one night on B&B basis. The room had a private balcony overlooking the pool and the sea. We ordered room service for both lunch and dinner. The food was good, delivery was quick and service was friendly and efficient. The breakfast buffet had a good spread with both international and Sri Lankan cuisine. The only complaint we had was that the A/C vent in the room was old and/or faulty as it made a rattling noise throughout the entire stay. We called maintenance and they came to take a look at it, but it couldnâ€™t be rectified allegedly the hotel was full, so we didnâ€™t have the option of moving to another room. Because of this, we didnâ€™t sleep very well and our short stay was not as relaxing as we hoped.

Heritance Ahungalla maintains the high standards it is reputed for. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. Vast range of food at mealtime! I was particularly impressed with the friendliness and warmth of the reception staff. The entertainment at night was outstanding. The foreign guests were genuinely thrilled! Plenty of activity in the hotel. Animator Raju who handled the Water Aerobics segment was truly outstanding!!! My only complaint is that the hotel was fully booked....and therefore somewhat over crowded!!!!! My wife Farina and I had a relaxing week-end.

My wife Lynda and I have just returned from a 9 day stay at the Heritance as part of a cricket watching tour of Sri Lanka. We were in a ground floor room that was very nice, great shower and a door which opened onto a small patio facing the gardens, it was also kept spotlessly clean. Both pools are really nice with plenty of sunbeds, towels and mattresses provided by the eager pool staff. The beach is right there at your doorstep but the ocean is quite rough and not really suitable for younger children. the food is excellent throughout the hotel but the rice and curry in the cafe is to die for, with most Sri Lankan food it is very spicey but just ask and they will tone it down if required. Best of all were the staff, always with a smile and very attentive and helpful, a special mention must go to my friend Nimesh Shamalka Fernando with who we had great fun throughout our stay. The only small negative is the hotel location, It's a long way from the airport and not much within walking distance along the beach or outside the gates. Forget the taxis and use the local air conditioned smaller local bus to get to Galle, takes approx 1 hr and costs 50/75pence, use the Tuk-Tuk's for shorter journeys, a real eye opening experience!!! but a "must do" :-)

We just got back from 9 nights at the Heritance in April (broken with a short tour to a national park). The hotel has lovely pools, the rooms were comfy and well air conditioned and the food was excellent too. It is not as cheap as some sri lankan fare, but for the most part it is good quality. We were B&B so buying other meals/drinks and this averaged at around Â£12 per person per day for lunch and dinner plus drinks throughout the day. We were there during the recent tsunami warning after the 8.7 earthquake in indonesia struck. The staff we calm helpful and reassuring- despite the fact that many of them must have been worried for families and friends in the area. We were evacuated to the top floor and given free food and drink throughout the 3 hour alert. I couldn't fault them. One down side is that it is a bit isolated- but its not far to bentota which is full of bustle and energy.

we arrived to find the england and sri lankan cricket team staying here.brilliant staff good food,nothing is to much trouble,we had a great stay 14 nights in total.not much entertaintment but nice and relaxing.two nice pools plenty of beds,great service by pool attendants.thanks for a great stay.
Beautiful hotel, could not fault it. Great food and although a big hotel the service was personal.
Had a great stay - ideal for a relaxing holiday by the beach - agree as regards pools with prior comment - breakfasts also excellent. Pool aerobics fun for all.

As you enter the hotel. You feel like you entering a mansion in South America with the ponds and coconut trees at the entrance porch which stretches about 500m.When you step into the hotel you will see a beautiful swimming pool which is almost same level as the see. The pools are the wonders of the hotel. The rooms are spacious and has nice interior design. Toilets are scary because of their design using cements makes it looks dirty. Otherwise the restaurant and buffet are excellent.
Beautifully designed pool...Love the food...amazing.. You have alot of peace & tranquilty; especially

A country full of lovely friendly people with happy smiling faces. Their delightfully naive view of life being that if they give something a 5* rating then it must be so. The problem is that prices have gone up to international 5* levels giving rise to the expectation that it will compare to other high graded hotels around the world. This maybe one of a group of Sri Lankan higher quality hotels but no way is it as 5* by INTERNATIONAL STANDARDS. At best it is a low 4*/high 3*. The entrance is spectacular and beautiful but the rest of the property is simply awful. Poor maintenance, unsafe tiles around the pools, under equipped rooms with intermittent electrical supplies and poor drainage. Hawkers on the beach screaming for your attention every time you go anywhere near them. Nobody walking around with any frequency to see if would like a drink whilst sunbathing etc. It could be so good if only they understood what makes a 5* hotel. Still delightful and enjoyable providing you don't go expecting the best, but it is poor value for money.
We were there to spend the day in January. It is a nice and clean hotel, friendly staff and good food.

We arrived at this hotel on the 13th February with friends we stayed for 3 weeks and they stayed for 4 weeks. It is a beautiful hotel, with the most fantastic reception view of the infinety pool. The reception staff were the most pleasant and helpful we have ever come across. We had a top floor (only 3 storey) at the end of the wide hotel with the most beautiful view from our spacious balcony. I have to say there is nothing much to do outside of the hotel but that was never a problem as there were lovely comfy bars to sit in on an evening. After having read some of the reviews about the food I honestly don't know what some people want because there was plenty of selection for everyone's taste and the quality was excellent. It is very hot and humid so the towels are changed twiced a day (never had that before) and the bedding fresh every day and they never missed. The beach is gorgeous however it is annoying when every time you go out the beach sellars pounce on you but if you are direct and say no then they leave you alone. There are 2 lovely pools one is the infinity pool and the other is a nice large pool at the other side both are very clean. It gets full marks for not having to fight for a sunbed as there are always plenty around and we got the same one's every time we sunbathed (arn't we boring!!) plus the boys always got the towels ready for you. You have to remember this is Sri Lanka 5 star and we would all stay there again in a heartbeat.

At one stage furing the tour planning, we planned to stay two nights at Heritance, Ahangulla. We thank our forefathers that we decided otherwise. It would have been an expensive disaster had we stayed there any longer than the 12 hours that we spent there. I can not fathom who ever gave this hotel a five star rating. It must be with the help of some under hand dealings. The mistake I did was that the tour was booked through the agency who owned this hotel. There is an obvious conflict of interest here. This is at best a three star hotel.....nothing more. Minuses: unclean floors, dirty pool, dirtier pool towels, fountain with black water in the front of the hotel and by the side of the main dining area, walls, roof all badly needing a stroke of paint, cracked walls, beaches infested with intrusive locals, stray dogs.... Plus: couldn't think of any!

Nicely designed hotel with a very relaxing atmosphere. Has 2 nice pools, out of which one is only for residence. I got a ground floor room which is open towards the residence pool area. The pool looks really nice with some trees falling over towards the pool from one side. Always ask for a room facing the residence pool area. I stayed in a basic room and it was spacious, clean & comfortable. Overall the hotel & the rooms look a bit old (with slightly broken walls & tiles) since the last time I visited, but the good thing is it was clean & nothing to complain. Staff was very friendly & pleasant and were always willing to serve. I had breakfast & lunch which I ordered from the a la cartemenu. It was tasty but a bit expensive compare to most Sri Lankan hotels. Only disappointment was the buffet, which was too expensive. They used to have a very good spread few years back.

This hotel was a great disappointment for us. This was our sixth night in Srilanka and when we made the bookings we were so excited about this hotel and the photos we have seen. However, our stay there was a disaster! We waited for more than 30 mins to Check in. When we checked it, the room was in a mess and the telephone lines were not working. We complained to the reception and all they said that this was because of the rain and it will come back within 10 mins but it didn't. We tried again but it was useless. The receptionist and the staff were rude and their service was far below the standards. to make things worse, there was a school trip that night and the kids occupied the swimming pool, the restaurant and everywhere in the hotel. The restaurant was expensive and the food was average but the service was a little bit better than anywhere else in the hotel. The room was small but the balcony was nice. In general I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. If you still want to go there, then please ensure that you are in the middle of the week and not on Saturday/Sunday or Friday to avoid the busy times at the hotel where the service drops down to the lowest level.
Perfect location on the beach, beautiful design, staff very kind, clean and well maintained room, really good meal in hotel restaurant.

On first appearances this hotel wow's you. This is not 5 star by any stretch of imagination. Over priced and quite tacky. Maybe the best in Ahungalla, not in Sri Lanka. There sister concern "The Tea Factory Hotel" beats them by a canter on all counts. The long corridors leading to the rooms were run down. The room was large with a sit out. The housekeeping was slack. The food was quite mediocre. The buffet is a total rip off. It is very highly priced and the food was very average. The beach boys on the beach are a menace and quite intimidating. It put you off from wanting to step out on the beach. Would I return? No.

Reception staff were quite rude and took 2 hours to check us in. We were part of a large party and bookings were made some 6 months in advance of our arrival. One family of 4 were made wait in reception for over 3 hours before their room was available. Having said that the service staff, room attendants, waiters and bar staff were extremely accommodating and nothing was too much trouble. Rooms were not up to 5 star cleanliness and linen was worse than 1 star standard. Mini Bar was only refilled on request. The only thing 5 star about the hotel is the price and possibly the location, but be prepared to be pestered by hawkers as soon as you set foot on the beach.

Right on the beach, 2 beautiful pools, and really lovely staff - who are definitely the major asset. But WHY do the bathrooms look so unclean? our shower screen was limescaled (heavily), the floors and walls needed upgrading as they were scuffed and marked and impossible to clean (polished concrete walls au naturel! - but evidently the architect who designed them loves the effect so it doesn't matter!). On the plus side the bed was wonderfully comfortable. Breakfast was in a low ceilinged dark room (often smokey from the cooking of bacon or hoppers) - where you help yourselves but have to wait for tea/coffee (i.e. flag down a waiter if you can catch their eye - although there are always plenty of them around) - and geared to Big Appetites and touring parties. The dinner buffet food in the same room was lukewarm and no one attends it to ensure it is stirred/kept hot. The menus are very restricted. Where are all the delicious tastes of Sri Lanka? Why travel all this distance to eat (mediocre) European food! The middle range restaurant (I think it was called Mustard) with a terrace overlooking the pool was the best, as the food was cooked to order, and the staff more than willing to experiment with something off the menu if they had the ingredients. The beauty salon was staffed by wonderful Balinese girls who gave a very good deep tissue massage - but the standard of the treatment rooms (just converted bedrooms) was poor. Expect more ambience for the price. Not 5* by European/International standards and more expensive for food/drink than the Amangalla or the Galle Face. The hotel facilities need upgrading to earn their stars!

The sign next to reception says the hotel was voted the best 5 star hotel in Sri Lanka in 2010. If it's true then I just wonder what the rest must be like ! The original standard room was appalling and after complaining we were upgraded to a deluxe room which was good. All public areas are in need of refurbishment and there is a lack of any serious evening entertainment. Alcoholic drinks are some of the most expensive I have come across, either in Europe, Asia or the USA. The dinner experience in the Jute restaurant is mediocre, unless you like curry. It's a buffet and nothing is really hot. There appears to be a problem with the extractor fans and as the breakfast is cooked in the restaurant there is always a cloud of smoke circulating in the mornings.The room has a low ceiling and the decor is dark. The are two nice pools but the tiling around the edges is very uneven and loose. The beach is long and pleasant but the irritating, aggressive beach hawkers who stand ten metres away shouting to attract the attention of the guests make life unpleasant, they are a major problem. The beach has a lot of debris strewn about , bottles, polystyrene etc, but the management claim it is the job of the local council to clear it. As a previous poster has said, there is nothing close to the hotel and very little to do. For $150 per night it would be reasonable, but for the $300 per night ( b&b) we paid it is way overpriced. As Sri Lanka seems to have their own star rating system, I would rate this hotel on an international basis as no more than 3.5 stars. The staff go out of their way to be helpful

If you are into stuffing your face on buffets and booze, probably a great hotel for you. If you are looking for quality food and culture, or even 5 star service probably not for you. Outwardly the hotel looks great, they rely on the great infinity pool for the wow factor but scratch the surface and there is not much else a pontins holiday park wouldn't provide. Probably why there are limited photo's on the website apart from the pool. We paid extra for a luxury room, which was very nice but cost enough to justify. The room along with the friendly staff were the best parts of the holiday. Breakfast was average, dark, dingy, smokey (cooking smoke) buffet room. Nice cooked options, and hoppers. Waffles were very nice, but coffee served was just terrible. Green pool was OK, but cloudy water. Good green pool service Nice beach, but not worth visiting due to the constant hassle. People have to earn a living but it gets a bit draining to be friendly, only to be hassled to buy something every time you want to walk along the beach. Grotty and hot gym, with old equipment. Miles away from anywhere, so unless you want a 1/2hr tuk tuk ride to Bentota (which is fine and plenty of offers outside the gate) you are stuck with hotel options. The best food we found was in the mustard cafe, lovely curries. Everything else was overpriced euro buffet. Final nail in the coffin was check-out, no service at the nice reception desk, you go round to the back office, smelly little room where you que up to pay your $$$$ bill while the cashier argues and discusses other bills with clients and colleagues. Then the taxi you ordered with the concierge isn't booked after all, they just look at each other and call over the 20 year old smelly wagon. We refused to get in, and they got an equally smelly but slightly newer car for the 9000 rupee ride to Colombo. Smelly is a reoccurring issue here. Overall, 5 star luxury room (for the right $$$) in a 3 star resort......With a really good looking pool.

We had visited this place along with our local freinds in Sri Lanka.. The most beautiful and human culture the Srilankans have is a BEAUTIFUL SMILE. The hotel staff very polite and on their toes to help in case required. But the most amazing thing is their breakfast , lunch and the dinner...ofcourse the INFINITY POOL. my daughte just would not want to be out of that place. All we did was lazed in the poola dn ate to our hearts content.. AMAZING SRILANKA

The layout of this hotel is sublime! Designed by the famous architect Geoffrey Bawa, it a series of pavilions joined together that feel more like a private residence than a luxury hotel. We stayed for 5 days over the local New Year celebrations last April & would go back in a heartbeat! Located right on the beach, with a couple of pools, our room opened out onto the grounds in front of the more private inner pool. It felt like a secret hideaway, with a massive low lying tree overhanging the pool that the kids had endless hours of fun with swinging off the branches. We were upgraded to a junior suite at the resort manager's discretion as the tour operator had stuffed up our booking. The room was Huge, so that when they brought in the 2 roll away beds for the children, there was still ample room to move around, sit, play, dress. On the ground floor, the balcony doors opened right onto the grass that led to the pool 10 meters away. It was quiet, helped by the pounding of the ocean waves 100 meters away..that was the only noise you heard! Totally comfortable, totally ideallic.
