The room did smell a bit musty when we got in but a few drops of cinnamon oil from housekeeping fixed that immediately ( we still associate cinnamon oil with Sri Lanka!). We stayed at a particularly festive period & there was much fussing & preparations with special meals, sweets & decorations for the Sri Lankan new year - simply the best time to visit! The food buffet every evening was superb with many choices of all foods but also a variety of curries, the breakfasts got a bit hectic as the new year day approached with the hotel at capacity from many local families holidaying, they had to open the ballroom to seat everyone, but that just added to the festive feel. Games & carnival excitement marked the day itself, a few rains & some brilliant thunderstorms over the week meant we had a very Tropical adventure! The beach is rough as the waves just pound onto the shore, the walk along the beach is peppered with animals, plants & all sorts of things that kids like to pass the time with...the best being the monkeys on the trees throwing coconuts when we arrived! Loads of things to do outside the resort like visit the turtle sanctuary, the lagoons, the fisherman on stilts, the shrine dedicated to the tsunami victims. It is a poor country, ravaged by civil war & mother nature but the people are one of a kind, ,totally happy & welcoming.This is a classic luxury beach hotel.

Would totally recommend this hotel. Stayed for 2 weeks on an all inc. basis. The hotel is situated right on the beach surrounded by tropical gardens. Enjoyed a room, no 256, on the second floor overloooking one of 2 swimming pools with a sea view. The room was kept spotlessly clean by the very friendly, attentive housekeeping staff who also visited in the evening to ensure we had everything we needed. All the staff at the hotel were courteous, smiley and extemely friendly. They werel helpful and eager to meet all queries and requests. We could not have been looked after better. The food is amazing with a wide variety to suit all tastes and the deserts were spectacular. Watch out for the beach traders who can pester you on the beach and 'enjoy' the persistance of the locals selling sarongs etc who stand on the edge of the hotel grounds trying to entice you over to buy their wares. The sea looks very enticing but is not safe for swimming due to the strong undertow which was a disappointment but obviously not the hotel's fault. The swimming pools more than make up for this. Another positive of this hotel is that the sunbeds are plentiful and well situated. Towels are provided. Would recommend the Arrak cocktails!

Got a great room overlooking the main pool area with a sea view. Very luxurious with a large balcony area. Had two great pools, each with a pool bar. Good sports facilities - pool, tennis, table tennis, etc. Food was fantastic - great spread and very delicious. But what struck my wife and I most was the staff - so courteous and helpful. They were always close at hand and ever ready to assist. Very very pleasant. The rates are not cheap but it is absolutely value for money. Will def look forward to visiting more hotels in the Heritance group soon!

This hotel has a fantastic, idyllic location on the beach with great views, sand, sea and a beautiful swimming pool. Rooms are all wooden with large beds and showers and most balconies overlook the sea in some way. Lots of staff are available to service your every need and are very willing to help. Buffet food was very good with plenty of choice and different themed nights. You can also eat outside which is far nicer but you have to ask as it isn't readily offered. The only down sides were that the staff were a little too friendly - there was a constant expectation that you tip - to take bags to the room, for sun beds, for someone to bring you an iron. The hotel adds tax on top of the menu prices as well as 10% service charge on everything. This means everything is 25% more expensive than it appears. There was a lot of conferences going on which had special attention and sometimes entertainment on but as guests there was nothing to tell you what that evening entertainment was. We went direct to the locals for tuk tuk rides and local trips as you are able to haggle prices and make sure the money goes directly into the local community rather than to the large hotel chain. Prices are cheaper this way too and we had no problems with the integrity of the locals at any point although they are inclined to pounce on you every time you go on the beach. I would recommend staying here but be prepared that it costs a huge amount more than you bargain for especially if you drink alcohol- a bottle of wine is anywhere upwards from Â£40!! Oh but don't fly with Sri Lankan Airlines they were terrible.

Just stayed here for two weeks including getting married on 8th Feb. Bit of a journey from the airport but well worth it!!! Room was superb, clean, spacious, great balcony. The staff were amazing, always checking you are ok, having a chat, asking if you ned anything, they cannot do enough to help. The food is excellent both in the main restaurant and the coffee shop and the two pools are fantastic too, both infinity pools and clean and well looked after. Our wedding was just the perfect day and was handled superbly by all the staff, there is nothing we could fault at all, they made it so special for us culminating in a superb meal on the beach. I can't speak highly enough of everyone at the hotel and would thoroughly recommend it for a holiday and wedding. Would love to go back at some point in the future. Sri Lanka is a beautiful country and holiday and wedding was made perfect by everyone at this hotel.
Very nice hotel, Situated perfectly on the beach of the Indian Ocean. Great room, good restaurants and bar. Beautiful design, magnificent swiming pools. What a pity, we have had only one night there.

We stayed two nights here ,were greeted with the usual welcome drink in a beautiful lobby ,the rooms on the other hand are very dated,had to walk quite a bit to get to them,reasonably clean but definitely not 5 star standard,the pools are lovely with the main pool having quite a bit of action.the beach is clean ,but young girls and pretty women beware of the beach boys.The buffet was average and the desserts really not very good.But still an overall relaxing time,especially if in good company.

when we checked with great expectations about the 5 star facility we were greeted with cob web with spiders running in the room. the ceiling fan was so dirty i think they have not cleaned the room for 3 or 4 months. we have to call the reception and lodge a compliant to clean the room so as to enable us to sleep.

This was our last stay of our travel around Sri Lanka. We were looking for somewhere to unwind and relax at the end of the trip and this is exactly what we did. The hotel is right on the Beach with a stunning reception / entry. When you step inside there is a pool which goes straight to the beach. Checkin was easy with the ususal welcome drinks. Our room was also fantastic which overlooked the beach, it was also clean and tidy and seviced to 5 star standards. The beach was also nice and warm, there is also another pool in the resort. Be prepared though when you go to the beach for the ladies selling saris and wraps, if you are not used to it it can be a shock, we just said no and kept walking. Gym was also great and had excellent equipment. The food and staff were excellent, the best of our whole stay in Sri Lanka. We were sick of Buffets but the ones here were just amazing. We also ate in the alacrate restaurant and that was some of the best we have had globally. We met the chefs and we talked to them as to what were were after for a special dinner and when it came our it was delicious. Lobstters / Seafood were caught daily and fresh. My wife and I also asked whether we could get a Sri Lankan cooking class and the Chefs kindly obliged and gave us a private demosntration in their kitchen. All staff from cleaners the hotel's executive team were extremely polite, helpful and would bend over backwards for you. The hotel also provides unlimited, free internet. In summary was one of the best hotels we have staye at, we cannot recommend it highly enough. We are already planning our trip back. This is the best in a great selection of hotels that the Aitken Spence chain has. At the end of the beach about 5 minutes walk there is also a great restaurant called sunshine run by locals, food is cheap and freash and tasty. Worth a visit.

I must comment on the food as it was wonderful. The lunch and dinner buffet was excellent. The hotels atmosphere is very relaxing. I was a little dissappointed with the rooms as I expected more quality from a five star hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Well designed hotel with two large pools right next to a lovely palm fringed beach. Food in the buffet was of a very high quality and the menu changed each day. Service was slightly patchy though staff were friendly and eager to please. Plenty of activities with volleyball, tennis, badminton and a gym on offer. We had few treatments at the spa which were very good and reasonably priced. There were a lot of families staying at the hotel which meant our children always had other kids to play with. Overall a v good beach hotel and we hope to go back someday.

This was my 5th visit to the Heritance in 5 years, and some of its spark has gone. The personalities on the Food and Beverage side used to be brighter, but as there is ample competition in Sri Lanka may have lured some of the better staff away. Check in is still and always has been problematic, especially the inability to get people through the process quickly or keep them occupied when the hotel is fully booked and rooms arent yet ready. Having said that, they did manage to accommodate the special request for my room, and ever facet of my stay was more than pleasant. The expedia rate was twice as expensive as the walk in rate which was odd. I expected expedia and others to have better rates, but when we extended for a night, we got a wonderful rate.

I took my family (wife and 2 boys - 11yrs and 8yrs) to spend 5 days upto Christmas day. The hotel is beautifully designed, blending well with the environment and having a colonial feel. The rooms are tastefully furnished with good quality furnishings and are well air conditioned. The room was kept clean by house keeping twice a day so inspite of my boys best efforts it didn't stay messy for long. The hotel isn't fully air conditioned, common areas are open to the environment which suits my tastes - I didn't go to the tropics to feel like I am in Nothern Europe but air conditioning is nice in the restaurant and in the bed rooms to help get some sleep. The hotel has two pools, an infinity pool at the centre of the hotel and a more secluded "green" pool. Both pools are spacious and clean. Both my boys enjoy swimming so it was impossible to keep them out of the pools. The sea next to hotel was nice to swim in and the beach was clean. The hotel has tennis courts, a badmington court, and a table tennis table that also helped to keep the boys occupied. It also has a gym that looks well equipped but if I am honest I didn't make use of it though I should have because the food was fanastic and plentiful. The hotels culinery team had just won first place in a competition among all the hotels in Sri Lanka, beating the Colombo Hilton team so you can understand it was of a very high standard. We found the staff from the maintenance workers to the the restaurant staff and right up to the hotel's general manager extremely polite and helpful. The reception staff were very helpful throughout and arranged a whale watching excursion for us. All the staff worked tirelessly to prepare for a Christmas eve party and though they were very busy they took time to find out whether there was anything else they can do. The hotel also provides unlimited, free wifi throughout the hotel by means of a key code you get from reception, really useful to keep in touch with family back home. All-in-all we had a wonderful time at this hotel and I cannot recommend it highly enough. We will definitely be visiting it again.

We checked in on New Year's eve to see 2012 in. We'd booked a triple room and paid a 50% advance at the head office at Aitken Sence Colombo, which was mandatory due to the New Year's eve rush. But the room was not ready at check- in and we had to wait quite awhile. We were given large half glasses (yeah half!) of a local fresh juice but realised later that other check in guests were given moist towels as well. Finally, we were taken into a 2 roomed suite that had been furnished for only two persons. We had to look for a room boy to tip him to bring in a third bed, third set of towels etc.etc. Our so-called luxury room was far from that - the 'fridge didn't work, the TV was badly tuned, the safety deposit locker malfunctioned, one bedside light didn't work.. Due to the malfunctioning fridge we were not even able to break a bottle of bubbly.. (now who likes warm champagne) - (BTW check the spelling of 'champagne' in the GM's letter of welcome - here my sex was wrong - I was titled as 'Mr' We had tipped the check-in steward - a name like Achila - do avoid this scoundrel at all costs! - generously to get us a table for the gala dinner, but he was nowhere to be seen. We looked into the area four times, to ensure that we had a table, but nothing had been set up for us. Finally, we were told to come down for dinner and that we would then get our table. No table when we arrived for dinner. We were then told to sit at another table. Five minutes later the same steward - named Mudalige - said he was sorry but the table had been booked by somebody else!!- I refused to get up! Our table had no lamp of decor etc like the other tables and after telling just about every waiter passing by, we got some of these things over 1 1/2 hours later!! The next day at breakfast, after standing in line for awhile, I requested a warm item from a serving chef, I was told by him that he had to serve over 50 guests at that time (so what?!). Finally, the time to depart arrived, and we breathed a sign of relief. We were all women but even the final receipt was titled 'Me & Mrs". When I got to my car in the hotel car park I found parts of it strewn about - it had been damaged by a tour operator who had claimed that I had been blocking him! Now this was a clearly designated hotel parking space which should have been so designed not to inconvenienced other vehicles. The hotel couldn't even inform the person to remove my vehicle (they didn't even know the name or company of the vandal) because it keeps no records of guest vehicles - rather a security threat in a country just recovering from civil strife, methinks.... Having said this, the general manager and front office manager were extremely nice and tried to compensate for our traumatic experience by even offering us an extra night on the house, but we had to get back to our families on new years day - so we were given a discount on the room rate, cakes and chocolates to forget our troubles.. The room rate for this unforgettable experience was well over $ 400 and unforgettable experience it certainly was! It will be a loooong time before we recover from the trauma of our stay at Heritance Ahungalla. This is a hotel that needs to get its act together in terms of processes, quality checks and staff training. This is what we pay for when we buy a hotel experience. It is also what we pay for when the hotel is incompetent.

The hotel has a very high standard of service. Check in was handled very professionally and courteously. We stayed in a Premium room which had an excellent sea frontage. Service levels from check in to check out were fantastic. I have to say that the Aitken Spence hotels service begins with the reservation process. They have the best and most customer friendly online booking service of all the hotel groups. You felt welcome as you arrived. The fine dining restaurant food, ambience and service was excellent and we enjoyed our dinner there. The breakfast buffet was also varied and the food tasty. I would highly recommend this hotel

We loved our time at the Heritance. The staff are amazing and really looked after us. Our driver Pema organised great trips and knew special places to take us. The hotel is in good condition the food was good but it could have had a wider a la carte menu. The only problem was a lack of things to do in the evening but that's typical of beach resorts. Definitely worth staying.

Having spent many holidays along the beautiful west coast of Sri Lanka, trying out the various hotels over the years, I can honestly say that Heritance Ahungalla is my favourite. Convenient to get to from Colombo on the new Expressway, it is situated about 90 kilometers from Colombo. From the moment I drive up to the entrance with the fantastic view right up to the sea, I feel at home. There is such a feeling of peace and serenity with the warm yet gentle welcome from the staff. I have requested sea view rooms and have never been disappointed. Room 305 is my favourite. If you like tasty food and lots of it, Heritance Ahungalla is the place to be. I think their chefs are about the best in Sri Lanka. The buffet has a huge selection of dishes to please the western and local palate. The salads varied and desserts yummy. Heritance has two attractive large swimming pools, and also a very attractive beach. The seas around Sri Lanka can be dangerous around monsoon time, but if you love messing around in the shallow water, going for long walks or just sun bathing it is wonderful. I strongly recommend Heritance Ahungalla, if you want a relaxing holiday. I always come away feeling rested and energized wishing I could stay longer! Elizabeth Gunewardene

A hotel with really delicious food, couldn't resist. Very nice and helpful staff. Pool attendance take care of every lonely bed not to be reserves with a towel too long. Very nice furnished rooms with a lot wood and wooden floor and nice furniture. A lot of place for sunbeds. A really great architecture of the hotel designed by the famous architecture. Wonderful atmosphere for couples in the reastaurant during evening. Do not bother when locals thry to sell you cloths on the beach, they are freindly though noisy, they are not allowed in the hotel garden, so will try to seduce you from a distance. But this is their way of eraning money for living...

Beautiful property with great pools and an excellent view. Staff was extremely friendly and accommodative. We travelled with our two kids (2 yrs and 1 yr) and had a chance to even meet Mr. Jayasuriya (Sri Lanka cricket team). Place looks even more beautiful when it rains :). We stayed for 4 nights and I must say it was all worth it

I went here just before Christmas, with friends. It's a lovely hotel - good rooms, nice food, good location (although sea swimming a bit rough). Gym, swimming pool, jacuzzi, free wi-fi, all the trappings. But the service just didn't match up - it was very pleasant. all the staff were extemely nice. But poor English, sloppy service, long waits when ordering anything. So although I'd recommend it, I do hope that Heritance take some time and trouble to train the staff properly - it's a great hotel, but the service lets it down. Biggest black mark was the very vocal hawkers on the beach - they stay just on the hotel boundary, and shout and harass the guests trying to sell things. Not pleasant at all, and really ruins what would otherwise be a restful and relaxing place. I'm surprised the hotel hasn't negotiated with them to tone down their somewhat agressive selling techniques.

Spent boxing day at Heritance Ahungalla. Architecture of the hotel is beautiful. There is a gorgeous infinity pool facing the ocean. Staff was friendly and check in was quick. Rooms and bathroom were spacious and could see that they had been renovated recently. Free wifi is also available in rooms for guests. The most impressive thing about the hotel is definitely the food. The range, the presentation and the taste of the buffet was truly excellent. I would go back for the food. For breakfast, lunch and dinner there were a number of action and carvery stations and plenty of choice for even the pickiest eaters. It is noteworthy that the Sri Lankan food is very good and worth trying. Highly recommend trying hoppers for breakfast and Sri Lankan rice and curry for lunch. Even though the hotel was full the staff was attentive and the service was quick in the restaurants. Summing up I would say Heritance Ahungalla lives up to the standards of the Heritance chain. It is a wonderful place to relax, enjoy the sea, sun and sand and indulge in good food.

On arrival we had to wait for 30 minutes to check in to our suite, The manager apologised and upgraded to the luxury Sir Cliff Richard suite, we were here for 4 nights and it was an amazing experience. Great architecture, amazing food and great service. Kids loved it.

The Heritance Hotel, Ahungalla is a five star luxury hotel with 154 rooms located on a 15 acre beach front estate. The Heritance Hotel, Ahungalla, has been awarded The Tourism Award for the 'Best 5-Star Resort'. The Heritance Hotel, Ahungalla uses many of Geoffrey Bawa Designs in their architecture, one of them being The infinity pool which makes you feel as if you are in the ocean itself when you get in and your eye level is just above the water. The Heritance Hotel, Ahungalla offers a wide range of facilities such as :- 1) Airport Pick-up 2) Luxury Car Services 3) Infinity Pool 4) Bicycle Rental 5) 24-Hour Room Service 6) Restaurant and Night Club 7) Business Centre 8) Shops and many more! They even provide leisure activities like Boat-rides, Elephant-rides, Cycling, Sports etc. The Heritance Hotel, Ahungalla offers a Brilliant array of food item in the breakfast buffet. * The Sugar Hoppers are to die for! The Heritance Hotel, Ahungalla has a very friendly staff and cater to each and every request and need of the guests be it big or small. Overall, The Heritance Hotel, Ahungalla is a great place to forget the problems of life and relax!

Stayed in this hotel with wife and kid. This hotel has great architecture and nice pool. Food was excellent and can go again for food. However room was very small and compact for a class of this hotel and other hotels have larger rooms and better bathrooms. Service could have been better. Empty plates from others rooms were left outside the room and it was not very pleasant. Was planning to stay an extra day, however did not because of the room. Expected more from the Heritance chain, especially compared to Kandalama

A very nice, fancy resort with all you need. Staff was great, room large and modern, breakfest and buffet dinner awsome, pools fantastic. THe beach is great, though it's not privet so vendors are there all thr time. no bath tub in my room but the shoer was huge and great.Wi fi is free for a week even though it's says otherwise when you first log in - the pasword will be given free at the reception.

The best thing about the resort is its brilliant architecture. It is very open, spacious and airy. If you see the pool from the lobby, it looks as if it has merged with the sea. Every room has a beautiful view of the pool and the beach. Food is a problem if you are a vegetarian. The staffs are courteous and had arranged a sightseeing trip to the turtle hatchery and mangrove boating for us. If you are travelling to Srilanka, a 2 days stay at Heritance Ahungalla is a must!!

Our first stay here in 2009 was on the very strong recommendation of Sri Lankan friends and we vowed to return sooner rather than later. Neither my wife or I recognised some of the negative comments on this site prior to booking our latest trip in December 2011 but we had some concerns. Those concerns were totally unfounded. From the moment we were met with refreshing cinnamon tea until the redoubtable Dudley packed our cases in the car at the end of our stay, it was total relaxation. The attitude of the staff is a delight and may explain some of the complaints - they have a wonderful ability of being remarkably attentive whilst appearing to be laid back which may be misinterpreted as appearing not to care.Nothing could be further from the truth. Some of the younger staff members are still extremely keen and their enthusiasm, whilst appreciated, intrudes slightly into the relaxed ambiance. They could do well to learn from Jacob. If you have the good fortune to have your table served by this gentleman you will understand the point I'm attempting to make. He is like a swan gliding serenely on the surface whilst away from view he is paddling like hell to ensure that you enjoy every minute in his care. Our room was excellent - the only criticism we could make was the that the Venetian blind in the bathroom was past its best.... this is really struggling to be negative. I can't believe that someone on here had complained about the food - how absurd! Not only was the buffet absolutely first class but the puddings were out of this world. A real trip down memory lane for persons of a certain age! Unsurprisingly, the dessert table won first prize in the hotel industry awards. Please don't take my word for this - our visit coincided with that of an annual trip of French gamblers(???!) to the hotel. They attacked each meal with that Gallic gusto which is unique, (complete with napkins tied around their necks!) - if it hadn't been up to standard I'm sure that it would have been the kitchen staff at risk rather than the food! When these lovely characters found that my wife was multi-lingual they hijacked her on a regular basis to tell the hotel chefs of their appreciation. Another negative comment I had read was regarding the beach folk. Yes, at times they can be boorish but they are trying to make a living. If you inform them that you are definitely not interested in purchasing anything today they will leave you alone. You are, however, missing the opportunity to chat to some fascinating people with experiences completely different to your own who would really appreciate the opportunity of honing their language skills on you - this is especially true of the clothing ladies. If all else fails the magic word to use is 'yanda!' whose interpretation is, I believe as rude as it is effective! We would like to thank the management team of Rifan (General Manager), Tilleth (Food and Beverage Manager) and above all the professional and gregarious Sampath (Assistant Manager) for a superb stay. You have staff and a hotel to be very proud of.

I stayed in this place for few days.. The beach was great and the pool quite never ending . I was really sure if this was a 5 star property , since the gym was absolutely poor and spread for lunch / dinner was quite limited . Overall its a great place to relax and enjoy the beach.

This is a superb hotel in southern coastal area in SL. All are great. Foods were fanastic. There are lot of varities to select. Location is also really good. Should request a room on sea side. So that you can enjoy. This is one best Aitkence Spence Hotel. Night you can enjoy music as well as dance. I recomond this hotel to anyone.

We stayed here 5 nights and had a great time, from the greeting to the departure we were made to feel very well looked after. The hotel is amazing and the buffet is probably to best out of all the hotels we stayed at in Sri Lanka. We had a dinner arranged on the beach and the Chef was great, he sat down with us and planned our 6 course meal, we did say that 3 course would be enough but he isisted and it was expensive (Â£150 with a bottle of sparkling wine- huge amount for a meal in Sri Lanka let alone England) but it was a 5* meal and very memorable. One of the staff members -Amenka was very helpful, always going that extra step- providing us with some local knowledge of Colombo for the later part of our trip. We were going to go Whale watching but the cost of this would have been Â£100 for the boat and the trip and Â£50 for the taxi- which we couldn't understand, the cab wouldn't be Â£50 in London so why so much in Sri Lanka, esp when we hired a driver for the first week of the holiday who drove us everywhere for about Â£100 for the week! Basically the hotel is expensive theres nothing to do in the local area, so I wouldnt recommend this if you want a taste of Sri Lankan life. The cocktails were disappointing, they had a good selection but they were not well trained in the art of cocktail making, I even asked them to make me a simple cocktail which a child could make (Whisky, lemonade, Sweet Vermouth and Agusto bitters) they put fresh lime instead of lemonade, when I told them they got it wrong they didnt understand and then said they would add lemonade on top- whisky with lime is not a good mix and lemonade wont fix it but I was still asked to pay for this undrinkable concoction! The other annoying thing is that we chose this Hotel as it is apparantly secluded but this doesn't stop the locals waiting at the border of the pool trying to get your attention throughout every day! selling anything from coconuts to sarongs or even advice!!! The top hotels in Sri Lanka seem to add on a charge to all bills which is misleading, the fine print on the menu says 10% service charge and Govt taxes, I looked into it and Govt charges are 12% but this hotel charges a total of 25.7% instead of 23.2%. Other hotels we went to charge up to 28%, we asked the cashier and he just smirked and said its another Govt charge! which it clearly is not, I felt bad about this as in effect the hotel keeps the "10%" (really about 12.2%!!!) service charge and the workers get no tips which is unfair. All in all a great trip and a wonderful hotel just a shame that its not really secluded and if they owned the beach and got rid of the locals it would be a fantastic retreat.

Had mixed feelings about the hotels. I was not bad but was never 5 star. The check in could have been done in a more pleasing manner. The staff was too harsh, not even with a proper smile on the face to welcome the guests. The much needed cold towels were not provided. We stayed in a standard room and is quite ok though three's nothing outstanding. The furniture was of good quality and the rooms had a prestigious look. We stayed in a tripple and the extra bed was a total disappointment. The mattress was terrible. The verandah of the room was nice and big. Toothbrushes, tooth pastes and a shaving kit was missing in the room. I had to give a few calls to get them to my room. there was central air conditioning with temperature control, but yet the temperature controller seemed not to work right. The bathroom was ok but could have been bit more large. The common areas of the second and the third floor was neither air conditioned nor had proper ventilation. So you can hardly relax on a sofa there. the food was good. had nice sea food. But need to have a few notches up to get it to 5 star level. The service was terrible. the staff is too harsh. No body has a smile on their face and you would have a real unpleasant situation. Those in the dining were ignorant of the guest's needs. During the dinner I had to ask five times to get a bottle of water. They take hours to prepare a new table. A really inefficient staff lacking the professionalism. The two pools were really good. both really large and well maintained. The green pool has a great privacy and is much better than the main one. That of course is 5 star. The towels by the pools were too old and doesnt sute for the five star quality. If you are finding some nice hotel to stay near Galle and if your budget permits the best would be the "The Fortress" Koggala and even the light house hotel may do better.

Stayed in September 2011 and was so impressed with this hotel that we have just returned from a further stay in December 2011.... Both stays have been excellent and exceeded our expectations. The hotel itself is extremely well kept to an excellent standard and the rooms are spotlessly clean. Staff are all very friendly and looked after us brilliantly - nothing is too much trouble! The food in the hotel can genuinely be described as fine dining and was lovely. We are in no doubt that this hotel is more than worthly of its star rating - ignore the few negative reviews here, you will have a relaxing time in a 1st class hotel! Looking forward to visiting again - Cherry and Dave (Nailsea, England).

architecturally very well set out right on the beach. very helpful reception staff but our room was dark and musty though when we complained a very nice room was provided. Buffet dinner was very over priced for those not on a inclusive budget and second rate anyway. After some hesitation an a la carte menu was provided in the non smoking air conditioned dining room, although at first told we should join the smokers on the terrace for this menu. The first two dinners we had were overcooked and poor and cold. A complaint to the restaurant manager brought a superb meal the next night. The message about this hotel is be prepared to complain and you will not be disappointed, when a complaint is made the staff can be very helpful.

We had a great time at Heritance Ahungalla from the time we stepped in. The rooms were lovely & the bathroom was earthy & nice. Very clean. Staff was great... very attentive & patient .To my utter dismay I managed to misplace my room key & was very upset but the front desk was very helpful & provided me with a tag & every time I requested for a person to be sent to open my room they were there though it was my mistake!! Finally they found the key for me!!! Food was great & a nice spread especially for dinner & breakfast. I'm a bit difficult to please being a strict vegetarian but they were very helpful. The ocean was the best!!!!!! Never seen such amazing waves..... I was not very keen on Bentota as most part of the beach in Bentota is not as nice as the east or the south but the ocean made up for all that & made me glad that I chose it. You could just literally walk in to the waves as the water is shallow till you reach a far point & then the gorgeous waves hit you 'bang'!! I'm sure it's great for the surfers too. We had a wonderful stay. Thank you.

We had such a fantastic time at Heritance Ahungalle, the food, the service and the staff were fantastic. When i did my research before our trip to SL and came across the reviews in this site and i was a bit worried about staying at Ahungalle, BUT my partner and i had an amazing time at Ahungalle. so thank you to the fantastic team for making our stay at Ahungalle really special. The staff was very pleasant and helpful and the food really great. Thank you to all at Ahungalle for a fantastic stay! We will definetely stay at Ahungalle again when we visit SL next year. Damon and Nicky

We arrived at Heritance Ahungalla on a rainy day and the service from the time of arrival was superb! The rooms are clean, and has all comforts some one can ask for. The pools are awesome and the smaller pool definitely has great privacy. The food is freat with a wide selection. Overall it was a great stay.

I stayed here in Feb 2011, near to the end of what had been a wonderful trip; but its seems nowt has changed, Staff were not too friendly as we'd experienced in rest of country, the whole hotel had an worn tired feel, the restaurant dark and hot, moved to outside tables for breakfast to sit with dirty table clothes even worse service but plenty of flies for company, asked at least 6 times to turn fans on but never did happen, oh and someone died while there - not sure if that was waiting?

Read some disppointing reviews here in the 2 or 3 weeks leading up to my holiday. I have travelled widely and stayed in some great hotels so I am not so easy to please, however I found that the Heritance was generally well run, staff were friendly and the room and amentities were of a good standard. I think you have to take into account that a country like Sri Lanka faces certain climatic conditions which means that the upkeep of any property would be a challenge, and creating something sympathetic to its environment and culture is difficult when you are trying to offer 5 star style services. So... Staff - unfailingly sweet and helpful. Not 5 star service but a very well meaning 4 star effort I would say. Only gripe was down at the beach area where there is a constant crowd of people trying to sell saris. massages, horse rides, you name it they were selling it. A number of security guards patrol this zone but I found them quite annoying in their own right and one of them approached me a couple of times on BEHALF of the beach vendors! If you said no I don't want a sari then the same person would ask if you wanted to visit his restaurant or have a massage or whatever. The hassle was constant. I think the hotel needs to train its security guards better so that they don't add to the problem. Beach area - I went on the beach only once and was hassled for all 100 metres of my walk. There was a red flag out the entire time I was there and frankly the sea was way too rough to even paddle in. Area was beautiful though. No sunbeds, presumably for all the reasons above. Pool areas - I used the "Green Pool". It was quieter than the main pool where a lot of noisy families and groups tended to congregate. Pools were both lovely, huge, clean and inviting. 5 star here. Restaurants - I ate a la carte every night in either the Coffee Shop or the fine dining restaurant. Both were good. Only thing was of course they were very very quiet (I was the only diner in the fine dining restaurant one evening) because most people use the buffet restaurant. I didn't go here in the evenings for 2 reasons. 1 - as I was on my own the staff would always try to tuck me away into a corner by the service area 2 - too many noisy children (really very loud indeed). I did have breakfast in the buffet restaurant and food was varied and delicious. I would say 4 star overall in this regard. Room - I had a standard room. It was large and well set out, great bathroom and shower. Air con was second to none. All spotless. Pillows were those nasty foam things though, but the bed was good otherwise. It did annoy me that the room was still being cleaned when I checked in at 6pm. I mean, they had 6 hours between turfing the last occupants out and my arrival!! As a result I had to sit in the room whilst they cleaned around me. I couldn't even use the bathroom after my very long trip. Gym - well equipped. But the air con was non existant. They have 2 small units for quite a big room with 2 fully glass walls, so it gets pretty hot in there. One of those units was broken for the duration of my stay and fixed the day I left. All equipment is in working order, but I would say that they could do with a couple of new treadmills pretty soon. I saw people in there working out in flip flops (always annoys me as it brings sand into the gym and gets into equipment) - the instructor was nowhere to be seen. On a couple of occasions I noticed that the instructor and other entertainment staff seem to congregate in the gym to watch the tv. I didn't visit the spa but the spa menu looked appealing and not too toppy. Nor did I visit the nightclub. The only shop on site is a gem shop and there was quite a hard sell if you so much as approached it. Reception - managed to give me a 4 am wake up call 1 day early. Pleased... I was NOT! They were very sorry about it of course. Check in was a bit slow (in retrospect they were probably trying to delay my discovering that the room wasn't ready). My welcome drink took ages to arrive and when it did the reception man reappeared and took me to my room before I could drink it! They were very helpful in giving me access to the internet though (free in the library area on the 3rd floor). All in all I would go back and I would recommend to my friends. The area is lacking in any other real amentities (a few very unappealing local shops outside and a busy main road to contend with) AND it is about 3 1/2 hours from the airport - that really adds to the long trip from the UK. But I guess you have to make an effort to get really good things and this is an effort I would definitely include in a future itinerary.

We just got back from Ahungalla one of 3 hotels we stayed at in Sri Lanka, we spent the first few days of our holiday travelling around and then 4 nights here. Quite frankly I cannot believe the rubbish some nit pickers write on here. The hotel is amazing, the setting is gorgeous and the staff are the friendliest we met. All the staff are very well trained and could not help us enough very approachable. The room was clean and kept clean daily by housekeeping who did an outstanding job. The A/C worked wonders and our room was a constant cool haven from the outside temperatures. We were on a half board basis and ate every day at the resturant. I found the variety good and my husband enjoyed all the local dishes, even on a day when i couldnt find a meal to my taste the kitchen prepared me something just for me. We were completely content in the hotel and only left once for a small shopping trip. I haved stayed in a variety of hotels in other countried but this was my first time to Sri Lanka, I was unsure what to expect but was completely happy with my hotel choices and the country a fab holiday.

I and my wife thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel during 3rd week of Nov 2011. All staff from Management to porters were very accommodating, and helpful. We would like to thank Assistant Manager Sampath DeSilva for ensuring that we had an enjoyable experience at the hotel. Also like to extend our thanks to Thushara Gnanarathne for providing us with excellent vegetarian meals at short notice. We were very happy with our executive room with sea views, always tidied and refreshed with clean towels, linen etc.and fresh fruits on the table. For this we wish to extend our thanks to the housekeeper Nilanga Weeraratne. Considering 5 star status, we must say that there is room for further improvements to recreational facilities. Hotel is in a nice location close to the beach and the infinity pool is great. Excellent choice of meals at breakfast, lunch and dinner makes it a great destination for adults and children alike. The sandy beach is nice and clean, sea can be rough at times, but overall we enjoyed the beach. Particularly at sunset time we have managed to take some very colourful, picturesque photos to remind us of this wonderful break in SriLanka.

This is a strange one, to be sure. With a few tweeks it could be one of the best beach hotels you'll ever stay in anywhere, but in the comparison with other places we stayed in Sri Lanka (and particularly Mount Lavinia), it just seems to fall short in areas that it would be so easy to correct. The setting, design and physical feel of the hotel are all quite stunning. But right away you get those little irksome contrasts that make this a frustrating place. Complacency abounds and you sense that they are still all patting themselves on the back for being able to re-open after the devastation of the Tsunami (yes those dreadful Youtube videos from Boxing Day 2004 were from balconies at The Triton, which has now become The Heritance). Positive sentiment isn't quite enough at the 5 star level unfortunately. It sits behind a gorgeous stretch of beach with surf that you just are dying to play in just 50 feet away - but to get from hotel gardens to the sea, you have to pass an almost comically persistent group of beach tradespeople each time. The hotel has a line of flags to keep them at bay, but the security staff still let them bother you from a distance when you are on a sun lounger by the pool. Would you get accosted by a panhandler on the steps of the Waldorf Astoria as you left to get in your cab? The sidewalk is public space but things can be done..... The two pools are large and magnificent, with the green pool so huge it even allows you to "length swim". There is also a gym with fairly up to date equipment, but its functionality was comprised every day of my stay by an inability of staff to get the message (despite 3 reminders in 3 days) that the aircon needs to be on and set to below 28 degs C for anyone to be able to use it. The minimalist design of the public areas has an overall calming effect on you, but with the architect apparently having a veto on everything, this extends to a lack of many of the features that you expect in any large resort - an excursions / news board; signs to different areas; names on the bars etc. We had little to complain about the food. In fact it was fairly reasonably priced for a putative 5 star, but it had little real wow factor, and apart from some of the local dishes on the buffet menu, it just scraped by. Last year we stayed on Meeru Island resort in the Maldives and despite the obvious abundance of produce in Sri Lanka compared to a coral attol, Meeru's buffets were both more inspiring and much cheaper. The room was spacious with a big balcony - as it should be for just over $300 a night! But the bathroom was blatantly unfinished with two walls smooth plastered but not painted. Some guests demanded a room change for this - we were told it was a design feature (see photo). With such a huge balcony a sun lounger rather than just 2 chairs and a table would have been an idea. And why oh why was there no rack to dry wet clothes. There was plenty of space, but maybe the architect had his say there as well. All the staff we interacted with were cheerful and accommodating, apart from the reception staff who were a bit feckless and needed to be a little more proactive. We were invited to a cocktail party given by the assistant manager, and found him charming and with an earnest concerned approach to some of the criticisms we gently raised. It really did not sit well however to be told that the beach sellers were tolerated on a "better the devil you know" basis and that other "newer" nationalities amongst the clientele liked having them around. I am not so sure the Heritance is that well advised to try to imitate Sharm El Sheikh at these prices. Lose the traditional customer base and I think they will lose much of their trade to the likes of Mount Lavinia. If you were to stay here and, as we are, you are fairly easy going if the weather is good, (as it was), you will probably be happy enough at the Heritance, give or take the $100 or so a night that should still be in your wallet. But I can imagine it could quite quickly become a nightmare in bad weather. You even had to pay to play on the pool table. Free pool if you spend 1500 rupees on drinks - come on! To end on a positive note of a review which I had intended to be somewhat more complimentary than it has turned out, the laissez-faire approach has allowed wildlife to remain on the grounds undisturbed. To see massive Iguanas digging for crabs next to your sun-lounger while chipmunks frolic around on your umbrella stand is a uniquely warming feeling. We were even able to film troupes of monkeys and even pass them mango pieces to eat on the branches of trees by the pool. Enchanting.

The Heritance Ahungalla is NOT a five or a four star. Was traveling with my older parents and children. The AC and lights in my parents room was not working, it took 3 hours, 3 phone calls and a conversion with a guy at the reception for someone to come and fix this. 2 strange men in the room fixing the AC and lights for 45 minutes. Moerover, the staff by the poolside is terribly slow. Hotel common areas are dirty. Saw used diapers and used band aids by the pool! Took them forever to ask for food and drinks. They did not even have mint to make certain cocktails! Ran out apparently. I would rate this as a 3 star, and nothing more. Will not return. Diasppointed. Waste of money.

We stayed at the Heritance Kandalama and were expecting the same high standard we had there. Unfortuantely we were very dissapointed by the Ahungalla. How this hotel managed to win an award I will never know! The hotel is dirty and tired and the service at breakfast is worth a special mention for all the wrong reasons. Dirty tables left uncleared for hours, the most disgusting tea and coffee I have ever tasted in my entire life and service without a smile. The only thing positive I have to say about the hotel is its location and the morning walk you can take along the stretch of beach on your door step. However, a word of warning, there are beach sellers who try to befriend (hassle) you about every 20 mins so go for your walk early before they get up!! All I can say is thank goodness we didnt spend our entire stay here!

Property: Whole Hotel is situated in a calm and quiet property... Though secluded from the city of colombo... you can manage to get all necessities if you travel in very short distance... Service: Service within hotel is not good... They need to stick to basics... * There was lint on the bed sheets from the cushions and the comforter... * There was no shampoo in the bath, on asking i was informed shampoo and bath gel is one and the same... When asked whether the person claiming so was sure about it... he returned with shampoo... * You are given seat in restaurant however you are not served water until you ask for it... You have to remind the attendants to refill water more than once... * Language is a problem, however all the people try their best to communicate... Thumbs Up: GEMS and Jewel Shop is pretty good...

We stayed at 2 other Heritance hotels which were fantastic, so we were bitterly disappointed by the Ahungalla. Service was consistently terrible, filthy mattresses on the sun loungers (they looked like something that belonged in a sri lankan prison), no soap in the toilets, dinning room so dark another guest actually bought a torch to see their food.

Okay it's one of the best hotel is Sri Lanka, it has won the award of best leisure hotel by the minister of tourism. Sure, the two pools are outstanding, the rooms are nice, the area is quiet and the beach is nice but... staying there we kept asking ourselves: is it how one should experience Sri Lanka beaches? Just before we stayed at Mirissa, a lovely beach with a lot of atmosphere, a couple small hotels and guest houses, a few waterfront bars and a great laid back atmosphere. The Heritance is the opposite. Big resort where you pay over-priced drink and food served by stylish staff. The hotel probably owns the beach, because there is nothing else around. Would advice to go there if you don't mind missing the charm of more "informal places". Compare to other places, we found the contact with the locals to be biased. It's either hotel staff or very insisting beach sellers. The later can be quite annoying especially when the seat in group of 8-10 just in front of your chair and stay all day long. The food was not exceptional, certainly not in line with the price they ask for it (in Sri Lankan terms of course!).

Nice beach hotel with 2 big swimming ball, service is nice, in the first day I went with my wife to the beach and enjoyed watching the waves but i had a problem with 3 of the citizens they came to me and circled me and my wife I think they want to steal my money, the taxi driver warn me about these bad people near the beach, they spoke to me in english and offered me a drink and a dinner in thier restaurant, I managed to escape from them by promising them in the next day I may visit them in thier restaurant. they allow me to go and in the next day morning I found them waiting for me, I refused to go to them. The hotel should notify all the visitors about these king of people for security reasons. the food is fantastic. don't miss it.

My now Husband and I stayed at Heritance Ahungalla for our wedding in Sept 2011, we were there for two weeks. We had been upgraded to a large room, 258. This was overlooking the green (residents) pool. the room was very spacious and with a huge bed. It was nice to have two seperate sinks and a bath. i would agree with some others that the smellies in the bathrooms are a bit thick and difficult to get out of the ceramic bottles. It was nice to have a sitting area. We didn't make full use of the balcony but it was nice to sit out there a few afternoons. We stayed on a B&B basis, which suited us. Breakfast is a good buffet, with meats, cheese, fruit, curries and an assortment of other items. There are chef's who will cook you an omlette, waffle, boiled eggs all to your specifications. Staff bring tea and coffee to your table, unsuprisingly the tea is gorgeous and my mother inlaw said the coffee was good. A little tip, if you like several cups of tea in the morning then ask for a pot for the table, the waiters will leave one and some milk. The pools are lovely to relax by and the pool staff are very helpful with bringing matresses and towels and moving the beds for you. It is interesting to chat to Bali and Sunnil (Older pool staff) as Sunnil has worked in the hotle for 30 years and Bali for 19 years. The nights we ate in the hotel we ate in the coffee shop. Lovely relaxed atmosphere and food a reasonable price. I would suggest if in a group order some of the curries with accompaniments, 1000 rupees but loads and the rest of the group said the curries were good, if hotter than most othe curries that were eaten. the chefs will change a dish if required but if you say mild, this may not be as mild as you would like. Staff were always friendly and helpful. The hotel was quite quiet whilst we were there and pretty much every member of staff was aware that we were there for our wedding. For anyone looking at getting married in Sri Lanka we can only say go for it. Especially at Heritance Ahungalla. Staff organised everything wonderfully. Buila (wedding co-ordinator) was great. So much easier than getting married in the UK. Also not everyone can say they have an elephant at their wedding. Special thanks to KK (food and beverage manager) and Chef Kasan. They organised our meal for us and our 7 guests. The food was stunning and again no problems to change the menu. A family joke is my love for the father in laws cauliflower cheese, so they made some especially. Also my friend doesn't drink tea or coffee but does peppermint tea, mint appeared to be hard to get hold of so KK had some secreted away in the kitchen and whenever my friend wanted mint leaves in hot water it was there. The beach sellers can be a littlein your face but a polite no is normally ok. There are lots of people around who will offer you tours etc. I would say go with your gut instinct and if you like someone then go with them. The hotel does get busy at weekends as special rates are offered to Sri lankan nationals and whilst we were there 2 conferences took place. The spa is lovely but not the cheapest. I had a package of massage, body scrub and facial. the treatment took just under 3 hours and cost Â£100. We would definatley return to Heritance Ahungalla. Especially to see how our coconut tree is going that we planted as part of our wedding package. P.S if anyone is thinking of getting married her please feel free to PM us.

Good hotel, great food, well trained staff but very quiet in the low season. Stayed in the famous room 305 with its huge balcony! Peaceful location but the beach sellers can be rather too persistent. We bought sarong, dress and skirt and used them for tuk tuk journeys to bentota where we also had a suit made, bought jewellery and local crafts. Despite this we were being pressured to book trips with them. We had already made arrangements with Rammuni Tours (who were excellent by the way)and since it was the low season there was not enough tourists to go round resulting in us trying to hide from them when by the pool! Both weekends the hotel was full of Sri lankans which was fine but they farmed us out to the shabby banqueting suite for our evening meal on the first weekend. We had just returned from our overnight trip to kandy only to find a small buffet set up with cold food and tables with chairs that seemed too low for the table. This was the only time we complained since the room was definitely not 5 star. We were allowed to use the main restaurant after that. It was much busier of course but we preferred this to feeling excluded. A special mention goes to Nayagar the trainee in the Jute restaurant - she always had a welcome smile on her face and made us feel very comfortable. We saw an English wedding being held on the lawn at the front of the hotel. An elephant was brought to hotel and it followed the bride on her walk to the alter! It all appeared to go very well and fireworks had been arranged for the wedding party in the evening.

My fiancÃ© & I stayed here for 3 days at the end of a tour of Sri Lanka. It was pure bliss; we only left the hotel once to go to the turtle farm. The service is fantastic, food amazing and very reasonable/cheap in the coffee shop with exceptional quality. The rice & curries for 1000rps is great value. We just walked the beach and use the pool all day. Such a relaxed atmosphere in the hotel. It also has the best sun set I have ever seen. Would strongly recommend.

Heritance Ahungalla is a lovely hotel, designed by renowned architect Geoffrey Bawa and situated on a beautiful stretch of beach about 80km from Colombo. The rooms are well equipped and furnished with great ocean views. Food is simply amazing and has something to offer every taste bud. The service offered was beyond expectations, and would gladly commend the staff, who were extremely helpful and capably obliging. There are 2 swimming pools and a common area jacuzzi and other activities that will keep you occupied if you're on long stay. While you're at it, check out the DIviyan spa as well. Had an amazingly relaxed time and awesome Balinese massage, from genuine therapists from Bali. Definitely one of the best hotels in Sri Lanka!
We stayed in this hotel during our honeymoon in 2009. Very nice hotel to relax near the beach with an excellent pool. During the night time they had local cultural dance festival as well.

My husband and I stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla in July for 2 weeks for our honeymoon. The hotel is about two hours away from the airport and the journey there can be quite hair-raising due to how the Sri-Lankans drive - be aware!!! On arriving at the hotel we were early, check in is normally 2pm however our travel company had warned them that we would be early and so a room was ready for us. Being honeymooners the hotel upgraded our standard room to a luxury suite and provided us with complimentary wine and fruit. The room itself was number 205. The room was very spacious with two single beds pushed together (not great for honeymooners!!), a living area and the biggest balcony I have ever seen, which overlooked the pool on one side and the beach on the other side. The bathroom was also huge and had both a bath and a rainforest shower. Complimentary toiletries were given however these were in bottles and were hard to get out (tip-put hot water in the bottle as well and this will loosen up the liquid). The towels in the room were changed twice a day and there was a bed turning down service. The room was always cleaned to a high standard. I would however say that aspects of the room could do with being re-painted or upgraded a bit, the air conditioning leaked, paint was chipping off walls and the table and chairs on the balcony really needed varnishing badly however these were minor details that did not put us off. The hotel itself is massive and completely open plan. As soon as you are driven up the massive driveway you can see the sea through the open plan reception, absolutely stunning! There are 2 swimming pools, one by the reception which was like an infinity pool overlooking the beach and the other was a quieter pool towards the rear of the property. We tended to choose this pool as it was quieter. The pool attendants could not have been more helpful, they position your sunlounger as you like it, provide towels and are so friendly. As well as this there is a bar attendant who will serve you food and drinks at your sunlounger. Perfect! There is also a jacuzzi by the pool which runs from 8am-midday and 4pm-8pm, lovely! There is also a gym which is open 24/7 and has all the machines you could possibly need. The beach is a massive, beautiful beach. When we were there the sea was too rough to swim in but we paddled in it and it was the warmest sea I have ever felt. You will have locals trying to sell you things on the beach but they are all very friendly and it is easier to say no to them straight away otherwise you will not be left alone for a second. We ate in the coffee shop most evening but we also tried the jute buffet restaurant. Although both were good I would recommend the coffee shop over the buffet. The buffet has a different theme every night and there is always a fantastic selection of food however we prefered the atmosphere andbeing outdoors at the coffee shop. A personal favourite of ours was the samosa starter, delicious! The prices were typical prices for a 5* hotel but if you think Sri Lanka is cheap, it is not at this hotel. The location of the hotel is not particularly great. There are no hotels nearby and there is relatively little to do in the immediate area. We did go on a trip organised by Kuoni which was a boat trip to an island where cinnamon was made. We had such a fantastic time on this trip, saw lots of wildlife and the people who made the cinnamon etc were lovely and did not pressurise you at all to buy anything. We also went to the turtle hatchery and it was lovely to hold the baby turtles. Thoroughly recommend this trip. Finally other people have said that check out was slow, we did not experience this at all, it was very quick and efficient, no problems. All in all I would recommend this hotel to families, couples, solo travellers, business people...anyone! It may not be a european 5* standard but it certainly is a gorgeous, clean hotel with friendly, helpful staff and I can guarantee you will have a lovely holiday here.

This hotel has actually been given 4.5 stars not 5 by some tour operators and I would say it is worth the 4.5 stars. I am unable to see why people have little gripes about the Heritance as no holiday is perfect. The service here was excellent especially in the main restaurant (jute), room service and around the pool areas where there was no shortage of beds or brollies was an excellent service The room was spacious and spotlessly clean. There was a big shower so if you want an upgraded room with a bath you should expect to pay for it nothing in life is free. Swimming pools and jacuzzi fab as quite big. Reception staff, money exchange all gave a good service. Staff very friendly, happy and willing. Service can be slow but people must understand this is the Sri Lankan culture so if you want fast food go to Macdonalds. The chap complaining about the price of the coffee if he doesn't want 5 star prices then go to a 3 star hotel. Yes the prices were a bit on the high side for Sri lanka. the buffet cost about Â£17 each but was worth it. The Mustard a la carte restaurant was excellent and cheaper. Menu in the Mustard was a little limited, as was the room service menu but one could usually find something to eat. The Mirror Coffee shop perhaps could have been a bit better as the menu was similar to the Mustard Restaurant and room service menus and yes the cappucino could have been better and gateau of the day was always chocolate but this is Sri Lanka not New York. The hotel was adept at handling weddings conferences you name it without impacting on the service which still remained first class however many guests stayed. There were a lot of locals staying over the weekend but this wasn't a problem as they were in the other pool so it wasn't overcrowded. The only drawback which wasn't the hotel's fault I thought was the location. There were no hotels nearby and as soon as you stepped outside the main entrance you were seriously pounced on by people wanting this that and the other. I have visited Lanka 6 times and this is the worst scenario for this ever. The gym was well equipped and had air con. The animation team did very little and seemed very unanimated but I am sure if you really wanted to do an activity you could approach them as they did not really ask you to take part in anything. We did the River trip but it was a bit disappointing as we saw a few jellyfish a kingfisher and about three different birds. On the trip saw Cinnamon Island briefly an old man telling us how cinnamon is processed. Picture a scrawny chicken running around, skinny man so we bought some cinnamon then walked past his hut and he had a bigger tv than me! Yala safari very enjoyable booked through Tui who use Aitken Spence. We also did Bindali bird park during the trip which is next to Yala but think shouldn't have bothered as saw various birds and animals at Yala which were also at Bindali so Yala would have been sufficient. It was easy to relax at the |Heritance and we came back happy and chilled out. i would recommend anyone visiting Lanka for the first time to do a few days tour then a beach stay, otherwise day trips from the hotel can be a bit too far. I would recommend this hotel without any hesitation, to anyone thinking of staying there.

We decided head off to the Heritence Ahungalle for the Weekend with my Family and was blown away by its sheer size and creative architecture by the late world renowned Architect " Geoffrey Bawa" Our room was very clean and spacious and most importantly had a wonderful View overlooking the large Swimming Pool and the beach. However the only drawback in the room was the quality of the shampoos which came in small reusable ceramic bottles. I must say that with the shampoo consisting of thick liquid, I was unable to release it on to my hair despite giving it a good shake and strongly recommend that Visitors who patronize this Hotel bring there own shampoo. Visitors will not be short of outdoor activities with a Tennis and Badminton court in addition to a Swimming Pool available which helped me burn some calories after having a sumptuous meal offered by the award winning culinary chiefs at the Hotel. We were spotlit for choice with the variety of meals offered during breakfast , lunch and dinner which consisted of Sri Lankan and far eastern cuisine. However I noted that our table had either a fork, spoon or a glass missing had to bring it to the notice to the waiters who happily obliged and did the needful. While checking in is quite smooth, I cant say in the same breath about checking out especially when you have one cashier in the counter behind the front desk processing all payments which kept me waiting for a good 20 minutes and created a bad taste in an otherwise memorable holiday. From a Personal point view I can say that despite the small shortcomings the staff are very friendly and committed to making your holiday memorable which is good for this hotel in the long run. I would like to reserve a special word of thanks to the Security Guard who was on duty near the Badminton Court on the 17th of July for going out of his way to assist me borrow some badminton rackets at a time when the person in charge was not around.

I went to Heritance Ahungalla for my Honeymoon & It was unbeatable amazing. I would like to start off with the location as this will be the first thing to see... It was really easy to find as it was just off the Colombo - Galle main road. When you get in to the hotel it was just amazing as hotel is open to stunning swimming pool & to the beach. From the second we entered to the reception it was a great experience & within 1-2 minutes we had a welcome drink followed by warm greetings from hotel staff. Accommodation was great & I just informed once that I am coming for my honeymoon & the bed was nicely decorated & the en suite facilities we had were brilliant & everything was clean & neat. Food was excellent & more surprisingly restaurant team has arranged an outside special table arrangement for honeymoon dinner. I cannot expect any better service than this & how good their communication within the departments as I only informed to reservations that I am coming for my honeymoon & itâ€™s been communicated through out to all department as housekeeping, restaurant, etc.... All I can say is that the every single minute I spent there was brilliant & the personal attention we had from the staff was amazing. There is no reason why I should suggest this hotel to someone who is looking for great beach resort experience & which is really value for money. I would like to thanks again for the team for giving us such a great experience on our honeymoon & I will definitely visit again in my next Sri Lanka trip.

We stayed one night as part of a tour of Sri Lanka. The hotel is lovely and is situated right on the beach, about 45 minutes drive from Galle. We happened to be there when the Sri Lankan and Aussie cricket teams were also staying there, which provided a bit of excitement (and incredible security). Our only gripe was being served a completely frozen samosa at dinner. Otherwise, a very good hotel.

went for a weekend away and had a wonderful exp. stayed at ahungalla twice before but got a luxury room this time around which was well worth it. the room was very spacious, with a lovely view. the service was great despite them being at full capacity ... the food was great. had dinner one evening at coffee shop/restaurant as we wanted a quieter evening and found the food in general was good not only the buffet however the atmosphere was hindered occasionally as there was a large noisy crowd from the two companies that had brought their staff on a company trip , if not for that factor it was a lovely relaxing and enjoyable stay

I have just had the experience of checking in my friend and his wife to the Heritance, it looked ok on the way in but the outlook is very sterile, having read most of the reviews about their coffee shop we eventually made it there after a labourious check in, I suggest to the management that they should send their coffee shop staff into the Capital city colombo to the almost genuine 5 star hotels to find out what a Capucino and a Cafe Latte is and how it is made and presented, we had 2 cups of ordinary coffee with a bit of milk froth on top and were charged the best part of 5 USD for this pathetic version of a Capucino and Latte, I don't mind paying 5 star prices but please please provide us with a 5 star cup of coffee, and how in heavens name do hotels classify themselves as 5 star, a ordinary 3 star hotel in Thailand will knock spots of any so called 5 star hotel in Sri Lanka, very very disappointed.

This hotel has been serving people i guess for more than two decades and it has never failed to impress me. The kind service, huge garden(coconut) lovely beach to play, great food, two lovely pools, and freedom from any mode of disturbance makes this a no 1 hotel in Sri Lanka. The buffet was wonderful, and being vegetarian it had quite an array for us too.

We spent two nights in this hotel and it was a fabulous experience. Apart from the great view of the ocean, the hotel has two great swimming pools. Its a great place to just relax and get away from the busy life. We wounld definitely vist this place again.

I stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla with my wife and two children as part of a two week stay in Sri Lanka - the first week in the "cultural triangle" and part of the second week on the coast in the Heritance property. It would be considered to be one of the best hotels in the region - and it didn't disappoint. We were greeted upon arrival with a welcome drink whilst looking over the swimming pool and onwards to the beach - only 5 metres beyond the edge of the infinity pool. A stunning vista which served to relax and excite in equal measure. The staff were wonderfully courteous as has been our experience with all the Sri Lankans we have come acorss during our stay. The country appears to be making great strides to come back from the political troubles it has been experiencing over the last 2 decades. Both the swimming pools were fantastic and the area was well complimented by very attentive pool staff. There are are a number of dining rooms however I only experienced the main buffet dining room due to being with a 13 and 4 year old. The variety and quality of food was very good. A special mention to KK, one of the F & B managers, who looked after us as if we were family! Perhaps he is a distant Sri Lankan cousin! Do try some of the Sri Lankan cuisine such as coconut sambol, string hoppers and any number of the curries - potatoe, egg..........wonderfully tasty, spicy and flavoursome. Take a wander down to the beach and sample the Indian Ocean - I've never experienced sea water as warm - anywhere in the World. You will be approached by local sellers of souvenirs - but like all Sri Lankan people, they are very gentle and will not intimidate you. We didn't take any of the Tours that were available for the region as we were just unwinding but there is a lot to do in the region including visiting turtle sanctuaries. In April, the weather was mixed - but due to the special atmosphere in the country, it really didn't appear to matter. It only lasted a couple of hours and then dried up almost as quickly as it arrived. In short, a wonderful few days break - we would definitely return.

Wonderful welcome after long journey,room was very clean and comfortable and remained so for entire holiday.We ate in hotel and found the food very good the staff in restaurant went out of their way to provide whatever we wanted even if it was not on menu.All hotel staff were freindly and helpful ,beautiful hotel will defintely return.

we were stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla for reason our family louting. The location was perfect & Nice hotel. Positives: - The bed was great, much more comfortable than my lousy bed back home! - Restaurant food was good but service was not great - Clean Towels Negatives: - Reception people did not do so great a job. When I arrived, there was many people around but no proper welcome.Dark GRE was not helpful at all.She was negative when we ask for bigger room. - Service in restaurant was not very good. - Bed room Carpet need to change. Overall, experince was not soo great.!!!

The spa facility they have is breath taking. My wife and daughter loved it overlooking the see directly. Brilliantly located close to many places and Bentota for water activities. Swimming pool is marvelous and food is great.

The reception people are very depressing. They are not courteous, rude and I was shocked that this hotel belongs to a group of hotels and a large company. The Reception people really gave my family a soar welcome and ruined our mood. They are very suspicious and look at you like we are thieves. Maybe the Management have to start customer service classes and put the right people there.At least people who can smile. Also responsiveness of services is also slow overall.

Stayed in the hotel during my vacation to Sri Lanka on July. I stayed Cinnamon grand, Kandalama before Heritance Ahungalla. I don't know what make this hotel 5 star. I ordered 3 triple rooms but when I got to room they are double rooms. When asked they said they put another bed to make it triple. checked in at 4:30PM but didn't get third bed until 12:30AM. 12:30 AM !!!!. Every time I called they said they have asked housekeeping for the extra bed. Finally got third beds from drivers quarters. Very nasty bed with 2 inch mattress. Food is average not best. I've seen better verity in average buffets. Try a different hotel before considering this.

We have just returned from a 10 day stay at this hotel where we also got married. Firstly I have to say that our wedding day was fantastic and everything was arranged perfectly for us thanks to Burla, the wedding co-ordinator at the hotel. She truely cared about giving us a day to remember. From the day we arrived Burla was attentive and supportive in making sure all of the arrangements were made for us. The hotel itself was lovely open style and very comfortable, making you feel instantly relaxed. The green pool area was lovely and the staff throughout the hotel were attentive and friendly. We had mainly in the buffet restaurant which we found had a great choice of food although at times the hot meals that werent being cooked for you at the time could have been hotter. The BBQ evening was fantastic. I would thoroughly recommend the Fine Dining restuarant. The food here was absolutely fantastic. We did a Elephant safari and a river safaru whilst in Sri Lanka which was also excellent. The only downside was the tim it takes to get to and from the airport around 2 and a half hours to do a relatively short journey however we did see the contsurction of the new highway which will hopefully help speed things up when thats complete. Overall I have to say we loved our stay in Sri Lanka and loved this hotel. We had a lovely holiday and a truly perfect wedding.

Good view of private beach from room, two good swimming pools and a jacuzzi But open only till 8 pm! Was served wrong wine, poor exchange rate, a baby girl fell down from above, ac had problems, very slow at check out! Overall a good experience but could be better if improvements are made to food quality, service and overall staff quality.

The Heritance Ahungalle is a lovely hotel on the South Coast of Sri Lanka and I recently choose the hotel to propose to my girlfriend. I would like to take a moment and thank everyone for making it as special as possible. The only instruction I had made while making my reservation was for something nice and am glad the hotel had attended to the specifics! On arrival we were greeted with refreshments and then taken to the most lovely corner suite. The suite consists of a beautifully furnished lobby area, the bedroom, a large bathroom and a private terrace. The hotel had arranged a table with a flower arrangement on the terrace for lunch, the four-poster bed was decorated with a pattern made of red flower petals and a bubble bath had been drawn with a few red shoe-flowers to complete the ambiance. It was perfect and the best part was I hadnâ€™t really requested anything. After a little time to unwind, lunch was served. Five kinds of bread and three varieties of butter were served with our starters. Followed by cream of tomato soup and passion fruit sorbet to cleanse the palate! As a vegetarian I was served very cheesy lasagna, while a seafood platter with lobster, tiger prawns, cuttle fish and fish was served to my girlfriend. A prelude to marriage was glimpsed as my girlfriend, enticed by the cheese left half the seafood to finish of my lasagna. After Ice cream sandwiches for dessert, tea / coffee and homemade chocolates, going down on one knee was a difficult task to manage. But manage I did and I proposed on a private terrace, overlooking the Indian Ocean. For one of the best days of my life and I would like to thank: â€¢ Shanaka and the Colombo team for arranging everything â€¢ Shyamalee Wijethilake and Kumara Karunaratne at the hotel â€¢ Praveen, who was our attentive waiter An ideal retreat for a romantic day by the sea.
