Stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla in December 2010 - was a fabulous stay with wonderful and attentive staff. We were upgraded to a suite with sea views and had fresh fruits delivered each day. The hotel is beautiful but the staff makes it the best stay. Special mention of KK. Highly recommended.

We visited during the Monsoon season in June 2011 but luckily the weather wa beautiful, the hotel had very few guests then but it was exactly what we needed, peace and quiet! The Pool is amazing and the staff is very friendly like everyone in Sri Lanka. They had few rennovation works going on during the low season but it was still ok. The hotel is located in Ahungalla which is a very small town but very close to Bentotta and reasonably close to Galle. We hired a Tuk Tuk driver who showed us around Bentotta and Galle, he asked for very reasonable charges and we always paid him double what he asked for. We enjoyed the trips in the red tuk tuk , Raja was very helpful and pleasant. He lives very close to the hotel and his mobile nb is 0094776954583

Located right on a beautiful and serene beach, this is a great property 2 hours south of Colombo. We had a very nice and relaxing time at this property. Teh ocean facing rooms were great. The people there were very friendly and took good care of us. The only issue i had was that the a/c's in the room was not working well.

A huge average tourist hotel. I would not call this place luxurious. Not sure if there are alternatives. If you can, skip this place. The beaches are not nice. Everything outside the hotel is depressing. They've had many years to fix, so there is no excuse for things looking so devastated and filthy after the Tsunami. Sorry, it's a real shame. The entire coast south and west looks terribly sad. I cannot in good conscience tell any of my friends to go there. There are so many poor people. Please give them employment and pay them to clean up the ENTIRE coast!

The staff were friendly and it was a lovely welcome. We had paid for half board but didnt realise this meant we could only eat in the buffet restaurant, we wanted to sample all the restaurants so negotiated a deal with the management. The Sri Lankan buffet night was brilliant but the rest of the time we preferred to have people waiting on us. The beach was a nightmare to walk along romantically as you always had a 3rd person there offering to take you on a trip somewhere. The entertainment at the hotel was brilliant. The cheeky chipmunks and lizardy things were ok once you got used to them wandering around and we had a group of monkeys in the trees outside our room which were good to watch! The room service wasnt good in the beginning as there was always something missing, we went on a day trip one day to come back late afternoon to find the breakfast tray still in the room and the room hadnt been done. I complained to the duty manager and he had a word with the room cleaner who came and apologised and things did improve. I would suggest that nothing at all however small is left out to avoid temptation, we all make sure we put valuables in the safe but it isnt always that sort of thing that goes missing. I lost some make-up and a book, they could have fallen into the bin. We went on a trip organised by a Trailfinders recomended company and he was fantastic. He fit the trip around us. We visited the turtle hatchery, the mask museum, the jewellery mine and the glass bottom boat.

We had a great time with our 8 month old baby.Pools,beaches are excellent.went to visit Kandy.beautiful trip. But never go with baby as it takes 6 hours to reach there from hotel.don't forget Stroller. Food is expensive.

Was working in Sri Lanka and had the weekend to myself and managed to get a very good rate last minute for a very reasonable price (same as a HIE in uk) however full rate I think would be maybe not so worth it. Please note when I arrived they were doing quite a bit of rennovations (though this was being done discreetly and quietly to minimise effect to guests). However hotel was probably at least 50% empty. Hotel is a Geofrey Bawa Hotel (famous architect) and you can see his style throughout the hotel. Its not the usually glassy inpersonal type hotel that you can sometimes stay in - this hotel does have character for a large hotel. Though I think the hotel could do more to enhance this. Its quite a Large hotel with reasonable facilities. I went for a wander when I first arrived and everytime I turned a corner I seemed to find something new whether it was table tennis, to the table courts to a bars that are nicely spread out. Hotel itself is in lovely bay with some wonderful views. Overall I think it was a lovely stay however not quite as special as I thought it would be from hotel website. LOCATION Its roughtly 1.5 hours drive from Colombo, and probably a good 3 hours drive from airport. If you are suffering after a travelling you maybe want to do a stop over in Negombo near airport or Colombo city. Its slightly away from many of the overcrowded toursit areas like Bentota and this can have good and bad points. ARRIVAL When you arrive at the hotel - you are ushered to sit down and they bring over some refreshments whilst you sign in. It was nicely done - though I think if busy this may take some time, this si kind of usual for Sri lanka so be prepared for this and I take the time to wander a little or orders ome drinks. ROOM Room was well furnished and decorated - I had view of the back Pool and beach. Full AC and Fan. Please note room leads to an open plan corridor (very Geffrey Bawa - but this does mean at night you may get a few mosi's in your room when you open door or use the balacony so get them to spray your room before you go to bed and use the fan(mosi cant land on you if you have fan on) - I carry a can of baygon which you can buy in local shops to kill any mosi that may be hiding at night. Toilet was nicely done - though please note - no bath - which if you have children you may want to check on which rooms have baths. The toiletries were fine - but nothing to write home about - personally I prefer my own. Hairdryer in bathroom was good enough for ladies use. All seemed very clean and nice Wardrobe and draws, and space above draws doubles as suitcase stand. Beds were very comfortable, and sheets and towels all seemed fine and I had no complaints compared to other reviewers. Room had safe in wardrobe which seemed usual good hotel quality. There was a console desk for laptop and stuff. Kettle coffee/tea facilities. There was a very small mini frdge but it had no icebox which is a shame. Also please note alcohol apart from local beer is expensive - I would purchase what you need at duty free. Also in room large media cabinet - I am hoping they will look into flatscreens tv soon! Usual Sri Lankan Satellite available. I would have liked a DVD player. Also is small sofa and coffee table. Room had good lighting and I loved instaed of heavy curtains. they have light muslin nets curtain and then huge sliding panels which makes the room very dark and peaceful. The windows seemed to insulate reasonable well against outside although to be fair it was very quiet in any case. The balcony was usual standard - 2 seats and table. They gave free wifi FACILITIES Not bad for Sri Lankan hotel, but not quite up to a top western hotel. 2 very lovely pools, one with jacuzzi. tennis court (not sure whether in good state), table tennis, fitness room (nobody uses), pool/snooker tables (you pay for this about $1.5) 3 restaurants and quite a few bars, there is a games room and library however I never bothered to check this out. However no shops (its shutdown) jsut a jewerally shop. To get to anywhere you need to take a short drive. There is very lovely Spa with Indonesian ladies brought in specially - my advice - check this out - its lovely! FOOD I never bothered with restaurants - prefering to get room service. My first order a salad was so dissappointing - I had 1 lettuce leaf - I kid you not. However I peservered and everything else that came was lovely, and they even brought me cocktails and extra's to the room. However for half board price its probably better value to just eat the buffet on offer. I did do breakfast and was a good Sri Lankan buffet with plenty of variety from European, German, English, French to Sri Lankan curries. BEACH Beach is lovely - pretty clean when I went and is a very long bay. No packs of dogs and all very pretty. However annoying youths spoiled my walk by myself but the other locals when they heard were so horrified by rude behavious and apologised - which was very sweet. they even offered to accompany me at a distance so I could enjoy my walk without being bothered. SPA Well worth a visit on 1st day to help you get into holiday spirit of relaxation. Not Sri Lankan cheap but reasonable price by western prices. SERVICE It was quiet, however I thought service was very good. nicely balanced although I can see how some reviewers may get annoyed with the overfriendliness of some staff. Bless them they are on the whole very eager to make sure you enjoy yourself and you stay is good. I would rather have this than the rude obnoxious service you can get in the UK. Other points - Ground floor rooms - balcony is open to the grounds. Its perfectly safe - but with very young children this may be either a blessing or an issue. Also the ground floor rooms near the back swimming pool - may get noisy. If this is an issue I would mention it when you book or email hotel before your arrival. BOOKING OUT The bane of all Sri Lankan Hotels and this one is no exception - allow 20 mins at least to book out if its not busy and a lot longer if it is busy. I would suggest get them to organise bill whilst you finish packing up or having breakfast. OVERALL A really lovely hotel but perhaps not quite up to the image suggested on the glossy website (but maybe after rennovations??). However I actually preferred this to the Lighthouse near galle (another Geofrey Bawa hotel) due to service and has a certain something to it. Location is lovely and tranquil when I visited. Would I go back - most definately however 3-4 days would be my limit. Just not enough there yet.

Ahungalla is a sea-side town about 2-3 hours from Colombo. Ahungalla Heritance resort was designed by Geoffrey Bawa, Sri Lanka's best known architect. As you arrive at the resort you are greeted by his signature style of blending the buildings with the natural environment. Lovely! We stayed in a luxury suite which was very spacious althougth the room's fittings are in need of an uplift. The housekeeping staff really let this hotel down! We called them 4 times for an extra towel which didn't arrive. The room was only turned down once for the 4 nights we were there. The room was a little grubby (stained rugs and cushions, dirty bathroom tiles.) The food was fantastic! Well prepared and a great variety. There are a lot of activities for guests to link into. Unfortunately the hotel rests on its reputation of winning architectual design and good food and has let that "5 star" service slip.

My (new) wife and i stayed here from 7th March till 14th March and had a fantastic time. We also got married here on the beach and would unreservedly recommend this hotel for a dream wedding. Right from when we first arrived we were amazed by the stunning location and the view from the lobby, over the eternity pool into the sea still sends shivers down my spine. We arrived early, so our rooms weren't ready but it didn't take long for us to be shown to our rooms (about the time it took to drink our coffee). The rooms were fantastic although a few minor things made us think it posssibly wasn't a 5star compared to British hotels. However, having not being used to this level of luxury we were very happy with our room. Large comfortable bed, spacious bathroom and working air con. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the food was just superb. Everyone should try the Sri Lankan food as we all found it magnificent. The wedding was spectacular with Kandyan drummers and dancers, a day we will never forget and are constantly boring everyone we meet with stories of how good it was. A special mention to Sarah for her help organising the wedding, especially as we found out later the girl who normally does it was ill and she was standing in. The pool boys were very good, you were never waiting long for beds and there was always barmen about you could order from. It was amazing to see a lizard every day wandering about the grounds looking for insects in the dirt, just added to the blissed out charm. It is a very good location for visits to Kosgoda Turtle Hatchery and the town of Ambalongoda. I could go on and on and on but summing up we can't wait to get back as soon as we can and miss the hotel and Sri Lanka every day

What a fabulous hotel. What a great place to get married. The service in this hotel far exceeds anything we have experienced in the UK. Truly amazing. When we arrived at 9pm, tired and jaded after 8 hours in a minibus, Bieulla our wedding organiser greeted us with flowers and a warm welcome. The next day she walked us through our options, where to get married, flowers, cake etc. Reassured us about everything and said she would be with us on the day right the way through. On the day she even helped with Michelle's hair. The dancers were amazing, the ceremony on the beach was stunning. There were even a couple of hotel guests crying! we finished up by leaving in the sunset on elephant back. We were full of small doubts when we arrived, the hotel gave us such service that we were 500% more than satisfied than what we expected. Brilliant, highly recommended. Thanks Bieulla, and everyone at the Hotel.

Is this a 5 star hotel?? The hotel is not well maintained. Staff are not professional. Service not up to standard. Waited for 20 mins to get towels and sun bed at the pool area, yet nobody came. Had to go to front desk to ask if anyone working around the pool. Staff standing around in groups, not interested in attending to guests.

The Problem with Hotels on the East coast, is that they are close to the main road. Less than 20 meters. This means you cannot get away from the noise of the buses and hooting that is so prevelant in the country. Heritance is more than 200 m away from the road and therefore away from the hussel and bussel of the surrounding area. You acutally feel like you are in a quiet tropical location. You hear the birds and natural noises. The Hotel itself is stunning, Geoff Bawa, the architect definately got the right balance between building and embracing nature. The nutaral colours the blending of building with nauture is appreciated. The beaches are clean and there is a lot of beach to cover so you do not feel onto of other tourists there. The waves were fun and water temp pefrect. The only blemish is the constant harrassment of locals trying to sell you clothing or go to their resturants. The staff are excellent and well trained. They did a lot for us in terms of assisting with our wedding and went further than requested in seeing that our wedding was as beautiful and romantic as dreamed. Thank you. It also helped that the level of English was good, so communication was not a problem. Heritance can handle all element s of arranging a wedding so there was no need for a wedding planner. They even have celebrety cheif, so meals were of high standard. . Prior to coming to Heritance we were originally in Hikaduwa, which was not that great. We are not surfer, lonely planet travellers, which I felt Hikaduwa was catering for. We are in our mid thirties with our priorities at (quiet, cleanliness, beauty and a level of comfort a lady expects at this age). The prices in Hikaduwa for Hotels was not in proportion to what you were getting. Heritance was more expensive but you got what you paid for and the website is not misleading in terms of quality of rooms and the look of the hotel. We found a number of hotels in Hikaduwa misleading on their websites. Therefore Heritance was our saviour! We also recommend Heritance for a family holiday. As a kid I would of had blast swimming in the sea and swimming in both pools, one of which has a beautiful tree covering it. Lots of activities in the hotel and surrounding area. We have been to Sri Lanka three times and if I was to go back, I would only go back to Heritance to the calm and beauty of the place. Use Heritence web site to book. You get the best prices there. Dont be afraid to negociate an upgrade once you get there. You might be surprised.

Food was terrific. Staff were so helpful. Rooms were perfect. Activities in the pool were fun. Beach was amazing. Lion beer was good. The sports bar was nice and it had air con. The best holiday I have been on so far

My first visit to this Hotel ( Hotel Triton) was back in 1985 and I made 4 subsequent visits until 1995, so this was my first for 16 years, and I was very much looking forward to arriving. The Wow factor has not been lost, the arrival and almost every corner of this fine hotel still does not disappoint. Forget the ridiculous Hotel star rating scheme that means nothing other than providing a tick list of facilities, this Hotel is Very good and has just the right atmosphere, making you very comfortable all day every day. The beach area is as always stunning and the Beach bar/Restaurant, along the beach a welcome lunch time stroll away. Food is good, although I did find some difficulty in making choices due to limited menu in the coffee shop. Of course everyone can find fault if they wish to, I found very little, except every day dirty table clothes at breakfast, now is this fault of the staff for not replacing them between every guests arrival for breakfast? or the eating habits of other guests, I regret to say that the eating habits of many guests are not what they should be, I witnessed Gluttony on a grand scale at the breakfast buffet, which is Im afraid a measure of the social sophistication of most of the guests more than the ability of the staff. I am sure full board packages does provide Heritance with valuable business in these difficult times, but a great number of guests are " Of a Type" and care should be exercised by the management if they wish to avoid the worst of low grade tourism that is so prolific in many European destinations. There was also an attempt to charge me for items I had not consumed, from the mini bar. I expected this, as on arrival there were a number of mini bar consumption forms in my room that had been partially completed. Not unexpected that they attempted to charge me for items that matched the forms that were in my room on arrival. A very firm refusal by me to pay unless they could demonstrate an audit and my consumption soon dealt with the situation. Thank you Heritance for a lovely stay, hopefully my next will not be after a gap of 16 years.

My son and now daughter in law arranged their wedding at the Heritance Ahungalla, what a brilliant day. The staff at the hotel could not have made it better or more special for them. Photos on Facebook confirm all being said. The rest of our extended family were in attendance and staying at the Heritance Ahungalla, I could not fault this hotel at all. Staff were very nice, food was brilliant, accommodation was excellent. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel whether it be for a holiday or a wedding venue. Keep up the good work Heritance Ahungalla. Thanks to you all for such a brilliant stay.

I have visited alot of the more expensive hotels south of Colombo. Bentota Beach, Taj Exotica, Kani Lanka to name a few. All of them have a similar drawback, the food. This is where Heritance stands out from the crowd. We went Half Board and both the Breakfasts and Dinners were excellent quality, with alot of variation for fussy eaters (like me!). In addition to this, the hotel is right on the beach, which is nice a clean and the two pools are beautiful. The hotel has free internet, a nice pub and nice staff. The only criticism I have of the hotel is that the room we had was a little dated and did not have a bathtub. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who fancied a break from the busy life of Colombo

Ahungalle Heritance is probably the best beach hotel in Sri Lanka. We had our daughters wedding at this hotel on February 26, 2011. We came from Australia to have the wedding in this hotel. My daughter wanted a beach wedding in Sri Lanka. We selected this hotel for the wedding after very careful evaluation. We knew that all hotels belonging to Heritance group are good. But we had many other reasons to select it. It was designed by Geoffrey Bava. It is near the beach and the beach is unpolluted and well maintained, comparatively free of outside visitors. The hotel is renowned for its good food and superior service. Their pastry chef who was to make the wedding cake is an international award winner. We stayed in the hotel for a few days while arranging the wedding. We got the hotel to plan the whole wedding and they arranged everything The hotel arranged Kandyan dancers to lead the couple to the podium, then some girls to sing Jayamangala gatha and another person to perform the wedding rites and sing Ashtaka,. Food was served on the beach A platform has been placed to dance and there was a band providing music. The complete package included a cake, champaine fountain and fireworks. The highlight was the bullock cart which took the bride and groom on a short going away trip. I would give full marks for their excellent arrangements and management of the whole function. The hotel is very flexible and you can get them to do whatever activities you want them to do and give the other activities to outsiders. We got a photographer and a videographer from outside, but if you want to, you can get the hotel to arrange them for you. We had about 85 guests for the wedding, but I understand the hotel undertakes weddings for very small groups or just the couple without any visitors. More than anything, I value the service. The hotel staff are very courteous and obliging. They will go to any length to make their guests happy and satisfied. In summary, the hotel gave my daughter a wedding function to remember and cherish for the rest of her life. - Andrew Fernando

Ahungalla is located 90KM south of Colombo. Unfortunately there is not another way to get there other than by bus/car. Depending on the time of the day, that journey can take a good 4 hours as there are no highways in Sri Lanka. Sit back, relax and enjoy the trip as I'm sure you will love the place you'll be heading to. This hotel is a little piece of paradise. My partner and I stayed there for a week (March 9 thru 17th, 2011) and we were very pleased with this hotel. It's supposed to be a 5-star, but I believe it is a 4-star for European standards. The room was pretty large and well-decorated. The food was excellent - the breakfast offered a variety of local fruits and breads. Your typical buffet. There were three "chefs" preparing delicious omelets, egg fritters, waffles and some other goodies just for you. The coffee was always fresh and served to your table. We were on a HB scheme, so we had dinners at the hotel as well. Lots of seafood (the shrimps were absolutely delicious!), local dishes (careful with the curry! might be a tad spicy!), different types of rice, salads, the best beef ever! Drinks not included. The central AC in the room worked perfectly. The best I've ever had!!! There's a thermostat so you can control the temperature very easily. They don't turn the AC off during the day when you're not in your room or in the middle of the night like many hotels in Europe! That is a big plus - the humidity is really high so you'll be happy with that AC! And the AC is still running when your key is not in the little card thingy by the door. If you want to eat at the hotel during the day, the prices are comparable to those in Europe ($10 to $15 can get you a decent meal). But if you want to eat good and cheap food prepared by locals, make sure to visit the Sunshine Restaurant, located at the end of the beach, on the right-hand side of the hotel facing the beach. Lovely people, great prices (beer half the price!), a decent menu for such a small place. Plus you get to chat with locals! (English is widely spoken in Sri Lanka, not always understood though!) The hotel has 2 pools - you'll see the 1st pool just past the lobby area. As you arrive, you will see this huge open space, with beautiful marble floors, and the pool, and the beach. What a great view! The 2nd pool is on the right hand side of the property. Towels and cushions are provided by the hotel staff. The cushions are a bit worn out but the towels are clean. You will be kindly reminded to tip the pool boys. From the pool, you will see a lot of people trying to sell you something on the beach. They will call you, ask for a cigarette (if you're a smoker), but they can't get too close to the pool as the hotels provides security guards to block them from entering the property. You talk to them if you wish to. One of the people we talked to was a man called "Pree". He (and many other guys) will offer you trips. My partner and I, after having read the recommendations on other websites that those people were actually reliable, decided to accept Mr. Pree's offer to go to Galle and to Kandy. His English is not that bad but he's a hard bargain! Together with some other people who work at the Sunshine Rest. he will bring you to the most common tourist places around Sri Lanka. They own vans and have experienced drivers working for them. Mr. Pree was very knowledgeable and we were very pleased with his work. Make sure to ask for Mr. Pree at the Sunshine Restaurant. You won't regret. The more people in your group, the cheaper it is. Close the final price including the tip before you agree on anything. Tipping seems to be a common practice in Sri Lanka, and even at a hotel like this one, the employees will expect a $1 (100 rupees) tip for most services provided. You can use dollar bills if you like - they don't mind it. I was told by a local man that the average salary in Sri Lanka is between $100 to $150 a month, so it is understandable the tipping practice. I will leave that up to you - use your common sense. I felt like I didn't have to tip them every day for cleaning my room and making my bed. They will come back around 6pm offering fresh towels, and will probably expect a tip if you get the towels. Again, it is up to you. I didn't always need those towels, so I didn't tip those 2 employees every day either. The check-in process was very different from any other hotels I've been to before. I flew from Poland with a group of Polish tourists (even though I'm not Polish, I live in Poland so we used a Polish travel agency). Upon our (late) arrival (around 2am), we were kindly asked by the hotel staff to wait at the restaurant area, where we were served tea/coffee. They brought us the check-in forms and got our passports to double check the information. Once everything was filled out, we were given room numbers and our luggage brought to the room. Easy breezy. Free wi-fi all over the hotel. Ask the receptionist for a wi-fi code. They'll give you a piece of paper with the login information - and the best, FREE OF CHARGE! There didn't seem to be a disco or anything of the likes in this hotel - so if you're looking for a peaceful place -- THIS is the place!!

Spent 7 nights at the hotel at the beginning of February. Enjoyed: the food, the pools (particularly the one with the leaning tree), the sound of the ocean waves crushing on the shore, the spa, the beautiful sunsets from the room balcony and generally the great feeling of being in Sri Lanka in a beautiful hotel. Did not enjoy: the monitor lizards walking around, (did not know they would be there and just got terrified when I saw the first one strolling around the beach!!!), the overwhelming strenght of the ocean waves which prevents you from swimming, the beach ladies constantly calling you in order to sell you something.

We had a beautiful and relaxing week. Our family consists of me, my husband and our little girl who is one year old and we needed a place where we could enjoy the sun, the nature, relax, and let the girl play. The room was perfectly situated just by the huge swimming pool so that we could swim and play in the garden the whole day (unfortunately the ocean in Sri Lanka is too wild to swim in it). While our daughter was taking her afternoon nap, my husband and I could lay in the sun as we were just in front of the room. Because villages in Sri Lanka cannot offer too much in terms of recreation, you can get everything you need in the hotel (nice restaurants, nice bars, evening shows). Mr Kekke from the hotel management needs a particular mention as he is taking very good care of customers, making sure that they all have an enjoyable time (sometimes he was even babysitting for us to let us have dinner quitely). I would definetly recommend the hotel to anyone who wants to stay in this area of Sri Lanka.

We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our tour. The hotel is right on the beachfront, at the end of its private drive, and the bay is beautiful. There are two large swimming pools, one with an old tree overhanging so you can swim in the shade, Friendly and helpful staff (if a bit slow and inefficient). Food is buffet style, and was really excellent, with lots of choice, particularly for desserts, including the likes of sticky toffee pudding. Our room was spacious and modern with a balcony with room for table and chairs. Beachboys and ladies were annoying, even calling out to you when you were lying on the sunbeds, though once you'd run the gauntlet, you can walk on the beautiful beach for a while. Grounds weren't as extensive as I'd hoped from this class of hotel. Only a few yards between hotel and beach front. There is a fair bit of wildlife, monitor lizards, monkeys (not aggressive) and bee-eaters. On our last night at sunset, a nest of turtles hatched out which was a beautiful end to our holiday. Every afternoon, about 40 villagers dragged a large fishing net through the surf, and sold their catch on the beach.

The hotel is truly beautiful. As soon as you drive in and stop at the portico the view through the lobby to the pool and the sea beyond is ure to leave you spell bound. Its a very charming place with a lovely beach front. The rooms are well appointed with great views. The staff is good but the service is too laid back and could be better. Overall an enjoyable experience with good food at the restaurants.

Lovely hotel and pool area. Room spacious and comfortable. Didn't like the check out procedure where we were taken into a back room with no windows and given receipts for every single thing we had signed for during our 10 days. Food ok, a bit repetitive after 10 days. Overall, a great holiday though.

I stayed in the hotel for 10 nights with my family in month of early February 2011. It was a wonderful stay in Sri Lanka. I did a tour to whale wathching too. Food was excellent , you will be able to experience the all kind of fresh seafood inside the hotel. Beach is excellent... It is a public beach... You will be able to visit some Sea food restaurants in the Beach but those are hopeless... we went once to the restaurant called Sun Shine... two of our family got badly effected with diaria... Hotel Doctor helped us very much, unfortunatly we had to spend two good days of our holiday in the room .. It was the only dissapointment I had in the my Holiday...... Pool bar Staff , Front office Staff, Housekeeping were very helpfull. I always recemmend to have your meals inside the hotel and you will be able get better quality food and service in the hotel........... We will be back soon.....

If you're planning a trip down south I would highly recommend a few nights at this amazing hotel. You will be completely blown away by the design. We stayed in an ocean view room. It's a little pricey but worth every penny. The staff are extremely professional and customer focused. The rooms are generous in size and very clean. The infinity pool is incredible.The cuisine served at each restaurant is of a very high standard. There is a generous spread of both eastern and western cuisine. The Spa treatments are wonderful. I will definitely stay here on future visits to Sri Lanka.

We were so lucky to have a wonderful room in an excellent position. The views were fabulous. The sea was quite rough, but my husband managed to swim for a little while before the waves knocked him down. Beach fabulous and the swimming pool was the best we have ever experienced. Staff were very attentive and helpful. Nihal in the restaurant looked after us really well. He produced a filet steak for my husband who said it was the best he had ever had. My only adverse comment on this hotel is that the staff all expected a tip even for the smallest of job.

We were two couples who went to this place to celebrate our first wedding anniversary.. This is a huge property with almost all the facilities.. Their service is really nice, they gave us some 4-5 hours early check-in without any problems.. It also has live-band which plays music and sing songs with a decent discotheque as well.. A little expensive on the food though for which we discovered this small restaurant called "Sunshine Restaurant' located near the beach (2 mins walk), it offers great, delicious authentic srilankan food at very decent prices.. we particularly liked the fact that they would always give some snacks complimentary for drinks like potato chips etc., impressed by their food we also asked them to arrange us for a dinner on the beach and they did it fantastically without any extra charge and made our trip memorable..

Our stay here cost about Â£180 per night for a double room. Overall the hotel is nice but just not really living up to the standards you'd expect of a 4 star hotel or the price tag. For example the toilets in the reception area were rather dark and needed a clean and tidy, there were lots of staff around but so many of them doing nothing and at one time I had to ask 5 different staff to order drinks over a period of about 20 mins before anything actually happened, a lot of the time the waiting staff seemed to just cluster in groups and were lost if actually asked to do anything. The cushions on the sun loungers were ancient, one of the things we noticed that should be easy to put right if the hotel put some of its profits back into the premises. The hotel makes a lot of its 'award winning' chefs which became a bit irritating after a couple of days as some food was great, some really not so good and I had the only stomach upset of the entire trip after eating at the hotel as did a couple of the family, I think due to food being reheated as some things looked rather familiar. Also they seemed thrown at breakfast if more than one or two people wanted the freshly cooked items such as hoppers so you had to wait absolutely ages or give up and have items that were not needing cooking - a real shame as I love my Dosa and hoppers! The kids club was good but the evening entertainment seemed to be the male ents team dressing in drag every night and miming to something and they seemed to abandon the kids pretty quickly if there was any sign of mingling with the grown ups. The other big downer for the hotel is the mosquitoes which are absolutely rife, not totally avoidable but I feel they could have made more of an effort with the rooms and common areas to minimise the mozzy numbers - as most of the other hotels we stayed in had done. Plus points were the two nice pools and the nice view of the sea. Without a fantastic rate to entice me back I'd be inclined to try somewhere else along the coast when I next go back.

I write this review purely to warn people to respect the surf. I have recently returned from this hotel where immediately in front of the hotel I body surfed a moderate size wave of hidden force which threw me head first into the ocean bottom. I escaped breaking my neck, but did not escape a head injury which left me with two black eyes. I am an experienced body surfer and I write this to warn people. There IS a danger flag in front of this hotel I just apparently chose to ignore it. Please don't be as stupid as I was.

Excellent Hotel, good food, friendly staff, beautiful clean rooms I spent 2 Nights in this wonderful Hotel and didn't want to leave Me and my friend were so saddened while leaving this magnificent Hotel It's the place to be :)

Planned to trip to Srilanka for my wedding anniversary with my entire family. After landing at the airport and a pleasant drive to ahungalla we reached this magnificent property that sprawls out from the entrance and the fabulous use of water spaces. The property with its alluring pool, fabulous beach and amazing large rooms is magical. With excellent food, great all day activities, 2 superb pools, a stunning beach front and pleasing service this is one stay that will linger in memory for a long time.

We had a wonderful holiday with our 10 month old baby here in November 2010. We stayed for 5 nights and came away so relaxed. The Resort has a fabulous setting right on the beach and is a fabulous design. The rooms are well appointed, with a very comfortable bed and the baby cot was a traditional wooden cot with high bars. Our baby slept very well. The bathrooms are lovely but a suggestion to the hotel to use different containers for the refillable products (as the shampoo etc was impossible to get out!). There are two excellent pools with loads of wildlife wandering around the poolside. The food was of good quality, and we had some nice meals. Not a lot of choice at lunch in the cafes. However in the main buffet restaurant, the breakfast was always lovely and there are different theme meals every night. The chef at the restaurant even made special meals for our fussy baby - fresh puree pumpkin etc at no charge. So kind of the Resort! The Coco Spa was also great, and I had a lovely body scrub and massage. My husband had a massage on another occasion and he loved that too. The staff were on the whole fantastic and couldn't do enough for you, but sometimes the cleaners of the rooms were a bit hit and miss (probably dependent on how much you tipped!). These minor criticisms aside, we would really reccomend this hotel.

76km down south from colombo city. Approx 3 hours of travel. Located 500meters inside from the main Galle Road. Entrance is magnificient, pass through big palm trees and the last turn brings the WOW factor, as you will see the pond, marbled lobby floor, swimming pool and the ocean in one level in the horizon. MAGINIFIQUE!. The welcome was warm and casual. Good way to start a holiday. Ideal place for relaxation and quite holiday. Beach is less populated as its the only hotel standing there. Food is nothing exclusive, usual 5 star food and service from the staff. One bar and the lounge. Reasonably priced menu. Activities are very much limited within the hotel. Nice place to pick your favourite author's latest production and enjoy the holiday. Beach is rough during the time we visited. Always check with the life guard before dipping in to the sea. There are 2 swimming pools to compensate the bad sea conditions for a nice swim.

Nice hotel but let down by a couple of things. Some of the staff are lovely but.... My daughter's favourite Jack Wills t-shirt went missing - one she wore to sleep in, so she never took it out of the room. The hotel staff are very hungry for tips (one waiter told me within a minute of meeting that he was the sole breadwinner for his family and he only earned 4,000 rupees a month). It gets oppressive. The cleaners come into your room (both sets, am and pm) and tell you they are the only person responsible for cleaning your room (and can I have a tip please! ). We were given only one mug, and there were a lot of mosquitos in the room. The toiletries are in refillable china containers and its impossible to get anything out of them. Food is very good but lunches and drinks very expensive. Gave us a lovely christmas eve meal and went to great efforts (ice sculptures and father christmas arriving in a boat.) Waited for ever for coffee in the morning. Not much to do when it rains and the water was too rough to go in the sea, plus you get hassled and followed on the beach. Could be so much better.

After a long and sick drive of about 9 hrs at a stretch right frm the Heritance Tea Factory Nuwaraeliya...totally devastated with the fluctuations in the temperatures ...n in the most crankiest of states i checked in at around 8 pm with my husband and my 9 yr old child..assumin its gonna be sad..but to our surprise we were welcomed by the stafff with that everlasting smile..not to forget the very patent quality on every face of the stafff...must thank the management for training them well..smart guys....followed with a young charming stafff leadin us to the main lobbyy..who offered us the welcom drinks..which she very meticulously carried each time ina lovely wooden old age herited trolly and offerd it to the guests with great pleasure..hope it was real...but if nt very well mastered.. And than followed the smooth checkins... we wwer led to our rooms....well to be honest..the roomsdi d have a perfect combination of asthetics but the only regret...no perfection in the fittings n finish of thewashrooms...although when demanded to the staff, was told it is one of the most expensive finishes they have used....very diplomatic...also the monotonous use of the tiger print cushions all around the room and the lobby appeared very loud..could have used more soothing colours as it hindered with the lovely asthetics....of the property...full marks for the external beautification...especially the greens created on the first floor..... excellent spread of food in jute...although no good ventilation...could use better exhaust systems s could be suffocsting for kids n for vegetarians..piping hot services in the coffee shop....which could be customised....a boon for veggies as have a seperate vegetarian menu...a special thanks to who so ever who included it...a lovely infinity poooll..which is the most significant n distinguishing portion..of the property....the blues ready to give the most perfect relaxation to ones eyes...n followed wwith the serene beach...where one can enjoy the sun settin down and watch how it adorns the sea n blazes it in shades of yellow,pink,and sometimes orange...a perfect romantic moment for a couple who has taken its first baby steps ina relation....cest voyage de noces....or honeymoon......and but ofcourse how can i forget the most over whelming experience..special private cocktails along the beach side for a few hand picked guests...and we were one of them it was aprivilege..the bartender showing all his skills..juggling away..well we were served cocktails to our hearts content...along with a perfect interaction with the guest relation guys....who made us feel extremly comfortable....n not to forget also apologised if anything was not done rightly throughout the stay...very convincing way..good training ..i had a stay for just three nights but i regret for havin done a late checkin at 8 i lost on a half day..... wish i could have stayed for the new years and hadent gonee to colombo...and wasted my stay at Taj samudra..one of the most horrible way to begin ones new year...a special thanks to ll the wonderful and ever helping and smiling staff..from ahungalla..YOU GUYS ROCK BUDDIES...THANKS for making my stay the most beautiful in srilanka....must say....c"'etait une experience inoubliable....et sans aucune doute selon moi c""est le meillieur property a srilanka entierment...bonne chance mes amis...je vais vous voir si j""aurai la chance...merci a tous..aurevoir...

This is a beach resort of excellent quality. The rooms are neatly done and comfortable. The pool is inviting. The beach has good sand and the hotel provides beach dinners. The spa is also good and offers fairly good value. The restaurant is also nice. The staff is polite overall , but lacks in service - because of the size of the property and their lack of English knowledge

A week into this hotel passed by very fast and to make a story short I will give my opinion in points: RESTAURANT 10/10 (absolutely genius, variety of food and all was perfect) STAFF 9/10 (always helpful, smiling, nice, one point less for hard "tip-looking" behaviour) POLLS 10/10 (clean and nice, up to 3 meters deep) BEACH 8/10 (clean, beatiful sand , "beachbboys" make it dirty sometimes but it's cleaned regurarly) ROOMS 5/10 - 8/10 first we were in ground floor room (small, dark and dungeons feeling), after complains we were moved to nice, light, first floor room with ocean view), some of our friend found grund floor better as terrace goes just next to the swimmig pool CATEGORY - for me it should be **** star hotel (because ot the bathrooms and room size) BEACHBOYS - they're standing all day log an the beach and try to sell you something, it's annoying if you want to lay down on the sand. They're not allowed to go into hotel area so it's easy to find quiet place near the pool. TRIPS: On the beach you may find Mr. Anil who helped us to organise short trip around and we were glad of his help - all was perfect! On the right of the beach (300m north) you will find nice seafood restaurat (we may recomend it) and Mr. Tino, owner of this place also organise trips. Our friend were happy of the trip but were overcharged so pls double check if you want to go with him somewhere. If you look for romantic, quiet spot it will be ideal. Me and my wife we are were glad to be there! WE HAD PERFECT TIME IN HERITANCE AHUNGALLA ;) Ps. I will not recomend this hotel for couples with children and night-life seekers!

Me and my partner stayed here in Sept 2010 on a half board basis. When booking the holiday in the May we were not told that Sept was Monsoon season! However during our 16 day stay we had rain for 3 - 4 days on and off. The rain lastest for maybe an hour or so and then everyone was back out by the pool, most people jumped in the pool whilst it was raining instead of going inside. Hotel is rated as 5 star, unfortunately this is not the rating i would give. It is more like 4 star, the curtains in the room were a little dirty, i think this was where they were getting caught in the balcony doors when closing them. There was dust on top of the lamp shades and in the corners of the room but nothing major. Beds and bathroom was spotless though. The hotel has alot of wildlife wandering around which i absolutely loved. Monatar lizards, chipmonks, newts, monkeys - it was brilliant. Food was lovely, loads to choose from every morning and evening. Service was like nothing i have ever experienced before, the waiters were so kind and couldn't do enough for you. When we left we were given gifts from a few of the waiters that served us in the evening. Would I stay again - definitely, during peak season not monsoon. Would i recommend the hotel - yes to couples who want to do nothing more than relax and take it easy, its certainly not for families with children or those who are adventurous and want to do something different every day. Value for money - 2 adults, 16 day stay on half board basis, flights and hotel Â£2300.

We got married at the Heritance Hotel 3 weeks ago and I must say that it was a â€œDREAM WEDDINGâ€. We had close to 100 guests attending from all over the world, many of whom were in Sri Lanka for the first time. We were also hosting 4 functions (3 dinners and a lunch), all to be coordinated by the hotel whom we had been interacting with mainly through email and phone calls (aside from a couple of visits to the hotel during the initial stages of planning). We were a bit concerned about how things would pan out over the three days of festivities and I have to say that we could not have been happier!!! During the evenings of our celebrations, it was expected to rain and the hotel did a great job to meet with us to discuss alternate locations for the functions in the event of rain. Even the alternate locations were all different places as we wanted to make sure we had different venues to create a different vibe for each of our functions. The chefs of the hotel held separate meetings with us to ensure that the menus were what we wanted. They delivered to all our needs, including creating figurines for our wedding cake that were wearing the same outfits my husband and I had on for the wedding!!! Additionally, a friend of ours had specific dietary needs and the staff at the functions made it a point to find it and give him his specially created meals. Our Friday evening function was to be held on an island outside the hotel but due to the threat of rain, we cancelled that and decided to reschedule it for the next day at lunchtime- quite a last minute decision! The hotel took charge of all the logistics and we had an incredible lunch the next day at the Island catered to by the hotel. We even wanted to rent a boat that was already on the lake to serve our guests drinks while they were taking a boat ride, and even on that the hotel delivered!!!!! On the day of our main event, it started to rain during our outdoor sit-down dinner. In less than 5 minutes (and I am NOT exaggerating), the hotel had moved us into the alternate location and we were back into the swing of our celebrations!! Sampath (the Assistant Manager at the hotel), the Chefs, the F&B team, Kay Kay and the rest of the staff bent over backwards to accommodate us at every instant, even when we had less formal dinners and meals before and after the wedding celebrations. In addition to this, the hotel rooms were very nice and the hotel accommodated all our requests in terms of room and needs. The ambiance itself of the hotel is great- the hotel is the perfect size: small enough where we could run into and mingle with our guests during the day and also large enough where our guests could have their own space and time. So in the end, we managed to have cocktails on the beach at sunset, dinner in the lawns, dancing in the nightclub, wedding ceremony on the beach, sit down dinner on another set of lawns, a welcome dinner in the open air at yet another location in the hotel and a great boat ride followed by an incredible lunch on an Island. It is a wonderful place to host a wedding and the hotel made sure that we got everything we wanted and made our wedding even more perfect!

Checked into hotel Mid August into a luxury room and I would highly reccomend paying that little bit extra as the rooms are huge! And you get a bath tub that overlooks the pool.. but no one can see in as there is mesh stopping.. so its very private! On arrival sat down with a welcome drink (Pineapple or Wood Apple juice) as we came early from Colombo around 11am and room was not ready.. but that did not bother me as they advised full occupancy in hotel before we came and cannot get early check in which was ok because My partner and I sat in the bar and had a few drinks.. they came to us and gave the key instead of us going to reception.... Went to our room! and I thought it was very very clean.. the bed was so comfy... In the luxury rooms there is no ceiling fan tho, but you have an aircon which gets cool in the nights ... Room was cleaned every morning and evening.. fresh towels and bathrobes... Both pools were good but i prefered the private pool the best! & it had a spa you can use from certain hours and relaxing!! I used the Coco Spa and got a sweedish massage and it was the most relaxing thing, and was very professional as they drape you properly with the towels and do an amazing job.. they are Balinese ladies and very lovely and do a great job! My husband got one the following day! Food in the resturant was beautiful... you can get your Sri Lankan curries or you can get Bbq night.. prawns.. lots of salad to choose from... & soups.. my favourite was the deserts.. so lovely ... Staff and chefs were nice! overall i would stay here again.. beach is too rough to swim though which is dissappointing.. as im from Australia .. i love the beaches.. I reccomend seing Hikkaduwa and the huge turtles you can swim with.. Great experience you dont even feel like your in the hustle and bustle of Sri Lanka.

My wife and I had two great weeks here, we found all the staff delightfully friendly and polite. special mention to Kithriri,Paleitha and Sunil the pool attendants and K K who is so helpful and friendly. Both the pools are fabulous, the food was good and plentifull. Two must visit places are the Turtle Hatchery which is very close to the hotel and the Elephant Orphenage even though it is a 3 and 1/2 hour drive by car. Dont drive yourself unless you are very brave.There is also a mix of wild life around the hotel like Chipmonks, Iguanas and monkeys, the chipmonks will come and eat from your hand. It was our first visit to Sri Lanka and we would visit again the people are wonderful.

We planned a weekend outing to the Heritance Ahungalle with the expectation of spending a weekend doing nothing but relaxing all day long. The Heritance didn't fail to deliver and in fact exceed our expectations. The striking points was the absolutely awesome food and very friendly and helpful nature of the staff. Despite the fact that all 150 rooms of the hotel were occupied, the staff still found the time to have a friendly chat with us and make us feel at home. My wife and I had a very relaxing holiday and my 1.5 year old daughter truly had the time of her life. In fact she enjoyed it so much that she got into a very playful mood and kept us up half the night. In a nutshell our experience was as follows, Pluses - Super food - Very friendly staff - Spacious and clean room - Two pools Minuses - Renovations were underway at the hotel and we couldn't use the room balcony - Spa was overpriced Overall it was a super holiday and a big thank you to the Heritance staff who made our stay so special.

This is a big beachfront property a little south of Bentota. Though the hotel is visibly aged, the rooms are maintained pretty well and are very comfortable. Most rooms have nice view of the sea. The swimming pool is large and is very well maintained. The beach is quite good and is clean but is not ok for swimming.

We stayed here for a few nights in August 2010 as part of a one month trip. I was very excited about staying here as it was designed by one of my favourite architects, Geoffrey Bawa. However, it was a little bit of a let down on a whole. On arrival the hotel is lovely. You drive through some large gates and up to the open reception area where you immediately notice the infinity pool which looks great. All the staff are very smiley but unfortunately the front desk staff don't really know what they are doing. There was a lot of commotion and we did not get checked in for an hour. Some of our friends did not get checked in for 2 hours. Not what you want after a long journey! First impressions of our room were ok. They are clean but nothing special. We were promised a spectular suite as we were there for a special occassion but we were just given a standard deluxe room which was disappointing. We eventually got our suite on our last night but the only difference was a bit more space and a bath so not really worth the extra money in my opinion. We spent a lot time around the infinity pool which is very clean and the pool boys are great. They provide water aerobics every morning and organise water volleyball straight after so it's a bit lively around that pool up unti lunchtime. There is another pool but we didn't use it. If you like your exercise there is also a small gym which is ok. It's small and basic but has the essentials. You can also go for a run along the beach but as with almost every beach in Sri Lanka be prepared to get hassled by the beach boys/women. One guy came for a run with me whilst trying to sell a tour which I thought was very amusing. Unfortunately I could not give him any business! The food here is great. There is a huge variety on offer and you won't be disappointed. However, if you order snack food be prepared to wait or for the staff to get your order wrong. This seemed to be the norm from our experience and speaking to other guests. The same goes for ordering drinks. They are super slow. You can quite often see your cold drink getting warm on the bar whilst the waiters have a chat. People were constantly chasing up the waiters or walking up to collect their own drinks. The staff, with a few exceptions, seemed to be the main problem at this hotel. They are all very friendly but even the simple things seemed to be an effort. Luckily we have a lot of patience so we found it funny but it was obvious some couples and groups there were getting very frustrated. We stayed at several other hotels in Sri Lanka and the staff were a lot more on the ball. Even when we checked out it became chaos. Lot's of confusion, incorrect bills and in one case it took nearly 1.5 hours! It was a group of 6 but still, not acceptable. We took 30mins and there was only 2 of us. To sum up, this hotel is nice. It has character but it is certainly not 5 star. The rooms and staff could be so much better. My plus points would be the infinty pool and the food. Everthing else could do with improvements. I would recommend this hotel but on the basis don't go there expecting the ultimate paradise. It's good but there is better in Sri Lanka. It's pretty good value for money but needs some attention. 7.5/10 overall.

Loved this hotel, great for couples. Gives you everything you expect from a 5 star hotel. nothing too fancy but very relaxing with very nice staff. "beach boys" as locals call them are a bit annoying when you leave the hotel boundaries which are marked with flags. those were the only thing to annoy, but as long as you keep yourself inside the hotel boundaries and enjoy watching the ocean not swimming you are fine.

We had a lovely 2 week stay at the Heritance. As a number of people have previously stated this not a 5 star hotel, but for the price we paid this was excellent value and met our expectations. The hotel is a little remote however you can get tuk-tuk to Bentota so we didn't feel too isolated. The main downside was wear and tear to the soft furnishings - rug and net curtains very stained and holes in curtains which had been repaired. The cleaner was very good though and thoroughly cleaned our room and bought extra towels when requested. I was also disappointed that the gym was out of order during my trip, it also looked very basic indeed. The breakfast was amazing - the fresh omelettes and the Dhosia/Thosias (pancake filled with potato masala and lentil curry) was particularly good and chef has even give us the recipe. The main restaurant was OK, but we did get a little bored with the buffet style every evening as well as the fact that the ambiance was lacking, however the Chinese evening and BBQ evening are probably worth a try. Didn't really understand the "animators" - especially with the water aerobics with music blearing out! Luckily this was in the main pool and we tended to sit by the Green pool so didn't really bother us. A little maintenance was taking place during our stay. We stayed on a B&B basis so ate out in Bentota most nights. Bentota is 20 mins in a tuk-tuk and costs 500 rupees return journey - that's Â£3!! The best restaurant was Diya Sisila (30 min drive / 700 rupees return by tuk-tuk), beautiful place by a lake over looking Bawa's house. You will need to pre-book and take your own alcohol. We also took a trip to Bawa house and gardens and the owner of Diya then collected us from the house and took us across the lake on his catamaran to the restaurant. Saman Villas is a luxury boutique hotel with an amazing restaurant - just watch the cost of the alcohol which was extortionate! Golden Grill has had loads of good reviews but we found this only to be average. The beach shack near the Hotel was wonderful - brilliant selection of fish and prawns! (Called the Sunshine Restaurant). River Safari was lovely morning out - lots of Kingfishers, Cormerants and Kites. Stopped of a the Cinnamon island. Took a trip to Hikkaduwa - very disappointed. Beach not special & moored boats all in the water which prevented you from swimming. If you are looking for a lovely beach try Unawatuna near Galle which we visited on a previous trip to Sri Lanka. Had a Ayurvedic massage at Happy Lanka - 10 min walk from hotel. Head massage was fantastic, although my husband had full body which he found rather rough indeed, much rougher than previous Ayurvdic centres we have visited, but was a good experience. Spa at the Hotel was very good but perhaps a little pricey. The best exchange rate we found was drawing cash out of the ATM. We have a Nationwide bank account for travelling abroad which means no withdrawal fees. At the time of our visit we got 175 rupees from the ATM where as the Hotel's rate was 160. The Hawkers can be a pain - I wish there was a way the Hotel could let them have a stall or something so you can look at there products/services without feeling the constant pressure. We were befriended by a chap called Pradeep who then organised our tuk-tuks and River Trip. Be careful of buying leather bags/goods at the hotel when the bag seller sets up his stall. My wife & I both bought brown leather bags at a good price but the colour on the leather transfers onto your clothing and stains it. It also stains items put inside the bag. I mentioned this to the seller on the day who said to put the bag in sunlight and it will solve the problem. This is not the case. I have made the Heritance aware of this but so far have not had a reply to my e mail.

The hotel was a very big disapointment. we arrived late in evening, the guy at the reseption looked as he didnt feel like showing us arround, tired, bored (?). On the way to the room, he said that we had been upgrated from the room that we had reserved, we got to the room and the first thing I look at is the bathroom, there was a funny smell, when i told the guy he said that is nothing, we just spraid cinamon before you arrived. the towels were old and far from being smooth and nice. At 7 oclock we were woken up by restaurations done at the hotel; we were not told this was going on. All this is not a five star hotel!!! finally we were moved to a suite but still the higine was not perfet and towells not soft.

Gthuthi estuti (Thank-you) to the staff of the Heritance Anhugalla. What can we say We had a fantastic time. Thank-you to all the staff, including Thilina who looked after our room, which we thought was out of this world. Thank-you for the lovely fruit boats and the flower displays. The bed linen and towels were changed every day and there was always a lovely smell of Cinamon in the room. Our room was at the residents pool beside a lovely hot tub and the pool attendants always brought us sun loungers and two fresh towels each. The life guards and the animators were very helpful and we enjoyed many good games of volleyball and waterpolo and also a game of snooker. Going to breakfast in the mornings we could hear lovely music from a man playing a flute in thelovely boat in the other fabulous infinity pool beside reception. There were six fabulous places (including room servce) to eat. Nihal looked after us every breakfast and at some of the evening buffets, we must compliment the chefs on the fabulous displays of food. Great choice of food, fresh omlettes in the morning amongst other things including egg hoppers (delicious). Cafe Mustarde restaurant was wonderful managed by Dayal and his very efficent Staff (sorry Anya lost the piece of paper that your names were on) Indika, H.C.Kumara, Lucky, Lakmal and Dayal combined to provide my wife with a fantastic brithday surprise dinner in the exclusive upper room restaurant. Beautiful beach and touts not too bad as others have said they are very poor and they were delighted when we bought a sarong and a hat. We also had a great day at the Turtle hatchery and the river Safari (Cinamon Island is worth a visit). Last but not least is the extremely helpful reception staff including DILSHAN and every body else. To all at Heritance Anhungalla, thank-you for all the lovely memories. Gthuthi estuti (Thank-you) and Gihin Ennam (Goodbye).

Heritance was a treat . we went there as part of our companies annual conference for three days and had a blast . the hotel rooms were spacious and had a great view of the beach . the pool in the hotel was majestic and there are many games facilities around the hotel like beach volleyball etc to keep you occupied in our free time . All the facilities undertaken by the hotel right from organizing the conference to evening dinners and lunches was good and professional . The nightclub was also good . the service was also very good ..the only thing lacking was the food ...none of the meals had in the hotel were really top notch ...and i felt that is what could have taken the hotel to another level .

We had a memorable week at The Heritance Ahungalla during September 2010. The hotel is very open and airey which is ideal for the climate in Sri Lanka. I can't speak too highly of all the staff from the management to the housekeepers. They were all very helpful and friendly. There are 2 swimming pools and 4 restaurants and bars. There is not a great deal to do in the village so we spent every evening in the hotel. We went on an excursion to the Yala National Park which required an overnight stay elsewhere with a 5 hour car journey each way. It was worth it to go on safari and see animals in the wild especially the elephants. There are one or two villages near to Ahungalla which don't have much in the way of tourist attracttions but are worth visiting. This area was badly hit by the tsunami in 2004 and although a lot of rebuilding has taken place, there is still much to be done and we found that the people were very appreciative of the help they had received form other countries and made tourists very welcome.

I was in Ahungalla for two days and absolutely loved it. The room I stayed was spacious and very clean and was facing the sea. The staff were very attentive and friendly. There are two pools in the hotel. The one infront of the lobby of the hotel is not the best, the one on the right hand corner of the hotel is more hidden and has a hot tub as well. Th sea was pretty rough the time I went there so was not able to really enjoy a sea swim. Just be aware of hawkers and so called beach boys hovering you when you go to the beach,. The hotel had good entertainment, from fun exercise classes in the pool to music in the nights. I must say the food was really good with a mix of Sri Lankan and western cuisine.

After reading some recent negative reviews of the Heritance, we wondered if we were staying in the same hotel! Our room was spacious, quiet, extremely comfortable and spotlessly clean with a wonderful view of the ocean and the pool from the balcony. All the staff were efficient, attentive and friendly and couldn't do enough to make you feel welcome and looked after. The grounds were attractive, well tended and relaxing and the pools provided a deliciously cooling antidote to the hot sun. Food was fresh and appetising, providing enough variety to suit all tastes morning and evening. We alternated the main restaurant with the 'cafe' and enjoyed both. Also loved the cool design of the hotel and the airy outside-in feeling throughout. The beach boys were a bit of a problem as they did hassle when you just wanted a peaceful stroll along the shore, but they were friendly and unthreatening and obviously just trying to relieve guests/tourists of a few rupees in exchange for their products - happens in most countries! All in all would recommend the hotel to anyone who enjoys a relaxing and pampered holiday in lovely surroundings as part of their trip to this beautiful island. Annaby

I am never usually that keen to leave hotel reviews as everyone has such different tastes and expectations from their holiday, but I was so impressed with the Heritance and the service myself and my boyfriend received I simply had to share! I also for the life of me cannot understand how anyone could leave a negative review of this place, although from reading these, it seems that these people may have chosen the wrong holiday destinations. Ok so theres no "entertainment" in the evening in the form of bingo (thank the Lord!) or whatever it is some people find enjoyable but I am more than happy to sit relaxing with my cocktail, being waited on hand and foot while listening to a traditional Sri Lanka band or the wonderful piano and violin players that are provided every evening in the bar. Our room was spotless, the air con worked a treat and the sheets and towels were changed every day. The room service guys even come back again at about 6pm to re-make your bed and change your towels again! Food wise, we were B & B. Breakfast was lovely, plenty of cakes and pastries, breads, bacon, eggs, cereal etc. You can even have a traditional Sri Lanka curry for breakfast if you wise! Tea and coffee is in plentiful supply and the tea is very nice. We ate our lunch at the pool bar every day and have a selection of casual sandwiches and bar food. The milkshakes are very tasty! Evening wise, you have a choice of the Fine Dining restaurant or the coffee shop (not really a coffee shop, more of a relaxed restaurant and alot cheaper than the Fine Dining). Both are excellent and have a lovely ambiance. The staff at the Heritance are nothing short of wonderful. They are all so friendly and helpful and enjoy a quick chat with you, everybodys English incidentally is extremely good. We felt so safe and well taken care of, far more so than on our past trips to Thailand and other parts of Asia. By the pool during the day the pool attendants are brilliant at getting you towels and chairs and the bar guys will bring you a lovely cold glass of lime juice. The pools are very very clean and the most perfect temperature. We always used the residence only pool around the side as it was quieter and whether you enjoy swimming proper lengths or wallowing around with your book there was always plenty of room for everyone. It can be difficult to brave the beach as you are accosted the second you step foot onto it buy people trying to sell you things and take you on trips, and I admit it did annoy me at first. However, its really important to remember that Sri Lanka is a poor country still feeling the repercussions of the Tsunami and it means the world to these people to buy a couple of scarves and table clothes (which are lovely if you take the time to look) for just a couple of quid. By the time we left we were so relaxed it was hard to stand up straight. I encourage anyone to try this place out. I am very particular about cleanliness and get nervous abroad sometimes about the food hygiene etc but this hotel and the staff made me feel so at ease. A fab holiday. Enjoy!

Ignored by the bell boys at arrival and left for half an hour in a dingy bar to await our room. Despite a choice of only 3 welcome drinks, the barman managed to get one of the two wrong !! Eventually given a room which was right on the beach, but seemed to be the only room in the hotel without net curtains, so no privacy at all. We then noticed that the door lock was hanging off so called maintenance. While waiting for them, we discovered a jammed cupboard (so no access to safe), a poky, smelly bathroom and a TV with no reception. Eventually went back to reception (after unconvincing lock fix) and demanded a new room which we were given after another hour's wait. It was better, although lighting was poor. Cleaning was haphazard, towels were often taken but not replaced and there were no insect sprays/mats. Each morning one of the pool boys comes and blasts the pool area with rap music to try to encourage aerobics participants - they should listen to the words one day, which are about 50% expletives and not everyone's taste !! Food was OK but nothing like the Kandalama, another Heritance hotel. Spa was very expensive although treatments were good - watch out for $ prices which mysteriously end up being a lot more in rupees (works out about 140 to the $, not 115). Lots of hassle from beach sellers as well. Overall we were very disappointed as we had such a wonderful time at the Heritance Kandalama in Dambulla and expected the same from this sister hotel. For half the price you can stay at the Kani Lanka in Kalutara which has better food and entertainment.

We just got back yesterday from our trip to Sri Lanka. We absolutely loved our stay at the Heritance, we had a nice room with fantastic views of the ocean and gardens. Our stay was very relaxing, so much that we decided we couldn't be bothered with leaving the hotel and upgraded to half board. The staff were definitely one of the main highlights, they were always ready to help with a smile. Loved the fact that there were 2 pools.The food was always fantastic with a good variety and the waiters very attentive. We were there for 5 nights & it was perfect.

The Inheritance Hotel at Ahungalla is spectacular: beautifully sited, wonderfully designed, serene, luxurious - a little piece of paradise. We arrived after a fabulous trip across Sri Lanka and found ourselves in lovely rooms overlooking the beach and the gardens, we wandered through the open hallways, enjoyed delicious food and relaxed in the sunshine - on the beach. I thoroughly recommend the Ahungalla: all the staff were attentive, friendly, helpful and efficient. The choice and quality of food in the restaurant was excellent, our rooms were clean, spacious, very well-equipped and the bed was marvellously comfortable. Whilst staying we walked on the beach, visited the turtle sanctuary, took a car into Galle and surfed at Bentota. Anne and Trevor de Silva

Totally disappointed with this hotel. The entrance foyer was cold and clinical which was about the standard for the whole hotel. There was no entertainment until we complained and then there was some water aerobics and that was about it. There was a games room that was filthy and had about 2 board games in it, the snooker table you had to pay for, the pool table you had to pay for. There were 3 restaurants but you only really had a choice of 2 as the Upper Dining Room was ridiculously expensive, we did not actually see anyone eat there in our 2 week stayy! There was a cafe with a very limited menu or the main restaurant that was a buffet. The food in these 2 restaurants was okay but the service was terrible. Breakfast was served in the buffet restaurant and the tables were always mucky, you had to constantly ask for tea or coffee and sometimes wait for up to 20 minutes for it to arrive. On a Saturday the hotel opens the main infinity pool area up to local customers, this meant that we had to use the other pool which upset the children. The main pool was rammed with people playing games and being extremely loud making it much to dangerous for children to swim and also a very uncomfortable environment. Whilst at the other pool we ordered lunch and were told we would have a long wait as they were so busy as it was a Saturday!! Whilst we were at the hotel the Sri Lankan and Indian national crickets teams were there, the hotels focus was totally on them and important members of staff were moved to run the catering at the matches - this was very much noticed by guests at the hotel as the service in the restaurants became ridiculously slow and many mistakes were made. The people of Sri Lanka our lovely and very kind and helpful and we felt totally safe when we wandered along the beach way from the hotel. We met a fantastic driver who was wonderful in showing us around and really looked after our children, he is a recommended driver at the hotel and his name is Erish. We had some absolutely wonderful experiences when he took us out as he really worked to make sure we saw everything and enjoyed ourselves, he is also a good driver and very safe which is quite a rarity in Sri Lanka!!!

I stayed in Heritance for 14 days within travelling through Sri Lanka in Aug 2010. I would say the hotel is excellent for non-developed country like Sri Lanka. The rooms are clean, they make the rooms up twice per day, though they forget to leave room accesorries (a comb, sewing set, etc). Sleeping facilities are also wonderful -very soft, they change linen everyday, two big pillows are also in your disposal. What I really appreciated in Heritance is excellent and friendly service and cuisines. I higly recommend you to take HB, you will not regret - the breakfasts and dinners are super! Pool restaurant and bar propose you good cocktails, I highly recommend you cocktails with fresh juices, s.a. Pina Colada. Fish restaurant and Lobby Restaurant are wonderful, the service and waiters there perform excellent service. But the real area for improvement for the mentioned hotel are so called "Beach Boys" (and girls)) who appear to be too annoying. Try to avoid speaking with them. They propose you everything - from restaurant in their village till trips. The trips are of course a bit cheaper then provided by official providers though I do NOT recommend u to take them. Which is more, one of the tourists mobile phone was stolen on the beach (presumabely by one of the beach boys). If I were the hotel manager I would not let them seating and annoying the tourists. I would say it is 4 Star good hotel, value for money, the best in this area.

We have just revisted the Ahungalla after staying there last year. We have stayed in many hotels across Sri Lanka including Kandalama and the Tea Factory, but for a pleaseant friendly holiday or business trip, this hotel really takes some beating. From the moment you arrive a friendly face greets you at reception and provides all of the information you require for your stay. If you are greeted by Arju the front of house Manager, you are in for a real treat as he is meticulous in his service provision. The rooms are of a very high standrad and an upgrade to a superior room is available. But believe me the standard rooms are of a level of any five star hotel across Asia. The food is excelent and the staff can not be more attentive. You are in for a great break if you are looking to stay at this hotel. Feel free to email us for any additional information and If you read this as a member of the Hotel staff team, thanks for making our trip special and we look forward to seeing you next year. Glen and Gill

We last visited this hotel 17 years ago when it was called the Triton. We returned with our 20 year old daughter and 18 year old son to hopefully have a similar holiday experience. The Heritance did not disappoint. As we drove throught the gates and up the long drive to the hotel it brought back many happy memories. The Hotel Heritance as it is now known retains much of the structure of the Triton , but in many ways is so much better. The staff are fantastic, the food is excellent, the rooms are excellent and its very difficult to find fault with anything. The pools are excellent. There were 2 weddings held at the hotel when we were there and it looked like an excellent location. Much better than other hotels we have stayed at.
