We had a lovely relaxing holiday in a beautiful place. We will not be waiting 17 years to go back, this hotel is now firmly on our list of favourite places we must return to.

On entering the private secured ornate gates to the Ahungalla Hotel in Sri Lanka I was overwhelmed by the view which I had arrived at. The beautiful water feature at the front of the hotel with its modern design and an open plan reception. I was greeted by a beautifully dressed Sri Lankan lady who presented me with a flower and showed me to a seat by a spectacular infinity swimming pool and a stunning bar area, I was then given a choice of a complimentary welcome drink and my luggage was taken to my room. On arriving at my room which was beautifully designed with an amazing view of yet another tranquil and beautifully designed pool area and the beach just behind I was more than happy with the accommodation, the bathroom was lovely and a great deal of thought had gone into the lay out and design, however there was no bath. After expressing my slight concern and explaining I was here alone for ten days and had stayed at another two Heritance hotels on this trip I was greeted by the Manager who then showed me to yet another stunning room with equally beautiful views and a bath. The food in the restaurant has been better than I could have ever imagined, with traditional, local, European and oriental and pretty much world wide cuisine. The staff were fabulous and could not do enough to help. The entertainment in the evenings was very tastefully, educational and fun. I would also like to express on my oppinion from a woman travelling alone this hotel was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at due to its atmosphere, staff, security and the clientel which it attracts. I will be returning in the very near future with my family to come and visit the lovely people who work here which I would now class as my friends.

Heritance Ahungalla is not by UK standards a 4,5 star hotel but it was a nice hotel. There is a good selection of restaurants from buffet, cafÃ© style, fine dining to an outdoor grill and all was off fantastic quality. We went for the B&B option and it worked out we spent about Â£28pp per day for lunch, dinner and a couple of drinks ( even had lobster one night!) The rooms are a good size however we found the linen and towels to often be dirty. Unfortunately we also had a small amount of money stolen by the cleaning staff. The location is perfect if you want a hotel that is more isolated but for us it was a little quite. During the monsoon session the sea was too rough to swim in so you are limited to sitting by and swimming in the pools.

We visited Heritance Ahungalla after long flight from UK. It took us 3Hrs to reach the hotel from the air port. Once we arrived in the hotel we had to wait another 2Hrs to get our rooms. 9in the mean time we not not informed that rooms were ready until I requested them the delay. Rooms were dirty in the old block and damp. Standard Sri Lankan food serverd in the main restaurant. But pricing is so high. (USD$50.00 for two people for rice & curry) Pool - was great - clean & large pool of two different pools were great. Checking out was a experience where we had to go to a back office to make the payment. The cashier in the back office has no customer service experience at all. Not even a THANK YOU were said when the final bill was settle down. Around the hotel area their is no any other shops, restuarnt or attractions. I hope the hotel improve standards. Considering the service you get in Asia South Hotels - Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia, these hotels give a better value for your $$$ and more great options.

Loved the hotel - rooms very classy with good air conditioning. Green pool was a fantastic area with squirrels and iguanas for entertainment. Food good and nicely varied in the evenings. Staff friendly and helpful. Would return with little hesitation. Do not attract the attention of the Hawkers on the beach though!

Just returned from two weeks at the Heritance and what an experience!! We were lucky enough to be staying at the hotel alongside the Sri Lankan and Indian cricket teamsand were made to feel part of the whole thing. Everyone was so welcoming and eager for us to join in with the celebrations associated with the national game. The Heritance is an experience that we would not to have missed - we have had an amazing two weeks and experienced luxury and elegance at its best - thankyou. The staff at the Heritance are truly amazing and take the time and trouble to get to know you and chat without always expecting the assoicated tips. A big thank you to Mr Arju and his staff, in particular Laknath who we understand left the day after we did - he will be missed at the hotel we are sure. The room we were upgraded to was again truly amazing, very clean with clean sheets daily and towels twice daily. The pool area was very clean and well maintained, with local widelife in abundance - again thankyou to Dr Filat who made sure our sun beds were ready each morning. Our increased waistlines are an example of how good the food was, ample choices with a wide variety available at each mealtime. Our stay at the Heritance was made even more special by the recommendations of Mr Dave Stockwell who is a regular visitor and we thank you for your input into our two week stay. Whilst on holiday we went on two trips, one a local boat trip and a 2 day trip to Kandy. We were treated to excellent service and an experience we would not have wanted to have missed by a local named Kamal. Kamal made us feel part of his family and welcomed us into his humble life eagerly. We thoroughly enjoyed our two week stay and once again thank you for all at the Heritance and Dave Stockwell. Truely amazing!!!!

My husband and I, both late twenties, booked this hotel on a two for one fantastic deal through hayes and jarvis. We travelled with my parents, whom are well travelled and have stayed in many 5star plush hotels around the world, and my sister and her 11 year old daughter. For value for money the hotel was fantastic. It was re built after the tsunami and so is relatively knew with most mod cons and was lovely and clean. The food was some of the best we have had, although sometimes funny combinations! All a'la carte except the occassional served themed buffet - and we are talking curry night wth some of the best curry we've had, and bbq night with amazing bbq'd seafood. Only downfall was the wine list of which most they didn't have. Lovely quiet hotel, friendly staff - even gave cooking lessons to one of the guests we met. Lovely beach - don't be put off by the few beach traders as they are really friendly and we were introduced to one of them by another guest and we did all our tours through him- fantastic value and local knowledge, really reliable and friendly. The jewellers on site is a real gem, excuse the pun!, and will make anything you like at superb value. Had some earrings and a ring made with diamonds and white sapphire for Â£500! Would recommend a water safari to see local wildlife and buda temple, local tea plantation, local auryvedic herb gardens where they will massage lots of natural potions into you, and also galle which are fairly local things to do. Unfortunately the elephant sanctuary up in the north was a little too far- about 6 hours away. Some people did do this excursion from our hotel but a very long day. So all in all one of the best holidays we've had. My parents did say that having stayed in lots of wonderful hotels that this one was lovely but not quite the added touches you might find in some other locations (like lovely toiletries and other luxuries) although they had a fantastic time and would thoroughly recommend it and go back. Only downfall was that it is a long transfer from the airport - about 3 hours. But once you get there you can relax and forget about that. Weather fine although rainier season so did have a few showers but still hot and rain didn't last for long. Enjoy!

A great place to relax away from the hustle and bustle of a major city. All the staff were friendly and could not do enough for you. Heritance is an impressive hotel situated in an idyllic location and the weather in July was perfect. The food and range of restaurants catered for all tastes and was inexpensive.

Well having had a long flight and a long drive I may have been slightly over tired but my first impressions of the hotel and the room was disappointment. It does come down to taste but I found the hotel is characterless. Our room was good but without the two extra beds for the children which was irritating as my husband had emailed the hotel directly confirming them but they were set up quickly and our request for table lamps in the lounge rather than overhead lighting met as quickly. The children loved the pools and I absolutely hated breakfast! It was enough to bring tears to your eyes the oppressive dining room the scrum around the breakfast bar seemingly at all times, the awful service. I had so many variations on getting a cup of earl grey they were green tea, warm milk, teabags and nothing else including water or a cup, they ran out of tea bags I supplied my own and then tea arriving 30 minutes later when you're just about to leave. In the land of bountiful fruit why are 3 out of 5 breakfast juices made from concentrate or nearer to cordial? Can they not default to 4 place servings, then if 2 come to breakfast they are happy and if 4 come down they are instantly satisified a win win rather than waiting 10 minutes for cutlery for 2 of the party. Can they not allocate a server to families staying longer than 3 nights thus establishing a rapport. Saying that the service elsewhere was fine. The food ranged from adequate to good. Amal's in Bentota was excellent for sea food and Refresh in Hikkaduwa(45 mins) had an enormous choice and was very good. The location was ok , Galle was an hour drive Bentota about 30 minutes. We did take some trips to Udawlawe 4 hours each way and Sinharaja 3 hours each way. As mentioned in previous reviews the beach is effectively out of bounds if you do not wish to be pursued by the local tour guides and hawkers. It could be a great hotel with adequate staff training to instill a sense of ownership and pride, a rethink of the decor, a complete overhaul of the main dining room practices, some investment in soft furnishings. Despite its short comings we thought the Heritance was good value for money.

18 years as a National Cricketer has taken me all over the world and I have had the privilege of staying at the most desirable places. I have also had the opportunity of staying over in the cream of hotels in my motherland as a guest and as a National Cricketer and though I am not comparing the services, I must pen my thoughts on my heartfelt feelings of the memorable and historical stay at Heritance Ahungalla which I consider an important milepost in my life. This is because of this test cricket match played at the Galle Stadium from 18th to 22nd July, 2010 being my final test match where I bid adieu to Test Cricket. It is also memorable to me because of my achievement in my cricketing career - 800 wickets the highest number taken by any cricketer so far. We, me and my mates and our families checked into Heritance Ahungalla on 13th July, 2010 and the warm welcome extended to us from the time we stepped out of the bus is a memory that would linger in my mind for a very very long time. The friendly smiling faces of the staff, from the highest rank to the lowest, came to greet us, offering thirst quenches. The beautiful architecture of another Sri Lankan Legend- Jeffory Bawa, hit me at once. The carpet of blue (pool and the sea being at the same level) waves a warm salty welcome to the tired travellers. Comfortable, spacious and clean rooms and the services rendered by the staff, is the Hallmark of Heritance Ahungalla. The standard of food catered to the national and international pallet is scrumptious and plenty. It is not surprising though, since the hotel is in possession the internationally acclaimed Olympic Gold Medalist - Chef Dimuthu Kumarasinghe in their Culinary Team. It takes one Celebrity to know another!!!! As a national cricketer, who needs to keep his mind, body and the total being in peaceful tact, the services offered, quality of food, facilities available, restful environment, recognition given, entertainment provided for relaxation, should be par excellence and I would say - "Hats Off to Heritance Ahungalla - Our stay at your hotel is Memorable". My wife Mathimalar and my Son Naren, have taken a great liking and love to your Hotel. We definitely will visit you, may be not as a National Cricketer, but as a loyal guest, because we know your service would be the same. It is only right that I thank the Management and the rest of the staff, for the fantastic service given right throughout our stay at your hotel. I would like to specially mention the following which touched my heart immensely: Grand Welcome extended to all our Team Members and our families; Giving me the great honour of declaring open the new office of the Olympic Gold Medalist - Chef Dimuthu Kumarasinghe; For organizing cocktails and entertaining us; Celebrating birthdays of the Cricketers and appreciation of their performance; Giving the Sri Lankan Cricket Team the honour in being a part of their staff activities - Opening of Staff Restaurant (Samudra Restaurant); Hosting my family and friends for a special and intimate dinner at the Supper Club of the Hotel; For the Grand and Mind Blowing Ceremony organized in par with my farewell to Test Cricket - Some of the pictures I will attach hereto. Here I must mention that I was completely taken by surprise and my family members were thrilled that such recognition and importance given to me by the Hotel. This celebration will remain in my memory even when I grow old. Last but not the least, the most beautiful, wonderful show piece cake created by Chef Dimuthu Kumarasinghe personally on my behalf. I'm so touched overwhelmed of this fact and I think it is a privilege no other cricketer in the world had been able to experience. This is what I call SSS (Super Style of Service). But I am sorry that I can't eat and keep the cake together!!! So this is the Hotel with which I would associate as the pinnacle of the most unforgettable achievement and finally I would say "Murali endorses Heritance Ahungalla with pleasure". Muttiah Muralidaran

Heritance Ahungalla is not by any standards a 4,5 star hotel. We have chosen it for our honeymoon trip as pictures seen on the website looked amazing and we also read many good reviews. However, our stay there turn out to be a great dissapointment and we won't be going back. To list just few problems you may encounter there : it is impossible to go for a walk on the beach as you are constantly pestered by locals who do not take no for an answer; cockroaches can be found not only on hotel corridors but also inside the rooms; the cutlery served at tables has leftovers of food stuck to it; the bed linen in the rooms as well as the curtains are stained and often with holes; the hotel provides hardly any toiletries and if so, they are stuck on the bottom of a ceramic bottles in a very small quantitiy; there are constant problems with electricity and it can go off for over 30mins at time. As for the service it is probably one of the most tiresom and annoying problems of all, as there is no communication between the team members serving meals in the restaurant, you need to ask several times for a pot of coffee or a bottle of water, provided that you will be understood by the waiter on the first occassion. If so, the requested drink may not be delivered at all, while few other team memers will approach with exactly the same question about your choice of drink but it will take ages for someone to actually deliver it to the table. The tips are expected while the service quality or rather its lack, does not jusitfy it at all. The most imposing are often the housekeeping supervisors (not the regular housekeepers- they work very hard and hardly ever strike a conversation with a guest), who can follow you down the corridor repeating few times that they are entirely responsible for cleaning your room....all obviously to be tipped. In case of any problems with the room calling reception is normally a waste of time, as you have to call back several times before someone turns up to deal with the problem. The hotel is full of damp and looks as if its times of glory have long gone. We have been travelling extensively over last couple of years throughout Africa and Asia and we are very much aware of difficulties some developing countries face, however we cannot find an explanation for advertising a very poor quality hotel as a 4,5 star resort.

Have just returned from 2 weeks at the Heritance and overall it was a disappointing experience, primarily because the service was so mixed, ranging from good, to indifferent, to frankly poor. My wife and I travelled with our 13 year old son, and we stayed in 2 adjacent luxury rooms, which were slightly tired, but extremely spacious, and thoroughly cleaned every day. A word of warning to anyone travelling with younger children, we had made 3 advance requests via our Tour Operator "Kuoni", for inter connecting rooms. We received no reply, and were only advised on arrival that the hotel has no interconnecting rooms. The 2 hotel pools are large and well maintained, one offering some limited organised activities and the other residents' pool offering a quieter option. The hotel and grounds are spacious, and even though the hotel was fully occupied for part of our stay, it never felt over crowded. We had opted for bed and breakfast, so didn't experience the buffet, all inclusive option. However a few of our fellow guests did and commented that the food was good quality, but repetitive if staying for 2 weeks. We mainly ate in the Coffee Shop restaurant where the food was good, and given a supposed 5 star hotel, we thought the prices were reasonable. Dining out options in the village of Ahungalla are non existent. If you walk out of the hotel complex, you are quickly surrounded by several locals, offering TukTuk rides, boat safaris, and numerous trips. They are persistent but never threatening, and several firm " no thank you" will usually see them retreat. The village does have a pharmacy and a bank. If you are cashing travellers cheques, it is worth the 5 minute stroll to the bank as it offers a significantly better exchange rate than the hotel. For dining out you need to get a taxi or a TukTuk to Bentota or else to HIkkaduwa. Bentota has several hotels and is 20 minutes in a taxi or about 25/30 minutes in a TukTuk. The drivers will wait for you and negotiate a return trip price. A hotel taxi was about Â£20 for a return trip, with the tuktuks costing about half of that. The best restaurant we found was the Golden Grill, good for curries and seafood. Dinner for 3 people with beer and soft drinks was typically Â£30 to Â£40 in total. Main frustration came with the inconsistent service in the hotel. At breakfast, there was a great range of food, and all well presented, and plenty of staff on hand. Unfortunately it wasn't unusual for 3 different waiters to approach you to ask whether we wanted tea or coffee, but then none of them would get round to serving it. The pool attendants are helpful but want tipping continually and the room cleaners changed several times and all made subtle overtures for tips. Reception staff were always smiling, but poorly trained and inefficient with simple requests having to be made several times before anything got done. After the first week we found a great guy working reception and just made sure we dealt with him. Some lovely staff serving drinks around the pool, always friendly and helpful. Wandering onto the beach is spoilt because the locals will lie in wait and then follow you round trying to sell you gouges or trips. They will ask your name and if you give it, they will stand at the edge of the hotel property calling to you while you try and relax on your sun bed. Again they aren't threatening in any way, just persistent and something of a pain. Just keep saying "no thank you" and they will eventually give up ! Overall, the Heritance is nice but dated hotel, but represents pretty reasonable value for what it is. The location is isolated but the grounds and pools are good, and the rooms are fine. It has the potential to offer a relaxed, get away from it all style resort, IF the management could get their act together and get the service to a consistently efficient level.

The welcome back for the sri lanka cricket team and for murali's retirement from test cricket was simply outstanding. the attention to detail and the acquisition was very good. the fact that all were allowed to participate, staff and guests, was touching and very much appreciated. it was certainly a historic and touching moment, not only for murali's family but for all those who were fortunate enough to be at the heritance ahungall hotel. The cake ! who's idea was that ? really very clever, congratulations to all involved in the making of the cake,it was so very thoughtful that a nice piece of cake was offered to everyone present. what a splendid finale! perfectly executed! Kind Rgds, Steven & Jemie

This is definately not a 5 star hotel, it's decor is very shabby, bed linen is off colour, stained and has seen better days. There isn't an on complex shop so you have to buy everything in the bar and trying to get out of the hotel main gate to the road is a nightmare as the locals swarm around the en trance ready to pounce on you, they find it very difficult to take "no" for an answer. The same goes for the beach, you cannot get on it in without being harassed as they line the edge of the hotel grounds. Would not recommend booking holidays thru the rep as these are double the price of using the hotel taxi's to take you to the same places. If you are not giving the locals, be it where ever you are, tips for this that and everything then they are very abrupt and can't get rid of you quick enough, especially the rep! They want tips for putting a cushion and towel on your sunlounger and then when it rains they want another one for putting it back again.

Maybe our expectations were different, but we didnâ€™t get what we were hoping for with our three-day stgay at the Heritance Ahungalla. We thought that an all-inclusive resort would be a relaxing base of operations but found that we were pretty much sequestered on the property. We wanted to get out and about during the day or night and the operation and setting did not lend themselves to that â€“ the Heritance wants to capture all of your money during your visit. Rooms were clean and nicely appointed but small. High premiums for everything, from bottled water to laundry to room service to internet. Food options were limited and consistently underwhelming. Front desk and concierge staff were not particularly helpful when we did ask for suggestions for activities or dining off of the property. Should we find ourselves back on the coast in Sri Lanka we will look for a smaller hotel closer to one of the towns or villages, not an all-inclusive resort.

We decided to stay at Heritance Ahungalla as it was designed by an architect that we like - Geoffrey Bawa. Later we realized so are many hotels en route Ahungalla from Colombo. Having said that, it sure is a beautiful hotel with two vast pools overlooking the beach. The brand is all about the blend of tradition and modernity. The service staff were all in their white sarongs with white shirts. The rooms were a bit disappointing. We requested for a triple room and realized that it is a double with an extra bed. We really thought there would be more space. The maintenance was not as good and lamp shades were falling off. For a property of that size and price the in-room amenities were dated including a large tube television that juts into the walk path. There were a lot of renovation going on and we had to walk through scaffolding all the time. We also had this noon drills and plumbing noise that would not let us take that much needed siesta. The food was again a strong blend of Lankan and Continental. I was ok with an odd piece of dried fish in my food. My wife and kids were not. So I had to taste the dishes before they ate. But the traditional food was enjoyable and we gorged. There is a fine dining restaurant in the property and I would rate that very high. The pools were fabulous - clean, well maintained and addictive. The gym was old, grubby and rusted (most of the equipment were not usable). When we go to Sri Lanka again we will not go south as it is intended to rip off unsuspecting tourists. And so we will not stay at Heritance Ahungalla either. I think all properties in that stretch of Bentota, Ahungalla are overrated. I would rather stay in a boutique property at Fort Galle.

Having returned on 11th June after 12 nights at this hotel on vacation with my wife, I feel the need to express my gratitude for such an amazing holiday. My wife and I were married in Sri Lanka last year and we fell in love with Sri Lanka - we felt compelled to return to celebrate our 1st anniversary (but this time at a different hotel). As soon as we arrived - the first impressions were..........wow. The brochures do not do this stunning hotel justice. Having had a long tiring journey, we were given a very warm welcome. We stayed in a Suite which was superb in every way. The rooms are serviced daily by friendly housekeeping staff to a very very high standard. I am a Executive Chef who is in charge of a group of Companies providing Fine Dining Catering with bespoke menu's to wealthy clientele, so I was intrigued to find out whether this 5* hotel would impress. I need not have questioned this thought. After talking to The Food and Beverage Manager, I was invited to look around the kitchens and meet their brigade. The kitchens were immaculate, staff spotless, motivated and relaxed in their work - delivering the most delicious fine dining experience. With Sri Lanka's top medal winning Chef at the helm this comes as no surprise. If it is fantastic food and excellent service you require, then look no further. We will definitely return.

We stayed at Heritance Ahungalla from 3rd to 16th May 2010 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were made very welcome by all of the staff and the hotel is very striking when you arrive. The initial room we were given had a problem with the air-conditioning that couldn't be fixed until the following day but we were promptly moved to another room, third floor above the restaurant and couldn't fault it and slept really well. Spacious clean room with a beautiful bed, heavy internal screens help to keep the room dark and cool, tea and coffee making facilities provided and topped up twice daily when towels were changed and beds turned down. Had a problem one day with a cockroach in the bathroom but Housekeeping were quick to attend to it and after all you are in a tropical environment. Beach staff were wonderful and two fantastic pools, beach touts were a bit of a nuisance at times, but easy enough to deal with. Ate most days in the hotel and found plenty to eat at both breakfast and dinner and food and drinks bill for 13 days was Â£290 for the two of us. Twice invited to Management Cocktail parties, and the night club re-opened for the season just as we were leaving otherwise not a lot to do in an evening. Took the train to Galle one day and bus back and had a two day trip to the Elephant Orphanage and Kandy which we throughly enjoyed. Lots of rest and relaxation and husband had a very nice massage in the Spa before we came home. Would we go back, probably yes but would look to try a different area as there wasn't a lot within walking distance of the hotel. If you are hesitating over choosing this hotel then don't, would recommend it to anyone and the overiding memory is how wonderful the staff were. They are genuinly interested in getting to know you and helping you and nothing is too much trouble they really are a credit to the hotel and to Sri Lanka. Overall had a wonderful holiday and made many friends amongst the staff

I had seen some excellent pictures of this place and was pleasantly surprised that the place did justice to the pictures and vice versa. The infinity pool extending from the lobby is the focus of this charming resort. What is even more remarkable is that this resort suffered greatly when the tsunami hit coastal Sri Lanka and the management put it back together very quickly. The rooms are cosy, ours was a little away from the central pool area and room service took a little longer. The balconies are perfect for a quiet cup of SriLankan tea or a beer depending on the time of the day. Dont miss the antique lift in the lobby. The buffet lunch and dinner are excellent with a sumptuous variety of food though vegetarians may have fewer choices. Make sure you have room for the desserts. As is the case with most Sri Lankan resorts, the staff go out of their way to make you comfortable.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Heritance. The hotel had everything one could ask for with a professional service. The beach was clean and all windows had a sea-view. Food was excellent and the whole ambience was marvellous. I will surely go there again, but maybe on a personal trip instead of official. Its soooooo romantic :)

Heritance Ahungalla is a place that will immediately bring your pulse rate down. A great atmosphere to relax, soak in the sun and enjoy a huge spread of Sri Lankan food. Geoffery Bawa's characteristic infinity pool, the sound of the crashing waves and the setting sun are guaranteed to put you in a mellow mood. The bar by the pool is nice and has a band playing in the evenings. There is another fairly large pool by the fitness centre. The spa was average. Rooms were large and clean. Strong smell of cinnamon oil - which I loved. We were there for a conference and the hotel agreed to arrange a Mongolian barbeque for us on the beach which, unfortunately, was rained out. The following night we opted to use the Night Club. The beach is clean - touts will point you in the direction of cheaper massages and shacks offering fresh sea food on the beach, both of which we did not try out.

We have just returned from a 2 week stay at the heritance. We travelled as a family of 2 children 2 and 4 yrs plus granparents. We had an excellent time and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. The architexture is stunning with a very calm atmosphere and a wonderful infinity pool that blends into the beach. The pictures don't do it justice. We stayed in their 2 interconnecting rooms 301 and 302 which were spacious and had excellent see views. They made them up as a king size and 2 singles which suited us great. You could hear the entertainment but it finished at a reasonable time. The "animators" were really helpful, building sandcastles and flying kites with the children. We all enjoyed the daily aqua aerobics. One of the best things about the hotel and sri lanka is the poeple. The were very friendly and genuine and made our stay one to remember. The service was very occasionally slightly chaotic in a nice sri lankan way, but everyone was very helpful. The food was the best that we tasted anywhere on our trip in the hotel. Breakfast is excellent and the food in the coffee shop was v tasty. The chinese and BBQ buffets were worth it and we weren't charged for the children. Drink prices were reasonable (we were charged twice as much in the hotel on our trip to Kandy). We did some trips around the area with Bertie from the sunshine resturant at the end of the beach. I would definitely recommend the river safari as not to be missed. This is an excellent choice for those looking for relaxation in a stunning setting. There is the option to explore locally and futher afield. We can't thank the hotel enough for an excellent stay, (they are happy to be contacted with room requests before you travel). We would go again!

We went as part of a much larger group here. The pool was large and therefore could accommodate a large number of people. The hotel was clean and had a very calm atmosphere to it. The room we had was very spacious with a very large bathroom. There was 24 room service and they served up food and beverages when called. The beds were big and comfy - the downside was the 21 inch CRT TV and for the price we were paying that could have been better. The downside to this hotel was the food at the buffet (lunch and dinner). The selection was very limited and not up to standard. Your probably better off ordering from room service - I did enjoy that. The service at this hotel was extremely good and the staff pleasant - from the dining room to the bar to the room service attendants. I would say for a great place to relax and be pampered this is one of the places to go.

Heritance architecture is remarkable and the rooms are spacious and very comfortable. It is a fun place to go in a group as their is just the resort to enjoy....very nice pool can spend half a day their itself!!!! massage was not up to the mark and food was a big disappointment.

We were planning to stay for 5 nights at the Heritance but ended up staying for 6 because of the volcano (we then moved to the Club Villa in Bentota). I booked the Heritance to contrast with the very small hotel we stayed at in Unawatuna so the children would have more to do. The setting is beautiful with two stunning swimming pools that feel virtually on the beach and never seemed busy at all. The gardens are very big with lots of trees if you want to be in the shade and the pool attendants move the sunbeds wherever you want and are very helpful. We had three double deluxe rooms on the second floor for the six of us that looked over the garden (you could see the sea if you leant over the balcony). It would have been nicer to have had a full sea view, but the rooms themselves were fine - very clean and comfortable with great showers. The balconies were big enough to comfortably sit on and it was very quiet. The beach is absolutely beautiful and the sea lovely, although it can be very dangerous at certain times of the year. The food at breakfast was excellent - a buffet with everything from traditional Sri Lankan hoppers, curries and soups to every kind of eggs, pancakes, waffles, omelettes, bacon .... Lots of fresh fruit but horrid concentrated fruit juices. The only, but annoying, quibble at breakfast was that it seemed impossible to get a cup of tea - there are armies of staff but no one seems to actually do anything. The food generally was quite good didn't really work for a family of six. The half-board option gave you the buffet supper that was rather expensive and disappointing so we only did that once. There is a very smart looking restaurant that would probably be lovely if there were only two of you, but we felt rather forced to stick to the coffee shop (better than it sounds!) where the menu was fine, but somewhat limited. You had a feeling that you were stuck in the middle of nowhere and the hotel rather exploited this which was slightly annoying. Charging for the internet and for the use of the dreadful tennis court (why did we cart all our tennis rackets all the way to Sri Lanka?!) seemed rather mean-spirited. My husband and sons used the gym and thought it was fine and played table tennis and crazy golf. On our last night the hotel was virtually full so we all moved into a suite on the third floor at the far end of the hotel. It was a stunning room with sitting-room and massive balcony with beautiful sunset views and would have made a perfect honey-moon spot (not quite so romantic with four teenagers camped out on the floor!). I would recommend the Heritance because of its beautiful setting but probably a four night stay would be enough.

We liked this hotel very much. It belongs to the company Aitken Spence and is one of its best hotels. Aitken Spence has 9 hotels on Sri Lanka and 8 on Maldives also they have tea plantation and make 4 - 15 and more days excursions and there are very talented guides. We were especially pleased with our guide and driver in one person with whom we traveled for 5 days. His name is Amereseri (tourists call him Gaston). He is working for Aitken Spence for 25 years. So if you will book your tour - better do it with this company and choose this guide, he is very attentive, experienced, he is the best. The ocean is beautiful, the sand is clean, the sky is blue. What else do you need??) The hotel is very clean and new one, all rooms are ocean view. They except cards so you can easily pay with it. Buffet breakfast is every day the same, but dinners were especially tasty- seafood and others. If you want to eat somewhere else out of hotel - you can go to the place that is called restaurant not far from Heritance. Locals are always annoying and proposing to go to this resto. It is not tidy there but do not mind because seafood there is excellent (we liked king prawns- very delicious). BUT FROM ENDLESS PLUSES THERE IS ONE MINUS. We made friends with people who stayed at this hotel the same time as we did, and somebody stole 200 dollars from their room. Money was in the inner pocket of the girl`s bag. They did it in such a way that there was nobody to blame. Room boy told that he came to their room to tidy it but he broke the key in the door and went away and started to clean another room. So maybe it was not he but another room boy who used this situation.Of course it was not the last money they had but they were disappointed cause everything was so good and the last day a little bit spoilt. They did not call police (but we read a lot of reviews that if smbd stoles smth on Sir Lanka better to call police and maybe they will return it). SO ALWAYS LEAVE MONEY JEWELRY AND OTHER PRECIOUS THINGS IN THE SAFE because it seems that they are looking through your belongings - that is not pleasant. But if not this case I will never believe that those pleasant, always smiling people can do such things. There is also internet in the library, you can buy card at the reception (1 hour - 2,5 dollars). If you are a romantic person - take the book of Maureen Lee "Stepping stones" from the library, I left it there, it is very interesting. Take with yourself cremes not to get sunburn. But I noticed that almost all people there become very very red burnt because the sun there is very strong. Everybody`s skin!!!!! flakes when you return from Sri Lanka. So, be careful. I highly recommend you to stay in this hotel, you will be very satisfied!!! Wish you good weather and exciting holidays!! Regards from Ukraine

When we arrived at the Heritance Ahungalla, we were pleasantly surprised by the exotic setting nestled amongst coconut groves and lush green vegetation. We could barely wait to jump into the infinity pool that looked directly onto the beach with the roaring waves of the Indian Ocean in the background. It was perfect. Don't get me wrong we did have some issues To read more; http://tinyurl.com/y58cyvl

There isn't a lot in the surrounding area but that does not matter as you won't want to leave the hotel. The service is good, the rooms are very nice indeed and the location is perfect if you just want to sit on a sunlounger for a week and drink cocktails. All the staff are lovely and the restaurants are nice. Our favourite was the Coffee Shop which was a lovely restaurant overlooking the beautiful swimming pool. Thanks to Dayal who looked after us impeccably. The management are very focused on good customer service. It's a long way to go for a week (from the UK) but we'd do it again.
Room was not that good.... first night we could not sleep due to hotel maintenance noise. Food was good... but only if you like spicy .... surrounding was nice...nice beach.... secure... nice pool.

We stayed in Heritance for 2 weeks and it was a great time! Nice rooms, amazing ocean view and what's more: DELICIOUS FOOD !!! It's peaceful, relaxing place, maybe not for people looking for fun and entertainment... not much to do in the evenings, but perfect for those who really want to relax. There are lots of places worth visiting in further and closer area. If You want to go for a trip we can really advise a local tour-operator Mr Sumana Siri De SIlva. We used his 'tuk tuk' services everytime we wanted to go somewhere. He charmed us with his good heart, honesty and engagement in his work. If You would like to go with him somewhere just call him: [--]he will come always on time! Ask him also to take You to spice garden 'Happy Lanka' for massage... You will feel like newly born :-) We cordially recommend !!!

Stayed for two nights found the room to be disappointing, small and a bit dirty, net curtains were stained as well as the rug on the floor very marked. Only one towel in room until more brought at 6pm which was a bit late. Toiletries supplied very poor, bathroom needed a good clean. Found the buffet to be disappointing and dishes not refilled very often also one night the vegetables were very undercooked, also little choice. Breakfast buffet good. Pool and beach lovely. snacks from pool bar good also.

Our 6th visit to this hotel & we would say that it is better in most aspects than before the tsunami damage. Transport would be needed to venture to places of interest such as Galle -we would not recommend using public transport . The beach traders were no problem to us . Special thanks to Sampath De Silva at F&B & Mr Gamage for making our stay so enjoyable abeyjackie

A perfect relaxing holiday. It does what it says on the tin. Located directly on a long stretch of sandy, deserted beach and within large tropical gardens. The sea can be rough, but good fun, the two pools are large, clean and inviting. Rooms are well furnished and modern/classy, we stayed in a one bedroomed suite which was excellent. Food is very good with a choice of local and international dishes, drinks are fairly priced. The service was excellent, all staff we met, including cleaners, waiters and management had good positive attitudes and really tried hard to satisfy at all times. We felt this was one of the best all round relaxing beach holidays we have had.

The title says it all really.After completing a 8 day tour of the island,we were definitely ready for our 8 night beach holiday and our choice of hotel couldnt have been better. We dined in all the resteraunts and really enjoyed the mustard and fine dining options.The in room dining selection was also ideal and eating breakfast on our balcony whilst gazing over the Indian ocean was a great start to the day Our room was very comfortable and kept spotless by our room boy(The air conditioning was bliss!!).The thing that really stands out at this hotel are the staff,the friendliness and service is second to none,we were greeted by the reception staff on our arrival as valued customers and made to feel special.I also had the pleasure of speaking to the room division manager(Arju),who whilst welcoming my posive opinions regarding the hotel, also seemed keen to hear any negative issues.I couldnt help him with any negative aspects!! This is a very well run hotel with amazing staff,a great choice for a romantic holiday.

A great hotel and beach location. We were not after somewhere that was in the middle of one of the large tourist areas and the Heritance provided just what we were after. Somewhere where we could walk on a beach and not be mobbed by beach boys or other tourists. There are some beach sellers by the hotel but they are friendly and after a while leave you alone. The staff at the hotel are attentive although sometimes seem to take awhile in returning with your order but that been said they are always smiling. The rooms were large enough for our needs and room service always asked how we were and if we had any other reqiurements. If you want to explore try the cycle ride with Charmin from the hotel around the local area or take the local Tuk-Tuk with Raja (orange shirt) from the front gate. He gave a great tour taking us off the beaten path and into the local community. A good price and very knowledgable. We'll be back.

We could not fault the welcome we received - it was a delight to find many of the pre -tsunami staff still in the hotel. The refurbishment has been really well done with rooms looking smart and well designed. We ate in three of the locations and enjoyed some excellent food which was professionally served with enthusiasm and politeness. If we had any disappointment it was in the wine which we thought was very expensive and due to the hot weather, not always of good quality.

We got excited seeing the brochures however when we arrived it exceed all our expectations. The reception was warm and courteous, rooms are well appointed and excellent service. We tried the restaurants for dinner and B/f, the spread was truly international. The pool is out of the world. The staff were very helpful. One must visit the hotel and dont miss the drive to Galle and the nearby tutle farm.

This hotel has a lovely atmosphere, Beautifully re-done.The three hour "hell" trip from the airport, made it worth it, as this is a little treasure. The rooms are beautifully done, and service is excellent.Would love to visit there again!

This ought to be a great hotel but it ends up only being a good one. It lets itself down on a couple of fronts. First the good - the food is excellent both in the main restaurant and the fine dining restaurant. In particular we were very impressed with the team that look after the pool bar and the fine dining room. Worthy of particular mention are the guys in Lakmal's team including Dilan, Kolitha and Silva who were chatty without being intrusive and went out of their way to help. Dinesh made sure that a birthday celebration in the fine dining restaurant was special and memorable. Also the pools are very large and the main pool is really beautiful. The hotel is justifiably proud of having been designed by Sri Lanka's most celebrated architect Geoffrey Bawa. The view as you arrive at reception is fantastic looking right through the hotel lobby and over the beach to the sea. Unfortunately our experience of the front desk staff is they manage to be both obsequious and a bit too full of how good they think the hotel is at the same time. We were particularly annoyed when they failed to pass on two important messages from our tour operator. The rooms also look the part at first but fall victim to style over substance. There are so many hotel 'ornaments' that you have to clear loads of stuff out of the way to put your own belongings away. The light over the desk is hung so low that you bang your head on it whilst it manages to keep the mirror above the desk in complete shade. You have to ring housekeeping to ask for many of the things we found provided automatically in other hotels such as adaptors and mosquito repellers. You also need to make use of the Do Not Disturb sign pretty much whenever you are in the room or you are likely to find your bed being turned down at 6 in the evening! We also experienced power failures on almost every evening - not the end of the world in themselves but it would have been nice to have had a torch in the room instead of sitting in complete darkness until the power came back on. The bathroom was one of the biggest disappointments as it only contain a shower. We asked twice about moving to a room with a bath and once were told there were no rooms with baths and the second time were asked for $100 per night to move to a room with a bath. On both occassions we were told we could use the jacuzzi near the resident's pool if we wanted a bath although we were never brave enough to stroll down there in the altogether with our soap and shampoo! The jacuzzi is actually a cheap plastic afterthought that would have Mr Bawa turning in his grave. In summary this hotel did not impress as much as other hotels we stayed in during our trip. It charged for things such as internet usage and had not done a great job of anticpating our needs in a way that other hotels did that did not cost anywhere near as much as this one and it would probably not be on our list of places to go back to or to recommend on that basis.

We stayed at this hotel for twelve days and expected more from a hotel with a deluxe reputation. The greatest asset this hotel has are its staff. They were simply excellent, so very friendly, exceptionally eager to please and polite and courteous at all times. You would find it difficult to find a better hotel staff anywhere. The food in the buffet restaurant was of a high standard and a perfect mix of Sri Lankan and International dishes. The food in the fine dining restaurant was even better and probably better than manyy top restaurants in London. The hotel is located right on the beach andmost of the rooms have a great sea view. There are many beach venders, but we did not find this too much a problem as they quickly learnt not to bother you once you made it clear you were not interested. Yes, there are many positives to this hotel, but unfortunately it does not deserve a deluxe rating. First impression are so important and this hotel is let down by being in need of care and attention. For example the furnishings in the public areas were stained and needed replacing and much of the woodwork needed attention. The tablecloths in the dining room were frequently filthy (unacceptable and easily rectified) and all the linen needed to be renewed. Many of the sunbeds were broken and needed replacing and wer covered with dirty matresses. However, the pool attendents were excellent and helped to make up for these problems. Our overall impression of this hotel was that it required significant investment to bring it up to an acceptable standard for a deluxe hotel. The hotel is saved by its excellent staff and fabulous food; two of the most impotant factors for a successful hotel. Would we return, possibly, but only if standards were improved. There are many boutique hotels opening in Sri Lanka and the Heritance needs to be able to match the very high standard that these hotels set.
We felt at home from the moment we arrived. The staff were all exceptional and the service was fantastic. The food was amazing and so plentiful. A really beautiful hotel.

After a 6 hour drive we were welcomed to Heritance Ahungalla with a drink and fast check in and shown to our rooms. We were upgraded to a suite which was a nice surprise and invited to the managers cocktail party. The rooms were very spacious, quiet and clean with wonderful views over the ocean. The pools and grounds were immaculately kept with staff to help you move day beds, supply towels and tend to your every need. The food was great in the restaraunts, but very dissapointing room service and pool bar/ outdoor cafe food - the "hot" food always came out cold and the icecream was served melted and the staff were not that keen to fix it. We wre lucky enough to be invited in to the kitchen for special cooking lessons which were wonderful. I found this hotel to be a wonderful place to relax and unwind at the end of a busy holiday.

I checked this hotel at tripadvisor before booking it and expected it to be nice and relaxing at the very least, however, the whole stay (we stayed there for 3 weeks) was a complete and utter disappointment! Looks like Heritance has changed a lot lately and it's surely not a 5* hotel anymore. After an almost 20-hour trip to the hotel, my only wish was to have a shower and lie down, however, we had to spent almost half an hour answering stupid questions about our anniversary, etc. The staff was too talkative and tactless even, several times we had spend almost the entire lunch in their company and nothing could possibly make them leave. All the advantages of this place faded away in comparison with its negative sides. Quite nice design of the room couldn't make up for holes in bedsheets, dirty curtains, breaking conditioning, old towels and other things. The food was really fabulous, however, when the evening food was under a set menu, almost all guest opted for the a la carte restaurant as the set menu was really poor and the meal lasted forever. The atmosphere was quite relaxing most of the time, however, there was no chance to even enter the pool as soon as weekend came and the hotel was fully packed with locals. Some things kept on spoiling our stay on every day basis. The beach area was constantly full of locals, who were trying to sell you a trip or whatever you wanted or didn't wanted. Even by the pool your every single movement was followed by their attempts to draw your attention. If you managed to escape and reach the ocean, several guys were waiting for you to come back. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone! For the first time in my life I was looking forward for going home!!

This hotel has a grand entrance and everything to suggest exclusive luxury. Hotel landscape is huge with 2 large pools and over 100 guestrooms. If you are interested in a romantic getaway place, this may not be the place for you as there are many family travellers in general. The guestroom is spacious with modern decoration and overlooking the beach. Bathroom amenities can definitely be upgraded to match the luxurious atmosphere. The TV can be changed as well. The biggest selling point of this hotel is the food. Especially the 2 dinners included in the half board was absoloutely amazing and would highly recommend anyone visiting to do at least a half board as there aren't any places to eat outside the hotel. The dinner had a variety of freshly cooked seafood and a great mix of western and local dishes. One of the problem with this hotel is that they really need to try to controll the flies, flying everywhere in the hotel. Especially near the pool bars. Whether a electric device to control this problem or any other way, they definitely need to try and solve this problem as it gets really annoying when you want to have a nice drink at that bar. Oh and the Residen't pool is much nicer than the main pool! The staff were mostly very friendly and helpful! If only they would deliver the internet card to the room instead of asking us to pick it up from the front desk!

It used to be a great place, sadly, not any more. For $172 USD you can find more magic in many other locations in Srilanka's southern coast. Food was nothing fabulous, the restaurant had flies, really far too many. The servers were not on the ball, coffee was horrible. checking in was not smooth, towels (some) threadbear or torn. bathroom water clogged up. However, It was fixed without much fuss. Sorry, I am done with this hotel.

After having read some of the mixed reviews about this hotel I was a little worried, but after having visited and experienced the Heritance I really find myself asking â€œexactly what do some people expect or wantâ€, We (my wife and I along with our 21 year old daughter and 18 year old son) visited in Dec 09 taking in New Years Eve 2010 and really I cannot fault the hotel. This comes from someone who as a rule is is not easily impressed by hotels. The New Years Eve Party was really such good fun, never seen so much varied food, great entertainment and fireworks on the beach. Generally food was good, even for those that are fussy eatersâ€¦you will find something you like, breakfasts buffets have all you could want, you wont find a better chicken sausage! Evening buffets are varied and offer great choice. The location of the hotel is on a wonderful beach, some complain about the beach sellers, for me they were no issue, yes they can be a little irritating but by and large providing you are firm in your request to be left alone (in a polite way please) then they will not bother you. We found them to be good fun and we got friendly with many of them, some are real characters and especially after we bought various items we had friends for life. These people are trying to earn a living and after the drop in tourism due to the Tsunami they have been having a really hard time. So please â€¦whilst you are fortunate enough to holiday at the Heritance have a little sympathy and understanding for those poor folk who depend on the likes of us tourists for their income. So what if you spend a few Euros, pounds or whatever, it wont make any difference to you..but a whole lot of difference to them! Also if you have children/teenagers the sea can be deceiving, at certain times there can be quite a strong undertow and on two occasions some swimmers needed help to be brought to shore so just be careful, the sea is warm and blue, the sand is golden like powder, the beach goes on for miles so you can be lulled into a false sense of security! We all swam in the sea with no problems but you need to be sensible. The staff are truly amazing and really cannot do enough for you, I wont single any one member of staff as they were all as good as each other, I cannot praise them highly enough. The rooms are superb, most offering great views and are spacious and well appointed. In some previous reviews there were some claims that at weekends and holiday time the pool gets too busy/too noisy with non resident locals, well we were there at the peak of their main season and yes there were some locals but the pool is huge (but also spotlessly clean) and those visiting were always well behaved so this was never an issue, besides there is another huge pool for residents only. The pools really are magnificent and again perfectly situated, pool to beach, 45 seconds! And donâ€™t ask me how but no sand in the pool! In the evening we went to the night club for Karaoke, a lot of fun. We stayed at the Heritance for 6 nights but next year weâ€™ll stay for longer, lots to do in the surrounding area, swim with turtles, great snorkelling, Bentota water sports centre, river safariâ€¦â€¦plus more. We look forward to returning next year, so if you want a great hotel, in a great location, on a wonderful beach, with super staff and good food all wrapped up with a real resort atmosphereâ€¦â€¦the Heritance is for you.

We have just returned from a three week stay at the Heritance Hotel. Hotel was basically good, everything worked, including the staff who, if anything, could be overly attentive. Rooms were stylish, had plenty of storage space and were serviced twice daily. Balconies had views across the beach to the setting sun. Some guests complained of minor faults, e.g. our fridge broke down but was repaired the same morning. Food was a good as could be expected with Buffet Service and we were never bored, although the dining room could be noisy. The hotel is proud of its swimming pools and rightly so. Attentive pool boys and life guards ensure there is not the usual scramble for beds and towels. We actually preferred the second (residents) pool to that shown in all the literature. The beach was regularly cleaned and patrolled. Constant slight surf, no problems for even moderate swimmers but small children should be supervised. The hotelâ€™s main drawback is its isolation. Locally, there is simply nowhere to go and little to do. Ahungalla village consists of some 70 yards of dilapidated shacks selling local produce and a few basics at blatantly â€™touristâ€™ and local prices. There is also a passable bakery, a pharmacy, a bank with no ATM and a railway station at which few trains actually stop. There are two bus services and two qualities of bus i.e. Air Conditioned and Local. It is difficult to ascertain what is a public bus, as opposed to touring or private hire and even more difficult to have them stop. Heritance guests are not expected to want to walk anywhere, let alone get on a bus. The weather was good. It rained frequently but usually in late evening and accompanied by spectacular lightning. Mosquitoes are in evidence and, despite a wall plug device and sprays we were both bitten frequently. Guests attempting to leave the hotel by the main entrance have to run the gauntlet of a persistent group of motorised tricycle (Tuk Tuk) taxi drivers who will resort to any device to have you hire them. In addition, the driver will insist on waiting for you and interfere with your activities. Their constant attentions became oppressive, more so than had we stayed in Bentota or Hikkaduwa where there are more hotels, more activities, thereby more tourists to go around. Beach vendors were a nuisance but were not permitted onto hotel premises. A fellow female guests was accosted on the beach some 200yds from the hotel and robbed of her hat and wrap. This was however an isolated incident and we found the local people welcoming and keen to promote their countries new found stability. Expeditions were possible, 400 yards North along the beach to a fish restaurant shack is worthwhile. I ordered Lobster and drank a local beer whist two young men went out with snorkels and a net to retrieve one. 800yds south along the Galle road, on the left, is the Lucky Lanka Spice Garden and Ayurvidic Centre run by a charming young man. Full body massage for Â£10 and a large selection of herbal potions to buy at â€˜localâ€™ prices. Other worthwhile excursions are a tour of lagoon at Balapitaya (or Bentota) with a visit to one island to see cinnamon being hand rolled by a wonderful old man and his elfin grand daughter. A morningâ€™s snorkelling by Some at International Dive Centre, located at Coral Sands Hotel in Hikkaduwa is good value where there is an excellent parade of fish, including Octopus. The coral was badly damaged in the Tsunami but hopefully showing signs of a return. If Temples and/or elephants are your thing, then there are further trips afield, e.g Kandy, Yala National Park and Burwela Bird Sanctuary. However, from Ahungalla, both entail an expenditure of over Â£110 pp, an overnight stay and between 5-7 hours in a minivan, each way. In summary; great hotel but we chose the wrong location for the type of holiday we enjoy. To get the best from Sri Lanka we would recommend dividing time between the Highlands, forests, wildlife parks and beaches. If however, you want a hotel based beach stay for a few days, you would be pushed to find better. Sri Lanka has great potential, stunning scenery, culture, a vibrant history and the most glorious beaches I have seen.

As architects, and fans of Geoffrey Bawa, my wife and I stayed at this hotel in 1999 and had a great time. For old times sake we spent a night here in December 2009. The hotel has had a refurbishment after the tsunami, and while it is still a great place to visit, I am afraid it does not retain the earlier Bawa magic. The richness of the detailing is not the same, and the room interiors are quite ordinary. But the location, the view from the lobby onto the pool and beach beyond, still makes it a great place to be. There was some confusion at the reception when we arrived, and it took a little time to get a room, but once that was over the service was quite good. Food is good (but not outstanding). Enjoyed my stay, but will probably look for new experiences the next time I am in the region.

I stayed here for 2 days at the end of a long holiday travelling around Sri Lanka. The entrance is stunning and the building can,t fail to impress. I had a lovely room and the service was first class. The hotel has 2 wonderful pools with views of the ocean and there were activities for those needing to get out of the beach chairs. The beach is like much of the west coast, empty and the sea very pough but you could swim with care.

I would like to say having traveled the world a fair bit , this has to be the best service we have ever had. My wife and i were married at this hotel on the 9th Nov 2009 and we were so pleased that we chose it as we were a bit concerned as this was our dream wedding location. It turned out to be fantastic from the accommodation to the staff and especially the attention to detail on our wedding day and throughout our stay. The accommodation was excellent and the rooms were kept immaculate through out our stay. The service from the waiters was excellent as were all the staff they made us feel so special. The facilities were very good , the spa, was fantastic especially after using the well equipped gymnasium. The food was second to none and the variety of food was amazing and extremely well presented. The site seeing was very good, the elephant orphanage is a must as is the visit to the buddist temple. Locally the Turtle hatchery is worth a look as are the stilt fishermen. I would like to say that this holiday was amazing and would 100 percent recommend that if you are thinking about this location and hotel its a must . I believe the reason this holiday was exceptional was the hard work and dedication from all the staff from the manager to the guys who clean the rooms whose ethos is to make our dream holiday come true and they certainly did that . Thank you very much indeed. Gerry and Lesley
I travel alot but in this trip to Ahungalla , i had a perfect time and many good memories .hope to be back there soon.

This is what lazy beach holidays should be all about... Wake, eat, drink, pool, beach..... and that's what is done best at Ahungalla Heritance. The food - especially breakfast was absolutely brill! They also arranged for a dinner on the beach with lobster & the works which was delicious & not expensive. The pools were glorious to just loll about it and for a change, it was nice to walk up the few yards onto the beach without being swamped by vendors trying to make a sale. I guess it was off season so there was nothing much happening at the night club; but I dont think we cared. We enjoyed ourselves thoroughly!

Just returned from a wonderful 2 week stay.We were treated like royalty from start to finish! I cannot fault any aspect of our holiday! Excellent location right on the beautiful,long,sandy beach. Spacious,immaculate suite with all amenities and good sea view. Excellent food in all restaurants and the food and beverage manager personally checked each day to ask if we had any particular requests and made special meals to order! The staff really make this hotel quite special.We found without exception that all staff from gardeners,room staff,reception staff,beach/pool attendants,bar and restaurant staff were very friendly,very efficient and could not do enough to make sure all guests were happy with everything, even though they were often faced with very rude, ill mannered,arrogant and unappreciative guests mainly from outside the UK !! We met the new General Manager who was charming and very keen to maintain and improve the very high standards of this hotel.We hope he can market this hotel to encourage more couples only and less groups and families so that this wonderful hotel can remain the refined place it was designed to be. We look forward to returning to this hotel and seeing more of this lovely country. Thank you Heritance Ahungalla for a lovely holiday experience!

Actually I just come back from Srilanka November 09. I was been 2 days in Colombo,2 days in Kandy and 2 days in Ahungalla I thinks Heritance is the best hotel in srilanka. the stuff and services was good and respectful. very beautiful and colorful yard and a big and enjoyful swimming pool. I think it is deserved to be more than a five star hotel. the caltural show that held every nights in lobby is not good and should be replaced by a more enjoyful program I recommend this hotel and I'm sure that you will happy if you are looking for full servive and relaxation

I have just returned form 10 days at the Heritance with my girlfriend and can honestly say there wasnt any aspect fo the hotel that was disappointing. I work for a top tour operator in england and have travelled around the world staying at many top hotels. The service at the Heritance matched, if not exceeded many of these. The pools were fantastic...clean, great suze and we had one of the two at leat to ourselves on many occasions..it was great!! Below are some further comments: Room - was brilliant. It was a great size, really nicely furnished, clean with a great bathroom. Great views to pool and ocean. Cleaned daily. Food - amazing! we were on ahalf board basis and te food was superb. Great choice, different them every day, fresh, beautiful curries! Service - amazing. The staff were so attentive it was incredible. They were polite and friendly all the time. They alwas say hello and and make a real rapport with you throughout the time we were there. Beach - lovely but you do get hounded a bit by the touts when you walk on it. Just ignore them if you want them to leave you alone. Theyre firendly though. The sea is a bit rough so you cant really swim in it. Touts - if you want to get a taxi just ask one of the touts for a tuk tuk Its so much cheaper than the hotel taxis. We had the same driver for the whole 10 days and he was great. He took us to lots of places cheaply and was a safe driver. Dont be scared to use one..youll probably be a bit nervous the first time you get in one but then you can get their number and as soon as you want to go somewheer give them a call and theyll come and pick you up. Overall..couldnt fault our time at the heritance in any way. Ive read some of the negative reviews on this site and cant really understand what theyre on about. One said this hotel was dated which is complete rubbish! Feel free to email me if you have any questinos or want to know more. Nick

We visited the Heritance Ahungalla in September having arrived on an early morning flight from Singapore. The journey from Colombo to the hotel took about 3 hrs but unlike some previous reports we did not find the" Sri Lankan driving experience" too alarming.On arrival at the hotel the reception staff were delightful and completed the check-in process quickly. Indeed the attitude of reception personnel was reflected throughout the hotel, but of particular note was Mr Arju Vijayarajah really did go the "extra mile" to ensure our stay was comfortable. We stayed in a deluxe room with Ocean view and found the accommodation to be nicely proportioned with a good sized balcony. Also worthy of comment is the food which was well cooked and well presented. Altogether it was peaceful and relaxing experience.

Wow what a place to get married. Beautiful hotel with friendly staff, great rooms, (bathroom needs brightening up a bit) but everything kept very clean. The swimming pools are lovely & pool guys look after you very well. A week wasn't long enough for us to see everything & arrange our wedding so will definately go back and see the friends we made there. we found the food rather good (definately wasn't chips every night) restaurant staff friendly and attentive. My hubby always had his beer chilling in an ice bucket at meal times, this was ready and waiting.... lol. Even the beach sellers were not as bad as we thought....they seem to know everything & are only trying to earn a living. They can't cross over to the hotel and have to stay on the beach as security guards are on duty day & night. The hotel has lovely foiliage in between floors, chipmunks are great & there was monkeys, but didn't get to see them. We both wanted to cry when we had to leave, it's truely a beautiful magical place.
Loved the hotel, beautiful setting, lovely service, good food, good settings, loved the pool

This was the best hotel holiday we have ever had - wife and I and son (21) and daughter (18) really appreciated the genuinely friendly and extraordinarily helpful staff. Food was was great in the main restaurant - no need to go to the exclusive restaurant. We were so impressed that we wrote to thank the manager and copied to our tour operator. We have never felt the desire to do that before! We had stayed at two apparently similar hotels elsewhere in Sri Lanka and these were clean and pleasant, but Heritance was simply in a different league altogether. Reception, restaurant and 'games' staff especially helpful

We stayed beginning of August for 3 nights in the Junior Suite in Heritance Ahungalla. In general, the rooms are clean, the swimming pool is nice, especially for kids and also the beach is great. Unfortunately, like most 5-star hotels in Sri Lanka, also this one lacked essential things like a proper finishing in the room (the bathroom was a desaster, I cut myself several times at the glass door there), a very small TV only etc. The food was good quality, thoug a little expensive, but because we liked it we only ate at the hotel. The breakfast had a wide selection, and there was a big variety at the dinner buffetts, for example "seafood grill night" etc. The service was very poor, anything you wanted to do or to get took ages and did not work properly. On one saturday night there was a wedding with extremely loud music next to the second pool (where all the suites are localed; it was like a disco), and with still going on after 11 oÂ´clock and the kids not being able to sleep I complained several times without success. It went on until 3 in the morning, which literally destroyed our next day and is something no 5-star hotel should accept. Many guests complained, but the management rather preferred to cash in the money for the ceremony instead of satisfiying their guests. Nevertheless we had altogether a good time, the animateurs at the hotel were dedicated and we had a lot of fun with waterpolo and beach volleyball. One last note: as generally in Sri Lankan 5 star hotels, they overprice taxis etc. by 300 to 400%. Just go out of the hotel and rent a taxi or tuc-tuc there, as next to the savings the locals know all the places to go.

The stunning view beach is the only positive memory that we have from our stay. Otherwise the hotel is dated, poorly managed, and many unmaintained facilities. Air conditioning, ceiling fan in our room did not work. The door locks in our room to the bathroom and balcony were broken. Considering that balconies from other rooms are essentially interconnected, there was little or no security from the balcony side of our room. The main restaurant buffet is expensive and of poor cafeteria style food. Very little flair to the food, designed to please those who did not really want to leave home. Entertainment in the lobby at night is essentially Karaoke musicians mouthing CD music. The hotel was built in the 1960s and it seems nothing was done to improve or redecorate the place since it's initial opening. It is a nice visit back to a mid 1960's contemporary architecture that has a seedy ambiance. The staff is friendly and helpful as long as it does not involve complicated activities such as room maintenance, directions to anywhere, or being served coffee in the restaurants. The hotel has no control over the touts in front of the hotel nor at the beach. These touts are of course part of the scenery but makes the guests not want to wander onto the beach since they will not leave visitors alone and will not take no as an answer. It is a sad commentary of Sri Lanka, but the hotel could do more to discourage these parasites.

We booked this hotel for the second part of our holiday by the coast. We were swayed to book this hotel due to the raging reviews on Trip Advisor. Unfortunately it didnâ€™t quite live up to our expectations, especially after leaving the Cinnamon Lodge in Habarana which was advertised to be a lower rating hotel. Our opinions do differ from those on here. The hotel is well known for the architect and so we expected something quite special, as it was also a â€˜5â€™ star resort. On arrival the Loby is attractive as you can see through to a lush swimming pool right onto the sea. The swimming pools were the best bit of this hotel. They are lovely. However, we did find the hotel lacked character and that holiday feel. The architecture was a bit cold and bleak, very concrete, modern and minimalist. Somewhat like a business Hilton hotel which is just not we want on a holiday. The plants around the hotel seemed tired and a bit dead, just outside our room we overlooked a moulding wall where there used to be vegetation climbing up it. The hotel was all very open which was good for a natural breeze, but as soon as the monsoons came this caused a death trap of slippery hallways bars, seat cushions etc. The hotel rooms were nice, again modern but of good quality. The whole place lacked good lighting though. There was also the natural bare plastered look in the hotel bathrooms etc. Not our taste but might appeal to some. I personally like a bright lick of paint or something it bit more luxurious. The hotel did have good facilities if you wanted tennis, ping pong, badminton, spaâ€™s etc. However going onto the beach was slightly annoying due to the persistent locals selling on the beach who would sit on the beach facing the hotel shouting at you to come and look as they will â€œgive you good priceâ€. This is a little off putting but I understand itâ€™s just the way there. We never managed to go onto the beach without having to say no thanks to several different people. The restaurants and entertainment were the biggest disappointment. The food was always nice (wine expensive) but the restaurants lacked atmosphere. The main restaurant had set menus for most of our stay and these were quite pricey. The buffets in that restaurant were a bit better as at least you got more choice. But the restaurant is dark and dreary. No ambience. The a la carte â€œCafeâ€? did have nice food but a bit limited on choice. You also donâ€™t expect to have your a la carte meal in a cafe which lacked again any sort of luxury and really had the ambience slightly above that of a McDonalds. (I am being slightly harsh). The entertainment at the hotel was pretty poor. Sometimes there was a band singing the same songs every night. A cocktail promotion (doesnâ€™t mean itâ€™s a price promotion) with live demonstration. Or simply someone plays an instrument. It was very quiet during our stay so maybe they do more in the main season. We actually spent many of our nights at the Taj hotel in Bentota after this was recommended to us by fellow guests in the same boat as us. I suggest you go there just to get a comparison of what a 5 star hotel should really be like. We had a Chinese in the restaurant there and it was lovely. There buffet meals also had a great deal more ambience. Just grab a tuk tuk to get there. The Refresh restaurant 20 mins away in Hikkaduwa was also lovely. I recommend you stay in Bentota though if you want choice and to be able to walk out the hotel to more restuarants. There is nothing near the Heritance. Having said all that, if you want a quiet, clean relaxing hotel to just unwind sit by the pool and have early nights then itâ€™s a great option. If you are lucky you will see some black monkeys around the hotel. We did get this hotel at a good price so we canâ€™t complain I just believe the ratings on here are misleading. This is not to discredit the staff at the Heritance who were mostly all very helpful and nice people.

We were lured to the Heritance by a ridiculously affordable package deal on Sri Lankan Airways, and I was very pleasantly surprised by the accommodations. Though I wouldn't quite call it 5-star, the place is beautiful and certainly afforded a very relaxing holiday. The one thing that came as a not so pleasant surprise was the cost of food and beverages, which were outrageous.
