On the beach local merchants, but we found common ground with them, they showed us turtles who went out to lay eggs on the beach , local animals) Went on excursions with local guide Janit +94707219723 (wrote in advance of the trip , chose dates and individual excursion for 2 days in the center of the island , paid in advance upon arrival ) were very pleased , he found a great minibus , speaks Russian , everything was perfectly timed where you could not pass , put us on a tuk tuki , took super photos , all entrances and tickets included in the price . And at the price of course much more profitable than in hotels and on the spot booking. Took so tuks outside the hotel went swimming with turtles and to the beach in bentota (there surfed ), many speak Russian

Nice hotel with wonderful staff. I have never seen such friendly, kind and sympathetic communication in any country. Jayaru has captured my heart in general, she has always helped with everything. Now, on the turf, everything's fine, I can't even find the downside. We lived in the far wing and we were very quiet. Only black monkeys culturally disturbed our peace twice in 10 days ğŸ˜… the warblers behaved modestly and the chipmunks ran merrily around the grounds. The food is also delicious, shrimp, squid, chicken, fish (except beef, here it is best not to take it :))), the fruit has always been in large quantities. Ice cream ğŸ‘ Rooms are cleaned well and always smell nice after cleaning.

Vacationing with your son at this hotel in November. Really enjoyed your holiday! The hotel is wonderful! Very beautiful, clean, cozy territory. Lots of vegetation, cute, funny and harmless animals and birds that constantly delight the look! A separate delight from the monkey family!ğŸ«¶ğŸ˜Š The hotel staff is very friendly, attentive!ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ The food is varied, delicious.The room is spacious, with a large balcony and beautiful views of the ocean and the hotel grounds! Comfortable bed! Huge, beautiful beach! Took a tour of the island through an individual guide Janita(+94 70 721 9723). Janit himself was unable to accompany us for health reasons, but found a worthy replacement. Our excursion took place at the appointed time, day, all taking into account our wishes , in a comfortable car!Swept everything that was planned, received a lot of positive emotions and new information!!! Thanks guys!!! All in all, the rest was great! I want to get back to this wonderful island!

The hotel is a little paradise! The room large and clean with a small balcony from which you could watch the monkeys on the tree opposite. The second, quieter pool with pleasantly warm water and a beautiful green area around it was very welcoming. The food was very varied. We were most pleased that there were so many typical dishes. Special thanks to Jayaru who helped us all the time. But everyone else at the staff was very friendly and always had a smile on their face. The Gala Dinner on New Year's Eve was a mega event!

In general: Architecturally very generously designed hotel complex with beautiful green areas directly on the Indian Ocean. The hotel definitely stands out from other hotels due to the friendliness and exceptional service of the staff. Thanks for letting me be part of the Heritance family for three weeks. I will definitely come back. Rooms: The rooms are larger than average and have a kettle and refrigerator in addition to the general standard. Recommended is the â€œlaundry serviceâ€, fast, clean and inexpensive. The housekeeping was good, thanks for the towel animals or flowers on my bed. In the evening the bed was revealed, the curtains were closed and if necessary the towels were changed again. Restaurant/Bars: In the restaurant, the high level of service is noticeable. You are led to a table set with cloth napkins and bread plates at each meal. Light background music underlines the atmosphere. Thank you Duminda, the good soul of the restaurant, and thank you Jananja for the always professional service. The offer as well as the quality of the food were above average and prepared with a lot of attention to detail. Extra wishes were also gladly fulfilled. Thanks for that, Kavindu. I was lucky enough to be able to take part in the gigantic buffets on Christmas and New Year's Eve. Chapeau Keshan!!! Service: The absolute plus of the hotel is the leadership and exceptional service of the staff. You always feel welcome as a guest. Staff are always friendly. As a solo traveler, I never felt lonely, but rather as part of the hotel family. Danke an Jayaru, Guest Relations Executive. She's helped me with some of my affairs. I'm really looking forward to seeing you again. Location/surroundings. Directly in front of the hotel entrance you can take public transport or tuk tuk to the surrounding towns. Excursions I booked through Sunil. You can find him on the beach. He speaks good German and is very reliable.

Wonderful hotel, service and service at a premium, friendly and responsive staff. There was a great room, the kitchen in the restaurant is varied and for every taste. I want to thank all the staff and celebrate the girl from Jayaru reception - competent, sympathetic, always prompt and help. Happy New Year... the organization was at the top. Unequivocally, I recommend you to leave the most positive impressions of rest and stay!

The structure is beautiful, especially for the location. The common areas are from 5-star hotels, even the breakfast buffet and restaurant, international cuisine where you can find just about everything! A note for coffee / tea for breakfast that is unfortunately not buffet style and you have to wait for it to be served, often without a teaspoon... The rooms should be modernized, they remained in the 80s/90s of dark wood. In the three-bed room the third bed should be a real bed in a 5-star hotel, not a folding bed with uncomfortable mattress. Also because the third person, if he is not a child, is still paying in all respects. The staff is very kind and helpful to any request, a special thanks to Dasuni ğŸ˜€

The worst hotel. I do not recommend his visit to anyone ğŸ¤¦ğŸ»â€â€™ï¸ Cheating and spinning accounts. Without a statement, 20% tax is included. Why???? The manager has no plans to deal with the problems adequately, instead of explaining or at least apologizing for the negative situation , and due to the incompetence of the workers, yelling at the guests The worst hotel ever. Dirty towels, bathrobes. Old interior

At the Heritance Ahungalla you will be offered everything you want from a perfect holiday. I can only confirm the other 5 star reviews. In addition, this hotel is a good base for many interesting getaways in Sri Lanka. A great tour guide is Sunil. Please ask for Sunil on the beach. He's honest, speaks perfect German, not a vampire.

I'm in a hotel right now. Today is the fifth day. The staff are very friendly and always available to help. They communicate in English. If there's a misunderstanding, Google gets the translator. The room is cleaned perfectly every day. Save some for a tip and it'll be nice to get back to your room. The area is large, green, running chipmunks ğŸ¿ï¸ and with luck , you can meet a waran. I'm lucky. It's delicious and varied. The ocean is turbulent, swimming is impossible, but breathing sea air and wetting feet is a must. Special thanks to sun fun guide Anjan. A very responsible, decent man.

We rested a couple from 23.11 to 02.12, we're going home today while we wait for the bus to write a review. The hotel recommends, do not expect the delights of cuisine as in Turkey all inclusive, but always fresh. Seafood was oysters, crab, shrimp, squid. Diverse cuisine with local flavor, you won't stay hungry, sharp but delicious. Desserts are delicious. Good responsive staff who try their best to make the holiday memorable. Particular mention should be made of the manager of Kavindu and the specialist in the work with guests Jayaru, all the issues that arose were solved quickly and with quality. Thank you very much to everyone else as well, very well done, so keep going! It's great! Before you go, I recommend reading about Sri Lanka, its way of life and customs, the service is underdeveloped, but try very hard. Come, relax, admire the ocean and the wonderful nature, pay no attention or pick on the little things, do not compare your holidays here with other countries and you will be satisfied.

In some places would need to be renovated in the area of the bathroom. Pool area. Staff are friendly. At checkout at noon, the all-inclusive is cancelled. If you are picked up at night . Bad luck, we were offered a lynx package, which I had declined. Even then alone I would have given inadequately.

great hotel!!! staff is very polite and the grounds are very beautiful ) live music in the bar, fed very delicious, we really enjoyed it. many different activities in the hotel,the exit leads directly to the ocean. Generally very nice hotel , we liked)

Very happy with the hotel! Diverse, delicious food, attentive, responsive staff! I saw the splinters in the reviews the opinion that the interior is "tired" - it seems there was a renovation, as in general the hotel is neat, well maintained! Perfect location - the ocean is fascinating! Yes, there are local vendors on the beach, dogs, drive to the hotel 3 hours from the airport - but! It's so small compared to the ocean experience and the pleasure of the hotel! In the evening, a varied program - more often live music!

Were there a family of four at this hotel. We booked two rooms with two people each. Since Mom had a birthday during our stay, the hotel proactively upgraded the parents' room. Instead of garden views, they had views of the main pool and the ocean. The hotel is quite remote from Colombo Airport, so it takes about 2.5 hours to get there. The location is picturesque, the area is vast. The garden is closely watched, as is the whole area. During our stay, we were gracious to the swift chipmunks, the birds of paradise, slightly afraid of the varan. No monkeys have been seen. I've even had some disappointment about it, but it's a joke. We were delighted by the abundance of dishes and all sorts of options for dinner. Fish are presented in different variations. Squid, shrimp, tuna and whitefish sashimi, crab claws and even oysters have occurred. Desserts were a particular delight. They differed from the typical desserts often seen in hotels on the buffet table. All kinds of cakes - biscuit and mousse, donuts, cookies, desserts in jars - in general, for all tastes and colors. Each breakfast has a wide range of delicious pastries and breads. Croissants are just a song. Juicy ripe fruit (especially pineapples, papayas and mini bananas, fresh greens. It's hard to stay hungry. Kitchen's an A. Cleaned up every day and did it well. If you leave a small tip, every day you will be greeted in your room by a funny arrangement of towels. Toothpaste is best taken with you, as there is not much in the set. The hotel has a gym. It's not big, the machines aren't the most modern, but there are treadmills. Among the holidaymakers are numerous represented Russians, Germans, French, Italians, Chinese. The environment is calm, not particularly noisy - good for family holidays. There is no separate animation for children as such. There was live music in the lobby every night. If you leave the hotel and walk 300 meters to the left, you can buy something from a small supermarket. Turn right - 200 meters and there's an alcohol store. Keep in mind that the price tags aren't there, so you should be brave enough to lower the price. We have determined that there is an overstatement of about Rs. 1,100-1,600 from the market value. What killed me was the constant obsessive attention and escort from the beach to the fights (from the ocean side) and the tuk-tuks as I left the hotel. Well, I'm not used to it. It's like you're being followed by paparazzi. On the ocean, he can stand with you, talk, and you can want to sit alone and see the ocean. Oh, yes, there were always waves. The difference was strength and height. But the water is warm! We fought the elements bravely. When leaving the hotel, there are individuals among the local mafia who will follow you all the way. No reason. One followed us to the store, waited for us to leave, tried to talk and drove us back to the hotel. Also, when we were buying alcohol, another comrade came with us. We took it the salesman was unbuttoning something, so we came. It kind of pissed me off. We told them to leave us alone, but it's not working. The hotel is the only point of attraction in this settlement. Apparently, this is where they expect to make money. White people are a bag of millions. But these are minor nuances that did not mar the overall positive impression. Just be prepared. The hotel our whole family recommends.

Very great hotel, me great food..highly recommended!The only downer was that the postcards that were dropped off in the hotel's own shop did not arrive. You can buy tickets there,but no stamps to it.I was then told in the shop that n. Paying the postage costs the cards are sent...unfortunately I think that's just a ploy to earn extra money .So don't fall for it too!

Great hotel. Service is high. The staff is friendly. You are greeted with sweets and freshly squeezed juices upon arrival. Clean rooms, clean grounds, clean beach. The food is delicious and varied. Warm ocean. There are monkeys running on the property.

The hotel at 5* doesn't pull at all. It needs a good repair. Rooms are good, cleaning is good. But there are nuances like a broken kettle, the doors to the balcony don't close. Strange scenery on the walls. The linens are not exactly white. There are two pools. Beautiful ocean view. People are kind, sympathetic. The food isn't very varied. A lot of it's spicy, the beef's really tough. Delicious pineapple and papaya. There was no fish variety. Amateur salads. Ice cream liked it. They gave oysters once. The shrimp is delicious. The restaurant's not big. Wifi is weak. There are no TV channels in Russian. For all the faults, you can rest here well. In food find your own, the population is very positive and simple, nature is beautiful. Just whoever is coming here will tune in to another level of service ğŸ˜Š Special thanks to the hotel, for your help and special attention to us!!! Not the hotel's indifference to tourists and quick response to the issue, for that thank you so much! Thank you very much to the staff! We wish the hotel prosperity and development!

Manicured area, wide sandy beach. Very comfortable rooms, large comfortable beds, bathrobes, slippers - everything, great food, wonderful service - the staff is very attentive! Nice bar and cocktails. In the evenings the hotel is not boring)

Sri Lanka is my love! Family vacation hotel. Ocean fire, pools of pure water. The rooms are super, cleaned every day. Service at the highest level. The food is varied and delicious, but peculiar. Live music every night. Jayaru is very friendly and polite at reception. She speaks Russian and understands us Russian.

The hotel is nice but the most happy thing was our friend who used to give us gifts every day. Very good staff attitude, lots of all kinds of presentations for all inclusive. We've had a good rest in this place and we'll be back sometime.

How and where should I start!? We were on Sri Lanka for the first time. the country the island, a green paradise. The hotel was paradise, all wishes were fulfilled. The food that was available to you all day was a force. The pools and gardens were well maintained and the rooms were restored to order 100% daily by angel hands. The staff really knows how to sweeten the stay. All in all, 150% recommended!!!!

The hotel is nice, especiallywm in a quiet location. Rooms are nice and always very clean. Many thanks to everyone here, whether nursery, roomboys, poolboys, ladies from the spa or the many staff! You always have a smile for your guests, that's what I wish for in Germany! The only thing I could complain about is no make-up mirror in the bathroom and too many mixing at the bar,as every drink tastes different,although it should be the same.why can't 2 solid bar mixers always mix to make it the same. You also make a lot of effort to create a nice ambience on the beach, with bar, dinner and fire, but unfortunately, there is no rush to go as you have to pay for it. They'd rather sit at the AI Bar. Maybe you should make it free to make the effort worthwhile. One more note, please play other songs. We have now 14 days always heard the same songs every night!!

Were at this hotel from October 30 to November 9. Traveling with Anex, very lucky to have a hotel representative - Nina. Thank her very much! The hotel is wonderful, the staff is very friendly and responsive. Every day there are different activities: aqua aerobics, volleyball, yoga, etc. In the evenings live music. The food is delicious and varied. Every day there are fish, seafood, fruit (watermelons, bananas, pineapples, etc.) The hotel is on the first line, but since it is an ocean, there is always a wave and a green flag.

We've had nine nights off since November 1. The weather was happy, the ocean is warming!! The hotel is quiet and peaceful. Not party!! The food is good, there's always choice, and spicy and ordinary food. All in all, clean, cozy, but didn't notice much chic either. Staff are polite and considerate, everyone smiles all the time!)

Been alone with his wife for two weeks. Overall, the impression is good. The hotel is large, the food is quality, but you have to get used to it, the staff is smiley, the linen is clean and fresh, the towels are changed frequently and everything is very neat. Cleaning is quick and thorough. Beach loungers with mattresses and clean towels give out every morning. The local population is a little obsessive, but staff and security are not allowed in. The beach is large and clean although sometimes there are difficulties entering the water because you must not forget that it is the ocean, high waves. The holiday was brightened by a local boy, Nalim, a very responsible and pleasant young man. It offers tourist activity by the hotel on the beach. Accompanied us throughout our 13 days of rest. On the first day they told him about our holiday wishes and he planned everything and arranged all transfers, be it travel in a comfortable car or local travel by knock knock. Organised quality trips to local attractions for which he is very grateful. Every day I enjoyed coconuts and a good mood.

Heritance Ahungalla offers a fantastic experience with excellent service and luxurious facilities. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are spacious and clean, and the food is really top notch. The pool is beautiful, and the restaurant offers delicious, varied cuisine. Perfect for those looking for relaxation and luxury!

We encountered very friendly and attentive staff during our stay. The hallways, pool's and rooms were always very clean. Room service did a meticulous job and delighted us daily with new funny towel figures. The large pools were cleaned daily and were always clean even without chlorine. Unfortunately, during our stay, due to the strong surf, we could not use the hotel's own beach. The staff will provide friendly and authentic information on all questions. The beautiful country and the warmth of the Sinhalese will remain in our fond memories for a long time to come. Claudia, Tessa and Olaf

The hotel is located directly on the beach and offers all the amenities you wish for. Particularly noteworthy is the friendliness of the entire staff . The food was rich and varied. No matter what meal we had, we were always more than full. We all booked our excursions with Sunil and also spent with him. He speaks good German and tries to fulfill all the wishes of the guests. Just ask the locals about him on the beach - definitely worth it.

14 days spent in a beautiful country, in a hotel that is absolutely typical of the country. No luxury, but Clean u the friendliest staff you can imagine ğŸ’ I was traveling alone u never had to be afraid at any time. At least not in the hotel... Once I tried to go across the street to a kiosk, this should not be done alone! At least not as a woman ğŸ«£ Unfortunately, it is not common in the hotel to sit outside on a terrace at meals. After a friendly request to the staff, however, this was made possible! We (I had met a married couple) had a table outside every morning and night. A very special thanks, goes here to Navidu ğŸ™ My room was not the newest but always tip top clean ğŸ§½ğŸ‘ŒğŸ¤© Thanks to RukmalğŸ™ Suggestions for improvement... The food is unfortunately usually only lukewarm... Again, after two days you have got used to it, it is just different from Europe. All around one of my most beautiful places I have visited, I will definitely come back.

Highly recommended. Very friendly, warm and courteous staff. Greetings to Chamuditha and Manduranga. You have enriched our vacation. Great beach location and two large pools with ample space. Great choice at every meal with delicious food. Rooms are clean and very spacious. Delicious cocktails at the pool bar to take full advantage of the all inclusive package:) All in all a very nice place, we will gladly come back.

We enjoyed a welcome drink after arrival until it was time to check in, had lunch and then checked in at 2pm. I am very comfortable with the room being upgraded. Samka, a tour company introduced by the hotel, took us to the finish line and picked us up from the airport. He was a very nice person and I asked him to drop us off and pick us up safely. full board During my stay, I ate breakfast, lunch and dinner at the hotel buffet and many staff members such as Nuwan cared about me and I enjoyed eating too. If you ask for something, it will come out very slowly, so you should ask for anything early, because it will be Sri Lanka time.

We spent 17 days at this hotel. The extraordinarily lovable helpful staff made our stay very embellished. We would particularly like to thank Executive Sous Chef Lakmal Chathuranga and Pastry Chef Cavinda Heshan and team for the excellent cuisine. The bar manager Kalinga Jayasekava and his team have always cared for the guests lovingly. The room cleaning and facilities were very good. Trilishiya received us warmly at the hotel and always had an open ear with concerns.

Overnight on tour. They said it was five stars, but there was no toothbrush or slippers. Shampoo is contained in a ceramic container, making it difficult to use. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, the location is great! The food buffet is not so different from other hotels. The staff are kind. Finally, after I went on a hotel tour, they took my phone away from me because it was a survey. I logged into Google without permission and the hotel staff ticked all the good ratings. The receptionist female staff had asked us to only include comments, but the male staff were surprised when they closed the box and returned without comment after checking all the good boxes. It was an incident that made me think you didn't know what you were doing or you were mocking me.

An excellent hotel for relaxation, family, reboot. Beautiful views, green area, 2 clean swimming pools, sun loungers. Friendly, smiling staff. Even if you donâ€™t understand English, they will translate, help, and advise. Your request will not go unnoticed. Thank you very much to the administrator Dulaj - a kind, sympathetic guy who resolved all organizational issues regarding accommodation throughout the entire vacation. Excellent restaurant, the food is varied and tasty, there is always fresh fruit. The waiters are caring and attentive. No swimming on the beach - big waves. But it is possible to use tuk tuk services, which are located next to the hotel, to get to the nearest lagoon. We accidentally met Ira, who speaks Russian. He took us for a ride along the nearby coast, showed us lagoons, a beach with turtles, interesting shops where you can buy jewelry, textiles, spices, tea. It turned out to be a good mini excursion. We exchanged phone numbers, wrote in advance when and where needed, and he drove up to the hotel. If you decide to take a ride in a tuk tuk, you won't regret calling one. Iâ€™ll leave the number, maybe someone will find it useful +94 77 664 1538. In the evening there is live music, there were fire performances and national dances. At 23:00 everything stops and you can go to bed. Everything here is amazing - colorful nature, Buddha statues, wildlife, differently organized traffic, crazy buses, water flushing counterclockwise :)

A wonderful hotel for a family holiday! Itâ€™s very safe with a child) delicious food, clean and comfortable rooms, clean pool, well-groomed beach by the ocean, incredibly nice staff!!!! It was a great 10 days!!! We will definitely come back again and again!)

Another lovely holiday. The room with a sea view is highly recommended. The beds are unique and a good night's sleep is guaranteed. The food in the coffee shop is very good and fresh. The pool is unique with a view of the sea. Unfortunately the music at the bar in the evening was very loud, a little quieter would have been more pleasant. All the staff are very friendly and they have once again contributed to an unforgettable holiday. Thank you very much for that. Api obava naevata dann balaporuttu venavata.

The hotel was booked by Russians, the young generation behaved suspiciously, the employees have an internal tipping mafia, in September you can't swim in the sea, it's impossible to walk out of the hotel - you'll be harassed by the locals, excursions are expensive and the tour guide takes the customer to shops that rip you off, I don't understand why some people go on holiday there three times

We felt totally at home from the first minute. Warm welcome, our rooms were ready shortly after we arrived (early). We had a spacious and very nice room. The pools were clean, one pool was shallower and more suitable for children and the other was more for those who like peace and quiet. Unfortunately the waves were very strong and you could only go into the sea to a limited extent. The beach is a dream! The food was always delicious and varied. All the staff were nice and always in a good mood. The hotel is very suitable for children! The spa area is also very nicely decorated and highly recommended, the girls do a great job. We'll be back! Ayubowan

Wonderful hotel! Excellent cuisine, lots of fruit, breakfast is quite standard and tasty, dinner is great, something new every time!! The rooms are very clean, cleaned every day, every day we were greeted from the beach by various figures - thanks to Rukmal!) The beach area is wide, the beach itself is clean, the sunset is long, but just right for big waves)

Good hotel. No frills, like most hotels in Sri Lanka, but here we must take into account the general situation with hotels on the island. Beautiful in architecture, green, safe, the staff tries very hard to make guests feel comfortable. For guides for individual excursions with a good car, I recommend Janita (+94 70 721 9723)

The hotel is very tired. Everything in my room worked, but everything was a little shabby and shabby - both the furniture and the plumbing. And even the ponds with lotuses and carp behind the hotel - if they were at least cleaned, it would be a completely different feeling. The food is beyond praise. There wasnâ€™t much to eat around anyway, but in the hotel - if you take national cuisine - huge portions and very tasty. The staff tries to solve your problems, but not quickly. The cleaning is lousy, whether you leave a tip or not, it doesnâ€™t affect the amount of sand on the floor. The hotel always had free sun loungers, which the staff will put where you need them upon request. There are a lot of different animals on the territory - monitor lizards, palm squirrels, funny birds. And also a skinny cat and two very cute dogs (the latter, however, were chased by the staff). Monkeys walk on the roofs, but they are also chased, it is not so easy to see them. The beach is public, but given the location it is mostly deserted. At the exit from the hotel to the beach there are annoying merchants, and you feel like you are alone on the coast. The entrance to the water is perfect fine sand. There were always waves, occasionally strong, so not everyone could swim. There are nuances, but overall itâ€™s a good hotel, although of course it barely reaches 4.

We vacationed with friends from 02/12/24 to 02/19/2024. The hotel is super, I donâ€™t know who writes angry reviews. You need to understand that this is Asia. The hotel is very clean, they cleaned and changed towels every day. There are only 2 bars, one is always empty, unfortunately, the second bar always has delicious cocktails and beer (beer is so-so, like lemonade), but whiskey and cola is super. The waiters are very attentive; in general, Sri Lankans themselves are very kind. When it comes to food, you wonâ€™t be left hungry; be sure to try the oysters, incredibly tasty. There are many Russians, 70-80 percent, the rest are Europeans, but everyone is very cultured, no one bothers anyone. There was a lot of security; once I was going to the beach to visit friends at night, the security escorted me to make sure I was not alone. The ocean is gentle, the waves are just super, I donâ€™t know who needs a lagoon, the ocean without waves is a lakeğŸ˜ on excursions: here they are trying to deceive our brother everywhere. Valuables just speak from their heads. We went to Kandy with Kamal, Iâ€™ve attached the number. He speaks Russian and charged us for an individual session, less than what we were charged for a group session. +940776085334. Lobster at the hotel was expensive. He even offered to buy it and fry it for free in a cafe from his friends.

Good afternoon. Iâ€™m not a fan of leaving reviews and, in principle, too lazy to do this, however, after certain nuances, I still decided to write. I have been vacationing with my wife since the beginning of August in this hotel through the tour operator Anex Tour. After reading positive reviews and looking at beautiful photos on booking, we decided to go to this hotel without hesitation, it didnâ€™t even bother us that it was not the season and that there were big waves on the side where the hotel is located at that time. In general, I'll start with the positives. Namely: the hotel is located among palm trees and many trees on which small chipmunks jump and beautiful birds fly, the beach is very large and wide, the length is about 3.5 km, but it is cleaned only directly in front of the hotel in the morning from among local vigilantes. which are photographed by a local police officer upon completion of work. The 5-star Heritance Hotel has: 2 swimming pools, one small gym, restaurant, one bar. That's basically all the advantages.) I donâ€™t want to be a boring person in your eyes, so that you donâ€™t think: â€œWell, there are people who always donâ€™t like something.â€ Because I thought so myself when I read several similar reviews before buying the tour. Arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by girls with white smiles. I was very pleased with the positive mood of the staff, always smiling. Always. But, as it turned out, from fulfilling my professional tasks of maintaining a comfortable client accommodation, this was the only well-developed skill. Simply put, in addition to the fact that the hotel is over 60 years old, its technical condition leaves much to be desired. Apart from the smell of â€œgrandmotherâ€™s sofa in the country,â€ no one plans to refresh the hotel and monitor its cleanliness, order in the premises, rooms, glass washing and sanitary disinfection! On the first day we arrived and entered the room, I noticed that the drain in the shower was clogged and the flush in the toilet did not work well enough to fulfill its function. Going down to the restaurant, I am not a squeamish and meticulous person, I was not pleasantly surprised that the tables were simply sticky, like in a dumpling shop! The window glass is incredibly dirty and there are flies flying around the room and landing on your plate. My wife cried when she saw it all... she was in a terrible mood. Not once, not once during all the time were there paper napkins on the table. pepper shakers and salt shakers were very rarely found on tables. But what struck me and other visitors from Europe most of all was that 95% of the dishes were incredibly spicy! A couple of days before departure, I couldnâ€™t resist and asked to see salads and hot dishes without â€œcurryâ€ and â€œblack pepperâ€. I would NEVER call the restaurant a restaurant. They greet you beautifully, open the doors, smile, BUT the food and service are below par! After eating, you need to wait until the receipt is closed, and sign the zero receipt, indicating that you do not owe any money for the drinks. Yes, yes, even if you have â€œall inclusiveâ€, even if you drank cola or local arak is free. The check takes a very long time. I left a lot of tips, but they still donâ€™t want to work. On the opposite side of the so-called â€œrestaurantâ€ with flies, sticky tables, dirty glass, there is a bar. Where can you buy alcohol, fries and a burger. Most of the time we ate there, there is no spicy food at all! The all-inclusive option includes the above items and local alcoholic drinks. Everything else is paid. He works a couple of hours before lunch and an hour after for cooking. By the way, after 24.00 it is impossible to drink cola, whiskey or smoke a pack of cigarettes. Everything in the hotel is closed. Outside the hotel, shops are closed after zero hours. For leisure, near the bar with paid drinks there is an area where a local musician plays until 23.00. Near the exit to the ocean, local traders and beggars are constantly on duty. Security guards do not allow them into the territory, but they watch you through a mesh fence when you go swimming at the beach. It looks funny, because you are 7-10 meters away on the sun loungers by the pool towards the ocean, you see them, and they look at you) they look at you, and you look at them) like in a zoo, itâ€™s not clear just who the animal is. The staff is very very lazy, no matter what anyone writes that they are trying. It is not true. While you give me a tip, they pretend. Sooo slow, very, very slow. And, of course, I couldnâ€™t help but pay attention to the staffâ€™s manicure and pedicure; this is a separate topic. There was a great desire to give nail scissors. My appeal and review was sent not to criticize, but so that the management would take note and work on the mistakes. Because if you oppose yourself as 5 stars, then correspond, be so kind! But the bosses only taught me to smile and bow. P.S. On the day of departure, our flight was postponed several times. From early morning the hotel staff saw us sitting and waiting for our bus, but at 12.00 when we handed over our bracelets, we became a different kind of people. At 12.10, the wife asked the hostess for 2 free bottles of water to take with her to the airport, which they usually bring to the room, to which she replied with a smile: â€œand now itâ€™s paid!â€ I was so amazed that I thought it was a joke, since I only didnâ€™t tip chipmunks. In general, thanks to the ocean and the cool chipmunks, they did not disappoint us.

Great hotel, polite staff, convenient location. Pleasant and warm sea within walking distance. The cleaner in the room was very attentive and always listened to our wishes and brought everything we asked for. During our vacation we saw monkeys, monitor lizards, many birds, squirrels and chipmunks, and all this without leaving the hotel

Hello . The hotel left a mixed impression, we stayed here from 02/03/24 to 02/12/24 Ocean 5+ (if you are afraid of waves like me, then 35 minutes along the beach and you are in a dream lagoon without waves) Kitchen 5+ Live music every evening 5+ The restaurant also has music for weekend dinners 5+ Cleaning 5+ cleaner Rukmal best every day did really masterpieces! Pool 5+, service 5+, atmosphere 5+ the hotel is really very good, the monkeys running on the balconies are just super. The worst ROOM ğŸ¤¦â€â™€ï¸ 1+ or 2+ I think you canâ€™t move into such rooms by any means. I'll attach a photo. Everything is falling apart, electrical wires are sticking out, the socket is barely there, everything is old and terrible, number 230 is terrible ğŸ¤¦ â™€ï¸ A 3 star hostel is better. We tried not to make the room creepy ğŸ¤ª Take the better room category and you will be happy ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼

All liked it ! We rested for 10 days from 01/30/24 We took breakfast, but itâ€™s better to take it with dinner, because there are 1-2 restaurants within walking distance. We always had dinner at a restaurant on the beach (right: white villa). The average price for a dish is 2500 rupees. Delicious, large portions The advantages of the hotel: Beautiful pool The ocean always has waves, but you can swim Breakfast is good, there is a lot to choose from They clean the room and change towels every day There are monitor lizards and monkeys on the territory Of the minuses: The reception itself is not very friendly and customer-oriented The location of the hotel is both a plus and a minus, everything is very quiet and clean, but there is nothing nearby. You need to take a bus / tuk tuk / taxi to Hikkaduwa (20 minutes) / to Bentota (20 minutes) One liquor store nearby, prices higher than in Hikkaduwa.

We spent a pleasant holiday as a family with a one-year-old baby. Service and attention at a high level. The hotel staff pays attention to every guest, especially the little ones. For kids, you can ask for special food: they prepared vegetables and crushed potatoes for us. The menu is very varied: meat, fish, fried, grilled, boiled seafood; local food, European food - for every taste and spiciness. Many thanks to supervisor Chamuditha - an attentive manager who helped organize special meals for the baby and in general feel very comfortable and surrounded by care ğŸ˜Š The hotel area is small, neatly decorated and filled with different animals: monkeys, monitor lizards, chipmunks, birds - itâ€™s interesting to watch them. There are 2 swimming pools on the territory - one is noisier and one is quieter. The rooms are a bit old, but clean. Every day they clean and change towels. Overall nice. The ocean is not calm - but the best thing is to ride the waves - they are not bigger and not small. There was never a calm ocean during our stay; you only need to drive about 10 minutes to the nearest bay if you want to swim. They organize excursions to suit every taste, but the main attractions are a bit far away. Hotel guests are mainly from Europe and Kazakhstan. Cool place for a relaxing family holiday ğŸ”¥

The hotel was built in the early 1980s in the Sri Lankan style. Helpful and nice service, trouble-free contact in English. Rooms clean and spacious. A good base for trips to the most important attractions of the region. The swimming pool is clean and well-kept. No problems with sunbeds in January/February. There is a wide beach next to the hotel with a flat entrance to the ocean. I would highly recommend!

The hotel is terrible!!! How can you like the ruined rooms, old dirty towels, sun loungers that are falling apart!!! The service is terrible, they try to cheat at every step!!!! At the bar we ordered Black rum Bacardi, they brought it local for the price of Bacardi and also included service for what????????? Because they tried to sell local alcohol at the price of imported alcohol!!!! They also added 18% tax to the price indicated in the price list. It's not worth the money, it won't spoil your holiday by staying in this hotel!!!!

We have been to some places in Italy, Greece, Spainâ€¦ But this placeâ€¦ we fell in love. The best food, the best staff. Especially Mr. Chamuditha!!! Professional, clean, nice. Full help! Time slows down here and your heart burns. I definitely love this place and the people here. 11/10.

I had a great holiday with my parents at Heritance Ahungalla. This hotel was built by the famous architect G.Bawa and it has its own unique charm and charm. It is ideal for a relaxing holiday; for those who go on vacation to swim, enjoy nature, and read books. Beach: amazingly beautiful beach with sand as soft as flour. It was very fun to jump on the waves in the Indian Ocean. You must understand that almost all beaches in Sri Lanka are municipal, so they are not equipped, and local residents will approach you to offer excursions, etc. but they are friendly and not particularly pestering. The beach is clean and the lack of infrastructure in the form of sun loungers makes it worse. Pools: The hotel has two very large and beautiful swimming pools. The weather and water temperature allow you not to get out of them at all. There are plenty of sun loungers by the pool and in the garden. There's always room. Room: we lived in room 303, a very large, beautiful room, there was a shower and a bathroom. Everything in the room works. The furniture is beautiful. Upon check-in, I received a compliment from the hotel - fruits and sweets. Cleanliness: everything is very clean, the room is cleaned every day. I liked the towel elephant (pictured) Animation: every evening there was live music or a show in the bar. I really enjoyed the fire show and the traditional Sri Lankan dance show. There is not much animation during the day Language: I speak English fluently, so I could easily communicate with the staff. For those who donâ€™t know English at all, it may be a little difficult, since few people speak Russian. Food: delicious and varied food. There is Indian and local food (spicy), as well as European options - grilled chicken, pork, etc. There is fish and seafood - crabs, shrimp, squid, etc. The only note is this: my parents and I mostly like to drink wine. Here it is served only for lunch and dinner (in unlimited quantities). The rest of the time, beer, cocktails and strong alcohol are available at the bar. Location: There is practically nothing within walking distance from the hotel. But we didnâ€™t want to go anywhere. The weather was gorgeous and we enjoyed swimming all day long. I recommend going on the Bentota River Safari. It's a 30-minute tuk-tuk ride from the hotel, and the excursion itself lasts 2 hours by boat. Very beautiful mangroves, small crocodiles, monkeys, various birds. The excursion was organized for us by Nimal, whom we met on the beach. Honest and polite guide. I can confidently recommend him. His number is +94779118912. Territory: the territory is very beautiful and well-groomed. I really liked the lotuses. A whole family of cool monkeys live here, and we also saw an iguana, a lot of chipmunks and beautiful birds.

Super friendly staff who were always accommodating and provided great service. The food was plentiful and very good. There were also vegetarian and vegan options. All in all, we had a really great vacation!

We stayed at Heritance Ahungalla over the Christmas and New Year break. This is a wonderful hotel (the rooms were spacious and classic) located in a quiet area next to a beautiful, wide, long, sandy beach. And remember about full board - you won't regret it. The staff was very helpful and always smiling. Special thanks to Supervisor Chamuditha who provided an exceptionally high level of service and Shanika from the bar who was always smiling and helpful. Heritance Ahungalla stands out for its picturesque atmosphere location by the beach and its peaceful complemented by picturesque views and wonderful sunsets. The cleanliness of the hotel especially the rooms, pool and beach, is at a high level. The area is beautiful, there are lots of different animals.Thank you Heritance Ahungalla for an unforgettable holiday! If we ever come to Sri Lanka, we will definitely come to Heritance Ahungalla! I will recommend it to all my friends! When it comes to trips and sightseeing in Sri Lanka, we recommend using the services of local guides. I recommend Ania from Poland (WhatsApp no: +48 502 629 829) and her husband Rasik from SL. We traveled with them in the interior of the island on a two-day trip including: Udawalawe Park Safari, Elephant Orphanage, Ravana Waterfall, Little Adams Peak trek, Nine Arche Bridge, Mount Heaven Hotell in Ella, jungle train ride, Damro Tea Factory , Royal Botanical Garden, Temple of the Tooth in Kandy, as well as a one-day trip with Ania: safari on the Madu Ganga River, Cinnamon Island, Buddhist temple on Kothduwa island, mask museum, Moonstone Mine, fort and lighthouse in Galle and a monument in honor of the tsunami victims in Hikkaduwa. Very good and efficient organization, great driver Shami who stopped at viewpoints and took great photos of us. The trips they organized will remain in our memory for a long time. They showed us the real Sri Lanka. Very good value for money. Thank you very much Ania and your team. We will never forget you! We stayed at Heritance Ahungalla over the Christmas and New Year break. This is a wonderful hotel (the rooms were spacious and classic) located in a quiet area, next to a beautiful, wide, long, sandy beach. And remember about full board - you won't regret it. The staff was very helpful and always smiling. Special thanks to Chamuditha who provided an exceptionally high level of service and Shanika from the bar who was always smiling and helpful. Heritance Ahungalla stands out for its picturesque location by the beach and its peaceful atmosphere, complemented by picturesque views and wonderful sunsets. The cleanliness of the hotel, especially the rooms, pool and beach, is at a high level. The area is beautiful, there are lots of different animals. Thank you Heritance Ahungalla for an unforgettable holiday! If we ever come to Sri Lanka, we will definitely come to Heritance Ahungalla! I will recommend it to all my friends! When it comes to trips and sightseeing in Sri Lanka, we recommend using the services of local guides. I recommend Ania from Poland (WhatsApp no.: +48 502 629 829) and her husband Rasik. We were with them in the interior of the island on a two day tour including: Udawalawe Park Safari, Elephant Orphanage, Ravana Falls, Little Adams Peak Trek, Nine Arche Bridge, Mount Heaven Hotell in Ella, Jungle Train Ride, Damro Tea Factory, Royal Botanical Garden , the Temple of the Tooth in Kandy, as well as a one-day trip with Ania: safari on the Madu Ganga River, Cinnamon Island, a Buddhist temple on the island of Kothduwa, a mask museum, the Moonstone Mine, a fort and a lighthouse in Galle, and a monument in honor of the tsunami victims in Hikkaduwa. Very good and efficient organization, great driver Shami, who stopped at viewpoints and took great photos of us. The trips they organize will remain in our memory for a long time. They showed us the real Sri Lanka. Very good value for money. Thank you very much Ania and your team. We will never forget you!

Wonderful hotel: proximity to the ocean, caring staff, delicious and varied food, availability of a gym. In terms of service, I am most grateful to Rukmal for the cleanliness of the room and wonderful surprises in the form of fresh flowers, cute notes and gorgeous animals made from towels.

I wanted to express my gratitude to Rukmal for the purity that he creates. For incredible towel figures that lift your spirits and make you smile. I have only seen such a variety of figures here. And thank you for the delicious treats for breakfast, lunch and dinner. And the greatest admiration was caused by the oysters. Here I ate them in abundance. Prosperity to you and deep gratitude.

Pros: 1. Nice staff, ready to help in all matters (if you give them a tip, and they expect it). 2. Beautiful area with many animals (monkeys, palm squirrels, monkeys) 3. Nice pools Minuses: 1. All rooms located around the lobby are forced to listen to VERY loud music until 11-12 pm (our beds literally almost vibrated). We had to move further away because it was impossible to rest. 2. The choice of food only seems large, the spiciness is not indicated anywhere, so you had to take it at random. There is nothing at all for children. If you have stomach problems, you will have nothing to choose from. In fact, the only fruits were papaya, pineapple and unleavened watermelons. Sometimes I have bananas for breakfast. 3. The staff in the dining room is very slow - drinks were sometimes brought by the end of the meal 4. You should not take excursions from the guys on the beach - they will charge you twice as much and will try to take you to every place where they have a kickback. It's better to leave the hotel and negotiate with the tuk-tukers there. 5. To get to the ocean you need to break through a crowd of very intrusive locals who are trying to push everything on you - by the end of your vacation itâ€™s already starting to irritate you. Not a minus of the hotel itself, but you wonâ€™t be able to swim in the ocean - the waves are quite shallow. No one has change, so count on it and change it for small money right away, otherwise you will also overpay.

The food is delicious and the staff is very helpful. The surroundings are beautiful. The rooms are very clean and are cleaned well. The holiday was simply wonderful all around and we didn't miss anything.

I really liked the hotel: quiet, calm, comfortable. Actually, that's what we wanted. Attentive staff, made you feel very welcome. The room was cleaned every day. The rooms are not super new, but everything is there and everything works. Apart from the hotel and along the ocean coast there is nowhere to walk - the village, but in fact we were warned and we were ready for this. There are always free sun loungers. You can't really swim in the ocean - waves. You can jump on the waves)). You can swim in the lagoon, but you have to walk 3 km along the beach or take a tuk tuk for 100 rubles with our money. The food is great. Every day seafood: crabs, shrimp, fish, and regular food for every taste. Be careful - a lot of spicy food! Fruit daily: pineapples. passion fruit. bananas, watermelon, papaya, carambola. Overall I recommend it, I liked everything.

An excellent hotel for a relaxing holiday with the whole family. Excellent service, excellent service, very varied food. A large selection of dishes for both children and lovers of European or local cuisine. A lot of seafood, fruits, a wide variety of hot dishes and salads. At Christmas the organization exceeded all our expectations. 3 huge halls with an incredibly wide variety of dishes and drinks! The animation and service are simply top notch! Beautiful beach with a clean, gentle entrance. The ocean has no competition! Lots of different animals in the garden. Monkeys, chipmunks, monitor lizards. Exotic in a word. Special thanks to waiters Dilusha and Bakhtiya. Super customer oriented. I would also like to mention the guide Pawar, who speaks excellent Russian and excursions with him are simply incredibly interesting. Will always help with solving any questions. His Instagram is @rusceylon. Contact us and you wonâ€™t regret it!

I vacationed in Sri Lanka for the first time, at the Heritage Ahungalla hotel from December 6 to 17, 2023, in room 234 overlooking the ocean and pool. And Iâ€™m very glad that I ended up in this cozy hotel. If you are very tired, I recommend coming here to recover. Because there will be a feeling of care and comfort. You can constantly hear the sound of the ocean, it helps to calm frayed nerves, warm sun, colorful nature, beautiful weather. The restaurant has delicious and varied food (seafood, local exotics with curry, and European). The room has a comfortable bed and pillows, high-quality bed linen, which was constantly changed. Good WI-FI signal throughout the hotel, itâ€™s very convenient!!! Warm ocean, sandy entrance, no urchins, no jellyfish, no fish, no stones and other things. But throughout the entire vacation there were constantly waves in the ocean that tried to drag you away, so you have to be very careful and donâ€™t forget about safety!!! The hotel has 2 swimming pools, a garden with flowers and chipmunks, stunning sunsets, silence and tranquility. Local and Indian cuisine is a table with familiar dishes such as soups and pasta, there is always fish, seafood, and meat. Ripe fruits: pineapple, watermelon, passion fruit, papaya, bananas, other local seasonal ones. Chef and kitchen team, all the waiters, I sincerely thank you for your great contribution to my vacation ğŸ˜˜ Thanks to all the room boys for the clean room, the twisted figures made from towels made me laugh a lot)) it was nice, thank you. I went on 2 individual excursions (2-day excursion: Kandy + Nuwara city + Ambuluwawa Tower + Ella city + Waterfall and 1 day excursion: Galle city + Wijaya Beach) with a wonderful Russian-speaking guide Janit (Tel.: +94 70 721 97 23) who turned out to be not only a professional in his field, but also a wonderful person. The car for the trip was clean and comfortable. Recommendation: if you get motion sickness on mountain serpentine roads, take anti-nausea pills!!! I would like to express my sincere gratitude and appreciation for the perfectly organized tour, educational and interesting stories about the culture and history of Sri Lanka. Janit was very attentive to questions and wishes, and was always ready to offer alternative route options. Janit took wonderful photos and videos to remember. Overall, I am very pleased with how our excursions in Sri Lanka went and I think that this is largely due to the guide. I can confidently recommend Janit to anyone who wants to get vivid impressions and unforgettable emotions from traveling around Sri Lanka.

Great hotel, wonderful service. The food is very tasty, the alcohol is only of good quality. The staff is friendly, the area is very clean. But the most important thing is the view of the ocean ğŸŒŠ Wonderful guide Anzhanna, helped and advised)

We stayed from 10/16/2023 to 10/26/2023, we really liked the hotel and the room, the work and attitude of the staff was wonderful, the kitchen was excellent. The ocean, beach, pools are excellent. For those who love a calm and quiet holiday. We wish the hotel further prosperity.

I have never written reviews about my travels, but I would like to leave a review about our recent trip with words of gratitude to a very good person. At the end of November this year, my wife and I vacationed in Ahungalla, the southern province of Sri Lanka, at the Heritance Ahungalla hotel, where Anjana Maduranga (Fun&Sun Tour Operator) works as a hotel guide. We liked Anjana immediately upon our first meeting: he is a pleasant and friendly person, he is attentive to tourists, he provides all the information in great detail and intelligibly, he talks about excursions very professionally, you can always contact us with any question at any time. I ask management to pay attention to this guide and note his excellent work and knowledge! More such employees. There were only positive impressions left. Thank you for a wonderful holiday.

We rested in this hotel in November 2023, we really liked the hotel, the food was varied, in the restaurant we were periodically entertained with music, there were various seafood products, I really liked the oysters in this hotel) the rooms were large, they were cleaned every day. people are very nice. We took all inclusive and were not disappointed, because it was very convenient. We couldnâ€™t find anywhere to eat outside the hotel, or we didnâ€™t look well. It would probably be necessary to go somewhere by tuk-tuk. The ocean was exciting in November. The beach in Sri Lanka is public, so there are sellers of beachwear on the beach, they try to get you to buy something from them, but they react to refusal without offense, then they offer again) there is a guy on the beach who offers trips on a tut-tuk There are several of them out there, but Siri was recommended to us by the guys and somehow he inspired us the most confidence. A nice nice guy, he took us to Bentota and bought some tea. He offered it on turtles and in shops and in the park and anywhere and everywhere he waited for $10. He can help organize excursions, my husband and I were thinking of going to Kandy village and the Temple of the Tooth Relic, with stops at various places along the way with this Siri in a Toyota car for $250, but I got sick and the trip was unfortunately canceled for us. A one-day excursion from the tour operator seemed to cost $90, but I think itâ€™s not easy to take a bus and wait for everyone there. In general, I really liked the Hotel.

The shortcomings that the hotel now has are more than compensated for by the service staff! The entire staff is always very nice and helpful. You are a happy guest here and are very well looked after. A special thank you to Dilsha, the good soul of the house ğŸ˜ŠğŸ‘ PS: Many rooms are currently being renovated. Unfortunately, unrenovated rooms are only 3* standard ğŸ˜•

Good afternoon We wanted to share our impressions of our stay at the Heritance Ahungalla 5* hotel (Sri Lanka) We really liked the hotel. Rooms: The rooms are very large. Comfortable. Cleaning is done every day and very efficiently. The room has a kettle, tea, coffee, sugar, milk powder, water, refrigerator, hair dryer, shampoo, shower gel, body lotion, toothbrushes, slippers, bathrobes. Hotel: the hotel area is very clean and well maintained. The hotel is located right on the ocean. Very quiet and peaceful. Very long coastline. Meals: we only had breakfast. The food is good. We had lunch and dinner at the hotel's Alya Carte restaurant. The only negative of the restaurant is the small selection of dishes. But everything we didnâ€™t try was very tasty. The waiters were always attentive, polite, and neat. Animation: every evening there was live music in the lobby. Artists came, danced, and put on a fire show. During the day there was water aerobics. Water polo and some other games) Beach: the hotel is located right on the ocean. There were huge waves during our holiday. But we really liked it. We spent all our time in the water) if you walk along the beach to the left, there will be a lagoon. There were no waves there at all. Infrastructure outside the hotel: there is nowhere to go. There is the only store in Sri Lanka with prices - food city. You can also buy fruits and alcohol. There is a clothing store and a jewelry store. We took a tuk here and went to the beach club restaurant. It's right on the ocean. Menu in Russian. Everything is very delicious. And the staff is just wonderful. There is also a restaurant if you walk along the beach to the left. Jungle beach. We are very glad that we chose this hotel. A very quiet and cozy place where you can relax from the hustle and bustle

An excellent hotel for a quiet holiday. Located in the village of Ahungalla. The infrastructure around is not very developed, you have to drive, but there wonâ€™t be any problems with that either, there are plenty of tuk-tuks. for a small fee - anywhere. Near the hotel, a gang of local taxi drivers and â€œoutsidersâ€ are lynched on the spot. With some disadvantages of the location, all are compensated by the gorgeous ocean views. As for food: itâ€™s impossible to eat local food, but the hotel has plenty of European food, although the guys who were traveling with us occasionally couldnâ€™t find non-spicy food (I didnâ€™t have such problems), on weekends the food is super chic due to the fact that a lot of people come there local. Excursions: I highly recommend not taking group excursions from a hotel guide; we went on a one-day trip and it was not far in distance, but it was hell. Everything is set up to sell you something, to push a packed bus to the limit, and stuff like that. But by chance, we were recommended a local Russian-speaking (surprisingly good) guide - he arranges individual excursions. Name is Janit, (+94 70 7219723). This is what I can recommend without any pitfalls. In terms of cost, it turned out to be the same as a group excursion, but there is no comparison. It's just a delight. We took a one-day excursion - Yala National Park, Ravana Falls, Little Adam's Peak, tea plantations, nine-arch bridge and train (how can you not ride the most Instagrammable train in Sri Lanka). And at every moment Janit organized everything in such a way that it was like fire. For example, the train was 2.5 hours late, and all the tourists were waiting (almost no one waited), and Janit contacted someone in advance, found out, while we were calmly driving to the waterfall, Adam's Peak, had lunch and arrived 10 minutes before the train arrived. The tourists were all spat on and almost no one waited. We were traveling on an empty train and no one stopped us from taking photos/videos. Again, we got into the station earlier and got off 2 later, where the driver was already waiting. In general, if you want to get high on an excursion and not get stressed out among a crowd of people for the same money, I recommend it. By the way, he has an Instagram (@sri_lanka_unawatuna_tours). About the flight: the Red Wings were flying... this is of course not quite the bottom, but still. The Boeing 777 was old, but it didnâ€™t create a particularly negative feeling (positive either), they arrived and thank God. They are trying to compensate with service. In general, ok. Mattala Airport is a gdp and a barn, in a nutshell. Sooooo long at passport control. Among the useful life hacks - be sure to buy a SIM card at the airport. 4$ and for the entire duration of the trip there are no problems with communication and the Internet. Social networks and instant messengers traffic is not taken into account, the rest is 30GB/month. Itâ€™s also convenient to change money into local tugriks at the airport, good exchange rate. Thereâ€™s nothing obvious to highlight, we didnâ€™t have any special expectations, the ocean was super warm and restless, it almost always rained at night, which in general wasnâ€™t particularly annoying. Recommended overall.

Good hotel and service. The staff is friendly and willing to help with any questions. We went on holiday with friends - we really enjoyed it. An excellent hotel for a relaxing holiday. Special menus and live entertainment are offered on Fridays and weekends. Live music at dinner)

We stayed at this hotel for the first time in 40 years. We were surprised that it was just as clean as when we first visited. The rooms are very clean and the air conditioning works very well and is easy to regulate. What particularly struck us was the extremely friendly service in all areas. Starting with the helpful receptionist Mintha, all the restaurant staff, especially Rukmal, and our room attendant Duminda, who also worked very well and excellently. The food was sometimes very good (at weekends) to good. Only the cold breakfast buffet was meager, with almost no sausage or cheese. There was never an a la carte option. Instead, there were stations for every meal where you could get freshly prepared lamb, pork or chicken. The sauces were excellent. The only downside was that the Heritance Ahungalla has become a Russian hotspot, which is why I would think twice about going there again despite the good hotel.

My family and I vacationed in Sri Lanka in November in this luxurious hotel. It is wonderful and has a gorgeous view of the ocean. We could call a taxi from the hotel and we decided to go to the shopping center which was located in Colombo. Thanks to fate that we came across such a luxurious a driver named Sampa, with whom we spoke in English and visited a lot of beautiful places: turtle beach, Little Adam's Peak, nine-arch bridge and even a Safari Park with many interesting animals. Sampa was always interested in whether we liked everything and whether everything was fine with us. The most pleasant thing awaited my family and me at the end, Sampa gave us a large box of mangoes that flew a long distance from Sri Lanka to Samara. Thank you very much Sampa for what you did our vacation is even better. You became not just a guide and driver for us, but also a very good friend. We will definitely return to climb the big Adamâ€™s Peak)

The first time was in Sri Lanka with my husband and daughter. We really enjoyed . Everything is fine. Excellent hotel, food, very friendly staff. gorgeous ocean. We also somehow called a taxi to the hotel, we wanted to go to Colombo to the shopping center and were lucky enough to meet a great guy named Sampa after this trip, he practically became our guide and tour guide around the island. He showed us the Nine Arches Bridge, Galle Fort, Adam's Peak, Yala Safari Park, swings, waterfall. In short, it was wonderful. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel and the private transfer and tour guide Sampa.

Very good hotel! The lobby is designed as a hall. The hotel is located on the seaside and has its own beach. At dusk, the sunset over the Indian Ocean is a highlight. However, how could there be salesmen mixed in on the beach? This is a disadvantage. The room is large in size, as is the bathroom, with complete equipment. One week after arriving in Sri Lanka, this is the first hotel to provide indoor slippers. There are many TV channels to choose from. There are channels in major languages in the world, which should be able to meet the needs of travelers from different countries. This time, we had all three meals at the hotel. There were quite a few choices of food and beverages, and the quality was also of a certain level. However, it seems that there are many newbies in the outfield, and some tasks are not in place, or the standard operating procedures are lacking. The staff encountered were very friendly and would greet the guests. It was obvious that the hotel's request was successful. Overall, the hotel has good qualities and is worth recommending.

I liked everything very much. There was great room service. The maid Rukmsn did his job efficiently and responsibly and every day after cleaning he left a beautiful figure made of towels. I always made sure that there was water and a comfortable temperature in the room. Near the beach and ocean. I will definitely come to you again. Thank you very much.

Hello dear travelers! My husband and I rested at the Heritance Hotel (Heritance 5*) in the town of Ahungalla, from 6.11.23. Very cozy hotel, clean, cleaning every day. Amazing location on the ocean, we got great photos for a long memory. The food at the hotel is a little spicy for me, but there were always dishes that were not spicy. I especially want to mention a very responsive person whom we were lucky enough to meet. His name is Sampa. He can lead any excursion with great pleasure. Phone number +94 765402575. It so happened that on vacation my phone broke and I found myself without communication. Sampa helped me solve this problem. He took us in a comfortable car to the service center, helped with translation while the phone was being repaired, and gave us a short excursion along the coast, where we watched moray eels and sharks and fed turtles. We also visited the monument to those killed in the tsunami in 2004. Sampa is very sociable, speaks English very well, we understood him and were able to communicate. Always friendly and constantly interested in whether we were happy or not)). Thank him very much. Holidays in Sri Lanka were wonderful. We will definitely come here again!

We were greeted very friendly. We asked for a room with an ocean view and were told that it was possible, but almost all of the rooms have an ocean view, all are cozy and have a balcony. We asked to change to another one because there was a smell from the restaurant and they changed it for us, a chic room, you can see the ocean, a swimming pool, next to a tree where a family of monkeys once came and posed for a photo. The staff was polite, gave a bouquet of flowers, made figures out of towels on the bed, brought a coconut. The area was green, many trees, eucalyptus and palm trees with coconuts, we sunbathed in the shade of the trees, we liked it better than under umbrellas. Two swimming pools, one has more action, animation, water polo, volleyball in the pool and on the sand, etc., the other has relaxation, silence, jacuzzi, drinks are served upon request. We saw a monitor lizard, he passed by, posing peacefully, small chipmunks and birds on thin legs were running around. It rained almost every day from 16 to late evening. Sometimes only at night, which gave freshness and the opportunity not to burn and take a break from the sun. It was fun to swim in the pool when it was already dark, the pool was illuminated, very beautiful, tree branches above the water, warm rain falling, it was a thrill. There is a gym, we went once, everything you need is there, everything is in good condition. For entertainment, there is also billiards, snooker, a separate room on the second floor, friends whom we met enjoyed spending time there, table football, although the handles are no longer spinning well. I saw how they played ping pong tennis, the table is on the ground floor at the end of the hotel. Renovation work is underway on several rooms, it was far from us. We took breakfast and dinner. For lunch we ate fruit or went to a restaurant. The choice is large, there are seafood, shrimp and fish always, oysters on weekends. Fruits - papaya, pineapples, watermelon, carambola, passion fruit. I eat everything else at home, so the emphasis was on that. Wine and beer are available for an additional fee if you do not have an all-inclusive package. Live music in the restaurant on weekends, at the bar every evening. The ocean always had waves, which everyone liked and everyone swam and frolicked in the waves. The water is warm, the sand is pleasant. You can buy fruits nearby in a supermarket or you need to go to Bentota. You can also buy alcohol; we bought it from the Balapitya store. I recommend local calypse rum, you can buy it in the store, price 4700 rubles, course 1d = 325 rubles. We went by tuktuk, price 5d. We chose two excursions, the first is Elle, Edam Peak, bridge, train, plantations, everything is fine, but the road is long. The second is fishing, we had an economy tour for 150d for four, Summy water sport. the boat was normal, with a cabin and a roof, equipped, we caught about 20 Spanish mackerel and 5 sea bream by trolling. We didnâ€™t catch any baracuda or tuna, but we saw the locals catch a large baracuda. Then the organizers prepared fish for us, everyone liked it. The restaurants we visited were Amal and Beach club. it is near the beach on the ocean. We went to Bentota for souvenirs. Everywhere they like to bargain, the prices are inflated, so feel free to cut the price in half, and you can, oddly enough, compare the price with WB. To summarize, I would go back there again.

When we bought a tour to this hotel, we didnâ€™t know that it was undergoing a complete restoration, so we arrived and ended up just at a construction site, all sorts of work is being done everywhere, sanding the walls, you breathe dust, or painting some kind of stinking paint, the rooms are shaky, itâ€™s extremely uncomfortable, Iâ€™ll attach photos to you now If you want to go on vacation at a construction site, I ask you to go to this hotel. Now I am in hotel number 262. The next day after my arrival, having met our respected guide in quotes from Anex, I asked to move us to another hotel, no action was taken on the part of Anex, after 4 days of correspondence, hotel representatives tried to move us to other rooms exactly like this stinky. Informative for those who want to spoil their holiday, the end of the hotel renovation is scheduled for spring!

Great stay at the hotel! Liked everything ! Very attentive staff! All requests were fulfilled instantly! The food is delicious, varied, the desserts are absolutely mind blowing! The ocean is very close. In the evening there is live music. There was a magic show for the children! There was a master class on making fish curry! I definitely recommend the hotel! For excursions I recommend the guide Janit +94 70 721 9723. He speaks excellent Russian. And most importantly, it doesnâ€™t impose any additional extras on you! ğŸ¤ª

5 Excellent service, wonderful people, cool staff, wow effect, wonderful beach. Good cuisine, happy holiday, recommend to everyone. Have a great time with your family or alone. Everything is done to create a wonderful atmosphere

A beautiful hotel and the staff are very friendly and personable. We spent the remaining three days in this hotel, perfect to finish off our tour. The service employee Dilsha was very nice, in general the service staff is very courteous and caring. I would visit this hotel again and would also recommend it to my friends.

The worst hotel I've ever seen. Traveled a lot. I donâ€™t know where the positive reviews came from here, but itâ€™s terrible. Dirty, the hotel is under construction (dirty construction workers eat with you at the next table, the dishes are dirty, the service is disgusting. During your vacation you listen not to the ocean, but to the sound of a jackhammer. The all-inclusive system is zero, you wonâ€™t wait for your cocktail (small choice). Bar from in the seventies. We got poisoned there (in response to our complaint, they said it was an allergy to curry), then other guys in this hotel got poisoned. The food was not tasty, the choice was small. After what I saw on the 4th day of our stay, I already had a showdown with the agent. , who sent us there with a tour operator and reached Colombo and Moscow, we were moved to another hotel in Rio (located nearby, the Heaven and Earth hotel is barely worthy of 2-3 stars, no more, very old with lazy staff,). the general lack of modern life, animation, etc. There are not enough sun loungers for everyone, there are 4 sun umbrellas for the entire hotel.

An absolutely deserted beach, a very calm and quiet place, but shops, entertainment and restaurants are also quite far away. The area is beautiful: monkeys, chipmunks, monitor lizards, a lot of greenery. We only took breakfast - there were seafood, meat, and fruits. The staff is helpful and polite, speaks English, Rukmal cleaned our room - always clean, fresh towels and water.

Once at Heritance, always again! From the very first moment you feel looked after. This applies to everyone from the general manager to the gardener, who surprises you with fresh flowers. The location right on the beautiful sandy beach is great. You can take wonderful walks there. Be careful when swimming, the current is strong and should not be underestimated. The beach boys keep a watchful eye! The food is simply great, the entire restaurant staff deserves an A. I hope that, despite being 90 years old, I can still be looked after often at Heritance. THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING!

We just returned from this hotel and can confidently recommend it. Polite and attentive staff, good all-inclusive meals, cozy rooms. The only negative is probably the distance from the airport (2.5 hours from Matala airport). Regarding excursions, we can recommend a local Russian-speaking guide - Dzhanita. Phone +94 70 7219723, Instagram @sri_lanka_unawatuna_tours. You can choose any convenient program for a day, two or another period. In terms of organization, everything is very cool; unlike a tour operator, the excursion is individual in a personal car and you can stay anywhere as long as you want. A good mood and great photos will be guaranteed.

A beautiful hotel and the staff are very friendly and personable. The service employee Dilsha was very nice and the service was fantastic: In general I was very impressed with everything. I will come to this hotel again and also recommend it to my friends.

A fantastic experience with attentive staff, whether in the restaurant, lobby, bar and room staff! I highly recommend it! Very clean with a super nice family atmosphere! The swimming pool is great with a second one even a little quieter. To do again!

A la carte restaurant could be improved. Head of reception was a bit rude and not so welcoming as we have booked throught booking. Breakfast price on the check in document was 10$/pp and she tried to charge 18$ per person.
Property should have some recreational facility on the beach
Hotel in need of renovation which is currently being undertaken. Staff in the restaurant were not attentive enough in my opinion. One evening we had to ask for drinks 3 times.
Everything was perfect Nothing to complain about
Everything was good! The only complaints would be that the dogs on the beach are a little too friendly, they will jump up at you and the bathroom does not offer much privacy.
The location is far away from any big city so its difficult to leave the property at night. The resort may need more activities especially during the night.
Nothing everything was great thank you
Needs a little refurbishment
Wet floor
Not much really - cooling ( A/C) could have been cooler the 22*c - had central air and we were told it didnâ€™t permit it ..
There was a problem with my booking which meant I was delayed checking in. They sorted it in the end so all was well.

Room size was smaller than expected. After the baby cot was put in the room, it felt a lot more cramped for space. In house liquor was really expensive. The USD to LKR conversion rate applied by the hotel was pathetic.
Old design, would need some refurbishment
Weather Lol! Rained most of the week, water came in and shut down mode applied. Shame because beach and pool are lovely. Just not so much in the rainMpx
A bit of roof maintenance and construction on site but that didn't affect any party of the trip except for certain facilities like the library to be temporarily out of commission.
Bit pricy
Indian food Breakfast is very poor & tasteless and dry must be bad chef,...Uludu wade like ppadam,..Those taste like eating a News paper,.Sambar is like water,.Other itemsare grate!!!

Not a fan of everyday live music in the lobby, it gets bit loud and uncomfortable when you wanna have a chat. Staff is very nice, sometimes the conversations felt little bit "robotic", but that should be caused by high customer service standards.
Buildings could use a major refurbishment
Hotel was a bit dated and sea view rooms are great but donâ€™t expect to see much of the sea
Hawkers right on the beachfront immediately outside the hotel, which felt a bit unsafe, but that's just a personal thing, did notice other guests enjoying that.

All-In guests and I suppose. And it is the same old story everywhere in the world that some guests - and I refrain from pointing my finger to any particular nationality - humans need to be treated with respect and the staff deserves to be treated in a respectful manner.

The QR code for in room dining was outdated. When we saw the bill for food it was a different amount altogether. But when we explained it to hotel management they were considerate enough to bill us as per the QR code rates
The live music in the evening is nice but might be bothering at rooms close by. All-In guests
They were bit pushy for the check-out. May be they had guests waiting, but they started calling us and reminding us from 1145am onwards
Maybe food could have been a bit more tastier

There was a total lack of communication as we didn't book a package . We discovered that every time we order anything we had to tell the staff we need to sign. Also we didn't realize it was a gated hotel which made it awkward to go anywhere. You are a captive audience!! No information in the room about facilities etc. Some staff had ex
