The dining room was a bit crowded because it was the weekend rush and it's the only thing I can think of to say I didn't like
Didnâ€™t get the rooms closer to each other in the group. I was given a room far at the corner even we had booked via booking.com much earlier
We booked the luxury king and they showed to us 2 different rooms in the beginning and only in the second day we moved in the room that was actually booked.
Some areas of the hotel looked neglected and is in need of renovation.

Only thing we did not like was the way the food was laid out in the buffet as it was a bit confusing. Better labelling would have helped. The thing the plates were very hot, when we collected them from the plate holder.
Itâ€™s a bit old and tired. Actually itâ€™s not that old, but needs a good amount of maintenance to bring it back to its former glory
The room is nice but the style of the hotel is not modern.
Cleanliness
Could get crowded if full...
Buffet prices a lil on the higher side

It definitely wasn't a 5* hotel. Was a little rough around the edges with construction work ongoing and painters who couldn't be bothered to cover the flora and fauna hence many plants covered in white paint which is a shame. Took longer than usual to check out at 5am..
Some staff were more attentive to some guests and not others - probably knew they were going to get a huge tip!!! Reception staff not as good as the other staff.
There are no hair dryers. Not recommended for international business. Some tribe rule over payment systems. Prices are all in USD, albeit in their own currency. â†Avoid if you have a Stripe wallet .
The staff in Resteraunt need Training, Not attentive to customers
We booked a sea view room but we got a pool view. The view of the sea wasnâ€™t there. But the view was good. Still wished they gave us what we booked.
Nothing. It was really good

Got the premium ocean view but I didnâ€™t have a good view of the ocean. My view was obstructed by trees and that was disappointing. Tried asking staff if they could place me in another room but due to lack of a availability, this could not be set up. Please see attached photo.

There were lots of dogs around that followed you to your room - I am afraid of dogs so it made me very nervous when I was walking around on my own. They could have some simple gates at the entrance to the stairs and this would stop the dogs getting to corridors with rooms. Booking.com advertised a few restaurants but only one restaurant and one pool bar were available to us. All inclusive guests were invited to a second restaurant but we were not allowed. Booking.com advertised shows and animators but there were none.
think it needs a bit of an uplift. be it painting or otherwise. The pool needs a good tile cleaning too. restaurant tables were very salty and a bit more effort on cleanliness
Locationâ€¦ beach was very pretty but the sea is dangerous for swimming. Red Flag permanently shown, even on days when the sea looked fairly calm.
The main Buffet restaruant is not too good. Lunch is over priced and lacks variety. Breakfast is a repeat of same items every day. The location makes it difficult to dine outside the restaurant.
The property was not exactly like in those photos. Need to be renovating and little bit of attention, itâ€™s looking old and tired .
all-inclusive is restricted, and no wine in the bar (just in the restaurant at lunch and dinner). Rooms are fine, but not 5-star by any means (maybe a generous 3 star).
Hotel too crowded especially during meal times
Itâ€™s a bit run down in some common areas.
Weekends for family as it gets noisy and too many people. Pricey.
Good size pool, Pool towels are limited, and would be better if they have better pool toys.

Cosmetic repair is required for all facilities. A lot of flies in a room and in a restaurant. Not sure about the quality of alcohol (local). The only working bar (before the pandemic there were 3 bars). Not enough sun loungers.

In terms of service, this is the worst experience we've had so far :D. I travelled through over 40 countries, and nowhere did I see the personnel so chilled - but not in a good way :) Restaurant & bar team easily forgets your order, and even when they don't, you can wait for a simple coffee in a bar with 2 tables occupied for over 0.5 hour. They graciously add someone else's drinks to your bill (8 glasses of wine instead of actual 2? easy!) Moreover, some of them literally beg for tips, and when you tip them, it doesn't mean the service becomes any better. I had a birthday on the first night of our stay, but the reception forgot to inform the restaurant, so we went to ask for a candle. On the same evening we asked for refill of water, coffee and tea in the room (we didn't get a refill on that day, so we called the reception to ask for it as they themselves advised us to do), but instead a boy came with a brewed coffee charged extra... The room keys didn't work on one day, so we had to go all the way back to the reception to then be escorted back to the room by the maintenance guy who spent quite some time fixing the issue. Oh, and as for maintenance, you simply can't be left in peace here - e.g., laundry man barbarically opens your door even with the DND sign on... Last but not least, on arrival, my bank card didn't work, while on the check-out it did. Quite strange. Luckily we had another card. Will I recommend this hotel? Not really. Maybe only for 1-night stay to enjoy the beauty of nature. But if you want nice service and a proper care you would expect for this price, avoid this place. :)
Poor maintenance and building cleanliness.
the property is in need of a refresh and a good deep clean.
Nothing.
Unfortunately on arrival their was a big group who had just arrived after us , with screaming kids running around and disregarding any other guest of the hotel, but this is not the hotels fault.
Nothing
They didnâ€™t have a kids pool which was inconvenient as I have an infant and toddler.
There was some maintenance going on, so got woken up in the morning by loud noises a few times. I wish they could inform me in advance.
The rust was formed in doors but that was not a problem.

I was not a fan of local sellers at the beach trying to sell us stuff even when we said no and they kept following us but it's a public beach and not in the hotel's control. The internet was also a bit spotty inside the rooms.
The exit to the sea.
Property itself
There is nothing we didnâ€™t like, Everything was perfect!
i think the spa and dining room decor has some touches that do not respect the great architecture of bawa. that was sad to see.
All goof

Disrespectful and unfriendly front office manager and staff. From the time I arrived to the lobby. Wasnt provided a welcome drink and towel while other non solo travelers were attended too. Had to carry my own bags to the room. The front office manager was the worst employee I've ever dealt with and was extremely rude. Tried to over charge me for meals and came up with some nonsense explanation which has nothing to do with the guest blaiming the head office. when i made a noise regarding it so other guests could hear he asked me what i want just to shut me up. Extremely unprofessional and sadly this hotel has lost its way especially with staff. Same menu everyday for breakfast which was boring.
Whilst we tipped the man cleaning the room on arrival, he was trying for a tip every day so he did not get another tip. Very annoying.
Facilities and comfort.(Pillows were very hard and bulky beds were not that comfortable.
Less options for vegetarians. Non vegetarian smell at the eating area was making us uncomfortable.
The view of the room. And the dinner. Breakfast was okay
Rude stuff

I have stayed at the hotel a number of times, but this was the first time in approx 13 years. The hotel is looking a bit tired and needs more money/investment. Whilst the staff are generally good and try, the quality of the staff is not as good as it used to be, which does affect the experience. I tried to extend my stay by a night at the reception desk, to be told I needed to do this via Booking.com. The price I paid was cheaper than the price I had paid via the hotel's website.
Location, facilities
Itâ€™s run down. Everything is old and need to be renewed. Food was horrible

As mentioned above the hotels seems to have changed its profile. The first thing that meets you after the majestic entry, that took my breath away the first time I came, is a large Russian banner. The hotel seems to accommodate huge groups of tourists from this country and many of them behave badly, bringing glass bottles into the pool, (drinking a lot in general) ignoring the personnel, treating the personnel like lesser beings (we saw this several times) and not greeting, making eye contact, or even acknowledging fellow hotel guests. I can understand that the world situation makes this awkward for them, but if you choose to travel out, you should make the effort- not expect to take over a beautiful tropical destination and ignore and cancel all others just by outnumbering them. I will not return to Heritance Ahungalla (the Triton to me) until this has changed. It was very expensive too, which is such a shame when the experience is so negative. I can understand the need to make money, but ruining such a beautiful hotel and experience along the way can hardly be worth it in the long run . Iâ€™m sure the architect Geoffrey Bawa wouldâ€™ve hated this development!
I had to walk to a lot to get to my room. There was no proper room service available. The ambience didnâ€™t feel relaxing. It was just bare minimum.

Room was very basic, not even free water which is usual for a 5* HOTEL. There was no toilet paper in the bathroom, we had to ask. Provided after asking. Phone in the room wasn't working only the one in the bathroom did.
Bad maintenance- lack of trained staff-not client friendly - deteriorating standards

1. The hotel did not reply my inquiries I sent via booking.com. Unlike other hotels I booked via booking.com, they always replied within 24 hours. 2. In contrast, they charged the room fee one day before I arrived based on the credit card info left here. My experience is the credit card is used for guarantee while other (5 stars) hotels will check with me my payment preferences when I check in. They can charge me via credit card if I didnâ€™t show up in the end. 3. I asked if I can have late check-out at 12:30 one night before checkout date. Hotel staff just told me she canâ€™t confirm it right now and asked me to check again the next day morning. My feeling is they donâ€™t care customer satisfaction but care more abt their occupancy rate as this is 5 star hotel, which they probably think they can always get sufficient tourists to stay. 4. Lastly, some staff i.e breakfast time is less patient.

beds were very old and not comfortable, we had a triple room and they have provided a very uncomfortable single bed to make it triple room, you can feel the springs in the mattress and it was very uncomfortable and I couldn't sleep well. the funny part is I'm the one who chose the hotel for everyone and paid.. the other room's A/C didn't work properly and they have switched to another room with the same issue.. We had A/C in our room.

The room service staff entered my room and he checked the fridge and he has asked me if I drunk from the mini-bar. I told him â€œNoâ€. When I cam to checked out I found â€œred and white wines in the bill that I never drinkâ€. So the manager solved it but what happened pissed me off. Because itâ€™s not my responsibility if I checked in room with lost items from mini-bar
The interior needs modernisation
Package tours wristband accommodation. Poor service and terrible guests made it a bad choice.

Lift is broken. Only 1 lift for the whole hotel. Elderly cannot climb the stairs. Booked 3 people room for 3 of us., but in there only 2 cups available. Hair dryer not working. No milk( even small complimentary 1) in the fridge. When I call the reception, they said they will fill the bar with some charges. Normally some milk is there in the fridge in the other hotels as complimentary,even a small pack.
Very old hotel. It requires deep renovation. Maximum 3 stars.

Booked for my friend who came to SL for his wedding. They did not get the room I booked and on top of that their manager lied to them and me that they did not have any deluxe rooms avaliable which I booked one month prior. Absolutely feeling disgusted about these type of low level treatment.

The room was smelly, the electrical switches were falling apart and there was no hair dryer or even a bottle opener in the room. The safety locker wasn't working and after three calls no one came to have a look at it. One of the doors going to the balcony of the room was jammed shut. The rooms were not well maintained at all.

Das Hotel ist schon sehr in die Jahre gekommen. Ich weiÃŸ nicht, warum das hier keiner bisher geschrieben hat. Die Fotos, die das Hotel eingestellt hat, geben nicht den Zustand des Hotels wieder, -->Hochglanzfotos. Ich hatte Wasserflecken an der Decke und auch sonst ist das Zimmer an der ein oder anderen Stelle nicht mehr ansehnlich gewesen. Es benÃ¶tigt, meiner Ansicht nach, dringend einer Renovierung. Das Essensangebot bzw. die Auswahl, in BÃ¼fett-Form, schwankte sehr je nachdem wie voll das Hotel war. Das gilt auch fÃ¼r das FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck. Sprich, je weniger GÃ¤ste, desto weniger Angebot. Das ist eigentlich kein Problem, jedoch fand ich zum Teil die Auswahl wirklich sehr spÃ¤rlich, vor allem da ich wusste, was an anderen Tagen angeboten wurde.

Am avut upgrade de camera gratuit, obtinut prin booking, insa pentru ei asta insemna sa ne dea aceeai camera, doar ca la un etaj superior. Dupa ce am stat 3 ore in receptie am reusit sa obtinem camera conform rezervarii, insa nu are legatura cu pozele. Mucegai in camera. Pretul de 250 de dolari pe noapte este exagerat pentru o camera cu tavanul plin de mucegai. Mancarea nu este chiar buna. Peste pretul din meniu se va adauga: 10% servicii, 3% alte taxe si peste toate astea (pretul de baza + 10% + 3%) se adauga tva de 18% la toata suma. Pointless in requesting any type of room beforehand. It didn't happen for us! As soon as we entered our room, there was a terrible smell of damp. On our balcony there was a white powder. I cleaned this up, and there it was again. It turned out they were decorating the room upstairs, and the "powder" was paint being rubbed down. You couldn't sit on the balcony without it getting on your clothes, and the stench in the room was really bad. In fairness, they said we could change room. I went to check and there was no smell or powder, and the room was prepared apart from bed and bathroom linen, but still they said it would not be ready for 24 hours. We then went for dinner around 9.00 pm. Unfortunately, the food had obviously been there since there since the start, and was either "scrapings" or what no one else wanted. Good nights sleep, then we both became I'll. I just had moderate sickness and diahorrea. My partner had diahorrea , but really, really bad vomiting. It lasted 15 hours, before he finally settled. Towards the end of this we were advised our new room was ready. I said how we sick we were. Probably, a language problem, but they offered us room service!!! The last thing we needed was food - we couldn't keep anything down. We couldn't move room - we were in bed, intermittently, using the bathroom.. By the following day, the powder has stopped appearing (later found out they had stopped rubbing down) and we kind of got used to the stench, and couldn't face packing up again and moving for 3 nights. _x000D_ The beach location is beautiful. The gardens are lovely. Our balcony view was lovely. _x000D_ The rooms are smelly and need updating(maybe why we got the powder). . I didn't enjoy the food, probably because we were ill, but it was varied, and maybe our sickness had nothing to do with it, who knows. But I would suggest you eat early, rather than later, when the food has been kept around for a couple of hours rather than replaced._x000D_ The food in the cafe is lovely, hot and freshly cooked. The staff are really good.

Taking an HSBC offer for lunch dinner and breakfast at a discounted price at Heritance Hotel, Ahungalla our visit to this hotel last weekend was to serve a purpose. We were looking for good hotel for my son, his wife and the two kids (my grand children) coming to Sri Lanka end of July this year for a weekâ€™s holiday from Germany._x000D_ _x000D_ For my daughter in law and my grand children it would be their first visit to this Island. So it was very natural we wanted the best available resorts in Sri Lanka. Having seen and been in many hotels around the island, Heritance Ahungalla vast space, a centrally located large pool, and the entire complex so close to the sea left us little to desire._x000D_ _x000D_ Being very health conscious I found the salad bar was more than average to keep my hunger at bay. There was a variety of hot and cold food to choose from and the restaurant staffs were very friendly serving with smiles too._x000D_ _x000D_ I would not exaggerate a rare feature absent at most tourist hotels: Meeting helpful personnel. However, a pleasant young lady- Vishmie de Silva- made it her second nature to disprove this common notion, by answering all our questions patiently. _x000D_ She took time to show the different kinds of rooms and all other the facilities available at this complex untiringly with a smiling face. She promoted and convinced us this hotel is exactly what we are looking for single handedly._x000D_ _x000D_ When she finally leaves this hotel to migrate to different country end of Feb 2013 this hotel loses a valuable asset. I also know that no one is indispensable but there are special people who leave lasting impressions on the sands of time and Vishmie does exactly this._x000D_ _x000D_ I am certain my grand children and daughter in law would not be disappointed with their stay here at Heritance Ahungalla shortly.
